dang ldan pa/ chos thams cad la bsgribs pa med pa'i ye shes rab tu thob pa/ byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyi mngon par shes pa ye shes kyi dkyil 'khor rnam par dag pa/ bdud kyi dkyil 'khor thams cad rnam par dkrug pa'i brtson 'grus dang ldan pa/ dus gsum thams cad shes pa'i stobs la rab tu gnas pa/ chos thams cad la ye shes bsgribs pa med pa rab tu thob pa/ gnas med pas nam mkha'i spyod yul dang ldan pa/ thams cad mkhyen pa'i sa len pa med pa/ nam mkha' lta bu'i brtson 'grus dang ldan pa/ srid pa thams cad mi dmigs pa'i ye shes kyi spyod yul can/ chos kyi dbyings thams cad kyi tshul rgya mtsho la rab tu zhugs pa/ 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad tha mi dad pa'i ye shes kyi sgor zhugs pa/ 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad gcig nas gcig tu gzung ba'i rnam par 'phrul pas byung ba/ 'jig rten gyi khams kyi rgyud thams cad du skyes pa'i lus yongs su ston pa/ 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad kyi dbyibs phra ba dang / rgya che ba dang / yangs pa dang / dog pa sna tshogs rab tu tshogs pa/ shin tu phra zhing rgya chen po yang dag par gzud pa'i ye shes khong du chud pa/ dmigs pa rgya chen po shin tu phra bar shes pa dang ldan pa/ sangs rgyas thams cad dang sems kyi skad cig la 'grogs pa rab tu thob pa/ de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi byin gyi rlabs kyi ye shes kyi lus dang ldan pa/ phyogs rgya mtsho thams cad du mgo rmongs pa med pa'i ye shes rab tu thob pa/ sems kyi skad cig gis phyogs rgya mtsho thams cad du rnam par 'phrul pas rgyas par 'gengs pa sha stag ste/ de bzhin gshegs pa'i byin gyi rlabs kyis de lta bu'i yon tan tshad med pa dang ldan pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sha stag gis dze ta'i tshal thams cad yongs su rgyas par gyur kyang;

All those enlightening beings, with their retinues, were born of the practices and vows of the Universally Good enlightening being; they had the pure eye of knowledge to see all buddhas face to face; they were endowed with the acute ears to hear the ocean of teachings of all buddhas; they had reached the ultimate transcendent attainment of the masteries of all enlightening beings; from moment to moment they issued manifestations of going to all buddhas; they were in the range of pervading all worlds with one body; they had luminous bodies appearing in the circles of the congregations of all buddhas; they were in the realm of showing the reflections of all worlds and one world contained in each other in a single atom; they had the power to guide and develop all people with appropriate timing; they were in the realm of emitting clouds of teachings of all buddhas from every pore; they had attained the knowledge that all realms of beings are like illusions; they had realized that all buddhas are like reflections; they knew that all existence, states of beings, and births are like dreams; they had pure knowledge that all developments of actions are like images in a mirror; they were intensely aware that all becoming is like a mirage; they perceived that all worlds are like emanations; they had attained the illumination of the knowledges of the ten powers of buddhas; they were fearless and mighty, able to roar the lion’s roar; they had entered the inexhaustible ocean of analytic knowledge; they had attained knowledge of expressions of principles of the ocean of instruments of thought of all people; they coursed in the knowledge of the unobstructed space of the reality realm; they had attained unimpeded knowledge of all things; they had purified the spheres of superknowledges of all enlightening beings; they had the rigor to roust out all bands of demons; they stood firm in the power of knowledge of past, present, and future; they had attained unobstructed omniscience; they coursed in the space of independence; they were powerful in the space of the effortless stage of omniscience; they coursed in knowledge of the ungraspability of all existence; they had exposed the knowledge of the ocean of principles of all realms of reality; they had entered the door of nondiscriminatory knowledge of all worlds; they demonstrated the mutual interpenetration of all worlds; they manifested incarnation in all realms of being; they knew the various forms of all worlds, subtle and gross, broad and narrow; they had attained knowledge of the interpenetration of minute objects and immense lands; they could reach all buddhas in a single moment of thought; they had the body of knowledge of all buddhas; they had attained unconfused knowledge of all regions; they could pervade the ocean of all locations in a single moment of thought by mystic metamorphosis. The whole Jeta grove became filled with enlightening beings of such immeasurable attainments, by the power of the buddhas.

nyan thos chen po shA ri'i bu dang / mo'u dgal gyi bu dang / 'od srung chen po dang / nam gru dang / rab 'byor dang / 'gag med dang / mos pa dang / ka t+ya'i bu dang / byams gang gi bu la sogs pas dze ta'i tshal na 'khod bzhin du/ de bzhin gshegs pa'i rnam par 'phrul pa de dag ma mthong ngo/ /sangs rgyas kyi bkod pa de dag dang / sangs rgyas kyi khyu mchog gi mthu dang / sangs rgyas kyi rnam par rol pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi cho 'phrul dang / sangs rgyas kyi mnga' chen po dang / sangs rgyas kyi spyod pa'i rnam par 'phrul ba dang / sangs rgyas kyi mthu dang / sangs rgyas kyi byin gyi rlabs dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag pa yang ma mthong ngo/ /byang chub sems dpa'i yul bsam gyis mi khyab pa de dag dang / byang chub sems dpa' kun nas 'ongs pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' kun nas 'dus pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' kun nas tshogs pa dang byang chub sems dpa' nye bar 'ongs pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' rnam par 'phrul pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i cho 'phrul dang / byang chub sems dpa'i 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor dang / byang chub sems dpa'i phyogs su 'khod pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i seng ge'i khri bkod pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i khang pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i rnam par spyod pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i ting 'dzin gyis rnam par rtse ba dang / byang chub sems dpa'i rnam par lta ba dang / byang chub sems dpa'i rnam par bsgyings pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i rnam par gnon pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i de bzhin gshegs pa mchod pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i lung bstan pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i yongs su smin par gyur pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i sngon du 'dor ba dang / byang chub sems dpa'i chos kyi lus rnam par dag pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i ye shes kyi lus yongs su rdzogs pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i smon lam gyi lus rnam par dmigs pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i gzugs kyi lus yongs su grub pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i mtshan phun sum tshogs pa yongs su dag pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i 'od kyi dkyil 'khor kha dog mtha' yas pa'i bkod pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i 'od zer gyi dra ba rab tu 'gyed pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i sprul pa'i sprin kun tu 'gyed pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i phyogs kyi dra ba rgyas par 'gengs pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa'i dkyil 'khor rnam par sprul pa yang ma mthong ngo/ /de ci'i phyir zhe na/

The great disciples, however—Shariputra, Maudgalyayana, Mahkashyapa, Revata, Subhuti, Aniruddha, Nandika, Kapphina, Katyayana, Purnamaitrayaniputra, and so so—did not see the transfiguration of the Buddha in the Jeta grove, the adornments of the Buddha, the majesty of the Buddha, the freedom of the Buddha, the magic of the Buddha, the mastery of the Buddha, the miracle performed by the Buddha, the light of the Buddha, the power of the Buddha, or the Buddha’s purification of the land; nor did they see the inconceivable sphere of the enlightening beings, the descent of the enlightening beings, the gathering of the enlightening beings, the descent of the enlightening beings, the approach of the enlightening beings, the miracle of the enlightening beings, the magic of the enlightening beings, the circles of the enlightening beings, the locations of the enlightening beings, the array of lion thrones of the enlightening beings, the mansions of the enlightening beings, the deportment of the enlightening beings, the enlightening beings’ mastery of concentration, the enlightening beings’ observation, the enlightening beings’ emergence, the enlightening beings’ vigor, the enlightening beings’ offerings to the Buddha, the enlightening beings’ bequest of enlightenment, the enlightening beings’ development, the enlightening beings’ strength, the enlightening beings’ clarification of the reality-body, the enlightening beings’ fulfillment of the body of knowledge, the enlightening beings’ manifestation of the body of vows, the enlightening beings’ perfection of the physical body, the enlightening beings’ purification of excellence of attributes, the enlightening beings’ array of spheres of light of eternal power, the enlightening beings’ radiation of networks of light beams, the enlightening beings’ emission of clouds of emanations, the enlightening beings’ pervasion of the network of all regions, or the transfiguration of the sphere of actions of enlightening beings.
Why didn’t the disciples see any of this?

dge ba'i rtsa ba mi mtshungs ba'i phyir te/ de dag gis ni sngon sangs rgyas kyi rnam par 'phrul pa mthong ba'i rgyur 'gyur ba'i dge ba'i rtsa ba ma bsags so/ /de dag la ni sngon sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyis phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams su gtogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing thams cad kyi yon tan dang / rgyan yongs su dag pa yang dag par bstan pa ma mdzad do/ /de dag la ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyis sangs rgyas kyi rnam par 'phrul pa yang dag brjod pa ma mdzad do/ /de dag gis ni sngon 'khor ba na 'khor ba'i tshe/ sems can rnams bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yang dag par bskul ba ma byas so/ /de dag gis ni gzhan gyi sems kyi rgyud la byang chub tu sems bskyed pa rab tu bzhag pa ma byas so/ /de dag gis ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i gdung rgyun mi 'chad pa'i phyir zhugs pa ma yin no/ /de dag gis ni sems can thams cad yongs su bsdu ba'i phyir brtson pa ma yin no/ /de dag gis ni byang chub sems dpa' rnam pha rol tu phyin pa la yang dag par bskul ba ma byas so/ /de dag gis ni sngon 'khor ba na 'khor ba'i tshe/ 'gro ba thams cad las khyad par du 'phags pa'i ye shes kyi sa la dmigs pa ma byas so/ /de dag gis ni thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du 'gyur ba'i dge ba'i rtsa ba nye bar bsags pa ma byas so/ /de dag gis ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i 'jig rten las 'das pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba yongs su ma bsgrubs so/ /de dag gis ni sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag pa thams cad du rnam par 'phrul pa'i mngon par shes pa khong du ma chud do/ /de dag gis ni byang chub sems dpa'i mig gi lam gyis rnam par dmigs par bya ba 'jig rten las 'das pa thun mong ma yin pa'i byang chub tu dmigs pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba byang chub sems dpa'i smon lam chen po las byung ba khong du chud do/ /nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kun gyis ni byang chub sems dpa' kun tu bzang po'i ye shes kyi mig gi lam gyis rnam par dmigs pa thun mong ma yin pa/ de bzhin gshegs pa'i byin gyi rlabs las byung ba'i sgyu ma'i rnam pa'i chos nyid kyis grub pa/ byang chub sems dpa'i 'du shes sna tshogs yongs su 'dzin pa byin gyis rlob pa/ byang chub sems dpa'i dga' ba'i shugs chen po rnam par 'phel bar byed pa khong du ma chud do/ /

Because of lack of corresponding roots of goodness. For they had not accumulated the roots of goodness conducive to vision of the transfiguration of all buddhas, and they had not had the purifications of the arrays of qualities of all buddha-lands in the ten directions described to them, and they had not had the various wonders of all buddhas described to them by the buddhas, and they had not established beings in supreme perfect enlightenment while they were involved in the world, and they had not instilled in others’ minds the determination for enlightenment, and they were not capable of perpetuating the lineage of buddhas, and they were not engaged in the salvation of all beings, and they had not exhorted enlightening beings to practice transcendent ways, and while they were involved in the world they had not focused their minds on the stage of knowledge superior to all worldlings, and they had not developed the foundations of goodness conducive to omniscience, and they had not perfected the transmundane roots of goodness of buddhas, and they had not realized the miraculous superknowledge to purify all buddha-lands, and they did not know the source of the great vow of enlightening beings, which is the good root of concentration on unique world-transcending enlightenment that represents the range of vision of enlightening beings, and they were not born of the magical essence emanating from the power of the enlightened, and because hearers and individual illuminates do not share in the knowledge of enlightening beings’ control over holding various perceptions as in dreams, the growth of the current of joy of enlightening beings, and the manifestations of the range of the eye of knowledge of the universally good enlightening being.

de bas na nyan thos chen po mchog gi zung dang / bzang po'i zung la sogs pa de dag gis de bzhin gshegs pa'i rnam par 'phrul ba de mi mthong ngo/ /mi thos so/ /mi shes so/ /khong du mi chud do/ /mi rtogs so/ /mi rig go /yid mi ches so/ /mi sems so/ /rnam par mi lta'o/ /rtogs par mi lta'o/ /nges par mi lta'o/ /nye bar mi sems so/ /de ci'i phyir zhe na/ de ni sangs rgyas kyi spyod yul te/ nyan thos kyi spyod yul ma yin no/ /

Because of that, those great disciples, who were the best of the best, did not see the miracle of the Buddha, did not hear it, know it, realize it, penetrate it, did not fix their minds on it, did not notice it, did not focus their attention on it, did not observe it, did not examine it, did not reflect on it, did not contemplate it. Why? Because that is the sphere of buddhas, not the sphere of disciples.

de bas na nyan thos chen po de dag dze ta'i tshal de nyid na 'khod kyang / sangs rgyas kyi rnam par 'phrul pa de dag mi mthong ste/ de dag la de dang mthun pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba med do/ /de dag gis sangs rgyas kyi rnam par 'phrul pa de dag mthong du/ de lta bu'i ye shes kyi mig rnam par ma dag go /dmigs pa chung ngu la rgya chen po'i byin gyi rlabs kyis 'jug tu ting nge 'dzin de lta bu med do/ /de dag shes pa dang / lta ba'am/ khong du chud par bya ba'am/ rtogs par bya ba'am/ rgyas par dgang bar bya ba'am/ 'jug par bya ba'am/ rnam par blta ba'am/ nyams su myong bar bya ba'am/ gnan ba'am/ rnam par mnan pa'am/ gzhan gyis thos par bya ba'am/ bstan par bya ba'am/ smos par bya ba'am/ yang dag par bstan par bya ba'am/ bstab par bya ba'am/ sbyin par bya ba'am/ de la sems can rnams yongs su bskul bar bya ba'am/ sbyar bar bya ba'am/ rab tu dgod par bya ba'am/ sangs rgyas kyi rnam par 'phrul pa'i chos nyid la sems can dgod par bya bar yang de dag la de lta bu'i rnam par thar pa med do/ /de lta bu'i rdzu 'phrul med do/ /de lta bu khyu mchog gi mthu med do/ /de lta bu'i stobs med do/ /de lta bu'i dbang med do/ /de lta bu'i gnas med do/ /de lta bu'i 'du shes med do/ /de lta bu'i mig gi mthu med do/ /de lta bu'i ye shes med do/ /

Therefore even though the disciples were in the very same Jeta grove, they did not see those miracles of the Buddha. For indeed they did not have the corresponding roots of goodness, they did not have that purity of the eye of knowledge, whereby they could have seen the miracles of Buddha. They did not know the concentration whose minute point of focus would have given them access to those vast magical manifestations. They did not know that liberation or that spiritual capacity or that might or that power or that mastery or that state or that perception or that power of vision whereby they might recognize or see or penetrate or approach or discover or head for or observe or experience or reveal to others or explain or show or describe or make visible or arrive at or produce or lead beings into the cultivation and realization of the realities of the miracles of Buddha. That knowledge did not belong to them.

de ci'i phyir zhe na/ de dag ni de ltar nyan thos kyi theg pas byung ba/ nyan thos kyi lam gyis yongs su grub pa/ nyan thos kyi spyod pa'i dkyil 'khor yongs su rdzogs pa/ nyan thos kyi 'bras bu la gnas pa/ bden pa snang ba shes pas nges par rtogs pa/ yang dag pa'i mtha' la gnas pa/ shin tu zhi ba'i mthar thug pa/ snying rje chen po'i bsam pa med pa/ 'jig rten thams cad la mi lta mi sdod pa/ rang gi don grub pa dag ste/

Why? Because they were emancipated by the vehicle of hearers, they had realized the path of hearers, they had fulfilled the sphere of practices of hearers, they were fixed in the fruit of hearers; they rested on the knowledge of the light of truth, they were fixed at the limit of reality, they had gone to the state of eternal peace, they had no thought of great compassion and had no pity for the beings of the world; they had accomplished what they had to do for themselves.

de dag ni dze ta'i tshal de nyid du kun nas 'dus te 'khod la/ bcom ldan 'das kyi spyan snga dang / g.yas g.yon dang / snam logs na bcom ldan 'das la mngon du lta bar gnas kyang / dze ta'i tshal der sangs rgyas kyi rnam par 'phrul pa de dag mthong bar ma gyur to/ /de ci'i phyir zhe na; thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes yang dag par ma bsgrubs pa dang / thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes yang dag par ma bsdus pa dang / thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes la yang dag par ma zhugs pa dang / thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes la smon lam yang dag par ma btab pa dang / thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes mngon par ma bsgrubs pa dang / thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes yongs su ma bsgoms pa dang / thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes ma sbyangs pa de dag gis ni/ de bzhin gshegs pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi rnam par 'phrul pa de la 'jug cing rtogs par bya ba'am/ blta zhing khong du chud par bya bar mi nus so/ /de ci'i phyir zhe na/ de ni byang chub sems dpa' rigs dang ldan pa rnams kyi mig gi lam gyis blta ba yin gyi/ nyan thos kyi mig gis blta ba ma yin no/ /de bas na nyan thos chen po de dag dze ta'i tshal de nyid na 'khod kyang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i rnam par 'phrul pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi byin gyi rlabs dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' kun nas 'dus pa'ang mthong bar ma gyur to/ /

They had gathered in the Jeta grove and were sitting there, in front of, behind, and to the left and right of the Buddha, in his presence, yet they did not see the miracles of the Buddha in the Jeta grove. Why? It is not possible for those who have not developed omniscient knowledge, have not accomplished omniscient knowledge, have not set out for omniscient knowledge, have not resolved on omniscient knowledge, have not undertaken omniscient knowledge, have not penetrated omniscient knowledge, have not purified omniscient knowledge, to understand or become aware of or see or discover the miraculous manifestation of the concentration of the Buddha. Why? Because that is discernible only to the range of the vision of developed enlightening beings, not to the range of the vision of hearers. That is why the great disciples, the great hearers, though in the Jeta grove, did not see the transfiguration of the Buddha, the magical appearances of the Buddha, the purifications of the buddha-land, the gathering of the enlightening beings.

de 'ang 'di lta ste/ dper na; gang+gA'i chu klung chen po'i ngogs pha rol tshu rol du yi bkres pa dang / skom pas rab tu mnar ba/ gcer ba/ gos med pa/ lus kyi mdog dang / kha dog tshig cing 'chums pa dang / rlung dang nyi mas bskams pa/ bya rog mang pos gtse ba/ spyang ki dang / was mtho btsam pa brgya stong mang po kun nas 'dus kyang / gang+gA'i chu klung chen po mi mthong ste/ sgrib pa'i las kyis bsgribs pa'i phyir/ la las ni bskams te chu med par mthong ngo/ /la las ni thal bas yongs su gang bar mthong ngo/ /de bzhin du nyan thos chen po gnas brtan de dag dze ta'i tshal de nyid na 'khod kyang / thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang mi mthun pa'i phyogs ma rig pa'i ling rtog gis mig kun nas khebs pa dang / thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi sa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba'i mthus yongs su ma bzung ba'i phyir/ de bzhin gshegs pa'i rnam par 'phrul pa de dag ma mthong / ma shes so/ /

The situation was like that of hundreds of thousands of ghosts gathered on the bank of the great river Ganges, hungry and thirsty, naked, without shelter, emaciated, dehydrated by the wind and heat, attacked by flocks of crows, terrorized by wolves and jackals—they do not see the Ganges River, or they may see it as dry, without water, or full of ashes, because they are shrouded by actions that blind them. In the same way the old great disciples there in the Jeta grove did not see or penetrate the transfigurations of the Buddha, because they rejected omniscience and their eyes were veiled by ignorance.

'di lta ste/ dper na/ 'dun ma chen po 'dus pa'i skye bo mang po dbus su/ mi la la zhig gnyid kyis myos te log par gyur nas/ de gnyid kyis log pa'i rmi lam du gnas de nyid na/ lha'i grong rdal brgya byin gyi gnas blta na mdzes pa dang / ri rab kyi steng shing dang bcas pa/ bza' shing gi ra ba'i 'khor dang bcas pa/ lha'i bu mo bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong gis gang ba/ lha'i bu khrag khrig brgya phrag stong snyed gnas pa/ lha'i me tog sna tshogs kyis yongs su gang ba dang / yid bzhin gyi shing lha rdzas kyi gos dang / mu tig gi phreng ba dang / rin po che'i rgyan dang / se mo do sna tshogs mang po 'byin pa dang / lha rdzas kyi sil snyan rnam pa sna tshogs rlung gis yongs su bskyod cing / sgra dbyangs yid du 'ong la snyan pa 'byin pa'i sil snyan gyi shing mang po dang / dga' ba'i rtsed mo'i bkod pa/ rnam pa sna tshogs mthong bar gyur la; lha'i bu mo mang pos glu blangs pa dang / lha rdzas kyi rol mo byas pa'i sgra yid du 'ong zhing snyan pa thos par gyur te/ bdag nyid kyang de na 'dug pa snyam byed la/ lha rdzas kyi bkod pas klubs pa'i gnas de dag thams cad mthong bar gyur kyang / skye bo'i tshogs mang po de dag gis gnas de nyid na 'khod bzhin du mi mthong / mi shes/ khong du mi chud do/ /de ci'i phyir zhe na/ de ni skyes bu gnyid kyis log pa de nyid kyi rmi lam gyis blta ba yin gyi/ gnas de nyid na 'khod kyang skye bo mang po de dag gis blta ba ma yin no/ /de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' de dag dang / 'jig rten gyi dbang po byang chub la mngon par mos pa de dag sangs rgyas kyi byin gyi rlabs rgya chen po dang / rang gi dge ba'i rtsa ba'i stobs ma nor bar shin tu bsags pa dang / thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du smon lam shin tu mngon par bsgrubs pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i yon tan thams cad la shin tu zhugs pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i lam bkod pa chen po dang ldan pa la shin tu gnas pa dang / thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes kyi chos nyid dang / yan lag rnam pa thams cad du shin tu rdzogs pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' kun tu bzang po'i spyod pa'i khyad par dang / smon lam yongs su rdzogs par bya ba rnam par dag pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i sa thams cad kyi ye shes kyi dkyil 'khor yongs su non pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i ting nge 'dzin gyis rnam par spyod pa thams cad la rnam par rtse ba dang / byang chub sems dpa'i ye shes kyi spyod yul thams cad la chags pa med par rnam par spyod pas bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i sangs rgyas kyi khyu mchog gi mthu phyung ba de dag dang / sangs rgyas kyi rnam par rol pa de dag mthong zhing khong du chud la/ nyams su myong bar gyur kyang / nyan thos chen po mchog gi zung dang / bzang po'i zung la sogs pa de dag la byang chub sems dpa'i mig med pas mthong bar ma gyur/ shes par ma gyur to/ /

It was like the case of a man who has dozed off in the daytime in the midst of a large group of people and while asleep sees a celestial city with beautiful mansions appearing there in his dream, and sees the whole summit of the polar mountain, with groves and gardens, with innumerable nymphs all around, innumerable godlings living there, and various celestial flowers scattered about, and sees wish-fulfilling trees providing various celestial garments, jewel ornaments, and flower garlands, and sees musical trees producing all kinds of sweet celestial sounds, and many kinds of forms of pleasure and diversion, and hears the sweet sounds of the music and singing of the heavenly nymphs, and perceives himself as being there, seeing the adornment of the celestial arrays all over the place. The group of people who are there in the same place do not see this, are not aware of it, do not observe it, because it is the vision of the man in his dream, not the vision of the group of people in the same place. In the same way the enlightening beings and the world rulers on the verge of enlightenment, by virtue of the tremendous power of the Buddha, by the attainment of their own roots of goodness, by their own undertaking of the vow for omniscience, by development of the qualities of all buddhas, by stabilization in the magnificent path of enlightening beings, by accomplishment of the outgrowths of the teachings of all aspects of omniscient knowledge, by fulfillment and purification of the higher aspirations of the acts of the Universally Good enlightening being, by entering the spheres of knowledge of all the stages of enlightening beings, by mastery of all the states of concentration of enlightening beings, and by unhindered contemplation of all the spheres of knowledge of enlightening beings, saw the inconceivable power and mastery of the Buddha, understood and comprehended, whereas the great disciples, the best of the best, did not see or understand, because they did not have the eye of enlightening beings.

'di lta ste/ dper na/ ri'i rgyal po kha ba can/ sman gyi 'byung gnas kyis gang ba la/ sngags dang / rig sngags dang / sman gyi tshul dang / blang ba'i rgyus shes shing / rig sngags grub pa'i skyes bu gnas pa/ sman gyi cho ga thams cad shes pa/ sman blang ba'i las byed kyang / ri bo'i dbang po de nyid la gnas pa'i phyugs dang / ba lang dang / ra lug 'tsho ba dang / rngon pa dang / de ma yin pa'i mi sman gyi tshul mi shes pa gzhan dag gis sman de dag gi cho ga dang / sman gyi ro dang / mthu dang / yon tan dang / byin dang / thabs dang / 'phrod pa mi shes so/ /de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes kyi yul la zhugs pa/ byang chub sems dpa'i rnam par 'phrul ba'i yul gyis byung ba/ de dag gis de bzhin gshegs pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi rnam par 'phrul ba'i yul de dag mthong yang / nyan thos chen po mchog gi zung dang / bzang po'i zung la sogs pa rang gi dgos pas tshim par gyur pa/ gzhan gyi dgos pa yal bar gzhog pa/ btang snyoms can de dag dze ta'i tshal de nyid na gnas kyang / tshe 'di la bde bar spyod pas bde zhing dga' bar gnas pa las/ phar de bzhin gshegs pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi rnam par 'phrul pa'i yul de dag khong du mi chud do/ /

On the snowy king of mountains are many medicinal herbs, which someone who is expert in secret lore and medicine, knowing all the principles of herbal medicine, may go and pick, while herders and hunters on the same mountain, ignorant of herbal medicine, do not know the essence, energy, results, efficacy, or method of application of the herbs. In the same way, those enlightening beings who had entered the sphere of knowledge of buddhas and produced the transformed perceptions of enlightening beings were aware of the transfigured perceptions of the concentration of Buddha, while the great disciples, even though they were there in the same Jeta grove, being satisfied with their own task and having no desire to work for others, being indifferent, dwelt in the feeling of bliss because they were in a condition of bliss in their present state and so were not aware of the perceptions of the concentration and miraculous transfiguration of Buddha.

'di lta ste/ dper na/ sa chen po rin po che thams cad kyi 'byung gnas phun sum tshogs pa/ gter brgya stong du mas gang ba/ rin po che sna tshogs rnam pa tha dad pas yongs su gang ba 'di la'ang rin po che'i 'byung gnas dang / gter gyi rgyus la mkhas shing byang ba'i mi/ rin po che brtag pa'i gtsug lag gi blo shin tu byang ba/ gter gyi gtsug lag dang / rgyus dang / dan rtags gya nom par lobs pa/ bsod nams rgya chen po'i stobs kyis bstan pa dag /de las rin po che ci 'dong bar blangs shing bdag kyang yongs su tshim par byed/ pha dang ma la yang legs par rim gro byed/ bu pho smos kyang legs par gso bar byed cing / de ma yin pa'i sems can rga ba dang / na ba dang / dbul ba dang / nyam nyes pa dang / kha zas dang / gos kyis mi 'byor pa rnams la btud cing khyad par bgo bsha' byed pa/ nor gyi dga' ba sna tshogs nyams su myong bar byed kyang sems can rin po che'i 'byung gnas dang / gter gyi rgyus mi shes pa/ bsod nams ma byas pa/ rin po che la shes pa'i mig yongs su ma dag pa/ de dag de nyid na 'khod kyang rin po che'i 'byung gnas de dag dang; rin po che'i gter de dag khong du mi chud mi shes pas/ rin po che yang blang du med do/ /rin po che'i don kyang byar med do/ /de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' de bzhin gshegs pa'i yul bsam gyis mi khyab pa la ye shes kyi mig shin tu rnam par dag pa/ de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes kyi yul bsam gyis mi khyab pa la zhugs pa de dag dze ta'i tshal na 'khod cing; sangs rgyas kyi rnam par 'phrul pa de dag mthong la/ chos kyi tshul rgya mtsho la 'jug cing / ting nge 'dzin gyi phyag rgya yongs su sgrub ste/ de bzhin gshegs pa'i mchod pa dang / rim gro la brtson zhing / dam pa'i chos yongs su gzung ba la mngon par brtson te/ bsdu ba'i dngos po bzhis sems can de dag yongs su sdud kyang / nyan thos chen po de dag gis de bzhin gshegs pa'i rnam par 'phrul pa de dag dang / byang chub sems dpa'i tshogs chen po kun nas 'dus pa de lta bu yang ma mthong / ma shes so/ /

This earth is abundantly endowed with mines of jewels of all kinds, with hundreds of thousands of deposits, filled with endless supplies of various jewels. Someone who has acquired knowledge of precious substances, sees where the deposits are, has thoroughly studied the appropriate science and technology, and is supported by immense virtue and strength, then can take jewels and enjoy himself as he wishes, properly honor his parents, support his wife and children, and also distribute them evenly to the old, the poor, the destitute, the unfortunate, those without food and clothing. On the other hand, those who do not know about the deposits of jewels, who have not done good works, and have not clarified the eye of knowledge of the precious, do not discover the jewel mines in spite of the fact that they are walking on them—they do not take the jewels and do not do what can be done with jewels. Similarly, the enlightening beings in the Jeta grove who had clarified the eye of knowledge of the inconceivable sphere of Buddha and who had entered the sphere of the inconceivable knowledge of Buddha saw the miraculous transfigurations of Buddha, entered the oceans of principles of the Buddha teachings, attained oceans of concentrations, engaged in the service of the buddhas, took to embracing all truths, took all beings into their care with the four means of integration. The great disciples, however, did not see or notice the transfigurations of the Buddha or the great assembly of the enlightening beings.

'di lta ste/ dper na/ skyes bu la la zhig mig gnyis gos kyi bkab ste/ rin po che'i gling du phyin par gyur na/ des rin po che'i gling der phan tshun 'gro ba dang / 'greng ba dang / 'dug pa dang / nyal ba byas kyang rin po che'i 'byung gnas mi mthong ngo/ /rin po che'i shing dang / gos kyi rin po che dang / spos kyi rin po che dang / rin po che thams cad kyang mi mthong la/ rin po che de dag gi spyod yul lam/ rin thang ngam/ yongs su spyad pa'i rgyus kyang mi shes pas/ de ni rin po che de dag len kyang mi len la/ rin po che'i don kyang nyams su myong bar mi byed do/ /gang gi mig la bsgribs pa med pa de dag gis ni de dag thams cad mthong zhing shes so/ /de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' chos rin po che'i gling chen por phyin pa de dag gis/ bla na med pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa'i rin po che/ 'jig rten thams cad kyi rgyan du gyur pa mngon du gyur te/ dze ta'i tshal na bzhugs shing / sangs rgyas kyi rnam par 'phrul pa bsam gyis mi khyab pa yongs su ston pa mthong yang / nyan thos chen po de dag de bzhin gshegs pa'i zhabs kyi drung de nyid na gnas shing spyod kyang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi yul rnam par 'phrul ba'i cho 'phrul de dag ma mthong ngo/ /byang chub sems dpa'i tshogs mang po de lta bu'i rin po che'i 'byung gnas chen po yang mthong par ma gyur to/ /de ci'i phyir zhe na/ de bzhin gshegs pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi khyu mchog gi mthu phyung ba dang / cho 'phrul bsam gyis mi khyab pa de dag bltar thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi ma rig pa'i gos kyis ye shes kyi mig bkab pa de dag la/ byang chub sems dpa'i ye shes kyi mig yongs su dag pa de lta bu med do/ /de dag gis chos kyi dbyings gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pa la 'jug pa de lta bu khong du ma chud do/ /

It was, again, as if a man came to a land of jewels with his eyes blindfolded by a rag: he might walk around, stand, sit, and lie there, but he would not see the masses of jewels, he would not see the jewel trees, jewel clothes, jewel fragrances, or any of the other jewels. Furthermore, he would not know the use, value, or enjoyment of those jewels. He would not take the jewels and would not know what to do with the jewels. Someone whose eyes were uncovered, however, would see and distinguish them all. In the same way, those enlightening beings, having come to the land of jewels of truth, where the unsurpassed jewel of the enlightened, adornment of all worlds, was right before them, standing in the Jeta grove, saw the Buddha displaying inconceivable miraculous transfigurations. The great disciples, however, were standing at the Buddha’s feet and gazing at the Buddha, but they did not see the miraculous occurrence emanating from the sphere of the Buddha’s concentration, and did not see the great treasury of jewels which was the great assembly of enlightening beings. Why? They were inimical to omniscience, their eyes covered with the rag of ignorance, and they had not clarified the eye of unobstructed knowledge of enlightening beings, and they did not realize that all things interpenetrate, which is how they could have seen the miracle produced by the inconceivable power of the Buddha’s concentration.

'di lta ste/ dper na/ mig yongs su dag pa rdul dang bral bas rab tu snang ba dang ldan pa zhes bya ba/ rab rib dang / mun pa thams cad dang mi 'grogs pa yod de/ de mi la la zhig gis thob par gyur na/ de rdul dang bral bas rab tu snang ba dang ldan pa'i mig yongs su dag pa dang ldan pas mtshan mo mun pa'i mun nag shin tu gnag par gyur pa'i nang na/ sems can bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong kun nas 'dus pa dang / cho ga dang / spyod lam rnam par sna tshogs dang ldan zhing / mun pa'i rab rib kyis mig yongs su 'khrugs par gyur pa'i mi'i khrod na 'dug cing / rnam par rgyu la phan tshun 'gro ba dang / 'greng ba dang / spyod lam rnam pa sna tshogs kyis spyod kyang; mi de dag gis skyes bu spyod lam sna tshogs kyis spyod pa de mi mthong / mi shes so/ /skyes bu des ni 'gro ba'i tshogs chen po/ spyod lam dang cho ga sna tshogs kyis rnam par spyod pa; phyogs tha dad du mngon par bltas pa/ dbyibs kyi rnam pa tha dad pa/ kha dog gi rnam pa tha dad pa/ dmigs pa'i tshul tha dad pa thams cad kyang mi mthong ba med do/ /de bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pa byang chub sems dpa'i tshogs kyi 'khor mnga' ba/ rnam par dag cing chags pa mi mnga' ba'i spyan dang ldan pas/ 'jig rten thams cad mkhyen cing gzigs te/ sangs rgyas kyi ting nge 'dzin gyi rnam par 'phrul pa dang / cho 'phrul chen po bstan pa mdzad kyang / nyan thos chen po de dag gis de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes dang / ting nge 'dzin gyis rnam par sprul pa'i cho 'phrul chen po de dag mthong bar ma gyur to/ /byang chub sems dpa' chen po'i tshogs chen po de lta bu yang mthong bar ma gyur te/

Again, it is as if there is an eye-purifier called “possessed of undefiled brilliance,” which is incompatible with any darkness or obscurity: suppose someone obtained it and with that eye-clarifier “possessed of undefiled brilliance” went in the dark of night among a huge crowd of people in various postures unable to see in the darkness, and walked around, stood there, sat down, and so on—those people would not see this person or distinguish what he was doing. On the other hand, this person would see the crowd of people, their various postures, positions, locations, appearances, and dress. In the same way, the Buddha, together with his company of enlightening beings, having the pure unobstructed eye of knowledge, discerns and sees all beings. Buddha shows the miracle emanated from the great concentration of Buddha, but the great disciples did not see the miracle emanated from the concentration of great knowledge of Buddha, or the great company of the assembly of enlightening beings.

'di lta ste/ dper na/ dge slong la la zhig skye bo mang po'i tshogs kyi dbus su sas khyab pa'i ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par zhugs sam/ chus khyab pa'am/ mes khyab pa'am/ rlung gis khyab pa'am/ sngon pos khyab pa'am/ ser pos khyab pa'am/ dmar pos khyab pa'am/ dkar pos khyab pa'am/ lhas khyab pa'am/ sems can sna tshogs kyi lus kyis khyab pa'am/ sgra dang dbyangs kun gyis khyab pa'am; dmigs pa thams cad kyis khyab pa'i ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par zhugs na/ 'gro ba mang po'i tshogs de dag gis chu'i phung po de mi mthong ngo/ /me'i snang ba de yang mi mthong ngo/ /sems can sna tshogs kyi lus kyis khyab pa dang / dmigs pa thams cad kyis khyab pa'i bar du yang mi mthong ste/ ting nge 'dzin de la snyoms par zhugs shing / rnam par spyod pa rnams ni ma gtogs so/ /de bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pas sangs rgyas kyi ting nge 'dzin gyis yul gyi rnam par sprul pa bsam gyis mi khyab pa de dag yongs su bstan pa mdzad na/ nyan thos chen po de dag gis mthong zhing shes par ma gyur te/ byang chub sems dpa' de bzhin gshegs pa'i lam la zhugs pa de dag gis ni/ de bzhin gshegs pa'i yul de dag mthong ngo/ /khong du chud do/ /

Also, it is as if a monk in the midst of a large group of people attained the concentration of total absorption in earth or water or fire or wind, or total absorption in blue, yellow, red, or white, or total absorption in heaven, or in the bodies of various beings, or in all sounds, or in all objects, that group of people would not see the body of water, would not see the realm of fire, would not see the various bodies or totality of objects in which the monk’s mind was absorbed, except for those who had themselves attained those states of concentration. In the same way, the great disciples did not see the Buddha’s revelation of the inconceivable wonder of the sphere of the concentration of Buddha, while the enlightening beings who had attained the path of the Buddha entered into the sphere of the Buddha.

'di lta ste/ dper na/ sku ba grub pa'i mi ni mig gnyis bskus ma thag tu/ skye bo mang po thams cad kyis lus mi mthong ngo/ /des ni 'gro 'am; 'dug gam/ 'greng yang rung ste/ skye bo mang po thams cad mthong ngo/ /de bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pa 'jig rten las 'das pa/ 'gro ba thams cad kyi yul las yongs su 'das pa/ thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes kyi yul du zhugs pa/ byang chub sems dpa'i ye shes kyi mig gis shes par bya ba des 'gro ba thams cad gzigs kyang / nyan thos chen po de dag gis de bzhin gshegs pa'i rnam par 'phrul pa de dag ma mthong ngo/ /

Again, it is as if there were an ointment, which simply by being applied to one’s eyes makes one invisible to others while one is able to see others. In the same way Buddha, beyond the world, beyond the spheres of all beings, having entered the sphere of omniscience, can be discerned by the eye of knowledge of enlightening beings, and sees all beings in the world, but the great disciples could not see those miracles of the Buddha.

'di lta ste/ dper na/ mi'i tsher 'grogs pa'i lha rtag tu rjes su 'brang ba ni des mi de mthong yang / mis lha de mi mthong ngo/ /de bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes kyi yul la zhugs pa/ byang chub sems dpa'i tshogs kun nas 'dus pa chen po'i dbus su; sangs rgyas kyi rnam par 'phrul pa chen po yongs su bstan pa mdzad kyang / nyan thos chen po de dag gis de bzhin gshegs pa'i rnam par 'phrul pa dang / cho 'phrul chen po dang / byang chub sems dpa'i 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor gyi rnam par 'phrul pa de dag kyang ma mthong / ma shes so/ /

It is also like the case of the celestial spirit born together with a person and always associated with the person—the spirit sees the person, but the person does not see the spirit. In the same way, the Buddha, in the sphere of omniscience, manifested great miraculous transfigurations of Buddha in the midst of the great assembly of enlightening beings, but the great disciples did not see, did not notice, the miracle of the transfiguration of the Buddha or the magical manifestation of the circle of enlightening beings.

'di lta ste/ dper na/ dge slong sems thams cad la dbang gi dam pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i mchog thob pa/ 'du shes dang / tshor ba 'gog pa la snyoms par zhugs pa ni/ shes pa med la tshor ba med pas dbang po drug gis kyang bya ba gang yang nyams su mi myong ste/ mya ngan las 'das pa yang ma yin la/ 'jig rten gyi rnam par spyod pa thams cad gnas de na yod kyang / snyoms par zhugs pa de nyid kyi byin gyi rlabs dang mthus des mi shes/ mi mthong ngo/ /de bzhin du nyan thos chen po de dag dze ta'i tshal de na yang rnam par spyod la/ de dag la dbang po drug kyang yod de/ de bzhin gshegs pa'i ting nge 'dzin dang / rnam par 'phrul pa dang / khyu mchog gi mthu phyung ba dang / cho 'phrul de dag mthong bar ma gyur/ khong du chud par ma gyur/ shes par ma gyur to/ /byang chub sems dpa'i cho 'phrul chen po de dag dang / byang chub sems dpa'i rnam par 'phrul pa de dag kyang khong du ma chud/ ma mthong / ma shes so/ /de ci'i phyir zhe na/ sangs rgyas kyi yul ni zab cing yangs la tshad med de/ blta bar dka' zhing rtogs par dka' ste/ khong du chud par dka' la 'jig rten thams cad las yongs su 'das pa'o/ /sangs rgyas kyi yul ni bsam gyis mi khyab pa ste/ nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas thams cad kyis mi 'dus pa'o/ /de bas na nyan thos chen po de dag dze ta'i tshal de nyid na 'khod cing / bcom ldan 'das kyis zhabs kyi drung na spyod kyang / sangs rgyas kyi rnam par 'phrul pa de dag dang / byang chub sems dpa'i tshogs chen po de dag kyang ma mthong ngo/ /dze ta'i tshal 'jig rten gyi khams grangs med pa/ bsam gyis mi khyab pa rnam par dag pa'i yon tan dang / bkod pa yongs su 'dus pa de yang ma mthong ma shes te/ de ni snod du ma gyur pa'i phyir ro/ /

Again, it is like the case of a monk who has attained perfect control of mind and has reached extinction of perception and sensation: he neither perceives nor cognizes and does nothing with his six sense organs, but still is not totally extinct. All the ordinary events of the world are going on there where he is, but he does not perceive or cognize them, because of the overmastery of the power of his concentration. In the same way, the great disciples were in the Jeta grove and had the six sense faculties, but they did not see, penetrate, perceive, or discern the miracle of the power emanated from the concentration of the Buddha, nor did they gain access to, see, or cognize the great gathering of the enlightening beings, the miracle of the enlightening beings, the transfiguration of the enlightening beings. Why? The sphere of Buddha is indeed profound, vast, immeasurable, difficult to see, difficult to realize, difficult to plunge into, completely beyond all worldlings: for all disciples and individual illuminates, the sphere of Buddha is unthinkable and ungraspable. Therefore, the great disciples, even though they were there in the Jeta grove at the feet of the Buddha, did not see the transfigurations of the Buddha, and they did not see or apprehend the great gathering of enlightening beings or their concentration of the arrays of qualities of enlightening beings or their concentration of the arrays of qualities of inconceivable, innumerable purified worlds in the Jeta grove, because they did not have the capacity to do so.
de nas byang chub sems dpa' rnam par snang mdzad kyi smon lam gyi gtsug gi 'od zer rab tu snang bas sangs rgyas kyi byin gyi rlabs kyis de'i tshe tshigs su bcad pa 'di dag smras so/ /
At that time the enlightening being Light from the Origin of the Vows of the Illumination, by the power of Buddha, looked over the ten directions and then spoke these verses:

ltos shig sems can dam pa yi; ; sangs rgyas byang chub bsam mi khyab/ / rgyal bas sangs rgyas rnam 'phrul pa/ / dze ta'i rgyal mtshan 'di bstan to/ /
rang byung rnams kyi byin gyi rlabs/ / bgrang du med par 'byung ba la/ / sangs rgyas chos tshul mi shes pa'i/ / 'jig rten kun kyang mgo rmongs so/ /
chos kyi rgyal po'i cho 'phrul dag / tshad med bsam gyis mi khyab cing / / shin tu zab pa 'byung ba ni/ / de la 'jig rten 'babs mi nus/ /
rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kha dog mdog / mtshan gyis shin tu rnam par klubs/ / yang dag sangs rgyas bskyed pa yi/ / chos rab de dag mtshan nyid med/ /
rnam 'phrul mtha' dang dbus med pa/ / tshig gi lam gyis brjod dka' ba'i/ / rnam 'phrul shin tu zab pa dag / rgyal bas dze ta'i tshal du bstan/ /
rgyal sras bdag nyid che ba'i rnams/ / zhing rnams bsam yas bye ba nas/ / rgyal ba'i zhal ltar mos dga' ste/ / kun nas 'dus pa'i tshogs la ltos/ /
smon lam yongs su phun sum tshogs/ / spyod lam spyod pa chags med pa/ / de dag bsam pa shes par ni/ / 'jig rten kun gyis mi nus so/ /
de dag sems dang spyod yul dang / / spyod pa dag kyang nyan thos dang / / rang rgyal thams cad yongs kyis kyang / / rnam pa kun tu shes mi nus/ /
rgyal sras shes rab chen po'i rnams/ / gzhan gyis thub dka' pham bya la/ / dpa' ba'i rgyal mtshan ma 'dres shing / / ye shes sa la gzhol gyur pa/ /
ting 'dzin dpag tu tshad med la/ / grags chen mnyam par bzhag pa rnams; / chos dbyings thams cad rgyas bkang zhing / / rnam par 'phrul pa kun kyang ston/ /

See how inconceivable is the enlightenment of Buddha, the best of beings: In the Jeta grove he shows the Victor’s transfiguration of the enlightened.
He exercises incalculable independent power, Whereat the world is confused, not knowing Buddha’s qualities.
Profound is the miracle worked by the Spiritual Sovereign, Infinite, inconceivable, beyond the range of the world.
The buddhas are adorned with infinite attributes, But the truths revealed by the buddhas are signless.
The Victor shows transfigurations in the Jeta grove, Boundlessly deep, most hard to put into words.
The enlightening beings do not look at the assembly of saints, Having come from innumerable lands to see the Buddha.
They have attained the sphere of unobstructed, unattached action By their determination; no one in the world can know their will.
All those enlightened on their own and the disciples all around Do not know their doings or their state of mind.
The enlightening beings, great in wisdom, are invulnerable, invincible, Paragons of heroism, undefiled, certain of the stage of knowledge;
Beyond measure, of great fame, they have attained concentration And display a miracle extending throughout the cosmos.
de nas byang chub sems dpa' thub par dka' ba'i brtson 'grus kyi shugs kyi rgyal pos sangs rgyas kyi byin gyi rlabs kyis/ phyogs bcur rnam par bltas nas de'i tshe tshigs su bcad pa 'di dag smras so/ /
Then the enlightening being King of Invincible Energy, by the power of Buddha, looked over the ten directions and spoke these verses:

bsod nams snying po shes rab che/ / byang chub spyod pa'i tshul rtogs shing / / 'jig rten kun la bde byed pa'i/ / bde gshegs sku las skyes pa ltos/ /
yid gzhungs blo gros mtha' yas shing / / shin tu mnyam gzhag sems ldan pa; ; mtha' dang dbus med zab pa yi/ / ye shes rgya chen spyod yul can/ /
rgyan rab mang pos mdzes byas pa'i/ / dze ta'i nags tshal rgya che ba/ / byang chub sems dpa' kun rgyas shing / / bde gshegs bzhugs pa'i gnas gyur par/ /
gnas med mi gnas gyur pa rnams/ / phyogs rnams bcu nas kun 'dus te/ / pad+mo'i stan la 'khod pa dag / rgya mtsho mang la lta ba gyis/ /
gnas med len pa med pa rnams/ / spros pa med cing mi rten la/ / rdul bral chags pa'i sems med pa/ / chos kyi dbyings la gzhol ba dang / /
ye shes rgyal mtshan rab dpa' ba/ / rdo rje'i sems ni mi g.yo zhing / / grub pa med pa'i chos rnams la/ / mya ngan 'da' bar gang ston pa/ /
phyogs bcu'i zhing mang bye ba rnams/ / grangs kyis mi chod kun nas 'dus/ / yang dag sangs rgyas drung du lhags/ / gnyis kyi 'du shes rnam par spangs/ /
rang byung shAkya seng ge yi/ / rnam par 'phrul pa 'di dag mthong / / de yi byin rlabs dam pa yis/ / byang chub sems dpa' 'di dag lhags/ /
sangs rgyas chos la 'byed pa med/ / chos dbyings gzhi la'ang de bzhin te/ / spyod pa tsam du yongs 'byed pa'i/ / pha rol phyin pa rgyal ba'i sras/ /
chos kyi dbyings la dbyer med pa'i/ / mtha' la thug pa de dag gnas/ / tshig rnams yongs su zad med pas/ / chos la dbye ba'ang rab tu byed/ /

Full of virtue and great knowledge, gone to the goal of enlightening practice, Givers of security to all worlds—behold these, the offspring of Buddha, Intelligent, with boundless wisdom and well-concentrated minds, In the realm of boundlessly deep and broad knowledge.
The great grove called Jeta, where the perfect Buddha sojourns, Is adorned with magnificent arrays and filled with enlightening beings. See the Great Oceans, nonreliant, independent, Sitting on lotus thrones, having come from the ten directions:
Not resting on anything, not grasping, free from falsehood, without abode, With unattached minds, dispassionate, set on the reality realm. Exemplars of knowledge, great heroes, with unshakable adamant minds, In the midst of unperishing truths, they make a show of nirvana.
They have come together from countless worlds in the ten directions, Come to the Buddha, without any notions of duality. They see the miraculous transfiguration of the autonomous Buddha, By the power of which these enlightening beings have come.
They are nondiscriminatory in regard to Buddha teachings and the plane of realities; The offspring of Buddha have thoroughly realized that distinctions are merely mundane conventions. The buddhas stand in the undifferentiated ultimate limit of the reality realm, Yet show the differentiation of things by inexhaustible sayings.
de nas byang chub sems dpa' dpal kun nas 'phags pa'i gzi brjid rgyal pos sangs rgyas kyi byin gyi rlabs kyis phyogs bcur rnam par bltas te/ de'i tshe tshigs su bcad pa 'di dag smras so/ /
Then the enlightening being King of Fiery Energy of Universal Splendor, by the power of Buddha, looked over the ten directions and spoke these verses:

ltos shig sems can dam pa yi/ / ye shes dkyil 'khor shin tu yangs/ / dus dang dus min mkhyen mdzad cing / / sems can rnams la chos kyang ston/ /
mu stegs ldan pa tshogs 'dus pa'i; ; rgol ba thams cad rab tu 'joms/ / sems can bsam pa ji bzhin du/ / rnam par 'phrul pa yongs su ston/ /
phyogs na mi bzhugs bde gshegs rnams/ / sangs rgyas yul gyi rjes mi bzhud/ / tshad med pa dang tshad yod las/ / thub pa chen po 'das pa min/ /
nyi ma mkha' las 'gro ba ni/ / nyin bar 'grangs pa smos pa byed/ / de bzhin mkhyen pas mkhas ston pa/ / dus gsum chags pa med pas brjod/ /
zla ba nye ba'i mtshan mo la/ / zla ba'i dkyil 'khor 'phags par snang / / de bzhin chos dkar yongs rdzogs pa'i/ / mgon po rnams kyang mthong ba yin/ /
bar snang nam mkha'i dbyings 'di las/ / nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor rgyu ba ni/ / gar yang thogs pa med par 'gro/ / sangs rgyas rnam 'phrul de bzhin no/ /
ji ltar nam mkha' phyogs rnams kyi/ / zhing rnams kun la mi gnas pa/ / de bzhin 'jig rten sgron ma yi/ / sangs rgyas rnam 'phrul shes par bya/ /
ji ltar sa ni 'jig rten na/ / lus can kun gyi gnas yin pas/ / 'jig rten sgron ma'i 'jig rten na/ / chos kyi 'khor lo de ltar gnas/ /
ji ltar rlung ni chags med par/ / mkha' la mgyogs par rab rgyu ba/ / de bzhin sangs rgyas chos nyid kyang / / 'jig rten khams su rab tu rgyu/ /
ji ltar chu yi phung po la/ / zhing rnams 'grangs pa kun gnas pa/ / de bzhin dus gsum sangs rgyas kyang / / ye shes tshogs la rab tu gnas/ /

See the immense sphere of knowledge of the best of beings; Knowing when is the right time and when not, he teaches the truth to people. Destroying the various arguments marshaled by heretics, He shows beings’ spiritual transfigurations according to their dispositions.
Buddha is not finite or infinite: The great sage has transcended finitude and infinity. Like the sun coursing through the sky giving light every day, So does the sagacious guide appear, independent of past, present, and future.
As the sphere of the full moon shines at night, So does one see the guide, full of pure qualities. As the globe of the sun courses through space without stopping, Such is the transfiguration of the Buddha.
Just as space is independent of all land, So is the Buddha transfiguration of the Lamp of the World to be known. As the earth is the support of all corporeal beings in the world, In the same way is the wheel of teaching of the Lamp of the World steadfast.
As the wind blows swiftly through the sky, not sticking to anything, In the same way does the nature of Buddha operate in the world. Just as all lands are founded on a mass of water, So are the buddhas of all times founded on a mass of knowledge.
de nas byang chub sems dpa' dpal gyi snying po chags pa med pa'i rgyal pos sangs rgyas kyi byin gyi rlabs kyis phyogs bcur rnam par bltas te/ de'i tshe tshigs su bcad pa 'di dag smras so/ /
Then the enlightening being King of Unobstructed Splendor, by the power of Buddha, looked over the ten directions and spoke these verses:

ji ltar rdo rje ri rab brag / zang yag shin tu mtho yod pa/ / de ltar 'jig rten kun skyob pa'i/ / sangs rgyas mngon par 'phags pas mtho/ /
ji ltar rgya mtsho'i chu chen dag / tshad med rnyog pa med pa ltar/ / sangs rgyas mthong ba'ang de bzhin te/ / 'jig rten kun gyi skom pa gcod/ /
rgya mtsho'i chu las 'phags pa yi/ / ri bo ri rab ci 'dra bar/ / de bzhin 'jig rten sgron ma yang / / chos kyi mtsho las mngon par 'phags/ /
rin chen kun gyi 'byung gnas kyis/ / rgya mtsho rgyas pa ji bzhin du/ / rang byung ye shes de bzhin te/ / mi zad skad cig rab tu mkhyen/ /
mgon po'i ye shes shin tu zab/ / tshad med de bzhin bgrang du med/ / de bas sangs rgyas rnam 'phrul ba/ / bsam gyis mi khyab tshad med ston; ;
sgyu ma'i mtshan nyid ston pa yi/ / sgyu mkhan mkhas pa ci 'dra ba/ / de ltar sangs rgyas mkhyen dbang yang / / rnam par 'phrul ba rab tu ston/ /
yid bzhin nor bu rnam dag pa; ; bsam don rdzogs byed ji lta ba/ / de bzhin bsam pa dag pa la/ / rgyal ba smon lam rdzogs pa mdzad/ /
'od snang gsal ba byed pa yi/ / rin chen rnam snang ji lta ba/ / de ltar thams cad mkhyen pa dag / 'gro ba'i bsam pa gsal bar mdzad/ /
ji ltar phyogs la mngon lta ba'i/ / rin chen zur brgyad rab gnas pa/ / de bzhin chags med sgron ma yang / / chos dbyings rab tu snang ba mdzad/ /
chu rin chen 'od gsal ba/ / ji ltar dri med chu byed/ / de bzhin sangs rgyas mthong bas kyang / / 'gro ba'i dbang po dag par 'gyur/ /

Like a lofty mountain made of diamond Does Buddha emerge in the world, savior of all beings. Like the water of the ocean, immeasurable, pure, Does the sight of Buddha stop the thirst of the world.
Just as the polar mountain emerges from the ocean water, So does the Light of the World emerge from the ocean of truth. Like an ocean filled with deposits of jewels Is the Independent One’s instant awareness of endless knowledge.
Profound is the Guide’s knowledge, incalculable, infinite, By which he shows infinite inconceivable Buddha transfigurations. As an expert magician shows illusory forms, Buddha, master of knowledge, displays transfigurations.
As a pure wish-fulfilling jewel grants what is desired, The Victor fulfills the aspirations of those whose intentions are pure. Like a luminous jewel shining, Omniscience, pure, illumines beings’ minds.
Like an octagonal jewel facing all directions, The Unobstructed Lamp illumines the cosmos. Like a water-clarifying light purifying water, Vision of Buddha purifies people’s senses.

de nas byang chub sems dpa' chos kyi dbyings su smon lam rab tu 'phrul ba'i zla ba'i rgyal pos/ /sangs rgyas kyi byin gyi rlabs kyis phyogs bcur rnam par bltas te/ de'i tshe tshigs su bcad pa 'di dag smras so/ /
Then the enlightening being Supreme Moon of Vows Emanated throughout the Cosmos, by the power of Buddha, looked over the ten directions and spoke these verses:

phyogs 'di in+d+ra nI la yis/ / kha dog mdog gcig byas pa ltar/ / sangs rgyas mthong bas skye dgu rnams/ / de bzhin byang chub mdog tu 'gyur/ /
sangs rgyas rdul phran re re la/ / rnam par 'phrul ba sna tshogs rnams/ / tshad kyis gzhal du med pa ston/ / byang chub sems dpa' rnam dag mdzad/ /
de ni rmad byung shin tu zab/ / mtha' yas bsgrub pa dga' ba ste/ / blo ldan ye shes yul de la/ / 'jig rten rnams ni 'bab mi nus/ /
byang chub sems dpa' bsgrub don du/ / bkod pa phun sum tshogs pa dang / / sangs rgyas tshul gyis rnam sbyangs pa'i/ / chos kyi dbyings la 'jug pa ston/ /
sangs rgyas zhing rnams bsam yas pa/ / blo ldan bskor ba'i sangs rgyas kyis/ / kun nas gang bar gyur pa yang / / rgyal ba de la ston pa mdzad/ /
chos kun mnga' sgyur ston pa ste/ / shAkya'i khyu mchog skyes par gyur/ / de yi cho 'phrul tshad med pa/ / 'di dag rab tu byung ba yin; ;
brtan pa'i spyod pa sna tshogs rnams/ / tshad med rnam par gzigs gyur nas/ / rnam par 'phrul ba mtha' yas pa/ / tshad med gzi can ston pa mdzad/ /
'jig rten mgon po rgyal sras rnams/ / chos kyi dbyings la slob pa mdzad/ / chos rnams thams cad yongs la yang / / chags med ye shes spyod yul 'gyur/ /
skyes bu dbang po'i byin rlabs kyis/ / cho 'phrul brgya dang rab ldan zhing / / 'jig rten thams cad rnam sbyong ba'i/ / chos kyi 'khor lo rab tu bskor/ /
sems can gtso bo'i yul la yang / / ye shes dkyil 'khor yongs sbyangs shing / / shes rab chen po'i klu chen rnams/ / 'jig rten thams cad 'grel bar 'gyur/ /

As everywhere is made one hue by an emerald, Vision of Buddha makes beings the hue of enlightenment. In each atom Buddha shows transformation of various kinds, Beyond measure, purifying the enlightening beings.
That is extremely profound, unlimited, hard to approach, In the realm of knowledge of the wise, inaccessible to worldlings. The full arrays of adornments purified by the works of Buddha Are perceived by enlightening beings entering the reality realm.
The inconceivable buddha-lands where the Victor appears Are filled with buddhas surrounded by the wise, everywhere. The Teacher, master of all truths, the Hero of the Shakyas, has come forth: It is his immeasurable miracle that has appeared.
You see the variety of the infinite deeds of the resolute: The one of infinite splendor shows endless transformations. The Leader of the World teaches the offspring of Buddha about the reality realm; And they develop the range of knowledge unattached in all things.
Buddha’s wheel of teaching turns by spiritual power, Filled with hundreds of miracles, purifying all worlds. In the realm of the Best of Beings, their sphere of knowledge purified, The Great Dragons, rich in wisdom, liberate all beings.
de nas byang chub sems dpa' chos kyi don gyi blo gros gzi brjid rgyal pos/ bcom ldan 'das kyi byin gyi rlabs kyis phyogs bcur rnam par bltas te/ de'i tshe tshigs su bcad pa 'di dag smras so/ /
Then the enlightening being King of Fiery Energy of Truth, by the power of Buddha, looked over the ten directions and spoke these verses:

drang srong dam pa'i mchog rnams kyi/ / dus gsum nyan thos gang byung ba/ / de dag kun gyis bde gshegs kyi/ / gshegs thabs 'jog 'deg mi shes so/ /
dus gsum ma lus thams cad kyi/ / ma nor rang rgyal gang byung ba/ / de dag gis kyang mgon po yi/ / gshegs thabs 'jog 'deg mi rig go /
ma rig mun pas bsgribs pa rnams/ / khyi ltar ltong la brgyus pa yi/ / sems can de 'dra kun gyis ni/ / mgon po mi shes smos mi dgos/ /
rgyal ba tshad mas gzhal ba min/ / de ni shes par mi nus te/ / sangs rgyas chags med ye shes can/ / tshig gi lam las shin tu 'das/ /
zla ba nya rgyas 'od mnga' ba/ / brtan pa mtshan gyis rnam par bris/ / de ni bskal pa dpag yas par/ / rnam 'phrul thog med spyod pa mdzad/ /
tshul sgo re res sangs rgyas la/ / shin tu mnyam gzhag bsams byas kyang / / bskal pa bye ba bsam yas pa/ / brjod du med pa zad 'gyur gyi/ /
rang byung rnams kyi yon tan las/ / phyogs gcig cha yi mthar mi phyin/ / sangs rgyas de yi zhal bltas kyang / / sangs rgyas chos ni bsam mi khyab/ /
gang zhig de la smon byed cing / / gang zhig yid kyis dga' mos pa/ / de dag kun kyang de 'dra ba'i/ / spyod yul blta dka' 'thob par 'gyur/ /
bsod nams ye shes mtha' yas shing / / tshogs chen yangs pas rnam gnon la/ / dri med blo ldan sems gnas pa/ / de dag 'di yi tshul la 'jug /
de dag smon lam rgya che bas/ / sems dang sdom pa rgya che ste/ / rgyal ba'i spyod yul thob gyur cing / / byang chub rgya chen gnon par 'gyur/ /

The disciples trained in past, present, and future, foremost sages, Do not even know a footstep of a perfect buddha. Even all individual illuminates Do not know a footstep of the Protector.
How much less could ordinary beings know the Guide, As they are bound in chains and wrapped in the dark of ignorance. Unquantifiable, the Victor cannot be known by any scales; Endowed with unobstructed knowledge, Buddha transcends the path of words.
Radiant as the full moon, steady, adorned with a multitude of qualities, He passes infinite eons creating transformations. Thinking of the Buddha in every way with perfect concentration, Even after untold billions of eons Buddha would still be inconceivable.
One cannot understand the limit of even a single attribute of the Independent, Even while gazing on Buddha, for the qualities of Buddha are inconceivable. Those who are intent on this, and whose minds delight therein, Will attain these realms, which are so hard to see.
Valiant ones of great resources, intelligent, pure-minded, stable, Enter into this teaching, made of endless virtue and knowledge. Great is their aspiration, great their discipline of mind; They will attain great enlightenment, having arrived at the sphere of the Victor.

de nas byang chub sems dpa' bdud kyi dkyil 'khor rnam par 'thor ba'i ye shes rgyal mtshan gyi rgyal pos/ sangs rgyas kyi byin gyi rlabs kyis phyogs bcur rnam par bltas te/ de'i tshe tshigs su bcad pa 'di dag smras so; ;
Then the enlightening being Standard of Knowledge Scattering All Bands of Demons, by the power of Buddha, looked over the ten directions and spoke these verses:

chags med ye shes sku mnga' bas/ / rang byung rnams ni sku med de/ / bsam yas ye shes yul mnga' bas/ / de dag bsam par mi nus so/ /
'phrin las dkar po bsam yas pas/ / sangs rgyas sku rab bsgrub pa'i phyir/ / de la 'jig rten gsum mi 'go / mtshan dang dpe byad bzang pos mdzes/ /
chos kyi dbyings kyis rnam sbyangs pas/ / 'jig rten kun tu snang ba mdzad/ / sangs rgyas byang chub sgo yin te/ / ye shes kun gyi gnas chen no/ /
chags pa thams cad rnam spangs pas/ / rdul med spros pa mi mnga' 'o/ / ye shes 'od zer rab 'gyed pas/ / 'jig rten kun tu nyi ma 'dra/ /
khams gsum thams cad rnam sbyong bas/ / srid pa'i 'jigs pa rnam par gcod/ / byang chub sems dpa' sgrub pa mdzad/ / byang chub 'byung gnas de bzhin no/ /
kha dog mtha' yas ston mdzad kyang / / kha dog kun la gnas pa med/ / sems can kun gyis bsam yas pa'i/ / kha dog tshad med yongs su ston/ /
skad cig gcig la sangs rgyas kyis/ / byang chub bsam yas sbyangs pas na/ / de yi ye shes mthar phyin par/ / brtag par sus kyang mi nus so/ /
ye shes brtan pa zad mi shes/ / rang bzhin rnam par 'gyur ba med/ / de la dus gsum rgyal ba kun/ / skad cig gcig gis rab tu brjod/ /
rtag par las gzhan yongs btang ste; ; shes ldan byang chub don gnyer bas/ / sems la sems shes bya bar yang / / de la sems skye med par bsam/ /
gang gis sangs rgyas bskyed pa yi/ / sangs rgyas chos rnams bsam mi khyab/ / de dag brjod pa'i yul ma yin/ / shin tu zab pas tshig lam spangs/ /

Being the body of unobstructed knowledge, the Independent is incorporeal; In the realm of inconceivable knowledge, that cannot be conceived. The buddha-body is realized by inconceivable pure deeds; Undefiled by the triple world, it shines with distinctive embellishments.
Universal light of the world, having clarified the reality realm, It is also the door of enlightenment, the mine of all knowledge. Dispassionate, free from falsehood, having shed all hindrances, As the sun of the world Buddha radiates lights of knowledge.
That which removes the fears of existence and purifies those in the triple world, The development of enlightening beings is thus the mine of buddhas’ enlightenment. Buddha shows infinite forms without sticking to any form, And shows those inconceivable forms through all living creatures.
No one can reach the end of the knowledge of Buddha, By which inconceivable enlightenment is instantly clarified. Inexhaustible exposition of knowledge, wherein are the buddhas of all times, Is produced in a single instant, without any change in essence.
The wise seeker of enlightenment, engaged in endless action, should always think— Although it be thought, no thought is born in this thought. The inconceivable elements of buddhahood realized by the perfectly enlightened Are profound beyond all telling, beyond the scope of words.

de nas byang chub sems dpa' rnam par snang mdzad kyi smon lam dpal gyi rgyal mtshan gyis; sangs rgyas kyi byin gyi rlabs kyis phyogs bcur rnam par bltas te/ de'i tshe tshigs su bcad pa 'di dag smras so/ /
Then the enlightening being Flames of Knowledge of Vows of the Illuminator, by the power of Buddha, looked over the ten directions and spoke these verses:

dran pa rmongs med dag pa rnams/ / chos 'dzin shin tu nges rtags shing / / blo gros bsam gyis mi khyab la/ / byang chub rgya mtsho mi zad pa/ /
de dag yid ni 'di la nges/ / de dag spyod pa'i spyod yul yin/ / de dag shes pa 'dir mi g.yo/ / de dag 'di la the tshom 'chad/ /
de dag skyo bar mi 'gyur te/ / de dag yid kyang zhum mi 'gyur/ / sangs rgyas chos la rab gzhol bar/ / de dag sems kyang rab tu 'byung / /
de dag dad pa rting tshugs shing / / yang dag 'phags pa rab tu skye/ / dmigs med gnas pa med pa yi/ / ye shes 'di la de dag dga'/ /
bskal pa bye bar bsags pa yi/ / yongs su rdzogs pa dge ba'i chos/ / ye shes 'di 'dod mtshungs med pa/ / de dag thams cad yongs su bsngo/ /
'khor ba'i nang na rnam rgyu yang / / 'khor ba dag la gnas pa min/ / sangs rgyas chos rnams rab rtogs pas/ / sangs rgyas yul la rab tu rtse/ /
sems can khams na ji snyed du/ / 'jig rten phun sum tshogs rgyu ba/ / de dag thams cad brtan pas spangs/ / sangs rgyas phun sum tshogs la gnas/ /
sangs rgyas rtag tu 'byung gyur kyang / / 'jig rten don med rab tu gnas/ / chags med spyod pa de dag ni/ / rtag tu sems can don la gnas/ /
de dag spyod pa mtshungs med de; ; lus can kun gyis bsam mi khyab/ / 'jig rten bde ba kun sems pas/ / de dag sdug bsngal rnam par bzlog /
'jig rten kun la snying brtse zhing / / byang chub ye shes rnam dag pas/ / de dag 'jig rten snang bar gyur/ / 'jig rten thams cad rab tu 'grel/ /

Those of unerring recollection, pure, born of truth, of certain mind And inconceivable wisdom, are inexhaustible oceans of enlightenment. This is the sphere of action of those whose minds are resolved hereon; Their knowledge is unshakable, they have ended doubt.
They do not become depressed or dejected; Their minds are on the way to buddhahood. Filled with good qualities realized over countless eons, The peerless seekers of knowledge dedicate them all.
They think about the course of life but do not take refuge in it— They take refuge in the Buddha teachings, sporting in the realm of Buddha. Whatever mundane fortune takes place in the world of sentient beings, The resolute relinquish it all, for they are set on the attainment of buddhahood.
Vainly clinging, the world is always fettered— There, those of unobstructed action are always set on the welfare of beings. Unequaled in their action, inconceivable to all beings, They consider the happiness of the world, whereby suffering is repelled.
They have purified knowledge of enlightenment and are sympathetic to all beings, As lights of the world, emancipating all beings.
de nas byang chub sems dpa' sgrib pa thams cad rnam par 'thor ba'i rgyal pos/ sangs rgyas kyi byin gyi rlabs kyis phyogs bcur rnam par bltas te/ de'i tshe tshigs su bcad pa 'di dag smras so/ /
Then the enlightening being Valiant One with Knowledge to Disperse All Barriers, by the power of Buddha, looked over the ten directions and spoke these verses:

bskal pa bye ba phrag brgyar yang / / sangs rgyas sgra ni rab dkon na/ / the tshom thams cad gcod pa yi/ / dam pa mthong ba ci zhig smos/ /
chos kun thugs su chud rtogs pa/ / 'jig rten gsum po'i bsod nams stegs/ / sems can thams cad rnam sbyong ba'i/ / 'jig rten sgron ma mthong gis dga'/ /
sems can gtso bo ma smad pa'i/ / gzugs kyi sku ni mthong gyur na/ / bskal pa bye ba khrag khrig tu/ / ngoms shing tshim pa skyer mi btub/ /
mi yi dbang po'i sku gzugs la/ / rgyal ba'i sras rnams blta blta zhing / / rang gi dge ba chags med pa/ / gzhan don brtson pa byang chub bsngo/ /
thub pa chen po'i gzugs kyi sku/ / de las tha dad yang dag shes/ / chags med ye shes 'byung 'gyur bas/ / de ni sangs rgyas byang chub sgo/ /
sems can bsam yas tshad med pa/ / snang bas mdzad de theg chen la/ / btsud nas thub pa chen po'i mchog / byang chub dam par lung yang ston/ /
bsod nams chen po'i rang bzhin zhing / / ye shes dkyil 'khor shar cing 'byung / / 'jig rten tshad mad [*med?] kun tu snang / / bsod nams phung po rnam 'phel mdzad/ /
sdug bsngal dra ba rab tu gcod/ / ye shes phung po rnam par sbyong / / gang gis rgyal ba bsnyen bkur pa; ; de dag ngan song 'jigs pa med/ /
rkang gnyis dam pa mthong gyur na/ / shin tu yangs pa'i sems skye ste/ / 'od snang gsal ba'i shes rab mthu/ / grangs med pa yang skye bar 'gyur/ /
sangs rgyas skyes bu'i mchog mthong zhing / / byang chub dam par nges par 'gyur/ / de bzhin gshegs par 'gyur bya zhes/ / de dag kun kyang nges par sems/ /

The name of Buddha is hard to come by even in a billion eons— How much more so the sight of Buddha, supreme, which ends all desires. Buddha appears as the light of the world, gone to the goal of all truth, Worthy of the offerings of the three worlds, purifier of all beings.
Those who regard the physical form of the impeccable best of beings Never tire of it even in countless eons. Offspring of the Victor looking at the form body of the Lord of Humans, Unattached, dedicate themselves purely to enlightenment, seeking the highest goal.
This is the door to enlightenment, the corporeal embodiment of the Great Sage, Whence issue unhindered, inexhaustible analytic intellectual powers. Having illumined infinite beings, the Great Sage foretells their supreme Enlightenment, having led them into the Great Vehicle.
The great field of blessings, a sphere of knowledge, has emerged And illuminates infinite beings, increasing the mass of virtue. There is no fear of evil ways for those who associate now with Buddha, The one who cuts through the net of misery and purifies the mass of knowledge.
A great mind is born in those who see the Buddha, Immeasurable wisdom and power is born, radiant as the moon. They will be sure of enlightenment, having seen the Buddha, And will be certain that they will become buddhas themselves.
de nas byang chub sems dpa' chos kyi dbyings kyi smon lam gyi gzhi rab tu rtogs pas/ sangs rgyas kyi byin gyi rlabs kyis de'i tshe tshigs su bcad pa 'di dag smras so/ /
Then the enlightening being King of Superknowledge Discerning the Differentiations of the Plane of the Cosmos, by the power of Buddha, looked over the ten directions and spoke these verses:

yon tan mtha' yas phun ldan pa/ / shAkya'i khyu mchog thub mthong nas/ / yongs su bsngo ba byed pa'i sems/ / theg pa che la rnam par 'dag /
sems can kun gyi don gyi phyir/ / thugs rje mnga' ba brtan pa'i rnams/ / chos kyi 'khor lo bskor mdzad pa/ / de bzhin gshegs pa 'byung bar 'gyur/ /
bskal pa khrag khrig phrag brgyar yang / / sems can don la brtson mdzad pa'i/ / sangs rgyas rnams la lus can rnams/ / kun gyis lan glan cis kyang nus/ /
ngan song gsum po mi bzad par/ / bskal pa bye bar btsos bla yi/ / chags pa thams cad zlog mdzad pa'i/ / ston pa mi mthong ma yin no/ /
sems can kun gyi rgyud rnams na/ / sdug bsngal phung po ci yod pa/ / ma lus nyams su bzod nus kyi/ / sangs rgyas mi mthong ma yin no/ /
'jig rten 'di dag thams cad na/ / tha dad ngan song rgyud yod pa/ / de dag yun ring gnas bla yi/ / sangs rgyas mi thos ma yin no/ /
sems can dmyal ba re rer yang / / bskal pa tshad med gnas bla yi/ / mtha' yas rgyal bas brnyes pa yi/ / byang chub mchog las ring gnas min/ /
ci zhig phyir ni ngan song du/ / yun ring gnas par 'dod ce na/ / rgyal ba'i dbang po mthong ba ni/ / ye shes 'phel ba'i rgyur 'gyur phyir/ /
rgyal ba 'jig rten mchog mthong na/ / sdug bsngal thams cad 'chad par 'gyur/ / rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas spyod yul gyi/ / ye shes khong du chud pa 'byung / /
sangs rgyas mi yi mchog mthong zhing / / sgrib pa thams cad zad par 'gyur/ / byang chub gang gis 'thob pa yi/ / bsod nams tshad med 'phel bar 'gyur/ /
sangs rgyas mthong bas sems can rnams/ / the tshom yid gnyis chad par 'gyur/ / 'jig rten 'das dang 'jig rten gyi/ / bsam pa'ang yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur/ /

Having seen the Sage endowed with infinite virtues, The minds of those dedicated to the Great Vehicle are purified. The buddhas appear for the welfare of all beings, Universally compassionate, steadfast, turning the wheel of the teaching.
How can all creatures requite the buddhas’ Countless eons of dedication to their welfare? It is better to burn in the fearsome three evils for eons Than not to see the Teacher, who quells all attachments.
All the mass of suffering that takes place in all realms of being Is tolerable, but not deprivation of the sight of Buddha. It is better to live long in every miserable way in the world Than not to hear the buddhas.
Each eon spent even in hell is better Then elsewhere apart from Buddha, distant from enlightenment. What is the reason for wanting to live long amid calamities? It is to see the Buddha and increase in Knowledge.
All miseries are ended once the Buddha has been seen, And entry into knowledge takes place, into the sphere of the enlightened. All obstructions are removed when Buddha is seen, Increasing measureless virtue, whereby enlightenment is attained.
Sight of Buddha severs all doubts of sentient beings And fulfills all purposes, mundane and transcendental.

de nas byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po kun tu bzang pos byang chub sems dpa'i tshogs thams cad la rnam par bltas te/ de bzhin gshegs pa'i ting nge 'dzin seng ge rnam par bsgyings pa 'di nyid de bas kyang rnam par dbye ba dang / rgya cher brjod pa dang / gsal bar bya ba dang / rab tu brjod pa dang / yang dag par bstan pa dang / shin tu snang bar bya ba dang / rab tu gsal bar bya ba dang / man ngag bstan pa'i phyir chos kyi dbyings kyi tshul nam mkha'i dbyings dang mnyam pas dus gsum mnyam pa nyid dang / chos kyi dbyings mnyam pa nyid dang / sems can gyi khams mnyam pa nyid dang / 'jig rten thams cad mnyam pa nyid dang / las kyi rgyud thams cad mnyam pa nyid dang / sems can gyi bsam pa mnyam pa nyid dang / sems can gyi mos pa mnyam pa nyid dang / chos kyi snang ba mnyam pa nyid dang / sems can yongs su smin par bya ba'i dus mnyam pa nyid dang / 'gro ba thams cad kyi dbang po mnyam pa nyid kyis de bzhin gshegs pa'i ting nge 'dzin seng ge rnam par bsgyings pa 'di nyid/ byang chub sems dpa' de dag la bstan pa'i tshul bcus yang dag par rab tu ston te/ bcu gang zhe na/ 'di lta ste; chos kyi dbyings thams cad du gtogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing gi rdul shin tu phra ba rnams la/ sangs rgyas gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pa bstan pa dang / 'di lta ste/ nam mkha'i dbyings kyis klas pa'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing thams cad du phyi ma'i mtha'i mur thug pa'i bskal par de bzhin gshegs pa'i yon tan rjes su brjod pa bstan pa dang / 'di lta ste sangs rgyas kyi zhing thams cad du de bzhin gshegs pa yongs su skye ba dang / mtha' dang dbus med pa'i mngon par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi sgo rgya mtsho yongs su brjod cing bstan pa dang / 'di lta ste/ nam mkha'i dbyings kyis klas pa'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing gi de bzhin gshegs pa'i 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor gyi byang chub sems dpa'i dge 'dun snying po byang chub la mngon du gyur pa'i gnas bstan pa dang / 'di lta ste/ dus gsum gyi sangs rgyas kyi sku dang 'dra bar sprul pa/ ba spu'i sgo thams cad nas sems skad cig la rab tu dgye zhing chos kyi dbyings rgyas par dgang ba bstan pa dang / 'di lta ste/ phyogs rgya mtsho thams cad du sangs rgyas kyi zhing rgya mtsho gzhi mnyam par byin gyis brlab cing / lus gcig gis rgyas par dgang ba bstan pa dang / 'di lta ste/ dmigs pa'i gzhi thams cad la sangs rgyas kyis rnam par sprul pa dus gsum thams cad yang dag par gzhol bar 'gyur ba'i byin gyi rlabs yang dag par bstan pa dang / 'di lta ste/ zhing thams cad kyi rdul shin tu phra ba rnams la/ dus gsum gyi zhing gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pa'i sangs rgyas kyi rnam par 'phrul pa dang / bskal pa rgya mtsho yongs su bshad cing bstan pa dang / 'di lta ste/ dus gsum gyi sangs rgyas kyi smon lam rgya mtsho thams cad ba spu'i sgo thams cad nas rab tu brjod pa phyi ma'i mthar byin gyis brlabs pas/ byang chub sems dpa' yang dag par 'byung ba bstan pa dang / 'di lta ste/ chos kyi dbyings dang mnyam pa'i seng ge'i khri dang / byang chub sems dpa'i 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor dang / byang chub sems dpa'i snying po'i rgyan tha mi dad pa dang / chos kyi 'khor lo rnam pa tha dad pa rab tu bskor pa phyi ma'i mthar byin gyis brlab pa bstan pa'o/ / kye rgyal ba'i sras/ de ltar seng ge rnam par bsgyings pa'i ting nge 'dzin 'di la bstan pa bcu po 'di dag la sogs pa shin tu bstan pa/ sangs rgyas rgyas kyi zhing brjod du med pa'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed de/ kye rgyal ba'i sras dag /de ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes kyi spyod yul lo/ /

Then the great enlightening being Universally Good, having looked over the host of enlightening beings everywhere, to further analyze, discuss in detail, explain, reveal, elucidate, bring to light, illumine, and point out, by means of the cosmos of truths, equal to the realm of space, equal to past, present, and future, equal to the realm of realities, equal to the realm of beings, equal to the realm of all worlds, equal to all sets of actions, equal to the dispositions of beings, equal to the interests of beings, equal to the specific illustrations of truth, equal to the appropriate times for the maturation of beings, and equal to the faculties of all beings, elucidated this “lion emergence” concentration of Buddha by means of ten indications: indication of the succession of all buddhas and the succession of lands in the atoms of the buddha-lands throughout all universes; indication of the seeking and following of virtues of the buddhas in all buddha-lands in space throughout the future; indication of buddhas emerging in all buddha-lands and showing the ocean of infinitely various doors of enlightenment; indication of the hosts of enlightening beings in the circles of the buddhas in the buddha-lands throughout space facing the terrace of enlightenment; indication of pervading the cosmos in a moment of thought with emanations in the forms of the buddhas of past, present, and future, emitted from every pore; indication of the light of magical pervasion of all multitudes of lands in all the oceans in all directions equally with one body; indication of revelation of the power of concentration of all pasts, presents, and futures of the transfigurations of the state of buddhahood in the surfaces of all objects; indication of manifestation of the oceans of eons of various successive transfigurations of Buddha in the lands of past, present, and future, equal to the atoms in all lands; indication of the birth of enlightening beings from the endless power emanating from every pore by the ocean of vows of all buddhas of past, present, and future; indication of endless manifestation of varied expositions of truth amid equal adornments of sites of enlightenment with circles of enlightening beings around lion thrones equal in extent to the cosmos: “These ten, O offspring of the Victor,” said Samantabhadra, the Universally Good enlightening being, “are the first ten of as many expressions of the ‘lion emergence’ concentration as atoms in untold buddha-lands, which I follow.
