de dag la sogs pa tshe dang ldan pa shA ri'i bus 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa lam du zhugs pa'i yon tan gyi rgyan tshad med pa dag dge slong de dag la yongs su bstan to/ / brjod do/ /bshad do/ /smos so/ /bkrol lo/ /rab tu brjod do/ /rnam par phye'o/ /gsal bar byas so/ / de ltar gnas brtan shA ri'i bus 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa'i yon tan ji tsam du brjod pa de tsam du dge slong de dag gi sems rnam par dag par gyur to/ /rab tu dang bar gyur to/ /dga' ba'i shugs rnam par 'phel bar gyur to/ /mos pa skyes par gyur to/ /de dag gi sems kyi rgyud las su rung bar gyur to/ /dbang po rab tu dang bar gyur to/ /yid bde ba rnam par 'phel bar gyur to/ /yid mi bde ba rab tu byang bar gyur to; ;sems kyi skyon dang bral bar gyur to/ /sgrib pa thams cad phyir ldog par gyur to/ /sangs rgyas blta ba la mngon par mos par gyur to/ /sangs rgyas kyi chos la sems rab tu gzhol bar gyur to/ /byang chub sems dpa'i dbang po yongs su dag par gyur to/ /byang chub sems dpa'i dad pa'i shugs skyes par gyur to/ /snying rje chen po 'byung bar gyur to; ;pha rol tu phyin pa'i dkyil 'khor gnon par gyur to/ /snying rje chen po yongs su skyes par gyur to/ /phyogs bcu'i sangs rgyas rgya mtsho yongs su snang bar gyur to/ /de ltar de dag thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du mos pa'i shugs thob par gyur nas 'di skad 'dzer to/ /mkhan po/ bdag cag kyang skyes bu dam pa de'i drung du phyin par mdzad du gsol zhes nas/

Beginning with these, Shariputra revealed and described to the monks measureless arrays of qualities of the procession of Manjushri, and as Shariputra spoke of the qualities of Manjushri, the minds of the monks were purified, calmed, and delighted; they were thrilled, their mental states became suitable for religious practice, their senses became clear and tranquil, their gladness increased and their depression vanished, all obstructions disappeared, they came face to face with the vision of Buddha, they dedicated their minds to the buddha-teachings, their enlightening faculties were clarified, the power of faith of enlightening beings rose in them, great compassion developed in them, they entered the sphere of the transcendences, they conceived great vows and came to perceive the oceans of buddhas in the ten directions: with this supreme power of faith in omniscience, they said to Shariputra, “Teacher, lead us to the presence of that wise person.”

de nas tshe dang ldan pa shA ri'i bu dge slong de dag dang 'grogs te/ 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa gang na ba der song nas 'di skad ces smras so/ /'jam dpal/ dge slong 'di dag ni khyod la blta bar 'dod pa dag go / de nas 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pas dge slong de dag dang / 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor gyi sa'i phyogs de tsam dang bcas pa glang po'i lta stangs kyi sa gzi dang ldan par khyab par bltas pa dang / de'i rjes la dge slong de dag gis 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa'i rkang pa gnyis la spyi bos phyag 'tshal nas/ thal mo sbyar te 'di skad ces smras so/ /skyes bu dam pa khyod mthong ba dang / khyod la phyag 'tshal ba'i dge ba'i rtsa ba 'di dang / bdag cag gi dge ba'i rtsa ba gzhan khyod kyis mkhyen pa dang / mkhan pos thugs su chud pa dang / gang yang bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa shAkya thub pas mngon du gzigs pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba des khyod ci 'dra bar de 'dra bar gyur te/ rnam pa 'di 'dra ba'i lus thob par shog cig /rnam pa 'di 'dra ba'i dbyangs dang / rnam pa 'di 'dra ba'i mtshan dang / 'di lta bu'i rnam par 'phrul pa dag kyang khyod ji lta ba bzhin thob par shog cig ces/ dge slong de dag gis de skad du smras pa dang / 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pas/ dge slong de dag la 'di skad ces smras so/ /dge slong dag /yongs su mi skyo ba'i sems bskyed pa bcu dang ldan pa'i rigs kyi bu'am/ rigs kyi bu mo theg pa chen po la zhugs pa ni/ byang chub sems dpa'i sa lta smos kyang ci smos kyi/ de bzhin gshegs pa'i sa yang gnon par 'gyur ro/ /bcu gang zhe na/

Then Shariputra went together with the monks to Manjushri and said, “O Manjushri, these monks want to see you.” Then Manjushri, who was together with a great host of transfigured enlightening beings, turned with the gaze of an elephant and looked at the monks. The monks then bowed their heads to the feet of Manjushri, saluted him, and said, “By this root of goodness, witnessed by the blessed Shakyamuni Buddha—by the root of goodness may we become like you, may we attain bodies, voices, embellishments, and spiritual transfigurations like you.”
To this Manjushri replied, “A man or woman setting out on the Great Vehicle imbued with ten indefatigable determinations will enter the stage of realization of Thusness, to say nothing of the stage of enlightening beings. What are the ten?

'di lta ste/ de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad blta ba dang / bsnyen bkur ba dang / mchod pa dang / rim gro bya ba la yongs su mi skyo ba'i sems bskyed pa dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad bsags pa las phyir mi ldog cing / yongs su mi skyo ba'i sems bskyed pa dang / chos thams cad btsal ba la yongs su mi skyo ba'i sems bskyed pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i pha rol tu phyin pa thams cad sbyor ba la yongs su mi skyo ba'i sems bskyed pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i ting nge 'dzin thams cad yongs su bsgrub pa la yongs su mi skyo ba'i sems bskyed pa dang / dus gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pa thams cad du 'jug pa la yongs su mi skyo ba'i sems bskyed pa dang / phyogs bcu'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing rgya mtsho rgyas par dgang zhing yongs su dag par bya ba la yongs su mi skyo ba'i sems bskyed pa dang / sems can gyi khams thams cad yongs su smin par bya ba dang / gdul ba la yongs su mi skyo ba'i sems bskyed pa dang / zhing dang bskal pa thams cad du byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa mngon par bsgrub pa la yongs su mi skyo ba'i sems bskyed pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing thams cad kyi rdul shin tu phra ba snyed kyi pha rol tu phyin pa sbyar bas/ sems can gcig yongs su smin par bya ba'i tshul du sems can thams cad yongs su smin par bya bas/ de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs gcig yongs su bsgrub pa la yongs su mi skyo ba'i sems bskyed pa'o/ /dge slong dag /yongs su mi skyo ba'i sems bskyed pa bcu po 'di dag dang ldan pa'i rigs kyi bu'am/ rigs kyi bu mo dad pa dang ldan pa ni/ dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad la yongs su 'grub par 'gyur ro/ /'khor ba'i rgyud thams cad las phyir ldog par 'gyur ro/ /'jig rten gyi rgyud thams cad las gyen du 'phags par 'gyur ro/ /nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi sa thams cad las yongs su 'da' bar 'gyur ro/ /de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi rigs dang rgyud du 'byung bar 'gyur ro/ /byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyi smon lam la yang dag par 'grub par 'gyur ro/ /de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi yon tan gyi nan tan la rnam par dag par 'gyur ro/ /byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa thams cad la yongs su dag par 'gyur ro/ / de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi stobs la yang dag par 'byung bar 'gyur ro/ /bdud dang phas kyi rgol ba thams cad rab tu 'dul bar 'gyur ro/ /byang chub sems dpa'i sa yongs su gnon par 'gyur ro/ /de bzhin gshegs pa'i sa dang shin tu nye bar 'gyur ro/ /

The indefatigable resolution to see, attend, and serve all buddhas; to build up all roots of goodness without retreating; to seek all truths; to practice all the transcendent ways of enlightening beings; to fully accomplish all concentrations of enlightening beings; to enter successively into all ages; to thoroughly purify all oceans of buddha-lands in the ten directions; to lead all realms of sentient beings to perfect development; to carry out the practices of enlightening beings in all lands and ages; to fully attain each power of buddhas by maturing all beings through the process of practicing as many transcendent ways as atoms in all buddha-lands to mature each being. Men or women with faith who are imbued with these ten indefatigable determinations grow in all roots of goodness, leave all compulsive, routine mundane tendencies, drop out of all social castes, go beyond all stages of individual emancipation, are born in the family of all buddhas, fulfill the vows of enlightening beings, become pure with the attainment of all qualities of the enlightened, become clarified in all the practices of enlightening beings, develop all the powers of buddhas, overcome all demons and challengers, progress through all the stages of enlightening beings, and reach buddhahood.”

de nas dge slong de dag gis chos kyi tshul 'di thos nas/ sangs rgyas thams cad rnam par mthong ba la chags pa med pa'i mig gi yul zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin thob par gyur to/ /de'i mthus phyogs bcu mtha' yas mu med pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams na bzhugs pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa'i 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor mthong bar gyur to/ /'jig rten gyi khams de dag gi 'gro ba'i rgyud du skyes pa'i sems can de dag kyang ma lus par mthong bar gyur to/ /'jig rten gyi khams de dag gi sems can rnams kyang ma lus par mthong bar gyur to/ /'jig rten gyi khams de dag kyang rnam par phye ba sna tshogs su mthong bar gyur to/ /'jig rten gyi khams de dag na rdul shin tu phra ba ji snyed yod pa de dag kyang bgrang ba'i tshul gyis rab tu shes par gyur to/ /sems can de dag gi rin po che'i gnas dang longs spyod de dag kyang mthong bar gyur to/ /de bzhin gshegs pa de dag gi dbyangs kyi yan lag rgya mtsho yang thos par gyur to/ /chos bstan pa de dag kyang tshig dang / yi ge dang / nges pa'i tshig dang / skad dang / ming dang / brdas yongs su shes par gyur to/ /sems can de dag gi sems dang / dbang po dang / bsam pa la yang rnam par lta bar gyur to/ /sngon gyi mtha' dang / phyi ma'i mtha'i tshe rabs bcu yang rjes su dran par gyur to/ /de bzhin gshegs pa de dag gi chos kyi 'khor lo bcu'i nges pa'i tshig mngon par bsgrub pa la yang rab tu zhugs par gyur to/ /rdzu 'phrul gyis rnam par 'phrul pa mngon par bsgrub pa bcu la yang rab tu zhugs par gyur to/ /bstan pa'i tshul mngon par bsgrub pa bcu la yang rab tu zhugs par gyur to; ;rjes su bstan pa'i tshig mngon par bsgrub pa bcu la yang rab tu zhugs par gyur to/ /de bzhin gshegs pa de dag gi tha dad pa yang dag par mkhyen pa'i tshul mngon par bsgrub pa bcu la yang rab tu zhugs par gyur to/ /ting nge 'dzin de thob ma thag tu byang chub kyi sems kyi yan lag stong phrag bcu yang yongs su rdzogs par gyur to/ /ting nge 'dzin stong phrag bcu yang yongs su non par gyur to/ /pha rol tu phyin pa'i yan lag stong phrag bcu yang rnam par dag par gyur te/ snang ba chen po rab tu thob cing shes rab chen po'i dkyil 'khor gyis snang bar gyur pa de dag gis/ byang chub sems dpa'i mngon par shes pa bcu rab tu thob par gyur to/ /de ltar mngon par shes pa'i myu gu gzhon zhing shin tu phra ba thob ste/ byang chub tu sems skyes pa brtan pa la gnas pa de dag 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pas/ byang chub sems dpa' kun tu bzang po'i spyod pa la yang dag par bskul nas rab tu bkod do/ /de ltar byang chub sems dpa' kun tu bzang po'i spyod pa la rab tu gnas pa de dag smon lam chen po rgya mtsho la zhugs shing mngon par bsgrub par gyur to/ / de ltar smon lam chen po rgya mtshos mngon par bsgrubs pa'i sems rnam par dag pas lus yongs su dag pa rab tu thob par gyur to/ /lus rnam par dag pas lus yang ba rab tu thob par gyur to/ /de ltar lus rnam par dag pa dang / lus yang bas mngon par shes pa'i sgo de dag shin tu yangs par byed pas mi nyams shing / rjes su 'brang ba'i mngon par shes pa rab tu thob par gyur to/ /mngon par shes pa de dag thob pas/ 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa'i rkang pa'i drung nas kyang mi g.yo la/ sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad yongs su bsgrub pa'i phyir phyogs bcur yang de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi sku'i 'phrin las kyi sprin mngon par bsgrub par gyur to/ /

Then the monks, having heard this teaching, attained a concentration called sphere of the unobstructed eye of vision of all buddhas, by the experience of which they saw the circles of assemblies of the buddhas in all worlds throughout the ten directions. They also saw all the beings in those worlds, and they also saw the various differentiations in those worlds. They also knew how many atoms were in these worlds. They also saw all the dwellings and furniture of those beings, made of various precious substances. They also heard the oceans of the qualities of the voice and the buddhas in those worlds, and understood the various statements, allusions, expressions, mystic formulae, terminology, and concepts of their teachings. They also discerned the minds, faculties, and dispositions of the beings in those worlds, and called to mind the events of ten lives past and future. They also comprehended the utterance of ten cycles of teaching of those buddhas. They also comprehended ten states produced by mystical powers, ten productions of guiding principles, and ten productions of instructive statements. They also comprehended ten accomplishments of analytic knowledge of those buddhas.
When they attained this concentration, they developed ten thousand qualities of the determination of enlightenment, entered ten thousand concentrations and purified ten thousand aspects of transcendence; having attained great illumination, being illumined by the sphere of great wisdom, they attained ten mystic knowledges of enlightening beings.
Manjushri exhorted and led them, now with soft and delicate sprouts of mystic knowledge and firm determination for enlightenment, into the practice of the universally good enlightening being. Based on the practice of the universally good enlightening being, they entered into the oceans of great vows and began to carry them out. By undertaking the oceans of great vows, and by purification of mind, they attained purity of body; by physical purity they gained physical lightness, by which physical purity and lightness they opened wide the doors to mystic knowledge and attained undiminishing mystic knowledge. By this attainment of mystic knowledge they appeared in multitudes of bodies to all the buddhas in the ten directions for the sake of accomplishing all Buddha teachings, yet without leaving the presence of Manjushri.

de nas 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pas/ dge slong de dag bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu bkod nas/ mthar gyis yul rgyu zhing lho phyogs logs skyid pa'i 'byung gnas zhes bya ba'i grong rdal chen po gang na ba der logs su song ste phyin nas/ grong rdal chen po skyid pa'i 'byung gnas kyi shar phyogs logs na nags tshal chen po sA la sna tshogs kyi rgyal mtshan gyi rgyan ces bya ba sngon gyi sangs rgyas bzhugs bzhugs pa'i mchod rten/ sems can smin par mdzad pa'i don du de bzhin gshegs pas byin gyis brlabs pa/ zhing mtha' yas par ming gi sgra rjes su grags pa/ sngon chad bcom ldan 'das byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa mdzad pa'i tshe/ yongs su btang bar dga' ba du ma yongs su btang ste/ sa'i phyogs de na lha dang / klu dang / gnod sbyin dang / dri za dang / lha ma yin dang / nam mkha' lding dang / mi'am ci dang / lto 'phye chen po dang / mi dang / mi ma yin pa rnams rtag tu rgyun mi 'chad par mchod pa la brtson pa'i gnas yod pa der/ 'khor dang bcas te phyin nas/ der 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pas mdo sde chos kyi dbyings kyi tshul rab tu snang ba zhes bya ba mdo sde bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong phrag bcu 'byung ba bstan to/ / de bstan pa'i tshe/ rgya mtsho chen po nas klu bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong du ma nye bar lhags te/ de dag gis chos kyi tshul de thos nas/ klu'i rgyud la rnam par smod cing de bzhin gshegs pa'i yon tan la mos par gyur nas klu'i rgyud rnam par bzlog ste/ lha dang mir skya ba yongs su 'dzin par gyur nas/ der klu stong phrag bcu bla na med par rdzogs pa'i byang chub las phyir mi ldog par gyur to/ /chos de bstan pa'i tshe/ sems can gyi khams mtha' dang dbus med pa theg pa gsum gyis dus gzhan dang gzhan du rnam par dul bar gyur to/ /

Then Manjushri, having set those monks on the foundation of unexcelled true enlightenment, continued his journey to the human realm and came to a great city in the south named Dhanyakara. There he stayed with his retinue in a forest called Array of Various Standards of Strength, to the east of the city, at a shrine where past buddhas had dwelt, established by buddhas for the sake of perfecting sentient beings, the repute of which resounded in infinite lands, a place where the Buddha, in the past, carrying out the practice of an enlightening being, relinquished many things that are difficult to relinquish, a place where gods, dragons, goblins, nymphs, titans, birds, centaurs, serpents, humans, and nonhumans always presented offerings to the earth. There Manjushri expounded a scripture called Illumination of the Principles of the Cosmos, whence flowed ten hundred thousand trillion scriptures. As he was expounding the scripture, many tens of hundreds of thousands of trillions of dragons came to him from the ocean; having heard this teaching, disdaining the condition of dragons and desiring the qualities of buddhahood, they left the state of dragons and gained birth as celestial or human beings. There ten thousand dragons became irreversible in their progress toward supreme perfect enlightenment. And during his exposition of the teaching, innumerable beings were edified through the Three Vehicles.

de nas skyid pa'i 'byung gnas kyi mi rnams kyis/ 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa'i skyid pa'i 'byung gnas kyi grong rdal du phyin te/ sA la sna tshogs kyi rgyan gyi gzhi 'di nyid na rnam par spyod do zhes thos nas/ dge bsnyen tshong dpon shes rab chen po la sogs pa dge bsnyen pha dang / dge bsnyen ma dang / khye'u dang / bu mo mang po dag so so nas 'khor lnga brgya lnga brgya dang bcas te/ skyid pa'i 'byung gnas kyi grong rdal nas byung nas/ 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa gang na ba dar dong ngo/ /de la dge bsnyen shes rab chen po ni/ dge bsnyen bzang pos byin dang / lhas byin dang / bsod nams 'od dang / grags pa'i lha dang / grags pas byin dang / zla ba'i dpal dang / zla ba dga' bo dang / blo gros bzang po dang / blo gros chen po dang / sgra gcan bzang po dang / dge bsnyen bzang po'i dpal dang / de dag la sogs pa dge bsnyen lnga brgyas ba skor cing mdun du byas te; 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa gang na ba der dong nas/ 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa'i rkang pa gnyis la spyi bos phyag 'tshal te/ 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa la lan gsum du bskor ba byas nas phyogs gcig tu 'khod do/ /de la dge bsnyen ma shes rab chen mo ni/ dge bsnyen ma 'od bzang mo dang / lus bzang mo dang / dge ba yod pa dang / dge ba'i dpal dang / zla ba'i 'od dang / dpal gyi 'od dang / dpal bzang mo dang / dge bsnyen ma mig bzang mo dang / de dag la sogs pa dge bsnyen ma lnga brgyas bskor cing mdun du byas te/ 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa gang na ba der dong nas/ 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa'i rkang pa gnyis la spyi bos phyag 'tshal te/ 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa la lan gsum du bskor ba byas nas phyogs gcig tu 'khod do/ /

Now the people of the city heard that Manjushri had come and was staying at the shrine in the forest. Having heard this, pious men and women, boys and girls, each a company of five hundred, led by Mahaprajna, the foremost of the pious men, went from the city to where Manjushri was. Then the pious man Mahaprajna, with a company of five hundred pious men such as Sudatta, Vasudatta, Punyaprabha, Yashodeva, Somashri, Somanandi, Sumati, Mahamati, Rahulabhadra, and Bhadrashri, went to Manjushri, bowed their heads to his feet, circled him three times, and then sat to one side.
Then a pious woman named Mahaprajna, with a company of five hundred pious women including Suprabha, Sugatra, Subhadra, Bhadrashri, Candraprabhasa, Ketuprabha, Shribhadra, and Sulocana, went to Manjushri, bowed to him and circled him, and then sat to one side.

de la tshong dpon gyi bu nor bzang ni tshong dpon gyi bu brtul zhugs bzang po dang / tshul khrims bzang po dang / ngang tshul bzang po dang / rnam par gnon pa bzang po dang / bsam pa bzang po dang / blo gros bzang po dang / blo bzang po dang / mig bzang po dang / lag pa bzang po dang / tshong dpon gyi bu 'od bzang po dang / de dag la sogs pa tshong dpon gyi bu lnga brgyas bskor cing mdun du byas te/ 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa gang na ba der dong nas/ 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa'i rkang pa gnyis la spyi bos phyag 'tshal te/ 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa la lan gsum du bskor ba byas nas phyogs gcig tu 'khod do/ /de la khyim bdag shes rab chen po'i bu mo dge ba bzang mo ni/ bu mo bzang mo dang / yid du 'ong ba'i bzhin dang / brtan pa'i blo gros dang / dpal bzang mo dang / tshangs pas byin pa dang / dpal gyi 'od dang / bu mo 'od bzang mo la sogs pa bu mo lnga brgyas bskor cing mdun du byas te/ 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa gang na ba der dong nas/ 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa'i rkang pa gnyis la spyi bos phyag 'tshal te/ 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa la lan gsum du bskor ba byas nas phyogs gcig tu 'khod do/ /

Then Sudhana, an outstanding boy, together with a company of five hundred outstanding boys including Suvrata, Sushila, Svacara, Suvikrami, Sucinti, Sumati, Subuddhi, Sunetra, Subahu, and Suprabha, went to Manjushri, bowed to him and circled him, and then sat to one side.
Then the girl Subhadra, daughter of the householder Mahaprajna, together with a group of five hundred girls including Bhadra, Abhiramavarta, Drdhamati, Brahmadatta, Shribhadra, Shriprabha, and Suprabha, went to Manjushri, bowed to him and circled him, and then sat to one side.

de nas 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pas skyid pa'i 'byung gnas kyi grong rdal nas skyes pa dang / bud med dang / khye'u dang / bu mo de dag 'dus te 'khod par shes nas/ bsam pa ji lta ba bzhin du bstan pa'i byin gyis zil gyis gnan te/ byams pa chen po'i byin gyis sim par byas nas/ snying rje chen po'i byin gyis chos bstan pa mngon par bsgrubs te/ ye shes kyi byin gyis sems dang bsam pa rnam par phye nas tha dad pa yang dag par shes pa chen pos chos bstan par dga' ste/ tshong dpon gyi bu nor bzang la bltas so/ /tshong dpon gyi bu nor bzang zhes bya ba/ ci'i phyir nor bzang zhes bya zhe na/ tshong dpon gyi bu nor bzang zhes bya ba/ thog ma ma'i mngal du zhugs ma thag tu khyim de'i 'khor kun nas rnam par phye ba'i rin po che sna bdun gyi sdong po 'thon par gyur to/ /rin po che'i sdong po de dag gi 'og na rin po che'i gter bdun yod de/ gser dang / dngul dang / bai DUr+ya dang / shel dang / mu tig dmar po dang / asma gar b+ha dang / mu sa ra gal pa dang / rin po che de bdun gyi rin po che'i sdong po de dag kyang gter de dag nas skyes te/ sa'i gzhi brtol nas mngon par 'thon par gyur to/ /de yan lag dang nying lag thams cad yongs su rdzogs te/ zla ba bcu lon nas btsas pa dang / de'i tshe gter chen po bdun po de dag kyang chu zheng dang / rngams su khru bdun tsam du sa'i steng nas mngon par 'phags te snang bar byung nas rnam par snang zhing mdzes par gyur to/ /khyim der rin po che sna tshogs kyi snod lnga brgya yang byung bar gyur te/ 'di ltar mar gyi snod dang / til mar gyi snod dang / sbrang rtsi'i snod dang; mar gsar gyi snod dang / gzhan dag kyang so so nas yo byad sna tshogs thams cad kyis yongs su gang ba dag ste/ 'di ltar rdo rje'i snod spos sna tshogs kyis yongs su gang ba dang / spos kyi snod gos sna tshogs kyis yongs su gang ba dang / man shel gyi snod kha zas dang spyan gzigs sna tshogs ro mchog tu zhim pas yongs su gang ba dang; nor bu'i snod rin po che sna tshogs kyis yongs su gang ba dang / gser gyi snod dngul sil mas yongs su gang ba dang / dngul gyi snod gser phyes yongs su gang ba dang / phra men gyi snod nor bu rin po che bai DUr+yas yongs su gang ba dang / shel gyi snod mu sa ra gal pas yongs su gang ba dang / mu sar gal pa'i snod rin po che shel gyis yongs su gang ba dang / asma gar b+ha'i snod mu tig dmar pos yongs su gang ba dang / mu tig dmar po'i snod asma gar b+has yongs su gang ba dang / nor bu rin po skar ma'i rgyal mtshan gyi snod nor bu rin po che chu 'dang gis yongs su gang ba dang / nor bu rin po che chu 'dang gi snod nor bu rin po che skar ma'i rgyal mtshan gyis yongs su gang ba dang / de dag la sogs pa rin po che'i snod lnga brgya 'thon par gyur to/ /tshong dpon gyi bu nor bzang de btsas ma thag tu khyim dang / bang ba dang / mdzod thams cad du nor dang / 'bru dang / dbyig dang / gser dang / rin po che sna tshogs kyi char mngon par bab par gyur to/ /de la bram ze'i bltas pa dang / pha dang / ma dang / gnyen gyi tshogs kyis 'di btsas ma thag tu nor mang po phun sum tshogs pa byung bar gyur pas na/ nor bzang / nor bzang zhes de ltar ming du btags te/ tshong dpon gyi bu nor bu bzang de ni/ sngon gyi rgyal ba la bya ba byas pa'o/ /dge ba'i rtsa ba bskyed pa'o/ / mos pa rgya chen po dang ldan pa'o/ /dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyi rjes su 'brang ba'i bsam pa can no/ /lus dang ngag dang yid kyi spyod pa kha na ma tho ba med pa'o/ /byang chub sems dpa'i lam yongs su sbyang ba la rab tu brtson pa'o/ /thams cad mkhyen pa la mngon par mos pa'o/ /sangs rgyas kyi chos kyi snod du gyur pa'o/ /bsam pa'i nam mkha' yongs su dag pa'o/ /byang chub kyi sems chags pa med pa yongs su rdzogs pa'o/

Then Manjushri, seeing that the women, men, boys and girls from the city had gathered and were seated, according to their dispositions overwhelmed them with his power over appearance, soothed them with his power of great benevolence, undertook to teach them with his power of great compassion, considered their mentalities with his power of knowledge, and, imbued with great analytic intelligence, wishing to expound the truth, he observed the outstanding boy Sudhana: “Why is Sudhana called Sudhana, which means ‘Good Wealth’? When Sudhana was conceived in his mother’s womb, there appeared in the house sprouts of seven precious substances, evenly distributed throughout the house. Beneath those precious sprouts were seven great treasuries, from which those sprouts emerged, splitting the surface of the earth as they grew, treasuries of gold, silver, sapphire, crystal, ruby, emerald, and coral. When his limbs were perfectly formed and he was born after ten months, those treasuries, which were seven spans high, wide, and long, rose to the surface of the earth, opened, glittered, and shone. Five hundred vessels made of precious substances also appeared in the house—vessels of clarified butter, sesame oil, honey, and fresh butter, each equipped with all the necessary utensils; there also appeared diamond vessels filled with all kinds of perfumes, fragrant vessels filled with various cloths, crystal vessels filled with various foods and drinks, pearl vessels filled with various jewels, gold vessels filled with silver powder, silver vessels filled with gold powder, gold and silver vessels filled with agates, crystal vessels filled with sapphires, sapphire vessels filled with crystal jewels, emerald vessels filled with rubies, ruby vessels filled with emeralds, star sapphire vessels filled with water-clarifying jewels, water-clarifying jewel vessels filled with star sapphires. Five hundred such precious vessels appeared in the storerooms of the house simultaneously with the birth of Sudhana, raining money, grain, gold, and various other valuables. Because of this great prosperity that appeared in the house by his mere birth, the fortune-tellers and priests and his parents and kin called him Sudhana, ‘Good Wealth.’”
Sudhana, furthermore, having served past buddhas and planted roots of goodness, imbued with great zeal and devotion, intent on following spiritual benefactors, impeccable in word, thought, and deed, engaged in clarification of the path of enlightening beings, heading for omniscience, having become a vessel of the Buddha teachings, his course of mind purified, had achieved an unhindered, unattached determination for enlightenment.

de nas 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pas/ tshong dpon gyi bu nor bzang la bltas te/ dga' ba'i gtam byas nas/ de la 'di lta ste/ sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad las kyang brtsams/ sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad yang dag par bsdu zhing thob par bya ba las kyang brtsams/ sangs rgyas thams cad gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pa las kyang brtsams/ sangs rgyas gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pa thams cad shes par bya ba las kyang brtsams/ sangs rgyas thams cad kyi 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor rnam par dag pa las kyang brtsams/ sangs rgyas thams cad kyi chos kyi 'khor lo dang sprul pa'i rgyan las kyang brtsams/ sangs rgyas thams cad kyi gzugs kyi sku'i mtshan dang dpe byad bzang po rnam par dag pa las kyang brtsams/ sangs rgyas thams cad kyi chos kyi sku yongs su grub pa las kyang brtsams/ sangs rgyas thams cad kyi gsung rnam par phye ba las kyang brtsams/ sangs rgyas thams cad kyi 'od kyi dkyil 'khor gyi rgyan rnam par dag pa las kyang brtsams/ sangs rgyas thams cad kyi mnyam pa nyid las kyang brtsams te/ chos kyang bstan par gyur to/ /

At that point Manjushri, having regarded Sudhana, greeted him in a friendly manner and expounded the Teaching to him, dealing with all elements of buddhahood, the cultivation and attainment of all elements of buddhahood, the infinity of all buddhas, the successive appearance of all buddhas in the world, the purification of the congregations surrounding all buddhas, the achievement of the reality-body of all buddhas, the magnificent arrays of wisdom and eloquence of all buddhas, the purification of the array of spheres of light of all buddhas, and the equality of all buddhas.

de nas 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pas tshong dpon gyi bu nor bzang dang / skye bo'i tshogs chen po de dag chos dang mthun ba'i gtam gyis bstan te/ yang dag par bskul nas spro ba bskyed de dga' bar byas nas/ bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed du btsud de/ sngon gyi dge ba'i rtsa ba yongs su dran par byas nas/ skyid pa'i 'byung gnas kyi grong rdal de'i sems can rnams kyi bsam pa ji lta ba bzhin du chos bstan pas byin gyis brlabs te/ bde bar byas nas de nas song ngo/ /

Then Manjushri, having edified, inspired, sharpened, and delighted Sudhana and the great crowd of people with his talk on the Teaching, having caused them to set their minds on perfect enlightenment and made them remember their past roots of goodness, stopped his teaching there, given as it was to the people in accord with their mentalities, and left.

de nas tshong dpon gyi bu nor bzang gis/ 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa las/ rnam pa de lta bu'i sangs rgyas kyi yon tan dang / che ba nyid thos nas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mos shing brtson pas phyi bzhin du 'brang ste/ 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa la tshigs su bcad de mngon par bstod do/ /

Then Sudhana, having heard from Manjushri of such magnificence of the qualities of Buddha, with the quest for supreme perfect enlightenment uppermost in his mind, uttered these verses as he watched Manjushri going:

blo gros chen po mtha' yas spyod yul can/ / khyod kyi mthus ni sems can sman slad du/ / bdag kyang byang chub mchog tu zhugs par gyur/ / de la nges pa gang mchis bdag la gson/ /
dga' ba'i chus bkang 'obs kyis kun nas bskor/ / nga rgyal dregs pa'i ra ba mtho bar brtsegs/ / sems can lam rgyud sgo rnams btsud cing gdangs/ / de 'dra'i khyim ni srid gsum ming ldan che/ /
de ni gti mug ma rig gzings pas khebs/ / 'dod chags zhe sdang me lces rab tu gdungs/ / rtag par bdud kyi dbang po'i dbang du gyur/ / de la byis pa ma rig rten kyang 'cha'/ /
sred pa'i sgrog dang zhags pas shin tu glags/ / g.yo dang sgyu yi skyon gyis mtho brtsams shing / / the tshom yid gnyis dag gis mig mdongs pa/ / log pa phyin phyogs lam la rab tu zhugs/ /
phrag dog ser sna'i thag pas btags shing bcings/ / yi byol song sems dmyal mi khom rgyu/ / rga shi na dang skye bas rab tu mnar/ / mgo rmongs lam rgyun 'bar lo kun tu 'khor/ /
de la khyod ni thugs rje rnam dag pa'i/ / dkyil 'khor ye shes 'od zer snang ba mdzad/ / nyon mongs rgya mtsho skam par shar te 'phags/ / nyi ma 'dra bas bdag la snang ba mdzod/ /
byams pa bsgoms pas dkyil 'khor rdzogs shing nya/ / bsod nams zla 'od bde ba'i zer 'gyed pa/ / sems can kun gyi gnas su shar gyur gyi/ / zla ba nya ba lta bus bdag snang mdzod/ /
dkar mthus thams cad yongs bsags bskor mnga' zhing / / chos dbyings mkha' la chags pa mi mnga' ba/ / chos kyi 'khor lo rin chen sngon 'dren pas/ / rgyal por gyur pas bdag la bstan du gsol/ /
byang chub theg pa'i smon lam mthu mnga' ste/ / bsod nams ye shes shin tu yangs bsags shing / / sems can kun la phan pa'i don bzhugs pa'i/ / ded dpon chen pos bdag kyang bskyang du gsol/ /
bzod pa brtan zhing sra ba'i go mnabs te/ / ye shes spyan mnga' thugs rje'i phyag ring bas/ / bdud kyi dmag dpung tshogs rnams mngon 'gyur bar/ / dpa' ba chen pos bdag gi sel yang mdzod/ /

By your power, Great Sage, I am set on enlightenment for the good of all beings, Resolved on this, with an endless vista; hear what is on my mind.
Moats filled with the water of delight, with high walls of conceit and pride, Its doors the conditions of all beings—that is how the great city of existence is.
Shrouded in the great darkness of ignorance, burnt by the fire of lust and hate, Ever under the sway of the lord of demons, the abode of the unenlightened.
Completely bound by the ropes and chains of craving, made desolate by the wastelands of deceit, Blinded by doubt and confusion, standing on the ground of falsehood.
Bound up in envy and jealousy, becoming ghosts, animals, and fiends, Oppressed by birth, sickness, age, and death, they wander lost in the wheel of transmigration.
May the pure orb of your compassion for them, a sun radiating the light of knowledge, Risen to evaporate the sea of afflictions, shine on me like the sun.
Orb full of the power of love, radiating moonbeams of virtue, grant happiness; You give light like the full moon appearing in the abodes of all beings.
Endowed with all virtues and powers, your mind is in the sky of the reality realm; Instruct me, O King, with the jewel of the wheel of the teaching.
Boldly advancing, resolute, on the vehicle of enlightenment, having developed great virtue and knowledge, O Caravan Leader arising to benefit all beings, protect me.
Girt with the armor of forbearance, strength, and firmness, wielding the sword of knowledge in the hand of compassion, Facing the band of demons in battle, lead me to safety, O Hero.

chos kyi ri rab spo la brtan bzhugs shing / / ting 'dzin mchog gi lha mos kun nas bskor/ / nyon mongs sgra gcan lha min 'dul mdzad pa/ / brgya byin gyur pas bdag kyang gzigs su gsol/ /
byis pa'i gnas gyur khams gsum khang pa na/ / nyon mongs las rnams rnam par bsal ba mkhyen/ / rgyu yi sa dang lam rgyud 'khor rmongs par/ / me mar 'dra bas bdag kyang shul bstan gsol/ /
ngan 'gro'i lam rnams rnam par zlog mdzad cing / / bde bar 'gro ba'i lam rnams rnam sbyong ba/ / 'jig rten kun gyi lam gyi rgyud las 'das/ / bdag la'ang thar pa'i sgo ni bstan du gsol/ /
rtag dang bdag dang bde bar 'du shes ldan; ; log 'dzin sgo re'i skyabs kyis bcad gyur gyi/ / bden pa'i ye shes spyan rno mchog mnga' bas/ / thar sgo bdag la'ang myur du dbye bar gsol/ /
yang dag log pa'i lam la mkhas gyur cing / / lam gyi rgyus dang tshul la bsnyengs mi mnga'/ / lam rnams kun gyis 'dul ba thugs chud pa/ / bdag la byang chub shul ni bstan du gsol/ /
yang dag lta ba'i sa yi thang la bzhugs/ / sangs rgyas kun gyi yon tan chab kyis bskrun/ / sangs rgyas chos legs me tog char 'bebs pa/ / byang chub shul ni bdag la bstan du gsol/ /
rgyal ba gang 'das ma byon gang rnams dang / / da ltar byung ba'i rgyal ba snang mdzad pa/ / sems can gtso bo legs par gshegs pa'i phyogs/ / de yang lam ston mdzad pas bdag bstan gsol/ /
las kyi 'khrul 'khor tshul la mi bsnyengs pa/ / chos theg shing rta'i 'khrul 'khor mkhyen gyur cing / / ye shes theg pa'i tshul la rnam nges pa/ / byang chub theg pa bdag la bshad du gsol/ /
mos shing smon pa'i 'khor lo'i mu khyud can/ / bzod pa rdo rje snying rje srog shing brten/ / dad pa'i gnya' shing rin chen legs spras pa'i/ / byang chub theg la bdag kyang bskyon du gsol/ /

Dwelling on the peak of the polar mountain of truth, surrounded by the archangels of concentration, Destroyer of the titans of affliction, look upon me, O Mighty One.
In the city of existences, the abode of the unaware, your guidance out of afflictive action is definitive; Amid the confusion of the cycle of transmigration on the ground of cause, as a lamp reveal to me the Way.
Turning away from the paths of woe, purifying the paths of bliss, Transcender of all worldly states, lead me to the door of liberation.
I am stuck to the notions of permanence, self, and pleasure, blocked by falsehood and grasping— With the sharp eye of truth, knowledge, and power, quickly open the door of liberation for me.
Knower of the paths of truth and falsehood, fearless in the varied knowledge of the Way, Certain of the guidance of all paths, show me the Way to enlightenment.
Tree of right insight standing firm on the ground, nourished by the water of the virtues of all buddhas, Showing flowers of virtues of buddha-teaching, show me the Way to enlightenment.
O teacher of the Way, show me the buddhas of the past, future, and present, Makers of light, best of beings, gone to bliss.
Familiar with the various mechanics of action, expert in the mechanics of the vehicle of religion, Sure of the various vehicles of knowledge, show me the vehicle of enlightenment.
Put me on the vehicle of enlightenment, driven by faith, studded with jewels of virtue, A globe with wheels of prayer and vows, steeled by forbearance, resting on the axle of compassion.

gzungs rnams kun gyis rnam dag dkyil 'khor can/ / byams pa brtsegs pa'i dga' bas rab brgyan pa/ / tha dad yang dag shes pa'i dril phreng can/ / theg mchog bzang pos bdag la bstan du gsol/ /
tshangs pa'i spyod pa'i lam gyis mngon par brgyan/ / ting 'dzin bud med khrag khrig kun nas rgyu/ / chos kyi rnga yi dbyangs chen rab bsgrags pa/ / theg pa'i dam pa bdag la bstab tu gsol/ /
bsdu ba bzhi yi mi zad mdzod ldan pa/ / ye shes rin chen yon tan phreng gis brgyan/ / khrel yod dul ba'i 'phreng bas mchog bsdams pa'i/ / theg pa'i dam pa bdag la bstan du gsol/ /
sbyin pa'i 'od zer dkyil 'khor bzang po can/ / tshul khrims tsan dan snying rje'i byug ldan zhing / / bzod pa'i gzer gyis mtshams rnams dam sbyar ba'i/ / theg pa'i mchog la myur du bdag gzhag gsol/ /
sems can thams cad 'dul las mi ldog pa/ / bsam gtan ting 'dzin kha khyer mthor sgron cing / / shes rab thabs gnyis 'byor mthun 'gro rgyu ba'i/ / chos kyi theg pa mchog la bdag gzhag gsol/ /
smon lam 'khor los lam gyi 'khor sbyong ba/ / chos kyi gzugs dam mthu brtan che ldan zhing / / ye shes 'khrul 'khor legs sbyangs legs byas pa'i/ / chos kyi theg pa de la bdag bskyon gsol/ /
kun tu bzang po'i spyod pas rab sbyangs shing / / sems can lta bas rgyu la thogs med pa/ / kun tu bzang po'i spyod pas gnon gyur pa'i/ / ye shes theg pas bdag la bsdud du gsol/ /
de ni brtan pas rdo rje bzhin gnas pa/ / ye shes sgyu mas legs sbyangs legs byas shing / / sgrib dang chags pa thams cad gcod pa yi/ / bzang po'i theg la bdag kyang bskyon par gsol/ /
'gro mnyam dri med shin tu yangs gyur pa/ / sems can thams cad skyob pas bde sgrub cing / / chos dbyings shin tu rgya chen rnam snang ba'i/ / byang chub theg la bdag kyang bskyon du gsol/ /

Orb of all memory, purified, with a roof of kindness, well adorned, And a beautiful bell-garland of analytic powers—put me in this supreme vehicle.
Adorned with a couch of pure conduct, filled with millions of concentration-ladies, With the drum of truth resounding—bring me to this royal vehicle.
With an infinite chamber of the four integrative methods, adorned with jewels of knowledge and pearls of virtue, Harnessed with the finest rope of modesty—show me the chief of vehicles.
It has the radiance of the pure sphere of light of relinquishment, the sandalwood of morality, the perfume of compassion, With the lance of forbearance, and is held together by firmness—place me on the supreme vehicle.
It guides all beings, never turning back; its frame of meditation is set up on concentration, It is drawn by the team of wisdom and means—place me on that eminent vehicle of truth.
Vows set the course and alignment of its wheels; it holds the truth steadfastly, having great power; It is well made by the dynamics of knowledge, expertly—lift me onto the vehicle of truth.
It is refined by Universally Good action, proceeding slowly with concern for beings: Bring me to that vehicle of knowledge, of valor in pure conduct everywhere.
Put me on that vehicle which cuts through all obstructions, Steady and firm as the finest steel, adorned with garlands of knowledge.
It is spacious, clean, impartial toward people, a refuge for all beings, bringing happiness: Put me on that vehicle of enlightenment, which sheds light throughout the cosmos.

sdug bsngal phung po rab byung gcod byed pa/ / nyon mongs las kyi rdul mang sbyong sel cing / / bdud dang phas kyi rgol ba kun 'joms pa'i/ / chos kyi theg la bdag kyang bskyon du gsol/ /
phyogs rnams kun tu ye shes rab snang ba/ / chos dbyings nam mkha' rnam par klubs byed cing / / sems can kun gyi bsam pa rdzogs byed pa'i/ / chos kyi theg la bdag kyang bskyon du gsol/ /
rnam dag mkha' ltar tshad med mi zad pa/ / sred dang ma rig lta ba'i skyon med cing / / sems can kun la phan par rab gnas pa'i/ / chos kyi theg la bdag kyang bskyon du gsol/ /
rlung chen langs pa'i shugs kyi shugs ldan pas/ / smon lam mthu yis 'jig rten kun 'dzin cing / / zhi ba'i gnas rab kun sar skyel byed pa'i; ; chos kyi theg la bdag kyang bskyon du gsol/ /
sa chen bzhi yi stobs kyi stobs ldan pa/ / snying rje'i mthu dang shugs kyis khur khyer zhing / / ye shes lo tog 'gro ba nyer 'tsho ba'i; ; theg pa'i mchog la bdag kyang bskyon du gsol/ /
nyi ma lta bur 'gro ba nyer 'tsho zhing / / bsdu ba rab yangs 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor can/ / gzungs kyi stobs mchog dag pa'i 'od bzang ba'i/ / ye shes nyi ma bdag la bstan du gsol/ /
bskal pa mang po du mar rab bslabs pa/ / rgyu yi tshul dang sa kun mkhas gyur pa/ / gang gis 'dus byas grong khyer gzhom 'gyur ba'i/ / shes brtan rdo rje 'phags pas bdag la stsal du gsol/ /
sangs rgyas legs kun bslab pa phun sum gyis/ / ye shes rgya mtsho yangs pa gang zhig la/ / tshad med rgya mtsho'i blo mang bslab gyur pa/ / de legs ci 'dra 'phags pas bka' stsal gsol/ /
gang na yang dag spyan mnga' khyod bzhugs shing / / ye shes rgyal po'i cod pan legs brgyan te/ / chos kyi dbu thod dam pas dbu bcings pa'i/ / chos kyi rgyal po'i pho brang bdag kyang ston/ /

Its advance cuts through the mass of suffering, clears the sphere of dust of afflictions of action, And subdues all demons and challengers—put me on that vehicle of truth.
Its scope is universal knowledge, it arrays the sky of the reality realm; Bring me to that vehicle of truth, which fulfills the aspiration of all beings.
Put me on that spiritual vehicle, pure and infinite as space, Unstained by the ignorance and obscurity of views, serving all sentient beings.
Put me on that spiritual vehicle, swift as the wind, Sustaining the world by the wind-power of vows, establishing the ground of all citadels of peace.
Put me on the supreme vehicle, unshakable as the earth, carrying its cargo By the intense power of compassion, full of knowledge, beneficial to the world.
It is like the sun, giving life to the world, a concentrated orb of great lights, Radiant with supreme purity of mental command; show me the sun of knowledge.
Give me that mighty thunderbolt of knowledge, O Noble One, which is learned over many eons, Knows the reasons and grounds of all causes, and smashes the fortress of conditioning.
As you have learned a vast ocean of knowledge, an unequaled ocean of awareness, Imbued with all qualities of buddhas, tell me what it is like.
As you have highly developed vision and are graced with the crown of the king of knowledge, Your head wrapped in the turban of truth, look into the city of the spiritual sovereign.

de nas 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pas/ glang po'i lta stangs kyis bltas te/ /tshong dpon gyi bu nor bzang la 'di skad ces smras so/ /rigs kyi bu/ de ltar khyod kyis bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed de/ dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyi rjes su 'brang zhing / byang chub sems dpa'i lam yongs su rdzogs par bya bar 'dod de/ byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa yongs su dri bar bsam pa legs so/ /legs so/ /rigs kyi bu/ 'di lta ste/ dge ba'i bshes gnyen rnams la bsnyen cing bsten pa dang / rim gror bya ba 'di ni thams cad mkhyen pa nyid yongs su grub par 'gyur ba'i gzhi yin te/ 'di ni mthun pa'i rgyu yin gyi/ rigs kyi bu/ de bas na khyod kyis dge ba'i bshes gnyen bsnyen bkur bas yongs su ma skyo bar gyis shig /

Then Manjushri, gazing like an elephant, said to Sudhana, “It is good that you follow spiritual benefactors, having set your mind on supreme enlightenment, that you think you should inquire into the practice of enlightening beings, wishing to fulfill the path of enlightening beings. Attending and serving spiritual friends is the beginning, the logical course, for the accomplishment of omniscience. Therefore you should tirelessly attend spiritual benefactors.”

nor bzang gis smras pa/ 'phags pa/ ji ltar byang chub sems dpas byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa la bslab par bgyi/ ji ltar nan tan du bgyi/ ji ltar byang chub sems dpas byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa brtsam par bgyi/ ji ltar byang chub sems dpas byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa la spyad par bgyi/ ji ltar byang chub sems dpas byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa yongs su rdzogs par bgyi/ ji ltar byang chub sems dpas byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa yongs su sbyang bar bgyi/ ji ltar byang chub sems dpas byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa la 'jug par bgyi/ ji ltar byang chub sems dpas byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa mngon par bsgrub par bgyi/ ji ltar byang chub sems dpas byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa'i rjes su 'brang bar bgyi/ ji ltar byang chub sems dpas byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa la lhag par dmigs par bgyi/ ji ltar byang chub sems dpas byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa rgyas par bgyi/ ji ltar byang chub sems dpas kun tu bzang po'i spyod pa'i dkyil 'khor yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ba rgya cher bstan du gsol/

Sudhana said, “Noble One, please give me a full explanation of how an enlightening being is to study the practice of enlightening beings, how an enlightening being is to accomplish it. How is an enlightening being to initiate the practice of enlightening beings? How is an enlightening being to carry out the practice of enlightening beings? How is an enlightening being to fulfill the practice of enlightening beings? How is an enlightening being to purify the practice of enlightening beings? How is an enlightening being to comprehend the practice of enlightening beings? How is an enlightening being to effect the practice of enlightening beings? How is an enlightening being to follow the practice of enlightening beings? How is an enlightening being to keep to the practice of enlightening beings? How is an enlightening being to expand the practice of enlightening beings? How can an enlightening being fulfill the sphere of the universally good practice?”
de nas 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pas/ tshong dpon gyi bu nor bzang la tshigs su bcad de smras pa/
Then Manjushri spoke to Sudhana in verse:

dge ba'i bsod nams gangs chen mtsho/ / de ltar khyod ni nga yi drung du nyer phyin te; ; snying rje'i snying brtse rgya chen gyi/ / yid ldan byang chub dam pa tshol bar legs/ /
'gro ba thams cad dgrol don du/ / spyod pa mtshungs med don du smon lam rab 'debs shing / / 'gro ba kun gyi skyabs 'gyur ba/ / byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa'i tshul 'di yin/ /
byang chub sems dpa'i brtan pa rnams/ / 'khor ba'i nang na skyo med yid kyis spyod byed pa/ / de dag kun tu bzang po yi/ / spyod pa thub med chags med 'thob par 'gyur/ /
bsod nams 'od can bsod nams dpal/ / de ltar khyod ni kun tu bzang po'i spyod pa la/ / 'gro la phan phyir smon byed pa/ / bsod nams rgya mtsho dge zhing dag pa'i mtshan/ /
mtha' dang dbus med tshad med pa'i/ / phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten sangs rgyas kun kyang mthong bar 'gyur/ / dran pa'i mthu dang stobs kyis kyang / / de dag chos kyi sprin kyang yongs su 'dzin par 'gyur/ /
de ltar khyod kyis phyogs bcu yi/ / sangs rgyas zhing rnams kun tu rgyal ba mthong nas kyang / / byang chub spyod pa'i don gyi phyir/ / de dag kun la smon lam rgya mtsho dag byed 'gyur/ /
'jig rten gtso la slob byed cing / / gang rnams sangs rgyas sa la gnas ni bcas byas shing / / 'di tshul rgya mtshor zhugs gyur pa/ / de dag kun kyang thams cad gzigs par 'gyur/ /
khyod ni 'byams klas zhing kun du/ / bskal mang zhing rdul snyed du kun tu bzang po yi; ; spyod pa'i dam pa spyod byas shing / / byang chub dam pa zhi ba 'thob par 'gyur/ /
zhing rnams mtha' dang dbus med pa/ / ma lus kun tu bskal pa rgya mtshor spyad par gyis/ / kun tu bzang po'i spyod mchog phyir/ / smon lam rgya chen yongs su rdzogs par byos/ /
khyod kyi smon lam thos gyur nas/ / sems can khrag khrig dga' ba yongs su skyes gyur cing / / kun tu bzang po'i ye shes kyis/ / byang chub mchog tu smon pa byed la ltos/ /

Bravo, ocean of pure virtues, who has come to me; With a mind of vast compassion, you seek supreme enlightenment.
You are committed to the peerless course of conduct for the sake of the liberation of all beings; You will become a savior of the world—this is the principle of enlightening beings’ practice.
Enlightening beings who are steadfast and indefatigable work within the mundane— They attain universal good, invincible and unobstructed.
Light of virtue, star of virtue, mine of virtue, ocean of virtue, pure— You are committed to universal good in practice, for the welfare of the world.
You will see infinite buddhas, in the worlds of the ten directions: And you will hold their clouds of teachings by the power of memory.
As you see the buddhas in the buddha-lands of the ten directions, You will clarify their ocean of vows in enlightenment practice.
Those who enter this ocean of principles and stand on the ground of buddhahood Will become all-seers, learning from the Guides of the world.
Having practiced the conduct of universal good throughout all lands, for as many eons as there are atoms in the lands, You will reach enlightenment, the abode of peace and bliss.
You should practice for boundless oceans of eons in all lands And fulfill this undertaking of the conduct of universal higher good.
Behold the millions of beings who are happy to hear your vow, Who seek enlightenment by the knowledge of universal good.

de nas 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pas/ tshigs su bcad pa de dag smras nas/ tshong dpon gyi bu nor bzang po la 'di skad ces bsgo'o/ /rigs kyi bu/ de ltar khyod bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed cing / byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa yongs su btsal bar sems dpa' legs so/ /legs so/ /rigs kyi bu/ 'di ltar bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed pa de lta bu'i sems can yang rab tu dkon te/ de bas kyang gang gis bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed nas/ byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa yongs su tshol ba de lta bu'i sems can ni ches dkon no; ;rigs kyi bu/ de bas na byang chub sems dpas thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes thob par bya ba'i phyir/ yang dag pa'i dge ba'i bshes gnyen las gdon mi za bar rtogs pa thob par gyis shig /dge ba'i bshes gnyen yongs su btsal ba la yongs su skyo ba'i yid med par gyis shig /dge ba'i bshes gnyen blta ba la ngoms pa med par gyis shig ;dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyis bstan pa la mthun par 'dzin par gyis shig /dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyis thabs mkhas pa'i spyod pa la khong khro ba med par gyis shig/ rigs kyi bu/ lho phyogs kyi rgyud 'di nyid na/ yul mi mo gya nom mchog ces bya ba yod de/ de na mgul legs pa zhes bya ba'i ri zhig yod pa de la/ dge slong sprin gyi dpal zhes bya ba 'dug gi /de'i gan du song la ji ltar byang chub sems dpas byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa la bslab par bya ba dang / ji ltar nan tan du bya ba dang / ji ltar byang chub sems dpas/ byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa brtsam par bya ba dang / ji ltar byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa la spyad par bya ba dang / ji ltar byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa yongs su rdzogs par bya ba dang / ji ltar yongs su dag par bya ba dang / ji ltar 'jug par bya ba dang / ji ltar mngon par bsgrub par bya ba dang / ji ltar rjes su 'brang bar bya ba dang / ji ltar lhag par dmigs par bya ba dang / ji ltar rgyas par bya ba dang / ji ltar byang chub sems dpa' kun tu bzang po'i spyod pa'i dkyil 'khor yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ba dris shig dang / dge ba'i bshes gnyen de khyed la kun tu bzang po'i spyod pa'i dkyil 'khor ston to/ /

Then Manjushri, having uttered these verses, said to Sudhana, “It is good that you think, having set your heart on supreme enlightenment, that you should find out the practice of enlightening beings. It is hard to find beings who set their hearts on supreme enlightenment. It is even harder to find beings who, once they have set their minds on enlightenment, seek the practice of enlightening beings. An enlightening being is to attain certainty through true spiritual friends, spiritual benefactors, for the realization of omniscience. One should indefatigably seek spiritual benefactors and be tireless in seeing spiritual benefactors. One should respectfully follow the appropriate instructions of spiritual benefactors and should carry out the techniques skillfully devised by spiritual benefactors, without interruption. South of here is a country called Ramavaranta; there is a mountain there called Sugriva, where a monk named Meghashri lives. Go to him and ask how an enlightening being should learn the conduct of enlightening beings, and how to apply it; how one is to fulfill, purify, enter into, carry out, follow, keep to, and expand the practice of enlightening beings, and how an enlightening being is to fulfill the sphere of universally good action. That spiritual friend will tell you about the sphere of universally good conduct.”

de nas tshong dpon gyi bu nor bzang dga' rangs te/ mgu zhing nyams bde la/ tshim zhing yid bde ba skyes nas/ 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa'i rkang pa gnyis la spyi bos phyag 'tshal te/ 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa la/ lan brgya stong du mar g.yas phyogs su bskor ba byas nas/ lan brgya brgya stong du mar phyir bltas te/ dge ba'i bshes gnyen yid du 'ong ba'i sems dang ldan pas dge ba'i bshes gnyen mi mthong ba mi bzod de/ gdong mchi mas gang bar du zhing; 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa'i drung nas song ngo/ /

Then Sudhana, pleased, enraptured, transported with joy, delighted, happy, and cheerful, laid his head at the feet of Manjushri in respect, circled Manjushri hundreds and thousands of times, and looked at him hundreds and thousands of times, with a mind full of love for the spiritual friend, unable to bear not seeing the spiritual friend, with tears streaming down his face as he wept, and left Manjushri.
[dge slong sprin gyi dpal]
Meghashri

de nas tshong dpon gyi bu nor bzang mthar gyis yul mi mo gya nom mchog ces bya ba der song ste/ phyin nas yul mi mo gya nom mchog nas rnam par rgyus te/ sngon gyi dge ba'i rtsa bas byung zhing las rgya chen byin gyis brlabs pa'i longs spyod yid du 'ong ba la yongs su spyod cing / ri mgul legs pa gang na ba der phyin nas/ mgul legs pa'i ri la 'dzegs te/ dge slong sprin gyi dpal tshol tshol zhing shar phyogs logs su byung ngo/ /de bzhin du lho dang / nub dang / byang dang / byang shar gyi phyogs mtshams dang / shar lho'i phyogs mtshams dang / lho nub kyi phyogs mtshams dang / nub byang gi phyogs mtshams su'ang byung ste/ bla 'og tu'ang lta zhing dge slong sprin gyi dpal tshol tshol ba las/ des zhag bdun lon pa dang / dge slong sprin gyi dpal ri rtse zhig gi sman ljongs na 'chag cing 'dug pa mthong nas/ dge slong sprin gyi dpal gang na ba der song ste/ dge slong sprin gyi dpal gyi rkang pa gnyis la spyi bos phyag 'tshal nas/ dge slong sprin gyi dpal la g.yas phyogs su bskor ba byas te/ mdun du 'dug nas thal mo sbyar te/ 'di skad ces smras so/ /'phags pa thugs su chud par mdzad du gsol/ /bdag gis bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed na/ ji ltar byang chub sems dpas byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa la bslab par bgyi ba dang / ji ltar nan tan du bgyi ba dang / ji ltar byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa brtsam pa dang / ji ltar byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa la spyad par bgyi ba dang / ji ltar byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa yongs su spyod pa rdzogs par bgyi ba dang / ji ltar yongs su dag par bgyi ba dang / ji ltar 'jug par bgyi ba dang / ji ltar rjes su 'brang bar bgyi ba dang / ji ltar mngon par bsgrub par bgyi ba dang / ji ltar lhag par dmigs par bgyi ba dang / ji ltar rgyas par bgyi ba dang; ji ltar byang chub sems dpas kun tu bzang po'i spyod pa'i dkyil 'khor yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ba ma 'tshal te/ 'phags pa khyod ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams la gdams ngag dang / rjes su ston pa mdzad ces thos na/ 'phags pa ji ltar byang chub sems dpa' bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu 'byung bar 'gyur ba bdag la bstan du gsol/ de skad ces smras pa dang /

Then Sudhana proceeded by stages to the country of Ramavaranta. Having reached Ramavaranta, reflecting on and tasting the mentally pleasing enjoyments based on higher action born of past roots of goodness, he went to Mount Sugriva, climbed the mountain, and looked in every direction for the monk Meghashri. Finally, after seven days, he saw the monk walking on the plateau of another peak. He went to Meghashri, paid his respects, and said, “O noble one, I have determined to seek supreme enlightenment, but I do not know how an enlightening being should learn the conduct of enlightening beings, or how one should accomplish it, or how to begin the practice of enlightening beings, how to carry it out, fulfill it, purify it, comprehend it, realize it, follow it, keep to it, and expand it, or how an enlightening being is to fulfill the sphere of universally good action. I hear that you give instruction for enlightening beings, so please tell me how enlightening beings proceed to supreme perfect enlightenment.”

dge slong sprin gyi dpal gyis/ tshong dpon gyi bu nor bzang la 'di skad ces smras so/ /rigs kyi bu/ de ltar khyod kyis bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed cing / byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa yongs su dri ba legs so/ /legs so/ /rigs kyi bu/ 'di lta ste/ byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa yongs su btsal ba dang / byang chub sems dpa'i spyod yul yongs su btsal ba dang / byang chub sems dpa'i 'byung ba rnam par dag pa yongs su btsal ba dang / byang chub sems dpa'i lam rnam par dag pa yongs su btsal ba dang / byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa rgya chen po rnam par dag pa yongs su btsal ba dang / byang chub sems dpa'i mngon par shes pa bsgrub pa rnam par dag pa yongs su btsal ba dang / byang chub sems dpa'i rnam par thar pa yongs su bstan pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i snang ba'i snying rje'i rgyud yongs su bstan pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i 'gro ba'i bsam pa ji lta ba bzhin du rjes su 'brang ba dang / byang chub sems dpas 'khor ba dang / mya ngan las 'das pa'i sgo yongs su bstan pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi 'dus byas dang / 'dus ma byas kyi skyon dang / 'jigs pas mi gos pa'i rgyud yongs su btsal ba 'di ni dka'o/ /shin tu dka'o/ /rigs kyi bu/ kho bo ni mos pa'i stobs kyi dbang gis/ mig gi blo gros dang / dad pa'i mig rnam par dag pas/ kun tu mngon par blta ba'i ye shes kyi 'od snang ba phyin phyogs med pa dang / yul kun la thogs pa med cing bsgribs pa thams cad dang bral ba'i lhag mthong la mkhas pa dang / mig gi yul kun nas yongs su dag pa'i lus rnam par dag pa dang / phyogs kyi rgyud 'byams klas pa thams cad du mngon par 'dud pa'i lus kyis 'dud pa la mkhas pa dang / sangs rgyas thams cad kyi chos kyi sprin yongs su 'dzin pa'i gzungs kyi stobs kyis/ phyogs kyi rgyud thams cad kun nas mngon du gzigs pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa rnams mthong ste/ 'di ltar shar phyogs kyi de bzhin gshegs pa gcig kyang mthong ngo/ /sangs rgyas gnyis dang / bcu dang / sangs rgyas brgya dang / sangs rgyas stong dang / sangs rgyas brgya phrag stong dang / sangs rgyas bye ba dang / sangs rgyas bye ba brgya dang / sangs rgyas bye ba stong dang / sangs rgyas bye ba brgya phrag stong dang / sangs rgyas bye ba khrag khrig brgya phrag stong nas/ de bzhin gshegs pa tshad med pa/ dpag tu med pa/ grangs med pa/ bsam gyis mi khyab pa/ mtshungs pa med pa/ kun tu mtha' yas pa/ sa mtshams med pa/ gzhal du med pa/ brjod du med pa'i yang brjod du med pa dag kyang mthong ngo/ /de bzhin gshegs pa 'dzam bu'i gling gi rdul shin tu phra ba snyed kyang mthong ngo/ /de bzhin gshegs pa gling bzhi pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams rdul shin tu phra ba snyed dang / stong dang / stong gnyis pa dang / stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams na sangs rgyas kyi zhing gi rdul shin tu phra ba snyed kyang mthong ngo/ /de bzhin gshegs pa sangs rgyas kyi zhing bcu'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed kyang mthong ngo/ /de bzhin gshegs pa sangs rgyas kyi zhing brgya'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing stong gi rdul shin tu phra ba snyed dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing brgya phrag stong gi rdul shin tu phra ba snyed dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing bye ba'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing bye ba phrag brgya'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing bye ba phrag stong gi rdul shin tu phra ba snyed dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing bye ba brgya phrag stong gi rdul shin tu phra ba snyed dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing bye ba khrag khrig brgya phrag stong gi rdul shin tu phra ba snyed nas/ sangs rgyas kyi zhing brjod du med pa'i yang brjod du med pa'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed dag kyang mthong ste/ shar phyogs logs su ji lta ba de bzhin du/ lho phyogs dang / nub phyogs dang / byang phyogs dang / byang shar gyi phyogs mtshams dang / shar lho'i phyogs mtshams dang / lho nub kyi phyogs mtshams dang / nub byang gi phyogs mtshams dang / 'og dang / bla'i phyogs kyi de bzhin gshegs pa gcig kyang mthong ba nas/ de bzhin gshegs pa sangs rgyas kyi zhing brjod du med pa'i yang brjod du med pa'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed dag kyang mthong ba'i bar du ste/ phyogs re rer rnam par bltas kyang de bzhin gshegs pa kha dog sna tshogs mnga' ba dang / dbyibs sna tshogs mnga' ba dang / rnam par 'phrul pa sna tshogs mnga' ba dang / khyu mchog gi mthu dang / rnam par rol pa sna tshogs mnga' ba dang / 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor gyi rgyan rnam pa sna tshogs mnga' ba dang / 'od zer gyi dra ba snang ba kha dog du ma can dang / kha dog mtha' yas pa rab tu 'gyed pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing rnam par dag pa dang / pho brang dang rgyan sna tshogs mnga' ba dang; sku tshe'i tshad rnam par dag pa sna tshogs mnga' ba dang / 'gro ba'i bsam pa ji lta ba bzhin du rnam par dmigs par mdzad pa dang / mngon par 'tshang rgya ba rnam par dag pa'i sgos rnam par 'phrul pa rnam pa sna tshogs mnga' ba dang / sangs rgyas kyi khyu mchog dang / seng ge'i nga ro rnam par sgrog pa mang po mthong ngo/ /

The monk Meghashri replied to Sudhana, “It is good that you ask about the practice of enlightening beings, having set your mind on supreme perfect enlightenment. It is difficult, most difficult, to seek the practice of enlightening beings, to seek the sphere of enlightening beings, to seek the purification of emancipation of enlightening beings, to seek the purification of the path of enlightening beings, to seek the far-ranging purification of the conduct of enlightening beings, to seek the purification of the accomplishment of mystic knowledge of enlightening beings, to show the liberation of enlightening beings, to show enlightening beings’ exercise of compassion for the world, to oblige people according to their mentalities in the manner of enlightening beings, to show enlightening beings’ mundane and transcendental faces, to seek the thought and action of enlightening beings undefiled by the ills and fears of the created and the uncreated. Son, by virtue of mastery of the power of devotion, purity of the eye of perceptive faith, illumination of the light of knowledge without aversion, purity of the universal eye looking in all directions with unobstructed universal perspective and unobstructed vision skillfully observing, skillfulness in obeisance, bowing in all directions in a state of physical purity, and the power of memory command perfectly holding the masses of teachings of all buddhas, I see the buddhas in all the lands of the ten directions. That is, in the east I see one buddha, two buddhas, three buddhas, a hundred buddhas, a thousand buddhas, a hundred thousand buddhas, a million buddhas, a hundred million buddhas, a billion buddhas, a hundred billion buddhas, a quintillion buddhas—I see incalculable, immeasurable, uncountable, inconceivable, incomparable, incomprehensible, unlimited, ungraspable, inestimable, unutterable numbers of buddhas. I see as many buddhas as atoms in this continent; I see as many buddhas as atoms in the land masses of the four continents; I see as many buddhas as atoms in thousand-world, million-world, and billion-world buddha-lands; I see as many buddhas as atoms in ten buddha-lands; I see as many buddhas as atoms in a hundred buddha-lands; I see as many buddhas as atoms in a thousand buddha-lands; I see as many buddhas as atoms in a hundred thousand buddha-lands; I see as many buddhas as atoms in a million buddha-lands; I see as many buddhas as atoms in a hundred million buddha-lands; I see as many buddhas as atoms in a billion buddha-lands; I see as many buddhas as atoms in a hundred billion buddha-lands; I see as many buddhas as atoms in a quintillion buddha-lands; I see as many buddhas as atoms in untold numbers of buddha-lands. As in the east, in the same way I see untold buddhas in all the other directions as well; looking in each direction, I see buddhas with various appearances, I see buddhas with various forms, various transfigurations, various exercises of power, various congregations, radiating light in networks of rays of many colors, with various arrays of states of purity in their buddha-lands, various life spans, showing magical projections of various ways of purification of enlightenment to beings according to their mentalities, roaring the mighty lion roar of buddhas.

de ltar rigs kyi bu/ kho bos ni sgo kun nas dmigs pa thams cad rnam par rig pa la yang dag par gzhol ba'i sangs rgyas rjes su dran pa 'di thob par zad na/ byang chub sems dpa' ye shes kyi dkyil 'khor rnam par dag pa gang gis de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi dkyil 'khor dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing dang / pho brang rnam par dag pa'i rgyan mngon par mthong bas/ sangs rgyas rjes su dran pa'i sgo nas kun nas snang ba'i dkyil 'khor rab tu thob pa dang / bsam pa ji lta ba bzhin du rnam par dmigs par/ de bzhin gshegs pa mthong ba rnam par dag pas; sangs rgyas rjes su dran pa'i sgo 'gro ba thams cad du sgro btags pa rab tu thob pa dang / gang gis de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu tshad med pa'i rjes su 'brang bas/ sangs rgyas rjes su dran pa'i sgo stobs kyis sgro btags pa rab tu thob pa dang / gang gis chos mnyan pa'i rnam pas de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi sgo'i sprin la blta bas/ sangs rgyas rjes su dran pa'i sgo chos kyis sgro btags pa rab tu thob pa dang / gang gis phyogs rgya mtsho thams cad kyi sangs rgyas mtsho tha mi dad pa la 'jug pas; sangs rgyas rjes su dran pa'i sgo phyogs rnam par snang ba'i snying po rab tu thob pa dang / gang gis de bzhin gshegs pa'i rnam par 'phrul pa dang / khyu mchog gi mthu phyung ba la rab tu phra bar dmigs shing 'jug pas/ sangs rgyas rjes su dran pa'i sgo phyogs thams cad du 'jug pa rab tu thob pa dang / bskal pa thams cad du de bzhin gshegs pa mthong zhing rnam par dmigs pa dang mi 'bral bas/ sangs rgyas rjes su dran pa'i sgo bskal par sgro btags pa rab tu thob pa dang / gang gis dus thams cad du de bzhin gshegs pa mthong zhing 'grogs pa dang mi 'bral bas/ sangs rgyas rjes su dran pa'i sgo dus su sgro btags pa rab tu thob pa dang / gang gis sangs rgyas kyi zhing thams cad nas mngon par 'phags shing / zil gyis mi non pa'i sangs rgyas kyi sku yongs su mthong zhing rnam par rig pas sangs rgyas rjes su dran pa'i sgo zhing du sgro btags pa rab tu thob pa dang / gang gis dus gsum gyi de bzhin gshegs pa'i dkyil 'khor rang gi sems dang bsam par yang dag par gzhol bas/ sangs rgyas rjes su dran pa'i sgo dus gsum du sgro btags pa rab tu thob pa dang / gang gis dmigs pa thams cad la de bzhin gshegs pa gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pa yang dag par tshogs pa mthong zhing dmigs pas/ sangs rgyas rjes su dran pa'i sgo dmigs par sgro btags pa rab tu thob pa dang / gang gis skad cig gcig la 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba rnam par dmigs pas sangs rgyas rjes su dran pa'i sgo zhi bas sgro btags pa rab tu thob pa dang / gang gis nyin gcig tu gnas thams cad du de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad gshegs par rnam par dmigs pas/ sangs rgyas rjes su dran pa'i sgo 'bral bas sgro btags pa rab tu thob pa dang / gang gis de bzhin gshegs pa re re skyil mo krung du bzhugs pas kyang / chos kyi dbyings thams cad du rgyas par khyab ba'i sangs rgyas kyi sku rnam par dmigs pas/ sangs rgyas rjes su dran pa'i sgo shin tu yangs pas sgro btags pa rab tu thob pa dang / gang gis skra'i rtse mo gcig la sangs rgyas brjod du med pa byung ba mnyes par bya ba la 'jug pas/ sangs rgyas rjes su dran pa'i sgo shin tu phra bas sgro btags pa rab tu thob pa dang / skad cig gcig la 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du mngon par 'tshang rgya zhing rnam par 'phrul pa ston pa rnam par dmigs pas/ gang gis sangs rgyas rjes su dran pa'i sgo rgyan du sgro btags pa rab tu thob pa dang / sangs rgyas byung ba thams cad kyi chos kyi 'khor lo dang / rnam par 'phrul pa dang / ye shes snang ba rab tu thob pas/ gang gis sangs rgyas rjes su dran pa'i sgo bgos par sgro btags pa rab tu thob pa dang / rang gis sems dang bsam pa la bltas nas/ de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad rab tu snang ba thob pas/ sangs rgyas rjes su dran pa'i sgo sems kyis sgro btags pa rab tu thob pa dang / 'gro ba thams cad kyi las rnam pa ji lta bur bsags pa'i gzugs brnyan yongs su ston pas gang gis sangs rgyas rjes su dran pa'i sgo las kyis sgro btags pa rab tu thob pa dang / chos kyi dbyings ma lus pa thams cad pad+mo'i tshal gyis rgyas par sangs rgyas rnam par 'phrul pa rgya chen po ston pa/ phyogs kun tu mngon sum du dmigs pas gang gis sangs rgyas rjes su dran pa'i sgo rnam par 'phrul pas sgro btags pa rab tu thob pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku gzugs brnyan gyi sprin dbyangs sgrog pas chos kyi dbyings dang nam mkha' kun nas snang ba/ gang gis sangs rgyas rjes su dran pa'i sgo nam mkha' sgro btags pa rab tu thob pa de dag gi spyod pa shes pa'am/ yon tan brjod par nus re skan/

“Son, from this universal light in which is concentrated the information of all sense objects, I have attained mindfulness of the buddhas: but how can I know the practice, or tell of the virtues, of the enlightening beings who have purified the sphere of endless knowledge, who have attained the means of mindfulness of buddhas in the sphere of universal illumination, by seeing right before their eyes the pure arrays of abodes in all buddha-lands in the spheres of all buddhas; who have attained the means of mindfulness of buddhas in which the ten powers are developed, by following the infinite ten powers of the enlightened; who have attained the means of mindfulness of buddhas in which the truth is displayed, by observation of the clouds of bodies of all buddhas as sources from which the truth is heard; who have attained the means of mindfulness of buddhas which is the seed of illumination of all realms, by plunging into the undivided ocean of buddhas in all oceans of realms; who have attained the means of mindfulness of buddhas throughout the ten directions, by comprehending the majesty of projections of all buddhas in all microcosms; who have attained the means of mindfulness of buddhas in all ages, by communication of the inseparable vision of Buddha in all ages; who have attained the means of mindfulness of buddhas in all times, by seeing buddhas according to the time in all times and living with them inseparably; who have attained the means of mindfulness of buddhas in all fields, by communication of the vision of the transcendent, unsurpassed body of buddhas in all buddha-fields; who have attained the means of mindfulness of buddhas in all sense objects, by communication of vision of successive emergence of buddhas in all objects; who have attained the means of mindfulness of buddhas by which peace is developed, through revelation of the ultimate extinction of all buddhas in all worlds in a single instant; who have attained the means of mindfulness of buddhas by which detachment is developed, by revelation of all buddhas going forth from all abodes in one day; who have attained the means of mindfulness of buddhas in the past, by revelation of the bodies of buddhas, each buddha sitting cross-legged filling the cosmos; who have attained the means of mindfulness of buddhas in the minute, by entering into the service of untold buddhas appearing in a single point; who have attained the means of mindfulness of buddhas in supernal manifestations, by communication of visions of mystical displays of attainment of enlightenment in all worlds in one instant; who have attained the means of mindfulness of buddhas in religious actions, by attainment of the illumination of knowledge of the miracle of all buddhas coming forth and teaching; who have attained the means of projected mindfulness of buddhas, by apprehending appearances of all buddhas seen as they wish; who have attained the means of mindfulness of buddhas in deeds, by showing reflected images according to the deeds that all beings have done; who have attained the means of mindfulness of buddhas in mystic projections, by means of the ubiquitous manifestation of visions of tremendous projections of buddhas on lotus blossoms blooming in all phenomenal and noumenal realms; who have attained the means of mindfulness of buddhas in space, by vision of the space of the cosmos adorned by clouds of images of buddhas?

song / rigs kyi bu/ lho phyogs kyi rgyud 'di nyid na; phyogs kyi ljongs rgya mtsho'i sgo zhes bya ba yod pa de na/ dge slong rgya mtsho'i sprin ces bya ba 'dug gi de'i gan du song la/ ji ltar byang chub sems dpas byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa la bslab par bya ba dang / ji ltar nan tan du bya ba dris shig dang / rigs kyi bu/ dge ba'i bshes gnyen de khyod la/ dge ba'i rtsa ba'i tshogs dang / rgyu yongs su ston par 'gyur ro; ;tshogs kyis rgya chen po yang khong du chud par byed do/ /dge ba'i rtsa ba'i stobs dang / shugs rgya chen po yang yongs su skyed par byed do/ /byang chub kyi sems kyi tshogs dang / rgyu rgya chen po yang yongs su brjod par 'gyur ro/ /theg pa chen po rab tu 'thob pa dang / snang bar 'gyur ba'i rgyu rgya chen po yang skyed par byed do/ /pha rol tu phyin pa'i tshogs kyi stobs rgya chen po yang rab tu ston par byed do/ /spyod pa rgya mtsho la 'jug pa'i tshul rgya chen po yang rab tu brjod par 'gyur ro/ /smon lam gyi dkyil 'khor rgya chen po yang yongs su sbyong bar 'gyur ro/ /sgo kun nas 'byung ba'i rgyan rgya chen po yang rnam par sbyong bar 'gyur ro/ /snying rje chen po'i stobs rgya chen po yang yongs su 'phel bar byed do/ /

“Go, son—south of here is a place called Sagaramukha, where there lives a monk named Sagaramegha. Go to him and ask him how an enlightening being is to learn and accomplish the conduct of enlightening beings. He will reveal to you a spiritual benefactor; he will introduce you into the cause of accumulation of roots of goodness; he will get you to develop the vast ground of provisions for enlightenment; he will tell you of the immense, intense power of roots of goodness; he will inform you of the great cause of preparation of the determination for enlightenment; he will establish in you the great cause of the illumination of the vehicle of universal salvation; he will cause you to develop the great power of the set of transcendent ways; he will get you to purify extensive means of entry into the ocean of religious practice; he will get you to purify the vast sphere of vows; he will get you to develop extensive systems of all-sided emancipation; he will get you to develop the immense power of compassion.”

de nas tshong dpon gyi bu nor bzang gis dge slong sprin gyi dpal gyi rkang pa gnyis la spyi bos phyag 'tshal nas/ dge slong sprin gyi dpal la lan brgya stong du mar g.yas phyogs su bskor ba byas te/ lan brgya stong du mar phyir bltas nas/ dge slong sprin gyi dpal gyi drung nas song ngo// //
Then Sudhana paid his respects to the monk Meghashri and left.
bam po dgu bcu tham pa/
[dge slong rgya mtsho'i sprin]
Sagaramegha

de nas tshong dpon gyi bu nor bzang dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyi gdams ngag de rjes su bsam pa dang / ye shes snang ba de rjes su dran par bya ba dang / byang chub sems dpa'i rnam par thar pa de rnam par dpyad pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi tshul de rjes su sbyang ba dang / byang chub sems dpa' rgya mtsho'i tshul de blta ba dang / sangs rgyas kyi dkyil 'khor de la mngon par mos par bya ba dang / sangs rgyas kyi blta ba'i phyogs de la mngon par spro bar bya ba dang / sangs rgyas rgya mtsho de la rjes su bsam pa dang / sangs rgyas gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pa de rjes su dran par bya ba dang / sangs rgyas kyi tshul rtogs par bya ba de khong du chud par bya ba dang / sangs rgyas kyi nam mkha' de la rjes su blta bar bya ba byed cing mthar gyis phyogs kyi ljongs rgya mtsho'i sgo gang na ba dang / dge slong rgya mtsho'i sprin gang na ba der phyin nas/ dge slong rgya mtsho'i sprin gyi rkang pa gnyis la spyi bos phyag 'tshal te/ dge slong rgya mtsho'i sprin la lan brgya stong du mar g.yas phyogs su bskor ba byas nas/ dge slong rgya mtsho'i sprin gyi mdun du 'dug ste/ tham mo sbyar nas 'di skad ces smras so/ /'phags pa/ bdag ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par zhugs te/ bla na med pa'i ye shes rgya mtsho la 'jug par 'tshal na/ ji ltar byang chub sems dpa' rnams 'jig rten gyi rgyud las phyir ldog cing / de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs su 'grub par 'gyur ba dang / 'khor ba'i rgya mtsho las brgal zhing / thams cad mkhyen pa'i rgya mtshor 'jug par 'gyur ba dang / byis pa so so'i skye bo'i sa las gyen du 'phags par 'gyur zhing / de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs su 'grub par 'gyur ba dang / 'khor ba'i rgyud las ldog par 'gyur zhing / byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa'i rgyud du 'jug par 'gyur ba dang / 'khor ba'i rgya mtsho'i rgyud kyi 'khor lo las phyir ldog cing / byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa dang / smon lam gyi 'khor lor 'jug par 'gyur ba dang / bdud kyi dkyil 'khor thams cad rab tu 'joms shing / sangs rgyas kyi dkyil 'khor 'byung ba thams cad rab tu ston pa dang / srid pa'i rgya mtsho yongs su skems shin snying rje chen po'i mtsho rnam par 'phel bar byed pa dang / mi khom pa dang / ngan song dang / ngan 'gro dang / log par ltung ba thams cad kyi sgo gcod cing mtho ris dang mya ngan las 'das pa'i sgo 'byed pa dang / khams gsum gyi grong khyer gyi sgo rnam par gcod cing / thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi pho brang gi sgo rnam par 'byed pa dang / yo byad thams cad kyi sred pa rnam par spong zhing 'gro ba thams cad bsdu ba'i smon lam yongs su bskyed par 'gyur ba ma 'tshal to/ /de skad ces smras pa dang /

Then Sudhana, reflecting on the instructions of that spiritual benefactor, pondering that enlightening liberation, polishing that enlightening method of concentration, peering into that conductor into the ocean of the essence of enlightenment, intent upon the sphere of buddhahood, seeking that direction to the vision of Buddha, thinking about that ocean of buddhas, remembering the succession of buddhas, following that approach to the means of enlightenment, looking throughout that sky of the enlightened, went gradually to the monk Sagaramegha in the region of Sagaramukha.
