When he got there, he paid his respects to Sagaramegha and said, “O noble one, I have set out for supreme perfect enlightenment and want to enter the supreme ocean of knowledge; but I do not know how enlightening beings get out of the host of worldlings and into the host of the enlightened, emerge from the ocean of the mundane whirl and enter the ocean of omniscience, die away from the state of ignorant sentient beings and are born in the family of buddhas, withdraw from the stream of the mundane whirl and follow the stream of enlightening practice, escape from the wheel of transmigration in the mundane whirl and turn to the wheel of practice and vows of enlightening beings, destroy the gang of all demons and make manifest the light of the host of all buddhas, evaporate the ocean of craving and increase the water of great compassion, close all doors of decadence and miserable states and evils which are inopportune for enlightenment and open the door of heaven and nirvana, break through the door of the city of the mundane and enter the door of the city of omniscience, give up craving for all luxuries and give rise to the determination to care for all being.”

dge slong rgya mtsho'i sprin gyis; tshong dpon gyi bu nor bzang la 'di skad ces smras so/ /rigs kyi bu/ khyod kyis de ltar bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed pa legs so/ /legs so; ;rigs kyi bu/ dge ba'i rtsa ba ma bskyed pa'i sems can rnams ni/ byang chub tu sems kyang mi skye'o/ /dge ba'i rtsa ba sgo kun tu snang ba rab tu thob dang / thabs kyi snying po dang ldan pa'i lam gyi ting nge 'dzin gyi ye shes snang bas rab tu snang bar 'gyur ba dang / bsod nams rgya mtsho'i tshogs rgya chen po bsags pa dang / dkar po'i tshogs thams cad kyi rgyun mi 'chad pa dang / dge ba'i bshes gnyen thams cad bkur bas yongs su skyo ba med pa dang / lus dang srog la phangs par mi rtsi ba dang / dngos por 'dzin pa thams cad dang bral ba dang / mthon dman med pa'i sa ltar sems mnyam pa dang / rang bzhin gyis snying rje che zhing byams par sems pa dang ldan pa dang / srid pa'i lam gyi rgyud thams cad du gnas par 'dug pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i yul la mngon par mos pa'i sems can rnams byang chub tu sems skye ste/ 'di ltar sems can thams cad yongs su bskyab pa'i phyir snying rje chen po'i sems dang / 'gro ba thams cad la snyoms par nan tan du bya ba'i phyir byams pa chen po'i sems dang / 'gro ba thams cad kyi sdug bsngal kyi phung po zhi bar bya ba'i phyir bde ba'i sems dang / mi dge ba'i chos thams cad las rnam par bzlog pa'i phyir phan pa'i sems dang / 'jigs pa thams cad las yongs su bsrung ba'i phyir snying brtse ba'i sems dang / sgrib pa thams cad rnam par bzlog pa'i phyir chags pa med pa'i sems dang / chos kyi dbyings thams cad rgyas par dgang ba'i phyir rgya chen po'i sems dang / nam mkha'i dbyings kun tu gzhol zhing kun tu 'gro bar bya ba'i phyir mtha' yas pa'i sems dang / de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad mthong zhing rnam par dmigs par bya ba'i phyir dri ma med pa'i sems dang / dus gsum gyi dmigs pa ma lus par ye shes kyis rgyas par dgang ba'i phyir rnam par dag pa'i sems dang / thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes rgya mtsho la 'jug par bya ba'i phyir ye shes kyi sems kyang skye bar 'gyur ro/ /

To this Sagaramegha replied, “It is good that you have set your mind on supreme perfect enlightenment. The will for enlightenment is not developed by people who have not planted roots of goodness; the will for enlightenment is produced by those who have attained the illumination of all-sided roots of goodness, who are illumined by the light of knowledge of concentration on the path containing the means of enlightenment, who have accumulated a vast ocean of virtue as provisions for the path to enlightenment, who ceaselessly practice all that is pure and good, who tirelessly apply the methods set up by all spiritual benefactors, who are not worried about their physical subsistence, who are free from clinging to material things, whose minds are equanimous as the earth, without high or low, who are by nature compassionate and friendly, who face up to all states of being, who seek the sphere of those who realize Thusness. In such people arises the mind of enlightenment—the mind of great compassion, for the salvation of all beings; the mind of great kindness, for unity with all beings; the mind of happiness, to stop the mass of misery of all beings; the altruistic mind, to repulse all that is not good; the mind of mercy, to protect from all fears; the unobstructed mind, to get rid of all obstacles; the broad mind, to pervade all universes; the infinite mind, to pervade all spaces; the undefiled mind, to manifest the vision of all buddhas; the purified mind, to penetrate all knowledge of past, present, and future; the mind of knowledge, to remove all obstructive knowledge and enter the ocean of all-knowing knowledge.

rigs kyi bu/ kho bos ni phyogs kyi ljongs rgya mtsho'i sgo 'dir lo bcu gnyis su rgya mtsho chen po 'di la dmigs te/ mngon du byas nas 'di ltar rgya mtsho rgya che zhing tshad med pa rjes su bsam pa dang / dri ma med cing dang ba dang / zab cing gting dpag dka' ba dang / bags kyis gzhol zhing legs par gnas pa dang / rin po che'i 'byung gnas du mas rnam par brgyan pa dang / chu'i phung po tshad med pa dang / kha dog rnam pa tha dad pa mang zhing bsam gyis mi khyab pa dang / 'byung po mtha' yas pa'i gnas su gyur pa dang / srog chags mang po sna tshogs kyi rten du gyur pa dang / sprin chen po'i char yongs su 'dzin pa dang / gang zhing 'bri bar 'gyur ba med pa la rjes su sems pa byed cing gnas gnas te/ rigs kyi bu/ de la kho bos 'di snyam du bsams so/ /'jig rten gyi khams 'di na rgya mtsho chen po 'di bas kyang 'phags par rgya che la 'di bas kyang yangs shing / 'di bas kyang tshad med la 'di bas kyang ngo mtshar dang ldan pa la la zhig yod dam snyam ste/ de de ltar kho bos tshul bzhin du bsam pa yid la byed pa la brtson par gnas pa'i tshe/ rgya mtsho chen po'i 'og gi gzhi las pad+ma chen po nor bu rin po che in+d+ra nI la thub pa med cing rdo rje lta bur sra ba'i chu ba can/ nor bu rin po che bai DUr+ya dam pa'i rgyan dang ldan pa/ 'dzam bu chu klung gi gser ltar dri ma med pa'i lo ma rgya chen po can/ dus dang mthun pa'i tsan dan gyi snying po'i rgyan gyis brgyan pa/ rin po che asma gar b+ha'i ze ba can/ rgya mtsho tsam du yangs shing rgya che ba/ lha ma yin gyi dbang po brgya stong phrag bcus sdong po'i lhun nas bzung ba/ rin po che sna tshogs brgya phrag stong gi dra bas kun nas yog pa/ klu'i dbang po brgya stong phrag bcus spos chu'i char mngon par phab pa/ nam mkha' lding gi dbang po brgya stong phrag bcus dar dang rin po che'i lda ldi dang / sen mo do mang po mchus gzung zhing rab tu dbyangs pa/ mi'am ci'i dbang po brgya stong phrag bcus phan pa'i sems kyis kun nas blta ba/ lto 'phye chen po'i dbang po brgya stong phrag bcus 'khor nas mngon par 'dud pa/ srin po'i dbang po brgya stong phrag bcus lus btud cing mngon par mchod pa/ dri za'i dbang po brgya stong phrag bcus rol mo dang glu sna tshogs snyan pas bstod cing mchod pa/ lha'i dbang po brgya stong phrag bcus lha rdzas kyi me tog dang / spos dang / phreng ba dang / bdug spos dang / byug pa dang / phye ma dang / gos dang / gdugs dang / rgyal mtshan dang / lha'i ba dan gyi sprin gyi char mngon par phab pa/ tshangs pa'i dbang po brgya stong phrag bcus spyi bos gtugs te phyag 'tshal zhing mchod pa/ gnas gtsang ma'i ris kyi lha brgya stong phrag bcus thal mo sbyar cing phyag bya ba/ mi'i dbang po 'khor los bsgyur ba brgya stong phrag bcus rin po che sna bdun gyis bsu zhing mngon par mchod pa/ rgya mtsho'i lha brgya stong phrag bcus mngon par 'thon cing phyag bya ba/ nor bu rin po che skar ma'i ngad brgya stong phrag bcu'i 'od zer gyi rgyan gyis rab tu snang bar byas pa/ nor bu rin po che bsod nams kyis dag pa brgya stong phrag bcus mkhos su phebs par 'phel bas rab tu brgyan pa/ nor bu rin po che rnam par snang ba brgya stong phrag bcus snying po rab tu gsal bar byas pa/ nor bu rin po che dpal gyi snying po brgya stong phrag bcus dpal chen po shin tu 'bar bar gyur pa/ nor bu rin po che mdzod sna tshogs brgya stong phrag bcus mtha' yas par snang bar byas pa/ nor bu rin po che 'dzam bu'i chu klung brgya stong phrag bcus yongs su ston par gnas pas rab tu brgyan pa/ nor bu rin po che rdo rje'i seng ge brgya stong phrag bcus thub pa med par brgyan pa/ nor bu rin po che nyi ma'i snying po brgya stong phrag bcus rgya cher gsal ba bsgrubs pa/ nor bu rin po che 'bar ba brgya stong phrag bcus kha dog sna tshogs su brgyan pa/ nor bu rin po che yid bzhin gyi rgyal po brgya stong phrag bcus mi zad pa'i rgyan dang / 'od 'bar bar byas pa byung ste/ pad+mo chen po de ni/ de bzhin gshegs pa'i 'jig rten las 'das ba'i dge ba'i rtsa ba las byung ba'o/ /byang chub sems dpa'i bsam pas yongs su brtan pa'o/ /phyogs thams cad du mngon par dmigs su yod pa'o/ /sgyu ma'i rnam pa'i chos kyis byung ba'o/ /rjen pa'i dri ma med pa'i las kyis byung ba'o/ /nyon mongs pa med pa'i chos kyi tshul gyis brgyan pa'o/ /rmi lam lta bu'i chos nyid kyis yongs su byung ba'o/ /mngon par 'du bya ba med pa'i chos kyi tshul gyis rgyas btab pa'o/ /chags pa med pa'i chos kyi tshul dang ldan pa'o/ /phyogs kyi khams kun tu chos kyi dbyings rgyas par 'gengs pa'o/ / sangs rgyas kyi yul brjod pa dang mthun pa ste/ de'i rnam pa dang / yon tan dang / dbyibs dang / kha dog dang / rgyan gyi mthar phyin par ni/ bskal pa brgya stong grangs med par yang khong du chud par mi nus te/ pad+mo chen po de yang de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku skyil mo krung du bzhugs pas khyab cing / yongs su rgyas par mthong ngo/ /de bzhin gshegs pa sku de yang 'di nas bzung ba nas/ srid pa'i rtse mo'i bar gyi mthas klas par mthong ngo/ /de bzhin gshegs pa de'i gdan gyi rgyan bsam gyis mi khyab pa'ang mthong ngo/ /'khor gyi dkyil 'khor gyi rgyan bsam gyis mi khyab pa dang / 'od kyi dkyil 'khor gyi rgyan bsam gyis mi khyab pa dang / mtshan phun sum tshogs pa bsam gyis mi khyab pa dang / dpe byad bzang bzang po sna tshogs bsam gyis mi khyab pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi khyu mchog gi mthu dang / sangs rgyas kyi rnam par 'phrul ba bsam gyis mi khyab pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku mdog rnam par dag pa bsam gyis mi khyab pa dang / spyi gtsug ltar mi mthong ba bsam gyis mi khyab pa dang / ljags yangs pa bsam gyis mi khyab pa yang mthong ngo/ /sangs rgyas kyi gsung gi rgyan bsam gyis mi khyab pa dang / dbyangs kyi dkyil 'khor bsam gyis mi khyab pa yang thos so/ /stobs tshad med pa bsam gyis mi khyab pa dang / mi bsnyems pa'i rgyan rnam par dag pa bsam gyis mi khyab pa dang / tha dad pa yang dag par mkhyen pa'i stobs mngon par bsgrub pa bsam gyis mi khyab pa yang rjes su shes so/ /sngon byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa yang dag par bsgrub pa bsam gyis mi khyab pa yang rjes su dran no/ /mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa'i rnam par 'phrul pa bsam gyis mi khyab pa yang mthong ngo/ /chos kyi sprin gyi 'brug sgra mngon par bsgrags pa bsam gyis mi khyab pa dang / yongs su bstan pa rnam par dmigs pa'i gnas dang / rgyan bsam gyis mi khyab pa yang thos so/ /g.yas g.yon gyi sku'i rnam par tshad med pa bsam gyis mi khyab pa dang / sems can gyi don dang / dgos pa bsam gyis mi khyab pa yongs su grub par gyur pa yang mthong ngo/ /

“Son, I have been living here in Sagaramukha (‘Ocean-Door’) for twelve years, having focused my mind on the ocean and kept it present in my awareness, reflecting on the measureless vastness of the great ocean, its pure clarity, its unfathomable depth, its gradual deepening, its variety of deposits of precious substances, the measurelessness of its body of water, its infinity, its being the dwelling place of various immense creatures, its being covered by great clouds, and how it neither increases nor decreases. I think: is there anything else in the world as vast as the great ocean, as broad, as measureless, as deep, as various? While I was engaged in these thoughts, an enormous lotus from the bottom of the ocean appeared before me. Its stem was of unsurpassed jewels, sapphires, and diamonds, with a wreath of agate; its broad leaves of pure gold, with an array of buds of yellow sandalwood and filaments of emerald, as measureless in breadth as the ocean; its calyx was on a stem held by a million titan chiefs, it was covered by a net of a million various jewels, sprinkled by rain from clouds of fragrant water by a million chief water spirits, with a million bird chiefs trailing silks and strings of jewels over it, a million centaur chiefs gazing at it benevolently, a million serpent chiefs bowing to it in respect, a million goblin chiefs honoring it with bowed bodies, a million celestial musician chiefs celebrating it with music and song, a million celestial leaders raining on it clouds of heavenly flowers, fragrances, garlands, incenses, perfumes, aromatic powders, cloths, parasols, banners, and pennants, a million Brahma chiefs bowing their heads in respect, a million celestial beings of the pure abodes paying respect with joined palms, a million human rulers making offerings of precious substances, a million ocean deities emerging to pay respect; it was illumined by arrays of light beams from a million luminous jewels, adorned with a million pure jewels in orderly arrays, containing a million radiant jewels, blazing with the great splendor of a million dazzling jewels, shining endlessly with a million jewels from various sources, adorned with a million jewels symbolic of earth arrayed all around, incomparably arrayed with a million of the finest diamonds, brilliantly covered with a million sun-containing jewels, decorated with a million beautiful jewels in various colors, blazing with the light of an endless array of a million wish-fulfilling jewels. That great lotus is born from the transcendental roots of goodness of the enlightened; it appears everywhere, directed to the will of enlightening beings; it comes forth from the principle of illusoriness; it is produced by pure deeds; it is adorned by the principle of the state of noncontention; it is a presentation of the nature of being equal to a dream; it is marked by the principle of nonfabrication; it accords with the principle of nonattachment; it pervades all universes everywhere; it is in the realm of illumination by the light of the sphere of Buddha. It would be impossible to reach the end of the array of characteristics, qualities, forms, and appearances of that lotus even in countless hundreds of thousands of eons. Also I saw an embodiment of Buddha clearly manifest sitting cross-legged on that great lotus, completely filling it; I saw that embodiment of Buddha reaching from here to the very summit of being. I also saw the inconceivable adornments of the Buddha’s throne, the inconceivable adornments of the Buddha’s congregation, the inconceivable adornments of his aura of light, his inconceivable marks of greatness, various embellishments, and inconceivable majesty, the inconceivable projection of Buddha, the inconceivable purity of appearance of the Buddha; I heard the Buddha’s inconceivable eloquence and drew near to the inconceivable infinity of Buddha’s power, the inconceivable purity of his adornments of expertise, and his inconceivable accomplishment of the power of analytic knowledge; I recalled his past consummation of practices as an enlightening being, I saw the inconceivable transformation of the attainment of enlightenment, I heard of the inconceivable array of senses conveying universal insight and saw the inconceivable infinite division of his body into left and right and his consummate attainment of physical being beneficial to all creatures.

de bzhin gshegs pa des kyang phyag g.yas pa brkyang zhing / kho bo'i mgo la byugs nas/ chos kyi rnam grangs kun nas mig ces bya ba/ de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi yul byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa rab tu brjod pa/ chos kyi dbyings kyi gzhi dang / rnam pa tha dad pa thams cad rab tu snang ba/ chos thams cad kyi dkyil 'khor la yang dag par gzhol zhing snang bar byed pa/ zhing gi dkyil 'khor dang / rnam pa thams cad rnam par dag pas yongs su snang ba/ phas kyi rgol ba'i dkyil 'khor thams cad rnam par 'thor ba/ bdud kyi dkrugs ma'i dkyil 'khor thams cad rab tu 'joms pa/ sems can gyi khams thams cad shin tu tshim par byed pa/ sems can thams cad kyi sems kyi thibs po rab tu snang bar byed pa/ sems can thams cad kyi bsam pa ji lta ba bzhin du rnam par dmigs pa/ sems can thams cad kyi dbang po'i 'khor lo'i rgyud dang mthu snang bar byed pa yang dag par bstan te/ kho bos kyang kun nas mig gi chos kyi rnam grangs de blangs so/ /bzung ngo/ /spel to/ /bsams so/ /de ltar bzung ba de la yang bri na ni snag tsha rgya mtsho chen po'i chu'i phung po tsam dang / smyu gu'i phung po ri rab ri'i rgyal po tsam zad par gyur kyang chos kyi rnam grangs de las le'u re re dang / sgo re re dang / chos kyi tshul re re dang / chos kyi tshig rnam par phye ba re re las kyang zad pa'am/ 'grib pa'am/ 'byang ba'am/ mthar thug pa'am/ mtha' zad par 'gyur ba dmigs par mi rung ngo/ /

“Then the Buddha extended his right hand, rubbed my head, and revealed to me a teaching called universal eye, which is the sphere of all buddhas, revealing the practice of enlightening beings, showing the differentiation of the planes of all universes, showing the spheres of all truths together, the light purifying all lands, dispersing all challengers, crushing all demons and devils, making all beings happy, illumining the hidden recesses of all beings’ minds, communicating to all beings in accord with their mentalities, illuminating the turning of the wheels of the senses of all beings. And I have taken up that teaching of the universal eye, keep it in mind, apply it, and contemplate it, taking it in this way—even if it were being written by a collection of pens the size of the polar mountains with as much ink as water in the oceans, it could never be finished; it would be impossible to finish even a part of a single line of a single formula of a single principle of a single doctrine of a single chapter of the teaching—it cannot be even partially exhausted, let alone fully exhausted or comprehended.

rigs kyi bu/ de ltar bdag gis lo bcu gnyis tshang bar chos kyi rnam grangs kun nas mig ces bya ba 'di la nyi ma gcig cing yang thos pa 'dzin pa'i gzungs kyi 'od snang bas le'u grangs med pa zhig khong du chud do/ /zhi ba'i sgo'i gzungs kyi 'od snang bas le'u grangs med pa zhig la zhugs so/ /glong mtha' yas pa'i gzungs kyi 'od snang bas le'u grangs med pa zhig la yang dag par 'jug go /sa la rnam par dpyod cing rjes su rtogs par byed pa'i gzungs kyi 'od snang bas le'u grangs med pa zhig rnam par bsgom ste rnam par dbye ba byas so; ;gzi brjid dang ldan pa'i gzungs kyi 'od snang bas le'u grangs med pa zhig yongs su blangs so/ /pad+mo'i rgyan gyi gzungs kyi 'od snang bas le'u grangs med pa zhig mngon par bsgrubs so/ /dbyangs kyi tshul gyi gzungs kyi snang bas le'u grangs med pa zhig yang dag par bshad do/ /nam mkha'i snying po'i gzungs kyi 'od snang bas le'u grangs med pa zhig rab tu phye'o/ /skar ma brtsegs pa'i gzungs kyi 'od snang bas le'u grangs med pa zhig shin tu rgyas par byas so/ /rgya mtsho'i snying po'i gzungs kyi 'od snang bas le'u grangs med pa zhig yongs su bkod do/ /kho bo'i drung du shar phyogs logs nas/ lha dang lha'i dbang po'am/ klu dang klu'i dbang po'am/ gnod sbyin dang gnod sbyin gyi dbang po'am/ dri za dang dri za'i dbang po'am/ lha ma yin dang lha ma yin gyi dbang po'am/ nam mkha' lding dang nam mkha' lding gi dbang po'am/ mi'am ci dang mi'am ci'i dbang po'am/ lto 'phye chen po dang lto 'phye chen po'i dbang po'am/ mi dang mi'i dbang po'am/ tshangs pa'am tshangs pa'i dbang po'am/ sems can gang su 'ongs kyang rung ste/ de dag thams cad de bzhin gshegs pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa snang ba'i chos kyi rnam grangs kun nas mig ces bya ba 'di nyid la rab tu bkod cing btsud do/ /de dag kun kyang kun nas mig gi chos kyi rnam grangs 'di nyid la mos par byas so/ /rtog tu btsud do/ /yongs su bstan to/ /yang dag par brjod do/ /yongs su gsal bar byas so/ /rnam par phye'o; ;rgyas par byas so/ /mngon par bstan to/ /rnam par bkrol lo/ /rab tu phye'o/ /shin tu snang bar byas so/ /de ltar shar phyogs la ji lta ba de bzhin du lho phyogs dang / nub phyogs dang / byang phyogs dang / byang shar gyi phyogs mtshams dang / shar lho'i phyogs mtshams dang / lho nub kyi phyogs mtshams dang / nub byang gi phyogs mtshams dang / 'og dang / bla'i phyogs nas sems can gang su 'ongs kyang rung ste/ kun la yang snga ma bzhin no/ /

“So, son, having taken up this teaching of the universal eye for a full twelve years—taking it up in this way: in one day I master countless chapters by the light of mental command to retain what is heard; I penetrate countless chapters by the light of mental command that is a way of access to tranquillity; I plunge into countless chapters by the light of mental command that progresses endlessly; I contemplate and investigate countless chapters by the light of mental command that is imbued with fiery energy; I put countless chapters into practice by the light of mental command adorned with lotuses; I elucidate countless chapters by the light of mental command that is beyond words; I analyze countless chapters by the light of mental command that is a mass of brightness; I arrange countless chapters in order by the light of mental command containing the ocean—whatever beings come to me from the ten directions, I direct and introduce them all into this teaching of the universal eye, the manifestation of the practice of enlightened and enlightening beings; to all of them I elucidate, represent, illumine, describe, show, analyze, expound upon, open up, explain, unlock, and clarify the teaching of the universal eye.

rigs kyi bu/ de ltar kho bos ni chos kyi rnam grangs gcig cig shes par zad na/ byang chub sems dpa' smon lam yongs su dag pa dang ldan pas/ byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa rgya mtsho thams cad la zhugs pa dang / bskal pa thams cad du gnas pa rgyun mi gcad pa'i phyir smon lam rgya mtsho thams cad la zhugs pa dang / bsam pa ji lta ba bzhin du rjes su 'brang bar bya ba'i phyir sems can rgya mtsho thams cad la zhugs pa dang / stobs bcu'i ye shes chags pa med pa'i snang ba yongs su bskyed pa'i phyir 'gro ba thams cad kyi sems rgya mtsho la zhugs pa dang / yongs su smin par bya ba dang gdul ba'i dus las mi 'da' bar bya ba'i phyir sems can thams cad kyi dbang po rgya mtsho la zhugs pa dang / zhing thams cad rnam par dag par bya ba'i smon lam mngon par bsgrubs pas zhing rgya mtsho thams cad la zhugs pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa la mchod cing rim gro byed pa'i stobs kyis sangs rgyas rgya mtsho thams cad la zhugs pa dang / ye shes rnam par rig pas chos rgya mtsho thams cad la zhugs pa dang / nan tan dang ldan pas yon tan rgya mtsho thams cad la zhugs pa dang / brjod pa thams cad du chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba mngon par bsgrub pa'i phyir 'gro ba'i skad rgya mtsho thams cad la zhugs pa rnams kyi spyod pa shes pa'am/ yon tan brjod par nus re skan/

“I know this teaching, son, but how can I know the practice or tell of the virtues of the enlightening beings who have entered into the ocean of all enlightening beings’ practices in accord with pure vows; who have entered into the ocean of all vows, to remain in the world through all ages; who have entered into the mundane whirl of all beings, to act appropriately according to their mentalities; who have entered the ocean of minds of all beings, to communicate knowledge; who have entered the ocean of all virtues, to produce the vision of the knowledge of the ten powers without obstruction; who have entered the ocean of all beings’ faculties, to guide them to maturity and perfection with appropriate timing; who have entered the ocean of all lands, by carrying out the vow to purify all lands; who have entered the ocean of all buddhas, by the power of the vow to honor and attend all enlightened ones; who have entered the ocean of all truths, for the communication of knowledge; who have entered the ocean of all virtues by pursuing their realization; who have entered the ocean of languages of all beings, to carry out the turning of the wheel of the teaching in all languages?

song / rigs kyi bu/ 'di nas dpag tshad drug cu 'das pa'i lho phyogs kyi gnas 'di nyid na/ lang+ka'i gnas rgya mtsho'i dogs zhes bya ba yod de/ de na dge slong shin tu brtan pa zhes bya ba 'dug gi /de'i gan du song la ji ltar byang chub sems dpa' byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa yongs su sbyang bar bya ba dris shig /

“Go, son, to a place called Sagaratira, in the region of Sri Lanka, sixty leagues south of here. A monk named Supratishthita lives there; go to him and ask how a great enlightening being is to purify enlightening practice.”

de nas tshong dpon gyi bu nor bzang gis/ dge slong rgya mtsho'i sprin gyi rkang pa gnyis la spyi bos phyag 'tshal te/ dge slong rgya mtsho'i sprin la lan brgya stong du mar g.yas phyogs su bskor ba byas nas yang dang yang bltas te/ dge slong rgya mtsho'i sprin gyi drung nas song ngo/ /
Then Sudhana, paying his respects, departed from the presence of Sagaramegha.
[dge slong shin tu brtan pa]
Supratishthita

de nas tshong dpon gyi bu nor bzang dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyi gdams ngag de dang / kun nas mig gi chos kyi rnam grangs de yang rjes su dran par byed cing / de bzhin gshegs pa'i rnam par 'phrul pa de yang rjes su bsam pa dang / chos kyi tshig dang yi ge'i sprin de dag kyang yongs su gzung ba dang / chos kyi sgo rgya mtsho'i tshul de dag la'ang 'jug par bya ba dang / chos kyi tshul de la'ang rjes su rnam par blta ba dang / chos kyi le'u dang / glong gi tshul de dag la 'jug par bya ba dang / chos kyi nam mkha' de la yang dag par gzhol bar bya ba dang / chos kyi dkyil 'khor de yang rjes su sbyar bar bya ba dang / chos rin po che'i gling de yang rjes su sems shing mthar gyis lang+ka'i gnas rgya mtsho'i ngogs zhes bya ba gang na ba der phyin nas/ dge slong shin tu brtan pa mthong bar dga' zhing shar phyogs su bltas so/ /de bzhin du lho phyogs dang; nub phyogs dang / byang phyogs dang / byang shar gyi phyogs mtshams dang / shar lho'i phyogs mtshams dang / lho nub kyi phyogs mtshams dang / nub byang gi phyogs mtshams dang; bla dang / 'og tu yang dge slong shin tu brtan pa mthong bar dga' ste kun tu bltas pa dang / des dge slong shin tu brtan pa nam mkha'i dbyings la lha brgya stong grangs med pas yongs su bskor cing phan tshun du 'chag pa mthong ngo/ /nam mkha'i dbyings de yang lha'i dbang po rnams kyis/ dge slong shin tu brtan pa la mchod pa'i las su bya ba'i phyir lha rdzas kyi me tog sil ma'i sprin gyis yog pa dang / lha rdzas kyi rol mo'i sprin gyi sgra dang / dar gyi ba dan grangs med pa'i rgyan gyis brgyan par mthong ngo/ /klu'i dbang po rnams kyis nam mkha' de la/ a ka ru nag po'i spos mngon par 'thul ba'i sprin shin tu mtho ba las 'brug sgra bsam gyis mi khyab pa 'byung bar byas pa mthong ngo/ /mi'am ci'i dbang po rnams kyis nam mkha'i de la lha rdzas kyi ngag snyan pa'i rgyud kyis bstod pa'i rol mo brdung ba dang / dkrol ba dang / glur blang ba'i dbyangs thams cad sbyar cing blangs ba thos par gyur to/ /lto 'phye chen po'i dbang po rnams kyis nam mkha' de la gos shin tu phra zhing mdog bzang pa'i sprin bsam gyis mi khyab pa dag yid dga' bas bkye ste/ dge slong shin tu brtan pa la dad cing mos pa'i gzugs su phyung ba mthong ngo/ /lha ma yin gyi dbang po rnams kyis kyang nam mkha' de la/ nor bu rin po che'i sprin bsam gyis mi khyab pa byin gyis brlabs te/ yon tan bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i rgyan snang ba dang ldan par byas pa mthong ngo/ /nam mkha' lding gi dbang po mang po yang mi'i gzugs dang / kha dog dang / dbyibs su 'khod cing / nam mkha' lding gi dbang po'i bu mos kun nas bskor te gsod pa med la dga' zhing thal mo sbyar te gnas pa bsam gyis mi khyab pa mthong ngo/ /gnod sbyin gyi dbang po brgya stong 'khor dang bcas pa bsam gyis mi khyab pa dag kyang nam mkha' de la shin tu mi sdug pa'i gzugs su/ dge slong shin tu brtan pa la byams pa'i mthu dang ldan par 'khor ba mthong ngo/ /srin po'i dbang po brgya stong 'khor dang bcas pa bsam gyis mi khyab pa dag kyang / nam mkha' de la dge slong shin tu brtan pa yongs su srung ba byed cing kun tu rgyu ba mthong ngo/ /tshangs pa'i dbang po brgya stong bsam gyis mi khyab pa dag kyang nam mkha' de la thal mo sbyar cing dga' ba dang yid du 'ong ba'i tshig gi rgyud kyis bstod pa rab tu brjod pa mthong ngo/ /gnas gtsang ma'i lha brgya stong bsam gyis mi khyab pa dag kyang nam mkha' de la dge slong shin tu brtan pa la mchod pa'i las su bya ba'i phyir/ thal mo sbyar cing gzhal med khang na gnas pa mthong ngo/ /

Then Sudhana, remembering that spiritual benefactor’s teaching of the universal eye, reflecting on that projection of buddhahood, keeping in mind those multitudes of statements of the Teaching, entering into those oceans of entries into the Teaching, pondering that method of teaching, plunging into the principles of that whirlpool of teaching, entering fully into the space of that teaching, clarifying that sphere of teaching, and contemplating that treasure island of teaching, gradually made his way to Sagaratira in Lanka, where he looked in all directions, desiring to see the monk Supratishthita. He saw Supratishthita walking in the sky, surrounded by countless hundreds of thousands of celestial beings. He also saw the sky covered with clouds of celestial flowers, with the sound of countless clouds of heavenly music and countless streamers and banners offered by the chief celestials to the monk Supratishthita as tokens of respect. He also saw inconceivable clouds of black aloe-scented water thundering in the sky, raised on high by the chief water spirits. He also heard countless sounds of pleasing celestial music and song coming from the sky with words of reverence and hymns of praise, performed by supernatural beings; he also saw inconceivable clouds of fine cloths spread out in the sky by joyous serpent chiefs out of respect for Supratishthita. He also saw inconceivable clouds of jewels set in the sky by the chief titans, with the light of the magnificent array of their inconceivable qualities. He also saw inconceivable hosts of bird girls, standing in the sky with their hands joined in gestures of respect, with noninjury uppermost in their minds. He also saw inconceivable hundreds of thousands of goblin chiefs in the sky with their retinues, their bodies transfigured, directed there by goodwill toward the monk Supratishthita. He also saw inconceivable numbers of demigod chiefs with their retinues circling in the sky to protect Supratishthita. He also saw inconceivable hundreds of thousands of Brahma chiefs in the sky making salutations, uttering pleasant words of respect and songs of praise. He also saw inconceivable hundreds of thousands of celestial beings of the pure abodes in their palaces in the sky, paying their respects to the monk Supratishthita.

de nas tshong dpon gyi bu nor bzang gis dge slong shin tu brtan pa de ltar nam mkha'i dbyings la 'chag cing 'dug pa mthong nas dga' rangs te mgu zhing nyams bde la tshim zhing yid bde ba skyes nas/ dge slong shin tu brtan pa la thal mo sbyar te/ phyag 'tshal nas 'di skad ces smras so/ /'phags pa/ bdag gis bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed nas/ ji ltar byang chub sems dpas sangs rgyas kyi chos btsal bar bgyi ba dang / ji ltar byang chub sems dpas sangs rgyas kyi chos yongs su bsgrub par bgyi ba dang / ji ltar byang chub sems dpas sangs rgyas kyi chos yongs su bsdu bar bgyi ba dang / ji ltar byang chub sems dpas sangs rgyas kyi chos bstan par bgyi ba dang / ji ltar byang chub sems dpas sangs rgyas kyi chos bsgom par bgyi ba dang / ji ltar byang chub sems dpas sangs rgyas kyi chos kyi rjes su 'brang bar bgyi ba dang / ji ltar byang chub sems dpas sangs rgyas kyi chos yongs su brtul bar bgyi ba dang / ji ltar byang chub sems dpas sangs rgyas kyi chos yongs su bsgom par bgyi ba dang / ji ltar byang chub sems dpas sangs rgyas kyi chos rnam par dag par bgyi ba dang / ji ltar byang chub sems dpas sangs rgyas kyi chos yongs su sbyang bar bgyi ba dang / ji ltar byang chub sems dpas sangs rgyas kyi chos khong du chud par bgyi ba ma 'tshal te/ 'phags pa ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams la gdams ngag dang / rjes su bstan pa mdzad do/ /zhes bdag gis thos na/ 'phags pa/ ji ltar byang chub sems dpas sangs rgyas kyi chos la nan tan du bgyi/ ji ltar nan tan du bgyis na yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin dang / skol bar mi 'gyur ba'i slad du sangs rgyas mthong ba dang mi 'bral ba dang / byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyi dge ba'i rtsa ba dang tshul gcig tu 'gyur ba'i slad du byang chub sems dpa' mthong ba dang mi 'bral ba dang / ye shes rtogs par 'gyur ba'i slad du sangs rgyas kyi chos dang mi 'bral ba dang / byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyi don yongs su thob par bgyi ba'i slad du byang chub sems dpa'i smon lam thams cad dang mi 'bral ba dang; bskal pa thams cad du gnas pas yongs su mi skyo bar bgyi ba'i slad du byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa dang mi 'bral ba dang / 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad yongs su dag par bgyi ba'i slad du sangs rgyas kyi zhing thams cad rgyas par dgang ba dang mi 'bral ba dang / de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi rnam par 'phrul pa thams cad rnam par dmigs par bgyi ba'i slad du sangs rgyas kyi rnam par 'phrul pa mthong ba dang mi 'bral ba dang / byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa sprul pa lta bus srid pa'i rgyud thams cad du skye zhing shi 'pho ba'i skye mched rang gi lus kyis nyams su myong bar bgyi ba'i slad du 'dus byas kyi gnas dang mi 'bral ba dang / de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi chos kyi sprin yongs su gzung ba'i slad du chos mnyan pa dang mi 'bral ba dang / dus gsum gyi ye shes khong du chud cing rjes su 'brang bar bgyi ba'i slad du ye shes snang ba dang mi 'bral bar 'gyur ba de bdag la bstan du gsol/ de skad ces smras pa dang /

Then Sudhana, seeing the monk Supratishthita walking in the sky, was pleased, enraptured, transported, overjoyed, happy; he saluted and greeted Supratishthita and said to him, “Noble one, I have set my mind on supreme enlightenment, but I do not know how an enlightening being is to seek the qualities of buddhas, how an enlightening being is to acquire the qualities of buddhas, how an enlightening being is to accumulate the qualities of buddhas, how an enlightening being is to cultivate the qualities of buddhas, how an enlightening being is to actualize the qualities of buddhas, how an enlightening being is to act in accord with the qualities of buddhas, how an enlightening being is to assemble the qualities of buddhas, how an enlightening being is to contemplate the qualities of buddhas, how an enlightening being is to clarify the qualities of buddhas in order to accomplish all the tasks of enlightening beings, how an enlightening being is to approach and follow the qualities of buddhas. Noble one, I hear that you give instructions to enlightening beings: please tell me how an enlightening being is to set to work on the Buddha teachings, not to lose sight of Buddha whatever one is doing, not to lose sight of enlightening beings so as to be always in contact with reality, always to be involved with the Buddha teachings so as to be at one with the roots of goodness of all enlightening beings, always to be involved with the vows of enlightening beings so as to accord with knowledge, always to be involved in the practices of enlightening beings so as to accomplish the task of all enlightening beings, always to be pervading all buddha-fields so as to live continuously through all ages, to remain in the conditional for the manifestation of the projections of all buddhas, always to be hearing the Teaching in order to visit in one’s own body the places of death and birth of all buddhas by the emanationlike action of enlightening beings, and to always be in contact with the light of knowledge so as to receive the teachings of all buddhas and accord with knowledge of past, present, and future.”

dge slong shin tu brtan pas/ tshong dpon gyi bu nor bzang la 'di skad ces smras so/ /de ltar khyod kyis bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed de/ sangs rgyas kyi chos dang / thams cad mkhyen pa'i chos dang; rang byung gi chos 'dri ba legs so/ /legs so/ /rigs kyi bu/ kho bos ni byang chub sems dpa'i rnam par thar pa thogs pa med pa'i sgo thob pa ste/ rigs kyi bu/ byang chub sems dpa'i rnam par thar pa thogs pa med pa'i sgo de kho bos blangs te/ yongs su bzung nas rjes su 'brang zhing rnam par dbye ba dang / rnam par dpyad pa dang / rnam par brtag pa dang; snang bar 'du bya ba med pa'i rdzu 'phrul de'i byin gyis kho bo nam mkha'i dbyings 'di las phan tshun du 'gro zhing 'dug pa dang / bsnyes pa dang / spyod lam sna tshogs su spyod do/ /mi snang bar byed do/ /snang bar 'byung ngo/ /du ba 'thul bar byed do/ /me lce 'bar bar byed do/ /gcig tu byas shing mang por bsgyur ro/ /mang por byas shing gcig tu bsgyur ro/ /snang ba dang mi snang ba'ang nyams su myong thams cad kyang / byang chub sems dpa'i rnam par thar pa kun tu 'gro ba 'di dang / byang chub sems dpa'i rnam par thar pa rnam par gnon pa don yod pa la rab tu gzhog go/

To this, Supratishthita replied, “It is good that you have set your mind on supreme perfect enlightenment and ask about the qualities of buddhahood, the qualities of omniscience, the qualities of independence. I have attained the enlightening liberation ‘unobstructed door.’ Going in and out of this ‘unobstructed door’ liberation, practicing it, analyzing it, examining it, investigating it, and clarifying it, I have attained a light of knowledge called ‘ultimate nonobstruction,’ whereby I am free from obstruction in awareness of the mental actions of all sentient beings, knowing where all sentient beings die and are born, entries into the channels to memory of past states, associations with all beings in future ages, communications to all sentient beings of the present time, knowledge of the conventions of languages of all sentient beings, cutting off the doubts of all sentient beings, comprehending the differences in the faculties of all sentient beings, approaching all sentient beings at appropriate times to guide them to full development, comprehension of time divisions as being conceptual, and in noncorporeal pervasion of the buddha-fields in the ten directions, all by the attainment of nonbeing, nonabiding, and nondoing. By the realization of this mystic power of nondoing I walk, stand, sit, and lie down in the sky, disappear and appear, produce smoke and flame. Being one, I become many; being many, I become one. I become now visible, now invisible. I go through walls unhindered, as through empty space. While sitting cross-legged I travel in space, like a bird on the wing. I go in and out of the earth as if in water. I walk on water unhindered as on the earth. I smoke and flame like a great conflagration. I cause even the earth to quake. With my hand I polish even the sun and moon, those bodies of great potency, power, and light. I envelop even up to the Brahma world in my body. Covering the world with clouds of lights the colors of all jewels, I emit clouds in the forms of all beings. Emanating clouds of webs of light of infinite colors, I go forth in all directions: in each moment of thought I pass one world to the east, I pass two worlds, three worlds, a hundred worlds, a thousand worlds, a hundred thousand worlds, a million worlds, a hundred millions worlds, a billion worlds, a hundred billion worlds, a quintillion worlds, countless, measureless, endless, incomparable, inconceivable, incalculable, untold, unspeakably unspeakable numbers of worlds; and in those worlds are buddhas living, in each of those oceans of worlds, in each of those streams of worlds, in each region of those worlds, in each age of those worlds, in each set of those worlds, in each occurrence of those worlds, in each expression of those worlds, in each medium of those worlds, in each particular of those worlds, in each sacred place in those worlds, in each site of enlightenment in those worlds, in each assembly in those worlds—I go to each of the buddhas teaching in those worlds with as many bodies as atoms in endless buddha-lands, each body raining as many clouds of offerings as atoms in endless buddha-lands. Going to the buddhas, I ceaselessly make offerings of all kinds of flowers, fragrances, garlands, unguents, robes, banners, pennants, canopies, nets, and ornaments. Those buddhas explain, reveal, and elucidate, and I acknowledge and take up all that they teach. I also remember the purity of the buddha-lands of those buddhas. As in the east, so also in all directions do I go to innumerable worlds, see the buddhas teaching there, make offerings to them, acknowledge and take up what they say, and remember the purity of their buddha-lands. Also, all the beings who see me, to whom I come, are assured of supreme perfect enlightenment. Also, whatever beings I see, small or large, underdeveloped or well developed, happy or unhappy, I adopt a corresponding physical form, in order to guide them to maturity and perfection in the appropriate time. And all beings who come to me I establish in this enlightening liberation, which is everywhere at once and which is the consummation of unerring power.

rigs kyi bu/ kho bos ni byang chub sems dpa'i rnam par thar pa thogs pa med pa'i sgo kun tu 'gro ba/ de bzhin gshegs pa'i mchod pa dang / rim gro rab tu sbyor ba/ sems can thams cad yongs su smin par bya ba dang mthun pa 'di shes par zad na kho bos byang chub sems dpa' snying rje chen po'i ngang tshul can/ theg pa chen po'i ngang tshul can/ byang chub sems dpa'i lam dang mi 'bral ba'i ngang tshul can/ thogs pa med pa'i ngang tshul can/ byang chub sems dpa'i bsam pa'i snying po chud mi gson pa'i ngang tshul can/ byang chub kyi sems yongs su mi gtong ba'i ngang tshul can; sangs rgyas kyi chos la lhag par dmigs pa'i ngang tshul can/ thams cad mkhyen pa yid la bya ba dang mi 'bral ba'i ngang tshul can/ nam mkha' dang mnyam pa'i ngang tshul can/ 'jig rten thams cad la mi gnas pa'i ngang tshul can/ chud mi gson pa'i ngang tshul can/ mnyam pa'i ngang tshul can/ ma god pa'i ngang tshul can/ glags med pa'i ngang tshul can/ ma 'dres pa'i ngang tshul can/ rnyog pa med pa'i ngang tshul can/ 'gyod pa med pa'i ngang tshul can/ rnam par dag pa'i ngang tshul can; byang chub sems dpa' rdul dang bral ba de dag gi spyod pa shes pa'am/ yon tan brjod par nus re skan/

“Son, I know this enlightening liberation ‘unobstructed door,’ which is everywhere at once engaged in the service of the buddhas, appropriate to the development of all beings. How can I know the practice, or tell the virtues, of the great enlightening beings who act on great compassion, who act in accord with the practice of the Great Vehicle, whose conduct never deviates from the path of enlightening beings, whose conduct is free from attachment, whose conduct always embodies the will of enlightening beings, who always act with the thought of enlightenment, whose action is focused on the way of the enlightened, who always act with the thought of omniscience, whose way of action is like the sky, whose conduct is independent of all mundane realms, whose conduct is flawless, whose conduct is uncorrupted, whose conduct is consistent, whose conduct is faultless, whose conduct is pure, whose conduct is unblemished, whose conduct is free from evil, whose conduct is honest, whose conduct is dispassionate, whose conduct is undefiled?

song / rigs kyi bu/ lho phyogs kyi rgyud 'di nyid na/ dra byi la'i grong rdal rdo rje'i grong khyer ces bya ba yod de/ de na dra byi la sprin ces bya ba 'dug gi de'i gan du song la/ ji ltar byang chub sems dpas byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa la bslab par bya ba dang / ji ltar nan tan tu bya ba dris shig /
“Go south, son, to the Dravidian city Vajrapura. There lives a grammarian named Megha. Go to him and ask him how an enlightening being is to learn and practice the conduct of enlightening beings.”

de nas tshong dpon gyi bu nor bzang gis dge slong shin tu brtan pa'i rkang pa gnyis la spyi bos phyag 'tshal nas/ lan brgya stong du mar g.yas phyogs su bskor ba byas te/ yang dang yang du bltas nas/ dge slong shin tu brtan pa'i drung nas song ngo/ /
Then Sudhana again paid his respects to the monk Supratishthita and left.
[dra byi la sprin]
Megha

de nas tshong dpon gyi bu nor bzang chos kyi dad pa'i shugs dang byin gyis non pa sangs rgyas yid la bya ba'i 'du shes dang ldan pa/ dkon mchog gsum gyi gdung mi gcad pa la rab tu brtson pa/ dus gsum snang bas sems snang bar gyur pa smon lam chen po yid la byed pa dang ldan pa/ sems can gyi khams thams cad yongs su bskyab pa'i thabs la zhugs pa/ 'dus byas kyi dga' ba thams cad la mi gnas pa'i sems dang ldan pa/ chos thams cad kyi rang bzhin nges par rtogs par bya ba la brtson pa/ 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad yongs su sbyang ba'i smon lam las mi g.yo ba/ sangs rgyas thams cad kyi 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor na gnas pa med par gnas pa/ chos kyi snang ba rjes su dran par bya ba dang / dge ba'i gshegs gnyen rjes su dran par bya ba dang / 'dod chags dang bral ba'i rigs yongs su rjod par byed cing / mthar gyis dra byi la'i grong rdal rdo rje'i grong khyer du phyin nas/ dra byi la sprin yongs su tshol tshol ba las/ grong khyer gyi khams shig na chos bstan pa'i don du/ seng ge'i khri la 'dug cing / srog chags stong phrag bcu tsam zhig la/ chos kyi rnam grangs yi ge'i 'khor lo'i rgyud kyi rgyan ces bya ba yongs su ston cing 'dug pa mthong ngo/ /
de nas tshong dpon gyi bu nor bzang gis/ dra byi la sprin gyi rkang pa gnyis la spyi bos phyag 'tshal te/ dra byi la sprin la lan brgya stong du mar g.yas phyogs su bskor ba byas nas mdun du 'dug ste/ thal mo sbyar nas 'di skad ces smras so/ /'phags pa/ bdag gis bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed na/ ji ltar byang chub sems dpas byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa la bslab par bgyi ba dang / ji ltar nan tan bgyi ba dang / ji ltar byang chub sems dpa'i byang chub kyi sems srid pa'i lam rgyud thams cad du chab mi 'tshal ba dang / ji ltar yongs su skyo ba ma mchis shing / bsam pa brtan par 'gyur ba dang / ji ltar thub pa ma mchis shing / lhag pa'i bsam pa yongs su dag par 'gyur ba dang / ji ltar yongs su skyo ba ma mchis shing / snying rje chen po'i stobs yang dag par skye bar 'gyur ba dang / ji ltar sgo kun nas rnam par dag cing gzungs kyi stobs gnon par 'gyur ba dang / ji ltar ma rig pa'i rab rib dang sgrib pa rnam par 'thor zhing / shes rab kyi 'od chos thams cad la rab rib ma mchis pa'i snang ba skye bar 'gyur ba dang / ji ltar don dang / chos dang / nges pa'i tshig dang / spobs pa la mkhas pa'i dbyangs kyi dkyil 'khor yongs su rdzogs shing / tha dad pa yang dag par shes pa'i stobs gnon par 'gyur ba dang / ji ltar sangs rgyas thams cad kyi 'khor lo tha mi dad pa yang dag par 'dzin cing dran pa'i stobs yongs su gnon par 'gyur ba dang / ji ltar chos thams cad kyi phyogs rig pa'i snang ba rjes su rtogs shing rig pa'i stobs rnam par dag par 'gyur ba dang / ji ltar byang chub sems dpa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi stobs chos thams cad kyi don rnam par gdon mi za bar rab tu dbye ba la brtson pas 'grub par 'gyur ba ma 'tshal to/ /

Then Sudhana, mindful of the light of the Teaching, steeped in intensity of faith in the Teaching, his attention focused on thoughts of Buddha, intent on perpetuating the lineage of the three treasures, remembering spiritual friends, his mind having illumined the worlds of past, present, and future, thinking of great vows, striving for the salvation of all beings, his mind unattached to enjoyment of any created things, praising the tradition of dispassion, intent upon contemplation of the instrinsic essence of all things, firm in the commitment to purify all worlds, sojourning without attachment in the congregations of all buddhas, gradually approached the Dravidian city Vajrapura, looking for the grammarian Megha.
He saw Megha at a crossroads in the middle of the city, sitting on a lion seat to talk about the Teaching, elucidating a scripture called Manifestation of Turning of the Wheel of Letters. Sudhana went up to him, paid his respects, and said, “Noble one, I have set my mind on supreme perfect enlightenment, but I do not know how an enlightening being is to learn and carry out the practice of enlightening beings. How is an enlightening being to preserve the determination for enlightenment? How does one develop a will that is firm in all states of existence and is indefatigable? How does one purify one’s intent, in accord with invincibility? How is the power of great compassion produced so that it never flags? How does one acquire mental command that is totally purified? How is the light of wisdom produced, light free from obscurity in regard to meaning, principle, expression, and presence of mind? How does one acquire the power of recollection, keeping in mind the teachings of all buddhas without confusion? How is the power of migration purified, illumining all states of existence with the truth? How is an enlightening being’s power of concentration perfected, intent on the ascertainment and discernment of the meanings of all principles?”

de nas dra byi la sprin gyis byang chub sems dpa' la rim gror bya ba'i phyir seng ge'i khri de las langs te/ babs nas/ tshong dpon gyi bu nor bzang la lus thams cad kyis phyag byas nas/ tshong dpon gyi bu nor bzang la gser gyi me tog gi phung pos mngon par gtor to/ /nor bu rin po che rin thang med pa mang po dang / tsan dan gyi phye ma dam pas kyang mngon par gtor to/ /gos tshon sna tshogs rnam pa tha dad pas kha dog bsgyur ba/ brgya stong phrag du mas kyang mngon par bkab bo/ spos kyi me tog kha dog rnam pa tha dad cing yid du 'ong la blta na sdug pa mang pos kyang mngon par gtor nas/ mchod pa rnam pa sna tshogs gzhan dag gis kyang mchod pa dang / rim gro dang / bkur sti dang / bsti stang cher byas te/ tshong dpon gyi bu nor bzang la 'di skad ces smras so/ /rigs kyi bu khyod kyis de ltar bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed pa legs so/ /legs so/ /rigs kyi bu/ gang gis bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed pa de ni/ sangs rgyas thams cad kyi gdung mi gcad pa'i phyir zhugs pa yin/ 'dod chags dang bral ba'i rigs yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rnam par rigs par bya ba la brtson pa yin/ zhing gi rgyud thams cad yongs su dag par bya ba la zhugs pa yin/ sems can gyi rigs thams cad yongs su smin par bya ba dang / gdul ba la sta gon du gnas pa yin/ chos kyi rigs thams cad yang dag par ji lta ba bzhin du brtag pa la brtson pa yin/ las kyi rigs thams cad dang mi 'gal bar gnas pa yin/ byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa'i rigs thams cad yongs su rdzogs par bya ba la rab tu brtson pa yin/ smon lam gyi rigs thams cad rgyun mi gcad pa'i phyir yang dag par zhugs pa yin/ dus gsum gyi rgyud thams cad ye shes kyis khong du chud par bya ba la zhugs pa yin/ mos pa'i rigs shin tu brtan par bya ba'i phyir brtson pa yin/ de ni de bzhin gshegs pa mang po thams cad kyis byin gyis brlabs pa yin/ sangs rgyas thams cad kyis yang dag par dgongs pa yin/ byang chub sems dpa' thams cad dang mnyam pa nyid du gyur pa yin /'phags pa thams cad kyis rjes su dgyes par bya ba yin/ tshangs pa'i dbang po thams cad kyis mngon par dga' bar byas pa yin/ lha'i dbang po thams cad kyis yang dag par mchod pa yin/ gnod sbyin gyi dbang po thams cad kyis yongs su bsrung ba yin/ srin po'i dbang po thams cad kyis rim gror byas pa yin/ klu'i dbang po thams cad kyis bsu ba yin/ mi'am ci'i dbang po thams cad kyis mngon par bstod pa yin/ 'jig rten gyi dbang po thams cad kyis yang dag par bsngags pa yin/ des ni sems can gyi khams thams cad kyang ngan song gi lam rgyud gsum po yongs su bcad pa dang / mi khom pa dang / ngan 'gro'i lam thams cad bzlog pa dang / dbul ba'i lam thams cad las yang dag par bzla ba dang / lha dang mi'i phun sum tshogs pa thob par bya ba dang / dge ba'i bshes gnyen mthong ba dang mi 'bral ba dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos rgya chen po mnyan pa dang 'bral bar mi 'gyur ba dang / byang chub kyi sems kyi yan lag yongs su dag par bya ba dang / byang chub kyi sems kyi 'byung ba'i rgyu yongs su bsgrub pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i lam snang ba thob par bya ba dang / byang chub sems dpa'i ye shes khong du chud par bya ba dang / byang chub sems dpa'i sa la gnas par bya bas dbugs phyin par bya ba yin/ rigs kyi bu de la bdag 'di snyam du sems te/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni dka' ba byed pa ste/ 'byung bar dka' zhing mthong bar dka' ba'o/ /byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni sems can rnams la bag dro bar byed pas pha dang ma lta bu'o/ /byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni lha dang bcas pa'i 'jig rten gyi rgyan du gyur pa'o/ /byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni sdug bsngal gyis mnar ba rnams la skyabs su gyur pa'o/ /byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni 'gro ba thams cad yongs su bsrung ba'i phyir gnas su gyur pa'o/ /byang chub sems dpa' ni 'jigs pa sna tshogs kyis gtses pa rnams la dpung gnyen du gyur pa'o/ /byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni 'gro ba thams cad ngan song gsum du ltung ba las yongs su rton pa'i phyir rlung gi 'khor lo lta bu'o/ /byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni sems can thams cad kyi dge ba'i rtsa ba rnam par 'phel bar byed pas lta bu'o/ /byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni bsod nams rin po che'i mdzod mi zad pa'i gtos dang ldan pas rgya mtsho lta bu'o/ /byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni ye shes kyi 'od kyis snang bar byed pa'i phyir nyi ma lta bu'o/ /byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni dge ba'i rtsa ba shin tu mtho bas ri rab lta bu'o/ /byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni snying po byang chub tu ye shes kyi zla ba 'char bar 'gyur ba'i phyir zla ba lta bu'o/ /byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni bdud kyi sde thams cad rab tu 'joms pas dpa' bor gyur pa'o/ /byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni rang byung gi chos kyi grong khyer du phyin par byed pas rtul phod pa lta bu'o/ /byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni sems can thams cad kyi bdag la bya mas ba'i rlan yongs su skem pas me lta bu'o; ;byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni chos sprin rgya chen po'i char mngon par 'bebs pas sprin lta bu'o/ /byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni sems can gyi dbang po dad pa la sogs pa'i myu gu rnam par 'phel bar byed pas char pa lta bu'o/ /byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni chos rgya mtsho'i 'gram yongs su ston pas mnyan pa lta bu'o/ /byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni sems can thams cad 'khor ba'i rgya mtsho las yang dag par sgrol ba'i phyir zab pa lta bu'o/ /byang chub sems dpa' ni sems can thams cad kyis mngon par bgrod par bya ba'i phyir mu stegs lta bu'o/ /

Now Megha, out of respect for an enlightening being, got off his seat and prostrated himself before Sudhana, then showered Sudhana with golden flowers, precious jewels, and the finest sandalwood powders, covered him with hundreds of thousands of robes dyed in various colors, showered him with beautiful flowers of many various colors with pleasant scents, and honored him with various other offerings, then said to him, “It is good that you have set your mind on supreme perfect enlightenment; one who arouses the determination for supreme perfect enlightenment becomes engaged in the perpetuation of the lineage of buddhas, intent on correctly communicating the tradition of dispassion, engaged in purifying the family of all lands, directed toward guiding the family of all sentient beings to perfection, engaged in properly accomplishing all the teachings and transcending all things, intent on harmony of all actions, engaged in the fulfillment of all practices of enlightening beings, directed toward preserving the continuity of all religious vows, engaged in following knowledge of all times, active in making devotion steadfast, the focus of attention of all buddhas, near to equality with all buddhas, appreciated by all enlightening beings, praised by all sages, honored by all the chief Brahmas, protected by all the chief gods, respected, welcomed, and praised by the chiefs of the various supernatural beings, sought out by all world rulers; one becomes very well suited for putting an end to the three kinds of bad conditions in all worlds, getting rid of all difficult conditions inopportune for attaining enlightenment, getting beyond all states of destitution, attaining birth in celestial or human states, always seeing spiritual benefactors, consistently listening to the lofty buddha-teaching, purifying the will for enlightenment, cultivating the cause of the thought of enlightenment, gaining the illumination of the path of enlightening beings, following the knowledge of enlightening beings, and dwelling in the stages of enlightening beings.
“This is what I think of such a one: enlightening beings do what is difficult to do; it is hard to get to actually see them; they are comforts to the world; enlightening beings are the mothers and fathers of all sentient beings; enlightening beings are an adornment to the world with its gods; enlightening beings are a refuge for those oppressed by suffering; enlightening beings are a place of rest for the protection of all sentient beings; enlightening beings are the breath of life to those suffering all kinds of terrors and calamities; enlightening beings are a wind protecting all sentient beings from the heat of the three evils; enlightening beings are earth, causing the roots of goodness of all sentient beings to grow; enlightening beings are an ocean, a repository of endless treasures of virtue; enlightening beings are a sun, producing the light of knowledge; enlightening beings are the polar mountain, by virtue of the height of their roots of goodness; enlightening beings are a moon, the moon of knowledge of the essence of enlightenment having risen in them; enlightening beings are warriors crushing the armies of all demons; enlightening beings are heroic, having reached the city of the state of independence; enlightening beings are fire, annihilating the self-love of all sentient beings; enlightening beings are clouds, causing vast clouds of true teaching to shower; enlightening beings are rain, causing the sprouts of faculties such as faith to grow; enlightening beings are navigators, showing the way on the ocean of truth; enlightening beings are bridges conveying all sentient beings across the sea of mundane life; enlightening beings are a pathway to the holy for all sentient beings.”

de ltar dra byi la sprin gyis tshong dpon gyi bu nor bzang gi mdun du 'dug ste/ tshig gi rgyud de dag gis byang chub sems dpa' rnams la yongs su bsngags pa byas nas/ tshong dpon gyi bu nor bzang la legs so/ /zhes bsngags so/ /de ltar des byang chub sems dpa' yang dag par dga' bar bya ba'i phyir tshig brjod pa'i tshe; kho'i sgo nas 'od 'phro ba'i phung po rnam pa 'di lta bu byung ste/ 'od 'phro ba'i phung po des stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams rgyas par gang bar gyur nas/ lha dang / lha rdzu 'phrul chen po'am/ klu dang / klu rdzu 'phrul chen po'am/ gnod sbyin dang / gnod sbyin rdzu 'phrul chen po'am/ dri za dang / dri za rdzu 'phrul chen po'am/ lha ma yin dang / lha ma yin rdzu 'phrul chen po'am/ nam mkha' lding dang / nam mkha' lding rdzu 'phrul chen po'am, mi'am ci dang / mi 'am ci rdzu 'phrul chen po'am/ lto 'phye chen po dang / lto 'phye chen po rdzu 'phrul chen po'am/ mi dang / mi rdzu 'phrul chen po'am/ mi ma yin pa dang / mi ma yin pa rdzu 'phrul chen po'am/ tshangs pa pa dang / tshangs pa rdzu 'phrul chen po'am/ sems can gang sus mthong yang rung ste/ snang ba des yongs su snang bar byas pa de dag /dra byi la sprin gyi drung du 'ongs so/ /
de nas de ltar dra byi la sprin gyis bsam pa byin gyis brlabs shing thal mo sbyar te gnas pa/ lus dang sems sim par gyur pa/ dga' ba rgya chen po skyes pa/ sri zhu chen po la gnas pa/ nga rgyal gyi rgyal mtshan bcom pa/ g.yo sgyu dang bral ba/ dbang po rnam par dang bar gyur pa de dag la/ dra byi la sprin gyis chos kyi rnam grangs yi ge'i 'khor lo'i rgyud kyi rgyan ces bya ba de nyid rgya cher yang dag par bstan te/ khong du chud pa dang / rtogs pa dang / shes pa dang / rig par byas so/ /de thos nas kyang de dag thams cad bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub las phyir mi ldog par gyur to/ /

Thus praising enlightening beings to Sudhana in such terms, Megha applauded Sudhana. While he was saying these words pleasing to enlightening beings, there issued from his mouth a mass of flames that made a thousand worlds clearly visible; and all the sentient beings who perceived that light came to Megha, illumined by the light; to them, their attention commanded by Megha, their hands held forth in respectful supplication, their bodies and minds cooled, enraptured, inspired with reverence, divested of conceit, freed from deception, senses tranquil, Megha expounded and conveyed the teaching of the manifestation of the turning of the wheel of letters, upon hearing which they became irreversible in their progress toward supreme perfect enlightenment.

de nas de'i phyir chos kyi stan la 'dug nas tshong dpon gyi bu nor bzang la 'di skad ces smras so/ /rigs kyi bu/ kho bo ni dbyangs dang ldan pa'i gzungs thob pa ste/ de'i mthus kho bo stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams 'di'i lha rnams kyi lha'i skad kyang shes so/ /de bzhin du klu dang / gnod sbyin dang; dri za dang / lha ma yin dang / nam mkha' lding dang / mi 'am ci dang / lto 'phye chen po dang / mi dang / mi ma yin pa dang / tshangs pa rnams kyi tshangs pa'i skad kyang shes so/ /lha rnams kyi lha'i skad sna tshogs kyang shes so/ /de bzhin du klu dang / gnod sbyin dang / dri za dang / lha ma yin dang / nam mkha' lding dang / mi 'am ci dang / lto 'phye chen po dang / mi dang / mi ma yin pa dang / tshangs pa rnams kyi tshangs pa'i skad sna tshogs kyang shes so/ /lha rnams kyi lha'i skad gcig pa yang shes so/ /de bzhin du klu dang / gnod sbyin dang / dri za dang / lha ma yin dang / nam mkha' lding dang / mi'am ci dang / lto 'phye chen po dang / mi dang / mi ma yin pa dang / tshangs pa rnams kyi tshangs pa'i skad gcig pa yang shes so/ /lha rnams kyi lha'i skad tha dad pa yang shes so/ /de bzhin du klu dang / gnod sbyin dang / dri za dang / lha ma yin dang / nam mkha' lding dang / mi 'am ci dang / lto 'phye chen po dang / mi dang / mi ma yin pa dang / tshangs pa rnams kyi tshangs pa'i skad tha dad pa yang shes so/ /byol song gi skye gnas su skyes pa'i sems can rnams kyi brda dang; skad dang / ming tha dad pa yang shes so/ /sems can dmyal ba pa'i sems can rnams kyi skad dang ming rnams kyang shes so/ /gshin rje'i 'jig rten pa'i sems can rnams kyi skad dang ming rnams kyang shes so/ /'phags pa'i skad dang ming rnams kyang shes so/ /'phags pa ma yin pa'i skad dang ming rnams kyang shes so/ /byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi tshig dang / brda dang / nges pa'i ngag sems can gyi bsam pa bzhin du 'byung ba yang shes so/ /sems kyi skad cig re re la yang dus gsum du gshegs pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi dbyangs kyi yan lag dang / gsung rgya mtsho sems can thams cad kyi ming dang / gtam gyi sgra dang / tshig tu ldan pa yang rtogs shing khong du chud do/ /ji ltar stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams 'di'i sems can rnams kyi brda dang / nges pa'i tshig dang / skad dang / ming rgya mtsho la 'jug cing shes pa de bzhin du shar phyogs kyi 'jig rten gyi khams bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong tshad med pa/ grangs med pa/ bsam gyis mi khyab pa/ mtshungs pa med pa/ kun tu mtha' yas pa/ mu med pa/ sa mtshams med pa/ gzhal du med pa/ brjod du med pa'i yang brjod du med pa dang / de bzhin du lho phyogs dang / nub phyogs dang / byang phyogs dang / byang shar gyi phyogs mtshams dang / shar lho'i phyogs mtshams dang / lho nub kyi phyogs mtshams dang / nub byang gi phyogs mtshams dang / 'og dang / steng gi phyogs kyi 'jig rten gyi khams bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong tshad med pa nas/ brjod du med pa'i yang brjod du med pa'i bar gyi sems can rnams kyi brda dang / nges pa'i tshig dang / skad dang / ming rgya mtsho thams cad la yang 'jug cing shes te/ 'di ltar lha rnams kyi lha'i skad kyang shes so/ /tshangs pa rnams kyi tshangs pa'i skad kyi bar du'ang shes so/ /rigs kyi bu/ kho bos ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi gzungs snang ba dbyangs dang ldan pa 'di shes par zad na/ kho bos byang chub sems dpa' 'gro ba sna tshogs kyi brda'i rnam pa rgya mtsho la zhugs pa de dag dang / 'gro ba sna tshogs kyi skad dang ming rgya mtsho la zhugs pa de dag dang / 'gro ba sna tshogs kyi ming shin tu bstan pa rgya mtsho la zhugs pa de dag dang / 'gro ba sna tshogs kyi brjod pa rab tu bkod pa dang / rnam par spyod pa rgya mtsho la zhugs pa de dag dang / tshig thams cad kyi mtshams sbyar ba rgya mtsho la zhugs pa de dag dang / tshig lhur blangs te bstan pa rgya mtsho la zhugs pa de dag dang / dus gsum gyi dmigs pa thams cad dmigs pa gcig tu rnam par spyod pa rgya mtsho gangs chen mtsho la zhugs pa de dag dang / tshig gis brtsegs te bstan pa rgya mtsho la zhugs pa de dag dang / tshig gnyis nas brtsegs te bstan pa rgya mtsho la zhugs pa de dag dang / tshig rab tu phye ste bstan pa rgya mtsho la zhugs pa de dag dang / chos thams cad rab tu dbye bas 'dul ba'i tshul bstan pa rgya mtsho la zhugs pa de dag dang / 'gro ba thams cad kyi skad rgya mtsho la zhugs pa de dag dang / dbyangs kyi dkyil 'khor rnam par dag pa'i rgyan thams cad la zhugs pa de dag dang / yi ge'i 'khor lo'i mthar phyin par bya bas rab tu dbye ba las byung ba de dag gi spyod pa shes pa'am, yon tan brjod par nus re skan/

Megha sat back down on the seat of teaching and said to Sudhana, “I have attained the light of the spell of eloquence: I know the speech of all kinds of beings in a billion-world universe; I know the variety of speech of each kind of being; I know the unity of speech of each kind of being; I know the mixture of speech of each kind of being; I know the terms, speech, and concepts of all creatures; I know the ideas of all sages; I know the ideas of all ignoble people; I know the speech of enlightening beings, expressed according to the mentalities and languages of sentient beings; I enter into and focus on the oceans of utterances addressed to all sentient beings by the buddhas of past, present, and future. As in this billion-world universe in each moment of thought I enter into the oceans of all terms, expressions, speech, and concepts of sentient beings, I do the same in untold worlds in each of the ten directions.
“I know this light of the spell of eloquence of enlightening beings, but how can I know the practice or tell the virtues of the enlightening beings who have entered the ocean of what is in various conceptions, who have entered the ocean of the various conceptions and languages of all people, who have entered the ocean of the various conventions of verbal designation used by all people, who have entered the ocean of logical connections of all statements, who have entered the ocean of literalism, who have entered the ocean of designation of all objects of past, present, and future in one object, who have entered the ocean of teaching which is beyond verbal expression, who have entered the ocean of the teaching of the Buddha, who have entered the ocean of explanations of distinct types of statements, who have entered the ocean of explanation guiding the analysis of statements of all truths, who have entered the ocean of speech of all beings, who have gone into the pure arrays of all spheres of sound, who are conversant with the ultimate distinctions of the wheel of phonemes?

song / rigs kyi bu lho phyogs kyi rgyud 'di nyid na yul nags tshal na gnas pa zhes bya ba yod de/ de na tshong dpon btang brjod ces bya ba 'dug gi /de'i gan du song la/ ji ltar byang chub sems dpas byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa la brtson par bya ba dang / ji ltar 'byung bar bya ba dang / ji ltar sems nges par gzhag par bya ba dris shig /

“Go, son—there is a country south of here called Vanavasin, where there lives a distinguished man named Muktaka. Go ask him how an enlightening being is to undertake the practice of enlightening beings and become familiar with it, and how the mind is to be observed.”

de nas tshong dpon gyi bu nor bzang gis/ dra byi la sprin gyi rkang pa gnyis la spyi bos phyag 'tshal te/ chos kyi rim gro byas nas/ dad pa'i mtshan nyid rtsa ba tshugs pa la rab tu brtag pa dang / dge ba'i bshes gnyen las 'ongs pa'i thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la yang dag par lta zhing gdong mchi mas gang bar ngus te/ dra byi la sprin la lan brgya stong du mar g.yas phyogs su bskor ba byas nas/ yang dang yang du bltas te phyag 'tshal zhing dra byi la sprin gyi drung nas song ngo// //

Then Sudhana, having bowed to Megha and paid respect to the teaching, describing the faith rooted in him, observing that all-knowledge comes from following good spiritual benefactors, reluctantly took his leave and went on.
bam po dgu bcu rtsa gcig pa/
[tshong dpon btang brjod]
Muktaka

de nas tshong dpon gyi bu nor bzang byang chub sems dpa'i gzungs snang ba dbyangs dang ldan pa'i rgyan de nyid la rjes su bsam pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i skad kyi tshul rgya mtsho de nyid la 'jug par bya ba dang / byang chub sems dpa'i tshul phra mo la 'jug pa de nyid rjes su dran par bya ba dang / byang chub sems dpa'i sems rnam par byang bas rnam par dag pa de nyid kyi rjes su 'brang bar bya ba dang / byang chub sems dpa' dge ba'i rtsa ba'i bag chags bsdu zhing bsgrub pa mngon par bsgrub pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i yongs su smin par bya ba'i sgo de nyid rnam par sbyang ba dang / byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi sems can bsdu ba'i ye shes de nyid shin tu byang bar bya ba dang / byang chub sems dpa'i bsam pa'i stobs rnam par dag par bya ba de nyid brtan par bya ba dang / byang chub sems dpa'i lhag pa'i bsam pa'i stobs de nyid nye bar brtan par bya ba dang / byang chub sems dpa'i mos pa'i rgyud de yang yongs su sbyang ba dang / byang chub sems dpa'i sems de nyid gdon mi za bar dge bar bsam pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i yi dam chen po de nyid mthar phyin par byed cing / tshong dpon gyi bu nor bzang yi dam la brtan zhing smon lam gyi sems kyis yongs su skyo ba med pa'i rgyud kyi rgyan dang ldan pa phyir mi ldog pas rnam par gnon pa'i brtson 'grus can/ yid kyis brtul ba las mi zlog pa/ dad pa mi 'phrogs pa'i stobs dang ldan pa/ rdo rje'i mthu bo ches mi phyed pa'i sems dang ldan pa/ dge ba'i bshes gnyen thams cad kyi gdams ngag mthun par len pa/ shes rab kha ma bab pa'i yul dang ldan pa/ sgo kun nas rnam par dag pa la mngon du gyur pa/ ye shes rnam par dag pa'i spyod yul thogs pa med pa/ kun tu lta ba'i ye shes kyi tshul snang ba dang ldan pa/ sa'i gzungs kun nas snang ba rab tu thob pa/ chos kyi dbyings kyi gzhi'i bye brag la mngon sum du gyur pa'i sems dang ldan pa/ gzhi kun la rten pa'i rgyan rnam par dag pa'i rang bzhin rnam par dmigs pa gnas pa med pa dang / bdag gi med pa dang / gnyis su med pa'i spyod yul la rab tu brtson pa/ 'du shes thams cad las 'da' bar byed pa'i ye shes kyi sgo rnam par dag pa/ chos kyi phyogs dang gzhi tha dad pa'i phyogs la so sor rtog pa med pa/ 'jig rten gyi gzhi dang phyogs kyi bye brag las phyir mi ldog pa/ chos kyi gzhi dang phyogs kyi bye brag las phyir mi ldog pa/ sangs rgyas kyi phyogs dang gzhi tha dad pa mthong ba dang / rnam par rig par bya ba la gzhol ba/ dus kyi phyogs dang gzhi'i bye brag khong du chud pa'i ye shes can/ chos kyi 'khor lo yid du 'ong bas yang dag par bsgrubs pa'i blo dang ldan pa/ ye shes kun nas snang ba'i ting nge 'dzin gyi rnam pa snang bas sems gsal bar byas pa/ yid kyi lus yul kun dang ldan pa'i sa la zhugs pa/ de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes snang bas rgyud shin tu snang bar byas pa/ thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du dad pa'i dba' rlabs kyi shugs kyis rab tu slob pa/ sangs rgyas kyi chos la mos pa'i shugs dang 'bral ba med pa/ de bzhin gshegs pa'i byin gyi rlabs kyis byin du brlabs pa/ sangs rgyas thams cad rang gi sems kyi rgyud du khong du chud pa'i 'od kyis snang bar gyur pa/ 'jig rten gyi khams kyi dra ba thams cad rang gi lus kyis rgyas par dgang ba'i smon lam dang / chos kyi dbyings thams cad rang gi lus su yang dag par bsdu ba dang mngon par bsgrubs pa la brtson pa de/ mthar gyis song song ste/ lo bcu gnyis kyis yul nags tshal na gnas par phyin nas/ des tshong dpon btang brjod de btsal btsal te mthong ngo/ /

Then Sudhana, reflecting on that array of light of the spell of eloquence of enlightening beings, plunging into that enlightening beings’ ocean of principles of speech, remembering that enlightening beings’ mental purification, undertaking that enlightening beings’ production of inclination to goodness, clarifying that enlightening beings’ method of perfecting sentient beings, purifying that enlightening beings’ knowledge of how to take care of sentient beings, making firm that enlightening beings’ purity of willpower, establishing that enlightening beings’ power of supreme resolve, clarifying that body of interest of enlightening beings, producing that goodness of intent and thought of enlightening beings, evoking that effort of enlightening beings, equipped with a mind of firm commitment and tireless consistency, with unrelenting energy and determination, imbued with unshakable power of faith, with an indestructible mind, follower of the instructions of all spiritual benefactors, with the perspective of sane knowledge, on the verge of all-sided purity, coursing in the purity of unobstructed knowledge, imbued with the light of the principle of the universal eye, illumined by the mystic formulations of all stages of enlightenment, his mind directed to the differentiations of the planes of the cosmos, aware of the pure essence of forms unfixed anywhere, intent on the sphere of absolute unity with no attachment, having purified the medium of powerful knowledge of all ideas, having broken through the boundaries of all spaces, progressively distinguishing the realms of worldly planes, progressively distinguishing the realms of planes of reality, intent on the manifestation of the vision of the varieties of abodes of Buddha, knowing about the distinctions of realms of time, his intellect bearing the radiant wheel of the teaching, his mind illumined by the light of the treasury of concentration of universally radiant knowledge, mentally and physically according with the stage of universal perspective, his mind illumined by the lightning of knowledge of those who realize Thusness, realizing the exaltation of faith in omniscience, never without the exaltation of faith in the buddha-teaching, filled with the exaltation of the empowerment of Buddha, illumined by the inherent mental light of all buddhas, hearing the vow to penetrate all networks of worlds with his own body, intent on putting all universes at once into his own body, made his way gradually to the country Vanavasin, arriving there after twelve years.

mthong nas kyang lus thams cad kyis phab ste/ phyag 'tshal nas mdun du 'dug ste/ thal mo sbyar nas 'di skad ces smras so/ /'phags pa/ bdag de ring dge ba'i bshes gnyen dang mjal bar gyur pa ni/ bdag gis 'thob par bgyi ba legs par thob bo/ /de ci'i slad du zhe na/ dge ba'i bshes gnyen rnams ni mthong bar dka' ba'o/ /'byung bar dka' ba'o/ /mjal bar dka' ba'o/ /bgrod par dka' ba'o/ /bsnyen bkur bgyi bar dka' ba'o/ /mnyes par bgyi ba dka' ba'o/ /'grogs par dka' ba'o/ /rim gror bgyi ba dka' ba'o/ /dge ba'i bshes gnyen rnams ni rjes su 'brang bar dka' ba lags na/ de lta bu'i dge ba'i bshes gnyen dang 'grogs pa de ring bdag gis thob par gyur to/ /'phags pa/ bdag gis 'di lta ste/ sangs rgyas thams cad la bsnyen bkur ba dang / sangs rgyas thams cad la rim gror bgyi ba dang / sangs rgyas thams cad kyi zhal blta ba dang / sangs rgyas thams cad rnam par dmigs par bgyi ba dang / sangs rgyas thams cad dang mnyam pa nyid thob par bgyi ba dang / sangs rgyas thams cad kyi smon lam khong du chud par bgyi ba dang / sangs rgyas thams cad kyi smon lam yongs su rdzogs par bgyi ba dang / sangs rgyas thams cad kyis yang dag par bsgrub pa'i ye shes snang bar bgyi ba dang / sangs rgyas thams cad rang gi lus su mngon par bsgrub pa dang / sangs rgyas thams cad kyis yang dag par bsgrubs pa rang gi spyod par mngon par bsgrub par bgyi ba dang / sangs rgyas thams cad kyi rnam par 'phrul ba mngon sum du rtogs par bgyi ba dang / sangs rgyas thams cad kyi stobs dang mi bsnyengs pa yongs su dag par bgyi ba dang / sangs rgyas thams cad kyi chos bstan pa mnyan pas mi ngoms par bgyi ba dang / sangs rgyas thams cad kyi chos brtan pa mnyan cing blang bar bgyi ba dang / sangs rgyas thams cad kyi chos bstan pa yang dag par gzung bar bgyi ba dang / sangs rgyas thams cad kyi chos bstan pa rnam par dbye bar bgyi ba dang / sangs rgyas thams cad kyi chos bstan pa yongs su gzung ba dang / byang chub sems dpa' thams cad dang tshul gcig tu 'gyur bar bgyi ba dang / byang chub sems dpa' thams cad dang skal pa mnyam par bgyi ba dang / byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyi spyod pa yongs su dag par bgyi ba dang / byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par bgyi ba dang / byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyi smon lam mngon par bsgrub pa rnam par dag par bgyi ba dang / byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyi sangs rgyas kyi byin gyi rlabs kyi mdzod rab tu thob par bgyi ba dang / byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyi chos kyi gter dang mdzod mi zad pa'i ye shes snang ba thob par bgyi ba dang / byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyi ting 'dzin gyi gter dang mdzod khong du chud par bgyi ba dang / byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyi mdzod tshad med pa mngon par bsgrub pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyi snying rje chen po'i gter dang mdzod sems can 'dul ba'i mthar phyin par bgyi ba dang / byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyi rnam par 'phrul ba'i gter dang mdzod rnam par dmigs par bgyi ba dang / byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyi dbang gi gter dang mdzod rang gi sems kyi dbang du bgyi ba dang / byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyi rnam par dag pa'i gter dang mdzod rnam pa thams cad du brgyan par bgyi ba'i slad du/ bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed nas/

He looked for the noble Muktaka, saw him, paid his respects, and said, “Noble one, I have made gains, having met the spiritual benefactor Megha. Why do I say this? Spiritual benefactors are hard to get to see, hard to get to encounter, hard to visit, hard to attend, hard to approach, hard to stay with, hard to be perfected by, hard to associate with. But I have met the spiritual benefactor Megha. Noble one, I have set my mind on supreme perfect enlightenment, to attend all buddhas, to be on good terms with all buddhas, to see all buddhas, to know all buddhas, to approach equality with all buddhas, to follow the vows of all buddhas, to fulfill the vows of all buddhas, to view the knowledge attained by all buddhas, to produce all buddhas in my own body, to accomplish the realization of all buddhas in my own practice, to directly know the mystical transformations of all buddhas, to purify the powers and confidences of all buddhas, to hear all true teachings tirelessly, to listen to and take up the teachings of all buddhas, to hold the teachings of all buddhas, to distinguish the teachings of all buddhas, to preserve the instructions of all buddhas, to be one being with all buddhas, to be equal to all enlightening beings, to purify the practice of all enlightening beings, to fulfill the transcendent ways of enlightening beings, to purify the accomplishment of the vows of all enlightening beings, to attain all enlightening beings’ store of mystical power of buddhas, to be illumined by the endless knowledge of the treasury of truths of all enlightening beings, to approach the treasury of enlightening beings, to produce the infinite treasury of enlightening beings, to realize the ultimate consummation of guidance of sentient beings with the treasury of great compassion of all enlightening beings, to know the treasury of spiritual transformations of all enlightening beings, to command in my own body the treasury of powers of all enlightening beings, to be fully arrayed with the treasury of purities of all enlightening beings.
