'phags pa/ de lta bu'i sems kyis bdag 'dir mchis so/ /bsam pa de lta bu dang / yid la smon pa de lta bu dang / mngon par dga' ba de lta bu dang / sems pa de lta bu dang / gdon mi 'tshal bar bsgrub par bsam pa de lta bu dang / spyod yul mngon du bgyi ba de lta bu dang / tshul khong du chud par bgyi ba la mos pa de lta bu dang / rnam par dag pa la gzhol ba de lta bu dang / rnam par dpyod pa'i bsam pa de lta bu dang / rab tu gzhol ba'i sems de lta bu dang / dge ba'i sbyor ba de lta bu dang / mngon du gyur pa'i dbang po de lta bus bdag 'dir mchis te/ 'phags pa ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams la gdams ngag dang rjes su ston pa mdzad cing / tshul ni nye bar ston pa mdzad/ rtogs par bgyi ba ni snang bar mdzad/ lam ni bstan par mdzad/ mu stegs la ni 'jog par mdzad/ chos kyi sgo ni rnam par 'byed pa mdzad/ the tshom ni yongs su gcod par mdzad/ nem nur ni sel bar mdzad/ yid gnyis kyi zug rngu ni 'byin par mdzad/ dogs pa'i dri ma ni sbyong bar mdzad/ sems kyi thibs po ni snang bar mdzad; sems kyi dri ma ni yongs su sel bar mdzad/ sems kyi rgyud ni rab tu dang bar mdzad/ sems kyi g.yo sgyu ni yongs su sel bar mdzad/ sems kyi gdung ba ni yongs su sim par mdzad/ 'khor ba las ni sems rnam par bzlog par mdzad/ mi dge ba'i las ni phyir bzlog par mdzad/ sems can dmyal ba las ni ldog par mdzad/ gnas dang ni dbral bar mdzad/ mngon par zhen pa las ni gyen du bskyod pa mdzad/ chags pa thams cad las ni yongs su 'grel ba mdzad/ thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du ni bsgrub pa mdzad/ chos kyi grong khyer du 'jug par bgyi ba'i slad du ni mngon du gyur par mdzad/ snying rje chen po la ni rab tu bsgrub pa mdzad/ byams pa chen po la ni rab tu gzhog pa mdzad/ byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa la ni rab tu sbyor ba mdzad/ ting nge 'dzin gyi sgo bsgom pa la ni 'dzud pa mdzad/ rtogs par 'gyur ba'i sgo la ni gnas par mdzad/ rang bzhin nges par rtogs pa la ni gzhog par mdzad/ stobs dang ldan pas ni khyab par mdzad/ 'gro ba thams cad mnyam pa nyid du ni sems rnam par dbye ba mdzad do zhes thos na/ 'phags pa/ ji ltar byang chub sems dpas byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa la brtson par bgyi/ ji ltar sbyar bar bgyi/ ji ltar brtson par bgyis na byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa'i dkyil 'khor rnam par dag par 'gyur ba bdag la bstan du gsol/

“Noble one, I have come in such a spirit, with such desires, such wishes, such intentions, such thoughts uppermost in my mind, aiming for such a realm, determined to follow such principles, intent on such purity, seeking such adornments, with such a humble mind, applied to such good, my faculties oriented in this way. Noble one, I hear you give instructions to enlightening beings, explain principle and clarify procedure, explain the Path, take them across the bridge, open the door of the Teaching, cut off doubts, dispel craving, pull out the arrow of confusion, clear away the grime of uncertainty, light up the obscurity in the mind, remove defilement from the mind, calm the mental flow, remove deviousness from the mind, cool the fever of the mind, foster nonattachment, turn back the mind revolving in the mundane whirl, turn enlightening beings away from evil, separate them from hells, free them from attachments, direct them toward omniscience, lead them into the city of truth, establish them in great compassion, settle them in great kindness, introduce them into the practice of enlightening beings, cause them to enter into the development of ways of concentration, establish them in means of realization, fill them with contemplation of inherent nature, and explain mind according to power for the sake of attainment of equanimity toward all beings. Noble one, please tell me how an enlightening being is to learn, commence, and carry out the practice of enlightening beings, and how one so engaged can quickly purify the sphere of practice of enlightening beings.”

de nas tshong dpon btang brjod kyis de'i tshe byang chub sems dpa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi sgo sangs rgyas kyi zhing thams cad yang dag par 'du ba zhes bya ba gzungs kyi sgo klong mtha' yas pa sngon du 'gro ba la sngon gyi dge ba'i rtsa ba'i shugs dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i byin gyi rlabs dang / 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pas yang dag par bsams shing / ye shes snang ba nye bar bsgrubs pas snyoms par zhugs so/ /tshong dpon btang brjod de ltar snyoms par zhugs ma thag tu gzugs kyi lus yongs su dag pa rnam pa 'di lta bur gnas par gyur te/ lus yongs su dag pa de'i mthus phyogs bcu'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das/ sangs rgyas kyi zhing bcu'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag pa dang bcas/ 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor dang bcas/ 'od rnam par dag pa dang bcas/ sngon spyod pa la zhugs pa dang bcas/ sangs rgyas kyi rnam par 'phrul pa dang bcas/ smon lam gyi tshogs dang bcas/ spyod pa dang 'byung ba'i rgyan rnam par dag pa dang bcas/ mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya ba yongs su ston pa dang bcas/ chos kyi 'khor lo shin tu ston pa dang bcas/ sems can yongs su smin par mdzad pa dang bcas/ chos kyi mu'i mthar thug pa dang bcas par kun kyang lus kyi khong du chud cing 'dus par snang ste/ de dag kyang phan tshun ma 'dres pa dang / phan tshun mchod pa dang / phan tshun shin tu rnam par phye ba dang / phan tshun shin tu rnam par gnas pa dang / tshul sna tshogs su bzhugs pa dang / yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rnam par dmigs pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing rgyan sna tshogs can mnga' ba dang / byang chub sems dpa'i 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor sna tshogs kyi rgyan dang ldan pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi rnam par 'phrul pa sna tshogs su yongs su ston par snang ngo/ /theg pa sna tshogs rnam par dgod pa mdzad pa dang / smon lam gyi sgo sna tshogs yongs su brjod pa dang / 'jig rten gyi khams la la na ni dga' ldan gyi pho brang du skyes shing / sangs rgyas kyi 'phrin las thams cad mdzad par snang ngo/ /la la na ni dga' ldan gyi pho brang nas 'pho ba dang / la la na ni yum gyi sku na bzhugs shing rnam par 'phrul pa sna tshogs yongs su ston pa dang / la la na ni skye ba dang / la la na ni byis pa'i rtsed mo ston pa mdzad pa dang / la la na ni btsun mo'i 'khor gyi nang na bzhugs pa dang / la la na ni mngon par 'byung ba dang / la la na ni snying po byang chub tu gshegs te rnam par 'phrul ba'i rgyan chen pos bdud kyi sde pham par mdzad pa dang / la la na ni lha dang / klu dang / gnod sbyin dang / dri zas yongs su bskor cing tshangs pa'i dbang pos chos kyi 'khor lo bskor bar gsol ba gdab pa dang / la la na ni chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba mdzad pa dang / la la na ni sems can thams cad kyi gnas na bzhugs pa dang / la la na ni yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar snang ngo/ /'jig rten gyi khams la la na ni de bzhin gshegs pa mya ngan las 'das pa rnams kyi ring bsrel rnam par 'god par snang ngo/ /sangs rgyas kyi zhing la la na ni lha dang mi rnams de bzhin gshegs pa'i mchod rten la rgyan gyis klubs pa byed par snang ste/ sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag gis sems can gyi ris rnam pa tha dad pa dang / sems can gyi 'jig rten gyi rnam pa tha dad pa dang / sems can gyi lam rnam pa tha dad pa dang / sems can gyi skye gnas rnam pa tha dad pa dang / sems can gyi tshogs rnam pa tha dad pa dang / sems can gyi dge ba'i rtsa ba'i rgyud rnam pa tha dad pa dang / sems can gyi lam gyi rgyud rnam pa tha dad pa dang / sems can gyi bsam pa'i rgyud rnam pa tha dad pa dang / sems can gyi mos pa'i rgyud rnam pa tha dad pa dang / sems can gyi dbang po'i rgyud rnam pa tha dad pa dang / dus kyi rgyud rnam pa tha dad pa dang / sems can gyi las kyi bye brag rnam pa tha dad pa dang / sems can gyi las mi mthun pa rnam pa tha dad pa dang / sems can gyi 'jig rten rnam par dbye ba rnam pa tha dad pa dang / sems can gyi tshul lam dang / spyod pa rnam pa tha dad pa la rnam par spyod pa dang / sems can rgya mtsho bsam pa dang / sbyor ba'i rnam pa tha dad pa dang / dbang po mi mthun pa sna tshogs rnam par dag pa dang / nyon mongs pa dang / bag chags sna tshogs bag la nyal bar gyur pa'i sems can 'byams klas pa rnams la/ sangs rgyas kyi rnam par 'phrul pa rnam pa sna tshogs yongs su bstan pa dang / yul sna tshogs kyi nges pa'i tshig dang / dbyangs kyi yan lag dang / gsung rnam pa sna tshogs su bsgrub pa dang / mdo sde sna tshogs kyi tshul rab tu brjod pa dang / gzungs kyi sgo rnam pa tha dad pa'i rgyud dang / tha dad pa yang dag par mkhyen pa'i tshul gyi gzhung sna tshogs dang / 'phags pa'i bden pa'i ming rgya mtsho'i rgyud rnam pa sna tshogs dang / sangs rgyas kyi khyu mchog dang / seng ge'i nga ro rab tu bsgrags pa dang / sems can gyi dge ba'i rtsa ba sna tshogs bstan pa'i cho 'phrul yongs su bstan pa dang / dran pa'i sgo sna tshogs can shin tu bstan pa'i rnam par 'phrul pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' lung bstan pa'i seng ge'i nga ro sna tshogs dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i chos kyi 'khor lo'i mthu phyung ba rnam pa sna tshogs kyis 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor mtha' dang / dbus med pa mtha' yas par rnam pa tha dad pa phan tshun mchod pa dang / rnam par dag pa'i 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor sna tshogs yangs pa dang / 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor shin tu phra bar 'dus pa dang / dpag tshad gcig gi tshad tsam dang / dpag tshad bcu'i tshad tsam dang / dpag tshad brgya'i tshad tsam nas/ 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor 'jig rten gyi khams sangs rgyas kyi zhing brjod du med pa'i yang brjod du med pa'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed kyi tshad tsam du sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag gis/ de bzhin gshegs pa'i gsungs dbyangs kyi yan lag dang / sgra skad thams cad kyi rjes su 'gro bas chos ji snyed du bstan pa de dag thams cad kyang tshong dpon gyi bu nor bzang gis thos so/ /blangs so/ /yang dag par bzung ngo/ /bsams so/ /sangs rgyas kyi sa rnam par 'phrul pa de dag kyang mthong ngo/ /byang chub sems dpa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi khyu mchog gi mthu phyung ba de dag kyang mthong ngo/ /

At that juncture Muktaka entered an enlightening concentration medium called “collection of all buddha-fields,” led by a mystic formula of endless progression, accomplishing entry into this concentration by the power of his past roots of goodness, by the empowerment of the Buddha, and by Manjushri’s attention and gift of the light of knowledge. As soon as Muktaka had entered that state, his body became pure, and by that purity of body as many buddhas in the ten directions as atoms in ten buddha-lands were visible within his body, along with the adornments of their pure lands, their congregations, their pure lights, their past actions and abodes, their mystical projections, their vows, their pure arrays of liberative practices, their manifestations of attainment of perfect enlightenment, their turnings of the wheel of teaching, their developments of sentient beings, and the ultimate consummation of their teaching. All these were visible within Muktaka’s body without mutual confusion, without mutual obstruction, clearly distinct, showing the various individual ages accurately defined, the various arrays of the buddha-lands, the various adornments of the congregations of enlightening beings, and the various miracles of the buddhas. Some buddhas were seen to be in the heaven of happiness in a world setting forth various means of liberation and illumining various undertakings; some were seen descending from the heaven of happiness doing the duty of buddhas; some were seen in the womb of the mother displaying various miracles; some were seen being born and showing a child’s play; some were seen at home, some leaving home, some gone to the summit of enlightenment defeating the army of demons; some were seen surrounded by deities, spirits, and cherubim, being asked by Brahma and Indra to turn the wheel of the teaching; some were seen turning the wheel of teaching; some were seen in the abodes of all beings; some were seen passing away; in some cases the division of the relics of deceased buddhas in a world was seen, and in some cases people and celestial beings in a buddha-land were seen adorning a buddha’s shrine. And what those buddhas said, in various groups of beings, in various beings’ worlds, in various realms of existence, in various assemblies of beings, in various situations according to beings’ virtues, states, inclinations, beliefs, and faculties, in various periods of time, amid various kinds of beings’ activities, in various manifestations of worlds of beings carrying out various intentions, in the midst of beings with various degrees of purity of senses and various afflictions, habits, and propensities, teaching by various manifestations of buddhas’ transfigurations and projections, by various expressions, various utterances, various enunciations of doctrine, various mystical mnemonic formulae, various intellectual analyses of principles, various stirrings of the ocean of names of truth, various roarings of the mighty lion’s roar of buddhas, various manifestations of magical performances teaching beings bases of goodness, mystic projections showing various facets of memory, various lion roars foretelling the buddhahood of enlightening beings, various manifestations of the wheel of teaching of the enlightened, in infinite assemblies of infinite varieties, all interdependent, in groups variously purified, in large groups contained in small groups, in groups a league deep, ten leagues deep, up to groups the size of as many worlds as atoms in untold buddha-fields—all that those buddhas taught, Sudhana heard, took in, remembered, undertook, and contemplated. He also saw the mystic projection and the inconceivable power of concentration of the enlightening being.

de nas tshong dpon btang brjod dran zhing shes bzhin du ting nge 'dzin de las langs nas/ tshong dpon gyi bu nor bzang la 'di skad ces smras so/ /rigs kyi bu/ kho bo ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i rnam par thar pa/ thogs pa med pa'i rgyan ces bya ba yongs su blangs shing 'dzin pa ste/ rigs kyi bu/ de ltar kho bo de bzhin gshegs pa'i rnam par thar pa thogs pa med pa'i rgyan de la rtog cing dpyod pa'i tshe/ shar phyogs kyi 'jig rten gyi khams 'dzam bu chu klung gi mdog dang ldan pa na/ de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas skar ma'i dbang phyug rgyal po zhes bya ba/ byang chub sems dpa' rnam par snang ba'i snying po la sogs pa byang chub sems dpa'i 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor thams cad dang thabs gcig tu bzhugs pa'ang mig lam du snang ngo/ /lho phyogs kyi 'jig rten gyi khams stobs thams cad kyi shugs dang ldan pa na/ de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas spos kun tu rnam par yangs pa zhes bya ba/ byang chub sems dpa' bsam pa'i rgyal po la sogs pa byang chub sems dpa'i 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor thams cad dang thabs gcig tu bzhugs pa yang mig lam du snang ngo/ /nub phyogs kyi 'jig rten gyi khams spos thams cad kyi 'od dang ldan pa na/ de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas ri rab mar me'i rgyal po zhes bya ba/ byang chub sems dpa' chags pa med pa'i sems la sogs pa byang chub sems dpa'i 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor thams cad dang thabs gcig tu bzhugs pa yang mig lam du snang ngo/ /byang phyogs kyi 'jig rten gyi khams ngur smrig rgyal mtshan na/ de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rdo rje rab tu 'dul ba zhes bya ba/ byang chub sems dpa' rdo rje'i gom pas rnam par gnon pa la sogs pa byang chub sems dpa'i 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor thams cad dang thabs gcig tu bzhugs pa yang mig lam du snang ngo/ /byang shar gyi phyogs mtshams kyi 'jig rten gyi khams rin po che thams cad rab tu 'bar ba na/ de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas mi dmigs pa'i spyan rnam par dmigs pa zhes bya ba/ byang chub sems dpa' dmigs pa med par shin tu sprul pa la sogs pa byang chub sems dpa'i 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor thams cad dang thabs gcig tu bzhugs pa yang mig lam du snang ngo/ /shar lho'i phyogs mtshams kyi 'jig rten gyi khams spos kyi 'od zer rab tu snang ba na/ de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas spos kyi mar me zhes bya ba/ byang chub sems dpa' chos kyi dbyings kyi gzhi tha dad pa'i dpal gyi rgyal po la sogs pa byang chub sems dpa'i 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor thams cad dang thabs gcig tu bzhugs pa yang mig lam du snang ngo/ /lho nub kyi phyogs mtshams kyi 'jig rten gyi khams nyi ma'i 'od zer ltar snang ba na/ de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas sgo kun nas ye shes rnam par snang ba'i dbyangs zhes bya ba/ byang chub sems dpa' me tog gi 'od kun nas 'phro bar gtsug phud rab tu 'phyang ba la sogs pa byang chub sems dpa'i 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor thams cad dang thabs gcig tu bzhugs pa yang mig lam du snang ngo/ /nub byang gi phyogs mtshams kyi 'jig rten gyi khams spos kyi rgyan yid du 'ong ba dge ba'i snying po na/ de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas yon tan rgya mtsho tshad med pa'i 'od ces bya ba/ byang chub sems dpa' lus kyi 'od zer thogs pa med pa'i gzi brjid rgyal po blo gros la sogs pa byang chub sems dpa'i 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor thams cad dang thabs gcig tu bzhugs pa yang mig lam du snang ngo/ /'og gi phyogs kyi 'jig rten gyi khams rin po che'i seng ge snang zhing 'phar ba na/ de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas 'od zer chos kyi dbyings su snang ba zhes bya ba/ byang chub sems dpa' chos kyi dbyings 'od 'phro zhing rnam par snang bar byung ba'i blo gros la sogs pa byang chub sems dpa'i 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor thams cad dang thabs gcig tu bzhugs pa yang mig lam du snang ngo/ /steng gi phyogs kyi 'jig rten gyi khams mtshan gyi 'od rnam par snang ba na/ de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas yon tan grags pa thogs pa med pa'i rnam par thar pa'i 'od kyi rgyal po zhes bya ba/ byang chub sems dpa' stobs dang brtson 'grus thogs pa med pa'i blo gros la sogs pa byang chub sems dpa'i 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor thams cad dang thabs gcig tu bzhugs pa yang mig lam du snang ngo/ /rigs kyi bu/ de ltar de bzhin gshegs pa 'di dag la sogs pa phyogs bcu'i de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas sangs rgyas kyi zhing bcu'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed mthong yang de bzhin gshegs pa de dag kyang 'dir mi byon/ kho bo yang der 'gro ba med de/ nam 'dod pa de na/ bde ba yod pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams na de bzhin gshegs pa 'od snang mtha' yas bzhugs pa yang mthong ngo/ /tsan dan yod pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams na/ de bzhin gshegs pa 'od snang rdo rje bzhugs pa yang mthong ngo/ /spos dri yod pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams na/ de bzhin gshegs pa 'od snang rin chen bzhugs pa yang mthong ngo/ /pad+mo yod pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams na; de bzhin gshegs pa 'od snang rin chen pad+mo bzhugs pa yang mthong ngo/ /gser yod pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams na/ de bzhin gshegs pa 'od snang zhi ba bzhugs pa yang mthong ngo/ /mngon par dga' ba'i 'jig rten gyi khams na/ de bzhin gshegs pa mi sgul ba bzhugs pa yang mthong ngo/ /shin tu brtan pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams na/ de bzhin gshegs pa seng ge bzhugs pa yang mthong ngo/ /me long gi dkyil 'khor ltar snang ba'i 'jig rten gyi khams na/ de bzhin gshegs pa blo gros zla ba bzhugs pa yang mthong ngo/ /rin chen dpal gyi dad pas brgyan pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams na/ de bzhin gshegs pa rnam par snang mdzad bzhugs pa yang mthong ngo/ /rigs kyi bu/ de ltar kho bos ni phyogs gang dang gang na/ 'jig rten gyi khams gang dang gang gi de bzhin gshegs pa gang dang gang mthong bar 'dod pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa de dang de dag kyang mthong ngo/ /dus gang dang gang du dmigs pa gang dang gang la sngon gyi spyod pa gang dang gang gis de bzhin gshegs pa mthong bar 'dod pa dang / rnam par 'phrul pa gang dang gang gi don dang / sems can 'dul ba gang dang gang gi don du de bzhin gshegs pa gang dang gang mthong bar 'dod pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa de dang de dag kyang mthong ste/ de bzhin gshegs pa de dag kyang 'dir gshegs pa ma yin/ bdag kyang der phyin pa ma yin no/ /rigs kyi bu/ de ltar kho bos de bzhin gshegs pa rnams ga las kyang byon pa med par shes la/ rang gi lus kyang gar yang 'gro ba med par shes pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa rnams rnam par dmigs pa yang rmi lam lta bur shes la/ rang gi sems rnam par dmigs pa yang rmi lam dang 'dra bar rgyu bar shes pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa rnams rnam par dmigs pa yang gzugs brnyan lta bur shes la/ rang gi sems rnam par dmigs pa yang chu'i snod gsal ba lta bur shes pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa rnams rnam par dmigs pa yang sgyu mas byas pa'i gzugs brnyan lta bur shes la/ rang gi sems rnam par dmigs pa yang sgyu ma lta bur shes pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i gsung yang sgra brnyan ri'i brag ca lta bur brjod par shes la/ rang gi sems rnam par dmigs pa yang sgra brnyan lta bur shes pas/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad ni/ rang gi sems kyi byin gyi rlabs las 'byung ngo zhes bya bar rjes su rtogs shing khong du chud do/ /sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag pa thams cad kyang rang gi sems kyi byin gyi rlabs so/ /byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa yang rang gi sems kyi byin gyi rlabs so/ /sems can thams cad yongs su smin par bya ba dang / gdul ba yang rang gi sems kyi byin gyi rlabs so/ /byang chub sems dpa'i smon lam mngon par bsgrubs pa yang rang gi sems kyi byin gyi rlabs so/ /thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi grong khyer du phyin par bya ba yang rang gi sems kyi byin gyi rlabs so/ /rnam par thar pa bsam gyis mi khyab pas rnam par rtse ba yang rang gi sems kyi byin gyi rlabs so/ / sangs rgyas kyi byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya ba yang rang gi sems kyi byin gyi rlabs so/ /chos kyi dbyings kun nas 'dus par khyu mchog gi mthu 'byung zhing / rnam par 'phrul pa yang rang gi sems kyi byin gyi rlabs so/ /bskal pa thams cad shin tu phra bar bsdu ba'i ye shes kyang rang gi sems kyi byin gyi rlabs so/ /zhes bya bar khong du chud cing rjes su rtogs so/ /

Then Muktaka, mindful, perfectly cognizant, arose from that concentration and said to Sudhana, “I go in and out of a liberation of buddhas which is called ‘unobstructed manifestation.’ As I go in and out of the ‘unobstructed mainfestation’ liberation of buddhas, to the east I see in the world Golden Light a buddha named Supreme Savior, along with the whole group of enlightening beings there, led by the enlightening being Child of Radiance. To the south I see in the world Possessed of All Powers a buddha named Universal Spread of Fragrance, with the whole group of enlightening beings there, led by King of Thought. To the west I see in the World Possessed of All Fragrances and Beauties a buddha named Supreme Lamp, with the whole group of enlightening beings there, led by Unobstructed Mind. To the north I see in the world Vestment Banner a buddha named Diamond Crusher, with the whole group of enlightening beings there, led by Boldly Advancing on Indestructible Feet. To the northeast I see in the world Beauty of All Jewels a buddha named Radiance of the Independent Eye, with the whole group of enlightening beings there, led by Independent Emanation. To the southeast I see in the world Glow of Fragrant Flames a buddha named Fragrant Lamp, with the whole group of enlightening beings there, led by Supreme Intellect Differentiating the Planes of All Realms of Reality. To the southwest I see in a world Sunny Golden Shining a buddha named Illuminating Voice of Universal Knowledge, with the whole group of enlightening beings there, led by Hanging Crest of Radiant Flowery Flames. To the northwest I see in the land Brilliant Shining Treasury with Fragrant Adornments a buddha named Light of a Measureless Ocean of Virtue, with the whole group of enlightening beings there, led by Mind Blazing with Light in a Body Free from Attachments. In the nadir I see in the world Blaze of Lights from Jewel Lions a buddha named Beam of Light Illumining the Cosmos, with the whole group of enlightening beings there, led by Mind Born of the Light of the Cosmos. In the zenith I see in the world Radiant with Splendor of Appearance a buddha named Light of Liberation of Indestructible Virtue and Glory, with the whole group of enlightening beings there, led by Mind of Energy of Unobstructed Power. Beginning with these, I see as many buddhas in the ten directions as atoms in ten buddha-lands: and yet those buddhas do not come here and I do not go there. Also, whenever I want to see the buddha Infinite Light in the world Blissful, I see the buddha Diamond Light in the world Like Sandalwood, I see the buddha Jewel Light in the world Fragrant, I see the buddha Jewel Lotus Light in the world Lotuslike, I see the buddha Silent Light in the world Golden, I see the buddha Imperturbable in the world Joy, I see the buddha Lion in the world Standing Well, I see the buddha Moonlike Awareness in the world Mirror Globe Light, I see the buddha Luminous in the world Pure Clarity of Jewellike Splendor. In this way I see whatever buddha I wish in whatever world in whichever direction. I see whatever buddha I wish to see in whatever time in whatever abode involved in whatever past practice, whatever buddha I wish to see in whatever miraculous performances, in whatever teaching activity: and yet the buddhas do not come here, nor do I go there. Without discerning any coming from anywhere on the part of the buddhas, without discerning any going on the part of my own body, knowing the buddhas as like a dream, knowing my own mind as dreamlike thought, knowing the buddhas as like a reflection, knowing my own mind as like a vessel of clear water, knowing the buddhas as like magically produced forms, knowing my mind as like magic, knowing the nature of voices of the buddhas as the reverberation of the sound of echoes in the mountains, knowing my own mind as like an echo, I realize, I am mindful, that all enlightenment principles of enlightening beings are based on one’s own mind, that all their purification of buddha-lands, all enlightening practices, all development and guidance of sentient beings, all undertaking of the vows of enlightening beings, all attainment to the ocean of omniscience, roaming in the inconceivable liberation of enlightening beings, attainment of the enlightenment of buddhas, spiritual communion with the cosmos, and knowledge of subtle communion with all ages, all are based on one’s own mind.

rigs kyi bu/ de la kho bo 'di snyam du sems te/ dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad kyis ni rang gi sems nyid nye bar brtan par bya'o// chos kyi sprin gyis ni rang gi sems nyid yongs su brlan par bya'o/ /sgrib pa'i chos rnams las ni rang gi sems nyid yongs su sbyang bar bya'o/ /brtson 'grus kyis ni rang gi sems nyid brtan par bya'o/ /bzod pas ni rang gi sems nyid mnyam par bya'o/ /ye shes khong du chud par bya ba la ni rang gi sems nyid gzhol bar bya'o/ /shes rab kyis ni rang gi sems nyid yongs su sbyang bar bya'o/ /dbang rnams la ni rang gi sems nyid mngon par bsgrub par bya'o/ /sangs rgyas dang mnyam pa nyid la ni rang gi sems nyid rgyas par bya'o/ /de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcus ni rang gi sems nyid snang bar bya'o snyam mo/ /

“In this connection, I think that one’s own mind should be supported by roots of goodness, moistened by the clouds of the Teaching, purified by principles that should be focused on, made firm by vigor, made calm by forbearance, guided by following knowledge, clarified by wisdom, developed in spiritual powers, expanded to equality with the buddhas, illumined by the ten powers of the enlightened.

rigs kyi bu/ kho bo ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i rnam par thar pa thogs pa med pa'i rgyan 'di shes te/ blangs shing yongs su 'dzin par zad na/ kho bos byang chub sems dpa'i chags pa med pa'i sems dang ldan pa/ chags pa med pa rnam par spyod pa'i spyod yul dang ldan pa/ da ltar byung ba'i sangs rgyas thams cad mngon sum du bzhugs pa'i ting nge 'dzin rab tu thob pa/ mya ngan las 'da' ba med pa'i mtha' la gnas pa'i rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi sgo'i ting nge 'dzin rab tu thob pa/ dus gsum mnyam pa nyid du gyur pa/ gzhi kun nas phyed pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi spyod yul gyi tshul shes pa/ sangs rgyas kyi zhing thams cad du lus rnam par bkram pa/ sangs rgyas kyi yul tha mi dad pa la rnam par spyod pa/ phyogs thams cad du mngon par phyogs pa'i spyod yul dang ldan pa/ phyin phyogs med pa'i ye shes kyi dkyil 'khor gyis rnam par lta ba de dag gi lus la 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad 'jig cing 'du bar snang yang / de dag la bdag dang 'jig rten gyi khams su gnyis kyi 'du shes med pa de dag gi spyod pa shes pa'am/ yon tan brjod par nus re skan/

“I know this buddha-liberation of unobstructed manifestation, and go in and out of it; how can I know the practice or tell of the virtues of enlightening beings whose minds are unobstructed, whose sphere is a state free from obstruction, who have attained concentration focused on the teachings of all buddhas of the present, who have attained concentration leading into enlightenment that does not become ultimately extinct, who have realized the equality of past, present, and future, who know the science of the sphere of concentration on the continuity of all planes, who distribute their bodies throughout all buddha-lands, who abide in the unfragmented state of buddhas, whose perspective faces in all directions, who observe the sphere of all-inclusive knowledge, who know the becoming and disintegration of all worlds in their own bodies, without any dualistic notions regarding their bodies or the worlds.

song / rigs kyi bu/ lho phyogs kyi rgyud 'di nyid kyi 'dzam bu'i gling gi mgo 'gebs pas rgyas par 'gengs pa zhes bya ba yod de/ de na dge slong rgya mtsho'i rgyal mtshan zhes bya ba 'dug gi /de'i gan du song la/ ji ltar byang chub sems dpas byang chub sems dpa' spyod pa la bslab par bya ba dang / ji ltar nan tan du bya ba dris shig /

“Go south, to Milaspharana, on the tip of the continent. A monk named Saradhvaja lives there. Go to him and ask how an enlightening being is to learn and undertake the practice of enlightening beings.”

de nas tshong dpon gyi bu nor bzang gis tshong dpon btang brjod kyi rkang pa gnyis la spyi bos phyag 'tshal te/ tshong dpon btang brjod la lan brgya stong du mar g.yas phyogs su bskor ba byas nas/ yang dang yang bltas te/ tshong dpon btang brjod kyi yon tan grangs med pa la snyan par brjod de brtag pa dang / mos par bya ba dang / mi btang bar bya ba sems shing du ste/ smre sngags bton nas/ dge ba'i bshes gnyen sdug par sems shing dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyi rjes su 'brang ba dang / dge ba'i bshes gnyen la bsnyen bkur bar mos pa dang / dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyis bsgo ba dang mi 'gal bar byed pa dang / thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dge ba'i bshes gnyen la rag lus par rjes su lta ba dang / dge ba'i bshes gnyen la rjes su bsam pa dang / dge ba'i bshes gnyen la g.yo sgyu med par spyod pa dang / dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyi sems kyi dbang du 'gro bar bya ba dang ldan pas dge ba'i bshes gnyen rnams gnod pa thams cad yongs su spong bar byed pas ma tsam du sems/ dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad yongs su bskyed pas pha tsam du sems shing / tshong dpon btang brjod kyi drung nas song ngo/ /

Then Sudhana, paying his respects to Muktaka, eulogizing, contemplating, desiring, and dwelling on Muktaka’s countless virtues, with love for spiritual benefactors, taking refuge in spiritual benefactors, seeking to please spiritual benefactors, not contesting the knowledge of spiritual benefactors, seeing omniscience as realized by following spiritual benefactors, obedient to spiritual benefactors, to be spiritually healed by the techniques of spiritual benefactors, his thoughts following the direction of spiritual benefactors, thinking of spiritual benefactors as a mother because they get rid of all that is not beneficial, thinking of spiritual benefactors as a father because they produce all good qualities, Sudhana left Muktaka.
[dge slong rgya mtsho'i rgyal mtshan]
Saradhvaja

de nas tshong dpon gyi bu nor bzang / tshong dpon btang brjod kyis bstan pa de la rjes su sems shing / tshong dpon btang brjod kyi gdams ngag la nan tan du bya ba dang / byang chub sems dpa'i rnam par thar pa bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i rjes su 'brang bar bya ba dang / byang chub sems dpa'i ye shes snang ba bsam gyis mi khyab pa rjes su dran par bya ba dang / chos kyi dbyings la 'jug cing 'bab pa bsam gyis mi khyab pa khong du chud par bya ba dang / byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi yongs su 'du bar bya ba'i tshul bsam gyis mi khyab pa la 'jug par bya ba dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i rnam par 'phrul pa bsam gyis mi khyab pa rjes su blta bar bya ba dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su bsdu ba bsam gyis mi khyab pa la mos par bya ba dang / sangs rgyas kyi byin gyi rlabs kyi rgyan rjes su sbyang ba dang / byang chub sems dpa'i ting nge 'dzin dang / rnam par thar pa'i rnam par dgod pa dang / khyu mchog gi mthu phyung ba bsam gyis mi khyab pa la yongs su brtag pa dang / 'jig rten gyi khams tha dad pa la bsgribs pa med pa bsam gyis mi khyab pa la 'jug pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i las la bsam pa shin tu brtan pa de la nan tan du bya ba dang / byang chub sems dpa'i las dang smon lam gyi rgyud bsam gyis mi khyab pa de'i rjes su spyod cing / mthar gyis 'dzam bu gling gi mgo 'gebs pas rgyas par 'gengs pa zhes bya ba gang na ba der phyin nas/ dge slong rgya mtsho'i rgyal mtshan tshol tshol ba las/ 'chag pa'i gnas shig gi 'chag sa'i mthar 'dug ste/ ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par bzhag nas/ dbugs phyi nang du rgyu ba med cing mi g.yo la/ byed pa med cing lus drang por bsrang ste/ dran pa mngon du byas nas/ ting nge 'dzin gyi rnam par 'phrul pa bsam gyis mi khyab pas rnam par 'phrul zhing / g.yas g.yon dang / steng logs su lus mtha' yas la/ tshad med cing bsam gyis mi khyab pa/ spyi gtsug bltar mi mthong ba/ kha dog du ma'i lus dang ldan pa sems kyi skad cig re re la kha dog rnam pa tha dad pa tshad med pa yongs su ston pa de/ de de ltar mnyam par bzhag cing zab la zhi ba ste/ g.yo ba med cing dmigs pa med la/ dga' bas lus mtho bar gyur pa de'i ba spu'i sgo thams cad nas/ byang chub sems dpa'i rnam par thar pas rnam par 'phrul pa bsam gyis mi khyab pa rab tu 'gyed par byed cing 'dug pa mthong ngo/ /
rnam par thar pas rnam par 'phrul pa de'i mthus/ sems kyi skad cig re re la sems can thams cad yongs su smin par bya ba dang / de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi mchod pa sbyang ba dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing thams cad yongs su dag par bya ba dang / sems can thams cad kyi sdug bsngal gyi phung po rnam par bzlog pa dang / ngan song gi lam thams cad yongs su bcad pa dang / sems can thams cad kyi bde ba'i lam gyi sgo dbye ba dang / sems can thams cad kyi nyon mongs pa'i gdung ba rab tu zhi bar bya ba dang / sems can thams cad kyi mi shes pa'i sgrib pa rnam par gtor ba dang / sems can thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la dgod pa'i phyir/ rnam par 'phrul pa'i bye brag rnam pa sna tshogs mtha' yas pas chos kyi dbyings thams cad rgyas par 'gengs shing /

Then Sudhana, reflecting on the instruction of the eminent Muktaka, following Muktaka’s direction, remembering the inconceivable liberation of enlightening beings, remembering the inconceivable light of knowledge of enlightening beings, following the inconceivable entrance into the realm of reality, entering into the inconceivable principle of the communion of enlightening beings, observing the inconceivable transformation of those who realize Thusness, intent on the inconceivable communion of buddha-fields, clarifying the inconceivable manifestation of the magical power of buddhas, contemplating the magnificence of the inconceivable order of the concentrations and liberations of enlightening beings, following the steadfast determination to perform the inconceivable work of enlightening beings, conforming to the stream of undertaking of the inconceivable deeds of enlightening beings, gradually proceeded to Milaspharana on the tip of the continent, where he looked all over for the monk Saradhvaja.
He saw Saradhvaja by the side of a place for walking at a retreat, sitting in concentration, following his breath, not stirring, not thinking, his body straight, his mindfulness on the immediate present, by the inconceivable power of concentration producing to the left, right, and above an inconceivable infinite body in each successive mental moment manifesting an infinite variety of bodies. Sudhana saw an inconceivable miraculous display of the liberation of enlightening beings coming forth from every pore of the ecstatic body of Saradhvaja, who had attained such profound tranquility, silence, and objectlessness. With this miraculous display of the medium of liberation, Saradhvaja filled the cosmos moment to moment with endless varieties of mystic projections, to perfect all beings, to honor all buddhas, to purify all buddha-fields, to do away with the mass of suffering of all sentient beings, to cut off the courses of all bad conditions, to open the door to good conditions for all beings, to extinguish the burning of afflictions of all beings, to dissolve all beings’ obstructions to knowledge, and to introduce all beings into omniscience.

de'i rkang pa'i mthil gnyis nas/ tshong dpon gyi tshogs bkur sti dang / rim gro sna tshogs byed pa/ 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du gtogs pa'i tshong dpon dang 'dra ba'i gzugs dang ldan pa/ lhag pa'i yul la spyod pa/ rgyan sna tshogs kyis lus shin tu klubs pa/ thor tshugs dang / gtsug gi rin po che dang / cod pan sna tshogs thogs pa/ sangs rgyas kyi zhing grangs med pa'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed/ byis pa bye ba 'phyes pa'i 'khor dang ldan par 'byung ba mthong ngo/ / bram ze dang; khyim bdag mang po bza' btung rnam pa mang po dang / ro'i yan lag sna tshogs su sbyar ba thams cad dang / rgyan thams cad dang / gos thams cad dang / me tog thams cad dang / phreng ba thams cad dang / spos thams cad dang / byug pa thams cad dang / 'dod pa'i yo byad thams cad dang / rin po che thams cad dang / gnas thams cad dang; snod rnam pa sna tshogs thams cad dang / yo byad rnam pa sna tshogs thams cad kyis sems can dbul po rnams yongs su sdud cing / 'gro ba sdug bsngal ba rnams dbugs dbyung ba dang / sems can gyi sems tshim par bya ba dang / sems can gyi bsam pa rnam par dag par bya ba dang / sems can rnams byang chub tu yongs su smin par byed cing / phyogs bcu bkang ste 'dong ba mthong ngo/ /

Sudhana saw emanating from the soles of Saradhvaja’s feet masses of grandees as numerous as atoms in countless buddha-lands, their forms like those of the grandees in all worldly realms, wearing gorgeous clothing, variously adorned, wearing variously crested jewel crowns, surrounded by images of sons. He also saw priests and householders going throughout the ten directions caring for the poor with all kinds of food and drink, services, supplies, clothing, flowers, garlands, fragrances, ointments, acts of love, jewels, dwellings, vessels, and implements, restoring life to the miserable world, satisfying sentient beings, purifying sentient beings’ minds, developing sentient beings for enlightenment.

pus mo'i lha nga gnyis nas rgyal rigs mkhas pa'i gzugs dang / bram ze mkhas pa'i gzugs dang / 'jig rten na mkhas pa'i gzugs dang / bzo sna tshogs la mkhas pa'i gzugs dang / mi'i 'gro ba'i rgyud na mkhas pa'i gzugs dang / 'jig rten pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i las kyi tshul dang / rgyus la gsal zhing mkhas pa'i gzugs dang / 'jig rten gyi slob dpon du bya bar mkhas pa'i gzugs cha byad rnam pa du ma dang ldan pa/ dbyibs dang rgyan rnam pa du ma dang ldan pa/ yid du 'ong ba'i tshig mang po brjod pas yi mi bde ba'i sems can rab tu dga' bar byed cing / chos kyi nor gyis dbul ba'i sems can rnams la phan gdags pa dang / sdug bsngal ba'i sems can rnams bde bar bya ba dang / log par lhung ba'i sems can rnams mngon par gdon pa dang / theg pa'i gru la nyam nyes su gyur pa'i sems can rnams dbugs dbyung ba dang / 'jigs pa'i sems can rnams yongs su bskyab pa dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba'i sgra kun tu grag par bya ba dang / sdig pa las bzlog pa'i sgra yongs su bsgrags pa dang / dge ba'i chos yang dag par blangs pa la sems can gzud pa dang / don spyad pa la sems can dgod pa dang / dga' ba'i shugs yongs su bskyed pa dang / snyan par smra ba'i bsdu ba'i dngos po yongs su brjod pa dang / 'jig rten la don mthun par bsgrub pa ston par byed cing / phyogs bcu rgyas par bkang ste 'dong ba mthong ngo/ /

Sudhana saw forms of warrior sages, priestly sages, worldly sages, scholars versed in various crafts, humanistic scholars, scholars expert in knowledge of the sciences of mundane and transmundane activities, sages considered teachers of the world, emanate from the circles on Saradhvaja’s knees and go throughout the ten directions in many forms and guises, speaking pleasant words, cheering up dejected sentient beings, taking care of spiritually and materially poor beings, comforting beings in distress, uplifting the fallen, reviving the shipwrecked, rescuing the imperiled, causing the voice of goodness to be heard, preaching rejection of evil, exhorting beings to virtuous practices, directing beings to beneficial actions, producing joy, uttering kind words, and showing the world the nature of cooperation.

lte ba'i dkyil 'khor nas drang srong mang po 'gro ba thams cad kyi lus dbyibs su 'khod pa/ pags pa dang / shun pa'i gos gyon pa/ ril ba thogs pa; gzugs dang / cha byad dang / dbyibs sna tshogs can/ spyod lam rab tu zhi ba dag byung nas/ steng gi bar snang las sangs rgyas kyi yon tan rjod par byed cing / chos kyi sgra yongs su bsgrag pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi sgra brjod pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i dge 'dun yongs su bstan pa dang / tshangs pa'i spyod pa yongs su brjod pa dang / dbang po dben pa la sems can dgod pa dang / rang bzhin med pa'i don rab tu brtag pa dang / ye shes kyi don la 'jig rten rab tu dgod pa dang / 'jig rten gyi gtsug lag gi rnam pa yongs su brjod pa dang / thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes kyis 'byung ba'i lam gyi tshul rab tu bstan pa dang / mthar gyis bya ba'i las la sems can rab tu dgod pa byed cing / phyogs bcu bkang ste 'dong ba mthong ngo/ /

Sudhana saw various forms of wizards, as many as there are living beings, emanating from Saradhvaja’s navel and going throughout the ten directions, wearing leather, rags, and bark, carrying staffs and pitchers, their deportment extremely calm, up on the sky extolling the qualities of buddhas, causing the voice of the Teaching to be heard, speaking the voice of Buddhas, showing the community of enlightening beings, praising religious conduct, directing sentient beings to guard their senses, describing the meaning of the voidness of intrinsic essence, introducing sentient beings into the meaning of knowledge, teaching worldly science, showing the science of the Path to omniscience and emancipation, guiding beings in gradual practice.

rtsib logs gnyis nas klu'i bu mo 'jig rten rgyu ba thams cad kyi grangs dang mnyam pa/ lus kyi dbyibs bsam gyi mi khyab pa du ma dang ldan pa byung ste/ klu'i rnam par 'phrul pa bsam gyis mi khyab pa yongs su bstan pa dang / spos kyi sprin gyi rgyan bsam gyis mi khyab pa nam mkha'i dbyings la byin gyis brlab pa dang / me tog gi sprin gyi rgyan bsam gyis mi khyab pas nam mkha'i dbyings thams cad brgyan pa dang / phreng ba'i sprin bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i rgyan gyis nam mkha'i dbyings thams cad rnam par klubs pa dang / rin po che'i gdugs kyi sprin bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i rgyan gyis chos kyi dbyings thams cad yongs su khebs par bya ba dang / rin po che'i rgyal mtshan gyi sprin bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i rgyan dang / rin po che'i lha'i ba dan gyi sprin bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i rgyan dang / rin po che'i phyang phrul sna tshogs kyi sprin dang / char bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i rgyan dang / nor bu rin po che dam pa'i sprin gyi char 'bab pa bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i rgyan dang / rin po che'i se mo do sna tshogs dang / me tog gi sprin gyi char bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i rgyan dang / rin po che'i khri la skyil mo krung du 'khod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sangs rgyas kyi chos kyi sprin gyi char bsam gyis mi khyab pa 'bebs pa'i rgyan dang / lha rdzas kyi rin po che'i rgyan sna tshogs dang ldan pa'i lha'i bu mo mang po chos kyi glu snyan pa'i sgra dbyangs kyi sprin gyi char 'bebs pa bsam gyis mi khyab pa dang / rin po che'i pad+mo ze ba mtho ba/ mu tig gi dra bas brgyan pa/ rin po che'i rgyal po thams cad kyi 'bru'i sprin gyi char rnam par 'thor ba bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i rgyan dang / rin po che'i cod pan gyi sprin nor bu rin po che thams cad kyis rab tu brgyan pa/ 'od zer gyi sprin mtha' yas pa'i char 'bebs pa bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i rgyan dang / lha'i lus kyi sprin gyi me tog dang / phreng ba dang / gdugs dang / rgyal mtshan dang / lha'i ba dan bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i rgyan dang / lha'i bu mo mang po'i lus kyi sprin thal mo sbyar te/ gser gyi me tog snyim pas 'thor ba/ de bzhin gshegs pa la yon tan dang legs pa thams cad du bstod pa'i sprin gyi 'brug sgra 'byin cing char 'bebs pa bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i rgyan/ nam mkha'i dbyings la byin gyis rlob cing / spos kyi phung po'i sprin rin po che thams cad kyi kha dog tu 'dug pa dang / bdug spos kyi na bun dang / sprin shin tu rgya che bas de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor mngon par khebs par bya ba dang / 'jig rten gyi khams 'byams klas pa thams cad rab tu brgyan pa dang / sems can thams cad rab tu dga' bar bya ba dang / sangs rgyas thams cad mchod pas skad cig skad cig tu chos kyi dbyings thams cad rgyas par 'gengs pa tshong dpon gyi bu nor bzang gis mthong ngo/ /

Sudhana saw as many water spirit girls as all worldly events, in inconceivably many forms, emerging from Saradhvaja’s sides, pervading all universes moment to moment, showing the miracle of water spirits, adorning the sky with inconceivable fragrant clouds, adorning the whole sky with inconceivable clouds of flowers, arraying the whole realm of space with inconceivable adornments of clouds of garlands, covering all universes with inconceivable adornment of bejeweled parasols, adorning the sky with inconceivable clouds of jeweled banners, inconceivable clouds of jeweled pennants, rain from inconceivable endless clouds of great jewels, rain from inconceivable clouds of jewel necklaces and various flowers, inconceivable clouds of jewel seats with enlightening beings sitting on them teaching the ways of enlightenment, inconceivable clouds of troves of celestial jewels, rain of clouds of sounds of goddesses singing praises of the Teaching, inconceivable raining clouds of jewel lotuses adorned with nets of pearls crowned with diamonds, inconceivable clouds of jewel crowns and rain of clouds of endless lights adorned by all jewels, inconceivable clouds of celestial beings graced with flowers, garlands, parasols, and banners, inconceivable clouds of goddesses, adornments of rain produced by clouds of songs of praise of buddhas’ qualities sung by the goddesses on high standing with joined palms or scattering golden flowers, also covering all buddhas’ assemblies with clouds of heaps of fragrances the colors of all jewels and clouds of smoke of the finest incense, adorning all worlds, delighting all beings, honoring all buddhas.

mthongs ka'i dpal gyi be'u nas lha ma yin gyi dbang po sangs rgyas kyi zhing grangs med pa'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed byung ste/ lha ma yin gyi sgyus rnam par 'phrul pa bsam gyis mi khyab pa rab tu ston cing / chu 'dzin chen po yongs su bskyab pa dang / 'jig rten gyi khams brgya stong rab tu bskyod pa dang / ri'i rgyal po chen po thams cad 'thab par bya ba dang / lha'i gnas thams cad yongs su bskyod pa dang / bdud kyi dkyil 'khor thams cad zil gyis mnan pa dang / bdud kyi sde thams cad rab tu gdul ba dang / nga rgyal dang / rlom pa dang / dregs pa thams cad rab tu gzhom pa dang / gnod par sems pa'i sems bzlog cing dga' bar bya ba dang / mtho 'tsham pa'i sems phyir bzlog par bya ba dang / sems can rnams kyi mi dge ba'i chos rab tu zhi bar bya ba dang / nyon mongs pa'i ri rnam par gtor bar bya ba dang / nyon mongs pa'i 'thab mo shin tu zhi bar bya ba dang / lha ma yin gyi sgyus rnam par 'phrul pa dang / rnam par rtse ba sna tshogs kyis sems can rnams skyo bar bya ba dang / sdig pa las gyen du bskyod pa dang / 'khor pas 'jigs par bya ba dang / srid pa'i lam gyi rgyud thams cad nas gyen du bskyod de/ gnas med pa la rab tu gnas par bya ba dang / byang chub kyi sems la sems can rnams rab tu dgod pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa rnam par dag par bya ba dang / byang chub sems dpa' rnams pha rol tu phyin pa la rab tu dgod par bya ba dang / byang chub sems dpa'i sa la rab tu gzud pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi sangs rgyas kyi chos kyi tshul snang ba yongs su bskyed pa dang / chos kyi tshul rnam par dgod pa sna tshogs kyis sems kyi skad cig re re zhing chos kyi dbyings rgyas par 'gengs par byed pa/ tshong dpon gyi bu nor bzang gis mthong ngo/ /

Sudhana saw as many titan kings as atoms in countless buddha-fields emerging from the auspicious mark on Saradhvaja’s chest and pervading the cosmos moment to moment, displaying the inconceivable magic transformations of titans, agitating the oceans, causing hundreds of thousands of worlds to quake, causing all the highest mountains to crash together, shaking up all celestial abodes, eclipsing all hordes of demons, crushing all armies of demons, causing all people to destroy intoxication, conceit, and arrogance, restraining and purifying corrupt minds, restraining malicious minds, extinguishing being’s bad qualities, shattering the mountains of afflictions, quieting grasping for pleasure, frightening sentient beings by exercises of titanic magical powers and scaring them away from evil, making them wary of the mundane whirl, getting them to leave all states of conditioned existence and enter into nondwelling, leading sentient beings to the thought of enlightenment, getting them to purify the conduct of enlightening beings, establishing enlightening beings in the transcendent way, causing them to enter the stages of enlightening beings, causing them to produce enlightening beings’ light of the way to buddhahood, defining various principles and methods.

rgyab kyi gzhung nas nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas mang po sangs rgyas kyi zhing grangs med pa'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed byung nas/ nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyis 'dul ba'i sems can bdag tu mngon par zhen pa rnams la bdag med pa dang / sems can med pa yongs su rjod par byed cing / rtag par mngon par zhen pa rnams la 'du byed thams cad mi rtag par yongs su bstan pa dang / 'dod chags kyi spyod pa can rnams la mi sdug pa dang / zhe sdang gi spyod pa can rnams la byams pa dang / gti mug gi spyod pa can rnams la rkyen las 'byung ba'i rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba brjod pa dang / cha mnyam pa'i spyod pa can rnams la ye shes kyi yul dang ldan pa'i chos kyi tshul mngon par bstan pa dang / yul la mngon par dga' ba rnams la gnas med pa rab tu brjod pa dang / zhi ba la gnas su sems pa rnams la smon lam gyi khyad par gyis spro ba bskyed pa dang / phyogs kyi rgyud dang sgo thams cad du chos kyi tshul rgya mtsho'i rgyud dang sgo thams cad sems can thams cad kyi don du rjod par byed cing chos kyi dbyings rgyas par 'gengs pa/ tshong dpon gyi bu nor bzang gis mthong ngo/ /

Sudhana saw as many bodies of Buddhist disciples and individual illuminates as atoms in countless buddha-fields emerge from Saradhvaja’s spine and pervade the cosmos, telling sentient beings attached to self and suited to guidance by disciples or individual illuminates about selflessness and the voidness of the being, clarifying the impermanence of all conditioned states to those attached to eternity, telling the lustful about the contemplation of impurity, telling the hostile about love, telling the deluded about causality and interdependent origination, illumining principles connected with the sphere of knowledge to those who are equally lustful, hostile, and deluded, telling those attached to objects about nondwelling, causing those inclined to stick to tranquillity to like the superiority of undertaking vows, showing actions beneficial to beings, in all places, in the beginning of all turnings of the ocean of ways to truth.

phrag pa'i lhun gnyis las gnod sbyin dang / srin po'i dbang po'i dbyibs sna tshogs dang ldan zhing / lus mi sdug pa dang / kha dog dang chu zheng sna tshogs can/ spyod lam gyi rnam pa sna tshogs dang ldan pa/ bzhon pa sna tshogs la zhon pa/ 'khor sna tshogs kyis yongs su bskor ba sems can gyi khams yongs su bskyang ba la brtson pa/ 'od sna tshogs kyis snang bar bya ba la brtson pa/ dbyangs sna tshogs rab tu sgrog pa/ sangs rgyas kyi zhing grangs med pa'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed byung nas thabs mngon par bsgrub pa sna tshogs ma 'dres pas/ phyogs dang phyogs mtshams kun gyi nam mkha' rgyas par 'gengs shing / dge ba'i spyod pa thams cad yongs su bsrung ba dang / 'phags pa'i dkyil 'khor thams cad yongs su bsrung ba dang / byang chub sems dpa' thams cad yongs su gzung ba dang / lag na rdo rje'i las kyis yang dag par song ba dang / yang dag par zhugs pa thams cad yongs su bsrung ba dang / sangs rgyas thams cad la mchod pa dang / rim gro bya ba dang / sems can log par lhung ba rnams kyi ngan song gi lam gyi rgyud thams cad rnam par bzlog pa dang / 'jig rten thams cad kyi nad dang / gnod pa dang / 'jigs pa thams cad zhi bar bya ba'i don du brtson pa/ sems can gyi don bya bas 'jig rten yongs su bskyang ba la brtson pa rnams bsod nams dang ye shes kyi 'khor lo yongs su rdzogs par bya ba dang / chos kyi 'khor lo'i rjes su 'brang bar bya ba dang / phas kyi rgol ba'i 'khor tshar gcod par byed cing / chos kyi dbyings thams cad rgyas par 'gengs par byed pa/ tshong dpon gyi bu nor bzang gis mthong ngo/ /

Sudhana saw as many demigods and supernatural beings as atoms in countless buddha-fields emerging from Saradhvaja’s shoulders and pervading the cosmos, with various physical forms, colors, and sizes, in various attitudes, riding various vehicles, surrounded by various retinues, striving to protect sentient beings, showing various powers, uttering various sounds, going everywhere employing various different means to guard the good actions of all sentient beings, to guard all circles of sages, to assist all enlightening beings, to protect those who are rightly oriented, to attend and honor all buddhas with the work of thunderbolt bearers, to remove all fallen sentient beings from evil ways, striving to annihilate all worldly calamities and perils such as disease, anxious to preserve the light of actions beneficial to beings, filling the stores of knowledge and virtue, causing the wheel of the teaching to roll along, restraining controversy.

mdun gyi lto nas mi'am ci'i dbang po/ sangs rgyas kyi zhing grangs med pa'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed/ mi'am ci'i dbang po'i bu mo'i 'khor brgya stong grangs med pa can dang / dri za'i dbang po sangs rgyas kyi zhing grangs med pa'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed dri za'i dbang po'i bu mo'i 'khor brgya stong grangs med pa can dag byung nas lha'i rol mo brgya stong grangs med pa'i sgra snyan pa dang / glu'i dbyangs kyis chos kyi rang bzhin dang ldan pa'i sangs rgyas kyi bstod pa rjod pa byed cing / byang chub kyi sems yongs su bsngags pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa yongs su brjod pa dang / mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya ba'i sgo thams cad la mngon par bstod pa dang / chos kyi 'khor lo'i sgo thams cad du 'jug pa dang / rnam par 'phrul pa'i sgo thams cad la mngon par spro bar bya ba dang / yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba'i sgo thams cad yongs su brjod pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi bstan pa'i sgo thams cad yongs su gzung ba dang / sems can gyi sgo thams cad rab tu dga' bar bya ba dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing gi sgo thams cad yongs su dag par bya ba dang / chos kyi sgo thams cad mngon par bstan par bya ba dang / sgrib pa'i sgo thams cad rnam par bzlog par bya ba dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba'i sgo thams cad yongs su skyed pa byed cing chos kyi dbyings rgyas par 'gengs pa/ tshong dpon gyi bu nor bzang gis mthong ngo/ /

Sudhana saw as many centaur chiefs as atoms in countless buddha-fields surrounded by countless hundreds of thousands of centaur princesses, and as many celestial musician kings as atoms in countless buddha-fields surrounded by countless hundreds of thousands of celestial musician princesses emerge from Saradhvaja’s abdomen and pervade the cosmos, performing music and songs in praise of Buddha dealing with the essence of things, illumining the thought of enlightenment, describing the conduct of enlightening beings, eulogizing all ways to attainment of enlightenment, fostering understanding of all ways of presenting the Teaching, causing attraction to all ways of spiritual transformation, illumining all ways into ultimate release, publicizing all buddhas’ teachings, gladdening all beings, purifying all buddha-fields, illuminating all ways to truth, removing all obstructions, begetting all roots of goodness.

kha'i sgo nas 'khor los bsgyur ba'i rgyal po/ rin po che bdun dang ldan zhing / stobs kyi yan lag bzhi'i tshogs kyi 'khor dang ldan pa byung nas/ sbyin pa chen po'i 'od zer gyi rgyan rab tu 'gyed cing rin po che'i 'byung gnas thams cad yongs su gtang ba dang / nor bu rin po che'i tshogs thams cad spyin pa dang / dbul po rnams nor dang ldan par bya ba dang / srog gcod pa las 'jig rten rnam par bzlog pa dang / byams pa'i sems la sems can rab tu dgod pa dang / ma byin par len pa dang rab tu dbral ba dang / rgyan gyis shin tu brgyan pa'i bu mo bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong yongs su gtang ba dang / 'dod pas log par g.yem pa las rnam par bzlog pa dang / tshangs pa'i spyod pa la rab tu dgod pa dang / brdzun du smra ba las rnam par bzlog pa dang / bslu ba med pa la gzhol bar rab tu dgod pa dang / phra ma'i tshig las rnam par bzlog pa dang / gzhan 'dum par brtson pa'i tshig rab tu brjod pa dang / zhe gcod pa'i tshig las 'jig rten rnam par bzlog pa dang / 'jam zhing yid du 'ong ba'i tshig rab tu brjod pa dang / gnod pa'i chos dang ldan pa'i byung rgyal du smra ba las sems can rnam par bzlog pa dang / don zab mo'i tshig rab tu dbye ba gdon mi za ba las yang dag par dgod pa dang / ngag gi nyes pa thams cad las 'jig rten rnam par bzlog pa dang / snying rje dang ldan pa'i tshig rab tu brjod par bya ba dang / 'jig rten gyi snying gi dri ma yongs su sel cing / 'dod pa chung ba dang / chog shes pa la brtson par sems can rab tu dgod pa dang / chags sems las 'jig rten rnam par bzlog pa dang / gzhan gyi sems kyi rgyud dga' bar byed pa la rab tu dgod pa dang / lta ba'i dra ba thams cad las 'jig rten rab tu gdon pa dang / yid gnyis kyi ra ba thams cad rnam par gtor ba dang / the tshom gyi spo thams cad rab tu gzhom pa dang / nem nur dang som nyi'i rab rib yongs su bsal ba dang / chos rnam par dbye ba 'jig rten du rab tu dbye ba dang / rkyen las byung ba rab tu brjod pa dang / rang bzhin gyis bden pa'i tshul la sems can rab tu dgod pa dang / sgrib pa thams cad rnam par bzlog pa dang / sgrib pa med pa'i tshul la gzud pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi don gyi tshul sna tshogs brjod pa byed cing / phyogs bcu'i chos kyi dbyings rgyas par 'gengs pa tshong dpon gyi bu nor bzang gis mthong ngo/ /

Sudhana saw as many emperors as atoms in countless buddha-fields, each surrounded by seven treasures and four armies, emerge from Saradhvaja’s face, pervading the cosmos, radiating arrays of light beams of great relinquishment, spewing forth masses of all kinds of jewels, distributing multitudes of all kinds of jewels, enriching the poor, causing people to desist from killing, fostering kindness in sentient beings, causing them to give up stealing, giving them countless beautifully adorned maidens, causing them to give up sexual misconduct, establishing them in chastity, causing them to desist from lying, enjoining on them supreme honesty, causing them to desist from slander, causing them to speak words of ultimate kindness and consideration, causing them to desist from harsh words and speak pleasantly, causing people to desist from all meaningless statements, statements connected with what is not beneficial and what is not right, urging them to certainty of distinction of statements of profound meaning, causing people to desist from all evils of speech and speak compassionately, removing mental defilements from people, enjoining the excellent state of having few desires and being content, causing people to desist from malice and urging them to be peaceful in their relations with others, extracting people from the web of all views, causing them to break up all kinds of uncertainties, throwing off all masses of doubts, taking away the darkness of all confusion and hesitation, definitively analyzing the truth for people, telling them about causality and interdependent origination, directing them to the principle of the truth about inherent existence, dispelling all obstacles, leading into the way of nonobstruction, illuminating the meaning of enlightenment.

mig gnyis nas nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor brgya stong / sangs rgyas kyi zhing grangs med pa'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed byung ste sems can dmyal ba chen po thams cad yongs su snang bar byed cing / 'jig rten gyi mun pa chen po sel ba dang / sems can rnams kyi gti mug gi rab rib sel ba dang / grang ba'i sems can dmyal ba na 'khod pa'i sems can rnams kyi grang ba'i sdug bsngal rab tu zhi bar byed pa dang / sa'i rang bzhin gyi zhing rnams su 'od kha dog dkar bo can rab tu 'gyed pa dang / gser gyi rang bzhin gyi zhing rnams su 'od bai DUr+ya'i kha dog can rab tu 'gyed pa dang / bai DUr+ya'i rang bzhin gyi zhing rnams su 'od dngul gyi kha dog can rab tu 'gyed pa dang / dngul gyi rang bzhin gyi zhing rnams su 'od gser gyi kha dog can rab tu 'gyed pa dang / gser gyi rang bzhin gyi zhing rnams su 'od shel gyi kha dog can rab tu 'gyed pa dang / gser gyi rang bzhin gyi zhing rnams su 'od mu tig dmar po'i kha dog can rab tu 'gyed pa dang / asma gar b+ha'i rang bzhin gyi zhing rnams su 'od gser gyi kha dog can rab tu 'gyed pa dang / gser gyi rang bzhin gyi zhing rnams su 'od asma gar b+ha'i kha dog can rab tu 'gyed pa dang / in+d+ra nI la'i rang bzhin gyi zhing rnams su 'od rin po che'i rgyal po nyi ma'i snying po'i kha dog can rab tu 'gyed pa dang / rin po che'i rgyal po nyi ma'i snying po'i rang bzhin gyi zhing rnams su 'od rin po che'i in+d+ra nI la'i kha dog can rab tu 'gyed pa dang / mu tig dmar po'i rang bzhin gyi zhing rnams su 'od rin po che'i rgyal po zla ba'i 'od zer gyi dra ba dang / dkyil 'khor gyi snying po'i kha dog can rab tu 'gyed pa dang / rin po che'i rgyal po zla ba'i 'od zer gyi dra ba dang / dkyil 'khor gyi snying po'i rang bzhin gyi zhing rnams su 'od mu tig dmar po kha dog can rab tu 'gyed pa dang / rin po che gcig gi rang bzhin gyi zhing rnams su 'od rin po che sna tshogs kyi kha dog can rab tu 'gyed pa dang / rin po che sna tshogs kyi rang bzhin gyi zhing rnams su 'od rin po che gcig gi kha dog can rab tu 'gyed pa dang / de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa'i 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor thams cad du sems can gyi don tshad med pa la brtson zhing chos kyi dbyings rgyas par 'gengs pa tshong dpon gyi bu nor bzang gis mthong ngo/ /

Sudhana saw as many hundreds of thousands of suns as atoms in countless buddha-fields emanate from Saradhvaja’s eyes, lighting up all the great hells, dispersing the great darkness in the world, removing the darkness of sentient beings’ delusions, relieving the beings in the frigid hells from the pains of cold, shining clear light in lands made of lotus fibers, shining lapis-lazuli-colored light in gold lands, shining golden light in lands of lapis lazuli, shining golden light in silver worlds, shining crystal light in gold lands, shining golden light in crystal lands, shining coral light in gold lands, shining golden light in coral lands, shining golden light in ruby lands, shining ruby light in gold lands, shining golden light in emerald lands, shining emerald light in gold lands, shining light the color of sun-filled jewels in sapphire lands, shining sapphire light in lands made of sun-filled jewels, shining light the color of jewels containing networks of moonbeams in red pearl lands, shining light the color of red pearls in lands made of jewels containing networks of moonbeams, shining light the colors of various jewels in lands made of one jewel, shining light the color of one jewel in lands made of various jewels, thus involved in the infinite tasks of sentient beings, in the assemblies of all enlightening beings, pervading the universes of all beings.

smin mtshams kyi mdzod spu nas zla ba mang po sangs rgyas kyi zhing grangs med pa'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed byung nas/ lha'i dbang po thams cad zil gyis gnon cing / 'jig rten thams cad kyi 'dod pa'i dga' ba rnam par bzlog pa dang / sangs rgyas blta bar dga' ba la rjes su bsngags par byed cing / sems can tshad med pa gdul ba la brtson par phyogs bcu'i chos kyi dbyings rgyas par 'gengs pa mthong ngo/ /

From the circle of hair between Saradhvaja’s eyebrows Sudhana saw as many moons as atoms in countless buddha-fields emerge, outshining all the celestial chiefs, turning all worldlings away from lust to enjoyment of the vision of Buddha, pervading the cosmos engaged in the guidance of infinite beings.

dpral ba nas tshangs pa chen po spyod lam rab tu zhi ba/ sangs rgyas kyi zhing grangs med pa'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed byung nas tshangs pa'i dbyangs su brjod de sangs rgyas thams cad la gsol ba gdab pa dang; byang chub sems dpa' thams cad rab tu dga' bar bya ba byed cing sems can gyi don tshad med pa la brtson par phyogs bcu'i chos kyi dbyings rgyas par 'gengs pa tshong dpon gyi bu nor bzang gis mthong ngo/ /

From Saradhvaja’s forehead Sudhana saw as many great Brahmas as atoms in countless buddha-fields emerge, their deportment extremely tranquil, murmuring prayers, asking all buddhas for instruction, praising all buddhas, gladdening all enlightening beings, pervading all universes in the ten directions, involved in the infinite tasks of sentient beings.

mgo nas byang chub sems dpa' sangs rgyas kyi zhing grangs med pa'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed byung nas/ kha dog dang dbyings sna tshogs kyis brgyan pa'i lus yongs su ston cing / dpe byad bzang pos rnam par bris pa'i lus rab tu bstan pa dang / 'od kyi dkyil 'khor gyi sprin mtha' dang dbus med pa rab tu dgye ba dang / ba spu'i bu ga thams cad nas sangs rgyas thams cad kyi sngon gyi byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa nas bzung ste/ gtong ba dang / len pa dang / dngos po yongs su gtong ba'i rnam pa'i sprin mang po rab tu dgye ba dang / pha rol tu phyin pa sna tshogs dang ldan pa'i sngon gyi spyor ba rgya mtsho yongs su bstan pa dang / sbyin pa'i spyod pa 'jig rten du yongs su brjod pa dang / ser sna'i dri ma rnam par bzlog pa dang / chags pa thams cad spang ba la sems can rab tu dgod pa dang / 'jig rten rin po che sna tshogs thams cad kyi rgyan gyis brgyan par byin gyis brlab pa dang / sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la sems can rab tu dgod pa dang / mtshan thams cad kyi yon tan yang dag par brjod pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi mtshan 'byung ba'i rgyu ston pa byed pa mthong ngo/ /

From Saradhvaja’s head Sudhana saw emerge as many enlightening beings as atoms in countless buddha-fields, manifesting bodies of various appearances, forms, adornments, and embellishments, emanating infinite spheres of light, taking up the past enlightening practices of all buddhas and projecting from every pore multitudes of forms practicing charity without attachment to giver, receiver, or gift, showing oceans of past efforts involved in the various ways of transcendence, commending the act of giving to the world, getting rid of the filth of envy, directing beings to give up all grasping, causing the world to appear adorned with all kinds of jewels, establishing sentient beings in the practice of transcendent giving and in command over material things, praising all virtues, and teaching the cause of the characteristics of buddhas.

yang byang chub sems dpa' sangs rgyas kyi zhing grangs med pa'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed byung nas/ tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su brjod cing / ba spu'i bu ga thams cad nas sangs rgyas thams cad kyi tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang ldan pa'i sngon gyi sbyor ba rgya mtsho yongs su bstan pa dang / sems can thams cad lam gyi rgyud dang yul las phyir phyogs par byas te/ de bzhin gshegs pa'i yul la mngon du phyogs par bya ba dang / 'jig rten gyi 'dod pa la rnam par smad pa dang / 'jig rten gyi phyin ci log gi ling tog rnam par bsal ba dang / log pa'i rnam par rtog pa rab tu zhi bar byas nas/ byang chub sems dpa'i tshul khrims la yang dag par dgod pa dang / snying rje chen po'i tshul khrims yongs su brjod cing / de bzhin gshegs pa'i tshul khrims rab tu thob par bya ba'i phyir/ sangs rgyas kyi lam nan tan du bya ba'i tshul khrims la sems can rab tu dgod pa dang / srid pa'i lam gyi rgyud rmi lam lta bur sems can rnams la rab tu brjod cing; rmi lam gyi tshul dang mnyam par yongs su gzhol bar bya ba'i phyir/ yul yongs su 'dzin pa dang / nyon mongs pa la dbang bsgyur ba sems can rnams rab tu dgod pa byed pa mthong ngo/ /

He also saw as many enlightening beings as atoms in countless buddha-fields emerge praising transcendent morality, manifesting from every pore oceans of past efforts of all buddhas involved in transcendent morality, turning all beings away from the spheres of all mundane states and turning them toward the sphere of the enlightened, disdaining the world of desire, dispersing the veil of error from the world, stopping untrue thoughts and enjoining the way of life of enlightening beings, commending the ethic of great compassion and leading beings into the conduct of the practice of the path of buddhas to attain the conduct of the enlightened, showing sentient beings that the state of existence is like a dream and guiding them into power over afflictions caused by grasping sense objects so that they may fully enter into the way of acting as in a dream.

yang byang chub sems dpa' sangs rgyas kyi zhing grangs med pa'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed byung nas/ 'jig rten rnams la mdog gser gyi kha dog lta bur mngon par ston cing; khro ba med pa dang / 'khrug pa med pa dang / shar gnyer ba med pa dang / zhe sdang ba med pa dang / chud gson pa med pa dang / khong khro ba med pa'i sems la sems can rab tu dgod pa dang / byol song gi skye gnas kyi lam gyi rgyud thams cad yongs su gcad pa'i phyir/ ba spu'i sgo thams cad nas bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang ldan pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa'i sngon gyi sbyor ba'i srid rab tu 'gyed cing / bzod pa'i stobs la sems can rab tu dgod pa dang / chos la dbang bsgyur ba la sems can rab tu snang bar byed pa mthong ngo/ /

He also saw as many enlightening beings as atoms in countless buddha-fields emerge, lighting up the world with golden light, guiding beings to a state of mind without hatred or malice, free from all corruption and defect, emanating from every pore multitudes of past efforts of buddhas involved in transcendent tolerance in order to cut off all brutal tendencies, leading sentient beings into the power of tolerance, showing sentient beings mastery over phenomena.

yang byang chub sems dpa' sangs rgyas kyi zhing grangs med pa'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed byung ste/ byang chub sems dpa'i brtson 'grus kyi stobs mtha' yas pa shin tu ston cing / thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du brtsams pa las phyir mi ldog pa'i stobs kyis thos pa rgya mtsho yongs su btsal bas mi skyo bar bya bar yongs su brjod pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad mchod cing rim gro bya ba la sems can rab tu gzud pa/ sdug bsngal gyi phung po thams cad rnam par bzlog pa'i brtson 'grus chen po la sems can rab tu dgod pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang ldan pa'i sngon gyi sbyor ba mang po'i sprin lus thams cad las rab tu 'gyed cing / byang chub sems dpa'i brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i spyod pa yongs su bstan pa dang / sems can rnams kyi le lo'i ri rnam par gtor ba dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la sems can rab tu dgod pa dang / las la dbang bsgyur ba la 'jig rten rab tu gzud pa dang / rgyun ma 'chad par brtson par byed pa mthong ngo/ /

He also saw as many enlightening beings as atoms in countless buddha-fields emerge, engaged in miraculous displays showing the endless power of energy of enlightening beings, commending tireless quest for the ocean of learning by the power of nonregression in progress toward omniscience, guiding beings to honor and attend all buddhas, leading beings to arouse great energy to get rid of the mass of all suffering, emanating from all their bodies multitudes of past efforts involved in enlightening beings’ perfection of transcendent energy, shattering sentient beings’ mountains of sloth, leading sentient beings into transcendent energy, guiding sentient beings to mastery over action.

yang byang chub sems dpa' sangs rgyas kyi zhing grangs med pa'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed byung nas byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi rjes su dran pa'i lam la sems can thams cad rab tu dgod cing / sgrib pa dang / bar du gcod pa dang / rab rib thams cad rnam par bsal ba dang / rlom pa dang bag med pa thams cad las sems can rnam par bzlog pa dang / bag yod pa'i chos la rab tu dgod pa dang / khengs pa 'gying ba dang / nga rgyal gyi rgyal mtshan rab tu snyol ba dang / sangs rgyas kyi bsam gtan gyi yan lag rgya mtsho brjod pa dang / 'jig rten rnams la bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su bsngags pa dang / ba spu'i bu ga thams cad nas bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang ldan pa'i sngon gyi tshul mang po'i sprin rab tu dgye ba dang / sems can la dbang bsgyur ba la sems can rab tu dgod pa byed cing / skad cig re re la chos kyi dbyings rgyas par 'gengs pa mthong ngo/ /

He also saw as many enlightening beings as atoms in countless buddha-fields emerge guiding sentient beings into the path of mindfulness, dissolving the darkness of all obstructions, causing sentient beings to desist from all intoxication and leading them into sobriety, taking down the flags of pretentiousness, arrogance, and pride, telling of the ocean of branches of meditation of buddhas, describing transcendent meditation to people, emanating from every pore multitudes of past efforts involved in perfection of transcendent meditation, guiding sentient beings to mastery of mind, pervading the cosmos moment to moment.

yang byang chub sems dpa' sangs rgyas kyi zhing grangs med pa'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed byung ste/ ba spu'i bu ga thams cad nas sangs rgyas kyi chos yongs su tshol ba dang ldan pa'i sngon gyi sbyor ba mang po'i sprin rab tu dgye ba dang / dbyangs kyi yan lag rgya mtsho'i skad thams cad kyis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i sprin gyi 'brug sgra sgrog pa dang / yang dag par lta ba'i glog rab tu 'gyed pa dang / chos kyi rang bzhin gyi sgra dbyangs rab tu bsgrag pa dang / sems can rnams kyi bdag tu lta ba'i ri'i lhun rab tu gzhig pa dang / lta ba thams cad kyi zug rngu dbyung ba dang / the tshom dang yid gnyis dang nem nur gyi rab rib rnam par bsal ba dang / ye shes kyi dbang yang dag par bsngags pa byed cing sems kyi skad cig re re la chos kyi dbyings rgyas par 'gengs pa mthong ngo/ /

He also saw as many enlightening beings as atoms in countless buddha-fields emerge and pervade the cosmos in every moment of thought emanating from every pore multitudes of past efforts involved in the search of buddhahood, uttering multitudes of perfections of transcendent wisdom by oceans of words, emanating the lightning of right insight, expressing the inherent nature of phenomena, shattering the mountainous masses of sentient beings’ notion of self, extracting all arrows of views, dispersing the darkness of desire, heedlessness, and doubt, commending control of inclination.

yang byang chub sems dpa' sangs rgyas kyi zhing grangs med pa'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed byung nas/ sangs rgyas thams cad kyi thabs mkhas pa'i tshul gyi dkyil 'khor rab tu rjod par byed cing / ba spu'i bu ga thams cad nas thabs mkhas pa dang ldan pa'i sngon gyi sbyor ba mang po'i sprin rab tu dgye ba dang / 'jig rten rnams la thabs mkhas pa'i spyod pa rab tu brjod pa dang / theg pa chen po'i 'byung ba mngon par bstan pa dang / sangs rgyas thams cad kyi dkyil 'khor yang dag par bsngags pa dang / 'khor ba dang / mya ngan las 'das pa tha mi dad pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa yongs su bstan pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi thabs mkhas pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la sems can rab tu dgod pa dang / 'jig rten rnams la byang chub sems dpa'i dbang gi dkyil 'khor rab tu bstan pa byed cing / sems bskyed pa re re la chos kyi dbyings rgyas par 'gengs pa mthong ngo/

He also saw as many enlightening beings as atoms in countless buddha-fields emerge and pervade the cosmos in a mental impulse, showing the sphere of methods of all buddhas’ skill in liberative means, emanating from every pore multitudes of past efforts involved in skill in means, spreading the practice of skill in means in the world, illuminating the way of universal emancipation, describing the sphere of all buddhas, describing and showing the practice of enlightening beings which unites the mundane and the transcendental, guiding sentient beings to enlightening beings’ perfection of skill in means, demonstrating in the world all enlightening beings’ mastery of regeneration.

yang byang chub sems dpa' sangs rgyas kyi zhing grangs med pa'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed byung ste/ ba spu'i bu ga thams cad nas de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi mtshan rgya mtsho'i sprin gyi 'brug sgra sgrog cing / ba spu'i bu ga thams cad nas byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyi smon lam gyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su dag pa dang ldan pa'i sngon gyi sbyor ba mang po'i sprin rab tu dgye ba dang / smon lam gyi pha rol tu phyin pa yang dag par bsngags pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i dbang thams cad la sems can rab tu dgod pa dang / smon lam chen po'i shing rta'i 'khor lo phyi ma'i mtha'i mur thug par 'dril ba/ chos thams cad kyi rjes su 'brang ba/ nyon mongs pa thams cad rnam par bzlog pa/ mi shes pa'i ri rnam par 'thor ba 'jig rten du rab tu rjod pa byed cing smon lam sna tshogs kyi rnam par 'phrul bas/ sems kyi skad cig re re la chos kyi dbyings rgyas par 'gengs pa mthong ngo/ /

He also saw as many enlightening beings as atoms in countless buddha-fields emerge and pervade the cosmos in each moment of thought by various projections of will, emanating from every pore multitudes of oceans of names of all buddhas, radiating from every pore multitudes of past efforts involved in purification of transcendent vows of all enlightening beings, commending transcendent commitment, guiding sentient beings into the masteries of all enlightening beings, powering through the world the eternally rolling chariot wheel of great vows which follows all truths and gets rid of all afflictions and shatters the mountains of nescience.

yang byang chub sems dpa'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing grangs med pa'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed byung ste/ byang chub sems dpa'i stobs rab tu snang bar bya ba dang / byang chub sems dpa'i stobs yongs su bsgrub pa'i sgra rab tu dbyung ba dang / ba spu bu ga thams cad nas stobs kyi pha rol tu phyin pa sgrub cing 'byin pa'i sngon gyi sbyor ba mang po'i sprin rab tu dgye ba dang / bdud dang phas kyi rgol ba thams cad kyis mi thub pa'i stobs yongs stobs yongs su bstan pa dang / khor yug dang rdo rje'i ri thams cad lus kyi steng du rdib kyang mi nyams pa'i stobs rab tu brjod pa dang / bskal pas 'tshig pa thams cad kyi me rgya mtsho'i nang na gnas kyang lus la gnod pa med pa'i stobs yongs su bstan pa dang / 'jig rten gyi khams 'byams klas pa thams cad lag pa'i mthil gyis nam mkha'i dbyings su ston pa'i stobs yongs su ston pa byed cing / sems kyi skad cig re re la chos kyi dbyings 'gengs pa rgyun mi gcod pa mthong ngo/ /

He also saw as many enlightening beings as atoms in countless buddha-fields emerge and ceaselessly fill the cosmos in each moment of thought, manifesting the power of enlightening beings’ consummation of power, emanating from every pore multitudes of past efforts producing the consummation of transcendental power, showing power which cannot be overcome by any demons or challengers, nurturing such power that all the adamantine mountains surrounding the earth would shatter upon contact with their bodies, showing power such that their bodies do not even blaze up in the ocean of fire that burns the universe at the end of each eon, showing the power to hold all worlds in their hands while hovering in space, guiding beings to control of magical powers.
