yang byang chub sems dpa' sangs rgyas kyi zhing brjod du med pa'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed byung nas sems can rnams la ye shes kyi dkyil 'khor ston cing / ba spu'i bu ga thams cad nas ye shes kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su dag pa dang ldan pa'i sngon gyi sbyor ba mang po'i sprin rab tu 'gyed pa dang / 'jig rten rnams la sangs rgyas thams cad kyi yon tan dang ye shes mngon par shes pa dang ldan pa'i ye shes kyi sa rab tu brjod pa dang / sangs rgyas thams cad kyi mtshan mngon par shes pa dang ldan pa'i ye shes kyis mngon par bstan pa dang / smon lam thams cad mngon par bsgrub pa'i ye shes mngon par shes pa dang ldan pa'i ye shes kyis yongs su brjod pa dang / sems can thams cad yongs su bsdu ba'i smon lam mngon par bsgrub pa'i ye shes mngon par shes pa dang ldan pa'i ye shes kyis shin tu yangs par bya ba dang / sems can thams cad bdag med pa'i rang bzhin la gzud pa mngon par shes pa dang ldan pa'i ye shes kyis rnam par bstan pa dang / sems can thams cad kyi sems rgya mtsho rnam par blta ba mngon par shes pa dang ldan pa'i ye shes kyis rab tu brjod pa dang / sems can thams cad kyi dbang po rnam par dbye ba'i ye shes mngon par shes pa dang ldan pa'i ye shes kyi sa rab tu dbye ba dang / sems can thams cad kyi bsam pa dang / mos pa rnam par blta ba'i ye shes mngon par shes pa dang ldan pa'i ye shes kyis yang dag par brjod pa dang; sems can thams cad kyi las rgya mtsho la 'jug pa'i ye shes mngon par shes pa dang ldan pa'i ye shes kyi sa rnam par dgrol ba dang / sems can thams cad kyi smon lam rgya mtsho la 'jug pa'i ye shes mngon par shes pa dang ldan pa'i ye shes kyi sa yongs su ston pa byed cing sems kyi skad cig re re la chos kyi dbyings rgyas par 'gengs pa tshong dpon gyi bu nor bzang gis mthong ngo/ /

He also saw as many enlightening beings as atoms in countless buddha-fields emerge and fill the cosmos in every thought illuminating the sphere of knowledge of sentient beings, emanating from every pore multitudes of past efforts involved in purification of consummate knowledge, manifesting in the world the stage of knowledge characterized by mystic knowledge of all buddhas’ virtues and knowledges, showing the stage of knowledge characterized by mystic knowledge of all buddhas’ perceptions, illuminating the stage of knowledge characterized by mystic knowledge of the undertaking of all vows, revealing the stage of knowledge characterized by mystic knowledge of the undertaking of the vow to save all sentient beings, revealing the stage of knowledge characterized by mystic knowledge penetrating the lack of self or independent existence in all beings, illumining the stage of knowledge characterized by mystic knowledge observing the ocean of minds of all sentient beings, analyzing the stage of knowledge characterized by mystic knowledge discerning the faculties of all sentient beings, describing the stage of knowledge characterized by mystic knowledge observing the inclinations and interests of all sentient beings, disclosing the stage of knowledge characterized by mystic knowledge comprehending the ocean of actions of all beings, showing the stage of knowledge characterized by mystic knowledge penetrating the ocean of commitments of all sentient beings, guiding sentient beings into the perfection of knowledge.

spyi bo'i gtsug tor gyi gseb nas/ de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku sangs rgyas kyi zhing grangs med pa'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed mtshan dam pa dang / dpe byad bzang po rnam par dag pas brgyan pa/ 'dzam bu chu klung gi gser gyi ri bo shin tu 'bar ba ltar snang ba/ 'od kyi dkyil 'khor phyogs bcur spa zhing tshad med par 'bar ba dang / chos kyi dbyings tshul gyis rgyas par 'gengs pa'i dbyangs mnga' ba/ sangs rgyas kyi rnam par 'phrul pa mtha' dang dbus med pa yongs su ston pa 'gro ba thams cad la tha mi dad par chos kyi sprin gyi char mngon par 'bebs pa ste/ 'di ltar snying po byang chub mchog tu phyin pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams la chos kyi dbyings kyi gzhi'i bye brag mngon sum du shes pa'i sprin ces bya ba'i chos kyi sprin gyi char mngon par dbab pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' dbang bskur ba thob pa rnams la gzhi kun tu rten pa'i sprin ces bya ba'i chos kyi sprin gyi char mngon par dbab pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' chos chen po'i rgyal tshab tu dbang bskur ba rnams la sgo kun nas 'jug pa zhes bya ba'i chos kyi sprin gyi char mngon par dbab pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' gzhon nur gyur pa rnams la kun nas brgyan pa zhes bya ba'i chos kyi char mngon par dbab pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' phyir mi ldog pa rnams la snying rje chen po'i tshogs shin tu brtan pa zhes bya ba'i chos kyi sprin gyi char mngon par dbab pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' lhag pa'i bsam bdag pa rnams la chos thams cad kyi rang bzhin gyi bye brag shes pa'i rdo rje zhes bya ba'i chos kyi sprin gyi char mngon par dbab pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' sngon gyi sbyor ba dang ldan pa rnams la 'gro ba yongs su sdud pas kun nas brgyan pa zhes bya ba'i chos kyi sprin gyi char mngon par dbab pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' cher skyes pa rnams la dus gsum gyi de bzhin gshegs pa'i dkyil 'khor mngon sum du dmigs pa'i sprin ces bya ba'i chos kyi sprin gyi char mngon par dbab pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' rnal 'byor la spyod pa rnams la chos thams cad kyi rang bzhin dang / gzhi rab tu sgrog pa zhes bya ba'i chos kyi sprin gyi char mngon par dbab pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' las dang po pa rnams la snying rje chen po'i tshul dang / thabs kyi snying po'i sprin kun tu 'byung ba zhes bya ba'i chos kyi sprin gyi char mngon par dbab pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' sems dang po bskyed pa rnams la dga' bar bya ba'i mdzod shin tu bsags pa'i snying po zhes bya ba'i chos kyi sprin gyi char mngon par dbab pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' yangs pa la mos pa rnams la rnam par thar pa la rnam par thar pa mi zad pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i smon lam gyis dga' bar byed pa'i mdzod ces bya ba'i chos kyi sprin gyi char mngon par dbab pa dang / gzugs la spyod pa'i sems can rnams la gzhi kun tu mi zad pa'i mdzod ces bya ba'i chos kyi sprin gyi char mngon par dbab pa dang / tshangs pa'i ris kyi lha rnams la tshul rgya mtsho tshad med pa'i 'brug sgra'i dbyangs zhes bya ba'i chos kyi sprin gyi char mngon par dbab pa dang / dbang sgyur gyi lha rnams la stobs 'byung ba'i chos kyi yo byad mi zad pa'i mdzod ces bya ba'i chos kyi sprin gyi char mngon par dbab pa dang / bdud kyi ris kyi lha rnams la thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi tshogs rgyal mtshan sna tshogs can yang dag par bsgrub pa'i dbyangs zhes bya ba'i chos kyi sprin gyi char mngon par dbab pa dang / 'phrul dga'i lha rnams la ye shes rin po che sna tshogs la brtson pa zhes bya ba'i chos kyi sprin gyi char mngon par dbab pa dang / dga' ldan gyi lha rnams la byang chub sems dpa'i smon lam rin po che sna tshogs kyi rgyal mtshan zhes bya ba'i chos kyi sprin gyi char mngon par dbab pa dang / mtshe ma'i lha rnams la de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad rjes su dran pa'i mdzod ces bya ba'i chos kyi sprin gyi char mngon par dbab pa dang / lha'i dbang po brgya byin gyi gnas su de bzhin gshegs pa mthong bas dga' ba'i shugs 'byung ba zhes bya ba'i chos kyi sprin gyi char mngon par dbab pa dang / gnod sbyin gyi dbang po'i gnas su chos kyi dbyings kyi nam mkha' la de bzhin gshegs pa'i gnas rnam par 'phrul pas rgyas par 'gengs pa zhes bya ba'i chos kyi sprin gyi char mngon par dbab pa dang / dri za'i dbang po'i gnas su de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi chos yang dag par bgro ba zhes bya ba'i chos kyi sprin gyi char mngon par dbab pa dang / lha ma yin gyi gnas su ye shes kyi tshul rdo rje'i dkyil 'khor ces bya ba'i chos kyi sprin gyi char mngon par dbab pa dang / nam mkha' lding gi dbang po'i gnas su de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad 'byung ba'i thabs kyi sprin ces bya ba'i chos kyi sprin gyi char mngon par dbab pa dang / mi'am ci'i dbang po'i gnas su chos kyi sprin yang dag par 'gro ba thams cad kyi dbyangs zhes bya ba'i chos kyi sprin gyi char mngon par dbab pa dang / klu'i dbang po'i gnas su byang chub sems dpa'i rnam par 'phrul ba sgrog cing srid pa'i lam gyi rgyud las skyo ba skyed pa zhes bya ba'i chos kyi sprin gyi char mngon par dbab pa dang / lto 'phye chen po'i dbang po'i gnas su dga' ba rgya mtsho rnam par 'phel bar byed pa'i shugs zhes bya ba'i chos kyi sprin gyi char mngon par dbab pa dang / mi'i gnas su 'gro ba thams cad las khyad par du 'phags pa'i ye shes rnam par 'byed pa zhes bya ba'i chos kyi sprin gyi char mngon par dbab pa dang / sems can dmyal ba'i 'jig rten du 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal thams cad rab tu zhi ba'i dbyangs dang / 'phags pa'i lam gyi tshig gi rgyud kyis brgyan pa zhes bya ba'i chos kyi sprin gyi char mngon par dbab pa dang / byol song gi skye gnas su las kyi lam kha na ma tho ba med pa la nan tan du bya ba'i dbyangs dang / de bzhin gshegs pa rjes su dran pa'i sprin gyi dkyil 'khor gyi lhun ces bya ba'i chos kyi sprin gyi char mngon par dbab pa dang / gshin rje'i 'jig rten du de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgrags pas/ sems can thams cad kyi gtong ba'i sems 'byung ba zhes bya ba'i chos kyi sprin gyi char mngon par dbab pa dang / sems can log par lhung ba rnams la sdug bsngal thams cad zhi ba rab tu 'thob pas dbugs dbyung ba'i dbyangs kyi nga ro zhes bya ba'i chos kyi sprin gyi char mngon par dbab pa mdzad cing / chos kyi dbyings rgyas par 'gengs pa tshong dpon gyi bu nor bzang gis mthong ngo/ /

From Saradhvaja’s topknot of flesh Sudhana saw emerge as many embodiments of buddhas as atoms in countless buddha-fields, adorned with the finest characteristics and embellishments, appearing like mountains of gold, with immeasurable auras of blazing light illumining everything in the ten directions and voices pervading the cosmos, suffusing all universes, showing endless miraculous transformations of Buddha, showering rain from clouds of teaching on all without discrimination—showering rain from a cloud of teaching called knowledge confronting the distinction of all planes of the cosmos on enlightening beings on the verge of enlightenment, showering rain from a cloud of teaching called the ground of universality on coronated enlightening beings, showering rain from a cloud of teaching called entry into the ground of universality on enlightening beings ordained as princes of the great teaching, showering rain from a cloud of teaching called universal arrangement on enlightening beings of youthful nature, showering rain from a cloud of teaching called steadfast head of great compassion on nonregressing enlightening beings, showering rain from a cloud of teaching called diamond of knowledge distinguishing the intrinsic essence of all phenomena on enlightening beings of purified intent, showering rain from a cloud of teaching called arrangement taking in all beings on enlightening beings accomplished in preparatory practices, showering rain from a cloud of teaching called cloud of communication with the assemblies of all buddhas of past, present, and future on regenerated enlightening beings, showering rain from a cloud of teaching called voice of the ground of intrinsic essence of all phenomena on enlightening beings engaged in concerted practice, showering rain from a cloud of teaching called source of clouds containing the ways and means of great compassion on enlightening beings engaged in primary practices, showering rain from a cloud of teaching called store of kindness on enlightening beings newly determined to see enlightenment, showering rain from a cloud of teaching called inexhaustible treasury of kindness of the buddhas’ commitment to liberation on enlightening beings of great zeal, showering rain from a cloud of teaching called inexhaustible treasury of the universal ground on beings in the world of form, showering rain from a cloud of teaching called sound produced by the measureless ocean of principles on Brahma body deities, showering rain from a cloud of teaching called inexhaustible treasury of power producing spiritual methods on controlling deities, showering rain from a cloud of teaching called sound cleaning variously represented provisions for omniscience on demon-body deities, showering rain from a cloud of teaching called varied cargo of jewels of knowledge on the deities who enjoy emanations, showering rain from a cloud called varied representation of the vows of enlightening beings on deities in the heavens of happiness, showering rain from a cloud of teaching called treasury of recollection of all buddhas on deities in the heavens of timely portion, showering rain from a cloud of teaching called source of the rapture of the vision of Buddha on the abodes of the chief deities, showering rain from a cloud of teaching called multitude of transformations of Buddha pervading the space of the cosmos on the abodes of the chief demigods, showering rain from a cloud of teaching called sound of eulogies of the qualities of all enlightened ones on the abodes of the chief celestial musicians, showering rain from a cloud of teaching called indestructible sphere of ways to knowledge on the abodes of the chief titans, showering rain from a cloud of teaching called multitude of means of development of all enlightened ones on the abodes of the chief birds, showering rain from a cloud of teaching called source of the magical utterances of enlightening beings traveling swiftly through the states of existence on the abodes of the chief dragons, showering rain from a cloud of teaching called speed of increase of the ocean of joy on the abodes of the chief serpents, showering rain from a cloud of teaching called sphere of the highest knowledge of all beings on the realms of humans, showering rain from a cloud of teaching called ornament bearing the words of the holy path bespeaking the extinction of all the pains of mundane existence on the hells, showering rain from a cloud of teaching called round body of clouds of remembrance of buddhas bespeaking the practice of impeccable action on the realms of animals, showering rain from a cloud of teaching called declaration of the transcendence of all buddhas producing a mind of nonattachment in all sentient beings on the ghost realms, showering rain from a cloud of teaching called comforting sound effecting the cessation of all pains on beings in distress.

ba spu'i bu ga thams cad las ba spu'i sgo re re nas kyang 'od zer gyi dra ba dang / dkyil 'khor gyi kha dog dang / gzugs kyi glong dang rgyan grangs med pa can/ dgos pa sna tshogs grangs med pa la sta gon du gnas pa/ sangs rgyas kyi zhing grangs med pa'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed byung nas phyogs bcu'i chos kyi dbyings rgyas par 'gengs pa mthong ste/ 'di ltar ba spu'i sgo'i 'od zer gyi dra ba dang / dkyil 'khor la la las ni/ sbyin pa'i spyod pa skyon med pas bdog pa thams cad yongs su gtong bar rnam par 'phrul ba mthong ngo/ /
ba spu'i sgo'i dra ba dang / dkyil 'khor la la las ni/ dus gsum gyi byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyi tshul khrims dang / brtul zhugs dang / yid dam dang / tshul gyi dkyil 'khor du rnam par 'phrul pa mthong ngo; ;
ba spu'i sgo'i 'od zer gyi dra ba dang / dkyil 'khor la la las ni/ byang chub sems dpa' thams cad bzod pa'i spyod pa'i rnam pa dus gsum du byung ba'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams rkang lag dang / yan lag gi dam pa gcad kyang / nyams su bzod pa byed pa'i rnam par 'phrul ba dang / khu tshur dang dbyig pas bsnun te/ mtshon gyis lus la btab kyang; nyams su bzod par byed pa'i rnam par 'phrul pa dang / lus thams cad gshegs sam snying dang mig phyung yang / nyams su bzod pa byed pa'i rnam par 'phrul pa mthong ngo; ;
byang chub sems dpa' dus gsum du byung ba/ rnam par brtags pa'i lus dang ldan pa gzhan dag gis thams cad mkhyen pa'i chos nyid yongs su btsal ba'i ched du lus dang sems la gnod pa thams cad dang / yan lag dang / nying lag gcad pa thams cad kyang snying rje chen pos dbang du byas pa'i phyir nyams su bzod par byas pa dang / bag la zha bar byas pa dang / gtang snyoms su bzhag pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i bzod pa'i spyod pa rnam par 'phrul ba'i gzugs brnyan gyi gzugs de lta bu dag kyang mthong ngo/ /
ba spu'i sgo'i 'od zer gyi dra ba dang / dkyil 'khor la la las ni/ byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyi brtson 'grus kyi spyod pa rnam pa tha dad pa rnam par phye ba'i gzugs dang / byang chub sems dpa' 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i brtson 'grus kyi rnam par 'phrul ba 'jig rten yongs su bskyod pa dang / rgya mtsho yongs su skem pa dang / sems can yongs su skyo bar bya ba dang / mu stegs can thams cad yongs su tshar gcad pa dang / bdud thams cad spa bkong ba dang / chos kyi phyogs snang bar bya ba'i byang chub sems dpa'i mthu chen po rnam par 'phrul ba mthong ngo/ /
pa spu'i sgo'i 'od zer gyi dra ba dang / dkyil 'khor la la las ni/ byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyi spyod pa rnam par rgyu ba'i rnam grangs ji snyed pa dang / lus nye bar len pa ji snyed pa dang / rigs su skye ba yongs su gzung ba ji snyed pa dang / gzugs kyi lus yongs su grub pa ji snyed pa dang / dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyis rjes su bstan pa yongs su gzung ba ji snyed pa dang / dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyi man ngag la nan tan du bya ba'i gnas ji snyed pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i bsam gtan gyi yan lag yongs su bsgrub pa dang mthun pa'i gtsug lag khang dang / gnas dang; gzhal med khang dang / yul dang / ri'i sul ji snyed pa dang / bsam gtan gyi yan lag de dag sus yongs su bsgrub pa'i drang srong gi lus ji snyed pa dang / rgyal po'i thabs ji snyed pa dang / 'byung ba la mngon par mos pa ji snyed pa dang / brtul zhugs dang / yi dam dang / tshul dang / spyod lam ji snyed pa de dag thams cad kyang tshong dpon gyi bu nor bzang gis mthong ngo/ /
ba spu'i sgo'i 'od zer gyi dra ba dang / dkyil 'khor la la las ni/ shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i spyod pa la rnam par spyod cing / chos thams cad yongs su tshol ba dang ldan pa'i lus yongs su bzung ba mthong ste/ lus gang gis chos kyi tshig gcig gi don du yang bdog pa thams cad yongs su btang ste/ sems can thams cad las yongs su btsal ba dang / rim gro dang / bkur sti thams cad kyis dge ba'i bshes gnyen thams cad las yongs su btsal ba dang; dad pa dang / sri zhus lus rab tu btud de/ de bzhin gshegs pa rnams las yongs su btsal ba dang / chos kyi tshig gcig la ji lta ba de bzhin du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang ldan pa'i chos kyi tshig thams cad la'ang de bzhin te/ 'gro ba thams cad du gzugs brnyan byung ba'i lus thams cad kyis yongs su btsal ba de dag thams cad kyang tshong dpon gyi bu nor bzang gis/ ba spu'i sgo gcig gi 'od zer gyi dra ba dang / dkyil 'khor las mthong ngo/ /ba spu'i sgo'i 'od zer gyi dra ba dang / dkyil 'khor la la las ni/ byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyi sems can yongs su smin par bya ba'i thabs 'gro ba'i rgyud rgya mtsho thams cad du 'byams klas pa sems can thams cad yongs su bsdu ba'i sbyor ba mthong ngo/ /sems can re re la yang lus dang spyod pa'i tshul gyi sgo sngon gyi lus nye bar blangs pa/ thabs mkhas pa'i spyod pa la brtson pa/ sems can thams cad kyi lus dang 'dra bas yongs su sdud pa yang ba spu'i sgo'i 'od zer gyi dra ba'i dkyil 'khor gcig las mthong ngo/ /ba spu'i sgo'i 'od zer gyi dra ba'i dkyil 'khor la la las ni/ sngon gyi bcom ldan 'das kyis bskal pa thams cad du smon lam mngon par bsgrubs pa'i spyod pa dang / sems can thams cad yongs su smin par bya ba'i smon lam mngon par bsgrubs pa'i spyod pa dang / zhing thams cad yongs su dag par bya ba'i smon lam mngon par bsgrub pa mdzad pa ji snyed pa dang / smon lam thams cad mngon par bsgrubs pa'i dkyil 'khor ji snyed cig de bzhin gshegs pa de dang de dag gi zhabs kyi drung du 'khor ba'i skyon thams cad las 'khor ba'i skyon so so re re'i gnyen por mngon par bsgrubs pa mdzad pa de dag thams cad kyang / tshong dpon gyi bu nor bzang gis/ ba spu'i sgo'i 'od zer gyi dra ba'i dkyil 'khor gcig las mthong ngo/ /ba spu'i sgo'i 'od zer gyi dra ba'i dkyil 'khor la la las ni/ stobs kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i spyod pa thams cad dang ldan pa'i sngon gyi sbyor ba rgya mtsho mthong ngo/ /ba spu'i sgo'i 'od zer gyi dra ba'i dkyil 'khor la la las ni/ ye shes kyi spyod pa rnam par rgyu ba thams cad dang ldan pa mi shes pa'i gnyid kyis log pa'i sems can sad par byed pa'i rang bzhin dang ldan pa'i sngon gyi sbyor ba rgya mtsho mthong bar gyur to/ /

He also saw as many orbs of webs of light beams as atoms in countless buddha-fields emerge from every pore, countless whirling arrays of phantom forms of power, manifestations of countless various works, pervading the entire cosmos. From some orbs of webs of light beams he saw scenes of the practice of pure giving, relinquishing everything; from some orbs of webs of light beams he saw scenes of the procedures of all past, present and future enlightening beings’ investiture with ethical precepts; from some orbs of webs of light beams he saw scenes of all enlightening beings of past, present, and future practicing forbearance, enduring dismemberment, beatings, having their hearts and eyes gouged out, and he saw magically produced images of the practices of forbearance of all enlightening beings by the oppressed enlightening beings of past, present, and future with bodies sundered in the search of omniscience, enduring, forgiving, and overlooking all physical and mental harassment, out of great compassion; from some orbs of webs of light beams he saw scenes of different forms of the immensity of the practice of vigor of all enlightening beings, scenes of the great prowess of enlightening beings shaking the world, agitating the seas, startling sentient beings, scaring all heretics; from some orbs of webs of light beams he saw embodiments of all deeds of enlightening beings, the forms taken on, the perfections of physical bodies to be born in good families, the acceptance of instructions of spiritual benefactors, the states of practice of the teachings of spiritual benefactors, the abandonments of home, country, and city for suitable abodes to accomplish the branches of meditation of the enlightened, the seers, the meditation adepts, the kings, the recluses, the manners of disciplined conduct; from some orbs of webs of light beams he saw embodiments involved in seeking all truths in the station of practice of transcendent wisdom; from the orbs of webs of light beams from each and every pore Sudhanasaw the bodies by which each statement of the Teaching was sought from the midst of all beings by relinquishing all that exists, sought from all spiritual benefactors through attendance and service, sought from buddhas with all the strength generated by faith and respect, and all the statements of the Teaching related to transcendent wisdom similarly sought by bodies manifested in the forms of all sentient beings; from some orbs of webs of light beams he saw all enlightening beings entering the ocean of states of being with means of development, endeavoring to save all sentient beings; from orbs of webs of light beams from every pore he saw enlightening beings saving sentient beings, engaged in the practice of skill in means taken on by their original bodies, approaching each and every being in a form resembling those beings; from some orbs of webs of light beams he saw the conduct of the Buddha’s undertaking of vows in all past ages, the conduct of the undertaking of the vow to perfect all beings, the conduct of the undertaking of the vow to purify all lands, the spheres of accomplishment of all vows effected by each buddha by the specific cures for each of the ills of the mundane whirl. Sudhanasaw all this from orbs of lights from each pore; from some orbs of webs of light beams he saw oceans of past efforts involved in the practice of transcendent power; from some orbs of webs of light beams he saw oceans of past efforts involved in the contemplations of the practice of omniscience and the awakening of sentient beings asleep in the slumber of ignorance.

de nas tshong dpon gyi bu nor bzang dge slong rgya mtsho'i rgyal mtshan de ltar mnyam par bzhag pa la sems shing rtog pa dang / ting nge 'dzin gyi rnam par thar pa'i dkyil 'khor de rjes su dran par bya ba dang / byang chub sems dpa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi khyu mchog gi mthu phyung ba de la rjes su rnam par bsam pa dang / sems can gyi don gyi tshul rgya mtsho de la 'jug par bya ba dang / mngon par 'du bya ba'i sgo rgyud kun la mngon du gnas pa'i rgyan de'i rjes su 'brang zhing khong du chud par bya ba dang / chos kyi dbyings kyi rgyan rnam par dag pa'i ye shes kyi sgo de la 'jug par bya ba dang / sangs rgyas kyi byin gyi rlabs yang dag par mnod pa'i ye shes de la rab tu brtag pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i dbang gi stobs de yongs su bskyed pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i smon lam gyi stobs de brtan par bya ba dang / byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa'i stobs de shin tu rgyas par bya ba byed cing / dge slong rgya mtsho'i rgyal mtshan gyi mdun du nyin zhag gcig kyang lon no/ /nyin zhag gnyis dang / bdun yang lon no/ /zla ba phyed dang / zla ba gcig dang / zla ba gnyis dang / zla ba drug gi bar dang / nyin zhag kyang drug tu dge slong rgya mtsho'i rgyal mtshan gyi mdun du lon te/ de ltar zla ba drug dang / nyin zhag drug 'das nas/ dge slong rgya mtsho'i rgyal mtshan ting nge 'dzin de las langs so/ /
de nas nor bzang gis smras pa/ 'phags pa/ ting nge 'dzin 'di de ltar zab la/ de ltar rgya che zhing / de ltar tshad ma mchis pa'i yul dang ldan pa dang / de ltar bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i rgyan dang ldan pa dang / de ltar snang ba mtshungs pa ma mchis pa dang / de ltar grangs ma mchis pa'i rgyan dang ldan pa dang / de ltar mi 'phrog pa'i spyod yul dang ldan pa dang; de ltar ma 'dres pa'i yul dang ldan pa dang / de ltar phyogs kun tu rnam par snang ba dang / ting nge 'dzin 'di de ltar sems can gyi don tshad ma mchis pa rab tu sgrub par gyur pa ni ngo mtshar te/ de nas sems can thams cad kyi sdug bsngal gyi phung po tshad ma mchis pa rnam par zhi bar bgyi ba la sta gon du gnas pa ste/ 'di ltar dbul ba'i sdug bsngal zhi bar bgyi ba la sta gon du gnas so/ /sems can dmyal ba'i lam gyi rgyud rgyun gcad pa dang / byol song gi skye gnas kyi lam gyi rgyud las yongs su bskyab pa dang / mi khom pa'i lam gyi rgyud kyi sgo thams cad gcad pa dang / mtho ris kyi lam gyi rgyud du phyin par bgyi ba dang / lha dang mi'i dga' ba dang bde ba 'byung bar bgyi ba dang / bsam gtan gyi yul gyi dga' ba nyams su myong bar bgyi ba dang / 'dus byas la spyod pa'i bde ba yongs su 'phel bar bgyi ba dang / khams gsum pa las 'byung ba'i sgo yongs su bstan pa la sta gon du gnas pa'o/ /byang chub kyi sems yang dag par skye ba'i rgyu yongs su brjod pa la sta gon du gnas pa'o/ /bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs yang dag par skye ba'i rgyu rnam par 'phel bar bgyi ba dang / snying rje chen po'i shugs rgya chen po rnam par 'phel bar bgyi ba dang / smon lam chen po'i stobs yongs su bskyed par bgyi ba dang / byang chub sems dpa'i lam snang ba rab tu 'thob par bgyi ba dang / pha rol tu phyin pa chen po'i theg pa rnam par dgod pa dang / theg pa chen po'i khyad par la 'jug pa mngon par bsgrub pa dang / kun tu bzang po'i spyod pa shes shing snang bar bgyi ba dang / byang chub sems dpa'i sa shes shing snang ba thob par bgyi ba dang / byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyi smon lam dang / spyod pa dang / 'byung ba'i rgyan rnam par dag pa yongs su bsgrub pa dang / thams cad mkhyen pa'i sa gnan pa la thogs pa ma mchis par bgyi ba sta gon du gnas pa'o/ /'phags pa/ ting 'dzin de'i ming ci zhes bgyi/

Then, observing the monk Saradhvaja thus concentrated in meditation, mindful of that sphere of concentration and liberation, contemplating the inconceivable power of concentration of enlightening beings, entering into that inconceivable ocean of ways of benefiting sentient beings, remembering that inconceivable medium of the performance of supernal manifestations confronting all the senses, strongly focusing his attention on it, entering that door of knowledge of purity of arrangement of the cosmos, aspiring to that enlightened power, expanding in knowledge, recognizing that controlling power of enlightening beings, stabilizing the power of vows of enlightening beings, extending the power of practice of enlightening beings, Sudhana stood before Saradhavja for a day and a night, for two days and nights, seven days and nights, a fortnight, a month, six months, and then six more days and nights.
After six months and six days and nights, the monk Saradhvaja rose from concentration. Sudhana said, “It is marvelous, noble one, how profound this concentration is, how vast, how measureless its scope, how inconceivable its arrays of projections, how incomparable its light, how innumerable its manifestations, how unsurpassable its range, how pure its sphere, how it illumines everywhere equally, how it works for the benefit of infinite beings, in that it is directed to the extinction of the measureless mass of suffering of all sentient beings, to extinguish the sufferings of the destitute, to end hellish states, to rescue beings from brutish states, to close the door on all conditions inopportune for enlightenment, to lead the way to heavenly states, to produce human and celestial pleasure and happiness, to foster experience of the pleasure of meditation, to increase happiness in the conditioned world, to show the way out of the mundane. It is set forth to illumine the cause of production of the aspiration of enlightenment, to develop the cause of production of provisions of virtue and knowledge, to increase the intensity of vast great compassion, to generate the power of great vows, for the attainment of the light of the path of enlightening beings, for the arrangement of the great vehicle of the transcendent ways, for the accomplishment of the supreme attainment of the Great Vehicle, for the vision of the knowledge of universally good action, for the attainment of the light of the knowledge of the stages of enlightening beings, for accomplishment of the purification of the array of means of emancipation in the practice of the vows of all enlightening beings, for the empowerment of accession to the sphere of omniscience. Noble one, what is the name of this concentration?”

smras pa/ rigs kyi bu/ shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa kun nas lta ba'i btang snyoms yongs su thob pa zhes bya ba yod de/ ting 'dzin 'di ni de'i snang ba ste/ sgo kun nas rnam par dag pa'i rgyan ces bya ba'o/ /rigs kyi bu/ shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa kun nas lta ba'i btang snyoms rab tu thob pa'i snang ba las skyes pa'i ting nge 'dzin sgo kun nas rnam par dag pa'i rgyan ces bya ba 'di shin tu bsgoms na/ sgo kun nas rnam par dag pa'i rgyan la sogs pa ting nge 'dzin brgya stong grangs med pa phrag bcu tshang ba yongs su 'grub par 'gyur ro/ /smras pa/ 'phags pa/ ting nge 'dzin 'di'i yul par bya ba la thogs pa med do; ;sems can gyi dbang po rgya mtsho thams cad shes shing khong du chud par bya ba la thogs pa med do/ /sems can gyi dbang po thams cad shes par bya ba la thogs pa med do/ /

Saradhvaja said, “There is a perfection of wisdom called equanimity of the universal eye, and this concentration is its light, called manifestation of universal purification. By the perfect accomplishment of the concentration of manifestation of universal purification, which springs from the light of the perfection of wisdom of equanimity of the universal eye, countless tens of hundreds of thousands of complete concentrations, beginning with the manifestation of universal purification, are born.”
Sudhana said, “Is this the greatest range of this concentration?”
Saradhvaja said, “One who has fully accomplished this concentration has the power to discern worlds, to enter worlds, to travel freely in worlds, to adorn worlds, to purify worlds, to beautify worlds, to see buddhas, to observe the grandeur of buddhas, to know the emanations of buddhas, to enter the powers of buddhas, to plunge into the ocean of virtues of buddhas, to receive the teachings of buddhas, to follow the knowledge of the unity of all buddhas’ teachings, to enter the ocean of congregations of buddhas, to go anywhere in the ten directions, to observe the teaching activity of the buddhas, to see the realms of the buddhas, to embrace all with great compassion, to pervade everywhere with love, to plunge tirelessly into the vision of buddhas everywhere, to enter into the ocean of all beings, to know the ocean of faculties of all beings, to know the distinction of faculties of all beings.

rigs kyi bu /kho bos ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la rnam par spyod pa 'di shes su zad na/ byang chub sems dpa' shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la rnam par spyod pa rgya mtsho la zhugs pa/ chos kyi dbyings kyi yul la blo gros rnam par dag pa/ chos thams cad la rig pa rjes su 'brang ba'i ye shes can/ blo shin tu yangs pas tshad med pa'i yul rgyas par 'gengs pa/ gzungs chen po'i snang ba la dbang bsgyur ba/ ting nge 'dzin gyi dkyil 'khor snang ba thams cad shin tu dag pa mngon par shes pas rnam par 'phrul pa dang / khyu mchog gi mthu 'byin pa la shin tu 'byung ba/ tha dad pa yang dag par shes pa mi zad pa'i rgya mtsho la zhugs pa/ ngag snyan pa sa'i snying po dang ldan pa brjod pa/ 'gro ba thams cad kyi rten du gyur pa rnams kyi spyod pa shes pa'am/ yon tan brjod pa'am/ spyod yul bstan pa'am/ yul rab tu brjod pa'am/ smon lam chen po'i stobs yang dag par bsngags pa'am/ 'byung ba'i sgo yongs su snang bar bya ba'am/ yang dag par bsgrub pa mngon par brjod pa'am/ lam yongs su bstan pa'am/ ting nge 'dzin gyi rgyun gyi rjes su 'brang bar bya ba'am/ sems kyi yul shes par bya ba'am/ ye shes mnyam pa nyid khong du chud par bya bar nus re skan;

“I know this state of perfection of wisdom; but how can I know the practice, tell of the virtues, show the realm, reveal the sphere, describe the power of great vows, illumine the way of emancipation, elucidate the attainment, shed light on the path, follow the stream of concentration, know the range of mind, or reach equality with the knowledge, of the enlightening beings who have entered the ocean of states of perfection of wisdom, who have clarified the cosmic perspective, who know where all teachings lead, who pervade an infinite sphere with vast awareness, who command the light of great mental control, who have purified the light of all spheres of concentration, who issue from the magical power of mystic knowledge, who have entered the inexhaustible ocean of intelligence, who speak pleasantly of the stages of enlightenment, who are refuges for all beings?

song / rigs kyi bu/ lho phyogs kyi rgyud 'di nyid na/ phyogs kyi gnas rgya mtsho rnam par rlob pa zhes bya ba yod de/ de na bza' shing gi ra ba kun nas rnam par brgyan pa zhes bya ba zhig /grong khyer 'od chen po zhes bya ba'i shar phyogs logs na yod de/ de na shes las skyes pa'i rgyal po 'od bzang gi chung ma/ dge bsnyen ma yid bzhin zhes bya ba yod kyi/ de'i gan du song la/ ji ltar byang chub sems dpas byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa la bslab par bya ba dang / ji ltar nan tan du bya ba dris shig /

“Go south, to a place called Samudravetadin, where there is a park called Samantavyuha, in front of the city Mahaprabha, where a lay woman named Asha, wife of king Suprabha, dwells; go to her and ask her how an enlightening being is to learn and apply the practice of enlightening beings.”

de nas tshong dpon gyi bu nor bzang dga' rangs te/ mgu zhing nyams bde la/ tshim zhing yid bde ba skyes nas/ dge slong rgya mtsho'i rgyal mtshan las snying po yongs su blangs te/ chos kyis nye bar 'tsho bar byas pa/ ting nge 'dzin gyi yul la zhugs pa/ snang ba thob pa ye shes snang bar gyur pa/ ting nge 'dzin gyi snang ba rab tu thob pa/ mos pa rnam par dag pa khong du chud pa/ sems can chos kyi tshul gyi snang ba'i rjes su song ba/ rnam par dag pa'i sgos snang ba dang ldan par gyur pa/ phyogs su ye shes kyi snang ba rab tu 'dal ba des/ dge slong rgya mtsho'i rgyal mtshan gyi rkang pa gnyis la spyi bos phyag 'tshal te/ lan brgya stong du mar g.yas phyogs su bskor ba byas nas/ dge slong rgya mtsho'i rgyal mtshan la btud de phyag 'tshal nas/ yang dang yang lta zhing / yang dang yang mngon par blta ba dang / phyag bya ba dang / rab tu gdud pa dang / gus bar bya ba dang / rim gror bya ba dang / yid la bya ba dang / bsam pa dang / bsgom pa dang / yongs su bsgom pa dang / legs par brjod pa dang / ngo mtshar du bya ba dang / yon tan mngon du bya ba dang / rjes su bsngags pa dang / rjes su 'brang bar bya ba dang / rjes su dran par bya ba dang / brtan par bya ba dang / mi btang ba dang / yid la bsam pa dang / rjes su 'brang bar bya ba dang / smon lam gyi rjes su 'jug par bya ba dang / mthong bar dga' ba dang / dbyangs kyi mtshan ma gzung ba dang / gzungs kyi rjes su bsam pa dang / ming yongs su gzung ba'i rjes su song ba'i sems dang ldan par bya ba dang / kha dog dang dbyibs rjes su dran par bya ba dang / ye shes kyi yul rjes su bsam pa dang / ting nge 'dzin gyi yul la rjes su 'jug par bya ba dang / smon lam gyi yul la rjes su 'brang bar bya ba dang / spyod yul gyi yul rnam par dpyad par bya ba dang / ye shes kyi snang ba yongs su gzung ba byed cing dge slong rgya mtsho'i rgyal mtshan gyi drung nas song ngo// //

Then Sudhana, pleased, uplifted, transported, overjoyed, joyful and happy, invigorated and sustained by Sarasdhvaja, having entered the realm of concentration, having attained illumined knowledge, having attained the light of concentration, his consciousness illumined by the light of the principles of teaching pursuant to purifications of interest, seeing the way to purity, with knowledge emanating light in all directions, paid his respects to Saradhvaja and left, looking at him again and again, bowing to him, thinking and meditating on him, praising him, recalling his virtues and keeping them firmly in mind, joining in with his vow, seeking his vision, remembering his words, recalling his appearance, contemplating the excellence of his knowledge, plunging into his sphere of concentration, fixing his mind on his sphere of undertaking, reflecting on the scope of his experience, illumined by his knowledge.
bam po dgu bcu gnyis pa/
[dge bsnyen ma yid bzhin]
Asha

de nas tshong dpon gyi bu nor bzang dge ba'i ba shes gnyen gyi yon tan gyis ni mgu/ dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyis ni yang dag par bsngags te btang / dge ba'i bshes gnyen mthong ba'i byin gyis ni byin du brlabs/ dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyi gdams ngag la ni nan tan du byed/ dge ba'i bshes gnyen yid du 'ong ba ni rjes su sems/ dge ba'i bshes gnyen la ni sangs rgyas kyi chos kyi 'byung gnas tsam du lta/ dge ba'i bshes gnyen ni sangs rgyas kyi chos ston pa yin par yang dag par lta/ dge ba'i bshes gnyen ni thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi chos rjes su lta/ dge ba'i bshes gnyen ni sangs rgyas nam mkha' blta ba la mig tsam du lta zhing mthar gyis phyogs kyi gnas/ rgya mtsho rnam par rlob pa'i bza' shing gi rab kun nas rnam par brgyan pa gang na ba der phyin nas/ des mthong mthong ba/ bza' shing gi ra ba kun nas rnam par brgyan pa rin po che thams cad kyi ra bas kun nas bskor ba/ rin po che'i shing gi phreng ba spel legs pas yongs su brgyan pa/ rin po che thams cad kyi shing gi phreng ba'i me tog srad bu yid du 'ong ba'i sprin rab tu 'phrul bas gzhi rgyas pa/ rin po che thams cad kyi shing gis yang dag par brgyan pa/ shing thams cad kyi me tog shin tu rgyas pa sna tshogs kyis yongs su gang ba/ spos sna tshogs kyi shing gi phreng ba las phyogs kun tu spos kyi ngad zhim pa/ rin po che'i phreng ba'i shing sna tshogs kyi lhun las/ rin po che sna tshogs kyi phreng ba 'phyang ba rab tu 'byung zhing char ltar mngon par 'bab pa/ rin po che'i rgyal po thams cad kyi shing dang / nor bu rin po che sna tshogs kyis mdzes shing spa la rgya cher brgyan pa'i gzhi can/ yid bzhin gyi gos kyi shing thams cad las kha dog sna tshogs kyi gos 'byung bas gam yo khebs shing mdzes par brgyan pa/ sil snyan gyi shing thams cad las; lha rdzas las kyang 'phags pa'i sil snyan rlung gis bskyod cing sgra 'byin pa'i dbyangs snyan pa 'byung ba/ sa'i gzhi mthon dman med par gnas pa/ rgyan gyi shing sna tshogs kyi gseb nas rgyan sna tshogs rnam pa tha dad par rgyun du 'byung zhing 'phyang bas rab tu brgyan pa'i rgyan dang ldan pa mthong ste/ bza' shing gi ra ba chen po kun nas rnam par brgyan pa de'i nang na khang pa bye ba brgya stong phrag bcu kun kyang / nor bu rin po che dam pa sna tshogs kyi ba gam gyis rnam par brgyan pa dang / khang pa brtsegs pa brgya stong phrag bcu 'dzam bu chu klung gi gser las brtsegs pa'i bde dang ldan pa dang / gzhal med khang brgya stong phrag bcug gdung rin po che rnam par snang pa las bres pa dang / rdzing bu brgya stong phrag bcu rin po che thams cad las gzhi blangs te/ rin po che sna tshogs kyi pha gus mu khyud byas pa/ rin po che thams cad kyi them skas btags pa/ rin po che sna tshogs kyi stegs bus bskor ba/ lha rdzas kyi tsan dan gyi dri dang ldan pa'i chus gang ba/ gser gyi bye mas kun tu gram pa; gzhi nor bu rin po che chu 'dang kun tu bkram pa/ phyogs bzhi nas them skas rnam par bres pa/ yan lag brgyad dang ldan pa'i chus gang ba dang / ngang dur dang / rma bya dang / khu byug dang / khrung khrung dang / ka la ping+ka dang / ku na la'i sgra skad snyan pa'i dbyangs dang ldan pa/ rin po che'i ta la'i phreng bas kun nas brgyan pa/ gser gyi dril bu'i dra bas kun nas yog pa/ rlung gis bskyod pa'i sgra yid du 'ong ba 'byung ba/ steng nas rin po che'i bla re chen po bres pa/ rin po che sna tshogs kyi shing gi ra bas yongs su bskor ba; rin po che'i dra bas brgyan pa'i gdugs dang / rgyal mtshan legs par bsgreng ba/ lu ma brgya stong phrag bcu dus dang mthun pa'i tsan dan gyi 'dam gyis mtha' 'khor ba/ rin po che sna tshogs kyi kha dog tu 'dug pa'i pad+mos yongs su khyab pa/ rin po che'i pad+mo'i 'od chen pos snang bar gyur pa'i chu dri ma med pa dang ldan pa yod pa ste;

Then Sudhana, uplifted by the virtues of the spiritual benefactor, sent forth by the spiritual benefactor, having gained access to the vision of the spiritual benefactor, putting the instructions of the spiritual benefactor into practice, remembering the words of the spiritual benefactor, kindly disposed toward spiritual benefactors, seeing spiritual benefactors as mines of the vision of buddhas, seeing spiritual benefactors as those who show the teachings of buddhas, seeing spiritual benefactors as teachers of the elements of omniscience, seeing spiritual benefactors as eyes to see the sky of buddhahood, gradually made his way to Samantavyuha Park in Samudravetadin.
He saw the park surrounded by fences made of all kinds of jewels, in the midst of rows of all kinds of jewel trees, adorned throughout with beautiful delicate flowers like sets of all kinds of jewels releasing pollen, adorned by all kinds of jewel trees, strewn with the various blossoms of the flowers of all kinds of jewel trees, with rows of trees of all kinds of fragrances giving off their scents in all directions, trees of garlands of all jewels with their flower buds bursting forth streaming a rain of garlands of various jewels, the ground beautifully spread with various decorations made of jewels from trees of all kinds of diamonds, the area well distributed with cloths of various colors hanging down from trees of flowers of various forms, with trees of all kinds of musical instruments making beautiful sounds surpassing the heavens when stirred by the wind, the ground level throughout, neither high nor low, adorned with various trailing streamers of ornaments welling forth from the flower buds of trees of all ornaments. In the park, furthermore, were ten hundred thousand arrays of turrets adorned with all kinds of precious jewels, extremely pure; ten hundred thousand towers covered with gold, ten hundred thousand mansions adorned with radiant jewels, ten hundred thousand lotus ponds made of all kinds of jewels, inlaid with jewel bricks, with varied stairways made of seven precious substances, surrounded by benches made of various gems, fragrant as pools of water scented with celestial sandalwood, the bottoms covered with golden sand, spread with ten layers of pure gold and jewels, stairways set on four sides, filled with water of eight qualities, vibrant with the beautiful sounds of the calls of various birds, surrounded by rows of jewel palms, covered by nets of gold bells chiming sweetly when stirred by the wind, with canopies of great jewels above, surrounded by enclosures of trees of various jewels, with banners and streamers flying from jewel nets. There were also ten hundred thousand pools, lined with sandalwood clay, covered with lotuses of various colors made of all kinds of jewels, with pure water shining with lotuses of huge gems.

bza' shing gi ra ba de'i dbus na gzhal med khang chen po rgyal mtshan sna tshogs zhes bya ba sa'i gzhi rin po che rgya mtsho'i snying po las blangs pa/ nor bu rin po che'i ka ba bkye ba/ 'dzam bu chu klung gi gser gyi lhun mngon par 'phags pa nor bu rin po che 'gro bar rnam par snang ba'i spang leb bkye bas brgyan pa/ gzhi nor bu rin po che 'bar ba grangs med pa'i ra bas bres pa/ rin po che'i rgyal po mi pham pa'i spos kyi dris gam yo kun nas bdugs pa/ rin po che'i rgyal po sgra snyan pa 'byin pa'i dri'i ngad kun tu ldang ba; rin po che'i rgyal po dri rnam par gsal bar byed pas/ dbang po rno ba'i bag chags rnam par bsgrubs pa dang ldan zhing gzhal med khang chen po rgyal mtshan sna tshogs der stan grangs med cing tshad med pa bting bar gyur pa 'di lta ste/ pad+mo'i snying po can dang / nor bu rin po che phyogs snang bar byed pa'i pad+mo'i snying po can dang / nor bu rin po che rnam par snang ba'i pad+mo'i snying po can dang / nor bu rin po che 'gro ba yid du 'ong ba'i pad+mo'i snying po can dang / nor bu rin po che mdzod sna tshogs kyi pad+mo'i snying po can dang / nor bu rin po che seng ge'i shing thags pad+mo'i snying po can dang / nor bu rin po che dri ma med pa'i pad+mo'i snying po can dang / nor bu rin po ches brgyan pa'i pad+mo'i snying po can dang; nor bu rin po che sgo kun nas brgyan pa'i pad+mo'i snying po can dang / nor bu rin po che 'od kyi rgyan gyi pad+mo'i snying po can dang / nor bu rin po che rgya mtsho'i gnas rnam par dag pa'i rin po ches rnam par brgyan pa'i 'od zer kun tu 'byung ba'i pad+mo'i snying po can dang / nor bu rin po che rdo rje'i seng ges gnon pa'i pad+mo'i snying po can dag bshams shing bting ba ste/ gzhal med khang chen po rgyal mtshan sna tshogs de'i ba gam mang po yang rin po che bsam gyis mi khyab pa las byas pa/ rin po che sna tshogs kyis rnam par brgyan pa/ kha dog bsam gyis mi khyab par mdzes shing gzugs yod du 'ong ba dag go /

In the middle of the park was a large mansion called Multicolored Banner standing on a ground of jewels, adorned with pillars of sapphire, roofed with gold, surfaced with arrays of world-illumining jewels, its base blazing with webs of countless jewels, graced by the scent of unsurpassed jewels of fragrance, perfumed by jewels of compounded fragrances, filled with jewels of awakening fragrance extinguishing the heat of the senses.
In that mansion were arranged infinite seats—the calyxes of lotuses, luminous jewel lotuses, radiant jewel lotuses, world-illumining jewel lotuses, lotuses of various treasures, lotuses of pure jewels, lotuses inlaid with jewels, lotuses of omnifaceted jewels, lotuses of jewels with auras of light, lotuses of jewels shining with the radiant lights of arrays of pure jewels of the ocean, jewel lotuses covered with diamond lions.
The many turrets of the mansion were made of inconceivably many jewels, arrayed with varicolored jewels, their forms resplendent with light of inconceivably many colors.

bza' shing gi ra ba kun nas brgyan pa de steng nas bla re chen po brgya stong phrag bcus kun nas khebs pa ste/ 'di ltar gos kyi bla re dang / 'khri shing gi bla re dang / me tog gi bla re dang / phreng ba'i bla re dang / spos kyi bla re dang / nor bu rin po che'i bla re dang / gser gyi bla re dang / rgyan gyi bla re dang / rin po che rdo rje snang ba'i bla re dang / glang po'i shugs dang ldan pas sprul pa'i lha mo'i bla re dang / nor bu rin po che brgya byin mngon par dga' ba'i bla re dang / de dag la sogs pa bla re brgya stong phrag bcus kun nas khebs par byas pa'o// rin po che'i dra ba brgya stong phrag bcus kun nas yog pa ste/ 'di ltar rin po che dam pa'i dril bu'i dra ba dang / rin po che'i gdugs kyi dra ba dang / rin po che'i 'bru'i dra ba dang; mu tig rgya mtsho'i snying po'i dra ba dang / nor bu rin po che bai DUr+ya sngon po'i dra ba dang / seng ge'i 'khri shing gi dra ba dang / nor bu rin po che chu shel gyi dra ba dang / spos kyi gzugs kyi dra ba dang / rin po che'i cod pan dang / rin po che'i phreng ba'i dra ba dang / de dag la sogs pa rin po che'i dra ba brgya stong phrag bcus kun nas yog pa/ snang ba chen po brgya stong phrag bcus kyang kun nas yog pa ste/ 'di ltar nor bu rin po che skar ma'i 'od zer gyi snang ba dang / nor bu rin po che nyi ma'i snying po'i snang ba dang / nor bu rin po che zla ba'i rgyal mtshan gyi snang ba dang / nor bu rin po che spos kyi dud pa 'od 'phro ba'i snang ba dang / nor bu rin po che dpal gyi snying po'i snang ba dang / nor bu rin po che pad+mo'i snying po'i snang ba dang / nor bu rin po che skar ma'i rgyal mtshan gyi snang ba dang / nor bu rin po che sgron ma chen po'i snang ba dang / nor bu rin po che phyogs kun tu rnam par snang ba'i snang ba dang / nor bu rin po che spos kyi sprin chen po'i snang ba dang / glog gi phreng ba 'byung ba'i snang ba dang / de dag la sogs pa nor bu rin po che'i snang ba chen po brgya stong phrag bcus rtag tu snang bar byas pa'o/ /

The park was also covered above by ten hundred thousand canopies, such as canopies of cloth, canopies of plant tendrils, canopies of flowers, canopies of garlands, canopies of fragrances, canopies of jewels, golden canopies, canopies of jewels glittering like diamonds, canopies of nymphs magically produced by the chief of the water spirits, canopies of jewels prized by the king of gods.
It was also covered by ten hundred thousand precious nets such as nets of bells with jewels inside, nets of jeweled streamers, nets of jewel figures, nets of pearls, nets of sapphires, nets of moonlike jewels, nets emanating fragrance, nets of jeweled crowns.
It was also illumined by ten hundred thousand great lights, such as starlight-jewel light, sun-filled-jewel light, moonlike-jewel light, scenting-flame-jewel light, luster-filled-jewel light, lotus-calyx-jewel light, starry-jewel light, great blazing jewel light, radiant jewel light, and the light of jewels like wreaths of lightning emitting great clouds of fragrance.

bza' shing gi ra ba de ni rgyan chen po'i sprin brgya stong phrag bcu'i char 'bab pa'i rgyan dang ldan pa ste/ dus dang mthun pa'i tsan dan gyi sprin brgya stong phrag bcu'i 'brug sgra rab tu 'byung ba lha rdzas las 'das pa'i phreng ba dang lda ldi'i sprin chen po kun tu mched pas rab tu brgyan pa/ lha rdzas las 'das pa'i gos tshon sna tshogs dang ldan pa'i sprin brgya stong phrag bcu'i sprin mngon par 'bab pa/ lha rdzas las 'das pa'i rgyan gyi sprin brgya stong phrag bcus rnam par klubs pa/ lha'i bu brgya stong phrag bcu mthong bar dga' ste/ 'og tu lta zhing rab tu 'dud pa'i phyag char bzhin du 'bab pa/ lha mi'i sprin brgya stong phrag bcu sngon gyi spyod pa'i skal ba mnyam pos rang rang gi lus 'bul ba'i char mngon par 'bab pa/ byang chub sems dpa'i sprin brgya stong phrag bcus chos mnyan pas sgom zhing 'ong ba'i char mngon par 'bab pa ste/

The park was also adorned by rain from ten hundred thousand great clouds of ornaments; ten hundred thousand sandalwood-scented clouds thundered; it was adorned by ten hundred thousand trailing clouds of garlands surpassing those in the heavens; ten hundred thousand clouds of varicolored cloths surpassing the celestials rained; it was adorned by ten hundred thousand clouds of ornaments surpassing those of the heavens; it was showered by ten hundred thousand celestial beings bowing their heads to see; it was showered by ten hundred thousand clouds of nymphs producing beings of their own kind who did the same things in the past, with bodies like their own; it was showered by ten hundred thousand clouds of enlightening beings who had come to hear the Teaching.

de na dge bsnyen ma yid bzhin gser gyi snying po'i khri chen po la 'dug cing mu tig rgya mtsho'i snying po'i dra bas brgyan pa'i cod pan thogs pa/ lag pa la lha rdzas las 'das pa'i gser gyi dpung rgyan dang / gdu bu thogs pa/ lag pa nor bu rin po che dpal gyi rang bzhin gyi 'od zer gyis rnam par mdzes par gyur pa/ rna cha rin po che mthon thing dri ma med pa rab tu 'phyang ba/ mgo nor bu rin po che'i dra bas mdzes par brgyan pa/ nor bu rin po che seng ge'i gdong gi rna ba'i gong rgyan thogs pa/ nor bu rin po che yid bzhin gyi rgyal po'i mgul 'khor thogs pa/ lus rin po che thams cad kyi dra bas yog cing 'od rab tu 'bar ba; srog chags bye ba khrag khrig gis lus rab tu btud de/ phyag bya ba zhig 'dug ste/ dge bsnyen ma yid bzhin de'i drung du shar phyogs nas tshangs pa chen po'am/ tshangs lha nye phan nam/ tshangs pa'i ris su gtogs pa'am/ dbang byed dam/ gzhan 'phrul dbang byed kyi ris su gtogs pa'am/ rab 'phrul dga'am/ 'phrul dga'i ris su gtogs pa'am/ rab dga' ldan nam/ dga' ldan gyi ris su gtogs pa'am/ rab mtshe ma'am/ mtshe ma'i ris su gtogs pa'am/ lha'i dbang po'am/ sum cu rtsa gsum gyi ris su gtogs pa'am/ gnod sbyin gyi dbang po'am/ gnod sbyin nam/ dri za'i dbang po'am/ dri za'am/ grul bum gyi dbang po'am/ grul bum mam; klu'i dbang po'am/ klu'am/ lha ma yin gyi dbang po'am/ lha ma yin nam/ nam mkha' lding gi dbang po'am/ nam mkha' lding ngam/ mi'am ci'i dbang po'am/ mi'am ci'am/ lto 'phye chen po'i dbang po'am/ lto 'phye chen po'am/ gshin rje'am/ gshin rje'i bu mo'am/ yi rdzu 'phrul chen po'am/ yi sam/ mi'i dbang po'am/ mi yang rung ste/ sems can tshad med grangs med pa dag 'ong ba dang / de bzhin du lho phyogs dang / nub phyogs dang / byang phyogs dang / byang shar gyi phyogs mtshams dang / shar lho'i phyogs mtshams dang / lho nub kyi phyogs mtshams dang / nub byang gi phyogs mtshams dang / 'og dang steng gi phyogs nas kyang tshangs pa chen po'am/ tshangs lha nye phan nam/ tshangs pa'i ris su gtogs pa'am/ dbang byed dam/ dbang byed kyi ris su gtogs pa nas/ mi'i dbang po'am/ mi'i bar gyi sems can mang po 'ong ba de dag nad sna tshogs shig gis btab pas/ nyon mongs pa sna tshogs kyis kun nas 'khor tam/ lta ba'i rnam pa sna tshogs la mngon par zhen tam/ las kyi sgrib pas bsgribs pa zhig yod na'ang / de dag gis dge bsnyen ma yid bzhin de mthong ma thag tu nad thams cad kyang rab tu zhi bar gyur; sems kyi nyon mongs pa'i dri ma dang yang bral bar gyur/ lta ba'i gsal shing yang phyin par gyur/ sgrib pa'i ri thams cad kyang rnam par shigs par gyur/ rnam par dag pa'i dkyil 'khor bsgribs pa med pa yang khong du chud par gyur te/ rnam par dag pa'i dkyil 'khor de yod pas ni dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad kyang rab tu byang bar 'gyur/ dbang po'i myu gu thams cad kyang rnam par 'phel bar 'gyur/ thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes kyi tshul rgya mtsho la'ang yang dag par gzhol bar gyur/ gzungs kyi sgo rgya mtsho thams cad la'ang 'jug par gyur/ ting nge 'dzin gyi sgo dang tshul rgya mtsho thams cad kyang mngon sum du gyur/ smon lam gyi sgo thams cad kyang yang dag par skye bar gyur/ spyod pa'i sgo thams cad kyang rab tu 'byung bar gyur/ yon tan mngon par bsgrub pa'i sgo thams cad kyang rnam par dag par gyur/ sems rgya chen po yang mngon par shes pa thams cad dang ldan pa'i tshul du 'byung bar gyur/ lus thogs pa med pas kyang thams cad du rjes su 'gro bar gyur to/ /

Innumerable living beings in all states of existence came from the ten directions to the laywoman Asha, who was seated on a golden throne, adorned with a net of pearls from the ocean, wearing a tiara, her wrists adorned with bracelets of gold more beautiful than that of the heavens, her arms resplendent with jewels of glorious light, wearing earrings of pure deep blue gems, her head adorned with a veil of all kinds of jewels, her neck draped with a string of wish-fulfilling jewels. Those who came to her, affected with various sicknesses, filled with various afflictions, immersed in various views, covered by obstructions caused by actions, had their sicknesses alleviated when they saw Asha. Their minds freed from the defilement of afflictions, the thorns of views removed, the mountains of obstructions disintegrated, they entered the sphere of unobstructed purity, in which sphere of purity all their roots of goodness were clarified, the sprouts of spiritual faculties grew, and they entered the ocean of principles of omniscience, they recited the ocean of all mystic spells leading to mental command, came face to face with the ocean of all concentration media, began all holy vows, set all means of practice into operation, purified the means of accomplishing all virtues, proceeded according to wisdom characterized by all higher knowledges with unregressing breadth of mind, and became physically unattached and unobstructed, able to go everywhere.

de nas tshong dpon gyi bu nor bzangbza' shing gi ra ba kun nas rnam par brgyan pa'i nang du phyin te bltas na/ dge bsnyen ma yid bzhin khri bzang po la 'dug pa mthong nas de dge bsnyen ma yid bzhin gang na ba der stong ste phyin nas/ dge bsnyen ma yid bzhin gyi rkang pa gnyis la spyi bos phyag 'tshal te/ dge bsnyen ma yid bzhin la lan brgya stong du mar g.yas phyogs su bskor ba byas nas/ 'di skad ces smras so/ /'phags ma/ bdag gis bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed na/ ji ltar byang chub sems dpas/ byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa la bslab par bgyi ba dang / ji ltar nan tan du bgyi ba ma 'tshal te/ 'phags ma ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams la gdams ngag dang rjes su bstan pa mdzad do zhes thos na/ 'phags ma/ ji ltar byang chub sems dpas byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa la bslab par bgyi ba dang / ji ltar nan tan du bgyi ba bdag la bshad du gsol/

Then Sudhana entered the park, looking all over till he saw Asha sitting there. He went up to her, paid his respects, and said, “Noble one, I have set my mind on supreme perfect enlightenment, but I do not know how to learn and carry out the practice of enlightening beings. I hear you give instructions to enlightening beings, so please tell me how an enlightening being is to learn and carry out the practice of enlightening beings.”

des smras pa/ rigs kyi bu/ kho mo ni byang chub sems dpa'i rnam par thar pa mya ngan med pa/ bde ba'i rgyal mtshan thob pa ste/ rigs kyi bu/ kho mo ni de'i mthus mthong na don yod pa'o/ /mnyan na don yod pa'o/ /rim gror byas pa don yod pa'o/ /gnas gcig na 'grogs pa don yod pa'o/ /rjes su dran par byas pa don yod pa'o/ /rigs kyi bu/ kho mo ni sems can dge ba'i rtsa ba ma bskyed pa/ dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyis yongs su ma zin pa/ yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyis ma dgongs pa rnams kyis mthong zhing rnam par dmigs par mig lam du 'ong bar mi 'gyur te/ rigs kyi bu/ kho mo mthong btsam gyis ni/ sems can rnams kyang bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub las phyir mi ldog par 'gyur ro/ /gzhan yang rigs kyi bu/ kho mo'i drung du shar phyogs nas de bzhin gshegs pa dag byon cing / gdan rin po che'i khri la bzhugs nas chos ston to/ /shar phyogs nas ji lta ba bzhin du phyogs bcu nas kyang de bzhin te/ rigs kyi bu/ de lta bas na kho mo ni de bzhin gshegs pa mthong ba dang mi 'bral ba'o/ /chos mnyan pa dang mi 'bral ba'o/ /byang chub sems dpa' dang 'grogs pa dang mi 'bral ba'o/ /rigs kyi bu/ kho mo dang spyod pa'i skal pa mnyam pa'i srog chags bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong phrag brgyad cu rtsa bzhi po bza' shing gi ra ba kun nas rnam par brgyan pa 'di na gnas pa de dag thams cad kyang / bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub las phyir mi ldog pa sha stag go /rigs kyi bu/ sems can gzhan gang 'di na gnas pa de dag kyang / bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub las mi ldog pa phyir mi ldog pa'i dge 'dun du gtogs pa sha stag ste/ kho mo dang spyod pa'i skal pa mnyam pa dag go /

She said, “I have attained an enlightening liberation called ‘characterized by sorrowless well-being.’ It is definitely beneficial to see me, hear me, attend me, live with me, remember me. I am not visible to those who have not developed the bases of goodness, who are not under the tutelage of spiritual benefactors, who are not in the care of the perfect buddhas. Those who see me thereupon become irreversible in progress toward supreme perfect enlightenment. Furthermore, the buddhas of the ten directions come here and sit on this jewel seat and expound the truth to me. I am always seeing buddhas, hearing the truth, and meeting enlightening beings. The eighty-four thousand quadrillion beings who live here in this park are all irreversible in progress toward supreme perfect enlightenment, having performed the same practices as I have. Any others who live here too will all be irreversible in progress toward supreme perfect enlightenment, as enlightening beings of the same practice as I who have entered the community of those who cannot regress.”
smras pa/ 'phags ma khyod kyis bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yun ji srid cig nas thugs bskyed/
Sudhana said, “Noble one, how long ago did you set your mind on supreme perfect enlightenment?”

smras pa/ rigs kyi bu/ kho mos ni/ sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran te/ de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas mar me mdzad ces bya ba byung ba de bzhin gshegs pa de'i drung na/ kho mos tshangs pa'i spyod pa spyad do/ /de bzhin gshegs pa de kho mos mchod do/ /de bzhin gshegs pa de las chos bstan pa kho mos yongs su bzung ngo/ /de'i snga rol du de bzhin gshegs pa dri ma med ba zhes bya ba byung ste/ de'i bstan pa la'ang kho mo rab tu byung ngo/ /chos kyi 'khor lo yang kho mos bzung ngo; ;de'i snga rol du de bzhin gshegs pa dpal zhes bya ba byung ste/ de yang kho mos bsnyen bkur to/ /de'i snga rol du de bzhin gshegs pa ri rab dpal zhes bya ba byung ngo/ /de'i snga rol du de bzhin gshegs pa pad mo'i snying po zhes bya ba byung ngo/ /de'i snga rol du de bzhin gshegs pa rnam par snang mdzad ces bya ba byung ngo/ /de'i snga rol du de bzhin gshegs pa kun tu gzigs pa zhes bya ba byung ngo/ /de'i snga rol du de bzhin gshegs pa tshangs pa dag pa zhes bya ba byung ngo/ /de'i snga rol du de bzhin gshegs pa rdo rje'i gtsug ces bya ba byung ngo/ /de'i snga rol du de bzhin gshegs pa chu bo'i lha zhes bya ba byung ste/ rigs kyi bu/ gzhung de ltar tshe gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pa dang; bskal pa gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pa'i sangs rgyas gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pa de bzhin gshegs pa'i mtshams 'dab chags su bsams te dran par byas na; gang kho mos rim gror byas te bsnyen bkur ba dang / mchod pa dang / bsti stang du byas pa dang / gang gi spyan sngar kho mos chos thos par gyur pa dang / gang gi bstan pa la kho mos tshangs pa'i spyod pa spyad pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa chu klung gang+gA sum cu rtsa drug gi bye ma snyed rjes su dran te/ rigs kyi bu/ de phan chad du kho mos de bzhin gshegs pa ji snyed cig bsnyen bkur ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis mkhyen to/ /rigs kyi bu/ sems dang po bskyed ma thag tu chos kyi dbyings rgyas par 'gengs pas/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni tshad med pa'o/ /rigs kyi bu/ snying rje chen po'i khongs su 'gro pa thams cad chud pas byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni tshad med pa'o/ /rigs kyi bu/ smon lam chen pos phyogs bcu'i chos kyi dbyings kyi gzhi zad zad du 'gro bas byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni tshad med pa'o/ /rigs kyi bu/ byams pa chen pos 'gro ba thams cad rgyas par 'gengs pa'i phyir/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni tshad med pa'o/ /rigs kyi bu/ byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pas zhing thams cad du bskal pa thams cad yongs su sdud pas byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni tshad med pa'o/ /rigs kyi bu/ ting nge 'dzin gyi stobs kyis byang chub sems dpa'i lam las phyir mi ldog pas byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni tshad med pa'o/ /rigs kyi bu/ gzungs kyi stobs kyis 'gro ba thams cad yongs su 'dzin pa'i gzungs kyi tshul khong du chud par byed pas/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni tshad med pa'o/ /rigs kyi bu/ ye shes snang ba'i stobs kyis dus gsum gyi ye shes kyi tshul khong du chud par byed cing / yang dag par 'dzin pas byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni tshad med pa'o/ /rigs kyi bu/ mngon par shes pa'i stobs kyis zhing thams cad du sems can rnams kyi bsam pa dang; mos pa ji lta ba bzhin du 'od kyi dra ba'i 'khor lo mngon par bsgrub pas byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni tshad med pa'o/ /rigs kyi bu/ tha dad pa yang dag par shes pa'i stobs kyis tshig gcig brjod kyang / 'gro ba thams cad shin tu tshim par byed pas byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni tshad med pa'o/ /rigs kyi bu/ lus rnam par dag pas sangs rgyas kyi zhing thams cad rang gi lus kyis rgyas par 'gengs pas byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni tshad med pa'o/ /

She said, “I remember a past state when I cultivated religious practice in the company of the buddha known as the Lamp, whom I served and from whom I received teaching. Before that was a buddha named Undefiled; I went forth from society into the tutelage of that buddha and held the wheel of teaching of that buddha. Before that was a buddha named Star; I propitiated that buddha. Before that was a buddha named Splendor of the Polar Mountain; before that was a buddha named Lotus Calyx; before that was a buddha named Illuminating; before that was a buddha named Universal Eye; before that was a buddha named Purified by Spiritual Knowledge; before that was a buddha named Diamond Navel; before that was a buddha named Deifying the Universe. Remembering back in this way lifetime to lifetime, age to age, as successive buddhas appeared in the world, I remember as many buddhas as grains of sand in thirty-six Ganges Rivers whom I propitiated, attended, served, and honored, from whom I heard spiritual teaching, under whose tutelage I carried out spiritual practice. Beyond this, only the buddhas know how many buddhas I propitiated. Enlightening beings are infinite because of the aspiration of enlightenment, because of pervading all universes; enlightening beings are infinite because of the guidance of great compassion, because of entry into the midst of all beings; enlightening beings are infinite because their great vows go to the end of all universes; enlightening beings are infinite because of great love, because of suffusing all beings with love; enlightening beings are infinite because of the practice of enlightening beings, because of entering into all ages in all lands; enlightening beings are infinite because of the power of concentration, because of not regressing on the path of enlightening beings; enlightening beings are infinite because of the power of mental command, because of attainment of the method of mystic spells able to hold the memory of truths for all beings; enlightening beings are infinite because of the power of the light of knowledge, because of retaining the realization of the knowledge and wisdom of past, present, and future; enlightening beings are infinite because of the power of mystic knowledge, because of ability to produce wheels of nets of light pleasing beings according to their mentalities; enlightening beings are infinite because of the power of intelligence, because of satisfying all beings with one utterance; enlightening beings are infinite because of purity of body, because of pervading all buddha-fields with their own body.”
nor bzang gis smras pa/ 'phags ma khyod ji srid cig na/ bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur ro/ /
Sudhana said, “Noble one, when will you realize supreme perfect enlightenment?”

smras pa/ rigs kyi bu/ 'di lta ste/ sems can gcig la dmigs shing gdul bar bya ba dang / smin par bya ba'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi sems byang chub tu skye ba ma yin te/ sems can brgya'i Asha said, “Enlightening beings do not aspire to enlightenment with the object of leading just one sentient being to perfection, nor for the sake of a hundred or a thousand or a million or a billion sentient beings, nor for any number of beings, nor for all the sentient beings in as many worlds as atoms in untold, inexpressibly vast numbers of billion-world universes. Enlightening beings aspire to enlightenment for the sake of all sentient beings in all worlds, to lead them to perfection.

Enlightening beings do not aspire to enlightenment to propitiate, honor, and attend one buddha, or even as many buddhas as atoms in untold worlds, or to propitiate, honor, and attend the lineage of buddhas in one world or the lineage of buddhas in as many worlds as atoms in untold buddha-fields. Enlightening beings do not aspire to enlightenment to purify one buddha-land, or even to purify as many buddha-lands as atoms in untold, inexpressible numbers of worlds. Enlightening beings do not aspire to enlightenment to preserve the teaching of one buddha, or even to preserve the teachings of as many buddhas as atoms in untold, inexpressible numbers of worlds. Enlightening beings do not aspire to enlightenment to enter into the diversity of vows which are the point of departure of one buddha, nor even to enter into the diversity of vows which are the points of departure of as many buddhas as atoms in untold, inexpressible numbers of buddha-fields. Enlightening beings do not aspire to enlightenment to enter into the array of the buddha-field of one buddha, nor even to enter into the arrays of buddha-fields of as many buddhas as atoms in untold, inexpressible numbers of buddha-fields. Enlightening beings do not aspire to enlightenment to take part in the assembly of one buddha, nor even to take part in the assemblies of as many buddhas as atoms in untold, inexpressible numbers of buddha-fields. Enlightening beings do not aspire to enlightenment to preserve the wheel of teaching of one buddha, nor to preserve the wheels of teaching of even as many buddhas as atoms in untold, inexpressible numbers of buddha-fields. Enlightening beings do not aspire to enlightenment to penetrate the ocean of mind of one sentient being, nor to penetrate the oceans of mind of even as many sentient beings as atoms in untold, inexpressible numbers of buddha-fields.

Enlightening beings do not aspire to enlightenment to know the sphere of faculties of one sentient being, nor to know the faculties of even as many sentient beings as atoms in untold, inexpressible numbers of buddha-fields. Enlightening beings do not aspire to enlightenment to penetrate the ocean of faculties of one sentient being, nor to penetrate the oceans of faculties of even as many sentient beings as atoms in untold, inexpressible numbers of buddha-fields. Enlightening beings do not aspire to enlightenment to enter into the succession of ages in one world, nor to enter into the succession of ages in even as many worlds as atoms in untold, inexpressible numbers of buddha-fields. Enlightening beings do not aspire to enlightenment to comprehend the continuity of actions and habits of the sentient beings in one world, nor to comprehend the continuity of actions and habits of the sentient beings even in as many worlds as atoms in untold, inexpressible numbers of buddha-fields. Enlightening beings do not aspire to enlightenment to comprehend the ocean of afflictions of sentient beings in one world, nor to comprehend the oceans of afflictions of the sentient beings even in as many worlds as atoms in untold, inexpressible numbers of buddha-fields. Enlightening beings do not aspire to enlightenment to comprehend the ocean of all actions of the beings in one world, nor even to comprehend the oceans of all actions of beings in as many worlds as atoms in untold, inexpressible numbers of buddha-fields. Enlightening beings do not aspire to enlightenment to comprehend the ocean of all modes of behavior of all beings in one world, nor even to comprehend the ocean of all modes of behavior of all beings in as many worlds as atoms in untold, inexpressible numbers of buddha-fields. Rather, enlightening beings aspire to enlightenment to lead all sentient beings without exception to full development—they wish to propitiate and honor and attend all buddhas, to propitiate and honor and attend the successions of buddhas in all worlds; they are determined to purify all buddha-lands; they strive to hold the teachings of all buddhas; they are zealously devoted to following the variety of vows which are the points of departure of all buddhas; they are determined to enter into the arrays of all buddha-lands; they wish to enter the oceans of assemblies of all buddhas; they seek to go deeply into the ocean of mind of all sentient beings; they wish to know the spheres of faculties of all sentient beings; they aspire to penetrate the ocean of faculties of all sentient beings; they wish to enter into the succession of ages in all worlds; they are inspired with courage to cut off the continuity of afflictions and habit energies of all sentient beings; their sun of knowledge rises to evaporate the ocean of afflictions caused by actions of all sentient beings; their light of wisdom becomes manifest to know the ways of behavior of all sentient beings; their cloud of great compassion gathers to extinguish the mass of fire of suffering of all sentient beings.

rigs kyi bu/ mdor na de dag la sogs pa byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa'i tshul dang / sgo grangs med pa brgya stong phrag bcu dag /byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis yongs su bsgrub par bya'o/ /rigs kyi bu/ gzhan yang 'di lta ste/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi spyod pa ni ye shes khong du chud par bya ba'i phyir/ chos thams cad la yang dag par gzhol ba'o/ /byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi spyod pa ni yongs su dag par bya ba'i phyir; zhing thams cad la yang dag par gzhol ba'o/ /rigs kyi bu/ de lta bas na kho mos ni bdag gi smon lam nam mkha'i dbyings rnam par dag pa'i mtha' gang du thug pa de'i mthas klas par shog cig /bdag gi smon lam 'jig rten gyi khams rnam par dag pa'i mtha' gang du thug pa de'i mthas klas par shog cig /bdag gi smon lam ma sems can thams cad kyi nyon mongs pa dang / bag chags kyi mtshams sbyor ba dang / bdag la nyal ba'i mtha' gang du thug pa de'i mthas klas par shog cig ces de ltar smon lam btab bo/

“To put it briefly, there are ten hundred thousand incalculable numbers of such aspects of the conduct of the practice of enlightening beings, which are to be accomplished by an enlightening being. Furthermore, the practice of enlightening beings enters into all things, for the attainment of knowledge; the practice of enlightening beings enters into all lands, to thoroughly purify them. Because of this vow of mine, when the purification of the realm of desire is finished, my commitments will be finished; when the purification of the world is finished, my commitments will be finished; when all sentient beings’ propensities to continue afflictive habits are ended, my commitments will be ended.”
smras pa/ 'phags ma/ rnam par thar pa 'di'i ming ci zhes bgyi/
Sudhana said, “What is the name of this liberation?”

smras pa/ rigs kyi bu/ rnam par thar pa 'di ni nyon mongs pa med pa/ bde ba'i rgyal mtshan zhes bya ba ste/ rigs kyi bu/ kho mos kyang byang chub sems dpa'i rnam par thar pa de gcig pu shes par zad na; byang chub sems dpa'i sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad yang dag par 'dzin pa'i phyir sems rgya mtsho dang ldan pa/ lhag pa'i bsam pa brtan pa'i phyir ri rab dang 'dra ba/ sems can thams cad kyi nyon mongs pa'i nad rab tu sos par byed pa'i phyir sman gyi rgyal po mthong na legs pa lta bu/ sems can thams cad kyi ma rig pa'i mun pa sel ba'i phyir nyi mar gyur pa /sems can thams cad kyi bsam pa'i gnas su gyur pas ba lta bu'i sems dang ldan pa/ 'gro ba thams cad kyi don byed pa'i phyir rlung du gyur pa/ sems can thams cad la ye shes kyi snang ba 'byin pa'i phyir mar mer gyur pa/ zhi ba'i sgras sangs rgyas kyi chos kyi char yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du 'debs pa'i phyir sprin du gyur pa/ bsod nams kyi 'od zer gyi dra ba rab tu 'gyed pa'i phyir zla ba lta bu/ 'gro ba thams cad yongs su bsrung ba la zhugs pa'i phyir brgya phyin lta bu de dag gi spyod pa shes pa'am/ yon tan brjod pa'am/ byang chub sems dpa'i bslab pa bsam gyis mi khyab pa smos pa'am/ byang chub sems dpa'i smon lam gyi rnam pa mtha' dang dbus med pa yongs su bstan par nus re skan/

Asha said, “This liberation is called ‘characterized by sorrowless well-being.’ I know this enlightening liberation, but how can I know the practice, tell of the virtues, convey the inconceivable enlightening skills, or show the infinite varieties of enlightening vows of the enlightening beings who have oceanic minds because of seeking all the buddha-teachings, who are like the polar mountain because of steadfast will, who are like the medicine ‘good to see’ because they free all sentient beings from the sicknesses of afflictions, who are like the sun because they eliminate the darkness of ignorance of all sentient beings, whose minds are like the earth because they are a refuge for all sentient beings, who are like air because they benefit all sentient beings, who are lamps producing the light of knowledge for all sentient beings, who are like clouds raining truth with a quiet sound, who are like the moon because they radiate a web of light beams of virtue, who are like gods because they protect all sentient beings?

song / rigs kyi bu /lho phyogs kyi rgyud 'di nyid kyi rgya mtsho rnam par rlob pa 'di na/ yul chu ba gtsang ma zhes bya ba yod de/ de na drang srong 'jigs mchog dbyangs zhes bya ba 'dug gi /de'i gan du song la dris shig dang / des rigs kyi bu khyod la byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa ston par 'gyur ro/ /
“Go south—there is a district in Samudravetalya called Nalayur where a seer named Bhishmottaranirghosha lives. Go ask him, and he will instruct you in the practice of enlightening beings.”

de nas tshong dpon gyi bu nor bzang gis/ dge bsnyen ma yid bzhin gyi rkang pa gnyis la spyi bos phyag 'tshal te/ dge bsnyen ma yid bzhin la lan brgya stong du mar g.yas phyogs su bskor ba byas nas yang dang yang bltas te/ phyag 'tshal nas ngo mchi mas gang bar ngus te/ byang chub mchog tu dkon pa rjes su sems shing / dge ba'i bshes gnyen rim gro bya ba dkon par rjes su bsdam pa dang / skyes bu dam pa dang 'phrad pa dkon pa rjes su bsam pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i dbang po thob par bya ba rjes su bsam pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i bsam pa yongs su dag pa dkon par rjes su bsam pa dang / skal ba mnyam pa'i dge ba'i bshes gnyen dang 'phrad pa dkon par rjes su bsam pa dang / byang chub tu yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du mngon par mos shing sems nges par gzhog pa dkon par rjes su bsdam pa dang / mi mnyam pa med pa'i chos kyi tshul rjes su bstan pa'i sbyor ba dkon par rjes su bsdam pa dang / sems dri ma med cing mi 'phrogs pa'i sbyor ba yang dag par bsgrub pa dka' bar rjes su bsam pa dang / thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du shugs drag po rnam par skyed pa'i chos kyi snang ba dkon par rjes su bsam pa byed cing / dge bsnyen ma yid bzhin gyi drung nas song ngo/ /

Then Sudhana left Asha, after paying his respects, reflecting on the extreme rarity of enlightening beings, on how hard it is to get on good terms with spiritual benefactors, on how very difficult it is to get to meet people of truth, on how hard it is to attain the faculties of enlightening beings, how hard it is to attain the purity of intent of enlightening beings, how hard it is to find colleagues, how hard it is to focus the mind accurately on enlightenment, how hard it is to apply the teachings leading to the state of freedom from distress, how hard it is to find ways to develop invincible goodness of mind, and how hard it is to get to see ways to quickly develop omniscience.
[drang srong 'jigs mchog dbyangs]
Bhishmottaranirghosha
