de nas tshong dpon gyi bu nor bzang / byang chub sems dpa'i gdams ngag gi rjes su song ba'i sems dang ldan pa/ byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa yongs su dag par bya ba'i rjes su song ba'i sems dang ldan pa/ byang chub sems dpa'i bsod nams kyi stobs rnam par 'phel bar bya ba'i sems dang ldan pa/ sangs rgyas blta ba'i shugs drag po rab tu snang bar byas pa'i sems dang ldan pa; chos kyi gter 'thob par bya la shugs drag po skyes pa'i sems dang ldan pa/ smon lam chen po mngon par bsgrub pa'i shugs drag po rab tu 'phel ba'i sems dang ldan pa/ chos thams cad kyi phyogs la mngon du lta ba'i sems dang ldan pa; chos kyi rang bzhin gyi 'od kyis snang bar byas pa'i sems dang ldan pa/ sgrib pa thams cad rnam par 'thor ba'i sems dang ldan pa/ chos kyi dbyings la mun pa med par rnam par lta ba'i sems dang ldan pa/ rdo rje rin po che mthu bo ches mi choms pa ltar dri ma med pa'i sems dang ldan pa/ bdud thams cad kyi dpung gis brgal bar dka' zhing thub par dka' ba'i sems dang ldan pa de/ mthar gyis yul chu ba gtsang ma ga la ba der phyin nas/ drang srong 'jigs mchog dbyangs tshol tshol ba las/

Then Sudhana, his mind on the instruction of the enlightening being, his mind on the purification of the conduct of enlightening beings, his mind developing the power of virtue of enlightening beings, his mind lit by the energy of the vision of Buddha, with mental energy arising from receiving a treasury of teaching, his mental energy increased by the undertaking of great vows, all things apparent to his mind, his mind aware of the intrinsic essence of things, his mind free from all obstructions, his mind viewing the reality realm without obscurity, his pure will indestructible, his mind invulnerable and immune to the power of all demons, gradually made his way to Nalayur and sought out the seer Bhishmottaranirghosha.

de'i tshe drang song 'jigs mchog dbyangs/ dge ba sbyang ba'i gnas shing dang / shing phran sna tshogs grangs med pa'i nags tshal mdangs dga' ba/ lo mas rgyas pa'i shing gis kun nas 'grigs pa/ rtag tu me tog rgyas pa dang ldan pa'i shing sna tshogs can/ rtag tu shing tog mang po dang ldan pa'i shing tog gi shing dang ldan pa/ nor bu rin po che sna tshogs kyi shing drung / nor bu rin po che'i spang leb kyis rtag tu gshibs pa dang ldan pa/ tsan dan dam pa'i shing kun nas rnam par bres pa/ a ga ru yid du 'ong ba'i shing las spos kyi dri rtag tu 'byung bas rab tu brgyan pa/ phyogs bzhi nas shing pa ta la rnam par mdzes par skyes pas yongs su brgyan pa/ nya gro da'i shing dbyibs yid du 'ong ba dang ldan pa/ 'dzam bu'i shing las rtag tu shing thog smin pa 'brul ba/ me tog gi tshal pad+mo dang / ut+pa la gsar du skyes pas rab tu brgyan pa zhig na 'dug 'dug ste/

At that time Bhishmottaranirghosha was sojourning in a retreat, a pleasant place with countless diverse trees and plants, shaded by the leaves of various trees, with flowering trees perpetually blooming in various colors and fruit trees perpetually bearing, the ground made of the finest jewel-fruits from various jewel trees, well distributed with great sandalwood trees, graced with fragrance constantly coming from pleasant aloes wood trees, adorned with trumpet-flower trees distributed in the four directions, with beautifully formed fig trees, with perpetually ripe fruits raining from rose apple trees, beautified by fresh water lilies and lotus blossoms.

tshong dpon gyi bu nor bzang gis/ drang srong 'jigs mchog dbyangs/ drang srong stong phrag bcus bskor cing; tsan dan gyi yal gshin tu 'brel ba'i bya skyibs shig na/ thor tshugs kyi cod pan can/ pags pa dang / gos gyon pa/ shing shun gyi smad g.yogs can; stan la 'dug pa mthong ngo/ /mthong nas kyang drang srong 'jigs mchog dbyangs ga la ba der stong ste/ phyin nas yang dag pa'i dge ba'i bshes gnyen dang phrad pa'i bsam pas/ dge ba'i bshes gnyen ni yang dag pa'i lam ston pas/ thams cad mkhyen pa nyid 'byung ba'i sgo yin par yang dag par lta/ thams cad mkhyen pa'i sa la gzhog pas/ thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ni dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyi gdams ngag la rag lus par yang dag par lta/ stobs bcu'i ye shes rin po che'i gling du skyel bas/ thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ni dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyi mnyan pa la rag lus par yang dag par lta/ stobs bcu'i ye shes snang ba yang dag par bskyed pas/ thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ni dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyi sgron mas snang bar bya ba yin par yang dag par lta/ nyam nyes med par thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi grong du phyin par byed pas/ thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi lam ni dge ba'i bshes gnyen yin par yang dag par lta/ mnyam pa dang mi mnyam pa yongs su ston pas/ thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi mar me ni dge ba'i bshes gnyen yin par yang dag par lta/ g.yang sa'i 'jigs pa thams cad med par byed pas; thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi stegs ni dge ba'i bshes gnyen yin par yang dag par lta/ byams pa chen po'i stobs kyis sim pa yongs su skyed pa'i phyir/ thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi gdugs ni dge ba'i bshes gnyen yin par yang dag par lta/ snying rje chen po yongs su bskyed pas/ thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi shugs drag po ni dge ba'i bshes gnyen yin par yang dag par lta zhing / chos kyi rang bzhin gyi tshul rab tu snang bar byed pas/ thams cad mkhyen pa nyid gsal bar mthong ba ni/ dge ba'i bshes gnyen la rag las par mthong nas/ lus thams cad kyis phab ste/ phyag byas nas langs te/ drang srong 'jigs mchog dbyangs la lan brgya stong du mar bskor ba byas nas mdun du 'dug ste/ thal mo sbyar nas/ yid du 'ong ba'i tshul gyis yid du 'ong ba'i tshig brjod de/ 'di skad ces smras so; ;'phags pa/ bdag gis bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed na/ ji ltar byang chub sems dpas byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa la bslab par bgyi ba dang / ji ltar nan tan du bgyi ba ma 'tshal te/ 'phags pa ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams la gdams ngag dang / rjes su bstan pa mdzad do/ / zhes thos na/ 'phags pa/ ji ltar byang chub sems dpas byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa la bslab par bgyi ba dang / ji ltar nan tan du bgyi ba bdag la bshad du gsol/ /

Sudhana saw the seer Bhishmottaranirghosha wearing matted hair, sitting on a seat of bark, rags, fragrant grass, and antelope skin on a layer of straw in a hut built at the foot of a sandalwood tree, surrounded by ten thousand seers. Seeing Bhishmottaranirghosha, Sudhana went up to him, and thinking he had found a true spiritual benefactor, looking upon spiritual benefactors as the door to omniscience because they guide one on the true path, looking upon omniscience as coming from the teaching of spiritual benefactors because they lead to the stage of all-knowledge, looking upon omniscience as coming from the guidance of spiritual benefactors because they lead to the jewel land of the knowledge of the ten powers, looking upon omniscience as illumined by the torch of spiritual benefactors because they produce the light of knowledge of the ten powers, looking upon spiritual benefactors as the path to omniscience leading unbroken to the city of omniscience, looking upon spiritual benefactors as lamps on the way to omniscience because they show the level and the uneven, looking upon spiritual benefactors as a bridge to omniscience because the peril of falling is eliminated, looking upon spiritual benefactors as parasols of omniscience because they produce coolness by the power of great love, looking upon spiritual benefactors as streams of omniscience because they give rise to great compassion, looking upon the satisfaction of the vision of omniscience as coming from spiritual benefactors because they illumine the principle of the inherent nature of phenomena, Sudhana paid his respects to the seer and said, “Noble one, I have set my mind on supreme perfect enlightenment, but I do not know how an enlightening being is to learn and carry out the practice of enlightening beings. I have heard you give enlightening beings instruction; please tell me how an enlightening being is to learn and carry out the practice of enlightening beings.”

de nas drang srong 'jigs mchog dbyangs kyis/ bram ze'i byis pa stong phrag bcu po de dag la bltas te/ 'di skad ces smras so/ /byis pa dag /rigs kyi bu'dis bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed de/ sems can thams cad 'jigs pa med pa la mgron du gnyer to/ /rigs kyi bu/ 'di ni sems can thams cad la phan pa dang / bde ba'i don du sta gon du gnas pa ste/ ye shes rgya mtsho mngon du gyur pa'o/ /de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad chos kyi sprin gyi char btung bar 'dod pa'o/ / chos kyi tshul rgya mtsho thams cad la 'jug par 'dod pa'o/ /ye shes kyi snang ba chen po la gnas par 'dod pa'o/ /snying rje chen po'i sprin bsdu bar 'dod pa'o/ /chos kyi char chen po mngon par dbab par 'dod pa'o/ /ye shes chen po'i zla ba 'jig rten du shar bar byas te/ nyon mongs pa'i gdung ba thams cad rab tu gzhil bar 'dod pa'o/ /sems can thams cad kyi dge ba'i rtsa ba rnam par spel bar 'dod pa'o/ /

The seer Bhishmottaranirghosha looked at the ten thousand people surrounding him and said, “This youth has set his mind on supreme perfect enlightenment and has invited all sentient beings to fearlessness. He is aiming for the welfare and happiness of all beings; he is facing the ocean of knowledge; he wants to spread the clouds of teaching of all buddhas; he wants to plunge into the ocean of all principles of the Teaching; he wants to live by the light of knowledge; he wants to bring the cloud of great compassion near; he wants to cause the rain of the great Teaching to shower; he wants to have the moon of great knowledge rise in the world and extinguish the burning of all afflictions; he wants to develop the roots of goodness of all sentient beings.”

de nas bram ze'i byis pa stong phrag bcu po de dag gis/ me tog dri zhim la yid du 'ong zhing / kha dog sna tshogs dang ldan pa mang pos/ tshong dpon gyi bu nor bzang la gtor to/ /mngon par gtor to/ /rab tu gtor to/ /mngon par phyag 'tshal te/ rab tu btud de phyag 'tshal nas/ g.yas phyogs su bskor ba byas te/ tshig 'di skad du brjod do/ /'di ni sems can thams cad yongs su skyob par 'gyur ro/ /sems can dmyal ba'i sdug bsngal thams cad rab tu zhi bar bgyid par 'gyur ro/ /byol song gi skye gnas kyi lam gyi rgyud thams cad rnam par gcod par 'gyur ro/ /gshin rje'i 'jig rten gyi lam gyi rgyud thams cad rnam par bzlog par 'gyur ro/ /mi khom pa'i sgo thams cad gcod par 'gyur ro/ /sred pa'i rgya mtsho yongs su skem par 'gyur ro/ /sred pa'i 'ching ba gcod par 'gyur ro/ /sdug bsngal gyi phung po rnam par bzlog par 'gyur ro/ /ma rig pa'i mun pa sel bar 'gyur ro/ /bsod nams kyi khor yug gis 'jig rten yongs su bskor bar 'gyur ro/ /ye shes rin po che'i 'byung gnas yongs su ston par 'gyur ro/ /ye shes kyi nyi ma 'char bar bgyid par 'gyur ro/ /chos kyi mig rnam par sbyong bar 'gyur ro/ /'jig rten rnams la mnyam pa dang / mi mnyam pa yang dag par ston par 'gyur ro/ /

Then those ten thousand people scattered beautiful fragrant flowers over Sudhana, bowed to him, and circled him in respect, and said, “This person will be a savior; he will extinguish all the hellish torments of all beings, he will stop all brutish ways, he will get rid of the ways of the underworld, he will shut the door of all conditions inopportune for enlightenment, he will evaporate the ocean of craving, he will sever the bonds of craving, he will remove the mass of suffering, he will dispel the darkness of ignorance, he will surround the world with mountains of virtue, he will reveal the mine of jewels of knowledge, he will cause the sun of knowledge to rise, he will clarify the eye of truth, he will show what is good and bad in the world.”

de nas drang srong 'jigs mchog dbyangs kyis/ byis pa de dag la 'di skad ces smras so/ /byis pa dag /gang gis bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed pa de ni /byang chub sems dpa'i spyad pa spyod pa'i tshe/ sems can thams cad kyi bde ba rab tu bskyed de/ rim gyis thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyang 'thob par 'gyur ro/ /byis pa dag /rigs kyi bu'dis ni/ bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed pa ste/ de bas na 'di ni/ sangs rgyas kyi yon tan thams cad kyis yongs su sbyong bar 'gyur ro/ /

Then the seer Bhishmottaranirghosha said to those people, “Whoever aspires to supreme perfect enlightenment promotes the happiness of all sentient beings, carrying out the practice of enlightening beings, and will eventually attain omniscience. This youth has set his heart on supreme perfect enlightenment; he will fulfill the stage of complete buddhahood.”

de nas drang srong 'jigs mchog dbyangs kyis/ tshong dpon gyi bu nor bzang la 'di skad ces smras so/ /rigs kyi bu/ kho bo ni byang chub sems dpa'i rnam par thar pa gzhan gyis mi thub pa'i rgyal mtshan thob pa'o/ /nor bzang gis smras pa/ byang chub sems dpa'i rnam par thar pa gzhan gyis mi thub pa 'di'i yul ji lta bu zhig mchis/

Then the seer said to Sudhana, “I have attained an enlightening liberation called ‘unsurpassed banner.’”
Sudhana said, “What is the scope of this liberation?”

de nas drang srong 'jigs mchog dbyangs kyis lag pa g.yas pa brkyang ste/ tshong dpon gyi bu nor bzang gi mgo la byugs nas/ lag pa g.yas pas bzung ngo/ /tshong dpon gyi bu nor bzang la drang srong 'jigs mchog dbyangs kyis lag pa g.yas pas bzung ma thag tu de'i mod la/ tshong dpon gyi bu nor bzang gis phyogs bcur sangs rgyas kyi zhing brgya stong phrag bcu'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed kyi sangs rgyas kyi zhing mthong bar gyur te/ de dag gi de bzhin gshegs pa sangs rgyas kyi zhing brgya stong phrag bcu'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed kyi zhabs kyi drung na/ bdag nyid 'dug pa shes par gyur to; ;sangs rgyas kyi zhing de dag kyang / rnam pa grangs med par rnam par dag pa'i rgyan dang ldan par mthong ngo/ /de dag na'ang de bzhin gshegs pa'i 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor rgya mtsho kha dog sna tshogs can/ rgyan rnam pa tha dad pa dang ldan pa dag 'khod par mthong ngo/ /'khor gyi dkyil 'khor rgya mtsho de dag na'ang de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku mtshan dang dpe byad bzang po 'bar bas brgyan pa dag bzhugs pa mthong ngo/ /de dag las kyang tshig dang yi ge gcig las kyang / phyir phyogs pa med par chos bstan pa nyan to/ /de bzhin gshegs pa'i chos kyi 'khor lo de dag kyang phan tshun ma 'dres par yang dag par 'dzin to/ /chos kyi sprin gyi char sems can gyi bsam pa sna tshogs la rab ba pa de dag kyang yang dag par 'dzin to/ /de bzhin gshegs pa de dag gi sngon gyi smon lam/ mos pa sna tshogs kyi stobs kyis rnam par sbyangs pa rgya mtsho la yang zhugs so; ;sangs rgyas kyi yang dag par bsdu ba smon lam sna tshogs rgya mtshos rnam par dag pa rgya mtsho de dag la'ang zhugs so/ /sangs rgyas kyi sku mdog sems can gyi bsam pa ji lta ba bzhin du tshim par 'gyur bar rnam par dmigs pa de dag kyang mthong ngo/ /sangs rgyas kyi 'od zer gyi dra ba 'dod chags dang bral ba sna tshogs kyis rnam par dag pa'i rgyan gyi dkyil 'khor de dag kyang mthong ngo/ /sangs rgyas kyi stobs de dag la'ang ye shes snang ba bsgribs pa med pa dang ldan pas zhugs so/ /de ltar byang chub sems dpa'i rnam par thar pa gzhan gyis mi thub pa'i rgyal mtshan gyi ye shes kyi 'od kyis snang bar gyur pa/ ting nge 'dzin gyi rnam par snang mdzad kyi snying po snang ba rab tu thob pa/ ting nge 'dzin ye shes mi zad pa'i rnam par thar pa dang ldan pa/ gzungs kyi sgo snang ba/ phyogs kun gyi dra ba rab tu thob pa/ gzungs kyi sgo rdo rje'i snying pos sems rab tu gsal bar byas pa/ ting nge 'dzin gyi ye shes brtsegs pa rnam par phye ba'i yul la rnam par phye ba rab tu thob pa/ shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la rnam par spyod pa/ gzhi kun nas rnam par brgyan pa'i snying po yul du gyur pa/ ting nge 'dzin gyi snang ba sangs rgyas nam mkha'i snying po'i dkyil 'khor la rab tu zhugs pa/ ting nge 'dzin sangs rgyas thams cad kyi chos kyi 'khor lo'i mu khyud kyis sems rab tu snang bar byas pa/ ting nge 'dzin gyi snang ba dus gsum gyi ye shes rin po che mi zad pa'i dkyil 'khor la rab tu brtson pa des/ de bzhin gshegs pa la la'i zhabs kyi drung du ni nyin zhag gcig lon par shes so/ /la lar ni nyin zhag bdun lon pa snyam/ la lar ni zla ba phyed lon pa snyam/ la lar ni zla ba gcig lon pa snyam/ la lar ni lo gcig lon pa snyam/ la lar ni lo brgya lon pa snyam/ la lar ni lo stong lon pa snyam/ la lar ni lo brgya phrag stong lon pa snyam/ la lar ni lo bye ba lon pa snyam/ la lar ni lo bye ba brgya lon pa snyam/ la lar ni lo byed ba stong lon pa snyam/ la lar ni lo bye ba brgya phrag stong lon pa snyam/ la lar ni lo bye ba khrag khrig lon pa snyam/ la lar ni bskal pa phyed lon pa snyam/ la lar ni bskal pa gcig lon pa snyam/ la lar ni bskal pa brgya lon pa snyam; la lar ni bskal pa stong lon pa snyam/ la lar ni bskal pa brgya phrag stong lon pa snyam/ la lar ni bskal pa bye ba lon pa snyam/ la lar ni bskal pa bye ba phrag brgya lon pa snyam/ la lar ni bskal pa bye ba phrag stong lon pa snyam/ la lar ni bskal pa bye ba brgya phrag stong lon pa snyam/ la lar ni bskal pa bye ba phrag khrig brgya phrag stong lon pa snyam byed pa nas/ de bzhin gshegs pa la la'i zhabs kyi drung du ni/ bskal pa brjod du med pa'i yang brjod du med pa snyed lon par gyur pa snyam byed pa nas/ de bzhin gshegs pa la la'i zhabs kyi drung du ni/ bskal pa 'dzam bu'i gling gi rdul shin tu phra ba snyed lon pa snyam byed pa nas/ bskal pa sangs rgyas kyi zhing brjod du med pa'i yang brjod du med pa'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed lon pa snyam byed par gyur to/ /

Bhishmottaranirghosha stretched forth his right hand and rubbed Sudhana’s head, then took Sudhana by the right hand. At that moment Sudhana saw in the ten directions as many buddha-lands as atoms in ten hundred thousand buddha-lands, and in them he perceived himself at the feet of as many buddhas as atoms in ten hundred thousand buddha-lands. He also saw the innumerable features in the pure adornments of those buddha-lands, and he saw the various arrays of the oceans of audiences surrounding the buddhas therein. He also saw the radiant mass of the marks and embellishments of the buddhas’ bodies in the midst of the congregations. He also heard teaching from the buddhas without missing a single word, and he remembered the cycles of teachings of those buddhas in order without confusion, and he received the rain of those clouds of teaching as they showered on beings of various mentalities. He also entered the oceans of past vows of those buddhas, purified by zealous application of various kinds. He also entered oceans of past attainments of the buddhas, purified by oceans of various vows. He also saw the forms of buddhas manifested so as to please all sentient beings according to their mentalities. He also saw the nets of light rays of the buddhas, their various cool, pure halos. He also entered into those buddhas’ powers by following the light of unobstructed knowledge. He seemed to be with one buddha for a day and a night, with another for seven days and nights, another for a fortnight, another for a month, another for a year, another for a century, another for a millennium, another for a hundred millennia, another for a million years, another for a hundred million years, another for a billion years, another for a hundred billion years, another for a trillion years, another for half an eon, another for an eon, another for a hundred eons, another for a thousand eons, another for a hundred thousand eons, another for a million eons, another for a hundred million eons, another for a billion eons, another for a hundred billion eons, another for a trillion eons, up to untold, inexpressible numbers of eons, or as many eons as atoms in the continent, or as many eons as atoms in untold buddha-lands. Thus did he perceive himself with the buddhas, illumined by the light of knowledge of the liberation “unsurpassed banner,” imbued with the light of the concentration filled with sunlike radiance, reaching absorption in liberation of endless knowledge, imbued with the light of the mystic formulation of the structure of the universe, his mind illumined by the mystic formulation of the indestructible sphere, abiding in absorption in the realm of well-ordered bodies of knowledge, intent on the state of transcendent wisdom of the path of adornment of all planes, illumined by the light of concentration on the sphere containing the space of the enlightened, his mind illuminated by concentration on the circumference of the wheel of teaching of all buddhas, imbued with the light of absorption in the inexhaustible sphere of jewels of knowledge of past, present, and future.

de nas drang srong 'jigs mchog dbyangs kyis/ tshong dpon gyi bu nor bzang btang ba dang / des yang bdag drang srong 'jigs mchog dbyangs kyi mdun na 'dug par shes par gyur to/ /de la drang srong 'jigs mchog dbyangs kyis smras pa/ rigs kyi bu/ dran mod/ smras pa/ 'phags pa/ dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyi byin gyi rlabs kyis dran no/ /

Then the seer let go of Sudhana, who found himself once again standing before the seer Bhishmottaranirghosha. The seer said, “Do you remember?” Sudhana said, “I remember, noble one, by the empowerment of the spiritual benefactor.”

smras pa/ rigs kyi bu kho bos ni/ byang chub sems dpa'i rnam par thar pa gzhan gyis mi thub pa'i rgyal mtshan 'di shes par zad na/ byang chub sems dpa' 'gro ba thams cad las khyad par du 'phags pa'i ye shes mngon par shes pa dang ldan pa'i ting nge 'dzin thob pa/ dus thams cad du 'khor lo bskor ba/ sangs rgyas kyi mtshan dang ye shes mngon par sgrub pa la mkhas pa/ de bzhin gshegs pa byung ba'i nyi ma la rnam par dmigs pa'i rgyan rab tu 'god pa/ dus gsum gyi yul skad cig gcig gis ye shes su yang dag par sdud pa/ 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du lus shin tu rnam par bkram pa/ chos kyi dbyings thams cad la/ ye shes snang ba'i rang bzhin dang ldan pa sems can thams cad kyi bsam pa ji lta ba bzhin du mngon sum du mngon par langs pa/ sems can gyi bsam pa ji lta ba bzhin du spyod pas rnam par dpyod pa dang mthun pa'i tshul dang ldan pa 'dod pa bzhin du kun tu snang zhing dri ma med la/ 'od dang ldan pa'i ye shes kyi dkyil 'khor rnam par dag pa de dag gi spyod pa shes pa'am/ yon tan brjod pa'am/ smon lam gyi khyad par smos pa'am/ zhing gi mngon par 'du bya ba shes pa'am/ ye shes kyi yul la 'jug par bya ba'am/ ting nge 'dzin gyi spyod yul gyi rjes 'brang bar bya ba'am/ rdzu 'phrul dang rnam par 'phrul pa la 'jug par bya ba'am/ rnam par thar pa'i khyu mchog gi mthu phyung ba dang / rnam par rtse ba'i rjes su 'brang bar bya ba'am/ lus rnam par phye ba'i mtshan ma gzung bar bya ba'am/ dbyangs kyi dkyil 'khor rnam par dag pa brjod pa'am/ ye shes kyi snang ba rab tu bstan par nus re skan/

Bhishmottaranirghosha said, “I know this enlightening liberation known as the unsurpassed invincible banner, but how can I know the practice, or tell the virtues, or accurately express the excellence of vows, or know the structure of the lands, or plunge into the sphere of knowledge, or enter into the realm of concentration, or attain the mystic powers, or attain to the freedom of liberation, or take up the various physical manifestations, or reveal the purity of voice, or show the light of knowledge of the enlightening beings who have attained absorption in the mystic knowledge supreme among all creatures, who are masters of all wheels of time, who are skilled in achievement of the knowledge of the characteristics of buddhas, who are supernal manifestations of the incarnation of the buddhas, who have comprehended the knowledge of all objects of past, present, and future as of one characteristic, whose bodies are distributed throughout all worlds, who are embodiments of knowledge in which all realms of reality are revealed, who appear to all sentient beings according to their inclinations, who benefit sentient beings according to their ways of thought and action, who glow with a brightness that illumines everywhere, who have purified the sphere of pure, vast, radiant knowledge?

song / rigs kyi bu/ lho phyogs kyi rgyud 'di nyid na yul yongs su tshol ba zhes bya ba yod de/ de na bram ze rgyal ba'i drod kyi skye mched ces bya ba 'dug gi /de'i gan du song la/ ji ltar byang chub sems dpas byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa la bslab par bya ba dang / ji ltar nan tan du bya ba dris shing / /
“Go south to a land called Ishana, where there lives a priest named Jayoshmayatana. Go ask him how an enlightening being is to learn and apply the practice of enlightening beings.”

de nas tshong dpon gyi bu nor bzang dga' rangs te/ mgu zhing nyams bde la tshim zhing yid bde ba skyes nas/ drang srong 'jigs mchog dbyangs kyi rkang pa gnyis la spyi bos phyag 'tshal te/ drang srong 'jigs mchog dbyangs la/ lan brgya stong du mar g.yas phyogs su bskor ba byas nas/ yang dang yang bltas te/ drang srong 'jigs mchog dbyangs kyi drung nas song ngo// //
Then Sudhana, pleased, uplifted, transported, overjoyed, happy, paid respects to the seer Bhishmottaranirghosha and departed, looking back at him again and again.
bam po dgu bcu rtsa gsum pa/

drop.crumb: rgyal ba'i drod kyi skye mched

fuse.drop: [bram ze rgyal ba'i drod kyi skye mched]
Jayoshmayatana

de nas tshong dpon gyi bu nor bzang / byang chub sems dpa'i rnam par thar pa gzhan gyis mi thub pa'i rgyal mtshan gyi ye shes kyis snang bar byas pa/ sangs rgyas kyi yul gyi rnam par 'phrul pa bsam gyis mi khyab pa la mngon sum du rnam par spyod pa/ byang chub sems dpa'i rnam par thar pa bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i mngon sum gyi ye shes kyis mngon par shes pa/ byang chub sems dpa'i ting nge 'dzin bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i ye shes kyis sems snang bar gyur pa/ dus thams cad du yang dag par 'jug pa'i ting nge 'dzin ye shes snang ba rab tu thob pa/ 'du shes kyi rnam pa thams cad la yang dag par 'jug pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi yul gyis snang bar gyur pa/ 'gro ba thams cad las khyad par du 'phags pa dang ldan pa'i ye shes snang ba thob pa thams cad kyi rjes su song ba'i spyod yul la rnam par spyod pa mngon du gyur pa/ gnyis su rnam par rtog pa med pas mnyam pa nyid du bstan pa'i ye shes lhur len pa/ dmigs pa thams cad la rab tu 'dal ba'i ye shes snang ba dang ldan pa/ mnyam pa thams cad la mngon du gyur pa'i bzod pa rnam par dag pa la mos pa'i mdzod la mkhas pa/ rang bzhin gyi chos la bzod pa khong du chud pa'i ye shes mngon par shes pa dang ldan pa/ byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa'i rang bzhin bsgom pa dang mi 'bral ba'i sems dang ldan pa/ thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi shugs drag po las phyir mi ldog pa'i sems dang ldan pa/ stobs bcu'i ye shes snang ba'i 'od rab tu thob pa/ chos kyi dbyings brjod pa la mngon par mos pas ngoms pa med pa'i sems dang ldan pa/ thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la rnam par spyod pa'i spyod yul la 'jug pa khong du chud pa'i sems dang ldan pa/ byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa'i rgyan mtha' yas pa mngon par bsgrub pa'i sems dang ldan pa/ byang chub sems dpa'i smon lam gyi dkyil 'khor mtha' yas pa rnam par spyad pa'i sems dang ldan pa/ 'jig rten gyi khams kyi dra ba mi zad pa khong du chud pa'i ye shes mtha' dang dbus med pa mngon du gyur pa'i sems dang ldan pa/ sems can rgya mtsho mtha' yas pa yongs su smin par bya ba dang gdul bar bya ba la zhum pa med pa'i sems dang ldan pa des/ byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa'i yul mtha' yas pa la yang dag par blta ba dang / 'jig rten gyi khams kyi rgyud rnam pa tha dad pa mtha' yas pa la yang dag par blta ba dang / 'jig rten gyi khams rnam par phye ba sna tshogs mtha' yas pa la yang dag par blta ba dang / 'jig rten gyi khams mtha' yas pa dmigs pa phra ba dang / yangs pa'i khongs su chud par bya ba la yang dag par blta ba dang / 'jig rten gyi khams kyi gzhi mtha' yas pa'i ming gi dra ba sna tshogs yang dag par blta ba dang / 'jig rten gyi khams su rnam par spyad pa rnam par gdags pa mtha' yas pa'i kun rdzob rnam pa tha dad pa la yang dag par blta ba dang / sems can gyi mos pa sna tshogs mtha' yas pa la yang dag par blta ba dang / sems can rnam par phye ba'i rnam pa tha dad pa mtha' yas pa la yang dag par blta ba dang / sems can mtha' yas pa yongs su smin par bya ba dang / gdul ba khong du chud par bya ba la yang dag par blta ba dang / sems can dang / phyogs dang / dus mtha' yas pa'i ming gi rnam pa sna tshogs la yang dag par blta ba dang / dge ba'i bshes gnyen mngon du bya ba byed cing / mthar gyis yul tshol ba dang ldan pa gang na ba dang / bram ze rgyal ba'i drod kyi skye mched ga la ba der phyin to/ /

Then, illumined by the light of knowledge of the enlightening liberation “unsurpassed banner,” directly witnessing the inconceivable miracles of the realm of buddhas, endowed with mystic knowledge directly aware of the inconceivable liberation of enlightening beings, his mind illumined by the inconceivable knowledge of concentration of enlightening beings, imbued with the light of knowledge of concentration comprehending all times at once, illumined by the realm of concentration comprehending that all is in perception, having attained the light of the highest knowledge in all worlds, approaching the state whose scope reaches everywhere in past, present, and future, intent on the knowledge showing nondual equality in differentiation, with the light of knowledge extending to all objects, with skillfulness rich in zeal for the purification of tolerance in the face of people’s beliefs, having attained the light of certain knowledge of acceptance of things in terms of their inherent nature, his mind constantly involved in enlightening beings’ practice of mystic knowledge reaching everywhere, which is meditation on inherent nature, his mind progressing rapidly and irreversibly toward omniscience, illumined by the lightning of knowledge of the ten powers, his mind tirelessly seeking the sound of the reality realm, determined to enter the realm of omniscience, intent on accomplishing the infinite array of practices of enlightening beings and purifying the infinite sphere of great vows of enlightening beings, his mind directed toward endlessly ongoing knowledge of the infinite network of all worlds, his mind not shrinking from guiding infinite beings to complete development, beholding the infinite sphere of practice of enlightening beings, seeing the variety of conditions in infinite worlds, seeing the variety of differentiations of infinite worlds, seeing infinite worlds within microcosms and macrocosms, seeing the variety of the webs of perceptions and conceptions on which infinite worlds are based, seeing the variety of conventional terminology in infinite worlds, seeing the variety of interests of infinite beings, seeing the variety of differentiations of infinite beings, seeing the following of developmental teachings of infinite beings, seeing the variety in perceptions of place and time of infinite beings, Sudhana, his attention on spiritual benefactors, gradually made his way to the priest Jayoshmayatana in the land of Ishana.

de'i tshe bram ze rgyal ba'i drod kyi skye mched thams cad mkhyen pa nyid bsgrub pa'i gzhir byas shing dka' thub drag po la spyod de/ de'i phyogs bzhi nas me'i phung po ri rab tsam du che ba bus pa dang / ri shin tu mtho ba'i g.yang sa'i lam gyi rgyud spu gri'i sos gshibs pas 'khod par snang ngo/ /

At that time the priest was practicing an ascetic exercise of enduring fierce heat, with his mind on omniscience; on four sides were huge bonfires like mountains ablaze. Rising above appeared a great mountain precipice, a razor-edge path.

de nas tshong dpon gyi bu nor bzang gis/ bram ze rgyal ba'i drod kyi mched kyi rkang pa gnyis la spyi bos phyag 'tshal te; mdun du 'dug nas thal mo sbyar te/ 'di skad ces smras so/ /'phags pa/ bdag gis bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed na/ ji ltar byang chub sems dpas byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa la spyad pa dang / ji ltar nan tan du bgyi ba ma 'tshal te/ 'phags pa ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams la gdams ngag dang / rjes su bstan pa mdzad do zhes bdag gis thos na/ 'phags pa/ ji ltar byang chub sems dpas byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa la bslab par bgyi ba dang / ji ltar nan tan du bgyi ba bdag la bshad du gsol/

Sudhana went up, paid his respects to the priest, and said, “Noble one, I have set my mind on supreme perfect enlightenment, but I do not know how an enlightening being is to learn and carry out the practice of enlightening beings. I hear you give enlightening beings instruction; please tell me how to learn and carry out the practice of enlightening beings.”
des smras pa/ rigs kyi bu/ song la spu gri'i so dang ra ba'i ri 'di la 'dzegs te/ me'i 'obs 'dir mchongs shig dang / des khyod kyi byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa yongs su dag par 'gyur ro zhes nas/
The priest said, “Climb this razor-edge-path mountain and jump from there into the fire—thus will your enlightening practice be purified.”

tshong dpon gyi bu nor bzang'di snyam du sems par gyur te/ mi khom pa brgyad las rnam par ldog pa yang shin tu dkon/ mir 'gyur te/ khom pa phun sum tshogs shing rnam par dag pa yang shin tu dkon/ sangs rgyas 'byung ba yang shin tu dkon/ dbang po nyams su med pa yang shin tu dkon/ sangs rgyas kyi chos thos pa yang shin tu dkon/ skyes bu dam pa dang phrad pa yang shin tu dkon/ yang dag pa'i dge ba'i bshes gnyen yang shin tu dkon/ yang dag pa'i tshul rjes su bstan pas legs par sdud pa yang shin tu dkon/ yang dag par 'tsho bar bya ba yang shin tu dkon/ mi'i 'jig rten na chos dang gnyen ba'i chos la nan tan byed pa yang shin tu dkon na/ de skad zer zhing bdag gi dge ba'i bar chad la zhugs la/ de ltar bdag gi srog gcad par brtson pa 'di bdud dam zhig ma yin nam/ bdud kyis byin gyis brlabs pa'am/ bdud kyi ris su gtogs pa'am/ dge ba'i bshes gnyen ltar brdzus pa'am/ byang chub sems dpa' la mi gcags pa byed pa zhig ma yin grang / bdag gi thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la gegs byed par 'dod pa zhig ma yin grang / bdag lam gol ba ngan par gzhug par 'dod pa zhig ma yin grang / bdag gis sangs rgyas kyi chos khong du chud par bya ba'i chos kyi sgo la gegs byed pa zhig ma yin grang snyam nas/

At that point Sudhana thought, “It is hard to avoid the situations that are inopportune for enlightenment; it is hard to get to be human; it is hard to remove error and doubt about the right opportunity; it is hard to find a buddha in the world; it is hard to have all one’s faculties in order; it is hard to get to hear the truth; it is hard to meet people of truth; it is hard to find genuine spiritual benefactors; it is hard to get genuine guidance and instruction; it is hard to live right in the human world; it is hard to carry out truth in all respects. Might this not be a demon, or someone possessed by a demon, or a cohort of the devil, or an imitation spiritual teacher, or a false enlightening being, who has undertaken to impede my roots of goodness, who is out to destroy my life? Does he not want to prevent me from reaching omniscience? Does he not want to lead me on a wrong path? Does he not want to prevent me from attaining buddhahood?”

de de ltar sems shing yid la byed pa'i tshe/ tshangs pa stong phrag bcu steng gi bar snang la gnas te/ 'di skad ces 'dzer to/ /rigs kyi bu/ de lta bu'i sems mi brtan par ma byed cig /rigs kyi bu/ 'phags pa 'di ni/ ting nge 'dzin rdo rje 'od 'phro ba'i snang ba rab tu thob pa ste/ brtson 'grus ldog pa med pa'o/ /brtsams pa chen po mthar dbyung ba la zhugs pa'o/ /'gro ba thams cad kyi sred pa'i rlan bskam pa la mngon par brtson pa'o/ /lta ba'i rnam pa dang / dra ba thams cad gtub pa la brtson pa'o/ /nyon mongs pa'i lcag lcig thams cad zad par bsreg pa la sta gon du gnas pa'o/ /mi khom mi shes pa'i bas mtha'i dgon pa thams cad snang bar bya ba la brtson pa'o/ /sems can thams cad kyi rga shi'i g.yang sa dang / 'jigs pa rnam par bzlog pa la yi dam brtan pa'o/ /dus gsum gyi mun pa bsal pa la mngon par brtson pa'o/ /chos thams cad kyi 'od zer dgye ba la zhugs pa'o/ / rigs kyi bu/ 'phags pa 'di dka' thub lngas yongs su gdung ba mdzad pa'i tshe/ tshangs pa ji snyed cig mkhan po dang / dbang sgyur ba dang / 'jig rten thams cad kyi gtso bor rang rang rlom zhing / sems pa blta ba'i rnam pa sna tshogs la mngon par zhen pa de dag thams cad/ 'phags pa 'di dka' thub dang / brtul zhugs kyi thugs dam gyi mthus/ rang rang gi gnas na bag dga' ba med cing / de dag bsam gtan gyi ro dga' ba myong ba med pas/ 'phags pa 'di'i drung du 'dong ngo/ /de dag phyin pa dang / 'phags pa 'di'i rdzu 'phrul gyi byin dang / drag shul kyi dka' thub dang / brtul zhugs kyi sa zil gyis mnan te/ lta ba'i rnam pa thams cad rnam par bzlog pa dang / nga rgyal dang; rlom sems thams cad rab tu spang ba'i phyir chos ston to/ /'gro ba thams cad la byams pa chen po dang / snying rje chen pos khyab par bya ba dang / byang chub kyi bsam pa brtan par bya ba dang / byang chub tu sems bskyed pa shin tu yangs par bya ba dang / sangs rgyas thams cad yang dag par blta ba la mngon par brtson par bya ba dang / sangs rgyas kyi gsung gi dkyil 'khor thob par bya ba yongs su rdzogs par bya ba dang / thams cad du grag pa'i sangs rgyas kyi dbyangs la thogs pa med cing / bsgribs pa med par bya ba'i phyir chos ston to/ /

While he was involved in these thoughts, ten thousand Brahma gods appeared in the sky and said to him, “Do not get fixed on such thoughts. This sage has attained the light of the concentration of adamantine flame. He has unrelenting energy and has begun the great undertaking of salvation. He has set out to end the emotional attachments of all sentient beings. He is striving to dissolve the webs of all views. He is determined to burn up the deadwood of all afflictions and their actions. He is working to shed light in the wilderness of all kinds of knowledge that is not conducive to enlightenment. He is resolved upon eliminating all beings’ fears of old age and death. He is intent on dispersing the darkness of past, present, and future. He has undertaken to shine beams of light of all truths. As he mortifies himself with four fires under the blazing sun, even the Brahma gods, who think themselves creators and lords and supreme beings, and are engrossed in various views, do not take pleasure in their own states because of the light given off by this priest’s peerless practice of heat austerity. Not enjoying the pleasure of meditation, they come to the priest, and he overwhelms them by mystic power, and through fierce austerity teaches them to get rid of all their views and destroy all pride and arrogance. He also teaches them so that they may suffuse all worlds with great love and compassion, make their will for enlightenment firm, enlarge their determination for enlightenment, turn to the vision of all buddhas, fully receive the voice of the buddhas, and hear the voice of buddhas everywhere without resistance or obstruction.”

bdud stong phrag bcu yang steng gi bar snang la 'khod nas/ lha rdzas kyi nor bu rin po ches mngon par gtor te/ 'di skad ces 'dzer to/ /rigs kyi bu/ 'phags pa 'di dka' thub lngas yongs su gdung ba mdzad pa'i tshe/ 'od 'phro ba'i phung po 'di las snang ba chen po byung zhing / kho bo cag gi khyim dang / lus dang / rgyan gyi longs spyod thams cad zil gyis gnon to/ /de'i phyir kho bo cag kyang so so'i gnas gnas na bag dga' ba med pas 'khor dang bcas te/ 'phags pa 'di'i drung du 'dong ngo/ /kho bo cag 'di'i drung du phyin nas kyang / 'phags pa 'di ni kho bo cag la ci nas kyang / rang rang gi sems sor chud nas byang chub tu sems bskyed de/ bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub las phyir mi ldog par 'gyur ba/ de lta de ltar chos ston to/ /

Ten thousand demons also stood in the sky, showered celestial jewels, and said, “The light emitted from the flames used by this priest in his heat mortification obscures our abodes, our ornaments, and our paraphernalia. Terrified, we and our cohorts go to the priest, who teaches in such a way that, coming to ourselves and getting back our right minds, we aspire to enlightenment and become irreversible on the way to supreme perfect enlightenment.”

dbang sgyur gyi lha'i rgyal po stong phrag bcus kyang / lha rdzas kyi me tog gis mngon par gtor te/ 'di skad ces 'dzer to/ /rigs kyi bu/ 'phags pa 'di dka' thub lngas yongs su gdung ba byed pa'i tshe/ kho bo cag kyang rang rang gi gnas na dga' ba med de/ de ltar bdag cag kyang rang rang gi skye bo'i 'khor dang bcas te/ 'di'i drung du 'dong ngo/ /bdag cag drung du phyin pa dang / 'di ni bdag cag la rang rang gi sems la dbang bsgyur ba thob par bya ba'i phyir chos ston to/ /nyon mongs pa thams cad la dbang bsgyur ba thob par bya ba dang / bsam pa ji lta ba bzhin du skye ba la dbang bsgyur ba thob par bya ba dang / las kyi sgrib pa thams cad rnam par dag pa'i dbang rab tu thob par bya ba dang / snyoms par 'jug pa thams cad la dbang bsgyur ba thob par bya ba dang / yo byad la dbang ba'i rgyan yongs su dag par bya ba dang / bsam pa ji lta ba bzhin du tshe la dbang bsgyur ba thob par bya ba'i phyir chos ston to/ /

Also, ten thousand controlling gods, scattering celestial flowers, said, “While he is mortifying himself with four fires under the fiery sun, we find no pleasure in our own abodes. We and our cohorts go to him, and he teaches us so that we attain control of our own minds, control of afflictions, ability to be born in any state we wish, power to clear away obstructions caused by action, mastery of all concentrations, control of paraphernalia to purify our arrangements, and control conforming to our wishes.”

rab 'phrul dga'i lha'i rgyal po stong phrag bcu yang / steng gi bar snang la 'khod de/ lha rdzas kyi glu yang dag par sbyar ba'i nga ro snyan pa'i dbyangs bsgrags te/ mchod pa byas nas 'di skad ces 'dzer to/ /rigs kyi bu/ 'phags pa 'di dka' thub lngas yongs su gdung ba mdzad pa'i tshe/ me'i phung po 'di las de dang 'dra ba'i 'od byung zhing kho bo cag gi gzhal med khang 'di dag rnam par dag ste/ gsal ba dang / 'od shin tu dang bar 'gyur ro/ /rgyan 'di dag dang / lha'i bu mo 'di dag kyang / rnam par dag cing gsal la 'od shin tu dang bar 'gyur ro/ /de bas na bdag cag kyang lha'i bu dang / lha mo'i tshogs kyi 'khor dang bcas par/ 'dod pa la dga' bar tshor ba med de/ 'dod pa'i bde ba la mngon par dga' ba med pas/ lus dang sems sim par gyur nas/ 'phags pa 'di'i drung du 'dod pa yin te/ 'phags pa 'di ni/ bdag cag de ltar phyin pa rnams la sems rnam par dag par bya ba'i phyir chos ston to/ /sems kyi 'od dang bar bya ba dang / sems shin tu dag par bya ba dang / sems las su rung bar bya ba dang / sems kyi dga' ba yongs su bskyed pa dang / stobs bcu'i ye shes 'thob pa rnam par dag par bya ba dang / chos kyi shugs chen po rnam par 'phel bar bya ba dang / sangs rgyas kyi sku tshad med pa mngon par bsgrub pa'i phyir lus rnam par dag par bya ba dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i gsung thob par bya ba'i phyir ngag rnam par dag par bya ba dang / thams cad mkhyen pa nyid rab tu thob par bya bar sems rnam par dag par bya ba'i phyir chos ston to/ /

Ten thousand gods of pleasant emanations also stood in the sky, presented sweet sounds of celestial music and song, and said, “The fire of the priest is producing such light that our palaces are glowing, being purified and becoming more radiant, and so are the decorations and nymphs here. We and our cohorts of godlings and nymphs no longer find pleasure in desires, and we do not enjoy sensual pleasures. Our minds and bodies cooled, we go to the priest, who teaches us so that our minds will be purified, so that our minds will be radiant, so our minds will be good, so our minds will be malleable, so we will become joyful, so we may purify the realization of the knowledge of the ten powers, so we may grow in enthusiasm for the great Teaching, so we may purify our bodies and produce measureless buddha-bodies, so we may purify our voices and attain the voice of Buddha, so we may purify our minds and attain omniscience.”

rab dga' ldan gyi lha'i rgyal po stong phrag bcu'i lha'i bu dang / lha'i bu mo'i tshogs kyi 'khor dang bcas pa dag kyang / steng gi bar snang la 'khod nas/ spos sna tshogs kyi phye ma'i sprin gyi char mngon par phab pas mchod pa byas te/ phyag 'tshal nas 'di skad ces 'dzer to/ /rigs kyi bu/ 'phags pa 'di dka' thub lngas yongs su gdung ba mdzad pa'i tshe/ bdag cag kyang rang rang gi gnas na dga' ba med de/ de ltar dga' ba med pas 'di'i drung du 'dong ste/ bdag cag phyin pa rnams la/ 'phags pa 'di ni yul thams cad la ltos pa med par bya ba'i phyir chos ston to/ /chog shes pa'i sems su bya ba dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba yang dag par bskyod pa dang / byang chub tu sems bskyed pa rab tu thob par bya ba nas/ sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir chos ston to/ /

Ten thousand gods of the heaven of satisfaction, along with their companies of celestial boys and girls, also stood in the sky, showered all kinds of fragrant powders, paying honor and respect, and said, “While he mortifies himself with fire there is no pleasure in our abodes. Being freed from attachment, we go to the priest and he teaches us so that we will be indifferent to all objects of sense, so that we will be perfectly and completely satisfied in mind, so that we will produce roots of goodness, so that we will aspire to enlightenment, and so that we will eventually fulfill all qualities of buddhas.”

rab mtshe ma'i lha'i rgyal po stong phrag bcu lha'i bu dang / lha'i bu mo'i tshogs kyi 'khor dang bcas pa dag gis kyang lha rdzas kyi me tog man da ra ba'i char mngon par phab ste/ 'di skad ces 'dzer to/ /rigs kyi bu/ 'phags pa 'di dka' thub lngas yongs su gdung ba mdzad pa'i tshe/ bdag cag kyang lha rdzas kyi glu snyan pa la dga' ba med de/ de ltar dga' ba med pas 'phags pa 'di'i drung du 'dong ste/ bdag cag phyin nas kyang / 'phags pa 'di ni 'dod pa'i dga' ba thams cad rnam par bzlog par bya ba nas/ sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad rab tu thob par bya ba'i phyir chos ston to/ /

Ten thousand gods of the heaven of timely portion, along with their celestial sons and daughters, showered a rain of flowers and said, “While this priest is mortifying himself with fire, we have no pleasure in our celestial song. Freed from attachment, we go to the priest and he teaches us so that we will become detached from all sensuality and eventually attain all qualities of buddhahood.”

lha'i dbang po brgya byin stong phrag bcu so so nas nye ba'i dbang po sum cu rtsa gnyis dang; lha'i bu dang / lha'i bu mo'i tshogs kyi 'khor dang bcas pas/ lha rdzas kyi gos dang / rin po che'i rgyan dang / me tog gi sprin gyi char mngon par phab ste/ 'di skad ces 'dzer to/ /rigs kyi bu/ 'phags pa 'di dka' thub lngas yongs su gdung ba mdzad pa'i tshe/ bdag cag kyang brgya byin gyi khang pa dang / bza' shing gi ra ba dang / rtse ba'i nags tshal dang / lha rdzas kyi rol mo brdung zhing dkrol ba dang / gam yo na glu len pa'i longs spyod la dga' ba med/ de ltar bdag cag dga' ba med pas 'di'i drung du 'dong ngo/ /bdag cag der phyin nas kyang / 'phags pa 'di ni kho bo cag la 'dod pa'i dga' ba thams cad yongs su spang pa'i phyir chos ston to/ /'di dag thams cad ni rtag pa ma yin te/ mi brtan zhing 'jig par 'gyur ba'i chos can no zhes bya ba'i tshig brjod do/ /dregs pa dang / bag med pa thams cad yongs su gcad pa dang / bla na med pa'i byang chub tu spro ba bskyed pa'i phyir chos ston to/ /rigs kyi bu/ gzhan yang 'dis bltas pa tsam gyis ri rab kyi rtse mo thams cad kyang g.yo bar 'gyur te/ des bdag cag gshigs pas sems skyo bar gyur nas thams cad mkhyen pa'i sems brtan pas/ thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes su smon lam mngon par sgrub bo/ /

Ten hundred thousand celestial beings of the thirty-three-fold heavens, each with thirty-two siblings, along with their celestial sons and daughters, showered rain from clouds of celestial cloths, jewels, ornaments, and flowers, then said, “While this priest is mortifying himself with fire, we have no pleasure in our palaces, parks, and groves, or in such enjoyments as music, dance, and song. Freed from attachment, we go to the priest, and he teaches us to remove all sensuality. He tells us this is all impermanent, unstable, bound to perish. He teaches us to thoroughly cut off all arrogance and heedlessness, to increase our desire for supreme enlightenment. Furthermore, at the sight of this priest, these peaks of the polar mountain quake. Terrified, we commit ourselves to reach omniscience, that we may be firm in our aspiration for omniscience.”

klu'i rgyal po shugs ldan dang / dga' bo dang / bsnyen dga' bo la sogs pa klu brgya stong phrag bcu dag kyang steng gi bar snang la gnas shing; dus dang mthun pa'i lha rdzas kyi tsan dan gyi sprin dang / klu'i bu mos blangs pa'i nga ro snyan pa'i dbyangs dang / lha rdzas kyi spos chu'i rgyun rab tu 'bab pa'i char mngon par phab ste/ 'di skad ces 'dzer to/ /rigs kyi bu/ 'phags pa 'di dka' thub lngas yongs su gdung ba mdzad pa'i tshe/ me'i phung po chen po 'di las 'od chen po 'byung ste; des klu'i gnas thams cad snang bar byas nas/ bye ma'i char dang / nam mkha' lding gi 'jigs pa yongs su sel to/ /khro ba 'byung ba yang zhi bar byas te/ lus sim par byas nas yid shin tu mos par byed do/ /de ltar sems shin tu mos par gyur nas/ 'phags pa 'di ni bdag cag la chos ston te/ /'di ltar klu'i lam gyi rgyud ngan pa rnam par smad pa dang / sgrib pa'i las thams cad rab tu spang ba'i phyir nyes pa 'chags su btsud cing / bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed du btsud de/ thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la rab tu 'god do/ /

Also, ten thousand rain spirits in the sky showered rain from clouds of celestial sandalwood, along with the sweet sounds of the songs of nymphs, producing clouds of celestial fragrance, and said, “The light emitted from this priest’s fires, illumining the abodes of all the water spirits, removes fears of the hot rain of sand. It also extinguishes anger, and the water spirits become cool and clear in mind. Then, once our minds are clear, the priest teaches us to reject our low state as dragons and to stop all obstructive actions. Having taught us to overcome evil, he inspires us to supreme perfect enlightenment and leads us to omniscience.”

gnod sbyin gyi dbang po stong phrag bcu yang nam mkha'i dbyings la 'khod de/ mchod pa rnam pa sna tshogs kyis bram ze rgyal ba'i drod kyi skye mched dang / tshong dpon gyi bu nor bzang la mchod pa byas nas/ 'di skad ces 'dzer to/ rigs kyi bu/ 'phags pa 'di dka' thub lngas yongs su gdung ba mdzad pa'i pa'i tshe/ kho bo cag gi 'khor kun kyang mi rnams la byams pa'i sems skye bar gyur te/ gnod sbyin dang / srin po dang / grul bum thams cad kyang byams pa'i sems dang ldan par gyur to/ /de dag byams pa'i sems dang ldan zhing 'tsho ba med pa la zhugs pa rnams kho bo cag gi drung du 'ong ngo/ kho bo cag kyang de ltar byams pa'i dbang gis zil gyis non pas/ rang rang gi gnas de dang / de dag na dga' ba med de/ de ltar bdag cag kyang rang rang gi skye bo'i 'khor dang bcas te/ 'phags pa 'di'i drung du 'dong ngo/ /bdag cag de ltar 'ongs pa rnams la/ 'phags pa 'di'i sku las byung ba'i 'od kyis lus thams cad snang bar byas shing bde bas khyab par mdzad de/ de ltar bdag cag lus dang sems bde bar gyur nas/ 'phags pa 'di ni ci nas kyang bdag cag la gnod sbyin dang / srin po dang / grul bum dang / lus srul po mang po byang chub tu sems skye bar 'gyur ba de ltar chos ston to/ /

Also, ten thousand spirit chiefs, standing in the sky, honored the priest Jayoshmayatana and the youth Sudhana with various offerings, then said, “Son, as this priest mortifies himself with fire, goodwill toward human beings is born in our minds, and all spirits, goblins, and demons also become benevolent. Benevolent, now harmless, they come to us; overcome by the dominant power of goodwill, we find no pleasure in our various estates. We all go with our respective companions to the priest; he radiates light from his body, which shines on us and fills our bodies with bliss. Our bodies and minds blissful, he teaches us in such a way that many spirits, goblins, demons, and ghosts are inspired to seek enlightenment.”

dri za'i dbang po stong phrag bcu dag kyang steng gi bar snang la 'khod nas/ 'di skad ces 'dzer to/ /rigs kyi bu/ kho bo cag kyang rang rang gi gnas na 'khod pa'i tshe/ 'phags pa 'di dka' thub lngas yongs su gdung bar mdzad pa'i tshe/ me'i phung po 'di las 'od byung ste/ bdag cag gi gnas snang bar gyur to/ /de ltar bdag cag 'od des phog ste/ bde ba bsam gyis mi khyab pa dang ldan par gyur pas/ 'phags pa 'di'i drung du 'dong ste/ bdag cag drung du phyin nas kyang 'phags pa 'di ni/ bdag cag ci nas kyang bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub las phyir mi ldog par 'gyur ba de ltar chos ston to/ /

Ten thousand chief celestial musicians also stood in the sky and said, “While we are in our abodes too, our abodes are illumined by the light of the priest’s fires; touched by that light, we are filled with inconceivable bliss and we go to the priest, who then teaches us in such a way that we become irreversible in progress toward supreme perfect enlightenment.”

lha ma yin gyi dbang po stong phrag bcu dag kyang rgya mtsho'i nang nas mngon par 'thon te/ nam mkha' la pus mo g.yas pa'i lha nga btsugs te/ thal mo sbyar nas phyag 'tshal zhing 'di skad ces 'dzer to/ /rigs kyi bu/ 'phags pa 'di dka' thub lngas yongs su gdung ba mdzad pa'i tshe/ kho bo cag gi lha ma yin gyi 'jig rten rgya mtsho dang rir bcas pa'i sa chen po'i dkyil 'khor rab tu g.yo bar gyur te/ bdag cag kun gyi nga rgyal dang / rlom sems dang / dregs pa thams cad brtul zhugs dang dka' thub kyi zil gyis non te/ 'phags pa 'di'i drung du 'dong ngo/ /der phyin nas kyang 'phags pa 'di ni/ bdag cag la g.yo sgyu thams cad rab tu spang ba dang / chos zab mo'i bzod pa dang / mi g.yo ba'i chos nyid la rab tu dgod pa dang / stobs bcu'i ye shes yongs su grub par bya ba'i phyir chos ston to/ /

Ten thousand titan kings rose from the ocean, knelt on their right knees, joined their palms in salutation, and said, “As this priest mortifies himself by fire, all our titan worlds, including the oceans, mountains, and land spheres, quake: we are all thereby divested of arrogance, heedlessness, and conceit; overwhelmed by the heat of his religious practice, we go to him, and he teaches us so that we may do away with all deceitfulness and guile, enter into acceptance of the profound truth, abide in the state of imperturbability, and perfect the knowledge of the ten powers.”

nam mkha' lding gi dbang po shugs chen po 'dzin pa la sogs pa nam mkha' lding gi dbang po stong phrag bcus kyang / bram ze'i bu shin tu sdug gu'i gzugs su mngon par sprul te/ /'di skad ces 'dzer to/ /rigs kyi bu/ 'phags pa 'di dka' thub lngas yongs su gdung ba mdzad pa'i tshe/ me'i phung po 'di dag las 'od chen po byung ste/ bdag cag gis gnas snang bar byas nas yongs su g.yo bar byed do/ / des bdag cag kyang 'jigs shing skrag ste/ skyo ba'i yid dang ldan par gyur nas 'phags pa 'di'i drung du 'dong ngo/ 'phags pa 'di yang bdag cag la chos ston cing / byams pa chen po la yang dag par sbyor bar mdzad do/ /snying rje chen po la yang dag par dgod pa mdzad do/ /'khor ba'i rgya mtshor 'jug pa la yang yang dag par sbyor ba mdzad do/ /'dod pa'i 'dam du bying ba'i sems can mngon par gdon par bya ba la yang yongs su sbyor ba mdzad do/ /lhag pa'i bsam pa'i sgo rnam par dag par bya ba la yang rab tu sbyor ba mdzad do/ /shes rab dang thabs shin tu gsal ba la yang yang dag par sbyor ba mdzad do/ /rnam pa ji lta bur yongs su smin par bya ba'i sems can rnams gdul bar bya ba la yang rab tu sbyor ba mdzad do/ /

Also ten thousand bird kings, assuming splendid human forms, said, “Son, the light from the flames of the priest’s fires, shining on our abodes, causes them to quake. Frightened and agitated, we go to him, and by teaching us he exhorts us to great benevolence and compassion, he urges us to plunge into the ocean of mundane life to serve sentient beings sunk in the mud of desire, he urges us to purify our will for enlightenment, he exhorts us to keenness of wisdom and skill in means, and gets us to work at guiding sentient beings according to their maturity.”

mi'am ci'i dbang po stong phrag bcu yang steng gi bar snang la 'khod do/ /'di skad ces 'dzer to/ /rigs kyi bu/ 'phags pa 'di dka' thub lngas yongs su gdung ba mdzad pa'i tshe/ kho bo cag gi gnas na 'khod pa'i shing ta la'i phreng ba las dril bu'i dra ba rin po che'i srad bus lda ldir brgyus pa'i sil snyan dang / rol mo'i yo byad dang / rin po che'i rgyan dang / khyim gyi longs spyod thams cad las sangs rgyas kyi sgra 'byung ngo/ /chos kyi sgra dang / phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i dge 'dun gyi sgra dang / byang chub tu yang dag par zhugs pa'i smon lam gyi sgra 'byung ngo/ /'jig rten gyi khams kyi grangs su bya ba che ge mo zhig na ni/ byang chub sems dpa' ming 'di zhes bya ba zhig byang chub tu smon lam 'debs so/ /'jig rten gyi khams kyi grangs su bya ba che ge mo zhig na ni/ byang chub sems dpa' ming 'di zhes bya ba zhig dka' ba yongs su gtong ba byed do/ /'jig rten gyi khams kyi grangs su bya ba che ge mo zhig na ni/ byang chub sems dpa' ming 'di zhes bya ba zhig /thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi ye shes kyi dkyil 'khor yongs su sbyong ba byed do/ /'jig rten gyi khams kyi grangs su bya ba che ge mo zhig na ni/ byang chub sems dpa' ming 'di zhes bya ba zhig snying po byang chub tu 'gro'o/ / 'jig rten gyi khams kyi grangs su bya ba che ge mo zhig na ni/ byang chub sems dpa' ming 'di zhes bya ba zhig dpung dang bzhon par bcas pa'i bdud rab tu pham par byas te/ bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par 'tshang rgya'o/ /'jig rten gyi khams kyi grangs su bya ba che ge mo zhig na ni/ de bzhin gshegs pa mtshan 'di zhes bya ba zhig chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba mdzad do/ /'jig rten gyi khams kyi grangs su bya ba che ge mo zhig na ni/ de bzhin gshegs pa mtshan ni che ge mo zhig sangs rgyas kyi 'phrin las ma lus par mdzad nas/ phung po ma lus pa'i dbyings su yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba mdzad do zhes bya ba'i sgra 'byin te/ rigs kyi bu; 'dzam bu'i gling gi dang / shing dang / yal ga dang / lo ma dang / 'dab ma thams cad rdul shin tu phra ba'i char blags pa'i mur thug par ni rung yang srid kyi/ de bzhin gshegs pa de dag gi mtshan dang / byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi smon lam dang / byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa la 'jug pa'i khyad par gang kho bo cag gi gnas na yod pa'i shing ta la'i phreng ba las rol mo'i yo byad dang / rin po che'i rgyan dang / khyim gyi longs spyod rlung gis bskyod pa'i sgra 'byung zhing / nga ro 'byin pa dang / rna lam du grag pa'i mtha' ni thug par mi rung ngo/ /de ltar bdag cag kyang sangs rgyas dang / chos dang / dge 'dun dang / byang chub sems dpa' rab tu 'jug pa'i smon lam dang; spyod pa dang / mtshan gyi chu klung gi sgras dga' ba chen po'i shugs drag pos nyams bde ba skyes te/ 'phags pa 'di'i drung du 'dod do/ /de ltar bdag cag phyin par gyur nas kyang / 'phags pa 'di ni bdag cag la ci nas kyang kho bo cag gi 'khor gyi sems can du ma zhig /bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub las phyir mi ldog par 'gyur ba de lta bur chos ston pa mdzad do/ /

Ten thousand centaur kings also stood in the sky and said, “As this priest mortifies himself by fire, the voice of Buddha comes forth from the rows of palms, the trees hung with nets of bells, strings of jewels, garlands, and musical instruments, and the houses and furniture with all kinds of musical instruments and jewelry in our abodes as they are blown by the wind; the voice of the Teaching, the voice of the host of nonregressing enlightening beings, and the voice of the vows on which enlightening beings act also emerge, saying that in such-and-such a world the enlightening being so-and-so is vowing to attain enlightenment, in such-and-such a world the enlightening being so-and-so is giving up that which is difficult to give up, in such-and-such a world the enlightening being so-and-so is purifying the sphere of universally aware knowledge, in such-and-such a world the enlightening being so-and-so is going to the summit of enlightenment, in such-and-such a world the enlightening being so-and-so has conquered the demon hordes and is becoming supremely and perfectly enlightened, in such-and-such a world the buddha so-and-so is turning the wheel of the teaching, in such-and-such a world the buddha so-and-so has finished all the tasks of buddhas and is passing away into absolute nirvana. There may be an end to the particles of every tree and plant, limb and leaf, on this continent, but there is no end to those names of the buddhas and the vows of enlightening beings, the lofty points of departure of the conduct of enlightening beings, which are heard to sound from the rows of palms and all the musical instruments, jewelry, houses, and furniture in our abodes as they are blown by the wind, producing the voices of Buddha, the Teaching, and enlightenment. Ecstatically joyful at the sound of the names of the buddhas and the community of enlightening beings and the vows and practices they proceed upon, we go to the priest, and he teaches us so that we and the many beings around us become irreversible in progress toward supreme perfect enlightenment.”

'dod pa la spyod pa'i lha'i bu stong phrag dpag tu med pa/ kha dog shin tu mdzes pa dag kyang nam mkha' la 'khod cing / yid kyis sprul pa'i mchod pa byas nas 'di skad ces 'dzer to/ /'phags pa 'di dka' thub lngas yongs su gdung ba mdzad pa'i tshe/ me'i phung po 'di dag las rnam pa 'di lta bu'i 'od 'byung ste/ 'od des mar na mnar med pa yan chad du sems can dmyal ba rnams snang bar byas nas/ sems can dmyal ba pa'i sems can thams cad kyi sdug bsngal rtse zil bar byas te/ 'od de nyid kyis 'phags pa 'di bdag cag gi mig lam du snang bar bstan pas/ de'i phyir kho bo cag kyang 'phags pa 'di la sems mos par gyur nas 'dod pa la spyod pa'i lha'i ris nyams su bde bar skyes so/ /de ltar bdag cag kyang 'phags pa 'di'i mdzad pa la drin du gzo zhing mthong bas mi ngoms pas/ 'dod pa'i dga' ba thams cad yongs su spangs te/ 'phags pa 'di'i drung du 'dong ngo/ /der bdag cag phyin nas kyang / 'phags pa 'di ni ci nas kyang sems can tshad med pa rnams byang chub tu smon lam 'debs par 'gyur ba de ltar chos ston pa mdzad do/ /

Innumerable gods of the realm of desire with magnificent appearances also stood in the sky, presented mental offerings, and said, “As this priest mortifies himself with heat, his bonfires give off such light that it illumines all the hells all the way to the uninterrupted hell, and the pains of all the creatures in hell cease. He also is visible to us by the same light. We above him, our minds clarified, have been born in the heavens of the realm of desire we wished for. Grateful to him, never tired of seeing him, we give up all sensuality and go to him, and he teaches us in such a way that innumerable sentient beings resolve to realize enlightenment.”

de nas tshong dpon gyi bu nor bzang gis chos kyi tshul rnam pa 'di lta bu thos nas dga' rangs te/ mgu zhing nyams bde la/ tshim zhing yid bde ba skyes te/ bram ze rgyal ba'i drod kyi skye mched la yang dag pa'i dge ba'i bshes gnyen du 'du shes bskyed; bram ze rgyal ba'i drod kyi skye mched kyi rkang pa gnyis la spyi bos phyag 'tshal te/ 'di skad ces smras so/ /'phags pa/ de ltar bdag gis dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyi bka' dang 'gal bar bgyis pa'i nongs pa la nongs par bshags so/ /

Then Sudhana, pleased, enraptured, transported, overjoyed, happy, having heard this teaching, considered the priest Jayoshmayatana to be a true spiritual benefactor, and prostrated himself at the priest’s feet and said, “I confess my error, noble one, in not recognizing you as a spiritual benefactor.”
de nas bram ze rgyal ba'i drod kyi skye mched kyis/ tshong dpon gyi bu nor bzang la tshigs su bcad pa 'di dag smras so/ /
Thereupon the priest spoke a verse to Sudhana:

byang chub sems dpa' gang zhig rjes su bstan dang mthun byed cing / / dran pa nye bar bzhag ste bla ma'i ngag gcog mi byed na/ / de'i phyir de yi don rnams thams cad mthun par 'grub par 'gyur/ / mthun pa'i sangs rgyas ye shes byang chub drung du 'tshang yang rgya/ /

An enlightening being who follows instructions Has no doubts, his mind at one with the teachers. All benefits will be his, and they will be auspicious; Sure of buddha-knowledge too, he awakens at the foot of the enlightenment tree.

de nas tshong dpon gyi bu nor bzang gis/ ri g.yang sa'i lam spu gri'i so gshibs pa la 'dzegs te/ me'i phung po chen po der mchongs so/ /de de ltar mchongs pa'i tshe/ byang chub sems dpa'i ting nge 'dzin shin tu brtan pa zhes bya ba thob par gyur to/ /me des reg nas kyang byang chub sems dpa'i ting nge 'dzin rab tu zhi ba'i bde ba mngon par shes pa zhes bya ba thob par gyur nas/ des 'di skad ces smras so/ /'phags pa/ me'i phung po la de ltar reg na bde ba dang / ri'i lam spu gris gtams pa 'di yang de ltar reg na bde ba de ni ngo mtshar che'o/ /

Then Sudhana climbed the path up the cliff of the mountain, a mass of razor edges, and threw himself into the fire. As he was falling he attained an enlightening concentration called “well established.” On contact with the fire he attained an enlightening concentration called “mystic knowledge of the bliss of tranquillity.” He said, “How wonderful is the pleasant feeling of this fire and this razor-edge mountain.”

des smras pa/ rigs kyi bu/ kho bo ni byang chub sems dpa'i rnam par thar pa dkyil 'khor yongs su mi zad pa thob pa ste/ rigs kyi bu/ kho bos ni/ byang chub sems dpa'i rnam par thar pa dkyil 'khor yongs su mi zad pa 'di shes par zad na/ kho bos byang chub sems dpa' me'i phung po lta bu/ 'gro ba thams cad kyi nyon mongs pa dang / lta ba'i rnam pa thams cad yongs su zad par bya ba'i smon lam can/ ru mtshon phyir mi ldog pa dang ldan pa/ sems la thub pa med cing / sems dma' ba med pa dang ldan pa/ yid zhum pa med pa can rdo rje'i snying po dang ldan pa'i mthu bo che lta bu/ brtsams pa chen po mthar phyin par bya ba la sgyid lug pa med pa/ sbyor ba lhod pa med pa rlung gi dkyil 'khor lta bu/ 'gro ba thams cad kyi don du brtson pa/ brtson 'grus phyir mi ldog pa dang ldan pa/ phyir mi ldog pa'i go cha bgos pa de dag gi spyod pa shes pa'am/ yon tan brjod par nus re skan/ /

The priest said, “I have attained the enlightening liberation in which one is not overcome. I know this liberation, but how can I know the practice or tell the virtues of the enlightening beings whose resolve is like rays of fiery energy, determined to end all beings’ afflictions and views, who are eminent leaders who never turn back, whose hearts are never exhausted or overcome, whose minds are never depressed, whose spirits never cringe or cower, whose resolve is adamant, who are never dejected in carrying out their great undertakings, who never slacken in their efforts, who are like whirlwinds, who work for the benefit of all beings, whose vigor never recedes?

song; rigs kyi bu/ lho phyogs kyi rgyud 'di nyid na/ grong khyer seng ge rnam par bsgyings pa zhes bya ba yod de/ de na rgyal po seng ge'i dpal gyi bu mo byams ma zhes bya ba/ bu mo lnga brgya'i 'khor dang bcas pa 'dug gi /de'i gan du song la/ ji ltar byang chub sems dpas byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa la bslab par bya ba dang / ji ltar nan tan du bya ba dris shig/

“Go south, to a city called Simhavijurmbhita, where there lives a girl named Maitrayani, daughter of the rajah Simhaketu; go ask her how an enlightening being is to learn and carry out the practice of enlightening beings.”

de nas tshong dpon gyi bu nor bzang gis/ bram ze rgyal ba'i drod kyi skye mched kyi rkang pa gnyis la spyi bos phyag 'tshal te/ bram ze rgyal ba'i drod kyi skye mched la lan brgya stong du mar g.yas phyogs su bskor ba byas nas/ yang dang yang bltas te/ bram ze rgyal ba'i drod kyi skye mched kyi drung nas song ngo/ /
Then Sudhana paid his respects and left the priest Jayoshmayatana.
[bu mo byams ma]
Maitrayani

de nas tshong dpon gyi bu nor bzang / dge ba'i bshes gnyen la rim gro bsam gyis mi khyab pa la zhugs pa mos pa rgya chen pos rnam par dag pa/ theg pa chen po la mngon du phyogs pa/ sangs rgyas kyi ye shes la mngon par mos pa/ sangs rgyas kyi chos la yang dag par zhugs pa/ dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyi rjes su 'brang bar spro ba/ chos kyi rim gro la rnam par spyod pa/ chags pa med pa'i ye shes la mngon du gyur pa/ yang dag pa'i mtha' shin tu rtogs pa/ ye shes kyi mtha' la mi gnas pa'i yul dang ldan pa/ dus gsum skad cig gi cha shas la khong du chud par byed pa/ nam mkha'i mtha' gnyis su med pa mngon du gyur pa/ mi gnyis pa'i mtha' rnam par gdon mi za ba thob pa; chos kyi dbyings kyi mtha' la rnam par mi rtog par gnas pa/ bsgribs pa med pa'i mthas gdul ba khong du chud par bya ba la zhugs pa/ chos kyi mtha' dang mi 'gal bar bya ba la gzhol ba/ de bzhin gshegs pa'i mtha' la mtha' med par khong du chud pa/ sangs rgyas thams cad kyi mtha' la rnam par mi rtog par gnas pa/ sems can thams cad kyi 'du shes kyi dra ba rnam par gtor ba'i ye shes la gzhol ba/ zhing la mngon par chags pa thams cad dang bral ba/ sangs rgyas kyi 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor thams cad la chags pa med pa'i sems dang ldan pa/ sangs rgyas kyi zhing thams cad yongs su dag par bya ba la gnas pa med par spyod pa/ sems can thams cad la bdag med pa dang / sems can med pa'i 'du shes dang ldan pa/ sgra thams cad tshig gi lam lta bur khong du chud pa/ gzugs thams cad gzugs kyi gzugs brnyan dang mnyam par rnam par rig par bya ba la gzhol ba de mthar gyis seng ge rnam par bsgyings pa'i grong khyer gang na ba der phyin te/ bu mo byams ma tshol zhing yongs su rmed rmed pa las/

Then, with inconceivable respect for spiritual benefactors, the great zeal purified, ready for the Great Vehicle, seeking enlightened knowledge, absorbed in the way to enlightenment, seeking association with spiritual friends, dwelling in the sphere of the Teaching, approaching unhindered knowledge, certain of the supreme truth, intent on ultimate knowledge, realizing that past, present, and future are ultimately one instant, aware of ultimate nonduality like space, sure of the ultimacy of nonduality, dwelling in the ultimate nondifferentiation of the reality realm, devoted to discipline whose goal is freedom from obstruction, intent on ultimate harmony in action, dwelling on the ultimate nondifference of those who realize Thusness, intent on the knowledge to tear apart the net of conceptions of all sentient beings, free from attachment to any land, his mind not attached to the congregations of the buddhas or to the purities of the buddha-lands, perceiving all sentient beings as void of self or inherent identity, realizing that all sounds are like echoes and eminently aware that all forms are like reflections, Sudhana gradually made his way to the city Simhavijurmbhita, looking for the girl Maitrayani.

rgyal po seng ge'i dpal gyi bu mo byams ma; 'khor bu mo lnga brgya dang ldan pa de khang pa rnam par snang ba'i snying po zhes bya ba'i nang na/ khri tsan dan sprul gyi snying po'i rkang pa can/ gser gyi lcags bod kyi dra bas legs par blas pa/ lha rdzas kyi stan bting ba la 'dug cing chos ston to zhes thos nas/ seng ge rnam par bsgyings pa'i grong khyer du song ste/ rgyal po seng ge'i dpal gyi gnas gang na ba der phyin nas/ rgyal po'i phyi sgo'i sgo khang na/ bu mo byams ma mthong bar dga' ba'i phyir sdod cing 'dug 'dug pa dang / des der srog chags brgya phrag du ma dang / srog chags stong phrag du ma dang / srog chags brgya stong phrag du ma 'dong ba mthong nas/ khyed gang nas 'ong / da gang du 'dong zhes dris pa dang / de dag na re/ ded ni bu mo byams ma'i drung du chos mnyan pa'i phyir 'dong ngo zhes nas/ des bsams pa/ 'dir ni su 'gro yang dag pa med pa lta zhig snyam ste/ de yang nang du phyin to/ /de ltar phyin te bltas na; khang pa rnam par snang ba'i snying po can de yang / gzhi shel du 'dug pa'i sa las blangs te/ bai DUr+ya'i ka ba bkye ba/ rtsig pa rdo rje las byas pa/ 'dzam bu chu klung gi lhun dang ldan pa'i ba gam brgya phrag stong gis brgyan pa nor bu rin po che grangs med pas rnam par bris pa/ rin po che stong gi snying po'i me long gi dkyil 'khor gyis shin tu spa bar byas pa/ nor bu rin po che 'gro ba'i yid du 'ong bas rnam par brgyan pa/ rin po che'i shing rta grangs med pas yongs su bskor ba/ gser gyi dril bu brgya stong shin tu 'khrol ba'i sgra snyan pa bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i rgyan dang ldan par 'dug par mthong ngo/ /bu mo byams ma de yang mig dkar nag 'byes pa/ skra mthon mthing du 'dug pa/ mdog gser gyi kha dog ltar 'dug pa mthong nas/ des de'i rkang pa gnyis la spyi bos phyag 'tshal te/ lan brgya stong du mar g.yas phyogs su bskor ba byas nas thal mo sbyar te/ mdun du 'dug nas 'di skad ces smras so/ /'phags ma/ bdag gis bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed na/ ji ltar byang chub sems dpas byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa la bslab par bgyi ba dang / ji ltar nan tan du bgyi ba ma 'tshal te/ 'phags ma ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams la gdams ngag dang rjes su bstan pa mdzad do zhes bdag gis thos pa; 'phags ma/ ji ltar byang chub sems dpas byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa la bslab par bgyi ba dang / ji ltar nan tan du bgyi ba bdag la bshad du gsol/

He was told, “The girl Maitrayani, daughter of the rajah Simhaketu, with a retinue of five hundred girls, is up on the roof of a palace of radiant jewels, sitting on a seat set on sandalwood legs and draped with nets of strings of jewels and arrayed with celestial cloth, expounding spiritual teaching.”
Hearing this, Sudhana entered the city, went to the house of the rajah, and stood at the outer foyer, desirous of seeing the girl Maitrayani. There he saw hundreds of thousands of people going in. He asked them where they were going and why they had come, and they told him they were going to Maitrayani to hear the Teaching. He thought to himself, “No one is prevented from going in.” So he went in.
Having gone in, he saw the palace of radiant jewels set on a crystal base, with pillars of lapis lazuli and walls of diamond, ornamented with a hundred thousand projections of gold, furnished with countless jewel mirrors, arrayed with world-illumining jewels, spread with countless jewel nets, graced with inconceivable arrays of beautiful sounds from a hundred thousand golden bells shaken by the breeze. He also saw the girl Maitrayani, with dark eyes, black hair, and golden skin. Sudhana paid his respects to her and said, “Noble one, I have set my mind on supreme perfect enlightenment, but I do not know how an enlightening being is to learn and carry out the practice of enlightening beings.”
smras pa/ rigs kyi bu; kho mo'i gnas kyi rgyan la ltos shig ces nas/
She said, “Look at the adornments of my palace.”

des kun tu yul te bltas pa dang / rtsig pa re re dang / ka ba re re dang / me long gi dkyil 'khor re re dang / rnam pa'i bye brag re re dang / dbyibs re re dang / nor bu rin po che re re dang / gser gyi dril bu re re dang / rin po che'i shing re re dang / ba sbu'i bu ga re re dang / rin po che'i sen mo do re re dag las kyang / chos kyi dbyings thams cad na bzhugs pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa/ thog ma thugs bskyed pa dang bcas pa/ spyod pa dang smon lam gyi yul dang bcas pa/ 'byung ba'i rgyan dang bcas pa/ mngon par 'tshang rgya ba'i rnam par 'phrul pa dang bcas pa/ chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba dang bcas pa/ yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba ston pa dang bcas par gzugs brnyan gyi tshul du mthong bar gyur to/ /dmigs pa de dag re re las/ ji lta ba de bzhin du dmigs pa thams cad las kyang mthong bar gyur to/ / 'di lta ste/ dper na/ chus yongs su gang ba'i mtsho dang zhing rnyog pa med pa la rnam par gsal ba la ni/ nam mkha' nyi zla dang / skar ma'i tshogs kyis brgyan pa gzugs brnyan gyi tshul du yongs su snang ngo; ;de bzhin du khang pa rnam par snang ba'i snying po 'di dmigs pa re re las kyang / chos kyi dbyings kun na bzhugs pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad gzugs brnyan gyi tshul du yongs su snang bar gyur te/ de ni bu mo byams ma'i sngon gyi dge ba'i rtsa ba'i rgyu'i phyir te/

Looking all around, in each wall, each pillar, each mirror, each figure, each formation, each jewel, each golden bell, each jewel tree, each girl’s body, each jewel necklace, he saw reflected images of the buddhas in the cosmos, with their first inspirations, spheres of practice and vows, manifestations of emergence in the world, mystical transformation on attainment of enlightenment, turnings of the wheel of teaching, and displays of ultimate extinction. This he saw in each and every object. Just as the sun, moon, and stars in the sky are seen reflected in a clear, limpid pool of water, so did all the buddhas of the cosmos appear reflected in each object of the luminous jewel palace, this as a result of the girl Maitrayani’s past roots of goodness.

des de ltar rnam par bltas nas/ sangs rgyas mthong ba'i rgyan gyi mtshan ma de yongs su bzung ste thal mo sbyar nas/ bu mo byams ma'i gdong du bltas pa dang / des smras pa/ rigs kyi bu/ kho mo ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i sgo'i rgyud kun nas rnam par brgyan pa zhes bya ba thob pa ste/ shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i sgo'i rgyud 'di ni/ kho mos de bzhin gshegs pa chu klung gang+gA sum cu rtsa drug gi bye ma snyed las yongs su btsal ba ste; de bzhin gshegs pa de dag gis kyang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i sgo'i rgyud kun nas rnam par brgyan pa 'di/ sgo sna tshogs kyi khong du chud par bya bas rtogs par mdzad de; gcig gis gang du gsungs pa de yang gnyis kyis ma gsungs so/ /

Having viewed this, holding in mind the features of this supernal array of visions of Buddhas, Sudhana joined his hands in a gesture of respect and turned his attention to Maitrayani’s words. She said, “I have attained the means of access to perfect wisdom from the arrangement of the totality. I sought this from buddhas as numerous as grains of sand in thirty-six Ganges Rivers, and those buddhas introduced me to the means of access to perfect wisdom by way of the arrangement of the totality through various ways of entry into it, each different.”
smras pa/ 'phags ma/ shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i sgo'i rgyud kun nas rnam par brgyan pa 'di'i yul ji lta bu zhig mchis/
Sudhana said, “What is the sphere of this means of access to perfect wisdom by way of the arrangement of the totality?”

smras pa/ rigs kyi bu/ shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i sgo'i rgyud kun nas rnam par brgyan pa 'di la/ kho mo mngon du byed cing / sems pa dang / rjes su 'brang bar bya ba dang / rnam par dpyod pa dang / rjes su sems pa dang / dran par bya ba dang / yongs su gzung ba dang / rnam par brtags pa dang / mngon par bsgrub pa dang / yang dag par brgyan par bya ba dang / rab tu rnam par dbye ba byed pa'i tshe/ gzungs kun nas sgo zhes bya ba yongs su skye ste/ gzungs kyi dkyil 'khor der ni chos kyi sgo brgya stong grangs med pa phrag bcu yongs su 'du'o/ /khong du chud do/ /mngon du 'gyur ro/ /mngon par 'du'o/ /khongs na 'khod do/ / 'di lta ste/ sangs rgyas kyi zhing gi sgo dang / sangs rgyas kyi sgo dang / chos kyi sgo dang / sems can gyi sgo dang / 'das pa'i sgo dang / ma 'ongs pa'i sgo dang / da ltar byung ba'i sgo dang / gnas pa'i mtha' sgo dang; bsod nams kyi sgo dang / bsod nams kyi tshogs kyi sgo dang / ye shes kyi sgo dang / ye shes kyi tshogs kyi sgo dang / smon lam gyi sgo dang / smon lam gyi rnam pa'i sgo dang; spyod pa'i sgo dang / spyod pa rnam par dag pa'i sgo dang / spyod pa yongs su 'byung ba'i sgo dang / spyod pa yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i sgo dang / las kyi sgo dang / las dang mi 'gal pa'i sgo dang / las kyi rgyun gyi sgo dang / lam mngon par 'du bya ba'i sgo dang / mi mnyam pa'i las yongs su spang pa'i sgo dang / yang dag pa'i las la nan tan du bya ba'i sgo dang / las la dbang bsgyur ba'i sgo dang / legs par spyad pa'i sgo dang / legs par spyad pa yang dag par blang ba'i sgo dang / ting nge 'dzin gyi sgo dang / ting nge 'dzin khong du chud par bya ba'i sgo dang / sems rnam par rgyu ba'i sgo dang / sems can kun nas nyon mongs pa rgyu ba'i sgo dang / nyon mongs pa'i bag chags kyi sgo dang / nyon mongs pa'i sbyor ba'i sgo dang; mos pa'i sgo dang / sems can gyi spyod pa'i sgo dang / sems can gyi spyod pa rnam pa tha dad pa'i sgo dang / 'jig rten 'byung ba'i sgo dang / sems can gyi bsam pa'i sgo dang / sems can gyi 'du shes kyi rnam pa'i sgo dang
