chos kyi sgo dang / nyan thos kyi chos kyi sgo dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi chos kyi sgo dang / 'jig rten gyi chos kyi sgo dang / 'jig rten 'byung ba'i chos kyi sgo dang / 'jig rten 'jig pa'i chos kyi sgo dang / 'jig rten kun nas gnas pa'i sgo dang / 'jig rten gyi khams rnam par dag pa'i sgo dang / 'jig rten gyi khams kun nas nyon mongs pa'i sgo dang / 'jig rten gyi khams kun nas nyon mongs pa rnam par dag pa'i sgo dang / 'jig rten gyi khams rnam par dag pa la kun nas nyon mongs pa'i sgo dang; 'jig rten gyi khams gcig tu kun nas nyon mongs pa'i sgo dang / 'jig rten gyi khams gcig tu rnam par dag pa'i sgo dang / 'jig rten gyi khams gzhi mnyam pa nyid du khong du chud par bya ba'i sgo dang / 'jig rten gyi khams snrel zhi'i sgo dang / 'jig rten gyi khams spyi'u tshugs su rgyu ba'i sgo dang / mig 'phrul du 'jug pa'i sgo dang / 'jig rten gyi khams kyi rgyud kyi sgo dang / gnas kyi 'du shes kyi rnam par gyur pa'i sgo dang / phra ba rgya chen por khong du chud par bya ba'i sgo dang / rgya chen po sgo dang / sangs rgyas kyi gsung gi dkyil 'khor rnam par phye ba'i sgo dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos kyi 'khor lo mngon par bsgrub pa'i sgo dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos kyi 'khor lo tha dad pa'i sgo dang byin gyi rlabs kyi sgo dang / sangs rgyas kyi sprul pa'i sgo dang / sangs rgyas kyi sems can pha rol gyi sems thugs su chud pa'i sgo dang / sangs rgyas kyi rdzu 'phrul rnam par 'phrul pa'i sgo dang / dga' ldan gyi pho brang na bzhugs pa'i sgo nas/ yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba bstan pa'i bar gyi sgo dang / sems can gyi don tshad med pa mdzad pa'i sgo dang / chos zab mo'i tshul gyi sgo dang / chos sna tshogs kyi tshul gyi sgo dang / byang chub kyi sems kyi chos kyi rnam pa'i sgo dang / byang chub kyi sems 'byung ba'i rnam pa'i chos kyi sgo dang / byang chub kyi sems kyi tshogs kyi rnam pa'i sgo dang / smon lam gyi rnam pa'i sgo dang / spyod pa'i rnam pa'i sgo dang / mngon par shes pa'i rnam pa'i sgo dang / 'byung ba'i rnam pa'i sgo dang / gzungs rnam par dag pa'i rnam pa'i sgo dang / ye shes kyi dkyil 'khor rnam par dag pa'i rnam pa'i sgo dang / shes rab yongs su dag pa'i rnam pa'i sgo dang / byang chub tshad med pa'i rnam pa'i sgo dang / dran pa rnam par dag pa'i rnam pa'i sgo dag ste/

She said, “Focusing my attention on this means of access to perfect wisdom by way of the arrangement of the totality, meditating on it, following it, pondering it, contemplating it, making it familiar, keeping it in mind, putting it in order, putting it into effect, perfecting it, thoroughly examining it, I developed a mental control called ‘facing in all directions,’ in the sphere of which mental control incalculable tens of hundreds of thousands of media of the Teaching operate, assemble, become visible, become accessible, and develop—for example, the medium of buddha-lands, the rigs kyi bu/ de ltar kho mos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i sgo'i rgyud dran pas kun nas rnam par brgyan pa 'di shes par zad na/ kho mos byang chub sems dpa' nam mkha'i dbyings dang mnyam pa/ blo gros chos kyi dbyings ltar yangs pa/ rgyud bsod nams kyi tshogs kyis brtan pa/ 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam du zhugs pa/ 'jig rten gyi chos yongs su mi rgyu ba/ ye shes snang ba'i mig rab rib med pa rab tu thob pa/ chos kyi dbyings thams cad mun pa med par khong du chud pa/ blo nam mkha' ltar tshad med pa dang ldan pa/ dmigs pa thams cad kyi rjes su song ba'i mig can/ chags pa med pa'i sa snang ba'i snying po dang ldan pa/ chos thams cad kyi don rab tu dbye ba la mkhas pa zil gyis gnon la/ 'jig rten kun gyis zil gyis mi non pa/ 'jig rten gyi spyod pa'i tshul la rnam par spyod pa/ 'jig rten gyi lam gyi rgyud thams cad na kha na ma tho med pa/ 'jig rten gyi don byed pa la brtson pa/ 'gro ba thams cad kyi rten du gyur pa/ 'gro ba thams cad kyi ngag gi tshul dang rnam pa la mkhas pa/ 'gro ba thams cad du gnas pa'i bsam pa dang ldan pa/ bsam pa ji lta ba bzhin du rnam par dmigs pa ston pa/ dus kyi 'khor lo thams cad la dbang bsgyur ba de dag gi spyod pa shes pa'am/ yon tan brjod par nus re skan/

“I know this means of access to perfect wisdom which is the array of total mindfulness; how can I know the practice orteil the virtues of the enlightening beings whose minds are like space, whose intellects are broad as the cosmos, whose mental flow is based on accumulated virtue, who have attained transmundane understanding, who do not practice worldly ways, who have attained the eye of the light of knowledge without obscurity, who clearly discern all realms of reality, whose awareness is infinite as space, whose eyes are mindful of all objects, who are filled with the light of the state of nonobstruction, who are skilled in analyzing all doctrines, meanings, and statements, who are not overcome by any world, who conduct themselves well according to worldly standards and are irreproachable in any worldly state, who are intent on the well-being of all worlds, who are a refuge for all beings, who know the manners and courtesies of speech of all worlds, who can give the appearances of dress and habitation of all worlds as they wish, and who are masters of all wheels of time?

song / rigs kyi bu/ lho phyogs kyi rgyud 'di nyid na/ yul mig gsum pa zhes bya ba yod de/ de na dge slong blta na sdug pa zhes bya ba 'dug gi/ de'i gan du song la; ji ltar byang chub sems dpas byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa la bslab par bya ba dang / ji ltar nan tan du bya ba dri sa shig /
“Go south, to the land called Trinayana, where a monk named Sudarshana lives. Go ask him how an enlightening being is to learn and carry out the practice of enlightening beings.”

de nas tshong dpon gyi bu nor bzang gis/ bu mo byams ma'i rkang pa gnyis la spyi bos phyag 'tshal te/ bu mo byams ma la lan brgya stong du mar g.yas phyogs su bskor ba byas nas/ yang dang yang bltas te/ bu mo byams ma'i drung nas song ngo//
Then Sudhana paid his respects to Maitrayani and left.
[dge slong blta na sdug pa]
Sudarshana

de nas tshong dpon gyi bu nor bzang byang chub sems dpa'i ye shes kyi rnam par spyod pa zab mo rjes su bsam pa dang / chos kyi dbyings kyi gzhi zab mo khong du chud par bya ba rjes su bsam pa dang / sems can gyi ye shes shin tu phra zhing zab pa rjes su bsam pa dang / 'jig rten gyi 'du shes kyi rnam pa zab mo rjes su bsam pa dang / mngon par 'du bya ba med pa'i dbyings zab mo rjes su bsam pa dang / sems kyi rgyud kyi dbyings zab mo rjes su bsam pa dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i dbyings zab mo rjes su bsam pa dang / rang bzhin gyis bden pa'i dbyings zab mo rjes su bsam pa dang / 'gro ba thams cad kyi rnam par spyod pa bden pa'i dbyings zab mo rjes su bsam pa dang / chos kyi dbyings brgyan pa'i rgyan gyi dbyings zab mo rjes su bsam pa dang / lus kyi 'khrul 'khor shugs kyis 'khor ba'i dbyings zab mo rjes su bsam pa dang / las kyis sna tshogs su gyur pa'i dbyings zab mo rjes su bsam pa byed cing / mthar gyis yul mig gsum pa gang na ba der phyin te/

Then, contemplating the profound discernment of enlightening beings’ knowledge, the profound attainment of the base of the reality realm, the profound knowledge of all subtleties, the profundity of the conceptuality of the world, the profundity of the base of nondoing, the profundity of the base of the mental stream, the profundity of the base of interdependent origination, the profundity of the plane of truth in terms of inherent nature, the profundity of the plane of truth in terms of the conventions of sentient beings, the profundity of the ground of adornment of the cosmos, the profundity of the plane of observation of the operation of the body, and the profundity of the ground of the world of action and thought, Sudhana made his way to the land of Trinayana.

Looking for the monk Sudarshana in towns and cities, marketplaces and villages, in herding stations, in hermitages, in the provinces, in mountains, caves, and forests, he saw Sudarshana walking around in a certain woods, young and handsome, with the physical marks and embellishments of a great man, his gaze steady, mindful, of vast intelligence, intent on the sphere of insuperable knowledge, his mind free from all vacillation, vain imagination, idle fancies, and false ideas, abiding in pure knowledge, aware of the vast range of enlightened knowledge, firmly resolved to guide all beings to full development, with a vast sphere of great compassion, aiming to bear the eye of the teachings of all buddhas, aiming to produce the light of knowledge in all sentient beings, ever-mindful of the way of the enlightened, treading it for the sake of all sentient beings, walking quietly and steadily, neither quickly nor slowly, dressed like the deities of the pure abodes, surrounded by all kinds of beings.
Furthermore, in front of Sudarshana as he walked were deities of direction who caused the world to turn; footstep-following deities received his steps on jewel lotuses; fire deities with inexhaustible spheres of light dispelled the darkness; forest deities showered rain of flowering plants; earth deities, the source of stability, revealed jewel mines; sky deities, their splendor illumining everywhere, adorned the sky; glorious ocean deities scattered great jewels over him; polar mountain deities, full of purity, folded their hands in respectful salutation; wind deities of unobstructed power gave off a fragrant flowery breeze; springlike night deities prostrated their beautifully adorned bodies in respect; ever-awakening daylight deities hovered in the sky holding banners of radiant jewels to produce light.

de nas tshong dpon gyi bu nor bzang / dge slong blta na sdug pa gang na ba der phyin nas/ dge slong blta na sdug pa'i rkang pa'i bol gnyis la/ spyi bos gtugs te phyag 'tshal nas/ dge slong blta na /kho bos de bzhin gshegs pa de dag thams cad kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rnam par dag pa'ang / kun tu bzang po'i spyod pas 'byung ba'i stobs kyis mngon par bsgrubs so/ /

Sudhana went up to the monk Sudarshana, paid his respects, and said, “Noble one, I have set out for supreme perfect enlightenment and seek the practice of enlightening beings. I have heard you give enlightening beings instruction, and I ask you to tell me how an enlightening being is to learn and carry out the practice of enlightening beings.”
Sudarshana said, “I am young, and have only recently become a monk. At that, in one life I have performed religious practice in the company of as many buddhas as grains of sand in thirty-eight Ganges Rivers. With some I performed spiritual practice for a day and a night, with some for a week, with some for a fortnight, with some for a month, with some for a year, with some for a century, with some for a millennium, with some for a hundred millennia, with some for a million years, with some for a trillion years, with some for untold, inexpressible numbers of years, with some for an intermediate eon, with some for half an eon, with some for an eon, with some for as long as untold, inexpressible numbers of eons, and from all those buddhas I heard explanation of the Teaching and received instruction. My vows were purified, my sphere of practice entering into the realm of realization was purified, the oceans of transcendent ways were fulfilled, I perceived their mystical transformations on attainment of enlightenment, I remembered their successive cycles of teaching without confusion, I realized the equality of their powers, and I preserved their instructions till the end of the right doctrine.
“I also realized all those buddhas’ past vows for the purification of their buddha-lands, by the power of accomplishment of concentration on the sphere of vows. I also realized all those buddhas past enlightening practices for the purification of their own practice, by the power of attainment of concentration entering into all practices. I realized all those buddhas’ purification of the transcendent ways, by the power of setting out on universally good practice.

gzhan yang rigs kyi bu/ kho bo 'chag sa 'di na 'chags pa'i tshe/ phyogs kyi rgyud kyi sgo thams cad kyang shin tu rnam par lta ba'i ye shes kyi sgos mngon du 'gyur ro/ /'jig rten gyi khams kyi rgyud kyi sgo thams cad kyang / smon lam chen po mngon par bsgrubs pa'i stobs kyis sems bskyed pa gcig la 'jig rten gyi khams brjod du med pa'i yang brjod du med pa 'da' zhing / yongs su dag par bya ba'i phyir rnam par 'grub par 'gyur ro/ /sems kyi skad cig gcig la sems can gyi spyod pa'i tshul gyi sgo brjod du med pa'i yang brjod du med pa dag kyang / byang chub sems dpa' kun tu bzang po'i spyod pa dang / smon lam mngon par bsgrubs pa'i stobs kyis stobs bcu'i ye shes yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir mngon sum du 'gyur ro; ;sems bskyed pa gcig la sangs rgyas brjod du med pa'i yang brjod du med pa mthong ba rnam par dag pa dag kyang snga phyi'i de bzhin gshegs pa rnams la mchod pa'i smon lam mngon par bsgrubs pa'i stobs kyis de bzhin gshegs pa sangs rgyas kyi zhing brjod du med pa'i yang brjod du med pa'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed la mchod pa dang / bsnyen bkur ba dang; rim gro bya ba'i phyir mngon du 'gyur ro/ /sems bskyed pa gcig la de bzhin gshegs pa brjod du med pa'i yang brjod du med pa'i chos kyi sprin gyi char rnams kyang / chos kyi 'khor lo yongs su 'dzin pa'i gzungs dang / smon lam mngon par bsgrubs pa'i stobs kyis chos kyi tshul grangs med pa rnam par 'tshang rgya zhing khong du chud par bya ba'i phyir bsam pa la mngon par 'bab bo/ /sems bskyed pa gcig la byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa rgya mtsho brjod du med pa'i yang brjod du med pa dag kyang / byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa mig 'phrul lta bu yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i smon lam mngon par bsgrubs pa'i stobs kyi spyod pa'i dkyil 'khor thams cad yongs su dag par bya ba'i phyir mngon du 'gyur ro; ;sems bskyed pa gcig la ting nge 'dzin rgya mtsho brjod du med pa'i yang brjod du med pa dag kyang / ting nge 'dzin gyi sgo gcig tu/ ting nge 'dzin gyi sgo thams cad yang dag par 'du bar bya ba'i smon lam mngon par bsgrubs pa'i stobs kyis ting nge 'dzin gyi dkyil 'khor thams cad yongs su dag par bya ba'i phyir mngon du 'gyur ro/ /sems bskyed pa gcig la dbang po rgya mtsho brjod du med pa'i yang brjod du med pa dag kyang / dran pa'i mthar phyin pa'i dbang po thob par bya ba'i smon lam mngon par bsgrubs pa'i stobs kyi dbang po'i 'khor lo dang / dus kyi 'khor lo thams cad kyi rjes su 'brang bar bya ba'i phyir mngon du 'gyur ro/ /sems bskyed pa gcig la dus kyi 'khor lo brjod du med pa'i yang brjod du med pa dag kyang / sems can zad mi shes pa zad par bya ba'i smon lam mngon par bsgrubs pa'i stobs kyis dus thams cad du chos kyi 'khor lo rab tu bskor ba'i phyir mngon du 'gyur ro/ /sems bskyed pa gcig la dus rgya mtsho brjod du med pa'i yang brjod du med pa thams cad kyang / dus gcig tu rnam par dgod pa'i tshul khong du chud pa'i ye shes snang ba'i smon lam mngon par bsgrubs pa'i stobs kyis/ 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad kyi dus gsum rnam par dgod pa'i phyir mngon sum du 'gyur te/ rigs kyi bu/ kho bos ni/ byang chub sems dpa'i rnam par thar pa shin tu zhi bar mi 'gyur ba'i sgron ma zhes bya ba 'di shes par zad na/ kho bos byang chub sems dpa' bsam pa rdo rje lta bu dang ldan pa/ de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi rigs su rigs dang ldan par byung ba/ srog gi dbang po la rgyun chad pa med pa/ ye shes kyi sgron ma zhi bar 'gyur ba med pa/ mi shigs mi phyed pa'i lus dang ldan pa/ sgyu ma'i rnam pa lta bu'i gzugs shin tu grub pa rgyu'i chos mnyam pa'i yan lag dang nying lag tu ldan pa'i lus can; 'gro ba rnams kyi bsam pa ji lta ba bzhin du/ rnam par dmigs par byed pa'i lus dang ldan pa/ 'gro ba thams cad dang 'dra ba'i gzugs dang / lus dang / kha dog dang dbyibs dang / chu zheng yongs su ston pa/ me mdag dang / me lce dang / dug dang / mtshon gyis mi tshugs pa'i lus dang ldan pa/ rdo rje ltar sra zhing khor yug ltar thub pa med pa'i lus can; bdud dang phas kyi rgol ba thams cad kyi stobs kyi stobs med par byed pa/ 'dzam bu chu klung gi gser gyi ri bo dang 'dra bar 'gro ba kun las mngon par 'phags pa'i lus dang ldan pa/ 'gro ba thams cad du rnam par dmigs pa'i gzhi dang ldan pa/ sgo thams cad du rnam par dmigs shing thos par 'gyur ba/ 'gro ba thams cad kyis ngor blta ba/ chos thams cad kyi sprin gyi 'byung gnas su gyur pa/ phyogs kun du rnam par snang ba/ sgrib pa'i ri thams cad rnam par gtor bas blta na mdzes pa/ mi dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad shin tu 'joms pas shin tu dpa' bar snang ba/ dge ba'i rtsa ba rgya chen po'i rgyu mthun pa las byung bas blta na dga' ba/ 'byung bar shin tu dka' zhing dkon pas me tog u dum wA ra lta bu de dag gi spyod pa shes pa'am/ yon tan brjod par nus re skan/

“Furthermore, as I walk here, all realms flow toward me because of keenly observant knowledge being brought to the fore: all worlds flow away from me for the purification of passing over untold worlds in a single thought, by the power of accomplishment of great vows. In a single thought untold practical principles for sentient beings appear to me, for the fulfillment of the knowledge of the ten powers, by the power of carrying out the vows of practice of universally good enlightening beings. In a single thought the purities of visions of untold buddha-lands appear to me, so I may honor, attend, and serve as many buddhas as atoms in untold buddha-lands, by the power of carrying out the vow to serve former and future buddhas. In a single thought the teachings of untold buddhas occur to my mind, by the power of carrying out the vow to remember wheels of teaching accompanied by countless ways of proceeding with the teachings in action. In a single thought, untold oceans of enlightening practices appear to me, for the purification of all spheres of practice, by the power of carrying out the vow to fulfill the practices of enlightening beings, which are all interrelated. In a single thought, untold oceans of concentrations become manifest to me, for the purification of all spheres of concentration, by the power of carrying out the vow to comprehend all ways of concentration in one way of concentration. In a single thought untold oceans of faculties appear to me, for adaptation to all faculties and times, by the power of carrying out the vow to attain the faculty of ultimate mindfulness. In a single thought, untold wheels of time are manifest to me, for conveying timely teachings, by the power of carrying out the endless vow to continue till the end of sentient beings. In a single thought, untold oceans of all pasts, presents, and futures appear to me, for the definition of past, present, and future in all worlds, by the power of carrying out the vow for illumination of comprehensive knowledge.
“So I know the enlightening liberation ‘the lamp of knowledge which is never extinguished.’ How can I know the practice or tell the virtues of the enlightening beings with adamantine will, who are born in the families of all buddhas, who have undying life-roots, whose light of knowledge is never extinguished, who have indestructible bodies, whose magical forms are without end, who embody the principle of relativity, who appear to sentient beings according to their mentalities, whose bodies appear like those of all beings in color, form, and size, whose bodies are not harmed by fire, poisons, or weapons, whose beings are invulnerable as adamantine mountains, who vitiate the power of all demons and opponents, who shine like mountains of gold, whose bodies stand out among all beings, whose bodies are perceived by all beings, who are heard of everywhere, who are looked up to by all sentient beings, who are mines of the earth of all truths, who illumine all quarters, who are seen without opposition because they have destroyed the mountains of obstructions, who are seen as supreme heroes because they extirpate all roots of evil, who are a welcome sight because they are products of many virtues, who are like udumbara flowers because they very rarely appear?

song / rigs kyi bu/ lho phyogs kyi rgyud 'di nyid na/ yul dge sbyong gi dkyil 'khor zhes bya ba na/ grong khyer sgo bzang po zhes bya ba yod de/ de na khye'u dbang po'i dbang phyug ces bya ba 'dug gi/ de'i gan du song la/ ji ltar byang chub sems dpas byang chub sems dpa'i spyad pa la bslab par bya ba dang / ji ltar nan tan du bya ba dris shig /

“South of here, in the land of Shramanamandala, is a city called Sumukha, where a boy named Indriyeshvara lives. Go ask him how an enlightening being is to learn and carry out the practice of enlightening beings.”

Then, intent on purifying attainment of the valor of enlightening beings, his mind illumined by the light of the power of enlightening beings, with the invincible energy of enlightening beings in his heart, his mind girded with the armor of the steadfast vows of enlightening beings, the breadth of the firm basis of intent of enlightening beings on his mind, determined to maintain the multitude of practices of enlightening beings, never tiring of the ways of enlightening beings, resolved to attain all qualities of enlightening beings, desiring to offer himself as a charioteer for all beings, desiring to bring all beings across the wasteland of the mundane whirl, never tiring of seeing, listening to, and attending spiritual benefactors, with immeasurable respect for the Teaching, Sudhana paid his respects to the monk Sudarshana and left.

Indriyeshvara

de nas tshong dpon gyi bu nor bzang dge slong blta na sdug pa de'i gdams ngag rjes su zlos shing / spel ba dang / bstud pa dang / rab tu dbye ba dang / bshad pa dang / so sor rnam par sgom pa dang / brjod pa dang / yang dag par bstan pa dang / rjes su bsam pa dang / mngon par 'jug pa bya ba dang; Thinking about the instruction of Sudarshana, applying it, passing it on, investigating it, talking about it, revealing it, contemplating it, approaching it, following it, reflecting on the principle of his teaching, entering into it, bringing it near, analyzing it, explaining it, elucidating it, pondering it, Sudhana, surrounded by celestial beings, spirits, and cherubim, made his way to the city of Sumukha in the land of Shramanamandala, looking for the boy Indriyeshvara.
Then, when Sudhana got to the city Sumukha, near a river junction, he saw Indriyeshvara, surrounded by ten thousand boys, playing in the sand. He went up to Indriyeshvara, paid his respects, and said, “Noble one, I have set my mind on supreme perfect enlightenment, but I do not know how an enlightening being is to learn and carry out the practice of enlightening beings.”

Indriyeshvara said, “I have been taught writing and mathematics by Manjushri, and have been led into the door of knowledge encompassing higher knowledge of all practical arts. So I know all the various arts and crafts and sciences in the world dealing with writing, mathematics and symbols, physiology, rhetoric, physical and mental health, city planning, architecture and construction, mechanics and engineering, divination, agriculture and commerce, conduct and manners, good and bad actions, good and bad principles, what makes for felicity and what for misery, what is necessary for the vehicles of buddhas, disciples, and individual illuminates, what is necessary for buddhahood, and behavior linking reason and action. I know all these sciences, and I also introduce and teach them to people, and get people to study and practice them, to master and develop them, using these as means to purify, refine, and broaden people.

an immeasureable to the fourth power is unspeakable; an unspeakable to the fourth power is unspeakably unspeakable; and unspeakably unspeakable squared is untold.”

de'i mdun na bye ma'i phung po chen po dpag tshad du ma'i tshad dang ldan pa zhig 'dug 'dug pa las 'di la bye ma'i 'bru 'di snyed cig yod do/ /zhes bya ba nas/ bye ma'i 'bru brjod du med pa'i yang brjod du med pa la bsgres pa 'di snyed cig yod do/ /zhes rab tu phye nas bgrang brtsis te grangs su bcad do/ /des bye ma'i phung po de rtsis kyi brdar bstan pas shin tu bstan nas 'di skad ces smras so/ /rigs kyi bu/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi bgrang ba'i tshul 'di ni/ 'jig rten gyi khams gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pa kun na'ang yod do/ /byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni bgrang ba'i tshul 'dis/ shar phyogs kyi 'jig rten gyi khams 'byams klas pa dag kyang bgrang zhing brtsi'o/ /de bzhin du lho phyogs dang / nub phyogs dang / byang phyogs dang / byang shar gyi phyogs mtshams dang / shar lho'i phyogs mtshams dang / lho nub kyi phyogs mtshams dang / nub byang gi phyogs mtshams dang / 'og dang / steng gi phyogs su'ang byang chub sems dpa' rnams bgrang ba'i tshul 'dis/ 'jig rten gyi khams 'byams klas pa dag kyang bgrang zhing brtsi'o /rigs kyi bu/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi bgrang ba'i tshul 'di ni/ phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyi ming du bya ba/ gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pa bstan du yod pa thams cad na'ang yod do/ /byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni bgrang ba'i tshul 'dis phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyi ming gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pa bgrang zhing brtsi'o /ji ltar 'jig rten gyi khams kyi ming gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pa bstan du yod pa de bzhin du/ phyogs bcu'i bskal pa'i ming gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pa bstan du yod pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi mtshan gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pa bstan du yod pa dang / chos kyi ming gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pa bstan du yod pa dang / sems can gyi ming gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pa bstan du yod pa dang; las kyi ming gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pa bstan du yod pa kun la'ang 'jug ste/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi bgrang ba'i tshul 'di nyid ni/ phyogs bcu na ming du bya ba gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pa bstan du rung ba ji snyed pa thams cad la'ang 'jug ste/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni bgrang ba'i tshul 'dis/ phyogs bcu na ming gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pa ji snyed yod pa thams cad kyang bgrang zhing brtsi'o/ /

He counted out the grains of sand in the miles-wide mass of sand before him, telling how many grains of sand there were, and how many unspeakable numbers of grains of sand there were; then, having indicated this by these conventions of enumeration, he said, “This counting device serves enlightening beings for the succession of worlds; by this method of counting they count the multitudes of worlds in the ten directions. This method of counting serves enlightening beings in indicating the worlds in the ten directions in an orderly continuum. By this method of counting, enlightening beings count the string of names of the worlds in the ten directions. As in the case of indications of the string of names of worlds, in the same way this method of counting serves enlightening beings in indicating the successions of names of eons, buddhas, doctrines, sentient beings, actions, and indeed everything in the ten directions.

de ltar rigs kyi bu/ kho bo pa ni/ byang chub sems dpa'i ye shes snang ba chos thams cad shes par bya ba'i bzo mngon par shes pa dang ldan pa 'di shes par zad na/ kho bos byang chub sems dpa' 'gro ba thams cad kyi grangs la zhugs pa/ chos kyi tshul thams cad kyi grangs la zhugs pa/ dus gsum gyi grangs la zhugs pa/ sems can thams cad kyi grangs la zhugs pa/ chos kyi phung po thams cad kyi grangs la zhugs pa/ sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyi grangs la zhugs pa/ chos thams cad kyi ming gi 'khor lo dbang bsgyur ba de dag gi spyod pa shes pa'am/ yon tan brjod pa'am/ spyod yul smos pa'am/ yul brjod pa'am/ stobs bsngags pa'am/ bsam pa bstan pa'am/ tshogs yongs su brjod pa'am/ smon lam bshad par bya ba'am/ spyod pa yongs su bstan pa'am/ pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su dag pa mngon par brjod pa'am/ yang dag par bsgrub pa yongs su dag pa'am/ yang dag par bstan pa'am/ ting nge 'dzin gyi khyad par smos pa'am/ ye shes snang ba khod du chud par nus re skan/

“I know this light of knowledge of enlightening beings which is characterized by higher knowledge of all arts and sciences. How can I know the practice, tell of the virtues, indicate the range, show the sphere, describe the power, show the will, elucidate the preparation, explain the commitment, show the conduct, illumine the purity of transcendent ways, expound the purity of accomplishment, tell of the sphere of concentration, or approach the light of knowledge of the enlightening beings who know the number of all worlds, who know the number of all modes of spiritual practice, who know the number of pasts, presents, and futures, who know the number of all sentient beings, who know the number of all bodies of doctrine, who know the number of enlightenments of all buddhas, and who command the wheel of names of all the teachings?”

song / rigs kyi bu/ lho phyogs kyi rgyud 'di nyid na/ grong khyer rgya mtsho brtan pa zhes bya ba yod de/ de na dge bsnyen ma phul du byung ba zhes bya ba 'dug gi/ de'i gan du song la ji ltar byang chub sems dpas byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa la bslab par bya ba dang / ji ltar nan tan du bya ba dris shig /
“South of here is a city called Samudrapratishthana, where lives a lay devotee named Prabhuta. Go ask her how an enlightening being is to learn and carry out the practice of enlightening beings.”

de nas tshong dpon gyi bu nor bzang dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyi tshig thos nas spu g.yos te/ dga' ba chen po'i shugs skyes nas/ rab tu dga' ba'i yid dang ldan par gyur pa/ ngo mtshar gyi bsam pa rin po che rab tu dkon pa thob pa/ 'gro ba mang po la phan pa'i sems dang / bsam pas byung ba/ sangs rgyas skyes pa gcig nas gcig tu brgyud par 'gro ba la dbang bsgyur ba/ chos kyi dkyil 'khor rnam par dag pa'i blo gros la rten pa/ thams cad du rjes su song ba'i rigs rnam par phye bas 'byung ba bstan pa la brtson pa/ dus gsum gyi dbyings su ma 'dres pa'i sangs rgyas gyi yul dang ldan pa/ bsod nams mi zad pa'i rgya mtsho las byung ba'i sems dang ldan pa/ ye shes kyi snang ba chen po la dbang bsgyur ba khams gsum gyi khyim du sdud pa'i sgo shin tu gcod pa des/ khye'u dbang po'i dbang phyug gi rkang pa gnyis la spyi bos phyag 'tshal nas/ khye'u dbang po'i dbang phyug la lan brgya stong du mar g.yas phyogs su bskor ba byas nas/ yang dang yang bltas te/ khye'u dbang po'i dbang phyug gi drung nas song ngo/ /

Having heard the words of the spiritual benefactor, Sudhana was thrilled and overjoyed; he paid his respects and took leave of Indriyeshvara, having obtained the treasure of will that is rare and most difficult to obtain, setting out to act benevolently toward all, freely able to perceive the succession of emergence of buddhas, intent on the wisdom to clarify the sphere of the Teaching, intent on showing the various means of emancipation everywhere, aware of past, present, and future without confusion, his mind an inexhaustible ocean of virtue, in control of the light of great knowledge, having broken open the doors of confinement in the city of mundane existence.
[dge bsnyen ma phul du byung ba]
Prabhuta

de nas tshong dpon gyi bu nor bzang / dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyi gdams ngag gi sprin gyi char yongs su 'dzin pa byed cing / gangs chen mtsho ltar sprin chen po'i char gyis ngoms mi shes pa/ dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyi nyi ma'i ye shes kyi 'od zer gyis/ dge ba yongs su smin par byas pa'i sa gzhi las dbang po'i myu gu 'thon cing skyes pa/ dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyi zla ba nya zhing rgyas pa'i gdams ngag gi 'od zer kyi dra bas/ lus dang sems shin tu tshim par byas pa/ dpyid kyi nyi ma'i 'od kyis gdungs pa'i ri kyi tshogs gsal zhing bsil ba'i gangs chu la 'thung bar 'dod pa ltar dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyi gdams ngag gi chu la 'thung bar 'dod pa/ bung ba mang po 'khor zhing lding bas rgyas par gyur pa'i pad mo dang ldan pa'i pad mo'i mtsho ltar dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyi gdams ngag gis/ sems kyi me tog puN+Da ri ka kha bye ba/ rin po che sna tshogs kyis yongs su rgyas pa'i rin po che'i gling ltar dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyi gdams ngag rin po che 'phel ba'i snang bas sems shin tu snang bar byas pa/ 'dzam bu'i shing chen po me tog dang 'bras bu'i tshogs chen po dang ldan pa ltar dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyi gdams ngag /bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs su gyur pa phun sum tshogs pa dang ldan pa/ klu'i dbang po chen po rtsed mo dam pas rtse ba las byung ba'i nam mkha'i sprin chen po ltar dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyi gdams ngag thos pa'i tshogs su gyur pa'i rnang shin tu che ba/ sum cu rtsa gsum pa'i 'jig rten gyis brgyan pa'i sna tshogs kyi spo ltar dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyi gdams ngag las byung ba'i chos dri ma med pa sna tshogs brtsegs pa'i spor gyur pa /sum cu rtsa gsum pa'i tshogs kyi 'khor gyis bskor ba'i brgya byin/ lha ma yin gyi dbang po'i tshogs rab tu 'joms pa ltar dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyi gdams ngag las byung ba'i yon tan dri ma med pa'i tshogs kyis yongs su bskor cing zil gyis mi non la/ gzhan la zil gyis gnon pa de/ mthar gyis grong khyer rgya mtsho brtan pa gang na ba der phyin te/ dge bsnyen ma phul du byung ba yongs su tshol tshol ba las/ de la skye bo mang pos bstan te/ rigs kyi bu/ dge bsnyen ma phul du byung ba de/ grong khyer gyi dbus kyi rang gi khyim na 'dug go zhes nas/

Then, receiving the multitude of teachings of spiritual benefactors as the ocean receives torrential rains without being filled, the sprouts of his faculties raised from clear ground and developed by the rays of light of knowledge of sunlike spiritual benefactors, his body and mind cooled by the aura of light of teaching of the full moon of spiritual benefactors, having drunk the water of the teachings of spiritual benefactors like a herd of animals burnt by the heat of the summer sun, the lotuses of his mind opened like a blooming lotus pond by the instructions of spiritual benefactors like water flowing from the snowy mountains, his being illumined by the practice of the precious instructions of spiritual benefactors, like a treasure island covered with jewels, successful in accumulating knowledge and virtue according to the instructions of spiritual benefactors, like a great tree laden with flowers and fruits, having an abundant store of learning of instructions of spiritual benefactors, like a great cloud in the sky produced by the sport of dragons, a radiant mountain peak of various virtues arising from the instruction of spiritual benefactors like the wonderful peak of the world of the thirty-three heavens, full of pure qualities produced by the instructions of spiritual benefactors, overpowering and invincible like the god Indra surrounded by the deities of the thirty-three heavens who conquers the leaders and hordes of titans, Sudhana made his way to the city Samudrapratishthana, looking for the devotee Prabhuta. He was told by the people there that Prabhuta was in her house in the middle of town.

tshong dpon gyi bu nor bzang dge bsnyen ma phul du byung ba'i gnas gang ba der song ste/ thal mo sbyar nas sgo khang na sdod sdod pa dang / des dge bsnyen ma phul du byung ba'i khyim de shin tu rgya che la yangs shing rin po che'i ra bas yongs su bskor ba/ phyogs bzhi nas sgo shin tu mdzes pa rnam par phye ba/ rin po che tshad med grangs med pa'i rgyan gyis brgyan pa/ bsod nams kyi rnam par smin pas mngon par grub pa mthong nas/ de khyim der song ste kun tu bltas na/ dge bsnyen ma phul du byung ba/ na chung shin tu gzhon la/ thog ma dar la bab pa/ gzugs mngon zhing mdzes la blta na sdug pa/ kha dog dam pa pri ya pa shin tu rgyas pa dang ldan pa/ skra phye mar bzhag pa/ lus la rgyan med pa/ gos dang / smad g.yogs dkar po bgos pa/ rin po che'i khri la 'dug pa mthong ste/ sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' ma gtogs par de'i lus sam/ sems kyi dbang ngam/ gzi brjid dam/ kha dog gis zil gyis mngon pa'i sems can ni khyim de na gang yang med de/ lha'am mi'ang rung ste/ sems can gang gis dge bsnyen ma phul du byung ba mthong bar gyur pa de dag thams cad kyis kyang / dge bsnyen ma phul du byung ba la ston pa'i 'du shes su bsam pa zhig /rin po che'i khri la 'dug pa mthong ngo/ /

Sudhana went to Prabhuta’s house and stood before the entrance with his hands joined in respectful salutation. He saw that her house was very large, covered with precious ornaments, with doors on all four sides, arrayed with countless jewels, the result of the development of inconceivable virtues. Entering the house and looking around, he saw the devotee Prabhuta in a jeweled chair, young, slim, fresh, in the blossom of youth, radiantly beautiful, her hair hanging loose, wearing no ornaments on her body, clothed in pure white garments. Except for buddhas and enlightening beings, no one came to that house whom she did not overwhelm by her appearance, her mastery of mind, her radiance, her voice, or her splendor. All who saw Prabhuta, whether human or celestial beings, thought of her as a teacher.

gzhan yang khyim de na/ stan lha rdzas dang / mi'i rdzas las shin tu 'phags pa/ byang chub sems dpa'i las kyi rnam par smin pas yongs su grub pa bye ba stong phrag bcu bting ba dang / mdun du phru ba gcig cig bzhag pa las kha zas dang / skom gyi bag gam/ gos dang / rgyan gyi longs spyod kyi bag gzhan ci'ang mi snang ngo/ / bud med stong phrag bcu tsam zhig mdun na 'dug par mthong na'ang / de dag thams cad kyang lha'i bu mo'i kha dog dang ldan pa/ lha'i bu mo'i gzugs dang ldan pa/ lha'i bu mo'i tshul dang ldan pa/ lha'i bu mo'i spyod pa dang ldan pa/ lha'i bu mo'i longs spyod dang ldan pa/ lha'i bu mo'i tshul du shis pa dang ldan pa/ lha rdzas kyi gos yid bzhin du gyon pa/ lha rdzas kyi lhab lhub kyis shin tu klubs pa/ lha'i bu mo'i skad lta bu'i dbyangs snyan pa dang ldan pa/ lha'i bu mo'i chu zheng mdzes pa dang ldan pa sha stag ste/ de'i 'khor gyi bud med kyang / nges ci bsgo ba bzhin du byed cing mdun na 'khod do/ /rim gro byed do/ /bkur sti byed do/ /gdong du lta'o/ /ci bsgo ba nyan cing gnas so/ /rje sar 'khod do/ /yongs su lta'o/ /rnam par lta'o; ;'dud do/ /rab tu 'dud do/ /phyag 'tshal lo/ /de dag gi lus las spos kyi ngad ldang pas ni/ grong khyer de'i 'khor thams cad du dri zhim pos khyab par 'dug ste/ sems can gang gis dri de tshor bar 'gyur ba de dag thams cad kyang gnod sems med pa'i sems dang / shar gnyer med pa'i sems dang / 'tshe ba med pa'i sems dang / phrag dog dang; 'jungs pa dang bral ba'i sems dang / sgyu dang g.yo med pa'i sems dang / chags pa dang / khong khro ba med pa'i sems dang / zhum ba dang / gzengs mtho ba med pa'i sems dang; byams pa'i sems dang / phan pa'i sems dang / sdom pa la gnas pa'i sems dang / gzhan gyis yongs su bzung ba la re ba med pa'i sems su gyur te/ gang gis de dag gi skad thos pa de dag thams cad kyang dga' ba dang / mos pa dang / dul ba'i sems dang ldan par 'gyur ro/ /gang gis de dag mthong bar gyur pa de dag kyang 'dod chags dang bral ba tsam du rang rang gis shes par 'gyur ro/ /de ltar mthong nas/

Also, in her house were arrayed ten million seats, superior to those of celestials and humans, perfected by the deeds of enlightening beings. There were no provisions of food or drink, or clothing or jewelry or other accoutrements to be seen in the house, except for a vessel placed before her. He also saw ten thousand ladies like goddesses standing before her, wearing celestial clothing and ornaments, with pleasing voices like goddesses. Those ladies, her attendants, responding to her word, waited on her, watched her, kept their attention on her, respectfully saluted her, looked at her, bowed to her, and expressed their reverence for her. The fragrance from their bodies perfumed the whole city, and all who smelled the fragrance became free from malice, free from hostility, nonviolent, free from envy and jealousy, free from guile and deceitfulness, disciplined, mentally unobstructed, free from depression and elation, even-minded, kind, altruistic, restrained in mind, charitable. And whoever heard their voices became happy, joyful, and humble in mind. And whoever saw them felt themselves freed of lust.

tshong dpon gyi bu nor bzang gis/ dge bsnyen ma phul du byung ba'i rkang pa gnyis la spyi bos phyag 'tshal te; dge bsnyen ma phul du byung ba la lan brgya stong du mar g.yas phyogs su bskor ba byas nas/ mdun du 'dug ste thal mo sbyar nas 'di skad ces smras so/ /'phags ma/ bdag gis bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed na/ ji ltar byang chub sems dpas byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa la bslab par bgyi ba dang / ji ltar nan tan du bgyi ba ma 'tshal te/ 'phags ma ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams la gdams ngag dang rjes su bstan pa mdzad do/ /zhes bdag gis thos na/ 'phags ma/ ji ltar byang chub sems dpas byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa la bslab par bgyi ba dang / ji ltar nan tan du bgyi ba bdag la bshad du gsol/

Then Sudhana paid his respects to Prabhuta and politely said to her, “Noble one, I have set my mind on supreme perfect enlightenment, but I do not know how to learn and carry out the practice of enlightening beings. I hear you give enlightening beings instruction, so I beg of you to tell me how an enlightening being is to learn and carry out the practice of enlightening beings.”

smras pa/ rigs kyi bu/ kho mo ni/ byang chub sems dpa'i rnam par thar pa bsod nams kyi mdzod mi zad pa'i rgyan ces bya ba thob ste/ rigs kyi bu/ kho mo ni phru ba gcig po 'di las mos pa sna tshogs can rnams/ kha zas ci la dga' ba bzhin du tshod ma sna tshogs dang / ro sna tshogs dang / kha dog sna tshogs dang / dri sna tshogs kyis tshim par byed de/ rigs kyi bu; de ltar kho mo ni phru ba gcig po 'di las ci la dga' ba'i kha zas kyis sems can brgya'ang yongs su tshim par byed do/ /sems can stong dang / sems can brgya phrag stong dang / sems can bye ba dang / sems can bye ba phrag brgya dang / sems can bye ba phrag stong dang / sems can bye ba brgya phrag stong dang / sems can bye ba khrag khrig brgya phrag stong nas/ sems can brjod du med pa'i yang brjod du med pa/ mos pa sna tshogs can rnams kyang / ci la dga' ba'i kha zas kyis yongs su tshim par byed do/ /yongs su stob par byed do/ /yongs su dga' bar byed do/ /yongs su mgu bar byed do/ /yongs su spro bar byed do/ /shin tu tshim par byed do/ /yid bde bar byed do/ /'on kyang phru ba 'di las 'god par 'gyur ba med de/ 'grib pa med do/ /dma' bar mi 'gyur ro/ /zad par mi 'gyur ro/ /'bri bar mi 'gyur ro/ /sa mtshams yod par mi 'gyur ro/ /mthar thug par mi 'gyur ro/ /mur thug par mi 'gyur ro/ /rigs kyi bu/ gzhung de dang 'dra bar sems can 'dzam bu'i gling gi rdul shin tu phra ba snyed dang / de bzhin du gling bzhi pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams gyi rdul shin tu phra ba snyed dang / stong gi 'jig rten gyi khams kyi rdul shin tu phra ba snyed dang / stong gnyis kyi 'jig rten gyi khams kyi rdul shin tu phra ba snyed dang / stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyi rdul shin tu phra ba snyed nas/ sems can mos pa sna tshogs can/ sangs rgyas kyi zhing brjod du med pa'i yang brjod du med pa'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed cig 'ongs kyang ci la dga' ba'i kha zas tshod ma sna tshogs dang / ro sna tshogs dang / kha dog sna tshogs dang / dri sna tshogs kyis yongs su tshim par byed do/ /yongs su dga' bar byed do/ /nyams bde bar byed do/ /shin tu tshim par byed do/ /yid shin tu bde bar byed do/ /'on kyang phru ba 'di las 'god par 'gyur ba med de/ 'grib pa med do; ;dma' bar mi 'gyur ro/ /zad par mi 'gyur ro/ /sa mtshams yod par mi 'gyur ro/ /mthar thug par mi 'gyur ro/ /mur thug par mi 'gyur ro/ /rigs kyi bu/ gal te phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du gtogs pa'i sems can mos pa sna tshogs can dang / bsam pa sna tshogs can thams cad 'ong bar gyur na yang / de dag thams cad ci la dga' ba'i kha zas kyis yongs su tshim par byed pa nas yid bde bar bya ba'i bar du byed do/ /kha zas sna tshogs kyis ji lta ba de bzhin du btung pa rnam pa sna tshogs dang / ro rnam pa sna tshogs dang / stan sna tshogs dang / mal cha sna tshogs dang / bzhon pa sna tshogs dang / gos sna tshogs dang / me tog sna tshogs dang / phreng ba sna tshogs dang / spos sna tshogs dang / bdug spos sna tshogs dang / byug pa sna tshogs dang / phye ma sna tshogs dang / rin po che sna tshogs dang / rgyan sna tshogs dang / rin po che'i shing rta sna tshogs dang / gdugs sna tshogs dang / rgyal mtshan sna tshogs dang / lha'i ba dan sna tshogs dang / yo byad kyi yul rnam pa sna tshogs kyis yongs su tshim par byed pa nas/ yid dga' bar 'gyur ba'i bar du byed do/ /

She said, “I have attained an enlightening liberation which is an inexhaustible treasury of manifestations of good. From this one vessel I satisfy sentient beings of various tastes with food conforming to their wishes, with various sauces and spices, of various colors and aromas. From this one vessel I satisfy even a hundred beings with whatever food they wish, even a thousand beings, a hundred thousand, a million, a billion; I satisfy untold numbers of sentient beings of various tastes with whatever foods they wish, gratifying and pleasing them and making them happy—and yet this vessel does not diminish or run out. In this way, even if as many sentient beings as atoms in a continent, or four continents, or a thousand-world universe, or a million-world universe, or a billion-world universe, or even if as many sentient beings as atoms in untold buddha-lands come to me with various tastes, I satisfy, please, and delight them with foods according to their wishes, with various sauces, spices, colors, and aromas—yet this vessel never diminishes or runs out, it is never depleted or exhausted. Even if all the beings in all worlds in the ten directions, with various tastes and desires, should come to me, I would satisfy them all with whatever food they wished. And as with food, so also would I satisfy and please them with various kinds of drinks, various delicacies, various couches, various clothing, various flowers, various garlands, various fragrances, various incenses, various unguents, various aromatic powders, various jewels, various ornaments, various conveyances, various parasols, various banners, various pennants, and various kinds of utensils.

rigs kyi bu/ gzhan yang shar phyogs kyi 'jig rten gyi khams gcig na nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas sku'i tha ma 'dzin pa gang ji snyed gcig bzhugs pa de dag thams cad kyang / kho mo'i kha zas las gsol cing / nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi byang chub kyi 'bras bu brnyes par mdzad do/ /shar phyogs kyi 'jig rten gyi khams gcig na ji lta ba de bzhin du 'jig rten gyi khams brgya dang / 'jig rten gyi khams stong dang / 'jig rten gyi khams brgya phrag stong dang / 'jig rten gyi khams bye ba dang / 'jig rten gyi khams bye ba phrag brgya dang / 'jig rten gyi khams bye ba phrag stong dang / 'jig rten gyi khams bye ba brgya phrag stong dang / 'jig rten gyi khams bye ba khrag khrig brgya phrag stong dang / 'jig rten khams 'dzam bu'i gling gi rdul shin tu phra ba snyed dang / gling bzhi pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyi rdul shin tu phra ba snyed dang / stong gi 'jig rten gyi khams kyi rdul shin tu phra ba snyed dang / stong gnyis kyi 'jig rten gyi khams kyi rdul shin tu phra ba snyed dang / stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyi rdul shin tu phra ba snyed nas/ de bzhin du shar phyogs kyi sangs rgyas kyi zhing brjod du med pa'i yang brjod du med pa'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed kyi 'jig rten gyi khams na/ nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas sku'i tha ma 'dzin pa ji snyed cig bzhugs pa de dag thams cad kyang / kho mo'i kha zas las gsol cing / nyan thos dang; rang sangs rgyas kyi 'bras bu brnyes par mdzad do/ /shar phyogs na bzhugs pa ji lta ba de bzhin du lho phyogs dang / nub phyogs dang / byang phyogs dang / byang shar gyi phyogs mtshams dang / shar lho'i phyogs mtshams dang / lho nub kyi phyogs mtshams dang / nub byang gi phyogs mtshams dang / 'og dang / steng gi phyogs na ji snyed cig bzhugs pa de dag thams cad kyang de bzhin no/ /

“Furthermore, any Buddhist disciples or individual illuminates in their last embodiment in one world in the east who attain the fruit of discipleship or individual illumination all do so after having eaten my food. And as this is true in one world in the east, so it is true in a hundred worlds, a thousand, a million, a billion, a trillion, a quadrillion, in as many worlds as atoms in a continent, as many worlds as atoms in four continents, as many worlds as atoms in a thousand-world universe, as many worlds as atoms in a million-world universe, as many worlds as atoms in a billion-world universe, up to as many worlds as atoms in untold buddha-lands—all those who realize the fruit of discipleship or individual illumination do so after having eaten my food. And as this is true in so many worlds to the east, so it is true in the worlds in all ten directions.

rigs kyi bu/ shar phyogs kyi 'jig rten gyi khams gcig tu sku tshe gcig gis thogs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ji snyed cig bzhugs pa de dag thams cad kyang / kho mo'i kha zas las gsol cing / snying po byang chub tu bzhugs nas/ bdud sde dang bcas pa pham par mdzad de/ bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par 'tshang rgya'o/ /shar phyogs kyi 'jig rten gyi khams gcig na bzhugs pa ji lta ba de bzhin du/ 'jig rten gyi khams brgya dang / 'jig rten gyi khams stong dang / 'jig rten gyi khams brgya phrag stong dang / 'jig rten gyi khams bye ba dang / 'jig rten gyi khams bye ba brgya dang / 'jig rten gyi khams bye ba stong dang / 'jig rten gyi khams bye ba brgya phrag stong dang / 'jig rten gyi khams bye ba khrag khrig brgya phrag stong dang / 'jig rten gyi khams 'dzam bu'i gling gi rdul shin tu phra ba snyed dang / gling bzhi pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyi rdul shin tu phra ba snyed dang / stong gi 'jig rten gyi khams kyi rdul shin tu phra pa snyed dang / stong gnyis kyi 'jig rten gyi khams kyi rdul shin tu phra ba snyed dang / stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyi rdul shin tu phra ba snyed nas/ shar phyogs kyi sangs rgyas kyi zhing brjod du med pa'i yang brjod du med pa'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed kyi 'jig rten gyi khams na/ byang chub sems dpa' sku tshe gcig gis thogs pa ji snyed cig bzhugs pa de dag thams cad kyang / kho mo'i kha zas las gsol cing snying po byang chub la bzhugs nas/ bdud sde dang bcas pa pham par mdzad de/ bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par 'tshang rgya'o/ /shar phyogs na bzhugs pa ji lta ba de bzhin du/ lho phyogs dang / nub phyogs dang / byang phyogs dang / byang shar gyi phyogs mtshams dang / shar lho'i phyogs mtshams dang / lho nub kyi phyogs mtshams dang / nub byang gi phyogs mtshams dang / 'og gi phyogs dang / steng gi phyogs kyi 'jig rten gyi khams gcig na/ byang chub sems dpa' sku tshe gcig gis thogs pa ji snyed cig bzhugs pa de dag thams cad kyang / kho mo'i kha zas las gsol cing snying po byang chub tu bzhugs te/ bdud sde dang bcas pa rab tu pham par mdzad nas/ bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par 'tshang rgya'o/ /shar phyogs kyi 'jig rten gyi khams gcig na bzhugs pa ji lta ba de bzhin du/ 'jig rten gyi khams brgya dang / 'jig rten gyi khams stong dang; 'jig rten gyi khams brgya phrag stong dang / 'jig rten gyi khams bye ba dang / 'jig rten gyi khams bye ba brgya dang / 'jig rten gyi khams bye ba stong dang; 'jig rten gyi khams bye ba brgya phrag stong dang / 'jig rten gyi khams bye ba khrag khrig brgya phrag stong dang / 'jig rten gyi khams 'dzam bu'i gling gi rdul shin tu phra ba snyed dang / gling bzhi pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyi rdul shin tu phra ba snyed dang / stong gi 'jig rten gyi khams kyi rdul shin tu phra ba snyed dang / stong gnyis kyi 'jig rten gyi khams kyi rdul shin tu phra ba snyed dang / stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyi rdul shin tu phra ba snyed nas/ rigs kyi bu/ steng gi phyogs kyi 'jig rten gyi khams sangs rgyas kyi zhing brjod du med pa'i yang brjod du med pa'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed na/ byang chub sems dpa' sku tshe gcig gis thogs pa ji snyed cig bzhugs pa de dag thams cad kyang / kho mo'i kha zas las gsol cing snying po byang chub tu bzhugs nas/ bdud sde dang bcas pa pham par mdzad de/ bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par 'tshang rgya'o/ /

“The enlightening beings in one world in the east who are bound to attain enlightenment in one life all sit on the site of enlightenment, conquer the demons, and realize supreme perfect enlightenment after having eaten my food. The same is true of the enlightening beings to realize enlightenment in one life in up to as many worlds as atoms in untold buddha-lands in each of the ten directions—they all sit on the site of enlightenment, conquer the demons, and realize supreme perfect enlightenment after having eaten my food.”

rigs kyi bu khyod kyis kho mo'i 'khor bud med stong phrag bcu po 'di dag mthong ngam/ smras pa/ 'phags ma/ bdag gis mthong ngo/ /smras pa/ rigs kyi bu/ bud med 'di dag la sogs pa brgya stong grangs med pa phrag bcu kho mo dang skal pa mnyam par spyod pa/ smon lam gcig pa/ dge ba'i rtsa ba gcig pa/ 'byung ba'i rgyan gcig pa/ mos pa'i lam rnam par dag pa gcig pa/ kho mo dang skal pa mnyam par dran pa rnam par dag pa/ skal pa mnyam par blo rnam par dag pa/ skal pa mnyam par blo tshad med par gyur pa/ skal pa mnyam par dbang po rab tu thob pa/ skal pa mnyam par sems kyis rgyas par 'gengs pa/ skal pa mnyam par spyod yul gyi yul dang ldan pa/ skal pa mnyam par chos kyi tshul la zhugs pa/ skal pa mnyam par don nges par rtogs pa/ skal pa mnyam par chos kyi don ston pa/ skal pa mnyam par gzugs rnam par dag pa/ skal pa mnyam par stobs tshad med pa/ skal pa mnyam par brtan pa gzhan gyis mi thub pa/ skal pa mnyam par chos kyi sgra sgrogs pa/ skal pa mnyam par dbyangs rnam par dag pa/ tshad med pa'i yon tan brjod du yod pas rnam par spyod pa thams cad la skal pa mnyam par yon tan rnam par dag pa/ las kyi rnam par smin pa la kha na ma tho ba med cing / rnam par dag pas bskal pa mnyam par las kyi rnam par smin pa rnam par dag pa/ 'gro ba thams cad yongs su skyob pa/ skal pa mnyam par byams pa chen pos rgyas par 'gengs pa/ 'gro ba thams cad yongs su smin par byed pas mi skyo ba'i phyir/ skal pa mnyam par snying rje chen pos rgyas par 'gengs pa/ bsam pa ji lta ba bzhin du sems can thams cad tshim par byed pa'i lus yongs su ston pas skal pa mnyam par lus kyi las rnam par dag pa/ chos kyi dbyings kyi nges pa'i tshig tha snyad la skal pa mnyam par ngag gi las rnam par dag pa/ sangs rgyas thams cad kyi 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor du skal pa mnyam par 'dod pa/ sangs rgyas la mchod cing rim gror bya ba'i phyir sangs rgyas kyi zhing thams cad du skal pa mnyam par rgyu ba/ chos thams cad kyi tshul khong du chud par bya ba la skal pa mnyam par mngon sum du gyur pa'i ye shes dang ldan pa/ byang chub sems dpa'i sa thams cad thob par bya ba la skal pa mnyam par spyod pa rnam par dag pa sha stag cig kyang yod de/

“Do you see these ten thousand women, my companions? Beginning with these, there are countless tens of hundreds of thousands of women whose practice is the same as mine, who are one in vows, one in roots of goodness, one in ways of emancipation, one in purity of devotion, equal in purity of mindfulness, one in purity of deportment, equal in infinity of understanding, equal in attainment of spiritual faculties, equal in pervasive awareness, equal in range of sphere of action, equal in penetration of spiritual principles, equal in ascertainment of meanings, equal in elucidation of doctrines and meanings, equal in purity of form, equal in infinity of power, equal in unsurpassed energy, equal in voicing truth, equal in purity of voice, equal in purity of qualities in all manners by manifesting infinite virtues, equal in purity of action by virtue of purity of results of irreproachable actions, equal in pervasive kindness by virtue of saving all sentient beings, equal in pervasive compassion by virtue of tirelessly developing all sentient beings, equally pure in physical action by virtue of appearing to all sentient beings in forms that please them, equally pure in speech in usage expressing the realm of realities, equal in going to the assemblies of all buddhas, equal in speeding to all buddha-lands to attend all the buddhas, equal in direct knowledge in understanding the principles of all doctrines, equal in purity of practice in attainment of all the stages of enlightening beings.

rigs kyi bu/ bud med stong phrag bcu po 'di dag kyang skad cig gcig tu 'di lta ste/ byang chub sems dpa' sku tshe gcig gis thogs pa rnams la zhal zas yongs su dbul ba'i phyir/ phyogs bcu rgyas par 'dong ngo/ /phru ba 'di nyid nas kha zas blangs shing srid pa tha ma pa dang; nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa pa rnams la bsod snyoms dbul ba'i phyir phyogs bcur rgyas par 'dong ngo/ /phru ba 'di nyid nas kha zas blangs shing phyogs bcu rgyas par bkang ste/ yi kyi tshogs thams cad kha zas kyis yongs su tshim par byed do/ /rigs kyi bu/ de ltar kho mo ni phru ba 'di nyid nas lha rnams ni lha'i kha zas kyis yongs su tshim par byed do/ /klu rnams ni klu'i kha zas kyis/ gnod sbyin rnams ni gnod sbyin gyi kha zas kyis/ dri za rnams ni dri za'i kha zas kyis/ lha ma yin rnams ni lha ma yin gyi kha zas kyis; nam mkha' lding rnams ni nam mkha' lding gi kha zas kyis/ mi'am ci rnams ni mi'am ci'i kha zas kyis/ lto 'phye chen po rnams ni lto 'phye chen po'i kha zas kyis/ mi rnams ni mi'i kha zas kyis/ mi ma yin pa rnams ni mi ma yin pa'i kha zas kyis yongs su tshim par byed do/ /rigs kyi bu/ yud tsam zhig sdod dang / de'u re mngon du 'gyur ro/ /

“These ten thousand women pervade the ten directions in a single instant to present food to the enlightening beings who are bound to become enlightened in one lifetime, giving them food from this same vessel. They pervade the ten directions to give food and drink to the saints and individual illuminates who are in their last existence. They go everywhere and satisfy all hungry ghosts with food. I also satisfy all the celestial beings with celestial food from this same vessel: I satisfy dragons with dragon food, spirits with spirit food, cherubim with cherub food, titans with titan food, birds with bird food, centaurs with centaur food, serpents with serpent food, humans with human food, and nonhumans with nonhuman food. Come here and in a moment you shall see with your own eyes.”

dge bsnyen ma phul du byung ba des tshig de brjod ma thag tu de'i mod la 'di lta ste/ dge bsnyen ma phul du byung bas sngon gyi smon lam gyis pos pas/ sems can grangs med pa zhig shar phyogs kyi sgo nas nang du 'ongs par gyur to/ /de bzhin du 'di lta ste/ dge bsnyen ma phul du byung ba'i sngon gyi smon lam gyis bos pas/ sems can grangs med pa zhig lho phyogs dang / nub phyogs dang / byang phyogs kyi sgo nas nang du 'ongs par gyur te/ de ltar 'ongs pa de dag dge bsnyen ma phul du byung bas/ stan de dag la bkod de/ so so nas ci dga' ba'i kha zas tshod ma sna tshogs dang / ro sna tshogs dang / kha dog sna tshogs dang / dri sna tshogs dang ldan pas yongs su tshim par byas so/ /yongs su bstabs par byas so// yongs su dga' bar byas so/ /yongs su mgu bar byas so/ /yongs su spro bar byas so/ /shin tu tshim par byas so/ /yid bde bar byas so/ /kha zas sna tshogs kyis ji lta ba de bzhin du btung ba rnam pa sna tshogs dang / ro rnam pa sna tshogs dang / stan sna tshogs dang / mal cha sna tshogs dang / bzhon pa sna tshogs dang / gos sna tshogs dang / me tog sna tshogs dang / phreng ba sna tshogs dang / spos sna tshogs dang / bdug spos sna tshogs dang / byug pa sna tshogs dang / phye ma sna tshogs dang / rin po cha [*che?] sna tshogs dang / rgyan sna tshogs dang / rin po che'i shing rta sna tshogs dang / gdugs sna tshogs dang / rgyal mtshan sna tshogs dang / lha'i ba dan sna tshogs dang / yo byad kyi yul rnam pa sna tshogs kyis yongs su tshim par byas pa nas/ yid dga' bar 'gyur ba'i bar du byas so/ /lha rnams ni lha'i kha zas kyis yongs su tshim par byas so/ /klu dang / gnod sbyin dang / dri za dang / lha ma yin dang / nam mkha' lding dang / mi'am ci dang / lto 'phye chen po dang / mi dang / mi ma yin pa rnams kyang / mi ma yin pa'i kha zas kyis yongs su tshim par byas pa nas/ yid bde bar 'gyur ba'i bar du byas so/ /'on kyang phru ba de las god par gyur pa med/ 'grib pa med/ dmas pa med/ zad par gyur pa med/ sa mtshams su gyur pa med/ mthar thug pa med/ mur thug pa med do/ /

No sooner had Prabhuta said these words than immeasurable numbers of such beings came in through the four doors of her house, invited by Prabhuta’s standing vow. Prabhuta seated them in the places prepared and satisfied them with whatever kind of foods they wished, pleasing and delighting them. In the same way she also satisfied and pleased them with various drinks, delicacies, seats, couches, conveyances, clothes, flowers and garlands, perfumes and incenses, unguents and aromatic powders, ornaments, jeweled chariots, parasols, banners, pennants, and utensils. She satisfied all the various kinds of beings with their various kinds of food, yet the vessel was not depleted or exhausted; it never ran out.

de nas dge bsnyen ma phul du byung ba des/ tshong dpon gyi bu nor bzang la 'di skad ces smras so/ /rigs kyi bu/ kho mos ni/ byang chub sems dpa'i rnam par thar pa bsod nams kyi mdzod mi zad pa'i rgyan ces bya ba 'di shes par zad na/ byang chub sems dpa' bsod nams chen po'i rgya mtsho mi zad pas/ mi zad pa'i bsod nams dang ldan pa/ bsod nams kyi tshogs rgya chen po shin tu bsags pas nam mkha' lta bur gyur pa/ 'gro ba thams cad kyi smon lam yongs su rdzogs par byed pas/ nor bu rin po che yid bzhin gyi rgyal po lta bu/ 'gro ba thams cad kyi dge ba'i rtsa ba yongs su bsrung bas/ bsod nams chen po'i khor yug dang ldan pa/ 'gro ba thams cad du rin po che snyim pa nas char ltar 'thor bas/ bsod nams chen po'i sprin du gyur pa chos kyi grong khyer gyi sgo 'byed pas/ bsod nams chen po'i mdzod la mngon sum du lta ba/ 'gro ba thams cad kyi phongs pa'i mun pa sel bas/ bsod nams chen po'i sgron mar gyur pa de dag gi spyod pa shes pa'am/ yon tan brjod par nus re skan/

Then Prabhuta said to Sudhana, “I know this enlightening liberation, which is an inexhaustible treasury of manifestations of good; how can I know the practice or tell the virtues of enlightening beings whose goodness is inexhaustible because of the endlessness of the ocean of good, who are like the sky in that they have produced a vast store of good, who are like wish-fulfilling jewels in that they fulfill the wishes of all sentient beings, who are mountains of good because they protect the roots of goodness of all beings, who are great clouds of good as they shower jewel rain on all beings, who are superintendents of the great treasury of good in that they open the door of the city of truth, who are great lamps of good in that they dispel the darkness of destitution for all sentient beings?

song / rigs kyi bu/ lho phyogs kyi rgyud 'di nyid na/ grong khyer 'byung ba chen po zhes bya ba yod de/ de na khyim bdag mkhas ba zhes bya ba 'dug gi/ de'i gan du song la/ ji ltar byang chub sems dpas byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa la bslab par bya ba dang / ji ltar nan tan du bya ba dris shig /
“South of here is a city called Mahasambhava, where a householder named Vidvan lives. Go ask him how an enlightening being is to learn and carry out the practice of enlightening beings.”

de nas tshong dpon gyi bu nor bzang dge bsnyen ma phul du byung ba'i rkang pa gnyis la spyi bos phyag 'tshal te/ dge bsnyen ma phul du byung ba la lan brgya stong du mar g.yas phyogs su bskor ba byas nas/ yang dang yang bltas te/ dge bsnyen ma phul du byung ba'i drung nas blta bas mi ngoms bzhin du song ngo/ /
Then Sudhana, paying his respects to the devotee Prabhuta, looking at her again and again without tiring of the sight of her, took his leave and departed.
[khyim bdag mkhas ba]
Vidvan

de nas tshong dpon gyi bu nor bzang / bsod nams kyi mdzod mi zad pa'i rgyan gyi rnam par thar pa'i snang ba rab tu thob pa de/ bsod nams rgya mtsho de la ni rjes su sems/ bsod nams kyi nam mkha' de la ni kun tu lta/ bsod nams kyi phung po de ni yongs su 'dzin/ bsod nams kyi ri bo de la ni mngon par 'dzeg /bsod nams kyi tshogs de ni yang dag par sdud/ bsod nams kyi chu bo de la ni yongs su 'bog /bsod nams kyi mu stegs de la ni rab tu 'bab/ bsod nams kyi dkyil 'khor de ni yongs su sbyong / bsod nams kyi gter de la ni yang dag pa blta/ bsod nams kyi tshul de la ni rjes su dran par byed/ bsod nams kyi chos de ni yongs su 'dzin/ bsod nams kyi rgyud de ni yongs su sbyong ba byed cing / mthar gyis grong khyer 'byung ba chen po gang na ba der phyin nas/ dge ba'i bshes gnyen 'dod cing / dge ba'i bshes gnyen blta bas bsgos pa'i sems kyi rgyud dang / dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyis byin gyis brlabs pa'i bsam pa dang / dge ba'i bshes gnyen la thogs pa med pa'i sbyor ba dang / dge ba'i bshes gnyen la rim gro bya bas skyo ba med pa'i brtson 'grus dang / dge ba'i bshes gnyen la rag lus pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad dang / dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyis nges par gyur pa'i bsod nams kyi tshogs thams cad dang / dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyis rnam par spel ba'i thabs mkhas pa'i spyod pa dang / gzhan gyi dring mi 'jog par dge ba'i bshes gnyen la rim gro bya ba la mkhas pa dang / rnam par 'phel ba'i dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad dang / rnam par dag par 'gyur ba'i byang chub sems dpa'i lhag pa'i bsam pa dang / yang dag par 'phel ba'i byang chub sems dpa'i dbang po dang / yongs su smin par 'gyur ba'i dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad dang / yang dag par 'phel ba'i smon lam chen po mngon par bsgrub pa dang / shin tu yangs par 'gyur ba'i snying rje chen pos bdag nyid thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du nye bar gyur par yang dag par mthong nas/ sangs rgyas thams cad las byang chub sems dpa' kun tu bzang po'i spyod pas/ chos kyi snang ba yang dag pa blang ba dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu snang ba rnam par 'phel bar byed cing / khyim bdag mkhas pa yongs su tshol tshol ba las/ grong khyer gyi dbus lam gyi bzhi mdo zhig na/ rin po che sna bdun gyi stegs bu zhig la/ rin po che grangs med pa las byas pa'i khri/ nor bu rin po che'i rkang pa rdo rje dang / in+d+ra nI la sna tshogs kyis spras pa bkye ba/ gser gyi lcag pod kyi dra bas legs par blas pa/ nor bu rin po che dri ma me pa'i snying po can rin po che lnga brgya tsam gyis gzugs legs par brgyan pa/ lha rdzas kyi stan sna tshogs bting ba/ gam yo na sa lha rdzas kyi gos kyi rgyal mtshan dang / ba dan mang po bsgreng ba/ rin po che du ma'i dra bas kun nas yog pa/ rin po che'i bla re chen po bres pa/ bla nas gser dang / rin po che'i me tog gi lda ldi mang po bkye ba zhig la 'dug cing / 'dzam bu chu klung gi gser gyi gdugs yu ba dri ma med pa bai DU r+ya las byas ba ni drung na bsgreng zhing bzung / rin po che'i g.yag rnga dri ma med pa'i rdul yab ngang pa'i rgyal po lta bus ni legs par g.yab/ spos kyi rim gro yo byad sna tshogs kyis ni bdugs shing bsangs/ rol mo brdung ba dang / dkrol ba lha rdzas kyi dbyangs las 'das par sgra 'byin pa lnga brgya tsam ni g.yas g.yon nas brdungs shing dkrol/ grong khyer 'byung ba chen po na 'khod pa'i sems can rnams shin tu dga' bar bya ba'i don du/ lha rdzas kyi me tog gi sprin gyi char ni kun nas 'bab par gyur/ g.yog srog chags stong phrag bcu tsam sngon dge ba'i rtsa ba skal pa mnyam par spyod spyod pa/ ngag nyan cing ci dga' bar byed pa/ lha rdzas las 'das pa'i rgyan gyis shin tu brgyan pa/ byang chub sems dpa'i bsam pa yongs su grub pa/ lha dang mi'i gzugs las shin tu 'das pa sha stag gis kun nas bskor cing 'dug pa mthong nas/

Then, having gained the illumination of that enlightening liberation which is an inexhaustible treasury of goodness, reflecting on that ocean of good, gazing into that sky of good, climbing that mountain of good, gathering that mass of good, plunging into that stream of good, crossing that bridge of good, purifying that sphere of good, viewing that treasury of good, recalling that principle of good, contemplating that eye of good, purifying that multitude of good, Sudhana made his way to the city of Mahasambhava and looked all around for Vidvan, seeking a spiritual benefactor.
Looking for Vidvan, his whole being perfumed by the sight of spiritual benefactors, finding strength in spiritual benefactors, relying on spiritual benefactors, striving to follow spiritual benefactors, with tireless vigor in attending spiritual benefactors, all his roots of goodness due to spiritual benefactors, all his stores of virtue sustained by spiritual benefactors, his practice of skill in means developed by spiritual benefactors, all his roots of goodness growing by skill in attendance of spiritual benefactors without depending on others, his will for enlightenment becoming purified, his enlightening faculties developing, all his roots of goodness maturing, his accomplishments of great vows growing, his great compassion broadening, seeing himself near omniscience, receiving the light of teaching of all buddhas by the practice of Universally Good enlightening beings, the manifestations of the ten powers of buddhas increasing, Sudhana saw Vidvan at a crossroads in the middle of the city, on a seat on a high pedestal made of innumerable jewels, set on legs of diamonds and emeralds, with a web of white cowries on golden strings, set in pure jewels, with five hundred ornamental jewel figurines, arrayed with multicolored celestial cloth, with celestial banners and pennants flying above, covered with many nets of jewels, overspread with a great canopy of jewels, with garlands of gold and jewels hanging from it. A golden parasol with a handle of pure lapis lazuli was held over Vidvan, and he was being fanned by plumes made of pure white goose feathers while various incenses perfumed the air around him. He was attended by ten thousand people of equally virtuous past conduct, finer in appearance than celestials or humans, perfect in the will of enlightening beings, adorned with ornaments superior to those of the gods, playing music sweeter than that of the heavens to please all the people in the city, and showering celestial flowers.

tshong dpon gyi bu nor bzang / khyim bdag mkhas pa gang na ba der song ste phyin nas/ khyim bdag mkhas pa'i rkang pa gnyis la spyi bos phyag 'tshal te/ khyim bdag mkhas pa la lan brgya stong du mar g.yas phyogs su bskor ba byas nas mdun du 'dug ste; thal mo sbyar nas 'di skad ces smras so/ /'phags pa/ bdag ni 'di lta ste/ sems can thams cad kyi sdug bsngal zhi bar bgyi ba dang / sems can thams cad shin tu bde ba la dgod pa dang / sems can thams cad 'khor ba'i rgya mtsho nas mngon par gdon pa dang / sems can thams cad chos rin po che'i gling du yang dag par bskyal ba dang / sems can thams cad kyi sred pa'i rlan shin tu bskam pa dang / sems can thams cad kyi snying rje'i rlan yang dag par bskyed pa dang / sems can thams cad kyi 'dod pa'i dga' ba dang / sred pa rnam par bzlog pa dang / sems can thams cad sangs rgyas kyi ye shes la mos shing bsgrub par bgyi ba dang / sems can thams cad 'khor ba'i dgon pa las yang dag par bzla ba dang / sems can thams cad sangs rgyas kyi yon tan dang / chos la dga' zhing mos pa yang dag par bskyed pa dang / sems can thams cad khams gsum gyi grong brdal nas gdon pa dang / sems can thams cad thams cad mkhyen pa'i pho brang du gzung par sems can thams cad kyi don du bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu zhugs kyis kyang / ji ltar byang chub sems dpas byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa la bslab par bgyi ba dang / ji ltar nan tan du bgyi ba ma 'tshal te/ 'phags pa ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams la gdams ngag dang rjes su bstan pa mdzad do zhes bdag gis thos na/ 'phags pa/ ji ltar byang chub sems dpas byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa la bslab par bgyi ba dang / ji ltar bslabs na byang chub sems dpa' rnams sems can thams cad kyi rten du 'gyur ba bdag la bshad du gsol/ /de skad ces smras pa dang /

Seeing Vidvan, Sudhana went up to him, paid his respects, and said, “Noble one, I have set out for supreme perfect enlightenment for the benefit of all beings—to extinguish the sufferings of all beings, to lead them to ultimate happiness, to rescue them from the ocean of the mundane whirl, to deliver them to the island of jewels of truth, to evaporate their cravings, to produce great compassion in them, to divert their craving for sensual pleasure and arouse in them craving for enlightened knowledge, to help them all cross over the wildness of the mundane whirl, to develop in them a taste for the way of buddhahood, to lead them out of the city of mundane states and lead them to the city of omniscience. But I do not know how an enlightening being is to learn and carry out the practice of enlightening beings. Noble one, I hear that you give enlightening beings instruction, so I ask you to tell me how an enlightening being is to learn the practice of enlightening beings, and how enlightening beings in the course of learning become a refuge for all sentient beings.”

khyim bdag mkhas pas/ tshong dpon gyi bu nor bu bzang la 'di skad ces smras so/ /rigs kyi bu/ de ltar khyod kyis bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed pa legs so/ /legs so/ /rigs kyi bu/ sems can gang bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed cing byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa yongs su tshol ba dang / dge ba'i bshes gnyen blta bas mi ngoms pa dang / dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyi drung du 'gro bas mi skyo ba dang / dge ba'i bshes gnyen la rim gro bya bas sgyid lug pa med pa dang / dge ba'i bshes gnyen btsal bas yid mi bde ba mi skyed pa dang / dge ba'i bshes gnyen btsal ba las phyir mi ldog pa dang / dge ba'i bshes gnyen la mos shing dad pa'i yid las rnam par mi ldog pa dang / dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyi ngor blta ba las phyir mi zlog pa dang / dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyi gdams ngag gi tshul la zhum pa med pa dang / dge ba'i bshes gnyen la rim gro dang / bsnyen bkur bya bas mi skyo ba de lta bu ni shin tu dkon no/ /rigs kyi bu/ khyod kyis kho bo'i 'khor 'di dag mthong ngam/ smras pa/ 'phags pa/ mthong ngo/ /smras pa/ rigs kyi bu/ 'di dag kun kyang kho bos bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed bdag ste/ 'di dag ni kho bos de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs su bskyed pa'o/ /'di dag ni kho bos pha rol tu phyin pas bstud de/ gsos pa'o/ /'di dag ni kho bos chos dkar po thams cad kyis bskyed pa'o/ /'di dag ni kho bos de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu la rnam par bskyed pa'o/ /'di dag ni kho bos 'jig rten gyi rigs las gyen du bskyod pa'o/ /'di dag ni kho bos de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs la bkod pa'o/ /'di dag ni kho bos 'jig rten gyi lam gyi 'khor lo las bzlog pa'o/ /'di dag ni kho bos chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba la btsud pa'o/ /'di dag ni kho bos ngan song gsum gyi rgyud du ltung ba las yongs su bzung ba'o/ /'di dag ni kho bos chos nyid khong du chud par bya ba la bkod pa ste/ rigs kyi bu/ de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' rnams sems can thams cad kyi skyabs su gyur pa yin no/ /

Vidvan replied, “It is good that you have aroused the aspiration for supreme perfect enlightenment. Rare are those who aspire to supreme perfect enlightenment, and rare are those who, having aspired to enlightenment, are tireless in seeking the practices of enlightening beings by meeting spiritual benefactors, who do not weary of going to spiritual benefactors, who are not pained by attendance on spiritual benefactors, who are not depressed by the difficulty of approaching spiritual benefactors, who do not give up seeking spiritual benefactors, who do not turn away from the sight of the countenance of spiritual benefactors, who do not get discouraged in the path taught by spiritual benefactors, who do not tire in the service of spiritual benefactors. Do you see my companions? I inspired them all to seek supreme perfect enlightenment; I caused them to be born in the family of buddhas; I nourished them by providing them with the ways of transcendence; I got them to live in good ways; I developed them in the ten powers of buddhas; I lifted them out of worldliness; I established them in the ranks of the enlightened; I removed them from the circle of mundane states; I started them in the cycle of enlightening teaching; I saved them from falling into bad conditions; I led them to realization of equality of things: for thus do enlightening beings become saviors of all sentient beings.

rigs kyi bu/ kho bo ni yid kyi mdzod nas byung ba'i bsod nams mang po thob pa ste/ de'i mthus kho bo ni zas 'dod pa rnams la zas kyi sbyin pa byed do/ /btung ba 'dod pa rnams la btung ba dang / ro dam pa 'dod pa rnams la ro'i dam pa dang / bza' ba 'dod pa rnams la bza' ba dang / bca' ba 'dod pa rnams la bca' ba dang / bldag pa 'dod pa rnams la bldag pa dang / mur pa 'dod pa rnams la mur ba dang / gos 'dod pa rnams la gos dang / me tog 'dod pa rnams la me tog dang / phreng ba 'dod pa rnams la phreng ba dang / spos 'dod pa rnams la spos dang / bdug pa 'dod pa rnams la bdug pa dang / byug pa 'dod pa rnams la byug pa dang / phye ma 'dod pa rnams la phye ma dang / rgyan dang lhab lhub 'dod pa rnams la rgyan dang lhab lhub dang / rin po che 'dod pa rnams la rin po che dang / gser 'dod pa rnams la gser dang / dngul 'dod pa rnams la dngul dang / mu tig 'dod pa rnams la mu tig dang / rten 'dod pa rnams la rten dang / stan 'dod pa rnams la stan dang / mal cha 'dod pa rnams la mal cha dang / na ba'i gsos sman dang / yo byad 'dod pa rnams la na ba'i gsos sman dang yo byad dang / bzhon pa 'dod pa rnams la bzhon pa dang / dga' ba 'dod pa rnams la dga' ba dang / glang po dang / rta dang / shing rta dang / ba lang dang / bong bu dang / ma he dang / ra lug 'dod pa rnams la glang po dang / rta dang / shing rta dang / ba lang dang / bong bu dang / ma he dang / ra lug dang / rgyal mtshan dang / gdugs dang / ba dan 'dod pa rnams la/ rgyal mtshan dang / gdugs dang / ba dan dang / bran pho dang / bran mo 'dod pa rnams la bran pho dang / bran mo dang / 'khor gyi byis pa 'dod pa rnams la 'khor gyi byis pa dang / bud med 'dod pa rnams la bud med dang; bu mo gzhon nu 'dod pa rnams la bu mo gzhon nu dang / cod pan dang / gtsug gi rin po che 'dod pa rnams la cod pan dang / gtsug gi rin po che dang / thor pag dang bcas pa'i gtsug gi rin po che 'dod pa rnams la thor pag dang bcas pa'i gtsug gi rin po che dang / skra mthon mthing dri ma med pa'i dkyil 'khor 'dod pa rnams la/ skra mthon mthing dri ma med pa'i dkyil 'khor gyi sbyin pa byed pa nas/ yo byad sna tshogs thams cad 'dod pa rnams la yang yo byad sna tshogs thams cad kyi sbyin pa byed do/ /rigs kyi bu/ yud tsam zhig sdod dang / de'u re mngon sum du mthong bar 'gyur ro/ /

“I have attained good works produced from the treasury of mind: to those who need food I give food, to those who need drink I give drink, to those who need clothing I give clothing, to those who need flowers I give flowers, to those who want garlands I give garlands, To those who need perfumes or incenses I give perfumes or incenses, to those who need ornaments I give ornaments, to those who need jewels I give jewels, to those who need gold I give gold, to those who need silver I give silver, to those who need pearls I give pearls, to those who need chairs I give chairs, to those who need beds I give beds, to those who need means of transportation I give means of transportation, to those who need medicine I give medicine, and so on—whatever the needs, I provide them. Come here, and in a moment you will see for yourself.”
