de skad du khyim bdag mkhas pas tshig de brjod ma thag tu de'i mod la/ sems can grangs med pa zhig khyim bdag mkhas pa'i sngon gyi smon lam gyis bos pas/ phyogs tha dad pa dang / yul tha dad pa dang / gnas tha dad pa dang / grong khyer tha dad pa dang / grong rdal tha dad pa dang / tshong 'dus tha dad pa dang / ljongs tha dad pa dang / 'khor gyi grong tha dad pa dang / khyim tha dad pa dang / sems can gyi rgyud tha dad pa dang / sems can gyi rigs tha dad pa dang / sems can rnam pa mi mthun pa tha dad pa dang / lam gyi rgyud tha dad pa dang / gnas kyi rnam pa dang / ming du bya ba tha dad pa dang / sems can skye mched rnam par dag pa sna tshogs dang ldan pa kha zas sna tshogs don du gnyer ba/ kha zas sna tshogs 'dod pa/ bsam pa tha dad pa bza' ba dang btung ba gtsang ba 'dod pa dang / sha 'dod pa dang / kha zas rnam pa tha dad pa sna tshogs don du gnyer ba/ lam gyi rgyud rnam pa sna tshogs kyi khyad par du skyes pa'i skye mched la gnas pa 'di lta ste/ mi'i nang nas 'bras chan dang / sran chan dang / 'khur ba dang / skyo ma dang / nya dang / sha la sogs pa/ kham gyis bza' ba'i kha zas sna tshogs don du gnyer ba dang / mi'i nang nas ji lta ba bzhin du 'gro ba'i rgyud thams cad rnam par spyod pa dag las kyang / kha zas dang btung ba sna tshogs don du gnyer ba dag de ltar byang chub sems dpa'i mthu dang / byang chub sems dpa'i sbyin pa thogs pa med par gtong ba'i rnga'i sgra dang / byang chub sems dpa'i sngon gyi smon lam gyis bos pas kun kyang 'ongs par gyur te/ 'ongs nas kyang khyim bdag mkhas pa la slong mo 'debs so/ /gdong du lta'o/ /sdod do/ /gsol ba 'debs so/ /

As soon as Vidvan had spoken these words, innumerable beings gathered at his house, summoned by his past vows. They came from various regions, various nations, various cities, various towns, and various groups, of various conditions, various states of consciousness, various degrees of purity of sense, desiring various kinds of food, having various inclinations, needing diverse kinds of sustenance according to their states of being. They were invited by the vow of the enlightening being, by the power of the enlightening being, by the sounds of the drums of unattached giving; they came to Vidvan, looked at him, and made requests of him.

de nas khyim bdag mkhas pas/ slong ba de dag kun nas 'dus par shes nas yud tsam du bsams te/ nam mkha' la bltas pa dang / nam mkha'i dbyings nas kha zas dang / btung ba rnam pa sna tshogs/ ro sna tshogs dang ldan pa/ kha dog sna tshogs dang ldan pa/ dri sna tshogs dang ldan pa mang po 'thon te/ lag mthil du 'ongs par gyur to/ /des de dag yongs su blangs shing de ltar kun nas 'dus pa'i slong mo pa mos pa sna tshogs dang ldan pa de dag ci 'dod pa'i zas dang / btung ba'i rnam pa dang / yo byad kyi khyad par thams cad kyis yongs su tshim par byas so/ /ci 'dod pa yongs su byin no/ /rab tu dga' bar byas so/ /shin tu tshim par byas so/ /dga' ba shin tu skye bar byas so/ /nyams shin tu bde bar byas so/ /yid rab tu dga' bar byas so/ /de ltar de dag shin tu tshim par byas nas/ des kyang mchog ste/ de'i 'og tu chos bstan pa 'di lta ste/ ye shes kyi tshogs rgya chen po bsags pa'i rgyu yongs su brjod de/ chos bstan to/ /phongs pa thams cad 'byung mi srid pa'i rgyu yongs su brjod pa dang / skyid pa chen po yongs su 'grub pa'i rgyu yongs su brjod pa dang / chos kyi ye shes kyi tshul 'thob pa 'byung ba'i rgyu yongs su brjod pa dang / bsod nams kyi tshogs rgya chen po bsags pa'i rgyu yongs su brjod pa dang / dga' ba bza' ba'i zas rab tu 'thob pa 'byung ba'i rgyu yongs su brjod pa dang / mtshan dang / dpe byad bzang pos shin tu brgyan pa'i lus 'thob pa 'byung ba'i rgyu yongs su brjod pa dang / thub pa med pa'i stobs rnam par dag pa 'thob pa 'byung ba'i rgyu yongs su brjod pa dang / bla na med pa'i kha zas yongs su shis pa 'thob pa 'byung ba'i rgyu yongs su brjod pa dang / bdud kyi dpung thams cad rab tu 'joms pa'i bsod nams kyi stobs mi zad pa rab tu 'thob pa 'byung ba'i rgyu'ang yongs su brjod pa byas te chos ston to/ /de kha zas don du gnyer cing 'ongs pa rnams la nam mkha'i dbyings nas kha zas rnam pa sna tshogs blangs shing tshim par byas te/ de dag la tshe dang / mdog dang / stobs dang / bde ba dang / spobs pa phun sum tshogs pa thob par bya ba'i phyir chos bstan to/ /des btung ba don du gnyer cing 'ongs pa rnams la/ btung ba mang po zhim pa kha na ma tho ba med pa/ yid shin tu dga' ba byed pa de dag gis tshim par byas nas/ de dag la 'khor bas skom zhing 'khor ba la dga' ba las rnam par bzlog pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos la dga' zhing sangs rgyas kyi chos la mos pa yongs su bskyed pa'i phyir chos bstan to/ /des ro'i mchog don du gnyer zhing 'ongs pa rnams la ro'i mchog sna tshogs mngar ba dang / skyur ba dang / lan tsha dang / tsha ba dang / kha ba dang / bska ba rnam pa tha dad pas yongs su tshim par byas te/ de'i 'og tu skyes bu chen po'i mtshan ro bro ba'i mchog thob par bya ba'i phyir chos bstan to/ /des bzhon pa don du gnyer zhing / phyogs kyi rgyud sna tshogs nas 'ongs pa rnams la bzhon pa sna tshogs kyi sbyin pas yongs su bstud de/ de dag theg pa chen po la gnas par bya ba'i phyir chos bstan to/ /des gos don du gnyer cing phyogs sna tshogs nas 'ongs pa kun nas 'dus par shes nas yud tsam du bsams te/ nam mkha'i dbyings la bltas pa dang / nam mkha'i dbyings las gos sna tshogs dang / sngon po dang / ser po dang / dmar po dang / dkar po dang / leb rgan dang / shel gyi kha dog tu 'dug pa/ kha dog sna tshogs can/ kha dog du mar rnam par dag pa dag 'thon cing / lag pa'i mthil du 'ongs pas/ des de dag gi slong mo pa de dag la yongs su bstud nas/ de bzhin gshegs pa'i ngo tsha shes pa dang / khrel yod pa bla na med pa dang / mdog gser gyi kha dog lta bu thob par 'gyur ba rnam par dag par bya ba'i phyir chos bstan to/ /de bzhin du yo byad sna tshogs thams cad kyis/ ji ltar 'ongs pa'i slong mo pa rnams la bstud byas nas/ ci rigs su chos bstan to/ /

Seeing them gathered there begging, Vidvan thought for a moment, then looked at the sky. From the sky various kinds of food and drink streamed into his hand, and this Vidvan gave to the beggars according to their various tastes and desires, satisfying and delighting them with the food and drink they wanted, with the best kinds of all means of subsistence. Then, after satisfying them, he expounded the Teaching to them: that is, he elucidated means of accumulating a great store of knowledge, means of eliminating all poverty, means of producing all enjoyments, means of finding ways to knowledge of truth, means of accumulating a vast store of virtue, means of being able to feed on joy, means of attaining a body adorned with the marks and embellishments of greatness, means of attaining purity of invincible power, means of attaining knowledge of uninterrupted livelihood, and means of attaining inexhaustible good powers overcoming the power of all demons. As for those who came for food, once they were satisfied by the various foods from the sky, he taught them to attain intelligence for life, health, and strength. As for those who came for drink, once they were satisfied by the various fine, good, and pleasant drinks, he taught them to put an end to mundane cravings and develop craving for the pleasure of the way of enlightenment. Those who came for delicacies he satisfied with sweets, and then taught them to attain the refined characteristics of great people. Those who came for means of transportation he satisfied with gifts of various vehicles, then taught them to get on the Great Vehicle of universal enlightenment. Seeing those who came for clothing, he thought for a moment and looked at the sky: then from the sky immaculate clothes of various colors fell into his hand; giving them to the beggars, he taught them purification by attainment of buddhas’ supreme golden complexion of modesty. Having provided each of the beggars with their needs, he taught them according to what they were fit for.

de ltar khyim bdag mkhas pas byang chub sems dpa'i rnam par thar pa bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i yul bstan pa byas nas/ tshong dpon gyi bu nor bzang la 'di skad ces smras so/ / rigs kyi bu/ kho bos ni yid kyi mdzod nas byung ba'i bsod nams kyi rnam par thar pa 'di shes par zad na/ kho bos byang chub sems dpa' yo byad la dbang thob pa/ rin po che'i lag pa thob par gyur pa/ 'jig rten gyi khams ma lus pa thams cad lag pas yongs su khebs par byas shing; sangs rgyas kyi mchod pa sna tshogs bsgrub pa'i phyir/ de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor du rin po che'i kha dog sna tshogs kyi sprin gyi char rab tu 'bebs pa/ de bzhin du rgyan kha dog sna tshogs kyi sprin dang / cod pan kha dog sna tshogs kyi sprin dang / khang pa brtsegs pa kha dog sna tshogs kyi sprin dang / na bza' kha dog sna tshogs kyi sprin dang / lha rdzas kyi rol mo brdung ba dang / dkrol ba dang / glu yid du 'ong ba'i dbyangs snyan pa sna tshogs kyi sprin dang / ma tog kha dog sna tshogs kyi sprin dang / spos kha dog sna tshogs kyi sprin dang / bdug spos dang / phreng ba dang / byug pa dang / phye ma dang / chos gos dang / gdugs dang / rgyal mtshan dang / ba dan kha dog sna tshogs dang / rnam pa thams cad du sangs rgyas thams cad mchod pa'i sprin gyi char dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor thams cad dang / sems can thams cad kyi gnas su sangs rgyas thams cad mchod cing bsnyen bkur ba dang / sems can thams cad yongs su smin par bya ba dang / gdul bar bya ba'i phyir yo byad thams cad kyi sprin gyi char 'bebs pa de dag gi spyod pa shes pa'am/ yon tan brjod pa'am/ rnam par 'phrul pa bstan par nus re skan/

Having shown Sudhana the inconceivable scope of this enlightening liberation, Vidvan said to him, “I know the liberation of the capacity of the treasury of mind. How can I know the practice, tell the virtues, or show the miracles of the enlightening beings who have attained control over paraphernalia, who have treasure-producing hands, who cover all worlds with their hands, as treasuries of offerings to buddhas, and shower rain from clouds of various jewels in the assemblies of all buddhas, various clouds of ornaments, towers, clothing, celestial music and song, fragrances, incenses, unguents, aromatic powders, robes, parasols, banners, pennants, and all kind of paraphernalia, raining all kinds of offerings for buddhas, in the assemblies of all buddhas, in the abodes of all beings, to serve all buddhas and to develop and guide all sentient beings?

song / rigs kyi bu/ lho phyogs kyi rgyud 'di nyid na/ grong khyer seng ge'i gzugs zhes bya ba yod de/ de na chos kyi tshong dpon rin chen gtsug phud ces bya ba 'dug gi/ de'i gan du song la ji ltar byang chub sems dpas byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa la bslab par bya ba dang / ji ltar nan tan du bya ba dris shing /
“South of here is a city called Simhapota. An eminent person named Ratnachuda lives there. Go ask him how to learn and carry out the practice of enlightening beings.”

de nas tshong dpon gyi bu nor bzang dga' rangs te/ mgu zhing nyams bde la tshim zhing yid bde ba skyes nas/ khyim bdag mkhas pa la chos kyi rim gros slob ma'i tshul bstan te/ de'i byin gyi rlabs kyis sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad thob par 'gyur bar yongs su blta zhing / thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyang de la rag lus par blta ba dang / dge ba'i bshes gnyen dben par sems rgyun mi 'chad par bstan pa dang / dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyi bka' shin tu nyan pa'i sems dang ldan par bstan pa dang / dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyi dbang du 'gyur ba'i rjes su 'brang bar bya ba dang / dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyi gdams ngag dang tshig mnyan par bya ba dang / dge ba'i bshes gnyen las byung ba'i dang pa'i dbang po la bsam pa byed cing / dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyis btams te btang bas/ dge ba'i bshes gnyen bsten cing bkur ba dang / rjes su 'brang bar bya ba'i sems kyis khyim bdag mkhas pa'i rkang pa gnyis la spyi bos phyag 'tshal te/ khyim bdag mkhas pa la lan brgya stong du mar g.yas phyogs su bskor ba byas nas/ yang dang yang bltas te/ khyim bdag mkhas pa'i drung nas song ngo/ /

Sudhana, pleased, elated, uplifted, overjoyed, expressing his respect for the householder Vidvan as a disciple for a teacher, in honor of the Teaching, seeing all qualities of buddhahood as being fostered by him, seeing omniscience as coming from him, showing undying regard for spiritual benefactors, showing the inconceivability of unlimited knowledge in spiritual friends, acting in accord with the mastery of spiritual benefactors, heeding the instructions of spiritual benefactors, meditating on the faculty of faith deriving from spiritual benefactors, in quest of the instruction of spiritual benefactors, his mind on propitiation of spiritual benefactors, paid his respects to Vidvan and left.
bam po dgu bcu lnga pa/
[chos kyi tshong dpon rin chen gtsug phud]
Ratnachuda

de nas tshong dpon gyi bu nor bzang / bsod nams kyi chu bo de la ni yid ches par sems/ bsod nams kyi zhing de la ni yang dag par blta/ bsod nams kyi ri bo de ni yongs su sbyong / bsod nams kyi mu stegs de la ni yang dag par 'dzeg /bsod nams kyi mdzod de ni rnam par 'byed/ bsod nams kyi gter de la ni shin tu blta/ bsod nams kyi dkyil 'khor de ni yongs su spyod/ bsod nams kyi phung po de ni yang dag par len/ bsod nams kyi stobs de ni yongs su bskyed/ bsod nams kyi shugs de ni rnam par 'phel bar byed cing / mthar gyis grong khyer seng ge'i gzugs gang na ba der phyin te/ chos kyi tshong dpon rin chen gtsug phud yongs su tshol tshol ba las; tshong 'dus kyi srang zhing na 'dug pa mthong nas/ des de'i rkang pa gnyis la spyi bos phyag 'tshal te/ g.yas phyogs su bskor ba byas nas mdun du 'dug ste/ thal mo sbyar nas 'di skad ces smras so/ /'phags pa/ bdag gis bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed na/ ji ltar byang chub sems dpas byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa la bslab par bgyi ba dang / ji ltar nan tan du bgyi ba ma 'tshal na/ 'phags pa/ lam gang gis bdag thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du 'byung bar 'gyur ba de lta bu'i byang chub sems dpa'i lam gyi man ngag legs par mi stsal tam/

Then, resorting to that water of goodness, watching that field of goodness, clearing off that mountain of goodness, plunging into that channel of goodness, opening that treasury of goodness, looking into that mine of goodness, clarifying that sphere of goodness, gathering that mass of goodness, generating that power of goodness, increasing that stream of goodness, Sudhana made his way to Simhapota city. Looking all over for the religious eminent Ratnachuda, he saw him in the middle of the marketplace. Sudhana went up to him, paid his respects, and said, “Noble one, I have set my mind on supreme perfect enlightenment, but I do not know how to learn or carry out the practice of enlightening beings. Please teach me the path of enlightening beings, on which path I may set out for omniscience.”

de nas chos kyi tshong don rin chen gtsug phud kyis/ tshong dpon gyi bu nor bzang gi lag nas bzung ste/ rang gi khyim gang na ba der khrid de/ khyim de bstan nas 'di skad ces smras so/ /rigs kyi bu/ kho bo'i khyim la ltos shig ces nas/ des bltas na khyim de dag cing 'od gsal la/ 'dzam bu chu klung gi gser las byas pa ste/ yangs shing mtho la dngul gyis ra bas bskor ba/ shel gyi rtsig pas shin tu legs par brtsigs te mdzes par byas pa/ bai DUr+ya'i phung po brgya phrag stong gis rab tu brgyan pa/ mu sa ra gal pa'i ka ba bkye ba/ mu tig dmar po las byas pa'i seng ge'i khri shin tu bshams pa/ nor bu rin po che rang bzhin snang ba'i seng ge'i rgyal mtshan bsgreng ba/ nor bu rin po che rnam par snang ba'i bla re bres pa/ gser gyi dra ba yid bzhin gyi nor bus brgyan pas kun nas yog pa/ nor bu rin po che sna tshogs grangs med pas rab tu brgyan pa/ asma gar b+ha las brtsigs pa'i rdzing bu chu bsil pas gang ba dang ldan pa/ rin po che thams cad kyi shing gis bskor ba/ rgya che zhing yangs pa/ rim pa bcur brtsegs pa/ shin tu mtho ba/ sgo brgyad dang ldan par 'dug pa mthong nas/

Ratnachuda took Sudhana to his house and showed it to him, saying, “Look at my house.” Looking it over, Sudhana saw that the house was radiant, made of gold, wide and high, surrounded by silver walls, adorned with crystal terraces, embellished with hundreds of thousands of lapis lazuli turrets, on coral pillars; there was a lion seat arrayed with red pearls, flying lion banners made of starry jewels, covered with a canopy of radiant jewels, draped with a net of wish-fulfilling jewels, arrayed with countless gem-stones. There was a lotus pond, with cool water, made of emeralds. Surrounded by trees of all kinds of jewels, the house was large, ten stories high, with eight doors.

des khyim de'i nang du phyin te/ kun tu bltas na/ rim khang tha ma'i nang na/ bza' ba dang / btung ba'i rnam pa yongs su gtong ba mthong ngo/ /rim khang gnyis pa'i nang na/ gos kyi rnam pa thams cad yongs su gtong ba mthong ngo/ /rim khang gsum pa'i nang na/ rin po che thams cad kyi rgyan dang lhab lhub yongs su gtong ba mthong ngo/ /rim khang bzhi pa'i nang na/ btsun mo'i 'khor dga' ba'i yo byad du bya ba/ bud med rin po che sa chen po'i steng na bzang du bya ba yongs su gtong ba mthong ngo/ /rim khang lnga pa'i nang na/ sa lnga pa la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i chos yang dag par 'gro ba'i dga' ba la mos pa/ 'jig rten la phan pa dang / bde ba'i sems kyi spyod pa dang ldan pa/ gtsug lag thams cad mngon par sgrub pa/ gzungs kyi tshul dang / ting nge 'dzin gyi phyag rgya dang / ting nge 'dzin las rnam par ldang ba dang / ting nge 'dzin la rnam par spyad pa dang / ye shes kyi snang ba mngon par sgrub pa 'dus shing 'khod par mthong ngo/ /rim khang drug pa'i nang na/ byang chub sems dpa' shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la rnam par spyod pa rab tu thob pa/ shes rab shin tu zab pa/ rab tu zhi ba'i chos thams cad mngon par shes pa/ ting nge 'dzin dang / gzungs kyi sgo dang / snying po mang pos sgo kun nas 'byung ba/ bsgribs pa med pa'i spyod yul can mi gnyis pa la yang dag par spyod pa/ chos yang dag par 'gro ba la rnam par 'phrul ba/ shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i rgyud kyi rjes su 'brang zhing rnam par dbye ba dang / rab tu gsal bar byed pa/ shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i sgo mang po yang dag par 'gro ba byed pa rnams kun nas 'dus shing 'khod pa mthong ste/ 'di ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i sgo zhi ba'i snying po zhes bya ba dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i sgo 'gro ba thams cad du ye shes rnam par phye ba zhes bya ba dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i sgo mi g.yo ba'i gling zhes bya ba dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i sgo rdul dang bral ba'i 'od ces bya ba dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i sgo thub par dka' ba zhes bya ba dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i sgo 'gro ba thams cad mos par byed cing / rjes su 'brang ba'i dkyil 'khor zhes bya ba dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i sgo phyi bzhin 'brang ba'i tshul gyi dkyil 'khor zhes bya ba dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i sgo rgya mtsho'i snying po zhes bya ba dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i sgo kun tu lta ba'i btang snyoms thob pa zhes bya ba dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i sgo mi zad pa'i mdzod dang ldan pa zhes bya ba dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i sgo chos thams cad kyi tshul rgya mtsho zhes bya ba dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i sgo 'gro ba rgya mtsho'i rjes su song ba zhes bya ba dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i sgo thogs pa med pa'i spobs pa zhes bya ba dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i sgo chos kyi sprin la dmigs pas rim pas mi dmigs pa'i gnas zhes bya ba dang / de ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i sgo de dag la sogs pa/ shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa grangs med pa brgya stong phrag bcu tshang bar yang dag par bgro ba byed cing / rgyan brjod du med pa shin tu rnam par phye ba'i 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor na 'khod pa mthong bar gyur te/ /rim khang bdun pa'i nang na/ byang chub sems dpa' sgra brnyan lta bu'i bzod pa rab tu thob pa/ thabs dang ye shes rnam par gdon mi za ba la shin tu byung ba/ de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi chos kyi sprin yang dag par 'dzin pa sha stag 'dus shing 'khod par mthong ngo/ /rim khang brgyad pa'i nang na/ byang chub sems dpa' ma nyams par 'gro ba'i mngon par shes pa rab tu thob pa/ 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du rnam par rgyu ba/ 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor thams cad du gzugs brnyan rab tu 'byung ba/ chos kyi dbyings thams cad du lus shin tu rnam par phye ba/ de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi zhabs kyi drung nas gud du mi 'phags pa'i yul dang ldan pa/ sangs rgyas thams cad kyi sku la yang dag par gzhol ba/ de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor du sngon du brjod pa'i gtam gyi skyes bur gyur pa sha stag kun nas 'dus shing 'khod pa mthong ngo/ /rim khang dgu pa'i nang na/ byang chub sems dpa' tshe gcig gis thogs pa sha stag 'dus shing 'khod pa mthong ngo/ /rim khang bcu pa'i nang na/ de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad thog ma byang chub tu thugs bskyed pa dang / spyod pa dang / 'byung ba dang / smon lam rgya mtsho dang / sangs rgyas kyi rnam par 'phrul ba'i yul dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing dang / 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor thams cad dang bcas pa dang / chos kyi 'khor lo rab tu sgrog pa dang bcas pa dang / sems can 'dul ba mdzad pa'i byin gyi rlabs dang bcas par mthong ngo/ /

Entering the house, Sudhana looked around. On the first floor he saw supplies of food and drink being given away. On the second floor he saw all kinds of clothing being given away. On the third floor he saw all kinds of jewelry being given away. On the fourth floor he saw royal concubines, the most talented women on earth, being given away. On the fifth floor he saw a gathering of enlightening beings of the fifth stage, celebrating the Teaching in song, thinking and acting for the welfare and happiness of the world, practicing all sciences, putting into effect the method of mystic spells, the ocean of concentration, emergence from concentration, contemplation in concentration, and the light of knowledge. On the sixth floor he saw a gathering of enlightening beings who had attained transcendent wisdom, who had profound wisdom, who had mystic knowledge of the quiescence of all phenomena, who were completely familiar with the comprehensive method containing the method of concentration spells of the stages, whose sphere of action was unimpeded, who practiced nondualism, who were making songs of the Teaching following the process of transcendence by wisdom, analyzing and opening it up—a door of transcendent wisdom called matrix of equality, a door of transcendent wisdom called orderly analysis of the knowledge of all sentient beings, a door of transcendent wisdom called unmoving, a door of transcendent wisdom called light of dispassion, a door of transcendent wisdom called invincible matrix, a door of transcendent wisdom called world-illumining sphere, a door of transcendent wisdom called sphere of ways to attainment, a door of transcendent wisdom called oceanic matrix, a door of transcendent wisdom called attainment of equanimity of the universal eye, a door of transcendent wisdom called arrival at the inexhaustible treasure, a door of transcendent wisdom called ocean of all ways to truth, a door of transcendent wisdom called entry into the ocean of all beings, a door of transcendent wisdom called unobstructed intelligence, a door of transcendent wisdom called site of gradual descent of the clouds of the Teaching—he saw enlightening beings in untold numbers of orderly groups singing in chorus of countless tens of hundreds of thousands of such doors of transcendent wisdom. On the seventh floor he saw a gathering of enlightening beings who had attained acceptance of the fact that all sounds are like echoes, who were completely familiar with ascertainment of knowledge of means, and who took in the multitude of teachings of all buddhas. On the eighth floor he saw a gathering of enlightening beings who had attained undiminishing mystic knowledge, who observed all worlds, who were able to appear reflected in all communities, whose bodies were distributed evenly throughout all universes, who perceived the presence of all buddhas as a unified sphere, who were united with the body of all buddhas, who were chief interlocutors in the audiences of all buddhas. On the ninth floor he saw a gathering of enlightening beings who were to attain buddhahood in one lifetime. On the tenth floor he saw the oceans of first inspirations, practices, emancipations, and vows of all buddhas, mystic displays of all ways of enlightenment, the audiences of all buddhas, the sounds of the teachings of all buddhas, magical displays to edify all sentient beings.

mthong nas kyang chos kyi tshong dpon rin chen gtsug phud la 'di skad ces smras so/ /'phags pa/ khyod la 'di lta bu'i phun sum tshogs pa mnga' na/ phun sum tshogs pa'i rnam pa de/ ji lta bu zhig tu sbyang ba mdzad mdzad/ dge ba'i rtsa ba ni su zhig la yongs su bskrun bskrun/
Having seen this, Sudhana said to Ratnachuda, “Noble one, how did you achieve this? Where did you plant roots of goodness resulting in such an attainment?”

des smras pa/ rigs kyi bu/ kho bos dran te/ 'das pa'i dus kyi bskal pa sangs rgyas kyi zhing gi rdul shin tu phra ba snyed 'das pa'i yang pha rol gcig na/ 'jig rten gyi khams 'khor lo sna tshogs zhes bya bar/ de bzhin gshegs pa chos kyi dbyings 'od zer mtha' yas pas yongs su brgyan pa'i chos kyi rgyal po zhes bya ba mkhyen pa dang zhabs su ldan pa/ bde bar gshegs pa/ 'jig rten mkhyen pa/ bla na med pa skyes bu 'dul ba'i kha lo sgyur ba/ lha dang mi rnams kyi ston pa/ sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das 'jig rten du byung ste/ de bzhin gshegs pa de ye shes rnam par snang ba la sogs pa/ nyan thos bye ba phrag brgya dang / ye shes nyi ma'i gzi brjid la sogs pa/ byang chub sems dpa' bye ba brgya phrag stong dang thabs gcig tu rgyal po chos kyi dbang phyug rgyal pos spyan drangs nas/ bza' shing gi ra ba chen po rin chen rgyal mtshan gyis mdzes pa zhes bya bar gshegs te/ de bzhin gshegs pa de grong khyer du gshegs nas/ tshong 'dus kyi srang nas bzhud pa'i tshe/ kho bos de bzhin gshegs pa de dang / byang chub sems dpa' dang / nyan thos kyi dge 'dun dang bcas pa la mchod pa bya ba'i phyir sil snyan dang / rol mo'i sgra zhig kyang phyung / spos kyi ri lu gcig gcig kyang bsregs te/ bdug spos kyis bsangs so/ /spos kyi ri lu gcig po de de ltar bsregs pas/ zhag bdun du 'dzam bu'i gling thams cad kyang spos kyi na bun gyi sprin kha dog sna tshogs dang ldan pa/ sems can thams cad kyi lus dang 'dra bas yongs su khebs par gyur to/ /spos kyi na bun gyi sprin de dag las kyang sgra 'di skad du brjod de/ de bzhin gshegs pa ni bsam gyis mi khyab pa ste/ dus gsum du dri ma med pa'i ye shes kyi phung po dang ldan pa'o/ /thams cad mkhyen pa ste/ sgrib pa thams cad mi mnga' ba'o/ /nyon mongs pa'i bag chags thams cad yongs su byang ba ste/ de bzhin gshegs pa la yon phul ba thams cad kyang / thams cad mkhyen pa'i don chen po tshad med pa bsgrub par 'gyur ro/ /thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du yang dag par gzhol bar 'gyur ro zhes de skad du kho bo'i dge ba'i rtsa ba yongs su smin par bya ba dang / sems can thams cad dge ba'i rtsa ba la shugs yang dag par bskyed pa'i phyir/ spos kyi na bun gyi sprin de las; sangs rgyas kyi byin gyi rlabs kyis sgra'i rnam pa de lta bu byung ngo/ /rigs kyi bu/ de ltar de bzhin gshegs pa'i byin gyi rlabs kyis bstan pa'i cho 'phrul gyi dge ba'i rtsa ba de yang / kho bos gnas gsum du yongs su bsngos te/ gsum gang zhe na/ 'di ltar phongs pa thams cad shin tu rgyun gcad pa dang / dam pa'i chos mnyan pa dang mi 'bral ba dang / dge ba'i bshes gnyen sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' thams cad mthong ba yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur par bya ba'i phyir yongs su bsngos so/ /

Ratnachuda said, “I remember that in the past, eons ago, more than as many eons ago as atoms in a buddha-land, in a world called Wheel of Many Colors, a buddha named King of Teaching Adorning the Cosmos with Infinite Rays of Light emerged in the world, tamer and leader of people, teacher of celestials and humans, accomplished in knowledge and action, blissful, supreme knower of the world, enlightened, blessed. Together with a billion disciples led by Radiance of Knowledge, and a trillion enlightening beings led by Energy of the Sun of Knowledge, he went to a royal park at the invitation of the king Master of the Law. I played music for that buddha in the middle of the marketplace of the city and burned one ball of incense as an offering to the buddha and the enlightening beings and disciples. By the burning of that one ball of incense, the whole continent was covered by infinitely various fragrant clouds in the forms of all sentient beings for seven days, and from those clouds emerged such sounds as these—‘Inconceivable is the Buddha, possessed of a body of knowledge extensive as past, present, and future, omniscient, free from all obstructions, rid of all afflictions and habit energies, raised by all enlightened ones, sincere, giver of the fruits of measureless omniscience, concentration of all knowledge.’ Such utterances came from the incense clouds by the power of Buddha to develop my roots of goodness to maturity and to rapidly generate roots of goodness in inconceivable numbers of beings. I dedicated the root of goodness in that miraculous vision of the Buddha’s power to three points: to forever ending all poverty, to always hearing truth, and to meeting all enlightened and enlightening spiritual benefactors.

rigs kyi bu/ kho bos ni byang chub sems dpa'i rnam par thar pa/ smon lam gyi dkyil 'khor thogs pa med pa'i rgyan ces bya ba 'di shes par zad na/ kho bos byang chub sems dpa'i yon tan rin po che tshad med pa'i 'byung gnas su gyur pa/ sangs rgyas kyi sku rgya mtsho dang tha mi dad pa la zhugs pa/ tha mi dad pa'i chos kyi sprin gyi char yang dag par 'dzin pa/ tha mi dad pa'i yon tan rgya mtsho la zhugs pa/ kun tu bzang po'i spyod pa'i dra ba rnam par rgyas par gyur pa/ ting nge 'dzin tha mi dad pa'i yul la zhugs pa/ byang chub sems dpa' thams cad tha mi dad pas dge ba'i rtsa ba rgyun gcig tu gyur pa/ de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad dang tha mi dad cing rnam par mi rtog par spyod pa/ dus gsum tha mi dad pas mnyam pa nyid la zhugs pa/ bskal pa thams cad tha mi dad par yongs su gnas pas mi skyo ba/ kun tu lta ba tha mi dad pa'i yul gyi sa la gnas pa de dag gi spyod pa shes pa'am/ yon tan brjod par nus re skan/

“I know this enlightening liberation of the supernal manifestation of the sphere of unobstructed vows. How can I know the practice or tell the virtues of enlightening beings who are mines of inconceivable, immeasureable virtues, who have entered the indivisible ocean of buddha-bodies, who take in the indivisible multitude of truths, who have attained an indivisible ocean of virtues, who have spread the net of the practice of universal good, who have entered the realm of indivisible absorption, whose roots of goodness are one with those of all enlightening beings, who abide in the pure nondiscrimination of buddhas, who have entered the indivisible equality of past, present, and future, who live continuously through all ages without tiring, who are in the stage of the sphere of the unfragmented universal eye?

song / rigs kyi bu/ lho phyogs kyi rgyud 'di nyid na yul sba'i rtsa ba zhes bya ba yod de/ de'i grong khyer kun nas sgo zhes bya ba na/ tshong dpon spos 'tshong kun tu lta ba zhes bya ba 'dug gi/ de'i gan du song la ji ltar byang chub sems dpas byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa la bslab par bya ba dang; ji ltar nan tan du bya ba dris shig /

“South of here is a land called Vetramulaka. A perfumer named Samantanetra lives in a city there called Samantamukha. Go ask him how an enlightening being is to learn and carry out the practice of enlightening beings.”

de nas tshong dpon gyi bu nor bzang gis chos kyi tshong dpon rin chen gtsug phud kyi rkang pa gnyis la spyi bos phyag 'tshal te/ chos kyi tshong dpon rin chen gtsug phud la lan brgya stong du mar g.yas phyogs su bskor ba byas nas yang dang yang bltas te/ chos kyi tshong dpon rin chen gtsug phud kyi drung nas song ngo// //
Then Sudhana paid his respects to Ratnachuda and left.
[tshong dpon spos 'tshong kun tu lta ba]
Samantanetra

de nas tshong dpon gyi bu nor bzang sangs rgyas mtha' yas pa mthong ba la zhugs pa/ byang chub sems dpa' mtha' yas pa dang 'grogs pa rab tu thob pa/ byang chub sems dpa'i lam mtha' yas pa'i tshul gyis snang bar gyur pa/ chos kyi tshul mtha' yas pas mngon par brlan pas shin tu rtogs pa'i sems dang ldan pa/ byang chub sems dpa'i mos pa mtha' yas pa'i lam gyi rnam par dag pa/ byang chub sems dpa'i dbang po mtha' yas pa'i snang ba rab tu thob pa/ byang chub sems dpa'i bsam pa mtha' yas pa'i stobs la gnas pa/ byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa mtha' yas pa'i rjes su song ba'i sems dang ldan pa/ byang chub sems dpa'i smon lam mtha' yas pa'i stobs yongs su skyes pa/ byang chub sems dpa' gzhan gyis thub pa med pa mtha' yas pa'i rgyal mtshan can/ byang chub sems dpa'i ye shes snang ba mtha' yas pa'i rgyud dang ldan pa/ byang chub sems dpa'i chos mtha' yas pa'i snang ba rab tu thob pa de/ mthar gyis yul sba'i rtsa ba gang na ba der phyin nas/ grong khyer kun nas sgo yongs su tshol zhing phyogs dang / phyogs mtshams dang / yul phyogs nyen kor kun dang / sgang dang / gshong dang; mnyam pa dang / mi mnyam pa thams cad du yongs su skyo ba med pa'i bsam pa dang / 'jigs pa med pa'i sems dang / ldog pa med pa'i brtson 'grus dang / thub pa med pa'i sems kyis dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyi gdams ngag ma brjed pa dang / rtag tu dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyi spyod pa ma nor bas sems rab tu bsgos pa dang / sgo kun nas rnam par dmigs pa'i dbang po dang ldan pa dang / bag med pa thams cad dang bral ba dang / mig dang rna ba g.yeng ba med par kun tu tshol tshol nas/ yul sba'i rtsa pa'i dbus shig na/ grong khyer kun nas sgo tshong 'dus kyi rdul stong phrag bcu'i gnas su gyur pa de/ shin tu bzang po grub pa/ ra ba brtan pas bskor ba/ shin tu mtho ba/ bzhi mdo brgyad kyis brgyan pa 'dug par mthong ste/ de'i nang na spos 'tshong kun tu lta ba yang / spos 'tshong gi khyams shig na 'dug pa mthong nas/

Immersed in the endless vision of buddhas, in communication with the endless congregation of enlightening beings, illumined by the endless means of the way of enlightening beings, his mind broadened and made sure by the endless principles of enlightening beings, pure in the endless path of devotion of enlightening beings, imbued with the infinite light of the faculties of enlightening beings, secure in the infinite willpower of enlightening beings, consciously following the infinite practice of enlightening beings, generating the infinite power of vows of enlightening beings, characterized by the infinite invincibility of enlightening beings, abiding in the infinite light of knowledge of enlightening beings, aware of the infinite law of enlightening beings, Sudhana made his way to the land called Vetramulaka, where he looked for the city Samantamukha, searching all over, here and there, in the highlands and the lowlands, over level and rough terrain; with tireless determination, unceasing, single-minded, with unflagging vigor and an inexhaustible mind, never forgetting the instructions of spiritual benefactors, wishing always to speak with spiritual benefactors, his senses fully aware, rid of all heedlessness, his eyes and ears open, he searched all over for the city of Samantamukha, and finally saw it, in the middle of the country of Vetramulaka, surrounded by ten thousand towns, with strong, high walls, adorned in forty-eight ways. He saw the perfumer Samantanetra in a perfumers’ shop in the city.

spos 'tshong kun tu lta ba gang na ba der phyin te/ spos 'tshong kun tu lta ba'i rkang pa gnyis la spyi bos phyag 'tshal nas mdun du 'dug ste/ thal mo sbyar nas 'di skad ces smras so/ /'phags pa/ bdag gis bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed na/ ji ltar byang chub sems dpas byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa la bslab par bgyi ba dang / ji ltar nan tan du bgyi ba ma 'tshal to/ /

Seeing Samantanetra, Sudhana went up to him, paid his respects, and said, “I have set my mind on supreme perfect enlightenment, but I do not know how an enlightening being is to learn and carry out the practice of enlightening beings.”

smras pa/ rigs kyi bu/ de ltar khyod kyis bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed pa legs so/ /legs so/ /rigs kyi bu/ kho bos ni sems can thams cad kyi nad shes te/ rlung las gyur pa dang / mkhris pa las gyur pa dang / bad kan las gyur pa dang / cha mnyam par 'khrugs pa dang / gzhan gyis gnod par byas pa dang / mi ma yin pa las gyur pa dang / dug 'thungs pa dang / sngags dang / mtshon dang / ro langs pa'i sbyor ba sna tshogs dang / me las gyur pa dang / chus bskyod pa las gyur pa dang / dngangs pa dang / 'jigs pa sna tshogs las gyur pa thams cad kyang shes so/ /nad de dag thams cad zhi bar bya ba'ang shes te/ 'di ltar snum par bya ba'ang rab tu shes so/ /skyug par bya ba dang / bkru ba dang / brta ba dang / gtar ba dang / sna'i cho ga dang / nyar dang / dugs dang / lums dang / byug pa dang / dug gso ba dang / 'byung po'i gdon med par bya ba dang / bcud dang / khrus dang / bzhag pa dang / bskyed pa dang / kha dog sbyang ba dang / nyam bstod pa'ang rab tu shes te/ rigs kyi bu/ phyogs bcu nas sems can gang ji snyed cig kho bo'i drung du 'ong ba de dag thams cad kyi nad thams cad kyang rab tu zhi bar byed de/ nad sos nas kyang legs par bkru ba dang / lus la byug pas byugs pa byas nas ci tshul gyi rgyan gyis yan lag shin tu brgyan te/ ci rigs pa'i gos lus la bskon nas/ kha zas bro ba'i mchog dang ldan pa sna tshogs kyis yongs su tshim par byas te; nor dpag tu med pas kyang phun sum tshogs par byed do/ /de'i 'og tu yang de dag la mi gtsang ba bstan cing 'dod chags spang ba'i phyir chos ston to/ /byams pa chen po yongs su bsngags shing zhe sdang spang ba'i phyir chos ston to/ /chos rnam par dbye ba'i bye brag bstan cing gti mug spang ba'i phyir chos ston to/ /khyad par khong du chud pa'i tshul gyi sgo yang dag par bstan cing cha mnyam pa'i spyod pa dang / nyon mongs pa spang ba'i phyir chos ston to/ /sangs rgyas kyi yon tan gyi chos dang ldan pa'i gtam thams cad yongs su brjod cing / byang chub kyi sems 'byung ba'i rgyu yongs su ston to/ /'khor ba'i sdug bsngal tshad gzung du med pa yongs su bstan cing / snying rje chen po 'byung ba'i rgyu yongs su ston to/ /bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs rgya chen po bsags pa yang dag par bsngags shing / yon tan tshad med pa 'thob pa dang 'byung ba'i rgyu yongs su ston to/ /sems can thams cad yongs su smin par bya ba dang / gdul bar bya ba yongs su bstan cing / theg pa chen po'i smon lam 'byung ba'i rgyu yongs su ston to/ /sangs rgyas kyi zhing thams cad dang / bskal pa thams cad du gnas par bya ba'i spyod pa'i dra ba shin tu rgyas par bshad cing / byang chub sems dpa' kun tu bzang po'i spyod pa 'thob pa dang 'byung ba'i rgyu yongs su ston to/ /sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su bsngags shing mtshan dang / dpe byad bzang pos brgyan pa'i sangs rgyas kyi sku 'thob pa dang / 'byung ba'i rgyu yongs su ston to/ /tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su brjod cing / de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku yongs su dag pa thams cad du 'gro ba thob pa dang 'byung ba'i rgyu yongs su ston to/ /bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su brjod cing / de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku gzugs dang / sku mdog rnam par dag pa bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i rgyu yongs su ston to/ /brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su brjod cing / de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku thub par dka' ba yongs su ston to/ /bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su brjod cing / de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku zil gyis ma non pa rnam par dag pa yongs su ston to/ /shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su brjod cing / chos kyi sku yongs su ston to/ /thabs mkhas pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su brjod cing / 'gro ba thams cad la mngon du gyur pa'i sku gtsang zhing rnam par dag pa yongs su ston to/ /smon lam gyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su brjod cing / bskal pa thams cad kyi dus su 'gro ba thams cad kyi sems dang 'grogs pa'i sku rnam par dag pa yongs su ston to/ /stobs kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su brjod cing / sangs rgyas kyi zhing thams cad du mngon par 'byung ba'i sku rnam par dag pa yongs su ston to/ /ye shes kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su brjod cing / 'gro ba thams cad kyi bsam pa ji lta ba bzhin du tshim par mdzad pa'i sku rnam par dag pa yongs su ston to/ /mi dge ba'i chos thams cad las rnam par ldog pa yongs su brjod cing / blta na phul du bzang ba'i sku rnam par dag pa yongs su ston to/ /de ltar de dag chos kyi sbyin pas yongs su bsdus te/ nor dang rin po che mtha' yas pa'i tshogs kyis nye bar brtan pa byas shing so sor 'gyed do/ /

Samantanetra said, “It is good that you aspire to supreme perfect enlightenment. I know the maladies of all sentient beings and how to cure those maladies. All who come to me from the ten directions, I cure of their maladies. Once they are cured, bathed, and anointed, I satisfy them with suitable ornaments, clothes, and food, and furnish them with immeasurable wealth. After that I teach them, presenting impurity to rid them of lust, praising great love to rid them of hatred, showing them analysis of elements to rid them of delusion. I teach them to get rid of the afflictions of action equally combining lust, hatred, and delusion by illuminating the ways to higher knowledge. I clarify the means of producing the determination for enlightenment by talking about the virtuous qualities of all buddhas. I elucidate the means of producing great compassion by showing the immeasurable miseries of the mundane world. I elucidate the means of attaining immeasurable virtuous qualities by describing the accumulation of vast stores of goodness and knowledge. I elucidate the means of producing the vows of the Great Vehicle by showing the development and guidance of all sentient beings. I elucidate the means of attaining the practice of universally good enlightening beings by spreading out the net of practice in all lands in all times. I elucidate the means of attaining a buddha-body of amassed distinguishing marks and embellishments by praising transcendent generosity. I elucidate the means of attaining buddhas’ purity in all situations by explaining transcendent morality. I elucidate the means of producing the inconceivable purity of appearance of buddhas by explaining transcendent tolerance. I elucidate the means of producing the invincible body of buddhas by explaining transcendent vigor. I elucidate the unsurpassed purity of body of buddhas by explaining transcendent meditation. I elucidate the purity of the reality-body by explaining transcendent wisdom. I elucidate the purity of the body of Buddha appearing before all beings by explaining transcendent skill in means. I elucidate the purity of body involved in entering the minds of people in all eras and times by explaining transcendent commitment. I elucidate the purity of body appearing in all buddha-lands by explaining transcendent power. I elucidate the purity of body pleasing all sentient beings according to their inclinations by explaining transcendent knowledge. I elucidate the purification of the body of supremely pure appearance by explaining the removal of all unwholesome elements. Thus taking care of them with this giving of teaching, I provide them with the support of endless treasures and let them go.

yang rigs kyi bu/ kho bo ni spos dang / bdug spos dang / bsgo ba dang / bsku ba sbyor shes te/ 'di ltar spos kyi rgyal po gzhal du med pa la sogs pa dang / spos kyi rgyal po sin+d+hu wa ra la sogs pa dang / spos kyi rgyal po mi pham pa la sogs pa dang / spos kyi rgyal po rnam par gsal byed la sogs pa dang / spos kyi rgyal po nyi ma yod pa la sogs pa dang / spos kyi rgyal po dus dang mthun pa la sogs pa dang / spos kyi rgyal po sprul gyi snying po'i tsan dan la sogs pa dang / spos kyi rgyal po sprin gyi a ga ru la sogs pa dang / spos kyi rgyal po dbang po mi 'khrugs pa la sogs pa spos sbyar ba thams cad kyang rab tu shes so/ /yang rigs kyi bu/ kho bos ni sems can thams cad yongs su tshim par byed pa dang / sgo thams cad nas sangs rgyas blta zhing mchod pa dang / bsnyen bkur ba'i spos kyi gzugs shes te/ rigs kyi bu/ sems can thams cad yongs su tshim par byed pa dang / sgo thams cad nas sangs rgyas blta zhing mchod pa dang / bsnyen bkur ba'i spos kyi gzugs 'dis kho bo'i bsam pa thams cad kyang yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur te/ de'i mthus kho bo sems can thams cad yongs su skyob pa'i rgyan gyi sprin byin gyis rlob pa byed do/ 'di ltar spos kyi khang pa brtsegs pa'i sprin gyi rgyan nas/ rnam pa thams cad du de bzhin gshegs pa mchod cing rim gror bya ba'i rgyan gyi sprin gyi bar du byin gyis rlob pa byed do/ /
rigs kyi bu/ kho bo ni nam de bzhin gshegs pa la mchod par bya bar 'dod par gyur pa de'i tshe/ kho bos sems can thams cad yongs su tshim par byed pa dang / sgo thams cad nas sangs rgyas blta zhing mchod pa dang bsnyen bkur ba'i spos kyi gzugs 'di las spos kyi mdzod kyi khang pa brtsegs pa'i sprin tshad gzung du med pa bton cing / phyogs bcu'i chos kyi dbyings thams cad na bzhugs pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa'i chos kyi dkyil 'khor gyi chos kyi dbyings thams cad du spos thams cad kyi mdzod kyi khang pa brtsegs pa'i sprin gyi rgyan byin gyis rlob pa byed do/ /chos kyi dbyings thams cad du sangs rgyas kyi zhing thams cad yongs su sbyong ba'i sprin gyi rgyan dang / spos kyi khang pa'i sprin gyi rgyan dang / spos kyi ra ba'i sprin gyi rgyan dang / spos kyi ba gam gyi sprin gyi rgyan dang; spos kyi rta babs kyi sprin gyi rgyan dang / spos kyi skar khung gi sprin gyi rgyan dang / spos kyi pu shu'i sprin gyi rgyan dang / spos kyi zla gam gyi sprin gyi rgyan dang / spos kyi gdugs kyi sprin gyi rgyan dang / spos kyi rgyal mtshan bsgreng ba'i sprin gyi rgyan dang / spos kyi lha'i ba dan gyi sprin gyi rgyan dang / spos kyi bla re'i sprin gyi rgyan dang / spos kyi gzugs kyi dra ba'i sprin gyi rgyan dang / spos kyi 'od kyi sprin gyi rgyan dang / spos kyi snang ba dri ma med pa'i sprin gyi rgyan dang / spos thams cad kyi sprin gyi char rab tu 'bab pa'i rgyan byin gyis rlob ste;

“I also know how to compound all scents, incenses, perfumes, and unguents. Moreover, I know the ball of fragrance making offerings on meeting buddhas everywhere, pleasing to all beings. By this ball of fragrance all wishes are fulfilled; by it I produce multitudes of dwelling places, and so on, including multitudes of all kinds of offerings for buddhas. Whenever I want to make offerings to buddhas, I produce clouds of towers of fragrance and cause them to appear in all universes, in the assemblies of all buddhas. I adorn all universes with purification of buddha-lands, palaces of fragrance, walls of fragrance, turrets of fragrance, arches of fragrance, windows of fragrance, penthouses of fragrance, crescents of fragrance, parasols of fragrance, banners and pennants of fragrance, canopies of fragrance, webs of fragrance, lights of fragrance, immaculate adornments of fragrance, and rain showering from clouds of all fragrances.

rigs kyi bu/ kho bos ni sems can thams cad yongs su tshim par byed pa dang / sgo thams cad nas sangs rgyas blta zhing mchod pa dang / bsnyen bkur ba'i spos kyi gzugs kyi chos kyi sgo 'di shes par zad na/ kho bos byang chub sems dpa' sman gyi rgyal po lta bur gyur pa blta na don yod pa/ 'grogs na don yod pa/ rjes su dran na don yod pa/ brtul zhugs rjes su byas na don yod pa/ ming thos na don yod pa/ mthong ba tsam gyis sems can thams cad kyi nyon mongs pa zhi bar 'gyur ba/ mthong ba tsam gyis sems can rnams ngan song gi rgyud las ldog par 'gyur ba/ mthong ba tsam gyis sems can thams cad sangs rgyas kyi chos la skabs bye ba thob par 'gyur ba/ mthong ba tsam gyis sems can rnams kyi sdug bsngal gyi phung po thams cad zhi bar 'gyur ba/ mthong ba tsam gyis sems can rnams 'jigs pa dang / 'khor ba'i lam gyi rgyud thams cad kyi 'jigs pa dang bral bar 'gyur ba/ mthong ba tsam gyis sems can rnams thams cad mkhyen pa'i phyogs la rten par 'gyur ba'i phyir mi 'jigs pa thob par 'gyur ba mthong ba tsam gyis sems can rnams rga shi'i grog po dang / g.yang sar mi ltung ba/ mthong ba tsam gyis sems can rnams chos kyi dbyings mnyam pa nyid la gnas pas mya ngan las 'das pa'i bde ba 'thob par 'gyur ba de dag gi spyod pa shes pa'am yon tan brjod pa nus re skan/

“I know this medium of the Teaching, the ball of fragrance making offerings on meeting buddhas everywhere, pleasing all sentient beings; how can I know the practice or tell the virtues of the enlightening beings who are like great medicines, whom it is beneficial to see, to hear, to associate with, to remember, to follow, and to recall their names, with the sight of whom all sentient beings are relieved of afflictions, with the sight of whom sentient beings leave all evil ways, with the sight of whom sentient beings find a way to buddhahood, with the sight of whom the sufferings of sentient beings are relieved, with the sight of whom sentient beings are freed from fear of all mundane states, with the sight of whom sentient beings become fearless because of being near the abode of omniscience, with the sight of whom sentient beings no longer fall into the abyss of old age and death, with the sight of whom sentient beings attain the bliss of tranquillity through cosmic equanimity?

song / rigs kyi bu/ lho phyogs kyi rgyud 'di nyid na/ grong khyer ta la'i rgyal mtshan zhes bya ba yod de/ de na rgyal po me zhes bya ba 'dug gi /de'i gan du song la/ ji ltar byang chub sems dpa' byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa la bslab par bya ba dang / ji ltar nan tan du bya ba dris shig /
“South of here is a city called Taladhvaja, where there lives a king named Anala. Go ask him how to learn and carry out the practice of enlightening beings.”

de nas tshong dpon gyi bu nor bzang / tshong dpon spos 'tshong kun tu lta ba'i rkang pa gnyis la spyi bos phyag 'tshal te/ tshong dpon spos 'tshong kun tu lta ba la lan brgya stong du mar g.yas phyogs su bskor ba byas nas/ yang dang yang bltas te/ tshong dpon spos 'tshong kun tu lta ba'i drung nas song ngo/ /
So then Sudhana paid his respects to the eminent perfumer Samantanetra and left.
[rgyal po me]
Anala

de nas tshong dpon gyi bu nor bzang dge ba'i bshes gnyen gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pa de dag rjes su dran par byed cing / dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyi gdams ngag gi sgo de dag rjes su dran par bya ba dang / bdag ni dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyis yongs su bzung ngo zhes rang gi sems yongs su tshim par bya ba dang / bdag ni dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyis yongs su bsrungs pas/ bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub las phyir ldog par mi 'gyur ro snyam du rnam par sems shing sems dga' ba ni rab tu thob/ sems dang ba dang / sems rab tu dga' ba dang / sems rangs pa dang / sems mgu ba dang / sems mos pa dang / sems kyi shugs dang / sems rnam par zhi ba dang / sems rgya chen po dang / sems rgyan dang / sems la thogs pa med pa dang / sems la sgrib pa med pa dang / sems rnam par phye ba dang / sems yang dag par gzhol ba dang / sems kyi dbang dang / sems dbang bsgyur ba dang / sems kyi chos khong du chud pa dang / sems kyis zhing rgyas par dgang ba dang / sems sangs rgyas mthong bas brgyan pa dang / sems stobs bcu'i yid la bya ba dang mi 'bral ba'ang thob nas/

Recalling those spiritual benefactors one after another, focusing his attention on the instructions of those spiritual benefactors, rejoicing in himself at being in the care of spiritual benefactors, reflecting that through the protection of spiritual benefactors he would never lose the way to supreme perfect enlightenment, Sudhana became joyful, serene, pleased, happy, calm, broadminded; he attained adornment of mind, nonattachment of mind, nonobstruction of mind, aloofness of mind, unification of mind, control of mind, extraordinary power of mind, mental conformity with the Teaching, mental pervasion of lands, mental beatification by the vision of Buddha, and constant mental focus on the ten powers.

de mthar gyis ljongs nas ljongs dang / grong nas grong dang / yul nas yul du tshol zhing / grong khyer ta la'i rgyal mtshan gang na ba der phyin te/ rgyal po me gang na bzhugs zhes dris na/ de la 'gro ba gzhan dag gis 'di skad du bstan te/ rigs kyi bu/ 'di re/ rgyal po me ni/ rgyal po'i don bsgrub pa'i phyir seng ge'i gdan la bzhugs shing rgyal po'i 'phrin las mdzad do/ /khams rab tu skyong ngo/ /chad pas gcad par 'os pa ni chad pas gcod do/ /bya dgas [*dgas?] bsdu bar 'os pa ni/ bya dgas [*dgas?] sdud do/ /g.yon yod pa rnams la ni gyod rmod do/ /rtsod pa rnams kyi zhal che ni yongs su gcod do/ /dma' ba rnams ni dbugs 'byin to/ /dregs pa rnams ni/ 'dul ba mdzad do/ /srog gcod pa las ni rnam par zlog go /ma byin par len pa dang ni rnam par 'byed pa mdzad do/ /gzhan gyis yongs su bzung ba la mngon par zhen pa ni rnam par zhi bar mdzad do/ /brdzun du smra ba las ni phyir zlog pa mdzad de/ /phra ma'i tshig dang ni rnam par dbral bar mdzad do/ /zhe gcod pa'i ngag ni rgyun gcod pa mdzad do/ /tshig kyal ba las ni yongs su glon no/ /chags sems dang ni mi 'dre bar mdzad do/ /gnod sems dang ni rgyang sring ngo/ /log par lta ba ni 'dre ba med par mdzad do/ /

He made his way from country to country, village to village, place to place, searching, till he came to the city of Taladhvaja, where he asked after the whereabouts of King Anala. He was told, “King Anala is on the throne carrying out his royal duties for the welfare of the populace. He governs the communities, punishes those who should be punished, promotes those who deserve promotion, chastises criminals, settles disputes, comforts and encourages the wretched and dejected, subdues the wild and arrogant; he puts a stop to the injury of living beings, theft, desire for others’ spouses, falsehood, slander, harsh or violent talk, and divisive talk; he frees us from craving, malice, and false ideas.”

de nas tshong dpon gyi bu nor bzangrgyal po me gang na ba der phyin na/ des mthong ba/ rgyal po me de ni rin po che'i seng ge'i khri chen po rdo rje mthu bo che'i nor bu sna tshogs kyis spras pa/ rin po che 'od gsal ba rnam pa sna tshogs grangs med pa las byas pa'i rkang pa bkye ba/ rin po che gcig ma yin pas legs par spras shing brgyan pas yid du 'ong ba'i lhun dang ldan pa/ gser gyi lcag/ bod kyi dra bas legs par blas shing chub par btags pa/ nor bu rin po che du ma'i sgron mas shin tu snang bar byas pa/ nor bu rin po che dbang gi rgyal po las byas pa'i pad+mo'i snying po can lha rdzas kyi rin po che'i stan rim pa du mar bting ba/ gam yo nas lha rdzas kyi spos sna tshogs kyi bdug spos kyis shin tu bdug pa/ rin po che'i rgyal mtshan bsgreng ba brgya stong gis mdzes par byas pa/ rin po che'i ba dan brgya phrag rnam par bres pas brgyan pa/ rin po che'i me tog gi chun po sna tshogs kyi lda ldi rab tu bkye bas shin tu mdzes par byas pa/ steng nas lha rdzas kyi rin po che'i bla re sna tshogs bres pa zhig la 'dug cing / de ni gzhon zhing dar la bab pa gzugs mdzes shing blta na yid du 'ong ba/ skra mthon mthing g.yas phyogs su 'khyil ba dang ldan pa/ mgo gdugs ltar 'dug pa/ gtsug tor gyi spyi bo can/ dpral ba yangs pa/ mig dkar nag 'byes shing ring la/ rdzi ma ba'i rdzi ma ltar 'dug pa/ sna'i dbyibs legs shing bzang la/ ran par mdzes pa dang ldan pa/ mchu mtshal ltar mdog bzang zhing shin tu legs pa dang ldan pa/ so mnyam zhing thags bzang la shin tu dkar ba bzhi bcu tshang ba dang ldan pa/ 'gram pa'i lha nga seng ge'i 'gram pa ltar 'dug pa/ mkhur ba shas rgyas pa/ smin tshugs gzhu ltar 'dug cing ring la shin tu mdzes pa/ mdzod spu zla ba'i kha dog ltar 'dug pa'i thig le can/ rna shal ring zhing lhod par 'phyang ba/ zla ba nya ba ltar bzhin mdangs dang ldan zhing bzang pa/ mgul zlum zhing dung ltar mdzes pa; snying ga dpal gyi be'us brgyan pa/ ro stod seng ge'i stod ltar 'dug pa/ thal gong shin tu rgyas pa/ dpung mgo'i lhun legs shing zlum pa/ lag pa ring ba/ dra bar 'brel ba'i sor mo can/ rkang lag 'khor los brgyan pa/ rkang lag 'jam zhing gzhon la shas rgyas pa/ bdun shin tu mtho ba/ rked pa rdo rje ltar 'dug pa/ lus che zhing drang ba/ bral zlum pa/ pho mtshan gsang ba'i sbubs na 'dug pa/ byin pa ri e na ya'i byin pa ltar 'dug pa/ sor mo ring ba/ rkang pa'i rting pa yangs pa/ 'od 'dom gang ba dang ldan pa/ mdog gser gyi kha dog ltar 'dug pa/ ba spu re re nas g.yas phyogs gyen du 'khyil ba/ shing nya gro ha'i [*ta'i?] rgyal po ltar chu zheng gab pa/ lus mtshan dang dpe byad bzang pos shin tu brgyan pa/ mgo la nor bu rin po che yid bzhin gyi cod pan thogs pa/ 'dzam bu chu klung gi gser las byas pa'i dpral ba'i rgyan zla gam gyis mdzes par brgyan pa/ rna ba las rin po che in+d+ra nI la'i rna cha dri ma med pa 'phyang ba/ nor bu rin po che rin thang med pa'i se mo do'i 'od kyis snang bar byas pas/ dri ma med pa'i ro stod rgyas pa dang ldan pa/ lha rdzas kyi nor bu dam pa'i dpung rgyan dang / gdu bus lag pa mdzes par brgyan pa zhig ste/ rin po che'i gdugs chen po rin po che'i bai DUr+ya dri ma med pa'i yu ba can/ rin po che shar bu brgya phrag bcus rnam par phye ba/ 'dzam bu chu klung gi gser gyi bla gab can/ nor bu rin po che sgra snang ba rnam par dag pa'i snying po can/ rin po che'i dril bu'i phreng ba las sgra snyan cing yid du 'ong ba 'byung ba/ nor bu rin po che'i 'od phyogs kun tu 'phro ba can drung nas bzung zhing bsgreng ba/ rgyal po'i gzi brjid dang dbang chen po la gnas pa/ srid la gzhan gyi 'khor gyis gco ba med pa; dgra'i 'jigs pa dang bral pa'i dbang phyug dang ldan par 'dug pa mthong ngo/ /

Then Sudhana went to King Anala and saw him sitting on a great jeweled lion throne brilliant with diamonds, set on legs of countless varieties of luminous jewels, with beautiful figurines inlaid with jewels, arrayed with cowrie shells on golden threads, lit by many jewel lamps, in a lotus calyx made of magic gems, spread with many precious celestial robes, perfumed with various celestial incenses, embellished with a hundred thousand jeweled parasols, adorned with a hundred thousand jeweled banners, beautified by trailing flower garlands made of varicolored jewels, covered by a canopy of various celestial jewels. The king was young and handsome, with the marks and embellishments of a great man, wearing a crown of wish-fulfilling jewels, his forehead adorned with golden crescents, pure blue sapphire earrings hanging from his ears, a breastplate radiant with jewels on his chest, bracelets of the finest celestial gems on his arms, shaded by a large precious parasol with a cane of pure lapis lazuli and a thousand ribs of jewels with a gold covering, a wreath of jewel bells sweetly ringing, illumining all directions with its luster. The king had great regal power; his rule was invincible to enemy armies, his sovereignty was free of danger from enemy armies.

de'i 'khor kun nas kyang blon po stong phrag bcu tshogs shing rgyal po'i dgos pa sgrub pa la brtson/ pa mthong ngo/ /de'i mdun na chad pas gcod pa'i mi sems can dmyal ba'i srung ma lta bu/ gshin rje'i g.yog 'khor lta bu/ 'jigs 'jigs lta'i gos gyon pa/ gtum zhing mi bzad la 'jigs pa chen po bskyed pa/ mig dmar ba/ so gtsigs pa/ gdong gi gnyer ma gsum khro gnyer du bsdus pa/ ral gri dang / sta re dang / lcags kyi changs mdung dang / mda' dang / ber ga dang / mdung la sogs pa'i mtshon cha dang / lag cha thogs pa/ lus dang bzhin gyi dbyibs mi sdug cing 'jigs su rung ba/ sprin nag po ltar 'dug pa/ mi snyan cing brlang la sdang ba'i sgra drag po 'byin pa/ gzi blta bar dka' ba 'jigs pa chen po bskyed pa/ srog chags brgya phrag stong gi snying 'gems par byed pa de lta bu dag chad pas gcad par 'os pa'i sems can chad pas gcod pa la brtson pa mthong ngo/ /de na srog chags rku ba/ gzhan gyi nor la 'phrog pa/ sems can gyi longs spyod chud gson pa/ lam sgugs shing 'phrog pa/ grong dang / grong khyer dang / grong rdal dang / lhas la mes gtong ba/ grong du chom po byed pa/ khyim phugs 'debs pa/ sdig sdig ltar byed pa/ dug ldud pa/ bkrugs ma byed pa/ thong mi byed pa/ byi bo byed pa/ log par zhugs pa/ gnod par sems pa/ 'dod chen che ba/ sdig pa sna tshogs kyi las mi bzad pa byed pa brgya stong mang po bcing ba dam po lngas bcings shing / rgyal po me'i drung du khrid pa dag kyang mthong ngo/ /de dag la'ang rgyal po mes ci rigs par chad pas gcad par gyur pa mthong ngo/ /des de na rgyal po mes bsgo zhing / la la ni rkang lag bcad/ la la ni rna ba dang sna bcad/ la ni mig phyung / la la ni yan lag dang nying lag dang mgo bcad/ la la ni lus thams cad mes btang / la la ni ba tsha'i chu khol mas lus la gtor cing / pags pa brnyil ba la sogs pa de lta bu'i chad pa sna tshogs du ma mi bzad pa/ drag pa/ brlang ba/ yid du mi 'ong ba/ srog 'phrog pa dag kyang byed par mthong ngo/ /gsad pa'i sa de na yang / gsang ba'i rkang lag dang / rna ba dang; mig dang / sna dang / mgo dang / yan lag dang / nying lag gi phung po ri tsam du spungs pa mthong ngo/ /khrag gi mtsho dpag tshad gsum tsam du zabs su zab la chu zheng du dpag tshad du ma yod pa yang mthong ngo/ /de na shi ba'i keng rus yan lag dang / nying lag dang / mgo dang bral ba brgya stong du ma la/ spyang ki dang / wa dang / khyi dang / bya rog dang / bya rgod dang / khra dang / bya ku ra ra mang pos gang ste/ 'drad cing 'thog pa mthong ngo/ /de la'ang la la ni kha dog gyur te/ sngon por gyur pa tsam/ la la ni rangs pa tsam/ la la ni bam pa tsam/ la la ni 'bu zhugs pa tsam du gyur to/ shin tu skyi g.ya' zhing 'jigs 'jigs ltar 'dug pa mthong ngo/ /gsad pa de dag gsod pa'i tshe/ mi sdug pa cho dgur byas pas na/ 'jigs 'jigs skad dang / snying rje rje skad du sgra 'byin cing / cho nges 'debs pa'i sgra chen po thos nas kyi g.ya' zhing mi dga' ba chen po bskyed pa/ sems can dmyal ba chen po ris gzhom pa'i sgra lta bu yang thos so/ /des de ltar kha btags te brdungs pa dang / shin tu 'jigs pa'i drag shul mthong nas 'di snyam du gyur to/ /bdag ni sems can thams cad la phan pa dang bde ba'i phyir/ bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par zhugs te/ byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa yongs su tshol zhing 'bad de/ dge ba'i bshes gnyen rnams la dge ba ni ci zhig bgyi/ mi dge ba ni gang zhig spang zhes 'dri 'dri na/ rgyal po me'di la ni dge ba'i chos kyang med de/ kha na ma tho ba chen po'i las la spyod pa/ yid kyi yongs su rtog pa shin tu gtum pa dang ldan pa/ sems can pha rol gyi srog gcad pa la zhugs pa/ sems can pha rol shin tu mnar ba la brtson pa/ tshe phyi ma la lta ba med pa; ngan song gi g.yang sa'i gad kha na 'dug pa zhig na/ 'di las ci byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa yang thob par 'gyur ram snyam ste/

Sudhana saw ten thousand ministers gathered around the king conducting the affairs of state. He also saw ten thousand torturers before the king, looking like the warders of hell, of violent, terrifying appearance, holding swords, axes, spears, clubs, and impaling stakes, involved in punishing those to be punished. He saw criminals—thieves, bandits, murderers, troublemakers, rapists, and so on—brought bound before King Anala and saw the king deal out appropriate punishments: by the king’s order, some had their hands and feet cut off, some had their ears and noses cut off, some had their eyes gouged out, some had their limbs or heads cut off, some had their whole bodies burnt by fire, some were being dismembered, crippled, burnt, sprinkled with acid. Sudhana watched them undergoing such harsh, injurious, and deadly punishments and saw a mountainous heap of rendered body parts on the execution ground and a tremendous torrent of blood. He also saw animals and birds eating the mutilated corpses there. He also saw some of the corpses hideously decomposing. He also heard the screams and cries of those being mutilated and killed, as terrifying as hell.
Seeing that dreadful, horrifying butchery, Sudhana thought, “I have set out for supreme perfect enlightenment for the sake of the welfare and happiness of all beings and am devoted to pursuing the practice of enlightening beings; I ask spiritual benefactors what good an enlightening being should do and what evil one should avoid. This King Anala, though, is devoid of goodness, an evildoer, malicious, a killer and oppressor, without regard for others, doomed to a miserable fate: so how can I hear about the practice of enlightening beings from him?”

de de ltar sems shing yid la byed de/ sems can thams cad yongs su bskyab pa la mngon par brtson pa/ snying rje rgya chen po skyes pa'i sems dang ldan pa de la/ steng gi nam mkha'i dbyings las lha mang pos bos pa/ rigs kyi bu/ drang srong rgyal ba'i drod kyi skye mched kyi dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyi gdams ngag tu bya ba mi dran nam/

As Sudhana was thinking this, concerned with saving all sentient beings, his mind full of compassion, celestial beings in the sky over his head called out, “Do you not remember the instructions of the seer Jayoshmayatana?”
des gyen du nam mkha'i dbyings la bltas nas dran no zhes brjod do/ /
Sudhana looked up and said, “I do.”

lha rnams kyis smras pa/ rigs kyi bu khyod dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyi gdams ngag la de ltar the tshom ma skyed cig /rigs kyi bu/ dge ba'i bshes gnyen rnams ni yang dag pa ma nor bar ston gyi/ log pa ma yin no/ /rigs kyi bu/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi thabs mkhas pas spyod pa'i ye shes ni bsam gyis mi khyab bo/ /sems can yongs su sdud pa'i ye shes bsam gyis mi khyab bo/ /sems can la phan 'dogs pa'i ye shes bsam gyis mi khyab bo/ /sems can tshar gcod pa'i ye shes bsam gyis mi khyab bo/ /sems can gzengs bstod pa'i ye shes bsam gyis mi khyab bo/ /sems can yongs su spyod pa'i ye shes bsam gyis mi khyab bo/ /sems can yongs su skyong ba'i ye shes bsam gyis mi khyab bo/ /sems can 'dzud pa'i ye shes bsam gyis mi khyab bo/ /sems can yongs su smin par byed pa'i ye shes bsam gyis mi khyab bo/ /sems can 'dul ba'i ye shes bsam gyis mi khyab bo/ /song / rigs kyi bu/ de la byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa dris shig ces nas/

The celestials said, “Do not give rise to doubt about the instructions of spiritual benefactors; they guide you on the right way. Indeed, the practical knowledge of skill in means of enlightening beings is inconceivable. The knowledge of how to take care of all sentient beings is inconceivable. The knowledge of how to benefit sentient beings is inconceivable. The knowledge of how to restrain sentient beings is inconceivable. The knowledge of how to further sentient beings is inconceivable. The knowledge of how to care for sentient beings is inconceivable. The knowledge of how to protect sentient beings is inconceivable. The knowledge of how to purify sentient beings is inconceivable. The knowledge of how to liberate sentient beings is inconceivable. The knowledge of how to perfect sentient beings is inconceivable. The knowledge of how to guide sentient beings is inconceivable. Go ask the king about the practice of enlightening beings.”

tshong dpon gyi bu nor bzang gis lha'i ngag mnyan te/ rgyal po me gang na ba der song ste phyin nas/ rgyal po me'i rkang pa gnyis la spyi bos phyag 'tshal te/ rgyal po me la lan brgya stong du mar g.yas phyogs su bskor ba byas nas/ mdun du 'dug ste thal mo sbyar nas 'di skad ces smras so/ /'phags pa/ bdag gis bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed na/ ji ltar byang chub sems dpas byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa la bslab par bgyi ba dang / ji ltar nan tan du bgyi ba ma 'tshal te/ 'phags pa ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams la gdams ngag dang / rjes su bstan pa mdzad do zhes bdag gis thos na/ 'phags pa/ ji ltar byang chub sems dpas byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa la bslab par bgyi ba dang / ji ltar nan tan du bgyi ba bdag la bka' stsal du gsol/ /

Hearing the words of the celestials, Sudhana went to King Anala, paid his respects, and said, “Noble one, I have set my mind on supreme perfect enlightenment, but I do not know how to learn and carry out the practice of enlightening beings. I hear that you give instruction to enlightening beings; pray tell me how to learn and apply the practice of enlightening beings.”

de nas rgyal po mes rgyal po'i bya ba byas te/ seng ge'i khri las langs nas/ tshong dpon gyi bu nor bzang gi lag pa g.yas pa nas bzung ste/ rgyal po'i pho brang ta la'i rgyal mtshan du khrid do/ /de mthar gyis rang gi gnas su phyin nas/ tshong dpon gyi bu nor bzang btsun mo'i 'khor gyi nang du khrid de/ khri la bzhag nas 'di skad ces smras so/ /rigs kyi bu/ nga'i khyim dang longs spyod la ltos zhes nas/ des bltas na/ khyim de rgya che zhing yangs la/ rin po che bdun gyi ra bas yongs su bskor ba/ nor bu rin po che sna tshogs kyi khang pas shin tu mdzes par byas pa/ rin po che'i khang pa brtsegs pa brgya stong du mas rab tu brgyan pa/ nor bu rin po che bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i 'od shin tu 'bar bas gzi brjid rab tu 'bar byas pa/ nor bu rin po che sna tshogs kyis rnam pa tha dad par rnam par phye zhing bris pas rnam par mdzes par byas pa/ mu tig dmar po'i ka ba bkye ba/ nang du seng ge'i khri mu sa ra ga ba las byas pa/ rin po che brgya stong du mas rnam pa sna tshogs su brgyan pa shin tu bshams pa/ nor bu rin po che sgra snang ba'i seng ge'i rgyal mtshan shin tu bsgreng ba/ steng nas nor bu rin po che rnam par snang ba'i bla re bres pa/ yid bzhin gyi nor bu rin po che sna tshogs kyi dra bas kun nas yog pa/ nor bu rin po che sna tshogs grangs med pas rab tu brgyan pa'i ba gam gyi rgyan dang ldan pa/ asma gar+b+ha las byas pa'i rdzing chu bsil bas gang ba dang ldan pa/ rin po che sna tshogs kyi shing gis 'khor bar 'dug par mthong ngo/ / de'i 'khor bud med bzang zhing mdzes la blta na sdug pa/ kha dog rgyas pa bzang ba'i phul du bya ba dang ldan pa/ sgyu rtsal thams cad kyi tshul la mkhas pa/ sngon du ldang ba/ phyi nas nyal ba/ byams pa'i sems dang ldan pa/ ci bsgo ba bzhin du byed cing ngag nyan pa bye ba phrag bcu yang 'khod par mthong ngo/ /

King Anala, having finished his duties, got off the throne and took Sudhana into the palace. Entering his own residence, the king seated Sudhana on a seat of honor and said to him, “Look at the furnishings of my house.” Sudhana looked and saw that the house was large, with walls of seven precious substances, adorned with terraces of various jewels, embellished with hundreds of thousands of jewel towers, blazing with the radiance of inconceivable numbers of jewels, with pillars made of various jewels. In it were hundreds of thousands of variously adorned jewel lion chairs; jeweled regal banners flew overhead; it was covered with canopies of radiant jewels, draped with various webs of magical gems, decorated with countless ornaments of various jewels, complete with cool emerald lotus ponds, surrounded by rows of trees of all kinds of jewels. He also saw the king’s hundred million ladies, all extremely beautiful, versed in all the arts, diligent, kindhearted, and attentive.

de nas rgyal po mes/ tshong dpon gyi bu nor bzang la 'di skad ces smras so/ /rigs kyi bu/ ji snyam du sems/ cig sdig pa byed pa rnams la las kyi rnam par smin pa mngon par grub pa 'di lta bu yod dam/ lus phun sum tshogs pa 'di lta bu yod dam/ 'khor phun sum tshogs pa 'di lta bu yod dam/ skyid pa chen po phun sum tshogs pa 'di lta bu yod dam/ dbang phyug dang dbang chen po thob pa phun sum tshogs pa 'di lta bu yod dam/ smras pa/ 'phags pa/ de lta bu ni ma mchis so/ /

Then King Anala said to Sudhana, “What do you think—could such fruits of action come to a villain? Could a villain attain such a condition, with such a retinue, such riches, such power?”
Sudhana said, “No indeed, noble one.”

des smras pa/ rigs kyi bu/ nga ni byang chub sems dpa'i rnam par thar pa sgyu ma'i rnam pa thob pa ste/ rigs kyi bu/ nga'i yul na gnas pa'i sems can 'di dag kyang / phal cher srog gcod pa byed pa/ ma byin par len pa/ 'dod pas log par g.yem pa/ brdzun du smra ba/ phra ma can/ tshig brlang por smra ba/ byung rgyal du brjod pa/ chags sems dang ldan pa/ gnod sems can/ log par lta ba/ sdig pa'i las byed pa/ khro zhing gtum pa/ bab rgyal can mi dge ba'i las kyi bya ba sna tshogs dang ldan pa dag ste/ de dag ni rnam pa gzhan gyis sdig pa'i spyod pa las bzlog pa dang / dgag pa dang bstan par mi nus te/ de ltar/ rigs kyi bu/ nga ni sems can 'di dag gdul ba dang / yongs su smin par bya ba dang / shin tu dul bar bya ba dang / phan pa la dgod par bya ba'i phyir snying rje chen po mdun du byas te/ gsod pa'i gshed ma sprul pa rnams bsad pa'i mir sprul pa rnams la gsod du gzud pa dang / chad pas gcod pa'i mi sprul pa rnams/ mi dge ba'i las kyi lam la spyod par sprul pa'i mi rnams la chad pa sna tshogs kyis gcod du gzud pa dang / rkang lag dang / sna dang / rna ba dang / yan lag dang / nying lag dang / mgo bcad pa las byung ba'i sdug bsngal mi bzad pa nyams su tshor bar gyur pa lta bu dag kyang yongs su ston pa byed de/ de mthong nas nga'i khams na gnas pa'i sems can de dag nyes pa gtong zhing skyo ba'i shugs thob par 'gyur ro/ /'jigs pa skye zhing bag tsha ba skye bar 'gyur ro; ;de dag sdig pa'i las byed pa rnams gtong zhing bag byed par 'gyur ro/ /rigs kyi bu/ de ltar nga ni sems can 'di dag thabs des/ nyes pa gtong zhing / 'jigs pa'i sems dang ldan pa dang / skyo ba'i yid dang ldan par shes nas/ mi dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam las bzlog ste/ dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam dang ldan par byas nas/ dga' zhing bde ba'i mthar phyin pa sdug bsngal thams cad rgyun chad pa'i thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bde ba la dgod pa byed kyi/ rigs kyi bu/ nga ni lus dang ngag gam/ yid kyis kyang sems can su la'ang co mi 'dri/ mtho mi 'tsham mo/ /rigs kyi bu/ nga ni phyi ma'i mtha'i mnar med pa'i sdug bsngal gyis bgrings shes pa ste/ byol song gi skye gnas glen pa'i khams su gtogs pa las kyang / chung ngu na rtse mos blta ba'i srog chags phra'u 'ga' la yang sems bskyed pa gcig tsam du yang sdug bsngal bar bya bar mi dga' na/ zhing du gyur cing dge ba'i las kyi lam bskyed par nus pa'i mi lta zhig la ci smos/ rigs kyi bu/ nga ni rmi lam na yang mi dge ba'i chos yongs su rgyu ba mi skyed na/ ched du bsams te lta smos re skan/

The king said, “I have attained enlightening beings’ magical liberation. The people in my realm are given to all sorts of evildoing—murder, theft, rape, falsehood, slander, vilification, divisive talk, covetousness, malice, false views, villainy, violence, cruelty. I am unable to turn them away from evildoing by any other means, so in order to subdue them, mature them, guide them, and secure their welfare, out of compassion I have illusory executioners kill and maim illusory criminals, making a display of intense suffering and pain; seeing this, the people in my realm become afraid to do evil. Seeing the people alarmed by this device, I have them give up evildoing and conduct themselves virtuously; then I establish them in ultimate security, the end of all suffering, the bliss of omniscience. I do not harm anyone by thought, word, or deed. I would sooner go to the deepest hell than so much as think of hurting even a dumb animal or an insect, much less a human being, who has potential for virtuous conduct. I do not do anything bad even in dreams, much less while awake.

rigs kyi bu/ de ltar ngas ni byang chub sems dpa'i rnam par thar pa sgyu ma'i rnam pa 'di shes par zad na/ ngas byang chub sems dpa'i mi skye ba'i chos kyi bzod pa thob pa/ srid pa dang lam gyi rgyud thams cad sgyu ma'i rnam par khong du chud pa/ sprul pa lta bu'i byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pas byung ba gzugs brnyan lta bu'i 'jig rten thams cad rnam par rig pa/ rmi lam lta bu'i chos nyid khong du chud pa/ thogs pa med pa'i sgo'i chos kyi dbyings kyi tshul la rjes su zhugs pa/ mig 'phrul lta bu'i spyod pa'i dra ba rtogs par gyur pa/ ye shes bsgribs pa med pa'i spyod yul gyi yul dang ldan pa/ kun tu yang dag par gzhol ba'i ting nge 'dzin gyi lam gyis byung ba/ glong kun tu 'khyil pa'i rgyud kyi gzugs la dbang bsgyur ba/ sangs rgyas kyi spyod yul gyi yul khong du chud pa rnams kyi spyod yul shes pa'am/ yon tan brjod par nus re skan/

“I have attained this magical enlightening beings’ liberation. How can I know the practice or tell the virtues of the enlightening beings who have attained acceptance of the truth of nonorigination, who relate to all states of being as illusions, who understand that the practices of enlightening beings are like magical creations, who know that all worlds are like reflections, who comprehend that the nature of things is like a dream, who conform to the principle of the reality realm by nonattachment, who accomplish the network of interrelated practices, who are in the sphere of unimpeded knowledge, who know the way of universally comprehensive concentration, who are masters of endlessly progressing mental command, who are intent on the sphere of buddhahood?”

song / rigs kyi bu/ lho phyogs kyi rgyud 'di nyid na/ grong khyer 'od bzang po zhes bya ba yod de/ de na rgyal po 'od chen po zhes bya ba 'dug gi /de'i gan du song la ji ltar byang chub sems dpas byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa la bslab par bya ba dang / ji ltar nan tan du bya ba dris shig /
“South of here is a city called Suprabha, where a king named Mahaprabha lives. Go ask him how to learn and carry out the practice of enlightening beings.”

de nas tshong dpon gyi bu nor bzang gis/ rgyal po me'i rkang pa gnyis la spyi bos phyag 'tshal nas/ rgyal po me la lan brgya stong du mar g.yas phyogs su bskor ba byas te/ yang dang yang bltas nas/ rgyal po me'i drung nas song ngo/ /
So then Sudhana paid his respects and left King Anala.
[rgyal po 'od chen po]
Mahaprabha

de nas tshong dpon gyi bu nor bzang ye shes sgyu ma de rjes su dran par byed cing / byang chub sems dpa'i rnam par thar pa sgyu ma'i rnam pa de la bsam pa dang / chos nyid sgyu ma'i rnam pa de la rab tu brtag pa dang / las kyi sgyu ma mnyam pa de khong du chud par bya ba dang / chos kyi sgyu ma mnyam pa de la rjes su bsam pa dang / chos kyis yongs su smin par bya ba'i sprul pa mnyam pa de khong du chud par bya ba dang / ye shes las byung ba'i snang ba bsam gyis mi khyab pa de'i rjes su 'brang bar bya ba dang / smon lam gyi sgyu ma'i rnam pa mtha' yas pa mngon par bsgrub pa de mngon par bsgrub par bya ba dang / spyod pa sprul pa'i chos nyid chags pa med pa de rnam par sbyang bar bya ba dang / dus gsum sgyu ma'i rnam pa'i mtshan nyid de yang rnam par dbye bar byed cing / mthar gyis yul nas yul du dri ba dang / kun du btsal ba dang / rjes su rnam par blta ba byed cing / phyogs dang / phyogs mtshams dang / lam dang / sman ljongs dang / thang dang / thag thug dang / khal kol dang / ri dang / ri sul dang / grong dang; grong khyer dang / grong rdal dang / ljongs dang / khams dang / rgyal po'i gnas thams cad du yongs su skyo ba med pa'i sems dang / lus la dub pa med par tshol tshol te; grong khyer chen po 'od bzang po'i nyen kor zhig tu phyin nas/ rgyal po 'od chen po gang na bzhugs zhes dris na/ de la 'gro ba mang pos bstan pa/ rigs kyi bu/ 'de re/ 'di ni grong khyer 'od bzang po zhes bya ba yin te/ 'di na rgyal po 'od chen po bzhugs so zhes nas/

Remembering that magic of knowledge, meditating on that magical liberation of enlightening beings, contemplating that magical nature, realizing the equality of the illusoriness of all actions, reflecting on the equal illusoriness of phenomena, following the equality of didactic developmental magical creations, remembering the inconceivable light born of knowledge, undertaking the magical performance of endless vows, purifying the magical nature of unattached conduct, thinking about the magical character of past, present, and future, Sudhana made his way from country to country, looking everywhere, high and low, over even and rough terrain, wet and dry places, mountains and valleys, villages, cities, towns, provinces, and capitals, tireless in body and mind, searching everywhere till he came to the environs of the great city Suprabha. He asked where King Mahaprabha was, and people pointed out the great city Suprabha and told him the king lived there.

de nas tshong dpon gyi bu nor bzang / grong khyer chen po 'od bzang po gang na ba der phyin nas/ grong khyer chen po 'od bzang po mthong ngo/ /mthong nas kyang dga' rangs te/ mgu zhing nyams bde la tshim zhing yid bde ba skyes nas/ 'di snyam du bsams so/ /'di na bdag gi dge ba'i bshes gnyen bzhugs pa blta ste/ de ring ni dge ba'i bshes gnyen de yang mthong bar 'gyur ro/ /de las byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa yang thos par 'gyur ro/ /byang chub sems dpa'i 'byung ba'i sgo dang / byang chub sems dpa'i chos nyid bsam gyis mi khyab pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i yon tan bsam gyis mi khyab pa
