dang / byang chub sems dpa'i spyod yul bsam gyis mi khyab pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i khyu mchog gi mthu phyung ba bsam gyis mi khyab pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i ting nge 'dzin la rnam par spyod pa bsam gyis mi khyab pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i rnam par thar pas rnam par rol pa bsam gyis mi khyab pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i brtsams pa chen po mthar dbyung ba rnam par dag pa bsam gyis mi khyab pa 'di thos par 'gyur ro zhes de ltar bsam pa yid la byed cing / grong khyer chen po 'od bzang po gang na ba der song ste phyin nas/ grong khyer chen po 'od bzang po de la bstas na/ gser dang / dngul dang / bai DUr+ya dang / shel dang / mu tig dmar po dang / asma gar b+ha dang / mus ra gal pa dang / rin po che 'di bdun gyis shin tu bzang zhing blta na mdzes pa/ rin po che'i 'obs zabs su zab pa/ chus gang ba/ gzhi gser gyi gram pas gang ba/ lha rdzas kyi ut+pa la dang / pad+mo dang / ku mu da dang / pun da ri kas kun nas yog pa/ dus dang mthun pa'i tsan dan gyi 'dam dang / lu mas 'khor ba bdun gyis kun nas yongs su bskor ba/ rin po che sna bdun gyi ta la'i phreng ba'i rim pa bdun gyis kun nas yongs su bskor ba/ rdo rje rin po che'i ra ba bdun gyis kun nas yongs su bskor ba 'di lta ste/ seng ge yid du 'ong ba'i rdo rje'i ra ba dang / rdo rje gzhan gyis thub pa med pa'i ra ba dang / 'bug pa'i ngang tshul gyi rdo rje'i ra ba dang / thub par dka' ba'i ngang tshul gyi rdo rje'i ra ba dang / rdo rje brtan pa chags pa med pa'i ra ba dang / rdo rje'i 'od zer dra ba'i snying po'i ra ba dang / rdul dang bral ba'i kha dog gi rgyan gyi rdo rje'i ra bas yongs su bskor ba ste/ rdo rje rin po che'i ra ba de dag thams cad kyang nor bu rin po che grangs med pas yongs su spras pa/ 'dzam bu chu klung gi gser gyi lan kan dang / ba so mdzes par bkye ba/ dngul rin po che'i ba so'i phreng ba mdzes pas brgyan pa/ rin po che bai DUr+ya'i ba so'i phreng ba mdzes pas brgyan pa/ rin po che shel gyi ba so'i phreng ba mdzes pas brgyan pa/ rin po che'i byi ru'i ba so'i phreng ba mdzes pas brgyan pa/ mu tig dmar po'i ba so'i phreng ba mdzes pas brgyan pa/ mu tig rin po che'i rgya mtsho'i snying po'i ba so'i phreng ba mdzes pas brgyan pa ste/ grong khyer chen po de'i sgo chen po brgyad kyi bar bar na'ang dpag tshad bcu bcu yod do/ /sgo de dag kyang rin po che sna bdun las sna tshogs mdzes par byas pa ste/ blta na yid du 'ong ba'o/ /grong khyer chen po de ni de ltar rgya che zhing yangs la/ yan lag rnam pa brgyad du rnam par phye ba/ bai DUr+ya sngon po'i sa la gnas pa ste/ grong khyer chen po de'i nang na yang srang chen po bye ba phrag bcu yod de/ srang re re'i glo gnyis nas kyang khyim chen po brgya phrag stong stong mkhos legs par 'grigs pa ste/ kun kyang rin po che sna tshogs las byas pa dag go /rin po che'i rgyan sna tshogs kyis rab tu brgyan pa dag go /rin po che'i gdugs dang / rgyal mtshan bsgreng ba dang / ba dan che phra dang ldan pa dag go /yo byad thams cad phun sum tshogs pa dag go /sems can khrag khrig du ma gnas pa dag go /

So then Sudhana went to the city and was delighted upon seeing it. He thought, “Where does the spiritual benefactor live? I shall see the spiritual benefactor today and hear from him about the practice of enlightening beings, the way of emancipation of enlightening beings, the inconceivable nature of enlightening beings, the inconceivable range of virtues of enlightening beings, the inconceivable majesty of enlightening beings, the inconceivable concentration of enlightening beings, the inconceivable freedom of enlightening beings, and the inconceivable purity of accomplishment of great undertakings of enlightening beings.” With these thoughts in mind Sudhana went into the great city Suprabha.
Once he was there, Sudhana looked around the city: it was beautiful, made of seven precious substances—gold, silver, lapis lazuli, crystal, red pearl, emerald, and coral. It was surrounded by deep moats made of the seven precious substances, with gold sand on the bottom, their surfaces covered with heavenly lotuses, and particles of sandalwood suspended in the water. The city was also surrounded by rows of palm trees made of the seven precious substances, and enclosed by walls made of seven kinds of diamonds—majestic, insuperable, indestructible, invincible, without obstacle, blazing with light, free from impurities. Each of the diamond walls was also inlaid with countless jewels, inset with gold posts and adorned with garlands of ivory and jewels. The gates of the city, at intervals of ten leagues on eight sides, were beautifully constructed of the seven precious substances. The city was large, a symmetrical octagon, set on a ground of blue lapis lazuli. There were ten million streets in the city, each one lined on both sides with hundreds of thousands of mansions made of various precious substances and adorned with arrays of many kinds of gems, flying jeweled banners and flags, fully furnished, with millions of people living in them.

grong khyer chen po de yang nor bu rin po che kha dog grangs med pa'i khang pas mdzes par byas pa ste/ 'dzam bu chu klung gi gser gyi khang pa brtsegs pa la rin po che bai DUr+ya'i dra bas kun nas khebs pa/ bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i rin po che'i rgyan gyis brgyan pa grangs med pa dang ldan pa'o/ /dngul gyi khang pa brtsegs pa la mu tig dmar po'i dra bas kun nas khebs pa/ bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i rin po che'i rgyan gyis brgyan pa grangs med pa dang ldan pa'o/ /bai DUr+ya'i khang pa brtsegs pa la rin po che mdzod sna tshogs kyi dra bas kun nas khebs pa/ bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i rin po che'i rgyan gyis brgyan pa grangs med pa dang ldan pa'o/ /shel gyi khang pa brtsegs pa la rin po che'i rgyal po snying po yangs pa'i dra bas kun nas khebs pa/ bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i rin po che'i rgyan gyis brgyan pa grangs med pa dang ldan pa'o/ /nor bu rin po che 'gro ba'i yid du 'ong ba'i khang pa brtsegs pa la rin po che'i nyi ma'i snying po'i dra bas kun nas khebs pa/ bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i rin po che'i rgyan gyis brgyan pa grangs med pa dang ldan pa'o/ /rin po che in+d+ra nI la'i khang pa brtsegs pa la rin po che dpal gyi 'od zer gyi dra bas kun nas khebs pa/ bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i rin po che'i rgyan gyis brgyan pa grangs med pa dang ldan pa'o/ /rin po che'i rgyal po 'gro ba rgya mtsho'i khang pa brtsegs pa la rin po che'i rgyal po skar ma'i 'od zer gyi dra bas kun nas khebs pa/ bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i rin po che'i rgyan gyis brgyan pa grangs med pa dang ldan pa'o/ /rin po che rdo rje'i khang pa brtsegs pa la rin po che'i rgyal po gzhan gyis mi thub pa'i dra bas kun nas khebs pa/ bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i rin po che'i rgyan gyis brgyan pa grangs med pa dang ldan pa'o/ /dus dang mthun pa'i tsan dan gyi khang pa brtsegs pa la lha rdzas kyi me tog man+da ra ba'i dra bas kun nas khebs pa/ bsam gyis mi khyab pa rin po che'i rgyan gyis brgyan pa grangs med pa dang ldan pa'o/ /spos kyi rgyal po mtshungs pa med pa'i khang pa brtsegs pa la lha rdzas kyi me tog sna tshogs kyi dra bas kun nas khebs pa/ bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i rin po che'i rgyan gyis brgyan pa grangs med pa dang ldan pa'o/ /rin po che'i khang pa brtsegs pa de dag re re zhing yang / rin po che'i lan kan du mas brgyan pa/ rin po che'i stegs bu rim pa bdun gyis bskor ba/ rin po che ta la'i phreng ba rim pa bdun gyis bskor bar dkrigs pa'o/ /rin po che'i lan kan de dag dang / rin po che'i ta la de dag thams cad du'ang / phan tshun rin po che'i srad bus sbrel ba'o/ /rin po che'i srad bu de dag thams cad kyang gser gyi dril gyi phreng bas brgyan pa'o/ /gser gyi dril gyi phreng ba de dag thams cad kyang rin po che'i chun po'i lda ldi sna tshogs kyi rnam par bres shing sbrel ba'o/ /rin po che'i chun po'i lda ldi de dag thams cad las kyang / rin po che'i dril bu g.yer ka'i dra ba mngon par dpyangs pa de dag ste/ de ltar grong khyer chen po de thams cad ni/ nor bu rin po che'i dra ba grangs med pas kun nas khebs pa'o/ /rin po che'i dril bu g.yer ka'i dra ba grangs med pas kun nas khebs pa'o/ /lha rdzas kyi spos kyi dra ba grangs med pas kun nas khebs pa'o/ /lha rdzas kyi me tog sna tshogs kyi dra ba grangs med pas kun nas khebs pa'o/ /rin po che'i 'bru'i dra ba grangs med pas kun nas khebs pa'o/ /rdo rje'i bla re grangs med pas kun nas khebs pa'o/ /rin po che'i bla re grangs med pas kun nas khebs pa'o/ /rin po che'i gdugs kyi bla re grangs med pas kun nas khebs pa'o/ /rin po che'i khang pa brtsegs pa'i bla re grangs med pa'i kun nas khebs pa'o/ /gos rin po che'i bla re grangs med pas kun nas khebs pa'o/ /me tog gi phreng ba'i bla re grangs med pas kun nas khebs pa'o/ /rin po che'i gdugs dang / rgyal mtshan sna tshogs btsugs shing bsgreng ba ste/

The city was also adorned with countless temples of gold and jewels, countless gold towers arrayed with innumerable jewels and covered with nets of lapis lazuli, countless silver towers arrayed with innumerable jewels and covered with nets of red pearls, countless lapis lazuli towers arrayed with innumerable jewels and covered with nets of varicolored jewels, countless crystal towers arrayed with innumerable jewels and covered with nets of diamonds, countless luminous jewel towers arrayed with innumerable jewels and covered with nets of sunny jewels, countless sapphire towers arrayed with innumerable jewels and covered with nets of radiant jewels, countless diamond towers arrayed with innumerable jewels and covered with nets of unsurpassed jewels, countless sandalwood towers arrayed with innumerable jewels and covered with nets of celestial flowers, countless towers of incomparable fragrances arrayed with innumerable jewels and covered with nets of heavenly flowers, all adorned with turrets of many jewels, encircled with balconies of seven precious substances, surrounded by rows of jewel trees. The turrets of the towers and the nets of jewels were also interconnected by jewel strings, and those strings were adorned with garlands of golden bells, to each of which were fastened strings of various jewels, from each of which hung circlets of small bells. Also the whole city was covered with countless nets of jewels, bells, celestial fragrances, heavenly flowers, and jewel figurines, with countless canopies of diamonds, various jewels, jeweled parasols, jewel pavilions, precious cloths, and jewel flower garlands, with variously jeweled banners and pennants flying overhead.

grong khyer chen po 'od bzang po de'i dbus su/ rgyal po 'od chen po bzhugs pa'i pho brang brtsegs pa 'khor kun tu dpag tshad bzhi yod pa ste/ rin po che sna bdun las byas pa'o/ /rin po che sna tshogs kyi stegs bu rim pa bdun gyis yongs su bskor ba'o/ /rin po che'i dril bu yid du 'ong ba'i sgra snyan par 'khrol ba'i dra ba rim pa bdun gyi sgra kun nas 'byung ba'o/ /rin po che sna bdun gyi ta la'i phreng ba rim pa bdun gyis kun nas bskor ba'o/ /rin po che sna tshogs kyi khang pa brtsegs pa'i rgyan brgya stong bsam gyis mi khyab pa dang ldan pa'o/ /rdzing rin po che sna tshogs du ma las byas pa gser gyi gram pa kun du bkram pa yan lag brgyad dang ldan pa'i chus yongs su gang ba/ lha rdzas kyi ut+pa la dang / pad+mo dang / ku mu da dang / me tog pun da ri kas chu'i steng kun du yog pa/ rin po che'i me tog dang / 'bras bu'i shing sna tshogs kyis rab tu brgyan pa/ phyogs bzhi nas rin po che'i pha gus brtsigs pa'i them skas rnam par bkye ba can gyis shin tu mdzes par byas pa dang ldan pa/ lha rdzas kyi sgra snyan cing yid du 'ong ba 'byin pa'i bya bran sna tshogs kyi sgra shin tu 'byung ba yod pa/ lha'i dbang po'i pho brang dang 'gran pa ste; de'i dbus na rin po che 'gro ba la snang ba'i khang pa brtsegs pa shin tu bzang la mdzes shing yid du 'ong ba/ rin po che grangs med pa'i rgyan bsam gyis mi khyab pas gya nom par brgyan pa yod de/ de'i nang na rgyal po 'od chen po'i dam pa'i chos gces pa'i dbyig tu bya ba bzhugs so/ /

The house of King Mahaprabha was built in the middle of the city. It was four leagues wide on each side. Made of the seven precious substances, it was surrounded by arbors made of these seven precious substances in various combinations, decorated with nets of precious bells making pleasant sweet sounds. It was surrounded by seven rows of palm trees made of the seven precious substances and adorned with a hundred thousand towers made of inconceivable numbers of various jewels. The house was embellished with lotus ponds, made of jewels, their surfaces covered with celestial flowers, their floors spread with gold sand, with steps made of jewel bricks arrayed on four sides, graced with trees with jewel flowers and fruits. Pleasant sounds of birds warbling filled the air. It was like the palace of a celestial king. In the middle stood a tower of world-illumining jewels, wonderful, beautiful, brilliant with its inconceivable arrays of countless jewels, built by the King Mahaprabha as a treasury of good law.

de nas tshong dpon gyi bu nor bzang rin po che'i 'obs de dag la ni/ chags pa'i sems med/ rin po che'i ra ba de dag la ni/ ngo mtshar du 'dzin pa'i yid med/ rin po che ta la phreng ba de dag la ni 'dod cing chags pa med/ rin po che'i dril gyi dra ba'i sgra la ni ro myong bar byed pa med/ lha rdzas kyi rol mo'i sgra dang / glu bro snyan pa'i dbyangs la ni chags pa'i sems med/ rin po che rnam pa tha dad pa'i gzhal med khang dang / khang pa brtsegs pa sna tshogs kyi longs spyod ni yid la bya ba med par shin tu dga' bar gyur pa'i skyes pa dang / bud med kyi tshogs kyi chos kyi dga' ba'i mos pas shin tu dga' zhing / gzugs dang / sgra dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg la dga' bas dben pa'i sems dang ldan pa/ chos nges par brtag pa la shin tu mos pa/ sems can gang dang phrad kyang dge ba'i bshes gnyen rtag tu 'dri zhing mthar gyis grong khyer gyi lam gyi sum mdo'i drung zhig tu phyin nas kun du bltas na/ grong khyer gyi lam gyi sum mdo'i dbus kyi mchod rten gyi khang pa nas ha cang yang mi ring ba zhig na/ rgya chen po dang ldan pa khri rin po che bai DUr+ya sngon po'i rkang pa bkye ba bai DUr+ya dkar po'i seng ges blangs pa/ 'dzam bu chu klung gi gser gyi lcag pod kyis dra ba legs par btags pa/ lha rdzas las kyang 'das pa'i rin po che'i stan sna tshogs bting ba/ rin po che'i 'bru grangs med pas rnam par brgyan pa/ nor bu rin po che'i rgyan bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i dra ba kun nas khebs pa/ 'dzam bu chu klung gi gser gyi snam bu la lha rdzas rin po che sna tshogs kyi gur shin tu spa bar dgye ba'i gnam yol bres pa/ nor bu rin po che yid bzhin gyi rgyal po'i pad+mo'i snying po dang ldan pa/ de lta bu'i chos kyi khri chen po la rgyal po 'od chen po mi chen po'i mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis kyis lus shin tu brgyan pa/ dpe byad bzang po sna tshogs brgyad cu tham pas lus shin tu mdzes pa/ gser gyi ri bo ltar rin po che sna tshogs rnam par bkod pas rnam par mdzes pa/ nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor ltar gzi brjid rab tu 'bar ba/ zla ba nya zhing rgyas pa'i dkyil 'khor ltar blta na bzang ba/ tshangs pa ltar tshangs pa'i 'khor gyi nang na rnam par mdzes pa/ rgya mtsho ltar zab pa'i chos dang yon tan mtha' yas pa'i rin po che'i tshogs dang ldan pa/ sprin chen po ltar chos kyi rang bzhin gyi 'brug sgra sgrog pa/ nam mkha' ltar chos kyi tshul gyi skar ma'i tshogs kyis brgyan pa/ ri rab ltar kha dog bzhi po'i sems can rgya mtsho'i sems la gzugs brnyan rab tu snang ba/ rin po che'i gling ltar gzhi ye shes sna tshogs rin po ches yongs su gang ba de skyil mo krung du 'dug pa mthong ngo/ /de'i mdun na yang gser dang / nor bu dang / mu tig dang / bai DUr+ya dang / dung dang / man shel dang / byi ru dang / sa le sbram dang / dngul rin po che'i phung po dang / lha rdzas kyi gos kha dog sna tshogs kyi phung po dang / lha rdzas kyi rin po che'i rgyan sna tshogs kyi phung po dang / kha zas dang / spyan gzigs sna tshogs kyi phung po dang / zhim po'i mchog khyad par du 'phags pa rnam pa sna tshogs kyi phung po dgod pa dang / dngar ba'i thabs sna tshogs kyi yul du bkod pa mthong ngo/ /lha rdzas kyi shing rta rin po che bye ba brgya stong du ma dang / lha rdzas kyi sil snyan bye ba brgya stong du ma dang / lha rdzas kyi spos kyi rnam pa bye ba brgya stong du ma dang / nad kyi rkyen sman dang / yo byad kyi phung po du ma dang / yo byad kyi khyad par thams cad kyi phung po spyad du rung zhing kha na ma tho ba med pa mang po sems can rnams ci dga' bar spyod du gzud pa'i phyir bshams te bkod pa dang / ba bzhon gser gyi ru mig can stong phrag du ma 'o ma bres 'jal ba mang po yang sems can phongs pa rnams yongs su bsdu ba'i phyir bkod pa mthong ngo/ /bu mo rin po che bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong bzhin bzang ba shin tu mdzes pa blta na sdug pa/ rgyan thams cad kyis rnam par klubs pa/ lha rdzas kyi gos rin po che gyon pa/ lha rdzas kyi tsan dan sprul gyi snying pos lus byug pa/ sgyu rtsal drug cu rtsa bzhi'i tshul shes pa/ 'dod pa'i spyod pa dang / cho ga thams cad la mkhas pa dag kyang bsags shing bkod par mthong ngo/ /de'i mdun na ji lta ba de bzhin du/ sems can rnams yongs su bsdu ba dang / sems can rnams yongs su gzung ba dang / sems can rnams dga' ba bskyed pa dang / sems can rnams spro ba bskyed pa dang / sems can rnams kyi yid dang bar bya ba dang / sems can rnams kyi sems shin tu bde bar bya ba dang / sems can rnams kyi nyon mongs pa rnam par zhi bar bya ba dang / sems can rnams chos kyi rang bzhin gyi don la yongs su dgod pa dang / sems can rnams thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du don mnyam par bya ba dang / sems can rnams gzhan la 'khu ba rnam par bzlog par bya ba dang / lus dang ngag gis ngan du spyod pa thams cad rnam par bzlog pa dang / sems can rnams kyi lta ba'i zug rngu yang dag par dbyung ba dang / sems can rnams kyi lam yongs su sbyang ba'i phyir/ srang dang / lam gyi bzhi mdo dang / lam gyi sum mdo dang / sgo dang / khyams dag na'ang de bzhin te/ srang re re'i ngos g.yas g.yon nas kyang / stegs bu bye ba nyi shu tsam la yo byad thams cad yongs su spungs te bkod pa mthong ngo/ /

Then Sudhana, not drawn by the jewel moats, not amazed by the jewel walls, not attracted by the jewel trees, not relishing the sound of the jewel bells, unattached to the sweet sounds of celestial songs, not paying any attention to the various precious furnishings of the apartments and towers, while in the midst of the joyful crowds of people enjoying the pleasure of the way of enlightenment, detached from pleasures of the senses, intent on contemplation of the truth, constantly asking everyone he met about spiritual benefactors, made his way to a crossroads in the city. Looking around at the crossroads, he saw King Mahaprabha there, not far from his venerable abode, seated on a magnificent throne. The throne had legs of blue lapis lazuli and was set on a lion made of white lapis lazuli. It was arrayed with nets of cowries on gold strings and varicolored precious cloths surpassing those of the gods, and ornamented with countless jewel figures. It was covered with a network of inconceivable numbers of jewels, and above was a beautiful gold silk canopy with multicolored decorations of celestial jewels. The throne of the great law was in the shape of the calyx of a lotus made of wish-fulfilling gems, and the king sat cross-legged thereon, graced with the thirty-two marks of a great person, adorned with the various embellishments of the virtuous. He was like a mountain of gold, brilliant as a mine of jewels, blazing with light like the orb of the sun, of placid appearance like the full moon, an oceanic accumulation of endless virtues of the profound Teaching, like a great cloud thundering the sound of inherent nature, like the sky studded with stars of maxims of the Teaching, like the polar mountain appearing to the minds of the ocean of sentient beings, like an island of jewels covered with various gems of knowledge. Sudhana also saw heaps of jewels, pearls, conch shells, camphor, coral, gold, and silver, heaps of celestial robes, heaps of celestial jewelry, heaps of food, and heaps of the finest delicacies arrayed before the king. He also saw millions of celestial chariots, celestial musical instruments, mounds of celestial incenses, many medicinal preparations, and many collections of all kinds of utensils, suitable and proper for people to enjoy as they wish. He also saw hundreds of thousands of milk cows with golden horns and hooves, provided to care for the poor. He also saw many millions of beautiful girls, adorned with all kinds of jewelry, dressed in heavenly clothes, limbs anointed with sandalwood perfume, versed in all the arts and skilled in all manners of love play. All the kinds of goods that were before the king were also set out in countless numbers on the street corners, in front of every house, along both sides of every street, to support the population, to make everyone happy, joyful, serene, and comfortable, to extinguish their afflictions, to introduce them to the meaning of the nature of all things, to get them all to have omniscience as their common aim, to rid them of malice toward others, to stop them from all evil action and talk, to extract the thorns of views, and to purify their course of action.

de nas tshong dpon gyi bu nor bzang gis/ rgyal po 'od chen po la lus thams cad kyis phab nas phyag byas te/ rgyal po 'od chen po la lan brgya stong du mar g.yas phyogs su bskor ba byas nas mdun du 'dug ste/ thal mo sbyar nas 'di skad ces smras so/ /'phags pa/ bdag gis bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed na/ ji ltar byang chub sems dpas byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa la bslab par bgyi ba dang / ji ltar nan tan du bgyi ba ma 'tshal te/ 'phags pa ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams la gdams ngag dang / rjes su bstan pa mdzad do zhes bdag gis thos na/ 'phags pa/ ji ltar byang chub sems dpas byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa la bslab par bgyi ba dang / ji ltar nan tan du bgyi ba bdag la bka' stsal du gsol/

At that point Sudhana went up to King Mahaprabha, paid his respects, and said, “Noble one, I have set my mind on supreme perfect enlightenment, but I do not know how to learn and carry out the practices of enlightening beings. I hear you give enlightening beings instruction, and ask you to tell me how to study and accomplish the practice of enlightening beings.”

smras pa/ rigs kyi bu/ nga ni byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa byams pa chen po'i rgyal mtshan yongs su dag pa dang / yongs su rdzogs par byed pa ste/ rigs kyi bu/ ngas byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa byams pa chen po'i rgyal mtshan 'di yang sangs rgyas brgya phrag du ma dang / sangs rgyas stong phrag du ma dang / sangs rgyas brgya stong phrag du ma dang / sangs rgyas bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong du ma nas/ brjod du med pa'i yang brjod du med pa'i bar gyi sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams la yongs su dris so/ /yongs su zhus so/ /rnam par sbyangs so; ;yongs su sbyangs so/ /rnam par bkod do/ /rnam par bltas so/ /rnam par spyod do/ /rjes su btsal to/ /yongs su brtags so/ /rnam par bris so/ /rgya cher byas so; ;rigs kyi bu/ de ltar nga ni byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa byams pa chen po'i rgyal mtshan 'di la gnas shing / chos dang mthun par khams skyong zhing ston to/ /chos dang mthun par 'jig rten la phan par byed do/ /chos dang mthun par 'jig rten na rjes su spyod do/ /chos dang mthun par sems can bcos par byed do/ /chos dang mthun par sems can rnams la nan tan byed do/ /chos kyi dkyil 'khor la sems can rnams yongs su 'dzud do/ /chos kyi tshul sems can rnams la nye bar bsgrub bo/ /chos dang mthun par sems can rnams la yongs su bsgo ba byed do/ /chos kyi nan tan la sems can rnams yongs su sbyor ro/ /chos kyi rang bzhin nges par rtogs pa la sems can rnams rab tu 'god do/ /byams pa'i sems dang / byams pa chen po'i dbang dang / byams pa'i stobs dang / phan pa'i sems dang / bde ba'i sems dang / snying rje'i sems dang / phan 'dogs pa'i sems dang / yongs su bsrung ba'i sems dang / sems can yongs su 'dzin pa mi gtong ba'i sems dang / sdug bsngal thams cad rnam par bzlog pa'i smon lam rgyun mi gcod pa'i sems dang / bde ba'i mthar phyin pa la rab tu 'god par yang dag par spyod pa rgyun mi gcod pa la sems can rnams rab tu 'god do/ /bag yangs kyi bde ba yang dag par bskyed nas/ sems can de dag gi lus kyang shin tu bde bar byed do/ /de dag gi 'khor ba'i bde ba la zhen pa'i sems kyi rgyud kyang rnam par bzlog pa byed do/ /de dag gi sems kyi rgyun kyang chos kyi dga' ba dang / mos pa la yongs su gzhol bar byed do/ /nyon mongs pa'i dri ma thams cad las rnam par sbyong bar byed do/ /mi dge ba'i chos thams cad las yongs su sbyang bar byed do/ /'khor ba'i rgyun las rnam par bzlog pa byed do/ /chos kyi dbyings kyi tshul rgya mtsho la yongs su gzud pa byed do/ /de dag gi srid pa'i lam gyi rgyud du skye ba thams cad rgyun gcad pa'i phyir sems kyi ma rig pa yongs su bsreg pa byed do/ /thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi 'bras bu thob par bya ba'i phyir de dag gi sems kyi myu gu yongs su bskyed do/ /mi 'phrogs pa'i dad pa'i stobs yang dag par bskyed pa'i phyir de dag gi sems kyi rgya mtsho yang rab tu dang bar byed do/ /rigs kyi bu/ de ltar nga ni byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa byams pa chen po'i rgyal mtshan la gnas te; chos dang mthun par 'jig rten skyong zhing ston te/

The king said, “I purify and fulfill the enlightening beings’ practice, which is characterized by great benevolence. This practice I have asked about, purified, ordered, observed, carried out, pursued, entered into, diversified, and expanded in the company of hundreds, thousands, millions—indeed, untold numbers—of buddhas. Based on this enlightening practice of great benevolence, I command kingship justly, I treat the world justly, I pass through the world justly, I lead the people justly, I bring justice to people and turn them to the sphere of right, I give them right guidance, I saturate them with justice, I direct them to attainment of what is right, I get them to contemplate the nature of things. I establish people in kindness, in the command of great kindness, in the power of kindness, in altruism, in goodwill, in sympathy, in friendliness, in hospitality, in determination to get rid of all suffering, in conduct conducive to ultimate happiness. I cool their minds and remove their mental tangles by producing the bliss of cessation. I divert their continuity of mind attached to delight in mundane routines and purify it in enjoyment of the pleasures of truth. I purify them of all unwholesome qualities and turn them away from what is not good. I turn back the flow of the mundane whirl. I destroy their ignorance in the ocean of principles of the reality realm, to cut off rebirth in all states of being. I inspire them to attain omniscience. I calm the ocean of their minds, to generate the indestructible power of faith. Thus do I govern righteously based on this enlightening practice of great benevolence.

rigs kyi bu/ nga'i khams na gnas pa'i sems can rnams ni ngas 'jigs shing dngang ba'am/ bag tsha zhing skyi g.ya' ba med de/ rigs kyi bu/ sems can gang phongs shing yo byad sna tshogs kyis brel ba/ bza' ba 'dod pa'am/ btung ba 'dod pa'am/ gos 'dod pa nas/ yo byad sna tshogs thams cad gang 'dod kyang rung ste/ de dag thams cad nga'i drung du 'ong ngo/ /de dag la'ang ngas snga nas bsham bsham pa'i mdzod sgo phye zhing ci 'dod pa khyer cig ces bstabs te/ gang gi don du khyed sdig pa'i las la spyod par gyur cing / srog gcod pa'am/ ma byin par len pa'am/ 'dod pas log par g.yem pa'am/ brdzun du smra ba'am/ phra ma'am/ ngag rtsub po'am/ tshig kyal ba'am/ chags sems sam/ gnod sems sam/ log par lta ba'am/ de ma yin pa'i lta ba'i rnam pa sna tshogs la mngon par zhen par gyur pa de thams cad kyang grong khyer chen po 'od bzang po'di'i sgo dang / srang dang / khyams dang / lam gyi sum mdo dang / bzhi mdo kun du spungs te/ snga nas byin pa yin gyi/ su ci 'dod pa kun kyang khyer cig ces bstabs shing byin no/ /

“Furthermore, no one goes away from me intimidated, threatened, or frightened. If any poor people lacking in means of subsistence come to me seeking food or drink or clothing or any other need, I open the royal storehouse to them and allow them to take from there, or from the streets and crossroads of the city, whatever they need, things they would otherwise get involved in wrongdoing to get.

rigs kyi bu/ grong khyer 'od bzang po'di na sems can ji snyed gcig gnas pa de dag thams cad ni byang chub sems dpa' ste/ theg pa chen po la zhugs pa'o/ /de bas na grong khyer chen po 'od bzang ngo/ /'di yang de dag la bsam pa rnam pa ji lta bur dag pa'i tshul bzhin du snang ste/ la la la ni dog par snang ngo/ /la la la ni yangs par snang ngo/ /la la la ni gzhi sa la gnas par snang ngo/ /la la la ni gzhi rin po che bai DUr+ya las blangs par snang ngo/ /la la la ni sa'i ra bas bskor bar snang ngo/ /la la la ni rin po che rdo rje gzhan gyis mi thub pa'i rgyal mtshan gyi ra bas bskor bar snang ngo/ /la la la ni gseg ma dang / gyo mos gang zhing thag thug dang / grog po dang / g.yang sa mang po can du snang ngo/ /la la la ni nor bu rin po che dam pa grangs med pas gzhi brgyan cing yongs su bkram pa dang / lag mthil bzhin du gzhi mnyam par snang ngo/ /la la la ni sa las byas par snang ngo/ /la la la ni rin po che grangs med pa'i khang pa dang; gzhal med khang dang / khang bzhag dang / khang pa brtsegs pa dang / khang steng dang / ba gam dang / skar khung gi shar bu dang / zla gam rin po che seng ge'i dra bas brgyan par snang ngo/ /grong khyer gyi phyi rol na gnas pa'i sems can sngon ngas byang chub sems dpa'i spyad pa spyod pa'i tshe/ bsdu ba'i dngos po bzhis yongs su bsdus pa/ bsam pa dag pa/ dge ba'i rtsa ba bskyed pa/ sangs rgyas mang po la bsnyen bkur ba/ thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la mngon par mos pa/ thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du rab tu gzhol ba de dag la yang rin po che las byas par snang ngo/ /de ma yin pa gzhan dag la ni sa las byas par snang ste/

“All the inhabitants of this city are enlightening beings established in the Great Vehicle. They see this city according to the purity of their minds. Some see it small, some large; some see a ground of earth, some see a ground spread with lapis lazuli; some see clay walls, some see it surrounded by walls covered with the finest cloth, banners, and jewels; some see it full of gravel and sand, uneven, with a lot of ravines; some see the ground spread with large jewels, decorated and flat as the palm of the hand; some see it beautifully arrayed with mansions and palaces, with round windows, nets, crescents, jewels, and various other adornments. Even among those who live outside the city, those whose minds are pure, who have made roots of goodness, who have attended many buddhas, who are aiming for omniscience, and who make omniscience their ultimate goal, see it as made of jewels. Those whom I took care of in the course of past enlightening practice by means of charity, kindness, assistance, and cooperation see it this way, while others see it as made of clay.

rigs kyi bu/ nga'i khams na gnas pa'i sems can yul dang / phyogs dang / grong khyer dang / grong rdal dang / ljongs dang / khams dang / rgyal po'i pho brang dag na/ rnyog pa lnga dang ldan pa'i 'jig rten gyi dus kyi rang bzhin gyis dkrugs te/ mi dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam zhig byed par 'dod par gyur na yang / de'i tshe nga de dag la phan par bya ba'i sems kyis/ byang chub sems dpa'i ting nge 'dzin 'jig rten gyi dbang po'i glong zhes bya ba/ byams pa chen po sngon du 'gro ba la snyoms par 'jug ste/ rigs kyi bu; de ltar nga ting nge 'dzin de la snyoms par zhugs pa dang / de nyid kyi mod la sems can de dag gi 'jigs pa de dag dang / mi bde ba de dag dang / shar gnyer ba de dag dang / 'thab mo dang / rtsod pa de dag dang / sems kyi 'khrug pa de dag dang / 'tshe ba'i sems de dag kyang byang chub sems dpa'i ting nge 'dzin 'jig rten gyi dbang po'i glong byams pa chen po sngon du 'gro ba de'i chos nyid thob pas rab tu zhi bar gyur to/ /nye bar zhi bar gyur to/ /rnam par ldog par gyur to/ /'gag par gyur to/ /rigs kyi bu/ yud tsam zhig sdod dang / de'u re mngon sum du 'gyur ro/ /

“Whenever the inhabitants of my domain want to do anything wrong in the degenerate world, their natures disturbed by the times, in order to save them I go into an enlightening concentration guided by great benevolence called ‘adapting to the faculties of the world,’ whereupon their fears, misfortunes, animosities, quarrels, agitations, and hostilities cease. That happens as a matter of course by the achievement of the nature of the enlightening concentration adapting to the faculties of the world, which is guided by great benevolence. Come here and you shall see for yourself in a moment.”

de nas rgyal po 'od chen pos de'i tshe/ byang chub sems dpa'i ting nge 'dzin byams pa chen po sngon du 'gro ba 'jig rten gyi dbang po'i glong la mnyam par bzhag go /de ltar rgyal po 'od chen pos/ byang chub sems dpa'i ting nge 'dzin byams pa chen po sngon du 'gro ba 'jig rten gyi dbang po'i glong la mnyam par bzhag ma thag tu/ de'i mod la grong khyer chen po 'od bzang po'i yul dang phyogs su bcas pa/ grong khyer dang / grong rdal dang / ljongs dang / khams dang / rgyal po'i pho brang gi 'khor dang bcas par rnam pa drug tu g.yos so/ /de g.yos pa'i tshe rin po che'i ra ba de dag dang / rin po che'i khang pa dang / rin po che'i snying po dang / rin po che'i khyim dang; rin po che'i gnas dang / rin po che'i gzhal med khang dang / rin po che'i khang pa brtsegs pa dang / rin po che'i ba gam dang / rin po che'i pu shu dang / rin po che'i skar khung dang / rin po che'i stegs bu dang / rin po che'i rta babs dang / rin po che'i zla gam dang / rin po che'i seng ge'i dra ba dang / rin po che'i lan kan dang / rin po che'i 'bru dang / rin po che'i bla re dang / rin po che'i srad bus brgyus pa'i dril bu g.yer ka'i dra ba dang / rin po che'i dril bu dang / rin po che'i rgyal mtshan dang / rin po che'i ba dan dang / rin po che'i ta la de dag kyang rab tu g.yos te sgra 'byin to/ /rab tu 'khrol lo/ /de dag de ltar sgra 'byin cing / yid du 'ong la snyan pa dang / mnyan na dga' ba'i dbyangs brjod cing / rgyal po 'od chen po gang na ba der 'dud de phyag 'tshal lo/ / grong khyer chen po 'od bzang po'i nang na/ sems can ji snyed cig gnas pa de dag thams cad kyang dga' ba dang / rangs pa'i sems kyis yongs su rgyas nas/ rgyal po 'od chen po gang na ba de logs su mngon du bltas te/ lus thams cad kyis phab cing phyag 'tshal lo/ /de'i khams kyi grong dang / grong khyer dang / ljongs dang / yul dang / khams dang / rgyal po'i pho brang 'khor na gnas pa de dag thams cad kyang lus dang sems bde bar gyur te/ dga' zhing rangs pa skyes nas/ rgyal po 'od chen po gang na ba de logs su phyag 'tshal lo/ /byol song gi skye gnas su gtogs pa'i sems can de dag thams cad kyang / gcig la gcig byams pa'i sems dang / phan pa'i sems su ldan par gyur nas/ rgyal po 'od chen po gang na ba de logs su blta zhing mngon par 'dud do/ /ri dang sgang mthon po'i sa'i phyogs thams cad kyang / rgyal po 'od chen po gang na ba der mngon par 'dud do/ /me tog gi shing dang / 'bras bu'i shing dang / lo ma'i shing dang / sa bon gyi tshogs dang / 'byung po'i tshogs dang / lo tog dang / ldum bu dang / rtswa dang / gel pa dang / sman dang / nags tshal thams cad kyang / rgyal po 'od chen po gang na ba de logs su lta zhing mngon par 'dud par gyur to/ /de'i khams na mtsho dang / mtshe'u dang / lu ma dang / lteng ka dang / 'bab chu dang / chu klung dang / rdzing dang / khron pa ji snyed pa de dag thams cad kyang / rgyal po 'od chen po gang na ba de logs su mngon par gzhol zhing rlabs kyi sgra 'byin par gyur to/ /

At that point the king entered that concentration, whereupon the whole city as well as the provinces of the kingdom quaked. As they shook, the jewel walls, jewel temples, jewel treasuries, jewel houses, jewel mansions, jewel palaces, jewel towers, jewel windows, jewel balconies, jewel arches, jewel crescents, jewel domes, jewel statues, jewel canopies, jewel bells, jewel banners, and jewel trees gave off beautiful, pleasant sounds and bowed toward King Mahaprabha. The inhabitants of the city Suprabha, ecstatic, prostrated themselves in the king’s direction. The inhabitants of the rest of the domain, refreshed and joyful, bowed toward the king. Even the animals, in friendship and harmony with each other, bowed toward the king. Even the mountains and hills all bowed toward the king. All the trees and plants also bowed toward the king. All the lakes, ponds, streams, and rivers in the domain flowed toward the king. Ten thousand water spirits sent subtly aromatic rains from clouds of fragrant water, with thunder and lightning. Ten thousand celestial beings adorned the sky with countless clouds of celestial music, goddesses sweetly singing, clouds raining celestial jewel flowers, clouds raining various celestial fragrances, garlands, aromatic powders, jewelry, robes, parasols, banners, and pennants blazing with the radiance of jewels, presenting these to the king as tokens of respect.

klu'i rgyal po stong phrag bcu yang a ga ru nag po'i bdug spos kyi dud pa na bun du 'grigs pa'i spos kyi sprin las glog sna tshogs 'gyu ba'i 'od kyis snang bar byed cing / 'brug sgra sgrog pa dang / spos chu'i char gyi rgyun shin tu phra ba mngon par 'bebs par gyur to/ /brgya byin dang / rab mtshe ma dang / rab dga' ldan dang / rab 'phrul dga' dang / dbang sgyur gyi lha'i rgyal po la sogs pa/ lha'i bu stong phrag bcus kyang steng gi bar snang la 'khod do/ /nam mkha'i dbyings thams cad lha rdzas kyi rol mo'i sil snyan gyi sprin bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong gi sgra phyung bas/ dbyangs snyan pa rgya cher bsgrags pa'i rgyan gyis brgyan pa dang / lha'i bu mo grangs med pa/ lha'i glu snyan pa len pa'i sprin gyi sgra bsgrags pa'i dbyangs snyan cing yid du 'ong ba'i rgyan gyis brgyan pa dang / lha rdzas kyi rin po che'i me tog sna tshogs kyi sprin grangs med pa'i char rab tu 'bab pa'i rgyan gyis brgyan pa dang / lha rdzas kyi spos kyi sprin kha dog sna tshogs kyi sprin grangs med pa'i char rab tu 'bab pa'i rgyan gyis brgyan pa dang / lha rdzas kyi rin po che'i phreng ba sna tshogs kyi sprin grangs med pa'i char rab tu 'bab pa'i rgyan gyis brgyan pa dang / lha rdzas kyi phye ma kha dog sna tshogs kyi sprin grangs med pa'i char rab tu 'bab pa'i rgyan gyis brgyan pa dang; lha rdzas kyi rin po che'i lhab lhub sna tshogs kyi sprin grangs med pa'i char rab tu 'bab pa'i rgyan gyis brgyan pa dang / lha rdzas kyi gos sna tshogs dri ma med cing 'jam pa/ kha dog rnam pa tha dad pa'i sprin grangs med pa'i char rab tu 'bab pa'i rgyan gyis brgyan pa dang / lha rdzas kyi rin po che'i gdugs rnam par phye ba sna tshogs kyi sprin grangs med pa'i char rab tu 'bab pa'i rgyan gyis brgyan pa dang / lha rdzas kyi rin po che'i seng ge yid du 'ong ba'i rgyal mtshan gyi sprin grangs med pa'i char rab tu 'bab pa'i rgyan gyis brgyan pa dang; lha rdzas kyi rin po che 'bab ba'i lce shin tu 'phro ba'i rin po che'i ba dan gyi sprin grangs med pa'i char rab tu 'bab pa'i rgyan gyis brgyan par rgyal po 'od chen po la mchod pa bya ba'i phyir byin gyis brlabs so/ /

The chief of the water spirits also adorned the sky with a covering of countless clouds of celestial jewel lotuses, countless trailing ornaments of celestial jewel necklaces, streamers, garlands, ornaments, and leis, countless clouds of all-pervading celestial fragrances, countless clouds raining celestial cloths, incense balls, and aromatic powders, and countless clouds of nymphs playing sweet music and singing hymns of praise, producing these in the sky by the inconceivable power of the chief water spirit.

glang po'i rgyal po chen po shugs 'dzin gyis kyang / glang po'i dbang po'i khyu mchog gi mthu phyung ba dang / rnam par 'phrul ba'i mthus nam mkha'i dbyings thams cad lha rdzas kyi rin po che sna tshogs kyi pad+mo'i sprin grangs med pas kun nas yog par byin gyis brlabs so/ /lha rdzas kyi nor bu rin po che'i se mo do grangs med pa rab tu 'phyang ba dang / lha rdzas kyi rin po che'i snam bu'i lda ldi dang / chun po grangs med pa rab tu 'phyang ba dang / lha rdzas kyi rin po che sna tshogs kyi phreng ba'i rgyud grangs med pa mngon par 'phyang ba'i rgyan gyis brgyan pa dang / lha rdzas kyi rin po che sna tshogs kyi lhab lhub dang / phreng ba grangs med pa mngon par 'phyang ba'i rgyan gyis brgyan pa dang / lha rdzas kyi rin po che sna tshogs kyi me tog gi lda ldi grangs med pa mngon par bres pa'i rgyan gyis brgyan pa dang / lha rdzas kyi spos kyi rgyal po kha dog sna tshogs phyogs thams cad du dri zhim pos rgyas par 'gengs pa'i sprin grangs med pas kun nas khengs pa'i rgyan gyis brgyan pa dang / lha rdzas kyi rin po che'i gos kha dog sna tshogs kyi sprin grangs med pa'i char rab tu 'bab pa'i rgyan gyis brgyan pa dang / lha rdzas kyi bdug spos kyi dud pa na bun du 'khrigs pa'i sprin grangs med pa'i char rab tu 'bab pa'i rgyan gyis brgyan pa dang / lha rdzas kyi phye ma kha dog sna tshogs kyi sprin grangs med pa'i char phra mo rab tu 'bab pa'i rgyan gyis brgyan pa dang / lha'i bu mo'i tshogs lha rdzas kyi rol mo byed pa dang / glu snyan pa'i dbyangs yid du 'ong bar len cing / bstod pa'i sprin gyis kun nas yog pa'i char mngon par 'bebs pa'i rgyan gyis brgyan par nam mkha'i dbyings byin gyis brlabs so/ /

srin po'i dbang po brgya stong grangs med pa rgya mtsho la gnas pa dang / gling bzhi pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyi rten gyi sa'i gzhi la gnas pa/ kha zas su sha dang khrag 'thung zhing za la/ chu la spyod pa dang / ri dang / phyugs dang / bya dang / ba lang dang / rta dang / glang po dang / bong bu dang / skyes pa dang / bud med kyi tshogs kyi mdangs 'phrog pa/ zhe sdang ba'i yid kyi rnam par rtog pa dang ldan pa/ rtag tu 'gro ba la 'tshe zhing / mtho 'tsham pa la zhugs pa rnams kyang / byams pa dang phan pa'i sems dam pa dang ldan zhing / bzhin gyi mdog shin tu dang ba dang / 'gro ba thams cad la mi 'tshe zhing / mtho 'tsham pa med pa la zhugs te/ 'jig rten pha rol la blta bar gyur nas/ thal mo sbyar cing shin tu dga' ba'i sems kyis rgyal po 'od chen po gang na ba de logs su btud nas phyag 'tshal bar gyur te/ lus dang sems kyi bde ba rgya chen po mtshungs pa med pa yang myong bar gyur to/ /

Also, countless hundreds of thousands of sea and land goblins, malevolent beings who feed on flesh and blood and consume the vitality of fish, birds, animals, and humans, all became benevolent, placid, intent on not harming any creatures, and sympathetic to other beings; they joined their hands in respect and most joyfully bowed to the king, experiencing mental and physical bliss. Hundreds of thousands of other kinds of fiends and malevolent spirits, also becoming benevolent, placid, intent on not harming any creature, and sympathetic to other beings, joined their hands in respect and most joyfully bowed to the king, experiencing physical and mental bliss.

gnod sbyin dang / grul bum dang / sha za dang / 'byung po'i dbang po brgya stong du ma yang byams pa dang / phan pa'i sems dam pa dang ldan zhing / bzhin gyi mdog shin tu dang ba dang; 'gro ba thams cad la mi 'tshe zhing / mtho 'tsham pa med pa la zhugs te/ 'jig rten pha rol la blta bar gyur nas/ thal mo sbyar cing shin tu dga' ba'i sems kyis/ rgyal po 'od chen po gang na ba der 'dud cing phyag 'tshal bar gyur te/ lus dang sems kyi bde ba rgya chen po mtshungs pa med pa yang myong bar gyur to/ /de ltar gling bzhi pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad kyi sems can kun gyi 'jigs pa dang / gnod pa dang / mi bde ba dang / shar gnyer ba dang / 'thab mo dang / rtsod pa dang / sems kyi 'khrug pa dang / 'tshe ba'i sems thams cad rab tu zhi bar gyur to/ /rnam par zhi bar gyur to/ /rnam par log par gyur to/ /'gag par gyur to/ /phyir log par gyur to/ /gling bzhi pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams 'dir ji lta ba de bzhin du/ stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad nas/ phyogs bcur 'jig rten gyi khams bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong phrag bcu'i bar gyi sems can kun gyi 'jigs pa dang / gnod pa dang / mi bde ba dang / shar gnyer ba dang / 'thab mo dang / rtsod pa dang / sems kyi 'khrug pa dang / 'tshe ba'i sems thams cad kyang / byang chub sems dpa'i ting nge 'dzin byams pa chen po sngon du 'gro ba 'jig rten gyi dbang po'i glong gi chos nyid thob pa'i phyir rab tu zhi bar gyur to/ /rnam par zhi bar gyur to/ /rnam par log par gyur to/ /'gag par gyur to/ /phyir log par gyur to/ /

In this way all the fears, misfortunes, animosities, quarrels, agitations, and hostilities of all creatures on earth ceased. And as this happened on earth, so did it also happen throughout the galaxy, in as many as ten duodecillion worlds. This was by the achievement of the nature of the enlightening concentration adapting to the faculties of the world, which is guided by great benevolence.

de nas rgyal po 'od chen po ting nge 'dzin de las langs te/ tshong dpon gyi bu nor bzang la 'di skad ces smras so/ /rigs kyi bu/ ngas byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa'i ye shes snang ba'i sgo byams pa chen po'i rgyal mtshan 'di shes par zad na/ ngas byang chub sems dpa' 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad bde ba'i bsam pas rgyas par 'gengs pa/ byams pa chen po'i gdugs tshad med pa dang ldan pa/ 'khor mi phyed pa dang ldan pas/ 'gro ba thams cad 'khor du gyur pa/ dbang po rab dang 'bring dang tha ma'i sbyor bas 'gro ba thams cad yongs su bskyab pa la zhugs pa/ 'gro ba thams cad yongs su gzung ba la zhugs pas/ byams pa'i sems lta bu dang ldan pa/ bsod nams dang ye shes kyi 'od zer 'gro ba thams cad du 'byung bas zla ba nya zhing rgyas pa lta bur gyur pa/ shes bya thams cad ye shes kyi 'od kyis snang bar byed pa'i phyir nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor lta bur gyur pa/ sems can thams cad kyi sems kyi mun pa thibs po rab tu sel bas sgron ma chen po lta bur gyur pa/ sems can thams cad kyi sems kyi rgya mtsho'i g.yo sgyu'i rnyog pa dang bar byed pas nor bu rin po che chu 'dang dang 'dra ba; 'gro ba thams cad kyi bsam pa dang / smon lam yongs su rdzogs par byed pa nor bu rin po che yid bzhin gyi rgyal po dang 'dra ba/ 'gro ba thams cad ting nge 'dzin dang / snyoms par 'jug pa'i khang pa dang / thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi pho brang chen por gzhog pas/ rlung dmar chen po dang 'dra ba de dag gi spyod pa shes pa'am/ yon tan brjod pa'am/ bsod nams kyi ri bo gzhal ba'am/ yon tan gyi skar ma'i tshogs kyis brgyan pa'i nam mkha' la blta ba'am/ smon lam chen po'i rlung gi dkyil 'khor las mtshams gcad pa'am/ chos mnyam pa nyid kyi stobs la tshad gzung ba'am/ theg pa chen po'i rgyan gyis bsngags pa yongs su brjod pa'am/ kun tu bzang po'i spyod pa'i tshul gyi khyad par brjod pa'am/ byang chub sems dpa'i ting nge 'dzin chen po bsgom pa'i sgo dbye ba'am/ snying rje chen po'i sprin yongs su smos par nus re skan/

Then King Mahaprabha came out of that concentration and said to Sudhana, “I know this medium of the light of knowledge of practice of enlightening beings which is characterized by great benevolence. How can I know the practice, tell the virtues, measure the mountain of merit, view the myriad stars of virtuous qualities, encompass the atmosphere of great vows, measure the power of impartiality toward things, clarify the forms of arrangements of the vehicle of universal salvation, express the excellences of the principles of universally good practice, open the doors of cultivation of great enlightening concentrations, or describe the clouds of great compassion, of the enlightening beings who are like immeasurable umbrellas of great benevolence, filling all beings with happiness; who are inseparable companions to all beings; who have set out to save all beings, working equally with the superior, inferior, and middling; whose benevolence is as impartial as the earth, supporting all beings; who are impartial as the full moon, shining the light of virtue and knowledge equally on all beings; who are impartial as the sun, illumining the world with knowledge of all that can be known; who are like great lamps, dispelling the darkness in the recesses of all beings’ minds; who are like water-clarifying jewels, removing the turbidity of deceit and guile from the water of beings’ minds; who are like wish-fulfilling jewels, fulfilling the aspirations of all beings; who are like a gale, driving all beings into the citadel of omniscience with its houses of concentration and equilibrium?

song / rigs kyi bu/ lho phyogs kyi rgyud 'di nyid na rgyal po'i gnas brtan pa zhes bya ba yod de/ de na dge bsnyen ma mi g.yo ba zhes bya ba 'dug gi/ de'i gan du song la ji ltar byang chub sems dpas byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa la bslab par bya ba dang / ji ltar nan tan du bya ba dris shig /
“South of here is a kingdom called Sthira where a devotee named Achala lives. Go ask her how to learn and carry out the practice of enlightening beings.”

de nas tshong dpon gyi bu nor bzang gis/ rgyal po 'od chen po'i rkang pa gnyis la spyi bos phyag byas nas/ rgyal po 'od chen po la lan brgya stong du mar g.yas phyogs su bskor ba byas te/ yang dang yang bltas nas/ rgyal po 'od chen po'i drung nas song ngo// //
So Sudhana paid his respects to King Mahaprabha and left.
bam po dgu bcu drug pa/
[dge bsnyen ma mi g.yo ba]
Achala

de nas tshong dpon gyi bu nor bzang / grong khyer chen po 'od bzang po nas byung ste/ yud tsam du lam gyi mgo btsal nas/ rgyal po 'od chen po'i gdams ngag de la rjes su bsam pa byed cing / byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa'i tshul byams pa chen po'i rgyal mtshan de rjes su dran par bya ba dang / ting nge 'dzin gyi sgo 'jig rten gyi dbang po'i glong gi snang ba chen po de yongs su bsgom pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i lus rnam par dag pa bsam gyis mi khyab pas brgyan pa'i seng ge'i khri'i rgyan rnam par phye ba rnam pa sna tshogs de dag mngon par bsgrub pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i smon lam dang / bsod nams kyi dbang dang / stobs bsam gyis mi khyab pa de dag rjes su spel ba dang / byang chub sems dpa'i sems can yongs su smin par bya ba'i ye shes kyi tshul bsam gyis mi khyab pa de shin tu bstan par bya ba dang / byang chub sems dpa'i longs spyod kyi bdag nyid che ba thun mong du gyur pa bsam gyis mi khyab pa de la rjes su bsam pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i gnas rnam pa tha dad pa bsam gyis mi khyab pa de dag kyang mtshan mar bya ba dang / byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi sems can yongs su smin par bya ba rnam par dag pa bsam gyis mi khyab pa de rjes su dran par bya ba dang / byang chub sems dpa'i 'khor phun sum tshogs shing yongs su dag pa de la brtag pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' sems can gyi don bsam pa snang ba'i tshul bsam gyis mi khyab pa de la yid ches par byed byed pas/ sems dga' zhing mos pa'i shugs dang / sems kyi nyams bde ba dang / sems shin tu tshim pa dang / sems khong nas dga' ba dang / sems rnyog pa med pa dang / sems 'od dad pa dang / sems brtan pa dang / sems rgya che ba dang / sems mi zad pa thob ste/ de de ltar dge ba'i bshes gnyen rjes su dran zhing yid la byed pa la brtson pas gdong mchi mas gang nas rjes su sems pa/ kyi hud; dge ba'i bshes gnyen mthong ba 'di ni/ yon tan rin po che thams cad kyi 'byung gnas su gyur pa'o/ /byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa thams cad yongs su dag pa dang / yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ba'i rgyur gyur pa'o/ /byang chub sems dpa'i dran pa thams cad rnam par dag par byed pa'o/ /byang chub sems dpa'i gzungs kyi dkyil 'khor thams cad yongs su sbyong ba'o/ /byang chub sems dpa'i ting 'dzin gyi snang ba thams cad yongs su bskyed pa'o/ /sangs rgyas thams cad mthong bar 'gyur ba yongs su bsgrub pa'o/ /sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad kyi sprin gyi char rab tu 'bebs pa'o/ /byang chub sems dpa'i smon lam gyi tshul thams cad brjod pa'o/ / shes rab dang / ye shes kyi snang ba bsam gyis mi khyab pa yang dag par bskyed pa'o/ /byang chub sems dpa'i dbang po brtan pa'i myu gu skyed par byed pa'o/ /dge ba'i bshes gnyen rnams ni bdag ngan song gi g.yang sa thams cad nas skyob pa'o/ /dge ba'i bshes gnyen rnams ni bdag chos mnyam pa nyid kyi tshul khong du chud par bya ba la gzhog pa'o/ /dge ba'i bshes gnyen rnams ni bdag la lam bde ba dang / mi bde ba ston pa'o/ /dge ba'i bshes gnyen rnams ni bdag la theg pa chen po yongs su ston pa'o// dge ba'i bshes gnyen rnams ni bdag la byang chub sems dpa' kun tu bzang po'i spyod pa'i gdams ngag gis 'doms pa'o/ /dge ba'i bshes gnyen rnams ni bdag la thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi grong khyer gyi lam ston pa'o/ /dge ba'i bshes gnyen rnams kyi bdag thams cad mkhyen pa'i gnas su phyin par skyel ba'o/ /dge ba'i bshes gnyen rnams ni bdag chos kyi dbyings kyi tshul rgya mtsho la 'jug par byed pa'o/ /dge ba'i bshes gnyen rnams ni bdag la dus gsum gyi shes bya rgya mtsho'i tshul rab tu ston pa'o; ;dge ba'i bshes gnyen rnams ni bdag la 'phags pa'i tshogs kyi dkyil 'khor thams cad rab tu ston pa'o/ /dge ba'i bshes gnyen rnams ni bdag gi dkar po'i chos thams cad rnam par 'phel bar byed pa'o/ /zhes de de ltar ngu zhing smre sngags 'don pa'i tshe/ nam mkha'i dbyings la 'khod pa'i lha'i tshogs dang / rtag tu phyi bzhin 'brang zhing yang dag par bskul ba dang / sangs rgyas kyi pho nya ltar gyur pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams 'di skad 'dzer to/ /rigs kyi bu/ dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyi gdams ngag la zhugs pa'i byang chub sems dpas ni/ sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyang thugs shin tu dgyes par 'gyur ba yin/ dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyi tshig dang mi 'gal bar gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpas ni/ thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du'ang shin tu bsnyen pa yin/ dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyi tshig la the tshom mi za ba'i byang chub sems dpa' la ni dge ba'i bshes gnyen rnams kyang nye bar bsnyen pa yin/ dge ba'i bshes gnyen yid la bya ba dang mi 'bral ba'i byang chub sems dpa' la ni don thams cad kyang mngon du 'gyur ba yin gyi/ rigs kyi bu/ rgyal po'i pho brang brtan par dge bsnyen ma mi g.yo ba gang na ba der song zhig dang / de las byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa thos par 'gyur ro/ /

Then Sudhana left Suprabha city and shortly set forth on the road; reflecting on the teaching of King Mahaprabha, remembering the principle of enlightening practice of great benevolence, thinking of the light of that method of great concentration adapting to the faculties of the world, developing the inconceivable power commanding the goodness of the vows of enlightening beings, stabilizing the inconceivable wisdom of enlightening beings, knowing how to develop and perfect sentient beings, contemplating the inconceivable unique greatness of experience of enlightening beings, aiming for the inconceivable measurelessness of enlightening beings, remembering enlightening beings’ inconceivable purity of development of sentient beings, thinking of the inconceivability of the purity of company of enlightening beings, focusing on enlightening beings’ inconceivable way of considering and seeing what to do for sentient beings, Sudhana became joyful and happy, his mind became clear, light, steadfast, broad, and invincible. Weeping as he thought of his memories of spiritual benefactors, he thought, “Meeting spiritual benefactors is a mine of jewels of all virtues; it brings about the purification and fulfillment of all enlightening practices; it purifies the mindfulness of all enlightening beings; it purifies all enlightening beings’ sphere of mental command; it generates the light of concentration of all enlightening beings; it fosters accomplishments of the vision of all buddhas; it causes the clouds of teachings of all buddhas to rain; it reveals the principles of the vows of all enlightening beings; it generates the inconceivable light of wisdom and knowledge; it strengthens and develops the sprouting faculties of enlightening beings. Spiritual benefactors save me from falling into evil ways; they guide me according to the principle of equality of things; they show me which paths are safe and which dangerous; they elucidate the way of universal enlightenment; they explain to me universally good enlightening conduct; they tell me the way to the citadel of omniscience; they lead me into the stronghold of omniscience; they plunge me into the ocean of principles of the cosmos; they illumine for me the way into the ocean of what can be known in past, present, and future; they show me the multitude of spheres of all goals; they cause me to develop all good qualities.”
As Sudhana wept, a group of celestial enlightening beings in the sky, envoys of the buddhas who were always following Sudhana to inspire him, said, “The buddhas are pleased with an enlightening being who puts the instruction of spiritual benefactors into practice. An enlightening being who obeys the word of spiritual benefactors is close to omniscience. An enlightening being who does not doubt the word of spiritual benefactors becomes near to spiritual benefactors. An enlightening being who always pays attention to spiritual benefactors is within sight of all goals. Go to the devotee Achala in the kingdom of Sthira, and you will hear from her of the practice of enlightening beings.”

de nas tshong dpon gyi bu nor bzang ting nge 'dzin gyi ye shes snang ba las langs nas/ mthar gyis rgyal po'i pho brang brtan par dge bsnyen ma mi g.yo ba gang na ba der song nas/ dge bsnyen ma mi g.yo ba yongs su tshol zhing rmed rmed pa las/ de la 'gro ba mang pos bstan pa/ rigs kyi bu/ dge bsnyen ma mi g.yo ba de ni; rang gi khyim na pha ma dang 'phrogs shing gzhon nur gyur pa ste/ rang gi gnyen bshes kyi tshogs kyis yongs su bskor cing / skye bo'i tshogs chen po la chos ston to/ /
de nas tshong dpon gyi bu nor bzang dga' ba chen po dang mos shing spro bas yongs su rgyas pa'i sems dang ldan pa de dge bsnyen ma mi g.yo ba'i khyim gang na ba der song ste phyin nas/ dge bsnyen ma mi g.yo ba'i khyim gyi sgo na sdod pa'i tshe/ des khyim de thams cad 'od lus dang sems shin tu bde bar byed pa/ gser gyi kha dog tu 'dug pa zhig gis khyab cing gsal bar gyur nas/ 'od des tshong dpon gyi bu nor bzang la phog par gyur ma thag tu tshor ba thams cad la dbang bsgyur ba'i ting nge 'dzin gyi sgo mang po dang / zhi ba'i gnas kyi ting nge 'dzin gyi sgo mang po dang / 'gro ba thams cad dang bral ba'i ting nge 'dzin gyi sgo mang po dang / kun du lta ba'i btang snyoms dang ldan pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi sgo mang po dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i mdzod kyi ting nge 'dzin gyi sgo mang po la sogs pa ting nge 'dzin gyi sgo lnga brgya tsam la zhugs par gyur te yongs su skyes so/ /de dag kyang shin tu phra zhing gzhon pa ste/ 'di ltar dper na/ thog ma mngal du zhugs pa'i rnam par shes pa lta bu ste/ ting nge 'dzin de dag kyang shin tu phra zhing gzhon par skyes par gyur to/ /des dri zhim po zhig tshor na yang / de ni lha la yang med/ lha'i bu mo la yang med/ klu la yang med/ klu'i bu mo la yang med/ gnod sbyin la yang med/ gnod sbyin gyi bu mo la yang med/ dri za la yang med/ dri za'i bu mo la yang med/ lha ma yin la yang med/ lha ma yin gyi bu mo la yang med/ nam mkha' lding la yang med/ nam mkha' lding gi bu mo la yang med; mi 'am ci la yang med/ mi 'am ci'i bu mo la yang med/ lto 'phye chen po la yang med/ lto 'phye chen po'i bu mo la yang med/ mi la yang med/ mi'i bu mo la yang med cing mi srid pa de lta bu'i dri zhim po tshor bar gyur to/ /bud med de'i gzugs dang mnyam pa yang phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten na med na lhag pa lta ga las 'ong / kha dog dang mdog de lta bu yang de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku mdog dang / kha dog dang / byang chub sems dpa' dbang bskur ba'i kha dog dang / mdog ma gtogs par de'i kha dog dang; mdog tu mnyam pa phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten na med na lhag pa lta ga las 'ong / lus kyi chu zheng dang / dbyibs de lta bu'ang de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku'i khrun chu zheng dang / dbyibs dang / byang chub sems dpa' dbang bskur ba thob pa'i lus kyi chu zheng dang / dbyibs ma gtogs par de'i lus kyi chu zheng dang / dbyibs su mnyam pa phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten na med na lhag pa lta ga las 'ong / 'od kyi rgyan de lta bu yang de bzhin gshegs pa'i 'od kyi rgyan dang / byang chub sems dpa' dbang bskur ba thob pa'i 'od kyi rgyan ma gtogs par de'i 'od kyi rgyan dang mnyam pa phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten na med na lhag pa lta ga las 'ong / de'i kha'i drod kyi dri zhim po dang mnyam pa'i dri de lta bu yang phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi lha'i gnas sam/ klu dang / gnod sbyin dang / dri za dang / lha ma yin dang / nam mkha' lding dang / mi 'am ci dang / lto 'phye chen po dang / mi dang / mi ma yin pa'i gnas na med na lhag pa lta ga las 'ong / khyim gyi rgyan dang longs spyod de lta bu yang de bzhin gshegs pa'i longs spyod dang / byang chub sems dpa' dbang bskur ba thob pa'i longs spyod ma gtogs par/ de'i khyim gyi rgyan dang longs spyod dang mnyam pa yang phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten na med na lhag pa lta ga las 'ong / g.yog 'khor phun sum tshogs pa de lta bu yang de bzhin gshegs pa'i 'khor phun sum tshogs pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i 'khor phun sum tshogs pa ma gtogs par de'i g.yog 'khor phun sum tshogs pa dang mnyam pa yang phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten na med na lhag pa lta ga las 'ong ste/ dge bsnyen ma mi g.yo ba de la 'dod chags dang ldan pa'i sems kyis blta bar nus pa'i sems can de lta bu yang phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi sems can gyi ris na med do/ /dge bsnyen ma mi g.yo ba de mthong ma thag tu nyon mongs pa zhi bar mi 'gyur ba de lta bu'i sems can yang phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi sems can gyi ris na med de/ 'di lta ste/ dper na/ tshangs pa chen po stong phrag bcu la dbang bsgyur ba la ni/ 'dod pa la spyod pa'i nyon mongs pa rnams mi rgyu'o/ /de bzhin du dge bsnyen ma mi g.yo ba yang mthong ma thag tu sems can rnams kyi nyon mongs pa mi rgyu'o/ /dge bsnyen ma mi g.yo ba de la blta bas ngoms par 'gyur ba'i sems can de lta bu yang / shes rab kyis ngoms pa ma gtogs par phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyi sems can gyi ris na med do/ /

Then Sudhana emerged from the light of concentration knowledge and made his way to the kingdom of Sthira, looking for the devotee Achala. People told him, “The devotee Achala is a girl living at home with her parents and relatives; she gives spiritual teaching to a large group of people.” Filled with joy, Sudhana went to Achala’s house. Standing in the door, he saw the whole house lit up with a soothing golden light. The moment Sudhana was touched by the light, five hundred subtle trances descended upon him, beginning with a trance characterized by power over all sensations, trance absorption in the realm of tranquillity, absorption in the welfare of all beings, absorption in the equanimity of the universal eye, and absorption in the matrix of realization of Thusness. The feeling of those trances was as subtle as the consciousness of a half-day old embryo.
He also smelled a scent more beautiful than that of any gods or goddesses or humans or any other creatures of the world, and there was to be found in all the world no one even equal to, much less more beautiful than, that girl Achala. The radiance of her complexion, the proportions of her body, and the magnificence of her aura were such that none in the world, save buddhas and coronated enlightening beings, even equaled, much less surpassed them. Her scent was unequaled and unsurpassed by any celestial, preternatural, or human beings. The furnishings of her abode were unequaled and unsurpassed in all the world, except by the accoutrements of buddhas and coronated enlightening beings. Her company was also unequaled and unsurpassed by any in the world, except for the companies of buddhas and coronated enlightening beings. There was no one in all the world who could look upon Achala with lust—there was no one in the world whose afflictions did not cease the moment he beheld her. Just as gods with controlling power who live in the realm of desire do not activate afflictions, similarly people who saw Achala did not act on afflictions. There was no one in the world who became satiated with the sight of Achala, except those who were sated with wisdom.

de nas tshong dpon gyi bu nor bzang gis/ dge bsnyen ma mi g.yo ba'i lus kyi byin bsam gyis mi khyab pa dang / gzugs dang; kha dog dang / dbyibs dang / chu zheng bsam gyis mi khyab pa dang / sa'i gzhi dang / grong khyer dang / rin po che thams cad la thogs pa med pa'i 'od zer gyi dra ba'i rgyan bsam gyis mi khyab pa dang / sems can gyi don bsam gyis mi khyab pa sgrub pa mthong ste/ ba spu'i bu ga thams cad nas byung ba'i dri zhim po tshor nas/ 'khor rgya mtsho phun sum tshogs pa mtha' yas pa mthong ste/ khyim dang / gzhal med khang gi rgyan phun sum tshogs pa mi 'phrogs pa mthong nas/ yon tan rgya mtsho tshad med pa khong du chud de/ dge bsnyen ma mi g.yo ba la tshigs su bcad pa 'dis bstod do/ /
khyod kyis rtag tu tshul khrims dri med yongs bsrungs te/ / bzod pa shin tu yangs pa'ang yongs su bsgoms mdzad cing / / brtson 'grus brtan pa rdo rje lta bu bsgrubs pas na/ / ri bo'i rgyal po lta bur 'gro bar 'phags shing 'bar/ /

Then Sudhana, in an attitude of reverence, seeing Achala’s inconceivable physical majesty, her inconceivable appearance, and her inconceivable aura of light, which could not be blocked by all the cities and mountains on the face of the earth, sensing the inconceivable beneficial fragrance coming from her pores, looking over her endless company of followers, noticing the matchless adornment of her abode, immersed in the measureless ocean of her virtues, eulogized Achala with this verse:
Who keeps conduct pure, Develops great tolerance, And makes vigor enduring as diamond Stands out in the world like a mountain of light.

de nas tshong dpon gyi bu nor bzang gis/ dge bsnyen ma mi g.yo ba la tshigs su gcad pa des mngon par bstod de/ 'di skad ces smras so/ /'phags ma/ bdag gis bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed na/ ji ltar byang chub sems dpas byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa la bslab par bgyi ba dang / ji ltar nan tan du bgyi ba ma 'tshal te/ 'phags ma ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams la gdams ngag dang / rjes su bstan pa mdzad do zhes bdag gis thos nas/ 'phags ma/ ji ltar byang chub sems dpas byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa la bslab par bgyi ba dang / ji ltar nan tan du bgyi ba bdag la bshad du gsol/

Then Sudhana said to her, “Noble one, I have set my mind on supreme perfect enlightenment, but I do not know how to learn and carry out the practice of enlightening beings. I hear that you give instruction to enlightening beings, so I ask you to tell me how an enlightening being is to learn and carry out the practice of enlightening beings.”

de nas dge bsnyen ma mi g.yo bas/ byang chub sems dpa'i ngag 'jam zhing yid du 'ong la nyams su bde bas/ tshong dpon gyi bu nor bzang la dga' bar 'gyur ba'i tshig tu brjod nas/ 'di skad ces smras so/ /rigs kyi bu/ de ltar khyod kyis bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed pa legs so/ /legs so/ /rigs kyi bu/ kho mo ni byang chub sems dpa'i rnam par thar pa thub par dka' ba'i ye shes kyi snying po thob pa ste/ byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa'i sgo yi dam brtan pa la slob pa/ chos thams cad mnyam pa nyid kyi sa'i gzungs kyi sgo thob pa'o/ /kho mo ni spobs pa'i ye shes snang ba chos kyi gzhi thams cad snang bar brjod pa thob pa'o/ /kho mo ni chos thams cad yongs su btsal bas mi skyo ba'i rgyan gyi ting 'dzin gyi sgo thob pa'o/ /smras pa/ 'phags ma/ byang chub sems dpa'i rnam par thar pa thub par dka' ba'i ye shes kyi snying po de'i yul ni ji lta bu zhig mchis/ yi dam la brtan pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa'i sgo dang / chos thams cad mnyam pa nyid kyi sa'i gzungs kyi sgo dang / chos kyi gzhi thams cad snang bar brjod pa'i spobs pa snang ba'i sgo dang / chos yongs su btsal bas mi skyo ba'i rgyan gyi ting nge 'dzin gyi sgo'i yul ni ji lta bu zhig mchis/ smras pa/ rigs kyi bu/ gnas 'di ni yid ches par dka'o/ smras pa/ 'phags ma/ bstan du gsol/ sangs rgyas kyi byin dang / dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyis yongs su bzung na yid ches par mchi grang / rtogs pa dang / 'tshal pa dang / rnam par rtogs pa dang / rjes su rtogs pa dang / rig pa dang / dmigs su phebs pa dang / goms pa dang / mi 'gal ba dang / rnam par mi rtog pa dang / sgro 'dogs pa ma mchis pa dang / mnyam par bgyid par yang mchi grang /

In the affectionate, pleasing, charming words of an enlightening being, Achala greeted Sudhana and said, “It is good that you aspire to supreme perfect enlightenment. I have an enlightening liberation containing invincible knowledge, and I cultivate enlightening beings’ way of practice of firm resolve. I have also attained mental command of the stage of equanimity in all things, and I am imbued with the light of knowledge to clarify the true state of all phenomena. I have also attained concentration of tireless search for truth.”
Sudhana asked her about the sphere of these attainments, and she said her state was hard to believe. Sudhana urged her to tell him, assuring her that by the power of Buddha and the help of spiritual benefactors he would believe in it, enter into it, investigate, contemplate, follow, and cultivate it, and would not quarrel or make up arbitrary ideas or assumptions about it, but would strive to equal it.

de nas dge bsnyen ma mi g.yo bas/ tshong dpon gyi bu nor bzang la 'di skad ces smras so/ /rigs kyi bu/ sngon 'das pa'i dus shig na dri ma med pa'i 'od kyi bskal pa la de bzhin gshegs pa phyag rab tu brkyang pa zhes bya ba 'jig rten du byung ste/ kho mo yang de'i tshe rgyal po glog gis byin pa'i bu gcig ma zhig tu gyur nas/ de'i tshe nub mo mi nyal tsam zhig na rgyal po'i sgo yang bcad/ pha dang ma yang nyal/ skyes pa dang bud med dag kyang gnyid kyis log /rol mo brdung ba dang dkrol ba'i sgra yang zhi/ lhan cig spyod pa'i bud med lnga brgya tsam dag kyang nyal bar gyur pa zhig na/ kho mo mal gyi steng na 'dug cing / nam mkha'i dbyings la rgyu ba'i skar ma'i tshogs kyi phreng ba rnam par 'khod pa la lta lta ba las/ steng gi bar snang la/ bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas phyag rab tu brkyang pa ri'i rgyal po ri rab ltar lha dang / klu dang / gnod sbyin dang / dri za dang / lha ma yin dang / nam mkha' lding dang / mi 'am ci dang / lto 'phye chen po'i 'khor mang pos bskor ba/ byang chub sems dpa'i tshogs grangs med pas yongs su bskor ba/ phyogs thams cad du 'od zer gyi dra ba thogs pa med pas rgyas par khyab pa'i sku bzhugs pa mthong ngo/ /de bzhin gshegs pa de'i sku'i ba spu'i bu ga thams cad nas kyang dri zhim po rnam pa 'di lta bu byung ste/ des kho mo'i lus dang sems shin tu bde bar gyur/ yid shin tu dga' bar gyur te/ mal gyi steng nas langs nas/ sor mo bcu'i thal mo sbyar te sa la babs nas; bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa phyag rab tu brkyang pa de la phyag 'tshal te/ de'i spyi gtsug la bltas na yang mtha' thug par ma rung / g.yas g.yon gyi tshad kyang zin par ma rung / mtshan dang dpe byad phun sum tshogs pa la bsams na yang ngoms par ma rung ste/ de'i tshe kho mo 'di snyam du bsams so/ /las ji lta bu zhig byas na; lus phun sum tshogs pa 'di lta bu ni 'thob par 'gyur/ mtshan dang dpe byad bzang po phun sum tshogs pa ni skye bar 'gyur/ 'od kyi rgyan phun sum tshogs pa ni 'byung bar 'gyur/ 'khor phun sum tshogs pa ni 'grub par 'gyur/ yid kyi rang bzhin gyi gnas dang longs spyod phun sum tshogs pa ni 'byung bar 'gyur/ bsod nams phun sum tshogs pa ni skye bar 'gyur/ ye shes phun sum tshogs pa ni rnam par dag par 'gyur/ ting nge 'dzin gyi rnam par 'phrul pa bsam gyis mi khyab pa phun sum tshogs pa ni yang dag par 'grub par 'gyur/ gzungs phun sum tshogs pa ni yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur/ spobs pa phun sum tshogs pa ni dbang du 'gyur snyam pa dang /

Achala then said to Sudhana, “A long time ago, in a past eon called Undefiled Light, a buddha named Arms Extended Downward appeared in the world. I was the daughter of a king named Vidyuddatta. One quiet night, as my parents slept in the inner apartments of the palace, and the men and women of the court were fast asleep, and the sounds of music had all stopped, and my five hundred girl companions were all in bed, as I gazed up at the starry night sky I saw up there the Buddha, like the polar mountain, surrounded by many celestial beings, spirits, preternatural creatures, and countless enlightening beings, his body pervading everywhere with an aura of unobstructed light. From his pores came a fragrance that soothed my body and mind and made me happy. Getting up from bed, I saluted the Buddha; looking at him, I found I could not determine any limit to the extent of his height and breadth. As I reflected on his marks and embellishments of greatness, I thought, ‘By performing what kind of action is such a body obtained? How are the marks and embellishments of greatness attained? How is the aura of light attained? How does the retinue of followers develop? How do the mentally produced dwelling and furniture appear? How is virtue developed? How is knowledge purified? How are the inconceivable meditative projections accomplished? How is mental command perfected? How is eloquence mastered?’

rigs kyi bu/ de nas bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa phyag rab tu brkyang pa des/ kho mo'i bsam pa thugs su chud nas 'di skad ces bka' stsal to/ /bu mo khyod kyis nyon mongs pa thams cad gzhom pa'i phyir thub pa med pa'i sems skyed cig /mngon par zhen pa thams cad bsal ba'i phyir pham pa med pa'i sems skyed cig /chos zab mo'i tshul khong du chud par bya ba'i phyir zhum pa med pa'i sems skyed cig /sems can bsam pa mi bzad pa dang ldan pa'i rgya mtsho'i klong du ltung bas mi sgul ba'i sems skyed cig /srid pa'i lam gyi rgyud thams cad du skye ba'i skye mched du mgo rmongs pa med pa'i sems skyed cig /sangs rgyas thams cad blta bar mos pa rgyun mi gcad pa'i phyir ngoms mi shes pa'i sems skyed cig/ sangs rgyas thams cad kyi chos kyi sprin yongs su gzung ba'i phyir chog mi shes pa'i sems skyed cig /sangs rgyas thams cad kyi chos kyi tshul snang ba rtogs par bya ba'i phyir nges par rtogs pa'i sems skyed cig /de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi chos kyi 'khor lo gzung ba'i phyir yang dag par gzung ba'i sems skyed cig /de bzhin gshegs pa'i zhal nas byung ba shes par bya ba lta la ci smos kyi chung ngu na brdar byas pa tsam la yang 'khrul pa med pa'i sems skyed cig /bu mo khyod kyis sems can rnams kyi bsam pa ji lta ba bzhin du chos rin po che rnam par dbye ba'i phyir rnam par dbye ba'i sems skyed cig ces byung ste/

“Reading my mind, that Buddha said to me, ‘Daughter, you should produce an invincible mind to destroy afflictions, an indomitable mind to get rid of all clinging, an intrepid mind to enter into the profound truth, a mind unshakable while descending into the whirlpool of the ocean of sentient beings who are attached to objects, a mind undeluded in the midst of all states of being, a mind tireless in seeking vision of all buddhas, a mind receiving the multitudes of teachings of all buddhas without complacence, a contemplative mind to attain the light of wisdom of all buddha-teachings, a retentive mind remembering the cycles of teaching of all buddhas, a mind free from forgetfulness even in regard to conventional terms, to say nothing of knowledge arising from the word of buddhas; and you should develop a mind of sharing, to distribute the jewels of the Teaching to all sentient beings according to their mentalities.’

de ltar rigs kyi bu/ kho mos bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas phyag rab tu brkyang pa las/ chos kyi tshul gyi gdams ngag gi sgo rnam pa de lta bu dag thos nas/ thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes la ni mngon par mos par gyur/ stobs bcu'i rang bzhin la ni mngon par smon par gyur/ sangs rgyas kyi gsung la ni mngon par dad par gyur/ sangs rgyas kyi 'od kyi rgyan ni yongs su sbyang bar dga'/ sangs rgyas kyi sku phun sum tshogs pa ni yongs su bsgrub par dga'/ sangs rgyas kyi mtshan dang dpe byad bzang po rnam par dag pa la ni mngon par mos par gyur/ sangs rgyas kyi 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor phun sum tshogs pa la ni mngon par smon par gyur/ sangs rgyas kyi zhing rnam par dag pa la ni mngon par dad par gyur/ sangs rgyas kyi spyod lam phun sum tshogs pa la ni mngon par mos par gyur/ sangs rgyas kyi sku tshe'i tshad phun sum tshogs pa la ni mngon par dga' nas/ rdo rje ltar ri dang mtshon cha thams cad kyi mthus thub par dka' ba'i sems nyon mongs pa thams cad dang / nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas thams cad kyis mi phyed mi tshugs pa bskyed de/
rigs kyi bu/ de nas nye bar bzung ba tshun chad du sems bskyed pa de'i mthus/ bskal pa 'dzam bu'i gling gi rdul shin tu phra ba snyed cig tu yid kyi dgu las kyang 'dod pa la spyad par mi dran na/ gnyis kyis gnyis 'du ba lta ci smos/ rigs kyi bu/ de nas nye bar bzung ba tshun chad du rang gi gnyen bshes la'ang khong khro bo'i sems gcig ma bskyed na/ de ma yin pa'i sems can ma nyes pa gzhan lta la ci smos/ de nas nye bar bzung ba tshun chad du bdag tu lta ba dang ldan pa'i sems bskyed pa gcig tsam yang bskyed par mi dran na/ de ma yin pa'i yo byad gzhan la bdag gir byas te mngon par chags pa lta ci smos/ shi 'pho dang / mngal na gnas pa'i tshe 'ang sems rmongs pa'am/ 'du shes sna tshogs sam/ lung du ma bstan pa'i sems kyang byung du mi dran na/ legs par bsam shing gnas pa lta ci smos/ bskal pa de snyed cig tu sangs rgyas gcig kyang chung ngu na rmi lam du mthong ba'i rnam par dmigs par yang rjes su mi dran na/ byang chub sems dpa'i mig bcus mthong bar gyur pa lta ci smos/ de nas nye bar bzung ba tshun chad du de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi chos kyi sprin yang dag par 'dzin kyang chung ngu na ming du bya ba'i rnam pa tsam gyi chos kyi tshig dang / yi ge gcig kyang brjod par mi dran na/ de bzhin gshegs pa'i zhal gyi mdzod nas byung ba lta ci smos/ de nas nye bar bzung ba tshun chad du chos kyi rgya mtsho de snyed cig 'thung 'thung yang chung ngu na 'jig rten pa'i chos rnams la tshig 'ga' yang ma bsam ma brtags par mi dran no/ /
de nas nye bar bzung ba tshun chad du de snyed cig gis chos kyi tshul rgya mtsho las kyang chung ngu na 'jig rten pa'i bzo'i rgyus dang tshul yang rung ste/ chos kyi tshul gyi sgo gang la yang kho mos ting nge 'dzin mngon par ma bsgrubs pa de lta bu med do/ /
de nas nye bar bzung ba tshun chad du de bzhin gshegs pa de snyed kyi chos kyi 'khor lo bzung yang / ji ltar yongs su bzung ba las/ sems can 'dul ba'i dbang du bya ba ma gtogs par chung ngu na rjes su brgyud pa'i rgyus tsam gyi tshig dang / yi ge 'ga' yang por bar mi dran no/ /
de nas nye bar bzung ba tshun chad du sangs rgyas rgya mtsho de snyed cig mthong yang / chung ngu na sprul pa'i sangs rgyas kyi smon lam gyi rgyud kyang rung ste/ smon lam 'ga' yang kho mos sems can rgya mtsho thams cad rnam par dag par bya ba'i phyir mngon par ma bsgrubs pa med do/ /
de nas nye bar bzung ba tshun chad du/ sangs rgyas rgya mtsho de snyed cig gi sngon gyi byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa rgya mtsho las byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa 'ga' tsam yang / kho mos bdag gi spyod pa yongs su dag par bya ba'i phyir mngon par ma bsgrubs pa de lta bu mi dran no/ /
de nas nye bar bzung ba tshun chad du/ sems can gang kho mos bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu ma bskul pa de lta bu gcig kyang mig lam du 'ongs par mi dran no/ /
de nas nye bar bzung ba tshun chad du/ nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas yid la bya ba dang ldan pa'i sems bskyed pa gcig kyang mngon par bsgrubs su mi dran no/ /rigs kyi bu/ de nas nye bar bzung ba tshun chad du/ bskal pa 'dzam bu'i gling gi rdul shin tu phra ba snyed cig lon yang / tshig dang yi ge 'ga' la yang the tshom bskyed pa'am/ gnyis kyi 'du shes sam/ rnam par rtog pa'i 'du shes sam/ sna tshogs kyi 'du shes sam; rab kyi 'du shes sam/ bzang ngan gyi 'du shes sam/ sdug mi sdug gi 'du shes bskyed du mi dran no/ /

“Having heard such principles of the Teaching from the Buddha, desiring omniscience, aiming for the development of the ten powers, seeking the eloquence of a buddha, wishing to purify in myself the aura of light of a buddha, wishing to perfect a body like a buddha, desiring the purity of marks and embellishments of greatness of a buddha, aiming to gain a congregation like a buddha, seeking purification of a buddha-land, wishing to accomplish the deportment of a buddha, wanting to attain the span of life of a buddha, developing a mind that neither afflictions nor anyone concerned with self-liberation alone could break down, like indestructible adamant, I do not remember the arising of a single thought of enjoyment of desires—much less engaging in sexual intercourse—for as many eons thereafter as atoms in this continent. I do not remember a single thought of anger toward my relatives, much less toward innocent others. I do not remember a single thought related to the idea of self, much less having considered anything my own. I do not remember any confusion, or any notion of difference, or yet any indifference, even while in the womb between death and birth, much less while focusing my attention. In all those eons I did not forget a single vision of a buddha, not even a dream vision, much less those appearing to the ten eyes of an enlightening being.
