Ever since that original inspiration I have been imbibing the ocean of the Teaching, contemplating and reflecting on every single statement, even in the context of worldly phenomena. There is not a single facet of the Teaching that I have not become absorbed in, even in the context of worldly arts and sciences. Ever since that first inspiration, while holding the wheel of teaching of the buddhas, I have never omitted even a single word as I learned it, even in following logic, except to regulate the guidance of others. There is not a single vow I have not undertaken in the presence of the buddhas I have met since then to purify the ocean of all sentient beings, even carrying out vows made to phantom buddhas. There is not a single enlightening practice from the ocean of past enlightening practices of the oceans of buddhas that I have not undertaken to purify my own practice. There is not a single sentient being I have seen since then that I have not established in the determination for supreme enlightenment. I do not remember even having a thought of individual liberation since then. I do not remember ever conceiving any doubt, any notion of duality, any false discriminations, any notion of variety, any idea of grasping or rejection, any concept of inferior or advanced, or any thought of attachment or resistance, in regard to so much as even a single word or letter of the Teaching, for as many eons as atoms in this continent.

rigs kyi bu/ kho mo ni de phyin chad du sangs rgyas byung ba dang ma bral lo; ;sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams dang ma bral lo/ /byang chub sems dpa' rnams dang ma bral lo/ /yang dag pa'i dge ba'i bshes gnyen rnams dang ma bral lo/ /sangs rgyas kyi smon lam thos pa dang ma bral lo/ /byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa thos pa dang ma bral lo/ /byang chub sems dpa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i tshul thos pa dang ma bral lo/ /byang chub sems dpa'i sa'i ye shes snang ba'i tshul thos pa dang ma bral lo/ /byang chub sems dpa'i gzungs dang / ting nge 'dzin mi bzad pa'i mdzod dang gter thos pa thob pa dang ma bral lo/ /mtha' dang dbus med pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyi dra ba la 'jug cing / khong du chud par bya ba'i tshul thos pa dang ma bral lo/ /mtha' dang dbus med pa'i sems can gyi khams 'byung ba'i rgyu thos pa thob pa dang ma bral lo/ /'gro ba thams cad kyi nyon mongs pa'i dra ba'i dkyil 'khor yongs su zad par bya ba'i ye shes snang ba dang ma bral lo/ /sems can thams cad kyi dge ba'i rtsa ba 'byung ba'i rgyu'i ye shes thob pa dang ma bral lo/ /sems can thams cad kyi bsam pa ji lta ba bzhin du lus yongs su ston pa dang ma bral lo/ /sems can thams cad shes par byed pa'i dbyangs kyi dkyil 'khor rnam par dag pa dang ma bral lo/ /rigs kyi bu/ kho mos byang chub sems dpa'i rnam par thar pa'i sgo thub par dka' ba'i ye shes kyi snying po 'di dang / chos thams cad yongs su btsal bas mi skyo ba'i rgyan gyi ting nge 'dzin gyi sgo 'di la snyoms par zhugs te/ byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa'i sgo yi dam la brtan pa 'di rnam par phye ba dang / gzungs kyi sgo chos thams cad mnyam pa nyid kyis 'di dang / slobs pa'i ye shes snang ba'i sgo chos kyi gzhi thams cad snang bar brjod pa 'di rnam par phye ba dang / cho 'phrul bsam gyis mi khyab pa yod na/ rigs kyi bu khyod mngon sum du blta bar 'dod dam/

“Ever since then I have never been apart from buddhas, enlightening beings, and true spiritual benefactors. I have always been hearing of the vows of buddhas, the practices of enlightening beings, the transcendent ways of enlightening beings, the light of knowledge of the stages of enlightening beings, the inexhaustible treasury of mental command and concentration of enlightening beings, the way to enter the infinite network of worlds, the original causes of the infinite realms of sentient beings. I have never left the light of knowledge removing the web of afflictions of all beings. I have always been acquiring knowledge of the productive causes of the roots of goodness of all beings. I have always been appearing to all beings according to their mentalities. I have always been purifying the verbal range to instruct all beings.
“Having attained this enlightening liberation containing invincible knowledge and this concentration of tireless searches for all truths, accumulating this enlightening way of practice of firm resolve, contemplating this method of mental command of the stage of equanimity in all things and this medium of the light of knowledge clarifying the basis of all things, I am capable of inconceivable miracles. Do you want to witness them?”

smras pa/ 'phags ma/ 'tshal lo/ /
de nas dge bsnyen ma mi g.yo ba de na de ltar 'dug bzhin du/ byang chub sems dpa'i rnam par thar pa'i sgo thub par dka' ba'i ye shes kyi snying po la sogs pa dang / ting nge 'dzin gyi sgo thams cad yongs su btsal bas mi skyo ba'i rgyan la sogs pa dang / ting nge 'dzin gyi sgo don yod pa'i dkyil 'khor gyi rgyan la sogs pa dang / ting nge 'dzin gyi sgo stobs bcu'i ye shes kyi dkyil 'khor mngon du 'gyur ba la sogs pa dang / ting nge 'dzin gyi sgo sangs rgyas kyi rigs mi zad pa'i mdzod la sogs pa ting nge 'dzin gyi sgo brgya stong phrag bcu la rnam par blta ba dang / rnam par spyad pa dang / rjes su 'jug pa dang / nges par rtogs par byas so/ /de ltar dge bsnyen ma mi g.yo ba snyoms par zhugs ma thag tu/ tshong dpon gyi bu nor bzang gis/ phyogs bcur 'jig rten gyi khams sangs rgyas kyi zhing brjod du med pa phrag bcu'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed rnam pa drug tu g.yos pa dang / bai DUr+ya yongs su dag pa'i rgyu las gyur par gnas par mthong ngo/ /'jig rten gyi khams re re'i gling bzhi pa bye ba phrag brgya brgya na/ de bzhin gshegs pa bye ba phrag brgya brgya bzhugs par mthong ste/ la la ni dga' ldan gyi gnas na bzhugs pa nas/ la la ni yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba mdzad pa'i bar du'ang mthong ngo/ /de'ang 'jig rten gyi khams bai DUr+ya'i rang bzhin de dag yongs su dag cing sgrib pa med pa'i phyir te/ de bzhin gshegs pa de dag so so nas 'od zer dang / 'od kyi dkyil 'khor chos kyi dbyings thams cad du rgyas par khyab par mda' ba dang / de bzhin gshegs pa de dag so so'i 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor shin tu rnam par phye ba rgya mtsho yang mthong bar gyur to/ /de bzhin gshegs pa de dag re re'i gsung gi dkyil 'khor chos kyi 'khor lo thams cad brjod pa/ sems can thams cad kyi rna lam du rnam par grag pa'ang thos par gyur to/ /

Sudhana said, “I do.”
Then, as she sat there, Achala looked into, passed through, followed, and meditated on ten hundred thousand doors of concentration, beginning with the door of enlightening liberation containing invincible knowledge, the door of concentration of tireless searches for all truths, the door of concentration on the arrangement of the sphere of efficacy, the door of concentration on the sphere of the ten powers, and the door of liberation through concentration on the inexhaustible source of all buddhas. As soon as Achala had reach these concentrations, Sudhana saw as many worlds as atoms in ten inexpressible numbers of buddha-lands quaking, and appearing made of clear lapis lazuli. He also saw in each world a billion sets of four continents and a billion buddhas. He saw some of the buddhas in the heaven of satisfaction, some descending to be born on earth, some in the womb, some first-born, some leaving home for ascetic practice, some sitting under the tree of enlightenment, some defeating the demons, some realizing enlightenment, some teaching, some entering final extinction—this was because there was no obstruction to vision in the worlds made of clear lapis lazuli. He also saw the aura of light of each buddha pervading all universes, and he saw the orderly congregations of each buddha. He also heard the voice of the individual buddha communicating all the cycles of the Teaching to all sentient beings.

de nas dge bsnyen ma mi g.yo ba ting nge 'dzin de las langs nas/ tshong dpon gyi bu nor bzang la 'di skad ces smras so/ / rigs kyi bu khyod kyis mthong ngam/ thos sam/ shes sam/ smras pa/ 'phags ma/ mthong ngo/ /thos so/ /rig go /rigs kyi bu/ kho mo ni de ltar byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa yi dam brtan pa la slob cing / chos thams cad yongs su btsal bas mi skyo ba'i rgyan gyi ting nge 'dzin la mnyam par bzhag ste/ byang chub sems dpa'i rnam par thar pa'i sgo thub par dka' ba'i ye shes kyi snying po la gnas nas/ chos thams cad mnyam pa nyid kyi sa'i gzungs khong du chud pa dang / spobs pa'i ye shes snang ba chos kyi gzhi thams cad snang bar brjod pa la mkhas pa'i legs par bshad pas/ sems can thams cad yongs su tshim par byed par zad na/ kho mos byang chub sems dpa' yon tan tshad med pa bsam gyis mi khyab pa dang ldan pa nam mkha'i dbyings la 'dab chags khyu mchog 'khod pa ltar gnas med par spyod pa/ nam mkha' lding gi dbang po chen po ltar yongs su smin pa'i byang chub sems dpa' gdon pa'i phyir/ sems can thams cad kyi rgya mtsho la 'jug pa/ tshong pa ltar stobs bcu'i ye shes rin po che mngon par 'dod cing / thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi rin po che'i gling du rgyu ba/ mthu dang ldan pa'i nya pa ltar yid du 'ong ba'i chos kyi dkyil 'khor gyi rgya dang ldan pa'i lag pas sred pa'i chu las byung ba'i sems can yongs su smin par mngon par gdon pa'i phyir chos kyi rgya mtsho la rnam par rgyu ba/ lha'i dbang po ltar nyon mongs pa'i lha ma yin gyi g.yul chen po gdul ba bzlog pa'i phyir khams gsum gyi gnas yongs su bkang zhing rnam par rgyu ba/ nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor ltar sems can gyi sred pa'i chu dang nyon mongs pa'i 'dam shin tu bskam pa'i phyir chos kyi dbyings kyi nam mkha'i dbyings la yang dag par 'phags pa/ zla ba nya zhing rgyas pa ltar 'dul ba'i yid kyi me tog ku mu da rnam par kha dbye ba'i phyir ye shes kyi nam mkha' la mngon par shar ba; sa'i gzhi ltar 'gro ba thams cad kyi dge ba'i dbang po'i myu gu bskyed cing rnam par spel ba'i phyir/ byams mi byams dang / mthon dman med par 'jig rten na mnyam par gnas pa/ rlung dmar ltar sems can thams cad kyi nyon mongs pa dang / lta ba'i shing dang / shing phran gyi nags tshal dang / kun dga' rtsa ba nas gdon pa'i phyir chags pa med par phyogs thams cad du rnam par rgyu ba/ 'khor los bsgyur ba ltar bsdu ba'i dngos po'i yo byad dang rkyen gyis 'gro ba thams cad yongs su bsdu ba'i phyir/ 'jig rten na rnam par spyod pa de dag gi spyod pa shes pa'am/ yon tan brjod par nus re skan/

Then Achala emerged from concentration and said to Sudhana, “Did you see? Did you hear? Did you understand?”
Sudhana said, “I saw, I heard, I understood.”
Achala said, “In this way, learning enlightening beings’ practice of firm resolve, absorbed in tireless search for all truths, established in enlightening beings’ way of liberation by invincible knowledge, I satisfy all sentient beings with good explanation by following mental command of the stage of equanimity in all things, using the skill of the light of knowledge of how to elucidate the basis of all things. How can I know the practice or tell the virtues of the enlightening beings who are imbued with inconceivable, measureless virtues, who are like eagles soaring independently through the sky, who plunge into the sea of sentient beings to take out the mature enlightening beings, who search the treasure island of omniscience for the jewels of knowledge of the ten powers, who go like strong fishers into the sea of the mundane whirl with the net of the Teaching to mature beings born amid craving and pull them out of it, who go like titan kings throughout all realms of existence quelling the titanic disturbances and agitations of afflictions, who rise like the sun in the sky of the reality realm to evaporate the water of beings’ cravings and dry up the mud of afflictions, who rise like the full moon in the sky to awaken the water lilies of the minds of the teachable, who support all beings equally, whether friendly or hostile, high or low, to plant and grow the sprouts of roots of goodness in all sentient beings, who go everywhere unhindered like the wind to uproot the afflictions and views of all sentient beings, who go through the world like sovereigns uniting all beings with generosity, kindness, assistance, and cooperation?

song / rigs kyi bu/ lho phyogs kyi rgyud 'di nyid kyi yul dga' 'dzin tshad med pa na/ grong khyer dga' ba 'dzin pa zhes bya ba yod de/ de na kun du rgyu thams cad du 'gro ba zhes bya ba 'dug gi /de'i gan du song la/ ji ltar byang chub sems dpas byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa la bslab par bya ba dang / ji ltar nan tan du bya ba dris shig /
“South of here is a city called Tosala in a land called Amitatosala. There is a mendicant named Sarvagamin living there. Go ask him how to learn and carry out the practice of enlightening beings.”

de nas tshong dpon gyi bu nor bzang gis/ dge bsnyen ma mi g.yo ba'i rkang pa gnyis la spyi bos phyag 'tshal te/ dge bsnyen ma mi g.yo ba la lan brgya stong du mar g.yas phyogs su bskor ba byas nas yang dang yang bltas te/ dge bsnyen ma mi g.yo ba'i drung nas song ngo/ /
So then Sudhana paid his respects to Achala and left.
[kun du rgyu thams cad du 'gro ba]
Sarvagamin

de nas tshong dpon gyi bu nor bzang / dge bsnyen ma mi g.yo ba mngon du byas te/ dge bsnyen ma mi g.yo ba'i gdams ngag rjes su dran par byed cing / dge bsnyen ma mi g.yo bas bstan pa dang / yang dag par bstan pa dang / bsgrags pa dang / bshad pa dang / brjod pa dang / yang dag par brjod pa dang / bzhag pa dang / rnam par phye ba dang / smos pa dang / rgya cher bstan pa de dag thams cad la gdon mi za bar yid ches shing / rjes su 'brang bar bya ba dang / rjes su bsam pa dang / khong du chud par bya ba dang / bsgom pa dang / yongs su bsgom pa dang / gzhan du mi 'gyur ba dang / rtogs par bya ba dang / snang bar bya ba dang / mnyam par bya ba byed cing mthar gyis gnas nas gnas dang / yul nas yul du brgyu ste/ rgyu zhing song song nas yul dga' 'dzin tshad med pa gang na ba der phyin nas/ grong khyer dga' ba 'dzin pa rmed cing tshol tshol te/ nyi ma nub tu cha ba zhig na/ grong khyer dga' ba 'dzin par phyin nas/ grong khyer dga' ba 'dzin pa'i nang du song ste/ grong khyer gyi lam gyi bzhi mdo'i dbus shig tu phyin nas/ srang gi sgo nas srang gi sgo dang / lam gyi bzhi mdo nas/ lam gyi bzhi mdo dang / grong phrag nas/ grong phrag tu kun du rgyu thams cad du 'gro ba tshol zhing rmed rmed pa dang / mtshan mo mi nyal tsam zhig na/ grong khyer dga' ba 'dzin pa'i byang phyogs logs na ri shin tu mod pa zhes bya ba zhig yod pa de'i rtse mo dang / gel ba dang / sman sna tshogs dga' dga' ltar skyes pas brgyan pa/ 'od chen po dang ldan pa nyi ma shar ba lta bur gnas pa mthong ngo/ /des snang ba de mthong nas/ dga' ba'i shugs chen po skyes te/ 'di snyam du bsams so// bdag gis dge ba'i bshes gnyen ri'i rtse mo 'di la gdon mi za bar mthong bar 'gyur ba lta zhig snyam nas/ grong khyer de nas byung ste/ ri shin tu mod pa gang na ba der phyin pa dang / ri shin tu mod pa de la 'dzegs nas/ ri'i rtse mo snang ba chen po can gang na ba der phyin pa dang / rgyang yang ring po zhig nas/ kun tu rgyu thams cad du 'gro ba tshangs pa chen po las kyang lhag pa'i kha dog dang ldan pa dpal gyis shin tu 'bar ba zhig /tshangs pa stong phrag bcus kun nas bskor te/ 'chags na 'chag cing 'dug pa mthong nas de'i dung du phyin te/ rkang pa gnyis la spyi bos phyag 'tshal nas/ de la lan brgya stong du mar g.yas phyogs su bskor ba byas te/ mdun du 'dug nas thal mo sbyar te 'di skad ces smras so/ /'phags pa/ bdag gis bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed na/ ji ltar byang chub sems dpas byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa la bslab par bgyi ba dang / ji ltar nan tan du bgyi ba ma 'tshal te/ 'phags pa ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams la gdams ngag dang / rjes su bstan pa mdzad do/ / zhes bdag gis thos na/ 'phags pa/ ji ltar byang chub sems dpas byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa la bslab par bgyi ba dang / ji ltar nan tan du bgyi ba bdag la bshad du gsol/

His mind on the devotee Achala, remembering her teaching, absorbing what she had shown him, what she had told him, what she had described to him, what she had enjoined on him, what she had shared with him, what she had disclosed to him, what she had set forth to him, following it, reflecting on it, entering into it, cultivating it, embodying it, contemplating it, clarifying it, living up to it, Sudhana made his way from place to place, finally reaching the land of Amitatosala. There he sought out and found the city of Tosala.
Entering the city at sunset, he went from block to block, street to street, looking for the mendicant Sarvagamin. In the still of the night, he saw a mountain called Sulabha, north of the city. The mountain peak was adorned with thickets and groves of various plants and trees and was as bright as the sun. Seeing that light, Sudhana was ecstatic: he thought to himself, “I will undoubtedly see the spiritual benefactor on this mountaintop.”
Sudhana went out of the city to the mountain and climbed to the shining peak, where he saw the mendicant Sarvagamin from afar. The appearance of the mendicant was superior to that of the great god Brahma, glorious and radiant; he was walking around surrounded by ten thousand brahmic gods.
Sudhana went up to Sarvagamin, paid his respects, and said, “Noble one, I have set my mind on supreme perfect enlightenment, but I do not know how an enlightening being is to learn and carry out the practice of enlightening beings. I hear that you give enlightening beings instruction, so please tell me how to learn and carry out the practice of enlightening beings.”

smras pa/ rigs kyi bu/ de ltar khyod bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu zhugs pa legs so/ /legs so/ /rigs kyi bu/ kho bo ni thams cad du 'gro ba ste/ thams cad kyi rjes su song ba'i byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa la gnas pa'o/ /sgo thams cad du rnam par spyod pas snang ba'i ting 'dzin gyi sgo dang / dngos po med pa la gnas pas/ mngon par 'du bya ba med pa'i rdzu 'phrul dang / chos kyi dbyings kun gyi gzhir thug par thal ba'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i ye shes snang ba'i sgo dang ldan pa'o/ /rigs kyi bu/ de ltar kho bo ni sems can gyi snod kyi 'jig rten gyi rgyud thams cad dang / sems can gyi lam gyi rgyud thams cad dang / sems can gyi shi 'pho'i sgo thams cad dang / sems can gyi skye ba'i sgo thams cad dang / srid pa'i lam gyi rgyud tha dad pa thams cad dang / skye ba'i skye mched sna tshogs kyi 'jig rten gyi gnas rnam pa tha dad pa dag gi sems can kha dog dang / dbyibs dang / chu zheng rnam pa sna tshogs dang ldan pa/ skye ba kun du 'brel pa rnam pa sna tshogs dang ldan pa/ sbyor ba sna tshogs dang ldan pa/ mos pa sna tshogs/ can 'di lta ste/ lha'i lam gyi rgyud du gtogs pa dang / klu'i lam gyi rgyud du gtogs pa dang / gnod sbyin gyi lam gyi rgyud du gtogs pa dang / dri za'i lam gyi rgyud du gtogs pa dang / lha ma yin gyi lam gyi rgyud du gtogs pa dang / nam mkha' lding gi lam gyi rgyud du gtogs pa dang / mi'am ci'i lam gyi rgyud du gtogs pa dang / lto 'phye chen po'i lam gyi rgyud du gtogs pa dang / sems can dmyal ba'i lam gyi rgyud du gtogs pa dang / byol song gi skye gnas kyi lam gyi rgyud du gtogs pa dang / gshin rje'i 'jig rten gyi lam gyi rgyud du gtogs pa dang / mi'i lam gyi rgyud du gtogs pa dang / mi ma yin pa'i lam gyi rgyud du gtogs pa dang / lta ba'i rnam pa sna tshogs la gnas pa dang / nyan thos kyi theg pa la mos pa dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa la mos pa dang / theg pa chen po la mos pa'i sems can rnams kyi don thabs sna tshogs dang / ye shes kyi tshul dang / sbyor ba sna tshogs kyis byed de/ 'di ltar sems can la la la ni bzo'i rgyud tha dad pa thams cad dang ldan pa'i gzugs snang bas 'jig rten gyi bzo sna tshogs bslabs shing don byed do/ /sems can la la la ni 'di lta ste/ thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes bstabs pa'i phyir/ bsdu ba'i dngos po bzhis yongs su bsdu ba'i thabs kyi don byed do/ /sems can la la la ni 'di lta ste/ thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du 'gyur ba'i ye shes kyi sgo snang ba yongs su bskyed pas/ pha rol tu phyin pa yang dag par brjod cing don byed do/ /sems can la la la ni 'di lta ste/ byang chub kyi sa bon chud mi za bar brtan zhing yongs su bskyed pas byang chub sems dpa'i sems yongs su brjod cing don byed do/ /sems can la la la ni 'di lta ste/ sangs rgyas kyi zhing thams cad yongs su dag par bya ba dang / sems can thams cad yongs su smin par bya ba'i smon lam yongs su bskyed pa'i phyir/ byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa rnam pa thams cad du yang dag par brjod pas don byed do/ /sems can la la la ni 'di lta ste/ ngan du spyad pa'i rnam par smin pa dang mthun pa'i rgyus sems can dmyal ba'i lam gyi rgyud kyi sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba myong bar 'gyur ba yongs su bstan pas/ skyo ba yongs su bskyed cing don byed do/ /sems can la la la ni 'di lta ste/ de bzhin gshegs pa la bskyed pa'i yon tan thams cad ni gdon mi za bar thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi 'bras bu'i mthar thug par 'gyur bar brjod pas dga' ba chen po bskyed cing don byed do/ /sems can la la la ni 'di lta ste/ sangs rgyas kyi yon tan dang / sku la mngon par mos pas thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du smon lam 'debs par bya ba'i phyir/ de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi yon tan dang bsngags pa yang dag par brjod pas don byed do/ /sems can la la la ni 'di lta ste/ mi zlog cing lhun gyis grub pa dang / rgyun chad pa med par sangs rgyas kyi 'phrin las nan tan du mdzad pa'i mthu dang ldan pa'i sangs rgyas kyi sku 'thob par mos pa bskyed pa'i phyir/ sangs rgyas kyi bdag nyid che ba brjod pas don byed do/ /sems can la la la ni 'di lta ste/ tshur zil gyis gnon la/ phar zil gyis mi non pa'i sangs rgyas kyi sku phun sum tshogs pa 'thob par mos pa bskyed pa'i phyir sangs rgyas kyi mnga' chen po yongs su brjod cing don byed do/ /

Sarvagamin said, “It is good that you have set out for supreme perfect enlightenment. I am established in the enlightening practice of going everywhere, I have attained concentration of all-observing vision, and I am imbued with the light of knowledge of transcendent wisdom which distinguishes all planes of the cosmos without effort, based on nonbeing. In wandering through all worlds of living beings and inanimate objects, in wandering through the realms of existence of all beings, in the occasions of death of all sentient beings, in the occasions of birth of all sentient beings, in all kinds of conditions of existence, in the various places of birth, the worlds and abodes, of sentient beings of various appearances, forms, and sizes, bound to various kinds of existence, with various aims, wedded to various views and courses of action, believing in various forms of religion, I work for the benefit of sentient beings by various means and various applications of knowledge. Some I help by teaching various worldly arts, by means of the light of mental command of all kinds of arts. Some I help by charity, kindness, assistance, and cooperation, to lead them to omniscient knowledge. Some I help by describing the ways of transcendence, generating the light of knowledge of dedication to omniscience. Some I help by praising the aspiration for enlightenment, producing a basis for preservation of the seed of enlightenment. Some I help by describing all facets of the practices of enlightening beings, fostering the commitment to purify all buddha-lands and perfect all beings. Some I help by frightening them, showing them the misery and pain resulting from evil actions. Some I help by delighting them, telling them about the fruit of omniscience ultimately developing from giving gifts to all buddhas. Some I help by describing the virtues and qualities of all buddhas, to generate desire for the qualities of buddhas and determination for omniscience. Some I help by eulogizing the greatness of buddhas, to generate the desire to embody buddhahood and be constantly engaged in spontaneous, ceaseless buddha-work. Some I help by showing the mastery of buddhas, to generate the desire to attain supreme buddhahood.

rigs kyi bu/ gzhan yang kho mo ni grong khyer dga' ba 'dzin pa 'di yi bzhi mdo'i phongs thams cad dang / srang thams cad dang / lam gyi sum mdo thams cad dang / grong mtshams thams cad dang khyim thams cad dang / mthun par 'dus pa'i rdal thams cad dang / grong thams cad dang / grong gi rgyud thams cad du rnam pa ji ltar tshogs shing 'dus pa'i bud med dang / skyes pa dang / khye'u dang / bu mo rnams kyi bsam pa ji lta ba dang / sbyor ba ji lta ba dang / mthu ji lta ba dang / rnam par spyod pa ji lta ba bzhin du de dag dang mthun pa'i lus kyi chu zheng dang dbyibs mngon par bsgrubs shing chos ston kyang / sems can de dag gis de sum bstan pa dang / de ga las 'ongs pa mi shes te/ gzhan du na thos nas ma nor bar nan tan du byed pa ni med pa'ang ma yin no/ /gzhan yang / rigs kyi bu/ 'dzam bu'i gling 'di na zhags pa 'thub pa lta ba rnam pa sna tshogs la mngon par zhen pa dgu bcu rtsa drug 'khod pa de dag thams cad kyi nang du yang / sems can lta ba'i rnam pa sna tshogs la chags pa rnams yongs su smin par bya ba'i phyir thams cad dang mthun par gnas te/ rigs kyi bu/ ji ltar kho bo grong khyer dga' ba 'dzin pa 'di na/ sems can gyi don byed cing 'dug pa de bzhin du/ 'dzam bu'i gling gi grong dang / grong khyer dang / ljongs dang / yul dang / khams dang / rgyal ba'i pho brang 'khor thams cad na yang sems can gyi don byed do/ /'dzam bu'i gling na ji lta ba de bzhin du gling bzhi pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad dang / de bzhin du stong dang / stong gnyis pa dang / stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams dang / de bzhin du phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams sems can gyi rten du bya ba thams cad dang / sems can gyi gnas su bya ba thams cad dang / sems can gyi gzhir bya ba thams cad dang / sems can gyi khams su bya ba'i ming du gtogs pa thams cad dang / sems can yongs su rgyu ba thams cad dang / sems can yongs su 'du ba thams cad dang / sems can rgya mtsho na gnas pa thams cad dang / sems can gyi rgyud gnas pa thams cad dang / sems can gyi phyogs su bya ba thams cad dang / sems can gyi phyogs mtshams su bya ba thams cad dang / sems can spyod pa'i gnas thams cad du'ang thabs sna tshogs dang / tshul sna tshogs dang / sgo sna tshogs dang / rigs pa sna tshogs dang / phrad pa sna tshogs dang / thabs kyi tshul sna tshogs dang / bya ba sna tshogs kyis sems can rnams kyi don byed do/ /gzugs dang kha dog sna tshogs yongs su bstan cing mos par bya ba dang / tshig gi lam sna tshogs brjod pas kyang sems can rnams kyi don byed do/ /

“Furthermore, in every street, every block, every house, every district, every family and group, I assume forms like the men and women, boys and girls, and expound the Teaching to them according to their dispositions, aims, powers, and thoughts; they do not know who is teaching them or where I am from; they just practice truthfully what they have heard. And I go everywhere on this continent to those who are immersed in the views of false doctrines, in order to mature those who cling to various views. And just as I do so throughout the continent, so also do I work for the benefit of all beings on earth, in the galaxy, in the universe, in infinite worlds, in the paths of all beings, in the abodes of all beings, in the thoughts in which all beings rest, in the groups of all beings, in the masses of all beings, in all races of beings, among all types of beings, wherever they be, helping them according to their mentalities and inclinations, through various means, various methods, various approaches, various efforts, various devices, various expedients, various activities, assuming various forms, and speaking in various languages.

rigs kyi bu kho bos ni/ byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa thams cad du 'gro ba thams cad kyi rjes su song ba 'di shes par zad na/ kho bos byang chub sems dpa' 'gro ba thams cad dang mnyam pa'i lus dang ldan pa/ bdag dang sems can gyi lus su tha mi dad pa'i ting nge 'dzin thob pa/ 'phrul pa'i 'khor lo rgya chen pos srid pa'i lam gyi rgyud thams cad du khyab pa/ 'jig rten gyi skye ba thams cad rang gi lus la rjes su spyod la/ 'gro ba thams cad kyis blta na dga' zhing yid du 'ong ba'i sprul pa'i 'khor lo la brtson pa/ 'gro ba thams cad kyi rigs dang / rgyud dang / cher skye ba rab tu ston pa/ bskal pa thams cad du gnas pa la thogs pa med pa'i smon lam gyi 'khor lo dang ldan pa/ mig 'phrul lta bu'i spyod pa rnam par phye ba'i snang ba rab tu thob pa; 'gro ba thams cad kyi don byed kyang gos pa med par gnas pa la brtson pa/ dus gsum gyi 'gro ba'i dbyings mnyam pa nyid khong du chud pa/ ye shes kyi dbyings bdag med pa dang ldan pas snang bar byas pa'i snying rje chen po mtha' yas pa'i snying po dang ldan pa/ 'gro ba thams cad kyi dge ba'i rtsa ba yongs su bskyed pa la mngon par brtson pa de dag gi spyod pa shes pa'am/ yon tan brjod par nus re skan/

“I know this enlightening practice of going everywhere. How can I know the practice or tell of the virtues of the enlightening beings with bodies equal to all beings, who have attained concentration in which their own bodies and all bodies are indivisible, whose vast sphere of emanation adapts to all states of existence, who pass through existence in all worlds in their own bodies, who are intent on mystical projections pleasing to the sight of all beings, who appear to be born in all races, who carry out their vows unimpeded in all ages, who can manifest the interrelated cosmic network of practices, who are devoted to working for the welfare of all beings while living together with them without becoming defiled, who realize the basic equality of the worlds of past, present, and future, who are imbued with endless great compassion appearing in the realm of selfless knowledge, who aim to foster good in all beings?

song / rigs kyi bu/ lho phyogs kyi rgyud 'di nyid na/ yul khams chen po zhes bya ba yod de/ de na spos 'tshong gi tshong dpon longs spyod ut+pa la zhes bya ba 'dug gi/ /de'i gan du song la/ ji ltar byang chub sems dpas byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa la bslab par bya ba dang / ji ltar nan tan du bya ba dris shig /
“South of here is a land called Prthurashtra, where there lives an eminent perfumer named Utpalabhuti. Go ask him how to learn and carry out the practice of enlightening beings.”

de nas tshong dpon gyi bu nor bzang gis/ kun tu rgyu thams cad du 'gro ba'i rkang pa gnyis la spyi bos phyag 'tshal te/ kun tu rgyu thams cad du 'gro ba la lan brgya stong du mar g.yas phyogs su bskor ba byas nas/ yang dang yang bltas te/ kun tu rgyu thams cad du 'gro ba'i drung nas song ngo/ /
So Sudhana paid his respects to the mendicant Sarvagamin and left.
[spos 'tshong gi tshong dpon longs spyod ut+pa la]
Utpalabhuti

de nas tshong dpon gyi bu nor bzang lus dang srog la mi lta/ srid pa'i longs spyod dang / yongs su zin pa dang / nye bar blangs pa mngon par chags pa'i gnas thams cad la ni mi sems/ sems can gyi yul gyi dga' ba thams cad la ni mi lta/ gzugs dang / sgra dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg bya thams cad la ni mi lta/ g.yog 'khor dang / longs spyod dang / nye bar spyad pa thams cad la ni mi lta ste/ rgyal srid dang / dbang phyug gi dbang gi bde ba thams cad la ni mi lta la/ sangs rgyas kyi zhing bla na med par yongs su dag pa mngon par bsgrubs pas/ sems can thams cad yongs su smin par bya ba dang / gdul ba dang / yongs su dag par bya ba la blta ba/ mchod pa dang / bsnyen bkur ba dang / rim gror bya bas mi ngoms pas de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad la blta ba dang / rang bzhin med pa yongs su shes pa'i ye shes khong du chud par bya ba'i phyir chos thams cad la blta ba/ yon tan rgya mtsho thams cad kyi don du nan tan bya ba las nyams pa med par bya ba'i phyir/ byang chub sems dpa'i yon tan thams cad la blta ba dang / bskal ba thams cad du byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa la yang dag par gnas par bya ba'i phyir/ byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyi smon lam chen po la lta ba/ de bzhin gshegs pa'i 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor rgya mtsho thams cad du 'jug par bya ba la lta ba/ ting nge 'dzin gyi sgo re rer/ byang chub sems dpa'i ting nge 'dzin grangs med pa thams cad gzud pa la rnam par 'phrul par bya ba'i phyir/ byang chub sems dpa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi sgo thams cad la lta ba/ de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi chos kyi 'khor lo yang dag par bzung bas/ mi ngoms par bya pa'i phyir chos kyi ye shes snang ba'i 'khor lo thams cad la lta ba de/ sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa'i yon tan 'di dag dang / gzhan dag kyang dge ba'i bshes gnyen las byung ba ste/ dge ba'i bshes gnyen ni/ de dag thams cad kyi 'byung gnas su gyur pa yin par yang dag par lta zhing / mthar gyis yul khams chen po gang na ba der phyin nas; spos 'tshong gi tshong dpon longs spyod ut+pa la yongs su rmed cing tshol tshol ba las mthong nas/ spos 'tshong gi tshong dpon longs spyod ut+pa la gang na bder phyin te/ drung du song nas spos 'tshong gi tshong dpon spyod ut+pa la'i rkang pa gnyis la spyi bos phyag 'tshal te/ spos 'tshong gi tshong dpon longs spyod ut+pa la la lan brgya stong du mar g.yas phyogs su bskor ba byas nas/ spos 'tshong gi tshong dpon longs spyod ut+pa la'i mdun du 'dug ste thal mo sbyar nas/ 'di skad ces smras so/ / 'phags pa/ bdag sangs rgyas thams cad dang mnyam pa'i ye shes 'tshal te/ sangs rgyas thams cad kyi sngon gyi smon lam gyi dkyil 'khor yongs su rdzogs par bgyi bar yang dga'; sangs rgyas thams cad kyi chos kyi sku yongs su grub par bgyi bar yang dga'/ sangs rgyas thams cad kyi ye shes kyi sku yongs su 'tshal bar bgyi bar yang dga'/ byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa'i dkyil 'khor thams cad yongs su dag par bgyi bar yang dga'/ byang chub sems dpa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi dkyil 'khor thams cad snang bar bgyi bar yang dga'/ byang chub sems dpa'i gzungs kyi dkyil 'khor thams cad yongs su brten par yang dga'/ sgrib pa'i dkyil 'khor thams cad rnam par gtor bar yang dga'/ zhing gi dkyil 'khor thams cad du rnam par rgyu bar yang 'tshal nas/ bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yang dag par zhugs na/ ji ltar byang chub sems pas byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa la bslab par bgyi ba dang / ji ltar nan tan du bgyi ba dang / ji ltar nan tan du bgyis na/ byang chub sems dpa' thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du 'byung bar 'gyur ba ma 'tshal to/ /

Unconcerned with body and life, unconcerned with any material things, unconcerned with enjoyment of any people or places, unconcerned with objects of the senses, unconcerned with enjoying the experiences that go along with having followers, unconcerned with kingship, dominion, or power, concerned with developing, guiding, and purifying all sentient beings, with achieving supreme purity of a buddha-land, with tirelessly attending and serving all buddhas, with knowing and according with the inherent nature of all things, with permanently attaining the virtues of all enlightening beings, with carrying out the vows of enlightening beings through all ages, with entering the ocean of congregations of all buddhas, with entering all concentrations of enlightening beings in each particular mode of concentration by mystic transformation, with tirelessly receiving the light of knowledge of all truths through the cycles of teachings of all buddhas, pondering these and other virtues of all enlightening beings, Sudhana made his way to Prthurashtra, where he sought and found the eminent perfumer Utpalabhuti.
Seeing the perfumer, Sudhana went up to him, paid his respects, and said, “Noble one, I have set out for supreme perfect enlightenment, seeking the knowledge common to all buddhas, wishing to fulfill the vows fulfilled by all buddhas, wishing to see the embodiments of all buddhas, wishing to attain the reality body of all buddhas, wishing to know the body of knowledge of truths of all buddhas, wishing to purify all enlightening practices, wishing to manifest the sphere of concentration of all enlightening beings, wishing to master the sphere of mental command of all enlightening beings, wishing to disperse all obstructions, wishing to travel through all lands. But I do not know how an enlightening being is to learn and carry out the practice of enlightening beings. How does an enlightening being gain access to omniscience?”

smras pa/ rigs kyi bu/ de ltar khyod kyis bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub sems bskyed pa legs so/ / legs so/ /rigs kyi bu/ kho bo ni spos thams cad shes te/ spos sbyar ba thams cad dang / bdug spos thams cad dang / bdug spos sbyar ba thams cad dang / byug pa thams cad dang / byug pa sbyar ba thams cad dang / phye ma thams cad dang / phye ma sbyar ba thams cad dang / spos dang byug pa dang / phye ma'i rnam pa thams cad kyang shes te/ lha'i spos kyang shes so/ /klu dang / gnod sbyin dang / dri za dang / lha ma yin dang / nam mkha' lding dang / mi 'am ci dang / lto 'phye chen po dang / mi dang / mi ma yin pa'i spos kyang shes so/ /nad gso ba'i spos dang / yid mi bde ba bsal ba'i spos dang / 'jig rten gyi dga' ba yongs su bskyed pa'i spos dang / nyon mongs pa 'bar bar bya ba'i spos dang / nyon mongs pa zhi bar bya ba'i spos dang / 'dus byas kyi dga' ba dang bde ba sna tshogs yongs su bskyed pa'i spos dang / 'dus byas thams cad las skyo ba yongs su bskyed pa'i spos dang / bag bya ba'i gnas thams cad yongs su sel ba'i spos dang / sangs rgyas yid la bya ba'i rgyud yang dag par 'byung ba'i spos dang / chos kyi tshul khong du chud par bya ba'i spos dang / 'phags pas spyad pa'i spos dang / byang chub sems dpa'i spos rnam pa tha dad pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i sa thams cad rnam par dgod pa'i spos kyang shes te/ kho bos spos de dag thams cad rnam pa ji lta bu'ang rab tu shes so/ /'byung ba dang / skye ba dang / 'grub pa dang / yongs su rdzogs pa dang / yongs su dag pa dang / yongs su spangs pa dang / rab tu sbyar ba dang / yongs su spyad pa dang / yul dang / mthu dang / las dang / rgyu yang rab tu shes so/ /rigs kyi bu/ mi'i 'jig rten na spos glang po'i snying po zhes bya ba/ klu yongs su 'khrug par byed pa yod de/ de'i ri lu til gyi 'bru tsam gyis kyang / yul khams chen po thams cad spos kyi sprin gyi dra ba shin tu stug pas kun nas khebs par gyur te/ zhag bdun du spos chu'i rgyun shin tu phra ba'i char mngon par 'bab bo/ /de'i tshe sems can su'i lus sam/ gos la spos chu'i rgyun de dag gis bab par gyur pa de dag thams cad kyang / me tog gser gyi kha dog tu 'dug pas rnam par brgyan pa'i gos dang / lus su 'gyur ro/ /khang pa dang / gzhal med khang dang / khang pa brtsegs pa gang du bab par gyur pa de dag thams cad kyang / me tog gser gyi kha dog lta bus rnam par brgyan par gnas so/ /sems can khyim gyi nang na gnas par gang gis/ spos kyi sprin gyi dra ba de la rlung gis mngad pa'i dri tshor bar gyur pa de dag thams cad kyang / zhag bdun du dga' ba dang / mos pa chen pos yongs su rgyas par 'gyur te/ lus dang sems la bde ba dang / dga' ba sna tshogs kyang rab tu myong bar 'gyur ro/ /de dag gi lus la yang khams 'khrugs pa las gyur pa'am/ gzhan gyis gnod par byas pa las gyur pa'i nad kyang 'byung bar 'gyur ba med do/ /sems kyi sdug bsngal dang / mi bde ba yang mi 'byung ngo/ /'jigs pa'am/ dngang ba'am/ bag tsha ba'am/ yid 'khrugs pa'am/ gnod sems kyang mi rgyu ste/ de dag thams cad zhag bdun du dga' ba dang bde ba skyes te/ gcig la gcig byams pa'i sems su 'gyur ro; ;rigs kyi bu/ kho bo ni de dag de ltar dga' ba dang / nyams bde ba skyes pa rnams la bsam pa dag par bya ba'i phyir/ ci nas kyang bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu nges par 'gyur ba de ltar chos ston to/ /

Utpalabhuti said, “It is good that you aspire to supreme perfect enlightenment. I know about all fragrances—perfumes, incenses, ointments, and aromatic powders—and how they are compounded and used. I also know the sources of all fragrances. I know celestial fragrances, and I also know the fragrances of other types of beings, human and nonhuman. Indeed, I know various kinds of fragrances. I know fragrances that cure illness, I know fragrances that remove depression, I know fragrances that produce mundane joy, I know fragrances that incite passions, I know fragrances that extinguish passions, I know fragrances that produce pleasure in enjoyment of various created things, I know fragrances that produce rejection of all created things, I know fragrances that remove arrogance and heedlessness, I know fragrances that produce thoughts of Buddha, I know fragrances that accord with the principles of the Teaching, fragrances enjoyable to sages, the variety of fragrances of enlightening beings, and the fragrances of the arrangement of all stages of enlightening beings. I also know the external appearance of all these fragrances, as well as their source, production, manifestation, perfection, purification, removal, application, use, sphere of action, efficacy, nature, and root.
“In the human world there is a fragrance said to come from the agitation of water spirits: one grain the size of a sesame seed will cause this whole country to be covered with fragrant clouds that shower fine fragrant rain for seven days. Those on whose bodies or clothing that fragrant water falls become as brilliant as golden flowers, and any houses or buildings on which it falls become as brilliant as golden flowers. And any who smell the scent of that fragrant water wafting in on the breeze become ecstatic for seven days and experience many kinds of physical and mental pleasure and delight. Furthermore, no illness—whether due to constitutional upset or external trauma—occurs in their bodies, nor do they suffer any mental distress or depression, nor do they have any fear, anxiety, fright, agitation, or ill will. They become kind to one another, happy, and joyful. When they have become happy and joyful, I begin to purify their minds and teach them in such a way that they become certain of supreme enlightenment.

gzhan yang rigs kyi bu/ rim la ya las 'byung ba'i tsan dan sa steng dam pa zhes bya ba yod de; de lus la bskus na me'i 'obs su mchongs kyang tshig pa med do/ /rigs kyi bu/ rgya mtsho'i mtha' nas 'byung ba'i spos gzhan gyis thub pa med pa zhes bya ba yod de/ des rnga'am/ dung la bskus na/ de'i sgras gzhan gyi 'khor thams cad pham par 'gyur ro/ /rigs kyi bu/ mtsho ma dros pa'i ngogs nas 'byung ba'i a ga ru nag po pad+mo'i snying po zhes bya ba yod de/ de'i ri lu til gyi 'bru tsam gcig gi dris kyang / 'dzam bu'i gling thams cad rgyas par gang bar 'gyur te/ sems can gang gis spos kyi dri de tshor ba de dag thams cad kyang sdig pa la smod cing / sdom pa'i sems rab tu 'thob par 'gyur ro/ /rigs kyi bu/ ri'i rgyal po kha ba can las 'byung ba'i spos kyi rnam pa 'od dang ldan pa zhes bya ba yod de/ de'i dri tshor na sems can de dag 'dod chags dang bral ba'i sems su 'gyur te/ kho bo ni de dag la ci nas kyang rdul dang bral ba'i dkyil 'khor ces bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin thob par 'gyur ba de ltar chos ston to/ /rigs kyi bu/ srin po'i 'jig rten nas 'byung ba'i spos kyi rnam pa rgya mtsho'i snying po zhes bya ba yod de/ de ni 'khor los bsgyur ba'i longs spyod kyi don du 'byung ste/ des bdugs ma thag tu 'khor los bsgyur ba'i rgyal po'i dpung gi tshogs yan lag bzhi pa yang nam mkha'i dbyings la gnas so/ /rigs kyi bu; lha'i 'khor chos bzang po nas 'byung ba'i spos kyi rnam pa rnam par 'byed pa zhes bya ba yod de/ des bdugs ma thag tu lha rnams sangs rgyas kyi dri zhim po dran par 'gyur ro; ;rigs kyi bu/ lha'i rgyal po rab mtshe ma'i gnas na spos kyi rnam pa dag pa'i mdzod ces bya ba yod de/ des bdugs ma thag tu mtshe ma'i lha'i bu thams cad lha'i rgyal po rab mtshe ma'i drung du 'dong ngo/ /de dag der phyin nas kyang lha'i rgyal po rab mtshe mas chos kyi gtam bya'o/ /rigs kyi bu/ dga' ldan gyi gnas na spos kyi rnam pa sin du ba ra zhes bya ba yod de/ de'i spos kyi dud pa byang chub sems dpa' tshe gcig gis thogs pa chos kyi stan la 'dug pa'i mdun du phyung na/ spos kyi sprin chen pos chos kyi dbyings thams cad rgyas par gang zhing de bzhin gshegs pa'i 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor thams cad du rgyan rnam pa sna tshogs dang ldan pa'i chos kyi sprin chen po'i char rab tu bab bo/ /rigs kyi bu; lha'i rgyal po rab 'phrul dga'i gnas na/ spos kyi rnam pa yid 'phrog pa zhes bya ba yod de/ des lha'i rgyal po rab 'phrul dga'i gnas su bdugs na/ zhag bdun du chos kyi sprin gyi char bsam gyis mi khyab pa 'bab par 'gyur ro/ /

“There is a kind of sandalwood that comes from the mountains which will protect those anointed with its essence from burning even if they fall into a fire. The sound of kettledrums or conches smeared with it will drive away all enemy armies. There is a kind of aloe called ‘lotus calyx’ from the banks of the lake Heatless; a grain of it the size of a sesame seed will fill the whole continent with fragrance such that all who smell it gain a disciplined mind rejecting evil. There is a kind of fragrance from the Himalaya Mountains which is such that all who smell it become dispassionate; then I teach them in such a way that they attain a concentration called ‘sphere of dispassion.’ There is a kind of fragrance from the world of spirits called ‘ocean storehouse’ which is produced for the use of sovereign rulers; perfumed by it, the ruler and the ruler’s armies stand in the sky. There is a kind of incense called ‘beautiful array’ originating in the celestial hall of the good doctrine; when it is burned, celestial beings gain awareness of the scent of enlightenment. There is a kind of incense from the pure treasuries in the palace of the heaven of timely portion; when it is burned, inhabitants of that heaven all go to the ruler of the heaven of timely portion, who then talks to them about the Teaching. There is a kind of incense in the heaven of satisfaction which, when burned before an enlightened being destined to become a buddha in one lifetime who is sitting on the throne of the Teaching, fills the whole cosmos at once with a great fragrant cloud and causes rain from the great cloud of the Teaching to shower in many arrays on the audiences of all buddhas. There is a kind of incense called ‘fascinating’ in the palace of the king of the heaven of beautiful emanations which, when burned, causes rain to shower from the cloud of the inconceivable Teaching for seven days.

rigs kyi bu/ kho bos ni spos sbyar ba de shes su zad na/ kho bos byang chub sems dpa' skyon gyi dri ma med pa 'dod pa'i 'jig rten thams cad nas gyen du 'phags pa/ nyon mongs pa'i bdud kyi zhags pa dang bral ba/ srid pa'i lam gyi rgyud thams cad las shin tu 'das pa/ ye shes sgyu ma'i rnam pa dang / gzugs kyis rnam par spyod pa/ 'jig rten thams cad kyis gos pa med pa/ chags pa med pa'i ngang tshul can/ sgrib pa med pa'i ye shes kyi dkyil 'khor rnam par dag pa/ thogs pa med pa'i ye shes kyi spyod yul dang / yul du ldan pa/ kun gyi gzhi'i gnas thams cad la mi gnas par srid pa'i kun gzhi dang / gnas thams cad du rgyu ba rnams kyi spyod pa shes pa'am/ yon tan brjod pa'am/ tshul khrims kyi spyod pa rnam par dag pa'i sgo yongs su smos pa'am kha na ma tho ba med pa'i spyod pa'am/ gnod par spyod pa med pa'i lus dang / ngag dang / yid kyi rgyud bstan par nus re skan/

“I know this art of perfuming. How can I know the practice, tell of the virtues, elucidate the method of purification of conduct, convey the irreproachable action, or explain the malice-free words, thoughts, and deeds of the enlightening beings who are free from foulness, who are void of lusts, who are free from the snares of the demon of afflictions, who have transcended all conditions of existence, who proceed with material form as being something in the magic of knowing, who are unstained by any world, whose way of life is free from attachment, who have purified the sphere of unobstructed knowledge, who are in the realm of unimpeded knowledge, who do not take refuge in any abode or rely on anything in existence?

song / rigs kyi bu/ lho phyogs kyi rgyud 'di nyid na; grong khyer khang pa brtsegs pa zhes bya ba yod de/ de na mnyan pa dpa' bo zhes bya ba 'dug gi /de'i drung du song la/ ji ltar byang chub sems dpas byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa la bslab par bya ba dang / ji ltar nan tan du bya ba dris shig /
“South of here is a city called Kutagara, where there lives a mariner named Vaira. Go ask him how to learn and carry out the practice of enlightening beings.”

de nas tshong dpon gyi bu nor bzang gis/ spos 'tshong gi tshong dpon longs spyod ut+pa la'i rkang pa gnyis la spyi bos phyag 'tshal nas/ spos 'tshong gi tshong dpon longs spyod ut+pa la la lan brgya stong du mar g.yas phyogs su bskor ba byas nas/ yang dang yang bltas te/ spos 'tshong gi tshong dpon longs spyod ut+pa la'i drung nas song ngo/ /
So then Sudhana paid his respects to Utpalabhuti and left.
[mnyan pa dpa' bo]
Vaira

de nas tshong dpon gyi bu nor bzang grong khyer khang pa brtsegs par 'gro ba'i lam du 'jug pa'i tshe/ lam gyi gyen thur dang / lam mnyam pa dang / lam gyi thag thug dang / lam rdul yod pa dang / lam rdul med pa dang / lam bde ba dang / lam mi bde ba dang / lam dog pa dang / lam gegs med pa dang; lam 'khyug pa dang / lam 'khyug pa med pa la rnam par spyod de/ bltas nas 'dri snyam du bsams so/ /'di ltar bdag dge ba'i bshes gnyen de'i drung du 'gro ba 'di ni/ byang chub sems dpa'i lam gyi nan tan gyi rgyur 'gyur ro/ /pha rol tu phyin pa'i lam gyi nan tan gyi rgyur 'gyur ro/ /sems can la phan gdags pa'i lam gyi nan tan gyi rgyur 'gyur ro/ /sems can thams cad byams sdang dang / mthon dman du gyur pa'i g.yang sa las rnam par bzlog pa dang / sems can thams cad mi mnyam pa'i nan tan las bsgyur ba dang / sems can thams cad kyi nyon mongs pa'i rdul rab tu zhi bar bya ba dang / sems can thams cad kyi mi dge ba'i lta ba sna tshogs kyi sdong dum dang / tsher ma dang / gyo mo dang / gseg ma bsal ba dang / chos kyi dbyings bsgribs pa med pa la gzhol bar bya ba dang / thams cad mkhyen pa'i pho brang du thogs pa med par bskyal ba'i rgyur 'gyur ro/ /de ci'i phyir zhe na/ dge ba'i bshes gnyen ni/ dge ba'i chos thams cad kyi 'byung gnas so/ /dge ba'i bshes gnyen la ni/ thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi rag lus so zhes/ de de ltar sems shing yid la byed pas spyod pa thub par dka' ba de mthar gyis grong khyer khang pa brtsegs pa der phyin nas/ mnyan pa dpa' bo yongs su rmed cing tshol tshol ba las/ grong khyer chen po zhig gi sgo rgya mtsho chen po'i ngogs na mnyan pa dpa' bo de tshong pa brgya phrag stong tsam dang / srog chags brgya stong du ma gtam sna tshogs nyan par 'dong pa sha stag gis kun nas bskor cing / rgya mtsho'i gtam yongs su brjod pas/ sangs rgyas kyi yon tan rgya mtsho sems can rnams la ston cing 'dug pa mthong ngo/ /mthong nas kyang mnyan pa dpa' bo gang na ba der song ste phyin nas/ mnyan pa dpa' bo'i rkang pa gnyis la spyi bos phyag 'tshal te/ mnyan pa dpa' bo la lan brgya stong du mar g.yas phyogs su bskor ba byas nas/ mnyan pa dpa' bo'i mdun du 'dug ste/ thal mo sbyar nas 'di skad ces smras so/ /'phags pa; bdag gis bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed na/ ji ltar byang chub sems dpas byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa la bslab par bgyi ba dang / ji ltar nan tan du bgyi ba ma 'tshal te/ 'phags pa ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams la gdams ngag dang / rjes su bstan pa mdzad do/ /zhes bdag gis thos na/ 'phags pa; ji ltar byang chub sems dpas byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa la bslab par bgyi ba dang / ji ltar nan tan du bgyi ba bdag la bka' stsal du gsol/

On the way to the city Kutagara, Sudhana observed where the road was variously low and high, even and uneven, dusty and dust-free, safe and perilous, impassable and unobstructed, crooked and straight. As he went along he thought, “My going to that spiritual benefactor will be a means of accomplishment of the path of enlightening beings, a means of accomplishment of the path of knowledge to assist sentient beings; it will be a means of accomplishment of the path of transcendence, a means of accomplishment of the path of knowledge to assist sentient beings. It will become a means of stopping all beings from falling into attachment and rejection, arrogance and servility; a means of turning all beings away from bad inclinations; a means of ridding all beings of the dust of afflictions; a means of removing the thorns and grit of wrong views from all sentient beings; a means of absorption in the unobstructed reality realm; a means of leading to the eternal citadel of omniscience. Why is that? Spiritual benefactors are mines of all that is good, sources of omniscience.”
With these thoughts in mind, with a purpose rarely encountered, he made his way to Kutagara city looking for the mariner Vaira. When he got there, he saw the mariner surrounded by hundreds of thousands of merchants and hundreds of thousands of other people who wished to hear him talk, explaining to them the oceans of virtues of buddhas by talking about the ocean.
Sudhana went up to Vaira, paid his respects, and said, “Noble one, I have set my mind on supreme perfect enlightenment, but I do not know how to learn and carry out the practice of enlightening beings. I hear that you give enlightening beings instruction, and I hope you will tell me how one is to learn and carry out the practice of enlightening beings.”

smras pa/ rigs kyi bu khyod kyis de ltar bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed de/ ye shes chen po 'thob pa 'byung ba'i rgyu 'dri ba dang / 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal sna tshogs kyi rgyud 'byung ba'i rgyu dang / thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi gling gi gnas su 'gro ba 'byung ba'i rgyu dang / dbyer med pa'i theg pa chen po 'byung ba'i rgyu dang / nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi sar ltung bas 'jigs pa dang bral bar 'gyur ba'i lam gyi nan tan 'byung ba'i rgyu dang / zhi ba'i ting nge 'dzin gyi sgo dang rgyud sna tshogs khong du chud par bya ba'i ye shes kyi lam 'byung ba'i rgyu dang / byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa thams cad du 'gro bas rnam par spyod pa'i smon lam gyis shing rta'i 'khor lo thogs pa med pa'i lam 'byung ba dang / rnam par dag par 'gyur ba'i rgyu dang / byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa'i gzi brjid kyi dba' rlabs kyis rnam par brgyan pa thams cad kyi rang bzhin dang / tshul gyi lam 'byung ba dang / rnam par dag par 'gyur ba'i rgyu dang / chos kyi phyogs dang / sgo thams cad kyi phyi ma'i mtha'i lam 'byung ba dang / rnam par dag par 'gyur ba'i rgyu dang / thams cad mkhyen pa'i rgya mtshor 'jug pa'i lam 'byung ba dang / rnam par dag par 'gyur ba'i rgyu 'di 'dri ba legs so/ /legs so/ /rigs kyi bu; kho bo ni rgya mtsho'i ngogs kyi grong khyer khang pa brtsegs pa 'di na/ byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa snying rje chen po'i rgyal mtshan yongs su sbyong zhing gnas te/ rigs kyi bu; kho bo ni 'dzam bu'i gling gi sems can phongs pa rnams mthong nas/ de dag gi don du dka' ba spyod de/ de dag gi bsam pa yongs su rdzogs par bya'o/ /'jig rten gyi zang zing gis yongs su bsdu bar bya'o/ /chos kyi longs spyod kyis de dag yongs su tshim par bya'o/ /de dag la bsod nams kyi tshogs kyi lam man ngag tu bstan par bya'o/ / ye shes kyi tshogs rnam par spel bar bya'o/ /dge ba'i rtsa ba'i stobs yongs su spel bar bya'o/ /byang chub kyi sems bskyed par bya'o/ /byang chub kyi bsam pa rnam par dag par bya'o/ / snying rje chen po'i stobs nye bar brtan par bya'o/ /'khor ba'i sdug bsngal rnam par zhi bar bya'o/ /'khor ba'i spyod pas yongs su mi skyo ba'i stobs shin tu brtan par bya'o/ /sems can rgya mtsho bsdu ba la 'di dag sbyar bar bya'o/ /yon tan rgya mtsho'i nan tan gyi sgo la dgod par bya'o/ /'di dag la chos rgya mtsho'i ye shes snang ba nye bar bsgrub par bya'o/ /sangs rgyas rgya mtsho thams cad kyang 'di dag gis mngon par mthong bar bya'o/ /thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi rgya mtsho la yang 'di dag gzud par bya'o zhes de lta bu'i bsam pa dang / yid la byed pa la brtson par kho bos rgya mtsho'i ngogs kyi grong khyer khang pa brtsegs pa 'di na gnas so/ /

Vaira said, “It is good that you aspire to supreme perfect enlightenment and ask about the means of attaining great knowledge, about the cause of the various miseries of the mundane whirl, about the means of arriving at the island of omniscience, about the means of producing the indestructible vehicle of universal salvation, about the means of attaining the path leading away from the danger of falling into the state of individual liberation, about the source of the path of knowledge of the way to attain all kinds of tranquil concentrations, about the source of the unobstructed path of the chariot of vows carrying the practice of enlightening beings which goes everywhere, about the means of development and purification of the path guided by the nature of enlightening practice adorned with all waves of energy, about the means of development and purification of the endless path facing all things, the means of development and purification of the path into the ocean of omniscience.
“I live in this coastal metropolis of Kutagara, purifying enlightening practice characterized by great compassion. Observing those on this continent who are poor, I practice such spiritual exercises as will cause their wishes to be fulfilled: I will take care of their mundane needs, and I will satisfy them with spiritual enjoyments; I will teach them the way to accumulate virtue, I will foster knowledge in them, I will promote the growth of the power of roots of goodness, I will inspire them to seek enlightenment, I will purify their aspiration for enlightenment, I will firmly establish their power of great compassion, I will get them to extinguish the misery of the mundane whirl, I will firmly establish their power to act in the mundane world without tiring, and I will get them to care for all living beings. I will set them at the gate of entry into the ocean of virtue, I will produce in them the light of knowledge of the ocean of truths, I will turn them toward the ocean of all buddhas, and I will plunge them into the ocean of omniscience.
“With these thoughts in mind I roam this city on the edge of the ocean.

rigs kyi bu/ kho bo ni de ltar 'gro ba la phan pa dang / bde bar brtson pas rgya mtsho chen po'i rin po che'i gling thams cad kyang shes so/ /rin po che'i 'byung gnas thams cad dang / rin po che'i rigs thams cad dang / rin po che'i gtos thams cad kyang rab tu shes so/ /klu'i gnas thams cad dang / klu 'khrug pa thams cad dang / gnod sbyin gyi gnas thams cad dang / gnod sbyin 'khrug pa thams cad dang / srin po'i gnas thams cad dang / srin po'i 'jigs pa thams cad rab tu zhi bar bya ba dang / 'byung po thams cad dang / 'byung po'i bar chad rnam par zhi bar bya ba yang rab tu shes te/ klong yod pa thams cad dang / klong thams cad bkol ba dang / dba' rlabs chen po yongs su spangs pa dang / chu'i kha dog rnam pa tha dad pa'ang rab tu shes so/ /nyi zla dang / gza' skar gyi tshogs yongs su 'khor ba dang / nyin zhag dang / skad cig dang / yud tsam dang / thang cig kyang rab tu shes so/ /phan tshun du 'gro ba'i shol 'dums dang / bde mi bde dang / gru'i 'khrul 'khor brtan par bya ba dang / gru bzur ba dang / gru phul ba dang / rlung brdo ba dang / rlung bskyed pa dang / gru bsgyur zhing bzlog pa dang / gru rtod pa dang / gru gtang ba'ang rab tu shes so/ /rigs kyi bu/ de ltar kho bo ni shes pa de lta bu dang ldan pas/ rtag tu sems can gyi don dang; dgos pa byed do/ tshong pa'i tshogs gru brtan pos lam bde zhing nye zhor mi 'gyur la/ mi 'jigs pa nas chos kyi gtam gyis dga' ba dang / spro ba bskyed cing bsam pa ji lta ba bzhin du rin po che'i gling du phyin par byas nas/ de dag rin po che thams cad kyis chog ste phun sum tshogs par 'gyur ba dang / phyir yang 'dzam bu'i gling du 'gyed 'gyed kyang / rigs kyi bu/ kho bo'i gru ni nam yang bub pa'am/ nye zhor gyur ma myong ste/ sems can gang gis kho bo mthong bar gyur pa dang / sems can gang gis kho bo'i chos bstan pa thos pa de dag kyang 'khor ba'i rgya mtsho thams cad du nye zhor 'gyur ba'i 'jigs pa dang bral bar 'gyur ro/ /thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi rgya mtshor 'jug pa'i ye shes kyang mngon sum du 'gyur ro/ /srid pa rgya mtsho bskam pa'i don du'ang rab tu 'jug par 'gyur te/ dus gsum rgya mtsho'i ye shes snang ba'ang rab tu 'thob bo/ /sems can thams cad kyi sdug bsngal rgya mtsho zad par bya ba'i phyir yang mngon par mos par 'gyur ro/ /sems can thams cad kyi sems rgya mtsho'i rnyog pa dang bar bya ba'i phyir yang rab tu brtson par 'gyur ro/ /zhing rgya mtsho thams cad rnam par dag par bya ba'i phyir brtson 'grus rtsom par 'gyur ro/ /phyogs rgya mtsho thams cad rgyas par dgang ba las kyang phyir mi ldog par 'gyur ro/ /'gro ba thams cad kyi dbang po rgya mtsho tha dad pa'ang khong du chud par 'gyur ro/ /sems can thams cad kyi spyod pa rgya mtsho'i rjes su'ang 'brang bar 'gyur ro/ /'gro ba'i bsam pa rgya mtsho ji lta ba bzhin du'ang gzugs brnyan 'byung bar 'gyur ro/ /

Thus committed to the welfare and happiness of the world, I know all the treasure islands in the ocean. I know all the deposits of precious substances, all the types of precious substances, and all the sources of precious substances. I know how to refine, bore out, extract, and produce all precious substances, and I know all precious vessels, tools, and objects, and the light of all precious substances. I know the abodes of all water spirits, the agitations of all water spirits, the abodes of all sprites, the agitations of all sprites, the abodes of all goblins, how to alleviate the danger of goblins, the abodes of all ghosts, and how to put an end to obstacles caused by ghosts. I know how to avoid all the whirlpools and billows, and I know the colors and depths of all the waters. I know the cycles of the sun, moon, stars, and planets, and the lengths of the days and nights. I know when to travel and when not to; I know when it is safe and when it is dangerous. I know the performance and soundness of the hull and rigging of ships. I know how to control and steer ships, I know how to catch the wind, I know where the winds rise from, I know how to direct the ship and how to turn it around, I know when to anchor and when to sail.
“With this knowledge, always engaged in working for the benefit of beings, with a sturdy ship, safe, peaceful, without anxiety, I convey merchants to the treasure islands of their choice, pleasing them with spiritual conversation. Having enriched them with all kinds of jewels, I bring them back to this continent. And I have never lost a single ship. All who see me or hear my spiritual instruction are freed from all fears of sinking in the ocean of the mundane whirl; they become aware of the knowledge of how to go into the ocean of omniscience, they learn how to evaporate the ocean of craving, they are illumined with knowledge of the ocean of past, present, and future, they become capable of annihilating the ocean of suffering of all sentient beings, they undertake to clear the turbidity of the ocean of minds of all sentient beings, they begin the heroic effort to purify the ocean of all lands, they never turn back from going throughout the ocean of all places, they penetrate the variety in the ocean of faculties of all sentient beings, they adapt to the ocean of actions of all sentient beings, and they appear in the ocean of the world intentionally according to the mental set.

rigs kyi bu/ kho bo ni byang chub sems dpa'i rnam par thar pa mthong ba dang / thos pa dang / 'grogs pa dang / rjes su dran pa'i chu klung gi dbyangs zhes bya ba thob par zad na/ kho bos byang chub sems dpa' 'khor ba'i rgya mtsho thams cad du rnam par spyod pa/ nyon mongs pa'i rgya mtsho thams cad kyis gos pa med pa/ lta ba'i rnam pa'i rgya mtsho thams cad kyi chags pa'i chu srin gyi 'jigs pa dang bral ba/ chos rgya mtsho thams cad kyi rang bzhin dang gzhi las rnam par rgyu ba/ 'gro ba rgya mtsho thams cad bsdu ba'i dngos pos yongs su sdud pa'i rgya mtsho dang ldan pa/ thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi rgya mtsho dang 'grogs pa/ sems can gyi mngon par chags pa'i rgya mtsho thams cad rab tu bsrub pa/ dus rgya mtsho thams cad dang tha mi dad par rnam par spyod pa/ 'gro ba rgya mtsho thams cad yongs su smin par bya ba'i dmigs shes pa/ 'gro ba rgya mtsho thams cad kyi 'dul ba'i dbres las mi 'da' ba de dag gi spyod pa shes pa'am/ yon tan brjod par nus re skan/

“I have attained this enlightening liberation which is characterized by great compassion and the sound of flowing water, and it is beneficial to see me, hear me, live with me, and remember my name; but how can I know the practice or tell of the virtues of the enlightening beings who traverse all the oceans of the mundane whirl, who are unaffected by the ocean of afflictions, who are free from the danger of being engulfed by the ocean of views, who travel the water of inherent nature of the ocean of all phenomena, who travel the ground of inherent nature of the ocean of all beings, who hold the net of means of salvation of all creatures from the oceans of the mundane, who abide in the ocean of omniscience, who pull all sentient beings out of the ocean of attachments, who remain continuously through the ocean of all times, who have true higher knowledge to perfect the ocean of all sentient beings, who do not miss the right occasions to guide the ocean of all sentient beings?

song / rigs kyi bu/ lho phyogs kyi rgyud 'di nyid na grong khyer dga' ba'i phreng ba zhes bya ba yod de/ de na tshong dpon rgyal ba dam pa zhes bya ba 'dug gi/ de'i gan du song la/ ji ltar byang chub sems dpas byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa la bslab par bya ba dang / ji ltar nan tan du bya ba dris shig /
“South of here is a city called Nandihara. An eminent man named Jayottama lives there. Go ask him how to learn and carry out the practice of enlightening beings.”

de nas tshong dpon gyi bu nor bzang gis/ mnyan pa dpa' bo'i rkang pa gnyis la spyi bos phyag byas nas/ mnyan pa dpa' bo la lan brgya stong du mas g.yas phyogs su bskor ba byas te/ yang dang yang blta sa nas/ gdong mchi mas bkang ste ngu zhing dge ba'i bshes gnyen blta bas ma ngoms bzhin du mnyan pa dpa' bo'i drung nas song ngo// //
Then Sudhana paid his respects and reluctantly left the mariner Vaira.
bam po dgu bcu bdun pa/

Jayottama

de nas tshong dpon gyi bu nor bzang / byams pa chen pos sems can gyi khams tshad med pa rgyas par dgang ba'i sems dang ldan pa/ snying rje chen po'i rlan gyis mngon par brlan pa'i rgyud can/ bsod nams dang / ye shes kyi tshogs rgya chen po'i rgyan shin tu bsags pa/ nyon mongs pa'i rdul dang / mun pa dang / dri ma dang / 'dam thams cad dang bral ba/ chos mnyam pa nyid khong du chud pas thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi lam gyen thur med pa la zhugs pa/ dge ba'i chos tshad med pa la 'jug pa'i sgor zhugs pa/ mi dge ba thams cad kyis mi shigs pa'i brtson 'grus brtan pa'i mthu sngon du 'dor ba dang ldan pa/ byang chub sems dpa'i ting nge 'dzin bsam gyis mi khyab pa rab tu byang ba/ rgya chen po'i bde ba rab tu thob pa/ shes rab kyi nyi ma'i 'od zer snang bas ma rig pa'i mun pa ma lus bar bsal ba; thabs kyi ser bu bde zhing bsil bas blags pa'i ye shes kyi me tog gis rgyas ba/ smon lam chen po'i rgya mtshor 'byung ba'i ye shes kyi tshul dang mthun pa/ chos kyi dbyings thams cad du thogs pa med par rgyas par 'gengs pa'i ye shes dang ldan pa/ thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi pho brang du thogs pa med par 'gro ba la mngon du gyur pa/ byang chub sems dpa'i lam la mngon par mos pa de/ grong khyer dga' ba'i phreng ba gang na ba der phyin te/ tshong dpon rgyal ba dam pa yongs su rmed cing tshol tshol ba la/ grong khyer dga' ba'i phreng ba'i shar phyogs logs kyi 'dab gcig na/ shing a sho ka'i nags tshal rgyal mtshan sna tshogs zhes bya ba 'dug pa de'i nang na/ khyim bdag stong phrag du ma zhig gis bskor te/ grong khyer gyi bya ba sna tshogs yongs su bgro zhing de las brten te/ bdag tu bya ba thams cad yang dag par gzhom pa dang / yongs su 'dzin pa thams cad yongs su gtang ba dang / dngos por 'dzin pa thams cad rab tu spang ba dang / mngon par zhen pa thams cad shin tu gzhig pa dang / srid pa'i 'ching ba thams cad gcad par bya ba dang / lta ba'i rnam pa thams cad kyi sgo glegs gcag pa dang / the tshom dang / yid gnyis dang / nem nur gyi rab rib thams cad rnam par bsal ba dang / g.yo sgyu'i rnyog pa shin tu gdang ba dang / phrag dog dang ser sna'i dri ma yongs su sbyang ba dang / sems kyi mtsho shin tu gsal bar bya ba dang / sems rnyog pa med pa la sems can rab tu dgod pa dang / dad pa rnyog pa med pa'i stobs bskyed de/ sangs rgyas blta bar mos pa bskyed pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i stobs bsngags shing sangs rgyas kyi chos yang dag par blangs pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa smos te/ byang chub sems dpa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi stobs yongs su bskyed pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i shes rab kyi stobs yang dag par ston cing / byang chub sems dpa'i dran pa'i stobs rnam par dag pa'i mthar phyin par bya ba'i phyir/ chos kyi gtam byed cing 'di lta ste/ byang chub tu sems bskyed pa la mngon par mos par bya ba'i phyir chos ston cing 'dug pa mthong ngo/ /
de nas tshong dpon gyi bu nor bzang gis gtam de'i rjes chad chad du bsdad nas/ tshong dpon rgyal ba dam pa'i rkang pa gnyis la spyi bos phyag 'tshal te/ ring mo zhig tu btud nas/ chos la shin tu gus pa'i bsam pas tshig 'di skad du brjod do/ /'phags pa/ bdag ni nor bzangnor bzang zhes bgyi ba ste/ byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa yongs su tshol na/ ci nas kyang bdag byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa la slob par 'gyur ba dang / bslabs nas kyang ci nas sems can thams cad yongs su smin par bgyi ba dang / gdul ba'i don la mngon du mos par 'gyur ba dang / sangs rgyas thams cad kyi zhal blta ba las mi 'phang ba dang / sangs rgyas thams cad kyi chos thos par 'gyur ba dang / sangs rgyas thams cad kyi chos kyi sprin gyi char yongs su gzung ba dang; sangs rgyas thams cad kyi chos kyi tshul la nan tan du bgyi ba dang / 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa spyad pa dang / bskal pa thams cad du gnas kyang byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pas yongs su mi skyo ba dang / de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi rnam par 'phrul pa yongs su 'tshal bar 'gyur ba dang / sangs rgyas thams cad kyi byin gyi rlabs yang dag par mnod pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi stobs rnams la snang ba thob par 'gyur ba de ltar 'phags pas bdag la bshad du gsol/

His mind filled with great love for the infinite realm of life, overflowing with great compassion, having amassed immense stores of virtue and knowledge, freed from the defilement of ignorance, passion, and all afflictions, realizing the equality of all things, proceeding equanimously on the path of omniscience, having eradicated the entryways into countless bad tendencies, proceeding heroically by the power of steadfast energy immune to all evils, filled with great calm by the inconceivable concentrations of an enlightening being, having thoroughly dispelled the darkness of ignorance by the light of the sun of wisdom, adorned with flowers of knowledge vivified by the moon of bliss and the breeze of means, according with the principles of knowledge of liberation through the ocean of great vows, imbued with knowledge pervading the reality realm unimpeded, facing the entrance of the imperishable city of omniscience, seeking the path of enlightening beings, Sudhana made his way to the city of Nandihara and sought out the eminent Jayottama, whom he saw in a grove at the eastern edge of the city, surrounded by thousands of elders, giving instructions regarding the various affairs of the city, in the course of which he was also talking about spirituality in order to get rid of all egoism, possessiveness, acquisitiveness, clinging to material things, dependency, binding cravings, impeding views, obscuring doubts, beclouding deceit and guile, defiling envy and jealousy, in order to clear and purify everyone’s minds, in order to inspire them to delight in the vision of buddhas by fostering the power of pure faith in them, in order to get them to accept the buddha-teachings by bringing forth the powers of enlightening beings in turn, in order to generate the power of concentration of enlightening beings by revealing to them the practices of enlightening beings, in order to purify enlightening beings’ power of recollection by showing them the power of wisdom of enlightening beings. Thus he was expounding the Teaching, to inspire them to seek enlightenment.
Sudhana went up to the grandee Jayottama, bowed to him, and with respect for the Teaching said, “I am Sudhana, O noble one, and I seek the practice of enlightening beings. Please tell me how to learn the practice of enlightening beings, how to orient myself to the disciplines that will perfect all sentient beings while I am learning, how to see all buddhas, how to hear the teaching of all buddhas, how to remember the multitudes of teachings of all buddhas, how to carry out the principles of the teachings of all buddhas, how to perform the practice of enlightening beings in all worlds, how to be indefatigable living in all ages by the practice of enlightening beings, how to perceive the transformation of all who have gone to Thusness, how to receive the empowerment of all buddhas, how to attain knowledge of the powers of all buddhas.”

Jayottama said to Sudhana, “It is good that you aspire to supreme perfect enlightenment. I am purifying the method of enlightening practice that goes everywhere, by the power of attainment of nondoing based on nonbeing. By this method of purification of enlightening practice going everywhere, I expound the Teaching in all realms of being in the universe, I oppose untruth, I stop controversy, conflict, strife, combat, and hostility. I cut through bonds and break prisons apart. I eliminate fears. I put an end to evildoing, I turn people away from killing, stealing, sexual misconduct, falsehood, slander, harshness, divisive talk, longing, malice, and false views. I get them to stop all compulsive activity and to pursue all right and good actions. I teach everyone all arts and crafts that bring benefit to the world. I elucidate, articulate, explain, and promote all sciences for the happiness of the world. I go along with all false doctrines in order to develop the people involved in them. In order to show the excellence of higher knowledge, to put a stop to all views, to inspire interest in the teaching of all buddhas, I approach all the celestial beings in the realm of form all the way up to the world of Brahma and expound the Teaching to them. And as I teach in this universe, so also do I teach in as many worlds as atoms in ten unspeakable numbers of decillions of buddha-lands. I teach the ways of buddhas, the ways of enlightening beings, the ways of Buddhist disciples, and the ways of individual illuminates. I teach about the hells, what leads to hell, and the motives and actions of beings in hell. I teach about animality, the types who tend toward animality, what leads to animality, and the misery of animalistic life. I teach about the underworld, what leads to the underworld, and the misery of the underworld. I teach about heavens, what leads to heaven, and the enjoyments of heaven. I teach about the human world, what leads to the human world, and the variety of pleasant and unpleasant experiences in the human world.

de ltar rigs kyi bu/ kho bo ni 'jig rten gyi chos kyang ston to/ /'jig rten kun 'byung ba dang / 'jig rten nub par 'gyur ba dang / 'jig rten gyi kha na ma tho ba dang / 'jig rten nas 'byung ba yang ston to/ /de yang 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa'i lam yang dag par bstan pa dang / 'khor ba'i skyon rnam par bzlog pa dang / thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi yon tan yang dag par brjod pa dang / srid pa'i lam gyi rgyud du mgo 'khor ba dang / sdug bsngal du gyur pa yang dag par bstan pa dang / sgrib pa med pa'i chos nyid brjod pa dang / 'jig rten rgyu ba'i bya ba yongs su bstan pa dang / 'jig rten 'byung ba dang / ldog pa'i bde ba dang / sdug bsngal thams cad smos pa dang / 'gro ba thams cad gnas kyi ming du bya ba rnam par bsgom pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i chos gnas pa med pa mngon par bstan pa dang / las dang nyon mongs pa'i 'khor lo thams cad rnam par bzlog pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i chos kyi 'khor lo 'khor ba shin tu brjod pa'i phyir chos ston to/ /

“Thus I teach about the law of the world, the formation of the world, the decline of the world, the pain of the world, and emancipation from the world; I expound the Teaching in order to explain the path of practice of enlightening beings, to remove the ills of the mundane world, to show the virtues of omniscience, to extinguish the pain of infatuation with states of being, to elucidate the unimpeded nature of reality, to clarify the ordinary conduct of the world, to point out the happiness and misery of the conduct of all beings in the world, to show the notions on which all worlds are based, to elucidate the independent state of those who realize Thusness, to fend off all active afflictions, and to show the progress of the wheel of teaching of the enlightened.

rigs kyi bu/ kho bo ni byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa rnam par dag pa'i sgo thams cad du 'gro ba/ dngos po med pa la gnas pas mngon par 'du bya ba med pa'i rdzu 'phrul gyi mthus brgyan pa 'di shes par zad na/ kho bos byang chub sems dpa' thams cad mngon par shes pa/ zhing gi dbyings thams cad du sgyu ma lta bu'i ye shes kyi lus kyis rgyas par 'gengs pa/ kun du lta ba'i ye shes kyis rab tu thob pa /tshig gi lam dang / sgra thams cad rnam par dmigs pa la shin tu gzhol ba'i rna ba dang ldan pa/ dus gsum rgyas par 'gengs pa'i chos kyi sgo snang ba la dbang rab tu thob pa/ chos thams cad la yang dag par gzhol ba'i ye shes la dbang bsgyur ba'i skyes bu dpa' bo sems can tshad med bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i bsam pa ji lta ba bzhin du rnam par dmigs par bya ba lam 'dres pa'i dbyangs kyi dkyil 'khor dang ldan pa'i lce yangs shing srab la yid du 'ong ba dang ldan pa/ bsam pa tha dad pa'i sems can rgya mtsho'i yid du 'ong ba'i kha dog dang dbyibs su ldan pa'i byang chub sems dpa' thams cad dang mnyam pa'i lus sgyu ma lta bu dang ldan pa/ de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad dang mi gnyis pa'i spyod lam gyi bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i lus la gzhol ba/ dus gsum thams cad du rjes su 'brang ba'i ye shes kyi lus dang ldan pa/ nam mkha'i dbyings ltar tshad med pa'i spyod yul dpag tu med pa'i yul dang ldan pa de dag gi spyod pa shes pa'am/ yon tan brjod par nus re skan/

“I know this method of purification of enlightening practice that goes everywhere, an undefiled manifestation of nondoing based on illumination. How can I know the practice or tell of the virtues of enlightening beings who have all mystic knowledges, who go throughout all lands with the body of knowledge of illusoriness, who have attained the stage of knowledge of the universal eye, who hear all utterances, who have attained control of the light of the way to truth that pervades past, present, and future, who are heroic masters of knowledge comprehending all things, who speak with the voice of totality communicating to infinite sentient beings according to their mentalities, who have phantom bodies the same as all enlightening beings pleasing to the masses of sentient beings with their various wishes, who are intent upon one and the same inconceivable body of all buddhas, whose body of knowledge pervades past, present, and future, whose sphere is as vast and measureless as the sky?

song / rigs kyi bu/ lho phyogs kyi rgyud 'di nyid kyi yul shu ma phyi ma'i mtha' na grong khyer ka ling+ka'i nags tshal zhes bya ba yod de/ de na dge slong ma seng ge rnam par bsgyings pa zhes bya ba 'dug gi /de'i gan du song la/ ji ltar byang chub sems dpas byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa la bslab par bya ba dang / ji ltar nan tan du bya ba dris shig /
“South of here, in the land of Shronaparanta, is a city called Kalingavana, where a nun named Sinhavijurmbhita lives. Go ask her how to learn and carry out the practice of enlightening beings.”

de nas tshong dpon gyi bu nor bzang gis/ tshong dpon rgyal ba dam pa'i rkang pa gnyis la spyi bos phyag 'tshal te/ tshong dpon rgyal ba dam pa la lan brgya stong du mar g.yas phyogs su bskor ba byas nas yang dang yang bltas te/ tshong dpon rgyal ba dam pa'i drung nas song ngo/ /
Then Sudhana paid his respects to Jayottama and left.

drop.crumb: seng ge rnam par bsgyings pa

fuse.drop: [dge slong ma seng ge rnam par bsgyings pa]
Sinhavijurmbhita
