de nas tshong dpon gyi bu nor bzang mthar gyis yul shu ma phyi ma'i mtha'i grong khyer ka ling+ka'i nags tshal gang na ba der song ste phyin nas/ dge slong ma seng ge rnam par bsgyings pa yongs su tshol zhing sems can kun la rmed pa'i tshe/ gang nas gang du song ba de dang der/ rogs pa brgya phrag du ma dang / bu mo brgya phrag du ma zhig srang dang / lam gyi bzhi mdo dang; lam gyi sum mdo dag nas tshogs te rjes su 'brang ngo/ /skyes pa brgya phrag du ma dang / bud med brgya phrag du ma zhig gis kyang / rigs kyi bu/ 'di re/ dge slong ma seng ge rnam par bsgyings pa ni/ grong khyer ka ling+ka'i nags tshal 'di nyid kyi bza' shing gi ra ba chen po rgyal ba'i 'od kyis byin pa nyi ma'i mdog na/ sems can tshad med pa'i don du chos ston cing 'dug go zhes bstan to/ /

Then Sudhana made his way to the city called Kalingavana in the land of Shronaparanta, where he asked everyone he met the whereabouts of the nun Sinhavijurmbhita. As he was looking for the nun, everywhere he went hundreds of boys and girls came together from the streets and intersections and blocked the way. There were also hundreds of men and women, who told him, “the nun Sinhavijurmbhita is in this city, staying in Sunlight Park, which was donated by Jayaprabha, where she is expounding the Teaching for the benefit of countless beings.”

de nas tshong dpon gyi bu nor bzang / bza' shing gi ra ba nyi ma'i mdog der phyin nas kun tu btsal te bltas na/ bza' shing gi ra ba de na/ shing zla ba shar ba zhes bya ba/ khang pa brtsegs pa'i dbyibs ltar 'dug pa/ 'od sna tshogs kyi kha dog can/ 'od kyi mdog dang ldan pa/ 'khor kun du dpag tshad kyi khyon tsam du 'od kyis rgyas par 'gengs pa mang po dang / lo ma'i shing yongs su 'gebs pa zhes bya ba/ gdugs kyi rnam pa dang / dbyibs su 'dug pa'i 'dab mas kun nas khebs pa/ bai DUr+ya sngon po'i kha dog ltar 'dug pa'i sprin gyi mdog dang ldan pa mang po dang / me tog gi shing me tog gi mdzod ces bya ba/ ri'i rgyal po kha ba can ltar mdangs dga' ba'i dbyibs sna tshogs dang ldan pa/ kha dog sna tshogs kyi me tog mi zad pa'i char rab tu 'bebs pa/ sum cu rtsa gsum gyi lha'i pho brang gi rgyan gyis kun nas 'du ba dang / sus kyang mi shigs pa lta bu mang po dang / shing tog gi shing rtag tu smin pa'i ro dpe med pa'i 'bras bu'i tshogs zhes bya ba/ gser gyi ri bo'i lhun ltar 'dug pa/ rtag tu shing tog phun sum tshogs par gnas pa mang po dang / rin po che'i rgyal po'i shing rnam par snang ba'i mdzod ces bya ba/ rin po che'i rgyal po dpe med pa'i dbyibs ltar 'dug pa/ lha rdzas kyi rin po che'i phreng ba dang / se mo do dang / rgyan rin po che yid bzhin gyi rgyal po'i mdzod nas byung ba ltar phun sum tshogs pa dang ldan pa/ rin po che kha dog grangs med pa'i 'byung gnas su gyur pa mang po dang / gos kyi shing dga' bar byed pa zhes bya ba/ lha rdzas kyi gos rin po che kha dog sna tshogs kyi tshogs rab tu 'gyed cing 'phyang bas shin tu brgyan pa mang po dang / rol mo'i shing dga' ba bskyed pa zhes bya ba/ lha rdzas las kyang lhag pa'i rol mo yid du 'ong ba'i sgra snyan pa 'byin pa mang po dang / spos kyi shing kun tu zhim pas brgyan pa zhes bya ba/ phyogs thams cad du thogs pa med par rnam pa thams cad du yid du 'ong ba'i spos kyi ngad 'byung ba mang po dag kyang yod par mthong / mtshe'u dang / lu ma dang / lteng ka dang / rdzing bu rin po che bdun gyi pha gus mtha' brtsigs pa/ phyogs bzhi nas rin po che'i them skas btsugs pa/ rin po che sna tshogs kyi khri 'phang dus dang mthun pa'i tsan dan gyi dri zhim pos bskus pas kun nas bskor ba/ gzhi rin po che'i rgyal po bai DUr+ya sngon po las legs par blangs pa/ 'dzam bu chu klung gi gser gyi bye ma bdal ba/ yan lag brgyad dang ldan pa'i chu lha rdzas kyi dri yid du 'ong ba can gyis yongs su gang ba/ rin po che'i pad+mo dang / ut+pa la dang / ku mud dang / me tog pun da ri ka kha dog sna tshogs lha rdzas kyi bsung dang ldan pas chu kun nas yog pa/ bya bran sna tshogs kyi khyu lha rdzas las kyang 'das pa'i gzugs yid du 'ong ba dang ldan pa /sgra snyan pa 'byin cing brjod pas gang ba/ lha rdzas kyi rin po che sna tshogs kyi shing gi phreng ba legs par bkye bas yongs su bskor cing brgyan pa dang ldan pa/

So then Sudhana went to this Sunlight Park and looked all around. In the park he saw trees called “moon-risen,” which were covered like pavilions, of flamelike color and blazing radiance, lighting up the space of a league all around. He also saw leafy trees called “completely covering,” which are shaped like parasols, their clustered leaves providing shade, shining like blue crystal clouds. He saw flowering trees called “treasury of flowers,” which had various pleasing forms like the Himalaya Mountains and showered endless streams of varicolored flowers, like the trees of paradise adorning the heavens. He also saw ever-ripe sweet fruit trees called “gathering of fruits of indescribable sweetness,” which had the appearance of golden polar mountains and were always bearing fruit. He also saw jewel trees called “treasury of radiance,” which looked like incomparable jewels and bore riches in buds producing garlands and ornaments of celestial jewels and wish-fulfilling gems, and were adorned by jewels of countless colors. He also saw trees of cloth called “soothing,” from which hung precious celestial cloths of various colors. He also saw trees of musical instruments called “pleasing,” which produced music more sweet and pleasant than that of the heavens. He also saw trees of fragrance called “gracing everywhere,” which pervaded everywhere with all kinds of pleasing fragrances. There were also cool lotus ponds, with steps made of bricks of seven precious substances arrayed on four sides, surrounded by benches of various jewels painted with sandalwood fragrance, set in ground made of blue lapis lazuli, the bottom covered with gold sand, the ponds filled with water pleasantly scented with celestial fragrance, the surface of the water covered with varicolored lotuses of heavenly scent and texture, the air around them filled with the songs of birds, more lovely than the heavens, all surrounded by rows of beautiful trees of various celestial treasures.

shing sna tshogs de dag gi drung thams cad du'ang / rin po che'i seng ge'i khri sna tshogs yid du 'ong ba'i gzugs dang ldan pa/ rin po che sna tshogs kyi rgyan bsam gyis mi khyab pa du mas brgyan pa/ lha rdzas kyi stan rin po che sna tshogs 'brel bar bting ba/ lha rdzas kyi spos dang / bdug spos kyi rnam pa thams cad kyis bdugs pa/ lha rdzas las kyang 'das pa'i dar rin po che mngon par dpyangs pa/ rin po che sna tshogs kyi bla re bkye ba/ rin po che sna tshogs dang / 'dzam bu chu klung gi gser gyi dra ba sna tshogs kun nas bres pa/ rin po che'i dril gyi dra ba yid du 'ong zhing snyan pa'i sgra 'byin pa mang pos brgyan pa/ 'khor du lha rdzas kyi rin po che'i stan brgya stong phrag du ma bting zhing bshams pa mthong ngo/ /rin po che'i shing drung la lar ni seng ge'i khri rin po che'i pad+mo snying po can bshams pa mthong ngo/ /la lar ni seng ge'i khri nor bu rin po che spos kyi rgyal po'i pad+mos snying po byas pa bshams pa mthong ngo/ /la lar ni seng ge'i khri rin po che'i rgyal po klu'i rgyan gyi pad+mos snying po byas pa bshams pa mthong ngo/ /la lar ni seng ge'i khri nor bu rin po che'i rgyal po seng ge'i bya la'i pad+mos snying po byas pa bshams pa mthong ngo/ /la lar ni seng ge'i khri rin po che'i rgyal po rnam par snang ba'i pad+mos snying po byas pa bshams pa mthong ngo/ /la lar ni seng ge'i khri rin po che'i rgyal po phyogs rnam par snang ba'i pad+mos snying po byas pa bshams pa mthong ngo/ /la lar ni seng ge'i khri rin po che'i rgyal po dbang po'i rdo rje'i pad+mos snying po byas pa bshams pa mthong ngo/ /la lar ni seng ge'i khri rin po che'i rgyal po 'gro ba'i yid du 'ong ba'i pad+mos snying po byas pa bshams pa mthong ngo/ /rin po che'i shing drung la lar ni seng ge'i khri rin po che'i rgyal po mdog dkar po'i pad+mos snying po byas pa bshams pa mthong ngo/ /

shing sna tshogs de dag gi drung thams cad du'ang / rin po che'i seng ge'i khri sna tshogs yid du 'ong ba'i gzugs dang ldan pa/ rin po che sna tshogs kyi rgyan bsam gyis mi khyab pa du mas brgyan pa/ lha rdzas kyi stan rin po che sna tshogs 'brel bar bting ba/ lha rdzas kyi spos dang / bdug spos kyi rnam pa thams cad kyis bdugs pa/ lha rdzas las kyang 'das pa'i dar rin po che mngon par dpyangs pa/ rin po che sna tshogs kyi bla re bkye ba/ rin po che sna tshogs dang / 'dzam bu chu klung gi gser gyi dra ba sna tshogs kun nas bres pa/ rin po che'i dril gyi dra ba yid du 'ong zhing snyan pa'i sgra 'byin pa mang pos brgyan pa/ 'khor du lha rdzas kyi rin po che'i stan brgya stong phrag du ma bting zhing bshams pa mthong ngo/ /rin po che'i shing drung la lar ni seng ge'i khri rin po che'i pad+mo snying po can bshams pa mthong ngo/ /la lar ni seng ge'i khri nor bu rin po che spos kyi rgyal po'i pad+mos snying po byas pa bshams pa mthong ngo/ /la lar ni seng ge'i khri rin po che'i rgyal po klu'i rgyan gyi pad+mos snying po byas pa bshams pa mthong ngo/ /la lar ni seng ge'i khri nor bu rin po che'i rgyal po seng ge'i bya la'i pad+mos snying po byas pa bshams pa mthong ngo/ /la lar ni seng ge'i khri rin po che'i rgyal po rnam par snang ba'i pad+mos snying po byas pa bshams pa mthong ngo/ /la lar ni seng ge'i khri rin po che'i rgyal po phyogs rnam par snang ba'i pad+mos snying po byas pa bshams pa mthong ngo/ /la lar ni seng ge'i khri rin po che'i rgyal po dbang po'i rdo rje'i pad+mos snying po byas pa bshams pa mthong ngo/ /la lar ni seng ge'i khri rin po che'i rgyal po 'gro ba'i yid du 'ong ba'i pad+mos snying po byas pa bshams pa mthong ngo/ /rin po che'i shing drung la lar ni seng ge'i khri rin po che'i rgyal po mdog dkar po'i pad+mos snying po byas pa bshams pa mthong ngo/ /

bza' shing gi ra ba de'i gzhi thams cad kyang rin po che sna tshogs kyis yongs su gang zhing / rgya mtsho chen po ltar rin po che'i gling gis yongs su gang ba mthong ngo; ;bai DUr+ya sngon po'i dam pas spras te/ rin po che thams cad kyis brgyan pa'i sa'i phyogs ka tsa lin da ltar reg na bde zhing 'jam yang / gom pa bor zhing bteg pa'i tshe/ mtho dman med pa rdo rje rin po che'i mchog gi pad+mo dri yid du 'ong bar zhim zhing reg na bde ba'i sil ma kun tu bkram pa/ ngang ngur dang / rma bya dang / khrung khrung dang / kun la dang / ka la ping+ka dang / ko ki la dang / dzi ban dzi ba ka sgra snyan cing yid du 'ong ba'i nga ro 'byin pa mang pos gang ba/ lha rdzas kyi rin po che'i tsan dan gyi shing mang po'i nags tshal shin tu legs par 'grigs pas mdzes par brgyan pa/ rin po che sna tshogs kyi pad+mo'i sprin gyi char dang / rin po che'i me tog sna tshogs mi zad pa'i char rgyun du 'bab pa/ 'bres pa'i nags tshal las kyang khyad par du 'phags pa/ rin po che sna tshogs kyi khang bu brtsegs ma rgyan par bkod pa'i nang nas/ spos kyi rgyal po'i bdug spos rin thang med pa rtag tu 'thul zhing zhim pa/ lha'i 'dun sa chos bzang po'i rgyan las kyang lhag pas brgyan pa/ lha rdzas las kyang 'das pa'i rin po che'i dra ba sna tshogs kyis kun tu bres pa/ mu tig rin po che'i me tog gi phreng ba dang / lda ldi kun nas bres pas rab tu brgyan pa/ rin po che'i dril bu rnam pa sna tshogs su rnam par bkye ba'i gser gyi dra ba 'bar bas kun nas dkrigs pa/ rol mo'i shing dang / rin po che'i ta la las dril bu'i dra ba rlung gis legs par bskyod pas yid du 'ong ba'i sgra snyan pa'i dbyangs 'byung ba dang ldan pa/ dbang sgyur gyi lha'i rgyal po'i lha mo dpe tshul shin tu bzang ba rnams kyis/ glu snyan pa'i sgra rab tu yid du 'ong ba blang ba/ lha rdzas kyi yid bzhin gyi gos kha dog sna tshogs kyi sprin gyi char rab tu 'bab pas rnam par mdzes pa/ rgya mtsho chen po ltar kha dog dang / mdog sna tshogs su ldan pas blta na gtang mi bra ba/ khang pa brtsegs pa'i rin po che'i rgyan dang ldan pa brgya stong grangs med pas rab tu brgyan pa/ sum cu rtsa gsum gyi lha'i pho brang ltar blta na bzang ba/ rin po che sna tshogs rnam par phye bas rnam pa thams cad du brgyan pa'i gdugs shin tu legs pa rnam par bsgreng zhing bkram pas kun nas blta na mdzes pa/ dbang po chen po'i 'jig rten ltar shin tu mdzes pa'i de'u sna tshogs kyis brgyan pa/ yid du 'ong ba'i 'od snang ba chen po rtag par 'byung ba/ tshangs pa chen po'i gzhal med khang ltar nor bu rin po che'i rgyal po 'gro ba'i yid du 'ong ba'i 'od kyis 'bar ba ste/ bza' shing gi ra ba chen po nyi ma'i mdog ces bya ba de/ dge slong ma seng ge rnam par bsgyings pa'i rdzu 'phrul gyi mthu stobs dang / byin gyi rlabs che zhing bsam gyis mi khyab pas/ 'jig rten gyi khams grangs med pa'i gnas su gyur pa'i nam mkha'i dbyings ltar yangs shing tshad med de/ rgya chen po dang ldan par mthong ngo/ /

He saw that the ground of the whole park was scattered with various jewels, just as the ocean is scattered with jewel islands. The earth, studded with blue lapis lazuli and inlaid with all kinds of jewels, was soft and pleasant to the touch, and would give way and spring back as one walked on it. The grounds were covered with diamond lilies, of pleasant texture and lovely scent. The sweet sounds of the calls of various birds were heard, and the park was graced with well-arrayed stands of heavenly precious sandalwood trees. There were endless streams of jewel blossoms raining from clouds of various jewel flowers in a magnificent array surpassing the pleasure garden of Indra, chief of gods. There were well-spaced towers with various incomparably fragrant incenses always burning, more magnificent than Indra’s hall of justice, covered above with nets of various jewels surpassing those of the heavens, hung with garlands of pearl flowers spread all over with nets of shining gold arrayed with jewel bells. Trees of various musical instruments, jewel palm trees with nets of bells, played sweet music as they were stirred by the breeze, and the singing of goddesses was also heard. The park was splendidly adorned by rain from clouds of radiant celestial cloths, of infinite colors like the ocean, lovely to see. He saw Sunlight Park adorned with hundreds of thousands of towers arrayed with inconceivable, innumerable jewels, beautiful as the castle of the god Indra. It was adorned with arrays of all kinds of jewels, everywhere graced with arrays of beautifully formed parasols, always radiating pleasing light, like the abode of the god Brahma, shining with world-illumining light. It was as vast as a space that holds innumerable worlds. Sudhana saw this Sunlight Park by the strength of the mystic power of the nun Sinhavijurmbhita.

de nas tshong dpon gyi bu nor bzang gis/ de ltar yon tan tshad med pa bsam gyis mi khyab pa tshogs pa'i bza' shing gi ra ba'i rgyan byang chub sems dpa'i las kyi rnam par smin pas yongs su grub pa/ 'jig rten las 'das pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba rgya chen po las skyes pa/ sangs rgyas la mchod cing / rim gror byas pa'i rgyu mthun pa bsam gyis mi khyab pa las byung ba/ 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad na yod pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba ma lus pas mi 'phrogs pa/ chos kyi rang bzhin sgyu ma'i rnam pa lta bus grub pa/ dge ba'i bsod nams dri ma med pa rgya chen pos grub cing byung ba/ dge slong ma seng ge rnam par bsgyings pa'i sngon gyi spyod pa bzang po legs par byas pa dang / rgyu mthun pa'i stobs dang shugs kyis byung ba/ nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas thams cad dang thun mong ma yin pa/ mu stegs can dang; phas kyi rgol ba thams cad kyis mi 'phrogs pa/ bdud kyi lam yongs su rgyu ba thams cad kyis mi tshugs pa/ byis pa so so'i skye bo thams cad kyis bltar med par mthong ste

Sudhana looked all over and saw these magnificent adornments of the park, replete with infinite, inconceivable qualities, perfected by the maturation of the work of the enlightening being, born of vast supramundane roots of good, deriving from making offerings to inconceivably many buddhas, unsurpassed by all worldly goodness, sprung forth from the illusory nature of phenomena, composed of the results of extensive pure good works, without contamination, produced by the power deriving from the past virtuous actions of the nun Sinhavijurmbhita, unique, beyond the individually liberated, immune to the destructive influence of false teachers, imperceptible to maniacs and ignoramuses.

shing sna tshogs de dag gi drung gi seng ge'i khri chen po de dag la'ang / dge slong ma seng ge rnam par bsgyings pa lus shin tu mdzes pa/ spyod lam zhi ba/ dbang po zhi ba; yid zhi ba/ shin tu dben pa/ dbang po thul ba/ glang po ltar shin tu dul ba/ mtsho ltar shing gsal la rnyog pa med pa'i sems dang ldan pa/ rin po che'i rgyal po yid bzhin gyi nor bu ltar 'dod pa thams cad sgrub pa/ pad+mo la chus mi chags pa ltar 'jig rten gyi chos kyis ma gos pa/ seng ge ltar 'jigs pa dang / skyi g.ya'i ba med pa/ mi 'jigs pa rnam par dag pas ri'i dbang po chen po ltar mi sgul ba/ tshul khrims rnam par dag pas yid du 'ong ba'i spos kyi rgyal po ltar 'gro ba'i sems tshim par byed pa/ kha ba'i tsan dan ltar nyon mongs pa'i gdung ba rab tu zhi bar byed pa/ sman gyi rgyal po blta na bzang ba ltar 'gro ba thams cad kyi sdug bsngal rnam par zhi bar byed pa/ chu'i lha'i zhags pa ltar blta na don yod pa/ de bzhin gshegs pa'i 'od ltar lus dang sems kyi bag yangs bde ba bskyed pa/ tshangs pa chen po ltar 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug gi kun nas ldang ba dang bral ba/ rin po che'i rgyal po nor bu chu 'dang ltar nyon mongs pas rnyog pa can du gyur pa'i sems can gyi sems rab tu par byed pa/ zhing gshin pa ltar dge ba'i rtsa ba rnam par 'phel bar byed pa 'dug par mthong ngo/ /'khor gyi stan de dag la'ang 'khor sna tshogs 'khod par mthong ste/

In all of those lion seats under the various precious trees he saw the nun Sinhavijurmbhita sitting, surrounded by a great company of followers, calm, composed, her senses and mind quiet, well controlled, her senses subdued, as restrained as an elephant, her mind pellucid and clear as a deep pool, granter of all desires like a wish-fulfilling jewel, unaffected by worldly things as a lotus is not clung to by water, fearless as a lion, with polished expertise, unshakable as a mountain, pure in conduct, soothing the minds of beings like intoxicating perfume, extinguishing the burning of afflictions like sandalwood from the snowy mountains, alleviating the pains of all sentient beings like the medicine “good to see,” beneficial to all who behold her, producing the physical and mental bliss of quiescence like the light of a buddha free from the ills and delusions of passion, clearing the minds of sentient beings polluted by afflictions like the water-purifying crystal, promoting the growth of roots of virtue like a good field. He saw her sitting in those seats, with various audiences in the surrounding seats.

'khor gyi stan la la la ni lha'i bu dbang po chen po la sogs pa gtsang ma'i gnas kyi ris su gtogs pa'i lha'i bu rnams 'khod cing / dge slong ma seng ge rnam par bsgyings pas/ chos kyi sgo rnam par thar pa mi zad pa yang dag par 'byed pa zhes bya ba yang dag par bstan pa mthong ngo/ /'khor gyi stan la la la ni tshangs pa yid du 'ong ba la sogs pa tshangs pa'i ris su gtogs pa'i lha'i bu rnams 'khod cing / dge slong ma seng ge rnam par bsgyings pas/ dbyangs kyi dkyil 'khor rnam par dag pa gzhi kun nas 'byed pa zhes bya ba yang dag par bstan pa mthong ngo/ /'khor gyi stan la la la ni lha'i rgyal po dbang sgyur la sogs pa gzhan 'phrul dbang byed kyi lha'i bu/ lha'i bu mo'i 'khor dang bcas pa dag 'khod cing / dge slong ma seng ge rnam par bsgyings pas/ chos kyi sgo byang chub sems dpa'i bsam pa rnam par dag pa'i dbang gis rnam par brgyan pa zhes bya ba yang dag par bstan pa mthong ngo/ /'khor gyi stan la la la ni lha'i rgyal po rab 'phrul dga' la sogs pa 'phrul dga'i lha'i bu/ lha'i bu mo'i 'khor dang bcas pa rnams 'khod cing / dge slong ma seng ge rnam par bsgyings pas/ chos kyi sgo chos thams cad dge bas rnam par brgyan pa zhes bya ba yang dag par bstan pa mthong ngo/ /'khor gyi stan la la la ni lha'i rgyal po rab dga' ldan la sogs pa dga' ldan gyi ris su gtogs pa'i lha'i bu/ lha'i bu mo'i 'khor dang bcas pa rnams 'khod cing / dge slong ma seng+ge rnam par bsgyings pas/ chos kyi sgo rang gi sems kyi mdzod kyi klong zhes bya ba yang dag par bstan pa mthong ngo/ /'khor gyi stan la la la ni lha'i rgyal po rab mtshe ma la sogs pa lha'i bu/ lha'i bu mo'i 'khor dang bcas pa rnams 'khod cing / dge slong ma seng+ge rnam par bsgyings pas/ chos kyi sgo rgyan mtha' yas pa zhes bya ba yang dag par bstan pa mthong ngo/ /'khor gyi stan la la la ni lha'i rgyal po brgya byin la sogs pa sum cu rtsa gsum gyi ris su gtogs pa'i lha'i bu/ lha'i bu mo'i 'khor dang bcas pa rnams 'khod cing / dge slong ma seng+ge rnam par bsgyings bas/ chos kyi sgo skyo ba'i sgo zhes bya ba yang dag par bstan pa mthong ngo/ /'khor gyi stan la la la ni klu'i rgyal po gangs chen mtsho la sogs pa klu'i rgyal po 'od brgya pa dang / dga' bo dang / bsnyen dga' bo dang / yid du 'ong ba dang / shugs ldan dang / ma dros pa la sogs pa klu'i bu mo'i 'khor dang bcas pa/ klu'i byis pa'i 'khor dang bcas pa rnams 'khod cing / dge slong ma seng+ge rnam par bsgyings pas/ chos kyi sgo sangs rgyas kyi rdzu 'phrul dang yul gyi 'od kyi rgyan ces bya ba yang dag par bstan pa mthong ngo/ /'khor gyi stan la la la ni rgyal po chen po ngal bso po la sogs pa gnod sbyin gyi dbang po/ gnod sbyin gyi bu mo dang / gnod sbyin gyi byis pa'i 'khor dang bcas pa rnams 'khod cing / dge slong ma seng+ge rnam par bsgyings pas/ chos kyi sgo 'gro ba thams cad yongs su skyob pa'i mdzod ces bya ba yang dag par bstan pa mthong ngo/ /'khor gyi stan la la la ni dri za'i rgyal po gnas srung po la sogs pa dri za mang po dri za'i bu mo dang; dri za'i byis pa'i 'khor dang bcas pa rnams 'khod cing / dge slong ma seng+ge rnam par bsgyings pas/ chos kyi sgo dga' ba mi zad pa'i char rab tu 'bab pa zhes bya ba yang dag par bstan pa mthong ngo/ /'khor gyi stan la la la ni lha ma yin gyi dbang po sgra gcan na la sogs pa lha ma yin gyi bu mo dang / lha ma yin gyi byis pa'i 'khor dang bcas pa rnams 'khod cing / dge slong ma seng+ge rnam par bsgyings pas/ chos kyi sgo chos kyi dbyings shes pa'i tshul gyi shugs kyis brgyan pa zhes bya ba yang dag par bstan pa mthong ngo/ /'khor gyi stan la la la ni nam mkha' lding gi dbang po shugs 'dzin chen po la sogs pa nam mkha' lding gi dbang po/ nam mkha' lding gi bu mo dang / nam mkha' lding gi byis pa'i 'khor dang bcas pa rnams 'khod cing / dge slong ma seng+ge rnam par bsgyings pas/ chos kyi sgo srid pa'i rgya mtshos 'jigs pa'i yul zhes bya ba yang dag par bstan pa mthong ngo/ /'khor gyi stan la la la ni mi 'am ci'i rgyal po sdong po la sogs pa mi 'am ci'i dbang po/ mi 'am ci'i bu mo dang / mi 'am ci'i byis pa'i 'khor dang bcas pa rnams 'khod cing / dge slong ma seng+ge rnam par bsgyings pas; chos kyi sgo sangs rgyas kyi spyod pa snang ba zhes bya ba yang dag par bstan pa mthong ngo/ /'khor gyi stan la la la ni lto 'phye chen po'i dbang po khro gnyer gdong la sogs pa lto 'phye chen po'i bu mo dang / lto 'phye chen po'i byis pa'i 'khor dang bcas pa rnams 'khod cing / dge slong ma seng+ge rnam par bsgyings pas/ chos kyi sgo sangs rgyas la dga' ba skye zhes bya ba yang dag par bstan pa mthong ngo/ /'khor gyi stan la la la ni skyes pa dang / bud med dang / khye'u dang / bu mo brgya stong mang po 'khod cing / dge slong ma seng+ge rnam par bsgyings pas/ chos kyi sgo khyad par du 'gro ba zhes bya ba yang dag par bstan pa mthong ngo/ /'khor gyi stan la la la ni srin po'i dbang po rtag tu mdangs 'phrog sdong po'i rgyal po la sogs pa srin po'i dbang po/ srin po'i bu mo dang / sprin po'i byis pa'i 'khor dang bcas pa rnams 'khod cing / dge slong ma seng+ge rnam par bsgyings pas/ chos kyi sgo snying rje 'byung ba zhes bya ba yang dag par bstan pa mthong ngo/ /'khor gyi stan la la la ni sems can nyan thos kyi theg pa la mos pa rnams 'khod cing / dge slong ma seng+ge rnam par bsgyings pas/ chos kyi sgo ye shes khyad par du 'phags pa'i mthu zhes bya ba yang dag par bstan pa mthong ngo/ /'khor gyi stan la la la ni sems can rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa la mos pa rnams 'khod cing / dge slong ma seng+ge rnam par bsgyings pas/ chos kyi sgo sangs rgyas kyi yon tan rgya chen po'i 'od ces bya ba yang dag par bstan pa mthong ngo/ /'khor gyi bstan la la la ni sems can theg pa chen po la mos pa rnams 'khod cing / dge slong ma seng+ge rnam par bsgyings pas/ ting nge 'dzin gyi ye shes snang ba'i sgo kun du sgo zhes bya ba yang dag par bstan pa mthong ngo/ /'khor gyi stan la la la ni byang chub sems dpa' thog mar sems bskyed pa rnams 'khod cing / dge slong ma seng+ge rnam par bsgyings pas/ ting nge 'dzin gyi sgo sangs rgyas thams cad kyi smon lam gyi phung po zhes bya ba yang dag par bstan pa mthong ngo/ /'khor gyi stan la la la ni sbyang chub sems dpa' sa gnyis pa la gnas pa rnams 'khod cing / dge slong ma seng+ge rnam par bsgyings pas/ ting nge 'dzin gyi sgo rdul dang bral ba'i dkyil 'khor ces bya ba yang dag par bstan pa mthong ngo/ /'khor gyi bstan la la la ni byang chub sems dpa' sa gsum pa la gnas pa rnams 'khod cing; dge slong ma seng+ge rnam par bsgyings pas/ ting nge 'dzin gyi sgo rab tu zhi ba'i rgyan ces bya ba yang dag par bstan pa mthong ngo/ /'khor gyi stan la la la ni byang chub sems dpa' sa bzhi pa la gnas pa rnams 'khod cing / dge slong ma seng ge rnam par bsgyings pas/ ting nge 'dzin gyi sgo thams cad mkhyen pa'i shugs kyi yul 'byung ba zhes bya ba yang dag par bstan pa mthong ngo/ /'khor gyi stan la la la ni byang chub sems dpa' sa lnga pa la gnas pa rnams 'khod cing / dge slong ma seng ge rnam par bsgyings pas/ ting nge 'dzin gyi sgo sems kyi rgyud me tog gi snying po zhes bya bas yang dag par bstan pa mthong ngo/ /'khor gyi stan la la la ni byang chub sems dpa' sa drug pa la gnas pa rnams 'khod cing / dge slong ma seng ge rnam par bsgyings pas/ ting nge 'dzin gyi sgo rnam par snang ba'i snying po zhes bya ba yang dag par bstan pa mthong ngo/ /'khor gyi stan la la la ni byang chub sems dpa' sa bdun pa la gnas pa rnams 'khod cing / dge slong ma seng+ge rnam par bsgyings pas/ ting nge 'dzin gyi sogs kun nas brgyan pa zhes bya ba yang dag par bstan pa mthong ngo/ /'khor gyi stan la la la ni byang chub sems dpa' sa brgyad pa la gnas pa rnams 'khod cing / dge slong ma seng ge rnam par bsgyings pas/ ting nge 'dzin gyi sgo chos kyi dbyings su lus shin tu rnam par phye ba'i yul zhes bya ba yang dag par bstan pa mthong ngo/ /'khor gyi stan la la la ni byang chub sems dpa' sa dgu pa la gnas pa rnams 'khod cing / dge slong ma seng ge rnam par bsgyings pas; chos kyi sgo mi dmigs pa'i stobs kyis gnas kyi sa bstan pa zhes bya ba yang dag par bstan pa mthong ngo/ /'khor gyi stan la la la ni byang chub sems dpa' sa bcu pa la gnas pa rnams 'khod cing / dge slong ma seng ge rnam par bsgyings pas/ ting nge 'dzin gyi sgo sgrib pa med pa'i dkyil 'khor ces bya ba yang dag par bstan pa mthong ngo/ /'khor gyi stan la la la ni lag na rdo rje'i 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor 'khod cing / dge slong ma seng ge rnam par bsgyings pas/ chos kyi sgo ye shes rdo rje mthu bo che'i rgyan ces bya ba yang dag par bstan pa mthong ngo/ /

In one setting he saw the nun surrounded by gods of the heaven of pure abodes, expounding a doctrine called unity with endless liberation; in another he saw her surrounded by gods of Brahma’s heaven, expounding a purity of the sphere of the voice called division of the universal ground; in another he saw her surrounded by gods and goddesses of the heaven of control of others’ emanations, expounding a doctrine called array of powers of purification of mind of enlightening beings; in another he saw her surrounded by gods and goddesses of the heaven of enjoyable emanations, expounding a doctrine called pure array of all phenomena; in another he saw her surrounded by gods and goddesses of the heaven of satisfaction, expounding a doctrine called resorting to the treasury of one’s own mind; in another he saw her surrounded by gods and goddesses of the heaven of timely portion, expounding a doctrine called endless array; in another he saw her surrounded by gods and goddesses of the thirty-three-fold heaven, expounding a doctrine called the method of rejecting; in another he saw her surrounded by water spirits, nymphs, and sprites, expounding a doctrine called array of lights of the sphere of buddhas; in another he saw her surrounded by demigods and demigoddesses and their children, expounding a doctrine called treasury of salvation of the world; in another he saw her surrounded by celestial musicians, expounding a doctrine called endless giving of delight; in another he saw her surrounded by titans, with their wives and children, expounding a doctrine called manifestation of power of reason in the knowledge of the reality realm; in another he saw her surrounded by fantastic birds, expounding a doctrine called the sphere of action concerned with alarming those in the ocean of existence; in another he saw her surrounded by centaurs expounding a doctrine called the range of manifestation of the action of Buddha; in another he saw her surrounded by great serpents, expounding a doctrine called production of the joy of the enlightened; in another he saw her surrounded by hundreds of thousands of women, men, boys and girls, expounding a doctrine called higher reaches of knowledge; in another he saw her surrounded by goblins, expounding a doctrine called production of compassion; in another he saw her surrounded by people devoted to the vehicle of listeners, expounding a doctrine called higher power of knowledge; in another he saw her surrounded by people devoted to the vehicle of individual illumination, expounding a doctrine called splendor of the illustrious virtues of buddhas; in another he saw her surrounded by people devoted to the Great Vehicle of universal enlightenment, expounding a medium of light of knowledge of concentration called door to totality; in another he saw her surrounded by enlightening beings who had just been inspired to seek enlightenment, expounding a medium of concentration called multitude of vows of all buddhas; in another he saw her surrounded by enlightening beings in the second stage, expounding a medium of concentration called sphere of dispassion; in another he saw her surrounded by enlightening beings in the third stage, expounding a medium of concentration called sphere of tranquillity; in another he saw her surrounded by enlightening beings in the fourth stage, expounding a medium of concentration called production of the field of action of the energy of omniscience; in another he saw her surrounded by enlightening beings of the fifth stage, expounding a medium of concentration called treasury of flowers of the tendrils of the mind; in another he saw her surrounded by enlightening beings in the sixth stage, expounding a medium of concentration called filled with light; in another he saw her surrounded by enlightening beings in the seventh stage, expounding a medium of concentration called adornment of the stage of totality; in another he saw her surrounded by enlightening beings in the eighth stage, expounding a medium of concentration called realm of the body distributed equally throughout the structure of the cosmos; in another he saw her surrounded by enlightening beings in the ninth stage, expounding a medium of concentration called array of the abode of the power of nonacquisition; in another he saw her surrounded by enlightening beings in the tenth stage, expounding a medium of concentration called sphere of nonobstruction; in another he saw her teaching an audience of thunderbolt bearers a doctrine called mighty array of thunderbolts of knowledge.

de ltar skye ba'i skye mched rnam pa tha dad pa thams cad kyi sems can du gdags pa dang / sems can gyi lam gyi rgyud ji snyed pa de dag gi sems can yongs su smin pa rnam par 'dul ba/ snod du gyur pa ji snyed cig bza' shing gi ra ba der 'ongs shing / 'khor gyi stan la so sor 'khod pa/ bsam pa tha dad pa/ mos pa mi mtshungs pa/ bsam pa shin tu gzhol bar gyur pa/ dad pa'i ro rdam [*rngam?] chen po dang ldan pa rnams la/ dge slong ma seng ge rnam par bsgyings pas/ ci nas kyang thams cad bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu nges par 'gyur ba de lta de ltar chos bstan pa mthong ngo/ /de ci'i phyir zhe na/ de ni dge slong ma seng ge rnam par bsgyings pa des/ kun du lta ba'i btang snyoms dang ldan pa la sogs pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad shin tu bstan pa la sogs pa dang / chos kyi dbyings kyi gzhi tha dad pa la sogs pa dang / sgrib pa'i dkyil 'khor thams cad rnam par 'thor ba la sogs pa dang / 'gro ba thams cad kyi dge ba'i sems yang dag par 'byung ba la sogs pa dang / khyad par yod pa'i rgyan la sogs pa dang / chags pa med pa'i tshul gyi snying po la sogs pa dang / chos kyi dbyings kyi dkyil 'khor la sogs pa dang / sems kyi mdzod la sogs pa dang / kun du mos pa mngon par sgrub pa'i snying po la sogs pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i sgo brgya stong grangs med pa non pa'i phyir te/ bza' shing gi ra ba nyi ma'i mdog der/ byang chub sems dpa' ma/ sems can gzhan ji snyed cig /dge slong ma seng ge rnam par bsgyings pa la blta ba dang / chos mnyan pa'i phyir 'ong ba de dag thams cad kyang / sngon dge slong ma seng ge rnam par bsgyings pas/ dge ba'i chos yang dag par blangs pa la shin tu bkod pa nas; bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub las phyir mi ldog pa'i bar du byas pa sha stag go/

Thus he saw the mature, the teachable, the capable among those in all states of being gathered in this park, each type in a separate assembly, with various inclinations and interests, firmly intent and deeply faithful, with the nun Sinhavijurmbhita teaching them each in such a way that all became certain of supreme perfect enlightenment. How was that so? Because the nun Sinhavijurmbhita had gone into countless tens of hundreds of thousands of doors of transcendent wisdom, beginning with the equanimity of the universal eye, exposition of all buddhas’ teachings, differentiation of the planes of the reality realm, dispersing all obstructions, production of good thoughts in all sentient beings, supreme adornment, matrix of the principle of nonattachment, sphere of the realm of reality, treasury of mind, and source of miracles pleasing to all. And all the enlightening beings and others who came to this park to see the nun Sinhavijurmbhita and hear her teach were guided by her, from the beginning accumulation of virtues, until she had made them irreversible on the way to supreme perfect enlightenment.

de nas tshong dpon gyi bu nor bzang gis/ dge slong ma seng ge rnam par bsgyings ba'i bza' shing gi ra ba phun sum tshogs pa dang / nags tshal phun sum tshogs pa dang / gtsug lag khang phun sum tshogs pa dang / 'chag sa phun sum tshogs pa dang / longs spyod phun sum tshogs pa dang / mal cha phun sum tshogs pa dang / 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor phun sum tshogs pa dang / dbang chen po phun sum tshogs pa dang / rdzu 'phrul dang / rnam par 'phrul pa phun sum tshogs pa dang / dbyangs kyi rgyan phun sum tshogs pa rnam pa de lta bu mthong ste/ chos kyi tshul bsam gyis mi khyab pa'ang thos nas/ chos kyi sprin gyi char chen pos sems mngon par brlan pa de'i yid la/ dge slong ma seng ge rnam par bsgyings pas/ bsam pa rnam par dag pa phun sum tshogs par byas kyi/ da ni g.yas phyogs su bskor ba lan brgya stong du ma zhig tu bya'o snyam pa dang / de'i mod la dge slong ma seng ge rnam par bsgyings pas/ bza' shing gi ra ba dang 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor du bcas pa de dag thams cad kyang snang ba chen pos khyab par byas so; ;de ltar g.yas phyogs su bskor ba bya'o snyam du bsams nas/ skor ba byed pa'i tshe/ 'khor thams cad na'ang dge slong ma seng ge rnam par bsgyings pa 'dug pa mthong nas/ mdun du 'dug ste thal mo sbyar nas 'di skad ces smras so/ /'phags ma/ bdag gis bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed na/ ji ltar byang chub sems dpas byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa la bslab par bgyi ba dang / ji ltar nan tan du bgyi ba ma 'tshal te/ 'phags ma ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams la gdams ngag dang / rjes su bstan pa mdzad do zhes bdag gis thos na 'phags ma/ ji ltar byang chub sems dpas byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa la bslab par bgyi ba dang / ji ltar nan tan du bgyi ba bdag la bshad du gsol/

Then Sudhana, having seen the nun Sinhavijurmbhita with such an abode, such furnishings, such an audience, such mastery, such mystic power, and such eloquence, and having heard her teaching, his mind drenched by the immense cloud of the Teaching, his thoughts toward Sinhavijurmbhita pure, he prostrated himself and then circled her in respect hundreds of thousands of times. At that time the whole park and the congregations were suffused with a glorious light from the nun. Having made hundreds of thousands of circumambulations, he noticed that as he circumambulated he saw the nun whichever way he faced. He stood before her and said, “Noble one, I have set my mind on supreme perfect enlightenment, but I do not know how to learn and carry out the practice of enlightening beings. I hear you give enlightening beings instructions, so please tell me how to learn and carry out the practice of enlightening beings.”

des smras pa/ rigs kyi bu/ kho mo ni byang chub sems dpa'i rnam par thar pa rlom sems thams cad yongs su bcom pa zhes bya ba thob pa'o/ /smras pa/ 'phags ma/ byang chub sems dpa'i rnam par thar pa rlom sems thams cad yongs su bcom pa de'i yul ji lta bu zhig mchis/ smras pa/ rigs kyi bu/ de ni ye shes snang ba ste/ dus gsum du byung ba'i rgyan sems skad cig gi cha shas la rnam par dmigs pa'i rang bzhin no/ /smras pa/ 'phags ma/ ye shes snang ba de'i yul yang ji lta bu zhig mchis/ smras pa/ rigs kyi bu/ kho mo ye shes snang ba 'di la sgrub pa dang yongs su sgrub pa'i tshe/ chos thams cad rab tu 'thad pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin skyes te/ ting nge 'dzin de thob ma thag tu yid kyi rang bzhin gyi lus kyis phyogs bcu thams cad kyi 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du/ byang chub sems dpa' sku tshe gcig gis thogs pa/ dga' ldan gyi pho brang na bzhugs pa thams cad re re la yang lus sangs rgyas kyi zhing brjod du med pa'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed kyis mchod pa rnam pa tha dad pa/ sangs rgyas kyi zhing brjod du med pa'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed kyis mchod pa sbyar ba'i phyir 'gro ste/ 'di ltar lha'i lus dang / klu dang / gnod sbyin dang / dri za dang / lha ma yin dang / nam mkha' lding dang / mi 'am ci dang / lho 'phye chen po dang / mi dang / mi ma yin pa'i dbang po lus me tog gi sprin yongs su 'dzin pa dang / sbos kyi sprin yongs su 'dzin pa dang / bdug spos kyi sprin yongs su 'dzin pa dang / phreng ba'i sprin yongs su 'dzin pa dang / byug pa'i sprin yongs su 'dzin pa dang / phye ma'i sprin yongs su 'dzin pa dang / na bza'i sprin yongs su 'dzin pa dang / gdugs kyi sprin yongs su 'dzin pa dang / rgyal mtshan gyi sprin yongs su 'dzin pa dang / ba dan gyi sprin yongs su 'dzin pa dang / rin po che'i lhab lhub kyi sprin yongs su 'dzin pa dang / rin po che'i dra ba'i rgyan gyi sprin yongs su 'dzin pa dang / rin po che'i gnam yol gyi rgyan gyi sprin yongs su 'dzin pa dang / rin po che'i rgyan rnam par phye ba'i sprin yongs su 'dzin pa dang / rin po che'i sgron ma'i rgyan gyi sprin yongs su 'dzin pa dang / rin po che'i gdan gyi sprin yongs su 'dzin pa mang pos mchod pa sbyar ba'i phyir 'gro'o/ /dga' ldan gyi gnas na bzhugs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sku tshe gcig gis thogs pa rnams la/ mchod pa bya ba'i phyir ji ltar 'gro ba de bzhin du yum gyi skur gshegs pa dang / bltam pa dang / btsun mo'i 'khor gyi nang na bzhugs pa dang / mngon par 'byung ba dang / snying po byang chub tu gshegs pa dang / bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par sangs rgyas shing / snying po byang chub la bzhugs pa dang / chos kyi 'khor lo rab tu skor ba'i de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad dang / de bzhin du lha'i gnas na bzhugs pa dang / klu dang / gnod sbyin dang / dri za dang / lha ma yin dang / nam mkha' lding dang / mi 'am ci dang / lto 'phye chen po dang / mi dang / mi ma yin pa'i gnas na bzhugs pa dang / 'gro ba thams cad kyi sems dang / bsam pa yongs su tshim par mdzad nas/ yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba'i bar de dag thams cad la'ang / yid kyi rang bzhin gyi lus rnam pa de lta bu dag gis rnam pa de lta bu'i mchod pa byed cing / de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi drung du 'gro'o/ /sems can gang gis kho mo sangs rgyas mchod pa dang / rim gro byed pa'i las 'di shes par gyur pa de dag thams cad kyang / bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu nges par 'gyur ro/ /sems can gang kho mo'i drung du 'ong ba de dag thams cad la yang / kho mo ni/ shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i gdams ngag dang / rjes su bstan pa 'di nyid ston te/

She said, “I have attained the enlightening liberation of removal of all vain imaginings.” Sudhana asked her about the sphere of this liberation, and she said, “It is the light of knowledge whose nature is instantaneous awareness of the phenomena of past, present, and future.” Sudhana asked about the compass of this light of knowledge, and she replied, “As I go in and out the door of this light of knowledge, there is born in me a concentration called ‘possessed of all phenomena,’ by the attainment of which concentration I go to all worlds in the ten directions with mentally produced bodies to present offerings as numerous as atoms in untold buddha-lands with bodies as numerous as atoms in untold buddha-lands to each of the enlightening beings in the heavens of satisfaction who are bound to attain buddhahood in one lifetime. In the forms of all sorts of beings, bringing all sorts of gifts, I go to make offerings to the enlightening beings in the heavens of satisfaction who are going to become buddhas in the next life, and I go to all the buddhas, be they in the womb, being born, at home, leaving home, going to the heights of enlightenment, at the pinnacle of enlightenment, having become supremely perfectly enlightened, gone to various realms of existence, or entering final extinction after having satisfied the minds of all beings, making such offerings with such mentally produced bodies. Those sentient beings who know my work of making offerings to buddhas all become certain of supreme perfect enlightenment. And to all those sentient beings who come to me I give instruction in this same transcendent wisdom.

rigs kyi bu/ kho mo ye shes kyi mig gis sems can thams cad la blta'ang sems can gyi 'du shes kyang mi skyed la; rlom sems kyang mi byed do/ /'gro ba thams cad kyi skad rgya mtsho yang nyan te/ tshig gi lam thams cad la mngon par zhen pa med pas rlom sems su byed pa med do/ /de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyang mthong ste/ chos kyi lus yongs su shes pas rlom sems su byed pa'ang med de/ /de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi 'khor lo yongs su 'dzin kyang / chos kyi rang bzhin khong du chud pas rlom sems su byed pa med do/ /sems kyi skad cig re re la chos kyi dbyings thams cad rgyas par 'gengs kyang chos nyid sgyu ma'i rang bzhin khong du chud pas rlom sems su byed pa med do/ /

“I see all beings with the eye of knowledge, yet I do not conceive any notion of ‘sentient being,’ and do not imagine so. I hear all beings’ verbal signals, yet I do not imagine so, because I do not enter into the spheres of any discourses. I see all buddhas, yet I do not imagine so, because I know their body is reality. I remember the cycles of teachings of all buddhas, but I do not imagine so, because I am aware of the true nature of things. I pervade the cosmos in every moment of awareness, but I do not imagine so, because I know the nature of things as existing in illusion.

rigs kyi bu/ kho mos ni byang chub sems dpa'i rnam par thar pa rlom sems thams cad yongs su bcom pa 'di shes par zad na/ kho mos byang chub sems dpa' chos kyi dbyings mtha' dang dbus med pa la zhugs pa/ chos thams cad la rlom sems med par gnas kyang skyil mo krung gcig gis chos kyi dbyings thams cad rgyas par 'gengs pa/ sangs rgyas kyi zhing thams cad rang gi lus su 'dus par ston kyang / skad cig gcig gis de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi drung du 'dong ba/ lus la sangs rgyas kyi rdzu 'phrul thams cad 'byung zhing rgyu ba/ sangs rgyas kyi zhing brjod du med pa'i yang brjod du med pa ba spu'i nyag ma gcig gis spams shing mngon par 'phen pa/ rang gi ba spu'i bu gar 'jig rten gyi khams brjod du med pa'i yang brjod du med pa'i 'du ba dang / 'jig pa'i bskal pa yongs su ston pa/ skad cig gcig la bskal pa brjod du med pa'i yang brjod du med par gnas pa mnyan pa nyid kyis yang dag par 'dzud pa/ skad cig gcig gis brjod du med pa'i yang brjod du med pa'i bskal par 'khod pa de dag gi spyod pa shes pa'am/ yon tan brjod par nus re skan/

“Thus, I know the enlightening liberation of removal of all vain imaginings; but how can I know the practice or tell of the virtues of the enlightening beings who penetrate the infinite cosmos of realities, who are free from vain imaginings about all things, who pervade all realms of reality while sitting cross-legged in one body, who see all buddha-lands in their own bodies, who go to all buddhas in a single instant, in whose own beings the miracles of all buddhas are taking place, who lift up untold buddha-lands with a single hair, who show the eons of becoming and dissolution of untold worlds in their own pores, who in a single instant enter into the commonality of coexistence in untold eons, who enter untold eons in a single instant?

song / rigs kyi bu/ lho phyogs kyi rgyud 'di nyid kyi yul bgrod dka' ba na/ grong khyer rin po che'i rgyan zhes bya ba yod de/ de na bcom pa ma lha'i bshes gnyen ma zhes bya ba 'dug gi /de'i gan du song la/ ji ltar byang chub sems dpas byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa la bslab par bya ba dang / ji ltar nan tan du bya ba dris shig /

“South of here, in the land of Durga, is a city called Ratnavyuha, where Vasumitra, a worshiper of the god of light, is living. Go ask her how to learn and carry out the practice of enlightening beings.”

de nas tshong dpon gyi bu nor bzang gis/ dge slong ma seng ge rnam par bsgyings pa'i rkang pa gnyis la spyi bos phyag 'tshal te/ dge slong ma seng ge rnam par bsgyings pa la lan brgya stong du mar g.yas phyogs su bskor ba byas nas/ yang dang yang du bltas te/ dge slong ma seng ge rnam par bsgyings pa'i drung nas song ngo/ /
So, paying his respects to the nun Sinhavijurmbhita, Sudhana left her and went on his way.

drop.crumb: bcom pa ma lha'i bshes gnyen ma

fuse.drop: [bcom pa ma lha'i bshes gnyen ma]
Vasumitra

de nas tshong dpon gyi bu nor bzang / shes rab kyi snang ba chen po des sems snang bar gyur pa de/ thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes snang ba de la ni sems/ chos nyid kyi rang bzhin gyi stobs snang ba de la ni yang dag par rjes su lta/ sems can thams cad kyi skad rnam par dmigs pa'i mdzod kyi gzungs kyi tshul de ni brtan par byed/ de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi chos kyi 'khor lo yang dag par 'dzin pa'i gzungs kyi tshul de ni shin tu rgya che bar byed/ snying rje chen po 'gro ba thams cad kyi skyabs su gyur pa'i stobs de ni nye bar ston/ chos thams cad kyi tshul snang ba'i sgo nas yang dag par 'byung ba'i thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi shugs de la ni rab tu rtog/ chos kyi dbyings rgya chen po'i dkyil 'khor rgyas par 'gengs pa'i smon lam yongs su dag pa de'i rjes su ni 'brang / chos thams cad kyi phyogs snang bar byed pa'i ye shes kyi 'od de ni shin tu gsal bar byed/ chos thams cad kyi phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams rnam par phye ba rgyas par 'gengs pa'i mngon par shes pa'i stobs de ni mngon par sgrub/ byang chub sems dpa'i lam dang dran pa thams cad nye bar blangs pas brtsams pa mthar dbyung ba'i smon lam de ni yongs su rdzogs par byed cing / mthar gyis yul bgrod dka' ba'i grong khyer rin po che'i rgyan gang na ba der phyin te/ bcom pa ma lha'i bshes gnyen ma yongs su tshol tshol ba dang /

His mind illumined by the lightning of great vision, meditating on the light of omniscience, observing the manifestation of power of essential nature, making firm the mnemonic command of the treasury of verbal communications of all beings, extending the mnemonic command to retain the cycles of teachings of all buddhas, establishing the power of great compassion as a refuge for all sentient beings, examining the power of omniscience which is the source of the means of perceiving the principles of all laws, following the purity of vows extending throughout the cosmos, clarifying the light of knowledge illumining all things, developing the power of mystic knowledge pervading all phenomena arraying the worlds of the ten directions, fulfilling the vow to remember, undertake, and accomplish all the deeds of enlightening beings, Sudhana made his way to the city of Ratnavyuha in the country of Durga, where he sought out Vasumitra.

de la bcom pa ma lha'i bshes gnyen gyi yon tan mngon par mi shes la/ ye shes kyi spyod yul gyi tshul la mi mkhas pa'i mi ji snyed pa de dag 'di snyam du sems te/ mi 'di de ltar zhi zhing dul ba'i dbang po dang ldan la/ de ltar shes bzhin dang ldan te/ de ltar 'khrul pa med cing / de ltar yid 'khrug pa med la/ de ltar gnya' shing gang tsam du lta ste/ de ltar gnod pas mi tshugs shing / de ltar mtshan mar mi 'dzin la gzugs kyi rnam pa thams cad la g.yeng ba med ba'i mig dang ldan te/ yid la brel ba med cing / bsam pa zab la mngon par mdzes te/ rgya mtsho ltar 'dug cing sems mi nyams mi 'khrug pa de la/ bcom pa ma lha'i bshes gnyen mas ko ci zhig bya/ 'di lta bu dag ni 'dod chags la dga' ba med de/ sems phyin ci log dang ldan yang mi srid do/ /'di lta bu dag ni sdug cing gtsang ba'i 'du shes yongs su rgyu ba med de/ 'di lta bu dag ni 'dod pas 'khol kyang mi srid do/ /'di lta bu dag ni bud med kyi dpang du 'gyur ba med de/ 'di lta bu dag ni bdud kyi spyod yul la spyod kyang mi srid do/ /'di lta bu dag ni bdud kyi yul la chags pa med de/ 'di lta bu dag ni 'dod pa'i 'dam du bying yang mi srid do/ /'di lta bu dag ni bdud kyi zhags pas bcings par 'gyur ba med de/ mi dgos pa byed kyang mi srid do snyam mo/ /

People there who did not know of Vasumitra’s virtues or the scope of her knowledge said to Sudhana, “What has someone like you—with senses so calm and subdued, so aware, so clear, without confusion or distraction, your gaze focused discreetly right before you, your mind not overwhelmed by sensations, not clinging to appearances, your eyes averted from involvement in all forms, your mind so cool and steady, your way of life profound, wise, oceanic, your mind free from agitation or despondency—what have you to do with Vasumitra? You should not have any lust for her, your head should not be turned by her, you should not have any such-impure thoughts, you should not be ravaged by such desires, you should not be under the power of a woman, you should not be so bewitched, you should not enter the realm of temptation, you should not sink into the mire of sensuality, you should not be bound by the snares of the devil, you should not do what should not be done.”

gang yang bcom pa ma lha'i bshes gnyen ma'i yon tan gyi khyad par mngon par shes shing / ye shes kyi spyod yul mngon du gyur pa de dag ni 'di skad ces 'dzer te/ rigs kyi bu/ de ltar khyod bcom pa ma lha'i bshes gnyen ma la yongs su dri bar sems pa ni/ khyod kyang thob par bya ba legs par thob pa ste/ legs so/ /legs so/ /khyod ni nges par sangs rgyas su smon pa'o/ /khyod ni bdag nges par sems can thams cad kyi gnas su bsgyur bar 'dod pa'o/ /khyod ni nges par sems can thams cad kyi 'dod chags kyi zug rngu dbyung bar 'dod pa'o/ /khyod ni nges par sdug cing gtsang ba'i 'du shes rnam par gtor bar 'dod pa'o/ /rigs kyi bu/ 'di re/ bcom pa ma lha'i bshes gnyen ma ni grong khyer gyi lam gyi sum mdo'i byang phyogs logs shig na rang gi khyim na 'dug go /

Those who knew the excellence of the virtues of Vasumitra, however, and who were aware of the scope of her knowledge, said, “Good, good! You have really made gain if you ask about Vasumitra. You surely seek buddhahood; you surely want to make yourself a refuge for all sentient beings; you surely want to extract the barbs of passion from all sentient beings; you surely want to transform the notion of purity. Vasumitra is in her house, north of the town square.”

de nas tshong dpon gyi bu nor bzang gis tshig 'di thos nas/ dga' rangs te mgu zhing nyams bde la tshim zhing / yid bde ba skyes nas bcom pa ma lha'i bshes gnyen ma'i khyim gang na ba der phyin nas/ de'i khyim che zhing yangs la rin po che'i rab rim pa bcus bskor ba/ rin po che'i ta la'i phreng ba rim pa bcus kun nas bskor ba/ 'obs spos chus gang ba/ lha rdzas kyi rin po che'i pad+mo dang / ut+pa la dang / ku mud dang / me tog pun da ri kas chu yongs su khebs pa/ yan lag brgyad dang ldan pa'i chus yongs su gang ba/ gzhi gser gyi bye ma 'dal ba/ spos yid du 'ong ba dang 'dres pa'i chu dri zhim pos gang ba/ rin po che sil ma mang pos shin tu brgyan pa/ rim pa bcus kun nas bskor ba/ rin po che thams cad las byas pa'i khang pa dang / gzhal med khang dang / khang pa brtsegs pas rnam par dkrigs shing / ba gam dang / rta babs dang / skar khung gi shar bu dang / zla gam dang / seng ge'i shing thags dang / snang ba'i rgyal mtshan la sogs pa/ rin po che sna tshogs kyi 'od kyis 'bar ba/ rin po che rnam pa sna tshogs grangs med pa'i 'byung gnas kyis brgyan pa/ rin po che'i dgar bai DUr+ya sa spras pa'i g.yi dang ldan pa/ lha rdzas kyi spos zhim po thams cad kyis 'khor thams cad nas bdugs shing bsangs pa/ a ga ru nag po mchog gi bdug spos kyis dri zhim par bdugs pa; spos kyi byugs pas 'khor kun nas byugs pa/ rin po che sna tshogs kyi lan kan gyis rtsig ngos kun du bres pa/ steng 'dzam bu chu klung gi gser gyi dra ba rin po che sna tshogs kyis rab tu spras pas kun nas bkab pa/ gser gyi dril gyi dra ba brgya stong rlung gis bskyod cing 'khrol ba'i sgra yid du 'ong zhing snyan pa 'byung ba/ rin po che thams cad kyi me tog gi sprin sil ma kun tu bkram pas rin po che'i me tog gi rgyan dang ldan pa/ rin po che sna tshogs thams cad kyi rgyal mtshan bsgreng bas sgo shin tu brgyan pa/ nor bu rin po che sna tshogs kyi 'od kyi dra ba snang ba mu med par brjod du yod pa/ rin po che byu ru'i sdong po dang / rdo rje dang / man shel la sogs pa'i gter brgya stong kun gyis shes pa phun sum tshogs pas mdzod mi zad pa dang ldan pa/ bza' shing gi ra ba chen po bcus brgyan pa mthong ste/

Hearing this, Sudhana was delighted. He went to Vasumitra’s house and saw that it was surrounded by ten jewel walls, ten circles of jewel trees, and ten moats filled with fragrant water covered by celestial jewel lotuses of various colors, with gold sand spread on the bottom, the rippling waters producing an intoxicating fragrance, the banks adorned by many jewels. The house had well-arranged apartments and towers made of all kinds of precious substances; it had high arched doorways and circular windows, draped with nets and blazing with jewels. It was adorned with fences of countless various jewels, and its base was composed of masses of jewels studded with lapis lazuli. It was perfumed with all kinds of fragrant oils. The walls were studded with all kinds of jewels, and the roof was inland with various gems and covered with a gold net. A hundred thousand webs of gold bells gave off sweet, pleasant sounds as they rustled in the breeze. The house was adorned with sprays of jewel flowers from clouds of flowers of all kinds of jewels. The doors were decorated with multicolored banners of all kinds of jewels. The light of lamps of various jewels shone to an endless distance. The house had diamond beams made from the limbs of gigantic brilliant jewel trees, and it was an inexhaustible treasury of hundreds and thousands of riches in full view; it was also adorned with ten large gardens set around it.

de na bcom pa ma lha'i bshes gnyen ma/ gzugs mdzes shing bzang la blta na sdug pa/ gya nom pa'i kha dog dam pa rgyas pa dang ldan pa/ gser gyi kha dog ltar 'dug pa'i mdog can/ skra mthon mthing du 'dug pa/ lus kyi yan lag dang / nying lag tshul dang 'dra bar rnam par grub pa/ 'dod pa'i khams kyi lha dang / mi thams cad las 'phags pa'i kha dog dang / gzugs dang / dbyibs mdzes pa dang ldan pa/ tshangs pa las kyang 'das pa'i dbyangs kyi yan lag dang ldan pa/ sems can thams cad kyi sgra skad kyi tshul la mkhas pa/ rgyan thams cad dang ldan zhing yid du 'ong ba'i dbyangs can/ rnam par thar pa yi ge'i 'khor lo'i rgyan la mkhas pa dang ldan pa/ bzo dang gtsug lag thams cad la mkhas par byung ba/ chos kyi ye shes sgyu ma la mkhas par bslabs pa/ byang chub sems dpa'i thabs dang tshul rnam pa thams cad du thob pa/ rin po che'i lhab lhub sna tshogs kyis rnam par brgyan pa'i lus yid du 'ong ba dang ldan pa/ rin po che thams cad las byas pa'i dra ba 'od shin tu gsal bas lus rab tu brgyan pa/ lha rdzas kyi nor bu rin po che'i rgyan dang / lhab lhub grangs med pas rab tu brgyan pas lus shin tu 'bar ba/ nor bu rin po che dam pa yid bzhin gyi rgyal po'i cod pan thogs pa/ rin bo che bai DUr+ya'i phreng ba mdo zungs rdo rje rin po che sna tshogs dang / nor bu rin po che seng ge mdzes pa sna tshogs bkye ba mgul na thogs pa/ dge ba'i rtsa ba spyad pa la bskal pa mthun pa dang / smon lam gcig pa'i 'khor mang po gzhan gyis mi phyed cing yid du 'ong ba dang ldan pa/ bsod nams dang / ye shes kyi tshogs chen po'i gter mi zad pa'i mdzod dang ldan pa 'dug pa mthong ste/ des khyim de dag thams cad dang / rin po che'i gnas dang / gzhal med khang gi rgyan de dag thams cad kyang rang gi lus las byung ba'i 'od dga' bar byed pa/ lus bde ba dang sim pa skyed pa/ sems khong nas dga' bar byed pas gsal zhing snang bar byas pa mthong ngo/ /

There he saw Vasumitra, who was beautiful, with golden skin and black hair, her limbs and body well proportioned, more beautiful in form than all celestial and human beings in the realm of desire, her voice finer even than that of the god Brahma. She knew the language of all beings; she had a pleasant voice that could pronounce any sound, and was skilled in freedom of phonetic organization. She was well versed in all arts and sciences, she had learned to use the magic of true knowledge, and she had mastered all aspects of the expedient means of enlightening beings. Her beautiful body was decorated with assorted jewelry, draped with a radiant mesh made of all kinds of precious substances, shining with an array of countless celestial jewel ornaments. She wore a tiara of large wish-fulfilling gems, her waist was adorned with diamonds, and she had a lapis lazuli necklace on. She had a large, attractive retinue, all with the same virtues, the same practice, and the same vow. She was an inexhaustible treasury of goodness and knowledge. He also saw the whole house, with all its jeweled apartments and furnishings lit up by the lovely, refreshing, pleasant, blissful, enrapturing light that emanated from her body.

de nas tshong dpon gyi bu nor bzang gis/ bcom pa ma lha'i bshes gnyen ma'i rkang pa gnyis la spyi bos phyag 'tshal te mdun du 'dug nas thal mo sbyar te 'di skad ces smras so/ /'phags ma/ bdag gis bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed na/ ji ltar byang chub sems dpas byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa la bslab par bgyi ba dang / ji ltar nan tan du bgyi ba ma 'tshal te/ 'phags ma ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams la gdams ngag dang / rjes su bstan pa mdzad do zhes bdag gis thos na/ ji ltar byang chub sems dpas byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa la bslab par bgyi ba dang / ji ltar nan tan du bgyi ba 'phags mas bdag la bstan du gsol/

Sudhana went up to Vasumitra, paid his respects, and said, “Noble one, I have set my mind on supreme perfect enlightenment, but I do not know how to learn and carry out the practice of enlightening beings. I hear that you give enlightening beings instructions, and I hope you will tell me how an enlightening being is to learn and carry out the practice of enlightening beings.”

des smras pa/ rigs kyi bu/ kho mos ni/ byang chub sems dpa'i rnam par thar pa 'dod chags dang bral ba'i mthar phyin pa zhes bya ba thob ste// rigs kyi bu/ de ltar kho mo ni lha rnams la lha mo'i gzugs dang / /ba dog dang / dbyibs dang / chu zheng las kyang lhag par kha dog gsal ba dang / rnam par dag pas ci la mos pa bzhin du snang par byed do/ /de bzhin du klu dang / gnod sbyin dang / dri za dang / lha ma yin dang / nam mkha' lding dang / mi'am ci dang / lto 'phye chen po dang / mi dang / mi ma yin pa rnams la yang bud med kyi gzugs dang / kha dog dang / dbyibs dang / chu zheng lhag par 'od gsal zhing rnam par dag pas ci la mos pa bzhin du snang bar byed do/ /sems can gang 'dod chags kyis kun nas 'khor ba'i sems dang ldan pa dag kho mo'i drung du 'ongs na yang / de dag thams cad la kho mo ni 'dod chags dang bral bar 'gyur ba'i phyir chos ston te/ de dag gis chos de thos nas kyang 'dod chags dang bral ba thob par 'gyur ro/ /byang chub sems dpa'i ting nge 'dzin chags pa med pa zhes bya ba yang rab tu 'thob bo/ /

She said, “I have attained an enlightening liberation called ‘ultimately dispassionate.’ To gods, in accord with their inclinations and interests, I appear in the form of a goddess of surpassing splendor and perfection; and to all other types of beings I accordingly appear in the form of a female of their species, of surpassing splendor and perfection. And all who come to me with minds full of passion, I teach them so that they become free of passion. Those who have heard my teaching and attain dispassion achieve an enlightening concentration called ‘realm of nonattachment.’

la la ni kho mo mthong ma thag tu 'dod chags dang bral bar 'gyur te/ byang chub sems dpa'i ting nge 'dzin dga' ba dang ldan pa zhes bya ba yang rab tu 'thob bo/ /la la ni gtam byas pa tsam gyis 'dod chags dang bral ba thob par 'gyur te/ byang chub sems dpa'i ting nge 'dzin chags pa med pa'i dbyangs zhes bya ba yang rab tu 'thob bo/ /la la ni lag nas bzung ba tsam gyis 'dod chags dang bral ba thob bar 'gyur te/ byang chub sems dpa'i ting nge 'dzin sangs rgyas kyi zhing thams cad du rjes su 'gro zhing gnas pa zhes bya ba yang rab tu 'thob bo/ /la la ni gcig tu 'grogs pa tsam gyis 'dod chags dang bral ba thob par 'gyur te/ byang chub sems dpa'i ting nge 'dzin bral bas snang ba zhes bya ba yang rab tu 'thob bo/ /la la ni bltas pa tsam gyis/ 'dod chags dang bral ba thob par 'gyur te/ byang chub sems dpa'i ting nge 'dzin rab tu zhi ba'i rnam par brgyan ces bya ba yang rab tu 'thob bo/ /la la ni glal ba tsam gyis 'dod chags dang bral ba thob par 'gyur te/ byang chub sems dpa'i ting nge 'dzin phas kyi rgol ba rnam par 'thor ba zhes bya ba yang rab tu 'thob bo/ /la la ni mig btsums pa tsam gyis 'dod chags dang bral ba thob par 'gyur te/ byang chub sems dpa'i ting nge 'dzin sangs rgyas kyi yul snang ba zhes bya ba yang rab tu 'thob bo/ /la la ni pang du khyud pa tsam gyis 'dod chags dang bral ba thob par 'gyur te/ byang chub sems dpa'i ting nge 'dzin 'gro ba thams cad yongs su sdud cing mi gtong ba'i snying po zhes bya ba yang rab tu 'thob bo/ /la la ni 'o byas pa tsam gyis 'dod chags dang bral ba thob par 'gyur te/ byang chub sems dpa'i ting nge 'dzin 'gro ba thams cad bsod nams kyi mdzod la reg par byed pa zhes bya ba yang rab tu 'thob bo/ /de ltar kho mo ni sems can gang ji snyed cig kho mo'i drung du 'ong ba de dag thams cad kyang / byang chub sems dpa'i rnam par thar pa 'dod chags dang bral ba'i mthar phyin pa/ thams cad mkhyen pa'i sa chags pa med pa la mngon du gyur pa 'di nyid la rab tu 'god do/ /

“Some attain dispassion as soon as they see me, and achieve an enlightening concentration called ‘delight in joy.’ Some attain dispassion merely by talking with me, and achieve an enlightening concentration called ‘treasury of unimpeded sound.’ Some attain dispassion just by holding my hand, and achieve an enlightening concentration called ‘basis of going to all buddha-lands.’ Some attain dispassion just by staying with me, and achieve an enlightening concentration called ‘light of freedom from bondage.’ Some attain dispassion just by gazing at me, and achieve an enlightening concentration called ‘tranquil expression.’ Some attain dispassion just by embracing me, and achieve an enlightening concentration called ‘womb receiving all sentient beings without rejection.’ Some attain dispassion just by kissing me, and achieve an enlightening concentration called ‘contact with the treasury of virtue of all beings.’ All those who come to me I establish in this enlightening liberation of ultimate dispassion, on the brink of the stage of unimpeded omniscience.”
smras pa/ 'phags ma khyod de lta bu'i phun sum tshogs pa dang ldan pa de/ khyod kyis dge ba'i rtsa ba ni gang du bskyed/ 'phrin las ni ji lta bu zhig bzhugs/
Sudhana asked her, “Where did you plant roots of virtue, and what kind of deeds did you accumulate, that you got to be this way?”

smras pa/ rigs kyi bu/ kho mos dran na 'das pa'i dus shig na/ de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas mkhyen pa dang zhabs su ldan pa/ bde bar gshegs pa/ 'jig rten mkhyen pa/ bla na med par skyes bu 'dul ba'i kha lo sgyur ba/ lha dang mi'i ston pa sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das shin tu mtho bar gshegs pa zhes bya ba 'jig rten du byung ste/ de bzhin gshegs pa shin tu mtho bar gshegs pa de/ sems can rnams la thugs brtse ba'i sku don du/ rgyal po'i gnas sgo bzang po zhes bya bar gshegs nas/ sgo'i them pa la zhabs kyis non pa'i tshe/ grong khyer de thams cad kyang rab tu g.yos nas/ yangs shing rgya che la/ rin po che du ma las byas par yongs su grub par gyur te/ steng gi bar snang yang rin po che mang po'i 'od kyis rnam par brgyan pa dang / rin po che'i me tog sna tshogs kyis yongs su gang ba dang / lha rdzas kyi rol mo sna tshogs kyi sgra rab tu 'byung ba dang / lha'i lus kyi sprin tshad med par rgya che bas khebs par gyur to/ /rigs kyi bu/ kho mo yang de'i tshe/ tshong dpon gyi chung ma zhig tu gyur te/ blo gros bzang mo zhes bya'o/ /
de nas kho mo cho 'phrul gyis yang dag par bskul nas/ khyim thab dang lhan cig tu dong dong ste/ de bzhin gshegs pa grong bar gyi srang du gshegs pa la dad pa rgya chen po skyes te/ kho mos rin po che'i dril bu gcig cig phul lo/ /de'i tshe 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa yang / bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa shin tu mtho bar gshegs pa'i zham 'bring na 'dug ste/ des kho mo bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed do/ /

She replied, “I recall that in a past age a buddha named Reaching the Heights appeared in the world. When the buddha went to the royal capital out of compassion for the people, as he crossed the threshold the whole city quaked and appeared to-be vastly extended and made of jewels, adorned with the luster of many jewels, strewn with flowers of various jewels. A variety of celestial musical instruments played, and the sky appeared covered by high, immeasurable clouds of celestial beings. At that time I was the wife of a grandee. Impelled by the miracle of the buddha, I went with my husband in a state of exalted serenity and presented a coin to the buddha on the street. At that time Manjushri was an attendant of that buddha; it was by him that I was inspired to seek supreme perfect enlightenment.

rigs kyi bu/ kho mos byang chub sems dpa'i rnam par thar pa 'dod chags dang bral ba'i mthar phyin pa 'di shes par zad na/ kho mos byang chub sems dpa'i thabs dang / ye shes mtha' yas pa la gnas pa/ bsod nams rgya che zhing yangs pa'i mdzod dang ldan pa/ ye shes kyi yul la thub pa med pa de dag gi spyod pa shes pa'am/ yon tan brjod par nus re skan/

“I know this enlightening liberation of ultimate dispassion, but how can I know the practice or tell the virtues of the enlightening beings who are endowed with the skill of endless means and knowledge, who are vast, inexhaustible treasuries of good, who are in the realm of invincible knowledge?

song / rigs kyi bu/ lho phyogs kyi rgyud 'di nyid na/ grong khyer dge ba'i pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya ba yod de/ de na khyim bdag nan khugs zhes bya ba/ de bzhin gshegs pa'i mchod rten tsan dan gyi khri 'phang can la mchod pa byed pa zhig 'dug gi /de'i gan du song la/ ji ltar byang chub sems dpas byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa la bslab par bya ba dang / ji ltar nan tan du bya ba dris shig/

“South of here is a city called Shubhaparamgama, where a householder named Veshthila is presenting offerings to the shrine of the buddha Sandalwood Throne. Go ask him how to learn and carry out the practice of enlightening beings.”

de nas tshong dpon gyi bu nor bzang gis/ bcom pa ma lha'i bshes gnyen ma'i rkang pa gnyis la spyi bos phyag 'tshal te/ bcom pa ma lha'i bshes gnyen ma la lan brgya stong du mar g.yas phyogs su bskor ba byas nas/ yang dang yang bltas te/ bcom pa ma lha'i bshes gnyen ma'i drung nas song ngo/ /
So Sudhana paid his respects to Vasumitra and left.
[khyim bdag nan khugs]
Veshthila

de nas tshong dpon gyi bu nor bzang gis/ grong khyer dge ba'i pha rol tu phyin par khyim bdag nan khugs kyi khyim gang na ba der phyin nas/ khyim bdag nan khugs kyi rkang pa gnyis la spyi bos phyag 'tshal te/ mdun du 'dug nas thal mo sbyar te 'di skad ces smras so/ /'phags pa/ bdag gis bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed na ji ltar byang chub sems dpas/ byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa la bslab par bgyi ba dang / ji ltar nan tan du bgyi ba ma 'tshal te/ 'phags pa ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams la gdams ngag dang / rjes su bstan pa mdzad do zhes bdag gis thos na/ ji ltar byang chub sems dpas byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa la bslab par bgyi ba dang / ji ltar nan tan du bgyi ba 'phags pas bdag la bshad du gsol/ /

Then Sudhana went to Veshthila’s house in the city of Shubhaparamgama. Paying his respects to the householder, he said, “Noble one, I have set my mind on supreme perfect enlightenment, but I do not know how to learn and carry out the practice of enlightening beings. I hear that you give enlightening beings instruction; please tell me how to learn and carry out the practice of enlightening beings.”

des smras pa/ rigs kyi bu/ kho bo ni byang chub sems dpa'i rnam par thar pa yongs su mi zad pa thob pa ste/ rigs kyi bu/ kho bo'i sems kyi rgyud las ni 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad nas kyang / sems can 'dul ba'i dbang du mdzad pa ma gtogs par/ 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad nas kyang shin tu mya ngan las 'da' ba'i tshul du de bzhin gshegs pa yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa med do/ /yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba med do/ /yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar 'gyur ba med do; ;rigs kyi bu/ de ltar kho bo ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i mchod rten tsan dan gyi khri 'phang gi sgo 'byed pa ste/ kho bo mchod rten gyi sgo 'byed 'byed pas/ byang chub sems dpa'i ting nge 'dzin/ sangs rgyas kyi rigs mi zad pa'i rgyan ces bya ba thob bo/ /rigs kyi bu/ kho bo ni ting nge 'dzin 'di nyid la sems kyi skad cig skad cig tu mnyam par gzhog ste/ sems kyi skad cig thams cad la'ang khyad par gyi rnam pa du ma rab tu 'thob bo/ /

Veshthila said, “I have attained an enlightening liberation called ‘not ultimately exhausted.’ To my way of thinking, no buddha in any world ever has, does, or will become finally extinct, except as a docetic device. When I opened the door of the shrine of the buddha Sandalwood Throne, I attained an enlightening concentration called ‘manifestation of the endless lineage of buddhas.’ I enter this concentration in each mental moment, and every moment understand many kinds of excellence.”
smras pa/ 'phags pa/ ting nge 'dzin de'i yul ji lta bu zhig mchis/
Sudhana asked, “What is the sphere of this concentration?”

smras pa/ rigs kyi bu; kho bo ni ting nge 'dzin 'di la snyoms par zhugs pa'i tshe/ 'jig rten gyi khams kyi rgyud 'di sangs rgyas gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pa/ bsod skyabs la sogs pa de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad dang / gser thub dang / log par dad sel dang / thams cad mnga' ba dang / gtsug tor can dang / rnam par gzigs dang / rgyal dang / rdzogs mdzad dang / grags mchog dang / pad+mo'i bla la sogs pa/ de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyang / sangs rgyas mthong ba'i mtshams 'brel bas/ sangs rgyas gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pa rgyun mi 'chad pa'i tshul gyis mngon sum du mthong ste/ sems kyi skad cig gcig la sangs rgyas brgya'ang mthong ngo/ /de'i 'og ma'i sems kyis sangs rgyas stong yang mthong ngo/ /de'i 'og ma'i sems kyis sangs rgyas brgya phrag stong yang mthong ngo/ /de bzhin du sangs rgyas bye ba dang / sangs rgyas bye ba phrag brgya dang / sangs rgyas bye ba phrag stong dang / sangs rgyas bye ba brgya phrag stong dang / sangs rgyas bye ba khrag khrig dang / sangs rgyas bye ba dung phyur dang / sangs rgyas bye ba thams cad dang / sangs rgyas bye ba khrag khrig dang / de'i 'og ma'i sems kyis sangs rgyas 'byung ba gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pa/ brjod du med pa'i yang brjod du med pa dag kyang mthong ngo/ /de'i 'og ma'i sems kyis de bzhin gshegs pa 'dzam bu'i gling gi rdul shin tu phra ba snyed kyang mthong ngo/ /de'i 'og ma'i sems kyis de bzhin gshegs pa sangs rgyas kyi zhing brjod du med pa'i yang brjod du med pa'i bar gyi rdul shin tu phra ba snyed kyang mthong ste/ de bzhin gshegs pa de dag gis thugs dang po bskyed pa'i tshogs gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pa la'ang 'jug go /thugs dang po bskyed pas thob pa'i rnam par 'phrul pa la'ang 'jug go /smon lam rnam pa tha dad pa mngon par bsgrub pa rnam par dag pa la'ang 'jug go /spyod pa rnam par dag pa la'ang 'jug go /pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par mdzad pa la'ang 'jug go /byang chub sems dpa'i sa thams cad yongs su bsgrub pa la'ang 'jug go /bzod pa brnyes pa rnam par dag pa la'ang 'jug go /bdud kyi dkrugs ma rnam par 'thor ba'i khyu mchog gi mthu phyung ba la'ang 'jug go /mngon par rdzogs par 'chang [*tshang?] rgya ba'i rnam par 'phrul ba'i rgyan la'ang 'jug go /sangs rgyas kyi zhing rnam par dag par mdzad pa rnam pa tha dad pa la'ang 'jug go /sems can yongs su smin par mdzad pa rnam pa tha dad pa la'ang 'jug go /'khor kun nas 'dus pa rnam pa tha dad pa la'ang 'jug go /'od kyi dkyil 'khor rnam pa tha dad pa la'ang 'jug go /chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba'i khyu mchog gis mthu phyung ba la'ang 'jug go /sangs rgyas kyi rdzu 'phrul dang / rnam par 'phrul pa dang / cho 'phrul la'ang 'jug go /de bzhin gshegs pa de dag gis chos bstan pa'ang shin tu rnam par gsal ba dang / ma 'dres par dran te yang dag par 'dzin to/ /dran pas yongs su bcangs so/ /rig pas rab tu shes par byed do/ /blo gros kyis shin tu rnam par 'byed do/ /blos rtogs par byed do/ /shes rab kyis snang bar byed do/ /

Veshthila replied, “When I am in this concentration, all the successive buddhas of this world-system—beginning with Kashyapa, Kanakamuni, Krakucchanda, Vishvabhuj, Shikhin, Vipashyin, Tishya, Pushya, Yashottara, and Padmottara—appear to me. In the continuity of vision of buddhas, by the continuity of the succession of buddhas, in one mental moment I see a hundred buddhas; in the next moment of awareness I find a thousand buddhas, then a hundred thousand buddhas, a million buddhas, a hundred million, a billion, a trillion, a quadrillion, a quintillion; I immediately become aware of the succession of appearance of untold numbers of buddhas, of as many buddhas as atoms in the continent, as many as atoms in untold buddha-lands. I also comprehend the order of preparations of those buddhas’ initial aspiration, their spiritual transformation on achieving the aspiration for enlightenment, the purity of execution of their various vows, their purification of action, their fulfillment of the transcendent ways, their attainment of all the stages of enlightening beings, their perfection of attainment of tolerance, their conquering of demons, the supernal manifestation of their spiritual transfiguration on becoming perfectly enlightened, the variety of purity of their buddha-lands, the variety of their development of sentient beings, the variety of their audiences, the variety of their auras of light, the majesty of their teaching activities, and their accomplishment of the miracles of buddhas. I also distinctly remember their teachings, take them up mindfully, examine them in action, analyze them, follow them with discernment, and elucidate them with wisdom.

ma byon pa'i sangs rgyas gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pa byams pa la sogs pa dag kyang mthong zhing shes te/ sems kyi skad cig gcig la sangs rgyas brgya'ang mthong ngo/ /de'i 'og ma'i sems kyis sangs rgyas stong yang mthong ba nas/ de'i 'og ma'i sems kyis de bzhin gshegs pa sangs rgyas kyi zhing brjod du med pa'i yang brjod du med pa'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed dag kyang mthong ste/ de bzhin gshegs pa de dag gis thugs dang po bskyed pa'i tshogs gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pa la'ang 'jug go /de bzhin gshegs pa de dag gis chos bstan pa yang shin tu gsal ba dang / ma 'dres pa rjes su dran te/ yang dag par 'dzin to/ /dran pas yongs su bcangs so/ /rig pas rab tu shes par byed do/ /blo gros kyis rnam par 'byed do/ / blos rtogs par byed do/ /shes rab kyis snang bar byed do/ /ji ltar 'jig rten gyi khams kyi rgyud 'di/ sngon gyi mtha' dang / phyi ma'i mthar gtogs pa'i sangs rgyas gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pa mthong zhing shes pa de bzhin du phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyi rgyud 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa sangs rgyas kyi zhing brjod du med pa'i yang brjod du med pa snyed kyi de bzhin gshegs pa gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pa/ thams cad kyang shes shing mthong ngo/ /de bzhin gshegs pa de dag gi thugs dang po bskyed pa'i tshogs gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pa la'ang 'jug go /sangs rgyas gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pa de la'ang rgyun mi 'chad pa dang / mi zad pa dang / dad pas shes par bya ba dang / byang chub sems dpa'i brtson 'grus dang / zhe non pas khong du chud par bya ba dang / byang chub sems dpa'i brtson 'grus kyi shugs rnam par 'phel bar byed pa dang / 'jig rten thams cad dang / nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas thams cad dang / de'i yul la ma zhugs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyis mi 'phrogs par shes shing khong du chud par byed do/ /

“I also perceive the successive buddhas of the future, beginning with Maitreya, seeing a hundred buddhas in a single mental instant, then a thousand, and so on, uninterruptedly seeing as many buddhas as atoms in untold buddha-lands. I also see the order of their aspiration and preparation and so on, and distinctly remember their teachings, take them up mindfully, examine them, follow them, and elucidate them. And just as I see the succession of past, future, and present buddhas in this world-system, so do I also comprehend the succession of all buddhas in as many past and future world-systems in the ten directions as atoms in untold buddha-lands. I also comprehend the order of the aspiration and preparations of those buddhas, and I comprehend the unbroken continuity of the successive incarnations of those buddhas.

rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa da ltar byung ba'i de bzhin gshegs pa phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams na bzhugs pa/ gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pa thams cad kyang mthong zhing shes te/ sems kyi skad cig gcig la sangs rgyas brgya'ang mthong zhing shes so/ /de'i 'og ma'i sems kyis sangs rgyas stong yang mthong ba nas/ de'i 'og ma'i sems kyis/ de bzhin gshegs pa sangs rgyas kyi zhing brjod du med pa'i yang brjod du med pa'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed kyi bar du'ang mthong ste/ nam de bzhin gshegs pa gang zhig gi zhal blta bar dga' ba de'i tshe'ang de bzhin du mthong ste/ sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag gis bstan pa dang / bstan pa mdzad pa dang / bstan par 'gyur ba de dag thams cad kyang thos so/ /thos nas kyang 'dzin to/ /dran pas yongs su bcangs so/ /rigs pas rab tu shes par byed do/ /blo gros kyis rnam par 'byed do/ /blos rtogs par byed de/ /shes rab kyis snang bar byed do/ /

“I am also aware of the succession of buddhas of the present in all worlds in the ten directions, beginning with Vairocana, incomparable, accessible to faith and the vigorous resolution of enlightening beings, increasing the energy of enlightening beings, unsurpassed by any worldlings, individual illuminates, or enlightening beings who have not reached that sphere. In a single mental instant I see a hundred buddhas; in the next instant of awareness I see a thousand buddhas, continuing thus without interruption until I meet as many buddhas as atoms in untold buddha-lands.
“I see whatever buddhas I wish, whenever I wish, and I hear all that has been, is being, and will be spoken by those buddhas I meet, and I take up what I hear, remember it, examine it in action, analyze it, follow it with discernment, and elucidate it with wisdom.
