rigs kyi bu/ kho bos ni byang chub sems dpa'i rnam par thar pa yongs su mya ngan las mi 'da' ba'i mthar phyin pa 'di shes par zad na/ kho bos byang chub sems dpa' dus gsum skad cig gcig tu shes pa rab tu thob pa/ skad cig gi cha shas la ting nge 'dzin rnam par phye ba la spyod pa/ de bzhin gshegs pa'i nyi ma las byung ba/ rtog pa dang rnam par rtog pa thams cad mnyam pa nyid du khong du chud pa/ sangs rgyas thams cad dang mnyam pa'i ting nge 'dzin rjes su rtogs pa/ bdag dang / sems can dang / sangs rgyas mi gnyis par spyod pa/ rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba'i chos kyi rgyan gyi dkyil 'khor dang ldan pa/ ye shes kyi 'khrul 'khor gyis 'jig rten gyi dra ba 'gengs pa/ de bzhin gshegs pa rgya mtsho thams cad dang mi 'gal bar rnam par spyod pa/ chos kyi dbyings thams cad du rnam par rtogs par byed pa'i ye shes kyi yul dang ldan pa/ de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyis chos bstan pa rnam par rig par byed pa'i ye shes kyi yul can de dag gi spyod pa shes pa'am/ yon tan brjod par nus re skan/

“I know this enlightening liberation of ultimate nonextinction; how can I know the practice or tell of the virtues of the enlightening beings who have attained instantaneous knowledge of past, present, and future, who dwell in all concentrations in the space of an instant, who are imbued with the light of those who realize Thusness, who realize the equality of all thoughts and imaginations, who are focused on the equality of all buddhas, who abide in the nonduality of self, sentient beings, and buddhas, whose realm is the manifestation of principles, whose nature is clarity, whose workings of knowledge pervade the network of worlds, who dwell unwavering on the seal of the teaching of all buddhas, who are in the range of knowledge making known all realms of reality, who are in the range of knowledge conveying the teachings of all buddhas?

song / rigs kyi bu/ lho phyogs kyi rgyud 'di nyid na/ ri gru 'dzin ces bya ba yod de/ de na byang chub sems dpa' spyan ras gzigs kyi dbang po zhes bya ba 'dug gi/ de'i gan du song la/ ji ltar byang chub sems dpas byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa la bslab par bya ba dang / ji ltar nan tan du bya ba dris shig ces nas/
“South of here is a mountain called Potalaka, where an enlightening being named Avalokiteshvara lives. Go ask him how to learn and carry out the practice of enlightening beings.”
de'i tshe tshigs su bcad pa 'di gnyis smras so/ /
Then Veshthila said in verse,

song shig nor bzang dpal gyi chu rgyal dbus zhig na/ / mkhas pa rnams kyi ri rgyal gru 'dzin mdzes pa yod/ / rin chen rgyus byas shing dang nags tshal me tog mang / / bza' shing ra ba rdzing dang chu bran 'bab par ldan/ / ri mchog de la brtan pa spyan ras gzigs kyi dbang / / 'gro ba rnams la phan pa'i don du rnam par spyod/ / de gan song dang nor bzang khyod la mgon po yis/ / yon tan rgya chen tshul la 'jug pa ston par byed/ /

Go, Sudhana, to Mount Potalaka in the ocean, a pure abode of the valiant, Made of jewels, covered with trees, scattered with flowers, complete with gardens, ponds, and streams. On the mountain the steady, wise Avalokiteshvara dwells for the benefit of the world. Go ask him the virtues of the Guides—he will teach you great, wonderful means of attainment.

de nas tshong dpon gyi bu nor bzang gis/ khyim bdag nan khugs kyi rkang pa gnyis la spyi bos phyag 'tshal nas/ khyim bdag nan khugs la lan brgya stong du mas g.yas phyogs su bskor ba byas te/ yang dang yang bltas nas; khyim bdag nan khugs kyi drung nas song ngo// //
So Sudhana paid his respects to Veshthila and went on.
bam po dgu bcu rtsa brgyad pa/
[spyan ras gzigs kyi dbang]
Avalokiteshvara

de nas tshong dpon gyi bu nor bzang / khyim bdag nan khugs kyi gdams ngag rjes su sems shing / byang chub sems dpa'i mos pa'i mdzod de ni shes par byed/ byang chub sems dpa'i rjes su dran pa'i stobs de ni rjes su dran par byed/ sangs rgyas kyi tshul gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pa'i stobs ni yang dag par 'dzin/ sangs rgyas gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pa'i mtshams ni khong du chud par byed/ rnas thos pa'i sangs rgyas kyi mtshan de dag gi ni rjes su 'brang / sangs rgyas kyi chos bstan pa'i tshul de dag ni mthun par byed/ sangs rgyas kyi yang dag par bsgrub pa'i rgyan de ni khong du chud par byed/ sangs rgyas mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya ba'i khyu mchog gi mthu phyung ba de la ni yid ches par byed/ de bzhin gshegs pa'i 'phrin las bsam gyis mi khyab pa de ni mngon du byed cing / mthar gyis ri gru 'dzin gang na ba der song nas/

Reflecting on the teaching of Veshthila, entering the treasury of zealous application of enlightening beings, remembering the power of mindfulness of enlightening beings, remembering the power of the succession of enlightened guides, realizing the unbroken continuity of buddhas, remembering the progression of the hearing of the names of buddhas, following the principles of the teachings of the buddhas, entering into the array of collective practice of the buddha-teachings, intent on the the exclamation made by buddhas on becoming perfectly enlightened, focusing his attention on the inconceivable action of buddhas, Sudhana made his way to Mount Potalaka.

ri gru 'dzin gyi steng du phyin te/ byang chub sems dpa' spyan ras gzigs kyi dbang po yongs su rmed cing tshol tshol ba las/ nub phyogs logs kyi ri'i sman ljongs mtsho dang / mtshe'u dang / 'bab chus mdzes par gyur pa/ bai DUr+ya sngon po'i dkyil 'khor ltar sngo zhing 'jam la gzhon pa'i spang nags tshal chen po'i mthongs na 'dug pa zhig na/ rin po che rdo rje'i rdo stegs shig la skyil mo krung bcas te 'dug cing / rin po che sna tshogs kyi rdo stegs la 'khod pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i tshogs dpag tu med pas kun nas bskor cing chos ston te/ chos kyi rnam grangs 'gro ba thams cad yongs su sdud pa'i yul byams pa chen po dang / snying rje chen po'i sgo gsal bar ston pa zhes bya ba yang dag par ston cing 'dug pa mthong ngo/ /mthong nas kyang dga' rangs te/ mgu zhing nyams bde la tshim zhing yid bde ba skyes nas dga' bas rgyas shing mi 'dzum pa'i mig gis thal mo sbyar nas/ dge ba'i bshes gnyen la dad pa'i shugs dang ldan pas/ sems mi 'khrugs pa/ dge ba'i bshes gnyen mthong na sangs rgyas thams cad mthong bar 'dzin pa dge ba'i bshes gnyen las byung ba'i chos kyi sprin thams cad yang dag par gzung ba'i 'du shes dang ldan pa/ yon tan dang / nan tan thams cad dge ba'i bshes gnyen la rag lus pa'i 'du shes can/ dge ba'i bshes gnyen dang phrad pa shin tu dga' bar sems pa/ dge ba'i bshes gnyen las stobs bcu'i ye shes rin po che 'byung zhing 'thob par 'gyur pa'i 'du shes dang ldan pa/ dge ba'i bshes gnyen las ye shes snang ba mi zad pa 'byung ba'i 'du shes can/ dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyi rten gyis bsod nams kyi rgyud rnam par 'phel bar 'gyur ba'i 'du shes dang ldan pa/ dge ba'i bshes gnyen ni thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi sgo yang dag par ston pa'i 'du shes dang ldan pa/ dge ba'i bshes gnyen ni ye shes kyi rgya mtsho chen po la 'jug pa yongs su ston par 'du shes pa/ dge ba'i bshes gnyen ni thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi tshogs yang dag par 'dus pa yongs su bskyed pa'i 'du shes dang ldan pa de/ byang chub sems dpa' spyan ras gzigs kyi dbang po gang na ba der phyin te/ /

Climbing the mountain, he looked around for Avalokiteshvara and saw him on a plateau on the west side of the mountain, which was adorned with springs, ponds, and streams, sitting wakefully on a diamond boulder in a clearing in a large woods, surrounded by a group of enlightening beings seated on various jewel rocks, to whom he was expounding a doctrine called “light of the medium of great love and compassion,” which concerns the salvation of all sentient beings.
Transported with joy on seeing Avalokiteshvara, his eyes fixed on him, his mind undistracted, full of the energy of faith in the spiritual benefactor, thinking of seeing spiritual benefactors as at once seeing buddhas, thinking of reception of the multitudes of all truths as originating in spiritual benefactors, thinking of the attainment of all virtues as deriving from spiritual benefactors, thinking of how hard it is to meet spiritual benefactors, thinking of spiritual benefactors as the source from which the jewels of knowledge of the ten powers are obtained, thinking of spiritual benefactors as the source of vision of inexhaustible knowledge, thinking that the growth of the sprouts of goodness depends on spiritual benefactors, thinking that the door of omniscience is revealed by spiritual benefactors, thinking that the way to enter the ocean of great knowledge is pointed out by spiritual benefactors, thinking that the accumulation of the store of omniscience is fostered by spiritual benefactors, Sudhana went up to Avalokiteshvara.

de nas byang chub sems dpa' spyan ras gzigs kyi dbang pos/ tshong dpon gyi bu nor bzang ring zhig nas tshur 'ong ba mthong nas smras pa/ tshur shog/ dpe med pa'i theg pa chen po yangs shing / bsam gyis mi khyab pa la zhugs pa/ skye ba las byung ba'i sdug bsngal sna tshogs kyis gtses shing skyabs med par gyur pa'i 'gro ba thams cad yongs su bskyabs pa'i bsam pa dang ldan pa/ sangs rgyas kyis chos thams cad mngon sum du gyur pa/ 'jig rten thams cad las 'das te/ dpe med tshad med pa la mngon par mos pa/ snying rje chen pos byin gyis brlabs pas 'gro ba thams cad yongs su bskyabs pa'i blo gros can/ blta na kun tu bzang po'i spyod pa la mngon du bltas pa/ smon lam chen po'i dkyil 'khor yongs su sbyangs pa'i sems dang ldan pa/ sangs rgyas thams cad kyi chos kyi sprin yongs su gzung bar mos pa/ dge ba'i rtsa ba bsags pas ngoms mi shes pa'i bsam pa dang ldan pa/ dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyi gdams ngag la yang dag par zhugs pa/ 'jam dpal gyi ye shes rgya mtsho las byung ba'i yon tan gyi 'byung gnas sangs rgyas kyi byin gyi rlabs thob par bya ba la mngon du bltas pa/ ting nge 'dzin gyi snang ba dang shugs rab tu thob pa; sangs rgyas thams cad kyi chos kyi sprin gyi char yang dag par gzung ba la mngon par mos pa'i sems dang ldan pa/ sangs rgyas mthong bas dga' ba dang / mos pa'i shugs kyis yid rab tu bde bar gyur pa/ legs par spyod pa tshad med cing bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i shugs kyis mngon par brlan pa'i sems dang ldan pa/ yon tan la nan tan du bya ba'i shugs kyis rnam par dag pa'i bsod nams dang ye shes kyi mdzod bdag la mngon du gyur pa/ thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes mthong ba'i lam gyi shugs gzhan la yongs su bstan pa'i bsam pa can/ snying rje chen po'i shugs ma nyams pa'i rtsa ba dang ldan pa/ de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes snang ba'i shugs yang dag par gzung ba'i blo gros can khyod 'ongs pa legs so/ /

The enlightening being Avalokiteshvara, seeing Sudhana approaching in the distance, said, “Welcome, you who have set out on the incomparable, lofty, inconceivable Great Vehicle, intending to save all beings who are oppressed by various firmly rooted miseries and have no refuge, seeking to directly experience all the teachings of buddhas, which are beyond all worlds, incomparable, and immeasurable; you are filled with the energy of great compassion, determined to liberate all sentient beings, directed toward practice of the vision of universal good, intent on purifying the sphere of great vows, born of the ocean of knowledge of Manjushri, correctly proceeding on the instructions of spiritual benefactors, with the tireless will to build up roots of goodness, seeking to retain the multitudes of teachings of all buddhas; a mine of lotuses of virtue, fit to receive the empowerment of buddhas, imbued with the energy of the light of concentration, seeking to keep in mind the teachings of all buddhas, thrilled with the joy of the vision of buddhas, your mind expanded by the incalculable energy of achievement of virtue, wishing to reveal to others the power of the measure of omniscience to which you have access through your own mystic knowledge, determined to sustain the energy of light of knowledge of buddhas, firmly rooted in the power of great compassion.”

de nas tshong dpon gyi bu nor bzang / byang chub sems dpa' spyan ras gzigs kyi dbang po gang na ba der song nas/ byang chub sems dpa' spyan ras gzigs kyi dbang po'i rkang pa gnyis la spyi bos phyag 'tshal te/ byang chub sems dpa' spyan ras gzigs la lan brgya stong du mar g.yas phyogs su bskor ba byas nas mdun du 'dug ste/ thal mo sbyar nas 'di skad ces smras so/ /'phags pa/ bdag gis bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed na; ji ltar byang chub sems dpas byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa la bslab par bgyi ba dang / ji ltar nan tan du bgyi ba ma 'tshal te/ 'phags pa ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams la gdams ngag dang / rjes su bstan pa mdzad do zhes bdag gis thos na/ ji ltar byang chub sems dpas byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa la bslab par bgyi ba dang / ji ltar nan tan du bgyi ba 'phags pas bdag la bshad du gsol/ de nas byang chub sems dpa' spyan ras gzigs kyi dbang pos/ mdog 'dzam bu chu klung gi gser gyi kha dog tu 'dug pa/ 'od kyi dra ba rnam pa sna tshogs tshad med pa 'phro ba'i rgyan gyi sprin rab tu 'gyed pa'i lag pa g.yas pa brkyang ste/ mtshan dang dpe byad bzang po las byung ba'i 'od zer sna tshogs dri ma med pa/ lus dang sems kyi bde ba tshad med pa rab tu skyed pa'i tshogs kyis shin tu rgyas pa'i lag pa/ tshong dpon gyi bu nor bzang gi spyi bo la bzhag ste 'di skad ces smras so//

Then Sudhana went up to Avalokiteshvara, paid his respects, and said, “Noble one, I have set my mind on supreme perfect enlightenment, but I do not know how to learn and carry out the practice of enlightening beings. I hear you give enlightening beings instruction, and I ask you to tell me how to learn and carry out the practice of enlightening beings.”

rigs kyi bu/ de ltar khyod kyis bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed pa legs so/ /legs so/ /rigs kyi bu/ nga ni byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa'i sgo snying rje chen po'i sgo thogs pa med pa zhes bya ba shes te/ rigs kyi bu/ nga ni byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa'i sgo snying rje chen po'i sgo thogs pa med pa de ni/ 'gro ba thams cad la dbye ba med par sems can yongs su smin par bya ba dang gdul ba la zhugs pa/ sgo kun nas thos shing rnam par rig par 'gyur bas/ sems can yongs su bsdu ba dang gdul ba la nye bar gnas pa ste/ rigs kyi bu/ de ltar byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa'i sgo snying rje chen po'i sgo thogs pa med pa la gnas pas/ de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi zhabs kyi drung nas kyang mi g.yo la/ sems can thams cad kyi dgos pa la'ang sta gon du gnas te/ sbyin pas kyang sems can yongs su sdud do/ /ngag snyan pa dang / don bya ba dang / don mthun pas kyang sems can yongs su sdud do/ /gzugs kyi lus rnam par bstan pas kyang sems can yongs su smin par byed do/ /kha dog dang / dbyibs dang / gzugs bsam gyis mi khyab pa bstan te/ rnam par dmigs par bya ba dang / 'od zer gyi dra ba dgye bas kyang / sems can rab tu sim par byed cing yongs su smin par byed do/ /bsam pa ji lta ba bzhin du dbyangs brjod pa dang / ci la dga' ba'i spyod lam yongs su bstan pa dang / mos pa sna tshogs dang tshul mthun par chos bstan pa dang / rdzu 'phrul dang / rnam 'phrul ba rnam pa sna tshogs dang / dge ba'i chos bsags par bag mi byed pa'i sems can gyi sems yongs su bskul ba dang / bsam pa dang mthun par sprul pa sna tshogs tshad med pa yongs su bstan pa dang / rigs sna tshogs su skyes pa'i sems can rnam dang skal pa mthun pa'i gzugs yongs su bstan pa dang / gnas gcig tu 'grogs pas kyang / sems can yongs su bsdus shing yongs su smin par byed do/ /

Avalokiteshvara said, “It is good that you aspire to supreme perfect enlightenment. I know a way of enlightening practice called ‘undertaking great compassion without delay,’ which sets about impartially guiding all sentient beings to perfection, dedicated to protecting and guiding sentient beings by communicating knowledge to them through all media. Established in this method of enlightening practice undertaking great compassion without delay, I appear in the midst of the activities of all sentient beings without leaving the presence of all buddhas, and take care of them by means of generosity, kind speech, beneficial actions, and cooperation. I also develop sentient beings by appearing in various forms: I gladden and develop them by purity of vision of inconceivable forms radiating auras of light, and I take care of them and develop them by speaking to them according to their mentalities, and by showing conduct according to their inclinations, and by magically producing various forms, and by teaching them doctrines commensurate with their various interests, and by inspiring them to begin to accumulate good qualities, by showing them projections according to their mentalities, by appearing to them as members of their own various races and conditions, and by living together with them.

rigs kyi bu/ de ltar ngas byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa'i sgo snying rje chen po'i sgo thogs pa med pa 'di yongs su sbyangs pas/ 'gro ba thams cad rab tu rten pa'i smon lam bskyed de/ 'di ltar sems can thams cad kyi g.yang sa'i 'jigs pa dang / sems can thams cad kyi rgyud kyi 'jigs pa zhi bar bya ba dang / sems can thams cad kyi mgo rmongs pa'i 'jigs pa rnam par bzlog pa dang / sems can thams cad kyis bcings pa'i 'jigs pa yongs su gcad pa dang / sems can thams cad kyi srog la bab par mi bde ba'i 'jigs pa rnam par bzlog pa dang / sems can thams cad kyi yo byad kyis phongs pa'i 'jigs pa bsal ba dang / sems can thams cad kyi 'tsho ba med pa'i 'jigs pa zhi bar bya ba dang / sems can thams cad kyi grags pa med pa'i 'jigs pa las yongs su bzla ba dang / sems can thams cad kyi 'khor ba'i 'jigs pa rab tu zhi bar bya ba dang / sems can thams cad kyi 'khor du bag tsha ba'i 'jigs pa med pa bya ba dang / /sems can thams cad 'chi ba'i 'jigs pa las rnam par bzla ba dang / sems can thams cad kyi ngan song gi 'jigs pa rnam par bzlog pa dang / sems can thams cad kyi lam mun pas nyam nga ba phyir mi ldog pa'i snang bas gsal bar bya ba dang / sems can thams cad kyi skal ba mi mnyam pa dang 'grogs pa'i 'jigs pa shin tu bsal ba dang / sems can thams cad kyi sdug pa dang bral ba'i 'jigs pa dgag par bya ba dang / sems can thams cad kyi mi sdug pa dang 'grogs pa'i 'jigs pa med par bya ba dang / sems can thams cad lus la mi bde ba'i 'jigs pa dang bral bar bya ba dang / sems can thams cad sems la mi bde ba'i 'jigs pa las dgrol ba dang / sems can thams cad sdug bsngal ba dang / yid mi bde ba dang / 'khrug pa las yongs su bzla ba'i phyir/ 'gro ba thams cad rab tu rten pa'i smon lam mngon par bsgrub pa 'di byas so/ /sems can thams cad kyi 'jigs pa rnam par zhi bar bya ba'i phyir yang 'jig rten du rjes su dran pa'i sgo byin gyis brlabs so/ / sems can thams cad 'jigs pa dang bral bar bya ba'i phyir/ rang gi ming gi 'khor lo'ang 'jig rten du rnam par dmigs par byas so/ /dus ji lta ba bzhin du 'gro bas rnam par dmigs par bya ba'i phyir/ 'gro ba thams cad rnam pa'i bye brag mtha' yas pa dang mnyam par nga'i lus kyang byin gyis brlabs so/ /rigs kyi bu/ de ltar nga ni thabs 'dis sems can thams cad 'jigs pa las yongs su bkrol zhing sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad thob par bya ba'i phyir/ bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed cing phyir mi ldog par byed do/ /

“Perfecting this practice of unhesitating compassion, I have vowed to be a refuge for all sentient beings, to free them from fears of calamity, threat, confusion, bondage, attacks on their lives, insufficiency of means to support life, inability to make a living, ill repute, the perils of life, intimidation by the crowd, death, miserable conditions, unknown hardships, servitude, separation from loved ones, living with the uncongenial, physical violence, mental violence, sorrow, and depression. I have undertaken a vow to be a refuge for all beings from all these fears and perils. I have also caused a way of remembrance to appear in all worlds, to extinguish the fears of all beings; I have caused my name to be known in all worlds to drive away the fears of all beings. I have caused the tranquillity of all beings, in endless forms, to appear in my body, to communicate to all beings individually according to the time. By this means I release beings from all fears, inspire them to seek supreme enlightenment, and cause them never to regress in the attainment of the qualities of buddhas.

rigs kyi bu/ ngas byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa'i sgo snying rje chen po'i sgo thogs pa med pa 'di thob par zad na/ ngas byang chub sems dpa' kun tu bzang po rnams sangs rgyas thams cad kyi smon lam gyi dkyil 'khor la rnam par dag pa/ byang chub sems dpa' kun tu bzang po'i spyod pa khong du chud par rtogs pa/ dge ba'i chos mngon par 'du bya ba rgyun mi gcod pa'i rgyud dang ldan pa/ byang chub sems dpa'i ting nge 'dzin thams cad kyi rgyud la rtag tu mnyam par gzhag pa/ bskal pa thams cad du gnas shing spyod pa las phyir mi ldog pa'i rgyud dang ldan pa/ dus gsum thams cad kyi tshul rjes su rtogs pa'i rgyud dang ldan pa/ 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad kyi klong yongs su 'khyil ba'i rgyud la mkhas pa/ sems can thams cad kyi mi dge ba'i sems rnam par zhi bar byed pa'i rgyud dang ldan pa/ sems can thams cad kyi dge ba'i sems yongs su 'phel ba'i rgyud dang ldan pa/ sems can thams cad 'khor ba'i rgyun las phyir ldog par byed pa'i rgyud dang ldan pa de dag gi spyod pa shes pa'am/ yon tan brjod par nus re skan/

“I have only attained this way of enlightening practice through unhesitating great compassion. How can I know the practice or tell of the virtues of the universally good enlightening beings, who have perfected the vows of all enlightened ones, who have gone the way of the practice of the universally good enlightening being, who are uninterrupted streams of performance of good works, who are always focused on the perception of the concentrations of enlightening beings, who continue their practice without deviation or regression through all ages, who continuously adapt to the times everywhere, who are familiar with the changing currents in all worlds, who continuously work to extinguish all sentient beings’ bad thoughts and to increase their good thoughts, who continuously work to turn all sentient beings away from the repetitious circles of the mundane whirl?”
de la 'di skad ces bya'o/ /
Then this was said:

g.yas phyogs bskor ba byas te gus par bkur bstod nas/ /nor bzang shin tu dul ba lho phyogs rgyud du song / /spyan ras gzigs dbang drang srong snying rje rnam spyod pa/ /rin chen ri yi sul na gnas par des kyang mthong / /
rin chen sna tshogs rdo rje'i ri yi sman ljongs na/ /pad+mo'i snying po'i seng ge'i khri la brtan pa 'dug/ lha dang lha min klu dang srin po mi'am ci/ /rgyal ba'i sras kyis bskor cing de la chos kyang ston/ /
mthong nas nor bzang dga' ba tshad med skyes par gyur/ /bsnyen te yon tan rgya mtsho'i rkang la phyag 'tshal nas/ /ci nas bzang po'i spyod pa bdag gis thob 'gyur bar/ /'phags pas thugs rje bskyed de gdams shing bslab par gsol/ /
bsod nams brgya bas brgyan pa'i dri med lag brkyang ste/ /'od sprin dra ba rgya chen bzang po rab bton nas/ /nor bzang spyi bor bzhag ste sems can rnam dag pa/ /spyan ras gzigs kyi dbang po mkhas pas tshig 'di smras/ /
sangs rgyas sras po da ni rnam thar gcig sgo shes/ /ye shes snying po rgyal ba kun gyi thugs rjes sdug /'gro ba thams cad bskyab cing yongs su bsdu phyir byung / /kun tu bdag nyid rang la byams pa bzhin du rgyu/ /
'gro ba mang po thams cad sdug bsngal kun las skyob/ /gang rnams dam du bcings shing dgra lag phyin pa dang / /lus la gzer cing de bzhin btson rar btsud pa yang / /nga yi ming thos bcings shing bzung ba thar bar 'gyur/ /
rgyal po dag la nyes pa'i g.yon byas gsad spangs pa/ / de tshe de dag nga yi ming yang dran 'gyur na/ /mda' 'phangs de yi lus la phog par mi 'gyur te/ /mtshon rnon btab kyang de dag mi 'dzug rgal bar 'gyur/ /
dbang po'i 'khor du phyin dang gang rnams rtsod gyur pa/ /dgra rnams kun las rgyal 'gyur grags pa thob par 'gyur/ /grags dang grogs dang rigs dang nor rnams 'phel bar 'gyur/ /nga yi ming dran de dag thub pa med par 'gyur/ /
gang gis nga yi ming ni rjes su dran byas pa/ /de dag rkun pos 'jigs dogs dgras 'jigs nags phyin te/ /seng ge dom gzig gcan zan g.yag rgod sbrul gang yang / /dgra rnams kun las rgyal zhing 'jigs pa med par 'gyur/ /
gang rnams la las nga yi ming zhig dran byas na/ /sdang ba'i sems kyis rin chen ltongs su bor gyur tam/ /sol ma dag lce med rab tu 'bar bar bor gyur kyang / /me rnams pad+mos gang ba'i chu yi gter du 'gyur/ /
nga yi ming ni skad 'ga' yud tsam rjes dran na/ /rgya mtsho'i chur bor de yi nang du 'chir mi 'gyur/ /chu bos mi khyer me yi dbus su 'tshig mi 'gyur/ /don med kun tu mi 'gyur don rnams 'grub par 'gyur/ /
shing sgrog dbyig chings lcags sgrog de bzhin ltung rnams dang / /brnyas shing khyad bsad de bzhin bring cing bslus pa dang / /spyos shing bsdigs te gshe dang sma phab rnam pa las/ / nga yi ming tsam dran par byas na thar pa thob/ /
gang rnams shar gnyer sna tshogs glags lta ji snyed dang / /gang rnams rtag tu zhe sdang mi snyan brjod pa'i rnams/ /nga yi ming thos dran byas snyan par brjod par 'gyur/ /mthong ba tsam gyis mod la byams pa'i sems kyang skye/ /
nga yi ming tsam la la gang gis dran byas na/ /gnod pa'i don du ro langs sngags dang byad byed pa'i/ /dgra rnams rtag tu de yi zil gyis non par 'gyur/ /ma lus dug gis de yi lus la mi tshugs so/ /
la la gang gis nga yi ming tsam dran byas na/ /klu dbang srin tshogs mkha' lding sha za thams cad dang / /grul bum srul po 'tshe byed gtum pa'i sems ldan dang / /mdangs 'phrog 'jigs byed rmi lam 'ong ba'ang zhi bar 'gyur/ /
nga yi ming ni skad cig yud tsam dran byas kyang / /pha dang ma dang gnyen gshes mdza' ba kun dang yang / /'bral bar mi 'gyur sdang dang 'grogs par de bzhin min/ /nor zad mi 'gyur phongs pa'i dngos su mi 'gyur ro/ /
nga yi ming gi rjes su la la dran byed na/ /'di nas shi 'phos mnar med sems dmyal mi 'gro ste/ /byol song skye gnas yi mi khom gnas su min/ /sems can dag pa lha dang mi yi gnas su skye/ /nga yi ming ni la la gang gis dran byas na/ /
dmus long zhar ba 'on pa zha bor mi 'gyur te/ /theng po long bar mi 'gyur gsal smra blta sdug 'gyur/ /bskal ba bye ba mang por dbang po kun ldan 'gyur/ /la la gang gis nga yi ming ni rjes dran na/ /
sems can dag pa 'di nas shi 'phos phyogs bcu yi/ /'jig rten khams su sangs rgyas mngon sum skye bar 'gyur/ /sangs rgyas mthong 'gyur de dag chos kyang thos par 'gyur/ /'di dang de bzhin gzhan dag thabs mang ji snyed kyis/ /
'gro ba sems can nga 'dul gzhal dang zad mi nus/ /sangs rgyas sras po ngas ni rnam thar gcig bsgom ste/ / yon tan can gyi yon tan thams cad ngas mi shes/ /

Having respectfully rendered honor and praise, Sudhana, well controlled, went south. On a cliff of a mountain he saw Avalokiteshvara, the seer who abides in compassion.
On a diamond slope, adorned with jewels, Sitting on a lion seat in a lotus calyx, the Steadfast, Surrounded by various creatures and enlightening beings, Expounds the Teaching to them.
Seeing this, Sudhana, his joy unequaled, Went and bowed to the feet of the Ocean of Virtue And said, “Teach me, noble one, with compassion, To attain this good conduct.”
Extending his undefiled arm of a hundredfold auspicious splendor, Radiating far-reaching pure light, Avalokiteshvara, the purified being, the sage, Laid his hand on Sudhana’s head and spoke:
“I know a gate of liberation, the embryo of knowledge Of clouds of compassion of all buddhas, Born of my own love and operating everywhere To protect and care for all beings.
“I protect all beings from many disasters; Those caught in the grip of enemies, Physically injured, and imprisoned Are freed from their bonds on hearing my name.
“Arrows shot at the condemned do not wound them, Weapons break and swords are deflected If they remember my name.
“In disputes among kings, those who remember my name Defeat their adversaries and gain what is good, Increase in repute among friends and relatives, And their property becomes inviolable.
“Any who remember my name Go without fear To forests infested with bandits and wild animals, Conquering all enemies.
“For those who are thrown from a mountain into burning coals By malefactors to harm them, The flames become lotus sprouts in a pond of water If they remember my name.
“Thrown into the sea, they will not die, Nor will they be swept away by a river or burned in fire: No harm will come to them, but rather benefit instead, If they remember my name, even for a while.
“From fetters, chains, and beatings, Scorn, humiliation, and constraint, Abuse, whipping, threats, and scolding, Those who remember my name will gain release.
“The inimical, faultfinders, Those who always maliciously slander, Become friendly on sight When they hear my name remembered.
“Evil magicians trying to kill them are appeased, And no poison can injure those who remember my name. “Malicious spirits, fiends, demons, and goblins, life-sapping, dangerous, Are all quelled, even in dreams, once my name is recalled.
“One will not be separated from family and friends Or be joined with the unfriendly Or become materially destitute, If one remembers my name, even for a while.
“Those who remember my name will not go to hell Or become animals or ghosts Or fall into other unfavorable states; They will be reborn as celestial or human, purified beings.
“People remembering my name will not Be blind, deaf, or infirm; They will not be violent, but friendly And sound in mind and body for countless ages.
“Those who scatter a handful of flowers over me, Calling my name, go to my refuge of bliss; Those who give me offerings with a clear mind Will be worthy of receiving offerings in my buddha-land.
“Purified beings, passing away, are born here, Face to face with the buddhas of all worlds; Those who remember my name see the buddhas And hear their teaching.
“By this and infinite other means I guide sentient beings in the world; I have developed one liberation, And cannot know all the virtues of the virtuous.
“Sudhana has attended spiritual benefactors In the worlds of the ten directions And has not tired of hearing the teaching of the offspring of Buddha; Why would joy not arise while hearing the Teaching?”

de'i tshe byang chub sems dpa' gzhan du mi 'gro ba zhes bya ba/ shar phyogs nas nam mkha'i dbyings las 'ongs te mi mjed kyi 'jig rten gyi khams kyi khor yug gi rtse mor 'dug go/ byang chub sems dpa' gzhan du mi 'gro bas/ mi mjed kyi 'jig rten gyi khams khor yug gi rtse mo la rkang pa gnyis por ma thag tu/ mi mjed kyi 'jig rten gyi khams 'di rnam ba drug tu g.yos te/ rin po che du ma'i rang bzhin du kun nas gnas par gyur to/ /byang chub sems dpa' gzhan du mi 'gro ba des/ nyi ma dang / zla ba'i 'od thams cad zil gyis non pa dang / lha dang / klu dang / gnod sbyin dang / dri za dang / lha ma yin dang / nam mkha' lding dang / mi'am ci dang / lto 'phye chen po dang / brgya byin dang / tshangs pa dang / 'jig rten gyi mgon po dang / me dang / rin po che dang / glog dang / skar ma'i 'od kyang zil gyis non pa de lta bu'i 'od lus bkye ste/ sems can dmyal ba chen po dag kyang snang bar byas/ byol song gi skye gnas dang / gshin rje'i 'jig rten gyi lam gyi rgyud thibs po thams cad kyang snang bar byas te/ ngan song gi sdug bsngal thams cad kyang de ma thag tu zhi'o/ /sems can thams cad kyi nyon mongs pa'ang nyams su mi gnod par gyur to/ /mya ngan gyi zug rngu dang / sdug bsngal sna tshogs kyang rtse zil bar gyur to/ /sangs rgyas kyi zhing sa thams cad du'ang rin po che'i sprin gyi char phab ste/ me tog dang / spos dang / bdug pa dang / phreng ba dang / byug pa dang / phye ma dang / na bza' dang / gdugs dang / rgyal mtshan dang / ba dan gyi rgyan thams cad dang ldan pa'i mchod pa sna tshogs kyi sprin gyi char yang mngon par phab ste/ bcom ldan 'das gang na ba der song ngo/ /de'i lus de'i gzugs brnyan ni/ sems can thams cad kyi gnas su snang ba ste/ bsam pa ji lta ba bzhin du sim par byed pa la mngon par gzhol bas/ ri gru 'dzin de la byang chub sems dpa' spyan ras gzigs kyi dbang po'i drung du'ang phyin par snang ngo/ /

At that moment an enlightening being named Ananyagamin descended from the eastern sky and stood on the top of the mountain range surrounding this world. As soon as he set foot on the mountain, the whole world quaked and appeared to be made of jewels. The body of that enlightening being gave off such a light that the sun and moon were overwhelmed, the lights of all realms of being, fire, jewels, and stars were obscured, the great hells were lit up, the dark recesses of the realms of animals and ghosts were illumined, all ills and miseries were allayed, sentient beings were not bound by afflictions, and all sorrows ceased. He also appeared to go to the buddha, causing clouds of all kinds of offerings—jewels, flowers, perfumes, garlands, robes, parasols, banners—to rain all over the buddha-land, and he also appeared reflected in the abodes of all beings, appearing to them so as to please them according to their inclinations, and he also appeared to have come to the enlightening being Avalokiteshvara on the peak of Mount Potalaka.

de nas byang chub sems dpa' spyan ras gzigs kyi dbang pos/ tshong dpon gyi bu nor bzang la 'di skad ces smras so/ /rigs kyi bu khyod kyis byang chub sems dpa' gzhan du mi 'gro ba/ 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor 'dir phyin pa mthong ngam/ smras pa/ 'phags pa/ mthong ngo/ /smras pa/ rigs kyi bu/ byang chub sems dpa' gzhan du mi 'gro ba'i gan du song la/ ji ltar byang chub sems dpas byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa la bslab par bya ba dang / ji ltar nan tan du bya ba dris shig/

Then Avalokiteshvara said to Sudhana, “Do you see the enlightening being Ananyagamin in this assembly?”
Sudhana said, “Yes.”
Avalokiteshvara said, “Go to Ananyagamin and ask him how to learn and carry out the practice of enlightening beings.”

de nas tshong dpon gyi bu nor bzang gis/ byang chub sems dpa' spyan ras gzigs kyi dbang po'i rkang pa gnyis la spyi bos phyag 'tshal te/ byang chub sems dpa' spyan ras gzigs kyi dbang po la lan brgya stong du mar g.yas phyogs su bskor ba byas nas/ byang chub sems dpa' spyan ras gzigs kyi dbang po'i drung nas song ngo/ /
So then Sudhana paid his respects to Avalokiteshvara and went.
[byang chub sems dpa' gzhan du mi 'gro ba]
Ananyagamin

de nas tshong dpon gyi bu nor bzang / byang chub sems dpa' spyan ras gzigs kyi dbang po'i ye shes kyi gting ma rnyed pa'i sems kyis/ spyan ras gzigs kyi dbang po bltas pas kyang ma ngoms bzhin du bsgo ba dang mi 'gal bar byang chub sems dpa' gzhan du mi 'gro ba gang na ba der song ste/ byang chub sems dpa' gzhan du mi 'gro ba'i rkang pa gnyis la spyi bos phyag 'tshal nas/ mdun du 'dug ste thal mo sbyar nas 'di skad ces smras so/ /'phags pa/ bdag gis bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed na; ji ltar byang chub sems dpas byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa la bslab par bgyi ba dang / ji ltar nan tan du bgyi ba ma 'tshal te/ 'phags pa ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams la gdams ngag dang / rjes su bstan pa mdzad do zhes bdag gis thos na/ ji ltar byang chub sems dpas byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa la bslab par bgyi ba dang / ji ltar nan tan du bgyi ba 'phags pas bdag la bshad du gsol/

Then Sudhana, with Avalokiteshvara’s verse of knowledge in mind, had not seen enough of Avalokiteshvara but obeyed his words and went to the enlightening being Ananyagamin. Paying his respects, Sudhana said, “Noble one, I have set my mind on supreme perfect enlightenment, but I do not know how to learn and carry out the practice of enlightening beings. I hear you give enlightening beings instruction, so please tell me how an enlightening being is to learn and carry out the practice of enlightening beings.”

des smras pa/ rigs kyi bu/ nga ni byang chub sems dpa'i rnam par thar pa'i sgo kun tu 'gro ba thob pa'o/ / smras pa/ 'phags pa khyod kyis de bzhin gshegs pa gang gi zhabs kyi drung nas/ byang chub sems dpa'i rnam par thar pa sgo kun tu 'gro ba zhes bgyi ba 'di brnyes/ / 'jig rten gyi khams de ni 'di nas ji srid cig na mchis/ 'jig rten gyi khams de nas bzhud nas ni ji srid cig lags/ smras pa/ rigs kyi bu/ gnas 'di ni/ lha dang mi dang lha ma yin du bcas pa'i 'jig rten dang / dge sbyong dang bram zer bcas pa'i skye dgus kyang shes par dka' ste/ de ni byang chub sems dpa'i mthu dang / byang chub sems dpa'i brtson 'grus mi ldog pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa mi 'phrog pa'i yul te/ de ni rigs kyi bu/ dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyis yongs su ma zin pa/ sangs rgyas kyis ma dgongs pa/ dge ba'i rtsa ba ma bsags pa/ bsam pa yongs su ma dag pa/ byang chub sems dpa'i dbang po ma thob pa/ shes rab kyi mig dang mi ldan pa rnams kyis thos pa'am/ yongs su gzung ba'am/ yid ches pa'am/ khong du chud par bya bar mi nus so/ /

Ananyagamin said, “I have attained an enlightening liberation ‘speeding forth in all directions.’”
Sudhana asked, “What buddha did you learn it from? How far away is that buddha’s world, and when did you leave that world?”
Ananyagamin said, “This point is hard for celestial, human, and titanic beings, for monks and priests, to know, being the power of an enlightening being, the unregressing energy of an enlightening being, the accomplishment of the energy of an enlightening being. It cannot be heard or retained or believed in or comprehended by those who are not under the tutelage of spiritual benefactors, who are not under the attention of buddhas, who have no accumulated roots of goodness, who have not purified their intentions, who have not attained the faculties of enlightening beings, who do not have the eye of wisdom.”

smras pa/ sangs rgyas kyi mthu dang dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyi gzungs kyis dad pa dang mos par bgyi na 'phags pas bdag la bka' mi stsal tam/ des smras pa/ rigs kyi bu/ nga ni shar phyogs kyi 'jig rten gyi khams dpal gyi snying po dang ldan pa/ de bzhin gshegs pa dpal kun nas yang dag par 'byung ba'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing nas 'ongs te/ de bzhin gshegs pa dpal kun nas yang dag par 'byung ba'i zhabs kyi drung nas/ ngas byang chub sems dpa'i rnam par thar bsgo kun tu 'gro ba 'di thob bo/ /rigs kyi bu/ 'jig rten gyi khams dpal gyi snying po dang ldan pa de nas nga song nas ni/ bskal pa sangs rgyas kyi zhing brjod du med pa'i yang brjod du med pa'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed cig 'das te/ sems bskyed pa re re zhing yang gom pa sangs rgyas kyi zhing brjod du med pa'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed cig por ro/ /gom pa re res kyang sangs rgyas kyi zhing brjod du med pa'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed kyi sangs rgyas kyi zhing 'das te/ sangs rgyas kyi zhing de dag thams cad kyang / de bzhin gshegs pa dang ldan par shes te/ sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag thams cad la'ang de bzhin gshegs pa'i mchod pa bla na med pa/ yid kyi rang bzhin chos nyid mngon par 'du bya ba med pa'i rgyas btab pa/ de bzhin gshegs pas gnang ba/ byang chub sems dpa'i dga' ba yongs su bskyed pas mthong ba byas so/ /'jig rten gyi khams de dag na/ sems can gyi khams rgya mtsho ji snyed pa de dag thams cad kyang mthong ste/ de dag thams cad kyi sems rgya mtsho'ang khong du chud do/ /de dag thams cad kyi dbang po'i 'khor lo yang yongs su shes shing bsam pa dang mos pa ji lta bzhin du gzugs kyi lus yongs su bstan to/ /chos kyi dbyings rab tu bsgrags so/ /'od kyi dkyil 'khor yongs su bkye'o/ /yo byad sna tshogs phun sum tshogs pas kyang nye bar sdud do/ /rang gi lus kyang de dag la byin gyis brlabs te; de ni yongs su smin par bya ba dang / gdul ba'i sbyor ba rgyun mi 'chad pa'i phyir ro/ /shar phyogs nas ji ltar 'ongs pa de bzhin du lho phyogs dang / nub phyogs dang / byang phyogs dang / byang shar gyi phyogs mtshams dang / shar lho'i phyogs mtshams dang / lho nub kyi phyogs mtshams dang / nub byang gi phyogs mtshams dang / 'og dang / steng gi phyogs nas kyang de bzhin te/

Sudhana said, “Please tell me, noble one—I will believe, I will have faith, by the empowerment of buddhas and the assistance of spiritual benefactors.”
Ananyagamin said, “I come from the buddha-land of a buddha named Born of Universal Light in a world to the east called Full of Light. I attained the enlightening liberation ‘speeding forth in all directions’ at the feet of that buddha. As many eons as atoms in untold buddha-lands have passed since I left that world Full of Light. With each thought I take as many steps as atoms in untold buddha-lands, and with each step I pass as many buddha-lands as atoms in untold buddha-lands, in all of which are buddhas. I go to all those buddhas, and honor each buddha with the finest mentally produced offerings, stamped with the cosmic seal that has no formation, approved by the buddhas, pleasing to all enlightening beings. I also observe the oceans of sentient beings in all the worlds, penetrate their minds, discern their faculties, and appear to them bodily in accord with their inclinations and interests, speak of the Teaching, radiate auras of light, and provide them with various material necessities. I adapt my form for them, ceaselessly striving to guide them to perfection. And just as I proceed in the east, so do I also proceed in the south, west, north, northeast, southeast, southwest, northwest, the nadir and the zenith.

rigs kyi bu/ ngas ni byang chub sems dpa'i rnam par thar pa sgo kun tu 'gro ba zhes bya ba 'di shes par zad na/ ngas byang chub sems dpa' phyogs kun tu mngon par gzhol ba tha mi dad pa'i ye shes kyi yul dang ldan pa/ chos kyi dbyings thams cad du lus rnam par bkod pa/ sems can thams cad kyi bsam pa dang / mos pa ji lta ba bzhin du mthun par spyod pa/ zhing thams cad lus kyis rgyas par 'gengs pa/ chos thams cad kyi rgyud kyi rjes su song ba/ dus gsum gyi rgyud mnyam pa nyid du gyur pa/ chos kyi phyogs kyi rgyud dang mnyam pa nyid du gyur pa'i lus dang ldan pa/ 'gro ba'i rgyud thams cad du rnam par snang ba/ de bzhin gshegs pa'i rgyud thams cad la rnam par rtog pa med pa/ chags pa med pa'i rgyud thams cad khong du chud pa/ gnas med pa'i rgyud la rab tu gnas pa de dag gi spyod pa shes pa'am/ yon tan brjod par yang nus re skan/

“I only know this enlightening liberation speeding in all directions. How can I know the practice or tell of the virtue of the enlightening beings who go everywhere, who face in all directions, who are in the realm of unfragmented knowledge, whose bodies are distributed evenly throughout all universes, who adapt their action to all sentient beings according to the inclinations and interests of those beings, whose bodies pervade all lands, who act in accord with the way things really are, who have realized the equality of past, present, and future, who accord with the equality of all places, who illumine the paths of all beings, who do not have arbitrary notions of buddhahood, who go along all paths without attachment or obstruction, who stand on the path of nonreliance?

song / rigs kyi bu/ lho phyogs kyi rgyud 'di nyid na grong khyer sgo dang ldan pa zhes bya ba yod de/ de na lha lha chen po zhes bya ba 'dug gi /de'i gan du song la/ ji ltar byang chub sems dpas byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa la bslab par bya ba dang / ji ltar nan tan du bya ba dris shig /
“South of here is a city called Dvaravati, where the celestial Mahadeva lives. Go ask him how to learn and carry out the practice of enlightening beings.”

de nas tshong dpon gyi bu nor bzang gis/ byang chub sems dpa' gzhan du mi 'gro ba'i rkang pa gnyis la spyi bos phyag 'tshal te/ byang chub sems dpa' gzhan du mi 'gro ba la lan brgya stong du mar g.yas su bskor ba byas nas yang dang yang bltas te/ byang chub sems dpa' gzhan du mi 'gro ba'i drung nas song ngo/ /
So Sudhana paid his respects to the enlightening being Ananyagamin and went on.
[lha lha chen po]
Mahadeva

de nas tshong dpon gyi bu nor bzang byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa rgya chen po'i rjes su song ba'i sems dang ldan pa/ byang chub sems dpa' gzhan du mi 'gro ba'i ye shes kyi spyod yul 'dod pa'i ngang tshul can/ mngon par shes pa chen po/ mngon par bsgrubs pa'i yul la yon tan gyi khyad par du lta ba/ brtson 'grus brtan pa'i go cha rab tu dga' ba'i khyad par thob pa/ bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i rnam par thar pas rnam par rtse ba'i rjes su song ba'i bsam pa dang ldan pa de/ byang chub sems dpa'i yon tan gyi sa la ni nan tan du byed/ ting nge 'dzin gyi sa la ni rnam par dpyod/ gzungs kyi sa la ni rab tu gnas par byed/ smon lam gyi sa la ni 'jug par byed/ tha dad pa yang dag par shes pa'i sa la rjes su slob/ stobs kyis ni yongs su sgrub cing mthar gyis grong khyer sgo dang ldan pa gang na ba der song ste/ lha lha chen po kun tu dris pa dang / de la 'gro ba mang pos bstan pa/ rigs kyi bu/ 'di re/ lha lha chen po grong khyer gyi lam gyi bzhi mdo na/ bdag nyid shin tu che bas sems can rnams la chos ston cing 'dug go; de nas tshong dpon gyi bu nor bzang lha lha chen po gang na ba der song ste/ lha lha chen po'i rkang pa gnyis la spyi bos phyag 'tshal te/ mdun du 'dug ste thal mo sbyar nas 'di skad ces smras so/ /'phags pa/ bdag gis bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed na/ ji ltar byang chub sems dpas byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa la bslab par bgyi ba dang / ji ltar nan tan du bgyi ba ma 'tshal te/ 'phags pa ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams la gdams ngag dang / rjes su bstan pa mdzad do zhes bdag gis thos na/ ji ltar byang chub sems dpas byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa la bslab par bgyi ba dang / ji ltar nan tan du bgyi ba 'phags pas bdag la bshad du gsol/

His mind following the far-reaching practice of enlightening beings, eager to embody the sphere of knowledge of the enlightening being Ananyagamin, seeing the excellence of the qualities of the realm of exercise of great mystic knowledge, girding himself with the armor of steadfast vigor, full of joy, his mind on the freedom of inconceivable liberation, accomplishing the virtues of enlightening beings, practicing concentration, establishing mental command, entering into vows, learning powers of analysis and expression, bringing forth power, Sudhana went to the city of Dvaravati and asked for Mahadeva.
The people of the city told Sudhana, “This Mahadeva is in a temple at a crossroads in the city expounding the Teaching in a giant body.” Sudhana then went to Mahadeva, paid his respects, and said, “Noble one, I have set my mind on supreme perfect enlightenment, but I do not know how to learn and carry out the practice of enlightening beings. I hear that you give enlightening beings instruction, and wish you would tell me how to learn and carry out the practice of enlightening beings.”

de nas lha lha chen pos lag pa bzhi phyogs bzhir brkyang ste/ rgya mtsho chen po bzhi las shin tu myur ba'i shugs kyis chu blangs te/ bdag gi gdong bkrus nas/ tshong dpon gyi bu nor bzang la gser gyi me tog gis gtor te 'di skad ces smras so/ /rigs kyi bu/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni mthong bar shin tu dka' ste/ thos par yang rab tu dka'o/ / skyes bu mchog gi me tog pun da ri ka ni 'jig rten gyi phul du bya ba yin par ngos tshar rmad du byung ba yin te/ 'jig rten gyi gnas su gyur pa'o/ /'gro ba'i rten du gyur pa'o/ /sems can rnams la snang ba chen po 'byin pa'o/ /lam rmongs pa rnams la lam bde ba ston pa'o/ /chos kyi tshul du gzud pa la mgon du gyur pa'o/ /thams cad mkhyen pa'i grong khyer du phyin par bya ba la ded dpon chen po gyur pa ste/ de la kho bo 'di snyam du sems so/ /byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi ming ni sems dri ma med pa rnams la rang gi lus kyi gzugs brnyan ston cing / lus rnam par dag pa rnams la mngon par snang ba dang / ngag gi nyes pa spangs pa rnams dbyangs kyi snang ba yongs su gdon par byed pa dang / bsam pa dag pa rnams la dus thams cad du mngon sum du gyur par gnas pas lta ba ngan pa 'joms pa yin par bsams so/ /rigs kyi bu/ kho bo ni byang chub sems dpa'i rnam par thar pa sprin gyi dra ba thob pa'o/ /

Then the celestial Mahadeva extended four hands in four directions, brought water from the oceans with extreme speed and washed his face; he scattered golden flowers over Sudhana and said, “Enlightening beings are hard to get to see, extremely hard to get to hear. They rarely appear in the world, being so exalted. They are supreme lotuses of humanity, saviors of the world, refuges for the world, reliances for the world. They are great suns, makers of light for sentient beings, the ones who show the path of safety and peace to those on the path of delusion. They are guides to the truth, leaders on the way to the citadel of omniscience. I think ‘killer of wrong views’ is the name for enlightening beings, in that they manifest themselves to those whose minds are undefiled, they appear before those whose deeds are pure, they imbue those who are free from evils of speech with the light of eloquence, and at all times they stand before those whose intentions are purified. Son, I have attained an enlightening liberation called ‘cloud net.’”
smras pa/ 'phags pa/ byang chub sems dpa'i rnam par thar pa sprin gyi dra ba de'i yul ji lta bu zhig mchis/
Sudhana asked, “What is the sphere of this ‘cloud net’ liberation?”

de nas lha lha chen pos tshong dpon gyi bu nor bzang gi mdun du ri chen po tsam gyi gser gyi phung po dang / dngul gyi phung po dang / bai DUr+ya'i phung po dang / shel gyi phung po dang / mus ra gal pa'i phung po dang / asmra gar b+ha'i phung po dang / nor bu rin po che ngang gis snang ba'i phung po dang / nor bu rin po che dri ma med pa snying po'i phung po dang / nor bu rin po che rnam par snang ba'i phung po dang / nor bu rin po che phyogs kun tu mngon pa'i phung po dang / gtsug gi nor bu rin po che dang / cod pan gyi phung po dang / nor bu rin po che sna tshogs kyi se mo do'i phung po dang / dpung rgyan gyi phung po dang / rna cha'i rgyan gyi phung po dang / gdu bu'i phung po dang / ska rags kyi phung po dang / rkang gdub kyi phung po dang / mu tig dmar po'i dra ba'i phung po dang / nor bu rin po che sna tshogs kyi phung po dang / yan lag dang nying lag thams cad kyi rgyan gyi phung po dang / nor bu rin po che yid bzhin gyi rgyal po'i phung po dang / me tog thams cad dang / spos thams cad dang / bdug pa thams cad dang / phreng ba thams cad dang / byug pa thams cad dang / phye ma thams cad dang / gos thams cad dang / gdugs thams cad dang / rgyal mtshan thams cad dang / lha'i ba dan thams cad dang / rol mo brdung ba thams cad dang / rol mo dkrol ba thams cad dang / 'dod pa'i yul thams cad dang / bu mo bye ba brgya stong grangs med pa dag kyang nye bar bstan nas/ tshong dpon gyi bu nor bzang la 'di skad ces smras so/ /rigs kyi bu/ 'di dag las khyer la sbyin pa mang po ni byin cig/ bsod nams mang po ni gyis shig/ de bzhin gshegs pa rnams la ni mchod cig/ sems can mang po ni sbyin pas bsdu ba'i dngos pos yongs su bsdus te/ gtong ba'i pha rol tu phyin pa la khod cig/ 'jig rten na sbyin pa la slobs shig/ gtang bar dka' ba yongs su gtang ba ni ston cig /rigs kyi bu khyod la kho bos ji ltar yo byad kyi rnam pas bstud pa 'di bzhin du sbyin pa'i bsam pa dang ma bral ba'i sems can tshad med pa dag gis bsam pa'i rgyud kyang gtong bas yongs su bsgo ba byed do/ /sangs rgyas dang / chos dang / dge 'dun dang / byang chub sems dpa' dang / dge ba'i bshes gnyen rnams la'ang dge ba'i rtsa ba bskyed cing / bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yang dag par bskul ba byed do/ /

At that moment the celestial Mahadeva manifested a heap of gold the size of a mountain before Sudhana, as well as a heap of silver, a heap of lapis lazuli, a heap of crystals, a heap of coral, a heap of emeralds, a heap of starry jewels, a heap of clear jewels, a heap of radiant jewels, a heap of jewels with facets facing in all directions, a heap of crown jewels, a heap of varicolored jewels, a heap of necklaces, a heap of earrings, a heap of bracelets, a heap of belts, a heap of anklets, a heap of various kinds of flowers, fragrances, incenses, garlands, unguents, aromatic powders, robes, parasols, banners, pennants, musical instruments, and all objects of desire. He then said to Sudhana, “Take of these and give gifts, do good works, make offerings to buddhas, take care of beings by generous giving, get them to practice transcendent relinquishment, teach the world by giving, show relinquishment, which is hard to do. In the same way as I give you all these goods, so also do I make relinquishment habitual in countless sentient beings whose sense of generosity is not repressed. Having gotten them to plant roots of goodness with the Buddha, the Teaching, and the Community, and spiritual benefactors, I get them to aspire to supreme perfect enlightenment.

rigs kyi bu/ gzhan yang kho bo ni sems can 'dod pa'i dga' bas myos pa/ yul gyi longs spyod la yongs su chags pa rnams la yul de dag ni mi sdug par byin gyis rlob bo/ /khro bas non pa dang / nga rgyal can dang / rgyags shing dregs pa dang / rlom pa tshar gcod pas 'dul ba rnams la ni gtum zhing srin po ltar mi sdug la/ 'jigs pa'i lus sha za zhing khrag 'thung ba'i tshul dang ldan bar bstan te/ rlom pa dang snyems pas 'khrug pa de dag thams cad zhi bar byed do/ /le lo can brtson 'grus bor ba'i sems can rnams la ni me dang / chu dang / rgyal po dang / rkun po dang / gnod pa'i 'jigs pa yongs su bstan cing skyo bar byas te/ brtson 'grus rtsom pa la 'god par byed do/ /de ltar thabs de dang de dag gis pha rol tu phyin pa thams cad kyi phyogs dang mi mthun pa rab tu gzhom pa dang / pha rol tu phyin pa thams cad kyi tshogs bsags pa dang / sgrib pa'i ri'i g.yang sa'i lam thams cad las yang dag par bzla ba dang / sgrib pa med pa'i chos la gzud pa'i phyir mi dge ba thams cad las rnam par bzlog ste/ dge ba thams cad phun sum tshogs pa la yang dag par 'god pa byed do/ /

“Furthermore, to those who are intoxicated with the enjoyment of objects of desire, who are very greedy for the enjoyment of objects, I make objects appear impure. To those filled with anger, those who are arrogant, conceited, proud, and haughty, those who should be led away from strife, I show terrors like fiends and ghouls who feed on flesh and blood, and show them that it is all the vehemence of arrogance. To those who are lazy and negligent I show the dangers of fire, water, kings, and brigands, to stir them to vigor and diligence. Thus with various appropriate means I turn them away from bad conduct and get them to develop good qualities, to destroy all impediments to the transcendent ways, to make the necessary preparations for the transcendent ways, to cross over all the precipitous paths on the mountains of barriers to enlightenment, and to enter the unobstructed state.

rigs kyi bu/ kho bos ni/ byang chub sems dpa'i rnam par thar pa sprin gyi dra ba 'di shes par zad na/ kho bos byang chub sems dpa' dbang po ltar nyon mongs pa'i lha ma yin rab tu 'joms pa/ chu ltar 'gro ba thams cad kyi sdug bsngal gyi me'i phung po zhi bar byed pa/ me'i phung po ltar 'gro ba thams cad gyi srid pa'i chu skems pa/ rlung ltar 'dzin pa'i mngon par chags pa thams cad kyi ri rnam par 'thor ba/ rdo rje ltar bdag gis 'du shes sra ba'i brag rab tu rnyil ba de dag gi spyod pa shes pa'am/ yon tan brjod par nus re skan/

“I only know this ‘cloud net’ enlightening liberation. How can I know the practice or tell of the virtues of the enlightening beings who are like the celestial chief Indra, crushing the titans of affliction, who are like water, extinguishing the fire of suffering of all beings, who are like heat, evaporating the water of craving of all beings, who are like wind, shattering the mountains of all attachments, who are like thunderbolts, rending asunder the mountain of the congealed notion of self?

song / rigs kyi bu/ 'dzam bu'i gling 'di nyid kyi yul ma ga d+ha'i snying po byang chub na/ sa'i lha mo brtan ma zhes bya ba 'dug gi /de'i gan du song la/ ji ltar byang chub sems dpas byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa la bslab par bya ba dang / ji ltar nan tan du bya ba dris shig /
“South of here, at the site of enlightenment in the region of Magadha in Jambudvipa, lives an earth goddess named Sthavara. Go ask her how to learn and carry out the practice of enlightening beings.”

de nas tshong dpon gyi bu nor bzang gis/ lha lha chen po'i rkang pa gnyis la spyi bos phyag 'tshal te/ lha lha chen po la lan brgya stong du mar g.yas phyogs su bskor ba byas nas yang dang yang du bltas te/ lha lha chen po'i drung nas song ngo/ /
So then Sudhana paid his respects to Mahadeva and went on.
[sa'i lha mo brtan ma]
Sthavara

de nas tshong dpon gyi bu nor bzang / mthar gyis yul ma ga d+ha'i snying po byang chub tu sa'i lha mo brtan ma gang na ba der song ba dang / de 'gro ba'i tshe sa'i lha mo brgya stong phrag bcu gcig la gcig 'di skad ces 'dzer to/ /sems can thams cad kyi rten du 'gyur ba zhig ni 'di nas tshur 'ong ngo/ /de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying po can/ sems can thams cad kyi ma rig pa'i sgo nga'i sbubs 'dral bar 'gyur ba zhig ni 'di nas tshur 'ong ngo/ /chos kyi rgyal po'i rigs su byung ba/ chags pa med cing dri ma med pa'i chos kyi rgyal po'i go 'phang dam pa 'thob par 'gyur ba zhig ni 'di nas tshur 'ong ngo/ /ye shes kyi mthu bo che rdo rje'i mtshon cha can dpa' bo phas kyi rgol ba'i 'khor thams cad rab tu 'dul ba zhig 'di nas tshur 'ong ngo zhes nas/

Then Sudhana went to the earth goddess Sthavara at the site of enlightenment in Magadha. Ten hundred thousand earth goddesses said to one another, “Someone comes who will be a refuge for all sentient beings; a vessel of enlightenment comes who will break the shell of ignorance of all sentient beings; one who springs from the family of spiritual sovereigns comes who will put on the turban of unattached supreme purity of a spiritual sovereign; a hero bearing the mighty thunderbolt of knowledge comes who will destroy the weapons of all false teachers.”

de'i mod la lha mo brtan ma la sogs pa sa'i lha mo brgya stong phrag bcus sa chen po rab tu bskyod de/ 'brug sgra zab mo lta bu'i sgra chen po grag par byas nas/ stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams 'od chen pos snang bar byas te/ lus rin po che'i rgyan dang lhab lhub thams cad kyis shin tu brgyan nas/ glog gi phreng ba'i tshogs nam mkha'i dbyings las 'gyu zhing snang ba lta bu sha stag tu byas te/ shing thams cad kyi myu gu ni skye bar byed/ me tog gi shing thams cad ni kha 'bu bar byed/ chu klung gi rgyun thams cad ni 'bab par byed/ mtsho dang / mtshe'u dang / lu ma thams cad ni rgyas par byed/ spos chu'i char pa ni rab tu 'bab par byed/ me tog gi sprin rab tu 'thor ba'i rlung chen po ni ldang bar byed/ sil snyan bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong ni rab tu sgra sgrog par byed/ lha rdzas kyi gzhal med khang dang / rgyan gyi tshogs mang po ni rab tu 'khrol bar bed/ ba lang dang / khyu mchog dang / glang po dang / stag dang / ri kyi dbang po ni rab tu sgra 'byin par byed/ lha dang / lha ma yin dang / klu dang / 'byung po'i dbang po rnams ni 'brug sgra 'byin par byed/ ri'i dbang po chen po rnams ni phan tshun thug par byed/ gter gyi tshogs bye ba brgya stong ni mngon du 'byung bar byed cing / sa'i 'og nas 'thon to/ /

Then those earth goddesses, led by Sthavara, caused the earth to tremble, made the ocean roar, illumined the whole universe with a glorious light, and with bodies adorned with all kinds of jewelry, like bundles of lightning bolts descending from the sky, emerged from the surface of the earth, with all tree sprouts growing, all flowering trees blooming, all rivers flowing, all lakes and ponds rising, fragrant rains showering, great winds bearing flowers, billions of musical instruments playing, celestial palaces, ornaments, and tiaras appearing, bulls, elephants, tigers, and lions roaring, the lords of the gods, titans, serpents and spirits thundering, mountains crashing together, and hundreds of billions of treasuries surfacing.

de nas sa'i lha mo brtan mas/ tshong dpon gyi bu nor bzang la 'di skad ces smras so/ /rigs kyi bu khyod 'dir 'ongs pa legs so/ /sa'i phyogs 'di ni sngon khyod kyi gnas su gyur te/ kho mo'i mngon sum du dge ba'i rtsa ba bskyed pa yin na/ de'i rnam par smin pa'i phyogs 'ga' tsam blta bar 'dod dam/
Then the earth goddess said to Sudhana, “Welcome. This is a spot of ground where you have planted roots of goodness, which I have witnessed. Do you want to see the results in one place?”

de nas tshong dpon gyi bu nor bzang gis/ sa'i lha mo brtan ma'i rkang pa gnyis la spyi bos phyag 'tshal te/ sa'i lha mo brtan ma la lan brgya stong du mar g.yas phyogs su bskor ba byas nas/ sa'i lha mo brtan ma'i mdun du 'dug ste/ thal mo sbyar nas 'di skad ces smras so/ / 'phags ma/ 'tshal lo/ /
Sudhana paid his respects to the goddess and said, “I do.”

de nas sa'i lha mo brtan mas rkang pa'i mthil gyis sa chen po la brdabs te/ rin po che'i gter bye ba brgya stong grangs med pas rab tu brgyan pa bstan nas 'di skad ces smras so/ /rigs kyi bu/ rin po che'i gter bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong 'di dag kyang / khyod kyi rjes su 'brang ba'o/ /khyod kyi sngon du 'gro ba'o/ /khyod kyis ci dgar spyad pa'o/ /khyod kyi bsod nams kyi rnam par smin pa las byung ba'o/ /khyod kyi bsod nams kyi stobs kyis bsrungs pa'o/ /'di las long ste/ khyod kyis ci dgos pa de dag gyis shig/ rigs kyi bu/ gzhan yang kho mo ni byang chub sems dpa'i rnam par thar pa ye shes thub par dka' ba'i snying po can thob pa ste/ de ltar kho mo ni byang chub sems dpa'i rnam par thar pa 'di dang ldan pas/ de bzhin gshegs pa mar me mdzad tshun chad du byang chub sems dpa'i rjes su 'brang zhing / rtag tu srung ba la zhugs pa ste/ de tshun chad du/

Then the goddess, touching the earth with the sole of her foot, caused it to appear adorned with hundreds of billions of deposits of countless jewels, and said to Sudhana, “These billions of treasuries of jewels accompany you and are at your service, to be used as you wish; they have been produced as a result of your good works and are preserved by the power of your good works. Take of them and do whatever should be done.

rigs kyi bu/ kho mo ni byang chub sems dpa'i sems kyi spyod pa la rnam par spyod do/ /ye shes kyi yul la 'jug go/ smon lam gyi dkyil 'khor khong du chud par byed do/ /byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa rnam par dag pa rjes su rtogs par byed do/ /ting nge 'dzin thams cad kyi tshul gyi rjes su 'brang ngo/ /byang chub sems dpa'i mngon par shes pa thams cad dang / sems rgya chen pos rgyas par 'gengs so; ;byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyi stobs kyis dbang bsgyur ba dang / zhing gi dra ba thams cad rgyas par dgang ba dang / de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyis lung bstan pa yang dag par mnod pa dang / dus thams cad du mngon par 'tshang rgya ba yang dag par bstan pa dang / chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba'i tshul thams cad dang / mdo sde yang dag par brjod pa'i chos kyi sprin gyi tshul thams cad dang / chos snang ba chen pos snang bar bya ba'i tshul dang / sems can thams cad yongs su smin par bya ba'i tshul dang / sangs rgyas kyi rnam par 'phrul pa thams cad yang dag par bstan pa'i tshul yang rjes su rtogs par byed do/ /yang dag par 'dzin to/ /yang dag par nod do/ /rigs kyi bu/ byang chub sems dpa'i rnam par thar pa ye shes thub par dka' ba'i snying po can 'di yang bskal pa ri rab kyi rdul shin tu phra ba snyed kyi pha rol de'i yang pha rol gcig tu/ 'jig rten gyi khams zla ba'i rgyal mtshan zhes bya bar bskal pa snang bas rnam par brgyan pa la/ de bzhin gshegs pa spyan bzang po las thob ste/

“I have attained an enlightening liberation, ‘unassailable asylum of knowledge.’ Having attained this liberation, I have constantly stayed by and protected the enlightening being Vairocana since the time of Dipankara Buddha. Since then I have observed the enlightening being’s mental activity, entered his sphere of knowledge and all his vows, followed his purification of enlightening practice, gone along into all concentrations, pervaded the vastness of the mind of the mystic knowledges of all enlightening beings, and have comprehended, remembered, and taken in his mastery of the powers of all enlightening beings, his insuperability like that of all enlightening beings, his pervasion of the network of all lands, his reception of the prediction of enlightenment from all buddhas, his manifestation of attainment of enlightenment in all times, his way of activating all the cycles of the Teaching, the doctrines expounded in all the scriptures, his way of revealing the vista of the great Teaching, his way of knowing how to lead all sentient beings to perfection, and his way of manifesting all the miracles that buddhas perform.

rigs kyi bu/ de ltar kho mo byang chub sems dpa'i rnam par thar pa ye shes thub par dka' ba'i snying po can 'di la yongs su dpyod dpyod/ rnam par dpyod dpyod/ shin tu dpyod dpyod/ yang dag par 'phel bar byed de/ shin tu rgyas par byed byed pas/ bskal pa bzang po la thug gi bar du de bzhin gshegs pa mthong ba dang ma bral lo/ /de srid kyi bar gyis kho mos de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas/ sangs rgyas kyi zhing brjod du med pa'i yang brjod du med pa'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed cig bsnyen bkur to/ /de bzhin gshegs pa de dag thams cad snying po byang chub tu gshegs pa'i rnam par 'phrul pa yang mthong ste/ kho mo ni de bzhin gshegs pa de dag thams cad kyi dge ba'i rtsa ba mngon sum du mthong ba'o/ /

“I attained this ‘unassailable asylum of knowledge’ enlightening liberation from the buddha Skillful Guide in the world Moon Banner eons ago, more eons than the number of atoms in the polar mountain, in an eon called Supernal Manifestation of Light. Going in and out of this ‘unassailable asylum of knowledge’ liberation and causing it to expand and broaden, I have always been seeing buddhas, continuing up to this eon of virtue in the present, and now I have propitiated as many buddhas as atoms in untold buddha-lands, and I have seen the spiritual transformations of all those buddhas when they came to the site of enlightenment, and I have witnessed all those buddhas’ roots of goodness.

rigs kyi bu/ kho mos byang chub sems dpa'i rnam par thar pa ye shes thub par dka' ba'i snying po can 'di shes par zad na/ kho mos byang chub sems dpa' de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi zham ring du 'brang ba/ sangs rgyas thams cad kyi gsung gi rjes su 'brang ba/ de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes 'jug par dka' ba la rab tu zhugs pa/ sems kyi skad cig gis chos kyi dbyings thams cad rgyas par 'gengs pa'i shugs dang ldan pa/ de bzhin gshegs pa dang mnyam pa nyid du gyur pa'i lus dang ldan pa/ sangs rgyas thams cad kyi dgongs pa dri ma med pa'i snying por gyur pa/ sangs rgyas byung ba thams cad du rtag tu mngon par bsgrubs pa/ sangs rgyas kyi 'phrin las tha mi dad pa'i pho nyar gyur pa/ de dag gi spyod pa shes pa'am/ yon tan brjod par nus re skan/

“I know only this enlightening liberation ‘unassailable asylum of knowledge.’ How can I know the practice or tell the virtues of the enlightening beings who attend all buddhas, who remember the tales of all the buddhas, who have entered the recondite knowledge of all buddhas, who speed throughout the cosmos in a moment of thought, who are physically equal to the buddhas, who are undefiled receptacles of the mind of all buddhas, who have always effected the birth of all buddhas, who are envoys physically indivisible from all buddhas?

song / rigs kyi bu/ 'dzam bu'i gling 'di nyid kyi yul ma ga d+ha zhes bya ba na/ grong khyer ser skya'i gnas zhes bya ba yod de/ de na mtshan mo'i lha mo dpyid dang ldan pa zhes bya ba 'dug gi /de'i gan du song la/ ji ltar byang chub sems dpas byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa la bslab par bya ba dang / ji ltar nan tan du bya ba dris shig/
“In this country Magadha in Jambudvipa is a city called Kapilavastu, where a night goddess named Vasanti lives. Go ask her how to learn and carry out the practice of enlightening beings.”

de nas tshong dpon gyi bu nor bzang gis/ sa'i lha mo brtan ma'i rkang pa gnyis la spyi bos phyag 'tshal te/ sa'i lha mo brtan ma la lan brgya stong du mar g.yas phyogs su bskor ba byas nas/ yang dang yang bltas te/ sa'i lha mo brtan ma'i drung nas song ngo/ /
So then Sudhana paid his respects to the earth goddess Sthavara and went on.
[mtshan mo'i lha mo dpyid dang ldan pa]
Vasanti

de nas tshong dpon gyi bu nor bzang / sa'i lha mo brtan ma'i gdams ngag rjes su dran par byed cing / byang chub sems dpa'i rnam par thar pa ye shes thub par dka' ba'i snying po can de rjes su dran par bya ba dang / byang chub sems dpa'i ting nge 'dzin bsgom pa de rab tu goms par bya ba dang / byang chub sems dpa'i chos kyi tshul de'i rjes su bsam pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i rnam par thar pas rnam par rtse ba de la rnam par dpyad pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i rnam par thar pa'i ye shes shin tu phra ba de la rnam par blta ba dang / byang chub sems dpa'i rnam par thar pa'i ye shes rgya mtsho de la 'jug par bya ba dang / byang chub sems dpa'i rnam par thar pa'i ye shes tha dad pa de la yid ches par bya ba dang / byang chub sems dpa'i rnam par thar pa'i ye shes shin tu sbyangs pa de rjes su rtogs par bya ba dang / byang chub sems dpa'i rnam par thar pa'i ye shes rgya mtsho de la 'bab par bya ba byed cing / grong khyer chen po ser skya'i gnas gang na ba der phyin te/

Then Sudhana went to the great city Kapilavastu, remembering the teaching of the earth goddess Sthavara, remembering that enlightening liberation “unassailable asylum of knowledge,” extending the cultivation of that enlightening concentration, contemplating that enlightening doctrine, roaming in the freedom of that enlightening liberation, looking into the subtleties of knowledge of that enlightening liberation, entering into the ocean of knowledge of that enlightening liberation, focusing on the unity of the knowledge of that enlightening liberation, pursuing the accomplishment of the endless knowledge of that enlightening liberation, plunging into the ocean of knowledge of that enlightening liberation.

grong khyer chen po ser skya'i gnas la g.yas phyogs su bskor nas/ shar phyogs logs kyi grong khyer gyi sgo nas song ste/ nyi ma nub nas ring po ma lon pa zhig tu grong khyer gyi lam gyi sum mdo'i dbus shig na/ byang chub sems dpa'i gdams ngag mthun par len pa de/ mtshan mo'i lha mo dpyid dang ldan pa mthong bar 'dod cing / dge ba'i bshes gnyen yod na sangs rgyas kyi ye shes 'thob par 'gyur bar nges pa'i blo gros dang ldan pa/ ye shes kyi mig kun tu lta ba'i yul gyi rang bzhin gyi byin gyi rlabs dang ldan pa/ phyogs thams cad du mngon par gzhol zhing / dge ba'i bshes gnyen blta ba'i sems kyis mos pa dang / ye shes chen po'i snying por gyur pa'i 'du shes kyi sems dang ldan pa/ dmigs pa thams cad la rab tu zhugs pa'i ye shes kyi mig dang ldan pa/ chos kyi dbyings kyi tshul thams cad du ye shes rgya mtsho 'byams klas pas rgyas par 'gengs pa dang ldan pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi mig gis/ phyogs thams cad du shes bya'i rgya mtsho la rnam par blta ba/ ye shes chen po'i mig 'thob par bya ba la rab tu gzhol zhing bsam pa rtse gcig tu bzhag nas 'dug 'dug pa dang / mtshan mo'i lha mo dpyid dang ldan pa de/ grong khyer chen po ser skya'i gnas kyi steng gi nam mkha'i dbyings la/ nor bu rin po che sna tshogs dpe med pa'i khang pa brtsegs pa zhig na/ rin po che'i seng ge'i khri chen po spos zhim po thams cad kyi pad+mo'i snying po can zhig la/

Going around the city from left to right, he went in by the eastern gate and stood in the middle of the crossroads of the city. Before long the sun set, and, skillfully grasping the instructions of spiritual benefactors, he longed to see the night goddess Vasanti, considering spiritual benefactors a sure source of attainment of enlightened knowledge, based concretely on the sphere of the eye of universal knowledge, turning in all directions, wishing to see the spiritual benefactor, thinking of her with great respect as the abode of knowledge, his eye of knowledge extending to all objects, looking over the ocean of all that is knowable with the eye of concentration reaching throughout the ocean of knowledge of principles of all reality realms, intent on extension of the eye of great knowledge. He saw the night goddess Vasanti in the sky over Kapilavastu, in a tower of brilliant, incomparable jewels, sitting on a great jewel lion throne in the calyx of a lotus of all the finest fragrances.

lus kyi mdog gser gyi kha dog tu 'dug pa/ skra 'jam zhing mang la mthon mthing du 'dug pa/ mig dkar nag 'byes pa/ gzugs bzang ba shin tu mdzes pa/ blta na sdug pa/ lus rgyan dang lhab lhub thams cad kyis klubs shing brgyan pa/ kha dog bsgyur ba'i gos bgos pa/ tshangs pa'i gtsug tor gyi cod pan zla ba'i dkyil 'khor gyis brgyan pa thogs pa/ lus la rgyu skar dang / gza' dang / skar chen dang / skar ma'i tshogs thams cad kyi gzugs brnyan snang bar gyur pa 'dug par mthong ngo; ;des sems can gyi khams yangs par mi khom pa dang / ngan song dang / ngan 'gro dang / log par ltung ba nas/ sems can ji snyed cig yongs su dgrol ba de dag thams cad kyang / de'i ba spu'i sbubs su chud par mthong ngo/ /ji snyed cig mtho ris kyi 'jig rten du bkod pa dang / ji snyed cig nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi byang chub dang / thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du yongs su smin par bya ba de dag thams cad kyang de'i ba spu'i sbubs su chud par mthong ngo/ /lus mngon par bsgrub pa dang / gzugs mngon par bsgrub pa dang / kha dog mngon par bsgrub pa'i thabs sna tshogs kyis ji snyed cig yongs su smin par byas pa de dag kyang de'i ba spu'i sbubs su chud par mthong ngo/ /nga ro mngon par bsgrub pa dang / dbyangs kyi yan lag mngon par bsgrub pa dang / skad kyi tshul sna tshogs yongs su sbyar ba ji snyed cig gis yongs su smin par byas pa de dag kyang / de'i ba spu'i sgo nas rjes su brjod pa thos so/ dus mngon par bsgrub pa dang / bsam pa dang mos pa ji lta ba bzhin du sems can gyi rjes su 'brang bar bya ba dang / byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i rnam par gnon pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i ting 'dzin gyis rnam par 'phrul ba'i sgo dang / byang chub sems dpa'i khyu mchog gi mthu phyung ba dang / byang chub sems dpa'i rnam par spyod pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i yongs su lta ba dang / byang chub sems dpa'i rnam par lta ba dang / byang chub sems dpa'i rnam par 'phrul pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i skyes bu seng ge chen po'i rnam par bsgyings pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i rnam par thar pas rnam par rtse ba ji snyed cig gis/ des sems can yongs su smin par byas pa de dag kyang / de'i ba spu'i sbubs su chud par mthong ngo; ;

She was beautiful, with a golden complexion, soft, rich black hair, and dark eyes. Her body was adorned with all kinds of ornaments, and she was wearing a red robe. She wore a sacred crest adorned with the orb of the moon, and her body showed reflections of all the stars and constellations. He also saw in her pores all the sentient beings who had been liberated by her from the calamities of unfavorable circumstances, evils, and miserable conditions. He also saw in her pores all the sentient beings whom she had settled in heaven, and all whom she had perfected in the enlightenment of hearers and individual illuminates, and in omniscience. He also saw in her pores all the various means, embodiments, and appearances she assumed to perfect them. He also heard coming from her pores the various utterances she used to teach and develop them. He also perceived in her pores the timing, the adaptation to sentient beings’ inclinations and interests, the enlightening practices, forceful means, ways of mystic transformation through concentration, powers, states, observations, contemplations, mystic projections, powerful expansions of the great person, and free masteries of liberation by which they were perfected.

des thabs sna tshogs dang ldan pa'i chos kyi tshul rgya mtsho de dag mthong zhing thos nas dga' rangs te/ mgu zhing nyams bde la/ tshim zhing yid bde ba skyes nas/ mtshan mo'i lha mo dpyid dang ldan pa de la lus thams cad kyis phab nas phyag 'tshal te/ langs nas mtshan mo'i lha mo dpyid dang ldan pa la lan brgya stong du mar g.yas phyogs su bskor ba byas nas/ mtshan mo'i lha mo dpyid dang ldan pa'i mdun du 'dug ste/ thal mo sbyar nas 'di skad ces smras so/ /lha mo/ bdag gis bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed de/ de ltar bdag gis dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyi byin gyi rlabs kyis/ sangs rgyas kyi yon tan thams cad 'byung bar yang dag par mthong bas dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyi phyag tu bdag nyid por ba lags na/ lha mo shul gang la brten na/ byang chub sems dpa'i stobs bcu'i sar 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i thams cad mkhyen pa'i shul bdag la bshad du gsol/ de skad ces smras pa dang /

Having seen and heard those oceans of teachings involving various means, Sudhana was transported with joy; he paid his respects to the night goddess Vasanti and said to her, “Noble one, I have set my mind on supreme perfect enlightenment. Seeing all qualities of buddhahood as based on spiritual benefactors, I rely on spiritual benefactors. Please show me the way of omniscience whereon an enlightening being sets forth to the stage of the ten powers.”

mtshan mo'i lha mo dpyid dang ldan pas/ tshong dpon gyi bu nor bzang la 'di skad ces smras so/ /rigs kyi bu/ da ltar khyod dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyi byin gyis non te/ dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyi tshig mnyan par 'dod pa dang / dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyi gdams ngag la nan tan du byed pa legs so/ /legs so; ;rigs kyi bu/ khyod ni de ltar dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyi gdams ngag la nan tan du byed pas/ gdon mi za bar bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu nye bar 'gyur ro/ /rigs kyi bu/ kho mo ni byang chub sems dpa'i rnam par thar pa sems can thams cad kyi mun pa rnam par sel ba'i chos kyi snang bas 'gro ba rnam par 'dul ba'i sgo thob pa ste; bsam pa mi mnyam pa dang ldan pa'i sems can rnams la byams pa'i sems dang ldan pa'o/ /mi dge ba'i las kyi lam la zhugs pa rnams la snying rje'i sems dang ldan pa'o/ /dge ba'i las kyi lam la zhugs pa rnams la dga' ba'i sems dang ldan pa'o/ /sems mnyam pa dang mi mnyam par ldan pa'i sems can rnams la mi gnyis pa'i sems dang ldan pa'o/ /kun nas nyon mongs pa rnams la rnam par sbyang ba'i sems dang ldan pa'o/ /nyam nga bar gyur pa rnams la yang dag par zhugs pa'i sems dang ldan pa'o/ / dma' ba la mos pa rnams la yangs pa la mos pa yongs su bskyed pa'i sems dang ldan pa'o/ /dbang po zhum pa rnams la brtson 'grus chen po'i shugs rnam par spel ba'i sems dang ldan pa'o/ /'khor ba la mngon par mos pa rnams la 'khor ba'i rgyud kyi 'khor lo las rnam par bzlog pa'i sems dang ldan pa'o/ /nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa la mngon par mos pa'i sems can rnams la/ thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi lam la dgod pa'i sems dang ldan pa'o/ /

Vasanti answered Sudhana, “It is good that you are so devoted to spiritual benefactors and desire to hear the words of spiritual benefactors. Carrying out the instructions of spiritual benefactors, you will surely arrive at supreme perfect enlightenment. I have attained an enlightening liberation, a means of guiding sentient beings by the light of truth, which dispels the darkness for all sentient beings. I am kind to the evil-minded, compassionate to evil-doers, pleased with those who do good, impartial toward the good and the bad; I am determined to purify the defiled, to set the misguided straight, to inspire higher aspirations in those with low aspirations, to increase the energy of those with inferior faculties, to free those attached to the mundane whirl from its repetitious circles, and to set those oriented toward the vehicles of individual salvation onto the path of omniscience. I am concentrating on these concerns and am imbued with the enlightening liberation through which I guide sentient beings with the light of truth that dispels the darkness for all sentient beings.
