rigs kyi bu/ de ltar kho mo de lta bu'i sems dang yid la bya bar ldan la/ byang chub sems dpa'i rnam par thar pa sems can thams cad kyi mun pa rnam par sel ba'i chos kyi snang bas 'gro ba rnam par 'dul ba'i sgo 'di dang yang ldan pas/ sems can gang ji snyed cig mun nag smag tu gyur pa'i nam la/ mi ni nyal bar gyur/ 'byung po'i tshogs ni rgyu bar gyur/ rkun chom mang pos ni rgyas par gyur/ sems can mi srun pa'i tshul can ni phyogs su rgyu bar gyur/ sprin stug po nag pos kun nas khebs par gyur/ dud pa dang / rdul gyi tshogs kyis ni kun nas 'grigs par gyur/ rdzi char mi bzad pas ni rab tu gtags par gyur/ zla skar gyi tshogs ni mi snang bar gyur/ mig gis bya ba'i mthu ni med par gyur pa'i mun pa la/ sems can gang ji snyed cig rgya mtsho la spyod dam/ thang la spyod dam/ ri la spyod dam/ nags tshal gzhan na spyod dam/ yul gzhan na spyod dam/ grong gzhan na spyod dam/ phyogs gzhan na spyod dam/ phyogs mtshams gzhan na spyod dam/ lam gzhan na spyod kyang rung ste/ rgya mtsho la spyod spyod pa las gru bub par gyur pa'am/ thang la spyod spyod pa las nyam nyes pa'am/ ri la spyod spyod pa las g.yang sa chen por lhung bar gyur pa'am/ 'brog dgon pa la spyod spyod pa las kha zas kyis phongs par gyur pa'am/ nags tshal thibs por sba'i zang zing la thogs pa'am/ tshul ma yin pa'i nyam nyes shig tu gyur tam/ yul gzhan na spyod spyod pa las chom pos bcom pa'am/ grong gzhan na spyod spyod pa las mi srung pa'i tshul can gyis gtses pa'am; phyogs gzhan na spyod spyod pa las 'brog rmis pa'am/ phyogs mtshams gzhan na spyod spyod pa las mgo rmongs pa'am/ lam gzhan na spyod spyod pa las nye zhor gyur kyang rung ste/ rigs kyi bu/ kho mo ni sems can de dag la/ thabs sna tshogs kyi sgo nas skyabs su gyur par byed pa ste/ 'di ltar rgya mtsho chen po la spyod pa rnams kyi rlung sprin nag po gtor ba dang / chu'i rnyog pa dang ba dang / rlung mi bzad pa'i dkyil 'khor bzlog pa dang / rlabs kyi shugs chen po zhi bar bya ba dang / klong gi 'jigs pa las thar par bya ba dang / phyogs bstan pa dang / chu'i lam legs par dmigs pa dang / 'gram bstan pa dang / rin po che'i gling du phyin par bya ba'i phyir lam yongs su ston te/ yongs su sbud pa'i gzugs dang; ded dpon gyi gzugs dang / rta'i rgyal po rngog chen gyi gzugs dang / glang po'i rgyal po'i gzugs dang / rus sbal gyi rgyal po'i gzugs dang / lha ma yin gyi rgyal po'i gzugs dang; nam mkha' lding gi rgyal po'i gzugs dang / mi'am ci'i rgyal po'i gzugs dang / lto 'phye chen po'i rgyal po'i gzugs dang / rgya mtsho'i lha'i gzugs dang / mnyan pa'i gzugs kyis skyabs su gyur par byed do/ /dge ba'i rtsa ba de yang 'di ltar/ sems can thams cad sdug bsngal gyi phung po thams cad las yongs su bzlog pa'i phyir skyabs su gyur par shog cig ces yongs su bsngo'o/ /

“Any people who travel on a dark night, where ghosts, thieves, and thugs lurk, when the sky is covered with black clouds, when it is misty, windy, and raining, when there is no moonlight or starlight, when there is no visibility, if they go on the sea, or on land, or in the mountains, or over deserts, or through forests, or through provinces or villages, or on the roads, if they are shipwrecked at sea or held up on land, or fall in the mountains or run out of provisions in the desert, or if they get stuck in the underbrush in the forest or run into trouble, or if they get scattered in the darkness, or if they get mugged in a town, or if they get lost or confused and cannot tell which direction they are going in, or if they run into disaster on the road, I rescue them by various means. For those traveling on the sea I quell hurricanes, get them past bad waters, stop unfavorable winds, quiet the raging billows, free them from the perils of whirlpools, clarify the directions, lead them on the right sea lanes, show them the channels, guide them to the isles of treasure, show them the way in the form of a navigator. Through various forms of being I act as a support and reliance. This root of goodness, furthermore, I dedicate in this way: ‘May I be a refuge for all sentient beings, to put an end to all suffering.’

thang la spyod pa'i sems can mun pa chen po shin tu gnag pa'i nam la/ sa gzhi 'od ma dang / tsher ma dang / gseg ma dang / gyo mos gang ba/ sbrul gdug pa gtum po shin tu mang ba/ thag thug dang mi bde ba'i lam can/ rdul dang phyag dar shin tu 'thul ba/ rdzi char drag pos gtags pa/ tsha ba dang / grang ba'i sdug bsngal yod pa/ sbrul dang gcan zan gyis bag tsha ba yod pa/ thong [*thod?] mi dang chom po rgyu bar gyur pa zhig la/ mgo 'khor bar gyur ba'i sems can rnams la nyi ma'i gzugs dang / zla ba'i gzugs dang / skya rengs 'char ba'i gzugs dang / skar mda' chen po'i gzugs dang / glog gi phreng ba 'byung ba'i gzugs dang / rin po che'i 'od kyi gzugs dang / gza'i 'khor gyi gzugs dang / rgyu skar dang / skar ma'i tshogs kyi gzhal med khang gi 'od kyi gzugs dang / lha'i gzugs dang / byang chub sems dpa'i gzugs kyis skyabs su gyur par byed do/ /sems dge ba'i rtsa ba 'dis/ nyon mongs pa'i mun pa thams cad rnam par bsal ba'i phyir/ sems can thams cad kyi skyabs su shog cig par bskyed do/ /

“For those on land on a dark night, where there are thickets and brambles, gravel and grit, on uneven terrain, battered by vicious wind and rain, painfully cold or hot, where savage beasts lurk, where killers and bandits roam, I save those who have lost their way on the earth, by means of the forms of the sun, the risen moon, meteoric showers, planets, the light of the stars, celestial beings, and enlightening beings. And I think: By this root of goodness may I become a savior of all sentient beings.

ri'i g.yang sa la spyod cing 'chi bas 'jigs skrag pa rnams kyi srog dbyung ba dang / grags pa 'dod pa'i dbang du gyur pa dang / snyan pa dang / sgra'i rgyal mtshan 'dod pa dang / longs spyod tshol ba dang / 'dod pa'i zil gyis non pa dang / yo byad yongs su btsal ba la brtson pa dang / 'jig rten gyi phun sum tshogs pa 'dod cing brtson pa dang / bu dang chung ma gtong mi phod pas thogs par gyur pa dang / lta ba'i thibs por 'khyams pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / 'jigs pa sna tshogs kyis gtses pa rnams la yang / thabs sna tshogs kyi sgo nas skyabs su gyur par byed de/ 'di ltar ri'i phug dang / bya skyibs mngon par bsgrub pa dang / shing tog dang / rtsa ba bzar rung ba mngon par bsgrub pa dang / chu'i lam dang / chu mig mngon par bsgrub pa dang / tsha ba dang / grang ba'i gnyen po mngon par bsgrub pa dang / yang dag pa'i lam bstan pa dang / ka la ping+ka'i sgra skad bsgrag pa dang / rma bya'i rgyal po skad 'byin pa'i dbyangs dang / sman 'bar bas snang ba'i gzugs dang / ri'i lha'i 'od kyi gzugs dang / ri'i phug dang / sul dang / ltongs su rlag ste sdug bsngal sna tshogs kyis gtses pa'i sems can rnams kyi mun pa'i rab rib rnam par bsal ba dang / sa'i gzhi mnyam par mngon par bsgrub pas skyabs su gyur par byed de/ sems kyang ji ltar bdag gis sems can ri la spyod pa 'di dag yongs su bskyabs pa de bzhin du/ 'khor ba'i ri'i lam rgyud g.yang sa la gnas shing / rga shi'i gdon gyis zin pa de dag gi skyabs su yang bdag 'gyur bar shog cig par bskyed do/ /

“For those on precipitous mountain paths, in danger of death, so that they may live, and for those who are dominated by the desire for fame, those who wish for renown, those who seek enjoyment, those who are avaricious, those who strive to get material things, those whose foremost desire is worldly success, those who are wrapped up in affection for their families, those who are lost in the jungle of views, and those who are oppressed by various miseries and fears, I become a refuge by various means: for example, by producing caves in the mountains for shelter, by producing fruits and roots for food, by producing streams for drinking water, by producing shelter against cold and heat, by showing the right path, by the songs of birds, by the luster of medicinal plants, by the glow of mountain spirits. I become a refuge for those in mountain caves and crevices, those oppressed by various pains, dispelling the darkness, producing level ground for them. And I resolve that just as I rescue these people in the mountains, so will I become a refuge for those fallen on the precipitous trails of the mountain of mundane existence, who are in the grip of old age and death.

nags tshal thibs po'i dra bas thogs pa'i sems can mtshan mo mun pa'i mun nag gis chod de/ shing dang shing phran 'dzings pa'i gseb shin tu nyam nga ba dang / chu dang / rtswa dang / sdong po dang / 'khri shing gis lam chod pa dang / shing dang / shing phran sna tshogs kyi nags tshal thibs po'i nang du phyin te/ stag gi sgra thos pas skrag pa'i snying can/ don ma grub pas sems 'khrugs par gyur pa dang / 'jigs pa dang / 'tshe ba dang / mi dga' ba sna tshogs kyis nyams mi bde ba/ nags tshal stug po nas 'byung ba'i phyogs mi shes pa rnams la/ kho mo ni bde bar 'gro ba'i lam yongs su ston par byed do/ /sems kyang 'di ltar dge ba'i rtsa ba 'dis/ sems can lta ba thibs po sna tshogs la gnas pa/ sred pa'i dra bas 'khris par gyur pa/ 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal sna tshogs kyis gtses pa rnams sdug bsngal thams cad las yongs su 'grel par shog cig par bskyed do/ /

“For those stuck in the jungle on a dark night, confronted with a vast expanse of trees, on roads blocked by grass and water, reeds, trees, and vines, in thickets of various trees and creepers, frightened by tigers roaring, their minds filled with what they have to do, plagued with various perils and misfortunes, not knowing the way out of the forest, I show the right way to go. And I resolve that by this root of goodness I will free those in the thicket of views, caught in the web of craving, oppressed by the various pains and perils of the mundane whirl, liberating them from all miseries.

'brog dgon pa la spyod pa'i sems can mun pa'i nang na 'thoms pa rnams kyang thabs kyi sgo sna tshogs kyis bde ba yongs su bskyed cing lam bstan te/ de dag 'jigs pa med pa dang / bde ba la rab tu bkod nas /sems kyang dge ba'i rtsa ba 'dis/ sems can 'khor ba'i 'phrog dgon pa na 'thoms pa/ ngan song thams cad kyi lam du zhugs pa rnams/ sdug bsngal thams cad las yongs su bkrol te/ shin tu phun sum tshogs pas bde ba'i thams cad mkhyen pa'i lam la rab tu dgod par bya bar shog cig par bskyed do/ /

“And as for those in the desert, in the darkness, by various means I comfort them, show them the way, and lead them to safety, resolving that by this root of goodness I shall liberate those who are in the desert of the mundane whirl, who have fallen into evil ways, freeing them from all suffering and setting them on the road of omniscience, where there is eternal safety.

rigs kyi bu/ yul dang ljongs la chags pa'i sems can mngon par chags pa'i rgyu las byung ba'i sdug bsngal nyams su myong bar gyur pa rnams la yang kho mo ni skyo bar bya ba'i thabs sna tshogs kyis yul la mngon par chags pa de las gyen du bskyod pa byed de/ sems kyang 'di ltar dge ba'i rtsa pa 'dis sems can thams cad phung po la mngon par chags pa las gyen du bskyod de/ gnas med pa'i thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes la dgod par bya bar shog cig par bskyed do/ /

“As for those in inhabited areas who are experiencing the trouble of owning a home, I draw them away from their attachments to their abodes by various means and resolve by this root of goodness to remove all sentient beings from attachment to the elements of body and mind and establish them in nonreliant omniscience.

rigs kyi bu/ kho mo ni grong na spyod pa'i sems can khyim dang / gnas kyi 'ching pas glags pa rnams/ mtshan mo mun pa shin tu gnag pas chod pa'i nang na/ khyim gyi don sna tshogs nyams su gnod pas sdug bsngal bar gyur pa rnams kyang skyo bar 'gyur ba'i sgo sna tshogs kyis skyo bar byas te/ chags pa med pa'i sems yongs su bskyed nas/ chos kyi sbyin pas yongs su bzung ste/ tshim par byas nas rten pa med pa'i chos la bkod de/ sems kyang 'di ltar dge ba'i rtsa ba 'dis/ sems can skye mched drug gi grong la gnas pa rnams 'khor ba'i lam gyi rgyud kyi spyod yul las gyen du bskyod de/ thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes kyi spyod yul la dgod par bya bar shog cig par bskyed do/ /

“As for those in villages who are attached to their house and relatives, beset by various family troubles, their minds agitated by various anxieties, I take care of them by material gifts and please them in a proper manner, establish them in the state of nonattachment, and resolve by this root of goodness to remove those who cling to the village of their senses from the sphere of mundane objects and set them in the sphere of omniscience.

rigs kyi bu/ gang yang mtshan mo mun pa shin tu gnag pa'i nang na/ shar phyogs la sogs pa'i phyogs dang / phyogs mtshams re rer phyogs bslad par gyur pa/ sa'i phyogs mnyam pa la mi mnyam pa'i g.yang sar 'du shes pa dang / sgang bu la gshong du 'du shes par gyur te/ phyogs kyi lam dang / sa tshod la mgo 'khor bar gyur pa de dag la'ang / kho mo ni thabs sna tshogs kyis snang bar byas te/ phyir 'byung ba rnams la ni sgo yongs su ston to/ /rgal bar 'dod pa rnams la ni mu stegs yongs su ston to/ /brkyal bar 'dod pa rnams la ni gru yongs su ston to/ /khyim du 'gro bar 'dod pa rnams la ni khyim yongs su ston to/ /rnam par blta bar 'dod pa rnams la ni phyogs yongs su ston to/ /sa'i gzhi mtho ba dang / dma' ba yongs su ston to/ /sa'i gzhi phyogs mnyam pa dang / mi mnyam pa dang / gzugs kyi rnam pa sna tshogs kyang yongs su ston to/ /lam gyis dub pa rnams la grong dang / grong khyer dang / ljongs dang / khams dang / rgyal po'i pho brang 'khor kyang yongs su ston to/ /tsha ba dang / skom pas mnar ba rnams la yang mtsho dang / mtshe'u dang / lu ma dang / rdzing dang / rdzing bu dang / chu klung dang / nags tshal dang / bza' shing gi ra ba dang / kun dga' yid du 'ong ba yongs su ston to/ /sdug pa dang bral zhing phrad par 'dod pa rnams la; pha dang / ma dang / bu dang / chung ma dang / mdza' bo dang / blon po dang / gnyen bshes dang / yid du 'ong ba'i gzugs kyi rnam pa sna tshogs yongs su ston te/ sems kyang ji ltar bdag gis sems can mtshan mo mun pa mun gnag gis chod pa/ mig rab rib kyis nyams pa/ phyogs bslad pa/ lam 'khor ba rnams la/ gzugs kyi rnam pa sna tshogs rnam par dmigs par bya ba'i phyir snang ba bskyed de/ 'od byas pa de bzhin du/ bdag gis yun ring po nas 'khor ba'i mun ba na gnas pa'i sems can yang dag pa nyid kyi phyogs la bslad pa/ ma rig pa'i mun par 'thoms pa/ ye shes kyi mig mi shes pa'i ling tog gis chod pa/ 'du shes dang / sems dang / lta bas phyin ci log tu gyur pa/ mi rtag pa la rtag par 'du shes pa/ sdug bsngal ba la bde bar 'du shes pa/ bdag med pa la bdag tu 'du shes pa/ mi sdug pa la sdug par 'du shes pa/ bdag dang / sems can dang / srog dang / gso ba dang / gang zag tu 'dzin pa dam po la gnas pa/ phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched la gnas pa/ rgyu dang 'bras bu la mgo 'khor ba/ mi dge ba'i las kyi lam gyi phyogs su zhugs pa/ srog gcod pa/ ma byin par len pa/ 'dod pas log par g.yem pa/ brdzun du smra ba/ phra ma zer ba/ ngag rtsub po 'byin pa/ tshig kyal pa smra ba/ chags sems dang ldan pa/ gnod sems kyi sems dang ldan pa/ log par lta ba can/ phar mi shes pa/ mar mi shes pa/ dge sbyong dang bram zer mi shes pa/ dbang po mi shes pa/ skyes bu dam pa mi shes pa/ chos ma yin pa la chags shing zhen pa/ mi tshul pa'i 'dod pas zil gyis non pa/ log pa'i chos kyis yongs su 'khris pa/ de bzhin gshegs pa la skur pa 'debs pa/ chos kyi 'khor lo nub par bya ba la zhugs pa/ bdud kyi rgyal mtshan 'dzin pa/ byang chub sems dpa' la gnod par byed pa/ theg pa chen po la zhe sdang ba/ byang chub kyi sems la mos pa spong bar byed pa/ byang chub sems dpa' la mi snyan du brjod pa/ snod ma bskams par snying ring ba/ gnod pa ma byas par dgrar len pa/ 'phags pa la skur pa 'debs pa/ skyes bu dam pa ma yin pas spyod pa'i chos kyi spyod yul can/ mchod rten dang dge 'dun gyi dngos po la 'khu ba/ pha ma la log par sems pa/ mtshams med pa'i las byed pa/ g.yang sa chen po la mngon par bltas pa'i sems can rnams kyi ma rig pa'i mun pa/ shes rab kyi snang ba chen pos bsal te/ bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yang dag par bskul nas/ theg pa chen po kun tu bzang pos stobs bcu'i ye shes kyi sa'i lam yongs su ston par gyur cig /de bzhin gshegs pa'i sa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i yul dang / thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes kyi tshul rgya mtsho dang / sangs rgyas gyi ye shes kyi spyod yul dang / sangs rgyas kyi yul dang / stobs bcu yongs su grub pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi gzungs kyi stobs dang / sangs rgyas thams cad kyi sku mchog tu gyur pa yongs su ston par shog cig/ yongs su bstan nas kyang / sangs rgyas thams cad kyi mnyam pa nyid kyi gnas la rab tu dgod par shog cig par bskyed do/ /

“As for those who lose their sense of direction on a dark night, who think level ground is uneven, who think high ground is low, who think low ground is high, I light the way for them by various means. To those who want to go out I show the door, to those who want to travel I show the road, to those who want to cross over I show the bridge, to those who want to go in I show the house, to those who want to look around I show the directions. I show the high and low ground, the smooth and rough terrain and its various formations. I show travelers the villages, cities, towns, provinces, and capitals. I show those who are hot and thirsty streams and ponds and groves and parks. To those grieving at separation from their loved ones I show their family and friends, advisers, acquaintances, and kin, and various pleasing forms. And I resolve that just as I light the way for those in the dark who cannot see and have lost their way, as I create light to make various forms manifest, in the same way I will use the light of great wisdom to destroy the darkness of ignorance of those in the long night of the mundane whirl, who have no sense of direction at all, who are in the darkness of ignorance, whose eye of knowledge is covered by the veil of nescience, who are perverted in concepts, thoughts, and views, who think the impermanent is permanent, who think the painful is painless, who think the selfless has self, who think the impure is pure, who cling to a definite self, being, life, soul, individuality, and personality, who are attached to sense faculties, sense consciousnesses, and sense data, who are confused about cause and effect, who do what is not good, who take life, who steal, who abuse sexuality, who tell lies, who slander others, who speak harshly, who sow dissension, who are covetous, who are malicious, who hold erroneous views, who do not honor their parents or mendicants or priests, who do not recognize the blameworthy or the good, who do not take pleasure in what is right, who are dominated by ill-gotten gain, who pervert what is right by erroneous views, who falsely impugn the enlightened, who try to suppress true teaching, who fly the banner of demons, who injure or kill enlightening beings, who are hostile to the Great Vehicle, who cut off the aspiration for enlightenment, who defame enlightening beings, who injure or kill their mothers, who are hostile, who revile the wise, who consort with the corrupt and unjust, who damage the relics of saints and the goods of the religious community, who oppose their parents, who act in hellish ways, who are on the brink of disaster—having destroyed the darkness of their ignorance by the light of great wisdom and directed them toward supreme perfect enlightenment, by the Great Vehicle of universal good I shall show them the path to the stage of knowledge of the ten powers; I shall show them the stage of the enlightened, the realm of the enlightened, the ocean of wisdom of omniscience, the sphere of enlightened knowledge, the consummation of the ten powers, the power of mental command of buddhas, and the unity of all bud-dhas. Having shown them this, I will establish them in the knowledge of equality of all buddhas.

rigs kyi bu/ kho mo ni sems can yun ring po nas na zhing nad kyis yongs su skyo ba/ lus nyam chung ba dang / rgas pa/ rga ba'i zil gyis non pa dang / mgon med pa dang / phongs shing dbul pa dang / log par ltung ba dang / yul gzhan du phyin pa dang / phyogs log par zhugs pa dang / btson ra na 'dug pa dang / chad pas bcad pa dang / nyes pa byung ste rgyal pos gsad par bkri ba rnams kyang srog dang bral gyi 'jigs pa las yongs su bskyab pa'i phyir gnas so/ /
rigs kyi bu/ de ltar kho mo ni sems can nad pa rnams kyi nad thams cad ni thabs thams cad kyis gso bar nan tan du byed do/ /rgas pa dang / rga ba'i zil gyis non pa rnams la ni/ bsnyen bkur ba dang / rim gro dang / yo byad kyis mi phongs par yongs su sdud par byed do/ /mgon med ba'i sems can rnams la mgon byed do/ /phongs shing dbul ba rnams ni nor dang gser gyi phung pos yongs su sdud do/ /log par ltung ba rnams ni don mthun pas yongs su sdud do; ;yul gzhan du phyin pa rnams ni rang gi yul du phyin par byed do/ /phyogs log par zhugs pa rnams ni phyogs ma nor bar 'dzud do; ;btson ra na 'dug pa rnams ni btson ra nas thar bar byed do/ /chad pas bcad pa ni chad pa'i sdug bsngal las grol bar byed do/ /nyes pa byung ste rgyal pos gsad par bkri ba rnams ni srog gi dbugs phyin pa thob par byed de/ sems kyang bdag ji ltar sems can 'di dag 'jigs pa dang / gnod pa sna tshogs las yongs su skyob cing mgon byed pa de bzhin du/ bdag gis 'di rnams bla na med pa'i chos kyi yongs su bsdu bas yongs su bsdus te/ nyon mongs pa thams cad las yongs su dgrol bar bya'o/ /skye ba dang / rga ba dang / na ba dang / 'chi ba dang / mya ngan dang / smre sngags 'don pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / yid mi bde ba dang / 'khrugs pa las yang dag par bzla bar bya'o/ /ngan song dang / log par ltung ba'i 'jigs pa thams cad las yongs su dgrol bar bya'o/ /dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyi gzugs la rab tu dgod par bya'o/ /chos rin po che sbyin pa'i yongs su bsdu bas yongs su bsdu bar bya'o/ /kha na mtho ba med pa'i las la rab tu dgod par bya'o/ /de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku rnam par dag pa yang dag par bskul bar bya'o/ / rga shi yongs su med pa'i dbyings shin tu rtogs pa las rab tu dgod bar bya bar bskyed do/ /

“As for those who are sick, who are worn out from long illness, whose bodies are weakened, who have wasted away, those who have grown old and are overcome by old age, those who are wretched and poor, those who have come to the end of their lives, those who are in bondage, those who are being tortured, and convicts who have been imprisoned, I stand by them to save them from the danger of injury to their lives. I employ all means to remove the illnesses of those who are sick. Those who are wasted away and overcome by old age I take care of by constant attendance. I provide protection for the helpless, I enrich the poor, I take care of those who have fallen into misfortune by regarding their welfare as my own. Those abroad I lead to their own country, and those astray I lead in the right direction. Those in bondage I release from their bonds. Those who are being tortured I release from the pain of torture. I save the lives of convicts who have been handed over to the king for execution. I resolve that just as I am a refuge saving these beings from various perils and afflictions, so shall I take care of them with the supreme protection of the truth and liberate them from all mental afflictions. I shall enable them to transcend birth, old age, sickness, death, grief, lamentation, misery, depression, and mental disturbance. I shall free them from all fears of falling into bad conditions. I shall establish them in the care of spiritual benefactors. I shall take care of them by giving them jewels of true teaching. I shall get them to act impeccably. I shall direct them to the purity of the body of the enlightened. I shall establish them in the knowledge of the realm where there is ultimately no old age or death.

rigs kyi bu/ kho mo ni sems can log pa'i lam la zhugs pa/ lta ba'i rnam pa thibs po sna tshogs la mngon par zhen pa/ log par lta ba'i spyod yul can/ lus dang ngag dang yid kyi las nya ma nga bar 'gyur ba la yongs su spyod pa/ brtul zhugs dang dka' thub sna tshogs la gnas pa/ yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas ma yin yang / yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas su 'du shes pa/ lus gdung ba dang / yongs su gdung ba la rab tu brtson pa/ mtsho dang / mtshe'u dang / lu ma dang / rdzing bu dang / chu klung dang / ri'i gzar dang / phyogs dang / phyogs mtshams la 'dud cing phyag 'tshal ba la mos pa/ sdig pa'i grogs po'i dbang du gyur pa rnams la yang / thabs sna tshogs kyis mgon du gyur par byed de/ da dag sdig pa'i lta ba'i rnam pa dang / ngan song thams cad kyi g.yang sar ltung ba'i lam las rnam par bzlog go/ 'jig rten pa'i yang dag par lta ba la rab tu bkod cing / lha dang mi'i phun sum tshogs pa la yang yongs su 'god do/ /sems kyang ji ltar bdag gis sems can 'di dag nyam nga ba'i nan tan dang sdug bsngal las yongs su 'grol ba de bzhin du/ bdag gis sems can thams cad kyang 'phags pa 'jig rten las 'das pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i lam la bkod de/ thams cad mkhyen pa nyid las phyir mi ldog par byas la/ kun tu bzang po'i smom [*smon?] lam chen pos/ thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la dgod par bya'o/ /sems can gyi khams thams cad ma dul gyi bar du/ byang chub sems dpa'i sa las kyang mi g.yo bar bya bar bskyed do/ /

“As for those on wrong paths, those in the tangles of various views, those acting on erroneous conceptions, those doing evil in thought, word, and deed, those uncontrolled in action, those devoted to various pious observances and ascetic practices, those who think the unenlightened are enlightened, those who think the enlightened are unenlightened, those who practice self-torture, those who worship bodies of water, mountains, or particular places, and those who are under the control of bad companions, I become a refuge for them by various means and thence turn them away from evil, from immersion in views, from all bad conditions. I establish them in right seeing in the world and place them in celestial and human states. I resolve that just as I liberate these sentient beings from the miseries of such bad behavior, so shall I establish all sentient beings in the transmundane path of transcendence, make them irreversible in progress toward omniscience, and lead them to omniscience by the great vow of universal good; and I shall not fall from the stages of enlightening beings, while not turning away from the realm of all sentient beings.”

de nas mtshan mo'i lha mo dpyid dang ldan pas/ de'i tshe byang chub sems dpa'i rnam par thar pa'i phyogs sems can thams cad kyi mun pa rnam par sel ba'i chos kyi snang bas 'gro ba rnam par 'dul ba'i sgo 'di brnan te/ bstan par bya ba'i phyir/ sangs rgyas kyi byin gyi rlabs kyis phyogs bcur rnam par bltas te/ tshong dpon gyi bu nor bzang la/ tshigs su bcad pa 'di dag smras so/ /

At that point, further revealing the realm of the enlightening liberation which guides the world by the light of truth that dispels the darkness for all sentient beings, the goddess looked over the ten directions by the power of Buddha and spoke these verses to Sudhana:

gti mug ma rig mun nag bsal don du/ / sems can phan phyir kho mo chos ston te/ / dus la bsdad cing 'gro ba bde bar byas/ / 'di ni rnam thar tshul mchog zhi ba yin; ;
kho mos byams yangs shin tu sbyang ba byas/ / bskal ba mtha' yas sngon chad shin tu bsgoms/ / des ni 'jig rten rgyas bkang snang bar byed/ / nor bzang brtan pas tshul 'di shes par gyis/ /
kho mo'i snying rje rgya mtsho tshad med de/ / 'di las dus gsum rgyal ba 'jig rten 'byung / / de ni 'gro ba'i sdug bsngal zhi bar byed/ / nor bzang brtan pas tshul 'di shes par gyis/ /
'jig rten bde ba mngon par bsgrub pa dang / / ma byas 'phags pa'i bden pa mngon bsgrub cing / / des ni kho mo dga' mgur rangs par byed/ / rgyal sras khyod kyis tshul 'di shes par gyis/ /
sangs rgyas stobs rnams yongs su sbyong byed cing / / nyan thos ye shes rnam thar 'bras bu dang / / 'dus byas skyon las rtag tu phyir phyogs kyi/ / rgyal sras khyod kyis tshul 'di shes par gyis/ /
kho mo'i mig ni rgya che yongs su dag/ / des ni phyogs bcu'i zhing rnams mang po mthong / / zhing dbyings de dag kun gyi rang byung rnams/ / byang chub shing dbang drung na bzhugs pa mthong / /
sangs rgyas sku ni mtshan gyis yongs brgyan cing / / 'od bzang rnam pa sna tshogs kun 'gyed de/ / ba sbu kun nas 'od zer mang 'gyed pa'i/ / sangs rgyas 'khor dang bcas pa kho mos mthong / /
zhing dbyings de dag kun gyi sems can rnams/ / shi 'pho skye ba'i sgor yang kun mthong ste/ / byis pa de dag 'gro rgyud rgya mtsho na/ / 'khor zhing rang rang las kyang myong bar byed/ /
kho mo'i rna ba rgya mtsho rnam dag ste/ / der ni sgra rnams ma lus yongs su 'du/ / 'gro ba kun gyi sgra skrad [*skad?] rgya mtsho dag / kun kyang thos nas dran pas yongs su 'dzin/ /
dbyangs kyi yan lag sgra skad thams cad kyis/ / dpe zla med pa'i gsung ni rab brgyan te/ / des ni rgyal ba 'khor lo rab tu bskor/ / de dag kho mos thos shing dran pas 'dzin/ /
kho mo'i sna'i mthu yongs su rnam dag ste/ / chos tshul rgya mtsho dag la thogs pa med/ / rnam thar gnas rnams kun tu rab 'jug pa'i/ / tshul ni rgyal sras khyod kyis shes par gyis/ /
kho mo'i lce ni rgya che rab tu yangs/ / srab cing mdog dmar rin chen 'od du dag / sems can bsam pa ji bzhin des shes byed/ / rgyal sras khyod kyis tshul 'di shes par gyis/ /
kho mo'i chos lus shin tu rnam dag ste/ / dus gsum kun tu 'od gsal rab tu gnas/ / gzugs lus sems can bsam pa ji bzhin te/ / de dag kun gyi dad pa'i dbang du mthong / /
kho mo'i sems ni chags med zag pa med/ / sgra dbyangs sprin gyi nga ro ji bzhin te/ / de yi khongs su mi mchog kun chud kyang / / de la kho mo rnam par rtog pa med/ /
zhing gi dbyings kyi sems can bsam mi khyab/ / de dag sems kyi rgya mtsho kho mos shes/ / de dag dbang po bsam pa rab shes kyang / / de la kho mo rnam par rtog pa med/ /
kho mo'i rdzu 'phrul rab yangs shin tu grub/ / des ni bsam yas zhing yang rab tu bskyod/ / lus kyi 'od dang mthu yang de bzhin te/ / des ni sems can gdul dka' shin tu 'dul/ /
kho mo'i bsod nams rnam yangs yongs su dag / kun tu rgyan byed zad pa med pa'i mdzod/ / des ni rgyal ba rnams la mchod pa byed/ / 'gro ba thams cad nye bar 'tsho ba'ang yin/ /
kho mo'i shes rab rnam yangs shin tu dag / des ni chos mang rgya mtsho rab tu shes/ / 'gro ba kun gyi the tshom yongs su gcod/ / rgyal sras khyod kyis tshul 'di shes par gyis/ /
dus gsum kun la kho bo zhugs gyur pas/ / sangs rgyas rgya mtsho kun kyang mthong zhing shes/ / de dag smon lam la yang rab tu zhugs/ / tshul 'di dpag yas rab tu rdzogs pa yin/ /
rdul mang kun la zhing rnams rgya mtsho mthong / / de dag dus gsum 'jug pa'ang de bzhin te/ / de dag kun gyi sangs rgyas rgya mtsho mthong / / 'di ni kun tu gnas ba'i chu la byis/ /
rnam par snang mdzad byang chub sangs rgyas te/ / phyogs rnams kun gyi zhing rnams yongs bkang zhing / / rdul sbubs kun gyi byang chub shing drung na/ / zhi ba'i chos rnams gsung du sgrog pa ltos/ /

This peaceful liberation of mind guides the world To happiness in accord with the time By producing the light of truth To end the darkness of delusion and ignorance.
My kindness is vast and pure, Developed over boundless eons past; Dispelling evil, I illumine the world— Realize this wisdom, O Sudhana, steadfast one.
Measureless is my ocean of compassion for the world; Herein the buddhas of all times are born, Hereby the pains of the world are soothed— Realize this wisdom, O Sudhana, steadfast one.
Producing worldly happiness, both the joys Which are conditional and those of the sages, Thereby I am delighted, uplifted, pleased— Realize this wisdom, O son of Buddha.
Forever turned away from the ills of the conditional, As well as the knowledge and liberation of individual salvation, Perfecting the power of buddhas— Realize this wisdom, O son of Buddha.
Vast and pure is my eye, by which I see The lands of the ten directions— I see the buddhas in those lands Sitting under the enlightenment tree.
I see thousands of buddhas with their circles, The buddhas’ bodies adorned with marks of greatness, Emanating multifold glorious lights, Radiating oceans of light from their pores.
I see the sentient beings in those lands, How they die and are born; I see the ignorant in the ocean of transmigration as they go Round in circles experiencing the results of their own deeds.
My ocean of hearing is pure, And all sounds enter therein: Hearing the words of all sentient beings, I keep them in mind.
The infinite expressions of the teachings of buddhas I also hear and remember.
My sense of smell is far-reaching and pure, Unobstructed in the midst of all things, An entry into all states of liberation; You should realize this wisdom.
My tongue is broad and long, coppery red, Shiny like a jewel, pure; With it I communicate to beings according to their mentalities: You should realize this wisdom.
My reality body is transcendentally pure, Omnipresent in all times; The physical body beings see according to their mentalities, By the power of their devotion.
My mind is free from attachment and taint, Resonant with thunderous sound; Therein are all buddhas assembled, Yet I have no discrimination.
Innumerable are the beings on the face of the earth; I know the oceans of their minds, I know their faculties and inclinations, But I have no discrimination.
My occult power is vast and consummate, I shake innumerable worlds And produce an aura of light Whereby I tame the intractable.
My virtue is vast and pure, An endless treasury, adorning everywhere; With it I make offerings to buddhas And sustain the life of all beings.
I have entered the ocean of buddhas, Realizing the wisdom of all time, And I enter into their vows— This wisdom is peerless and perfect.
In every atom I see oceans of worlds Of past, present, and future; And I see oceans of buddhas therein, And their universal ground of wisdom.
See Vairocana, enlightened, Pervading all lands in the ten directions, Sitting at the foot of the enlightenment tree In each atom expounding the teaching of peace.

de nas tshong dpon gyi bu nor bzang gis/ /mtshan mo'i lha mo dpyid dang ldan pa la 'di skad ces smras so/ /lha mo khyod bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu zhugs nas ji srid cig lags/ de ltar khyod tshul 'di lta bus/ sems can gyi don bgyi ba la sta gon du zhugs pa'i rnam par thar pa de ni khyod kyis brnyes nas ji srid cig lags/ de skad ces smras pa dang /

Then Sudhana said to the night goddess Vasanti, “How long ago did you set out for supreme perfect enlightenment? How long ago did you attain this liberation, by the at tainment of which you have come to perform all beneficial actions in this way?”

mtshan mo'i lha mo dpyid dang ldan pas/ tshong dpon gyi bu nor bzang la 'di skad ces smras so/ /rigs kyi bu/ sngon 'das pa'i dus ri rab kyi rdul shin tu phra ba snyed kyi bskal pa'i yang pha rol gcig tu bskal pa rab tu zhi ba'i 'od ces bya ba/ sangs rgyas bye ba phrag lnga brgya skyes pa byung ste/ de'i 'jig rten gyi khams ni rin chen dpal 'byung ba zhes bya bar gyur to/ /'jig rten gyi khams de'i gling bzhi pa 'bring po rin chen zla ba sgron ma'i 'od ces bya ba de na/ rgyal po'i gnas pad+mo'i 'od ces bya ba yod de/ rgyal po'i gnas der/ rgyal po chos rab mu stegs zhes bya ba chos dang mthun pa'i rgyal po 'khor los bsgyur ba/ gling bzhi la dbang ba/ rin po che bdun dang ldan pa byung ste/ des sa chen po de yang ri dang rgya mtshor bcas pa'i mthas gtugs par chos kyis rgyas par byas nas/ bde bar gnas par byas so/ /

Vasanti replied, “As many eons ago as atoms in the polar mountain, there was an eon called Tranquil Light, in which five billion buddhas were born. There was then a world system called Born of the Light of Jewels, in which there was a central world of four continents called Jewel Moon Lamp Light, the capital city of which was called Lotus Light. In that capital city was a king named Bridge of Good Law, who was a just ruler, a sovereign with all the attributes of kingship. He had conquered that trouble-free earth by justice and ruled it righteously.

rgyal po chos rab mu stegs de'i btsun mo chos kyi blo gros zla ba zhes bya ba byung ste/ de srod la 'dod pas myos shing dga' bar rtse rtse bas dub nas nam gyi gung la btsun mo'i 'khor gyi gnas su phyin te nyal lo/ /de nas rgyal po'i gnas pad+mo'i 'od de'i shar phyogs kyi nags tshal chen po zhi ba'i dpal 'byung ba zhes bya bar rin po che'i rgyan thams cad kyi 'od dang ldan pa'i lhun can/ sangs rgyas thams cad kyi rnam par 'phrul pas byung ba'i byang chub kyi shing chen po'i drung du de bzhin gshegs pa chos thams cad rab tu sgrog pa'i rgyal po zhes bya ba/ bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par sangs rgyas nas/ de'i mthus 'jig rten gyi khams rin po che dpal 'byung ba thams cad ni 'od chen po kha dog du ma can gyis rgyas shing gang bar gyur to/ /

“The king’s wife was named Moon of Understanding of Right. She enjoyed herself making love in the first part of the night, and in the middle of the night, when the love play had ceased, she slept. At that time, in a forest called Source of Radiance of Peace, to the east of the city of Lotus Light, a buddha named Supreme Thunder of All Truths attained supreme perfect enlightenment at a great enlightenment site made of the finest jewels, with the lights of all supernal manifestations, radiating the lights of the magical displays of all buddhas. That buddha lit up the whole world-system Born of the Light of Jewels clearly with a great multicolored light.

rgyal po'i gnas pad+mo'i 'od ces bya ba de na/ mtshan mo'i lha mo zla ba shin tu rnam par dag pa'i 'od ces bya ba 'dug 'dug ste/ de rgyal po'i btsun mo chos kyi blo gros zla ba'i gan du song nas; rgyan dkrol ba'i sgras sad par byas te/ 'di skad ces smras so/ /'di ltar rgyal po'i btsun mo/ shes par gyis shig/ nags tshal chen po zhi ba'i dpal 'byung bar de bzhin gshegs pa; chos thams cad rab tu sgrog pa'i rgyal po zhes bya ba/ bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par sangs rgyas so/ /de nas des rgyal po'i btsun mo de'i mdun du/ sangs rgyas kyi yon tan bsngags pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi rnam par 'phrul pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' kun tu bzang po'i spyod pa dang / smon lam rgya cher bshad do/ /rigs kyi bu/ rgyal po'i btsun mo de yang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i 'od kyis snang bar gyur te/ bsam pa thag pas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yang dag par zhugs nas/ des de bzhin gshegs pa de dang / byang chub sems dpa' dang / nyan thos kyi dge 'dun du bcas pa la mchod pa dang / rim gro cher byas so/ /

“Also in that capital city Lotus Light was a night goddess named Pure Moonlight. She went to the wife of the king, awakened her by the sound of her jewelry jingling, and said to her, ‘Know, O queen, that in the forest Source of Radiance of Peace, a buddha named Supreme Thunder of All Truths has attained supreme perfect enlightenment.’ And she gave the queen an extensive explanation of the virtuous qualities of the buddha, the spiritual transformation of the buddha, and the vow practices by universally good enlightening beings. The queen, illumined by the light of the buddha, set out for supreme perfect enlightenment with overpowering resolve. She made great offerings to that buddha and to his group of enlightening beings and disciples.

rigs kyi bu/ de la ji snyam du sems/ de'i tshe de'i dus kyi rgyal po'i btsun mo chos kyi blo gros zla ba zhes bya ba de/ gzhan zhig yin pa tsam du sems na ni de ltar mi blta ste/ kho mo ni de'i tshe de'i dus na/ rgyal po'i btsun mo chos kyi blo gros zla ba zhes bya bar gyur to/ /rigs kyi bu/ kho mo ni mos pa'i sems bskyed pa de dang / de bzhin gshegs pa la bskyed pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba des/ bskal pa ri rab kyi rdul shin tu phra ba snyed tshun chad du nam yang ngan song ngan 'gro log par ltung bar ma skyes te/ sems can dmyal bar ma yin no/ /byol song gi skye gnas su ma yin no/ /yi su ma yin no/ /nam yang rigs dma' bar ma skyes so/ /nam yang dbang po dang mi ldan par ma gyur to/ /nam yang sdug bsngal bar ma gyur te/ de ltar kho mos rtag par lha'i nang du lha'i bdag nyid che ba nyid thob; mi'i nang du ni/ mi'i bdag nyid che ba nyid thob ste/ 'di ltar sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa'i dge ba'i bshes gnyen dang yang ma bral lo/ /dus ngan par yang ma skyes so; ;rigs kyi bu/ de ltar kho mos sangs rgyas gcig nas gcig tu dge ba'i rtsa ba bskyed de/ bskal pa ri rab kyi rdul shin tu phra ba snyed cig tu lam bde zhing mnyam pa nas nye zho med par phyin kyang / de tsam gyis kho mo'i byang chub sems dpa'i dbang po yongs su grub par ma gyur te/ ri rab kyi rdul shin tu phra ba snyed kyi bskal pa de dag ni 'das/ bskal pa bzang po 'di'i snga rol gyi ni bskal pa chen po stong phrag bcu'i thog ma la bab pa de'i tshe/ 'jig rten gyi khams gzi brjid rdul gyi dri ma med pa zhes bya bar/ bskal pa mya ngan med cing rdul dang bral ba zhes bya ba byung ste/

“Do not suppose that queen was anyone other than me myself—I was that queen Moon of Understanding of Right in that time. By virtue of that aspiration, and the roots of goodness I planted with that buddha, I was not born in any bad states for as many eons as atoms in the polar mountain, nor did I have defective faculties, nor did I suffer. I always attained celestial greatness among celestials, and human greatness among humans, and never was apart from spiritual benefactors—that is buddhas and enlightening beings. I never came upon bad times. So I passed as many eons as atoms in the polar mountain happily, peacefully, safely, and rightly, planting roots of goodness with the enlightened: yet after all that time my enlightening faculties were not yet perfectly developed.
“After those eons had passed, ten thousand eons before this eon of Virtue, there was an eon called Sorrowless Dispassion, in a world called Blazing Light Undefiled by Passion.

rigs kyi bu/ 'jig rten gyi khams gzi brjid rdul gyi dri ma med pa'i dpal de ni/ kun nas nyon mongs pa rnam par dag par gyur te/ der sangs rgyas lnga brgya byung ngo/ /sangs rgyas lnga brgya po de dag gi thog ma la de bzhin gshegs pa mkhyen pa dang zhabs su ldan pa/ bde bar gshegs pa/ 'jig rten mkhyen pa/ bla na med par skyes bu 'dul ba'i kha lo sgyur ba; lha dang mi'i ston pa/ sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das ri rab rgyal mtshan spyan yangs shing zhi ba'i dpal zhes bya ba 'jig rten du byung ste/ de'i tshe kho mo yang tshong dpon snyan pa rnam par grags pa'i bu mo shes rab snang ba'i dpal zhes bya ba gzugs mdzes shing bzang la/ blta na sdug pa/ kha dog shin tu mdzes shing rgyas pa dang ldan pa zhig tu gyur te/ mtshan mo'i lha mo zla ba shin tu rnam par dag pa'i 'od ces bya ba de yang smon lam gyi dbang gis/ gling bzhi pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams rdul dang bral ba'i rgyal po'i gnas rgyal mtshan sna tshogs su; mtshan mo'i lha mo mig rnam par dag pa zhes bya bar gyur te/ des kho mo mtshan mo mi nyal tsam zhig na/ pha ma nyal bar gyur pa dang / khyim de'ang yongs su bskyod de/ 'od chen po snang bar byas nas rang gi gzugs bstan te/ sangs rgyas kyi yon tan bsngags pa brjod nas/ de bzhin gshegs pa thog ma mngon par sangs rgyas nas zhag bdun lon te/ snying po byang chub la bzhugs pa de bstan to/ /

That world was both defiled and pure. Five hundred buddhas were born there. The first of those five hundred buddhas was named Light of Tranquil Eyes with Senses Like the Polar Mountain, accomplished in knowledge and action, gone to felicity, supreme knower of the world, guide of tractable people, teacher of celestials and humans, enlightened, blessed. I was an outstanding girl named Light of Wisdom, daughter of an eminent man named Resounding Fame, and I was beautiful and robust. The night goddess Pure Moonlight, by the power of a vow, became a night goddess named Light of Purified Eyes. In the still of the night when my parents were in bed, she made our house tremble, showed her body to me with a great light, told me about the qualities of the buddha, and then showed me the buddha sitting at the enlightenment site in the first week after his enlightenment.

de nas kho mo pha ma dang / gnyen bshes kyi tshogs chen po dang 'grogs te/ mtshan mo'i lha mo shin tu rnam par dag pa'i zla ba'i 'od sngon du bdar nas/ de bzhin gshegs pa de'i spyan sngar phyin to/ /
de nas kho mos de bzhin gshegs pa de la mchod pa rgya chen po byas te/ de bzhin gshegs pa de'i zhal mthong ma thag tu/ ting nge 'dzin 'gro ba 'dul zhing sangs rgyas mthong bar byed pa zhes bya ba dang / ting nge 'dzin dus gsum gyi dbyings ye shes kyi snang ba'i dkyil 'khor ces bya ba'ang thob par gyur to/ /de thob pas kyang kho mos bskal pa ri rab kyi rdul shin tu phra ba snyed po de dag kyang rjes su dran par gyur to/ /kho mo'i byang chub kyi sems de yang mngon du gyur te/ de ltar kho mos de bzhin gshegs pa de las chos bstan pa thos te/ byang chub sems dpa'i rnam par thar pa sems can thams cad kyi mun pa rnam par sel ba'i chos kyi snang bas 'gro ba rnam par 'dul ba'i sgo 'di yang thob par gyur to/ /de thob pas kyang 'jig rten gyi khams sangs rgyas kyi zhing bcu'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed lus kyis rgyas par 'gengs te/ 'jig rten gyi khams de dag tu de bzhin gshegs pa ji snyed cig bzhugs pa de dag thams cad kyang kho mo'i mig lam du snang zhing / bdag nyid kyang de dag thams cad kyi zhabs kyi drung na 'dug par shes so/ /'jig rten kyi khams de dag tu sems can ji snyed cig skyes pa de dag thams cad kyang / kho mo'i mig lam du snang ste/ de dag gi sgra skrad [*skad?] rnam pa tha dad pa'i brda yang rab tu shes so/ /sems dang / bsam pa dang / dbang po dang / mos pa yang rab tu shes so/ /sngon gyi mtha'i dge ba'i bshes gnyen rnams kyi drung du yongs su smin par gyur pa'ang rab tu shes so/ /de dag la bsam pa ji lta ba bzhin du tshim par 'gyur ba'i lus kyang yongs su ston to/ /

“I went with my parents and a large group of relatives to that buddha, led by the night goddess Pure Moonlight. I made great offerings to that buddha, and when I saw the buddha, I attained a concentration called ‘born of the world-guiding vision of Buddha,’ and I attained a concentration called ‘sphere of light of knowledge of the ground of past, present, and future,’ whereby I remembered those eons as many as atoms in the polar mountain; and my aspiration for enlightenment came to the fore. Having heard the Teaching from that buddha, I attained this enlightening liberation called ‘the means of guiding sentient beings by the light of truth which dispels the darkness for all sentient beings,’ by the attainment of which I physically pervade as many worlds as atoms in ten buddha-lands, and see the buddhas in those worlds, and perceive myself at the feet of those buddhas. I also see all the sentient beings in those worlds, and I know their vocal signals, and their thoughts, inclinations, faculties, and interests, and their previous development under the tutelage of spiritual benefactors; and I manifest a body to them which will please them according to their inclinations.

kho mo'i rnam par thar pa de yang sems kyi skad cig re re la rnam par 'phel te/ rnam par thar pa'i sems de'i 'og ma'i sems kyis/ sangs rgyas kyi zhing 'jig rten gyi khams brgya'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed lus kyis rgyas par 'gengs so/ / de'i 'og ma'i sems kyis sangs rgyas kyi zhing 'jig rten gyi khams stong gi rdul shin tu phra ba snyed lus kyis rgyas par 'gengs so/ /de'i 'og ma'i sems kyis sangs rgyas kyi zhing 'jig rten gyi khams brgya phrag stong gi rdul shin tu phra ba snyed lus kyis rgyas par 'gengs so/ /de bzhin du sems kyi skad cig re re zhing / sangs rgyas kyi zhing 'jig rten gyi khams brjod du med pa'i yang brjod du med pa'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed kyi bar dag kyang lus kyis rgyas par 'gengs so/ /sangs rgyas kyi zhing de dag na/ de bzhin gshegs pa ji snyed cig bzhugs pa de dag thams cad kyang kho mo'i mig lam du snang ste/ bdag nyid kyang de dag gi zhabs kyi drung na 'dug par shes so/ /sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag gis chos bstan pa de dag thams cad kyang len to; ;'dzin to/ /yongs su 'dzin to/ /nye bar 'dzin to/ /de bzhin gshegs pa de dag gi sngon gyi tshul rgya mtsho dang / smon lam rgya mtsho la yang 'jug go/ de bzhin gshegs pa de dag gi sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag pa de dag thams cad kyang rang gi sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par bya ba'i phyir mngon par sgrub bo/ /sems can ji snyed cig 'jig rten gyi khams rgya mtsho de dag tu skyes par gyur ba de dag thams cad kyang kho mo'i mig lam du snang ste/ sems can de dag gi bsam pa dang / dbang po dang / mos pa'i bye brag ji snyed pa de snyed kyi bre brag tu de dag yongs su smin par bya ba dang / gdul ba'i phyir lus byin gyis rlob ste/ de ltar kho mo'i rnam par thar pa de ni sems kyi skad cig re re la yang / chos kyi dbyings 'byams klas pa rgyas par 'gengs pa'i tshul gyis rnam par 'phel lo/ /

“Also, this liberation grows in each mental moment: in an unbroken succession of mental moments I pervade as many buddha-lands as atoms in a hundred worlds, as many buddha-lands as atoms in a thousand worlds, as many buddha-lands as atoms in a hundred thousand worlds; in each mental moment I go on like this to pervade up to as many buddha-lands as atoms in untold unspeakable numbers of worlds: and I see all the buddhas in those lands, and I perceive myself in their presence, and I hear, take in, remember, reflect on, and meditate on the teachings of those buddhas. I also enter into the oceans of past vows of those buddhas, and the purifications of the buddha-lands of those buddhas. I also undertake to purify a buddha-land. I also see the sentient beings in those oceans of worlds, and I transform my body to accord with the measures of the inclinations, faculties, and interests of those sentient beings, in order to develop and guide them. Thus this liberation expands in each mental moment, by working to expand it to pervade everywhere in the cosmos.

rigs kyi bu/ kho mos byang chub sems dpa'i rnam par thar pa sems can thams cad kyi mun pa rnam par sel ba'i chos kyi snang bas/ 'gro ba rnam par 'dul ba'i sgo 'di shes par zad na/ kho mos byang chub sems dpa' mtha' dang dbus med pa'i byang chub sems dpa' kun tu bzang po'i spyod pa dang / smon lam gyis byung ba/ chos kyi dbyings rgya mtsho'i tshul 'byams klas pa 'dal ba la 'jug par dbang bsgyur ba/ byang chub sems dpas yang dag par bsgrub pa'i ting nge 'dzin ye shes rdo rje'i dpal gyis rnam par rtse ba dang / 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs thams cad yang dag par gzung ba la smon lam chen pos byung ba/ 'jig rten gyi khams 'byams klas pa thams cad sems kyi skad cig gcig gis yongs su dag par bya ba'i bsod nams kyi rgya mtsho chen po yongs su grub pa/ sems kyi skad cig re re la sems can gyi khams thams cad yongs su smin par bya ba dang / gdul ba'i ye shes dbang bsgyur ba/ 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du sems can thams cad kyi sgrib pa'i mun pa thams cad rnam par sel ba'i ye shes kyi nyi ma'i mig dang ldan pa/ sems can gyi khams thams cad la theg pa chen po rnam par dmigs par bya ba'i mthu dang ldan pa/ 'gro ba thams cad kyi the tshom dang / nem nur dang / yid gnyis kyi rab rib rnam par sel ba'i blo gros kyi zla ba dang ldan pa/ srid pa'i rgya mtsho thams cad la mngon par chags pa las gyen du bskyod pa'i sgra dbyangs kyi dkyil 'khor rnam par dag pa; chos kyi dbyings thams cad kyi rdul gyi cha shas la rnam par 'phrul pa yongs su ston pa la dbang bsgyur ba/ dus gsum gyi dbyings kyi dkyil 'khor la ye shes dbyer med pa de dag gi spyod pa shes pa'am/ yon tan brjod pa'am/ spyod yul la 'jug pa'am/ rnam par thar pas rnam par rtse ba yongs su bstan par nus re skan/

“I only know this enlightening liberation that is a method of guiding the world by the light of the truth which dispels the darkness of all sentient beings—how can I know the practice or tell of the virtues or comprehend the sphere or show the freedom of liberation of the enlightening beings who are completely versed in the infinite vow of enlightening practice of universal good, who command the power to enter into every principle in the ocean of the cosmos, who have mastered the adamantine concentration of knowledge realized by all enlightening beings, who have undertaken the vow to preserve the lineage of buddhas in all worlds, who have perfected great goodness purifying all worlds in each mental moment, who command the knowledge to develop and guide all universes in each mental moment, whose eyes are suns that dispel the darkness of all obstructions for all sentient beings in all worlds, who strive to inform all sentient beings about the Great Vehicle of universal liberation, who are moons of wisdom dispelling the darkness of doubt and confusion for all sentient beings, whose pure voices obliterate attachment to existence, who have the power to show miracles in each atom of all phenomena, who have unfragmented knowledge of the ground of past, present, and future?

song / rigs kyi bu/ yul ma ga d+ha 'di nyid kyi snying po byang chub la kho mo bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed bskyed pa/ yang dang yang bskul bskul ba'i mtshan mo'i lha mo kun tu zab pa'i dpal dri ma med pa'i 'od ces bya ba 'dug gi/ de'i gan du song la/ ji ltar byang chub sems dpas byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa la bslab par bya ba dang; ji ltar nan tan du bya ba dris shig/

“In this very enlightenment site in Magadha lives a night goddess named Samantagambhirashrivimalaprabha, who inspired in me the determination for enlightenment and has encouraged me time and again. Go ask her how to learn and carry out the practice of enlightening beings.”
de nas tshong dpon gyi bu nor bzang gis/ mtshan mo'i lha mo dpyid dang ldan pa la/ tshigs su bcad pa 'di dag gis mngon par bstod do/ /
Then Sudhana praised the night goddess with these verses:

khyod sku shin tu rnam par dag pa mthong / / mtshan gyis rnam brgyan ri bo ji bzhin du/ / 'jig rten kun las mngon 'phags 'jig rten du/ / phun sum tshogs sku 'jam dpal bzhin du mdzes/ /
khyod kyi chos sku shin tu rnam dag ste/ / dus gsum kun tu mnyam zhing rnam mi rtog / der ni 'jig rten ma lus kun 'dus te/ / 'byung zhing rnam par 'jig kyang chags mi mnga'; ;
lam rgyud 'byams klas thams cad kun tu yang / / khyod kyi sku ni gzugs brnyan rnam par phye/ / skar chen zla skar rgyu skar tshogs bzhin du/ / spu rtse kun la'ang khyod ni bdag gis mthong / /
khyod kyi thugs yangs shin tu rnam dag ste/ / phyogs rnams kun gyi nam mkha'i dbyings su rgyas/ / der ni mi mchog kun kyang yongs su 'du/ / khyod la ye shes mi rtog dam pa mnga'/ /
zhing gi rdul snyed rnam pa sna tshogs sprin/ / khyod kyi spu rtse kun nas mngon 'thon pa/ / rgyal mang sna tshogs char pa mngon 'bebs shing / / phyogs bcu'i sangs rgyas zhabs drung rgyas par 'gengs/ /
'gro ba kun snyed lus rnams mtha' yas pa/ / khyod kyi spu rtse kun nas mngon 'thon cing / / phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten rgyas par yongs bkang nas/ / sna tshogs thabs kyis sems can rnam par spyod/ /
spu rtse kun la bsam yas zhing gi rnams/ / sna tshogs rgyan ldan rnam pa tha dad mthong / / lam rgyud sems can khyod kyis rnam sbyangs pa/ / ji snyed de dag bsam bzhin kun kyang byung / /
gang zhig khyod kyi mtshan thos dga' gyur pa/ / de dag thob bya legs thob legs par 'tsho/ / sems can gang gis khyod kyi sku mthong ba/ / byang chub lam la mngon du bltas par 'gyur/ /
de ltar thos nas rab tu sems dga' la/ / mthong ba tsam gyis nyon mongs zhi mdzad pas/ / bskal pa bsam yas ngan song gnas kyang rung / / khyod kyi zhal blta'i don du mos par bgyi/ /
zhing rnams stong gi rdul snyed lus byas te/ / de snyed bskal pa brgyud de khyod 'dra ba'i/ / spu gcig khyod kyi yon tan legs brjod kyang / / legs pa'i mthar phyin nam du'ang mi 'gyur ro/ /

I see your body now, pure, with various characteristics, Like the polar mountain. Above the world, you illumine the world, With a body like Manjushri.
Your reality body is transcendentally pure, Equal in all times, without distinction: Therein all worlds are gathered, And form and dissolve without obstruction.
I see your body in all realms, In a variety of manifestations: And in your pores I see The moon and stars.
Your mind is broad and pure, pervading Like space in all directions; Therein are assembled all buddhas, Yet your knowledge is free from the taint of discrimination.
Brilliant clouds, as many as atoms in lands, Issue from your pores; They reach the buddhas in the ten directions, Raining all kinds of ornaments.
Infinite bodies, as many as living beings, Emerge from your pores; They fill all the worlds in the ten directions, And purify beings by various means.
I see inconceivably many lands in your pores, Adorned in various ways, Which you have purified, Produced according to the minds of the beings.
Happy are those who hear your name, Great is their gain; And people who see you Are near the path of enlightenment.
One should endure inconceivable eons of misfortune In order to see you; For those who are happy to hear of you, You will extinguish their afflictions on sight.
Even if one were to speak Of your qualities for as many eons As atoms in a thousand lands, There is no exhausting them.

de nas tshong dpon gyi bu nor bzang gis/ mtshan mo'i lha mo dpyid dang ldan pa la tshigs su bcad pa de dag gis mngon par bstod nas/ mtshan mo'i lha mo dpyid dang ldan pa'i rkang pa gnyis la spyi bos phyag 'tshal te/ mtshan mo'i lha mo dpyid dang ldan pa la/ lan brgya stong du mar g.yas phyogs su bskor ba byas nas yang dang yang bltas te/ dge ba'i bshes gnyen la bsnyen bkur bya bas ma ngoms bzhin du/ mtshan mo'i lha mo dpyid dang ldan pa'i drung nas song ngo// //
Having praised the night goddess Vasanti with these verses, Sudhana paid his respects to her, looking at her again and again, never tired of attending spiritual benefactors, and left her.
bam po dgu bcu rtsa dgu pa/

drop.crumb: kun tu zab pa'i dpal dri ma med pa'i 'od

fuse.drop: [mtshan mo'i lha mo kun tu zab pa'i dpal dri ma med pa'i 'od]
Samantagambhirashrivimalaprabha

de nas tshong dpon gyi bu nor bzang / mtshan mo'i lha mo dpyid dang ldan pa/ thog ma byang chub tu zhugs pa'i byang chub kyi sems kyi dkyil 'khor yongs su dag pa ni khong du chud par byed/ byang chub sems dpa'i snying po yang dag par byung ba la ni rjes su dpyod/ byang chub sems dpa'i smon lam rgya mtsho la ni yongs su 'jug/ byang chub sems dpa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i lam ni yongs su sbyong / byang chub sems dpa'i sa'i dkyil 'khor ni yongs su gnon/ byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa'i dkyil 'khor ni rgya cher byed/ byang chub sems dpa'i 'byung ba rgya mtsho ni rjes su 'brang / thams cad mkhyen pa'i snang ba chen po rgya mtsho la ni rnam par blta/ 'gro ba thams cad yongs su bskyab pa la gzhol ba'i byang chub sems dpa'i snying rje chen po'i sprin ni rgya cher byed/ mtshan mo'i lha mo dpyid dang ldan pa'i byang chub sems dpa' kun tu bzang po'i spyod pa dang / smon lam gyi dkyil 'khor ni/ zhing thams cad du phyi ma'i mthar byin gyis brlabs pas mngon par bsgrub cing / mtshan mo'i lha mo kun tu zab pa'i dpal dri ma med pa'i 'od gang na ba der song ste/ mtshan mo'i lha mo kun tu zab pa'i dpal dri ma med pa'i 'od kyi rkang pa gnyis la spyi bos phyag 'tshal te/ mtshan mo'i lha mo kun tu zab pa'i dpal dri ma med pa'i 'od la/ lan brgya stong du mar g.yas phyogs su bskor ba byas nas/ mtshan mo'i lha mo kun tu zab pa'i dpal dri ma med pa'i 'od kyi mdun du 'dug ste/ thal mo sbyar nas 'di skad ces smras so/ /'phags ma/ bdag gis bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed na/ ji ltar byang chub sems dpas byang chub sems dpa'i sa la spyod pa dang / ji ltar 'byung ba dang / ji ltar nan tan du bgyid pa ma 'tshal to/ /

Realizing the purity of the sphere of the night goddess Vasanti’s initial stage of determination to be an enlightening being, contemplating the origin of the embryo of enlightenment, entering into the ocean of vows of enlightening beings, purifying the path of transcendent ways of enlightening beings, going into the sphere of stages of enlightening beings, extending the sphere of practice of enlightening beings, remembering the ocean of ways of emancipation of enlightening beings, looking over the vast ocean of light of omniscience, extending the cloud of great compassion of enlightening beings intent on the salvation of all sentient beings, putting Vasanti’s vow of practice of universally good enlightening action into effect throughout all lands forever, Sudhana went to the night goddess Samantagambhirashrivimalaprabha, paid his respects to her, and said, “Noble goddess, I have set my mind on supreme perfect enlightenment, but I do not know how an enlightening being acts in the stage of enlightening practice, or how one proceeds, and how one perfects it.”

smras pa/ rigs kyi bu/ de ltar khyod bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed cing / byang chub sems dpa'i sa la spyod pa dang / 'byung ba dang / yongs su 'grub pa 'dri ba legs so/ /legs so/ /rigs kyi bu/ chos bcu dang ldan pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams/ byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa la yongs su grub pa yin te/ bcu gang zhe na/ 'di lta ste/ de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad mngon du gyur par mthong ba'i ting nge 'dzin thob pa rnam par dag pa dang / sangs rgyas thams cad kyi sku mtshan sna tshogs dang ldan pa rnam par blta ba'i mig rnam par dag pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i kha dog rgya mtsho mtha' dang dbus med pa rnam par dmigs par bya ba la 'jug pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos snang ba'i dkyil 'khor rgya mtsho tshad med pa la chos kyi dbyings thams cad kyi tshad kyis 'jug pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi ba spu'i sgo nas 'od zer rgya mtsho sems can thams cad dang mnyam pa dang / sems can sna tshogs kyi don du bkye ba la 'jug pa dang / ba spu'i bu ga re re nas 'od 'phro ba rin po che thams cad kyi kha dog tu 'dug pa rgya mtsho ston pa dang / sems kyi skad cig re re la sangs rgyas kyi sprul pa rgya mtshos chos kyi dbyings thams cad rgyas par bkang zhing / sems can 'dul ba'i byin gyi rlabs la 'jug pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i gsung sems can thams cad kyi dbyangs kyi yan lag dang ldan pas dus gsum du byung ba'i chos kyi 'khor lo'i sgra sgrogs pas/ mdo sde thams cad kyi sprin gyi 'brug sgra 'byin pa'i dkyil 'khor la 'jug pa dang / sangs rgyas gyi mtshan rgya mtsho mtha' dang dbus med pa la 'jug pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi rnam par 'phrul ba bsam gyis mi khyab pa yongs su bstan pas sems can 'dul ba la 'jug pa ste/ rigs kyi bu/ chos bcu po 'di dag dang ldan pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams/ byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa la yongs su grub pa yin no/ /

She said, “It is good that, aspiring to enlightenment, you ask how to proceed and how to fully accomplish the stages of enlightening beings. By the fulfillment of ten things is the practice of enlightening beings accomplished: by purification of attainment of concentration in which all buddhas are seen face to face; by purification of the eye viewing the infinite body of all buddhas resplendent with marks of distinction; by entering into the manifestation of the infinite ocean of qualities of buddhas; by realizing the cosmic dimensions of the ocean of spheres of the infinite manifestations of the teaching of buddhas; by entering the emanation of multitudes of beams of light, as many as beings, from the pores of all buddhas, aiding sentient beings in various ways; by seeing oceans of flames the colors of all jewels coming from each pore; by penetrating the my stical manifestation of oceans of emanations of buddhas pervading all universes and guiding sentient beings in each mental moment; by penetrating the sounds of thunder of all the scriptures proclaimed in the past, present, and future cycles of teachings of the buddhas, using the myriad languages of all sentient beings; by entry into the infinite ocean of buddha-names; by penetrating the guidance of sentient beings by manifestation of inconceivable miraculous transformations of buddhas. By attainment of these ten things, enlightening beings become fully accomplished in enlightening practice.

rigs kyi bu/ kho mo ni byang chub sems dpa'i rnam par thar pa bsam gtan zhi ba'i bde bas kun tu rnam par gnon pa thob pa ste/ rigs kyi bu/ kho mo ni de'i mthus dus gsum du gshegs pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyang mthong ste/ de bzhin gshegs pa de dag gi sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag pa la'ang 'jug go /'khor gyi dkyil 'khor rgya mtsho dang / ting nge 'dzin mtha' dang dbus med pa'i rnam par 'phrul pa rgya mtsho dang / sngon gyi tshul rgya mtsho dang / mtshan rgya mtsho la'ang 'jug go/ de bzhin gshegs pa de dag gi chos kyi 'khor lo rab tu 'khor ba rnam pa tha dad pa la'ang 'jug go/ de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku tshe tshad sna tshogs dang / dbyangs kyi yan lag rnam pa tha dad pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa de dag gi chos kyi dbyings mtha' dang dbus med pa'i sku la'ang 'jug ste/ de bzhin gshegs pa de dag la dngos por mngon par zhen pa yang med do/ /de ci'i phyir zhe na/ 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du bzhud pa 'gags pa'i phyir/ de bzhin gshegs pa de dag ni bzhud pa med pa'o; ;rang bzhin gyis byung ba med pas na de bzhin gshegs pa de dag ni byon pa med pa'o/ /mi skye ba'i chos nyid dang mnyam pa'i sku mnga' ba'i phyir/ de bzhin gshegs pa de dag ni ma skyes pa'o/ /mi skye ba'i mtshan nyid dang ldan pa'i phyir/ de bzhin gshegs pa de dag ni ma 'gags pa'o/ /sgyu ma'i rnam pa lta bur mthong zhing rnam par dmigs pa'i phyir/ de bzhin gshegs pa de dag ni bden pa ma yin pa'o/ /'gro ba thams cad kyi don du byung ba'i phyir/ de bzhin gshegs pa de dag ni brdzun pa ma yin pa'o/ /shi 'pho dang skye ba las rnam par 'das pa'i phyir/ de bzhin gshegs pa de dag ni 'pho ba med pa'o/ /chos kyi rang bzhin gyis 'jigs pa med pa'i chos nyid yin pa'i phyir/ de bzhin gshegs pa de dag ni 'jig pa med pa'o/ /ngag gi lam thams cad las yongs su 'das pa'i phyir/ de bzhin gshegs pa de dag thams cad ni mtshan nyid gcig pa'o/ /chos kyi mtshan nyid kyi rang bzhin gyi mthar thug pas/ de bzhin gshegs pa de dag ni mtshan nyid mi mnga' ba'o/ /

“I have attained the enlightening liberation ‘bliss of tranquil meditation boldly going everywhere.’ By this I see the buddhas of past, present, and future, and enter into their oceanic congregations, their oceanic projections by concentration, their oceanic efforts in the past, and the oceans of their names. I also comprehend the differences of the teaching cycles of those buddhas, the variety of their life spans, the differences in their voices, and their embodiment of the infinite realm of reality. Yet I do not become attached to those buddhas in terms of state of being. Why? Because those buddhas do not go, having stopped all worldly courses of action; they do not come, because of the nonbecoming of intrinsic nature; they are not present, being physically equal to the unoriginated nature of reality; they are not extinct, being characterized by nonorigination; they are not real, because they convey the vision of phenomena as in illusion; they are not false, because of accomplishing the welfare of all beings; they do not pass from one condition to another, because they are free from death and birth; they do not perish, because of the imperishable nature of things; they are uniform, because they are beyond all manner of speech; they are formless, because of being done with the forms and natures of things.

rigs kyi bu/ kho mo ni de ltar de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad khong du chud par byed cing / byang chub sems dpa'i rnam par thar pa bsam gtan zhi ba'i bde bas kun tu rnam par gnon pa 'di/ de bzhin gshegs pa'i bsam gtan gyi dkyil 'khor snang bas shin tu rgya che bar byed do/ /shin tu yangs par byed do/ /khong du chud par byed do/ /rtogs par byed do/ /mnyam par byed do/ /mngon par bsgrub bo/ /gzhi snyoms par byed do/ /rab tu 'jug go/ rnam par 'phel bar byed do/ /nges par sems so/ /nye bar rtog go/ dran par byed do/ /spyod yul du byed do/ /brtan par byed do/ /snang bar byed do/ /rab tu brjod do/ /rnam par spyod do/ /rnam par 'byed do/ /tshogs su byed do/ /yid ches par byed do/ /yongs su rtog pa thams cad rgyu ba med pa'i snying rje chen po de la gnas te/ sems can thams cad yongs su bskyab pa la yang dag par spyad par sems rtse gcig tu bya ba'i phyir bsam gtan dang po bsgom mo/ /yid kyi las thams cad nye bar zhi bar bya ba dang / ye shes kyi stobs dang mthus sems can thams cad yongs su bsdu ba la dga' ba'i bde ba la sems rtse gcig tu bya ba'i phyir/ bsam gtan gnyis pa bsgom mo/ /'khor bar log par zhugs pa la btang snyoms su byas te/ sems can thams cad kyi rang bzhin nges par rtogs par bya ba'i phyir/ bsam gtan gsum pa bsgom mo/ /sems can thams cad kyi nyon mongs pa dang / sdug bsngal rab tu zhi bar bya ba'i phyir; bsam gtan bzhi pa bsgom mo// thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi smon lam gyi dkyil 'khor shin tu yangs par bya ba dang / ting nge 'dzin rgya mtsho thams cad mngon par bsgrub pa la mkhas par bya ba dang / byang chub sems dpa'i rnam par thar pa rgya mtsho thams cad kyi tshul la 'jug par bya ba dang / byang chub sems dpa'i rnam par rtse ba'i ye shes thams cad mngon par shes par bya ba dang / byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pas rnam par 'phrul ba thams cad mngon par bsgrub par bya ba'i phyir/ sgo kun nas chos kyi dbyings la 'jug pa'i ye shes kyi tshul yongs su spyod zhing / byang chub sems dpa'i rnam par thar pa bsam gtan zhi ba'i bde bas kun tu rnam par gnon pa 'di bsgom mo/ /

“Furthermore, while thus understanding all buddhas, by the light of the sphere of meditation of buddhas I expand this enlightening liberation ‘bliss of tranquil meditation boldly going everywhere’; I extend it, enter into it, follow it, live up to it, accomplish it, make it consistent, delve into it, develop it, meditate on it, contemplate it, internalize it, make it my sphere of action, stabilize it, make it manifest, illumine it, order it, analyze it, fulfill its requirements, and effect it.
“Therein, based on great compassion without any false conceptions, to focus my mind solely on carrying out the salvation of all beings, I cultivate the first stage of meditation. To cease all mental action and focus my mind solely on joy and happiness in taking care of all sentient beings with the power of knowledge, I cultivate the second stage of meditation. To realize the purity of inherent nature of all beings with equanimity detached from the mundane world, I cultivate the third stage of meditation. To extinguish the burning of the pain of afflictions of all sentient beings I cultivate the fourth stage of meditation. To extend the sphere of the vow for omniscience, for skill in producing the ocean of all concentrations, to enter the means of access to the ocean of liberation of all enlightening beings, to know the science of occult powers of all enlightening beings, to effect the mystic projection of practices of all enlightening beings, I cultivate the enlightening liberation that goes everywhere through tranquil meditation, purifying the knowledge that enters into every realm of reality.

rigs kyi bu/ de ltar kho mo rnam par thar pa 'di sgom zhing thabs sna tshogs kyi sems can yongs su smin par byed de/ 'di ltar nub mo zhi bar gyur pa'i tshe/ dga' ba la mos par gyur pa'i sems can rnams kyi mi sdug pa'i 'du shes bskyed do/ /mi dga' ba'i 'du shes dang / yongs su skyo ba'i 'du shes dang / gegs su 'gyur ba'i 'du shes dang / 'ching ba'i 'du shes dang / srin mo'i 'du shes dang / mi rtag pa'i 'du shes dang / sdug bsngal ba'i 'du shes dang / bdag med pa'i 'du shes dang / rje med pa'i 'du shes dang / gzhan la rag las pa'i 'du shes dang / rga shi'i 'du shes dang / 'dod pa'i yul dang / longs spyod thams cad la dga' ba med pa'i 'du shes bskyed de/ sems can de dag kyang sems de la yongs su bsgoms pas/ 'dod pa'i dga' ba thams cad la mngon par dga' ba med pas chos la mos pa'i dga' ba la 'jug cing khyim nas khyim med par rab tu 'byung ngo/ /de dag dgon pa la gnas pa'i tshe 'di chos dang mthun pa'i dad pa yongs su bskyed do/ /sgra chen po 'jigs pa mi snyan pa'i sgra skad thams cad kyang zhi bar byed do/ /mtshan mo zhi bar gyur pa las sangs rgyas kyi chos zab mo yang yang dag par ston to/ /spang ba dang mthun pa'i rkyen kyang nye bar ston to/ /khyim gyi sgo'ang rnam par 'byed do/ /lam yang yongs su ston to/ /snang bas kyang mngon par byed do/ /mun pas chod pa'ang rnam par sel to/ /'jigs pa'ang med par byed do/ /rab tu byung ba la yang yang dag par bsngags par byed do/ /sangs rgyas kyi legs pa'ang brjod do/ /chos kyi legs pa dang / dge 'dun gyi legs pa dang / dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyi legs pa'ang brjod do/ /dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyi drung du 'gro ba la'ang bsngags pa byed do/ /

“Furthermore, as I cultivate this liberation, I develop sentient beings to maturity by a variety of means. In people engrossed in sex play in the still of the night I induce the thought of impurity, the thought of disappointment, the thought of weariness, the thought of trouble, the thought of bondage, the thought of bedevilment, the thought of impermanence, the thought of pain, the thought of selflessness, the thought of ownerlessness, the thought of offense, the thought of old age and death, and the thought of indifference to all objects of desire. And those people, developing this state of mind, indifferent to all pleasures, coming to enjoy spiritual pleasure, go forth from home to homelessness. When they have gone into the forest and are following spiritual principles, I foster faith in them. I cause a lull in all disturbing, frightening, loud sounds, and in the quiet of the night I reveal to them the profundity of the buddha-teaching. I provide them with circumstances conducive to effort, open the door of renunciation, show the path, provide light, dispel darkness, put a stop to fear, praise renunciation, speak of the qualities of the Buddha, the Teaching, and the Community, and of spiritual benefactors, and praise going to spiritual benefactors.

rigs kyi bu/ kho mo rnam par thar pa 'di la sgom zhing / sems can rnams kyi chos ma yin pa'i 'dod chags kyi zhen pa rnams kyi chos ma yin pa'i 'dod chags kyi yongs su rtog pa rnams kyang med par byed do/ /tshul ma yin pa'i 'dod pas non pa rnams dang / log par yongs su rtog pa'i spyod yul can rnams kyi yongs su rtog pa de dag dang / yid la bya ba de dag kyang med par byed do/ /sdig to mi dge ba'i chos ma skyes pa rnams mi skye ba dang / sdig to'i yongs su rtog pa skyes par gyur pa rnams kyang med par 'gyur ba'i rkyen nye bar bsgrub bo/ /dge ba'i yongs su rtog pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang ldan pa dang / spyod pa dang ldan pa dang / thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes su 'byung ba'i smon lam mngon par bsgrub pa dang ldan pa dang / byams pa'i tshul dang ldan pa dang / sems can rnams la snying rje chen pos rgyas par 'gengs pa dang ldan pa dang / lha dang mi'i bde ba'i rnam pa sna tshogs yongs su bskyed pa dang ldan pa'i yongs su rtogs pa bskyed pa dang / skyes nas kyang tshul sna tshogs kyi rkyen nye bar sgrub pa byed pa nas/ thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang mthun pa'i rkyen kyang nye bar sgrub pa byed de/

“As I cultivate this liberation, I put a stop to sentient beings’ wrong passions and wrong feelings and thoughts. I put a stop to the ideas and thoughts of those dominated by wrongful gain, those who act on false notions. I see to it that evil does not arise in those in whom it has not yet arisen, and that the false conceptions of those in whom evil has arisen are stopped. For those in whom thoughts of roots of goodness have not yet arisen, I motivate thoughts of the ways of transcendence, spiritual practice, achievement of the aspiration for omniscience and release, the principle of kindness, suffusing all sentient beings with great compassion, and producing the various bases of celestial and human happiness. For those to whom such thoughts already occur, I provide various means of guidance. I motivate all the appropriate thoughts and intentions until they are in accord with the way to omniscience.

rigs kyi bu/ kho mos byang chub sems dpa'i rnam par thar pa bsam gtan zhi ba'i bde bas kun tu rnam par gnon pa 'di shes par zad na/ kho mos byang chub sems dpa'i kun tu bzang po'i spyod pa dang / smon lam gyis byung ba'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams mtha' yas pa'i chos kyi dbyings kyi ye shes rab tu thob pa/ dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad kyis rnam par spel ba'i sems dang ldan pa/ de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi ye shes kyi mthus sems kyi snang ba rab tu thob pa/ de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi yul la gnas pa'i sems dang ldan pa/ gnas thams cad du sgrib pa med pa'i sems dang ldan pa; thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi smon lam yongs su rdzogs pa'i sems dang ldan pa/ zhing rgya mtsho thams cad du zhugs pa'i sems dang ldan pa/ sangs rgyas rgya mtsho thams cad mthong bar bya ba la zhugs pa'i sems dang ldan pa/ de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi chos kyi sprin gyi char yang dag par gzung ba'i sems dang ldan pa/ sems can thams cad kyi ma rig pa'i mun pa rnam par sel ba/ 'khor ba'i bde ba la dga' zhing sred pa zad cing mthar phyin par 'gyur ba'i lam gyis thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du snang ba skyed pa'i sems dang ldan pa de dag gi spyod pa shes pa'am/ yon tan brjod par nus de skan/

“I know only this enlightening liberation of the bliss of tranquil meditation boldly going everywhere. How can I know the practice or tell of the virtues of the enlightening beings who are completely conversant with the vows of practice of universally good enlightening beings, who have attained knowledge of the cosmos with its endless forms, in whose minds all roots of goodness are developed, who have attained awareness of the knowledge and powers of all buddhas, whose minds abide in the sphere of all buddhas, whose minds are unhindered wherever they may be, who have fulfilled the resolve for omniscience, whose minds have entered the ocean of all lands, whose minds see all buddhas and take in the teachings of all buddhas, who dispel the darkness of all ignorance, whose minds generate the light of omniscience as the way to effect the final destruction of craving for repetitious mundane enjoyment?

song /rigs kyi bu/ 'di nyid nang dang yang rgyang mi ring ste/ rnam par snang mdzad kyi snying po byang chub kyi g.yas rol gcig nas mtshan mo'i lha mo rab tu dga' ba'i mig'gro bar rnam par snang ba zhes bya ba 'dug go/ de'i gan du song la/ ji ltar byang chub sems dpas byang chub sems dpa'i lam la brtson par bya ba dris shig;

“Right by me, on the right side of the site of enlightenment of Vairocana, there lives a night goddess named Pramuditanayanajagadvirocana. Go ask her how an enlightening being should work on the deeds of enlightening beings.”

de nas mtshan mo'i lha mo kun tu zab pa'i dpal dri ma med pa'i 'od kyis/ de'i tshe byang chub sems dpa'i rnam par thar pa bsam gtan zhi ba'i bde bas kun tu rnam par gnon pa 'di nyid brnan te bstan par bya ba'i phyir/ tshong dpon gyi bu nor bzang la tshigs su bcad de smras pa/
Then the night goddess Samantagambhirashrivimalaprabha spoke these verses to Sudhana, further revealing the enlightening liberation of the bliss of tranquil meditation boldly going everywhere:

dus rnams kun tu byung ba'i bde gshegs rnams; ; mngon du bya bar mos pa'i sems ldan pa/ / de dag mig yangs rnam par dag par 'gyur/ / des ni sangs rgyas rgya mtsho mthong bar 'ong / /
rgyal ba'i sku gsal dri ma med la ltos/ / mtshan gyis yongs su brgyan pas shin tu mdzes/ / rgyal ba'i rnam par 'phrul pa chos dbyings rnams/ / skad cig re res rgyas 'gengs de la'ang ltos/ /
byang chub shing drung sangs rgyas gdan rab la/ / bde gshegs rnam par snang mdzad mngon sangs rgyas/ / chos dbyings yangs pa rgyas pa khyab mdzad cing / / 'gro ba'i bsam pa ji bzhin 'khor lo bskor/ /
rgyal bas chos nyid lus med rab zhi ba/ / gnyis med rang bzhin med pa thugs chud nas/ / gzugs sku bzang po mtshan gyis brgyan pa yis/ / 'gro ba ma lus bkang zhing ston pa mdzad/ /
sangs rgyas sku ni rgya che bsam mi khyab/ / chos kyi dbyings kun yongs su rgyas bkang zhing / / de ni kun tu mnyam par snang ba ste/ / rgyal ba thams cad kun tu ston pa mdzad/ /
zhing rnams kun gyi rdul rab phra ba snyed/ / 'od kyi dkyil 'khor mnga' ba'i sangs rgyas sku/ / kha dog bzang po gzhan dang gzhan snang bas/ / chos dbyings rgyas par skad cig re res 'gengs/ /
rgyal ba'i ba spu'i sgo nas 'od zer sprin/ / rgya che bsam yas mi zad mngon 'byung ba/ / de dag 'gro ba ma lus 'gengs byed cing / / srog chags rnams kyi nyon mongs gdung ba sel/ /
sangs rgyas sprul pa rgya mtsho mi zad pa/ / rgyal ba'i spu yi 'khor nas yongs bton cing / / chos dbyings yangs pa rgyas par kun bkang ste/ / srog chags rnams kyi sdug bsngal ngan song sel/ /
sangs rgyas gsung snyan rab tu sgrog mdzad pa/ / dbyangs kyi yan lag rgya mtsho sgra 'od can/ / chos char chen po rab tu 'bebs pa mdzad/ / srog chags byang chub bsam pa yongs su skyed/ /
