bskal pa rgya mtshor spyad pa spyod pa'i tshe/ / 'dis ni sngon chad yongs su gzung mdzad pa/ / de dag kun gyis rgyal ba rnam snang mdzad/ / zhing rnams kun tu gzugs brnyan mtshan nyid mthong / /
de bzhin gshegs pa 'jig rten kun tu byung / / sems can re re kun la'ang mngon par bzhugs/ / mos pa'i tshul bzhin spyod yul gzhan dang gzhan/ / de dag kho mos kun tu shes mi nus/ /
rgyal sras dam pa thams cad ma lus par/ / bde bar gshegs pa'i spu gcig rtse las 'byung / / rnam par de la gang rnams bsam yas pa/ / de dag thams cad kho mos shes mi nus/ /
kho mo'i 'dab na gnas pa'i lha mo 'di/ / 'jig rten mgon la mngon 'gyur rab tu dga'/ / ming du snang ba 'od 'phro mig ces bya/ / de la byang chub spyod pa ci 'dra dris/ /

The buddhas, supreme in all times, Appear to those with faith.
Their eye is vast and pure; Thereby they enter the oceans of buddhas.
See the undefiled body of Buddha, Beautifully adorned with distinctive marks; And see the miracle of the Buddha Pervading the cosmos in every moment.
The felicitous one Vairocana has become enlightened Sitting at this enlightenment tree; Throughout the vast cosmos, He teaches according to mentality.
The Buddha has realized true nature As bodiless, utterly quiet, nondual; His physical body, adorned with marks of distinction, He manifests throughout the world.
The body of Buddha is vast, inconceivable, Filling the entire cosmos: It is seen everywhere equally, Showing all the buddhas everywhere.
The Buddha’s auras of light, Numerous as atoms in all lands, Reflecting each other’s radiant colors, Pervade the cosmos every moment.
Inconceivable, vast clouds of light Stream endlessly from the Buddha’s pores; They pervade all worlds and extinguish The heat of afflictions of all beings.
Infinite oceans of emanations of Buddha, Emerging from Buddha’s pores, Go throughout the cosmos and stop the suffering Of all miserable states of being.
Buddha’s voice thunders pleasantly, And the light of the ocean of good sayings Showers the widespread rain of truth And produces the will for enlightenment in sentient beings.
Those who have been guided by him in the past And practiced the ways of enlightenment for eons See Vairocana Buddha’s features Reflected in all lands.
The Buddha, appearing in all worlds, Stands before all beings: I cannot know all Their various realms of attention.
All the exalted enlightening beings Are together in one pore of Buddha: That way of liberation, which is inconceivable, I cannot know in full.
My neighbor goddess Stands rapt before the Buddha, Her eyes like starry fire— Go ask her how to practice enlightenment.

de nas tshong dpon gyi bu nor bzang gis/ mtshan mo'i lha mo kun tu zab pa'i dpal dri ma med pa'i 'od kyi rkang pa gnyis la spyi bos phyag 'tshal te/ mtshan mo'i lha mo kun tu zab pa'i dpal dri ma med pa'i 'od la/ lan brgya stong du mar g.yas phyogs su bskor ba byas nas/ /yang dang yang bltas te mtshan mo'i lha mo kun tu zab pa'i dpal dri ma med pa'i 'od kyi drung nas song ngo/ /
Then Sudhana paid his respects to the night goddess Samantagambhirashrivimalaprabha and took leave of her.

drop.crumb: rab tu dga' ba'i mig'gro bar rnam par snang ba

fuse.drop: [mtshan mo'i lha mo rab tu dga' ba'i mig'gro bar rnam par snang ba]
Pramuditanayanajagadvirocana

de nas tshong dpon gyi bu nor bzang dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyi gdams ngag gi byin gyis brlabs pa/ dge pa'i bshes gnyen gyi tshig la nan tan du bya ba'i sems yang dag par skyes pa/ dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyi sman pa la nad pa lta bu'i 'du shes kyis yongs su spyad pa'i sems dang ldan pa/ dge ba'i bshes gnyen mthong ba yid la byed pa ma 'khrugs pa'i sems dang ldan pa/ dge ba'i bshes gnyen blta ba la sgrib pa'i ri thams cad rnam par gtor ba'i glags rnyed pa'i sems dang ldan pa/ dge ba'i bshes gnyen mthong ba la sems can gyi khams thams cad yongs su bskyab pa'i snying rje chen po'i tshul rgya mtsho la 'jug pa thob pa'i sems dang ldan pa/ dge ba'i bshes gnyen mthong ba la chos kyi dbyings kyi tshul rgya mtsho'i ye shes snang ba rab tu thob pa'i sems dang ldan pa de/ mtshan mo'i lha mo rab tu dga' ba'i mig'gro bar rnam par snang ba gang na ba der song ngo/ /

Immersed in the teachings of the spiritual benefactors, with practice of the words of the spiritual benefactors in mind, desirous of the sciences of spiritual benefactors, his attention focused without distraction by seeing spiritual benefactors, his mind illumined through seeing spiritual benefactors with a light that destroys all obstructions, his mind immersed, through seeing spiritual benefactors, in the ocean of great compassion that saves all beings, his mind illumined, through seeing spiritual benefactors, by the light of knowledge of the ocean of principles of the cosmos, Sudhana went to the night goddess Pramuditanayanajagadvirocana.

de nas mtshan mo'i lha mo rab tu dga' ba'i mig'gro bar rnam par snang bas/ tshong dpon gyi bu nor bzang / de bas kyang dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyi drung du 'gro ba/ dge ba'i rtsa ba'i tshogs las byung bas yongs su smin par bya ba'i phyir/ dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyi drung du 'gro ba tshogs chen po las byung bar byin gyis brlabs so/ /dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyi drung du 'gro ba rnam par gnon pa chen por byin gyis brlabs so; ;dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyi drung du 'gro ba brtson 'grus kyi las 'jug par dka' bar byin gyis brlabs so/ /dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyi drung du 'gro ba bsdad cing shin tu legs par byin gyis brlabs so/ /dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyi drung du 'gro ba phyogs mtha' dang dbus med pa la 'jug par byin gyis brlabs so/ /dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyi drung du 'gro ba yun ring por gnas pas byung bar byin gyis brlabs so/ /dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyi drung du 'gro ba don mtha' yas pa yongs su rdzogs pa'i rnam par dmigs pa 'byung bar byin gyis brlabs so/ /dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyi drung du 'gro ba lam gyi rgyan mtha' dang dbus med pa'i tshogs kyis yongs su gnon par byin gyis brlabs so/ /dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyi drung du 'gro ba sgo kun nas rnam par gnon bas byung bar byin gyis brlabs so/ /dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyi drung du 'gro ba g.yo ba med par 'ong pas rnam par gnon par byin gyis brlabs so/ /

The goddess, in order to further mature the development of Sudhana’s roots of goodness based on visiting spiritual benefactors, showed him visiting spiritual benefactors as made possible by great provisions of virtue and knowledge, as great heroic effort, as energy that is hard to attain, as longterm perseverance, as entry into infinite realms, as connected with long association, as connected with manifestation of fulfillment of endless tasks, as undertaking the provision of the endless equipment of the path, as made possible by indomitably going everywhere, as coming and going without departure.

de nas tshong dpon gyi bu nor bzang / thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi tshogs kyi brtson 'grus la rab tu brtson pas/ dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyi drung du 'gro ba dang / smon lam chen po rgya mtsho mngon par bsgrub pa'i rnam par gnon pas dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyi drung du 'gro ba dang / sems can gcig gi don du phyi ma'i mtha'i bskal pa'i mur thug par sdug bsngal nyams su blangs pa'i zhe non pas/ dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyi drung du 'gro ba dang / rdul shin tu phra ba gcig la chos kyi dbyings thams cad du sgra sgrog cing / yun ring por gnas pa'i rnam par gnon pa dang / brtson 'grus chen po'i go bgos pas/ dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyi drung du 'gro ba dang / phyogs rgya mtsho 'byams klas pa thams cad du shugs kyis 'gro bas dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyi drung du 'gro ba dang / ba spu'i sbubs gcig tu phyi ma'i mtha'i bskal par byang chub sems dpa'i spyad pa spyod pa la gnas pas/ dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyi drung du 'gro ba dang / byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa la gnas nas kyang / sems kyi skad cig re re la thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes 'gengs pa la gnas par bya bas/ dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyi drung du 'gro ba dang / dus gsum du gshegs pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa'i rnam par 'phrul pa'i rgyan dang / lam yongs su gnon par zhe non pas/ dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyi drung du 'gro ba dang / chos kyi dbyings kyi tshul gyi rgyun du zhugs pa'i lam yongs su gnas pas/ dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyi drung du 'gro ba dang / chos kyi dbyings kyi tshul thams cad la dmigs pa las ma g.yos par chos kyi dbyings kun tu rgyas par 'gengs pas/ dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyi drung du 'gro bas/ mtshan mo'i lha mo rab tu dga' ba'i mig'gro bar rnam par snang ba gang nas ba der phyin pa dang / des mtshan mo'i lha mo rab tu dga' ba'i mig'gro bar rnam par snang ba/ bcom ldan 'das kyi 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor la/ seng+ge'i khri me tog gi snying po can la 'dug cing / byang chub sems dpa'i ting nge 'dzin kun tu bzang po'i dga' ba yangs shing dri ma med pa'i shugs kyi rgyal mtshan la mnyam par bzhag pa mthong ngo/ /
de'i ba spu'i bu ga thams cad nas/ sbyin pa la sogs pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i spyod pa mngon par ston pa'i sprin sems can thams cad mngon par dga' ba/ sems can thams cad kyi yid du 'ong ba /sems can thams cad kyis blta na nyams su bde ba/ sems can thams cad kyis blta na sdug pa/ rnam pa sna tshogs 'byung ba'ang mthong ste/ 'di ltar sems can thams cad la phan gdags shing rtsod pa med par bya ba dang / dngos po thams cad la phangs par rtsi ba med par bya ba dang / sems can thams cad la sbyor ba mtshungs pas yongs su gtang bar bya ba dang / sems can thams cad la mnyam pa'i sems su bya ba dang / sems can thams cad la brnyas pa med par yongs su gtang ba dang / nang dang phyi'i dngos po thams cad yongs su gtang ba dang / dka' ba chen po yongs su gtang bar bstan pa dang / 'jig rten thams cad du sems can gyi bsam pa ji bzhin gyi sbyin pa'i spyod pa yongs su bstan par bya ba'i phyir/ sems can thams cad kyi bsam pa ji lta ba bzhin du rnam par dmigs pa dang mthun pa'i sgras/ sbyin pa'i spyod pa yongs su ston pa'i sprin dang / dus gsum du byung ba'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams gtang bar dka' ba yongs su gtong ba'i sprul pa bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i sprin 'thon nas/ phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams 'byams klas par gtogs pa'i sems can thams cad kyis rnam par dmigs par gyur pa mthong ngo/ /

Then Sudhana went to the night goddess in the manner of one going to a spiritual benefactor energetically proceeding to provide for omniscience, striving to carry out the ocean of great vows, determined to endure endless suffering for the sake of even one single sentient being, proceeding with perseverance to traverse the cosmos in a single atom wearing the armor of great energy, speeding everywhere in all directions, associating with the practice of enlightening beings of endless eons at a single point, every moment of thought in enlightening practice entirely based on omniscience, determined to tread the path mystically projected by the buddhas of all times, treading the path flowing through all spheres of reality, keeping the attention on the principles of all realms of reality, pervading the whole cosmos of reality.
He saw the night goddess sitting in a lion seat in a flower calyx in the circle of the Buddha, in an enlightening concentration characterized by the vast, pure energy of the joy of universal good. He also saw emerging from all her pores multitudes of emanations illumining all sentient beings, making all sentient beings happy, showing the practices of the transcendent ways according to the vision of all sentient beings, pleasing to the sight of all sentient beings. He saw multitudes of emanations showing the practice of giving in accord with the mentalities of all sentient beings, using their own languages to communicate with them, to detach all sentient beings from their attachments, by indifference to material things, giving impartially to all sentient beings without neglecting any, impartial toward all sentient beings, not disrespecting or disregarding any sentient beings, relinquishing all things internal and external, showing the relinquishment of that which is very hard to give up, showing the practice of giving to sentient beings in all worlds according to their mentalities. He saw multitudes of emanations projecting the difficult act of relinquishment practiced by the enlightening beings of past, present, and future emerge and appear to all sentient beings in all worlds in the ten directions, by attainment of the inconceivable mystic power of enlightening beings.

'di lta ste/ byang chub sems dpa'i khyu mchog gi mthu phyung ba dang / rnam par 'phrul pa bsam gyis mi khyab pa thob pas /ba spu'i bu ga thams cad nas sems can thams cad dang mnyam pa'i skye ba sna tshogs su sprul pa'i lus kyi sprin mngon par 'thon te/ 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du gtogs pa'i sems can thams cad la rgyas par khyab par byas nas/ mngon sum du brtul zhugs thams cad kyi yi dam las mi g.yo bar yongs su ston pa dang / sems can gyi khams dang mnyam pa'i dka' thub dang / brtul zhugs kyi dkyil 'khor sna tshogs rab tu ston pa dang / 'jig rten thams cad du gnas pa med pa dang / yul thams cad la ltos pa med pa dang / 'khor ba thams cad du gnas pa las phyir phyogs pa dang / lha dang mi'i phun sum tshogs pa rgud pa'i sgor gzhol ba yongs su ston pa dang / mi sdug pa'i dkyil 'khor rab tu ston pa dang / 'jig rten gyi sdug pa'i 'du shes kyi phyin ci log rnam par bzlog pa dang / mi rtag pa dang g.yo ba dang 'jig pa dang / 'gyur ba'i chos nyid yongs su ston pa dang / 'du byed thams cad kyi chos nyid sdug bsngal zhing / bdag med pa yongs su ston pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i yul la gnas pa dang mi 'bral bar mos par byed pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i tshul khrims shin tu dag par bya ba'i phyir/ sems can thams cad la yang dag par bskul ba dang / sems can thams cad kyi bsam pa ji lta ba bzhin gyi sgras/ tshul khrims kyi spyod pa yongs su ston pa dang / sems can thams cad yongs su tshim par byed pa'i tshul khrims kyi dri zhim po yongs su ston par byed cing / sems can thams cad yongs su smin par byed pa mthong ngo/ /

He saw multitudes of projected bodies in the forms of all sentient beings emerge from every pore of the goddess, appearing before all sentient beings in all worlds, showing them unshakability in all aspects of self-control, illustrating as many forms of austerity as there are living beings, showing independence from all worlds, disregard of all objects, indifference to all mundane abodes, showing that celestial and human prosperity and decline, happiness and suffering, are all inextricably intertwined, showing impurity and putting an end to the false notion of purity in the world, revealing the nature of things as impermanent, unstable, and changing, showing the nature of all conditioned states as painful and selfless, promoting the appeal of living constantly in the realm of the enlightened, directing sentient beings to the ultimate purity of the way of life of the enlightened, teaching the practice of discipline using expressions adapted to the mentalities of all sentient beings, showing the grace of ethical conduct pleasing all sentient beings, developing all sentient beings to maturity.

ba spu'i sgo thams cad nas sems can thams cad dang mnyam pa'i lus kha dog sna tshogs su sprul pa'i sprin 'thon te/ yan lag dang nying lag thams cad kyang nyams su bzod pa sems can thams cad la yongs su ston pa/ sems can thams cad kyis lus la gnod par mtho ba tsams [?] kyang nyams su bzod par byed pa dang / sems can thams cad kyis tshul dang mi 'dra ba'i tshig gis spyo ba dang / brgyad pa dang / smad pa dang / bskyung ba dang / brdeg pa dang / bsdigs pa nyams su bzod par byed pa yongs su ston pa dang; sems can thams cad kyis mi sgul ba yongs su ston pa dang / rim gror byas pa dang / rim gror ma byas pa thams cad kyis mtho ba dang / dma' bar mi 'gyur ba yongs su ston pa dang / sems can thams cad la nga rgyal med pa yongs su ston pa dang / chos thams cad kyi rang bzhin la bzod pa mi zad pas/ ye shes mi zad pa yongs su ston pa dang / sems can thams cad kyi nyon mongs pa thams cad yongs su spang ba'i phyir/ bzod pa'i spyod pa yongs su ston pa dang / sems can thams cad kyi lus dbyibs mi sdug cing kha dog mi mdzes pa'i gzugs rnam par zlog par byed pa dang / sems can thams cad la de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku mdog rnam par dag pa bla na med pa yongs su ston cing / sems can yongs su smin par byed pa mthong ngo/ /

He also saw emerging from all the goddess’s pores multitudes of projected bodies with various appearances showing sentient beings’ patient endurance of mutilation and dismemberment, patient endurance of beatings, patient endurance of unjust abuse, reproof, contempt, degradation, beatings, and threats, showing unshakability, showing kindness to all beings without hauteur or servility, showing freedom from conceit, showing inexhaustible knowledge of the inexhaustibility of tolerance of the true nature of all things, showing the practice of forbearance to destroy all afflictions of all sentient beings, turning sentient beings away from all warped conditions, praising the supreme purity of the enlightened, developing sentient beings to maturity.

ba spu'i sgo thams cad nas sems can thams cad dang mnyam pa'i skye ba sna tshogs kya [*kyi?] lus kha dog dang / dbyibs dang / chu zheng sna tshogs su sprul pa'i sprin 'thon te; sems can rnams kyi bsam pa ji lta ba bzhin du rgyas par khyab par byas nas/ thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi tshogs chen po la/ brtson 'grus kyis sngon du 'dor ba yang dag par ston pa dang / bdud kyi dkrugs ma thams cad rnam par 'thor ba'i brtson 'grus dang / byang chub tu brtsams pa mi 'khrugs mi zlog pa'i brtson 'grus dang / sems can thams cad 'khor ba'i rgya mtsho las rab tu bsgral ba'i brtson 'grus dang / mi khom pa dang / ngan song dang / ngan 'gro dang / log par ltung ba'i lam thams cad rnam pa bzlog pa'i brtson 'grus dang / mi shes pa'i ri rnam par gtor ba'i brtson 'grus dang / de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad mchod cing bsnyen bkur bya bas yongs su mi skyo ba'i brtson 'grus dang / sangs rgyas thams cad kyi chos kyi 'khor lo yang dag par blang ba dang / yongs su gzung ba'i brtson 'grus dang / sgrib pa thams cad kyi ri rab tu gzhom zhing rnam par gtor ba'i brtson 'grus dang / sems can thams cad yongs su smin par bya ba dang / gdul bas mi skyo ba'i brtson 'grus dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing / thams cad yongs su dag par bya ba'i brtson 'grus dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i brtson 'grus rnam par dag pa bla na med pa yongs su ston cing / sems can yongs su smin par byed pa mthong ngo/ /

He also saw emerge from all the pores of the goddess multitudes of projections of the forms of various kinds of beings, the same as all beings in appearance and size, showing all sentient beings, according to their mentalities, the exertion of energy to store the great knowledge and virtue needed for omniscience, showing the energy to destroy all demons, the energy to work for enlightenment without being disturbed or deflected, the energy to lift all sentient beings out of the sea of the mundane whirl, the energy to get rid of all paths leading to falls into miserable conditions, evils, and states inopportune for enlightenment, the energy to pulverize the mountain of nescience, the energy to serve all buddhas tirelessly, the energy to receive and hold all buddha-teachings, the energy to cut through and shatter the mountains of all obstacles to enlightenment, the energy to develop and guide all sentient beings tirelessly, the energy to purify all buddha-lands, and the supreme purity of the energy of the enlightened, thus developing sentient beings to maturity.

ba spu'i sgo thams cad nas/ lus sna tshogs kha dog dang / dbyibs rnam pa tha dad par sprul pa'i sprin 'thon te/ thabs sna tshogs kyis sems can rnams kyi dga' ba yongs su skyed pa dang / yid mi bde ba rnam par zlog pa dang / 'dod pa'i dga' ba thams cad rnam par smod pa dang / ngo tsha shes pa'i chos nyid 'jig rten du sgrog pa dang / dbang po bsdams pa la sems can rnams rab tu dgod pa dang / tshangs pa'i spyod pa bla na med pa yang dag par bsngags pa byed pa dang / 'dod pa'i 'jig rten bdud kyi yul 'jigs pa dang bcas par yongs su ston pa dang / 'dod pa'i dga' ba dang bral ba rnams la 'jig rten gyi 'dod pa dang dga' ba'i yul thams cad yongs su ston pa dang / chos la mos shing dga' ba la sems can rab tu dgod pa dang / mthar gyis bsam gtan dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / snyoms par 'jug pa'i sgo mngon par sgrub pa dang / sems can thams cad kyi nyon mongs pa thams cad rnam par bsal ba la nges par rtogs pa'i sems yongs su brjod pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i ting nge 'dzin rgya mtsho'i rnam par 'phrul pa thams cad yongs su sten [*ston?] pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i mngon par shes pa dang / rnam par 'phrul pa dang / khyu mchog gi mthu phyung ba yongs su ston par byed cing / sems can thams cad kyi dga' ba yongs su bskyed pa dang / spro ba 'phel bar bya ba dang / nyams bde ba yongs su bskyed pa dang / yid mi bde ba bzlog pa dang / sems skyon med pa yongs su bsgrub pa dang / sems las su rung bar bya ba dang / bsam pa rnam par sbyang ba dang / dbang po gsal bar bya ba dang / lus kyi bde ba yongs su skyed pa dang / chos la dga' ba'i shugs rnam par 'phel bar bya ba byed cing sems can rnams yongs su smin par byed pa mthong ngo/ /

He also saw multitudes of projected bodies emanate from the goddess’s pores producing joy in sentient beings by various means, removing depression, wary of all sensuality, promoting modesty in the world, directing sentient beings to guard their senses, praising unexcelled religious practice, portraying the realm of desire as a perilous realm of demons, showing the realm of enjoyment of all worldly desires even to those free from sensuality, establishing sentient beings in enjoyment of truth, step by step producing the bliss of the attainments of meditation and concentration, praising conscious contemplation of all the afflictions of all sentient beings, showing the magical creativity of the ocean of concentrations of all enlightening beings, showing the majesty of the miracles of the mystic knowledges of enlightening beings, making sentient beings joyful and happy, removing melancholy, bringing goodness of mind, producing cleverness and activity of mind, purifying the mind, clarifying the senses, producing physical bliss, promoting the growth of the energy of the joy of truth, thus developing sentient beings to maturity.

ba spu'i sgo thams cad nas skye ba thams cad dang 'dra ba'i lus kyi sprin sna tshogs 'thon te/ zhing thams cad kyi khongs su chud pa'i sems can thams cad kyi yid bzhin du bstan pa'i phyir/ dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyi gan du 'gro bas skyo ba med pa yongs su ston pa dang / slob dpon dang / bla ma dang / dge ba'i bshes gnyen la rim gro bya ba dang / bsnyen bkur bas skyo ba med pa yongs su ston pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi chos kyi 'khor lo 'khor ba yang dag par blang zhing yongs su bzung bas skyo ba med pa'i brtson 'grus yongs su ston pa dang / sangs rgyas mtsho thams cad khong du chud par bya ba'i tshul yang dag par brjod pa dang / chos kyi sgo rgya mtsho thams cad rnam par 'byed pa dang / chos thams cad kyi mtshan nyid dang / rang bzhin dang / tshul mngon par brjod pa dang / chos thams cad ting nge 'dzin gyi sgor yongs su ston pa dang / sems can thams cad kyi dri ba dang / the tshom rgya mtsho rnam par sel bas shes rab kyi yul yongs su ston pa dang / sems can thams cad kyi lta ba'i ri shin tu 'joms pa'i shes rab rdo rje yongs su ston pa dang / sems kyi skad cig gcig dang ldan pas sems can thams cad kyi ma rig pa'i mun pa rnam par sel ba'i shes rab kyi nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor 'char ba yongs su ston pa byed cing / sems can thams cad kyi dga' ba yongs su skye bar bya bas sems can yongs su smin par byed pa mthong ngo/ /

He also saw multitudes of bodies in the forms of all sentient beings emanate from all the goddess’s pores, appearing agreeably to all sentient beings in all lands, showing them tirelessness in going to all spiritual benefactors, showing tirelessness in attendance on all mentors and spiritual benefactors, showing tireless energy in taking in and holding in mind the operations of the cycles of teachings of all buddhas, investigating the oceans of all approaches to the truth, describing the way to enter the ocean of all buddhas, elucidating the teaching of the characteristics and nature of all phenomena, showing the door of concentration, showing the thunderbolt of wisdom which breaks through the mountain of views of sentient beings, by continuous mental application showing the rise of the sun of wisdom dispelling the darkness of ignorance of all sentient beings, developing sentient beings in omniscience while engendering joy in all sentient beings.

ba spu'i sgo thams cad nas kha dog dang dbyibs bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i lus mang po 'gro ba thams cad dang mnyam pa'i sprul pa'i sprin 'thon te/ bsam pa dang mos pa ji lta ba bzhin du sems can thams cad la mngon du gnas shing sgra skad sna tshogs kyis yongs su sbyang ba bstan pas/ 'jig rten pa'i bsod nams dang / bsod nams ma yin pa mngon par ston pa dang / 'jig rten pa'i bya ba thams cad rab tu rgyu ba dang / khams gsum pa 'byung ba thams cad yongs su bstan pa dang / khams gsum pa thams cad las 'byung ba'i phyogs yang dag par brjod pa dang / lta ba'i mya ngan mi bzad pa thams cad las 'byung ba'i phyogs yang dag par bstan pas/ thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi lam gyi khyad par yongs su brjod pa dang / nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi sa'i lam las yongs su bzla ba yang dag par ston pa dang / rim gror byas pa dang / rim gror ma byas pa la byams sdang gis gos pa med pa yongs su ston pa dang / 'khor ba dang / mya ngan las 'das pa'i sgol [?] mi gnas pa yang dag par ston pa dang / dga' ldan gyi gnas la sogs pa gcig nas gcig tu rgyu ba rgyun mi 'chad pa yongs su ston pa dang / snying po byang chub tu song zhing mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar rgyun mi 'chad pa yongs su ston pa byed cing / thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du sems can yongs su smin pa byed pa mthong ngo; ;

He also saw multitudes of projected bodies, equal to all sentient beings, with splendid, inconceivably various appearances, emanate from the goddess’s pores and appear before all sentient beings in accord with their inclinations and interests, using various languages to reveal higher knowledge of all worldly good, explaining the excellence of the path of omniscience by doing all that should be done in the world, by showing the issue of all states of existence, by describing the way out of conditioned existences, and by showing the way out of the wilderness of all views, showing transcendence of the paths of individual salvation, showing absence of attraction or aversion toward the created or the uncreated, showing nonattachment to the pleasures of mundane life or nirvana, showing unceasing progression from the heaven of satisfaction, showing unceasing attainment of enlightenment at the pinnacle of enlightenment, showing the realm of wisdom to guide all beings out of the sea of doubt, illumining omniscience for sentient beings.

ba spu'i sgo thams cad kyi ba spu'i sgo re re nas kyang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing thams cad kyi rdul shin tu phra ba snyed kyi lus sprul pa'i sprin 'thon te/ sems can gyi 'jig rten thams cad la mngon sum du gnas shing byang chub sems dpa' kun tu bzang po'i spyod pa dang smon lam yongs su brjod pa dang / chos kyi dbyings thams cad rnam par dag pa'i mthar thug pa'i smon lam gyi khyad par yongs su brjod pa dang / sems kyi skad cig re re la 'jig rten gyi khams rgya mtsho thams cad yongs su dag par bya ba yongs su brjod pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad la mchod cing rim gror bya ba rgyun mi 'chad pa yongs su brjod pa dang / sems kyi skad cig re re la chos kyi tshul rgya mtsho thams cad la 'jug pa rgyun mi 'chad pa yongs su ston pa dang / 'jig rten gyi khams rgya mtsho thams cad du rdul shin tu phra ba snyed kyi chos kyi dbyings kyi tshul rgya mtsho la 'jug pa rgyun mi 'chad pa yongs su ston pa dang / zhing thams cad du phyi ma'i mtha'i bskal pa'i mur thug par gnas shing / thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi lam rnam par dag par bya bar yongs su brjod pa rgyun mi 'chad pa yang dag par ston pa dang / sems kyi skad cig re re la/ de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs la 'jug pa rgyun mi 'chad pa yang dag par brjod pa dang / dus gsum gyi tshul rgya mtsho thams cad la 'jug pa rgyun mi 'chad pa yongs su ston pa dang / zhing thams cad du rdzu 'phrul gyis rnam par 'phrul pa yongs su bstan pa rgyun mi 'chad pa yang dag par ston pa byed cing / byang chub sems dpa'i smon lam dang spyod pa yongs su bstan pas sems can thams cad thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la rab tu 'god pa mthong ngo/ /

He also saw as many multitudes of projected bodies as atoms in all lands emanate from each pore of the goddess and stand before all sentient beings praising the vow of practice of universally good enlightening beings, praising the excellence of the vow to ultimately purify all universes, praising purification of all worlds in each moment of thought, praising persistence in entering the powers of buddhas in each moment of thought, showing ceaseless entry into the ocean of principles of the cosmos—equal to the number of atomic particles in all oceans of worlds—in every single moment of thought, praising ceaseless elucidation of purification of the path of omniscience in all lands throughout all time, showing ceaseless entry into the ocean of past, present, and future means of guidance, showing ceaseless manifestations of all magical powers of enlightening beings, leading all sentient beings to omniscience by showing the practice of the vows of enlightening beings.

ba spu'i sgo thams cad kyi ba spu'i sgo re re nas kyis 'gro ba thams cad kyi sems dang mnyam pa'i lus kyi sprul pa'i sprin mang po 'thon te/ sems can thams cad la mngon par gnas shing; thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi tshogs kyi stobs mu med pa yongs su ston pa dang / thams cad mkhyen pa'i sems kyi stobs mi zad pa dang / mi 'jigs pa dang / chud mi za ba'i chos can yongs su ston pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa thams cad yongs su bsgrub pa'i stobs phyir mi ldog cing phyir mi ldog la/ thug pa med pa dang / rgyun med pa dang / bla na med pa yongs su ston pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi stobs 'khor ba'i nyes pa thams cad kyis mi gos pa yongs su ston pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi stobs bdud kyi dkyil 'khor thams cad rnam par 'thor ba dang / byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi stobs nyon mongs pa thams cad kyi dri mas nye bar nyon mongs pa med pa yongs su ston pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi stobs las kyi sgrib pa thams cad kyi ri rnam par 'thor ba yongs su ston pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi snying rje chen po'i stobs bskal ba thams cad du gnas kyang byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pas skyo ba med pa yongs su ston pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi stobs sangs rgyas kyi zhing thams cad yongs su bskyod cing bskul bas/ sems can thams cad rab tu dga' bar byed pa yongs su ston pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi stobs bdud dang / phas kyi rgol ba'i tshogs thams cad rab tu 'joms pa yongs su ston pa dang / chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba'i ye shes kyi stobs chen po 'jig rten du rab tu brjod pa byed cing / sems can thams cad thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du yongs su smin par byed pa mthong ngo/ /

He also saw multitudes of projected bodies as numerous as the minds of all beings emanate from each of the goddess’s pores and stand before all sentient beings, showing them the endless power of the provisions for omniscience, showing the unbreakable, invincible, indestructible power of the will for omniscience, showing the nonregressing, irreversible, sustained, ceaseless power of accomplishment of the supreme practice of all enlightening beings, praising enlightening beings’ power to remain unaffected by the ills of mundane life, showing enlightening being’s power to destroy all demons, showing enlightening beings’ power of great compassion tirelessly carrying out enlightening actions throughout all ages, showing enlightening beings’ power to shake all buddha-lands and please all beings, showing enlightening beings’ power to crush all demons and false teachers, to nurture the power of knowledge to turn the wheel of the great teaching in the world, elucidating omniscience for all sentient beings.

ba spu'i sgo thams cad kyi ba spu'i sgo re re nas kyang lus kyi sprul pa rgya mtsho kha dog mtha' yas pa/ 'gro ba thams cad kyi sems dang mnyam pa'i sprin/ phyogs bcu mtha' yas pa'i sems can gyi khams su rgyas par 'gengs pa 'thon te/ sems can rnams kyi bsam pa dang / mos pa ji lta ba bzhin du byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa dang / ye shes kyi rnam par gnon pa yongs su ston pa dang / sems can gyi khams rgya mtsho thams cad la 'jug pa'i ye shes yongs su ston pa dang / sems can thams cad kyi sems rgya mtsho la 'jug pa'i ye shes yongs su ston pa dang / sems can thams cad kyi dbang po rgya mtsho yongs su shes pa'i ye shes yongs su ston pa dang / sems can thams cad kyi spyod pa rgya mtsho la 'jug pa'i ye shes yongs su ston pa dang; sems can thams cad yongs su smin par bya ba dang / gdul ba'i dus las mi 'da' ba'i ye shes yongs su ston pa dang / chos kyi dbyings thams cad du grags par sgrog pa'i ye shes yongs su ston pa dang / sems kyi skad cig re re la chos kyi dbyings thams cad du ye shes kyi tshul rgya mtshos rgyas par 'gengs pa'i ye shes yongs su ston pa dang / 'jig rten gyi khams rgya mtsho thams cad 'du ba dang / 'jig pa'i ye shes yongs su ston pa dang / 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad kyi gzhi dang / dbyibs dang / rgyan rnam par dgod pa'i ye shes yongs su ston pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi mchod pa rnam par sprul te/ spyan sngar phyin nas mchod cing rim gro byed pa dang / chos kyi 'khor lo'i sprin yang dag par 'dzin pa'i ye shes yongs su ston pa byed cing / de ltar ye shes kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i spyod pa yongs su ston pas sems can rnams kyi dga' ba skyed pa dang / sems rab tu dang bar byed pa dang / rab tu dga' ba skyed pa dang / mos pa 'phel bar byed pa dang / yid mi bde ba rnam par zlog pa dang / sems rnam par sbyong ba dang / sems skyon med pa skye bar byed pa dang / dbang po gsal bar byed pa dang / mos pa'i stobs yongs su skyed pa dang / thams cad mkhyen pa nyid las phyir mi ldog par byed pa mthong ngo/ /

He also saw multitudes of projected bodies in endless forms, presented to the minds of all sentient beings, emanate from each pore of the goddess, filling the endless realms of sentient beings in the ten directions, showing beings, according to their mentalities, the energetic activity of the knowledge of the practice of enlightening beings, showing knowledge comprehending all realms of sentient beings, showing knowledge comprehending all sentient beings’ minds, showing knowledge thoroughly aware of the faculties of all sentient beings, showing knowledge comprehending all sentient beings’ actions, showing knowledge of proper timing in developing and guiding all sentient beings, showing the knowledge to echo the languages of all realms of existence, showing knowledge pervading the ocean of ways to knowledge of all phenomena in each moment of thought, showing knowledge of the formation and disintegration of all worlds, showing knowledge of the differences in basis, form, and arrangement of all worlds, showing the knowledge to go to buddhas with magical offerings, serve the buddhas, and receive their teachings, thus producing joy in sentient beings by showing the practice of the transcendent way of knowledge, soothing their minds, producing joy and happiness, getting rid of melancholy, purifying the mind, leading to goodwill, clarifying the senses, producing the power of resolution, making sentient beings irreversible on the way to omniscience.

pha rol tu phyin pa'i spyod pa yongs su bstan pas 'jig rten du ji ltar sems can yongs su smin par gyur pa mthong ba de bzhin du/ byang chub sems dpa'i chos thams cad rab tu sgrog pa'i tshul gyis mtshan mo'i lha mo rab tu dga' ba'i mig'gro bar rnam par snang ba'i thog ma sems bskyed pa'i tshogs dang / dge ba'i bshes gnyen bsnyen bkur ba'i thabs dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i zhabs kyi drung du phyin cing mchod pa dang rim gro byas pa'i tshul dang / dge ba'i chos spyad pa'i thabs ji snyed pa dang / sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i spyod pas gtang bar dka' ba yongs su btang ba dang / tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su sbyangs pa'i thabs dang / rgyal srid kyi dbang phyug chen po dang / 'khor mang po dang longs spyod kyi dbang chen po yongs su btang ste/ mngon par byung ba'i thabs ji snyed pa dang / 'jig rten gyi dka' ba'i spyod pa brtul zhugs dang / dka' thub chen po'i dkyil 'khor la bzod pa mngon par bsgrubs pa ji snyed cig yod pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i brtul zhugs yang dag par blangs pa'i sbyor ba la mi g.yo bar bya ba ji snyed cig yod pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i yi dam brtan pa'i chos rgya mtsho sems can gyi khams thams cad kyi nyes byas dang / ngan du smra ba dang / nyes par spyod pa thams cad bag la zha bar byed pa'i sbyor ba dang / lus dang sems kyi gnod pa nyams su bzod par byed pa'i sbyor ba ji snyed cig yod pa dang / chos thams cad 'jig pa med pa'i chos nyid la bzod pa dang / chos thams cad la yid ches pa'i bzod pa dang / chos thams cad kyi rang bzhin nges par rtogs pa'i bzod pa ji snyed cig yod pa dang / thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du rtsom zhing sbyor ba'i brtson 'grus ji snyed cig yod pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad yongs su sgrub pa'i brtson 'grus ji snyed cig yod pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i spyod pa ji snyed pa thams cad dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i tshogs dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa la brtson par bya ba dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgrub pa rnam par dag pa'i spyod pa ji snyed cig yod pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i ting nge 'dzin rab tu thob pas rnam par 'phrul pa ji snyed cig yod pa dang / ting nge 'dzin gyi sgo rgya mtsho la 'jug pa ji snyed cig yod pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i spyod pa ji snyed pa thams cad dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i tshogs ji snyed cig yod pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i shes rab chen po'i nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor rnam par spyad pa'i tshul ji snyed cig yod pa dang / shes rab chen po'i sprin yongs su 'du ba'i tshul ji snyed cig yod pa dang / shes rab kyi gter chen po'i tshogs ji snyed cig yod pa dang / shes rab kyi rgya mtsho chen po la rnam par dpyad pa'i tshul dang / sbyor ba ji snyed pa thams cad dang / thabs chen po la mkhas pa'i tshul gyi sbyor ba ji snyed cig yod pa dang / thabs chen po la mkhas pa yongs su dag par bya ba dang ldan pa'i sngon gyi sbyor ba ji snyed pa thams cad dang / byang chub sems dpa'i smon lam gyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i lus ji snyed cig yod pa dang / smon lam chen po'i pha rol phyin pa yongs su grub pa ji snyed cig yod pa dang / smon lam chen po'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i spyod pa ji snyed cig yod pa dang / smon lam chen po'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang ldan pa'i sngon gyi sbyor ba ji snyed pa thams cad dang / stobs kyi pha rol tu phyin pa thob par bya ba'i tshogs chen po ji snyed cig yod pa dang / stobs kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i rkyen du gyur pa ji snyed cig yod pa dang; stobs kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i tshul rgya mtsho chen po ji snyed cig yod pa dang / stobs kyi pha rol tu phyin pa shin tu bstan pa ji snyed cig yod pa dang / stobs kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang ldan pa'i sngon gyi sbyor ba ji snyed pa thams cad dang / ye shes kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i sbyor ba ji snyed cig yod pa dang / ye shes kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rnam par dag pa'i tshul ji snyed cig yod pa dang / ye shes kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i phyogs ji snyed cig yod pa dang / ye shes kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i rjes su 'brang bar bya ba ji snyed cig yod pa dang / ye shes kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'byams klas pa ji snyed cig yod pa dang / ye shes kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i tshul la yang dag par gzhol bar bya ba ji snyed cig yod pa dang / ye shes kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i tshul rnam par dmigs par bya ba ji snyed cig yod pa dang / ye shes kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'byams klas pa'i rjes su 'brang bar bya ba ji snyed cig yod pa dang / ye shes kyi pha rol tu phyin pas rgyas par 'gengs pa ji snyed cig yod pa dang / ye shes kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rgya chen po ji snyed cig yod pa dang / ye shes kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i lhun ji snyed cig yod pa dang / ye shes kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su grub par bya ba dang ldan pa'i sngon gyi sbyor ba ji snyed pa thams cad dang / ye shes kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i spyod pa'i rnam par rab tu phye ba la 'jug pa 'byung bar yongs su bsgrub pa ji snyed cig yod pa dang / ye shes kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la yang dag par gzhol bar bya ba'i tshul dang ldan pa'i chos rnams dang / chos yongs su bsdu ba dang / chos kyi ye shes kyi rjes su 'brang ba dang / las kyi ye shes kyi rjes su 'brang ba dang / zhing gi ye shes kyi rjes su 'brang ba dang / bskal pa'i ye shes kyi rjes su 'brang ba dang / dus kyi ye shes kyi rjes su 'brang ba dang / sangs rgyas 'byung ba'i ye shes kyi rjes su 'brang ba dang / sangs rgyas kyi ye shes kyi rjes su 'brang ba dang / byang chub sems dpa'i ye shes kyi rjes su 'brang ba dang / byang chub sems dpa'i sems yongs su 'byung ba'i ye shes kyi rjes su 'brang ba dang / byang chub sems dpa'i rnam par dgod pa'i ye shes kyi rjes su 'brang ba dang / byang chub sems dpa'i 'byung ba'i ye shes kyi rjes su 'brang ba dang / byang chub sems dpa'i rab tu 'jug pa'i ye shes kyi rjes su 'brang ba dang / byang chub sems dpa'i smon lam gyi ye shes kyi rjes su 'brang ba dang / byang chub sems dpa'i chos kyi 'khor lo'i ye shes kyi rjes su 'brang ba dang / byang chub sems dpa'i chos rnam par 'byed pa'i ye shes kyi rjes su 'brang ba dang / byang chub sems dpa'i chos rgya mtsho'i tshul gyi ye shes kyi rjes su 'brang ba dang / byang chub sems dpa'i chos gangs chen mtsho'i ye shes kyi rjes su 'brang ba dang / byang chub sems dpa'i chos kyi rgyud kyi ye shes kyi rjes su 'brang ba dang / byang chub sems dpa'i chos kyi gter gyi ye shes kyi rjes su 'brang ba dang / byang chub sems dpa'i chos kyi lugs kyi ye shes kyi rjes su 'brang ba ji snyed cig yod pa dang / mtshan mo'i lha mo rab tu dga' ba'i mig'gro bar rnam par snang ba'i ye shes kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang ldan pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa mtha' dang dbus med pa'i dmigs pa can de dag thams cad de'i ba spu'i sgo thams cad kyi ba spu'i sgo re re nas mngon par 'thon te/ sems can gyi lus kyi sprin kha dog sna tshogs can du mngon par mched cing sems can yongs su smin par byed pa mthong ngo/ /

Just as he saw her proceeding to develop sentient beings in the world by demonstrations of the practices of the transcendent ways, he saw multitudes of bodies of beings of various forms emanate from each of the goddess’s pores with the thunder of the laws of all enlightening beings, the preparations of the goddess’s first inspiration, propitiation of spiritual benefactors, going to buddhas and attending them, the practice of virtuous conduct, the relinquishment of what is hard to give up in the course of practicing transcendent giving, the purification of transcendent discipline, the abandonment of rulership and retinue and going forth from society, the exercise of forbearance in austerities difficult to practice in the world, unshakability in the application of the vows undertaken by enlightening beings, the oceans of practices of steadfast resolutions of enlightening beings, the endurance of suffering which is impossible, unspeakable, unthinkable to all worldly beings, the endurance of physical and mental harassment, acceptance of the nonperishing nature of deeds, earnest acceptance of all truths, contemplative acceptance of the nature of all things, energy in undertaking to become omniscient, energy in accomplishing all aspects of buddhahood, all practices of transcendent energy, the preparations for transcendent meditation, energetic efforts in transcendent meditation, practices purifying the attainments of transcendent meditation, mystical powers attained by enlightening beings through concentration, entries into the ocean of mediums of concentration, practices of transcendent meditation, the preparations for transcendent wisdom, the clarification of the sun of great wisdom of enlightening beings, the issue of great masses of wisdom, the treasures of wisdom, applications of the ways of contemplation of the ocean of great wisdom, applications of the principles of great skill in means, embodiments of the transcendent vows of enlightening beings, achievements of great transcendent vows, practices of transcendent commitment, past efforts involved in great transcendent vows, great resources for the attainment of transcendent power, cooperating circumstances of transcendent power, oceans of principles of transcendent power, indications of transcendent power, past efforts involved in transcendent power, principles of transcendent knowledge, applications of transcendent knowledge, methods of purification of knowledge, realms of knowledge, attainments of knowledge, ranges of knowledge, integration of principles of knowledge, methods of communicating knowledge, consequences of the courses of knowledge, suffusions of knowledge, expansions of knowledge, embodiments of knowledge, principles of the ocean of knowledge, past efforts involved in the accomplishment of knowledge, attainments made possible by ascertainment and entry into the modes of practice of knowledge, attainments of knowledge involved in the method of total integration of perfect knowledge, attainments of knowledge of truth comprehending right and wrong, attainments of knowledge of actions, of lands, of ages, of past, present, and future, attainments of knowledge of the emergence of buddhas, attainments of knowledge of buddhas, attainments of knowledge of enlightening beings, attainments of knowledge originating in the mind of enlightening beings, attainments of knowledge of the particular states of enlightening beings, attainments of knowledge of the origins of enlightening beings, attainments of knowledge of the orientation of enlightening beings, attainments of knowledge of the vows of enlightening beings, attainments of knowledge of the cycles of teaching of enlightening beings, attainments of knowledge of enlightening beings’ ascertainment of what is right, attainments of knowledge of principles of the ocean of practice of enlightening beings, attainments of knowledge of the multitude of enlightening beings’ doctrines, their spheres, their hidden resources, and their courses of action—all the principles of enlightening beings connected with consummate knowledge of infinite objects, Sudhana saw being embodied by emanations from the goddess to develop sentient beings to maturity. He saw multitudes of embodiments of the forms of all kinds of beings emanating from the goddess, filling the cosmos, appearing before all sentient beings, and developing them to maturity.

'di lta ste/ 'og min dang / shin tu mthong ba dang / gya nom snang ba dang / ma dros pa dang / mi che ba'i gtsang ma'i gnas kyi lha lta bu'i lus kyi sprin du mngon par 'thon cing sems can yongs su smin par byed pa mthong ngo/ /
de bzhin du 'bras bu che ba dang / bsod nams 'phel ba dang / sprin dang bral ba'i lha lta bu'i lus kyi sprin du mngon par 'thon cing sems can yongs su smin par byed pa mthong ngo/ /
dge rgyas dang / tshad med dge ba dang / dge ba chung ba'i lha lta bu'i lus kyi sprin du mngon par 'thon cing sems can yongs su smin par byed pa mthong ngo/ /
kun snang dang ba dang / tshad med snang ba dang / snang ba chung ngu'i lha lta bu'i lus kyi sprin du mngon par 'thon cing sems can yongs su smin par byed pa mthong ngo/ /
tshangs chen dang / tshangs lha nye phan dang / tshangs pa kun ris kyi lha lta bu'i lus kyi sprin du mngon par 'thon cing / sems can yongs su smin par byed pa mthong ngo/ /
dbang sgyur gyi lha'i rgyal po/ lha mo'i tshogs dang / lha'i bu dang bcas pa lta bu'i lus kyi sprin du mngon par 'thon cing sems can yongs su smin par byed pa mthong ngo/ /
lha'i rgyal po rab 'phrul dga'/ lha mo'i tshogs dang / lha'i bu dang bcas pa lta bu'i lus kyi sprin du mngon par 'thon cing sems can yongs su smin par byed pa mthong ngo/ /rab dga' ldan gyi lha'i rgyal po/ lha mo'i tshogs dang / lha'i bu dang bcas pa lta bu'i lus kyi sprin du mngon par 'thon cing sems can yongs su smin par byed pa mthong ngo/ /rab mtshe ma'i lha'i rgyal po/ lha mo'i tshogs dang / lha'i bu dang bcas pa lta bu'i lus kyi sprin du mngon par 'thon cing sems can yongs su smin par byed pa mthong ngo/ /lha'i rgyal po brgya byin/ lha mo'i tshogs dang / lha'i bu dang bcas pa lta bu'i lus kyi sprin du mngon par 'thon cing / sems can yongs su smin par byed pa mthong ngo/ /dri za'i rgyal po gnas srung po dang / dri za'i bu dang / dri za'i bu mo lta bu'i lus kyi sprin du mngon par 'thon cing sems can yongs su smin par byed pa mthong ngo/ /grul bum gyi rgyal po 'phags skyes po dang / grul bum gyi bu dang / grul bum gyi bu mo lta bu'i lus kyi sprin du mngon par 'thon cing sems can yongs su smin par byed pa mthong ngo/ /klu'i rgyal po mig mi bzang dang / klu'i bu dang / klu'i bu mo lta bu'i lus kyi sprin du mngon par 'thon cing sems can yongs su smin par byed pa mthong ngo/ /gnod sbyin gyi rgyal po chen po ngal bso po dang / gnod sbyin gyi bu dang / gnod sbyin gyi bu mo lta bu'i lus kyi sprin du mngon par 'thon cing sems can yongs su smin par byed pa mthong ngo/ /mi'am ci'i rgyal po sdong po dang / mi 'am ci'i bu dang / mi'am ci'i bu mo lta bu'i lus kyi sprin du mngon par 'thon cing sems can yongs su smin par byed pa mthong ngo/ /lto 'phye chen po'i dbang po blo gros bzang po dang / lto 'phye chen po'i bu dang / lto 'phye chen po'i bu mo lta bu'i lus kyi sprin du mngon par 'thon cing sems can yongs su smin par byed pa mthong ngo/ /nam mkha' lding gi dbang po shugs drag stobs chen dang / nam mkha' lding gi bu dang / nam mkha' lding gi bu mo lta bu'i lus kyi sprin du mngon par 'thon cing sems can yongs su smin par byed pa mthong ngo/ /lha ma yin gyi dbang po sgra gcan dang / lha ma yin gyi bu dang / lha ma yin gyi bu mo lta bu'i lus kyi sprin du mngon par 'thon cing sems can yongs su smin par byed pa mthong ngo/ /chos kyi rgyal po gshin rje dang / gshin rje'i bu dang / gshin rje'i bu mo lta bu'i lus kyi sprin du mngon par 'thon cing sems can yongs su smin par byed pa mthong ngo/ /mi'i dbang po dang / skyes pa dang / bud med dang / khye'u dang / bu mo thams cad lta bu'i lus kyi sprin du mngon par 'thon cing sems can yongs su smin par byed pa mthong ngo// de bzhin du 'gro ba'i rgyud thams cad du gtogs pa'i sems can thams cad lta bu'i lus kyi sprin du mngon par 'thon cing sems can yongs su smin par byed pa mthong ngo/ /nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas dang / drang srong thams cad lta bu'i lus kyi sprin du mngon par 'thon cing sems can yongs su smin par byed pa mthong ngo/ /
rlung dang / chu dang / me'i phung po'i lha lta bu'i lus kyi sprin du mngon par 'thon cing sems can yongs su smin par byed pa mthong ngo/ /rgya mtsho dang / chu klung dang / ri dang / nags tshal dang / lo tog dang / sman dang / shing dang / sa'i lha lta bu'i lus kyi sprin du mngon par 'thon cing sems can yongs su smin par byed pa mthong ngo/ /bza' shing gi ra ba dang / grong khyer dang / snying po byang chub dang / nyin bar dang / mtshan mo dang / nam mkha' dang / phyogs dang / rkang gis 'gro dang / lus kyi ris su gtogs pa'i lha lta bu'i lus kyi sprin du mngon par 'thon cing sems can yongs su smin par byed pa mthong ba nas/ de bzhin du lag na rdo rje lta bu'i lus kyi sprin du mngon par 'thon cing phyogs bcu rgyas par bkang ste/ chos kyi dbyings kyi tshul 'byams klas pa thams cad du sems can thams cad la mngon par gnas shing sems can yongs su smin par byed pa'i bar du mthong ste/

mtshan mo'i lha mo rab tu dga' ba'i mig'gro bar rnam par snang ba'i sems thog ma bskyed pa'i tshogs la sogs pa/ sngon gyi tshe rabs la yongs su bsgrubs pa'i dge ba'i sems gcig nas gcig tu brgyud de rgyun ma chad pa'i tshul ji snyed pa dang / byang chub tu sems bskyed pa'i bsngags pa gcig nas gcig tu brgyud cing 'dab chags pa dang / shi 'pho dang / skye ba yongs su bzung ba gcig nas gcig tu brgyud cing 'dab chags pa dang / lus yongs su bzung ba gcig nas gcig tu brgyud cing 'dab chags pa dang / ming gi 'khor lo gcig nas gcig tu brgyud cing 'dab chags pa dang / dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyi gan du 'gro ba gcig nas gcig tu brgyud cing 'dab chags pa dang / sangs rgyas byung ste bsnyen bkur ba gcig nas gcig tu brgyud cing 'dab chags pa dang / chos kyi tshig dang; yi ge blangs pa gcig nas gcig tu brgyud cing 'dab chags pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i lam gyi nan tan gyi sems gcig nas gcig tu brgyud cing 'dab chags pa dang; ting nge 'dzin rab tu thob pa gcig nas gcig tu brgyud cing 'dab chags pa dang / ting 'dzin thob pas sangs rgyas mthong ba gcig nas gcig tu brgyud cing 'dab chags pa dang / zhing mthong ba'i mig gis rgyas par bkang ba gcig nas gcig tu brgyud cing 'dab chags pa dang / bskal pa gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pa'i ye shes kyi 'khor lo 'dab chags pa dang / chos kyi dbyings khong du chud pa'i ye shes gcig nas gcig tu brgyud cing 'dab chags pa dang / sems can gyi khams la rnam par lta ba gcig nas gcig tu brgyud cing 'dab chags pa dang / chos kyi dbyings kyi tshul rgya mtshor gtogs pa'i sems can pha rol gyi shi 'pho dang skye ba shes pa gcig nas gcig tu brgyud cing 'dab chags pa dang / lha'i rna ba yongs su dag pa rtogs par byed pa'i shes pa gcig nas gcig tu brgyud cing 'dab chags pa dang / sems can gyi khams thams cad kyi sems la rnam par lta zhing dbyings la 'jugs pa'i sgo gcig nas gcig tu brgyud cing 'dab chags pa dang / thog ma lha'i mig la zhugs pa'i sgo gcig nas gcig tu brgyud cing 'dab chags pa dang / thog ma lha'i rna ba rnam par dmigs pa gcig nas gcig tu brgyud cing 'dab chags pa dang / thog ma sems can pha rol gyi sems shes pa gcig nas gcig tu brgyud cing 'dab chags pa dang / thog ma bdag dang sems can pha rol gyi sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa shes pa gcig nas gcig tu brgyud cing 'dab chags pa dang / thog ma dngos po med pa la rab tu gnas te/ mngon par 'du bya ba med pa'i rdzu 'phrul thob pa'i rkyen gcig nas gcig tu brgyud cing 'dab chags pa dang / rdzu 'phrul chen po'i rnam par gnon pas phyogs rgyas par 'gengs pa gcig nas gcig tu brgyud cing 'dab chags pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i rnam par thar pa thob pa gcig nas gcig tu brgyud cing 'dab chags pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i rnam par thar pa rgya mtsho tshul bsam gyis mi khyab pa la 'jug pa gcig nas gcig tu brgyud cing 'dab chags pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi rnam par 'phrul pa gcig nas gcig tu brgyud cing 'dab chags pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i rnam par gnon pa gcig nas gcig tu brgyud cing 'dab chags pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i yongs su gnon pa gcig nas gcig tu brgyud cing 'dab chags pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i ming du bya ba gcig nas gcig tu brgyud cing 'dab chags pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i lam la 'jug pa gcig nas gcig tu brgyud cing 'dab chags pa nas/ mtshan mo'i lha mo rab tu dga' ba'i mig'gro bar rnam par snang ba'i byang chub sems dpa'i ye shes shin tu phra ba gcig nas gcig tu brgyud cing 'dab chags pa ji snyed pa de dag thams cad de'i ba spu'i sgo thams cad nas sprul pa'i lus kyi sprin du mngon par 'thon te/ sems can rnams la chos 'chad pa dang / yang dag par ston pa dang / gsal bar byed pa dang / yongs su ston pa dang / rjes su brjod pa dang / rab tu 'byed pa dang / shin tu rgya cher byed pa dang / 'grang ba dang / nges par ston pa dang / rnam par rig par byed pa dang / nye bar bsgrub pa mthong ste/

He also saw projections of the streams of good thoughts rising in the goddess’s past lives, beginning with the preparations of her initial aspiration, the continuing successions of commendations of aspiration to enlightenment, the continuous successions of death and rebirth, the continuous successions of incarnation, the continuous successions of names, the continuous successions of visits to spiritual benefactors, the continuous successions of harmonizations with buddhas, the continuous successions of absorption of every sentence and syllable of the teachings of buddhas, the continuous successions of states of mind in carrying out the path of enlightening beings, the continuous successions of attainment of concentrations, the continuous successions of pervasion of vision of all lands, the continuities of the circles of knowledge of the succession of ages, the continuous succession of penetrating knowledge of the cosmos, the continuous succession of knowledge observing the realms of sentient beings, the continuous succession of knowledge of individual deaths and rebirths, penetrating the ocean of principles of the cosmos, the continuous successions of contemplative knowledge purifying the celestial ear, the continuous successions of media of access of wisdom observing the minds of all sentient beings, the continuous successions of media of initial access of the celestial eye, the continuous successions of initial perceptions of the celestial ear, the continuous successions of initial knowledge of others’ thoughts, the continuous successions of initial recollections of the past states of self and others, the continuous succession of the initial circumstances of attainment of uncontrived mystic powers based on nonbeing, the continuous succession of pervading everywhere by exercise of great mystic powers, the continuous succession of attainments of liberations of enlightening beings, the continuous successions of comprehension of the inconceivable principles of the ocean of liberations of enlightening beings, the continuous successions of mystic transformations of enlightening beings, the continuous successions of procedures of enlightening beings, the continuous successions of attainments of enlightening beings, the continuous successions of impressions of enlightening beings, the continuous succession of entries into the path of enlightening beings, and so on, including the night goddess’s continuous successions of entries into the most subtle knowledge of enlightening beings. He saw projected bodies emanate from each pore of the goddess, expounding the Teaching to sentient beings, elucidating, clarifying, demonstrating, discussing, analyzing, extending, categorizing, explaining, communicating, and conveying it to them.

la la la ni rlung gi dkyil 'khor shin tu 'khrugs pa'i sgra skad kyis chos ston pa mthong ngo/ /la la la ni chu'i phung po rab tu rlob pa'i sgra skad kyis/ la la la ni me'i me lce shin tu rlob pa'i sgra skad kyis/ la la la ni rgya mtsho'i 'brug gi sgra skad kyis/ la la la ni sa yongs su g.yos pa'i sgra skad kyis/ la la la ni ri chen po phan tshun thug cing 'thab pa'i sgra skad kyis/ la la la ni lha'i grong khyer g.yos pa'i nga ro snyan pa'i sgra skad kyis/ la la la ni lha'i gzhal med khang thug cing 'khrol ba'i sgra skad kyis chos ston pa mthong ngo/ /la la la ni lha'i dbang po'i skad kyis/ la la la ni klu'i dbang po'i skad kyis/ la la la ni gnod sbyin gyi dbang po'i skad kyis/ la la la ni dri za'i dbang po'i skad kyis/ la la la ni lha ma yin gyi dbang po'i skad kyis/ la la la ni nam mkha' lding gi dbang po'i skad kyis/ la la la ni mi'am ci'i dbang po'i skad kyis/ la la la ni lto 'phye chen po'i dbang po'i skad kyis/ la la la ni mi'i dbang po'i skad kyis/ la la la ni tshangs pa'i dbang po'i skad kyis/ la la la ni lha mo'i glu dbyangs kyis/ la la la ni lha rdzas kyi rol mo legs par blangs pa'i dbyangs kyis; la la la ni nor bu rin po che'i sgra dbyangs kyis/ la la la ni sems can gyi ris thams cad kyi skad sna tshogs kyis/ mtshan mo'i lha mo rab tu dga' ba'i mig'gro bar rnam par snang ba'i rnam par thar pa'i yul/ sems can rnams la rab tu brjod pa mthong ngo/ /de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa'i lus kyi sprin gyis byang chub sems dpa'i sgra skad sna tshogs dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i sprul pa'i sku'i sprin gyis de bzhin gshegs pa gsung rnam pa tha dad pa'i dbyangs kyi yan lag gi tshul gyis/ mtshan mo'i lha mo rab tu dga' ba'i mig'gro bar rnam par snang ba'i rnam par thar pa'i yul/ thog ma sems bskyed pa dang bcas pa yongs su byung ste/ grub cing yang dag par 'dus pa dang bcas/ rnam par thar ba'i rnam par rtse ba dang bcas pa/ sems can thams cad la rnam par dmigs par byed pa mthong ngo/ /de'i sprul pa'i gzugs kyi sprin re res kyang / sems kyi skad cig re re la phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyi sangs rgyas kyi zhing brjod du med pa'i yang brjod du med pa rnam par sbyong ba mthong ngo/ /sems can rgya mtsho mtha' yas pa dag kyang ngan song gi sdug bsngal thams cad las rnam par 'grel ba mthong ngo/ /sems can gyi khams mtha' dang dbus med pa dag kyang mi'i phun sum tshogs pa la rab tu 'god pa mthong ngo/ /sems can rgya mtsho mtha' dang dbus med pa dag kyang 'khor ba rgya mtsho las gyen du bskyod pa mthong ngo/ /sems can rgya mtsho mtha' dang dbus med pa dag kyang nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi sa la rab tu 'god pa mthong ngo/ /sems kyi skad cig re re la sems can rgya mtsho mtha' dang dbus med pa dag kyang stobs bcu'i ye shes kyi sar 'dzud pa tshong dpon gyi bu nor bu bzang gis mthong ngo/ /thos so/ /rnam par dpyad do/ /zhugs so/ /khong du chud do/ /nges par rtogs so/ /rjes su shes so/ /rjes su 'brangs so; ;rjes su zhugs so/ /mnyam pa nyid du byin gyis brlabs te/ de ni mtshan mo'i lha mo rab tu dga' ba'i mig'gro bar rnam par snang ba'i byang chub sems dpa'i rnam par thar pa kun tu bzang po'i dga' ba shin tu yangs pa'i rgyal mtshan bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i rnam par 'phrul pa dang / khyu mchog gi mthu phyung ba'i byin dang / sngon bskal pa mnyam par spyad pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i byin gyi rlabs kyis byin du brlabs pa dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba rnam par smin pa bsam gyis mi khyab pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa kun tu bzang po'i snod du gyur pa'i phyir ro/ /

He saw some teaching with the sound of wind, some with the sound of water, some with the sound of fire, some with the sound of the ocean, some with the sound of earth quaking, some with the thrilling sound of mountains crashing together, some with the sweet sound of celestial cities trembling, some with the sound of celestial palaces crashing together, some with the voices of celestial beings, some with the voices of various fantastic beings and entities, some with the voices of human chiefs, some with the voices of Brahma chiefs, some with the songs of nymphs, some with celestial music, some with the sound of jewels, some with the voices of all living beings, explaining the sphere of the night goddess’s liberation to sentient beings. Thus he saw the range of the night goddess’s liberation, with the attainment of perfection proceeding from her first aspiration, including her sport in liberation, being communicated to all sentient beings by means of multitudes of embodiments of enlightening beings, various utterances of enlightening beings, multitudes of emanation bodies of buddhas, and various utterances of buddhas.
He saw untold buddha-lands in the ten directions being purified in each instant of thought by each of her hosts of projected bodies; he saw infinitely varied oceans of sentient beings being liberated from all ills and miseries; he saw infinitely varied sentient beings being led to celestial and human states; he saw infinitely varied multitudes of sentient beings being led to the stages of individual liberations. In each moment of thought Sudhana saw infinite masses of sentient beings going through the ten stages; he listened, reflected, investigated, discerned, contemplated, approached, followed, entered, and made himself equal thereto, by the mystical power of the night goddess’s enlightening liberation characterized by the immensity of the inconceivable joy of universal good, by the development of inconceivable roots of goodness through having performed the same practices in the past and having been empowered by the support of the enlightened, and by having become a vessel of universally good enlightening practice.

de nas tshong dpon gyi bu nor bzang byang chub sems dpa'i dga' ba'i shugs drag po gangs chen mtsho snang ba chen po rab tu thob pa/ phyogs bcu'i de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyis byin gyis brlabs pa des/ mtshan mo'i lha mo rab tu dga' ba'i mig'gro bar rnam par snang ba'i mdun du 'dug ste thal mo sbyar nas/ mtshan mo'i lha mo rab tu dga' ba'i mig'gro bar rnam par snang ba la tshul dang 'dra ba'i tshigs su bcad pa 'di dag gis mngon par bstod do; ;

Then Sudhana, imbued with the light of the ocean of ecstasy of enlightening beings, empowered by the buddhas of the ten directions, stood reverently before the night goddess Pramuditanayanajagadvirocana and sang her praises in such terms:

rgyal ba'i chos rnams shin tu zab/ / de la khyod kyis bskal pa tshad med bslabs/ / bsam pa ji bzhin gzugs rnams kyis/ / 'gro ba kun kyang 'jig rten rim pas bstan/ /
bdag med mgon med log pa yi/ / 'du shes rtag tu 'khrul pa mkhyen gyur nas/ / rdzu 'phrul rnam pa du ma yis/ / lus dang dbang phyug ston mdzad 'gro ba 'dul/ /
shin tu rims bral rab tu zhi/ / chos sku gnyis med rnam par dag pa mnga'/ / 'gro ba ma lus gnyis gnas pa/ / sprul pa'i sprin sgra 'brug gis rnam par 'dul/ /
phung po khams dang skye mched la/ / khyod ni nam yang mi gnas mi rten te/ / yan lag kun rgyas gzugs mchog dang / / dbang phyug yongs su bsgrags pas 'gro ba 'dul/ /
phyi dang nang las rnam par grol/ / gnyis las byung ba'i mtsho las 'phags gyur kyang / 'khor ba'i rgya mtsho mtha' yas pa'i/ / gzugs brnyan 'gro ba'i rgyud du rab tu ston/ /
khyod la g.yo ba mi mnga' ste/ / nam yang rlom sems g.yo ba'i spros mi mnga'/ / 'jig rten spros mos byis pa rnams/ / chos kyi rang bzhin bstan cing 'dul ba mdzad/ /
ting 'dzin rgya mtsho kun spyod pas/ / bskal pa mang por rtse gcig thub bzhugs kyang / / phyogs bcu'i bde gshegs mchod don du/ / spu rnams rtse las sprul pa'i sprin kyang 'gyed/ /
sangs rgyas stobs la 'jug pa'i tshul/ / skad cig re rer mtha' yas thugs su chud/ / sems can bsdu ba'i sbyor ba rnams/ / so so'i rkyen bzhin go bar bgyi bas bstan/ /
khyod kyis srid pa'i rgya mtsho dag / las kyi rnam bris sna tshogs gzugs gzigs shing / / chos kyi sgrib pa med pa'i lam bstan te/ / sems can kun kyang rnam par sbyong ba mdzad/ /
khyod sku mtshan bris rnam dag kyang / / kun tu bzang po'i spyod pa dam pa yis; ; sems can bsam pa'i dbang tshul du/ / khyod ni lha mo'i sku gzugs ston/ /

For measureless eons you have studied The profound nature of the buddhas, Progressively extending throughout the worlds of the ten directions, Appearing according to the minds of the beings therein.
Knowing them to have no self, no master, To be always confused by untruth and false ideas, By occult powers you manifest many kinds of bodies And guide sentient beings.
Infinite, tranquil, the reality-body Is nondual and pure: Sentient beings clinging to duality You guide by myriad emanations.
While you have no attachment To mind or matter, You guide the world By emanation of perfect forms.
Detached from the internal and the external, Having left the ocean of mortality, You manifest infinite reflections In the states of mundane existence.
You have no vacillation, No vain imaginations or false ideas; To the ignorant attached to falsehood you show The inherent nature of things to guide them.
Single-minded for many eons On the states of the ocean of all concentrations, To make offerings to buddhas everywhere, you send forth Multitudes of emanations from your pores.
You enter the way to the powers of buddhas In every moment of thought: Striving to save all beings, You show them incarnations like themselves.
Observing the ocean of being, Its variety of actions and various forms, Showing the path of nonobstruction by things, You purify sentient beings.
Your body, of splendid appearance, Is purified by the practice of universal good: In command of the minds of beings, You manifest the form of a goddess in the world.

de nas tshong dpon gyi bu nor bzang gis/ mtshan mo'i lha mo rab tu dga' ba'i mig'gro bar rnam par snang ba la tshul dang 'dra ba'i tshigs su bcad pa de dag gis mngon par bstod de 'di skad ces smras so/ / lha mo khyod bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu zhugs nas ji srid cig lags/ lha mo khyod kyis byang chub sems dpa'i rnam par thar pa kun tu bzang po'i dga' ba shin tu yangs shing dri ma med pa'i shugs kyi rgyal mtshan 'di thob nas ni; ji srid cig lags/

Having praised the goddess with these verses, Sudhana said to her, “How long have you been devoted to supreme perfect enlightenment, and how long ago did you attain this enlightening liberation characterized by the immense pure energy of the joy of universal good?”
de nas mtshan mo'i lha mo rab tu dga' ba'i mig'gro bar rnam par snang bas/ tshong dpon gyi bu nor bzang la tshigs su bcad de smras pa/
The goddess answered him,

dran pa bskal pa mang 'das pa/ / zhing gi rdul snyed de yi snga rol na/ / zhing ni rin chen mdog bde byung / / de yi bskal pa zhi ba'i dbyangs zhes bya/ /
gling bzhi bye ba khrag khrig ste/ / brgya stong phrag bcu rnams kyis yongs su gang / / tshad med rin chen ri bo 'dra/ / gling bzhi'i bar ma bzang po rnam par bkram/ /
rgyal po'i pho brang bye ba brgya/ / stong phrag bcu rnams yongs su tshang ba ste/ / rgyal po'i pho brang mdangs dga' ba/ / dbus na gnas pa spos kyi rgyal mtshan 'od/ /
der ni phyogs kyi dbang po sa yi bdag / 'khor los bsgyur ba mngon par gzugs bzang byung / / mtshan rab sum cu gnyis dang ldan/ / de yi lus kyang dpe byad bzang pos brgyan/ /
pad+mo'i sbubs nas rdzus te byung / / gser gyi mdog bzang 'od 'byung lus dang ldan/ / 'dzam bu'i rgyal mtshan thams cad du/ / mkha' las 'gro zhing 'od kyis de 'gengs so/ /
de yi bu ni stong tshang ste/ / kun kyang yan lag dam pa'i gzugs dang ldan/ / blon po mkhas shing gsal ba dang / / mdzangs shing yid gzhungs bye ba shin tu mang / /
btsun mo bye ba phrag bcu tshang / / lha mo ji bzhin dga' ba'i tshul la mkhas/ / de dag phan sems bde sems kyis/ / rgyal po de la nye ba'i yid du gnas/ /
rgyal po de ni sa chen de/ / ri dang khor yug kun gyi mthas klas pa'i/ / gling bzhi phun sum tshogs pa dag / kun kyang chos kyi stobs kyis gnas par byed; ;
kho mo 'khor los bsgyur ba yi/ / btsun mo tshangs pa'i sgra skad rin chen lus/ / gser gyi mdog 'chang dri med 'od/ / dpag tshad stong du 'od kyis rgyas par 'gengs/ /
nyi ma nub par gyur nas kyang / / rgyal po sras dang 'khor bcas gzims gyur nas/ / rol mo'i dbyangs kyang zhir gyur te/ / kho mo mal na bde bar nyal nyal na/ /
nam gyi phyed tsam gung zhig la/ / sangs rgyas dpal gyi rgya mtsho byung bar gyur/ / de tshe rgyal bas rnam 'phrul ba/ / phyogs bcu rgyas par bkang ste bstan pa mdzad/ /
rgyal ba'i 'od zer rgya mtsho des/ / zhing gi rdul snyed 'jig rten khyab par gyur/ / rnam 'phrul sku rnams sna tshogs kyis/ / phyogs bcu thams cad ma lus rgyas par bkang / /
sa rnams ri dang bcas par g.yos/ / rgyal ba byung zhes sgra yang yongs su brjod/ / lha dang lha min mi dang klu/ / kun kyang rgyal ba byung bas rab tu dga'/ /
sangs rgyas ba spu'i sgo kun nas/ / sprul pa'i rgya mtsho mang po mngon par byung / / des ni phyogs bcu rgyas bkang nas/ / 'jig rten bsam pa bzhin du chos kyang bstan/ /
rnam 'phrul mtha' yas de dag kyang / / rgyal bas thams cad bdag gi rmi lam bstan/ / zab mo'i 'brug sgra thos gyur nas/ / khong du chud pas kho mo dga' yid gyur/ /
mtshan mo'i lha mo stong snyed kyang / / kho mo'i steng gi bar snang mkhar gnas shing / / rgyal ba'i legs pa brjod byas nas/ / kho mo sad par smra zhing brjod/ /
lha yi blo gros btsun mo longs/ / khyod kyi rgyal po'i khams su rgyal ba skyes/ / bskal pa rgya mtsho brgya dag tu/ / de 'dra'i phun sum tshogs pa rnam dag dkon/ /
kho mo dgar gyur sad par gyur/ / 'od gsal dri med rnam dag mthong / / 'od bzang de ni ga las blta blta na; ; byang chub shing rgyal drung gi rgyal ba mthong / /
mtshan nyid sum cu gnyis kyis brgyan/ / ba spu kun nas 'od zer rgya mtsho bkye/ / ri rab ji bzhin mngon par 'phags/ / rgyal ba g.yas g.yos kun tu'ang de bzhin no/ /
mthong nas kho mo rab dga' ste/ / de 'drar 'gyur bar sems kyang yongs su bskyed/ / sangs rgyas rnam 'phrul yang mthong nas/ / kho mos smon lam shin tu rgya chen btab/ /
kho mos rgyal po bzhes su gsol/ / de yi 'khor dang bud med tshogs kyang bslang / / sangs rgyas 'od yangs mthong gyur nas/ / kun kyang bde ba'i lus su gyur/ /
rgyal po de dang lhan cig tu/ / bzhon pa bye ba srog chags khrag khrig gis/ / yongs su bskor te dpung bcas pa/ / rgyal ba'i spyan sngar kun kyang dong / /
lo grangs stong phrag nyi shur yang / / kho mos rgyal ba de la mchod bkur byas/ / rin chen bdun yang yon du phul/ / rgya mtsho yongs dang bcas pa'i sa yang gsol/ /
mdo sde rgya mtsho yon tan sprin/ / smon lam mtsho las yongs su byung ba'i rgyan/ / kun kyang de bzhin gshegs las byung / / bsam pa ji bzhin 'gro bar de bzhin bstan/ /
mtshan mo'i lha mo ji snyed cig / de tshe snying brtser kho mo phan bstan pa/ / de 'drar gyur te myos gsal zhes/ / kho mo mos pa yongs su skyes par gyur/ /
kho mo'i smon lam de 'dra'i sems/ / thog ma byang chub mchog tu skyes par gyur/ / 'khor ba'i rgya mtsho gnas pa'i tshe/ / srid pa'i rgya mtshos de ni zhig ma gyur/ /

“I remember, many eons ago, past as many eons as atoms in the world, the land Blissful Light of Jewel Radiance, in the eon Silent Sound, filled with a hundred duodecillion sets of four continents, in the center of which were four beautiful continents, extending as far as the light of a mountain of jewels, filled with a hundred duodecillion royal cities, in the center of which was a delightful city Fragrant Banner, radiant with jewels: therein lived a wise king named Lord of the People, a world ruler, adorned with the thirty-two marks and eighty embellishments of great people, born spontaneously from a lotus calyx, his body shining gold, his light filling the continent all at once, spreading through the sky. He had a thousand sons, all with the constitution of heroes, ten million ministers, learned, intelligent, wise, and ten million concubines, beautiful as goddesses, expert in the arts of love, affectionate, altruistic, kind, attentive to the king. That king ruled the whole four continents and enriched them by the power of justice. I was the main wife of that king, with a clear voice and a pleasing body; my aura of pure golden light extended a thousand leagues. One night as the king, his sons, and his retinue slept, the sounds of singing ended, and as I was peacefully asleep in bed, in the middle of the night a buddha appeared in the world and filled the ten directions with infinite mystic projections, pervading everywhere with various magical bodies imbued with glorious oceans of light, as many as atoms in all lands. The earth, including the mountains, quaked, announcing the appearance of the buddha; gods, titans, humans and spirits, were all thrilled at the emergence of the buddha. The buddha’s emanations came forth from every pore; pervading the worlds of the ten directions, they taught according to people’s mentalities. The buddha showed me all those infinite manifestations in a dream: hearing those profound teachings, I was joyful while dreaming. Ten thousand night goddesses stood in the sky above me, describing the buddha in celestial tones and telling me to wake: ‘Arise, O queen, a buddha has appeared in your realm, hard to meet in a hundred oceans of eons; those who behold him are happy and purified.’ I became joyful, and on awakening I saw an immaculate light. Seeing this light, immediately I beheld the buddha at the enlightenment tree, adorned with the thirty-two marks, oceans of lights streaming from his pores, rising above all like the polar mountain. Seeing him, I joyfully wished to become like that; I made this vow upon seeing the grandiose manifestation of Buddha. I woke the king and his concubines, and when they saw the light of Buddha they were thrilled. I went to the buddha with my husband, accompanied by millions of people and troops. I made offerings to the buddhas for twenty thousand years, giving precious substances, the earth, and its seas. The buddha expounded myriad scriptures, multitudes of virtues, an ocean of vows, and the adornments thus produced, explaining the origins of all buddhas according to mentalities in this world. That night goddess awakened me for my benefit, and then I was inspired with compassion, eager to become like this and then awaken the heedless. This was my first aspiration to supreme enlightenment, and while coming and going in the oceans of being, I have never lost this resolve.

sangs rgyas bye ba khrag khrig la/ / kho mos dad pa bskyed de mchod pa byas/ / 'khor ba'i lha dang mi dbus su/ / yul gyi dga' dang bde la mngon par smon/ /
rgyal ba'i dang po dpal gyi mtsho/ / de yi 'og ma yon tan sgron ma ste/ / rgyal ba gsum pa rin chen dpal/ / sangs rgyas bzhi pa nam mkha'i shes rab bo; ;
rgyal ba lnga pa me tog mchog / rgyal ba drug pa chags med zla ba'i blo/ / rgyal ba bdun pa 'od rgyal chos kyi zla/ / brgyad pa ye shes dkyil 'khor snang ba'o/ /
rin chen 'od 'phro ri sgron te/ / rgyal ba dgu pa de tshe byung bar gyur/ / bcu pa dus gsum 'od dbyangs te/ / de dag kho mos dad pas mchod/ /
bcu po de la sogs pa dag / mi yi dbang po dam pa kun mchod de/ / tshul gyi rgya mtsho 'dir zhugs pa'i/ / mig ni de srid yun gyis thob ma gyur/ /

“I served ten decillion buddhas with faith while desiring celestial and human enjoyments in the mundane. The first buddha was Ocean of Glory, next was Lamp of Virtue, third was Jewel Brightness, fourth was Spacelike Wisdom, fifth was Flower Calyx, sixth was Moon of Unattached Intellect, seventh was Power King of the Moon of Truth, eighth was Light of the Sphere of Knowledge; ninth was Jewel Flame Mountain Lamp, and tenth was Light and Sound of All Times. I served all the buddhas, beginning with these, but had not yet attained the eye to enter this ocean of wisdom.

de 'og zhing gi mtshams sbyor ba/ / rin chen thams cad 'od ces bya ba byung / / bskal pa lha yi dpal zhes bya/ / sangs rgyas lnga brgya de la byung bar gyur/ /
thog ma zla ba'i dkyil 'khor byung / / gnyis pa nyi ma'i sgron ma mngon par skyes/ / snang ba'i rgyal mtshan sangs rgyas gsum; ; de yi 'og tu rin chen ri bo'o/ /
me tog 'od 'phro rgya mtsho sgron/ / me yi dpal dang lha yi dpal gyi mchog / snang ba'i rgyal po 'od kyi dpal/ / bcu pa ye shes kun snang rgyal po'o; ;
bcu po de la sogs pa dag / mi yi dbang po de dag kho mo yis/ / phung po'i gnas la dad dga' zhing / / gnas med chos la gnas kyi blos mchod do/ /

“After that a land called Jewel Light came into existence; the age was called Celestial Glory, and five hundred buddhas emerged therein. The first buddha was Light of the Lunar Sphere, second was Solar Lamp, third was Star Banner, fourth was Jewel Mountain, fifth was Flower Flame Ocean Lamp, sixth was Blazing Glory, seventh was Filled with Heavenly Glory, eighth was Shining King, ninth was Radiant Clarity, and tenth was King of Light of Universal Knowledge. Beginning with these ten, I served all those buddhas, but I was still attached to body and mind, my intellect dwelling on what really has no abode.

de 'og de yi mtshams sbyor ba; ; 'jig rten khams bzang byung bar gyur pa ni/ / pad+mo'i sgron ma sprin gyi dpal/ / de tshe bskal pa tshangs pa'i 'od ces bya/ /
de la rgyal ba tshad med de/ / de dag 'khor dang bcas pa kho mos mchod; ; rgyal ba de dag thams cad las/ / rim gro chen pos kho mos chos kyang thos/ /
rgyal ba'i dang po rin chen ri/ / de yi 'og ma yon tan rgya mtsho ste/ / rgyal ba chos dbyings dbyangs kyi dpal; ; chos rab rgya mtsho sgrog pa bzhi pa'o/ /
chos kyi rgyal mtshan gzungs kyi 'od/ / chos stobs 'od dang nam mkha'i blo gros te/ / chos 'od ri bo spo mthon dang / / de dag tha ma'i mtshan ni sprin dpal lo/ /
bcu po de la sogs pa dag / mi yi dam pa de dag kun mchod de/ / rgyal ba'i rgya mtsho 'dir zhugs pa'i/ / chos nyid de ni dag ma gyur/ /

“After that there was a world named Myriad Lights of the Lamp of Truth; the world was beautiful, the age was called Light of Brahma: the buddhas in that world were numberless, and I served them and their retinues, and reverently heard the teachings of all those buddhas. The first buddha was Jewel Mountain, second was Ocean of Virtues, third was Clarity of the Cosmic Voice, fourth was Roar of the Ocean of Truth, fifth was Banner of Truth, sixth was Energy of Mystic Spells, seventh was Light of the Power of Truth, eighth was Spacelike Awareness, ninth was Light of the Peak of the Polar Mountain of Flames of Truth, and tenth was Massive Radiance; beginning with these ten, I served all those buddhas, yet I did not awaken to the real nature whereby I could enter the ocean of buddhas.
