de yi 'og tu de bzhin gshegs/ / nyi ma'i sgron ma dpal gyi dpal zhes bya/ / zhing ni sangs rgyas yod pa ste/ / de la bskal pa zla ba'i dpal byung ngo/ /
de la stobs bcu byung ba ni/ / bye ba brgyad cu yongs su tshang ba ste/ / de dag kun la'ang mchod pa'i sgo/ / rgya che mtha' yas yid 'ong du ma byas/ /
thog mar byung ba dri za'i rgyal/ / de yi 'og tu sangs rgyas shing rgyal te; ; rgyal ba gsum pa yon tan ri/ / de yi 'og tu rin chen spyan gshegs so/ /
rnam par snang mdzad 'od kyi rgyan/ / chos kyi rgya mtsho sangs rgyas gzi brjid dpal/ / 'jig rten dbang po 'od bzang dpal/ / kun gyi tha ma chos 'od rgyal po'o/ /
bcu po de la sogs pa dag / bde gshegs de dag thams cad mchod byas kyang / / chos kyi rgya mtshor 'jug pa yi; ; ye shes kho mos thob par ma gyur to/ /

“After that was a buddha named Sun Lamp Brilliance; the land was called Enlightened Mind, and there was an age there called Glory of Soma. Therein were eight hundred octillion buddhas whom I served, with an endless variety of fine offerings. First was King of Celestial Musicians, second was Tree King, third was Polar Mountain of Virtue, fourth was Jewel Eye, fifth was Array of Shining Lights, sixth was Radiance of the Ocean of Truth, seventh was Lord of the World, eighth was Blazing Glory, ninth was Virtuous, and tenth was King of Light of All Laws; beginning with these ten, I served all those buddhas, yet still did not attain the knowledge to enter the ocean of truth.

de yi 'og tu zhing dag pa/ / rdo rje'i rang bzhin mi phyed gzi brjid brtan/ / kun tu 'od sprin ming ldan byung / / rgyan gcig kun nas mdzes par gnas pa'o/ /
de la sems can dag pa mang / / nyon mongs dri mas nyon mongs shin tu nyung / / bskal pa rab zhi blo gros 'od/ / sangs rgyas stong rnams byung bas rnam par brgyan/ /
rgyal ba'i dang po rdo rje gtsug / gnyis pa chags med stobs mnga'i mtshan ldan pa/ / rgyal ba chos dbyings gzugs brnyan dang / / phyogs rnams kun tu sgron ma gsal ba'i bdag /
rgyal ba lnga pa thugs rje'i 'od/ / rgyal ba drug pa brtul zhugs rgya mtsho'o/ / bde gshegs bzod 'khor sgron ma dang / / brgyad pa chos kyi dkyil 'khor snang ba ste/ /
snang ba rgya mtshos brgyan pa dang / / de dag tha ma zhi ba'i rgyal po'o/ / bcu po de la sogs pa dag / mi yi dam pa de kun kho mos mchod/ /
chos nyid nam mkha' mnyam pa 'di/ / rang bzhin yongs su kun nas dag pa ste/ / de la gnas shing zhing gi rnams/ / 'byams klas kun tu spyod spyad ma dag go /

“After that there was a pure land of indestructible energy, Omnipotent Cloud of Light, arrayed with various adornments; therein were many purified beings, mostly healthy, with few afflictions. In the age Energy of the Tranquil Mind, a thousand buddhas came forth: the first was Diamond Navel, second was Bearer of Unattached Power, third was Reflection of the Cosmos, fourth was King of Light Illumining All Quarters, fifth was Energy of Compassion, sixth was Ocean of Vows, seventh was Lamp of the Sphere of Patience, eighth was Light of the Sphere of Truth, ninth was Array of Oceans of Light, tenth was King of Tranquil Light. Beginning with these ten, I served all those buddhas, yet I did not awaken to the real nature which is spacelike, inherently pure, based on which I could carry on spiritual practices in all lands.

de yi 'og tu mdangs dga' ba'i/ / zhing gi spos sgron sprin gyi dpal zhes bya/ / kun nas nyon mongs yongs su dag / de yi bskal pa legs par byung zhes bya/ /
rgyal ba bye ba de tshe byung / / de dag kun gyis de tshe bskal pa brgyan/ / mgon po de dag chos gsung ba/ / kho mos dran pa'i stobs kyis yongs su bzung / /
rgyal ba'i dang po grags yangs te/ / chos kyi rgya mtsho shugs drag dpal gyi rgyal/ / chos dbang rgyal po yon tan sprin/ / chos kyi dpal dang lha yi cod pan no/ /
ye shes 'od 'phro gzi brjid dpal/ / rkang gnyis dam pa bdun pa de yin no/ / rgyal ba brgyad pa nam mkha'i dbyings/ / dgu pa kun tu 'byung ba'i sgron ma ste/ /
de dag tha ma'i sangs rgyas ni/ / mdzod spu'i dpal gyi 'od kyi blo gros te/ / rgyal ba mi mchog de dag la/ / mchod pa byas kyang chags med de ma sbyangs/ /

“Then there was a pleasant land called Radiance of a Multitude of Fragrant Lamps, both defiled and pure, where there was an age called Good Possibility, in which one hundred trillion buddhas appeared, by whom it was adorned for ten eons; I held in memory the teachings spoken by those Guides. The first one was Vast Renown, second was King of Powerful Radiance of the Ocean of Truth, third was Sovereign of Truth, fourth was Voice of Virtue, fifth was Glory of Truth, sixth was Celestial Crown, seventh was Radiance of Energy of the Flame of Knowledge, eighth was Sound of the Sky, ninth was Lamp Appearing Everywhere, and tenth was Mind of Light Radiating from the Brow. I served all those buddhas, but did not purify the unhindered path.

de yi 'og ma rgyan rab can/ / rin chen sna tshogs kun tu gnas pa ste/ / 'jig rten rnam par phye ba'i mtha'/ / rin chen rgyal mtshan blo gros mchog /
de tshe'i bskal pa snying po tshogs/ / de la sangs rgyas brgya phrag lnga byung ste/ / rnam thar chags med 'di 'dod cing / / rang byung de dag thams cad kho mos mchod/ /
thog ma'i mtshan ni yon tan 'khor/ / zhi ba'i dbyangs dang rgya mtsho phun sum tshogs/ / nyi ma'i gzi brjid dpal gyi bdag / mtshan gyi sprin sgra dbyangs zhes bya ba dang / /
chos dbang rgyal po yon tan bdag / bsod nams ri rab zhi ba 'od kyi rgyal/ / bcu po de la sogs pa dag / rgyal ba de dag kun kyang kho mos mchod; ;
rgyal ba'i lam ni der sbyangs te/ / de la rgyal ba kun kyang yang dag gzhol/ / 'on kyang da dung rgyal ba yi/ / tshul 'dir 'jug pa'i bzod pa ma thob bo/ /

“After that was a land called Supreme Mind, constructed of jewels, in fine arrays, well proportioned; in the age Luminous there, five hundred buddhas emerged. I honored all those buddhas, seeking this liberation: Host of Virtues was first, second was Silent Sound, third was Oceanic Glory, fourth was Sun Energy, fifth was Mountain King, sixth was Thunder on a Polar Mountain of Distinctive Marks, seventh was King of Law, eighth was King of Virtues, ninth was Mountain of Merit, and tenth was King of Silent Light; I served all those buddhas, beginning with these ten, but though the path of the buddhas, into which all buddhas enter, was purified, I still had not attained the forbearance to enter into this way of the buddhas.

de 'og yid 'ong 'od ldan pa; ; yongs su dag pa'i 'jig rten khams byung ste/ / zhing dbyangs phreng ba'i blo gros can/ / sems can nyon mongs nyung ba'i gnas yin no/ /
bskal pa bde zhing mngon dga' ste/ / de la sangs rgyas bye ba brgyad cu byung / / mi mchog de kun kho mos mchod/ / rgyal ba mchog gi lam yang rnam par sbyangs/ /
rgyal ba'i dang po me tog brtsegs/ / rgya mtsho'i snying po yang dag 'byung ba'i mchog / lha dbang gtsug phud rin chen gtso/ / gser gyi ri bo rin chen brtsegs pa dang / /
chos kyi rgyal mtshan nor gyi dpal/ / de dag kun gyi tha ma ye shes blo/ / bcu po de la sogs pa dang / / lha dang mi gtso de dag kho mos mchod/ /

“After that was a land of beautiful light called Mind Wreathed with Silent Sounds; that world was inhabited by purified beings with little affliction. In the age called Delightful Pleasure there were eight hundred octillion buddhas; I attended and served them all and clarified the path of the supreme buddhas. The first buddha was Mass of Flowers, second was Ocean Womb, third was Mountain of Being, fourth was Crest of the Lord of Gods, fifth was Jewel Matrix, sixth was Gold Mountain, seventh was Heap of Gems, eighth was Banner of Justice, ninth was Glory of Speech, tenth was Mind of Knowledge; beginning with these ten, I served all those buddhas.

de 'og mtshams sbyor zhing 'byung ba/ / sprul pa bzang po'i rgyal mtshan sgron ma ste/ / bskal pa stong gi dpal zhes bya; ; de la sangs rgyas bye ba khrag khrig drug /
zhi ba'i rgyal mtshan zhi gnas dpal/ / zhi ba'i sgron ma sprin gyi rgyal po'i dpal/ / snang ba'i 'od kyi rgyal po dang / / rnam par sprin mched nyi ma'i gzi brjid dang / /
chos kyi sgron ma dpal gyi ri/ / 'od 'phro'i dpal dang lha yi snying po'i dpal/ / de dag tha mar byung ba ni/ / seng+ge'i sgra sgrog mkhas pa sgron ma'o/ /
bcu po de la sogs pa dag / bde gshegs zla ba de dag kho mos mchod/ / 'on kyang tshul mtsho 'dir 'jug pa'i/ / bzod pa kho mos thob par ma gyur to/ /

“After that was a land called Lamp Emblematic of Beautiful Creations; in the age called A Thousand Glories were one hundred decillion buddhas: Quiescent Star of Tranquility, Supreme Glory of Myriad Silent Lamps, Illuminating King, Trailing Cloud, Solar Radiance, Light of the Lamp of Truth, Flaming Brilliance, Filled with Celestial Glory, Lamp of Wisdom Roaring Like a Lion; beginning with these ten, I served all those buddhas, but did not attain the forbearance to enter this ocean of wisdom.

de 'og mtshams sbyor zhing byung ba/ / kun tu snang ba'i dpal zhes bya ba ste; ; bskal pa gnas med rnam par brgyan/ / de la sangs rgyas bye ba sum cu drug /
dang po yon tan kun tu sprin/ / de yi 'og ma sangs rgyas nam mkha'i thugs/ / sangs rgyas legs byung rnam brgyan dang / / rgya mtsho'i chos kyi sprin sgra sgrog pa'i dbyangs/ /
rgyal ba chos dbyings gsung dbyangs dang / / sprul pa'i sprin sgra snyan pa'i dpal mnga' dang / / sangs rgyas phyogs kun gzi brjid dang / / chos kyi rgya mtsho yongs byung sgra dbyangs dang / /
yon tan rgya mtsho dpal gyi sgron/ / rgyal ba'i nyi ma dgu pa byung bar gyur/ / de dag kun gyi tha ma ste/ / rin chen dpal sgron yon tan dpal mchod do/ /
rin chen dpal sgron yon tan dpal/ / rkang gnyis dam pa byung bar gyur pa'i tshe/ / kho mo lha mo zla bzhin te/ / mi yi dam pa byung tshe mchod pa byas/ /
rgyal ba des ni kho mo la/ / mdo sde smon lam rgya mtsho 'byung ba'i rgyan/ / gnas med rgyan kyang rab tu bshad/ / thos nas kho mos dran pa'i stobs kyis bzung / /
kho mos mig yangs der thob ste/ / ting 'dzin zhi dang gzungs kyi stobs kyang thob/ / skad cig re rer zhing brgyud pa'i/ / rgyal ba rgya mtsho mang po'ang kho mos mthong / /
byams tshul kun tu snang ba'i sprin/ / byang chub sems rab mkha' dang mnyam pa ste/ / snying rje'i snying pos brgyan pa yang / / sangs rgyas stobs kyi tshad du yangs par skyes/ /

“After that was a land called Splendor of Universal Light, in an age called Independent Array, in which were twenty-six octillion buddhas: first was Mass of All Virtues, then Spacelike Mind, Array of Good Capacities, Thunder of the Ocean of Truths, Voice of the Cosmos, Blissful Light of Myriad Emanations, Universal Energy, Sound Born of the Ocean of Truths, Mountainous Lamp in an Ocean of Virtues; and the last of them I propitiated was Paragon of Virtue Radiant As a Jewel. When that buddha emerged in the world, I was a queen, Moonlike Face, going to honor the buddha. He expounded a scripture on the supernal manifestations originating in an ocean of independent vows, which I listened to and remembered. I attained tranquil concentration of broad vision, and the power of mental command. I see oceans of buddhas in one land after another, from moment to moment. I have borne a cloud of universal light from the womb of compassion by means of kindness, a will for enlightenment as vast as space, with the measureless light of the powers of buddhas.

'gro ba phyin ci log gyur te/ / rtag dang bde dang gtsang dang bdag zhen pa/ / gti mug ldongs gyur ma rig bsgribs/ / nyon mongs 'khrugs shing log par 'du shes pa/ /
lta ba'i rnam par stug la spyod/ / lam gyi 'gro rgyud nyam ngar sred dbang gyur/ / rnam pa sna tshogs bye brag tu/ / las kyis rnam par bris pas kun byung ba/ /
'gro rgyud kun gyi shi 'pho'i sgor/ / skye bar 'gyur bas kun tu skyer gyur cing / / skye dang rga shi gnod pa rnams/ / lus dang sems kyi nyams su myong gyur pa/ /
mthong nas de dag phan bde'i phyir/ / zhing rnams 'byams klas thams cad kyi/ / stobs bcu gang las byung ba yi/ / bla na med pa'i sems kyang kho mos bskyed/ /
de las smon lam sprin byung ba/ / 'gro ba kun la bde bar gzhol ba'i mchog / tshogs rnams dbyung ba mtha' yas dang / / lam tshul rgya mtsho rtogs pa'ang de nas byung / /
'jug pa'i sprin yangs thob gyur pa/ / lam rgyud kun tu sgo gsal shugs ldan te/ / pha rol phyin gyi sprin yangs pa'ang / / chos dbyings 'byams klas kun tu rnam par 'byed/ /
sa gnon shugs drag yangs ldan dang / / dus gsum rgya mtsho'i tshul gyi sa rnams la/ / chags pa med par spyod par gyur/ / skad cig gcig gis rgyal ba kun drung 'gro /
gzhan yang rgyal sras kho mos ni/ / spyod pa kun tu bzang po yongs su gnon/ / chos dbyings bye brag bcu rnams kyi/ / rgya mtsho'i tshul yang kho mos rtogs par 'jug /

“Seeing the world in error, engrossed in the glitter of permanence and pleasure, shrouded in the darkness of delusion and ignorance, filled with afflictions, thinking falsely, given to views, wandering in obscurity, controlled by craving and evildoing, accumulating a variety of deeds in mundane conditions, going from one state to another, suffering the physical and mental pains of birth, old age, and death, I have therefore wished above all for their welfare and happiness: in all places where there were buddhas, I produced a multitude of vows, to be as a source of happiness for all beings, with endless preparation and development according to the myriad methods of the path; and I emanated vast multitudes of projections of the transcendent ways throughout the cosmos, speeding to gladden the beings in all paths of existence. Progressing through the stages with great speed into the wisdom of all times, traversing the stages unhindered, I went to all buddhas in a moment of thought; and having entered the practice of universal good, I realized the myriad principles of the differentiations of the ten universes.

rigs kyi bu de la ji snyam du sems/ de'i tshe de'i dus na/ rgyal po 'khor los bsgyur ba sangs rgyas kyi rigs kyi rgyun mi gcod pa la zhugs pa mi'i bdag po zhes bya ba byung ba de/ gzhan zhig yin pa snyam du sems na ni/ rigs kyi bu/ de ltar mi blta ste/ 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa ni/ de'i tshe de'i dus na/ rgyal po mi'i bdag po zhes bya ba 'khor los bsgyur ba/ sangs rgyas kyi rigs rgyun mi gcod pa la zhugs pa'o/ / kho mo sad par byed pa'i mtshan mo'i lha mo de ni/ byang chub sems dpa' kun tu bzang pos sprul pa'o/ / rigs kyi bu/ de la ji snyam du sems/ de'i tshe de'i dus na/ 'khor los bsgyur ba'i btsun mo bud med rin po che bzang po'i blo gros ma zhes bya ba byung ba de/ gzhan zhig yin pa snyam du sems na ni/ de ltar mi blta ste/ kho mo ni de'i tshe de'i dus na/ 'khor los bsgyur ba'i btsun mo bud med rin po che bzang po'i blo gros ma zhes bya bar gyur te/ kho mo mtshan mo'i lha mo des sad par byas nas/ sangs rgyas blta ba la yang dag par bskul to/ / rigs kyi bu/ kho mos ni/ bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems de srid cig nas bskyed de/ de ltar kho mo sems bskyed pa de'i mthus/ bskal pa sangs rgyas kyi zhing gi rdul shin tu phra ba snyed du nam yang ngan song log par ltung bar ma skyes te/ rtag tu rgyun mi 'chad par lha dang mi'i 'gro ba'i rgyud la rten cing / thams cad du'ang de bzhin gshegs pa blta ba dang ldan par gyur to/ / tha mar kho mos bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rin chen dpal gyi sgron ma yon tan rgyal mtshan mthong ba tsam gyis byang chub sems dpa'i rnam par thar pa kun tu bzang po'i dga' ba shin tu yangs shing dri ma med pa'i shugs kyi rgyal mtshan zhes bya ba 'di thob ste/ de thob pas kho mo sems can yongs su smin par bya ba dang / gdul ba'i don du rnam pa 'di lta bus sta gon du gnas pa yin no/ /

“That king named Lord of the People, the world ruler who was determined to prevent the dying out of the lineage of buddhas, was none other than Manjushri, who had become a king, successful in perpetuating the family of buddhas. The night goddess by whom I was awakened was emanated by the enlightening being Universally Good. The wife of the king was me. When I was awakened by the night goddess, I was caused to see Buddha; this was when I first aspired to enlightenment. Ever since that inspiration, for as many eons as atoms in a buddha-land, I have never fallen into bad states but have always wound up in celestial and human states. Wherever I have been, I have never been apart from the sight of buddhas; then when I saw the buddha Paragon of Virtue Radiant As a Jewel, I attained this enlightening liberation characterized by the immense pure energy of the joy of universal good, by the attainment of which I have come to develop and guide all sentient beings in this way.

rigs kyi bu/ kho mos byang chub sems dpa'i rnam par thar pa kun tu bzang po'i dga' ba rgya chen po'i shugs kyi rgyal mtshan 'di shes par zad na/ kho mos byang chub sems dpa' de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi zhabs kyi drung na 'khod cing / sems kyi skad cig re re la thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du 'jug pa'i shugs drag po rgya mtsho chen po rab tu thob pa/ 'jug pa'i sgo thams cad la sems kyi skad cig re re zhing smon lam chen po rgya mtshos 'jug pa rab tu thob pa/ sems kyi skad cig re re zhing smon lam rgya mtsho thams cad kyi tshul la phyi ma'i mtha'i bskal par spyad pa'i dkyil 'khor mngon par bsgrub pa la mkhas pa/ spyod pa re re la yang lus sangs rgyas kyi zhing thams cad kyi rdul shin tu phra ba snyed mngon par bsgrub pa la mkhas pa/ lus re res kyang chos kyi dbyings kyi tshul rgya mtsho thams cad rgyas par 'gengs pa la mkhas pa/ chos kyi dbyings kyi tshul rgya mtsho re re la'ang sangs rgyas kyi zhing thams cad du sems can rnams kyi bsam pa ji lta ba bzhin du lus rnam par dmigs pa'i spyod pa yongs su ston pa la mkhas pa/ zhing thams cad du'ang zhing gi rdul shin tu phra ba thams cad la de bzhin gshegs pa rgya mtsho mtha' dang dbus med pa la 'jug par mkhas pa/ de bzhin gshegs pa re re zhing yang chos kyi dbyings kyis klas par rgyas par 'gengs pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa'i rnam par 'phrul pa la 'jug par mkhas pa/ de bzhin gshegs pa re re'i sngon gyi mtha'i bskal pa la byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa'i tshogs yongs su bsgrub pa yang dag par bsdus pa la 'jug par mkhas pa/ de bzhin gshegs pa re re'i chos kyi 'khor lo shin tu yangs pa yang dag par blang ba dang / yongs su gzung ba la mkhas pa/ dus gsum thams cad kyi de bzhin gshegs pa'i rnam par 'phrul pa'i tshul rgya mtsho la 'jug par mkhas pa de dag gi spyod pa shes pa'am/ yon tan brjod par nus re skan/

“I just know this enlightening liberation characterized by the immense pure energy of the joy of universal good. How can I know the virtues or tell of the practice of the enlightening beings who have attained the ocean of great speed setting out for omniscience in the presence of all buddhas in each instant, who enter unceasingly into the ocean of great vows at every moment in the beginning of all undertakings, who are skilled in carrying out a multitude of practices in every moment of thought over endless eons in the ways shown by the ocean of all vows, and who are skilled in producing in each practice as many bodies as atoms in all buddha-lands, and who pervade the systems of all universes with each body, and who are skilled in demonstrating practices according to the mentality of sentient beings in each universe, and skilled in comprehending the ocean of ways of transformation of all buddhas of past, present, and future?

song / rigs kyi bu/ de bzhin gshegs pa'i 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor 'di nyid na/ kho mo dang rgyang mi ring ba zhig na mtshan mo'i lha mo sems can kun tu skyong ba'i gzi brjid dpal zhes bya ba 'dug gi /de'i gan du song la/ ji ltar byang chub sems dpas byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa'i dkyil 'khor la 'jug par bya ba dang / ji ltar yongs su sbyang bar bya ba dris shig /

“There is a night goddess named Samantasattvatranojahshri who lives right here in the Buddha’s circle. Go ask her how an enlightening being is to enter and purify the sphere of practice of enlightening beings.”

de nas tshong dpon gyi bu nor bzang gis/ mtshan mo'i lha mo rab tu dga' ba'i mig'gro bar rnam par snang ba'i rkang pa gnyis la spyi bos phyag 'tshal te/ mtshan mo'i lha mo rab tu dga' ba'i mig'gro bar rnam par snang ba la/ lan brgya stong du mar g.yas phyogs su bskor ba byas nas yang dang yang bltas te/ mtshan mo'i lha mo rab tu dga' ba'i mig'gro bar rnam par snang ba'i drung nas song ngo// //
So then Sudhana paid his respects to the night goddess Pramuditanayanajagadvirocana and left her.
bam po brgya tham pa;

Samantasattvatranojahshri

de nas tshong dpon gyi bu nor bzang / mtshan mo'i lha mo rab tu dga' ba'i mig'gro bar rnam par snang ba'i byang chub sems dpa'i rnam par thar pa kun tu bzang po'i dga' ba shin tu yangs shing / dri ma med pa'i shugs kyi rgyal mtshan de la mos par bya ba dang / khong du chud par bya ba dang / rtogs par bya ba dang / shes par bya ba dang / yid ches par bya ba dang / rab tu gzhol bar bya ba dang / rgyas par dgang bar bya ba dang / rjes su shes par bya ba dang / rjes su dran par bya ba dang / rjes su gzhol bar bya ba dang / sgom pa byed cing / dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyi gdams ngag la nan tan du bya ba dang / gdams ngag rjes su bstan pa la bar chad med par bya ba'i phyir/ mtshan mo'i lha mo rab tu dga' ba'i mig'gro bar rnam par snang bas 'gro khar gdams pa rjes su dran pa byed cing / dge ba'i bshes gnyen blta ba'i rjes su sems pa'i dbang po'i dkyil 'khor dang / dge ba'i bshes gnyen mthong ba thob par bya ba la yang dag par spyod pa phyogs kun tu mngon par bltas pa dang / dge ba'i bshes gnyen btsal bar yid la bya ba dang / nga rgyal thams cad dang bral ba dang / dge ba'i bshes gnyen bsnyen bkur ba'i mthu tshogs chen po yongs su bsgrub par zhe non pa dang / dge ba'i bshes gnyen dang rgyud kyi tshul gcig tu gyur pa'i dge ba'i rtsa bas dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyi thabs mkhas pa'i spyod pa thams cad la bsam pa mi phyed pas zhugs pa/ dge ba'i bshes gnyen la brten pa yongs su 'phel bar bya ba la brtson 'grus kyi shugs chen po rgya mtsho yongs su skyes pa/ bskal pa thams cad du dge ba'i bshes gnyen mnyam pa nyid khong du chud pas gnas par bya ba'i smon lam dang ldan pa de/ mtshan mo'i lha mo sems can kun tu skyong ba'i gzi brjid dpal gyi drung du song ngo/ /

Entering with intense absorption into the night goddess Pramuditanayanajagadvirocana’s liberation of immense pure energy of the joy of universal good, understanding it, plunging into it, penetrating it, following it throughout its full range, going along with it, cultivating it, accomplishing it, encompassing it, carrying out the instructions of the spiritual benefactors, recollecting the teachings projected by the night goddess Pramuditanayanajagadvirocana for the continuity of teaching and instruction, with all faculties turned in all directions following the sight of spiritual benefactors, with the intention to get to see spiritual benefactors, free from all conceits, with attention focused on seeking spiritual benefactors, with determination to develop the great provisions of virtue and knowledge, with vigorous initiative to harmonize with spiritual benefactors, with all roots of goodness one with those of spiritual benefactors, firmly intent on the practice of all skill in means of spiritual benefactors, having generated an ocean of energy fostered by spiritual benefactors, Sudhana went to the night goddess Samantasattvatranojahshri.

de de ltar 'gro ba'i tshe/ mtshan mo'i lha mo sems can kun tu skyong ba'i gzi brjid dpal gyis; byang chub sems dpa'i rnam par thar pa 'jig rten thams cad mngon du gyur pas/ 'gro ba rnam par 'dul ba ston pa'i khyu mchog gi mthu phyung ba yongs su bstan pa'i phyir; mtshan dang dpe byad bzang pos yongs su grub pa'i lus bstan te/ mdzod spu nas 'od zer ye shes kyi 'od kun tu snang ba dri ma med pa'i mdangs kyi rgyal mtshan zhes bya ba 'od zer gyi mtha' dang dbus med pa dang ldan par bkye'o/ /des 'jig rten thams cad snang bar byas nas tshong dpon gyi bu nor bzang gi spyi bor 'dus te/ lus thams cad du khyab par gyur to/ /tshong dpon gyi bu nor bzang la 'od zer des reg par gyur ma thag tu de nyid kyi mod la ting nge 'dzin shin tu rdul dang bral ba zhes bya ba'i dkyil 'khor thob par gyur to/ /de thob pas mtshan mo'i lha mo rab tu dga' ba'i mig'gor bar rnam par snang ba dang / mtshan mo'i lha mo sems can kun tu skyong ba'i gzi brjid kyi dpal gnyis kyi bar gyi lam na sa'i dkyil 'khor yod pa de la me'i rdul shin tu phra ba'am/ chu'i rdul shin tu phra ba'am/ sa'i rdul shin tu phra ba'am/ rdo rje'i rdul shin tu phra ba'am/ nor bu rin po che'i rgyal po dam pa sna tshogs kyi rdul shin tu phra ba'am/ me tog dang / spos dang / phye ma'i rdul shin tu phra ba'am/ rgyan thams kyi rdul shin tu phra ba'am/ dmigs pa thams cad kyi rdul shin tu phra ba ji snyed cig yod pa'i rdul shin tu phra ba de dag thams cad la rdul phra mo re re zhing yang 'jig rten gyi khams sangs rgyas kyi zhing gi rdul shin tu phra ba snyed chu'i phung po dang bcas/ me'i phung po dang bcas/ rlung gi phung po dang bcas/ sa'i phung po dang bcas/ 'jig rten gyi khams kyi mtshams dang bcas/ gzhi dang bcas/ rten dang bcas pa dbyibs sna tshogs can/ sa'i gzhi rnam pa tha dad pa sna tshogs dang ldan pa/ ri'i 'khor sna tshogs can/ chu klung dang / mtsho sna tshogs kyis brgyan pa/ rgya mtsho sna tshogs kyis kun nas 'khor ba/ lha rdzas kyis khyim sna tshogs kyi rgyan dang ldan pa/ /shing sna tshogs kyis yongs su gang ba/ nam mkha'i dbyings kyi rgyan sna tshogs can/ lha'i grong khyer gyi khyim gyi rgyan dang bcas pa/ klu'i grong khyer gyi khyim gyi rgyan dang bcas pa/ gnod sbyin gyi grong khyer gyi khyim gyi rgyan dang bcas pa/ dri za'i grong khyer gyi khyim gyi rgyan dang bcas pa/ lha ma yin gyi grong khyer gyi khyim gyi rgyan dang bcas pa/ nam mkha' lding gi grong khyer gyi khyim gyi brgyan dang bcas pa/ mi'am ci'i grong khyer gyi khyim gyi rgyan dang bcas pa/ lto 'phye chen po'i grong khyer gyi khyim gyi rgyan dang bcas pa/ mi'i grong khyer gyi khyim gyi rgyan dang bcas pa/ phyogs dang phyogs mtshams thams cad na rnam par gnas pa'i sems can thams cad kyi grong khyer gyi khyim gyi gnas dang / sems can dmyal ba'i 'jig rten gyi yul dang / byol song gi skye gnas kyi 'jig rten gyi yul dang / gshin rje'i 'jig rten gyi yul dang / mi dang mi ma yin pa'i lam gyi rgyud kyi shi 'pho dang skye ba'i yul dang bcas pa/ skye ba sna tshogs kyis ma 'dres pa'i rgyud mtha' yas pa'i bye brag la yongs su gzhol ba rnams 'du zhing 'jig par gyur pa mthong ngo/ /'jig rten gyi khams de dag kyang rnam pa sna tshogs su mthong ste/ 'jig rten gyi khams la la ni kun nas nyon mongs par mthong ngo/ /la la ni yongs su dag par mthong ngo/ /la la ni shin tu kun nas nyon mongs par mthong ngo/ /la la ni lam gyi rgyud yongs su dag pa mthong ngo/ /la la ni kun nas nyon mongs pa la yongs su dag par mthong ngo/ /la la ni rnam par dag pa la kun nas nyon mongs par mthong ngo/ /la la ni shin tu yongs su dag par mthong ngo/ /la la ni gzhi mnyam par mthong ngo/ /la la ni spyi'u tshugs su gnas par mthong ngo/ /la la ni snrel zhir 'dug par mthong ngo/ /

When Sudhana came to her, the night goddess, in order to show him the majesty of the endless enlightening liberation manifesting guidance for sentient beings in all works, showed him a body replete with beautiful features and embellishments, and emanated a light from the circle of hair between her brows called “emblem of pure stars of the lamp of flames of universal knowledge,” with infinite light beams; the light illumined the whole world, then descended into Sudhana and pervaded his entire body. As soon as Sudhana was touched by the light, he attained a concentration called “sphere of ultimate dispassion,” whereby he saw as many worlds as atoms in a buddha-land forming and dissolving in each particle of fire, water, earth, diamond, various jewels, flowers, perfumes, incenses, arrays of gems, and all objects in between the night goddess Pramuditanayanajagadvirocana and the night goddess Samantasattvatranojahshri. He also saw clusters of water, fire, air, and earth, and the sentient beings in all the worlds, with the various abodes they dwell in and the various arrays of the lands—various mountain ranges, rivers, lakes, oceans, heavens, trees, adornments of the skies, adornments of the habitations of all kinds of beings, the realms of hells, animals, ghosts, the realms of death and birth among humans, all the various conditions of existence being interconnected, infinite different courses of being interrelated. He also saw the difference in those worlds—he saw some worlds to be defiled, some pure, some wholly defiled, some with purified states of being, some with purity in the midst of defilement, some with defilement in the midst of purity, some wholly pure, some level, some inverted, some askew.

'jig rten gyi khams de dag gi sems can gyi lam gyi rgyud dang / sems can gyi skye gnas thams cad na/ mtshan mo'i lha mo sems can kun tu skyong ba'i gzi brjid dpal/ sems can so so nas 'dul ba'i rkyen bzhin du 'jig rten thams cad la ma 'dres par yongs su bstan pa'i phyir/ sems can thams cad la mngon du gyur par gnas par mthong ngo/ /sems can tshe'i tshad rnam pa ji lta bu dang ldan pa dang / mos pa'i spyod yul rnam pa sna tshogs can dang / lus rnam pa ji lta bu dang ldan pa dang / ngag rnam par phye ba dang / nges pa'i tshig gi 'du byed kyi tha snyad rnam pa ji lta bu dang ldan pa dang / sbyor ba'i rnam pa ji lta bu dang ldan pa dang / dbang gi rnam pa ji lta bu dang ldan pa rnams yongs su smin par bya ba dang / gdul ba'i don du sems can thams cad la ma 'dres par mngon sum du gnas par mthong ngo/ /de yang 'di lta ste/ sems can dmyal ba'i lam gyi rgyud du gtogs pa'i sems can rnams kyi sems can dmyal ba'i sdug bsngal dang / 'jigs pa rnam par bzlog pa dang / byol song gi skye gnas sna tshogs su skyes pa'i sems can rnams kyi gcig la gcig za ba'i 'jigs pa rnam par bzlog pa dang / gshin rje'i 'jig rten gyi lam gyi rgyud du gtogs pa'i sems can rnams kyi bkres pa dang / skom pa la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal gyi 'jigs pa rnam par bzlog pa dang / klu'i 'jig rten gyi lam gyi rgyud du gtogs pa'i sems can rnams kyi klu'i sdug bsngal dang / 'jigs pa thams cad rnam par bzlog pa dang / 'dod pa'i khams su gtogs pa'i sems can thams cad kyi 'dod pa'i khams kyi sdug bsngal dang / 'jigs pa rnam par bzlog pa dang / mi'i 'jig rten gyi lam gyi rgyud du gtogs pa'i sems can rnams kyi mtshan mo mun pa mun nag gis chod pa'i mun pa'i 'jigs pa thams cad rnam par bzlog pa dang / mi snyan pa dang / bsngags pa ma yin pa dang / grags pa ma yin pa'i sgra dang / tshigs su bcad pa la mngon par zhen pa'i sems can rnams kyi grags pa ma yin pa dang / bsngags pa ma yin pa'i 'jigs pa rnam par bzlog pa dang / 'khor gyi 'jigs par lhung ba'i sems can rnams kyi 'khor du bag tsha ba'i 'jigs pa rnam par bzlog pa dang / 'chi bas 'jigs shing dngangs pa'i sems can rnams kyi 'chi ba'i 'jigs pa rnam par bzlog pa dang / ngan song gi g.yang sas 'jigs shing dngangs pa'i sems can rnams kyi ngan song gi g.yang sas 'jigs pa rnam par bzlog pa dang / 'tsho ba med pas 'jigs shing skrag pa'i sems can rnams kyi 'tsho ba med pa'i 'jigs pa rnam par bzlog pa dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba chud zos kyis 'jigs shing / bag tsha ba'i sems can rnams kyi dge ba'i rtsa ba chud zos kyis 'jigs pa rnam par bzlog pa dang / byang chub kyi sems nyams kyis 'jigs shing bag tsha ba'i sems can rnams kyi byang chub kyi sems nyams kyis 'jigs pa rnam par bzlog pa dang / sdig to'i grogs po dang phrad kyis 'jigs shing bag tsha ba'i sems can rnams kyi sdig to'i grogs po dang phrad pa'i 'jigs pa rnam par bzlog pa dang / dge ba'i bshes gnyen dang bral gyis dogs shing / bag tsha ba'i sems can rnams kyi dge ba'i bshes gnyen dang bral ba'i 'jigs pa rnam par bzlog pa dang / nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi sar lhung gis 'jigs shing bag tsha ba'i sems can rnams kyi nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi sar lhung ba'i 'jigs pa rnam par bzlog pa dang / 'khor ba'i gnas sna tshogs kyi sdug bsngal gyis 'jigs shing skrag pa rnams kyi 'khor ba'i gnas sna tshogs kyi sdug bsngal gyi 'jigs pa rnam par bzlog pa dang / sems can skal pa mi mnyam pa dang phrad kyis 'jigs shing bag tsha ba rnams kyi sems can skal pa mi mnyam pa dang phrad pa'i 'jigs pa rnam par bzlog pa dang / dus mi bzad par skyes kyis 'jigs shing bag tsha ba rnams kyi dus mi bzad par skye ba'i 'jigs pa rnam par bzlog pa dang / rigs ngan par skyes kyis 'jigs shing bag tsha ba rnams kyi rigs ngan par skye ba'i 'jigs pa rnam par bzlog pa dang / sdig to'i las byas kyis 'jigs shing bag tsha ba rnams kyi sdig to'i las byed pa'i 'jigs pa rnam par bzlog pa dang / las dang nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pas 'jigs shing dngangs pa rnams kyis las dang / nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa'i 'jigs pa rnam par bzlog pa dang / 'du shes kyi rnam pa sna tshogs kyi gnas dang / 'ching bas 'jigs shing dngangs pa rnams kyi 'du shes kyi rnam pa sna tshogs kyi gnas dang / 'ching ba'i 'jigs pa rnam par bzlog pa dang / sems can thams cad la so sor mngon du gyur par gnas par mthong ngo/ /

He saw the night goddess Samantasattvatranojahshri in all realms of being in those worlds, facing every sentient being capable of being guided; by seeing all worlds together at once, he saw her standing, without division, before all sentient beings, adapting to their life spans, their various spheres of belief, their physical forms, their conventions of verbal communication, and their mastery, in order to guide them to full development. That is to say, he saw her standing before all sentient beings without division to free beings in hells from the pains and fears of hell, to free beings in brutish states from the perils of mutual predation, to free beings in the realm of ghosts from the pains and perils of hunger and thirst, to free beings in the realm of dragons from all the pains and perils of the dragon realm, to free all beings in the realm of desire from all the pains and perils of the realm of desire, to free all beings in the human realm from all the fears and perils of darkness, to free beings from all fear of ill repute, to free beings from intimidation by groups, to free beings from fear of death, to free beings from fear of falling into states of misery, to free beings from fear of not being able to make a living, to free beings from fear of loss of virtue, to free beings from fear of loss of the determination for enlightenment, to free beings from the danger of association with bad companions, to free beings from fear of separation from spiritual benefactors, to free beings from fear of falling into the stages of individual salvation, to free beings from fear of suffering the pains of the various mundane states, to free beings from fear of all association with the uncongenial, to free beings from fear of coming on bad times, to free beings from fear of being born among bad people, to free beings from fear of doing evil, to free beings from fear of obstruction by deeds, to free beings from fear of bondage by attachment to various notions.

'di lta ste/ sgo nga las skyes pa'i sems can dang / mngal nas skyes pa dang / drod gsher las skyes pa dang / rdzus te skyes pa dang / gzugs yod pa dang / gzugs med pa dang / 'du shes yod pa dang / 'du shes med pa dang / 'du shes yod pa'ang ma yin/ 'du shes med pa'ang ma yin pa'i sems can thams cad yongs su bskyabs pa'i smon lam gyi stobs mngon par sgrub pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi shugs drag po dang / rnam par gnon pa shin tu yangs pa'i stobs dang / byang chub sems dpa'i mngon par shes pa chen po stobs dang / mthu dang / byang chub sems dpa' kun tu bzang po'i spyod pa dang / smon lam mngon par bsgrubs pa'i stobs kyis snying rje chen po'i tshul rgya mtsho'i shugs drag po shin tu skyes pa'i phyir; 'gro ba thams cad du thogs pa med pa'i byams pa chen pos rgyas par dgang ba dang / sems can thams cad kyi bde ba yongs su bsgrubs pa dang / dga' ba'i shugs rnam par 'phel bar bya ba dang / sems can thams cad yongs su bsdu ba'i ye shes rab tu bsgrub pa'i phyir/ byang chub sems dpa'i rnam par thar pa rgya chen po'i rnam par 'phrul pa dang / khyu mchog gi mthu phyung ba dang ldan pas zhing thams cad yongs su dag par bya ba la mngon du gyur pa gnas par mthong ngo/ /chos cad kyi rgyus shes par bya ba la mngon du gyur pa dang / sangs rgyas thams cad mchod cing rim gror bya ba la mngon du gyur pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi bstan pa yongs su gzung ba la mngon du gyur pa dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad bsags pa la mngon du gyur pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa thams cad rnam par 'phel bar bya ba la mngon du gyur pa dang / sems can thams cad kyi sems la sgrib pa med par mngon du gyur par gnas pa dang / sems can thams cad kyi dbang po yongs su smin par bya ba la mngon du gyur par gnas pa dang / sems can thams cad kyi mos pa rgya mtsho rnam par sbyang ba la mngon du gyur pa dang / sems can thams cad kyi sgrib pa'i chos rnam par bzlog pa la mngon du gyur pa dang / sems can thams cad kyi mi shes pa'i mun pa rnam par bsal ba la mngon du gyur cing / thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes snang ba yongs su bskyed pa'i don du gnas pa mthong ngo/ /

That is to say, he saw her confronting the purification of all lands by undertaking the vow to save all beings, whether corporeal or incorporeal, thinking, nonthinking, and neither thinking nor nonthinking, by the immense power of the vigorous exercise of the energy of concentration of enlightening beings, by exertion of the power of the great mystic knowledges of enlightening beings, by the power of execution of the vow to practice the conduct of universally good enlightening beings, by having generated the energy of the ocean of means of great compassion, to suffuse all beings with desireless universal love, to increase the energy of joy, which is the origin of happiness for all beings, to apply the knowledge of how to take care of all beings, by embodiment of the vast spiritual power of enlightening liberation. He saw her confronting realization of knowledge of all things, attendance of all buddhas, preservation of the teachings of all buddhas, accumulation of all roots of goodness, development of all enlightening practices, unhindered penetration of the minds of all beings, maturation of the faculties of all beings, purification of the ocean of interests of all beings, removal of obstructing elements for all beings, dispersal of the darkness of nescience of all beings, and the implementation of all good, to generate the light of omniscience.

de nas tshong dpon gyi bu nor bzang gis/ mtshan mo'i lha mo sems can kun tu skyong ba'i gzi brjid dpal gyi byang chub sems dpa'i rnam par thar pa'i khyu mchog gi mthu phyung ba dang / rnam par 'phrul pa 'jig rten thams cad la mngon par gnas shing / 'gro ba rnam par 'dul ba ston pa bsam gyis mi khyab pa de lta bu mthong nas rab tu dga' ba skyes te/ spro ba chen po'i shugs drag po rgya mtsho rab tu thob nas/ mtshan mo'i lha mo sems can kun tu skyong ba'i gzi brjid dpal la lus thams cad kyis phab ste; phyag byas nas ngor gyen du bltas so/ /
Then Sudhana, having seen this inconceivable manifestation of the night goddess’s enlightening liberation showing guidance for beings in all worlds, prostrated himself before her, enraptured.

de nas mtshan mo'i lha mo sems can kun skyong ba'i gzi brjid dpal gyis byang chub sems dpa'i gzugs dang / mtshan rnam par dag pa de mi snang bar byas te/ mtshan mo'i lha mo'i gzugs su byas nas/ rnam par 'phrul pa thams cad 'byin cing 'dug par gnas so/ /
At that point the night goddess stopped assuming the adornments of the forms of enlightening beings and continued to produce all the mystical manifestations by means of the form of a night goddess.
de nas tshong dpon gyi bu nor bzang gis/ mtshan mo'i lha mo sems can kun tu skyong ba'i gzi brjid dpal gyi mdun du 'dug ste thal mo sbyar nas/ de'i tshe tshigs su bcad pa 'di dag smras so/ /
Then Sudhana stood respectfully before her and spoke these verses to her:

khyod kyi sku yangs mtshan rab rgyan gyis brgyan/ / shin tu bzang zhing mdzes pa bdag gis mthong / / nam mkha' skar ma'i tshogs kyis brgyan pa bzhin/ / dpe byad bzang pos rnam par bris pa mthong / /
'od kyi 'khor can sku bzang dam pa'i mchog / mtha' yas zhing gi rdul khams mang po snyed/ / kha dog sna tshogs rnam pa'i dpe tshul du/ / phyogs rnams kun gyi dbyings su khyab par gang / /
'od zer dra ba mang po 'gro sems mnyam/ / khyod ni ba spu'i sgo nas 'gyed pa mdzad/ / 'od zer sgo la pad+mo yid 'ong gnas/ / khyod kyi sprul pa 'gro ba'i sdug bsngal sel/ /
spos kyi na bun sprin du chags pa'i 'gyed/ / 'gro ba'i gzugs su gnas te kun nas mdzes/ / me tog sgo rnams kun nas dgye mdzad pas/ / chos dbyings bzhugs pa'i rgyal ba kun tu khyab/ /
khyod kyi phrag pa'i lhun yangs 'phags pa ni/ / rin chen 'od 'phro ri bo ri rab 'dra/ / dri med de ni 'gro ba kun tu gsal/ / gti mug mun nag rnam par bzlog pa mdzad; ;
khyod kyi dri med zhal mdog bzang po las/ / na bun sprin dang nyi ma yangs pa 'byung / / khyod kyi nyi ma'i 'khor 'dra 'od bzang ba/ / rnam par snang mdzad spyod yul yangs pa 'byin/ /
khyod kyi spyan nas zla skar 'od 'byung ba/ / rtag tu dri med sprin ltar mang ba ste/ / de dag phyogs bcur bkang zhing 'gro ba rnams/ / rab tu snang byed 'jig rten rab rib sel/ /
khyod kyi mtshan las 'gro ba'i lus mnyam pa'i/ / sprul pa rgya mtsho phyogs su khyab par 'phro/ / de dag chos dbyings yangs pa rgyas 'gengs shing / / sems can tshad med tshogs rnams yongs su 'dul/ /
khyod kyi sku ni 'byams klas phyogs su snang / / 'gro ba kun la mngon gyur dga' ba bskyed/ / rgyal po me dang rkun po chus bskyed pa'i/ / 'jigs pa thams cad rnam sel zhi bar mdzad/ /
gang tshe khyod kyi spyan sngar bdag btang nas/ / yon tan rnam par sems shing nyer phyin pa/ / de tshe 'od zer dri med 'khor bzang po/ / khyod kyi zhal gyi smin mtshams gseb nas 'thon/ /
phyogs rnams rgya mtsho brgya mang snang mdzad nas/ / 'jig rten snang ba rgya che yongs bskyed de/ / rnam 'phrul rnam pa mang po rnams bstan nas; ; de tshe bdag gi lus kyi gseb tu zhi/ /
gang tshe 'od kyi 'khor gyis bdag reg pa/ / de tshe bde ba rmad byung yangs pa myong / / gzungs dang ting 'dzin brgya mang yongs su non/ / phyogs bcu'i rgyal ba dpag yas mthong bar gyur/ /
gom pa rnam por gyen du bteg pa la'ang / / rdul phran grangs snyed tshul ni bdag gis rig / rdul phran shin tu phra ba gcig la yang / / zhing gi rdul snyed zhing rnams mthong bar gyur/ /
rdul la gnas kyang rnam pa tha dgu ste/ / zhing mang brgya ni shin tu nyon yang mongs/ / de yi 'gro ba sdug bsngal nyams su myong / / cho nger ngu zhing smre sngags yongs su 'don/ /
zhing mang la la kun nas nyon mongs dag / de na sdug bsngal mang zhing bde ba chung / / rgyal ba thugs rje can yang der skye ste/ / rgyal ba'i nyan thos rang rgyal de bzhin no/ /
zhing tshul la la yongs dag nyon mongs te/ / byang chub sems dpa'i gnas bzang mang pos brgyan/ / skyes pa bud med yongs brgyan blta na sdug / skyon med rgyal ba'i gdung yang rgyun mi 'chad/ /
zhing rnams rgya mtsho yangs shing dri med pa/ / rdul la gnas shing mnyam pa'i gzhi dang ldan/ / de dag bskal pa brgya mang sngon gyi tshe/ / rnam par snang mdzad spyod mdzad yongs su sbyangs/ /
zhing rnams 'byams klas kun na rgyal ba dag / shing dbang dam pa'i drung du gshegs pa ston/ / rnam par 'phrul zhing byang chub 'tshang yang rgya/ / chos kyi 'khor lo bskor cing 'dul ba ston/ /
rnam par snang mdzad spyod yul yangs pa la/ / khyod kyang kun tu rjes su bzhud par mthong / / mchod pa stong phrag tshad med khrag khrig gis/ / rgyal ba kun la mngon par mchod mdzad mthong / /

I have seen your immense body, Of excellent appearance, adorned with jewels, Variously beautified by embellishments As the sky is by the stars.
Your aura of light, the sublime radiance of your body, Is equal to the atoms in endless lands; Like various kinds of matchless colors, It pervades everywhere endlessly.
From every pore you radiate nets of light, As many as minds of beings; On a beautiful lotus in each ray of light Stands an emanation of you, extinguishing pain in the world.
You emit fragrant clouds of light In the forms of all beings, all pure, Showering flowers everywhere, On all the buddhas in the cosmos.
Your multitude of lights, vast and pure, Is like a mountain radiant with jewels; With it you illumine all worlds And remove the darkness of delusion.
Myriad pure suns emerge From your mouth; Your sunlight shines throughout The vast realm of Vairocana.
Pure moon and star lights Radiate from your eyes in great numbers And pervade the ten directions, Illumining the world and destroying darkness.
From your features come myriad emanations In the forms of all beings; They go throughout the cosmos Developing the countless masses.
Your body appears before all beings Everywhere, creating joy; You put an end to measureless dangers— From kings, brigands, fire, and floods—guiding beings.
As directed, I have come to you, Observing your qualities; A pure aura of light beams Emanated from between your brows, Illuminating all places, Producing great light in the world; Having shown many various wonders, It descended into my body.
When the light descended on me, I experienced a marvelous, supreme happiness; I was imbued with mental command, a hundred concentrations, And I saw the infinite buddhas everywhere.
I knew the number of atoms In the ground where I walked, And saw in each atom As many lands as atoms in lands.
In an atom are hundreds Of various mixed-up, defiled lands, Where the beings suffer pains And weep and wail.
There are also many lands with purity amid defilement, Where the happiness is little and the suffering much, Where the compassionate buddhas, Their disciples, and the self-enlightened gather.
There are also lands with defilement amid purity, Where many enlightening beings are assembled, Beautiful lands graced with men and women, Where the family of buddhas abides.
Oceans of lands, vast and pure, Are in an atom, or an even plane, Purified over long eons past By the action of Vairocana.
In every land buddhas appear At the enlightenment tree; Having attained enlightenment, They teach and guide the world.
I see you in the vast realm of Vairocana, Honoring all the infinite buddhas.

de nas tshong dpon gyi bu nor bzang gis tshigs su bcad pa de dag smras nas/ mtshan mo'i lha mo sems can kun tu skyong ba'i gzi brjid dpal la 'di skad ces smras so/ /lha mo/ byang chub sems dpa'i rnam par thar pa de/ de lta bur zab pa ni ngo mtshar chen/ rnam par thar pa de'i ming ni ci zhes bgyi/ de khyod kyis brnyes nas yun ni ji srid cig lags/ byang chub sems dpas ji ltar nan tan du bgyis na rnam par thar pa de yongs su dag par 'gyur/

Then Sudhana said to the night goddess, “It is wonderful how deep your enlightening liberation is. What is this liberation called? How long ago did you attain it? How does an enlightening being practice so as to purify this liberation?”

smras pa/ rigs kyi bu/ gnas 'di ni lha dang bcas pa'i 'jigs rten dang / nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas su bcas pas yid ches par dka' ba ste; de ci'i phyir zhe na/ 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' kun tu bzang po'i spyod pa dang / smon lam khong du chud pa rnams kyi spyod yul te/ 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' snying rje chen po lhur len pa/ 'gro ba thams cad yongs su bskyab pa la zhugs pa/ mi khom pa dang / ngan song dang / ngan 'gro'i lam thams cad rnam par bzlog pa la zhugs pa/ sangs rgyas kyi zhing khams thams cad sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag pa bla na med par bya ba la zhugs pa/ sangs rgyas kyi zhing thams cad na bzhugs pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs rgyun mi gcod pa la zhugs pa/ sangs rgyas thams cad kyi bstan pa yongs su bzung ba la zhugs pa/ bskal pa thams cad du byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa la gnas pas gnas par bya ba'i smon lam chen po rgya mtsho la zhugs pa/ chos rgya mtsho thams cad la bsgribs pa med pa'i ye shes snang ba rnam par sbyang ba la zhugs pa/ skad cig re re zhing dus gsum gyi tshul rgya mtsho thams cad du ye shes snang bas rnam par gnas pa rab tu thob pa rnams kyi yul te/ 'on kyang de bzhin gshegs pa'i byin gyi rlabs kyis bstan par bya'o/ /rigs kyi bu/ sngon 'das pa'i dus bskal pa sangs rgyas kyi zhing gi rdul shin tu phra ba snyed cig gi pha rol tu/ 'jig rten gyi khams rnam par snang mdzad gzi brjid dpal zhes bya bar/ bskal pa rdul dang bral ba'i dkyil 'khor ces bya ba byung ste/ bskal pa de la sangs rgyas ri rab kyi rdul shin tu phra ba snyed byung bar gyur to/ /'jig rten gyi khams rnam par snang mdzad gzi brjid dpal zhes bya ba de ni/ rin po che thams cad kyi sprin gyi rgyan gyis brgyan pa ste/ rdo rje las byas pa'i gzhal med khang dang / gnas kyis yongs su mdzes par byas pa'o/ /'jig rten gyi khams de'i gzhi ni rin po che'i rgyal po dri ma med pa'i 'od kyi rgya mtsho las blangs pa ste/ lhun dang lus ni nor bu rin po che spos thams cad kyi rgyal po las gyur pa'o/ /de ni dbyibs kun tu zlum pa ste/ rnam par dag cing kun nas nyon mongs pa/ lhab lhub thams cad kyi sprin gyi bla res kun nas khyab pa/ rin po che'i khor yug rgyan thams cad dang ldan pa rim pa stong gis yongs su bskor ba/ gling bzhi pa bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong gis shin tu rgyas par brgyan pa ste/ de la gling bzhi pa la la ni kun nas nyon mongs pa ste/ sems can kun nas nyon mongs pa'i las dang ldan pa rnams kyi gnas so/ /la la ni kun nas nyon mongs shing rnam par dag pa ste/ sems can las 'dren ma dang ldan pa rnams kyi gnas so/ /la la ni rnam par dag cing kun nas nyon mongs pa ste/ sems can yongs su dag cing kun nas nyon mongs pa/ dge ba'i rtsa ba sbyangs pa/ kha na ma tho ba nyung ba rnams kyi gnas so/ /la la ni shin tu yongs su dag pa ste/ byang chub sems dpa' dag pa rnams kyi gnas so/ /

She replied, “This state is hard for celestials, Buddhist disciples, and individual illuminates to arrive at. Why? Because this is the realm of enlightening beings who follow the commitment to the practice of universally good enlightening beings; it is the sphere of enlightening beings imbued with great compassion who have undertaken the salvation of all sentient beings, who have undertaken the purgation of all unfavorable and unhappy states, who have undertaken the perpetuation of the lineage of buddhas in all buddha-lands, who have undertaken to preserve the teachings of all buddhas, who have plunged into the ocean of great vows to continue enlightening practice through all ages, who have undertaken to clarify the light of unobscured knowledge of the ocean of all phenomena, who have attained the state of the light of instantaneous knowledge of the ocean of wisdom of past, present, and future. “Now, then, by the empowerment of Buddha I will tell you: in the past, as many eons ago as atoms in a buddha-land, there was an age called Sphere of Dispassion in a world called Sunny Brilliance; as many buddhas as atoms in the polar mountain arose in that age. That world, furthermore, was arrayed with multitudes of all kinds of jewels and adorned with palaces and mansions made of diamond. Now, that world rested on an ocean of all kinds of jewels of pure light and was itself made of all kinds of fragrant jewels. It was perfectly round and pure, with some defilement. It was covered with canopies of all kinds of ornaments, and surrounded by a thousand peripheral mountain ranges, circles of jewels in all arrays. It had millions of sets of four continents, some of which were inhabited by beings whose actions were defiled and beings whose actions were undefiled, some of which were inhabited by beings whose actions were a mixture of defilement and purity, some of which were inhabited by beings who were mostly pure with some defilement, beings of refined virtues, beings with little in them that is blameworthy; and some were inhabited by wholly pure enlightening beings.

'jig rten gyi khams rnam par snang mdzad gzi brjid dpal zhes bya ba de'i shar phyogs logs kyi khor yug gi mtshams na/ gling bzhi pa rin po che me tog sgron ma'i rgyal mtshan zhes bya ba rnam par dag cing kun nas nyon mongs pa/ ma rmos/ ma skyes pa'i 'bras la yongs su spyod pa sngon gyi las kyi rnam par smin pas mngon par grub pa'i khang pa brtsegs pa'i gnas dang / gzhal med khang la yongs su spyod pa/ 'khor kun nas yid bzhin gyi shing gis 'khor ba/ spos kyi shing sna tshogs kyi lhun las spos kyi sprin rgyun mi 'chad par 'byung ba/ phreng ba sna tshogs kyi shing las phreng ba'i sprin rgyun mi 'chad par 'byung ba/ me tog sna tshogs kyi shing las me tog kha dog dang dri bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i sprin gyi char rgyun mi 'chad par 'bab pa/ phye ma kha dog sna tshogs kyi shing gi lhun las spos rin po che'i rgyal po thams cad kyi phye ma'i char rgyun mi 'chad par 'bab pa/ rin po che'i shing sna tshogs las rin po che'i 'bru mang po 'brul ba'i kha dog snang bas shin tu snang bar byas pa/ lha rdzas kyi rol mo sna tshogs kyi shing las sil snyan sna tshogs kyi sprin rlung gis bskyod cing / nam mkha'i dbyings las sgra dbyangs snyan pa 'byung ba/ nyin mtshan gyi bde ba nyi ma dang / zla bas 'byung ba/ nor bu rin po che kun tu snang bas gzhi byas pa'i sa rab tu mnyam par gyur pa ste/ gling bzhi pa der rgyal po'i pho brang bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong byung bar gyur te; rgyal po'i pho brang de dag re re zhing yang chu klung stong gis yongs su bskor ba'o/ /chu klung de dag thams cad kyang lha rdzas kyi me tog sil mas gang ba'o; ;lha rdzas kyi rol mo dang / glu'i sgra skad snyan cing yid du 'ong ba 'byin pa'o/ /chu 'gram rin po che'i shing yid du 'ong bas rnam par brgyan pa'o/ /rin po che sna tshogs kyis shin tu brgyan pa'i gru phan tshun du rgyu ba'o/ /bde ba sna tshogs ci dga' bar yongs su spyad du yod pa'o/ /chu klung gi mtshams kyi gzhi re re dag na yang grong khyer bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong phrag bcu kun nas gnas pa ste/ grong khyer de dag re re zhing yang grong rdal bye ba khrag khrig brgya phrag stong gi 'khor gyis yongs su bskor ba'o/ /grong dang grong khyer dang grong rdal de dag thams cad kyang lha rdzas kyi bza' shing gi ra ba dang / gzhal med khang dang / khang pa bye ba khrag khrig brgya phrag stong gi 'khor gyis yongs su bskor ba'o; ;

“In the eastern part of that world, at the border of the peripheral mountains, was a set of four continents called Jewel Flower Lamp Banner. The land was pure, with some defilement. There was an abundance of food without plowing or sowing, and there were dwelling places resulting from the maturation of past deeds. There were wish-fulfilling trees everywhere, trees of various fragrances always emitting clouds of perfume, various garland trees constantly showering garlands, various flower trees raining multitudes of flowers of inconceivable colors and scents, trees of aromatic powders of various qualities continually giving forth a rain of powder of fragrant jewels, various jewel trees shining with light from their jewel buds, and trees of various celestial instruments that filled the air with beautiful sounds produced when stirred by the breeze. The sun and moon shined pleasantly day and night, and jewels shone everywhere.
“At that time there were millions of capital cities on those four continents, each of which was surrounded by a thousand rivers. Each of those rivers carried various celestial flowers and produced celestial music; the banks were lined with trees of various jewels, and those who traveled by boat on the rivers enjoyed various delights to their hearts’ content. Between the river were built millions of cities, each surrounded by millions of towns. In all the cities and towns were many heavenly parks, palaces, and mansions.

gling bzhi pa de'i 'dzam bu'i gling gi dbus na/ rgyal po'i pho brang dbu ma rin po che'i me tog sgron ma zhes bya ba yod par gyur te/ de ni skyid cing longs spyod phun sum tshogs pa dang ldan la/ rtag tu lo legs shing bde ba'i rnam pa thams cad dang ldan pa'o/ /lha dang mi mang pos yongs su gang ba'o/ /sems can dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam dang ldan pa rnams kyi gnas su gyur pa ste/ rgyal po'i pho brang rin po che'i me tog sgron ma zhes bya ba de na/ rgyal po rnam par snang ba rin chen pad+mo dpal gyi gtsug phud snying po zhes bya ba 'khor los bsgyur ba gling bzhi la dbang ba/ pad+mo'i snying po la rdzus te byung ba/ mi chen po'i mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis kyis lus shin tu brgyan pa/ chos dang ldan pa/ chos kyi rgyal po rin po che bdun dang ldan pa gnas par gyur to/ /de'i bu dpa' zhing rtul phod la yan lag dam pa'i gzugs dang ldan pa/ gzhan gyi 'khor rab tu 'joms pa/ rnam pa thams cad yongs su tshang ba'i yan lag dam pa dang ldan pa stong tshang bar byung ngo/ /de'i btsun mo'i 'khor gyi bud med kyang bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong phrag bcu yod par gyur te/ de dag kun kyang 'khor los bsgyur ba'i skal ba dang mnyam pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba las byung ba mthun par spyod pa/ rin po che'i rgyan rang 'khrungs su byung ba/ dge ba'i sems dang ldan pa/ lha'i bu mo dang khyad par med par 'dra ba'i gzugs can/ dzam+bu chu klung gi gser gyi kha dog lta bu'i mdog dang ldan pa'i lus can/ lus kyi ba spu las lha rdzas kyi spos sna tshogs 'byung ba/ lus las lha rdzas kyi 'od dri zhim po dri ma med pa rab tu 'gyed pa sha stag go /de'i blon po bye ba phrag bcu byung ste/ blon po rin po che la sogs pa dag go /'khor los bsgyur ba'i rgyal po rnam par snang ba rin chen pad+mo dpal gyi gtsug phud snying po de'i btsun mo dam pa/ bud med rin po che dpal gyi bzhin yongs su rgyas pa zhes bya ba/ gzugs mdzes shing sdug pa/ blta na yid du 'ong ba/ kha dog bzang po shin tu rgyas pa'i dam pa dang ldan pa/ skra mthon mthing du 'dug pa/ mig dkar nag 'byes pa/ mdog gser gyi kha dog tu 'dug pa/ tshangs pa'i dbyangs dang ldan pa/ lus las 'od rtag tu 'byung ba/ 'khor kun tu dpag tshad stong gi tshad du 'od kha dog du ma dang ldan pa; lha rdzas kyi dri zhim po can 'gyed pa byung ngo/ /rgyal po'i btsun mo dpal gyi bzhin yongs su rgyas pa zhes bya ba de las/ bu mo pad+mo bzang mo mig yid du 'ong ba'i dpal gyi zla ba zhes bya ba/ yan lag thams cad tshang ba/ gzugs mdzes shing sdug pa/ blta na yid du 'ong ba/ 'jig rten thams cad kyis blta na mi ngoms pa byung bar gyur te/ rigs kyi bu/ 'di lta ste/ dper na/ 'khor los bsgyur ba'i rgyal po la blta na su yang ngoms par mi 'gyur ba de bzhin du/ 'khor los bsgyur ba'i bu mo pad+mo bzang mo mig yid du 'ong ba'i dpal de la blta bas kyang / su yang ngoms par mi 'gyur te/ shes rab kyis yongs su ngoms par 'gyur ba ni ma gtogs so/ /

“In the middle of the southernmost of those four continents was a central capital city called Jewel Flower Lamp Banner, which was prosperous and peaceful, with a large population of virtuous people. The king in that city ruled the four continents; spontaneously born in the calyx of a lotus, he had the thirty-two marks of a great man and was a just ruler. He had a thousand sons, valiant, strong, destroyers of enemy armies. He also had millions of concubines who were products of the same virtues as was the king, carried out the same practices, and were noble-minded. They were as beautiful as goddesses, with golden complexions, celestial fragrances and auras of pure light emanating from their bodies. He also had millions of ministers, superlative advisers.
“The king also had a beautiful wife, whose aura constantly suffused a thousand leagues all around her with multicolored light of celestial fragrance. That queen had a daughter by the king who was so beautiful that no one ever tired of looking at her. Just as no one was ever tired of the sight of the sovereign, in the same way no one was ever sated with the sight of the princess, except those sated with wisdom.

de'i tshe de'i dus na sems can rnams kyang tshe dpag tu med par gyur te/ tshe la gcig tu nges pa med pas bar ma dor 'chi ba ni yod do/ /de'i dus na sems can rnams kyi dbyibs sna tshogs dang / kha dog sna tshogs dang / dbyangs sna tshogs dang / ming sna tshogs dang / rigs sna tshogs dang / tshe'i tshad sna tshogs dang / chu zheng rnam pa tha dad pa dang / mos pa dang / stobs dang / brtson 'grus dang / mthu rnam pa tha dad pa dang / yid du 'ong ba dang / yid du mi 'ong ba rnam pa tha dad pa dang / yangs pa dang / dma' ba la mos pa sna tshogs kyang yod par gyur te/ de la sems can ji snyed cig kha dog bzang ba dang / yangs pa la mos pa dang / yan lag tshang ba dang / blta na sdug cing yid du 'ong bar gyur pa de dag ni 'di skad ces 'dzer to/ /kye/ mi dag /nga ni khyed pas kha dog ches bzang ngo zhes zer ro/ /de bzhin du sems can ji snyed cig lus kyi dbyibs legs pa dang ldan par gyur pa de dag kyang / sems can lus kyi dbyibs mi sdug par gyur pa rnams la rlom zhing khyad du gsod do/ /de dag de ltar gcig la gcig khyad du gsod pa las byung ba'i mi dge ba'i rtsa bas tshe'i tshad las kyang yongs su bri bar gyur to/ /kha dog dang stobs dang bde ba las kyang yongs su bri bar gyur to/ /rgyal po'i pho brang rin po che'i me tog sgron ma de'i byang phyogs logs na/ snying po byang chub kyi shing kun du grag pa'i chos kyi sprin sgra'i rgyal mtshan zhes bya ba/ de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi snying po byang chub kyi rgyan skad cig re re la yongs su ston pa/ rtsa ba rin po che'i rgyal po rdo rje ltar sra zhing mi 'jig pa/ nor bu rin po che thams cad las grub pas/ lhun shin tu yangs shing rgyas pa/ sdong po dang / yal ga dang / lo ma dang / 'dab ma dang / me tog dang / 'bras bu rin po che thams cad kyi rgyu las grub pa/ kun tu cha mnyam par rnam par bkod cing kun tu khyab pa'i yal ga dang ldan pa/ rgyan kun tu rgyas par 'gengs shing mi zad pa dang ldan pa/ rin po che sna tshogs kyi 'od 'phro ba dang / 'od zer kun tu snang bar 'gyed pa/ de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi yul gyi rnam par 'phrul ba'i dbyangs rjes su sgrog pa yod de/ snying po byang chub de'i mdun rol na/ spos chu'i mtsho rin po che'i me tog dang / glog dang / chos kyi 'brug sgra'i sprin gyi dbyangs zhes bya ba yod de/ de ni rin po che'i shing bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong phrag bcus kun nas bskor ba ste/ rin po che'i shing de dag thams cad kyang byang chub kyi shing gi dbyibs su 'khod pa sha stag go /spos chu'i mtsho chen po rin po che'i me tog dang / glog dang / chos kyi 'brug sgra'i sprin gyi dbyangs zhes bya ba de'i 'gram thams cad kyang / nor bu rin po che thams cad bkram zhing rnam par bkod pa ste/ rin po che thams cad kyi phreng ba sna tshogs su dkrigs pa'o/ /rin po che rnam par dag pa las byas pa'i khang pa sna tshogs kyi rgyan gyis yongs su brgyan pa'o/ /rgyan rnam par dag pa sna tshogs kyi rgyan gyis shin tu brgyan pa'o/ /snying po byang chub de'i 'khor thams cad kyang nor bu rin po che'i khang pa brtsegs pa chen po rgyan bsam gyis mi khyab pa dang ldan pa/ pad+mo'i snying po can sha stag gis yongs su 'khor ba ste/ spos chu'i mtsho chen po rin po che'i me tog dang / glog dang / chos kyi 'brug sgra'i sprin gyi dbyangs zhes bya ba de'i dbus nas/ pad+mo'i rgyal po chen po lo ma'i mtshams nas dus gsum gyi de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi yul rnam par ston pa'i 'od zer gyi sprin gyi rgyan ces bya ba byung bar 'gyur te/

“At that time the life span of the beings in that world was measureless—there were none with fixed life spans and no untimely deaths. Also at that time the variety of forms of sentient beings was known, as was the variety of their colors, voices, names, families, life spans, physical sizes, abilities and strengths, agreeable and unpleasant affairs, and higher and lower inclinations. There, those with better appearances and more confidence, who were physically perfect and good-looking, proclaimed their superiority to others; and those with well-formed bodies looked down on all those with ill-formed bodies. Then, because of the evil of mutual contempt, they lost their span of life, physical appearance, strength, and happiness—all was lost.
“There was an enlightenment tree north of the city called Sound of Clouds of Teachings Illumining All. Its strong roots were made of indestructible diamonds that showed the arrays of the enlightenment sites of all buddhas in every moment; its trunk was a mass of all kinds of jewels, high and wide; its foliage, flowers, and fruits were made of all kinds of jewels. It was perfectly formed, well proportioned everywhere, its foliage equally distributed, with endless adornments throughout, flashing with all kinds of jewel lights radiating in all directions, producing sounds of magical displays of the spheres of all buddhas.
“In front of that enlightenment site there was a pond of fragrant water called Sound of Clouds Thundering Teachings with Jewel Flower Lightning, surrounded by millions of jewel trees. Each of those trees was formed like the enlightenment tree. The banks of the pond were made of well-distributed collections of all kinds of gems, hung with strings of all kinds of jewels, graced with arrays of mansions made of pure jewels, adorned with pure arrays of all kinds of ornaments. The whole enlightenment site was also surrounded by countless jewel towers in lotus calyxes with inconceivable adornments. In the middle of the pond appeared a great ruby lotus called Array of Clouds of Light Rays Flashing Lightning from Between the Leaves Illumining the Sphere of the Buddhas of Past, Present, and Future.

pad+mo chen po de la de bzhin gshegs pa ri rab kyi rdul shin tu phra ba snyed de dag gi nang nas bskal pa'i thog ma pa/ de bzhin gshegs pa ye shes rin po che'i 'od kun tu 'phro ba'i dpal yon tan dpal gyi rgyal po zhes bya ba byung bar gyur te/ de ni bskal pa de la thams cad kyi thog mar bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas te/ des lo stong phrag du ma zhig tu chos bstan pas sems can yongs su smin par mdzad nas/ lo stong phrag bcur 'od zer snang ba'i rnam par 'phrul pas yongs su smin par mdzad do/ /de bzhin gshegs pa de lo stong phrag bcu na 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tshe/ pad+mo'i rgyal po chen po lo ma'i mtshams nas dus gsum gyi de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi yul rnam par ston pa'i 'od zer gyi sprin gyi rgyan ces bya ba de las/ sems can thams cad rdul dang 'byed pa'i sgron ma zhes bya ba'i 'od zer byung bar gyur te/ 'od des phog pa'i sems can rnams kyis kyang lo stong phrag bcu na de bzhin gshegs pa 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes bya bar shes so/ /lo stong phrag dgu na de bzhin gshegs pa de 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tshe/ byang chub kyi shing de las rdul dang bral ba'i dpal gyi snying po zhes bya ba'i 'od zer byung ste/ 'od zer des phog pa'i sems can de dag gis kyang gzugs thams cad shin tu phra ba mthong bar gyur to/ /lo stong phrag brgyad na de bzhin gshegs pa 'byung ngo zhes bya ba'i tshe/ byang chub kyi shing chen po de nyid las 'od zer sems can thams cad kyi las rnam par smin pa'i dbyangs zhes bya ba byung ste; des phog pa'i sems can de dag thams cad kyis kyang rang rang gi las rgya mtsho khong du chud par gyur te/ las dran pa'i ye shes kyang thob par gyur to/ /lo stong phrag bdun na de bzhin gshegs pa de 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tshe/ byang chub kyi shing de nyid las 'od zer dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad yang dag par 'byung ba'i dbyangs zhes bya ba byung ste; 'od zer des sems can de dag la phog nas/ dbang po nyams pa med cing yongs su tshang bar gyur to/ /lo stong phrag drug na de bzhin gshegs pa de 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tshe/ byang chub kyi shing chen po de nyid las 'od zer sangs rgyas kyi yul bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i dbyangs zhes bya ba byung ste/ des sems can de dag la phog nas bsam pa rgya chen pos rnam par 'phrul par gyur to/ /lo stong phrag lnga na de bzhin gshegs pa de 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tshe/ byang chub kyi shing chen po de nyid las 'od zer sangs rgyas kyi zhing thams cad yongs su dag par sgra 'byin pa'i gzugs brnyan rnam par dmigs pa zhes bya ba byung ste/ des sems can de dag la phog nas/ sangs rgyas kyi zhing rnam pa thams cad du yongs su dag par mthong bar gyur to/ /lo stong phrag bzhin de bzhin gshegs pa de 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tshe/ byang chub kyi shing chen po de nyid las 'od zer de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi yul tha mi dad pa'i sgron ma zhes bya ba byung ste/ des sems can de dag la phog nas de bzhin gshegs pa de'i rnam par 'phrul pa thams cad du song ba la zhugs par gyur to/ /lo stong phrag gsum na de bzhin gshegs pa de 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tshe; byang chub kyi shing chen po de las 'od zer 'gro ba thams cad la mngon du gyur pa'i sgron ma zhes bya ba byung ste/ des sems can de dag la phog nas de bzhin gshegs pa de yang mngon du mos pas mthong bar gyur to/ /lo stong phrag gnyis na de bzhin gshegs pa de 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tshe/ byang chub kyi shing chen po de las 'od zer dus gsum gyi ye shes kyi glog gi sgron ma zhes bya ba de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi sngon gyi tshul rab tu sgrog pa byung ste/ des sems can de dag la reg nas de bzhin gshegs pa de'i sngon gyi tshul rgya mtsho la rtog cing 'jug par gyur to/ /lo stong na de bzhin gshegs pa de 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tshe/ byang chub kyi shing chen po de las 'od zer ye shes rab ri ba med pa de bzhin gshegs pa'i sgron ma zhes bya ba byung ste/ des sems can de dag la phog nas/ de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi rnam par 'phrul pa dang / zhing thams cad dang / sems can thams cad mthong bar 'gyur ba'i mig kun tu lta ba thob par gyur to/ /de bzhin gshegs pa de lo brgya na 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tshe/ byang chub kyi shing chen po de nyid las 'od zer 'gro ba thams cad kyis sangs rgyas mthong ba rnam par smin pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba las byung ba zhes bya ba byung ste/ des sems can de dag la phog nas/ de bzhin gshegs pa skye ba'i 'du shes thob par gyur to/ /de bzhin gshegs pa de zhag bdun na skye bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tshe/ byang chub kyi shing chen po de nyid las 'od zer sems can thams cad rab tu dga' ba dang / spro ba dang / mos pa yongs su 'byung ba'i dbyangs zhes bya ba byung ste/ des sems can de dag la phog nas/ sangs rgyas mthong bar 'gyur ba'i dga' ba'i shugs chen po skyes par gyur to/ /

“In that lotus appeared a buddha named Paragon of Virtue Radiant with the Light of Universal Knowledge, who was the first of as many buddhas as atoms in the polar mountain to attain supreme perfect enlightenment in that eon. Having developed sentient beings for thousands of years by hearing the Teaching, he prepared them by manifestation of lights for ten thousand years for the appearance of the buddha in ten thousand years: there emanated from that great lotus a light called ‘spotless lamp of all beings,’ and the beings touched by that light became aware that the buddha would emerge in ten thousand years. They realized that the buddha would emerge in nine thousand years as a light called ‘full of undefiled radiance’ emanated from the enlightenment tree, and the beings touched by the light perceived all subtle forms. Realizing that the buddha would emerge in eight thousand years as a light called ‘voice of the results of the deeds of all beings’ emanated from the enlightenment tree, the beings touched by the light comprehended the oceans of their own doings and gained recollection and knowledge of their deeds. Realizing that the buddha would emerge in seven thousand years as a light called ‘voice produced by all roots of goodness’ emanated from the enlightenment tree, the beings touched by the light gained completeness of all their faculties. Realizing that the buddha would emerge in six thousand years as a light called ‘sound of revelation of the inconceivable sphere of buddhas’ emanated from the enlightenment tree, the beings touched by the light were transformed into higher states. Realizing that the buddha would emerge in five thousand years as a light called ‘conveying the dramatic mental impression of the purity of all buddha-lands’ emanated from the enlightenment tree, the beings touched by the light saw all aspects of the purity of buddha-lands. Realizing the buddha would emerge in four thousand years as a light called ‘lamp of the unity of the realm of buddhas’ emanated from the enlightenment tree, the beings touched by the light comprehended the omnipresent miracle of the buddha. Realizing the buddha would emerge in three thousand years as a light called ‘lamp in the presence of all beings’ emanated from the enlightenment tree, the beings touched by the light were engrossed in the sight of the buddha right before them. Realizing the buddha would emerge in two thousand years as a light called ‘lamp of lightning of knowledge of past, present, and future’ emanated from the tree of enlightenment along with the voice of the past efforts of the buddha, the beings touched by the light put faith in and entered into the oceans of past efforts of the buddha. Realizing the buddha would emerge in a thousand years as a light called ‘lamp of realization of suchness of unobscured knowledge’ emanated from the enlightenment tree, the beings touched by the light gained the power of the universal eye to see the miracles of all buddhas, the buddha-lands, and all sentient beings. Realizing the buddha would emerge in a hundred years as a light called ‘product of virtues of all beings resulting from seeing buddhas’ emanated from the enlightenment tree, the beings touched by the light got an impression of the emergence of Buddha. Realizing the buddha would appear in seven days as a light called ‘sound producing happiness and joy in all sentient beings’ emanated from the enlightenment tree, the beings touched by the light developed the energy of the great joy of seeing Buddha.

rigs kyi bu/ de ltar 'od zer gyis yongs su smin par bya ba'i tshul tshad med pa rnam pa de lta bus/ lo stong du sems can rnams yongs su smin par mdzad nas zhag bdun pa la thug pa dang / 'jig rten gyi khams de thams cad yongs su bskyod pa'i tshul tshad med pas yongs su bskyod nas shin tu dag par byin gyis brlabs so/ /phyogs bcu'i de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag pa ji snyed pa rgyan bsam gyis mi khyab pa rnam pa sna tshogs dang ldan pa de dag thams cad kyang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing der sems kyi skad cig re re la yongs su bstan par gyur to/ /
de nas zhag bdun pa tha ma la bab pa dang / 'jig rten gyi khams de na sems can sangs rgyas mthong bar 'gyur bar yongs su smin pa de dag thams cad snying po byang chub tu mngon par gzhol bar gyur to/ /
de nas 'jig rten gyi khams de'i khor yug thams cad dang / ri rab thams cad dang / ri thams cad dang / chu klung thams cad dang / rgya mtsho thams cad dang / shing thams cad dang / sa'i gzhi thams cad dang / grong khyer thams cad dang / ra ba thams cad dang / gnas thams cad dang / gzhal med khang thams cad dang / gos dang / rgyan dang / longs spyod thams cad dang / rol mo'i shing thams cad dang / rol mo brdung ba'i dbyangs thams cad dang / sprul pa'i rgyan thams cad kyi dmigs pa re re las kyang de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi yul dang / mthu'i sgra rab tu sgrog pa'i spros dang / bdug spos thams cad kyi sprin mngon par 'thon te/ rin po che 'od 'phro ba'i sprin dang / spos dang / bdug spos thams cad kyi 'od 'phro dam pa dang / spos rin po che thams cad kyi gzugs kyi sprin dang / gos rin po che dang / rgyan rin po che thams cad kyi sprin dang / rin po che'i me tog sna tshogs kyi ri rab kyi sprin dang / phye ma sna tshogs kyi sprin mang po de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi 'od zer gyi sprin rnam par ston pa/ de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi 'od kyi dkyil 'khor gyi sprin rab tu 'gyed pa/ rol mo brdung ba dang dkrol ba thams cad kyi sprin yongs su 'khrol zhing brdung ba/ de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi smon lam gyi sgra skad kyi sprin rab tu 'byin pa/ de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi dbyangs kyi yan lag dang / gsung rgya mtsho'i sprin rab tu sgrog pa/ de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi mtshan dang / dpe byad bzang po'i gzugs brnyan sna tshogs kyi sprin rab tu ston pa byed cing / de bzhin gshegs pa 'byung ba'i ltas sngon du byung ba bsam gyis mi khyab pa yongs su bstan te/ rin po che'i rgyal po'i pad+mo chen po lo ma'i mtshams nas/ dus gsum gyi de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi yul rnam par ston pa'i 'od zer gyi rgyan de'i pad+mo'i 'khor rin po che'i rgyal po las byas pa chen po sha stag tu byas te 'khod do/ /rin po che'i rgyal po'i pad+mo chen po'i 'khor gyi rin po che'i pad+mo chen po de dag gi ze ba dang / snying po la seng+ge'i khri rin po che'i pad+mo chen po'i snying po can/ sangs rgyas kyi zhing bcu'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed dag byung bar gyur te/ rin po che'i snying po can gyi khri de dag la'ang byang chub sems dpa' sangs rgyas kyi zhing bcu'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed skyil mo krung bcas te 'khod par gyur to/ /

“Having thus developed beings for ten thousand years by means of such measureless lights, when the seven days were up he shook that whole world with infinite means of shaking it and made it completely pure, as the buddha-lands of all buddhas in the ten directions are pure—and in each moment of thought he showed the various inconceivable arrays of all those buddha-lands. And in those final seven days all the beings in that world who were ripe for the sight of Buddha stood facing the site of enlightenment.
“Then the supremacy of the realm of all buddhas was proclaimed from every single object in that world—from all the peripheral mountains, all the polar mountains, all the other mountains, all the rivers, all the seas, all the trees, all the land masses, all the cities, all the walls, all the buildings, all the clothing, ornaments, and paraphernalia, all the music and song, and all the created adornments—emanating clouds of all kinds of fragrant smoke, clouds of lusters of all jewels, clouds of all kinds of precious clothing and jewelry, clouds of mountains of all kinds of jewel flowers, clouds of all kinds of aromatic powders, clouds of light rays of all buddhas flashing, clouds of auras of all buddhas, clouds of oceans of sayings of all buddhas, clouds of glorious manifestations of the marks and embellishments of all buddhas, manifesting the signs that a buddha is about to appear in the world. Around the great ruby lotus Array of Clouds of Light Rays Flashing Lightning from Between the Leaves Illumining the Sphere of the Buddhas of Past, Present, and Future, there stood as many ruby lotuses as atoms in ten buddha-lands, on which appeared as many jewel lion seats, on which appeared as many enlightening beings sitting cross-legged.

bcom ldan 'das ye shes rin po che'i 'od kun tu 'phro ba'i dpal yon tan dpal gyi rgyal po de bzhin gshegs pa de/ bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par sangs rgyas ma thag tu de'i mod la phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams su de bzhin gshegs pa mang po dag kyang bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par sangs rgyas te/ sems can rnams kyi bsam pa ji lta ba bzhin du mngon sum du chos kyi 'khor lo bskor bar gyur to/ /des kyang 'jig rten gyi khams de dag gi sems can tshad med pa rnams ngan song dang log par ltung ba thams cad las rnam par bzlog go /sems can tshad med pa ni mtho ris su skye ba la rab tu bkod do/ /sems can tshad med pa ni nyan thos kyi sa la rab tu bkod do/ /sems can tshad med pa ni rang sangs rgyas kyi byang chub tu yongs su smin par byas so/ /sems can tshad med pa ni shugs drag po 'od kyis 'byung ba'i byang chub tu yongs su smin par byas so/ /sems can tshad med pa ni brtson 'grus dri ma med pa'i rgyal mtshan gyi byang chub tu yongs su smin par byas so/ /sems can tshad med pa ni chos rab tu bsgom pa'i gnas su 'byung ba'i byang chub la rab tu bkod do/ /sems can tshad med pa ni dbang po yongs su dag pa rab tu bsgom pas 'byung ba'i byang chub tu yongs su smin par byas so/ /sems can tshad med pa ni stobs mnyam pa nyid la yang dag par spyod pa khong du chud pas 'byung ba'i byang chub tu yongs su smin par byas so/ /sems can tshad med pa ni chos grong khyer mngon du 'gyur ba'i yul gyi theg pa skye bas 'byung ba'i byang chub la rab tu bkod do/ /sems can tshad med pa ni thams cad du rjes su song ba'i rdzu 'phrul tha mi dad pa'i tshul gyi theg pas 'byung ba'i byang chub la rab tu bkod do/ /sems can tshad med pa ni spyod pa'i sbyor ba la yang dag par gzhol ba'i tshul gyis 'byung ba'i byang chub la rab tu bkod do/ /sems can tshad med pa ni ting nge 'dzin gyis 'jug pa'i tshul gyis 'byung ba'i byang chub la rab tu bkod do;
