;sems can tshad med pa ni dmigs pa'i yul thams cad yongs su dag pa'i dkyil 'khor gyi tshul gyi 'byung ba'i byang chub la rab tu bkod do/ /sems can tshad med pa ni byang chub sems dpa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed do/ /sems can tshad med pa ni byang chub sems dpa'i lam la rab tu bkod do/ /sems can tshad med pa ni pha rol tu phyin pa'i lam rnam par dag pa la rab tu bkod do/ /sems can tshad med pa ni byang chub sems dpa'i sa dang po la rab tu bkod do/ /sems can tshad med pa ni byang chub sems dpa'i sa gnyis pa dang / gsum pa dang / bzhi pa dang / lnga pa dang / drug pa dang / bdun pa dang / brgyad pa dang / dgu pa la rab tu bkod do/ /sems can tshad med pa ni byang chub sems dpa'i sa bcu pa la rab tu bkod do/ /sems can tshad med pa ni byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa smon lam gyi khyad par can la btsud do/ /sems can tshad med pa ni byang chub sems dpa' kun tu bzang po'i spyod pa dang / smon lam rnam par dag pa la rab tu bkod do/ /de ltar de bzhin gshegs pa des sangs rgyas kyi khyu mchog gi mthu phyung ba dang / rnam par 'phrul pa bsam gyis mi khyab pas chos kyi 'khor lo bskor bas/ sems kyi skad cig re re la sems can gyi khams mtha' dang dbus med pa rnam par dul bar gyur to/ /'jig rten gyi khams de'i sems can thams cad kyis kyang de bzhin gshegs pa de'i sku sna tshogs dang / thabs mkhas pa sna tshogs kyis bsgrubs pa'i chos bstan pa yongs su shes par gyur to/ /

“As soon as that buddha, Paragon of Virtue Radiant with the Light of Universal Knowledge, had realized supreme perfect enlightenment, the buddhas in all worlds in the ten directions attained supreme perfect enlightenment and set in motion the wheel of teaching for sentient beings in accordance with their mentalities: thereby innumerable sentient beings in that world were thenceforth freed from the calamities of all states of misery, innumerable sentient beings were led to heaven, innumerable beings were led to the stage of saints, innumerable beings were led to the stage of individual enlightenment, innumerable beings were developed to the point of enlightenment in which emancipation is realized by way of intense illumination, innumerable sentient beings were developed to the point of enlightenment characterized by pure exertion, innumerable sentient beings were developed to the point of enlightenment in which emancipation is realized through the efficacy of purification of the senses, innumerable sentient beings were developed to the point of enlightenment in which emancipation is realized through pursuing conduct consonant with the powers of knowledge, innumerable sentient beings were led to enlightenment in which emancipation is made possible by conveyance to the precincts of the citadel of truth, innumerable sentient beings were led to enlightenment in which emancipation is realized by means of integration of efforts in practice, innumerable sentient beings were led to enlightenment in which emancipation is realized through methods of concentration, innumerable sentient beings were led to enlightenment in which emancipation is realized through means of purifying all objects, innumerable sentient beings were inspired to the enlightenment of enlightening beings, innumerable sentient beings were set in the path of enlightening beings, innumerable sentient beings were led to the purification of the path of transcendent ways, innumerable sentient beings were led to the first stage of enlightening beings; in the same way, as the buddha turned the wheel of teaching by his inconceivable spiritual power, in each moment of consciousness innumerable sentient beings were led to the second, third, fourth, fifth, sixth, seventh, eighth, ninth, and tenth stages; innumerable sentient beings were introduced to the practice of enlightening beings based on the most excellent vows; innumerable sentient beings were led to the purification of commitment to the conduct of universally good enlightening beings. Thus, as the buddha turned the wheel of teaching by his inconceivable spiritual power, he succeeded in guiding innumerable sentient beings in each moment of consciousness, and all the sentient beings in that world, according to their mentalities, perceived the Teaching through various bodies expediently projected by the buddha.

rgyal po'i pho brang rin po che'i me tog sgron ma'i sems can du gzugs dang / kha dog dang / yul dang / longs spyod kyis rgyags shing dregs te/ gcig la gcig khyad du gsod pa de rnams gdul ba'i don du/ byang chub sems dpa' kun tu bzang pos kha dog dang gzugs mchog tu byon par mngon par sprul te/ rgyal po'i pho brang der phyin to/ /de'i 'od shin tu yangs pas rgyal po'i gnas de dag thams cad yongs su snang bar gyur te/ rgyal po'i gnas de'i 'od dang / 'khor los bsgyur ba'i rgyal po rnam par snang ba'i rin chen pad+mo dpal gyi gtsug phud snying po'i lus las byung ba'i 'od dang / bud med rin po che'i 'od dang / rin po che'i shing gi 'od dang / nor bu rin po che chen po'i 'od dang / nyi zla dang / gza' skar dang / rgyu skar gyi 'od dang / dzambu'i gling na 'od ji snyed cig yod pa de dag thams cad kyang mi snang bar gyur te/ dper na/ nyi ma shar te mun pa dang ba dang / zla ba dang / gza' skar dang / rgyu skar gyi 'od kyang mi snang la/ me dang nor bu'i 'od kyang mi snang ngo/ /de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' kun tu bzang po'i zil gyis non nas/ dzam+bu'i gling de na 'od yod pa thams cad kyang mi snang bar gyur to/ / 'di lta ste/ dper na; dzam+bu chu klung gi gser gyi sa le sbram gyi drung du snag tsha'i gzugs bzhag na mdzes par mi rung / lhag ger mi rung / lham mer mi rung / lhang nger mi rung ngo/ /de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' kun tu bzang po'i mdun du sems can de dag gi gzugs kyi lus kyang mdzes par mi rung / lhag ger mi rung / lha ma mer mi rung / lhang nger mi rung ngo/ / de nas de dag 'di snyam du gyur te; de lta su zhig /de ltar de'i drung du bdag cag gi lus sam/ 'od dam/ kha dog gam /gzi brjid kyis kyang mdzes par mi rung / lhag ger mi rung / lham mer mi rung / lhang nger mi rung ba de lta lha'am/ tshangs pa'am/ ci zhig /de'i mtshan ma ni gzung bar mi nus so snyam mo/ / de nas byang chub sems dpa' kun tu bzang pos/ rgyal po'i gnas rin po che'i me tog sgron ma'i dbus 'khor los bsgyur ba'i rgyal po rnam par snang ba rin po chen pad+mo dpal gyi gtsug phud snying po'i gzhal med khang gi steng gi bar snang la 'dug ste/ 'khor los bsgyur ba'i rgyal po rnam par snang ba rin chen pad+mo dpal gyi gtsug phud snying po la 'di skad ces smras so/ /rgyal po chen po/ shes par gyis shig /de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas 'jig rten du byung ste/ khyod kyi khams 'di nyid kyi snying po byang chub chos kun tu snang ba'i chos kyi sprin gyi sgra dbyangs rgyal mtshan 'di nyid na rnam par spyod do zhes pa dang / rgyal po'i bu mo ye shes kyi 'od kun tu 'phro ba/ pad+mo bzang mo mig yid du 'ong ba'i dpal gyi zla bas byang chub sems dpa' kun tu bzang po'i gzugs kyi lus dang / 'od dang / rnam par 'phrul pa dang / rgyan mthong ste/ dbyangs thos nas/ dga' ba dang mos pa'i shugs chen po skyes te/ de'i tshe sems 'di snyam du bskyed do/ /bdag gis dge ba'i rtsa ba gang ci bsags pa des/ bdag kyang lus 'di 'dra ba thob par shog cig /rgyan 'di 'dra ba dang / mtshan 'di 'dra ba dang / spyod lam 'di 'dra ba dang / rdzu 'phrul 'di 'dra bar shog cig /ji ltar 'dis mtshan mo mun nag gi nang na sems can rnams la snang ba chen po bskyed de/ sangs rgyas skye ba yongs su brjod pa de bzhin du/ bdag gis kyang sems can rnams kyi mi shes pa'i mun pa bsal te/ ye shes chen po'i snang ba bskyed par bya'o/ /gang dang gang du skyes pa thams cad du'ang / dge ba'i bshes gnyen 'di dang mi 'bral bar shog cig /de nas/ rigs kyi bu/ 'khor los bsgyur ba'i rgyal po rnam par snang ba rin chen pad+mo dpal gyi gtsug phud snying po yan lag bzhi'i dpung gi tshogs dang lhan cig /rin po che bdun dang lhan cig /bud med kyi tshogs kyi 'khor dang lhan cig /bu dang / blon po dang / ljongs kyi mi dang lhan cig tu rgyal bo'i rdzu 'phrul chen po dang / rgyal po'i mthu chen pos/ rgyal po'i gnas rin po che'i me tog sgron ma de nas 'phags te/ gyen du nam mkha' la dpag tshad gcig tsam du mngon par 'phags nas/ dzam+bu'i gling thams cad dang / gling bzhi pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad snang ba chen pos rgyas par bkang ste/ sems can thams cad sangs rgyas blta ba la yongs su bskul ba'i don du/ rin po che'i ri thams cad la gzugs brnyan mngon par bstan cing / gling bzhi pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams su gtogs pa'i sems can rnams la mngon sum du gnas te/ sangs rgyas blta ba de tshigs su bcad de glu'i dbyangs kyis bsngags pa/

“At that time, furthermore, in order to discipline the beings in the city who were intoxicated with enjoyment of forms and colors and who were contemptuous of each other, the enlightening being Universally Good magically assumed a body of superlative appearance and went to the city. His glorious light illumined the city so that the lights of the king and queen, the lights of the jewel trees and the precious stones, even the lights of the sun, moon, planets, and stars, and all the lights of the whole continent, could not be perceived. Just as when the sun rises the darkness disappears and the moon, planets, and stars cannot be seen, in the same way all the lights of the continent, overwhelmed by the light of Universal Good, could not be seen. Just as a mass of carbon black does not look beautiful or shine or seem bright or lustrous in the presence of pure gold, in the same way the bodies of those beings did not look beautiful or shine or seem bright or lustrous in the presence of the universally good enlightening being Samantabhadra. They thought, ‘Who might this be, a god, or Brahma, before whom we do not appear beautiful, do not shine, do not glow, have no radiance or luster? We cannot grasp his appearance.’
“Then Universally Good stood in the sky above the palace of the king in the middle of the city and said to the king, ‘Know, O king, that a buddha, a perfectly enlightened one, has arisen in the world. He is in this very realm of yours, at the enlightenment site Emblem of the Sound of Clouds of Teaching Revealing Universal Truth.’
“Now, the daughter of the king, seeing the form-body and the supernal manifestation of light of the enlightening being Universally Good, and hearing the sound of his ornaments, was enraptured and was inspired with this thought: ‘Whatever basic goodness I have accumulated, may I thereby attain such a body, such adornment, such features, such deportment, such mystic power. Just as he generates light in the dark night of sentient beings and announces the emergence of a buddha, in the same way may I also dispel the darkness of nescience in sentient beings and produce the light of great knowledge. Wherever I may be born, may I never be apart from this spiritual benefactor.’
“Then the king, along with his armies, his concubines, his sons, his ministers, and the inhabitants of the city, left the city and rose a league in the air by the magic power of the king, who filled the four continents with a great light, and who, in order to get all sentient beings to see the buddha, manifested his reflection in all the jewel mountains, stood before all the sentient beings in the four continents, and praised the sight of buddha in verse:

lus can thams cad skyabs mdzad pa'i/ / sangs rgyas 'jig rten byung bar gyur/ / 'jig rten gtso bo de blta bar/ / kun kyang longs te 'dong bar gyis/ /
lus can kun la phan don du/ / chos rab ston pa gang mdzad pa'i/ / de bzhin gshegs pa 'byung ba ni; ; bskal pa bye ba'i brgya lam na'o/ /
'jig rten phyin cir log gyur cing / / mi shes sgrib pas bsgribs gyur te/ / 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal myong ba rnams/ / gzigs shing thugs rje che bskyed nas/ /
sdug bsngal thams cad gzhil don du/ / sems can yongs su smin bya'i phyir/ / bskal pa bye ba grangs med du/ / byang chub spyod pa spyad pa mdzad/ /
bskal pa mtha' yas mu med par/ / sangs rgyas byang chub mchog don du/ / zhabs dang phyag kyang yongs su btang / / spyan dang snyan dang dbu yang btang / /
mthong zhing bsnyen bkur byas pa dang / / thos pa don yod 'gyur ba yin/ / 'jig rten mgon po 'jig rten du/ / 'byung ba bskal pa bye bar dkon/ /
de ni byang chub gdan la bzhugs/ / gsung ba'i dam pa bltar yang yod/ / bdud rnams sde dang bcas btul te/ / byang chub mchog tu rnam sangs rgyas/ /
'od zer dkyil 'khor mtha' yas pa/ / sangs rgyas sku las mngon bkye zhing / / 'gro ba tshim par mdzad pa yi/ / kha dog sna tshogs 'di la ltos/ /
'od zer sprin mang grangs med pa/ / sangs rgyas sku las 'thon pa rnams/ / de ni sems can snang gyur na/ / bde ba dpe med thob par 'gyur; /
brtson 'grus chen po rab rtsom ste/ / rang dang rang gi bsam pa yis/ / mgon po de la mchod pa gyis/ / tshur shog de yi gan du 'dong / /

Buddha has appeared in the world, Savior of all living beings; All should get up and go To see the guide of the world.
Buddhas appear once In millions of eons And teach the truth For the benefit of all beings.
Seeing the world in error, Shrouded by the darkness of nescience, And oppressed by the pains of life and death, Buddhas conceive great compassion.
For countless millions of eons They have practiced enlightenment To perfect sentient beings And extinguish all suffering.
They have given up Their hands and feet, ears, noses, and heads For endless eons, to attain The immortality of enlightenment.
It is hard to find a guide of the world, Even in millions of eons; To listen to them, meet them, and associate with them Cannot but be fruitful.
This supreme teacher is to be seen Sitting on the seat of enlightenment, Having conquered the demon armies And realized the highest awakening.
Behold the body of Buddha, With an endless array of lights, Emanating various glows Which soothe the world.
Countless multitudes of light beams Emanate from the Buddha’s pores; Those on whom they shine Feel incomparable joy.
Honor the guide of your own will— Muster great energy and go to him.

de nas rgyal po rnam par snang ba rin chen pad+mo dpal gyi gtsug phud snying pos/ tshigs su bcad pa de dag gis bdag gi khams na gnas pa'i sems can thams cad yongs su bskul te/ mchod pa'i sprin sna tshogs brgya stong phrag bcu 'khor los bsgyur ba'i dge ba'i rtsa bas yongs su grub pa'i char pa/ snying po byang chub kun nas snang ba'i chos kyi sprin gyi dbyangs kyi rgyal mtshan gyi 'khor kun tu mngon par 'bebs shing / rin po che'i gdugs kyi sprin gyis nam mkha' kun nas yog par bya ba dang / me tog thams cad kyi bla re'i sprin gyis nam mkha' bla nas khebs par bya ba dang / na bza' sna tshogs kyi sprin gyis nam mkha' kun nas yog cing brgyan par bya ba dang / rin po che sna tshogs kyi dril bu'i dra ba'i sprin gyis nam mkha'i dbyings brgyan par bya ba dang / spos sna tshogs rgya mtshos dri zhim par byas pa'i spos kyi 'od zer gyi sprin gyi rgyan nam mkha'i dbyings la byin gyis brlab par bya ba dang / rin po che thams cad kyi khri la rin po che'i gdan 'phel bar gting ba'i sprin gyi rgyan nam mkha'i dbyings la byin gyis brlab pa dang / rin po che thams cad kyi rgyal mtshan gyi sprin mngon par bsgreng ba'i rgyan nam mkha'i dbyings la byin gyis brlab pa dang / khang pa dang / gzhal med khang thams cad kyi sprin gyis kun nas yog pa'i rgyan nam mkha'i dbyings la byin gyis brlab pa dang / me tog sna tshogs kyi sprin gyis kun nas yog pa'i rgyan nam mkha'i dbyings la byin gyis brlab pa dang / mchod pa'i rgyan thams cad kyi sprin gyi char rab tu 'bab pa'i rgyan nam mkha'i dbyings la byin gyis brlab pa byed cing / bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa ye shes rin po che'i 'od kun tu 'phro ba'i dpal yon tan dpal gyi rgyal po gang na ba der dong ste phyin nas/ bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa ye shes rin po che'i 'od kun tu 'phro ba'i dpal yon tan dpal gyi rgyal bo'i zhabs gnyis la spyi bos phyag 'tshal te/ bcom ldan 'das la lan brgya stong du mar g.yas phyogs su bskor ba byas nas/ bcom ldan 'das kyi spyan sngar/ stan nor bu rin po che chen po phyogs kun tu rnam par snang ba'i pad+mo'i snying po can la 'dug go /

“Then the king, having exhorted the inhabitants of his domain with these verses, showering the whole enlightenment site with offerings from ten thousand clouds of offerings developed from the roots of goodness of the ruler, went to the buddha, covering the sky with clouds of parasols of all jewels and canopies of clouds of all kinds of flowers, adorning the sky with cloud covers of all kinds of robes, clouds of nets of jewel bells, clouds of fragrant flames given off by an ocean of all kinds of scents, clouds of chairs made of all kinds of jewels, magically adorning the sky with clouds raining all kinds of presents. Having gone to the buddha and paid his respects, the king sat before the buddha in a throne of great jewels flashing light in all directions.

de nas 'khor los bsgyur ba'i bu mo ye shes rin po che'i 'od kun tu 'phro ba'i pad+mo bzang mo mig yid du 'ong ba'i dpal gyi zla bas/ rang gi rgyan rnams lus las bkrol te/ bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa ye shes kyi 'od kun tu 'phro ba'i dpal yon tan dpal gyi rgyal po la gtor to/ /mngon par gtor to/ /
de nas rgyan de dag/ bcom ldan 'das de'i dbu'i gtsug gi steng gi bar snang la/ nor bu rin po che'i rgyan gyi gdugs chen po nor bu rin po che sna tshogs kyi dra bas yongs su bskor ba/ klu'i dbang po'i lus kyis bzung ba/ rgyan thams cad kyi lus kyi dbyibs shin tu legs par kun nas bskor ba/ rgyan gyi gdugs kyi dkyil 'khor bcus yongs su bskor ba/ shin tu dag pa/ khang pa brtsegs pa'i dbyibs sna tshogs kyis brgyan pa/ rin po che thams cad kyi lhab lhub kyi sprin gyis kun nas yog pa/ nor bu rin po che'i rgyal po thams cad kyi shing gi rgyan gyis kun nas khebs pa/ nor bu rin po che'i rgyal po spos thams cad kyi rgya mtshos yongs su brgyan bar 'dug par gyur te/ de'i dbus na byang chub kyi shing chen po chos kyi dbyings las byung ba'i rin po che thams cad kyi yal ga dang lhun du ldan pa zhes bya ba/ rgyan brjod na mtha' dang dbus med pa/ skad cig re re zhing rgyan sna tshogs yongs su ston pa yod par mthong bar gyur to/ /
de'i drung na de bzhin gshegs pa rnam par snang mdzad ces bya ba/ byang chub sems dpa' sangs rgyas kyi zhing brjod du med pa'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed kun kyang / byang chub sems dpa' kun tu bzang po'i spyod pa dang / smon lam gyis byung ba/ byang chub sems dpa'i rgyan sna tshogs tha mi dad cing bsam gyis mi khyab pa la rnam par spyod pa sha stag gis bskor cing mdun du byas pa dang / 'jig rten gyi dbang po thams cad kyang de la mngon du gyur par mthong ngo/ /

“At that point the daughter of the king took off all her jewelry and scattered it over the buddha; the jewelry formed a parasol over the buddha’s head and stayed there, covered all around with nets of various jewels, held by the chief water spirits, the whole body of jewelry forming a perfect circle surrounded by ten jewel parasols, all completely pure, in the shape of a tower, variously arrayed, covered by clouds of all kinds of jewel ornaments, covered by arrays of diamond trees, adorned with the finest pearls from all the fragrant seas. In the middle of that she saw a great enlightenment tree called ‘draped with foliage of all jewels produced by the cosmos of realities,’ with infinitely various adornments, displaying various auspicious supernal manifestations. There she saw a buddha named Vairocana surrounded by as many enlightening beings as atoms in untold buddha-lands, all of whom had undertaken the vows of practice of universally good enlightening beings and dwelt in the inconceivably various total unity of all enlightening beings. She also saw the leaders of all worlds in the presence of the buddha.

bcom ldan 'das rnam par snang mdzad de'i sangs rgyas kyi rnam par 'phrul pa mtha' dang dbus med pa yang mthong bar gyur to/ /sngon gyi byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa bskal pa gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pa la'ang zhugs par gyur to/ /'jig rten gyi khams de'i 'du ba dang / 'jig pa'i bskal pa la yang zhugs par gyur to/ /'jig rten gyi khams der 'das pa'i sangs rgyas kyi rgyud gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pa la yang zhugs par gyur to/ /'jig rten gyi khams de na byang chub sems dpa' kun tu bzang po/ de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi zhabs kyi drung na sangs rgyas mchod pa la brtson par gnas pa yang mthong ngo/ /sems can thams cad yongs su smin par bya ba dang / gdul bar bya ba la mngon du gyur par yang mthong ngo/ /byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyang byang chub sems dpa' kun tu bzang po'i lus la gzugs brnyan du gyur par 'khod cing / bdag nyid kyang de'i rjes su 'brang bar mthong ngo/ /de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi zhabs kyi drung dang / byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyi drung dang / sems can thams cad kyi gnas dang / 'jig rten gyi khams de dang de dag thams cad na'ang / byang chub sems dpa' kun tu bzang po'i gzugs brnyan kun tu byung ste/ 'jig rten gyi khams de dag re re na'ang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing rdul shin tu phra ba snyed kyi 'jig rten gyi khams mtshams kyi rgyan dang bcas pa dang / gzhi dang bcas pa dang / dbyibs dang bcas pa dang / lhun dang bcas pa dang / rgyan sna tshogs yongs su dag pa dang bcas pa/ rgyan sna tshogs kyi sprin gyis kun nas khebs pa rnam par bkod pa dang / ming dang grangs rnam pa sna tshogs dang ldan pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i rgyud sna tshogs las brjod pa/ dus gsum gyi tshul sna tshogs su gtogs pa/ phyogs 'byams klas pa sna tshogs su 'du ba/ chos kyi dbyings 'byams klas pa sna tshogs kyi khongs su gtogs pa/ chos kyi dbyings kyi gzhi sna tshogs su 'dus pa/ nam mkha'i dbyings sna tshogs la rnam par gnas pa; snying po byang chub sna tshogs kyis brgyan pa/ de bzhin gshegs pa'i rnam par 'phrul pa sna tshogs kyis byung ba/ sangs rgyas kyi seng+ge'i gdan sna tshogs kyis brgyan pa/ de bzhin gshegs pa'i 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor rgya mtsho sna tshogs dang ldan pa/ de bzhin gshegs pa'i 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor gyi rgyud sna tshogs can/ de bzhin gshegs pa'i thabs mkhas pa sna tshogs yongs su brjod pa/ dang ldan pa/ de bzhin gshegs pa'i chos kyi 'khor lo 'khor ba'i tshul sna tshogs can/ de bzhin gshegs pa'i dbyangs kyi yan lag dang gsung gi nga ro sna tshogs rab tu 'byung ba/ skad sna tshogs rgya mtsho shin tu bstan pa dang ldan pa/ mdo sde'i sprin sna tshogs rjes su sgrog pa can dag kyang mthong bar gyur to/ /

She saw the infinitely various projections of Vairocana Buddha and perceived the successive ages of his past enlightening practice. She also perceived that world’s ages of formation and disintegration, and the succession of past buddhas in that world. She also saw the universally good enlightening being Samantabhadra in that world, and saw him in the presence of all buddhas, honoring the buddhas and guiding all sentient beings to full development. She also saw all the enlightening beings reflected in the body of Universal Good, and saw herself there too in the presence of all the buddhas, in the presence of all the enlightening beings reflected in the body of Universal Good, in the abodes of all sentient beings. In each of those worlds she also saw as many worlds as atoms in a buddha-land, with their boundaries, bases, forms, masses, and various purities of adornment, covered by clouds of various supernal manifestations, with various names and numbers of ages, various lineages of buddhas appearing, various temporal locations, various spatial locations, belonging to various phenomenal realms within various planes of the cosmos, situated in various planes of space, with various arrays of enlightenment sites, various lights projected by buddhas, various buddhas’ lion thrones, various oceanic audiences of buddhas, various circulations of the audiences of buddhas, various clarifications by the skill in means of buddhas, various buddhas’ ways of turning the wheel of teaching, various sayings of buddhas, various indications of oceans of ways of expressing thought, and enunciations of multitudes of various scriptures.

mthong nas de bas kyang dga' ba dang mos pa'i shugs chen po thob par gyur te/ de de ltar dga' ba'i shugs chen po skyes par gyur pa la/ bcom ldan 'das ye shes rin po che'i 'od kun tu 'phro ba'i dpal yon tan dpal gyi rgyal po de bzhin gshegs pa des/ de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi chos kyi 'khor lo rab tu bsgrags pa zhes bya ba'i mdo sde/ 'khor gyi mdo sde sangs rgyas kyi zhing bcu'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed dang bcas pa yang dag par bstan te/ des mdo sde de thos par gyur nas/ ting nge 'dzin gyi sgo stong phrag bcu shin tu phra zhing reg na bde ba thob par gyur te/ de ni/ dper na/ ma'i mngal du rnam par shes pa zhugs par gyur ma thag pa lta bu dang / 'di lta ste/ dper na/ sems can rnams kyi las mngon par bsgrubs pa lta bu dang / 'di lta ste/ dper na/ zhing bzang po dam pa'i sa bon btab nas ring po ma lon yang myu gu skye ba'i rgyur gyur pa lta bu ste/ de bzhin du ting nge 'dzin de dag kyang 'jam zhing yid du 'ong ba ste/ 'di ltar de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad mngon du rnam par dmigs pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin dang / zhing 'byams klas pa thams cad du snang ba rjes su song ba zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin dang / dus gsum gyi tshul thams cad la 'jug pa khong du chud pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin dang / de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi chos kyi 'khor lo sgrog pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin dang / sangs rgyas thams cad kyi smon lam rgya mtsho rnam par dmigs pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin dang / 'khor ba thams cad kyi sdug bsngal gyis gzir ba'i sems can 'byung ba'i nga ro rab tu bsgrags pas rnam par dmigs par byed pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin dang / sems can thams cad kyi mun nag rnam par sel ba'i smon lam gyi rgyan ces bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin dang / sems can thams cad sdug bsngal dang dbral ba'i smon lam gyis rnam par dmigs pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin dang / sems can thams cad kyi bde ba 'grub pa yongs su 'byin pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin dang / sems can thams cad yongs su smin par bya ba dang / gdul bas mi skyo ba'i snying po zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin dang / byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyi lam la 'jug pa'i rgyal mtshan zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin dang / byang chub sems dpa'i sa thams cad yongs su gnon par sgrub pa'i rgyan ces bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin dang / de dag la sogs pa ting nge 'dzin gyi sgo stong phrag bcu rnams des thob par gyur to/ /

“Seeing all these, she was all the more enraptured. The buddha expounded to her in her rapture a scripture called Voice of the Cycles of Teaching of All Buddhas, along with as many accompanying scriptures as atoms in ten buddha-lands. When she had heard these scriptures, ten hundred thousand kinds of concentration entered into her, subtle and pleasant, like the consciousness of an embryo on the first day in the mother’s womb, like the commencement of activity in beings, like the impulse of the sprout in the seed of a tree on the day it is planted—this is how subtle and full of potential those concentrations were. Ten hundred thousand concentrations descended into her, beginning with such concentrations as one called ‘face-to-face communication with all buddhas,’ one called ‘illumination of all lands,’ one called ‘penetrating the principles of all pasts, presents, and futures,’ one called ‘voice of the teaching activity of all buddhas,’ one called ‘communicating the ocean of vows of all buddhas,’ one called ‘communicating the voice of all means of emancipation from all suffering and torture of the mundane whirl,’ one called ‘manifestation of the vow to dispel the darkness of all sentient beings,’ one called ‘determination to release all sentient beings from suffering’ one called ‘source of achievement of happiness for all sentient beings,’ one called ‘source of tireless developmental guidance for all sentient beings,’ one called ‘characterized by entry into the path of all enlightening beings,’ and one called ‘supernal manifestation produced by entry into the stages of all enlightening beings.’

de phra ba la mnyam par bzhag pa'i sems dang / mi g.yo ba'i sems dang / rab tu dga' ba'i sems dang / dbugs phyin pa'i sems dang / dpag tu med pa'i sems dang / dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyi rjes su 'brang ba'i sems dang / thams cad mkhyen pa nyid shin tu zab pa la dmigs pa'i sems dang / byams pa'i rjes su 'gro ba'i tshul rgya mtsho la zhugs pa'i sems dang / mngon par zhen pa thams cad las gyen du 'phags pa'i sems dang / 'jig rten gyi yul thams cad la mi gnas pa'i sems dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i yul la 'jug pa'i sems dang / sangs rgyas thams cad kyi gzugs dang / kha dog rgya mtshos snang bar gyur pa'i sems dang / 'khrug pa med pa'i sems dang / g.yo ba med pa'i sems dang / khong khro ba med pa'i sems dang / mthon dman med pa'i sems dang / mi skyo ba'i sems dang / mi zlog pa'i sems dang / zhum pa med pa'i sems dang / chos thams cad kyi rang bzhin nges par rtogs pa'i sems dang / chos thams cad kyi tshul rgya mtsho'i rjes su song ba'i sems dang / chos thams cad rab tu 'byed pa'i tshul gyi rjes su song ba'i sems dang / sems can rgya mtsho thams cad la 'jug pa'i sems dang / 'gro ba thams cad yongs su bskyab pa'i sems dang / sangs rgyas rgya mtsho mang po'i snang ba yongs su skyes pa'i sems dang / de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi smon lam rgya mtsho la 'jug pa'i sems dang / sgrib pa thams cad kyi ri rnam par 'thor ba'i sems dang / bsod nams kyi tshogs rgya chen po yang dag par sgrub pa'i sems dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu la spobs pa mngon sum du gyur pa'i sems dang / byang chub sems dpa'i yul thams cad la snang ba thob pa'i sems dang / byang chub sems dpa'i tshogs thams cad 'phel bar byed pa'i sems dang / phyogs rgya mtsho thams cad rgyas par 'gengs pa'i sems dang ldan pas/ kun tu bzang po'i smon lam chen po la lhag par dmigs par bya bas/ smon lam rgya mtsho sangs rgyas kyi zhing bcu'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed kyis/ de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi sngon gyi smon lam rang gi sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par bya ba'i don du mngon par bsgrub ste/ 'di ltar sems can gyi khams thams cad yongs su smin par bya ba dang / gdul bar bya ba dang / chos kyi dbyings 'byams klas pa yongs su shes par bya ba dang / chos kyi dbyings kyi tshul rgya mtsho la 'jug par bya ba dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing thams cad du phyi ma'i bskal par byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa spyad par bya ba dang / byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa'i dkyil 'khor thams cad la phyi ma'i mtha'i bskal par gnas par bya ba dang / de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi drung du 'gro bar bya ba dang / dge ba'i bshes gnyen thams cad bsnyen bkur ba dang / de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad la mchod cing rim gror bya ba yongs su rdzogs par bya ba dang / sems kyi skad cig re re la thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes rnam par bsgrub pa dang / rnam par 'tshang rgya bar bya bas byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa rgyun mi gcod par bya ba'i phyir/ de dag la sogs pa smon lam mngon par bsgrub pa'i sgo rgya mtsho sangs rgyas kyi zhing bcu'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed kyis/ byang chub sems dpa' kun tu bzang po'i spyod pa la smon lam mngon par sgrub par gyur to/ /

“With her mind subtly concentrated, unwavering, joyful, refreshed, unpreoccupied, in harmony with the wise, focused on profound omniscience, swelling with oceanic love, free from all attachments, not dwelling on any worldly objects, entering the sphere of those who arrive at Thusness, aware of the appearances of all buddhas, unperturbed, unagitated, unobstructed, unfragmented, neither excited nor depressed, tireless, unretreating, undiscouraged, meditating on the inherent nature of all things, realizing the ocean of principles based on the inherent nature of all things, following the principles of investigation of all things, plunging into the ocean of all sentient beings, determined to save all worldlings, illumined by the vast ocean of buddhas, plunging into the ocean of vows of all buddhas, breaking through all obstructions to enlightenment, gathering great stores of virtue, on the verge of attainment of the ten powers of buddhas, aware of the realms of all enlightening beings, amassing the provisions of all enlightening beings for the path of enlightenment, her mind reaching everywhere to take up the great vow of universal good, by as many oceans of vows as atoms in ten buddha-lands she undertook the past vow of all buddhas for the purification of their own buddha-lands. That is, by guiding all sentient beings to perfection, to know all ways to the realm of reality, to enter the ocean of all ways to the realm of reality, to enter enlightening practice in all buddha-lands forever, to live in the sphere of the practices of all enlightening beings forever, to visit all buddhas, to associate with all spiritual benefactors, to fully honor and serve all buddhas, to continue with each moment of consciousness the practice of enlightening beings which increasingly becomes aware of omniscient knowledge. She undertook the vow of universally good enlightening practice by means of as many oceans of ways of undertaking vows as atoms in ten buddha-lands, beginning with such vows as these.

de'i byang chub sems dpa' kun tu bzang po'i spyod pa dang / smon lam mngon par bsgrub pa'i phyir/ bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa ye shes rin po che'i 'od kun tu 'phro ba'i dpal yon tan dpal gyi rgyal pos/ sngon gyi dge ba'i rtsa ba yongs su bskul ba mdzad do/ /rab tu bstan pa mdzad do/ /yongs su bstan pa mdzad do/ /rnam par dbye ba mdzad do/ /rnam par dgrol bar mdzad do/ /yang dag par bstan par mdzad do/ /chud za bar mi 'gyur bar bya ba'i phyir rab tu brtan par mdzad do/ /rgya chen por khyab par bya ba'i phyir shin tu yangs par mdzad do/ /thams cad mkhyen pa nyid lhur len par bya ba'i phyir rab tu gnas par mdzad do/ /de ni 'di lta ste/ thog ma sems bskyed pa nas nye bar bzung ba phyin chad/ de bzhin gshegs pa'i sngon gyi smon lam rgya mtsho grangs med pa rab tu thob par bya ba'i phyir ro/ /

“Then the buddha Paragon of Virtue Radiant with the Light of Universal Knowledge made her aware of his past roots of goodness and inspired her to achieve them—he made them clear to her, revealed them, described them, analyzed them, and explained them; he strengthened them to endure without perishing, extended them to great range, and firmly established them so as to make them equal to the measure of omniscience, so she would apprehend, from the first determination for enlightenment, the incalculable past vows of the enlightened.

rigs kyi bu/ sngon 'das pa'i dus/ de'i yang pha rol gyi bskal pa bcu pa la/ 'jig rten gyi khams rin chen nyi ma'i 'khor lo rnam par snang ba'i 'od ces bya bar/ de bzhin gshegs pa zla ba'i rgyal mtshan dpal gyi gsung rab la/ bu mo ye shes kyi 'od kun tu 'phro ba pad+mo bzang mo mig yid du 'ong ba'i dpal gyi zla ba des/ byang chub sems dpa' kun tu bzang pos yongs su bskul te/ de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku gzugs pad+mo la bzhugs pa zhig bcos so/ /bcos nas kyang ri mo bris so/ /ri mo bris nas kyang rin po ches shin tu brgyan to/ /dge ba'i bshes gnyen byang chub sems dpa' kun tu bzang po la brten te/ bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu'ang sems bskyed do/ /de dge ba'i rtsa ba des log par mi ltung ba'i chos can du gyur te/ rtag tu lha'i dbang po'i rigs dang / mi'i dbang po'i rigs su skyes par gyur to/ /thams cad du yang gzugs mdzes shing sdug la blta na yid du 'ong ba dang / kha dog bzang po shin tu rgyas pa dam pa dang ldan par gyur te/ rtag tu de bzhin gshegs pa mthong ba dang / byang chub sems dpa' kun tu bzang po dang yang bral bar ma gyur to/ /dge ba'i bshes gnyen de nyid kyis tshe rabs de dang / de dag tu yongs su smin par byas so/ /dran par byas so/ /nga yang des byang chub sems dpa' kun tu bzang po yongs su bsnyen bkur te/ yid byung bar ma byas so; ;

“Ten eons before that, in the world Light Shining from a Jewel Sun and Moon, in which the teaching of the buddha Moonlike Brilliance was preserved, that same woman, instructed by the enlightening being Universally Good, repaired a ruined image of the Buddha seated on a lotus, painted it, and adorned it, having gone to Universally Good with the aspiration for enlightenment. Because of that root of goodness, she never fell into misfortune and always was born in celestial or human families and was always beautiful. She always saw buddhas and associated with the enlightening being Universally Good, and in every life was developed, inspired, and caused to be mindful by that spiritual benefactor. At this time, furthermore, Universally Good was thoroughly pleased with her.

rigs kyi bu/ de la ji snyam du sems/ de'i tshe de'i du sa na 'khor los bsgyur ba'i rgyal po rnam par snang ba rin chen pad+mo dpal gyi gtsug phud snying po zhes bya ba byung ba de gzhan zhig yin pa snyam du sems na ni/ rigs kyi bu khyod kyis de ltar mi blta ste/ byang chub sems dpa' byams pa ni/ de'i tshe de'i dus na/ 'khor los bsgyur ba'i rgyal po rnam par snang ba rin chen pad+mo dpal gyi gtsug phud snying po zhes bya bar gyur to/ /rigs kyi bu/ de'i tshe de'i dus na/ rgyal po'i btsun mo dpal gyi gzhir yongs su rgyas pa zhes bya ba byung ba de/ gzhan zhig yin pa snyam du sems na yang de ltar mi blta ste/ mtshan mo'i lha mo kho mo'i drung na 'dug pa sgra rgya mtsho rab tu zhi ba dang ldan pa 'di yin no/ / rigs kyi bu/ de la ji snyam du sems/ de'i tshe de'i dus na/ rgyal po'i bu mo ye shes kyi 'od kun tu 'phro ba pad+mo bzang mo mig yid du 'ong ba'i dpal gyi zla ba zhes bya ba byung ba de/ gzhan zhig yin pa snyam du sems na ni de ltar mi blta ste/ kho mo ni de'i tshe de'i dus na/ rgyal po'i bu mo ye shes kyi 'od kun tu 'phro ba pad+mo bzang mo mig yid du 'ong ba'i dpal gyi zla ba zhes bya bar gyur to/ /kho mo bu mo gzhon nur gyur te/ de bzhin gshegs pa dbang po'i rgyal mtshan dpal gyi gsung rab la/ de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku pad+mo la bzhugs pa bcos pa de ni/ kho mo'i bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi rgyur gyur to/ /de'i tshe byang chub sems dpa' kun tu bzang pos kho mo bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su bskul ba de ni kho mos byang chub tu sems dang po bskyed pa yin no/ /kho mos bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa ye shes rin po che'i 'od kun tu 'phro ba'i dpal gyi yon tan dpal gyi rgyal po'i drung du phyin te/ rgyan gyis gtor nas/ de bzhin gshegs pa'i rnam par 'phrul pa dang / cho 'phrul mthong bar gyur te/ kho mos bcom ldan 'das de'i drung nas chos thos par gyur pa de'i tshe/ kho mos byang chub sems dpa'i rnam par thar pa 'jig rten thams cad mngon du gyur pas 'gro ba rnam par 'dul ba ston pa 'di thob bo/ /de bzhin gshegs pa ri rab kyi rdul shin tu phra ba snyed de dag thams cad kyang bsnyen bkur te/ yo byad dang mchod cing rim gror bya ba thams cad kyis kyang bkur stir byas so/ /de bzhin gshegs pa de dag gi chos bstan pa de dag thams cad kyang kho mos thos te/ de bzhin gshegs pa de dag gi gdams ngag dang / rjes su bstan pa la'ang zhugs par gyur to/ /de bzhin gshegs pa de dag la kho mos rim gro cher byas te/ rim gro de'i rnam pas sems kyi skad cig gcig la de bzhin gshegs pa de dag thams cad dang / byang chub sems dpa'i 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor de dag dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing de dag thams cad kyang mthong ste/

“Who do you think the king of that time was? It was none other than the enlightening being Manjushri, the Glorious One, who was the king. And do not suppose that it was anyone else but the night goddess Prashantarutasagaravati, who is seated here near me, who was the queen. And do not think it was anyone but I who was the daughter of the king and queen, who in the time of the teaching left by the buddha Moonlike Brilliance repaired a ruined image of the Buddha on a lotus. That became a determining factor for me all the way to supreme enlightenment. And when I was directed by the enlightening being Universally Good toward supreme perfect enlightenment, I first aroused the determination for enlightenment. Then, when I went to the buddha Paragon of Virtue Radiant with the Light of Universal Knowledge and cast my jewelry over him, saw the buddha’s miraculous power, and heard the Teaching from him, I attained this enlightening liberation showing guidance to all sentient beings. And I propitiated all those buddhas, numerous as atoms in the polar mountain, and honored them with all kinds of offerings. And I listened to all their teachings, and put their instructions into practice; and I gained such intense respect for those buddhas that in a single moment of thought I would see all those buddhas, their circles of enlightening beings, and their buddha-lands.

'jig rten gyi khams rnam par snang ba'i khams de ni 'das par gyur/ bskal pa rdul dang bral ba'i dkyil 'khor de ni mthar phyin par gyur nas/ de'i rjes la 'jig rten gyi khams ni/ rin chen 'khor lo sna tshogs kyis klubs shing brgyan pa zhes bya/ bskal pa ni 'od chen po zhes bya ba zhig byung ste/ de la sangs rgyas lnga brgya byung bar gyur to/ /de dag thams cad kyang kho mos bsnyen bkur te/ bskal pa 'od chen po la de bzhin gshegs pa thugs rje chen po sprin gyi rgyal mtshan zhes bya ba bskal pa'i dang po la byung ste/ de mngon par 'byung ba'i tshe/ kho mo mtshan mo'i lha mor gyur pas mchod pa byas so/ /de'i 'og tu de bzhin gshegs pa rdo rje mthu bo che'i dpal zhes bya ba byung ste/ de la kho mos 'khor lo bsgyur bar gyur pas mchod pa byas so/ /de bzhin gshegs pa des kho mo la mdo sde sangs rgyas thams cad skye zhing 'byung ba zhes bya ba/ mdo sde sangs rgyas kyi zhing bcu'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed kyi 'khor dang bcas pa yang dag par bstan te/ de yang kho mos thos nas yongs su bzung ngo/ /de'i 'og tu de bzhin gshegs pa me'i 'od 'phro ri'i dpal gyis rnam par brgyan pa zhes bya ba byung ste/ de la kho mo tshong dpon gyi bu mor gyur pas mchod pa byas so/ /de bzhin gshegs pa des kho mo la mdo sde/ dus gsum snang ba'i snying po zhes bya ba/ mdo sde dzam+bu'i gling gi rdul shin tu phra ba snyed kyi 'khor dang bcas pa yang dag par bstan te/ de yang kho mos thos nas yongs su bzung ngo/ /de'i 'og tu de bzhin gshegs pa chos rgya mtsho thams cad kyis mngon par 'phags pa'i shugs kyi rgyal po zhes bya ba byung ste/ de la kho mo lha'i rgyal por gyur bas mchod pa byas so/ /de bzhin gshegs pa des kho mo la mdo sde chos kyi dbyings kyi gzhi thams cad shes pa'i bye brag ces bya ba mdo sde lnga brgya'i 'khor dang bcas pa yang dag par bstan te/ de'ang kho mos thos nas yongs su bzung ngo/ /de'i 'og tu de bzhin gshegs pa chos zab mo'i dpal rgya mtshos yang dag par 'byung ba'i 'od ces bya ba byung ste/ de la kho mo klu'i dbang po'i bu mor gyur pas/ nor bu rin po che yid bzhin gyi rgyal po'i sprin gyi char mngon par phab ste/ mchod pa byas so/ /de bzhin gshegs pa des kho mo la mdo sde dga' ba rgya mtsho rnam par 'phel ba shugs zhes bya ba/ mdo sde bye ba brgya stong phrag bcu'i 'khor dang bcas pa yang dag par bstan te/ de'ang kho mos thos nas yongs su bzung ngo/ /de'i 'og tu de bzhin gshegs pa rin chen ri bo'i spo'i 'od zer sgron ma zhes bya ba byung ste/ de la kho mo rgya mtsho'i lha mor gyur pas/ rin po che'i pad+mo'i sprin gyi char gyis nye bar bsnyen te mchod pa byas so/ /de bzhin gshegs pa des kho mo la mdo sde chos kyi dbyings rgya mtsho'i tshul zhes bya ba mdo sde sangs rgyas kyi zhing rdul shin tu phra ba snyed kyi 'khor dang bcas pa yang dag par bstan te/ de'ang kho mos thos nas yongs su blangs so/ /dran pas yang dag par bzung ngo/ /de'i 'og tu de bzhin gshegs pa yon tan rgya mtsho snang ba'i dkyil 'khor gyi dpal zhes bya ba byung ste/ de la kho mo drang srong mngon par shes pa lnga dang ldan par gyur pa/ drang srong stong phrag drug cus kun nas bskor bas/ rdzu 'phrul chen po'i rnam par 'phrul pas nye bar bsnyen te/ spos kyi me tog ri bo tsam gyi sprin gyi char mngon par phab nas mchod pa byas so/ /de bzhin gshegs pa kho mo la mdo sde chos gnas med pa'i sgron ma zhes bya ba mdo sde stong phrag drug cu'i 'khor dang bcas pa yang dag par bstan te/ de'ang kho mos thos nas yongs su bzung ngo/ /de'i 'og tu de bzhin gshegs pa rnam par snang mdzad dpal gyi snying po zhes bya ba byung ste/ kho mo yang mnyam pa nyid kyi don 'byung ba zhes bya ba'i sa'i lha mo zhig tu gyur nas kho mo sa'i lha mo'i 'khor grangs med pa dang bcas pas/ rin po che'i shing thams cad kyi lhun las/ rin po che'i me tog gi sprin gyi char mngon par phab ste/ rin po che'i phreng ba'i sprin gyi char yang rab tu phab nas/ de bzhin gshegs pa de la mchod pa bya ba'i phyir spyan sngar phyin to/ /de bzhin gshegs pa des/ kho mo la mdo sde de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad yang dag par 'byung ba'i gnas kyi snying po zhes bya ba/ mdo sde grangs med pa'i 'khor dang bcas pa yang dag par bstan te/ de'ang kho mos thos nas bzung ste/ chud zos par ma byas so/ /

“When that world Radiant Brilliance had passed away and the age Sphere of Dispassion was over, there followed a world called Magnificent Array Brilliantly Adorned with Jewel Discs, and an age called Great Light; five hundred buddhas emerged therein, and I propitiated them all. The first buddha in that age was named Representative of Great Compassion; when he was leaving home, I, who had become a night goddess, made offerings to him. After him, a buddha named Adamantine Paragon of Man arose; I, at that time a ruler, made offerings to him, and he expounded to me a scripture called Source of All Buddhas, accompanied by as many scriptures as atoms in ten buddha-lands, which I listened to and took up. After that a buddha named Magnificent Array of Lights of a Mountain of Blazing Fire appeared; at that time the daughter of a grandee, I made offerings to him, and he expounded to me a scripture called Containing the Manifestations of Past, Present, and Future, accompanied by as many scriptures as atoms in the continent, which I listened to and took up. After that a buddha named King of Energy Risen Above the Ocean of All Phenomena appeared in the world; at that time a titan chieftain, I made offerings to him, and he expounded to me a scripture called Analysis of Knowledge of the Planes of All Reality Realms, accompanied by five hundred scriptures, which I listened to and took up. After that a buddha named Light of the Ocean of Splendor of the Profound Doctrine appeared; at that time the daughter of a chief water spirit, I honored him with a shower of wish-fulfilling jewels, and he expounded to me a scripture called Light of Reason in the Ocean of Reality Realms, accompanied by as many scriptures as atoms in ten buddha-lands, which I listened to, took up, and memorized. After that a buddha named Splendor of the Multitude of Manifestations of the Ocean of Virtue appeared; at that time a seer with five kinds of occult knowledge, I went to him by magical power with a company of six thousand seers and honored him with incense and flowers. He expounded to me a scripture called Lamp of Independence, accompanied by six thousand scriptures, which I listened to and took up. After that a buddha named Imbued with Sunny Radiance appeared. At that time I was an earth goddess named Source of Common Weal; accompanied by countless earth goddesses, I went to that buddha showering jewel flowers and garlands from trees of all jewels as tokens of honor. He expounded a scripture called Womb of Knowledge from Which All Buddhas Are Born, along with countless scriptures, which I listened to and remembered permanently.

rigs kyi bu/ de bzhin gshegs pa lnga brgya po de dag thams cad kyi tha mar/ de bzhin gshegs pa chos kyi dbyings nam mkha' mdzod spus yongs su rgyas pa'i rtse mo dpal gyi sgron ma zhes bya ba 'jig rten du byung ste/ de'i tshe kho mo yang gar mkhan gyi bu mo bzhin mngon par mdzes pa'i dpal zhes bya ba zhig tu gyur te/ de bzhin gshegs pa de grong khyer du gshegs nas/ gar mkhan gyi tshogs kyis rol mo byas pa'i tshe/ kho mos sangs rgyas kyi byin gyis steng gi nam mkha'i dbyings las tshigs su bcad pa stong gis/ de bzhin gshegs pa de la mngon par bstod de spyan sngar phyin to/ /de bzhin gshegs pa des mdzod spu nas 'od zer chos dbyings rnam par snang ba'i rgyan ces bya ba bkye ste/ kho mo'i lus thams cad kyang snang bar mdzad do; ;'od zer des kho mo la phog ma thag tu/ rnam par thar pa chos kyi dbyings kyi tshul yongs su 'khyil ba'i snying po zhes bya ba thob par gyur cing /

“The last of those five hundred buddhas was named Lamp Radiant As a Mountain Peak of Jewels Filling the Space of the Cosmos. At that time I was a dancing girl named Radiantly Beautiful Face. When the buddha came into the city, I began to dance and by the power of the buddha rose into the air and went to the buddha, praising him with a thousand verses. He illumined my whole body with a light called Array of Cosmic Lightning, which emanated from the circle of hair between his brows; and as soon as that light touched me I attained a liberation called ‘offspring of contemplation of the principles of the reality realm.’

rigs kyi bu/ de ltar de bzhin gshegs pa de dag la sogs pa/ bskal pa 'od chen po la 'jig rten gyi khams rin chen 'khor lo sna tshogs kyis klubs shing brgyan par sangs rgyas lnga brgya byung bar gyur pa de dag thams cad kyang mnyes par byas te/ de bzhin gshegs pa de dag la kho mos mchod pa yang byas so/ /de bzhin gshegs pa de dag gis kho mo la chos bstan pa de dag thams cad kyang dran te/ chos kyi tshul de dag las yi ge 'ga'am/ tshig 'ga' yang brjed par ma gyur to/ /de bzhin gshegs pa de dag re re'i drung du 'gro ba'i tshe yang / sangs rgyas kyi chos yongs su brjod par bya bas sems can tshad med pa'i don byas so/ /de bzhin gshegs pa de dag re re la'ang kho mos chos kyi dbyings kyi rang bzhin rgya mtsho dus gsum gyi ye shes kyi snying po/ chos kyi dbyings shin tu yangs pa zhes bya ba'i thams cad mkhyen pa'i glog mngon par snang ba/ kun tu bzang po'i spyod pa thams cad la gnas par yang dag par gzhol ba thob par gyur te/ rigs kyi bu/ kho mo la ni da ltar yang sems kyi skad cig re re la de bzhin gshegs pa mtha' dang dbus med pa yongs su snang ste/ de bzhin gshegs pa de dag kho mos mthong bar gyur pas thams cad mkhyen pa'i glog mngon par snang ba sngan chad ma thob pa/ sngan chad ma mthong ba dag kyang kho mo'i sems kyi rgyud la gnas par gyur te/ 'on kyang byang chub sems dpa' kun tu bzang po'i spyod pa las g.yo ba med do/ / de ci'i phyir zhe na/ thams cad mkhyen pa'i glog mngon par snang ba thob pa 'di ni mtha' dang dbus med par bstan pa'o/ /

“Thus I associated with and honored all the five hundred buddhas of that age in that world, and I remember everything they taught me, forgetting nothing, not even a line or letter. Also, as I went to each buddha, I benefited innumerable beings by describing the ways of buddhas. Also, from each buddha I obtained illumination by the lightning of omniscience, called ‘womb of knowledge of past, present, and future, extensive as the cosmos,’ which is the oceanic body of the reality realm, containing at once all the practices of universal good. Now I perceive infinite buddhas in each mental moment, and from seeing those buddhas, flashes of light of omniscience which I have not previously apprehended or seen enter into my mind, and I do not fall away from the practice of universally good enlightening beings. Why? Because apprehending these flashes of light of omniscience is endlessly and infinitely revealing and instructive.”

de nas mtshan mo'i lha mo sems can kun tu skyong ba'i gzi brjid dpal gyis/ de'i tshe byang chub sems dpa'i rnam par thar pa 'jig rten thams cad mngon du gyur pas 'gro ba rnam par 'dul ba zhes bya ba 'di brnan te bstan pa dang / rnam par dbye bar bya ba'i phyir/ sangs rgyas kyi byin gyi rlabs kyis tshong dpon gyi bu nor bzang la tshigs su bcad de smras pa/
Then the night goddess Samantasattvatranojahshri spoke these verses to Sudhana, further elucidating the enlightening liberation showing guidance for beings in all worlds:

zab mo blta dka' khong du chud dka' ste/ / dus gsum dbyings kun tha dad tshul ldan la/ / chos 'od dkyil 'khor kun tu 'od 'byung ba'i/ / kho mo'i tshig 'di nor bzang mnyan par gyis/ /
sangs rgyas yon tan 'dod pas byang chub tu/ / kho mos thog ma ji ltar sems bskyed dang / / ji ltar kho mos rnam thar 'di thob pa/ / de dag rnam par phye ba'i tshul 'di nyon/ /
'di nas sangs rgyas zhing gi rdul snyed kyi/ / bskal pa gcig nas gcig brgyud pha rol tu/ / 'jig rten khams yangs dri ma'i skyon med pa/ / rnam snang rgyal mtshan sgron ma'i dpal byung ste/ /
bskal pa rdul dang bral ba'i dkyil 'khor byung / / de la sangs rgyas rigs ni rgyun ma chad/ / de tshe ri rab rdul phran rab snyed kyi/ / stobs bcu skyon med mang po byung bar gyur/ /
de la bde gshegs thog mar rin chen 'od/ / kun tu 'phro dpal yon tan dpal rgyal byung / / rgyal ba chos kyi rgyal mtshan ri rab dpal/ / yon tan seng+ge'i dbang po rgyal ba bzhi/ /
rgyal ba bzhi pa'i rgyal po skye bcil dang / / grags pa'i ri bo yon tan ri rab dpal/ / rgyal ba nyi ma zla zhal bcom ldan 'das/ / bcu po 'di dag tshul 'di thog ma'o/ /
rgyal ba nam mkha'i gzhi dang kun nas 'od/ / phyogs su yongs byung dran pa rgya mtsho'i sgo/ / rgyal ba mngon 'phags 'od mnga' ri rab dpal/ / bde gshegs chos kyi 'od 'phro ri bo dpal/ /
thugs rje che mnga' dgu pa pad+mos 'phags/ / sangs rgyas bcu pa chos dbyings me tog ste; / sangs rgyas rgya mtsho yongs su brjod pa las/ / tshul 'di bcu pa gnyis pa 'di yin no/ /
'od dpal rgyal po ye shes blo gros dang / / sna tshogs don dbang dpal gyi blo gros lha; ; rgyal ba shugs kyi rgyal blo ye shes dpal/ / snang ba'i rgyal po 'od kyi rgyal mtshan dpal/ /
rgyal ba rnam par gnon pa'i lha stabs dang / / de bzhin chos dbyings pad+mo bcu pa ste; ; rgya chen yongs su bstan las tshul 'di ni/ / tshul 'dir bcu pa gsum pa bstan pa'o/ /
rin chen 'od 'phro ri dpal bcom ldan 'das/ / de yi 'og ma yon tan rgya mtsho dpal/ / chos kyi 'od dang pad+mo snying po dpal/ / 'gro ba'i zla ba spyan tshul bde bar gshegs/ /
spos kyi 'od dang rin chen ri rab dpal/ / rgyal ba dri za lus 'od rgyal po dang / / rin chen snying po rgyal dpal gzi brjid ldan/ / rgyal ba bcu pa zhi ba'i gzugs rtsi stabs/ /
de yi 'og ma rgyal ba rgya chen blo/ / rin chen 'od dang nam mkha'i sprin gyi dpal/ / rgyal ba dam pa'i mtshan gyi dpal gyur dang / / brtul zhugs dkyil 'khor rang gi lus kyi 'od/ /
mthu chen brtul zhugs ri rab dpal mnga' dang / / rgyal ba yon tan khor yug dpal gyi rgyal/ / bcom ldan mi pham brtul zhugs rgyal mtshan dang / / shing gi ri bo rgyal ba de dag bcu/ /
rgyal ba sA la'i rgyal po dpal gyi mchog / 'jig rten dbang po'i lus ni snang ba'i 'od/ / mngon par 'phags 'od dpal gyi bcom ldan 'das/ / rdo rje 'od dang sa yi gzi brjid dpal/ /
rgyal ba zab chos 'od kyi rgyal po dpal/ / chos kyi rgya mtsho dbyangs kyi blo gros dang / / ri rab rgyal mtshan dpal dang blo gros snang / / rgyal ba bcu pa rin chen rgyal po dpal/ /
tshangs pa'i 'od dang rgyal ba nam mkha'i dbyings/ / de bzhin chos kyi dbyings ni gzugs brnyan dpal/ / snang ba'i dkyil 'khor 'od kyi bcom ldan 'das/ / tha dad phyogs mkhyen ye shes blo gros dang / /
nam mkha'i sgron ma mngon par dga' ba'i dpal/ / rnam par snang mdzad 'od dpal bde bar gshegs/ / bsod nams rab tu snang dpal zhi ba'i dpal/ / bcu pa snying rje chen po sprin gyi dpal/ /
de bzhin nyi 'od stobs snang blo gros/ dang / / rgyal ba 'gro ba thams cad mngon gzugs dang / / de tshe rgyal ba mngon 'phags 'od mnga' 'byung / / de yi 'og ma zhi ba'i sku yi 'od/ /
chos 'phags bde gshegs de bzhin byung bar gyur/ / de yi 'og ma rlung gi drag shul dpal/ / dpa' ba'i rgyal mtshan rin chen lus kyi dpal/ / dus gsum snang ba'i 'od ni bcu pa'o/ /
smon lam rgya mtsho rab tu snang dpal dang / / gnyis pa dgongs pa rdo rje ri bo dpal/ / rgyal ba gsum pa seng+ge ri rab dpal/ / dran pa'i rgyal mtshan rgyal po chos dpal blo/ /
shes rab sgron ma 'od kyi rgyal mtshan dpal/ / de yi 'og ma rgyal ba rgya chen blo/ / rgyal ba chos dbyings tshul gyi ye shes stabs/ / chos kyi rgya mtsho blo gros ye shes dpal/ /
chos 'dzin pa dang rin chen sbyin dpal dang / / rgyal ba yon tan khor yug dpal gyi sprin/ / bzod pa'i sgron ma dpal dang gzi brjid ldan/ / shugs 'ong zhi gnas dbyangs kyi rgyal ba dang / /
zhi ba'i rgyal mtshan 'gro ba'i sgron ma dpal/ / sangs rgyas smon lam chen po shugs kyi dpal/ / bcom ldan gzhan gyis mi thub rgyal mtshan stobs/ / rgyal ba ye shes 'od 'phro rgya mtsho dpal/ /
rgyal ba chos dbang blo gros chags pa med/ / 'gro skad rgya mtsho dbyangs kyi blo gros dang / / thams cad dbyangs kyi yan lag sgra skad dpal/ / dbang sgyur mchod sbyin grags pa'i mchod sdong blo/ /
phyogs yul 'gro ba mngon sum bcom ldan 'das/ / sems can bsam par mnyam pa sku yi dpal/ / gzhan yang sangs rgyas gnas dang bcas pa'i dpal/ / rgyal ba rang bzhin lus dpal bzang po dang / /
der ni rgyal ba de la sogs pa byung / / de dag byung nas 'gro ba'i sgron ma mdzad/ / bskal pa ri rab shin tu phra rdul snyed/ / bdag gis rgyal ba rgya mtsho de dag mchod/ /
bskal pa sangs rgyas zhing gi rdul snyed po/ / de dag tu ni rgyal ba gang byung ba/ / bde gshegs de dag thams cad bdag gis mchod/ / rnam par thar ba'i tshul ni 'di la zhugs/ /
rnam par thar pa'i tshul 'di sgom byed cing / / bskal pa mtha' yas bdag gis sngon spyad kyi/ / khyod kyis thos nas nan tan myur gyis shig / tshul 'di ring po mi thogs thob par 'gyur/ /

Listen, Sudhana, as I tell Of what is deep, hard to see, hard to fathom: Means of distinction of the planes of all times, Total illumination of the appearances of things.
Listen to me explain how I first aspired to enlightenment In quest of the qualities of buddhas, And how I attained This liberation of awareness.
More eons ago than atoms in a buddha-land, There was a land called Radiant Brilliance, vast and pure, Where there was an age called Sphere of Dispassion, During which there was an unbroken succession of buddhas.
As many buddhas as atoms in the polar mountain, free from evil, appeared: The first was Paragon of Virtue Radiant with the Light of Universal Knowledge; Then Banner of Truth, Polar Mountain of Light, and Lion of Virtue; King of Peace, Continual Life, Lofty Renown, Glory of Supreme Virtue, Light Maker, Moon Face—these were the first ten buddhas there.
Vault of the Sky, Universal Light, Omnipresent, Source of the Sea of Mindfulness, Exalted, Summit of Glory, Light of Lofty Flames of Truth, Lotus Born, The Compassionate, and Flower of the Cosmos— These were the second ten, lighting the ocean of buddhas.
Mind of Foremost Light, Mind of Knowledge, Manifold Benefits, Glory of Indra, Celestial Intellect, Mind of Supreme Energy, Splendor of Knowledge, Brilliance of the Best of Lights, Mighty Celestial Stride, Lotus of the Cosmos— These were the third ten buddhas, revealing this vast teaching.
Splendor of a Mountain of Jewel Lights, then Radiant Ocean of Virtues, Light of Truth, Lotus-Born Glory, Moonlike Eye of the World, Fragrant Light, Brilliant As a Mountain of Jewels, Radiant King in the Form of a Celestial Musician, Full of Glorious Light of the Finest of Jewels, and tenth was Physically Calm.
After that were Vast Awareness, Jewel Luster, Splendor of Clouds in the Sky, Superb Appearance, magnificent, and Sphere of Holy Practices, radiant, Living Like Primeval Man, Splendid As the Polar Mountain, King Resplendent with Virtue, Paragon of Invincible Resolve, and Lofty Tree the tenth of them.
Imbued with the Splendor of the King of Trees, Reflection of the Bodies of the Leaders of the Worlds, Superlative Radiance, Spotless Light, Brilliance of the Energy of Earth, Glory of the Supreme Virtues of the Profound Teaching, Knowledge of the Sound of the Ocean of Truths, Pole of the World, Radiant Mind, Diamond Light.
Light of Brahma, Sound of Space, Splendor of Reflection of the Cosmos, Sphere Of Lights, Brilliant Mind with the Ten Powers of Knowledge, Lamp of Space, Beautiful Splendor, Glory of Sunlight, Light of Virtue, Tranquil Radiance, and Beauty of Clouds of Compassion, were the next ten buddhas.
Mindful of the Light of Power Born of Thusness, Appearing to All Beings, Exalted Light, Embodiment of Impartiality, Born of Truth, Swift As the Wind, Paragon of Heroism, Jewel Body Luster, Light Appearing in All Times— These were the next ten buddhas.
Shining Light of the Ocean of Vows, Splendor of the Mountain of Adamantine Will, Exalted Brilliance, Paragon of Mindfulness, Aware of Truth, Lamp of Wisdom, Radiance of the Most Excellent Light, then Vast Intellect, Following the Course of Knowledge of the Principles of the Cosmos, and Light of Knowledge of Oceanic Awareness.
Sublime Giver of Jewels of Truth, Clouds of Glory of Mountains of Virtue, Light of the Lamp of Peace, Light of Fiery Energy, Voice of Cessation, Paragon of Tranquillity, Radiant Lamp of the World, Energy of Great Vows, Invincible Power, Radiant Sea of Lights of Knowledge.
Spiritual Master, Unattached Mind, Understanding the Speech of All Beings, Articulate in All Languages, Resolved to Sacrifice Willingly, Appearing to All Beings Everywhere, Adopting Forms Congenial to All Beings, Living Together for the Benefit of Others, Embodiment of Nature, and the Buddha Good: Beginning with these, I served as many buddhas, light-makers, As atoms in the polar mountain.
And I served all the buddhas who appeared In as many eons as atoms in the buddha-lands, And entered this ocean of liberation.
I have practiced and developed this liberation for infinite eons; Having heard it and put it into practice, You will accomplish this teaching soon.

rigs kyi bu/ kho mos byang chub sems dpa'i rnam par thar pa 'jig rten thams cad mngon du gyur pas 'gro ba rnam par 'dul ba ston pa 'di shes par zad na/ /kho mos byang chub sems dpa' mtha' dang dbus med pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa rgya mtsho la mos pa sna tshogs kyis yang dag par gnas pa/ bsam pa sna tshogs kyi lus dang ldan pa/ dbang po rgya mtsho sna tshogs yongs su grub pa/ byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa dang / smon lam sna tshogs shin tu rtogs pa de dag gi spyod pa shes pa'am/ yon tan brjod par nus re skan/ song / rigs kyi bu/ snying po byang chub 'di nyid na/ kho mo dang rgyang mi ring ba zhig na mtshan mo'i lha mo sgra rgya mtsho rab tu zhi ba dang ldan pa zhes bya ba/ pad+mo'i khri rin po che'i rgyal po snang ba'i rgyal mtshan gyis rab tu brgyan pa zhig la 'dug cing / mtshan mo'i lha mo grangs med pa brgya stong phrag bcu'i 'khor gyis bskor ba 'dug gi /de'i gan du song la/ ji ltar byang chub sems dpas byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa la bslab par bya ba dang / ji ltar nan tan du bya ba dris shig /

“I know only this enlightening liberation showing guidance to beings in all worlds. How can I know the practice on tell the virtues of the enlightening beings who live by various resolutions in the infinitely varied ocean of enlightening practices, who manifest various minds and bodies, who have perfected oceans of various faculties, who have carried through the various vows of enlightening beings?
“In this same enlightenment site is a night goddess named Prashantarutasagaravati, who sits next to me on a lotus seat, in a calyx adorned with starry diamonds, surrounded by countless tens of hundreds of thousands of night goddesses—go ask her how to learn and carry out the practice of enlightening beings.”

de nas tshong dpon gyi bu nor bzang gis/ mtshan mo'i lha mo sems can kun tu skyong ba'i gzi brjid dpal gyi rkang pa gnyis la spyi bos phyag 'tshal te/ mtshan mo'i lha mo sems can kun tu skyong ba'i gzi brjid dpal la/ lan brgya stong du mar g.yas phyogs su bskor ba byas nas/ yang dang yang bltas te/ mtshan mo'i lha mo sems can kun tu skyong ba'i gzi brjid dpal gyi drung nas song ngo// //
So Sudhana paid his respects to the night goddess Samantasattvatranojahshri and left her.
shin tu rgyas pa chen po'i mdo/ sangs rgyas phal po che las/ sdong pos brgyan pa'i le'u ste/ bam po brgya gcig pa/

Prashantarutasagaravati

de nas tshong dpon gyi bu nor bzang mtshan mo'i lha mo sems can kun tu skyong ba'i gzi brjid dpal gyi byang chub sems dpa'i rnam par thar pa'i 'jig rten thams cad mngon du gyur pas 'gro ba rnam par 'dul ba de la yongs su bsgom zhing khong du chud par bya ba dang / yid ches par bya ba dang / 'jug par bya ba dang / shin tu rgyas par bya ba dang / yongs su khyab par bya ba dang / rab tu mchod par bya ba dang / dbang du bya ba dang / snang bar bya ba dang / yang dag par gzhol bar bya ba byed cing / mtshan mo'i lha mo sgra rgya mtsho rab tu zhi ba dang ldan pa gang na ba der phyin te mtshan mo'i lha mo sgra rgya mtsho rab tu zhi ba dang ldan pa'i rkang pa gnyis la spyi bos phyag 'tshal te mtshan mo'i lha mo sgra rgya mtsho rab tu zhi ba dang ldan pa la lan brgya stong du mar g.yas phyogs su bskor ba byas nas mtshan mo'i lha mo sgra rgya mtsho rab tu zhi ba dang ldan pa'i mdun du 'dug ste thal mo sbyar nas 'di skad ces smras so/ /'phags ma lha mo/ bdag ni/ bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub du yang dag par zhugs pa ste/ bdag ni/ dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyi rten gyis byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa la slob cing byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa la zhugs te byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa la nan tan du bgyi ba dang / byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa la rab tu gnas pas thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du 'byung bar 'tshal na/ 'phags ma lha mo/ ji ltar byang chub sems dpas byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa la bslab par bgyi ba dang / ji ltar nan tan du bgyi ba bdag la bshad du gsol/

Then Sudhana, cultivating that enlightening liberation of the night goddess Samantasattvatranojahshri, showing guidance to beings in all worlds, entering into it, becoming absorbed in it, plunging into it, expanding it, spreading it, extending it, mastering it, making it manifest, attaining it, went to the night goddess Prashantarutasagaravati. He paid his respects to her and said, “With the help of spiritual benefactors I am learning the practice of enlightening beings, entering into the practice of enlightening beings, carrying out the practice of enlightening beings; having undertaken the practice of enlightening beings, I want to become thoroughly familiar with omniscience. So please tell me, noble goddess, how an enlightening being is to learn and carry out the practice of enlightening beings.”

de nas mtshan mo'i lha mo sgra rgya mtsho rab tu zhi ba dang ldan pas tshong dpon gyi bu nor bzang la 'di skad ces smras so/ / rigs kyi bu/ de ltar khyod dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyi rten gyis byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa yongs su tshol ba legs so/ / legs so/ /rigs kyi bu/ kho mo ni/ byang chub sems dpa'i rnam par thar pa dga' ba yangs pa'i shugs 'byung bas sems kyi skad cig rnam par brgyan pa thob pa'o/ /nor bzang gis smras pa/ 'phags ma/ khyod ni/ 'phrin las ci mdzad/ yul gang dang ldan/ sbyor ba gang dang ldan/ ci la rnam par dpyod/ byang chub sems dpa'i rnam par thar pa dga' ba yangs pa'i shugs 'byung bas sems kyi skad cig rnam par brgyan pa de'i yul ni/ ji lta bu zhig mchis/

The goddess said, “It is good that you seek the ocean of practices of enlightening beings by relying on spiritual benefactors. I have attained an enlightening liberation of supernal manifestations of a moment of consciousness producing floods of immense joy.”
Sudhana said, “What is your activity, your sphere of action, your means of practice, your contemplation? What is the scope of this liberation?”

bsam pa la zhugs pa'o/ /brtsams pa las mi ldog /mi ldog pa'i sems dang ldan pa'o/ /rin po che'i ri bo ltar yon tan gyis brgyan pa'i sems mi sgul ba dang ldan pa'o/ /mi gnas mi rten pa'i sems dang ldan pa'o/ /'gro ba thams cad yongs su bskyab pa la mngon par phyogs pa'i sems can dang ldan pa'o/ /sangs rgyas rgya mtsho thams cad mthong bas mi ngoms pa'i sems dang ldan pa'o/ /byang chub sems dpa' gyur pa'o/ /sems can thams cad 'khor ba'i gnas kyi sdug bsngal las 'byung ba yang dag par ston pa la mngon par brtson pa'o/ /sems can thams cad kyi rga shi dang / mya ngan dang / smre sngags 'don pa ba dang / bskyab pa dang / rim gro bya ba yang legs par byed de/ de dag rim pas thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du yongs su smin par byed do/ /'di lta ste/ khang khyim dang / gzhal med khang na gnas pa'i sems can rnams kyi mngon par chags pa med pa yongs su skyed do/ /yid mi bde ba de dang de dag kyang rnam par sel to/ /mngon par zhen pa thams cad rgyun gcad pa dang / chos thams cad kyi rang bzhin yongs su shes par bya ba'i phyir chos ston to; ;pha ma dang / phu nu dang / sring mo dang / gnyen bshes dang / 'grogs pa'i sems can yun ring po nas bshes shing mdza' bar gyur pa dag las sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' dang 'phrad par bya ba'i phyir chos ston to/ /bu smad dang 'grogs pa'i sems can rnams la 'khor ba'i sred pa thams cad rab tu spang ba dang / sems can thams cad la mnyam pa ston to/ /glu dang / gar dang / rol mo la mngon par dga' ba'i sems can rnams la chos kyi dga' ba la mos par bya ba'i phyir chos ston to/ /yul gyi dga' ba la chags pa'i sems can rnams la de bzhin gshegs pa'i yul la yang dag par gzhol bar bya ba'i phyir chos ston to/ /khro bas yongs su non pa'i sems can rnams la bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la rab tu dgod par bya ba'i phyir chos ston to; ;

She said, “I have attained equanimity through purification of the ocean of mind. I have attained indestructible adornment undefiled by the taint of all worldly passion. My mind is unregressing and unswerving from its object. My mind is unshakable, adorned with virtues like a mountain of jewels. My mind is not fixed on anything, not dependent on anything. My mind is intent on serving all beings. My mind is tireless in seeing all buddhas. My desire for the powers of all enlightening beings is pure. My mind dwells in the ocean of mindfulness of the manifestations of great knowledge. I have set out to overcome the sorrows of all beings and am devoted to removing the suffering and sadness of all beings. I have undertaken to stop all beings’ preoccupation with objects of sense. I have undertaken to extinguish beings’ suffering caused by separation from loved ones and contact with the uncongenial. I am intent on stopping all the sufferings of beings that come from delusion arising from their relations to objects. I am a refuge for all fallen beings and am engaged in showing all beings means of emancipation from the miseries of the mundane whirl. I have undertaken to stop all sentient beings’ sadness, lamentation, suffering, depression, and mental disturbance occasioned by birth, old age, and death. I have undertaken to produce the supreme felicity of the enlightened in all beings. I find satisfaction in presenting my services for the happiness of beings in all abodes, and I see to their spiritual protection, and I gradually develop them to omniscience. That is to say, I produce detachment in beings who live in great palaces and mansions, and I remove their various melancholies, and in order to put an end to all attachments, I teach them to realize the intrinsic nature of all things. I teach those who have long-standing ties of affection with their families and relatives in such a way that they may get to meet and associate with buddhas and enlightening beings. Those who are involved with their spouses and children I teach in such a way as to extinguish their craving for mundane enjoyments and so that they will become impartial toward all and will come to have great compassion. Those in the marketplaces I teach in such a way that they will enter into association with the community of sages and get to meet enlightened people. Those who are obsessed with consumer goods I teach in such a way that they acquire transcendent forbearance. Those who take pleasure in music, song, and dance, I teach the way to enjoy spiritual pleasures. Those eagerly desirous of enjoyment of sense objects I teach in such a way that they may arrive at the realm of the enlightened. Those who are filled with anger I teach in such a way as to lead them to transcendent tolerance.
