dag par sgom pa dang / mtshan mo'i lha mo sgra rgya mtsho rab tu zhi ba dang ldan pa'i gdams ngag rjes su bstan pa la ni/ rjes su 'brang bar bya ba dang / rjes su dran par bya ba dang / khong du chud par byed/ tshig dang yi ge re re la ni/ tshul du ma dang bsam pa tshad med pas chos nyid kyi tshul shes pa rjes su dran par byed cing / dren pas rjes su 'brang bar bya ba dang / blo gros kyis rnam par dbye ba dang / rigs pas khong du chud par bya ba dang / blos shin tu yangs par bya ba dang / lus kyis reg par byas te rnam par spyad pa dang / rjes su 'jug pa byed cing / mthar gyis mtshan mo'i lha mo grong khyer thams cad srung ba 'byung ba'i gzi brjid dpal gang na ba der phyin pa dang / mtshan mo'i lha mo grong khyer thams cad srung ba 'byung ba'i gzi brjid dpal pad+mo'i khri chen po nor bu rin po che'i rgyal po grong khyer dang / gnas thams cad rab tu snang bar byed pa'i snying po can la phyogs thams cad dang / 'gro ba thams cad la mngon du gyur pa'i lus dang / 'gro ba thams cad kyi gzugs dang mnyam pa'i lus dang / sems can thams cad la mngon du gyur pa'i lus dang / 'gro ba thams cad kyis ma gos pa'i lus dang / 'gro ba thams cad dang rang bzhin mnyam pa'i lus dang / 'gro ba thams cad las mngon par 'phags pa'i lus dang / 'gro ba thams cad yongs su smin par bya ba dang / gdul ba la mthun pa'i lus dang / 'gro ba thams cad du sgra rab tu sgrog pa'i lus dang / 'gro ba thams cad du 'pho ba med pa'i lus dang / sgrib pa thams cad shin tu bcom pa'i lus dang / de bzhin nyid kyi rang bzhin gyi lus dang / 'gro ba thams cad gdul ba mthar phyin par byed pa'i lus su 'dug cing / mtshan mo'i lha mo brjod du med pa'i 'khor gyis bskor te 'dug pa mthong nas dga' rangs te mgu zhing nyams bde la tshim zhing yid bde ba skyes nas mtshan mo'i lha mo grong khyer thams cad srung ba 'byung ba'i rkang pa gnyis la spyi bos phyag 'tshal te mtshan mo'i lha mo grong khyer thams cad srung ba 'byung ba'i gzi brjid dpal la lan brgya stong du mar g.yas phyogs su bskor ba byas nas mtshan mo'i lha mo grong khyer thams cad srung ba 'byung ba'i gzi brjid dpal gyi mdun du 'dug ste thal mo sbyar nas 'di skad ces smras so/ /lha mo/ / bdag bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yang dag par zhugs na/ lha mo/ /ji ltar byang chub sems dpas byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa la rjes su bslab na sems can la sman par 'gyur ba lags/ ji ltar na/ sems can bla na med pa yongs su bsdu bas yongs su sdud par 'gyur/ ji ltar na/ byang chub sems dpa' de bzhin gshegs pas gnang ba'i byang chub sems dpa'i las la brtson pa lags/ ji ltar brtson par bgyis na/ byang chub sems dpa' chos kyi rgyal por nye bar 'gyur ba bdag la bshad du gsol/ de skad ces smras pa dang / mtshan mo'i lha mo grong khyer thams cad srung ba 'byung ba'i gzi brjid dpal gyis tshong dpon gyi bu nor bzang la 'di skad ces smras so/ /rigs kyi bu/ khyod de ltar 'gro ba thams cad yongs su smin par bya ba dang / rnam par gdul ba'i mthar phyin par bya ba dang / de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi rigs yang dag par bzung ba'i sbyor ba mthar phyin par bya ba dang / phyogs 'byams klas pa thams cad rgyas par dgang ba'i ye shes rab tu sbyar ba dang / chos kyi dbyings kyi tshul rgya mtsho thams cad la 'jug pa mngon du 'gyur ba dang / shes bya nam mkha'i dbyings dang mnyam pa mtha' yas pa rgyas par dgang ba dang / de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi chos kyi 'khor lo rab tu blang zhing yongs su gzung ba'i phyir 'gro ba rgya mtsho thams cad kyi bsam pa ji lta ba bzhin du chos kyi sprin gyi char mngon par dbab pa'i spyod pa'i tshul yongs su 'dri ba legs [?] so/ /legs so/ /rigs kyi bu/ kho mo ni/ byang chub sems dpa'i rnam par thar pa sgra yid du 'ong ba dang / rnam par 'grul ba zab mo la 'jug pa thob pa ste/ de ltar kho mo rnam par thar pa de dang ldan pas chos smra ba chen po'i go 'phang thogs pa med pa la dmigs pa'i sbyor ba dang ldan pa/ de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi chos kyi mdzod yongs su btang ba'i smon lam dang ldan pa/ snying rje chen po dang ldan pa/ byams pa chen po'i stobs rab tu thob pa/ sems can thams cad byang chub kyi sems la dgod pa'i phyir sems can thams cad kyi don bya ba la zhugs pa; byang chub kyi sems kyi dge ba'i rtsa ba dang / tshogs rab tu bsags pa rgyun mi gcad pa'i phyir 'gro ba thams cad kha lo sgyur ba'i sa la yang dag par gnas pa/ sems can thams cad thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi lam la rab tu dgod pa'i phyir 'jig rten gyi chos kyi sprin thams cad las chos kyi nyi ma yongs su dbyung ba'i sbyor ba dang ldan pa dge ba'i rtsa ba tshad med pa bskyed pas 'jig rten thams cad snang bar bya ba'i phyir 'gro ba thams cad la mnyam pa'i sems su 'jug pa rgyun mi 'chad pa/ 'gro ba thams cad kyi dge ba'i rtsa ba mngon par 'du bya ba yongs su sgrub pa'i sbyor ba shes par bya ba'i phyir sems rnam par dag pa'i sbyor ba dang ldan pa/ dge ba'i las kyi lam thams cad mthun par sgrub pas sems can thams cad kyi ded dpon du zhugs pa/ mi dge ba'i las kyi lam thams cad rab tu spangs pa/ sems can thams cad dge ba'i chos la rab tu dgod pa'i sbyor ba dang ldan pa/ sems can thams cad la lam bde ba yongs su ston pa'i sbyor ba dang ldan pa/ sems can thams cad kyi theg pa'i rgyan gyi thog mar 'dren pa la zhugs pa/ dge ba'i chos kyi spyod pa thams cad la sems can thams cad rab tu dgod pa'i sbyor ba dang ldan pa/ dge ba'i bshes gnyen thams cad la mi phyed par bsnyen bkur dang rim gro byed pa la zhugs pa/ sems can thams cad de bzhin gshegs pa'i bstan pa la rab tu dgod pa'i sbyor ba dang ldan pa/ chos kyi sbyin pa'i sngon 'den cing chos dkar po thams cad yang dag par brtsams pa'i sbyor ba dang ldan pa/ thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi sems bskyed pas mngon par byung bas bsam pa brten zhing mi shigs pa/ rdo rje mthu bo che ltar brtan zhing sra bas sangs rgyas kyi stobs la dmigs pa'i sems rgya chen po'i dkyil 'khor dang ldan par dge ba'i bshes gnyen la brten cing rnam par spyod de/ kho mo ni/ nyon mongs pa dang / las kyi sgrib pa thams cad kyi ri rnam par gtor ba'i sems dang ldan pa'o/ /thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi tshogs yang dag par rtsom pa'o/ /dkar po'i chos thams cad yang dag par sgrub pa'i sbyor ba dang ldan pa'o/ /thams cad mkhyen pa nyid mtha' dang dbus med pa la mngon par 'dun cing dmigs pa'i sems kyi sbyor ba la brtson pa'o/ /

Then, contemplating that enlightening liberation of supernal manifestations in a moment of thought producing floods of joy, fostering it and making it manifest, remembering the instruction of the night goddess Prashantarutasagaravati, absorbing it, keeping in mind knowledge of the principles inherent in it, a measureless repository of many principles to be found in each statement, fixing it in memory, examining it intellectually, putting it into practice, consciously extending it, physically feeling and dwelling in it, entering into it, Sudhana made his way to the night goddess Sarvanagararakshasambhavatejahshri.
He saw the night goddess sitting on a great lotus seat full of diamonds illumining the dwelling places in all cities, accompanied by untold numbers of night goddesses, with a body appearing to the beings in all realms, with a body equal in form to all beings, with a body appearing to all beings, with a body unstained by all worlds, with a body equal to all beings in number of manifestations, with a body transcending all worlds, with a body adapted to developing and guiding all beings, with a body proclaiming the truth in all realms, with a body reaching everywhere, with a body ultimately freed from obstructions, with a body of the essence of those who arrive at Thusness, with a body guiding all beings to ultimate perfection.
Sudhana, enraptured upon seeing the night goddess, paid his respects to her and said, “O goddess, I have set out for supreme perfect enlightenment; please tell me how an enlightening being is to be a benefactor to others while carrying out enlightening practice, and how an enlightening being is to take care of sentient beings with the highest protection and care, and how an enlightening being, engaged in the work of enlightening beings by the assent of the enlightened, is to approach the seat of a spiritual sovereign?”
The night goddess replied, “It is very good that you ask about the way of practice of distributing teachings to sentient beings according to their mentalities, to attain the goal of guiding all sentient beings to perfection, to attain the goal of the effort to preserve the family of all buddhas, to apply all-pervasive knowledge, to confront entry into the ocean of means leading to all realms of reality, to penetrate all knowables by knowledge boundless as space, to receive and hold the teachings of all buddhas.
“I have attained an enlightening liberation, ‘entry into the profound miracle of pleasing sound.’ Having attained this liberation, engaged in preaching the great Teaching, free from attachment, dedicated to dissemination of the treasury of teachings of all buddhas, imbued with the power of great compassion and goodwill, set on working for the welfare of all sentient beings to inspire them to seek enlightenment, set out to become a leader of all sentient beings to ceaselessly accumulate stores of virtues in determination for enlightenment, engaged in producing clouds of teaching and suns of teaching in all worlds to guide all sentient beings on the path of omniscience, ceaselessly reaching out impartially to all sentient beings to illumine all worlds so as to produce infinite roots of goodness, applying a purified mind to practical knowledge of sustaining the performance of good works of all sentient beings, set out to lead all sentient beings to accord with all paths of good action, engaged in the work of directing all sentient beings in good ways, engaged in showing all sentient beings the way to peace and security, set out to lead all sentient beings to emancipation, engaged in directing all sentient beings to all good practices, set out to serve all spiritual friends uninterruptedly, engaged in directing all sentient beings to the teaching of the enlightened, engaged in undertaking all pure and good practices such as giving, firmly resolved to realize omniscience, with a broad mental sphere firmly focused on the powers of buddhas, I stay by the spiritual benefactor, determined to shatter the mountains of afflictions and obstructions to enlightenment caused by actions, undertaking the preparations for omniscience, engaged in developing all good qualities, engaged in application of thought to the infinite variety of objects confronting omniscience.

rigs kyi bu/ de ltar kho mo chos snang ba'i sgo sems can thams cad la yongs su ston pa rnam pa de lta bu yongs su sbyong zhing dge pa'i rtsa ba bsags pa'i tshogs la sta gon du gnas pas rnam pa bcus chos kyi dbyings la rnam par lta zhing khong du chud pa dang / rjes su gzhal bar byed do/ /
bcu gang zhe na/ 'di lta ste/ ye shes snang ba shin tu yangs pa thob pas chos kyi dbyings ni/ tshad med pa khong du chung par byed do/ /de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi rnam par 'phrul ba rnam par dmigs par bya ba'i phyir chos kyi dbyings ni/ mtha' dang dbus med par khong du chud par byed do/ /sangs rgyas kyi zhing thams cad yongs su gnan pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa mchod cing rim gror bya ba'i phyir chos kyi dbyings ni/ mu med par khong du chud par byed do/ /'jig rten gyi khams rgya mtsho thams cad du byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa yongs su bstan pa'i phyir chos kyi dbyings ni/ sa mtshams med par khong du chud par byed do/ /de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes kyi dkyil 'khor tha mi dad pa la 'jug par bya ba'i phyir chos kyi dbyings ni/ ris tshad med par khong du chud par byed do/ / bsam pa ji lta ba bzhin du sems can thams cad kyis rnam par dmigs pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa'i gsung gi dkyil 'khor la 'jug par bya ba'i phyir chos kyi dbyings ni/ rgyud kyi tshul gcig tu gyur par khong du chud par byed do/ /'gro ba thams cad rnam par gdul ba'i mthar phyin pas de bzhin gshegs pa'i sngon gyi smon lam gyi mtha thug pa la 'jug par bya ba'i phyir chos kyi dbyings ni/ rang bzhin gyis rgya che bar khong du chud par byed do/ /byang chub sems dpa' kun tu bzang po'i spyod pa 'byams klas pa la 'jug par bya ba'i phyir chos kyi dbyings ni/ 'gro ba thams cad la mnyam pa nyid du gyur par khong du chud par byed do/ /kun tu bzang po'i spyod pa'i rnam par 'phrul pa'i rgyan la 'jug par bya ba'i phyir chos kyi dbyings ni/ rgyan gcig tu gyur par khong du chud par byed do/ /dge ba thams cad kyis chos kyi dbyings rgyas par dgang zhing rnam par dag par bya ba chud mi za ba'i chos can du bya ba'i phyir chos kyi dbyings ni/ thug pa med par khong du chud par byed do/ /rigs kyi bu/ de ltar kho mo rnam pa bcu po de dag gis dge ba'i rtsa ba dang / tshogs thams cad yongs su bsags pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi bdag nyid che ba nyid la 'jug par bya ba dang / sangs rgyas kyi yul bsam gyis mi khyab pa rjes su rtogs par bya ba'i phyir chos kyi dbyings thams cad la rnam par blta'o/ /khong du chud pa dang / rjes su gzhol bar byed do; ;

“Furthermore, as I purify this medium of light of the Teaching, communicating to all sentient beings, accumulating roots of goodness, I observe, approach, and proceed through the reality realm in terms of ten aspects. What are the ten? I realize that the reality realm is immeasurable, by gaining vast vision of knowledge. I realize that the reality realm is infinitely various, so as to perceive the miracles of all buddhas. I realize that the reality realm is endless, so as to fulfill travel to all buddha-lands and service of buddhas. I realize that the reality realm is boundless, so as to show the practice of enlightening beings in all oceans of worlds. I realize that the reality realm is uninterrupted, so as to enter the sphere of unfragmented knowledge of those who arrive at Thusness. I realize that the reality realm is one, so as to enter the sphere of the voice of those who realize Thusness, which communicates to all sentient beings according to their mentalities. I realize that the reality realm is inherently pure, so as to realize the ultimate end of the past vow to guide all sentient beings to perfection. I realize that the reality realm is equal in all worlds, so as to enter the range of the practice of universal good. I realize that all realms of reality are adorned with one adornment, so as to comprehend the adornment of the miracle of the universally good enlightening being. I realize that the reality realm is imperishable, because of the imperishable nature of the purity of all good pervading the reality realm. Thus do I observe, approach, and proceed through the whole reality realm in terms of ten aspects, to accumulate all roots of goodness, to realize the greatness of buddhas, to arrive at the inconceivable sphere of buddhas.

rigs kyi bu/ gzhan yang kho mo de ltar de bzhin gshegs pa'i bdag nyid che ba nyid kyi rjes su 'brang ba'i yid la bya ba dang ldan pas gzungs kyi dkyil 'khor gyi rgyud stong phrag bcus sems can rnams la chos ston te/
bcu gang zhe na/ 'di ltar chos rgya mtsho thams cad yang dag par 'du ba zhes bya ba'i gzungs kyi dkyil 'khor dang / chos thams cad byin gyis rlob pa'i gzungs kyi dkyil 'khor dang / chos kyi sprin thams cad yongs su 'dzin pa'i gzungs kyi dkyil 'khor dang / de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi dgongs pa sgron ma'i gzungs kyi dkyil 'khor dang / sems can thams cad kyi las rgya mtsho rab tu snang bar byed pa'i snying po'i gzungs kyi dkyil 'khor dang / theg pa'i tshul rgya mtsho dri ma med pa thams cad la yang dag par gzhol ba'i gzungs kyi dkyil 'khor dang / sangs rgyas rgya mtsho thams cad kyi sgron ma'i snying po'i gzungs kyi dkyil 'khor dang / de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi mtshan gyi 'khor lo'i glong rab tu sgrog pa'i gzungs kyi dkyil 'khor dang / dus gsum gyi sangs rgyas kyi sngon gyi smon lam rgya mtsho bstan pa la yang dag par gzhol ba'i gzungs kyi dkyil 'khor dang / chos thams cad la mngon par 'khyil ba'i shugs drag po'i gzungs kyi dkyil 'khor dang / thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi shugs rab tu 'byung ba zhes bya ba'i gzungs kyi dkyil 'khor dang / rigs kyi bu/ gzungs kyi dkyil 'khor bcu po de dag la sogs pa gzungs kyi dkyil 'khor gyi rgyud stong phrag bcus sems can rnams la chos ston to/ /

“Furthermore, I expound the Teaching to sentient beings by means of the operation of ten thousand spheres of mental command, with the attention on the greatness of Buddha in this way. I expound the Teaching to sentient beings by means of the operation of ten thousand spheres of mental command, beginning with the sphere of mental command called absorption in the ocean of all truths, the sphere of mental command of light of remembrance of all buddhas, the sphere of mental command containing light illumining the ocean of deeds of all sentient beings, the sphere of pure mental command of absorption in the ocean of all means of liberation, the sphere of mental command uttering the names of all buddhas, the sphere of mental command of absorption in manifestation of the ocean of past vows of all buddhas, the sphere of mental command of swift turning of the attention to all truths, and the sphere of mental command called light of absorption in omniscience.

rigs kyi bu/ gzhan yang kho mo ni/ thos pa'i shes rab kyis sems can rnams la chos ston to/ /bsam pa'i shes rab dang / bsgoms pa'i shes rab kyis sems can rnams la chos ston te/ srid pa'i rgyud gcig las kyang brtsams shing sems can rnams la chos ston to/ /srid pa'i rgyud rgya mtsho thams cad las kyang brtsams shing sems can rnams la chos ston to/ /de bzhin gshegs pa gcig gi mtshan gyi 'khor lo rgya mtsho las kyang brtsams shing chos ston to/ /de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi mtshan gyi 'khor lo rgya mtsho las kyang brtsams shing chos ston to; ;'jig rten gyi khams rgya mtsho gcig las kyang brtsams shing chos ston to/ /'jig rten gyi khams rgya mtsho thams cad las kyang brtsams shing chos ston to/ /sangs rgyas gcig gis lung bstan pa las kyang brtsams shing chos ston to/ /de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyis lung bstan pa rgya mtsho las kyang brtsams shing chos ston to; ;de bzhin gshegs pa gcig gi 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor rgya mtsho las kyang brtsams shing chos ston to/ /de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor rgya mtsho las kyang brtsams shing chos ston to/ /de bzhin gshegs pa gcig gi chos kyi 'khor lo las kyang brtsams shing chos ston to/ /de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi chos kyi 'khor lo rgya mtsho las kyang brtsams shing chos ston to/ /mdo sde gcig las kyang brtsams shing chos ston to/ /de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi chos kyi 'khor lo la yang dag par gzhol ba'i mdo sde las kyang brtsams shing chos ston to/ /de bzhin gshegs pa gcig gi 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor kun nas 'dus pa las kyang brtsams shing chos ston to/ /de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor kun nas 'dus pa rgya mtsho las kyang brtsams shing chos ston to/ /thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi sems gcig las kyang brtsams shing chos ston to/ /byang chub kyi sems kyi yan lag rgya mtsho thams cad las kyang brtsams shing chos ston to/ /theg pa gcig las kyang brtsams shing chos ston to/ /theg pa thams cad kyi 'byung ba rgya mtsho las kyang brtsams shing chos ston to/ /rigs kyi bu/ de ltar kho mos bstan pa'i tshul mngon par sgrub pa brjod du med pas sems can rnams la chos ston te/ rigs kyi bu/ de ltar kho mo chos kyi dbyings kyi tshul tha mi dad pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa rgya mtsho la 'jug cing sems can thams cad la chos ston pas bla na med pa'i yongs su bsdu ba byed cing / byang chub sems dpa' kun tu bzang po'i spyod pa la phyi ma'i mtha'i mur thug pa'i bskal pa rgya mtshor gnas par bya bas byang chub sems dpa'i rnam par thar pa sgra yid du 'ong ba dang / rnam par 'phrul pa zab mo la 'jug pa 'di la sems kyi skad cig re re zhing rnam par 'phel ba'i rnam par thar pa'i yul sgom pa'i tshul gyis yongs su sgom ste/ rnam par thar pa'i yul sgom pa'i tshul re res kyang sems kyi skad cig re re la chos kyi dbyings thams cad du rgyas par 'gengs so/ /

“Moreover, I teach sentient beings with wisdom consisting of learning, wisdom consisting of thinking, and wisdom consisting of practice. I teach sentient beings about the process of one existence, and I teach sentient beings about the processes of all existences. I teach about the ocean of names of one buddha, I teach about the oceans of names of all buddhas. I teach about one ocean of worlds, I teach about all oceans of worlds. I teach about the ocean of predictions of enlightenment of one buddha, I teach about the oceans of predictions of enlightenment of all buddhas. I teach about the ocean of audiences of one buddha, I teach about the oceans of audiences of all buddhas. I teach about the cycle of teachings of one buddha, I teach about the oceans of cycles of teachings of all buddhas. I teach about one scripture, I teach about the scriptures containing the cycles of teachings of all buddhas. I teach about one gathering of an audience of a buddha, I teach about the oceans of audiences of all buddhas. I teach about one thought of omniscience, I teach about the oceans of all elements of determination for enlightenment. I teach about one vehicle of emancipation, I teach about the oceans of all vehicles of emancipation. I teach sentient beings in untold ways such as these.
“Entry into the oceans of those who arrive at Thusness, identical to the structures of the reality realm, taking care of sentient beings in the highest spiritual way of expounding the Teaching to them, living by the practice of universally good enlightening beings for endless eons, I cultivate this enlightening liberation of entry into the profound miracle of pleasing sound, by expanding it in every moment of consciousness, by the means of actualizing the sphere of liberation; and I pervade all realms of reality in every moment of thought with each means of actualizing the sphere of liberation.”
nor bzang gis smras pa/ lha mo/ byang chub sems dpa'i rnam par thar pa de de ltar zab pa ngo mtshar chen/ 'phags ma/ khyod kyis byang chub sems dpa'i rnam par thar pa 'di brnyes nas ji srid cig lags/
Sudhana said, “This enlightening liberation is marvelous. How long ago did you attain it?”

smras pa/ rigs kyi bu/ sngon 'das pa'i dus bskal ba 'jig rten gyi rgyud kyi rdul shin tu phra ba snyed 'das pa'i pha rol cig tu 'jig rten gyi khams chos kyi 'od 'phro ba'i grong khyer dpal gyi sprin ces bya ba rin po che'i spos thams cad dang ldan pa/ gling bzhi pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams rdul shin tu phra ba snyed kyi sprin la blangs pa/ de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi sngon gyi smon lam dbyangs su sgrog pa'i pad+mos mtshams rnam par brgyan pa/ lhun sems can thams cad kyi las rgya mtshos byung ba'i nor bu rin po che'i rgyal po rgya mtsho las grub pa/ pad+mo chen po'i dbyibs su 'dug pa/ rnam par dag cing kun nas nyon mongs pa/ me tog gi khor yug ri rab kyi rdul shin tu phra ba snyed kyis kun nas bskor ba/ spos kyi rin po che ri rab kyi rdul shin tu phra ba snyed kyi rgyan ri rab ltar mngon par 'phags pa dang ldan pa/ gling bzhi pa chen po ri rab kyi rdul shin tu phra ba snyed kyi rgyan dang ldan pa/ gling bzhi pa re re zhing yang grong rdal bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong brjod du med pa'i yang brjod du med pa dang ldan pa byung ngo/ /

The goddess said, “Many eons ago there was world called Multitude of Cities of Spiritual Lights, set on a network of lofty fragrant jewel mountains, as many as atoms in four continents, arrayed with lotus flowers intoning the past vows of all buddhas, composed of multitudes of jewels produced by the deeds of all sentient beings, shaped like a huge lotus, pure with some defilement, encircled by as many masses of flowers as atoms in a mountain, adorned by lofty polar mountains of fragrant jewels, as many as atoms in a polar mountain, and with as many sets of four continents as atoms in a polar mountain. On each continent were untold trillions of cities.

rigs kyi bu/ 'jig rten gyi khams de'i bskal pa mdog dri ma med pa'i 'od ces bya ba byung ste/ bskal pa de la de bzhin gshegs pa ri rab kyi rdul shin tu phra ba snyed byung ngo/ /'jig rten gyi khams chos kyi 'od 'phro ba'i grong khyer dpal gyi sprin gyi gling bzhi pa dbu ma rgyal mtshan sna tshogs zhes bya ba byung ste/ de'i dbus na rgyal po'i gnas rin chan me tog kun tu snang ba zhes bya ba yod par gyur te/ rgyal po'i gnas de dang ha cang yang mi ring ba zhig na snying po byang chub chos kyi rgyal po'i pho brang rab tu snang ba zhes bya ba yod de/ snying po byang chub de la de bzhin gshegs pa ri rab kyi rdul shin tu phra ba snyed po de dag gi bskal pa'i dang po la de bzhin gshegs pa chos rgya mtsho thams cad kyi dbyangs 'od kyi rgyal po zhes bya ba byung ste/ de'i tshe 'khor los bsgyur ba'i rgyal po nyi ma ltar bzhin mdog dri ma med pa zhes bya ba byung nas des bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa chos rgya mtsho thams cad kyi dbyangs 'od kyi rgyal po las mdo sde chos thams cad kyi glong rgya mtsho zhes bya ba yongs su bzung ste/ bzung nas kyang chos kyi 'khor lo rjes su bskor to/ /yongs su mya ngan las 'das nas kyang rab tu byung ste bstan pa yongs su bzung ngo/ /bstan pa nub tu cha ste/ bstan pa yang stong du gyes/ chos bstan pa shin tu bstan pa'i tshul ni/ brgya phrag bcur gyur/ rnyog pa'i bskal pa bar ma ni/ nye bar gnas par gyur pa'i che sems can las dang nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pas bsgribs pa/ 'thab mo dang / rtsod pa dang / dkrugs ma la zhugs par gyur pa dang / dge slong sangs rgyas kyi bstan pa'i yon tan don du mi gnyer cing yul gyi dga' ba lhur len par gyur pa/ rgyal po dang rkun po'i gtam la zhugs pa/ bud med dang / yul dang / rgya mtsho'i gtam la mos pa/ 'jig rten rgyang pan pa'i tshig la zhugs pa rnams yongs su skyo ba bskyed pa'i phyir kye ma'o; ;bskal pa du mar yongs su bsgrubs pa'i chos kyi sgron ma chen po ni/ nub par gyur ma khad do/ /zhes chos dang ldan pa'i 'o dod bos te yongs su skyo bar 'gyur ba'i gtam byas nas de steng gi nam mkha'i dbyings su ta la bdun tsam du mngon par 'phags nas 'od 'phro ba kha dog mtha' yas pa'i sprin rab tu bkye ste/ 'od zer gyi dra ba'i rgyan chen po kha dog sna tshogs dang ldan pa bkye nas 'od kha dog du ma dang ldan pas 'jig rten gyi nyon mongs pa'i gdung ba zhi bar byas te sems can mtha' dang dbus med pa dag kyang byang chub la rab tu bkod do/ /de bzhin gshegs pa'i bstan pa de yang phyir gsal bar byas te lo stong phrag drug cur gnas par gyur to/ /de'i tshe 'khor los bsgyur ba'i rgyal po nyi ma ltar bzhin mdog dri ma med pa de nyid kyi bu mo dge slong ma chos kyi 'khor los sprul pa'i 'od ces bya ba dge slong ma brgya phrag stong gi 'khor dang ldan pa byung ste/ des yongs su skyo bar 'gyur ba'i sgra de thos nas cho 'phrul chen po de mthong ste/ 'khor dang bcas pas byang chub tu sems bskyed nas dge slong ma brgya phrag stong po de dag kyang bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub las phyir mi ldog par byas te/ de bzhin gshegs pa mngon du 'gyur ba la yang dag par gzhol ba zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin kyang rab tu thob par gyur te/ /de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi chos kyi 'khor los sprul pa'i 'od ces bya ba'i gzungs kyang rab tu thob bo/ /chos rgya mtsho'i tshul thams cad la 'jug pa zhes bya ba'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yang rab tu thob par gyur to/ /dge slong mchos kyi 'khor los sprul pa'i 'od kyis kyang de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi bstan pa las byung ba'i 'od kyi sgron ma zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin dang / byang chub sems dpa'i rnam par thar pa sgra yid du 'ong ba dang / rnam par 'phrul pa zab mo la 'jug pa 'di yang shin tu phra zhing 'jam pa'i tshul du rab tu thob par gyur te/ de thob pas de la de bzhin gshegs pa chos rgya mtsho thams cad kyi dbyangs 'od kyi rgyal po'i rnam par 'phrul pa de dag thams cad kyang mngon du gyur to/ /rigs kyi bu/ de la ji snyam du sems/ de'i tshe de'i dus na 'khor los bsgyur ba'i rgyal po nyi ma ltar bzhin mdog dri ma med pa zhes bya ba de bzhin gshegs pa chos rgya mtsho thams cad kyi dbyangs 'od kyi rgyal po'i bstan pa la rab tu byung ste chos kyi 'khor lo rjes su bskor ba dang / yongs su mya ngan las 'das nas kyang bstan pa nub tu cha ba'i che dang dus na bstan pa yongs su 'dzin cing chos kyi sgron ma chen po 'bar bar byed pa de gzhan zhig yin pa snyam du sems na ni/ rigs kyi bu/ khyod kyis de lta mi blta ste/ byang chub sems dpa' kun tu bzang po ni/ de'i tshe de'i dus na 'khor los bsgyur ba'i rgyal po nyi ma ltar bzhin mdog dri ma med pa zhes bya bar gyur to/ /rigs kyi bu/ de la ji snyam du sems/ de'i tshe de'i dus na 'khor los bsgyur ba'i rgyal po nyi ma ltar bzhin mdog dri ma med pa'i bu mo dge slong ma chos kyi 'khor lo sprul pa'i 'od ces bya ba/ dge slong ma brgya phrag stong gi 'khor dang ldan pa byung ba de gzhan zhig yin pa snyam du sems na ni; de ltar mi blta ste/ kho mo ni/ de'i tshe de'i dus na/ dge slong ma chos kyi 'khor los sprul pa'i 'od ces bya bar gyur te/ de ltar kho mos de bzhin gshegs pa chos rgya mtsho thams cad kyi dbyangs 'od kyi rgyal po'i bstan pa'ang yongs su bzung ngo/ /dge slong ma brgya phrag stong po de dag kyang bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub las phyir mi ldog par byas te/ de bzhin gshegs pa mngon du gyur pa la yang dag par gzhol ba'i ting nge 'dzin la'ang rab tu bkod do/ /de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi 'khor los sprul pa'i 'od kyi gzungs dang / chos rgya mtsho'i tshul thams cad la 'jug pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la'ang rab tu bkod do/ /

“In that world there was an age called Pure Light, in which there arose as many buddhas as atoms in a polar mountain. In the middle of the world was a set of four continents called Resplendent Banner, in the middle of which was a metropolis called Omnipresent Jewel Flower Light, not too far from which was an enlightenment site called Image of the Abode of a Spiritual Sovereign. At that site a buddha named Illuminating King Voicing the Ocean of All Truths arose, the first of the buddhas of that age. At that time there was a monarch named Radiantly Pure Countenance, who received from that buddha a scripture called Ocean of All Truths and followed it.
“After that buddha passed away, the king left home and preserved the buddha’s teachings. At the time of the ending of the teaching, when it was divided into a thousand sects, with a thousand different explanations of the doctrine, and uninterrupted degeneracy of the age was imminent, in order to shake up the people shrouded by the barriers of afflictions and contentious quarrelsome mendicants, who were not seeking the virtues taught by the buddha but were wholly devoted to enjoyment of sense objects, addicted to talk of kings and thieves, addicted to talk of women, lands, and seas, addicted to materialistic thought and conversation, the renunciant king, a true follower of the religion, warned them, ‘Alas! The torch of the great teaching, which was developed over many eons, is going to die out.’ Then he rose into the sky to the height of seven palm trees, emanated clouds of flames of infinite colors, produced great networks of multicolored lights from his body, extinguished the burning of afflictions in the world with multicolored light, and directed infinitely many sentient beings toward enlightenment. The buddha’s teaching was thereby rekindled and remained in the world for another sixty thousand years.
“At that time there was also a nun named Light of Projections of the Wheel of the Teaching. She was the daughter of that king Radiantly Pure Countenance, and she had a retinue of a hundred thousand nuns. Hearing that rousing speech and seeing that great miraculous performance, she and her retinue had been inspired to seek enlightenment. Furthermore, those hundred thousand nuns became irreversible in progress toward supreme perfect enlightenment: they attained a concentration called ‘coming into existence in the presence of those who have arrived at Thusness,’ and they attained a mental command called ‘adamantine light of the teachings of all buddhas,’ and a perfection of wisdom called ‘entry into the principles of the ocean of all truths.’ The nun Light of Projections of the Wheel of the Teaching attained a concentration called ‘lamp illumining the source of the teachings of all buddhas,’ as well as this subtle, gentle enlightening liberation ‘entry into the profound miracle of pleasing sound,’ after which all the miracles of the buddha Illuminating King Voicing the Ocean of All Truths became visible to her.
“What do you think—was the king of that time, who went forth into the teaching of the buddha Illuminating King Voicing the Ocean of All Truths, followed the buddha’s teaching, sustained the teaching after the buddha’s demise when it was dying out, and kindled the torch of the teaching, anyone else? You should not see it this way. It was none other than Samantabhadra, the universally good enlightening being, who was that king Radiantly Pure Countenance. And do you think the king’s daughter, who became a nun, accompanied by a hundred thousand nuns, was anyone else? Do not see it that way. It was I myself who was that nun at that time. I preserved the teaching of that buddha, and I made those hundred thousand nuns irreversible in their progress toward supreme perfect enlightenment, I established them in the concentration ‘coming into existence in the presence of those who have arrived at Thusness,’ I established them in the mental command ‘adamantine light of the teachings of all buddhas’ and the perfection of wisdom ‘entry into the principles of the ocean of all truths.’

de ltar rigs kyi bu / sangs rgyas brgya po 'di dag la sogs pa bskal pa mdog dri ma med pa'i 'od ces bya ba la de bzhin gshegs pa ri rab kyi rdul shin tu phra ba snyed cig byung ste/
rigs kyi bu/ de bzhin gshegs pa ri rab kyi rdul shin tu phra ba snyed po de dag thams cad kyi tha mar de bzhin gshegs pa chos kyi dbyings kyi grong khyer ye shes kyi 'od kyis rab tu snang ba'i rgyal po zhes bya ba byung bar gyur te/ de ltar rigs kyi bu; kho mos de bzhin gshegs pa ri rab kyi rdul shin tu phra ba snyed po de dag las chos kyi rgya mtsho thams cad kyi dbyings kyi 'od kyi rgyal po zhes bya ba la sogs pa tha ma chos kyi dbyings kyi grong khyer ye shes kyis rab tu snang ba'i bar de dag thams cad kho mos mchod do/ /de bzhin gshegs pa de dag thams cad la kho mos rim gror byas so// thams cad kyi chos bstan pa yang thos so/ /de bzhin gshegs pa de dag thams cad kyi bstan pa la yang kho mo rab tu byung ngo/ /de bzhin gshegs pa de dag thams cad kyi bstan pa yang kho mos yongs su bzung ngo/ /byang chub sems dpa'i rnam par thar pa sgra yid du 'ong ba dang / rnam par 'phrul pa zab mo la 'jug pa 'di yang de bzhin gshegs pa de dag thams cad las thob pa'i tshul rnam pa sna tshogs kyis rab tu thob bo/ de bzhin gshegs pa de dag thams cad kyi zhabs kyi drung du'ang kho mos sems can rgya mtsho mtha' dang dbus med pa yongs su smin par byas so/ /de tshun chad du bskal pa sangs rgyas kyi zhing gi rdul shin tu phra ba snyed la de bzhin gshegs pa ji snyed cig byung bar gyur pa de dag thams cad ni/ kho mos chos kyi nan tan gyis mchod pa byas te/ rigs kyi bu/ de phyin chad du kho mos sems can 'khor ba'i mun pa na 'khod cing mi shes pa'i gnyid kyis log pa rnams kyi mel tshe byas so/ /de dag gi sems kyi grong khyer yang yongs su bsrungs so/ /de dag khams gsum gyi grong khyer nas gyen du bskyod cing thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi grong rdal du'ang rab tu bkod do/ /

“In that age Pure Light, as many buddhas as atoms in the polar mountain appeared, beginning with these. The last of them was a buddha named Supreme Lamp of Knowledge Lighting the City of the Reality Realm. I served all those buddhas, from the first to the last, and I listened to their teachings, and left society to delve into all their teachings. I kept all their instructions in mind, and from all of them I attained this enlightening liberation of entry into the profound miracle of pleasing sound, by various methods of attainment, and I matured infinitely many sentient beings in the presence of all those buddhas. Since then I served all the buddhas that have emerged in as many eons as atoms in a buddha-land by putting their teachings into practice. Thenceforth I have been awake in the midst of beings asleep in the slumber of nescience during the night of mundane routines; I have guarded the city of their minds, removed them from the city of the triple world, and settled them in the city of the way of omniscience.

rigs kyi bu/ kho mos byang chub sems dpa'i rnam par thar pa sgra yid du 'ong ba dang / rnam par 'phrul pa zab mo la 'jug pa 'jig rten gyi tshig kyal ba rnam par zlog pa/ gnyis su smra ba med pa la rab tu 'god pa/ bden pa la rab tu gzhog pa'i mthar phyin pa 'di shes par zad na/ kho mos byang chub sems dpa' dag gi lam gyi rang bzhin thams cad thogs pa med par shes pa/ sems kyi skad cig re re la chos thams cad mngon par 'tshang rgya bar dbang bsgyur ba/ sems can thams cad kyi sgra skad dang tshig rgya mtsho la zhugs pa/ skad rgya mtsho thams cad mngon par 'du bya ba la mkhas pa/ chos thams cad kyi grangs dang / ming rgya mtsho'i tshul dang chog la mkhas pa/ chos thams cad la yang dag par gzhol ba'i gzungs rgya mtsho la dbang bsgyur ba/ sems can thams cad kyi bsam pa ji lta ba bzhin du chos kyi sprin mngon par sgrub pa la mkhas pa/ sems can thams cad yongs su smin par bya ba dang gdul bar spyod pa'i mthar phyin par byed pa de dag gi spyod pa shes pa'am/ yon tan brjod pa'am/ sems can thams cad yongs su sdud pa'i nan tan shes par bya ba'am/ byang chub sems dpa'i lam bla na med par brtsams pa'i sbyor ba'am/ byang chub sems dpa'i ye shes shin tu phra ba khong du chud pa'am/ byang chub sems dpa'i chos kyi gter dang / mdzod rnam par 'byed pa'i khyu mchog gi mthu'am/ byang chub sems dpa'i chos kyi gtam la seng+ge'i khri yongs su gnan par bya ba shes par nus re ska na/ de ci'i phyir zhe na/ skyes bu dam pa de dag ni/ chos thams cad kyi sa'i dkyil 'khor gyi gzungs yongs su gnon pa sha stag go /

“I just know this enlightening liberation of entry into the miracle of pleasing sound, which stops mixed-up worldly talk and does not use duplicitous speech, ultimately leading to truth. How can I know the practice or tell of the virtues of the enlightening beings who have unobstructed knowledge of the essential nature of all speech, who command awareness of all realities in each moment of thought, who comprehend the utterances of all beings, who are familiar with the patterns of thought of all beings, who know the ways of classification and naming of all things, who are masters of the ocean of mental command of all truths, who are skilled in producing teachings adapted to the mentalities of all beings, who endeavor to guide all beings to perfection—how can I know their accomplishment in taking care of all beings, or know their efforts applied to undertaking the supreme works of enlightening beings, their attainment of subtle knowledge of enlightening beings, their multifaceted powers of the mine of practice of enlightening beings, or their accession to the lion throne of those who tell of the deeds of enlightening beings? Why do I say this? They are people of truth who have entered mental command of all stages of the Teaching.

song rigs kyi bu/ bcom ldan 'das rnam par snang mdzad kyi zhabs kyi drung 'di nyid du mtshan mo'i lha mo shing thams cad kyi me tog rgyas pas bde bar gnas pa zhes bya ba 'dug ste/ kho mo dang rgyang mi ring ba zhig na 'dug gi /de'i gan du song la ji ltar byang chub sems dpa' rnams thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du slob pa dang / ji ltar nan tan du byed cing / sems can thams cad thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du 'god par byed pa dris shig /

“Right here in the presence of Vairocana Buddha there is a night goddess named Sarvavrikshapraphullanasukhasamvasa, who is sitting next to me. Ask her how an enlightening being is to learn omniscience and how one is to practice so as to lead all sentient beings to omniscience.”

de nas mtshan mo'i lha mo grong khyer thams cad srung ba 'byung ba'i gzi brjid dpal gyis de'i tshe byang chub sems dpa'i rnam par thar pa sgra yid du 'ong ba dang / rnam par 'phrul ba zab mo la 'jug pa 'di nyid brnan te bstan pa'i phyir tshong dpon gyi bu nor bzang la tshigs su bcad de smras pa/
Then the night goddess Sarvanagararakshasambhavatejahshri spoke these verses to Sudhana, further illustrating the enlightening liberation entering into profound miracles of pleasing sound:

rnam thar gang gis dus gsum rgyal ba ma lus dang / / chos dbyings kun tu 'byams klas mtha' dang dbus med pa/ / shes byed mtshan nyid kun gyi gzhir thug rtogs pa yi/ / rgyal sras rnams kyi rnam thar zab cing blta bar dka'/ /
tshogs las byung ba'i rnam thar tshul ni mtha' yas te/ / chos nyid thob pas tshad med bsam du med pa yin/ / yongs su 'phel zhing kun tu chags med shugs drag par/ / dus gsum byams pa'i tshul gyi lam la 'jug par gyis/ /
'di ltar sangs rgyas zhing rgyud rdul phran rab snyed kyi/ / bskal pa 'das pa'i snga rol sngon gyi zhing byung ba/ / 'jig rten khams ni chos 'od sprin gyi grong khyer dpal/ / bskal pa byung ba dri med mdog tu 'od chen no/ /
bskal pa de gcig rgyal ba'i gdung ni rgyud ma chad/ / sangs rgyas ri rab rdul phran rab snyed byung bar gyur/ / bde gshegs chos kyi rgya mtsho 'od dbyangs rgyal po ni/ / thog mar byung ste de dag bskal pa dang po pa; ;
rgyal ba chos sprin grong khyer 'od snang rgyal po ni/ / bde gshegs de dag kun gyi tha mar 'jig rten byung / / de dag kun gyi spyan sngar phyin te kho mos mchod/ / de dag kun las chos kyang dga' ba chen pos thos/ /
kho mos thog mar mthong ba gser mdog 'od mnga' ba/ / rgya mtsho'i chos 'od sgrog pa'i gsung gi rgyal po ste/ / mtshan rab sum cu gnyis kyis yongs brgyan ri bo 'dra/ / mthong nas bdag ni bde gshegs 'gyur snyam blo gros gyur/ /
de bzhin gshegs pa de ni kho mos mthong mod la/ / thams cad mkhyen nyid 'byams klas 'byung ba'i rgyu rkyen gyis/ / mkha' dbyings rnam yangs de bzhin nyid kyi rang bzhin can/ / rgyal ba'i sems kyi dang po stobs ldan rab tu skyes/ /
snying rje bdud rtsi rgya mtsho che las byung ba des/ / dus gsum gshegs pa'i bde bar gshegs pa thams cad kun/ / rgyal sras rgya mtshos bskor ba ma lus thams cad dang / / sems can rgya mtshor bcas pa'i rgya mtsho'i zhing yang rgyas/ /
lus kyis zhing rnams thams cad ma lus khyab bya dang / / 'gro ba kun gyi bsam pa bzhin du lus bstan phyir/ / zhing rnams ma lus bskyod cing snang bar bya ba dang / / 'gro ba smin bya'i don du bdag gis sems kyang bskyed/ /
rgyal ba gnyis pa'i spyan sngar kho mo phyin nas kyang / / zhing rnams rgya mtsho bcu bzhugs rgyal ba'i dbang po mthong / / rgyal ba tha ma mthong nas zhing gi rgya mtsho rnams/ / rgya mtsho'i zhing gi rdul phran rab snyed bzhugs pa mthong / /
de yi tshu rol bskal pa zhing rgyud rdul snyed du/ / rgyal ba 'gro ba'i sgron ma ji snyed skyes gyur pa/ / de dag thams cad spyan sngar kho mo phyin gyur te/ / rnam thar rgya mtsho'i tshul 'di sbyong tshe mchod pa byas//

Profound and hard to see is the liberation of enlightening beings, Like space, entering everywhere; They see the buddhas of all times, Infinite, throughout the cosmos.
They attain endless liberations born of virtue and knowledge, Of inconceivable nature, immeasurable: Increasing unimpeded momentum in all directions, They plunge into the paths of benevolence in all times.
Many eons ago there was a world Called Cities of Spiritual Lights: In that glorious world Was a brilliant age called Pure Light.
In that age was an unbroken succession of buddhas, As many as atoms in the polar mountain.
Illuminating King Voicing the Ocean of All Truths Was the first buddha of the age, Supreme Lamp of Knowledge Lighting the City of the Reality Realm Was the last of those buddhas: I visited and served them all, And joyfully heard their teachings.
I saw the golden light of the first buddha, Illuminating King Voicing the Ocean of All Truths, Like the polar mountain resplendent with the thirty-two marks, And seeing him I determined to become a buddha.
As soon as I saw that buddha there arose My first aspiration to buddhahood, full of power, By means arising from the progress of omniscience, As pure as space, of the nature of Thusness.
Thenceforth seeing all the buddhas throughout all times, And all the multitudes of enlightening beings, And all the myriad worlds and sentient beings there, I produced an ocean of ambrosia of goodwill.
I determined to pervade all lands, Showing my body differently to sentient beings according to their mentalities, To illumine and stir all the lands And develop the beings to maturity.
I went and saw the second buddha, And the buddhas in the oceans of lands in the ten directions, In as many lands as atoms in an ocean of lands, And finally saw the last buddha of that age.
I went and served all the buddhas, Lamps of the world, that appeared In as many ages as atoms in all worlds, That I might purify this liberation.

de nas tshong dpon gyi bu nor bzang byang chub sems dpa'i rnam par thar pa sgra yid du 'ong ba dang / rnam par 'phrul pa zab mo la 'jug pa thob pa/ ting nge 'dzin gyi sgo rgya mtsho mtha' dang dbus med pa la zhugs pa/ gzungs kyi sgo rgya mtsho rgya chen po las byung ba'i sems dang ldan pa/ byang chub sems dpa'i mngon par shes pa'i snang ba chen po rab tu thob pa/ tha dad pa yang dag par shes pa chen po rgya mtsho la zhugs pa/ dga' ba'i shugs rgya mtsho shin tu yangs pa rnam par 'phel ba'i sems dang ldan pa nges mtshan mo'i lha mo grong khyer thams cad srung ba 'byung ba'i gzi brjid dpal la tshul dang mthun pa'i tshigs su bcad pa 'di dag gis mngon par bstod do/ /

Then, having attained this enlightening liberation of entry into the profound miracle of pleasing sound, having entered an ocean of infinitely various media of concentration, his mind having developed an immense ocean of means of sustained attention, illumined with the great mystic knowledge of enlightening beings, having entered an ocean of great joyful intelligence, his mind expanded with a vast ocean of ecstasy, Sudhana praised the night goddess with these verses:

khyod kyi shes rab chos yangs rgya mtsho kun la spyod/ / srid pa'i rgya mtsho mtha' dbus med par khyod kyis spyad/ / ye shes lus mchog snying po tshe ring snyun bral ba/ / lha mo khyod ni 'khor 'dir byon cing rnam par mdzes; ;
chos kyi rang bzhin nam mkha' lta bur thugs chud de/ / dus gsum kun gyi tshul yang chags med thugs chud mdzad/ / thugs kyi skad cig gcig la tshad med bsam yas pa'i/ / dmigs pa thams cad rtog pa mi mngar 'jal ba mdzad/ /
ye shes spyan mnga' chos nyid sems can med gzigs kyang / / sems can rgya mtsho mtha' yas thugs rjes gzigs pa mdzad/ / thugs kyi rnam thar shin tu yangs la 'jug mdzad cing / / sems can tshad med 'dul zhing yongs su smin par mdzad/ /
khyod ni chos kyi dkyil 'khor rnam dpyad tshul mkhyen te/ / chos kyi rang bzhin shes bya'i tshul la rnam sangs rgyas/ / 'phags lam dri ma med pa thams cad yongs bsgoms te/ / 'gro ba ma lus rnam par sbyong zhing yongs su 'byung / /
thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes dri med rtogs mdzad pas/ / khyod ni sems can rgya mtsho'i mchog las mngon par skyes/ / khyod ni chos dbyings khong chud sems can kun khyab par/ / chos rab bstan cing 'jig rten 'jigs pa zhi bar mdzad/ /
khyod ni rnam par snang mdzad smon lam lam tshul gyis/ / yang dag bzhud cing chags med blo yangs dri med ldan/ / thams cad bgod pa'i rgyal ba'i stobs ni thugs chud cing / / zhing rnams kun gyi rgyal ba rnam par 'phrul pa gzigs/ /
khyod kyi thugs ni mkha' 'dra thub par dka' ba ste/ / nyon mongs kun gyi dri mas ma gos snga nas dag / der ni dus gsum byung ba'i zhing rnams thams cad dang / / sangs rgyas sras dang bcas pa sems can kun bcas 'dus/ /
skad cig gcig gis nyin mtshan yud du zla ba dang / / skad cig yud tsam lo dang 'du 'jig bskal pa dang / / bskal pa rgya mtsho ming grangs rgya mtshor bcas pa dang / / 'gro ba rnams kyi 'du shes rgya mtsho'ang thugs su chud/ /
phyogs rnams kun gyi sems can skye 'chi ji snyed dang / / gzugs yod pa dang gzugs med 'du shes yod med kyi/ / rnam spyod bden pa'i tshul ni thugs su chud mdzad cing / / de dag lam bstan byang chub mchog tu 'god pa mdzad/ /
rnam par snang mdzad smon lam dra ba'i rigs las byung / / bde gshegs kun gyi sku gcig tshul las yang dag 'khrungs/ / khyod ni chos sku yongs dag thugs la chags mi mnga'/ / 'jig rten kun tu sku gzugs yid bzhin ston pa mdzad/ /

Vast is your wisdom, coursing in the ocean of truth, And you have traversed the infinite sea of existences.
Long-lived, without affliction, an embodiment of beneficent knowledge, Your presence illumines this assembly, O goddess.
Aware of the nature of things, like the sky, You enter unhindered into all times; In an instant of consciousness without discriminatory thought You assess all objects, inconceivable as they are.
With the eye of knowledge you see into the beingless nature, While by compassion you enter infinite oceans of beings.
Deliberately plunging into most profound liberation, You guide and develop innumerable beings.
You know how to analyze all states of being, And are aware of the way to penetrate the essence of things: You practice the undefiled path of all sages; You will liberate all beings, purifying them.
You are an unexcelled leader of beings, O goddess, As you acquire omniscient knowledge throughout the universe, You expound the Teaching to all beings therein, And extinguish all fears in the world.
You go by way of the path of Vairocana’s vows, With unhindered, vast, undefiled understanding; Everywhere practicing the powers of the enlightened, You witness the miracles of buddhas in all lands.
Hard to accomplish is a skylike mind such as yours, Free from the taints of the afflictions; Therein are all lands in all times, All buddhas, enlightening beings, and all living creatures.
Day and night, instants and moments, seasons, fortnights, months, And years, along with their passing away and imagined discriminations, And the waves of eons, with their enumerations of myriad names, The oceans of concepts of sentient beings, all you see in an instant.
The deaths and births of beings in the ten directions, With form or without, thinking and thoughtless, You comprehend according to their conventional truth, And show them the way to supreme enlightenment.
Born of the family of the network of Vairocana’s vows, Having become one with all buddhas, Your spiritual body pure, your mind unobstructed, You appear to beings according to their minds.

de nas tshong dpon gyi bu nor bzang gis mtshan mo'i lha mo grong khyer thams cad srung ba 'byung ba'i gzi brjid dpal la tshul dang 'dra ba'i tshigs su bcad pa de dag gis mngon par bstod de/
mtshan mo'i lha mo grong khyer thams cad srung ba 'byung ba'i gzi brjid dpal gyi rkang pa gnyis la spyi bos phyag 'tshal nas mtshan mo'i lha mo grong khyer thams cad srung ba 'byung ba'i gzi brjid dpal la lan brgya stong du mar g.yas phyogs su bskor ba byas te/ yang dang yang bltas nas mtshan mo'i lha mo grong khyer thams cad srung ba 'byung ba'i gzi brjid dpal gyi drung nas song ngo/ /
Having eulogized the goddess with these verses, Sudhana paid his respects and went on.
shin tu rgyas pa chen po'i mdo/ sangs rgyas phal po che zhes bya ba las; sdong pos brgyan pa'i le'u ste/ bam po brgya gsum pa/

Sarvavrikshapraphullanasukhasamvasa

de nas tshong dpon gyi bu nor bzang byang chub sems dpa'i rnam par thar pa sgra yid du 'ong ba dang / rnam par 'phrul pa zab mo la 'jug pa de/ de bas kyang rgya cher sgom pa dang / yid ches par bya ba dang / shin tu rgyas par byed cing / mtshan mo'i lha mo shing thams cad kyi me tog rgyas pas bde bar gnas pa gang na ba der phyin nas mtshan mo'i lha mo shing thams cad kyi me tog rgyas pas bde bar gnas pa spos rin po che thams cad kyi shing gi yal ga'i khang pa brtsegs pa zhig na seng+ge'i khri rin po che'i shing gi myu gu'i snying po can zhig la 'dug ste/ mtshan mo'i lha mo stong phrag bcus kun nas bskor cing 'dug pa mthong ngo/ / de nas tshong dpon gyi bu nor bzang gis mtshan mo'i lha mo shing thams cad kyi me tog rgyas pas bde bar gnas pa'i rkang pa gnyis la spyi bos phyag 'tshal te mdun du 'dug nas thal mo sbyar te 'di skad ces smras so/ /lha mo/ bdag gis bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed na/ ji ltar byang chub sems dpa' rnams byang chub sems dpa'i spyad pa spyod pa dang / ji ltar slob pa dang / ji ltar spyod ji ltar slob cing thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du 'byung ba bdag la bshad du gsol/ de skad ces smras pa dang / mtshan mo'i lha mo shing thams cad kyi me tog rgyas pas bde bar gnas pas tshong dpon gyi bu nor bzang la 'di skad ces smras so/ /rigs kyi bu/ kho mo'i mthus ni/ mi mjed kyi 'jig rten gyi khams na nyi ma nub tu cha ba'i tshe pad+mo shin tu rgyas pa rnams kyang rnam par 'dzum par 'gyur ro// skyes pa dang bud med bza' shing gi ra ba na gnas shing dga' bar rtse ba la brtson pa dag kyang khyim du 'dong pa'i blo skyed do/ /lam dang srang na rgyu ba'i sems can rnams kyang zhag gi gnas sems shing tshol te/ 'gro ba'i gnas thams cad du mngon par gzhol bar 'gyur ro/ /nags tshal dang / gseb dang / phug la brten pa'i sems can rnams kyang nags tshal dang / gseb dang / phug tu 'dong ngo/ /shing la gnas pa'i sems can rnams kyang shing gi gnas la brten par mngon par gzhol lo/ /khung na gnas pa'i sems can rnams kyang khung du 'dong ngo/ /grong dang / grong khyer dang / ljongs dang / yul la gnas pa'i sems can rnams kyang grong dang / grong khyer dang / ljongs dang / yul du 'dong ngo// chu na gnas pa'i sems can rnams kyang chur 'dong ngo/ /phyogs gzhan gyi yul du phyin pa'i sems can rnams kyang nub mo bde zhing dga' bar gnas pa'i don du rang rang gi yul gyi phyogs kyi bsam pa skyed do/ /

Then Sudhana, further cultivating, fostering, and expanding the enlightening liberation of entry into the profound miracle of pleasing sound, went to the night goddess Sarvavrikshapraphullanasukhasamvasa. He saw her sitting on a lion throne of jewel tree shoots inside a tower of branches of jewel trees of all fragrances, surrounded by ten thousand night goddesses. He went up to her, paid his respects, and said, “Noble goddess, I have set my mind on supreme perfect enlightenment, but I do not know how an enlightening being is to carry out and learn the practice of enlightening beings. Please tell me how to perform and learn the practice of enlightening beings, and how to act and learn so as to arrive at omniscience.”
The goddess said to Sudhana, “By my power, when the sun goes down, the blooming lotuses become highly fragrant; all the men and women sporting in the parks decide to go home; the highly conscious beings on the roads and paths in the night head for the protection of all beings: those who live in mountain caves go into the mountain caves, those who lie in trees head for the trees, those who live in caves go into their caves, those who live in villages, cities, or towns go into their villages, cities, and towns, those who live in water go down in the water, those who live in other abodes go to their respective dwelling places, to spend the night comfortably.

rigs kyi bu/ gzhan yang kho mo ni/ skyes pa dang / bud med gzhon nu dar la bab pa/ dar ba'i nyams drod kyis myos pa dang / glu dang / gar dang / rol mo'i dga' bas myos pa dang / 'dod pa'i yon tan la dga' zhing brtson pa rnams la skye ba dang / rga shi dang / gti mug gi mun pa chen pos 'jigs pa'i gnyen por dag ba'i rtsa ba yongs su bskyed pa'i phyir brtson 'grus kyi legs pa'i bsngags pa byed do/ /sems can ser sna dang ldan pa rnams ni/ sbyin pa la rab tu sbyor ro/ /sems can tshul khrims ngan pa can rnams ni/ tshul khrims la rab tu 'god do/ /ngan sems dang ldan pa'i sems can rnams la ni/ byams pa'i legs pa rjod par byed do/ /sems 'khrugs pa'i sems can rnams ni/ bzod pa la rab tu 'god do/ /le lo can gyi sems can rnams ni/ byang chub sems dpa'i brtson 'grus brtsam pa la rab tu 'god do/ /sems rnam par myos pa'i sems can rnams ni/ bsam gtan la rab tu 'god do/ /shes rab 'chal ba can gyi sems can rnams ni/ shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la yongs su sbyor ro/ /theg pa dma' ba la mos pa'i sems can rnams ni/ theg pa chen po la rab tu 'god do/ / khams gsum la mngon par zhen pa'i sems can rnams ni/ byang chub sems dpa'i smon lam gyi pha rol tu phyin pa srid pa'i lam gyi rgyud mthar phyin pa'i dkyil 'khor la spyod pa la rab tu 'god do/ /dmigs pa'i dbang du gyur pa'i sems can las dang nyon mongs pas rab tu mnar ba/ bsod nams dang ye shes kyi stobs med pa rnams ni; byang chub sems dpa'i stobs kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la rab tu 'god do/ /mi shes pa'i mun nag gis khebs pa'i sems can bdag tu bya ba dang / bdag gir bya bas ma rig pa'i mun nag tu 'thom pa rnams ni/ byang chub sems dpa'i ye shes kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la rab tu 'god do/ /

“Furthermore, to the young men and women intoxicated with the joy of youth, reveling in music and song and intent on sensual pleasures, I praise the effort to produce roots of goodness as an antidote to the fears of the darkness of birth, old age, and death. I enjoin giving on those who are greedy and lead the ill-behaved to discipline. To those who are hostile I praise kindness, and I lead those agitated in mind to patience. I lead the lazy to undertake the vigorous effort of enlightening beings. Those whose minds wander I establish in meditation. I furnish the stupid with transcendent wisdom. Those who are interested in the Lesser Vehicle I establish in the Great Vehicle. Those who are attached to the world, who act within the sphere of attachment to the conditions of existence, I lead to the transcendent commitment of enlightening beings. Those who are overcome by obstructions, tormented by afflictions in their actions, lacking in the power of virtue and knowledge, I lead to the transcendent power of enlightening beings. Those bound up in the darkness of nescience, in the darkness of the ignorance characterized by egoism and possessiveness, I lead to the transcendent knowledge of enlightening beings.

rigs kyi bu/ gzhan yang kho mo ni/ byang chub sems dpa'i rnam par thar pa dga' ba'i 'od spro ba yangs pa yang dag par 'byung ba thob pa'o/ /nor bzang gis smras pa/ lha mo/ byang chub sems dpa'i rnam par thar pa dga' ba'i 'od spro ba yangs pa yang dag par 'byung ba de'i yul ji lta bu zhig mchis/ smras pa/ rigs kyi bu/ rnam par thar pa de ni/ de bzhin gshegs pa'i bsod nams kyis sems can yongs su sdud pa'i ye shes dang thabs snang ba dang ldan pa ste/ de ci'i phyir zhe na/ rigs kyi bu/ sems can rnams kyi bde ba nyams su myong ba ji snyed cig yod pa de dag thams cad ni/ de bzhin gshegs pa'i bsod nams kyi mthus byung ba'o/ /de bzhin gshegs pa'i gdams ngag gi tshul gyis byung ba'o/ /de bzhin gshegs pa'i gsung la nan tan du byas pas byung ba'o/ /de bzhin gshegs pa'i rjes su bslab pas byung ba'o/ /de bzhin gshegs pa'i byin gyi rlabs kyis byung ba'o/ /de bzhin gshegs pas bstan pa'i lam la nan tan du byas pas byung ba'o/ /de bzhin gshegs pa dang tshul 'dra ba'i dge ba'i rtsa ba bskyed pas byung ba'o/ /de bzhin gshegs pas chos bstan pa'i mthun pa'i rgyus byung ba'o/ /de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes kyi nyi ma snang bas byung ba'o/ /rigs kyi bu/ de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs kyi chos dkar po'i dkyil 'khor gyi snang bas ni/ sems can rnams kyi bde ba yongs su 'byung ste/ de ci'i phyir zhe na/ 'di ltar rigs kyi bu/ kho mos byang chub sems dpa'i rnam par thar pa dga' ba'i 'od spro ba yangs pa yang dag par 'byung ba 'di la 'jug pa'i tshe bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnam par snang mdzad kyi sngon gyi byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa rgya mtsho rjes su dran par byed cing / 'jug pa dang khong du chud par byed pa'i tshe 'di ltar bcom ldan 'das sngon byang chub sems dpa'i sa la bzhugs pas sems can bdag tu bya ba dang / bdag gir bya ba la mngon par zhen pa/ ma rig pa'i mun pas 'thom pa/ lta ba thibs po'i lta bas dgon par 'khyams pa/ sred pa'i dbang du gyur pa/ 'dod chags kyi bcings pas glags pa/ zhe sdang gis khong khro ba'i sems dang ldan pa/ gti mug gis sems kyi rgyud 'khrugs par gyur pa/ phrag dog dang ser sna kun nas 'khor ba/ nyon mongs pas rab tu dkrugs pa'i sems dang ldan pa; 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal chen po nyams su myong bar gyur pa/ 'khor ba na phongs pa'i sdug bsngal gyis rab tu gzir ba/ sangs rgyas blta ba las phyir phyogs par gyur pa thams cad gzigs nas thugs rje chen po'i thugs skyes par gyur to/ /sems can thams cad kyi don du 'gro ba thams cad la yo byad dang rin po ches yongs su bsdu zhing yongs su sdud pa'i thugs dang / sems can thams cad kyi 'khor ba'i yo byad yongs su sgrub pa'i thugs dang / dngos po thams cad la chags pa mi mnga' ba'i thugs dang / yul thams cad la ye rngam pa mi mnga' ba'i thugs dang / dga' ba thams cad la chags pa mi mnga' ba'i thugs dang / longs spyod thams cad la yongs su ma zhen pa'i thugs dang / sbyin pa thams cad la rnam par smin pa la re ba med pa'i thugs dang / 'jig rten gyi phun sum tshogs pa thams cad la bzhed pa mi mnga' ba'i thugs dang / rgyu dang rkyen la ma rmongs pa'i thugs dang / legs par btsal ba'i chos la yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du mkhyen pa'i thugs dang / sems can thams cad kyi don la gzhol bar bya ba mngon par sgrub pa'i thugs yang dag par skyes par gyur to/ /

“Furthermore, I have attained the enlightening liberation ‘manifestation of contentment with the treasure produced from great joy.’”
Sudhana said, “What is the sphere of this liberation?”
The goddess said, “The scope of this liberation is the knowledge and means to take care of sentient beings by the goodness of those who arrive at Thusness. How is that? Whatever well-being sentient beings experience is all due to the power of the goodness of the enlightened, due to the path of the teaching of the enlightened, due to putting the word of the enlightened into practice, due to learning from the enlightened, due to the support of the enlightened, due to practicing the path of knowledge of the enlightened, due to planting roots of goodness like the enlightened, due to the true teaching of the enlightened, due to the illumination of the sun of knowledge of the enlightened.
“Indeed, the happiness of beings comes from the light of the sphere of pure deeds of the family of the enlightened. How do I know? As I enter into this enlightening liberation of the manifestation of contentment with the treasure produced from great joy, and recall and plunge into the ocean of Vairocana Buddha’s past practices as an enlightening being, thus do I know and understand—as the Buddha was concentrating on the stages of enlightenment in the past, seeing sentient beings caught up in egoism and possessiveness, in the darkness of ignorance, gone into a tangle of views, dominated by craving, bound by the fetters of desire, hostile and malevolent, continuously pursuing delusions, wrapped up in envy and jealousy, their minds crowded with afflictions, experiencing the great misery of the mundane whirl, tormented by the pains of poverty in the mundane whirl, deprived of the sight of the enlightened, there appeared in the Buddha a mind of great compassion, a mind to take care of all sentient beings materially for their benefit, a mind to produce means of worldly support for all sentient beings, a mind free from attachment to all things, a mind without acquisitiveness for any objects, a mind not dwelling on any pleasures, a mind free from grasping for any material goods, a mind not seeking rewards for giving, a mind not eager for existence in any world, a mind not confused about causal relations, a mind contemplating the truth after thorough investigation, a mind to provide refuge for the welfare of all living beings.

de de ltar chos thams cad kyi rang bzhin la yang dag par zhugs pa'i thugs dang ldan pa/ sems can gyi khams thams cad du byams pa chen pos snyoms par zhugs pa/ 'gro ba thams cad thugs rje chen po'i sprin gyis rgyas par dgang ba'i sbyor ba mnga' ba/ sems can gyi 'jig rten thams cad kun nas khebs pa'i chos kyi gdugs chen po'i dkyil 'khor mnga' ba/ sems can thams cad kyi nyon mongs pa'i ri rnam par 'joms pa'i ye shes rdo rje'i mtshon cha mnga' ba/ 'gro ba thams cad kyi bde ba yongs su sgrub pas dgyes pa'i shugs rnam par 'phel ba'i thugs mnga' ba/ sems can thams cad la bde ba phul du phyin par mngon par sgrub pa'i smon lam gyi thugs mnga' ba/ bsam pa dang smon pa ji lta ba bzhin du sems can thams cad la nor gyi char rab tu dbab pa'i thugs mnga' ba/ sems can thams cad yongs su mi gtong zhing snyoms par sbyor ba'i thugs mnga' ba/ 'phags pa'i nor gyis sems can thams cad tshim par mdzad pa'i thugs mnga' ba/ stobs bcu'i ye shes rin po che phul du dri ma med pa thob par mdzad pa'i thugs mnga' ba/ byang chub sems dpa'i mngon par shes pa chen po'i stobs dang shugs rab tu brnyes pa de/ byang chub sems dpa'i rnam par 'phrul pa sna tshogs kyi sprin chen pos sems can gyi khams chos kyi dbyings kyis klas pa/ nam mkha'i mthas gtugs pa thams cad rgyas par bkang ste sems can thams cad la mngon par gyur par bzhugs shing sbyin pa'i dmigs pa thams cad kyi sprin gyi char chen po rnam pa thams cad du dbab pa dang / rin po che'i rgyan thams cad kyi sprin chen po'i char mngon par 'bebs pa mdzad de/ 'di ltar sems can thams cad so so'i tshul dang ji ltar mthun pas longs spyod par bya ba'i phyir dngos po rnam pa tha dad pa mtha' yas pa dang / yo byad rnam pa tha dad pa tshad med pa la spyad par bya ba dang / sbyin pa rnam pa sna tshogs thams cad kyis yongs su bsdu ba'i tshul dang / dngos po yongs su gtang ba rnam pa du ma la yongs su spyad pa dang / yo byad kyi rnam pa dang / rgyan gyi 'du byed brjod du med pa dang / sbyin pa'i tshogs rnam pa sna tshogs mtshan nyid sna tshogs dang ldan pa/ sems can rnams bsam pa ji lta ba bzhin du yongs su tshim par bya ba'i sbyin pa'i tshul mtha' yas pa thugs su chud pas sems can gyi bsam pa ji lta ba bzhin du yongs su tshim par bya ba/ mngon par bsgrubs pa'i dngos po thams cad gtang ba dang / yongs su gtang ba dang / sbyin pa bya ba dang / 'gro ba thams cad kyi 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal rgyun mi 'chad pa las yongs su bskyab pa'i tshul du bya ba rnams sems can thams cad la lan la re ba mi mnga' ba dang / 'gro ba thams cad la mnyam pa nyid du 'byung ba'i thugs mnga' bas 'gro ba thams cad kyi sems rin po che yongs su sbyong ba mdzad cing / sangs rgyas thams cad kyi dge ba'i rtsa ba rgya mtsho gcig tu gyur pa las byung ba'i yongs su bsdu ba'i tshul 'gro ba thams cad kyi bsam pa ji lta ba bzhin du yo byad kyi char dbab pa/ 'gro ba thams cad la thams cad mkhyen pa'i bsod nams rgya mtsho'i shugs rnam par 'phel bar mdzad pas thugs kyi skad cig re re la sems can ma lus pa thams cad yongs su smin par bya ba dang / gdul ba gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pa rnam par dag par bya ba'i phyir mngon par sgrub pa mdzad pa dang /

“Having comprehended the essence of all things as it really is, having impartial goodwill toward all sentient beings, working to fill all worlds with great compassion, covering all worlds with the canopy of the great Teaching, holding the thunderbolt of great knowledge, which shatters the mountain of afflictions of all sentient beings, his mind growing in satisfaction through the welfare of all sentient beings, determined to effect the ultimate happiness of all sentient beings, wishing to provide all sentient beings with everything they need, working impartially without abandoning any sentient beings, wishing to satisfy all sentient beings with the wealth of sages, determined to attain the jewel of knowledge of the supreme ten powers, empowered with the mystic knowledges of enlightening beings, pervading all worlds throughout the space of the entire cosmos with a multitude of various enlightening manifestations, appearing before all sentient beings, swirling a great cloud of all manner of objects and showering a rain of all kinds of precious ornaments, he undertook to give infinite various articles to all sentient beings for their use as appropriate, to perform innumerable services, to strive to provide care by all sorts of charity, giving away many kinds of things, to construct arrangements of myriad benefits, services, and useful articles, to practice various forms of giving, satisfying sentient beings according to their mentalities by endless giving, to make uninterrupted effort to save all beings from the miseries of the mundane world, without desiring the gratitude of anyone, impartial toward all beings, purifying the mind-jewel of all beings, increasing the flood of the ocean of wealth of all-knowledge for all beings produced from the ocean of roots of goodness at one with those of all buddhas, engaged in taking care of all beings by providing for their needs, undertaking all this continuously, from moment to moment, to develop and guide all sentient beings and gradually purify them.

thugs kyi skad cig re re zhing gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pa ma lus pa thams cad sangs rgyas kyi zhing nye bar nyon mongs pa med cing bla na med pa'i rgyan rnam par dag pas rnam par klubs shing rab tu brgyan pa yongs su rdzogs par bya ba dang / thugs kyi skad cig re re la chos kyi tshul rgya mtsho ma lus pa thams cad rgyas par dgang bar rnam par dag par bya ba dang / thugs kyi skad cig re re la nam mkha'i dbyings kyi gtos ma lus pa thams cad rgyas par dgang ba'i ye shes kyi tshul yongs su rdzogs par bya ba dang / thugs kyi skad cig re re la sems can dang dus ma lus pa thams cad la 'jug pa'i ye shes kyi tshul rnam par dag par bya ba dang / thugs kyi skad cig re re la 'gro ba ma lus pa thams cad rnam par 'dul ba'i ye shes kyi tshul snang ba rab tu thob par bya ba dang / thugs kyi skad cig re re la dus ma lus pa thams cad du chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba las phyir mi ldog par bya ba dang / thugs kyi skad cig re re la thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes kyi byin gyi rlabs la mkhas pa ma lus par yongs su bstan pas 'gro ba thams cad la phan thogs par bya ba dang / thugs kyi skad cig re re la 'jig rten gyi khams ma lus pa'i grangs su bya ba'i rgyud dang ldan pa/ 'jig rten gyi khams rgya mtsho thams cad mngon par bstan pa/ 'jig rten gyi khams rgya mtsho thams cad yongs su 'du ba/ 'jig rten gyi khams 'byams klas pa sna tshogs brjod du yod pa/ 'jig rten gyi khams kyi rgyud rnam par gnas pa sna tshogs kyis mtshams rnam par 'dul ba/ gzhi sna tshogs dang / lhun du mar brjod du yod pa/ rnam par phye ba sna tshogs kyi bskal pa rnam pa tha dad pa bstan du yod pa/ kun nas nyon mongs shing rnam par dag pa dang / rnam par dag cing kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / gcig tu yongs su dag pa dang / gcig tu kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / che ba dang / yangs pa dang / tshad med pa dang / dog pa dang / phra ba dang / rgya che ba dang / gzhi mnyam pa dang snrel zhi dang / spyi'u tshugs dang / phyogs dang phyogs mtshams su mngon par bltas pa dang / phyogs rgya mtsho sna tshogs su yongs su gzhol ba/ sgo sna tshogs nas bstan cing sgo mtha' yas pa'i dbyibs rnam pa sna tshogs su 'dug pa'i rnam par phye ba sna tshogs dang ldan pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams rgya mtsho thams cad du byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa spyod de/ byang chub sems dpa'i skyon med pa yongs su mnan nas byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa dang / rnam par 'phrul pas rgyas par dgang bar bya ba dang / thugs kyi skad cig re re la dus gsum gyi sangs rgyas kyi 'phrin las ma lus pa thams cad sems can pha rol gyi sems dang bsam pas rnam par dmigs par bya ba'i phyir 'gro ba thams cad la thams cad mkhyen pa'i bsod nams rgya mtsho'i shugs rnam par 'phel bar mdzad de/ mngon par sgrub pa mdzad par gyur pas mngon par shes so/ /rjes su dran no/ /

“He undertook to adorn every land as a supreme pure buddha-land in every moment of thought, to purify the practice of the ocean of methods of the Teaching in every moment of thought, to fulfill the means of knowledge pervading all of space in every moment of thought, to purify the means of knowledge of how to tame all sentient beings in every moment of thought, to bring to light the knowledge of how to guide all worldlings in every moment of thought, to always teach in a manner appropriate to the time in every moment of thought, to be a benefactor to all beings by showing the skillfulness to support all knowledge in each moment of thought, carrying out the practice of enlightening beings in each moment of thought in all kinds of worlds, in various forms, by various means, having entered the way of enlightening beings, to suffuse the worlds with various manifestations of the practice of enlightening beings, to show the bodies of all the buddhas of past, present, and future to other beings according to their mentalities in each moment of thought, increasing the flood of the ocean of wealth of all-knowledge for all beings.

rigs kyi bu/ de ltar bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa rnam par snang mdzad sngon byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa mdzad pa'i tshe 'jig rten gnas pa bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs dang bral ba/ sems can byas pa drin du mi gzo bas yongs su gang ba/ mi shes pa'i mun pas chod pa; bdag tu bya ba dang / bdag gir bya ba la mngon par zhen pa/ ma rig pa'i mun pa rab rib kyis bsgribs pa/ tshul bzhin ma yin par rnam par rtog pa la zhugs pa; lta ba thibs po bas dgon par mgo brlags pa/ rgyu dang 'bras bu la mgo rmongs pa/ nyon mongs pa dang las kyi dbang du gyur pa/ 'khor ba'i mya ngam chen po'i sdug bsngal gyi sa'i 'og tu lhung ba/ phongs pa'i sdug bsngal sna tshogs nyams su myong bar gyur pa rnams la thugs rje chen po bskyed de/ pha rol tu phyin pa sbyang ba'i sprin chen po mngon par bsgrubs te dge ba'i rtsa ba la brten par gnas pa/ yongs su bsngags pa dang sems can thams cad kyi 'khor ba'i phongs pa'i sdug bsngal rnam par bzlog pa dang / bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs chen po la mngon par mos par bya ba dang / rgyu'i dkyil 'khor gyi phyogs mngon par bstan pa dang / las dang chos su mi 'gal ba'i phyogs rab tu brjod pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos kyi dkyil 'khor yongs su bsdu ba'i phyogs snang bar bya ba dang / sems can thams cad kyi mos pa'i phyogs rab tu brjod par bya ba dang / sems can thams cad kyi zhing yongs su sgrub pa'i phyogs legs par bstan pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi rigs mi gcad pa'i phyogs kyi rjes su 'brang bar bya ba dang / sangs rgyas thams cad kyi bstan pa'i phyogs yongs su gzung ba dang / mi dge ba'i chos thams cad kyi phyogs rnam par bzlog pa dang / thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi tshogs kyi phyogs yongs su brjod pa mdzad de/ pha rol tu phyin pa'i sprin chen pos sems can gyi khams thams cad rgyas par bkang ste mngon par bsgrubs nas bsam pa ji lta ba bzhin du sems can tshim par 'gyur bar chos kyis shin tu bsdu ba la sems can rab tu dgod par mdzad do/ /thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi tshogs la yang dag par bskul to/ /byang chub sems dpa'i pha rol tu phyin pa chen po la rab tu btsud do/ /'phags pa'i nor thams cad rab tu thob par bya bas nye bar bstan to/ /thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du 'dun pa'i shugs kyis sems can rnams dge ba'i rtsa ba rgya mtsho rnam par 'phags par mdzad do/ /de bzhin gshegs pa rnam par 'phrul pa'i sgor yang de dag rab tu btsud de/ phung po shin tu zhi ba'i bde bas yongs su bsdu ba bsdus te/ de bzhin gshegs pa'i bdag nyid che ba la mngon du mos par byas nas byang chub sems dpas yongs su bzung ba'i ye shes la rab tu bkod do/ /

“Thus as Vairocana Buddha was carrying out the practice of enlightening beings in the past, he aroused great compassion for those without virtue or knowledge, those attached to the world, ungrateful, wrapped up in the darkness of nescience, egotistical and possessive, shrouded by the darkness of ignorance, immersed in unreasonable thought, lost in the wilderness of views, heedless of cause and effect, dominated by afflictions in action, fallen into a pit of suffering in the wasteland of the mundane whirl, experiencing the misery of various kinds of want; producing vast multitudes of practices of the ways of transcendence, praising the firm foundation of roots of goodness, removing the pain of mundane want from all sentient beings, fostering the growth of great stores of virtue and knowledge, clarifying the realm of causes, enlightening them on the consistency of deeds and states, showing the origin of all beings and lands, involving them in the continuation of the family of buddhas, getting them to remember the teachings of all buddhas, turning them away from all evil, describing the preparations for omniscience, producing a great multitude of transcendent practices filling all realms of beings, he established sentient beings in the care of the ultimate Teaching, satisfying them according to their mentalities. He directed them in preparation for omniscience, he introduced them to the great transcendent ways of enlightening beings, he got them to support themselves on the wealth of sages, he got them to increase their roots of goodness by the momentum of the joy of omniscience. Introducing them to the miracles of all buddhas, taking them into ultimate unattached bliss, showing them the greatness of the enlightened, he led them to enlightening beings’ knowledge of means of salvation.”

nor bzang gis smras pa/ 'phags ma khyod bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yang dag par zhugs nas ji srid cig lags/ smras pa/ rigs kyi bu/ gnas 'di ni/ yid ches par dka' ba ste/ shes par dka' ba'o/ /mos par dka' ba'o/ /'jug par dka' ba'o/ /brjod par dka' ba'o/ /khong du chud par dka' ba ste/ lha dang bcas pa'i 'jig rten dang / nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas thams cad kyis kyang khong du chud par mi nus so/ /gzhan du na de bzhin gshegs pa'i byin gyi rlabs dang / dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyis yongs su bzung ba ma gtogs te/ gnas 'di ni/ sems can 'khor ba'i bde ba thams cad la mngon par 'dod pa med pa/ de bzhin gshegs pa'i bde ba la lhag par dmigs pa/ sems can thams cad kyi sdug bsngal dang yid mi bde ba rab tu zhi bar bya ba la zhugs pa/ de bzhin gshegs pa'i yon tan rgya mtsho la 'jug pa'i nan tan la mngon par mos pa/ chos thams cad kyi rang bzhin nges par rtogs pa/ nam mkha'i spyod yul dang ldan pa/ mos pa yangs pa'i lam gyis rnam par dag pa/ 'khor ba'i rgyun las phyir phyogs pa/ de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi ye shes rgya mtsho la mngon par mos pa/ chos kyi grong khyer du 'gro bar gcig tu chad pa/ de bzhin gshegs pa'i yul yongs su gnon pa'i brtson 'grus can/ sangs rgyas kyi sa'i rgyud rnam par gnon pa/ thams cad mkhyen pa'i stobs yongs su rdzogs par bya ba la mngon par mos pa/ stobs bcu rab tu thob par bya ba'i mthar thug pa rnams kyis bsod nams dang / ye shes kyi tshogs yangs pas nye bar bsten pa'i sems dang / bsam pa rnam par dag pa dang ma zhum pa/ nyon mongs pa med pa dang ma yo ba dang / ma nyams pa dang / ma 'chums pa dang / mun pa med pa'i sems dang / ye shes kyi snang ba kun tu snang bas snang bar gyur pa'i sems dang / sems can thams cad la phan pa dang bde bar bya bar shin tu 'dun pa'i sems dang / bdud kyi 'khor dang nyon mongs pa thams cad kyis mi thub pa'i sems dang / thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi ye shes thob par bya bar skabs phye ba'i sems kyis kyang khong du chud pa dang / 'jug pa dang / yid ches par bya ba dang / gzung ba dang / rjes su 'brang bar bya ba'am/ shes par bya ba mi nus so/ /de ci'i phyir zhe na/ rigs kyi bu/ gnas 'di ni/ de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes kyi yul te/ byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyis yongs su ma non na/ sems can gzhan thams cad kyis lta ci zhig smos/ 'on kyang sems can cang shes rnams kyi bsam pa phun sum tshogs pa rnam par dag par bya ba dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba la spyod pa'i sems can rnams kyi lhag pa'i bsam pa dbang du 'gyur bar bya ba dang / khyod kyis bsam pa thag pa nas yongs su dris pa'i lung bstan pa'i chos nyid rab tu 'byung ba thob par bya ba'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa'i byin gyis bstan to/ / de nas mtshan mo'i lha mo shing thams cad kyi me tog rgyas pas bde bar gnas pas de'i tshe don de nyid brnan te bstan pa'i phyir dus gsum du byung ba'i de bzhin gshegs pa'i yul la rnam par bltas te tshigs su bcad pa 'di dag smras so/ /

Sudhana said, “How long ago did you set out for supreme perfect enlightenment?”
The goddess said, “This is hard to reach, hard to know, hard to believe, hard to penetrate, hard to say, hard to understand.
