Neither celestial nor human beings can comprehend it, nor can any listeners or individual illuminates comprehend it, except those who, by the empowerment of Buddha, by the help of spiritual benefactors, by the mind being stabilized on great stores of virtue and knowledge, by purity of intention, by the mind being buoyant, undisturbed, straightforward, unimpaired, open, unobscured, by the mind being illumined by the light of universal knowledge, by the mind being dedicated to the welfare and happiness of all beings, by the mind being invulnerable to the afflictions of all demons, by the mind being within range of attainment of omniscience, thus do not seek any mundane pleasures, are focused on the pleasure of the enlightened, have undertaken to put an end to the suffering and misery of all beings, are headed into the ocean of virtues of the enlightened, are in the realm of the space of meditation on the intrinsic nature of things, have purified the path of higher aspirations, have turned away from the flow of the mundane whirl, are turned toward the ocean of knowledge of the enlightened, are certain to arrive at the citadel of omniscience, proceed energetically into the sphere of those who arrive at Thusness, advance boldly toward buddhahood, are headed toward complete fulfillment of the powers of omniscience, and will ultimately attain the ten powers—such people can penetrate, believe in, grasp, follow, and know this matter. Why? Because this matter is the sphere of buddhas—not even enlightening beings can reach it, much less others. Now, with the support of the Buddha I will tell you, for the sake of the correct purification of the minds of those capable of learning, so that those who practice good can master their minds, and so that you may have an explanation of what is on your mind.”
Then the goddess, further elucidating what she meant, looked over the realm of the buddhas of past, present, and future and spoke these verses:

sangs rgyas sras po khyod kyis gang dris pa/ / de ni bsam yas zab mo sangs rgyas yul/ / bsam yas zhing gi rdul phran rab snyed kyi/ / bskal pa mang pos de kun brjod mi nus/ /
sems can 'dod pa'i sems ldan sdang ba dang / / de bzhin gti mug mun pas bsgribs pa dang / / 'chab dang dregs pas bsam pa nyams gyur pas/ / rgyal ba'i chos nyid zhi ba shes mi nus/ /
phrag dog 'jungs pa'i dbang gi rjes 'brang dang / / g.yo sgyus bsam pa rnyog par gyur pa dang / / nyon mongs las kyi sgrib pas bsgribs pa yis/ / sangs rgyas yul 'di shes par mi nus so/ /
phung po khams dang skye mched gnas pa dang / / 'jig tshogs mang la gnas par gyur pa dang / / lta sems 'du shes phyin ci log gyur pas/ / zhi ba'i sa 'di shes par mi nus so/ /
rgyal ba'i yul ni shes dka' zhi ba ste/ / rang bzhin dri med rnam par rtog pa med/ / srid par brten cing 'khor la chags pa yis/ / chos 'di yang dag shes par mi nus so/ /
sangs rgyas rigs su rigs ldan gang skyes pa/ / de bzhin gshegs pa kun gyis byin brlabs shing / / chos kyi rgyal po'i gdung rabs yongs 'dzin pa/ / drang srong de dag yul ni 'di yin no/ /
dkar chos rgya mtshos mi ngoms sems ldan zhing / / gang rnams dge ba'i bshes kyis yongs bzung ste/ / thub pa'i stobs la dmigs pa'i sems sprin can/ / de dag 'di thos bzod pa thob par 'gyur/ /
gang rnams bsam pa dri med rnams rtog med/ / bar snang mkha' bzhin phyogs dang phyogs mtshams su/ / mun pa rnam bsal blo gros sgron ma'i sprin/ / dri med de dag spyod yul 'di yin no/ /
snying rje'i bsam pas 'gro ba rgya mtsho rnams/ / dus gsum byung ba gang rnams rgyas byed cing / / sems can ma lus rjes 'brang byams pa can/ / de dag rgyal ba'i tshul 'dir 'jug par 'gyur/ /
gang rnams 'dzin med dga' ba'i sems ldan zhing / / rtag par bdog pa thams cad sbyin brtson la/ / sems can kun la mnyam par zhugs gyur pa/ / chags med de dag spyod yul sa 'di yin/ /
nyon mongs med sems bskyod med spyod ldan zhing / / gang rnams 'gyod pa rnams bsal la sems ldan te/ / sangs rgyas gdams ngag nan tan byed ldan pa/ / dri med de dag spyod yul 'di yin no; ;
gang rnams mi sgul sems ldan mi bskyod sems/ / chos kyi rang bzhin rtogs pa'i sems ldan zhing / / las kyi rgya mtshor mi 'gal sems ldan pa/ / mi bzad de dag rnam thar 'di yin no/ /
gang rnams mi skyo'i sems dang mi ldog sems/ / brtson 'grus mthu dang rtsal du ldan pa rnams/ / thams cad mkhyen tshogs brtson 'grus mtha' yas pa/ / brtul zhugs bzang ldan de dag yul 'di yin/ /
zhi ba'i sems ldan mnyam par bzhag pa gang / / shin tu zhir gyur rim dang bral ba rnams/ / kun mkhyen bsam gtan yan lag mchor spyod pa/ / rab tu zhi ba de dag tshul 'di yin/ /
gang rnams chags pa kun las sems grol zhing / / chos kyi rang bzhin khong du chud sems can/ / rgyal ba'i chos dbyings rtogs par khong chud pa/ / shes rab sgron ma de dag tshul 'di yin/ /
sems can rang bzhin rtogs sems ldan gyur cing / / gang rnams srid pa'i mtsho la chags med sems/ / sems can sems la gzugs brnyan zla 'char ba/ / lam mkhan de dag rnam thar 'di yin no; ;
dus gsum byung ba'i rgyal ba rgya mtsho rnams/ / smon lam gang chen mtsho rgyud skyes pa yi/ / zhing rnams kun tu phyi ma'i mthar spyod pa/ / kun tu bzang po de dag tshul 'di yin/ /
gang rnams chos dbyings tshul rnams rgya mtsho yis/ / 'gro ba rgya mtsho 'du dang 'jig pa yi/ / bskal par bcas pa khong du chud pa rnams/ / rtog med de dag rnam thar 'di yin no/ /
zhing rnams kun gyi rdul phran thams cad la/ / sangs rgyas grangs med shing rgyal drung bzhugs shing / / byang chub 'tshang rgya 'gro 'dul mthong ba yi/ / chags med dmigs can de dag tshul 'di yin/ /
khyod ni bskal pa rgya mtsho rgya chen du/ / dge ba'i bshes gnyen mang po bsnyen bkur te/ / chos 'dod chos tshol mi skyo 'dir phyin pas/ / thos nas de ni yongs su gzung bar nus/ /
khyod kyi bsam pa yongs su sbyang ba'i phyir/ / bde gshegs byin rlabs bsam gyis mi khyab pas/ / rnam par snang mdzad tshad med yul 'di yang / / kho mo'i tshig las chags pa med par 'byung / /

Profound, infinite, is the sphere of buddhas, Of which you now ask, O child of Buddha.
Even in eons as many as atoms in inconceivable lands It could not be fully told.
The peaceful nature of the buddhas cannot be known By the covetous or the malevolent, Or by those shrouded in the darkness of delusion, Or those whose minds are defiled by hypocrisy and conceit.
This sphere of buddhas cannot be known By those ruled by envy and jealousy, Or those whose minds are polluted by guile and deceit, Or those enshrouded by barriers of action based on afflictions.
Buddhahood cannot be known By those who depend on mental or material elements, Or those attached to the body as real, Or those with false views and ideas.
Hard to know is the tranquil realm of buddhas, Which is inherently pure and nonconceptual— This reality cannot be truly known By those attached to life and being.
Those who are born in the family of buddhas, Who are empowered by all the buddhas, Who preserve the lineage of the enlightened, Are the knowers of this sphere.
Those who are tireless in good practices And are helped by spiritual benefactors, With their minds focused on the powers of sages, They attain peace on perceiving this.
This is the sphere of the undefiled Whose minds are pure, without false ideas, Like the sky in all directions, Lamps of wisdom who have dispelled darkness.
Those who pervade all worlds Of all times with compassion And are benevolent to all beings Enter the way of the buddhas.
This is the stage of those without grasping, The happy ones without attachment Who always gladly give all there is Impartially to all beings.
This is the sphere of the undefiled, Whose minds are unafflicted and conduct impeccable, Whose minds are ultimately free from regret, Who apply themselves to practice of Buddha’s teaching.
This is the liberation of the inexhaustible Whose minds are unshakable, imperturbable, Whose minds are focused on the essence of things, Whose minds are unhindered by the oceans of actions.
This is the sphere of the disciplined, With indefatigable and nonregressing minds, With strength, vigor, and control, With endless energy in preparing for omniscience.
This is known to those gone to peace, With tranquil minds, concentrated, Ultimately calm and cool, Practitioners of all the branches of meditation.
This is known to the lamps of wisdom, Whose minds are liberated from all attachments And have penetrated the essence of things, Who have gone the way into the reality realm of the enlightened.
This is the liberation of those who know the path, Whose minds have penetrated the essence of beings, Whose minds are not imprisoned in the sea of existence, Who are moons reflected in the minds of beings.
This is known to the universally good, Who are born from the ocean of vows Of the buddhas past, present, and future, And carry them out forever in all lands.
This is the liberation of those who penetrate all oceans of worlds By means of the oceans of principles of the reality realm And see their ages of becoming and decay without discrimination.
This is known to those of unobstructed vision Who see the buddhas under the enlightenment trees, As many as atoms in all lands, Teaching after having realized enlightenment.
You have come after many eons Of serving spiritual benefactors In quest of the Teaching, seeking tirelessly; Having heard it, you can remember it.
To purify your mind I will tell you freely Of the infinite realm of Vairocana By the inconceivable power of Buddha.

rigs kyi bu/ sngon byung ba'i dus bskal pa 'jig rten gyi khams kyi rdul shin tu phra ba snyed kyi pha rol de'i yang pha snga zhig tu 'jig rten gyi khams rgya mtsho gser rin po che'i ri spos rnam par snang ba zhes bya ba byung ste/ rigs kyi bu/ 'jig rten gyi khams rgya mtsho gser rin po che'i ri spos rnam par snang ba der de bzhin gshegs pa ye shes ri bo'i 'od chos kyi dbyings su snang ba'i gzi brjid rgyal po zhes bya ba byung ste/ de bzhin gshegs pa ye shes kyi ri bo'i 'od chos kyi dbyings su snang ba'i gzi brjid rgyal po de/ sngon byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa mdzad pa'i tshe 'jig rten gyi khams rgya mtsho gser rin po che'i ri spos rnam par snang ba zhes bya ba/ 'jig rten gyi khams rgya mtsho'i sa dang ri rdul shin tu phra ba snyed kyi 'jig rten gyi khams 'byams klas pa bstan du yod pa dang ldan pa/ 'jig rten gyi khams kyi rgyud re re zhing yang bskal pa'i grangs shin tu bstan pa 'jig rten gyi khams kyi rdul shin tu phra ba snyed dang ldan pa; bskal pa re re zhing yang bskal pa bar ma shin tu bstan pa du ma dang ldan pa/ bskal pa bar ma re re zhing yang 'jig rten gyi khams rnam pa tha dad du bya ba bstan pa du ma dang ldan pa/ de bzhin gshegs pa 'byung ba dang / rdzu 'phrul sna tshogs bstan du yod pa/ de bzhin gshegs pa byung ba re re zhing yang mdo sde yang dag par bstan pa 'jig rten gyi khams kyi rdul shin tu phra ba snyed brjod du yod pa/ mdo sde re re la yang byang chub sems dpa'i lung bstan pa 'jig rten gyi khams brjod du med pa'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed bstan du yod pa/ sems can 'dul ba mtha' dang dbus med pa shin tu bstan pa tha dad pa'i tshul gyis bsgrubs pa/ sangs rgyas kyi rnam par 'phrul pa dang / cho 'phrul sna tshogs kyis rnam par 'dul ba dang ldan pa yongs su sbyangs te/ rigs kyi bu/ 'jig rten gyi khams rgya mtsho gser rin po che'i ri spos rnam par snang ba der 'jig rten gyi khams bar ma'i rgyud phyogs kun tu mngon par bltas pa'i sgo rgyal mtshan gyis rnam par brgyan pa zhes bya ba byung ste; rigs kyi bu/ 'jig rten gyi khams bar ma'i rgyud phyogs kun tu sgo mngon par bltas pa rgyal mtshan gyis rnam par brgyan pa der 'jig rten gyi khams rin po che thams cad kyi mdog kun tu snang ba'i dpal yon bya ba 'jig rten gyi khams kyi gzhi dang / mtshams kyi rgyan rin po che'i rgyal po de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi snying po byang chub rab tu snang ba las byas pa/ rin po che sna tshogs kyi me tog rgya mtsho la gnas pa/ lhun rin po che'i rgyal po de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi sprul pa'i gzugs brnyan rab tu ston pa las bsgrubs pa/ lha'i grong khyer gyi dbyibs su 'dug pa/ rnam par dag cing kun nas nyon mongs pa byang bar gyur te/ 'jig rten gyi khams der gling bzhi pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams ri rab kyi rdul shin tu phra ba snyed byung bar gyur to/ / gling bzhi pa'i ri rab kyi rdul shin tu phra ba snyed po de dag gi gling bzhi pa dbu ma rin po che sna tshogs kyi rtse mo'i rgyal mtshan zhes bya ba byung ste/ gling bzhi pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams rin po che sna tshogs kyi rtse mo'i rgyal mtshan der gling mchu zhang du dpag tshad brgya phrag stong yod pa bzhi byung nas gling re re la yang grong khyer chen po stong phrag re re byung ngo/ / gling bzhi pa de'i gling gi dbus su rgyal po'i gnas rin po che'i gnas rin po che'i sa las rnam par brgyan pa sprin gyi sgron ma zhes bya ba grong khyer stong phrag bcu'i 'khor dang ldan par byung ngo/ / de'i tshe 'dzam bu'i gling de'i mi rnams kyang tshe'i tshad lo stong phrag bcu thub par gyur to/ / rgyal po'i gnas rin po che'i sa las rnam par brgyan pa sprin gyi sgron ma der 'khor los bsgyur ba'i rgyal po chos thams cad kyi nga ro'i gdugs kyi dkyil 'khor rab tu sgrog pa zhes bya ba byung ste/ 'khor los bsgyur ba'i rgyal po chos thams cad kyi nga ro'i gdugs kyi dkyil 'khor rab tu sgrog pa de'i blon po ni/ lnga brgya byung ngo/ / btsun mo ni/ stong phrag drug byung ngo/ / sras ni/ kun kyang dpa' ba/ rtul phod pa/ yan lag dam pa'i gzugs dang ldan pa; blta na sdug pa/ gzi brjid che ba/ stobs che ba brgya phrag bdun byung ngo/ / rgyal po chos thams cad kyi nga ro'i gdugs kyi dkyil 'khor rab tu sgrog pa de'i tshe la dzam+bu'i gling thams cad kyang gdugs gcig gis bskyangs par gyur te pha rol gyi 'khor dang dgra thams cad kyang shin tu chom par gyur to/ /

The goddess continued, “Long ago, past eons as many as atoms in an ocean of worlds, there was an ocean of worlds called Sun on the Summit of a Mountain of Gold and Jewels. Therein, furthermore, was a buddha called Supreme Light Illumining the Realm of Truth at the Summit of Knowledge, who purified that ocean of worlds while carrying out the practice of enlightening beings in the past. In that ocean of worlds were as many world systems as atoms in all the mountains on earth, each system containing as many worlds as atoms in a galaxy. In each world there were as many sets of eons as atoms in a world, each containing many eons, in each of which there were many events, including buddhas appearing in the world and displaying miracles. Each buddha that appeared expounded as many scriptures as atoms in a world, in each of which scriptures were outlined as many instructions for enlightening beings as atoms in the world, with infinitely various indications of how to guide sentient beings, operated by the principles of various vehicles of liberation, guided by the buddhas’ various mystic powers of perception and prescription.
“Within that ocean of worlds was a central world-system called Array of Markers of Doors Facing All Directions, in which there was a world called Ubiquitous Light the Color of All Jewels. The borders of that world were arrayed with jewels reflecting images of the enlightenment sites of all buddhas; it rested on an ocean of flowers made of all kinds of jewels, it was composed of jewels showing the appearances of emanations of all buddhas, it was shaped like a celestial palace, and it was pure with an admixture of defilement. Furthermore, in that world there were as many world-regions with four continents as atoms in the polar mountain; at the center was a set of four continents called Mountain Peak of All Jewels, whose four continents were innumerable hundreds of thousands of leagues in extent. On each continent were ten thousand great cities. In the middle of the southern continent was a great metropolis called the Light of Myriad Arrays of Jewel Trees, surrounded by ten thousand cities. On that continent, furthermore, the life span of the people was ten thousand years. The king in that metropolis was named Encompassing Sound of the Proclamation of All Laws, a sovereign ruler. The king had five hundred ministers, six thousand concubines, and seven hundred sons all of whom were brave and manly, well built and handsome, dignified and strong. The whole continent was under the protection of that king, and he had no enemies or opponents.

de'i tshe 'jig rten gyi khams der bskal pa bar ma ni/ zad du cha/ rnyog pa lnga 'jig rten du byung / dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam ni/ nub par gyur nas sems can mi dge ba bcu'i lam la spyod pa phal cher ngan song du yang 'dong bar gyur to/ / de dag mi dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam yongs su 'dzin pa'i rgyus tshe thung ba dang / longs spyod chung ba dang / gzugs ma legs pa dang / kha dog mi sdug pa dang / lus ma legs pa dang / bde ba'i rnam pa nyung ba dang / sdug bsngal nyams su myong ba'i rnam pa mang ba dang / phan tshun slu zhing 'drid pa'i rang bzhin can dang / phan tshun dbye ba la zhugs pa dang / zhe gcod pa'i tshig la spyod pa dang / 'chal ba'i tshig tu smra ba dang / 'dod pa mi bzad pas zil gyis non pa dang / zhe sdang ba'i yid kyi rtog pa dang ldan pa/ lta ba'i thibs po sna tshogs kyi mya ngan du 'khyams par gyur nas de dag chos ma yin pa'i 'dod chags la zhen cing 'dod pa mi bzad pas zil gyis non la/ log pa'i chos kyis kun nas 'khor bas sa la shing rtsi dang / lo zas skye bar 'gyur ba'i char yang dus su mi 'bab par 'gyur te/ sems can de dag kyang dang / gel ba dang / sman dang / nags tshal dang / bza' shing gi ra ba dang / sdong po dag kyang bskams par gyur nas nad sna tshogs kyis thebs shing phyogs dang phyogs mtshams su skyabs med pas phan tshun khod mi myong zhing g.yen spyo bar gyur te/ de dag kun kyang gcig tu 'dus nas rgyal ba'i gnas rin po che'i sa las rnam par brgyan pa sprin gyi sgron ma gang na ba der dong ste kun tu bskor nas la la ni/ lag pa gyen tu bsgreng / la la ni/ thal mo sbyor/ la la ni/ lus shin tu 'dar/ la la ni/ gyed/ la la ni/ bub/ la la ni/ lus thams cad kyis phab cing phyag 'tshal/ la la ni/ pus mo sa la 'dzugs/ la la ni/ lag pa nam mkha'i dbyings su g.yo ba/ la la ni/ gos med cing sgren mor 'khod/ la la ni/ kha mig mi sdug par gyur cing rgyal po chos thams cad kyi nga ro'i gdugs kyi dkyil 'khor rab tu sgrog pa la mngon du bltas shing / snying rje rje skad du 'o dod chen po 'bod de/ lha chen po/ bdag cag ni/ nyam thag go /bkres pa dang skom pa'i sdug bsngal gyis rab tu gzir to/ / 'jigs pa sna tshogs kyis g.yen spyo'o/ / bdag cag la skyabs su yang ma mchis so/ / bdag cag la mgon dang dpung gnyen ma mchis so/ / sdug bsngal gyi shing thags kyis 'khor to/ / srog chad la thug go /'chi bar gyur ma khad do/ / zhes te/ smre sngags sna tshogs su bla zhing dbyangs kyi rnam pa sna tshogs dang / tshig sna tshogs kyis kha gdong mi sdug par gyur par 'du shes dang / tshig sna tshogs kyi tha snyad dang / cho 'brang dang / skad kyi gdangs don sna tshogs rjod pa'i tshig dang / ngag gis 'o dod bos so/ / rgyal po'i gnas de'i skyes pa dang / bud med dang / khye'u dang / bu mo bkres pa dang / skom pas mnar ba/ lus la rgyan med pa/ sgren mo gos med pa/ kha dog mi sdug pa/ lus gas shing rtsub pa/ sdug bsngal zhing yid mi bde la mi dga' ba de dag thams cad kyang bde ba ni/ mngon par 'dod/ sdug bsngal gyi 'jigs pas ni/ brla khyer nas rgyal po shes pa'i skyes bu chen po chos thams cad kyi nga ro'i gdugs kyi dkyil 'khor rab tu sgrog pa de la bde ba thams cad thob par bya ba'i 'du shes dang / sdug bsngal thams cad dang mi 'grogs par bya ba'i 'du shes dang / 'tsho ba'i bsam pa dang ldan zhing gter thob par bya ba'i 'du shes dang / mu stegs mthong bar bya ba'i 'du shes dang / lam chen po la nan tan du bya ba'i 'du shes dang / gru chen po'i 'du shes dang / ye shes kyi gling chen po'i 'du shes dang / don chen po rab tu thob par bya ba'i 'du shes dang / mtho ris kyi dga' ba dang / bde ba thams cad rab tu thob par bya ba'i 'du shes kyis mgon dang skyabs tshol bar gyur to/ /

“At that time the end of the eon was approaching in that world; the five corruptions were in evidence, people had stopped acting virtuously and had taken to bad ways, most of them were headed for misery. Because of their wrongdoings their lives were short, they had scanty means of subsistence, they were ugly, they experienced little pleasure and much pain, they were in the habit of argument and dissent, they were given to foul and incoherent speech, they were overcome by acquisitiveness, they were corrupt in mind and thought, they were lost in the jungle of various views. As they were obsessed with unreasonable desires and dominated by unwholesome acquisitiveness, the rain that would cause the crops to grow did not fall in the proper season. For that reason, furthermore, with all the vegetation withered, the people suffered from various diseases and scattered to the eight directions, without resort. They all went to the capital city Light of Myriad Arrays of Jewel Trees, surrounded it, and with various gestures of supplication raised a great outcry to the king—‘We are oppressed, abandoned, tormented by hunger and thirst, dismayed and distressed, without any savior, without refuge or resort, in a cage of suffering; our livelihood is threatened, and we are on the brink of death.’ The people in the city who were suffering from hunger and thirst, who were naked and homeless, who were in misery, despondent, and depressed, also were sick and tired of suffering. They betook themselves to the king as a man of great knowledge and a protector, thinking they had found a source of comfort, happiness, and livelihood, a guide to the way out, a great ship, an island of jewels of knowledge, a great benefit, thinking they had found all the delights of heaven.

rgyal po chos thams cad kyi nga ro'i gdugs kyi dkyil 'khor rab tu sgrog pas 'khor kun nas slong ba mang po snying rje rje skad du 'bod pa'i 'o dod chen po de thos nas de snying rje chen po'i sgo brgya stong grangs med pa phrag bcu la zhugs par gyur to/ / de snying rje chen po'i tshul yid la bab pa'i sems su gyur nas yud tsam zhig rtse gcig tu bsam ste snying rje chen po dang ldan pa'i tshig bcu brjod do/ /
bcu gang zhe na/ kyi hud kye sems can 'di dag ni/ 'khor ba'i g.yang sa chen por lhung yang skyabs med pa lta na/ bdag nam zhig 'khor ba'i g.yang sa chen por lhung ba'i sems can rnams de bzhin gshegs pa'i sa la 'god pas gnas su 'gyur/ kyi hud kyi sems can 'di dag ni/ nyon mongs pa'i gnod pas gtses shing skyabs med pa lta na/ nam zhig bdag sems can nyon mongs pa sna tshogs kyi 'jigs pa dang gnod pas gtses te skyabs med pa rnams kha na ma tho ba med pa'i las kyi mtha' la 'god pas skyabs su 'gyur/ kyi hud kye sems can 'di dag ni/ 'jig rten na rga shi'i 'jigs pas tshar chod cing mgon med pa lta na/ nam zhig bdag sems can mgon med pa rnams kyi 'khor ba'i 'jigs pa thams cad rnam par sel bas mgon du 'gyur/ kyi hud kye sems can 'di dag ni/ 'jig rten gyi 'jigs pa sna tshogs kyis gtses te rten med pa lta na/ nam zhig bdag sems can 'jig rten gyi 'jigs pa sna tshogs kyis gtses pa rnams shin tu bde zhing skyon med pa'i thams cad mkhyen pa'i lam la dgod pas rten du 'gyur/ kyi hud kye sems can 'di dag ni/ ma rig pa'i mun par 'thom ste the tshom dang / yid gnyis kyi rab rib kyis bsgribs pa lta na/ nam zhig bdag sems can thams cad kyi ma rig pa'i mun pa rnam par sel bas sgron mar 'gyur/ kyi hud kye sems can 'di dag ni/ snang ba dang bral ba lta na/ nam zhig bdag ye shes kyi sgo rab rib med pa yongs su ston pas ye shes chen po'i snang ba 'byin par 'gyur/ kyi hud kye sems can 'di dag ni/ phrag dog dang / 'jungs ba dang / g.yo dang / sgyu'i rnyog pas bsam pa rnyog pa can du gyur te ye shes kyi mdog gsal ba med pa lta na/ nam zhig bdag sems can thams cad shin tu dag pa la rab tu gsal bar byed par 'gyur/ kyi hud kye sems can 'di dag ni/ 'khor ba rgya mtsho'i yul gyi rgyud du zhugs shing 'dren pa med pa lta na/ nam zhig bdag sems can chos thams cad chos rgya mtsho'i tshul la 'dzud par gyur cing 'dren par 'ong / kyi hud kye sems can 'di dag ni/ ma dul zhing rnam par 'dren pa med pa lta na/ nam zhig bdag sems can thams cad rnam pa thams cad du yongs su smin par bya ba dang / rnam par gdul ba la de bzhin gshegs pa'i byin gyi rlabs kyis dus las mi 'da' zhing rnam par 'dren par 'ong / kyi hud kye sems can 'di dag ni/ dmus long du gyur te yongs su 'dren pa med pa lta na/ nam zhig bdag sems can thams cad sgrib pa med pa'i thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes kyi tshul la 'dzud cing yongs su 'dren par 'gyur/

“The king, hearing their outcry, was filled with countless tens of hundreds of thousands of facets of great compassion. Meditating on the principle of great compassion, in a moment he became single-minded and uttered ten statements of great compassion: ‘Alas, these people, without support, have fallen into the great pitfall of the mundane whirl—how can I be a refuge for them, leading them to the state of repose of the enlightened? Alas, these people have no savior and are oppressed by all kinds of afflictions—how can I become their savior, leading them to impeccable behavior? Alas, these people have no refuge in the world and are terrorized by old age and death—how can I become a refuge for them, removing all their fears of life and death? Alas, these people have no resort and are oppressed by various kinds of worldly distress—how can I become a resort for them, leading them to ultimate safety on the path of omniscience? Alas, everyone is in the darkness of ignorance, shrouded in the darkness of uncertainty and doubt—how can I become a light, dispelling the darkness of ignorance for them? Alas, these people are without illumination—how can I spread the light of great knowledge, showing them all the way into unobscured knowledge? Alas, the world of these people lacks the light of knowledge, and their minds are polluted by envy, jealousy, guile, and deceit—how can I produce the light of supreme knowledge, leading them all to cultivate purity? Alas, the world is without a guide and has plunged into a dangerous current in the ocean of the mundane whirl—how can I become a guide, to show them what to do? Alas, everyone lacks a teacher, all are misguided—how can I become a teacher for everyone, with the proper timing commanded by a buddha to guide people to complete maturity in all qualities? Alas, everyone lacks a leader, all are as though blind—how can I become a leader, to lead everyone on the way to unobstructed omniscience?’

de skad du des snying rje chen po dang ldan pa'i tshig rnam pa bcu brjod nas rgyal po'i gnas der dril chen po brdungs te gtong ba chen po'i rnga bo che'ang yongs su brdungs nas su ci 'dod pa de la de sbyin gyi/ 'gro ba thams cad kyang yongs su tshim par bya'o; ;zhes sgra brjod nas des 'dzam bu'i gling thams cad kyi rgyal po'i gnas thams cad dang / grong dang / grong khyer dang / ljongs dang / yul dang / grong rdal thams cad du yo byad thams cad kyi mdzod phye ste/ lam gyi mdo dang / lam gyi sum mdo dang / srang thams cad du'ang yo byad sna tshogs kyi rnam pa mang po bkod de/ 'gro ba thams cad nye bar 'tsho bar bstabs so/ / mdzod dang bang ba thams cad kyang phye ste/ rin po che'i gter chen po dang / tshogs kyang yongs su bstan to/ / rin po che rnam pa sna tshogs kyi phung po du ma yang spungs so/ / zas dang / skom dang / gos dang / bzhen pa dang / me tog dang / phreng ba dang / bdug pa dang / byug pa dang / phye ma dang / gos rin po che kha dog sna tshogs kyi mdzod phye nas khang pa dang / gzhal med khang dang / khyim mang po mal cha dang / stan dang / gos kyis yongs su brgyan te nor dang dbyig thams cad phun sum tshogs par byas nas nor bu rin po che'i rgyal po snang ba'i gzi brjid rnam par bkod pas mun pa rnam par sel ba bshams nas des sems can de dag ci 'dod pa'i bsam pa thams cad yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir khyim de dag re rer yang rang gi lus dang 'dra ba'i sprul pa'i lus mngon par sprul te kun tu bkod do/ / sems can thams cad kyi nad thams cad gso ba'i phyir sman pa dang / sman dang / rim gro pa dang / 'tsho ba'i yo byad sna tshogs kyi rkyen phun sum tshogs pa yongs su bshams so/ / rin po che sna tshogs kyi snod rnam pa tha dad pa yo byad sna tshogs kyis ci rigs su bkang pa dag kyang nye bar bkod de/ 'di ltar rin po che rdo rje'i snod ni/ spos kyi nor bu rin po che sna tshogs kyis yongs su bkang / spos kyi nor bu rin po che sna tshogs kyi snod ni/ gos kha dog dam pa sna tshogs kyis yongs su bkang ngo/ / shing rta mang po dbyibs dang mdog sna tshogs su 'dug pa/ rin po che sna tshogs kyis rab tu brgyan pa/ rta dang glang po dang ba lang cang shes la bcas pa/ rin po che'i shing rta sna tshogs rgyal po'i rkyen du rung ba/ rin po che thams cad kyi rgyan gyi longs spyod dang ldan pa/ stan sna tshogs bting ba/ rin po che sna tshogs kyis rnam par brgyan pa/ bla re sna tshogs bres pa/ rin po che'i dril bu'i dra ba bres pa/ gdugs dang / rgyal mtshan dang / ba dan bsgreng bas brgyan pa dag gis kyang yul gyi phyogs gang bar bkod do/ / grong dang / grong khyer dang / ljongs dang / yul thams cad sbyin par yang 'o dod kyis bsgo'o/ / bza' shing gi ra ba dang / kun dga'i ra ba dang / dka' thub kyi nags tshal sna tshogs yongs su gtang ba dang / khyim dang / chung ma dang; bu dang / bu mo thams cad yongs su gtang ba dang / rin po che rin thang med pa thams cad yongs su gtang ba dang / rang gi snying dang / rkang dang / rgyu ma dang / mkhal ma dang; tshil dang / sha dang / khrag dang / pags pa dang / rkang lag dang / rna ba dang / mig dang / sna dang / so dang / mchu dang / mgo yongs su gtang ba nas phyi nang gi dngos po thams cad rnam pa thams cad du yongs su gtang bar yang 'o dod kyis bsgo'o/ /

“Having made these expressions of compassion, the king announced that he would undertake a great sacrifice, that he would satisfy everyone, giving them whatever they needed. With that the storehouses in every city and town on the continent were opened and all kinds of goods were placed on the streets, all the necessities of life were set out, all treasuries were opened, all stores of valuables were displayed; and the king projected a likeness of himself to every house to fulfill their wishes.

des yo byad de lta bu yongs su gtang ba'i rnam pa mang po bshams te bsags nas rgyal po'i gnas rin po che'i sa las rnam par brgyan pa'i sprin gyi sgron ma de'i shar phyogs logs na grong khyer rin chen rtse mo'i gzi brjid ces bya ba'i mdun rol nas gzhi mnyam pa'i phyogs yangs pa mchu zheng du rgya che zhing mnyam pa/ mthon dman med pa/ rnam par dag cing gzhi mnyam pa/ ngam grog dang / g.yang sa dang / sdong dum dang; tsher ma dang / gseg ma dang / gyo mo thams cad med pa/ rin po che thams cad kyi khams las grub pa/ gzhi rin po che thams cad las byas shing rin po che'i rgyal po thams cad bkram pa; nor bu rin po che'i rgyan rnam pa du mas brgyan pa/ rin po che'i me tog sna tshogs kyis gang ba/ phye ma sna tshogs dri shin tu zhim pa'i rdul ldang ba/ bdug spos sna tshogs kyis bdugs pa/ rin po che'i sgron ma dpal gyi gzi brjid can rab tu 'bar ba/ spos dang bdug spos thams cad kyi na bun dang / sprin gyis nam mkha' kun tu khebs pa'i rgyan dang ldan pa; rin po che sna tshogs kyi shing gi phreng ba legs par bkye bas mdzes par brgyan pa/ khang pa dang / gzhal med khang dang / khang pa brtsegs pa sna tshogs kyis yongs su brgyan pa/ gdugs dang / rgyal mtshan dang / ba dan bsgreng ba/ rin po che'i snam bu lding ba/ rnam par snang ba/ rin po che sna tshogs kyi me tog gi dra bas kun nas khebs pa/ rin po che spos thams cad kyi rgyal po'i dra ba'i gdugs kyi dkyil 'khor can/ gser gyi dra ba las rin po che'i dril bu 'khrol ba dang ldan pa/ bla re rin po che sna tshogs kyis rnam par mdzes par byas pas khebs par bres pa/ spos kyi rgyal po sna tshogs kyi phye ma rnam par bkram pa/ rin po che sna tshogs kyi me tog sil mas dga' dga' ltar gang ba/ rol mo brdung ba dang dkrol ba bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong gi sgra skad yid du 'ong ba 'byung ba/ rin po che thams cad kyi rgyan sna tshogs rnam par dag pas rnam par brgyan pa/ byang chub sems dpa'i las rnam par smin pas mngon par grub pa zhig yod pa

“Having arranged this act of giving things away, he had a great place of sacrifice prepared east of the city, in front of the city gate called Jewel Mountain Light. That place was equal in length and width, covering a most extensive area. It was level and clean, without potholes, clear of brambles, dust, and gravel. It was made of all precious elements, and the surface was spread with jewels. It was adorned with many arrays of jewels and strewn with flowers of various jewels. There was an abundance of all the finest aromatic powders, and it was perfumed with all kinds of scents. There were lamps giving off jewel lights, and the sky was covered with radiant clouds of incense. The place was adorned with orderly rows of trees of all kinds of jewels as well as various mansions, palaces, and towers. Overhead were parasols, banners, and pennants, flashing with trailing strings of various jewels. It was covered with nets of various jewel flowers, encircled with parasols made of webs of fragrant jewels. Jewel bells on nets of gold rang. It was shaded by canopies shining with various jewels, spread with aromatic powders of all the finest fragrances, and beautifully strewn with flowers made of all kinds of jewels, while pleasant music sounded from innumerable instruments. It was purified with arrays of various ornaments of all kinds of jewels, produced as a result of the deeds of enlightening beings.

de'i dbus su seng+ge'i khri chen po rin po che sna bcu las grub pa'i sa'i gzhi sna tshogs la gnas pas rin po che'i khri 'phang sna tshogs bcu'i 'khor gyis rnam par mdzes par byas pa/ rin po che'i shing yal ga can bcus stegs bu'i mtshams rnam par klubs pa'i rgyan mdzes pa dang ldan pa/ rdo rje'i 'khor lo'i sa'i gzhi mi shigs pa la rkang pa rab tu brten pa/ rin po che thams cad kyi gzugs dang mdog yongs su 'dzin pa'i stan gyi 'khor lo can/ rin po che du ma las byas pa'i bog re'i rgyan brgya phrag du mas brgyan pa/ rin po che sna tshogs kyi tshom bu rnam pa tha dad pa'i rgyan gyis shin tu brgyan pa/ rin po che'i rgyal mtshan kun nas rnam par phye ste 'phel ba bsgreng ba/ rin po che sna tshogs kyi ba dan dbyangs pa/ rnam pa tha dad pa'i rgyan dang ldan pa/ rin po che'i dril bu'i dra bas brgyan pa'i lha rdzas kyi rin po che sna tshogs dang / gser gyi dra ba sna tshogs rnam par bres pa/ rin po che sna tshogs kyi me tog gi dra ba dang / rin po che'i rgyal po chen po'i dra ba dang / gos rin po che sna tshogs dang / rin po che'i dra ba ci rigs su kun nas bkab cing mdzes par byas pa'i rgyan dang ldan pa/ spos rin po che rnam pa tha dad pa'i tshogs las snyim pas bcus shing sprin mngon par gtor ba/ rin po che'i rgyal po kha dog dang dri bsam gyis mi khyab pa las byung ba'i dbyibs yid du 'ong ba sna tshogs dang / spos thams cad kyi na bun dang sprin 'byung ba/ gam yo nas lha rdzas kyi spos dang bdug spos sna tshogs kyis rab tu bdugs pa/ lha rdzas las kyang 'das pa'i stan reg na bde ba kha dog bzang po du ma can legs par bting ba/ lha rdzas kyi rol mo dang glu snyan pa yid du 'ong pa brgya stong du ma'i sgra kun nas 'byung ba/ rin po che sna tshogs kyi them skas kyi phreng ba gdan gyis rnam par klubs pas rab tu brgyan pa'i rgyan dang ldan pa/ rin po che'i 'bru'i gzugs rin po che sna tshogs kyis spras pa/ rnam par 'phrul pa sna tshogs kyis rnam par snang bar byed pa'i 'od dang ldan pa mngon par grub ste/ de la rgyal po chos thams cad kyi nga ro'i gdugs kyi dkyil 'khor rab tu sgrog pa gzugs bzang pa/ shin tu mdzes pa/ blta na sdug pa; kha dog bzang po dam pa rgyas pa dang ldan pa/ mi chen po'i mtshan rnam par dag pa rab tu thob pa/ rin po che rnam par snang ba'i cod pan can/ rdo rje mthu bo che ltar mkhregs shing mi shigs pa'i lus dang ldan pa/ rtsib ma'i mtshams thags bzang zhing brtan par 'brel ba/ yan lag dang nying lag thams cad yongs su bzang ba/ kun nas bzang ba/ kun nas mdzes pa/ kun nas sdug pa/ rnam pa'i mchog thams cad dang ldan pa/ chos kyi rgyal po chen po'i rigs su byung ba/ yo byad thams cad la dbang rab tu thob pa/ chos kyi dbang shin tu rnam par dag pas rang gi sems la dbang bsgyur ba/ tshig gi dkyil 'khor kha ma bab pa/ mi 'khrugs pa'i ye shes dang ldan pa/ chos kyi sbyor ba ma nor ba shin tu brtan par byas pa/ yon tan dang legs pa mtha' yas par brjod du yod pa de 'dug par gyur to/ /

“In the middle was a great lion throne, standing on a surface made of a variegated collection of ten kinds of jewels, surrounded by shining railings made of ten kinds of jewels, beautified with trees of ten kinds of jewels arrayed evenly between the railings, its feet firmly set on unbreakable diamond. The throne was set with jewel figurines and was adorned with hundreds of jewel protuberances. It was embellished with variegated arrays of jewels, jewel banners and streamers were raised all around it, and it was covered with nets of jewel bells, nets of celestial jewels, and nets of jewel flowers. It gave off clouds of fragrance and was arrayed with many-colored cloths of pleasant texture, finer than those of the heavens. Sweet music and song were heard all around. There were stairs of various jewels, arrayed with banners and railings, and shining jewel statues depicting various spiritual transfigurations. Here the king sat, handsome, serene, endowed with the pure marks of a great man, strong, robust, good, kind, and virtuous in all ways, endowed with all the best qualities, born of a line of great rulers, in command of all goods, pure in control of the law, master of his own mind, eloquent, endowed with unshakable knowledge, correctly applying well-constructed laws, showing endless virtues.

rgyal po chos thams cad kyi nga ro'i gdugs kyi dkyil 'khor rab tu sgrog pa de seng+ge'i khri chen po la 'dug pa dang steng gi spyi bo'i thad ka'i bar snang la gdugs kyi dkyil 'khor chen po rin po che sna tshogs rnam par 'brel ba'i yu ba can/ nor bu rin po che dam pa'i mdzod kyi snying po dang ldan pa/ rin po che sna tshogs kyi shar bu brgya stong legs par bres pa/ rin po che du ma'i 'od 'phro ba dpal gyi gzi brjid rab tu 'bar bas rnam par brgyan pa/ 'dzam bu chu klung gi gser 'od 'tsher zhing gsal la rnam par dag pas bla nas bkab pa/ rin po che sna tshogs spa bar spel bas spras pa'i gser gyi dra bas nang shun gyi rgyan byas pa/ mu tig sna tshogs kyi se mo do mngon par dpyangs pa/ rin po che sna tshogs kyi dra bas kun nas bkab pa/ rin po che'i dril bu'i dra ba las gser rin po che'i dril chen rin po che'i chun po'i lda ldi la brgyus pa mngon par dpyangs pa/ nor bu rin po che dam pa'i phreng ba kun nas mngon par dpyangs pa'i rgyan dang ldan pa/ lha rdzas kyi sgra yid du 'ong ba'i gdangs grags par 'byung ba/ sems can thams cad dag pa'i las kyi lam la skul ba'i dril gyi sgra rnam par grags pa byung bar gyur te/ rgyal po chos thams cad kyi nga ro'i gdugs kyi dkyil 'khor rab tu sgrog pa de/ rin po che'i rdul yab kyis mngon par g.yab cing lha'i dbang po brgya byin bas kyang lhag par gzi brjid rab tu 'bar bas shin tu mdzes so/ / de seng+ge'i khri de la 'dug ma thag tu 'gro ba mang po de dag thams cad mngon du gyur te thal mo sbyar nas rgyal po de la phyag 'tshal lo/ /

“Furthermore, as the king sat there, in the sky above him there appeared a great parasol, on a long, brilliant jewel pole, its hundred thousand ribs made of all kinds of jewels, brilliantly adorned with blazing lights, covered with lustrous gold, arrayed with nets of jewels, hung with bells of gold and jewels on strings of jewels, adorned with garlands of jewels twirling all around, producing sweet heavenly sounds, the ringing of the bells urging all beings to act virtuously. The king, moreover, fanned with jewel wisp fans, shone with a splendor surpassing that of the king of gods. As soon as the king sat on this throne, all the people stood before him with their palms joined and paid their respects.

de nas rgyal po chos thams cad kyi nga ro'i gdugs kyi dkyil 'khor rab tu sgrog pa de'i drung du slong ba'i srog chags bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong sna tshogs dngos po sna tshogs yongs su len pa/ yo byad sna tshogs la mos pa/ rigs sna tshogs dang ldan pa/ 'gro ba'i rgyun sna tshogs su gtogs pa/ 'dod pa sna tshogs kyi sems dang ldan pa/ smon pa dang bsam pa sna tshogs can/ phyogs sna tshogs nas 'dus pa/ yul gyi spyod pa sna tshogs la gnas pa; longs spyod sna tshogs la mngon par smon pa'i sems dang ldan pa/ bsam pa dang yongs su rtog pa sna tshogs can/ mi'i ris sna tshogs su gtogs pa/ rigs kyi skye gnas sna tshogs su skyes pa/ yul sna tshogs nas 'ongs pa/ sgra skad dang tshig gi 'du byed sna tshogs dang ldan pa/ dbyings kyi dkyil 'khor sna tshogs 'byin pa/ dngos po sna tshogs kyi don du gsol ba 'debs pa/ tshig dang ngag sna tshogs brjod pa/ bsod nams kyi ri rab chen po de 'ba' zhig gi gdong du lta ba/ 'di 'ba' zhig shes pa'i skyes bu chen po yin zhes nges par sems ba/ bsod nams chen pos brtan pa'o/ /skyes bu chen po'i zla ba'o/ /gtong ba chen po'i bsam pa dang ldan pa'o/ /zhes bya bar 'dun pa'i sems kyis rtog pa/ byang chub sems dpa'i smon lam gyi sems kyis 'dug pa/ byang chub sems dpa'i smon lam gyi sems kyis sprul pa'i slong mo pa'i tshogs chen po de mthong nas slong mo ba de dag la sems dga' ba dang / sems mos pa dang / sems spro ba dang / dge ba'i bshes gnyen mthong ba'i 'du shes su gyur to; ;snying rje chen po'i shugs drag po shin tu yangs pa yang byung bar gyur to/ /phyi ma'i mtha'i bskal par slong mo ba thams cad yongs su tshim par bya ba las phyir mi ldog pa'i brtson 'grus kyi shugs drag po yang skyes par gyur to/ /'gro ba thams cad du snyoms pa'i sbyor bas yongs su gtang ba'i sems kyis rgyas par dgang ba'i sprin kyang mngon par byung bar gyur te/

“Then, seeing the assembly of countless petitioners, with various needs and desires, from various places, speaking various languages, all looking up to the king as the pole of prosperity, each thinking of him as a man of great knowledge, looking up to him as a great man of goodness and charity, considering him to have undertaken the vows of enlightening beings, the king felt as if he were seeing good friends and was flooded with immense compassion. There arose in him the dauntless energy to satisfy all petitioners forever and the all-pervasive will to give to everyone impartially.

rgyal po chos thams cad kyi nga ro'i gdugs kyi dkyil 'khor rab tu sgrog pa des slong mo ba de dag mthong ba'i mod la de'i rgyus ches dga' bar gyur gyi; bskal pas mtshams med pa'i mthas klas par stong gsum gyi 'khor los bsgyur ba'i rgyal po thob pas ni/ ma yin no/ /bskal pa bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong mang po'i mthas klas par brgya byin gyi dbang la gnas pas ni/ ma yin no/ /bskal pa bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong mang po'i mthas klas par rab mtshe ma'i lha'i rgyal po'i dbang la gnas ba thob pas ni/ ma yin no/ /bskal pa bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong mang po'i mthas klas par rab dga' ldan gyi lha'i rgyal po'i dbang la gnas pas ni/ ma yin no/ /bskal pa tshad med pa'i mthas klas par rab 'phrul dga'i lha'i rgyal po'i dbang phyug gi dbang la gnas pa thob pas ni/ ma yin no/ /bskal pa bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i mthas klas par dbang sgyur gyi lha'i rgyal po'i dbang rab tu thob ste lha'i bu mo bzhin bzang mo yid du 'ong bas bsnyen bkur bas ni/ ma yin no/ /bskal pa brjod du med pa'i mthas klas par tshangs pa'i gnas kyi bde bas tshangs pa'i thabs la gnas pa thob pas ni/ ma yin no/ /bskal pa mtha' yas pa'i mthas klas par gya nom snang ba'i lha'i bde ba thob pas ni/ ma yin no/ /bskal pa dpag tu med cing mi zad par dge rgyas kyi lha'i bde ba thob pas ni/ ma yin no/ /bskal pa mu med pa'i mthas klas par gnas gtsang ma'i lha'i rnam par thar pa zhi ba'i bde ba la rnam par spyod pa thob pas ni/ ma yin no/ /rigs kyi bu/ 'di lta ste/ dper na/ skyes bu sred pa la spyod pa pha ma dang / phu nu dang / bu sring dang / mdza' bo dang / blon po dang / gnyen bshes dang / bu dang / bu mo dang / chung ma dang / yun ring mo zhig tu bral la/ 'brog dgon par 'khyams te/ de dag mthong bar 'dod 'dod pa las de dag dang phrad na/ de dag mthong bas mi ngoms shing dga' ba dang / chags pa chen po skye bar 'gyur ro/ / rigs kyi bu/ de bzhin du rgyal po chos thams cad kyi nga ro'i gdugs kyi dkyil 'khor rab tu sgrog pas slong mo ba de dag mthong par gyur pa'i mod la dga' ba'i shugs chen po skyes so/ /sems kyi dga' ba'i ro ba de ba dang ldan par gyur to/ /sems spro ba'i shugs rab tu byung ngo/ /rab tu dga' ba chen po'i shugs yongs su skyes so/ /sangs rgyas kyi byang chub tu dad pa dang mos pa'i shugs kyi stobs rgya chen po 'phel to/ /thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du rtsa ba brtan pa'i dad pa rnam par 'phel to/ /sangs rgyas thams cad kyi chos la lhag pa'i bsam pa rnam par dag pa'i stobs mngon par 'phel to/ /byang chub sems dpa'i dbang po las su rung ba yongs su byung ngo/ sems dga' bas rgyas pas mos pa'i shugs chen po skyes par gyur to/ /sems spro ba'i shugs yangs pas dge ba'i bshes gnyen la dbang po dang bsam pa shin tu gus par gyur to/ /

“Furthermore, when the king saw all those petitioners, he became happier than if he had acquired rule over the galaxy for boundless eons, more than if he had acquired the throne of lordship over the gods for countless eons. His joy upon seeing those petitioners was as that of someone in the wilderness, long separated from family and friends, upon being united with them. His mind was filled with happiness, he was uplifted with joy and flooded with delight. The power of his faith in the enlightenment of buddhas increased, his budding faith in omniscience grew, the power of his purity of determination for all the qualities of buddhahood swelled, his faculties as an enlightening being became fit for use, he was flooded with a feeling of contentment and well-being, and by the force of great joy his senses and will as a benefactor became flexible.

de ci'i phyir zhe na/ rgyal po chos thams cad kyi nga ro'i gdugs kyi dkyil 'khor rab tu sgrog pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du dmigs pa la brtson pa/ thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la rab tu gzhol ba/ thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi lam dang sgo la mngon du bltas pa/ 'gro ba thams cad shin tu tshim par bya ba'i yid la bya ba la brtson pa/ sangs rgyas thams cad kyi yon tan rgya mtsho la 'jug pa'i nan tan la 'dun pa/ bdud dang las dang nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa thams cad kyi ri rnam par 'thor ba la brtson pa/ de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi gdams ngag mthun par blang ba la sta gon du gnas pa/ dge ba'i rtsa ba rgya mtsho sgra kun nas yongs su bsdu ba la brtson pa'i snying po can/ mngon par zhen pa thams cad las gyen du 'phags pa'i rgyud dang ldan pa/ 'jig rten gyi yul thams cad la mngon par zhen pa med pa/ chos kyi rang bzhin nam mkha'i spyod yul can des slong mo pa de dag la bu gcig pa'i 'du shes bskyed pa'i phyir ro/ /pha dang ma'i 'du shes dang / sbyin pa'i gnas kyi 'du shes dang / dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyi 'du shes dang / dkon pa'i 'du shes dang / dka' ba byed pa'i 'du shes dang / mang po byas pa'i 'du shes dang / phan 'dogs pa dam pa'i 'du shes dang / byang chub kyi lam nye bar ston pa'i 'du shes dang / mkhan po'i 'du shes dang / ston pa'i 'du shes bskyed pa'i phyir te/ de ltar des slong mo pha de dag don ci la 'ongs pa dang / don ci la phyin pa dang / dus ci tsam na 'dus pa dang / yul gang dang gang na gnas pa dang / dngos po ci dang ci slong ba dang / rnam pa gang 'dod pa dang / bsam pa ci 'dra ba dang / ci dang ci la smon pa dang / ci dang ci 'dod pa dang / dngos po gang dang gang tshol ba de dag thams cad tshul bzhin du mi dga' ba med pa'i byams pa chen po'i dkyil 'khor dang / slong mo pa'i 'gro ba las phyin phyogs su ma bltas pa'i gtong ba chen po'i 'od zer dang / sems can thams cad la snyoms par sbyor ba'i gtong ba'i sgos yongs su tshim par byas so/ /des zas 'dod pa la ni; zas byin no/ /skom 'dod pa la ni/ skom byin no/ /gos 'dod pa la ni/ gos byin no/ /me tog 'dod pa la ni/ me tog byin no/ /de bzhin du spos dang / bdug spos dang / phreng ba dang / byug pa dang / phye ma dang / gos dang / gdugs dang / rgyal mtshan dang / ba dan dang / rin po che dang / rgyan dang / stan dang / mal dang / khyim dang / gzhal med khang dang / gtsug lag khang dang / bza' shing gi ra ba dang / kun dga'i ra ba dang / dka' thub kyi nags tshal dang / rta dang / glang po dang / shing rta dang / rkang thang dang / dgal ba dang / khyogs dang / bzhon pa dang / gser dang / dbyig dang / nor bu dang / mu tig dang / dung dang / man shel dang / byi ru dang / sa le sbram dang / dngul dag kyang byin par gyur to/ /rang gi khyim dang / gzhal med khang dang / btsun mo'i 'khor dang / g.yog 'khor dang / rgyal po'i mdzod thams cad kyang phye ste bgos nas rab tu btang bar gyur to/ /su ci 'dod pa de dag de khyer cig ces nas yul 'dod pa dag kyang yul byin no/ /grong 'dod pa dag kyang grong byin no/ /grong khyer 'dod pa dag kyang gron khyer byin to/ /sems can thams cad la snyoms par zhugs pa des slong mo pa de dag thams cad la ci bdog pa yongs su btang ste/ dngos po thams cad yongs su btang bas mngon par bstod do/ /

Why? Because the king, who was intent on omniscience, had betaken himself to the nature of omniscience, stood before the door to the path of omniscience, had engaged his attention on the satisfaction of all living beings, was on the verge of entry into the ocean of all enlightened virtues, was intent on shattering the mountains of obstructions caused by demons, actions, and afflictions, was absorbed in properly taking up the instructions of all buddhas, was endeavoring to embody all roots of goodness, was free from all attachments, was unattached to any objects in the world, and realized that all things are in essence like space, thought of all those petitioners as like an only son, as like his parents, as worthy of gifts, as spiritual benefactors, as precious, as doers of what is difficult, as useful in many ways, as supreme benefactors, as supporting the path of enlightenment, as guides and teachers.
“The king then fulfilled the needs and wishes of all the petitioners with unmitigated kindness, without turning his back on anyone, giving impartially to everyone, according to their needs. He gave away whatever he had to whoever required it, impartial toward all living beings.
shin tu rgyas pa chen po'i mdo/ sangs rgyas phal po che zhes bya ba las/ sdong pos brgyan pa'i le'u ste/ bam po brgya bzhi pa/

de'i tshe tshong dpon gyi bu mo rin cen 'od ces bya ba bu mo drug cu'i 'khor dang ldan pa/ gzugs bzang zhing mdzes la blta na sdug pa/ kha dog bzang po'i dam pa rgyas pa dang ldan pa/ mdog gser gyi kha dog lta bu dang ldan pa/ skra mthon mthing du 'dug pa/ mig dkar nag 'byes pa/ dri zhim po yid du 'ong ba dang ldan pa; tshangs pa'i dbyangs dang ldan pa/ gos bzang ba/ rgyan gyis legs par brgyan pa/ dran pa dang / blo gros dang / rig pa dang / khrel yod pa dang / dga' ba dang / ngo tsha shes pa dang / spyod pa dang / cha lugs phun sum tshogs pa/ bla ma la sri zhu dang ldan pa/ shes bzhin gyi dam pas spyod pa/ byed rgu zab pa/ chos blang ba dang / gzung ba dang / khong du chud par bya ba la yid gzhungs pa dang ldan pa/ sngon dge ba'i rtsa ba legs par byas pa/ chos kyis mngon par brlan pa'i sems kyi rgyud rab tu dang ba; dge ba'i bsam pa rnam par dag pa/ mos pa yangs pa/ nam mkha'i spyod yul can/ gzhan la phan par dga' ba'i sems dang ldan pa/ sangs rgyas blta ba'i phyogs la rnam par bltas pa/ thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes la mngon par 'dun pa zhig mchod sbyin gyi rab chen po der 'ongs te tshong dpon gyi bu mo rin cen 'od ces bya ba de rgyal po chos thams cad kyi nga ro'i gdugs kyi dkyil 'khor rab tu sgrog pa'i seng+ge'i khri chen po'i g.yas rol ha cang mi ring ba zhig na 'dug 'dug ste/ rgyal po de la phyag 'tshal nas phar ci la'ang len pa med do/ /de phyogs gcig na 'dug cing sems 'di ltar bskyed par gyur te/ bdag gis dge ba'i bshes gnyen 'di lta bu mthong zhing 'grogs su yod pa ni/ bdag gis thob par bya ba legs par thob bo/ /snyam ste/ des rgyal po chos thams cad kyi nga ro'i gdugs kyi dkyil 'khor rab tu sgrog pa de la dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyi 'du shes dang / ston pa'i 'du shes dang / snying brtse bar byed pa'i 'du shes dang / phan 'dogs pa'i 'du shes dang / sangs rgyas kyi 'du shes bskyed de g.yo sgyu med pa'i sems kyis dga' ba dang / mos pa dang / spro ba'i shugs rab tu yangs pa thob pas rang gi rgyan rnams lus las bkrol te/ rgyal po chos thams cad kyi nga ro'i gdugs kyi dkyil 'khor rab tu sgrog pa gang na ba der mngon par bltas te gtor ba dang / de dag de'i seng+ge'i khri'i 'og /khri'i 'phang gi sa'i steng du bkram par 'gyur to/ /de rgyan de dag de ltar gtor nas smon lam btab pa/ ji ltar rgyal po chos thams cad kyi nga ro'i gdugs kyi dkyil 'khor rab tu sgrog pa 'di sems can mgon med cing mun pa'i nang na 'thom pa rnams kyi mgon skyabs su gyur pa de ltar bdag kyang ma 'ongs pa'i dus na 'gyur bar shog cig /'di chos gang shes pa de dag kyang bdag gis kyang shes par shog cig /'di theg pa gang gis 'byung ba des bdag kyang 'byung bar shog cig /'di lam gang na zhugs pa de nas bdag kyang 'jug par shog cig /ji ltar 'di gzugs blta na btang mi bral zad mi shes pa'i longs spyod dang ldan te/ g.yog 'khor mtha' yas la gzhan gyis mi thub cing thub par dka' ste thub pa med pa de bzhin bdag kyang shog cig /'di gang dang gang du skye bar 'gyur ba de dang der bdag kyang skye bar 'gyur bar shog cig /snyam pa dang /

“At that time, in that gathering at the sacrificial ground, there was a grandee’s daughter, named Jewel Light, with a retinue of sixty girls. She was beautiful, with a clear, healthy complexion, dark hair and eyes, a pleasant scent, and a clear voice. She was well dressed and wore fine ornaments. She was alert and intelligent, modest, stable, and well behaved. She was respectful to the worthy, most circumspect and clear-headed in conduct, profound in action, endowed with wisdom. She had already accomplished basic skills involved in grasping, practicing, and realizing enlightening teachings, and she had attained clarity and serenity through the teachings. Her intentions were pure and good, and she was dedicated to the welfare of others. She was aiming for the vision of Buddha and was seeking omniscient knowledge. She stood near the king’s throne in an attitude of respect, but she did not take anything from among the goods the king was distributing. Just standing there, she thought, ‘I have gained a true boon in getting to see such a spiritual friend as this.’ Thinking of the king as a spiritual friend, a sympathizer, a protector, and an enlightened one, with a mind free from deceit or guile, flooded with supreme joy and happiness, she took off her jewelry and tossed it before the king, so that it lay on the ground between the railings around the throne. Having scattered her jewelry, she made these vows: ‘Just as the king Encompassing Sound of the Proclamation of All Laws is a refuge for leaderless people in the dark, so may I also become one such in the future. The reality he knows, may I also know. By the means through which he attains emancipation, may I also be emancipated. The path he practices, may I also practice. Just as he is fair to behold, has endless wealth and assistants, and is invulnerable and invincible, may I also become like this. Wherever he is born, may I also be born.’

de de ltar sems shing yid la byed pa la brtson pa rgyal po chos thams cad kyi nga ro'i gdugs kyi dkyil 'khor rab tu sgrog pas shes nas de la bltas te 'di skad ces smras so/ /bu mo/ khyod la ci dgos pa khyer cig /bu mo/ nga ni/ bdog pa thams cad yongs su gtong ba ste/ sems can thams cad yongs su tshim par bya ba la zhugs pa'o/ /de skad ces byas pa dang / de'i yid la'ang bdag ni/ rgyal po chos thams cad kyi nga ro'i gdugs kyi dkyil 'khor rab tu sgrog pas thugs su chud par gyur to; ;snyam nas de bas kyang mos par gyur to/ /de de ltar yod pa'i sems su gyur te dge ba'i rtsa ba yangs shing rgya che ba'i shugs yongs su skyes nas rgyal po chos thams cad kyi nga ro'i gdugs kyi dkyil 'khor rab tu sgrog pa la de'i tshe tshigs su bcad pa 'di dag smras so/ /

“Perceiving her involved in such thoughts, the king looked at her and said, ‘Take what you need. I am giving away all I have to satisfy everyone.’ Made this offer by the king, she gained even more faith; with a serene mind, energized by lofty, far-reaching virtue, she spoke these verses to the king:

sngon chad sa las rnam brgyan sprin 'di ni/ / rgyal po seng+ge khyod 'khrungs ma gyur tshe/ / mdangs dgar ma gyur gzi brjid ma mchis te/ / yi 'jigs pa'i gnas dang ci mi 'dra/ /
mi rnams kun kyang srog gcod mos par gyur/ / ma byin len la tshul dang sbyor ma mchis/ / brdzun du smra zhing brlang ba'i tshig kyang brjod/ / phra ma kyal ba'i tshig kyang rab tu smra/ /
gzhan gyi nor la chags pa'i sems dang ldan/ / gang zag gzhan la kun kyang ngan du sems/ / lta ba'i rnam gnas sdig to'i spyod yul can/ / log pa'i sbyor bas ngan pa'i 'gro bar ltung / /
chos ngan chos la spyod pa'i mi yi rnams; ; ma rig gti mug mun pas bsgribs pa dag / lta ba log zhugs phyin ci log mthong bas/ / dgung lo mang por dgung char bab ma gyur/ /
dgung char ma bab sa bon chab 'tshal te/ / lo tog mi 'khrungs zhugs shing 'khrungs ma gyur/ / mtsho dang lu ma chu bran rgyud kyang bskams/ / nags tshal rtsi shing kun kyang de bzhin te/ /
rnam dag spyan khyod 'khrungs par ma gyur bas/ / chab klung kun kyang ma lus bskams par gyur/ / bza' shing ra ba kun kyang ri dgon 'dra/ / rus pa dkar pos dogs bltams par gyur/ /
gang tshe khyod la slong ba mang 'dus te/ / slong ba thams cad yongs su tshim mdzad pas/ / phyogs bzhi kun nas sprin chen 'dus par gyur; ; thang dang gshong rnams kun kyang ngoms par bgyis/ /
slan chad rkun chom g.yon can chad par gyur/ / dgum pa ma mchis su yang gzung ma mchis/ / mgon med gang yang 'gum par mi 'gyur te/ / khyod ni 'gro ba mngon med kun gyi skyabs/ /
srog gcod pa la mngon par mos pa'i mi/ / gzhan rnams bkum zhing de yi khrag 'tshal la; ; gcig la gcig gi sha 'tshal gyur ba dag / khyod kyi sbyin pa chen pos byams sems gyur/ /
brgya stong grangs su bgrang bar gyur pa las/ / de tshe 'ga' zhig rad pa 'tshal gyur gyi/ / gzhan ni dang lo ma rad pa 'tshal/ / de tshe kun kyang yi bkres mnar bzhin/ /
'gro ba mgon med mgon du khyod 'khrungs nas/ / sa bon ma btab ma rmos 'bras kyang byung / / dpag bsam shing las mdzod rnams rnam par thon/ / skyes pa bud med mkhas pa gda' bar gyur/ /
zla ba zla phyed don du sngon chad ni/ / lam nor gnas pa gsog cing sri zhu ra bgyid/ / deng sang rad pa rab 'tshal rgyan mang ldan/ / dga' ba'i gnas na rtse ba'i lha yang 'dra/ /
sngon chad log pa rnams la mi bzad zhugs/ / chos ngan 'dod chags mi rnams zhen cing chags/ / na chung gzhon nu gzhan gyis bsrungs pa rnams/ / nan gyis 'phrog rlom chab 'tshal ma rung bgyis/ /
lha mo bzang mo'i kha dog gzugs ldan pa; ; gos bzang rgyan ldan deng sang mthong 'gyur te/ / gzhan gyi bud med spos dri gda' mchis kyang / / dga' ldan ji bzhin mchis brang rgyan gyis 'tshal/ /
sho be brlang pa phra ma rkyal ba rnams/ / sngon chad g.yo sgyu'i dbang gis ngag tu brjod/ / deng yang tshig gi nongs pa bzhi spangs shing / / lta ba ngan spangs chos la kun kyang spyod/ /
tshangs dbyangs ka la ping+ka'i sgra byung ba'i/ / khyod kyi gsung mchog 'di yi cha shas la'ang / / rol mo'i sgra dbyangs shin tu snyan pa dang / / lha rdzas glu dbyangs 'di dag nyer mi 'gyur/ /
khyod kyi spyi gtsug dbu steng gdugs lding ba/ / rin chen brgyus bgyis gser gyi dra bas bkab/ / dpal gyi snying mdzod yu ba bai DUr+ya/ / kun nas rin chen mchog gi dril gyis 'khor/ /
dril las byung ba'i sgras kyang ma lus pa'i/ / 'jig rten sgra dbyangs ma lus zil mnan cing / / sangs rgyas gsung gi yan lag 'dra bar 'khrol/ / dam pa'i chos kyi sgra dbyangs zhi ba sgrog /
de thos sems can nyon mongs zhi bar bgyid/ / ma lus phyogs kyi zhing rnams brgyud pa yi/ / bskal pa rgya mtsho'i bde gshegs rgya mtsho dang / / blo ldan rgya mtsho'i mtshan gyi 'khor lo rnams/ /
sngon mtha'i zhing rnams gcig nas gcig brgyud du/ / gang mtshan gang dang gang lags rim bzhin dang / / ma lus phyogs su dam chos 'khor lo yang / / khyod kyi byin gyis dril rnams rab tu sgrog /
khyod kyi dril sgra thogs pa ma mchis par/ / tshangs dbang lha dbang 'gro ba'i bdag po rnams/ / rang rang las kyi tshul ni kun rjod cing / / 'dzam bu'i rgyal mtshan khyab par kun tu sgrog /
dril gyi sgra las lha dang mi rnams kyis/ / rang rang las kyi tshul rgyud thos gyur nas/ / sdig to rnam spangs dge ba spyod par gyur/ / sangs rgyas byang chub mchog la kun kyang gnas/ /
khyod kyi yab ni mi bdag skar ma'i 'od/ / de yi btsun mo pad+mo khyod kyi yum/ / rnyog pa lnga rnams shin tu rgyas gyur du/ / chos 'grib rgyal srid des ni bzhes par gyur/ /
de yi bza' shing ra ba yangs byung ba/ / me tog rgyas brgyan rin chen sgron ma ste/ / shing mang brgyas bskor rdzing bu lnga brgya yis/ / de ni shin tu brgyan pa byung bar gyur/ /
de dag so so re re'i dogs su yang / / ka ba stong ldan gzhal med khang bzang byung / / stegs bu bzang po sna tshogs stong gis brgyan/ / zla gam dra bas kun nas mdzes par bgyis/ /
chos ngan stobs ni rab tu 'phel gyur bas/ / dgung lo mang por dgung char bab ma gyur/ / rdzing bu kun gyi chab dang zhugs shing rnams/ / de tshe lo ma mdog dang bcas te bskams/ /
dgung bdun na ni khyod bltams 'gyur ba'i tshe; ; de tshe ngo mtshar rmad byung ltas byung ste/ / de dag mthong nas sems can nges rtogs par/ / bdag cag skyob pa nges par 'byung zhes mchi/ /
dgung gi gung la bab nas rnam drug tu; ; khams kyi dogs yongs su g.yos par gyur/ / ma smad shin tu bzang ba'i rdzing de yi/ / dbus su gdugs dang mnyam pa'i 'od cig byung / /
chab bzang yan lag brgyad ldan rgyas par gyur/ / rdzing bu lnga brgya kun kyang de bzhin te/ / zhugs shing kun kyang lo ma 'khrungs par gyur/ / me tog 'bras bu kha dog mdog dang ldan/ /
rdzing bu de rnams chab kyis bltams gyur pas/ / nags tshal ma lus de dag ngoms par bgyis/ / chab chen de las byung ba'i rgyud 'phros pas/ / 'dzam bu'i rgyal mtshan chab kyis bltams par gyur/ /
zhugs shing sman dang lo tog ldum bu yang / / 'khrungs gyur zhugs shing me tog 'bras bu rgyas/ / dog sa'i steng na mchis rgu'i sa bon rnams/ / kun kyang chab kyis brlan pas rnam par 'khrungs/ /
chab kyis bangs gyur dog sa'i phyogs rnams kyang / / de tshe thams cad rab tu mnyam par gyur/ / sgang gshong dog sa'i phyogs rnams ji snyed pa/ / de dag kun kyang de tshe mnyam par gyur/ /
g.yang sa grog po mi bde'i phyogs kyi rnams/ / de tshe yud kyis kun kyang mnyam par gyur; ; tsher ma gseg ma la sogs ma mchis gyur/ / rin chen bzang po'i 'byung gnas yongs su thon/ /
skyes pa bud med tshogs rnams dga' bar gyur/ / skom pas gdungs pa kun kyang chab la 'tshal/ / kye ma de ring bde na su mthu zhes/ / snyan par brjod pa de skad chad du brjod/ /
ngog sa'i mnga' bdag skar 'od sras dang bcas/ / sras mo blon po'i tshogs bcas de yi tshe/ / skye bo bye ba stong gis yongs bskor te/ / bza' shing ra bar dgyes par gshegs pa mdzad/ /
mdangs dga' rdzing chen yongs su ma smad pa/ / spos chus bltams pa dbus na mchis gyur ba'i/ / de yi dbus su chos stegs bzang po yi/ / pho brang steng gshegs btsun mo bcas pas bzhugs/ /
dgung bdun lon par gyur nas de yi chab/ / dgung gi gung la gyen du lud par gyur/ / ri dang gzhal med khang gi phreng bcas pa'i/ / dog sa'ang de'i tshe yongs su g.yos par gyur/ /
yongs su ma smad de yi dbus nas kyang / / pad+mo chen po lo ma stong ldan 'khrungs/ / gdugs stong mdor gsal sprin gyi dra ba can/ / ri rab rtse mo man chad 'od kyis 'gengs/ /
chu ba rdo rje nang rim dri bda' ste/ / rin chen dbang po'i lo ma rnam dag yangs/ / 'dzam bu chu klung gser bzang snying po can/ / ze ba spos rab 'bar ba phun sum tshogs/ /
mgon po khyod ni de yi snying po las/ / skyil mo krung bcas sku ni byung bar gyur/ / mtshan gyis rnam brgyan yan lag shin tu mdzes/ / lha mang brgyas kyang mngon par mchod pa bgyis/ /
rgyal po pho brang steng nas shod gshegs te/ / phyag gnyis brkyangs te legs par khyod blangs nas/ / btsun mo'i mgo la bzhag ste 'di skad gsungs/ / khyod kyi bu 'di yin gyi dgar gyis shig /
'jig rten mgon khyod de ltar bltams gyur tshe/ / bye ba'i gter rnams rab tu thon par gyur/ / zhugs shing kun kyang mngon par kha 'bus te/ / steng gi mkha' las rol mo'i sgra yang byung / /
'dzam bu rgyal mtshan sems can thams cad kyang / / khyod la mngon lta 'dud cing phyag kyang 'tshal/ / thal mo sbyar cing kye ma mgon med pa'i/ / mgon zhig byung zhes dga' ba'i tshig kyang brjod/ /
khyod kyi sku las 'od zer mang 'byung bas/ / dog sa kun tu rab tu snang bar gyur; ; 'gro ba'i mun pa kun kyang rnam bsal nas/ / nad mang ma lus rab tu zhi bar gyur/ /
gnod sbyin grul bum sha za mang po'i tshogs/ / rnam par 'tshe ba de dag bsal bar gyur/ / shin tu gdug pas sems can 'gums pa yi/ / sbrul gdug kun kyang de tshe yong mi rgyu/ /
thob med sman pa mi snyan sdug bsngal dang / / nad rlangs nad mang gnod par 'tshe ba dag / mdor bsdus kun kyang zhi zhing ma mchis gyur/ / 'jig rten kun tu rab dga' byung bar gyur/ /
phan tshun ma dang 'dra ba'i 'du shes kyis; ; khong nas byams pa de tshe 'gro kun gyur/ / shar gnyer sems bral 'tshe ba ma mchis te/ / thams cad mkhyen lam nan tan ldan par gyur/ /
ngan song rgyud rnams rnam par rab tu bzlog / mtho ris lam chen kun kyang btod par gyur/ / thams cad mkhyen pa'i lam yang shin tu bstan/ / de ltar khyod kyis 'gro don yangs pa mdzad/ /
rgya mtsho che 'dra yongs su gtong mdzad pa/ / khyod mthong bdag ni thob pa dam pa thob/ / yun ring 'khyams pa'i 'gro ba mgon bral du/ / khyod ni rmad du byung ba'i mgon zhig gshegs/ /

Before you were here in this city, great king, It was joyless, lifeless, horrible as the realm of ghosts.
People were murderous, thieving, unrestrained, Deceitful, harsh, and foul in speech.
They were covetous, malicious, and opinionated; By their wrongdoing they fell into states of woe.
Because of the ills of the views of these unjust, ignorant people, For many years there was no rain.
Because of drought the seeds died, crops and trees did not grow: Lakes and streams dried up, plants and forests withered.
The rivers all went dry, the parks were like deserts; Before you appeared, clear-eyed, the earth was strewn with bleached bones.
Now you have joined with the needy, and all are satisfied— Coming forth, you shower gifts on the four quarters, fulfilling all, low and high.
There are no more thieves, mercenaries, or frauds—no one is killed or injured; None go hopelessly to death, the world is leaderless no more.
People who like to kill used to drink the blood of their victims— Those who used to eat each other’s flesh have become kindly due to your charities.
People used to wear rags and leaves, And were hungry and homeless.
With you here, the grains grow by themselves and the trees give forth their bounty; Wise women and men appear too, now that you have been born, leader of the world.
Those who were formerly all on wrong paths Are now well adorned and dressed, sporting like gods in paradise.
Men were wrongly obsessed with desires, delighting in unruly passion, Given to raping women and girls in their own care and the care of others.
Now, though others’ wives be like goddesses, well dressed, adorned, and perfumed, When men see them they are satisfied with their own wives, as in the heaven of content.
People used to be deceitful, cruel, coarse, and dishonest in speech; Having given this up, now they act justly, freed from wrong views.
No music or celestial song, nor even the voice of Brahma or the singing of birds Can match your voice, O leader.
Above you stands a jewel parasol with webs of gold, On a jewel cane, radiant, with nets of jewelry all around.
The notes of its bells surpass all sounds in the world: Like the tones of Buddha’s voice, they intone the tranquil sound of truth.
Those in all lands who hear this put an end to afflictions, Hearing the names of the buddhas over the ages and the oceans of the wise.
By your power the bells bespeak the successive lands since the past, The names of the lands, and the cycles of true teaching everywhere.
The sound of the bells, liquid, free-flowing, rings throughout the continent, Telling of the manners of action of the gods and the lords of the worlds.
Hearing the bells tell of the accumulations of their deeds, gods and people Give up evil, practice good, and rely on the enlightenment of the buddhas.
Your father was Starlight, the king, your mother queen Lotus Light; You were born in a corrupt age and acquired the rulership.
There was a large park, arrayed with flowers and precious lamps, Adorned with five hundred lotus ponds, and surrounded with hundreds of trees.
On the bank of each pond was a villa, with a thousand pillars, Resplendent with a thousand balustrades, with radiant nets and crescents all around.
When it had not rained for years, with lawlessness prevailing everywhere, The water in the ponds evaporated and the trees withered.
Seven nights before your birth there were innumerable wonders, Convincing all who saw them that a savior was surely to be born.
In the middle of the night the earth quaked, And a light like the sun appeared in the pond called Impeccable.
Thereupon the five hundred ponds were filled with pure water, The trees flourished, and flowers and fruits were filled with life.
The ponds, filled with water, refreshed the whole grove; By the streams flowing from them the whole continent was replenished with moisture.
The herbs, crops, and greenery growing, the trees flowered and fruited; All the seeds in the earth sprouted, moistened by the water.
Every place on earth was equally watered then, And all places low and high became level.
Ravines and rugged terrain then became instantly level; Brambles, gravel, and the like disappeared, replaced by beautiful jewels.
All the people exulted, like the thirsty drinking water, And celebrated this park, saying, “By whose power is this felicity?” Then the king Starlight, with his wife, son, and ministers, Surrounded by millions of people, went to enjoy the park.
In the middle was the pond Impeccable, filled with fragrant water; There the king stood, up in its villa, a temple of truth.
It had been seven nights since the water had appeared; Again the whole earth trembled, with all its mountains and abodes.
In the middle of the pond a thousand-petaled lotus appeared, Shining like a thousand suns, suffusing the peak of the polar mountain with light.
Its stem was diamond, its calyx the essence of beauty, its clean broad leaves Diamond, its pericarp of finest gold, its filaments radiant, with superb fragrance.
On that pericarp the Guide was born, sitting up straight, cross-legged; You shone, your body resplendent with the marks of greatness, attended by celestial beings.
Descending from the temple, the king took you in his arms, delighted, And handed you to the queen, saying “This is your son—be of good cheer.” Millions of hidden treasuries appeared, the trees of plenty released Their goods, and the air was filled with music as you were born, leader of the world.
All those living on the continent looked up to you, trusting— Respectfully they said, “This is the leader of the leaderless.” The light emanating from your body illumined the whole earth; Dispelling the darkness of the world, it put an end to all ailments.
All malevolent creatures, the venomous and harmful, Became inactive then.
Frustration, censure, ill-fame, pain, misfortunes, illness, accidents— These all ended, fortune came, and everyone became joyful.
Everyone loved one another, and all became kind; Free from animosity, nonviolent, they set out on the path of knowledge.
The righteous king shut off the evil ways, opened the way to heaven, And showed the way to omniscience—you have done a great service to the world.
We benefit further from seeing you, oceanic giver; after long absence, A leader of the helpless is born in the world—you are a rare guide.

de nas tshong dpon gyi bu mo rin chen 'od kyis rgyal po chos thams cad kyi nga ro'i gdugs kyi dkyil 'khor rab tu sgrog pa la tshigs su bcad pa de dag gis mngon par bstod de snyan par bkur nas rab tu bsngags te lan brgya phrag stong du g.yas phyogs su bskor ba byas te phyag 'tshal nas phyogs gcig tu gus pa'i tshul gyis 'dug go /
de nas rgyal po chos thams cad kyi nga ro'i gdugs kyi dkyil 'khor rab tu sgrog pas tshong dpon gyi bu mo rin chen 'od la bltas te 'di skad ces smras so/ /bu mo/ de ltar khyod sems can pha rol gyi yon tan gyi khyad par shes pa'i mngon par shes pa la zhugs pa legs so/ /legs so/ /bu mo/ 'jig rten thams cad na'ang sems can gang sems can pha rol gyi yon tan la mos pa de lta bu ni/ dkon te/ bu mo/ sems can mun pas bsgribs pa/ phan gdags pa la drin du mi gzo ba/ blo phyin ci log la zhugs pa/ sems 'khrugs par gyur pa/ rgyud 'dzings par gyur pa/ mun pa'i sems dang ldan pa/ bsam pa ngang gis log pa/ nan tan dang mi ldan pa/ sems can pha rol gyi yon tan gyi khyad par mngon par mi shes pa rnams kyis ni/ byang chub sems dpa'i yon tan la 'jug par bya ba'am/ de bzhin gshegs pa'i yon tan la brtag par bya ba'am/ yon tan thams cad shes pa'i khyad par mngon par shes pa thob par bya bar mi nus so/ /bu mo/ de ltar khyod sems can chen po mngon par shes pas byang chub sems dpa'i yon tan gyi rnam pa de lta bu la 'jug pa ni/ gdon mi za bar byang chub tu yang dag par zhugs pa'o/ /de ltar nga'i khams su khyod lta bu ye shes de 'dra ba dang ldan pa skyes pa ni/ dzam+bu'i gling du ngas sems can yongs su bsdus pa'i mthu don yod do/ /

“Having thus eulogized the king, the girl Jewel Light then paid her respects to him and stood there reverently. Looking at her, the king said, ‘Rare are those who appreciate the virtues of others. For the ignorant, the ungrateful, the undiscerning, the agitated, the disturbed, the muddled thinkers, the deranged, the backsliders, those who do not realize the excellence of others’ virtues, it is impossible to comprehend or even conceive of the virtues of the enlightened, or to realize the excellence of knowledge of all virtues. Without a doubt you have set out for enlightenment, since you have understood such virtues of enlightening beings. Our efforts for the care of beings have not been fruitless, as you, endowed with such knowledge, have appeared in our kingdom, by virtue of the higher knowledge of superior people.’

de nas rgyal po chos thams cad kyi nga ro'i gdugs kyi dkyil 'khor rab tu sgrog pas nor bu rin po che chen po rin thang med pa dang / nor bu rin po che skar ma'i 'od sna tshogs dang / gos rin po che rin thang med pa bdag gis lag bdar te blangs nas tshong dpon gyi bu mo rin chen 'od la byin no/ /de'i 'khor gyi bu mo thams cad kyang gos rin po che sna tshogs kyis khyad par byin nas 'di skad ces smras so/ /bu mo/ gos rin po che 'di khyer la bdag gis yongs su spyad pa gyis shig / de nas tshong dpon gyi bu mo rin chen 'od 'khor dang bcas pas pus mo gnyis sa la phab ste gos rin po che dag lag pa gnyis kyis blangs nas spyi bo la blangs te phyir byung nas rin po che de dag bgos so// de'i 'khor gyi bu mo thams cad kyis kyang so so nas rang rang gi gos rin po che de dag bgos nas des gos rin po che de dag bgos pa'i 'og tu rgyal po chos thams cad kyi nga ro'i gdugs kyi dkyil 'khor rab tu sgrog pa la bdag gi 'khor bu mo de dag dang bcas pas g.yas phyogs su bskor ba byas so/ /de dag thams cad kyi gos rin po che de dag la rgyu skar dang / skar ma thams cad kyi gzugs brnyan snang bar gyur te/ de dag mthong nas 'gro ba'i tshogs mang po 'di skad ces 'dzer te/ bu mo/ khyod kyi 'khor bu mo 'di dag ni/ mtshan mo'i lha mo skar ma'i tshogs kyis brgyan pa ltar shin tu mdzes pa ste/ khyod de dag gis bskor bas gya nom par mdzes so/ /

“Then with his own hand the king gave her a priceless robe, radiant with sparkling jewels, and also gave a precious robe to each of her companions. He said, ‘Take this and put it on.’ Jewel Light then knelt on the ground, picked up the robe in both hands, lifted it to her head, and put it on. Her companions likewise each put on their robes. Having put on the robes, the girl and her companions circled the king in respect, with the reflections of all the stars glittering in their robes. Seeing this, the people said, ‘You are beautiful, young lady, with your companions, adorned with stars like a night goddess; surrounded by them, you sparkle most brightly.’”

de nas mtshan mo'i lha mo shing thams cad kyi me tog rgyas pas bde bar gnas pas tshong dpon gyi bu nor bzang la 'di skad ces smras so/ /rigs kyi bu/ de la ji snyam du sems/ de'i tshe de'i dus na rgyal po chos thams cad kyi nga ro'i gdugs kyi dkyil 'khor rab tu sgrog pa zhes bya ba byung ba de gzhan zhig yin pa snyam du sems na ni/ de ltar mi blta ste/ bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnam par snang mdzad 'di ni/ de'i tshe rgyal po chos thams cad kyi nga ro'i gdugs kyi dkyil 'khor rab tu sgrog pa zhes bya bar gyur to/ /rigs kyi bu/ de'i tshe de'i dus na rgyal po skar ma'i 'od kyi btsun ma pad+mo'i 'od ces bya ba/ rgyal po chos thams cad kyi nga ro'i gdugs kyi dkyil 'khor rab tu sgrog pa'i yum du gyur pa de gzhan zhig yin pa snyam du sems na yang de ltar mi blta ste/ lha mo sgyu ma 'di ni/ de'i tshe rgyal po'i btsun mo pad+mo'i 'od ces bya bar gyur te/ rdzus te byung ba'i gzhon nu thu par len len pa'o/ /yang rigs kyi bu/ khyod de'i tshe de'i dus na rgyal po skar ma'i 'od ces bya ba; rgyal po chos thams cad kyi nga ro'i gdugs kyi dkyil 'khor rab tu sgrog pa'i yab tu gyur pa byung ba de gzhan zhig yin pa snyam du sems na'ang de ltar mi blta ste/ rgyal po zas gtsang ma ni/ de'i tshe de'i dus na rgyal po skar ma'i 'od ces bya bar gyur to/ /yang rigs kyi bu/ khyod de'i tshe de'i dus na tshong dpon gyi bu mo rin chen 'od ces bya ba byung ba de gzhan zhig yin pa snyam du sems na'ang de ltar mi blta ste/ kho mo ni/ de'i tshe de'i dus na tshong dpon gyi bu mo rin chen 'od ces bya bar gyur to/ /yang rigs kyi bu; khyod de'i dus na sems can dzam+bu'i gling der skyes shing rgyal po chos thams cad kyi nga ro'i gdugs kyi dkyil 'khor rab tu sgrog pas bsdu ba'i dngos po bzhis yongs su bsdus pa de dag gzhan dag cig yin pa snyam du sems na ni/ de ltar mi blta ste/ bcom ldan 'das kyi 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor 'di nyid du 'dus te bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub las phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i sa la bkod de/ la la ni/ sa dang po la bkod/ la la ni/ sa gnyis pa la/ la la ni/ sa gsum pa/ la la ni/ sa bzhi pa/ la la ni/ sa lnga pa/ la la ni/ sa drug pa/ la la ni/ sa bdun pa/ la la ni/ sa brgyad pa/ la la ni/ sa dgu pa/ la la ni/ byang chub sems dpa'i sa bcu pa la bkod par gyur pa'i byang chub sems dpa' smon lam sna tshogs rnam pa tha dad pa dang / thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du 'jug pa sna tshogs dang / tshogs sna tshogs dang / yang dag par sgrub pa sna tshogs dang / spyod pa sna tshogs dang / 'byung ba sna tshogs dang / lam gyi rgyan rnam par dag pa sna tshogs dang / rnam par 'phrul ba dang / khyu mchog gi mthu phyung ba sna tshogs dang / lam gyi rgyan rnam pa sna tshogs kyis yongs su byung ste rnam par thar pa la rnam par spyod pa sna tshogs kyis 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor 'di ni; chos kyi gzhal med khang sna tshogs na rnam par spyod pas 'khod cing rnam par spyod pa 'di dag yin no/ /

Then the night goddess Sarvavrikshapraphullanasukhasamvasa said to Sudhana, “You should realize that it was none other than the buddha Vairocana, who at that time was the king Encompassing Sound of the Proclamation of All Laws, and the queen Lotus Light, wife of the king Starlight and mother of the king Encompassing Sound of the Proclamation of All Laws, was none other than Queen Maya; Maya was the queen Lotus Light at that time, by whom the spontaneously born child was carried at the hip. And the king father, the elder king Starlight, was none other than King Shuddhodana. And you may think the girl Jewel Light of that time was someone else, but you should realize that she was none other than I—I myself was that girl Jewel Light in that time. As for the people of that time who were taken care of by the king Encompassing Sound of the Proclamation of All Laws by means of generosity, kindness, charitable works, and sympathy, you might think they were other people, but you should not see it that way—they are now the enlightening beings gathered here in the audience of the Buddha, standing on the ground of enlightening beings, irreversibly determined to reach supreme perfect enlightenment, some in the first stage, some in the second, some in the third, some in the fourth, some in the fifth, some in the sixth, some in the seventh, some in the eighth, some in the ninth, some in the tenth stage, who have attained by various different vows, various approaches to omniscience, various preparations, various accomplishments, various ways of emancipation, various purifications of manifestations of the path, various mystic powers, and various manifestations of the path, and, by various states of liberation, abide in various spiritual abodes in this assembly.”
