de nas mtshan mo'i lha mo shing thams cad kyi me tog rgyas pas bde bar gnas pas de'i tshe byang chub sems dpa'i rnam par thar pa dga' ba'i 'od spro ba yangs pa yang dag par 'byung ba 'di nyid brnan te bstan pa'i phyir tshong dpon gyi bu nor bzang la tshigs su bcad de smras pa/
Then the night goddess spoke these verses to Sudhana, further revealing the enlightening liberation of manifestation of satisfaction by treasure produced from great joy:

rgyal ba'i sras po kho mo'i mig yangs te/ / phyogs kun zhing mang rgya mtsho sna tshogs kyi/ / sems can rgya chen gang chen mtsho yi rnams/ / 'khor bar gyur tshe kun la rnam par lta/ /
'byams klas zhing rnams kun na bzhugs pa yi/ / rgyal ba byang chub shing gi drung bzhugs pa; ; rdul med kun kyang phyogs bcu rgyas bkang ste/ / chos sgrog rtag par 'gro 'dul mthong bar byed/ /
kho mo'i rna ba rgya mtsho yongs su dag / sgra rnams ma lus thams cad des thos te/ / bde bar gshegs pas chos gsungs ma lus par/ / thams cad dga' bas yang dang yang du thos/ /
kho mo'i ye shes gnyis med chags pa med/ / sems can gzhan gyi sems kyi yul la 'jug / 'gro ba'i sems kyi rgya mtsho yangs pa rnams/ / ma lus kun la mtshan nyid dngos kyis 'jug /
sngon gyi mtha' dran ting nge 'dzin stobs kyis/ / bskal pa rgya mtsho tshad med kho mos shes/ / tshe rabs rgyud mang gang chen mtsho dag kyang / / pha rol dag dang bdag gi'ang de bzhin shes/ /
rgya mtsho'i zhing gcig rdul phran rab snyed kyi/ / bskal pa skad cig gcig gis ma lus shes/ / sems can 'gro rgyud dag na 'khor ba dang / / sangs rgyas rnam 'phrul tshogs bcas de bzhin no; ;
de dag thog ma'i smon lam ci 'dra dang / / yang dag sgrub tshul 'jug tshul rnam yangs dang / / spyod la brten pas tshogs rnams yongs sgrub pa/ / 'jig rten mkhyen pa rnams kyang kho mos dran/ /
mnyam med tshad med tshogs gyur yon tan mtsho mnga' ba'i/ / dbang bskur sar byon ji snyed de dag dang / / byang chub 'tshang rgya'i tshul ni rnam yangs la/ / sems kyi skad cig gcig gis kho mo 'jug /
thabs kyi rnam pa gang dang gang dag gis/ / bde gshegs 'khor lo dam pa 'gror bskor dang / / mya ngan 'das pa yon tan tshad med dang / / chos rnams gnas pa'i dus kyang kho mos shes/ /
dri med theg pa rgya mtsho'i tshul rnams dang / / sems can rnams 'dul rnam yangs ji snyed dang / / 'gro bar de dag gis ni gang bstan pa/ / so so kun la sna tshogs tshul gyis 'jug /
dga' ba'i gter dang mos pa'i dbyig gi rnams/ / kun tu snang ba rnam thar tshul 'di yin/ / kho mos bskal pa brgya mang rgya cher bsgoms/ / de tshul de la khyod kyang myur 'jug gyis/ /

Broad is my vision, with which I observe everywhere, vast oceans Of lands of many kings, and oceans of beings in a whirl.
In all lands buddhas sit at enlightenment trees, dispassionate, Pervading everywhere by mystic powers and always teaching and guiding beings.
My hearing is perfectly clear, and I hear all sounds thereby; I hear all the teachings of the buddhas and am extremely joyful.
My knowledge, nondualistic, unhindered, penetrates the spheres of others’ minds; The vast ocean of minds of the world I comprehend in an instant.
I remember the past by the power of recollection and concentration, Know oceans of eons, the many hundreds of oceans of lives of myself and others.
I know in an instant as many eons as atoms in an ocean of lands, The beings transmigrating, the buddhas and their projections.
I also remember the initial vow of the buddhas, and those who attained, Having accomplished their practice, by many means appropriate to their undertaking.
The attainments to the stage of coronation of the oceans of lofty virtue, And their many ways of awakening, I comprehend in an instant.
I know the methods by which they taught in the world, their measureless virtues In nirvana, and how long their teachings remained.
The pure principles of their myriad vehicles and extensive guidance of beings Shown in the world, I know in particular, in countless various ways.
This way of liberation, witnessing the wealth of satisfaction produced from the treasury of joy, I have cultivated over many hundreds of eons, and you too should enter this way.

rigs kyi bu/ kho mos byang chub sems dpa'i rnam par thar pa dga' ba'i 'od spro ba yangs pa yang dag par 'byung ba 'di shes par zad na/ kho mos byang chub sems dpa' de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi zhabs kyi drung du thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la 'jug pa'i smon lam rgya mtsho la zhugs pa/ de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi sngon gyi smon lam rgya mtsho mngon par sgrub pa'i smon lam yongs su rdzogs pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i sa gcig non pas byang chub sems dpa'i sa rgya mtsho thams cad yongs su gnon pa'i stabs la mkhas pa/ byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa rgya mtsho thams cad spyod pa re rer yang dag par 'du ba'i smon lam dang spyod pa yongs su dag pa/ byang chub sems dpa'i rnam par thar pa re re la byang chub sems dpa'i rnam par thar pa rgya mtsho thams cad yongs su 'du bar rnam par spyad pa la dbang bsgyur ba de dag gi spyod pa shes pa'am/ yon tan brjod par nus re skan/

I know only this enlightening liberation of manifestation of satisfaction by treasure produced from great joy. How can I know the practice or tell of the virtues of the enlightening beings in the presence of all buddhas who have plunged into the ocean of commitment to omniscience, who have fulfilled the vow to accomplish the myriad past vows of all buddhas, who have the mighty knowledge to enter all stages of enlightening upon entering one stage of enlightening, who have purified the practice of the vow to comprehend all practices of enlightening beings in one practice, who are masters of the state of comprehension of the whole ocean of all enlightening liberations in each enlightening liberation?

song rigs kyi bu/ snying po byang chub 'di nyid na mtshan mo'i lha mo 'gro ba thams cad srung ba'i smon lam la brtson pa'i 'od ces bya ba zhig /bcom ldan 'das kyi spyan sngar phyin cing 'dug gi /de'i gan du song la ji ltar byang chub sems dpas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems can yongs su smin par bya ba dang / ji ltar sangs rgyas kyi zhing thams cad yongs su sbyang bar bya ba dang / ji ltar de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad shin tu mnyes par bya bas bsnyen bkur zhing rim gror bya ba dang / ji ltar byang chub sems dpas sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad la brtson par bya ba dris shig /

“In this same enlightenment site there is a night goddess named Sarvajagadrakshapranidhanaviryaprabha, in the presence of the Buddha; go ask her how an enlightening being is to develop sentient beings to supreme perfect enlightenment, purify all buddha-lands, serve all buddhas, and practice all buddhas’ teachings.”

de nas tshong dpon gyi bu nor bzang gis mtshan mo'i lha mo shing thams cad kyi me tog rgyas pas bde bar gnas pa'i rkang pa gnyis la spyi bos phyag 'tshal te mtshan mo'i lha mo shing thams cad kyi me tog rgyas pas bde bar gnas pa la lan brgya stong du mar g.yas phyogs su bskor ba byas nas yang dang yang du bltas te mtshan mo'i lha mo shing thams cad kyi me tog rgyas pas bde bar gnas pa'i drung nas song ngo/ /
Then Sudhana paid his respects to the night goddess Sarvavrikshapraphullanasukhasamvasa and went on.

ba sgo kun tu gsal ba rab tu thob pa shin tu nad med cing gdung ba med pa'i yid kyi lus dang ldan pa/ chos kyi sku mi shigs shing brtan pa dang ldan pa'i dbyings las byung ba/ de bzhin gshegs pa'i byin gyi rlabs gnas med pa'i rang bzhin kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa'i dang / dri ma med pa'i chos nyid kyi lus rnam par dag pa'i lus dang ldan pa de rin po che'i rgyal po 'gro ba thams cad kyi gnas rab tu snang ba'i snying po can gyi bstan la 'dug pa mthong ngo/ /des de mthong nas spyi bos btud de mthong bar bya ba'i tshul sangs rgyas kyi zhing gi rdul shin tu phra ba snyed rjes su dran par byas nas sa'i gzhi las btud de rgyang bcad pa zhig tu mngon par btud do/ /

Then Sudhana went to the night goddess Sarvajagadrakshapranidhanaviryaprabha and saw her sitting, in that same assembly, on a seat of jewels reflecting the abodes of all beings; her body was covered with a net of jewels reflecting the principles of the cosmos. Her body showed reflections of all moons, suns, stars, and planets; she appeared to sentient beings according to their mentalities, she manifested her own body in forms like those of all beings; her body manifested infinitely various appearances; her body manifested the principles of the states of all modes of bearing; her body appeared to be present everywhere; her body appeared to sentient beings everywhere to mature them; her body appeared to all beings, pervading everywhere with various projections proclaiming the truth; her body descended from the sky to meet the needs of beings at all times; her body was bowing at the feet of all buddhas; her body was leading all sentient beings in accumulating roots of goodness; her body was facing all buddhas, receiving their teachings and remembering them, heedfully minding and retaining them in fulfillment of her vows; her body was filling all directions with infinite various manifestations; her body was radiating the light of the lamp of truth dispelling darkness for all beings; her body showed the embodiment of pure knowledge of the illusoriness of things; her body showed the embodiment of spirituality free from ignorance and passion; her body was born of the magical nature of reality; her mind was aware of the nature of reality; she was illumined with the light of impartial knowledge; her mind and body were ultimately free from irritation and inflammation; she had come from the indestructible realm of the body of reality; her body was a pure embodiment of the nature of things, inherently undefiled, naturally unafflicted, empowered by the realization of Thusness, not fixed or dependent. Sudhana, seeing her, bowed his head; remembering as many ways of seeing her as atoms in a buddha-land, he prostrated himself on the ground for a long time.

de nas tshong dpon gyi bu nor bzang sa'i gzhi de las langs te thal mo sbyar nas mtshan mo'i lha mo 'gro ba thams cad srung ba'i smon lam la brtson pa'i 'od de'i lus la bltas pa dang / 'du shes rnam par dag pa bcu thob par gyur te/ de dag thob pas dge ba'i bshes gnyen thams cad dang skal pa mnyam pa rab tu thob par gyur to/ /

Finally rising from the ground, in a reverential attitude Sudhana gazed at the body of the night goddess, and as he did so he attained ten purities of thought, whereby he gained communality with all spiritual friends.

bcu gang zhe na/ 'di lta ste/ thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du brtsams pa'i brtson 'grus la dmigs pa thams cad du gnas par bya ba'i phyir dge ba'i bshes gnyen rnams la rang gi sems kyi 'du shes rab tu thob par gyur to/ /dge ba'i bshes gnyen bsnyen bkur zhing dge ba'i rtsa ba yangs pa yongs su sgrub pa grub par bya ba'i phyir rang gi las kyi rnam par smin pa rnam par dag pa'i rang bzhin gyi 'du shes rab tu thob bo/ /smon lam thams cad kyis brgyan pa'i spyod pa la yang dag par gnas par bya ba'i phyir byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa'i rgyan gyi 'du shes rab tu thob bo/ /dge ba'i bshes gnyen thams cad kyi gdams ngag gi lam la nan tan du bya ba'i phyir sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad rab tu sgrub pa'i 'du shes rab tu thob bo/ /sangs rgyas thams cad kyi yul du gyur pa'i chos bla na med pa la rnam par spyod pa'i snang ba yongs su mthong bar bya ba'i phyir nyams su myong ba ba skyed pa'i 'du shes rab tu thob bo/ /kun tu bzang po'i spyod pas 'byung ba'i smon lam dang / spyod pa rnam par dag par bya ba'i phyir 'byung ba gcig gi 'du shes rab tu thob par gyur to/ /dge ba'i chos yongs su bsags pa thams cad rnam par 'phel bar bya ba'i phyir thams cad mkhyen pa'i bsod nams rgya mtsho'i 'byung gnas kyi 'du shes rab tu thob bo/ /sangs rgyas kyi byang chub tu thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes la brtson 'grus kyi shugs yongs su 'phel bar bya ba'i phyir dge ba'i chos yongs su ma rdzogs pa yongs su rdzogs par byed pa dang / yang dag par 'phel bar byed pa dang / yongs su skyong ba'i 'du shes rab tu thob par gyur to/ /sems can thams cad kyi bsam pa thams cad yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad yongs su rdzogs pa'i 'du shes rab tu thob par gyur to/ /byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyi chos la dbang bsgyur bar rab tu gnas par bya ba'i phyir dge ba'i bshes gnyen rnams la don thams cad yongs su sgrub pa'i 'du shes rab tu thob ste/ 'du shes rnam par dag pa bcu po de dag rab tu thob par gyur to/ /de dag thob pas mtshan mo'i lha mo 'gro ba thams cad srung ba'i smon lam la brtson pa'i 'od snang ba las byang chub sems dpa' dang skal pa mthun pa sangs rgyas kyi zhing gi rdul shin tu phra ba snyed thob par gyur te/

What were those ten? He thought of spiritual friends as his own mind, to associate with them in all situations in the effort to attain omniscience. He thought of them as the pure essence of the development of his own actions, to accomplish the attainment of extensive roots of goodness to please spiritual friends. He thought of them as adorning the practice of enlightening beings, to associate with them in carrying out adornment by all spiritual vows. He thought of them as bringing him to all aspects of buddhahood, to practice the paths taught by all spiritual friends. He thought of them as the state of comfort, to manifest the abode of the supreme state of the realm of all buddhas. He thought of them as the one way of emancipation, to purify the practice of the commitment of emancipation by the vehicle of universal good. He thought of them as oceans of virtues of omniscience, to increase the production of all good qualities. He thought of them as fulfilling, increasing, and preserving all consummate good, to increase the force of energetic effort for total knowledge of complete enlightenment. He thought of them as fulfilling all roots of goodness, to fulfill the aspirations of all beings. He thought of spiritual friends as fulfillers of all aims, to establish the mastery of all acts of enlightening beings. He attained these ten purities of thought, whereby he attained communality with the night goddess and enlightening beings as numerous as atoms in a buddha-land.

'di ltar phyogs bcu'i de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi dus gsum rjes su dran pa'i tshul la dran pa'i skal ba mnyam pa dang / chos rgya mtsho'i tshul thams cad tha ma dad par khong du chud par bya ba la blo gros kyi skal pa mnyam pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi chos kyi 'khor lo'i dkyil 'khor rigs pas rjes su shes par bya ba'i bye brag dang / tshul tha dad par mkhas pa la rig pa'i skal pa mnyam pa dang / blo nam mkha' dang mnyam pas dus gsum thams cad kyi tshul rgya mtsho snang ba rab tu thob par bya ba'i phyir blo'i skal pa mnyam pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyi dbang po rgya mtsho shes pa'i snang ba rab tu thob par bya ba'i phyir dbang po rnam par dag pa'i skal pa mnyam pa dang / rnam pa thams cad du sems can yongs su bsdu ba'i rgyan gyis rnam par brgyan pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i lam gyi yon tan la nan tan du bya ba'i rgyan gyis lam khong du chud par bya ba'i phyir sems rnam par dag pa'i skal pa mnyam pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes kyi spyod yul snang ba rab tu thob par bya ba'i phyir spyod yul gyi skal pa mnyam pa dang / thams cad mkhyen pa'i tshul rgya mtsho la 'jug pa'i lam snang ba rnam pa thams cad rab tu thob par bya ba'i phyir tshul gyi rjes su 'brang ba'i skal pa mnyam pa dang / chos thams cad kyi rang bzhin shes shing khong du chud pa rab tu thob par bya ba'i phyir don khong du chud pa'i skal pa mnyam pa dang / chos kyi tshul rgya mtsho thams cad la chos la rnam par spyod pa'i skal pa mnyam pa dang / sgrib pa thams cad kyi ri rnam par gtor ba'i phyir mi 'jigs pa'i skal pa mnyam pa dang / bsam pa ji lta ba bzhin du 'gro ba rnams la rnam pa tha dad par yongs su bstan pa'i mtshan dang dpe byad bzang pos rnam par bris pa'i lus rnam par dag pa rab tu thob par bya ba'i phyir gzugs kyi lus rnam par dag pa'i skal pa mnyam pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i stobs yongs su rdzogs pas thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du dmigs pa rnam par 'phel bar bya ba'i phyir stobs kyi skal pa mnyam pa dang / sems dang bsam pa'i nam mkha' yongs su dag par bya ba'i phyir mi 'jigs pa'i skal pa mnyam pa dang / bskal pa thams cad du byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa la gnas pas mi skyo ba rab tu thob par bya ba'i phyir btson 'grus kyi skal pa mnyam pa dang /

That is, he attained communality of recollection, in remembering all buddhas of all times and places; communality of intellect, in unconfused ascertainment of the principles of the ocean of all truths; communality of course, in familiarity with the principles of clear distinction following the courses of the teachings of all buddhas; communality of enlightenment, so as to realize the ocean of all principles of all times by spacelike awareness; communality of purity of faculties, so as to realize the knowledge of the ocean of faculties of all enlightening beings; communality of mental purity, so as to accomplish the path of adornment achieving the virtues of the path of enlightening beings adorned by the protection and care of living beings in all ways; communality of sphere, so as to attain the scope of the sphere of knowledge of those who have arrived at Thusness; communality of following principles, so as to gain the light of the path of entry into the ocean of principles of complete omniscience; communality of comprehension of meaning, so as to attain comprehension of knowledge of the nature of all things; communality of spiritual abode, so as to shatter the mountains of all obstructions; communality of purity of the physical body, so as to attain physical purity resplendent with the marks and embellishments of greatness, appearing to sentient beings variously according to their dispositions; communality of power, so as to increase focus on omniscience in which all powers of enlightening beings are consummated; communality in expertise in all spiritual methods, so as to make the mind clear as space; communality of energy, so as to be capable of tireless perseverance in enlightening practices through all ages;

chos thams cad la sgrib pa med pa'i ye shes snang ba rab tu thob par bya ba'i phyir spobs pa'i skal pa mnyam pa dang /'gro ba thams cad las mngon par 'phags pa'i lus yongs su dag par bya ba'i phyir zil gyis mi non pa'i skal pa mnyam pa dang / 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor thams cad mngon par dga' bar bya ba'i tshigs yongs su dag par bya ba'i phyir ma zhum mi dma' ba'i skal pa mnyam pa dang / chos kyi tshul rgya mtsho thams cad kyi sgra rab tu bsgrag pa'i phyir dbyangs kyi skal pa mnyam pa dang / 'gro ba thams cad kyi tshig rnam par dmigs pa'i tha snyad dang / tshul rgya mtsho la dbyangs kyi yan lag rnam par dag pa'i skal pa mnyam pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i gdams ngag gi yon tan khong du chud pa rnam par dag par bya ba la yon tan rnam par dag pa'i skal pa mnyam pa dang / kha na ma tho ba med pa'i las rnam par smin pa yongs su dag par bya ba'i phyir chos dang las kyi rgyud du mi 'gal ba'i skal pa mnyam pa dang / sangs rgyas byung ba thams cad kyi chos kyi 'khor lo rab tu bskor ba'i phyir mchod sbyin gyi chos bzang po la rab tu gnas pa'i skal pa mnyam pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi yul dang ye shes la yang dag par gnas par bya ba'i phyir tshangs pa'i spyod pa rnams par dag pa'i skal pa mnyam pa dang / byams pa'i tshul sna tshogs kyis skad cig re re la sems can rgya mtsho thams cad du rgyas par dgang bar bya ba'i phyir byams pa chen po'i skal pa mnyam pa dang / sems can gyi khams thams cad yongs su skyob pa'i chos kyi sprin gyi char mngon par dbab pa'i phyir snying rje chen po'i tshul rgya mtsho la 'jug pa'i skal pa mnyam pa dang / sems can thams cad yongs su smin par byed pa'i thabs kyi rgyud du skal pa mnyam par bya ba'i phyir lus kyi las kyi skal pa mnyam pa dang / chos thams cad brjod cing smos pa la ngag gi las rnam par dag pa'i skal pa mnyam pa dang / sems can thams cad kyi sems la thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du dmigs pa nye bar bsgrub pa'i phyir yid kyi las kyi skal pa mnyam pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing thams cad la rgyan rnam pa sna tshogs thams cad kyis rab tu brgyan pa'i skal pa mnyam pa dang / sangs rgyas 'byung brgya mtsho thams cad du de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi spyan sngar 'gro ba'i skal pa mnyam pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad la chos kyi 'khor lo bskor bar gsol ba gdab pa'i skal pa mnyam pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad la dus ma lus par mchod pa thams cad kyis rim gro bya ba'i phyir mchod pas rim gror bya ba'i skal pa mnyam pa dang / sems can gyi khams thams cad du sems can yongs su smin par bya ba dang gdul ba'i skal pa mnyam pa dang / chos kyi tshul thams cad la snang ba rab tu thob pa'i skal pa mnyam pa dang / ting nge 'dzin gyi tshul rgya mtsho thams cad la ting nge 'dzin rab tu thob pa'i skal pa mnyam pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing rgya mtsho thams cad du byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa dang rnam par 'phrul pas rgyas par dgang ba'i phyir kun tu rgyas par dgang ba'i skal pa mnyam pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyi rnam par 'phrul pa'i tshul rgya mtsho la byang chub sems dpa'i rnam par spyod pa'i skal pa mnyam pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa la gnas pa la 'khor gyi skal pa mnyam pa dang / 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad shin tu phra bar 'jug pa la 'jug pa'i skal pa mnyam pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing shin tu yangs pa thams cad du sems rnam par phye ba'i skal pa mnyam pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing rgya mtsho thams cad la 'jug pa rnam pa tha dad pa khong du chud par bya ba la khong du chud pa rnam pa tha dad pa'i skal pa mnyam pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing thams cad rnam par phye ba ye shes mtha' yas pas rnam par dmigs par bya ba la tshul 'byams klas pas kun tu rgyas par dgang ba'i skal pa mnyam pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing thams cad du mngon par 'byung ba'i skal pa mnyam pa dang / phyogs thams cad rgyas par dgang bar yang dag par gzhol ba thogs pa med cing phyir mi ldog par bya ba'i phyir mi ldog pa'i skal pa mnyam pa dang / sangs rgyas thams cad kyi snying po byang chub tu rnam par 'tshang rgya ba'i ye shes kyi dkyil 'khor snang ba rab tu thob par bya ba'i phyir mun pa rnam par sel ba'i skal pa mnyam pa dang / sangs rgyas thams cad kyi 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor rgya mtshor rjes su phyin pa'i skal pa mnyam pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing brjod du med pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa mchod cing rim gro bya ba'i sbyor ba la sangs rgyas kyi zhing thams cad lus kyi dra bas rgyas par dgang ba'i skal pa mnyam pa dang / chos kyi tshul rgya mtsho rjes su rgyu ba de dang de dag la ye shes mngon sum gyi skal pa mnyam pa dang / rjes su mthun pa'i chos kyi tshul thams cad mngon du bya ba'i sbyor ba la nan tan gyi skal pa mnyam pa dang / chos kyi mos pa shin tu shas che ba'i brtsams pa rnam par dag par bya ba'i phyir btsal ba'i skal pa mnyam pa dang / lus dang ngag dang yid kyi las kyis sangs rgyas kyi yon tan gyi rgyan yongs su sgrub pa la rnam par dag pa'i skal pa mnyam pa dang / nyam nga ba'i rtog pa med pa'i sems kyi dkyil 'khor gyis chos thams cad kyi ye shes kyi dkyil 'khor yongs su dag par bya ba'i phyir yid kyi skal pa mnyam pa dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad kyi tshogs yang dag par brtsams pa mthar phyin par bya ba'i sbyor ba la brtson 'grus brtsams pa'i skal pa mnyam pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa thams cad yongs su rdzogs par bya ba la spyod pa'i rgyan gyi skal pa mnyam pa dang / chos thams cad kyi mtshan ma khong du chud par bya ba la chags pa med par rnam par spyad pa'i skal pa mnyam pa dang / chos la rnam par spyod pa'i ye shes kyis rnam par 'phrul pa de dang de dag tu thabs mkhas pa'i tshul gyi skal pa mnyam pa dang / bsam pa ji lta ba bzhin du sems can rnams la yul bstan pas yang dag par bskul ba'i phyir skye mched rnam par dag pa'i skal pa mnyam pa dang / chos thams cad sgom pa dang / rnam par sgom pa rab tu thob par bya ba'i phyir byang chub sems dpa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi sgo rab tu thob par bya ba'i skal pa mnyam pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi byin gyi rlabs kyi skal pa mnyam pa dang / sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyis rab tu thob par bya ba las yongs su gnan pa'i skal pa mnyam pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i rnam par dgod pa thams cad la rab tu gnas pa'i skal pa mnyam pa dang / sangs rgyas thams cad kyis lung bstan pa la yongs su bstan pa'i skal pa mnyam pa dang / skad cig gcig gi ting nge 'dzin rgya mtsho'i tshul thams cad la ting nge 'dzin gyi skal pa mnyam pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi 'phrin las mtshan nyid sna tshogs la ting nge 'dzin rnam par dgod pa'i skal pa mnyam pa dang / rjes su dran pa'i dmigs pa'i tshul rgya mtsho thams cad la rjes su dran pa'i skal pa mnyam pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i bya ba la phyi ma'i mtha'i bskal pa'i mur thug par zhe non pa la byang chub sems dpas spyad pa'i skal pa mnyam pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi ye shes tshad med pa la mos shing dga' ba'i shugs rgya mtsho rnam par 'phel bar bya ba'i phyir mos pa'i skal pa mnyam pa dang / sgrib pa'i ri thams cad la rnam par zlog pa'i skal pa mnyam pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi ye shes kyi tshogs mtha' yas pa yongs su bsgrub pa'i phyir phyir mi zlog pa'i ye shes kyi skal pa mnyam pa dang / sems can thams cad yongs su sbyin par bya ba dang / gdul ba'i dus su skye ba'i skal pa dang mnyam pa dang / thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi tshul gyi sgo la rnam par spyod pa'i skal pa mnyam pa dang / chos kyi dbyings kyi tshul gyis khyu mchog gi mthu phyung ba'i yul la rab tu 'jug par bya ba'i phyir yul gyi skal pa mnyam pa dang / gzhi thams cad yongs su chom pa'i sems su bya ba'i phyir gzhi med pa'i skal pa mnyam pa dang / chos mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes la 'jug par bya ba'i phyir chos bstan pa'i skal pa mnyam pa dang / sangs rgyas thams cad kyi byin gyi rlabs rang gi lus kyis yang dag par gnon pa'i phyir brtson pa'i skal pa mnyam pa dang / 'jig rten thams cad kyis khong du chud par bya ba'i phyir nan tan gyi tshul la mngon par shes pa'i skal pa mnyam pa dang / phyogs thams cad kyi zhing rgya mtshor 'jug par bya ba la mngon par 'du bya ba med pa'i rdzu 'phrul rab tu thob pa'i skal pa mnyam pa dang / gzungs rgya mtsho thams cad kyi snang ba rab tu thob par bya ba la gzungs kyi sa'i skal pa mnyam pa dang / mdo sde'i chos kyi rnam grangs thams cad la sangs rgyas thams cad kyi chos kyi 'khor lo'i dgongs pa khong du chud par bya ba'i skal pa mnyam pa dang / nam mkha'i dbyings lta bu'i chos kyi tshul thams cad khong du chud par bya ba'i phyir chos zab mo la 'jug pa'i skal pa mnyam pa dang /'jig rten gyi khams 'byams klas pa thams cad du snang bar bya ba'i skal pa mnyam pa dang / bsam pa ji lta ba bzhin du 'gro bas rnam par dmigs par bstan pa la mngon par gsal ba'i skal pa mnyam pa dang / zhing gi byin gyi rlabs dang / rnam par 'phrul pa sems can yongs su bstan pa'i phyir rab tu bskyod pa'i skal pa mnyam pa dang / mthong ba dang / thos pa dang / rjes su dran pas sems can gdul ba'i phyir don yod par spyad pa'i skal pa mnyam pa dang / smon lam rgya mtsho'i tshul thams cad yongs su rdzogs pas stobs bcu'i ye shes rjes su 'tshang rgya bar bya ba'i phyir 'byung ba'i skal pa mnyam pa yang rab tu thob par gyur to/ /

communality of eloquence, so as to illumine unobstructed knowledge of all things; communality of insuperability, so as to purify the body beyond all worldlings; communality of noble-minded, nondepressive, intrepid speech, for purity of good relations with all groups; communality of voice, for enunciation of all truths; communality of purity of articulation, in respect to the myriad principles of conventions of expression of the languages of all beings; communality of purity of virtue, in respect to purities of accomplishment of virtues taught by the buddhas; communality of harmonizing with the tradition of principles and actions of buddhas, for purity of consequences of blameless action; communality of devotion to truth, so as to turn the wheels of teaching of all buddhas who appear in the world; communality of religious practice, so as to dwell in the knowledge of the realm of all buddhas; communality of great kindness, so as to pervade the ocean of all beings in every moment with the various aspects of kindness; communality of entry into the ocean of great compassion, so as to rain teachings for the salvation of all beings; communality of physical action, for equality in application of means to perfect all beings; communality of purity in verbal action, in respect to seeking modes of expression of all truths; communality of mental action, for production of focus on omniscience in the minds of all beings; communality of adornment of all kinds, to approach all buddhas in all buddha-lands; communality of visitation of all buddhas appearing in the world; communality of seeking the teachings of all buddhas; communality of service, to serve all buddhas at all times; communality of leading beings to full development, in all realms of beings; communality of attainment of illumination of all methods of teaching sentient beings; communality of attainment of concentration, in all methods of concentration; communality of universal pervasion, so as to pervade all buddha-lands with projections of practices of enlightening beings; communality of states of enlightening beings, in the oceans of means of miracles of all enlightening beings; communality of associates, associating with all enlightening beings in practice; communality of entry, entering the most suitable aspects of all worlds; communality of mental distinction of the extent of all buddha-lands; communality of differences in approach, according to differences in entering the ocean of all buddha-lands; communality of thorough penetration of the entire range of reason, in representations of endless knowledge of differentiations of all buddha-lands; communality of emergence in all buddha-lands; communality of nonregression, never to regress in penetrating and comprehending all realms; communality of dispelling darkness, so as to illumine the sphere of knowledge of all buddhas awakening at the site of enlightenment; communality of arrival in the oceans of audiences of all buddhas; communality of pervasion of the network of all buddha-lands, in efforts to serve the buddhas in untold buddha-lands; communality of direct knowledge of the connections of all principles of the Teachings; communality of application, in undertaking all the principles of the Teaching in order; communality of seeking, to purify intensive seeking for truth; communality of purity, in accumulating the adornments of enlightened virtues of physical, verbal, and mental action; communality of goodness of mind, to purify the sphere of knowledge of all things and the sphere of mind without evil thoughts; communality of vigor, in efforts to fulfill the undertaking of collection of all roots of goodness; communality of arrays of practices, in accomplishments of all enlightening practices; communality of unhindered state, in understanding the characteristics of all things; communality of skill in means, in mystical displays of the knowledge of each spiritual state; communality of purification of senses, in assumptions of suitable appearances according to the mentalities of sentient beings; communality of attainment of the concentration methods of enlightening beings, in cultivation of all enlightening teachings; communality of base, in the abodes of all buddhas; communality of accession to the stages of enlightenment, in attainments of all stages of buddhas and enlightening beings; communality of standpoint, in all states of enlightening beings; communality of instruction, in receiving the instructions of all buddhas; communality of concentration, entering the ocean of all concentrations at once; communality of differentiation of concentrations, in the context of various buddha-works; communality of mindfulness, of all points to remember; communality of conduct of enlightening beings, continuing to perform the tasks of enlightening beings through all times; communality of pure faith, to expand the ocean of energy of joy of devotion to infinite enlightened knowledge; communality of destruction of all obstructions to enlightenment; communality of nonregressing knowledge, to produce endless stores of enlightened knowledge; communality of emergence at appropriate times to guide all sentient beings to full development; communality of abode on the ways to omniscience; communality of sphere, entering the sphere of the majesty of the design of the cosmos; communality of independence, so as to be mentally free of all dependence; communality of teaching of all truths, realizing knowledge of the equality of all things; communality of exertion, so as to embody the power of all buddhas; communality of higher knowledge of means of accomplishing communication with all beings; communality of attainment of uncontrived mystic powers, entering the oceans of lands in all directions; communality of the stage of mental command, so as to gain the illumination of the ocean of all concentration spells; communality of penetration of the secrets of all the buddhas’ teachings in the doctrines of all the scriptures; communality of entry into profundity, in realizations of the principle of all things being like space; communality of range, coursing through all worlds; communality of splendor, appearing to beings according to their mentalities; communality of shaking, showing beings changes in the basis of the world; communality of fruitful action, edifying all who see, hear, or remember them; communality of emancipation, so as to awaken to the knowledge of the ten powers, to fulfill all vows.

de ltar tshong dpon gyi bu nor bzang shin tu dga' ba'i sems su gyur te/ mtshan mo'i lha mo 'gro ba thams cad srung ba'i smon lam la brtson pa'i 'od la bltas pas 'du shes rnam par dag pa de dag thob par gyur te/ 'di dag la sogs pa mtshan mo'i lha mo 'gro ba thams cad srung ba'i smon lam la brtson pa'i 'od las skal pa mnyam pa'i tshul sangs rgyas kyi zhing gi rdul shin tu phra ba snyed kyang thob par gyur to/ / de nas tshong dpon gyi bu nor bzang mtshan mo'i lha mo 'gro ba thams cad srung ba'i smon lam la brtson pa'i 'od la blta ba'i tshul sangs rgyas kyi zhing rdul shin tu phra ba snyed la zhugs pa; dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyi 'du shes rnam par dag pa mtha' dang dbus med pa rab tu thob pa/ skal pa mnyam pa'i tshul sangs rgyas kyi zhing gi rdul shin tu phra ba snyed la zhugs pas bla gos phrag pa gcig tu gzar te mtshan mo'i lha mo 'gro ba thams cad srung ba'i smon lam la brtson pa'i 'od gang na ba der thal mo sbyar te btud nas de'i tshe tshigs su bcad pa 'di dag smras so/ /

Thus did Sudhana, by attainment of ten purities of thought while gazing at the night goddess, gain communality with the night goddess in as many such ways as atoms in a buddha-land. Then, having seen the night goddess in as many ways as atoms in a buddha-land, having attained an infinite variety of purity of perception of spiritual friends and entered into as many aspects of communality with them as atoms in a buddha-land, Sudhana bared one shoulder, bowed to the goddess, and spoke these verses:

de ni bdag gi sems la bdag dgongs te/ / byang chub mos pa mi ldog shin tu brtan/ / khyod kyi thugs la'ang bdag ni de bzhin du/ / bdag gi bzhin du de ring brtan par skyes/ /
sdig to ma lus rnam par byang bar gyur/ / dge ba'i rnam smin mi nya ma rab tu thob/ / bdag gis blta na mdzes pa khyod mthong bas/ / chos dkar mi bas bdag gis yongs su bsags/ /
bdag gi sems ni yon tan chu bos brgyan/ / sems can phan brtson rnam pa tha dad pas/ / brgyan 'gyur des ni phyi mtha'i bskal par yang / / zhing rnams kun tu spyod pa spyad par bgyi/ /
'phags mas bdag la thugs brtse mdzad slad du; ; chos rnams thams cad grub pa khyod kyis bstan/ / bdag la sman slad rjes su gzung dgongs te/ / chos kyi gdams ngag dam pa stsal du gsol/ /
ngan 'gror ltung ba'i lam ni rnam par bzlog / mtho ris shul gtsang dam pa yongs su bstan/ / bde gshegs ma lus bzhud cing rjes bzhud pa'i/ / thams cad mkhyen pa'i shul kyang khyod kyis bstan/ /
dpe med rmad du byung mang khyod la bdag / 'byung ba'i 'du shes dam pa nye bar skyes/ / nam mkha' lta bur dri med tshad med pa'i/ / thams cad mkhyen nyid chos sgo rnam par dag /
kun mkhyen tshad med 'byung gnas bzang po yi/ / 'du shes de ring tshad med khyod la skyes/ / bsod nams rgya mtsho mkha' ltar tshad med pa'i/ / sems las byung ba skad cig re rer 'byung / /
'phags ma pha rol phyin pas bdag bkur gsol/ / bsam yas bsod nams kyis kyang rnam spel gsol/ / yon tan dge ba thams cad yongs 'phel nas/ / thams cad mkhyen pa'i go 'phang myur thob mdzod/ /
dge ba'i bshes gnyen rnams la rtag par bdag / thams cad mkhyen lam rab rdzogs 'du shes te/ / de yi slad du bdag gi chos dkar rnams/ / myur du rdzogs par 'gyur zhes tshim par gyur; ;
de slad 'di las don kun rab tu 'byung / / dge ba'i yon tan ldan pa grub par gyur/ / brjod pa mtha' yas thams cad mkhyen pa'i lam/ / 'di ni yongs su bsgrubs shing 'gro la brjod/ /
yon tan tshad med khyod ni slob dpon gyur/ / thams cad mkhyen gyi chos la bdag 'dren pa/ / bskal pa bye ba khrag khrig grangs med pas; ; 'phags ma khyod la bdag gis lan mi lon/ /

As the power in my own mind, my will For enlightenment is firm and unbending; As in your mind, O goddess, so in mine This determination now spontaneously arises.
All evils are cleared away, And resplendent good is developed: From witnessing your beauty Endless goodness is born in me.
My mind is adorned with myriad virtues, Each to the benefit of living beings; Adorned thereby, I carry on practice In all lands for all time.
You have taught me the consummation Of all the teachings to aid me: For my benefit, thinking to assist me, You present supreme spiritual instruction.
You have blocked the path to woe and calamity And shown the way to felicity; You have also shown the way to omniscience, Followed by all enlightened ones.
I think of you as a vehicle Of emancipation, incomparable, rare; Like space, undefiled, infinite, Pure is the door to omniscience.
I think of you as a pure, Immeasurable mine of omniscience; Oceans of virtues, vast as the sky, Arise in my mind every moment.
Guide me by the transcendent ways And nourish me with inconceivable virtues; Fully developed by pure virtues, before long I will gain the turban of omniscience.
I always think of spiritual friends As fulfillers of the path of omniscience; Therefore I think by serving them all, Good can be quickly developed.
All advantages come from that, And achievement of good qualities; Having honored this infinite group, I will tell the world of the path of all knowledge.
You are my mentor, of measureless virtue, My guide on the way of omniscience; Even in countless millions of eons I could never thank you enough, O sage.

de nas tshong dpon gyi bu nor bzang gis tshigs su bcad pa de dag smras nas mtshan mo'i lha mo 'gro ba thams cad srung ba'i smon lam la brtson pa'i 'od la 'di skad ces smras so/ /lha mo/ khyod kyis bdag la byang chub sems dpa'i rnam par thar pa'i lus bsam gyis mi khyab pa 'di ni; bstan ni/ lha mo/ rnam par thar pa 'di'i ming ni/ ci zhes bgyi/ lha mo/ khyod ni/ ci srid cig nas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu zhugs/ ci srid cig na ni/ khyod bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur/ de skad ces smras pa dang /

Having spoken these verses, Sudhana said to the night goddess, “You have shown me the sphere of this inconceivable enlightening liberation; tell me, what is this liberation called? How long ago did you set out for supreme perfect enlightenment? When will you realize supreme perfect enlightenment?”

mtshan mo'i lha mo 'gro ba thams cad srung ba'i smon lam la brtson pa'i 'od kyis tshong dpon gyi bu nor bzang la 'di skad ces smras so/ /rigs kyi bu/ rnam par thar pa 'di ni/ sems can thams cad yongs su smin par bya ba la yang dag par skul ba'i dge ba'i rtsa ba yongs su 'byung ba zhes bya ba ste/ rigs kyi bu/ kho mo rnam par thar pa 'di dang ldan pas chos thams cad kyi rang bzhin mnyam pa nyid khong du chud do/ /chos thams cad kyi ngo bo nyid la zhugs nas gnas med pa'i chos la brten te 'jig rten thams cad las 'phags par gyur to; ;chos rnams kyi gzugs shin tu rnam par phye ba la zhugs te mi 'dra ba med pa'i kha dog dang / sna tshogs med pa'i kha dog dang / rnam pa tha dad pa med pa'i kha dog dang / mi rtog pa'i kha dog dang / mi sngo ba'i kha dog dang / mi ser ba'i kha dog dang / mi dmar ba'i kha dog dang / mi dkar ba'i kha dog dang / mi mthun pa med pa dang / sna tshogs med pa dang / rnam pa tha dad pa med pa dang / rtog pa med pa dang / mi sngo ba dang / mi ser ba dang / mi dmar ba dang / mi dkar ba'i kha dog gi chos nyid la zhugs nas kha dog rnam par phye ba du ma'i gzugs kyi lus sna tshogs kyi kha dog can/ kha dog du ma dang / kha dog tshad med pa dang / kha dog rnam par dag pa dang / rgyan thams cad 'byin pa'i kha dog dang / kun tu snang ba'i kha dog dang / 'gro ba thams cad dang 'dra ba'i kha dog dang / 'jig rten thams cad la mngon du gyur cing lhag pa'i kha dog dang / gzugs brnyan kun tu snang ba'i kha dog dang / mi mthun pa med pa'i kha dog dang / mtshan dang dpe byad bzang pos rnam par sbyangs pa'i kha dog dang / kha na ma tho ba med par spyod pa'i 'od dang ldan pa'i kha dog dang / stobs chen pos rnam par gnon pa yongs su ston pa'i kha dog dang / zab mo thob par dka' ba'i kha dog dang / 'jig rten thams cad kyis mi thub pa'i kha dog dang / 'gro ba thams cad kyi tshig gis mi zad pa'i kha dog dang / skad cig re re la sna tshogs su 'gyur ba'i kha dog dang / kha dog gi sprin sna tshogs yongs su ston pa'i kha dog dang / gzugs dang dbyibs sna tshogs kyi kha dog dang / rnam par 'phrul pa tshad med pa ston pa'i kha dog dang / shin tu yid du 'ong zhing rnam par snang ba'i kha dog dang / bzang po dang mdzes pa thams cad 'bel ba'i kha dog dang / sems can thams cad yongs su smin par bya ba dang mthun pa'i kha dog dang / bsam pa ji lta ba bzhin du 'dul ba la mngon du 'gyur ba'i dge ba'i kha dog dang / thogs pa med par kun tu snang ba'i kha dog dang / dang zhing rnyog pa med la rnam par gsal te 'od dang ba'i kha dog dang / mi shigs pa'i lus kyis bsgrubs pas mdzes par gyur pa'i kha dog dang / chos kyi tshul bsam gyis mi khyab pa rab tu ston pa'i kha dog dang / zil gyis ma non la zil gyis gnon pas thams cad zil du rlag par byed pa'i kha dog dang / mun pa dang rab rib med pa'i kha dog dang / mun pa thams cad rnam par sel ba'i kha dog dang / dkar po thams cad shin tu bsgrubs pa'i kha dog dang / bdag nyid che ba'i yon tan rgya mtsho'i kha dog dang / sngon bla ma la rim gror byas pas shin tu bsgrubs pa'i kha dog dang / lhag pa'i bsam pa nam mkha' yongs su dag par byed pa'i kha dog dang / mchog dam pa phul du byung bar shin tu yangs pa'i kha dog dang / mi 'phrog mi zad pa'i yon tan rgya mtsho rab tu ston pa'i kha dog dang / 'jig rten thams cad la mi gnas shing ma 'dres pa'i kha dog dang / thogs pa med par phyogs thams cad rgyas par 'gengs pa'i kha dog dang / sems kyi skad cig 'byams klas pa la zhing rgya mtsho brjod du med par kha dog sna tshogs rnam pa du ma yongs su ston pa'i kha dog dang / sems can thams cad kyi dga' ba'i shugs chen po rnam par 'phel bar byed pa'i kha dog dang / sems can rgya mtsho thams cad yongs su sdud pa'i kha dog dang / ba spu'i sgo thams cad na sangs rgyas kyi yon tan rgya mtsho ma lus pa'i sprin gyi sgra sgrog pa'i kha dog dang / sems can thams cad kyi bsam pa dang mos pa rgya mtsho rnam par sbyong ba'i kha dog dang / chos thams cad kyi don rnam par gdon mi za ba yongs su ston pa'i kha dog dang / 'od zer gyi dra ba'i dkyil 'khor kha dog sna tshogs su snang ba'i kha dog dang / nam mkha' ltar dri ma med par snang ba'i kha dog dang / rin po che'i rgyal po rnam par dag pa ltar rdul gyi dri ma med pa'i 'od la gnas pa'i kha dog dang / chos nyid dri ma med pa'i 'od kyi kha dog dang / kha dog dpag tu med pa'i tshul rgya mtsho rnam pa tha dad pa yongs su ston pa'i kha dog dang / phyogs kun tu snang bar byed pa'i kha dog dang / dus la gang du bab par 'gro ba yongs su ston pa ma 'dres pa'i kha dog dang / zhi ba dang dul ba'i phyogs las byung ba'i kha dog dang / nyon mongs pa thams cad rab tu zhi bar byed pa'i kha dog dang / 'gro ba bsod nams kyi zhing thams cad la rab tu ston pa'i kha dog dang / 'jigs pa thams cad rab tu sel ba'i kha dog dang / don yod par 'gro ba rgyas par 'gengs pa'i kha dog dang / ye shes kyi rnam par gnon pa chen po rab tu brjod pa'i kha dog dang / chags pa med pa'i lus kyis kun tu rgyas par 'gengs pa'i kha dog dang / lus dam pa'i sprin gyi dbyangs kyis 'gro ba kun tu ston par byed pa'i kha dog dang / byams pa'i rgya mtsho chen po yongs su sdud pa'i kha dog dang / bsod nams kyi ri rab chen po yongs su sgrub pa'i kha dog dang / 'gro ba thams cad du mi gnas kyang 'jig rten gyi rgyud thams cad du gzugs brnyan 'byung ba'i kha dog dang / ye shes kyi stobs chen po rnam par sbyong ba'i kha dog dang / 'jig rten thams cad kyi rjes su dran pa dang 'grogs pa'i kha dog dang / rin po che thams cad lta bu'i kha dog dang / rnam par snang ba'i snying po ltar yongs su ston pa'i kha dog dang / 'gro ba thams cad kyi mos pa'i tshul dang mthun pa'i kha dog dang / thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi rnam pa la mngon du gyur pa'i kha dog dang / mig 'dzum gyis rgyas pas 'gro ba mos par byed pa'i kha dog dang / rin po che'i rgyan dam pa'i 'od kyi kha dog dang / 'gro ba thams cad du thogs pa med pa la phyir phyogs pa med pa'i kha dog dang / nges pa med cing mngon par zhen pa med pa'i kha dog dang / byin gyi rlabs kyis rnam par 'phrul pa'i khyu mchog gi mthu 'byin pa yongs su ston pa'i kha dog dang / rdzu 'phrul thams cad kyis rnam par 'phrul ba'i khyu mchog gi mthu phyung ba yongs su ston pa'i kha dog dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba snang bar byed pa'i kha dog dang / chos kyi dbyings kha na ma tho ba med pa'i tshul rgya mtsho la rab tu zhugs pa'i kha dog dang / sangs rgyas thams cad kyi 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor du phyin pa'i gzugs brnyan 'byung ba'i kha dog dang / kha dog sna tshogs rab tu sgrub pa'i kha dog dang / legs par spyad pa dang / rgyu mthun pa bzang pos byung ba'i kha dog dang / 'dul ba ji lta ba bzhin du nye bar sgrub pa'i kha dog dang / 'jig rten thams cad kyis blta na mi ngoms pa'i kha dog dang / 'od dang ba rnam pa sna tshogs kyi 'od du snang ba'i kha dog dang / dus gsum gyi kha dog rgya mtsho thams cad yongs su ston pa'i kha dog dang / 'od zer kha dog thams cad dang ldan pa rgya mtsho rab tu 'gyed pa'i kha dog dang / 'od kyi dkyil 'khor rgya mtsho kha dog brjod du med pa sna tshogs rnam pa tha dad pa yongs su ston pa'i kha dog dang / spos thams cad kyi 'od 'phro ba kun las 'das pa'i kha dog dang / ba spu'i sgo re re nas sangs rgyas kyi zhing brjod du med pa'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed kyi nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor gyi sprin yongs su ston pa'i kha dog dang / zla ba'i dkyil 'khor gyi gzugs dri ma med cing yangs pa'i sprin gyi byin gyi rlabs kyi kha dog dang / me tog yid du 'ong ba'i ri rab kyi sprin mtha' yas pa rab tu 'gyed pa'i kha dog dang / phreng ba sna tshogs mngon par sgrub pa'i shing gi sprin phreng ba/ thams cad kyi char rab tu 'bebs pa'i kha dog dang / rin po che thams cad kyi pad+mo'i sprin yongs su ston pa'i kha dog dang / spos dang bdug spos thams cad kyi na bun gyi gzugs kyi sprin gyis chos kyi dbyings thams cad rgyas par 'grengs pa'i kha dog tu sems kyi skad cig re re la phye ma'i mdzod kyi sprin thams cad byin gyis brlabs shing phyogs bcur chos kyi dbyings kyi tshul rgya mtsho thams cad rgyas par bkang nas mthong bas 'dul ba'i sems can rnams dang / thos pas 'dul ba dang / rjes su dran pas 'dul ba dang / chos kyi 'khor lo sprul pa mngon par sgrub pas 'dul ba dang / yongs su smin par 'gyur ba'i dus la bab pas 'dul bar 'gyur ba dang / gzugs kyi lus yongs su bstan pas 'dul ba dang / bsnyen bkur bya bas 'dul ba dang / khong du chud par bya bas 'dul ba dang / rnam par 'phrul ba dang / chos 'phrul sna tshogs yongs su bstan pas 'dul ba dang / rnam par 'phrul pa dang / chos 'phrul bsam gyis mi khyab pa rnam par dmigs pa yongs su bstan pas 'dul ba'i sems can rnams kyi bsam pa'i dbang dang / dus kyi dbang dang / mi dge ba'i las las rnam par bzlog pa'i dbang dang / dge ba'i las yongs su sgrub pa la so sor dgod pa'i dbang dang / sngon smon lam chen po mngon par bsgrubs pa'i dbang dang / thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi shugs kyi dbang dang / byang chub sems dpa'i rnam par thar pa rgya chen po'i rnam par 'phrul pa rab tu thob pa'i chos kyi dbang dang / 'gro ba thams cad yongs su bskyab pa shin tu sgrub pa'i snying rje chen po'i stobs yongs su 'byung ba'i dbang dang / byams pa chen po'i rgya mtsho rnam par dag pa yongs su skyed pa'i bsam pa'i dbang gis de bzhin gshegs pa'i byin gyi rlabs yang dag par blang ba'i phyir rab tu 'jug go /

The goddess replied, “This liberation is called ‘made of roots of goodness fostering the development of all beings.’ Imbued with this liberation, realizing the equality of the essence of all things, comprehending the nature of all things, going to refuge in the independent state, passing away from all worlds, comprehending the differentiations in forms of things yet realizing the nature of things is without difference, without variation or distinction in appearance, not blue, yellow, red, or white, I manifest different bodies, of many appearances—of varying appearance, of nonvarying, undifferentiated appearance, neither colored nor colorless, of many appearances, infinite appearances, pure appearance, appearing to emanate all sorts of supernal manifestations, appearing to be visible everywhere, appearing to be the same as all beings, transcendent appearance manifest to all beings, appearance of light reflected everywhere, nonoffensive appearance, appearance beautified with the marks and embellishments of greatness, appearance resplendent with impeccable behavior, appearance manifesting the exertion of great power, appearance of unapproachable profundity, appearance unsurpassed in all worlds, appearance varying from moment to moment, appearance manifesting multitudes of different forms, appearance of various physical forms, appearance manifesting infinite miraculous displays, appearance as an eloquent speaker, appearance of all beautiful forms, appearance adapted to development of all beings, appearance of consummate good manifest to those who are teachable according to their mentalities, appearance reflected everywhere without obstruction, pure, untainted, serene, radiant appearance, healthy, beautiful appearance of an indestructible body, appearance of cultivation of inconceivable spiritual methods, superlative appearance overwhelming all, appearance without darkness or obscurity, appearance dispelling all darkness, appearance imbued with all good qualities, appearance of an ocean of virtues of a great soul, appearance attained by honoring the worthy in the past, appearance of supreme vastness of a mind clear as the sky, appearance revealing an ocean of indestructible, inexhaustible virtues, appearance free from all worldly attachments, appearance freely pervading everywhere, appearance instantly manifesting a multitude of different appearances in untold myriads of realms, appearance increasing floods of great joy in all sentient beings, appearance to protect all beings, appearance emanating multitudes of manifestations of all virtues of buddhahood from every pore, appearance purifying the wills and aspirations of all sentient beings, appearance showing determination of the meanings of all spiritual teachings, appearance radiating a network of varicolored lights, appearance of pure light as vast as the sky, appearance contained in the light of the untainted essence of pure jewels, appearance reflecting the undefiled real nature of things, incomparable appearance, appearance reflecting the variety of the ocean of means of liberation, appearance of ubiquitous light, appearance manifest to the world according to the time without fragmentation, appearance originating in the realm of tranquillity and restraint, appearance quelling all afflictions, appearance revealing a field of blessing for all sentient beings, appearance producing calm by all means, appearance fruitfully manifest throughout the world, appearance revealing the exertion of great knowledge, appearance of an unobstructed all-pervasive body, appearance of a universally supreme body manifest in ways beneficial to all beings, appearance embodying an ocean of great love, appearance embodying a mountain of great virtue, appearance reflected in all states of being while independent of all worlds, appearance purifying the power of great knowledge, appearance coexisting with the memory of all worlds and beings, appearance of light of all jewels, appearance showing the matrix of the source of light, appearance corresponding to the faith of all beings, appearance actualizing expression of all knowledge, appearance with laughing eyes cheering the world, appearance of light of the finest arrays of all jewels, appearance without grasping yet not turning away from sentient beings, unfixed, uninvolved appearance, appearance manifesting mystical powers, appearance showing all kinds of miracles, appearance of revealing the roots of goodness of the enlightened, impeccable appearance arising from the ocean of principles of all realms of reality, appearance as reflections going to the assemblies of all buddhas, appearance perfecting all kinds of forms, appearance resulting from good action, appearance adapted to guide those to be taught, appearance that all beings never tire of seeing, appearance radiating multicolored lights, appearance showing the ocean of forms of past, present, and future, appearance radiating lights of all colors, inexpressible appearance, appearance showing a variety of meanings in halos of light, appearance transcending all worlds, appearance manifesting as many suns as atoms in untold buddha-lands in each pore, appearance magically producing multitudes of forms like the clear moon, appearance emanating multitudes of mountains of flowers of infinite colors, appearance emanating garlands of all kinds of adornments, appearance manifesting multitudes of lotuses of all jewels, appearance filling all universes with clouds of incense of all fragrances; in each moment of consciousness producing clouds of treasuries of all kinds of fragrant powders and pervading all universes in the ten directions, I show all this to sentient beings who can be guided by seeing, those who can be guided by hearing, those who can be guided by remembering, those who can be guided by production of emanations of teaching cycles, those who can be guided when the time is ripe, those who can be guided by seeing physical bodies, those who can be guided by service, those who can be guided by comprehension, those who can be guided by manifestation of various miraculous effects, those who can be guided by manifestation of inconceivable miraculous effects, by mastery of minds, by mastery of timing, by mastery of prevention of evil deeds, by mastery of promotion of good deeds, by mastery of accomplishment of past great vows, by mastery of momentum toward omniscience, by mastery of the means of attainment of the immense miracles of the liberations of enlightening beings, by mastery of the source of power of great compassion accomplishing the salvation of all beings, by mastery of the will producing purity of the ocean of great love, empowered by the enlightened.

rigs kyi bu/ de ltar kho mos byang chub sems dpa'i rnam par thar pa sems can thams cad yongs su smin par bya bas bsam pa ji lta ba bzhin du dge ba'i rtsa ba la yang dag par bskul ba la rab tu gnas te/ rnam par dbye ba med pa'i chos la zhugs nas mtha' dang dbus med pa'i lus kyi kha dog dang dbyibs yongs su bstan te/ spyod pa'i lus re re las mtha' dang dbus med pa'i kha dog rgya mtsho 'jig rten du rnam par dmigs par byas te spyod pa'i kha dog re re las mtha' dang dbus med pa'i 'od zer gyi spring yongs su bkye zhing / 'od zer re re las kyang sangs rgyas kyi zhing gi gzugs brnyan mtha' dang dbus med pa yongs su bstan nas sangs rgyas kyi zhing re rer yang de bzhin gshegs pa 'byung ba mtha' dang dbus med pa yongs su bstan te/ de bzhin gshegs pa re re zhing yang sangs rgyas kyi rnam par 'phrul pa mtha' dang dbus med pa yongs su ston pa byed cing / sngon gyi dge ba'i rtsa ba yang dag par skul ba byed do/ /dge ba'i rtsa ba ma bskyed pa rnams kyang yongs su skyed do/ /bskyed pa rnams kyang yangs par byed do/ /dge ba'i rtsa ba yangs par byas pa rnams ni/ rnam par 'phel bar byed de/ kho mo ni/ sems kyi skad cig re re la yang sems can gyi khams mtha' dang dbus med pa bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub las phyir mi ldog pa'i sa la rab tu dgod par byed do/ /

“Thus, based on this enlightening liberation, fostering roots of goodness according to sentient beings’ mentalities for their development, realizing the undifferentiated essence of reality, manifesting an infinite variety of physical forms, projecting visions of an infinite variety of multitudes of appearances from each body representing practices, radiating an infinite variety of multitudes of light beams from each appearance of action, showing reflections of buddha-lands, showing infinite buddhas emerging from each beam of light in each buddha-land, showing the infinite variety of projections of each buddha, I vivify past roots of goodness, develop new roots of goodness, increase existing roots of goodness, and enhance developed roots of goodness; and in each mental moment I establish infinite beings in the stage of nonregression, where they will not retreat, advancing toward supreme perfect enlightenment.
shin tu rgyas par chen po'i mdo; sangs rgyas pa po che zhes bya ba las/ sdong pos brgyan pa'i le'u ste/ ` bam po brgya lnga pa/

rigs kyi bu/ gzhan yang khyod kyis 'di skad du smras te/ khyod bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu zhugs nas ni/ ji srid cig lon/ bskal pa brgya phrag ji snyed cig nas ni/ byang chub kyi spyod pa la spyod ces zer ba de'i don kyang sangs rgyas kyi byin gyi rlabs kyis bstan par bya'o/ /
“Also, you ask how long ago I set out for supreme perfect enlightenment, and how many eons I have been carrying out enlightening practice. I will tell you this, too, by the power of Buddha.

rigs kyi bu/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi ye shes kyi dkyil 'khor ni/ rtog pa dang rnam par rtog pa'i yul dang ldan pa ste/ de la 'khor ba ring ba'am/ 'khor ba thung bar rnam par dgod cing brjod par bya ba med do/ /bskal pa kun nas nyon mongs pa'am/ bskal pa rnam par dag pa'am/ bskal pa chung ba'am/ bskal pa che ba'am/ bskal pa mang ba'am/ bskal pa tha dad pa'am/ bskal pa rnam pa sna tshogs su bya ba'am/ bskal pa rnam pa tha dad par bya bar yang rnam par dgod pa dang / brjod par bya ba med do/ /de ci'i phyir zhe na/ rigs kyi bu/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi ye shes kyi dkyil 'khor ni/ rang bzhin gyi ngo bo nyid kyis yongs su dag pa ste/ 'du shes kyi dra ba thams cad dang bral bar sgrib pa'i ri thams cad las yang dag par 'das pa'i bsam pa la yongs su 'char te/ de'ang sems can thams cad yongs su smin par bya ba'i dus su 'dul ba ji lta ba bzhin du snang bar byed do/ /

“The sphere of knowledge of enlightening beings is not in the realm of thought, conception, or imagination. It cannot be known in terms of length or brevity of life, or in terms of defilement or purity of ages, or in terms of brevity or length of ages, or in terms of multitude or variety of ages, or in terms of variation or differentiation of ages. Why? Because the sphere of knowledge of enlightening beings is utterly pure in its essential nature, it is outside the net of all conceptions, it is beyond the mountains of all obstructions. It appears in the mind and sheds light on beings who can be guided, according to their mentalities, when the time is ripe for their development.

rigs kyi bu/ 'di lta ste/ nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor la nyin mtshan gyi grangs su bya ba med de mi srid kyang nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor nub na ni/ nub mor snang ngo/ /nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor shar na ni/ nyin par du snang zhing brjod pa yod do/ /rigs kyi bu; de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa'i ye shes kyi dkyil 'khor rnam par rtog pa med pa la rtog pa dang / yongs su rtog pa thams cad med de/ 'khor ba na gnas pa'i 'du shes kyi rnam pa thams cad dang dus su bya ba thams cad kyang med mod kyi/ 'on kyang byang chub sems dpa'i bsam pa las byung ba'i ye shes kyi dkyil 'khor rnam par rtog pa med pa ni/ sems can thams cad yongs su smin par bya ba'i dus kyi dbang gis bskal par gnas pa dang / 'khor ba'i 'du shes kyi rnam par bgrang ba'i grangs su bgrang ba yin te/ ye shes kyi dkyil 'khor rnam par rtog pa med pa la sngon gyi mtha' dang / phyi ma'i bskal par gnas pa'i 'du shes kyi rnam par bgrang ba yod do/ /

“It is like the sun: there is no reckoning of day and night on the sun, but when the sun has gone down that is known as the night, and when it has come up that is known as the day. In the same way, in the nonconceptual sphere of knowledge of enlightening beings there are no thoughts or conceptions of imaginations, or notions of cycle or duration or time frames: but when the will of enlightening beings arises, then by the light of the sphere of nonconceptual knowledge, and by mastery of timing in development of all sentient beings, conceptual calculations of ages, duration, and cycles are distinguished; in the sphere of nonconceptual knowledge, conceptual calculations of passage of time in past and future ages are distinguished.

rigs kyi bu/ 'di lta ste; dper na/ nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor ni/ nam mkha'i dbyings la 'dug kyang rin po che'i ri thams cad dang / rin po che'i shing thams cad dang / rin po che'i snod thams cad dang / rin po che'i 'byung gnas thams cad dang / rgya mtsho thams cad dang / mtsho dang mtshe'u thams cad dang / chu dang ba'i snod thams cad dang / 'gro ba thams cad kyi sems la gzugs brnyan rnam par dmigs pa snang ste/ sems can thams cad la mngon du gyur bar snang ngo/ /rin po che thams cad kyi rdul shin tu phra ba rnams la nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor gyi gzugs brnyan byung bar snang yang nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor de ni/ rin po che'i ri rnams la yang gnas pa med do/ /rin po che'i shing nas rin po che'i rdul shin tu phra ba rnams kyi bar du'ang zhugs pa med/ rin po che'i 'bru rnams kyi khongs su chud pa'ang ma yin/ rin po che'i 'byung gnas rnams kyi rjes su song ba'ang ma yin/ rgya mtsho rnams kyi nang du song ba'ang ma yin/ chu'i snod thams cad kyi nang du zhugs pa'ang ma yin mod kyi/ thams cad kyi khongs na 'dug par yang snang ngo/ /rigs kyi bu/ de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po yang 'khor ba'i rgya mtsho las ni/ gyen du 'phags/ de bzhin gshegs pa'i chos kyi dbyings kyi nam mkha' la ni/ mngon par byung / chos kyi rang bzhin nam mkha'i rgyud la ni/ rgyu zhing spyod/ zhi ba'i nam mkha'i dbyings la ni/ gnas par gyur mod kyi/ srid pa'i lam gyi rgyud dang / skye gnas thams cad du'ang sems can thams cad yongs su smin par bya ba dang gdul ba'i don du sems can thams cad dang 'dra ba'i lus su skye bar snang ste/ 'khor ba'i nyes pas gos par mi 'gyur ro/ /skyed dang shi 'pho ba'i sdug bsngal gyis nye bar gdung ba med do/ /rtog pa dang rnam par rtog pa dag dang 'grogs pa med do/ /bskal pa la'ang ring ba'i 'du shes sam thung ba'i 'du shes su 'gyur ba med do/ /de ci'i phyir zhe na; de ni/ byang chub sems dpa' phyin ci log las shin tu 'das pa dang / 'du shes dang / sems dang / lta ba'i phyin ci log las yongs su 'das pa dang / rmi lam lta bu'i 'jig rten thams cad yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du ye shes kyis khong du chud pa dang / sgyu ma lta bu'i 'jig rten thams cad rab tu rtogs pa dang / sems can med pa'i ye shes kyi dbyings rab tu thob pa dang / yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du chos rab tu mthong bas snying rje'i dkyil 'khor shin tu yangs pa dang / smon lam chen po'i stobs kyis sems can thams cad yongs su smin par bya ba dang / gdul ba'i don du sems can thams cad la mngon du gyur par snang ngo/ /

“It is like the orb of the sun in the sky: it is perceived reflected in all jewel mountains, in all jewel trees, in all jewels, in all jewel treasuries, in all oceans, in all springs and streams, in all vessels of clear water, and in the minds of all beings; it appears to all beings, and is seen reflected in each particle of all the jewels—the sun does not originate in the jewel mountains, does not enter the jewel trees or particles, is not in the crystals, does not come to the jewel treasuries, does not enter the oceans, does not enter any bodies of water—yet it is seen within them all. In the same way a great enlightening being, leaving the ocean of existence, risen into the sky of the reality realm of the enlightened, dwelling in the realm of the sky of the essence of things, abiding in the sky of peace, is seen in all realms of existence in forms similar to all sentient beings, for the development and civilization of sentient beings: yet the enlightening being is not stained by the ills of the mundane whirl, is not burnt by the suffering of death and birth, does not live by concepts and imaginations, and has no notion of length or brevity of the age. Why? The enlightening being is ultimately beyond all errors of mistaken conceptions, thoughts, and views, sees with accurate knowledge of all worlds as dreamlike, realizes all worlds are like magic, has attained knowledge of the realm devoid of beings, sees things as they are, and yet by control of great vows of the sphere of vast compassion appears to all sentient beings to guide them to perfection.

rigs kyi bu/ 'di lta ste/ dper na/ chu klung chen po la sogs pa la gru ni/ rtag tu rgyun mi 'chad par sems can yongs su bsgral ba la brtson pa ste/ nam ma zhig gi bar du rgyun gcod pa med kyang de la pha rol gyi ngogs la mngon par chags pa med/ tshu rol gyi ngogs la'ang chags pa med/ chu'i dbus na'ang gnas pa med do/ /rigs kyi bu/ de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' yang pha rol tu phyin pa chen po'i gru'i mthus 'khor ba'i chu klung gi rgyud las sems can thams cad yongs su bsgral ba la zhugs pa yin te/ de la tshu rol gyi mus 'jigs pa med do/ pha rol gyi mur bde bar 'gyur ba'i 'du shes med do/ /'on kyang rtag tu rgyun mi 'chad pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa la bskal pa dpag tu med pa thams cad du gnas par bya bar zhe non pas sems can thams cad yongs su bsgral bar bya ba la zhugs pa yin te/ bskal pa'i rnam pa tha dad pa la mngon par zhen pa med do/ /bskal pa 'da' bar bya ba la ring ba'i 'du shes su gyur cing byang chub sems dpa'i spyad pa la spyod pa ma yin no/ /

“Just as a boatman is always at work on the rivers to ferry people over, never ceasing, all his life never dwelling on the near shore or on the farther shore, and not remaining in midstream either, in the same way the enlightening being undertakes to save sentient beings from the current of the mundane whirl by the power of the boat of the transcendent ways; the enlightening being does not fear the near shore, does not think of the farther shore as safety, and yet is always engaged in ferrying sentient beings over. Though the enlightening being enters the variety of ages by persisting in enlightening practice through all ages, beyond measure, yet the enlightening being does not carry on enlightening practice within notions of passage and length of ages.

rigs kyi bu/ 'di lta ste/ dper na/ chos kyi dbyings ltar yangs pa'i nam mkha'i dbyings nam mkha'i gzhi'i dkyil 'khor na 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad 'du 'am/ 'jig gam/ 'das par gyur kyang rnam par rtog pa med cing rang bzhin gyis rnam par dag pa la kun nas nyon mongs pa med de/ 'khrug pa med cing bsgribs pa med la phyi ma'i mtha'i dus su zhing thams cad 'dzin kyang yongs su skyo ba med do/ /rigs kyi bu/ de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa'i bsam pa ye shes nam mkha'i dkyil 'khor kyang smon lam chen po'i rlung gi dkyil 'khor gyis kun nas bskor cing ngan song gi g.yang sa thams cad las sems can yongs su 'dzin kyang yongs su skyo ba med do/ /bde ba'i lam la 'god pa byed kyang yongs su sgyid lug pa med do/ /thams cad mkhyen pa'i lam la 'god kyang zhum par byed pa med do/ /nyon mongs pa thams cad kyis kyang 'khrug pa med do/ /'khor ba'i nyes pa thams cad kyis kyang yongs su gdung ba med do/ /

“Just as space, extensive as the cosmos, is without discrimination whether worlds become, decay, or disappear, is by nature pure, undefiled, neither turning back nor tiring, not long or short, eternally supporting all lands, in the same way the space of the will and knowledge of the enlightening being, with the whirlwind of great vows, never tires in keeping sentient beings from falling into all states of misery, has no fear in leading them to the paths of felicity, is not exhausted in setting them on the ways to omniscience, does not follow afflictions, and is not stained by the ills of the mundane whirl.

rigs kyi bu/ 'di lta ste/ dper na/ sgyu ma'i rnam pa las grub pa'i mi yan lag dang nying lag shin tu tshang ba la lus la gnas pa'i chos bcu med de/
bcu gang zhe na; 'di lta ste/ dbugs nang du rgyu ba'am/ dbugs phyir rgyu ba'am/ grang ba'am/ dro ba'am/ bkres pa'am/ skom pa'am/ dga' ba'am/ mi dga' ba'am/ skye ba dang / rga ba dang / na ba dang / 'chi ba'am/ gnod par 'gyur ba med do/ /rigs kyi bu/ de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' ye shes kyi sgyu ma'i rnam pa las byung ba'i gzugs dang ldan pa/ chos kyi dbyings tha mi dad pa'i lus dang ldan pa/ srid pa'i lam gyi rgyud thams cad du sems can yongs su smin par byed pa'i don du skyes te bskal pa thams cad du gnas pa la'ang chos bcu med de/ bcu gang zhe na/ 'di ltar 'khor ba la mngon par dga' ba'am/ 'khor ba srid pa'i lam gyi rgyud du skye bas skyo bar 'gyur ba'am/ yul gyi dga' ba la 'dun pa'am/ khong khro ba'i sems sam/ longs spyad par 'dod pa'am/ nyon mongs pa thams cad kyis yongs su gdung ba'am/ sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba nyams su myong ba'am/ lam nyam nga bar skye bas 'jigs pa'am/ srid par mngon par 'dun pa'am/ mngon par chags pa med do/ /

“Just as a magically produced man has all his limbs and body parts but lacks ten physical elements—inhalation and exhalation, coolness and warmth, hunger and thirst, joy and sorrow, the pains of birth, old age, sickness, and death—in the same way, in the enlightening being whose form is born of the magic of knowledge, whose body is one with the cosmos, who appears in all states of existence to perfect sentient beings, who lives through all ages, ten things are not to be found: desire for the mundane world, rejection of life in the mundane, currying of enjoyment of objects, malevolence, desire for enjoyment, the burning of afflictions, experiences of painful feelings, fear of difficult situations, desire for existence, and attachment.

'on kyang rigs kyi bu/ sangs rgyas kyi byin gyi rlabs kyis ma 'ongs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi byang chub sems dpa'i smon lam rgya chen po'i stobs rnam par 'phel bar bya ba'i phyir bstan par bya'o/ /
“I will tell you more, by the power of Buddha, to increase the power of vows of enlightening beings of the future.

rigs kyi bu/ sngon 'das pa'i dus bskal pa 'jig rten gyi khams rgya mtsho'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed kyi pha rol de'i yang pha snga 'das par gyur pa de'i tshe de'i dus na 'jig rten gyi khams rin po che'i 'od ces bya ba zhig byung ste/ rigs kyi bu/ 'jig rten gyi khams rin po che'i 'od de la bskal pa ni/ 'od bzang po zhes bya ba byung ngo/ /bskal pa 'od bzang po zhes bya ba de la ni/ sangs rgyas stong phrag bcu byung bar gyur te/ rigs kyi bu/ sangs rgyas stong phrag bcu po de dag las bskal pa'i dang po la de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas chos kyi 'khor lo'i sgra nam mkha'i sprin gyi sgron ma rgyal po zhes bya ba mkhyen pa dang zhabs su ldan pa/ bde bar gshegs pa/ 'jig rten mkhyen pa/ bla na med pa/ skyes bu 'dul ba'i kha lo sgyur ba/ lha dang mi'i ston pa sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das 'jig rten du byung ste/ de thams cad kyi thog ma la bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par sangs rgyas so/ /rigs kyi bu/ de bzhin gshegs pa de gling bzhi pa'i dbus na rgyal po'i gnas dga' bas brgyan pa zhes bya ba yod pa dang tshad du'ang rgyang mi ring ba zhig tu byung ste/ rgyal po'i gnas dga' bas brgyan pa de'i shar phyogs logs na nags tshal 'od bzang po zhes bya ba zhig yod de/ nags tshal 'od bzang po der snying po byang chub rin po che'i me tog gi sprin ces bya ba byung ngo/ /snying po byang chub rin po che'i sprin ces bya ba der gdan seng+ge'i khri rin po che rnam par snang ba'i snying po can byung ste/ de la bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa chos kyi 'khor lo'i sgra nam mkha'i sprin gyi sgron ma rgyal po bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par sangs rgyas so/ /

“In the very remote past there was a world called Jewel Light. In that world was an age called Beautiful Light. In that age ten thousand buddhas appeared. The first of those buddhas was one called King Illumining Space with the Voice of Truth, who was one of those who has arrived at Thusness, perfectly enlightened, consummate in knowledge and action, arrived at felicity, supreme knower of the world, tamer of humans, teacher of humans and gods, a blessed buddha.
“That buddha appeared not far from a capital city called Array of Delights, in the middle of the four continents of the world. East of that city was a forest called Beautiful Light, in which there was an enlightenment site called Cloud of Jewel Flowers. At that site a lion throne in the calyx of a lotus of radiant jewels appeared, and this is where that buddha realized supreme perfect enlightenment.

de'i tshe mi'i tshe'i tshad lo stong phrag bcu thub pa las 'jig rten du sems can srog gcod pa dang / ma byin par len pa dang / 'dod pas log par g.yem pa dang / brdzun du smra ba dang / phra ma zer ba dang / zhe gcod pa'i tshig smra ba dang / tshig kyal ba zer ba dang / chags sems dang ldan pa dang / gnod sems yod pa dang / log par lta ba can byung ste/ de ltar mi dge ba'i las kyi lam bcu rnam par rgyas par gyur nas rab tu brtan par gyur te/ bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa chos kyi 'khor lo'i sgra nam mkha'i sprin gyi sgron ma rgyal po des 'jig rten gyi dbang po sngon gyi rgyal ba la bya ba byas pa rnams dang / 'dzam bu'i gling gi mi rnams kyi dge ba'i rtsa ba yongs su smin par bya ba'i phyir snying po byang chub mchog tu gshegs te byang chub sems dpa' rnams la chos bstan to/ /

“At that time the human life span was ten thousand years. Now, there being many who were set in evil ways—killing, stealing, raping, lying, foul and harsh in speaking, divisive, covetous, malicious, and deluded—the buddha sat at the site of enlightenment for a full thousand years and taught enlightening beings, world leaders, and people who had served past buddhas, in order to mature people’s existing roots of good.

de'i tshe rgyal po'i gnas dga' bas brgyan pa de na rgyal po rgyal ba'i 'od ces bya ba 'dug 'dug ste/ des mi ma byin par len pa/ rku ba/ sdig to byed pa/ srog gcod pa/ 'dod pas log par g.yem pa/ rdzun zer ba/ phra ma smra ba/ zhe gcod pa'i tshig dang ldan pa/ tshig kyal pa smra ba/ chags sems can/ gnod sems yod pa/ log par lta ba/ chos ma yin pa'i 'dod chags la zhen pa/ 'dod pa mi bzad pas mngon par non pa/ log pa'i chos kyi kun nas 'khor ba/ sdig to byed byed pa/ khro gtum byed byed pa/ bsod nams ma byas pa/ 'jigs pas bag tsha ba med pa/ mar mi shes pa/ phar mi shes pa/ dge sbyong du bya ba med pa/ bram zer bya ba med pa/ tshul mi shes pa/ g.yo dang ldan pa brgya stong du ma rab tu gdul bar bya ba'i phyir btson rar btsud par gyur to; ;rgyal po rgyal ba'i 'od de la bu gzugs bzang ba/ shin tu mdzes pa/ blta na sdug pa/ kha dog bzang po dam pa rgyas pa dang ldan pa/ mi chen po'i mtshan nyi shu rtsa brgyad dang ldan pa rnam par rgyal ba zhes bya ba zhig yod pa de khang pa glu snyan pa'i dbyangs zhes bya ba'i steng du phyin te bud med kyi 'khor mang pos yongs su bskor cing 'dug 'dug pa las btson ra na 'khod pa'i sems can mtshon cha sna tshogs kyis dmad du glags pa de dag gi sgra 'jigs 'jigs skad du 'bod pa thos par gyur to/ /thos nas mi dga' zhing shin tu nyams mi bde ba'i sems su gyur te/ snying rje chen po skyes nas khang steng de nas shod du babs te/ btson ra der phyin nas btson ra dam po na 'khod pa'i sems can shing sgrog dang / lcags sgrog dang / khong sgril dang / ltung dang mdo rtod kyis sgrog shing brtod de gcig gi lus dang gcig tu sbrel nas mun pa mun nag tu btsud de dud pa'i rab rib kyis 'grigs shing rlung nad nyams su mi bde bas nyam thag par gyur pa/ dbugs shin tu mi bde bar rgyu ba/ bkres pa dang skom pas mnar ba/ sgren mo gos med pa/ lus thams cad phyag dar dang rdul gyi nang na 'gre ba/ lus rang gi skras yog pa/ brla sgril gyis dam du bcings pa/ nyon mongs pa sna tshogs kyis mtho brtsams pa/ sdug bsngal gyi tshor bas zil gyis mnan cing sdug bsngal nyams su myong bar gyur te/ mi bzad pa sna tshogs kyi smre sngags bla zhing 'o dod 'bod pa

“At that time there was a king called Victorious Light in that capital city Array of Delights. He had thrown many hundreds of thousands of criminals and evildoers into prison to discipline them—thieves, killers, rapists, liars, abusive and violent people, troublemakers, greedy people, malicious people, people obsessed with aberrant ideas, people addicted to unlawful pleasures, people overcome by desire for ill-gotten gains, people involved in false cults, evildoers, people who had committed violence, people who had done no good, people who had neglected to come to the aid of those in danger and fear, people without respect for their parents or for mendicants, priests, and holy people.
“The king had a son named Conqueror, who had twenty-eight of the marks of a great man, and lived in the palace surrounded by many graceful women. He heard the frightful cries of those who were bound up in prison; agitated and upset by these cries, moved with compassion, he left the palace and went into the prison, where he saw those people cast into the dungeons, bound by all sorts of fetters and shackles, chained together and thrown into the darkness, shrouded in smoke, exposed to unhealthy drafts, emaciated, hungry and thirsty, naked and homeless, filthy and unkempt, being subjected to various tortures, screaming in pain.

de dag mthong nas snying rje chen po skyes te/ snying rje'i bsam pa rgya chen po byung nas gzhan la phan par bya ba'i sems skyes te btson ra thibs po na 'khod pa'i sems can rnams btson ra nas thar par bya'o/ /zhes dbugs bton nas des sems can de dag la mi 'jigs pa byin te rgyal po rgyal ba'i 'od gang na ba der song ste 'di skad ces gsol to/ /lha'i zhal snga nas mkhyen pa mdzad du gsol/ btson ra mi bde ba na mchis pa'i sems can rnams la glo ba rje nas bdag gis mi 'jigs pa stsal na/ de dag dgye bar ci gnang zhes nas de nas rgyal po rgyal ba'i 'od kyis blon po lnga brgya po bsags nas khyed ji snyam du sems zhes smras pa dang / de dag gis smras pa/ btson 'di rnams ni/ rgyal po'i phyag mdzod rku ba/ rgyal po'i sku la dar ba/ btsun mo'i 'khor du zhugs pa las bzung ba sha stag ste/ de dag ni/ mi 'gum du'ang mi rung / de dag gi chad pa ni/ 'gum pas 'bra bar bas ste/ ma lags na'ang btson rar gum na/ chad pa 'bra lags grang / de dag gi mgon su bgyid pa de'ang rgyal po'i zhal sngar glo ba ring ngo/ /

“Seeing the prisoners, the prince was inspired with great compassion and an unprecedented determination to help others. He comforted the prisoners, intending to deliver them from their bonds. Giving them assurance, he went to the king and said, ‘Know, O king, that I have given assurance to the people in prison. Please set them free.’
“The king called his five hundred ministers together and asked them what they thought about this. They said, ‘These people are plunderers of the royal treasuries, attackers of the king, arrested entering the royal palace; they should be executed. Furthermore, anyone who wants to save them is also guilty of crime against the king.’
