de nas rgyal po'i bu rnam par rgyal ba'i snying rje chen pos mi bzod ches nas blon po de dag la smras pa/ khyed kyis ji skad du smra ba de ltar yang rung ste/ ngas khong ta 'di dag gi don du sdug bsngal nyams su blang ba thams cad kyang bzod par bya na/ de dag la khyed kyis ci bya ba de nga la gyis te nyes pa can de dag khye zhig /ngas de rnams btson ra nas dgrol ba'i don du mi bde ba thams cad nyams su blang ste lus dang / srog yongs su dor bar bya'o/ /de ci'i phyir zhe na/ gal te ngas sems can 'di rnams tsam zhig kyang btson ra nas dgrol bar ma nus na/ khams gsum pa'i btson ra na 'khod pa'i sems can sred pa'i zhags pas glags pa/ ma rig pa'i thibs po na 'khod pa/ gti mug gi mun par btsud pa/ phongs pa'i sdug bsngal gyis mnar ba/ ngan song gi rgyud zabs su ring zhing 'byung bar dka' bar chud pa/ dbyibs mi sdug la mdog mi sdug pa dang ldan pa/ dbang po'i sbyor ba thams cad dang bral ba/ nor ba'i yid dang ldan pa/ 'byung ba mi mthong ba/ snang ba med pa/ khams gsum pa la mngon par zhen pa/ bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs med pa/ ye shes kyi skye mched dang skol ba/ nyon mongs pa sna tshogs kyis sems dri ma can du gyur pa/ sdug bsngal gyi shing thags kyis 'khor ba/ bdud kyi dbang du gyur pa/ skye ba dang / rga ba dang / na ba dang / 'chi ba dang / mya ngan dang / smre sngags 'don pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / yid mi bde ba dang / 'khrug pas mnar ba rnams kyang ji ltar khrol bar bya zhes nas rgyal po gzhon nu rnam par rgyal bas btson ra na 'khod pa'i sems can de dag bdag nyid yongs su gtang ba dang / rnam pa thams cad du yongs su gtang bas g.yog 'khor thams cad dang / nor gyi phung po thams cad kyis blus te btson ra de dag nas yongs su bkye nas sems can de dag gi sdug bsngal nyams su blangs te phyir ldog pa med par gyur to/ /

“The prince, overwhelmed with great compassion, said to those ministers, ‘Let it be as you say. Just release these convicts—I can endure all pains for their sake. Whatever you would do to them, do to me. To free them from bondage I will undergo all kinds of torture and give up my body and life. Why? If I cannot liberate these people from bondage, how can I liberate those who are bound to the world, who are tied up by the ropes of craving, who are in the abyss of ignorance, who are cast into the darkness of delusion, who suffer the pains of poverty, who have fallen into the depths of evil ways, who act senselessly, whose minds are confused, who see no way to emancipation, who are without illumination, who are attached to the world, who lack virtue and knowledge, who have lost their faculties of knowledge, whose minds are tainted with various afflictions, who are flung in the mud of suffering, who are under the control of demons, who are tormented by birth, old age, death, grief, lamentation, misery, depression, and sorrow?’
“Then the prince released all those prisoners from their bonds, by giving up himself, his whole retinue, and all his wealth. Freeing them, he removed all that was torturing them once and for all.

de nas blon po lnga brgya po de dag gis lag pa gyen du bsgreng ste 'o dod bos nas rgyal po rgyal ba'i 'od kyi gan du dong ste 'di skad ces smras so/ /rgyal po'i zhal snga nas mkhyen par mdzad du gsol/ gzhon nu rnam par rgyal ba'i mchid thabs su bgyis pas rgyal po'i chab srid kyang stor bar 'gyur/ bdag cag rnams kyang srog la 'bab par the tshom 'tshal te/ lha'i zhal snga nas rgyal po gzhon nu rnam par rgyal ba la bka' nan ma mdzad na ni/ ring po'ang mi thogs par lha'i zhal sngar sku la dar bar 'gyur ro/ /zhes pa dang /

At that point the five hundred ministers, up in arms, went to the king and said, ‘Know that the law of the king has been broken by the will of the prince, and all of our lives are uncertain. If you do not punish the prince, your own life will not last long.’

de nas rgyal po rgyal ba'i 'od shin tu khros nas rgyal po'i bu rnam par rgyal ba dang / g.yon dang ldan pa'i mi de dag tu bcas te gsad par byas so/ / de nas de'i ma skyed skyed pas thos nas mi dga' ste/ bud med kyi 'khor stong dang bcas te skra ni/ bshig /lus kyi rgyan ni/ bor/ rang gi bzhin ni/ dral/ brang ni/ rdung / mgo ni/ phyag dar gyis gang bar snying rje rje skad kyi nga ror du zhing rgyal po'i drung du phyin nas 'khor dang bcas pas rkang pa gnyis la phyag byas te 'di skad du gsol ba btab bo/ /lha'i zhal snga nas thugs ci dgongs/ rgyal po gzhon nu rnam par rgyal ba gtang du gsol/ rgyal po gzhon nu rnam par rgyal ba'i srog stsal du gsol zhes nas de nas rgyal pos rgyal po gzhon nu rnam par rgyal ba mdun du bzhag ste 'di skad ces smras so/ /gzhon nu/ g.yon dang ldan pa'i mi 'di rnams thong / de ste mi gtong zhing de rnams kyi le lan du shi bar gyur ta re zhes pa dang / des zhum pa med pa'i sems ma 'khums pa/ thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du dmigs par brtson pa/ gzhan la phan par gzhol ba/ snying rje chen po sngon du 'gro bas 'chi bar khas blangs pa dang / de'i mas rgyal po rgyal ba'i 'od la zla ba phyed cig tu phrad par gsol ba btab pa/ dgung zla phyed cig tu gzhon nu 'di sbyin pa stsol du ci gnang / de slan chad ni; su ci dgyes pa de'ang mdzad par gsol zhes pa dang / de de ltar gyis shig /ces rgyal pos gnang ngo/ /

“The king, enraged, set out to kill his son and those convicts as well. The queen, hearing of this, was very upset: her hair undone, her jewelry and makeup removed, she went to the king with a thousand of her ladies, beating her breast and throwing dust on her head, weeping and wailing; she said to him, ‘Let the prince go free, let him live.’ The king turned to the prince and said, ‘Give up on these criminals. If you do not, you will die for their sake.’
“The prince, facing death, was not fazed, being focused on omniscience, dedicated to the welfare of others, guided by great compassion. The queen, his mother, asked the king to allow a fortnight for observation: ‘Let the prince give people whatever they need for half a month; then do whatever you want with him.’ The king agreed to this.

de nas rgyal po'i gnas dga' bas brgyan pa de'i byang phyogs logs shig na sngon mchod sbyin gyi gnas su bya ba'i bza' shing gi ra ba chen po nyi ma'i 'od ces bya ba der gzhon nu de song nas su ci 'dod pa de la de byin te/ des gtan pa med pa'i mchod sbyin byas nas zla ba phyed du sbyin pa rnam pa sna tshogs byin no/ /zas 'dod pa la ni/ zas byin/ skom 'dod pa la ni/ skom byin/ bzhon pa dang / gos dang / me tog dang / byug pa dang / phye ma dang / chos gos dang / gdugs dang / rgyal mtshan dang / ba dan dang / rin po che'i rgyan dang / yo byad thams cad dang / lhab lhub thams cad dang / yo byad kyi rnam pa thams cad kyang de dag 'dod pa la yongs su btang ste/

“North of the city there was a large park called Sunlight that had been made in the past as a sacrificial ground. The prince went there and gave to anyone who asked whatever they needed. Thus for half a month he freely gave away various goods—food, clothing, utensils, and so on—to whoever needed them.

de nas nyi ma tha ma la bab par gyur pa dang 'gro ba mang po'i tshogs kun nas 'dus te/ rgyal po'i blon po dang / bud med kyi tshogs dang / tshong dpon dang / khyim bdag dang / ljongs dang yul gyi mi dang zhags pa thub pa thams cad kyang kun nas 'dus/ bcom ldan 'das chos kyi 'khor lo'i sgra nam mkha'i sprin gyi sgron ma rgyal po de bzhin gshegs pa de yang sems can yongs su smin par bya ba dang / gdul ba'i dus thugs su chud nas mchod sbyin gyi gnas der gshegs te lha'i dbang po'i tshogs kyis ni/ yongs su bskor; klu'i dbang pos ni/ yang dag par mchod/ gnod sbyin gyi dbang pos ni/ lus mngon par btud/ dri za'i dbang pos ni/ mngon par bstod/ lha ma yin gyi dbang pos ni/ lus shin tu btud/ nam mkha' lding gi dbang po gtsug gi rin po ches rnam par brgyan pas ni/ sems dang ba'i mchod pa'i rnam pas rab tu bkang / mi'am ci'i dbang po rnams kyis ni/ dga' bas yongs su mchod de bstod pa'i glu dbyangs kyis yongs su bskul/ lto 'phye chen po'i dbang po rnams kyis ni/ kun nas bskor cing zhal du blta ba de 'gro ba'i tshogs chen po de dang / rgyal po gzhon nu rnam bar rgyal bas bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas chos kyi 'khor lo'i sgra nam mkha'i sprin gyi sgron ma rgyal po shin tu mdzes pa/ blta na sdug pa/ dbang po zhi ba/ thugs zhi ba; shin tu dben par dbang po las rgyal ba/ glang po ltar shin tu dul ba/ mtsho ltar rab tu shing gsal la rnyog pa med pa/ sangs rgyas kyi rnam par 'phrul pa dang; cho 'phrul chen po dang / sangs rgyas kyi khyu mchog gi mthu phyung ba chen pos ni/ rnam par mdzes/ sangs rgyas kyi bdag nyid che bas ni/ rab tu 'bar/ sangs rgyas kyi mtshan dang / dpe byad bzang po'i rgyan gyis ni/ sku mdzes par brgyan/ 'jig rten thams cad ni/ sangs rgyas kyi 'od kyi dkyil 'khor snang bas rgyas par 'gengs shing sangs rgyas kyi 'od zer gyis rab tu snang bar mdzad/ sku'i ba spu'i bu ga thams cad nas ni/ spos rin po che'i ngad 'phro ba'i 'khor lo rab tu 'gyed/ sangs rgyas kyi zhing rab tu bskyod pa'i tshul du ni/ 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad yongs su skyob pa mdzad cing rgyan thams cad kyi sprin gyi char rab tu 'bebs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi rnam par gnon pa dang / sems can thams cad kyi nyon mongs pa spong ba'i sangs rgyas kyi spyod lam dang / sems can thams cad kyi dga' ba'i shugs rnam par 'phel bar mdzad pa'i sangs rgyas kyi zhal blta ba'i byin gyis pha zad cig nas tshur gshegs pa mthong nas de bzhin gshegs pa la sems mngon par mos par gyur to/ /

“Then, on the last day of the fortnight, the whole population gathered—the king, his ministers, his women, the grandees, the landlords, the townspeople, and all the religious impostors. Now the buddha-king Illumining Space with the Voice of Truth, realizing it was an opportune time to teach people, went to that sacrificial ground, respectfully surrounded by celestial and spiritual beings. The crowd of people, and the prince, saw the buddha coming from afar, serene, pleasant to see, senses calm, mind quiet, self-controlled, master of his faculties, tranquil as an elephant, clear as a pool of water, purified, undefiled, miraculously radiating light by the great power of a buddha, overpowering with the mastery of a buddha, shining with the magnificence of a buddha, adorned with the marks and embellishments of a buddha, pervading all worlds with the light of his aura, illuminating them with rays of light, emanating orbs of fragrant jewel fire from every pore, causing all worlds to quake with the quaking of a buddha-land, destroying all beings’ afflictions, coming forth as a buddha raining multitudes of all kinds of supernal manifestations, bearing himself as a buddha, increasing the flow of joy in all beings, conveying the power of the sight of a buddha. Seeing the buddha thus, everyone’s mind became clear and serene.

de nas rgyal po gzhon nu rnam par rgyal ba dang / 'gro ba'i tshogs chen po de dag gis bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa chos kyi 'khor lo'i sgra nam mkha'i sprin gyi sgron ma rgyal po de pha zad du bsu nas mos pa'i sems kyis lus thams cad kyis phab ste phyag 'tshal nas zhabs gnyis la spyi bos gtugs te mchod pa rnam pa sna tshogs kyis yang dag par mchod nas tshig 'di skad du brjod do/ /bcom ldan 'das tshur gshegs su gsol/ bde bar gshegs pa tshur gshegs su gsol/ de bzhin gshegs pas bdag cag dgongs so/ /bde bar gshegs pas bdag cag yongs su bzung ngo/ / de nas rgyal po gzhon nu rnam par rgyal bas bcom ldan 'das la gdan dam pas bstabs te 'di skad ces gsol to/ /bcom ldan 'das gdan bting ba 'di la bzhugs su gsol zhes nas bcom ldan 'das der gshegs pa dang / gdan de yang gtsang sbra lhur len pa'i lus kyi ris su gtogs pa'i lha rnams kyis sangs rgyas kyi byin gyis rin po che spos kyi rgyal po'i pad+mo'i snying po can du byin gyis brlabs nas gdan de la bcom ldan 'das chos kyi 'khor lo'i sgra nam mkha'i sprin gyi sgron ma rgyal po de bzhin gshegs pa bzhugs so/ /'khor gyi stan de dag la byang chub sems dpa' rnams 'khod de/ de'i zhal mthong ma thag tu 'khor de'i sems can thams cad kyang sgrib pa thams cad dang bral te/ nad thams cad kyang zhi bar gyur nas 'phags pa'i chos kyi snod du gyur to/ /

“Then the prince and the people, going out to meet the buddha, their minds clear, prostrated themselves before the buddha, made offerings of many kinds, and said, ‘Welcome, welcome, Blessed One; the Buddha has turned his attention to us, the Buddha has bestowed his favor on us.’ Then the prince pointed out a seat of honor to the buddha and said, ‘Please sit down, O Blessed One—this seat has been prepared.’ Then, as the buddha approached, the gods of purity, by the power of the buddha, changed it into a calyx of a lotus of fragrant diamonds. The buddha sat on it, and enlightening beings sat on surrounding seats. As soon as they saw the buddha, everyone in the assembly was relieved of afflictions and obstruction and disturbance, and became fit vessels for the holy teachings.

de nas bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa chos kyi 'khor lo'i sgra nam mkha'i sprin gyi sgron ma rgyal pos sems can de dag snod du gyur par thugs su chud nas bstan pa rim pas bka' stsal te/ 'di ltar rgyu'i dkyil 'khor rab tu snang ba zhes bya ba'i mdo sde yang dag par bstan nas zhal gyi sgo nas 'gro ba thams cad kyi skad rgya mtsho dang / des pa'i tshig dang ngag gi dbyangs su brjod pa'i gsung dbyangs kyi yan lag stong dang ldan pa/ chos kyi yan lag thams cad dang ldan pa rab tu bsgrags pa dang; de'i mod la 'khor de nas srog chags bye ba phrag brgyad cu ni/ rdul dang bral te dri ma med par gyur nas chos la chos kyi mig skyes par gyur to/ /srog chags bye ba mang zhig gis ni/ mi slob pa'i sa thob par gyur to/ /srog chags stong phrag bcu ni/ theg pa chen po la rnam par dul bar gyur te/ 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa kun tu bzang po dang / smon lam chen po yongs su rdzogs pa'i tshul la zhugs par gyur to/ /de ltar bcom ldan 'das des sangs rgyas kyi rnam par 'phrul pa chen pos chos kyi 'khor lo rab tu bskor ba'i tshe phyogs bcu'i sems can sangs rgyas kyi zhing brgya phrag stong gi rdul shin tu phra ba snyed theg pa chen po la rnam par dul bar gyur to/ /phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten sangs rgyas kyi zhing 'byams klas pa sna tshogs su gtogs pa dag gi sems can mtha' dang dbus med pa dag gis kyang ngan song gi lam rnam par bzlog par gyur to/ /sems can grangs las 'das pa zhig ni/ mtho ris su skye ba'i lam la rab tu bkod par gyur to; ;rgyal po gzhon nu rnam par rgyal bas kyang byang chub sems dpa'i rnam par thar pa sems can thams cad yongs su smin par bya bas bsam pa ji lta ba bzhin du dge ba'i rtsa ba la yang dag par skul ba 'di thob par gyur to/ /

“Then the buddha, knowing that those people had become capable of receiving the Teaching, gave them a systematic talk. He expounded to them a scripture called Illumination of the Multitude of Causes, including all elements of the Teaching, which he spoke in the languages of all people. At that, eighty million people in that crowd attained dispassionate, pure, objective vision of things. Many millions reached the stage beyond learning. Ten thousand were led to the Great Vehicle, introduced to the way of fulfillment of the great vows of universally good enlightening action. Thus as the buddha turned the wheel of teaching by the great miraculous power of buddhas, as many beings as atoms in a hundred thousand buddha-lands in the ten directions came to the guidance of the Great Vehicle. An infinite variety of beings in the interrelated buddha-lands in the worlds of the ten directions put an end to evil. Countless beings were established in the way to paradise. And as for the prince, he attained this enlightening liberation made of roots of goodness fostering the perfection of all beings according to their mentalities.

rigs kyi bu/ de la de'i tshe de'i dus na rgyal po gzhon nu rnam par rgyal ba zhes bya ba byung ste/ rang gi lus dang srog yongs su btang nas nor gyi tshogs dang / 'khor thams cad dang / mi'i 'jig rten na 'tsho ba'i bde ba yongs su spangs nas btson ra na 'khod pa'i sems can de dag thar par byas pa/ mchod sbyin chen po gtan pa med pa'i mchod sbyin byed byed pa/ bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas chos kyi 'khor lo'i sgra nam mkha'i sprin gyi sgron ma rgyal po de la bsnyen bkur byed byed pa/ de bzhin gshegs pa de'i zhal mthong ba'i mod la bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed de/ byang chub sems dpa'i rnam par thar pa sems can thams cad yongs su smin par bya bas bsam pa ji lta ba bzhin du dge ba'i rtsa ba la yang dag par skul ba yang thob par gyur pa de gzhan zhig yin pa snyam du sems na ni/ rigs kyi bu/ khyod kyis de ltar mi blta ste kho mo ni/ de'i tshe de'i dus na rgyal po gzhon nu rnam par rgyal ba zhes bya bar gyur to/ /de ltar kho mo rgyal po gzhon nu rnam par rgyal ba zhes bya par gyur te/ snying rje chen pos rab tu mi dga' zhing 'gro ba thams cad la phan par zhugs te/ khams gsum la mi gnas pa dang / rnam par smin pa'i lan la re ba med pa dang / grags pa dang / snyan pa dang / ming smos pa la mngon par dga' ba med pa dang / bdag la bstod pa med pa dang / gzhan la smod pa med pa dang / dngos po thams cad la mngon par zhen pa med pa dang / sred pa'i 'du shes las gyen du 'phags pa dang / khams gsum pa la mngon par dga' ba med pa dang / 'jig rten gyi yul gyi bde ba las phyir phyogs pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i yul la mngon du gyur pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i bsam pa rnam par dag pa dang / lhag pa'i bsam pa rdo rje yongs su grub pa dang / 'gro ba thams cad la byams pa chen pos nan tan du byed pa dang / 'gro ba thams cad la snying brtse bas sdug bsngal rnam par zhi bar bya ba la brtson pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs la bsam pa thag pa nas lhag par dmigs pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i lam yongs su sbyang ba dang / theg pa chen po'i rgyan gyis 'byung ba'i lam rab tu brgyan par bya ba dang / thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi sgo mngon par blta bar bya ba'i tshul gyis de dag de lta bur dka' ba dag kyang byas par gyur to/ /rigs kyi bu/ kho mos ni/ byang chub sems dpa'i rnam par thar pa sems can thams cad yongs su smin par bya bas bsam pa ji lta ba bzhin du dge ba'i rtsa ba la yang dag par skul ba 'di yun de srid du ring ba zhig nas thob par gyur to/ /

“Now then, you may think that the prince in that time, who gave up his body and life, his wealth and retinue, and all human pleasures, in order to liberate those people from bondage, was somebody else. Who was it who made that great sacrifice without reservations, who won the favor of the buddha of that time, who resolved to attain perfect enlightenment when he saw the buddha, who attained this enlightening liberation made of roots of goodness fostering the development of all beings according to their mentalities? It was none other than I myself who was that prince in that time. As that prince, overwhelmed by great compassion, set on the welfare of all beings, unattached to the things of the world, desiring only perfection, with no wish for glory, fame, or repute, not elevating myself, not degrading others, unattached to things, without any notion of existents, without desire for anything in the world, material or immaterial, indifferent to the pleasures of the world, attentive to the sphere of the enlightened, purely intent on enlightenment, having developed an indomitable will, benevolent toward all living beings, compassionately resolved to quell the suffering of all beings, intent on the power of the enlightened, purifying the path of enlightenment, preparing the paths of emancipation of the Great Vehicle, contemplating the path to omniscience, I did these difficult deeds. This is how long ago I attained this liberation.

rigs kyi bu/ de la ji snyam du sems/ de'i tshe de'i dus ni rgyal po rgyal ba'i 'od la log par gsol ba 'debs shing kho mo gsad pa'i phyir gros su gsol ba'i blon po lnga brgya po de rnams gzhan dag cig yin pa snyam du sems na ni/ de ltar mi blta ste/ lhas byin gyis bcom ldan 'das dgrongs pa'i phyir skyes bu lnga brgya bkye ba de dag yin te/ de dag kyang bcom ldan 'das kyis ma 'ongs pa'i dus bskal pa ri rab kyi rdul shin tu phra ba snyed na bskal pa 'od bzang po zhes bya ba zhig la sangs rgyas lnga brgya sangs rgyas kyi zhing gi yon tan dang rgyan sna tshogs dang ldan pa/ rigs dang rgyud sna tshogs su skyes pa/ pha dang ma sna tshogs su smos pa/ skye ba'i rnam par 'phrul ba sna tshogs yongs su ston pa/ mngon par 'byung ba'i rnam par 'phrul pa sna tshogs dang ldan pa/ byang chub kyi shing gi 'od sna tshogs yongs su ston pa/ snying po byang chub sna tshogs su nye bar 'dong ba'i sgo sna tshogs dang ldan pa/ bdud pham pa sna tshogs yongs su ston pa/ mngon par 'tshang rgya ba'i rnam par 'phrul pa sna tshogs yongs su ston pa/ chos kyi 'khor lo rab tu bskor ba'i tshul dang / ming dang / nges pa'i tshig sna tshogs dang ldan pa/ mdo sde'i tshul shin tu bstan pa sna tshogs dang ldan pa/ tshig gi lam dang skad sna tshogs rab tu ston pa/ 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor gyi rgyan sna tshogs dang ldan pa/ 'od kyi dkyil 'khor gyi mthu dang rgyan sna tshogs rab tu 'gyed pa/ tshe'i tshad sna tshogs dang ldan pa/ bstan pa'i byin gyi rlabs sna tshogs dang ldan pa/ bstan pa rnam par dmigs pa sna tshogs dang ldan pa; ming sna tshogs dang ldan pa/ snying rje chen po'i lus su gyur pa sha stag tu 'gyur te/ de dag gi bskal pa'i dang po la de bzhin gshegs pa thugs rje chen po mnga' ba zhes bya ba 'jig rten gyi khams rin chen 'od du bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par 'tshang rgya'o/ /de'i rjes la 'jig rten gyi khams de nyid du de bzhin gshegs pa gnyis pa 'gro ba thams cad la phan pa'i smon lam zla ba zhes bya ba 'byung ngo/ /de bzhin gshegs pa gsum pa thugs rje chen po'i seng+ge zhes bya ba 'byung ngo/ /de bzhin gshegs pa bzhi pa 'jig rten thams cad la phan pa mdzad pa zhes bya ba 'byung ba nas thams cad kyi tha mar de bzhin gshegs pa sman pa'i rgyal po zhes bya ba 'byung bar 'gyur ro/ /zhes bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu lung bstan to/ /

“And who do you think those five hundred ministers were, who unjustly incited the king to execute me? They were none other than five hundred people whom Devadatta incited to kill the Buddha. The Buddha subsequently guided them and foretold their enlightenment, predicting that in the future, after as many eons as atoms in a polar mountain, in an age called Good Light, there would be five hundred buddhas, with buddha-lands of various qualities, born of various races, tribes, and families, showing various miracles at birth, undergoing various spiritual transmutations on leaving society, manifesting various lights at the tree of enlightenment, approaching the pinnacle of enlightenment in various ways, showing various ways of destroying demons, showing various miracles on attainment of enlightenment, articulating various terms for the principles of their teachings, expounding various scriptures, speaking various languages, surrounded by various audiences, emanating various auras of light, having various life spans, their teachings to remain for various lengths of time, their teachings variously circulating, and their names to be various, all embodiments of great compassion. The first buddha of the age to attain supreme enlightenment in the world Jewel Light would be one named Great Compassionate One, the second would be named Moon of Commitment to the Welfare of All Beings, the third would be Lion of Great Compassion, the fourth would be Desirous of the Welfare of All Beings, and the last one would be Supreme Healer.

rigs kyi bu/ de la ji snyam du sems/ de'i tshe de'i dus na g.yon dang ldan pa'i mi'i rgyal po la snying ring bar gyur te/ kho mos gsod ma mi'i lag tu phyin pa las rang gi lus dang srog yongs su btang ste btson ra de dag nas bkye ba de rnams gzhan dag cig yin pa snyam du sems na ni/ de ltar mi blta ste/ de bzhin gshegs pa log par dad sel la sogs pa bskal pa bzang po pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa rnams dang / de ma yin pa'i byang chub sems dpa' grangs med pa brgya stong phrag bcu dag ste/ bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa stobs mtha' yas grags par brjod pa'i dpal yang dag par 'byung ba'i blo gros mthong bar gyur ma thag tu bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed nas da ltar phyogs bcu na byang chub sems dpa'i spyad pa spyod cing byang chub sems dpa'i rnam par thar pa sems can thams cad yongs su smin par bya bas bsam pa ji lta ba bzhin du dge ba'i rtsa ba la yang dag par bskul ba 'di yang sgom zhing shin tu rgyas par byed pa dag go /

“Who do you think those criminals of that time were, doomed to die, whom I released from bondage by sacrificing my life? They were none other than the buddhas of the present age, Virtue, beginning with Krakucchanda, and countless millions of other enlightening beings who were inspired to seek enlightenment by seeing the buddha Resolution Born of the Glory of the Proclamation of Endless Power, and are now carrying out enlightenment practice throughout the universe, and are cultivating and extending this enlightening liberation born of roots of goodness aiding the development of all beings according to their mentalities.

rigs kyi bu/ de la ji snyam du sems/ de'i tshe de'i dus na rgyal po rgyal ba'i 'od ces bya ba byung ba de gzhan zhig yin pa snyam du sems na ni/ de ltar mi blta ste/ smra ba chen po bden pa can ni; de'i tshe de'i dus na rgyal po rgyal ba'i 'od ces bya bar gyur to/ /rigs kyi bu/ de la ji snyam du sems/ de'i dus na rgyal po'i 'khor du gyur pa btsun mo'i 'khor dang / btsun mo'i gnas kyi sgo ba'am/ 'khor na gnas pa'am/ rjes su 'brang ba de dag kyang gzhan dag cig yin pa snyam du sems na ni/ de ltar mi blta ste; zhags pa thub pa stong phrag drug cu po smra ba chen po bden pa can gyi smra ba'i rgyal mtshan yongs su gzung ba'i don du bcom ldan 'das la rgol du 'gro ba'i tshe bcom ldan 'das kyi sbyan sngar blags nas kun kyang zhing sna tshogs kyi rgyan dang / bskal pa sna tshogs dang / ming sna tshogs kyi de bzhin gshegs par 'jig rten du 'byung bar 'gyur ro/ /zhes bcom ldan 'das kyis bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu lung bstan pa dag go /

“Who do you think the Victorious Light of that time was? It was none other than the great debater Satyaka. And who do you think were the retinue and servants of the king, but the sixty thousand philosophers whom Satyaka brought to the buddha to debate and whom the buddha predicted would become enlightened and appear in the world as buddhas, with variously arrayed buddha-lands, in various ages, with various names.

rigs kyi bu/ rgyal po gzhon nu rnam par rgyal ba de pha dang mas gnang nas sems can brtson ra ba de dag yongs su bkrol ba'i 'og tu srid shin tu bde ba dang / nor dang / dbyig rin po che phun sum tshogs ba dag kyang por/ bu dang chung ma dag kyang spangs nas bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa chos kyi 'khor lo'i sgra nam mkha'i sprin gyi sgron ma rgyal po'i zham 'bring du rab tu byung ngo/ /rab tu byung nas kyang lo stong phrag lngar tshangs par spyod pa spyad de/ de'i bar skabs su ting nge 'dzin gyi sgo stong phrag bcu yongs su bsgrubs so/ /gzungs kyi sgo stong phrag bcu'ang rab tu thob bo/ /mngon par shes pa'i tshul stong phrag bcu la'ang rab tu zhugs so/ /byang chub sems dpa'i gter stong phrag bcu'ang rab tu thob bo; ;thams cad mkhyen pa'i shugs stong phrag bcu'ang yongs su skyes so/ /bzod pa'i sgo stong phrag bcu'ang yongs su sbyangs so/ /sems nges par gzhag pa stong phrag bcu'ang mngon par bsgrubs so/ /byang chub sems dpa'i stobs kyi lus stong phrag bcu'ang yongs su spel to/ /byang chub sems dpa'i ye shes kyi sgo stong phrag bcur yang rab tu zhugs so/ /shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i tshul stong phrag bcu yang yongs su skyes so/ /sangs rgyas blta ba'i phyogs kyi sgo stong phrag bcu yang mngon du gyur to/ /byang chub sems dpa'i smon lam stong phrag bcu'ang mngon par bsgrubs so/ /de de lta bu'i chos dang ldan pas sems kyi skad cig re re la phyogs bcur sangs rgyas kyi zhing stong phrag bcu yongs su gnon to/ /'jig rten gyi khams re re zhing yang sems kyi skad cig re re la sangs rgyas stong phrag bcu sngon gyi mtha' dang phyi ma'i mthar rjes su dran no/ /de bzhin gshegs pa de dag gi sangs rgyas kyi sprul pa rgya mtsho stong phrag bcu phyogs bcur gshegs pa de dag kyang mthong zhing shes so/ /sems kyi skad cig re re la yang sangs rgyas kyi zhing stong phrag bcur gtogs pa'i sems can 'gro ba'i rgyud sna tshogs su skyes pa shi 'pho zhing skye bar gyur pa mtho ba dang / dma' ba dang / bde 'gro'i lam du phyin pa dang / ngan song gi lam du phyin pa dang / kha dog sdug pa dang / kha dog mi sdug pa las ci bzhin du skyes par gyur pa thams cad kyang mthong bar gyur to/ /sems can de dag gi shi 'pho dang skye ba yang khong du chud cing mthong ste/ sems kyi rgyud dang / sems kyi spyod pa dang / sems kyi 'dab 'brel ba dang / bsam pa sna tshogs dang / dbang po rgya mtsho dang / sbyor ba 'byams klas pa dang / las mthar thug pa dang / yongs su smin par bya ba dang / rnam par gdul ba'i dus kyang khong du chud cing mthong ngo/ /

“To continue, the prince, Conqueror, given permission by his parents, after having released the prisoners, gave up his great wealth and family and went to the buddha. For five thousand years thereafter he cultivated spiritual practice, during which time he perfected ten thousand concentration methods, attained ten thousand ways of mental command, entered into ten thousand channels of mystic knowledge, attained ten thousand great treasuries of enlightening beings, produced ten thousand currents of momentum toward omniscience, purified ten thousand facets of tolerance, carried out ten thousand contemplations, developed ten thousand bodies of power of enlightening beings, entered ten thousand doors of knowledge of enlightening beings, produced ten thousand ways to transcendent wisdom, became aware of ten thousand channels of conscious vision of thousands of buddhas, and accomplished ten thousand vows of enlightening beings. With these realizations, in each mental moment he went to ten thousand buddha-lands in the ten directions, and in each moment of thought remembered ten thousand buddhas past and future in each world; and he perceived ten thousand multitudes of emanations of those buddhas radiating throughout the ten directions. In each moment of thought he saw all the beings in ten thousand buddha-lands, passing away and coming to life in various states, undeveloped and developed, felicitous and miserable, of good and bad appearance, following their desires; and he understood the passing away and coming to life of those beings, as well as the revolving of their minds, the conduct of their minds, the continuity of their thoughts, the variety of their inclinations, the multitude of their faculties, the courses of their endeavors, their habits of action, and the proper timing to develop and guide them.

rigs kyi bu/ rgyal po gzhon nu de de nas shi 'phos nas kyang 'dzam bu'i gling de nyid du rgyal po'i gnas dga' ba dang ldan par rgyal po de nyid kyi rigs su skyes nas 'khor los bsgyur ba'i rgyal srid thob par gyur to/ /de 'khor los bsgyur ba'i rgyal por gyur pas bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa chos kyi 'khor lo'i sgra nam mkha'i sprin gyi sgron ma rgyal po yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa'i 'og tu de bzhin gshegs pa chos kyi nam mkha' la dpal shin tu 'phags pa'i rgyal po bsnyen bkur to/ /de'i 'og tu snying po byang chub de nyid du brgya byin du gyur te/ de bzhin gshegs pa lha dbang snying po zhes bya ba bsnyen bkur to/ /de'i 'og tu 'jig rten gyi khams de nyid du rab mtshe ma'i lha'i rgyal por gyur te/ de bzhin gshegs pa sa'i dpal ri bo'i gzi brjid ces bya ba bsnyen bkur to/ /de'i 'og tu 'jig rten gyi khams de nyid du rab dga' ldan gyi lha'i rgyal por gyur te/ de bzhin gshegs pa chos kyi 'khor lo'i 'od rab tu bsgrags pa'i rgyal po zhes bya ba bsnyen bkur to/ /de'i 'og tu 'jig rten gyi khams de nyid du rab 'phrul dga'i lha'i rgyal por gyur te/ de bzhin gshegs pa nam mkha' mdzes pa'i rgyal po zhes bya ba bsnyen bkur to/ /de'i 'og tu 'jig rten gyi khams de nyid du dbang bsgyur gyi lha'i rgyal por gyur te/ de bzhin gshegs pa stobs la thug pa med pa'i dpal zhes bya ba bsnyen bkur to/ /de'i 'og tu 'jig rten gyi khams de nyid du lha ma yin gyi dbang por gyur te/ de bzhin gshegs pa chos thams cad kyi 'brug sgra bsgrags pa'i rgyal po zhes bya ba bsnyen bkur to/ /de'i 'og tu 'jig rten gyi khams de nyid du tshangs pa'i dbang por gyur te/ de bzhin gshegs pa chos kyi 'khor lo sprul pa kun tu snang ba'i dbyangs zhes bya ba bsnyen bkur to/ /rigs kyi bu/ 'jig rten gyi khams rin chen 'od de nyid du bskal ba 'od bzang po de nyid la de bzhin gshegs pa de dag la sogs pa sangs rgyas stong phrag bcu byung ste/ de bzhin gshegs pa de dag thams cad kyang rgyal po gzhon nu rnam par rgyal bas bsnyen bkur to/ /

“Subsequently the prince passed away from there and was reborn in the same city Array of Delights, in the same royal family, and attained sovereign rulership. As the king, following the demise of the buddha-king Illumining Space with the Voice of Truth, he propitiated a buddha named Glorious King Risen in the Sky of Truth. After that, at that same enlightenment site, having become a chief god, he propitiated a buddha named Sanctuary of Celestial Rulers. After that, in the same world, having become a celestial chief of the heaven of timely portion, he propitiated a buddha named Fiery Energy of the Radiant Mountain of Mental Command. After that, having become a celestial chief of the heaven of satisfaction in the same world, he propitiated a buddha named King Proclaiming the Light of the Wheel of the Teaching. After that, having become a celestial chief of the heaven of good emanation in the same world, he propitiated a buddha named King Like the Moon in the Sky. After that, having become a celestial chief of the heaven of command of others’ emanations in the same world, he propitiated a buddha named Paragon of Indestructible Power. After that, having become a chief Brahma god in the same world, he propitiated a buddha called Sound of Projections of the Wheel of Teaching Reflected Everywhere. Beginning with these, ten thousand buddhas emerged in the age Beautiful Light in the world Jewel Light, all of whom were propitiated by the prince Conqueror.

rigs kyi bu/ bskal pa 'od bzang po de'i 'og tu bskal pa 'od zer bzang po zhes bya ba byung ste; bskal pa 'od zer bzang po de la yang sangs rgyas stong phrag bcu byung ngo/ /kho mo yang bskal pa de la rgyal po blo gros chen po zhes bya ba zhig tu gyur te/ de'i tshe kho mo rgyal por gyur pas de bzhin gshegs pa mtshan gyi dpal ri bo zhes bya ba bsnyen bkur to/ /de'i 'og tu bskal pa de nyid la khyim bdag cig tu gyur te/ de bzhin gshegs pa phung po yongs su grub pa zhes bya ba bsnyen bkur to/ /de'i 'og tu bskal pa de nyid la blon po zhig tu gyur te/ de bzhin gshegs pa dri ma med pa'i sras zhes bya ba bsnyen bkur to/ /de'i 'og tu bskal pa de nyid la lha ma yin gyi dbang po zhig tu gyur te/ de bzhin gshegs pa shugs mnga' ba zhes bya ba bsnyen bkur to/ /de'i 'og tu bskal pa de nyid la shing gi lha mo zhig tu gyur te/ de bzhin gshegs pa mtshan nyid ri rab ces bya ba bsnyen bkur to/ /de'i 'og tu bskal pa de gnyis la ded dpon cig tu gyur te /de bzhin gshegs pa phyag dri ma med pa zhes bya ba bsnyen bkur to/ /de'i 'og tu bskal pa de nyid la grong khyer gyi lha mo zhig tu gyur te/ de bzhin gshegs pa seng+ge rnam par gnon pas bzhud pa zhes bya ba bsnyen bkur to/ /de'i 'og tu bskal pa de nyid la ngal bso bo zhig tu gyur te/ de bzhin gshegs pa lha dbang gtsug phud ces bya ba bsnyen bkur to; ;de'i 'og tu bskal pa de nyid la dri za'i rgyal po zhig tu gyur te/ de bzhin gshegs pa grags pa chos kyis 'phags pa zhes bya ba bsnyen bkur to/ /de'i 'og tu bskal pa de nyid la grul bum gyi dbang po zhig tu gyur te/ de bzhin gshegs pa snang ba'i cod pa na zhes bya ba bsnyen bkur to/ /

“Following that age Beautiful Light was an age called Subtle Light; in that age I was a king called Great Wisdom. As a king, I propitiated a buddha named Glorious Mountain of Marks of Greatness. Next, in the same age, as a householder I propitiated a Buddha named Restrained in Body and Mind. Next, in the same age, as a government minister, I propitiated a buddha named Undefiled Child. Next, in the same age, as a titan chief, I propitiated a buddha named Holder of Energy. Next, in the same age, as a tree spirit, I propitiated a buddha named Polar Mountain of Marks of Greatness. Next, in the same age, as a caravan leader, I propitiated a buddha named Undefiled Arms. Next, in the same age, as a city spirit, I propitiated a buddha named Walking Boldly As a Lion. Next, in the same age, as a god of riches, I propitiated a buddha named Crown of the Lord of Gods. Next, in the same age, as a celestial musician, I propitiated a buddha named Spiritual Renown. Next, in the same age, as a goblin chief, I propitiated a buddha named Crown of Light.

rigs kyi bu de ltar kho mos de bzhin gshegs pa bcu po de dag la sogs pa bskal pa 'od zer bzang po de la skye ba'i rigs sna tshogs su skyes nas de bzhin gshegs pa bye ba phrag drug cu bsnyen bkur te/ kho mos de bzhin gshegs pa de dag thams cad la mchod pa byas so/ /de bzhin gshegs pa re re'i sbyan sngar 'gro ba'i tshe yang sems can gyi khams mtha' dang dbus med pa/ bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su smin par byas so/ /de bzhin gshegs pa re re'i sbyan sngar 'gro ba'i tshe yang ting nge 'dzin gyi sgo sna tshogs rab tu thob par gyur to/ /gzungs kyi sgo sna tshogs dang / mngon par sgrub pa'i tshul sna tshogs dang / tha dad pa yang dag par shes pa mngon par sgrub pa'i tshul sna tshogs dang / thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi tshul rjes su rtogs par bya ba sna tshogs dang / chos snang ba'i sgo thob par bya ba'i tshul sna tshogs dang / ye shes kyi tshul khong du chud par dpyad pa rnams pa sna tshogs dang / phyogs rgya mtsho la 'jug pa'i snang ba sna tshogs dang / zhing rgya mtsho sna tshogs la 'jug cing khong du chud par bya ba'i snang ba sna tshogs dang / de bzhin gshegs pa rgya mtsho mthong bar bya ba rnam par dmigs pa'i snang ba sna tshogs kyang rab tu thob pa/ /yongs su non to/ /rnam par dag go /yongs su rdzogs so/ /yongs su gnas par gyur to/ /skyes so/ /byung ngo/ /rnam par 'phel to/ /yongs su 'phel to/ /rab tu byung ngo// rnam par byung ngo/ /

“In this way, I propitiated sixty million buddhas in the age of subtle light, beginning with these ten. I honored and served those buddhas in various forms of existence, and as I went to each buddha I matured countless beings for supreme perfect enlightenment. And as I went to each buddha I attained various concentrations, various mental commands, various accomplishments, various types of specialized knowledge, various perspectives on truth, various operations of knowledge, various perceptions of the totality of realms, various awarenesses of the totality of lands, various perceptions of the totality of visions of Buddha; all these I entered into, purified, enlarged, and devoted my attention to from start to finish.

bskal pa 'od zer bzang po de la de bzhin gshegs pa rnams ji ltar rim gror byas pa de bzhin du bskal pa 'jig rten gyi khams rgya mtsho thams cad kyi rdul shin tu phra ba snyed du de bzhin gshegs pa ji snyed cig byung bar gyur pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa ji snyed cig 'jig rten gyi khams gzhan nas de dag tu byon te chos bstan par gyur pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa de dag thams cad las kyang kho mos chos bstan pa thos te/ thos nas kyang yongs su bzung ngo/ /de bzhin gshegs pa de dag thams cad kyang kho mos bsnyen bkur to/ /rim gror byas so/ /sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag gi bstan pa yang kho mos yongs su bzung ngo/ /de bzhin gshegs pa de dag thams cad las kyang kho mos byang chub sems dpa'i rnam par thar pa sems can thams cad yongs su smin par bya bas bsam pa ji lta ba bzhin du dge ba'i rtsa ba la yang dag par skul ba 'di thob par bya ba'i tshul sna tshogs dang / rnam par thar pa'i tshul gyi sgo sna tshogs kyis thob par gyur to/ /

“And just as I propitiated the buddhas in the age of Subtle Light, so did I propitiate all the buddhas who arose in as many eons as atoms in all oceans of worlds and came from other worlds and taught, and I listened to their teaching and remembered it. I have retained all their teachings, and from all of those buddhas I got this enlightening liberation born of roots of goodness aiding the development of all beings according to their mentalities, by various means of attainment and by various ways of liberation.”

de nas mtshan mo'i lha mo 'gro ba thams cad srung ba'i smon lam la brtson pa'i 'od kyis de'i tshe rnam par thar pa'i tshul 'di nyid yongs su brjod pa dang / yongs su bstan pa'i phyir tshong dpon gyi bu nor bzang la tshigs su bcad de smras pa/
Then the night goddess spoke these verses to Sudhana elucidating this liberation:

bsam gyis mi khyab rnam thar dam pa 'di/ / grags pa khyod kyis bdag la gang dris pa/ / bde bar gshegs pa'i byin gyis de bstan gyi/ / ma lus yang dag ji bzhin bdag la nyon/ /
bskal pa bsam yas yangs pa mtha' yas pa/ / rgya mtsho'i zhing gi rdul dang grangs mnyam pa/ / de kun 'das pa'i snga rol mdangs dga' ba'i/ / 'jig rten khams shig byung ba rin chen 'od/ /
de tshe bskal pa bzang po'i 'od kyang byung / / de la rgyal ba dpag tu med pa skyes/ / thub pa'i dbang po de dag kho mo yis/ / rnam thar 'di la sgom zhing bsnyen bkur to/ /
rgyal po'i gnas rab yangs shing bzang byung ba/ / de yi ming ni dga' bas brgyan pa ste/ / de tshe sems can rnam par ma dag sems/ / mi bzang ngan du spyod pa der byung gyur/ /
der ni rgyal po rgyal ba'i 'od byung ste/ / sems can de dag chos kyis bskyang ba byas/ / de yi bu ni rnam par rgyal ba ste/ / mdzes shing mtshan gyis yan lag brgyan pa po/ /
g.yon ldan stong phrag mang po de dag kyang / / de tshe rgyal pos gsad par byas mthong nas/ / bzhon nu snying brtse mi dga' kun nas 'khor/ / myur du dgye bar rgyal po de la gsol/ /
rgyal pos thos nas de tshe blon po rnams/ / ma lus kun bsdus de la bka' stsal nas/ / kun gyis de la phyag byas phyir gsol pa/ / de ni rgyal po khyod dgrongs thabs cig lags/ /
rgyal po de ltar log par thugs bcug nas/ / sras de gsad par de tshe byas gyur kyang / / bdag srog phangs par ma brtsis ngo zum med/ / rgyal po'i sras kyis gsad par byas ma btang / /
gsad par byas pa de yi mas thos nas/ / rgyal po de la 'khor bcas gsol ba 'debs/ / dgung zla phyed cig sbyin pa ma lus par/ / 'jig rten stsol du gzhon nu gtang bar gnong / /
rgyal po des kyang de ltar gnang gyur nas/ / des ni ci 'dod sbyin pa yongs su btang / / zla ba phyed du nyin mtshan sbyin byas nas/ / nyi ma'i tha mar tshogs par gyur pa yi/ /
zhags pa thub pa gang rnams ci 'dod pa/ / de la de byin 'chi bar sta gon gnas/ / rgyal po'i gnas der 'gro ba mang po dag / cho der du zhing kun kyang 'dus par gyur/ /
byang chub shing drung bde gshegs de yi tshe/ / dam chos dbyangs mchog sgron ma'i rgyal zhugs pas/ / 'gro ba'i dbang po smin par thugs chud nas/ / mchod sbyin ra bar thugs rje chen pos byon; ;
de bzhin gshegs pa'i rnam 'phrul rnam phye bas/ / de yi 'khor du bde gshegs byon gyur nas/ / chos kyi sgron ma'i sprin gyi sgra sgrog pa'i/ / mdo sde rgyal po bde bar gshegs pas bshad/ /
'gro ba mtha' dang dbus med rnam btul nas/ / de tshe byang chub mchog tu lung yang bstan/ / rgyal ba'i sras po rnam par rgyal ba yang / / shin tu dga' bas byang chub mchog tu zhugs/ /
bde gshegs bsnyen bkur mchod pa rnam yangs pas/ / de la mchod byas dga' bar smras pa ni/ / 'gro ba rnam 'dul skyabs su bdag 'gyur bgyi/ / mgon dang gnas dang dpung du'ang de bzhin zhes/ /
rgyal ba de yi zham ring thar par zhugs/ / yang dag byang chub lam ni yongs tshol zhing / / chos kyi rang bzhin rab tu brtag bya bas/ / der gnas bskal pa brgya phrag mang du spyad/ /
sdug bsngal rgya mtshor lhung zhing ldongs gyur pa'i/ / 'gro ba mgon med kun la snying brtse bas/ / yang dag byang chub lam la yongs bsgoms nas/ / de tshe de yis rnam thar 'di thob bo/ /
bskal pa de la bde gshegs gang byung ba/ / de dag kun la'ang dga' bas bsnyen bkur nas/ / de dag kun la mchod pa chen po byas/ / chos kyi 'khor lo yongs su bzung bar gyur/ /
de yi 'og tu bskal pa rgya mtsho rnams; ; zhing mang rgya mtsho'i rdul snyed kun la yang / / rgyal ba ji snyed skyes par gyur pa dag / rab tu mchod cing de dag bsnyen bkur byas/ /
rnam par rgyal zhes bya ba kho mo yin/ / nyam nga btson rar gnas pa'i btson mthong nas/ / de dag dgrol phyir lus kyang yongs su btang / / rnam thar 'di yang de tshe thob par gyur/ /
zhing rnams rgya mtsho'i rdul phran rab bgrangs pa'i/ / bskal pa rgya mtsho mang po bsgoms par byas/ / tshul mang mtha' dang dbus med mnyam med pas/ / skad cig re re dag tu rnam par spel; ;
thub pa'i bdag po ji snyed mthong gyur pa/ / de dag spyan sngar sngon chad 'di thob ste/ / sgo tshul rnam pa gzhan dang gzhan dag gis/ / de dag gis ni rnam thar 'di yang bstan/ /
de dag rnam thar ma nor bsam yas la/ / bskal pa bye ba mang por kho mos bslab/ / de la rgyal bas bkod cing grol gyur pa/ / de dag dam chos sprin las gcig car 'thung / /
phyogs bcu kun gyi zhing rnams thams cad du/ / thogs pa med par lus kyis rgyas par 'gengs/ / skad cig re rer zhing rgyud bsam yas pa'i/ / dus gsum rgyud rnams kun la'ang rab tu 'jug /
dus gsum rgyal ba rgya mtsho ma lus pa/ / re re kun la'ang mngon du rab tu lta/ / de dag lus kyi gzugs brnyan rgyal ba la/ / sprin du gyur pa rnams kyang spyan sngar 'grim/ /
phyogs rnams kun tu nye bar phyin 'dong zhing / / rgyal ba'i spyan sngar 'dong bas shin tu mdzes/ / rgyan rnams ma lus mngon par char 'bebs shing / / rgyal ba rnams la de dag mchod pa byed/ /
sangs rgyas rgya mtsho che la rnam yangs pa'i/ / zhu ba mtha' yas kun kyang zhu ba byed/ / rgyal ba'i chos sprin mngon par char 'bab pa/ / kun kyang ma lus yongs su 'dzin pa byed/ /
phyogs bcu ma lus kun tu de dag 'dong / / rgyal ba'i dkyil 'khor kun gyi spyan sngar 'bab/ / gzugs mang rnam pa sna tshogs bstan gnas shing / / rnam 'phrul sna tshogs nye bar ston par byed/ /
kha dog mtha' yas rang gi lus gzugs kyis/ / phyogs rnams thams cad rnam pa stong du 'gengs/ / de dag lus gcig las kyang gzugs kyi rnams/ / mtha' dang dbus med rnam par ston par byed/ /
ba spu re re'i sgo nas grangs med pa'i/ / 'od zer mang po rgya mtsho de dag 'gyed/ / skye rgu'i nyon mongs me yi gdung pa dag / sna tshogs thabs kyis rab tu zhi bar byed/ /
'di la gnas pa lus sprul sprin mang ba/ / ba spu re re'i sgo nas 'gyed byed cing / / ngo mtshar rmad kyis phyogs kun rgyas bkang nas/ / chos chu'i char gyis sems can rnam par 'dul/ /
tshul 'jug 'di ni bsam gyis mi khyab gzugs/ / rgyal sras kun gyi gnas su gyur pa ste/ / de la gnas shing phyi mtha'i bskal par yang / / zhing rnams kun tu spyad pa rab tu spyod/ /
bsam pa ji bzhin chos rnams ston byed cing / / de dag lta ba'i dra ba rnam par zlog / mtho ris mya ngan 'das la sems can 'god/ / thams cad mkhyen pa'i sa yang rnam par ston/ /
'jig rten skye gnas thams cad ma lus par/ / kha dog mtha' yas lus mang bsam yas pa; ; bsam pa bzhin du chos rnams rjod byed de/ / de dag sems can kun gyi gzugs brnyan gzugs/ /
'di dang gzhan dag tshad las 'das pa yi/ / yon tan rgya mtsho zhing mang rgya mtsho yi/ / rdul phran rab snyed bsam gyis mi khyab pa/ / rnam thar zhi ba 'di ldan thob par gyur/ /

This supreme liberation is inconceivable; Resolute, you ask me about it.
Listen as I tell you all, By the power of the Buddha.
Endless, vast, inconceivable eons ago, Countless worlds away, There was a pleasant world Called Jewel Light.
There was an age called Beautiful Light In which numberless buddhas emerged; I propitiated those supreme sages As I cultivated this liberation.
There was a great and glorious metropolis there Called Array of Delights In which there lived both Pure-minded people and evildoers.
The king there was Victorious Light, Who ruled his people justly; His son was called Conqueror, A fine man with the marks of greatness.
Thousands of offenders had been Condemned to death by the king; Seeing them, the prince was seized with compassion And asked the king to release them.
Hearing this, the king called his ministers And told them all about it: They all said, bowing to the king, “He is out to destroy you.” Incited by the ministers, the king Hastened to kill the prince.
Undismayed, indifferent to his own death, The prince did not abandon the convicts.
Grieved to hear the prince was condemned, The queen and the palace ladies asked the king To free the prince for a fortnight To give all kinds of gifts to the people.
Granted permission by the king, the prince Made gifts of all that was asked for, Day and night, for half a month, Giving charity to all who came.
Whatever the needy required, That he gave them, prepared for death; The whole population of the city came out, Lamenting the fate of the prince.
Then the buddha at the enlightenment tree, Illumining Space with the Voice of Truth, Realizing people’s faculties were ripe, Went to that sacrificial ground out of compassion.
Going there, the buddha Produced a miraculous display And expounded a scripture, The voice of the Teaching as myriad lamps of truth.
Countless people were edified, And the buddha foretold their enlightenment; The prince Conqueror, enraptured, Set out for supreme enlightenment.
The prince gave the buddha Many offerings and joyfully said, “May I become a guide, savior, refuge, And resort for the people of the land.” He left home to join the buddha, Seeking the path of perfect enlightenment; He spent hundreds of eons Thoroughly investigating the essence of thing.
Pitying all the helpless ones Fallen into the sea of suffering, Having cultivated the path of enlightenment, He attained this liberation.
All the buddhas in that age He propitiated with pure faith; He made great offerings to them And kept their teachings in mind.
After that, for eons numerous As atoms in oceans of lands, He propitiated and made offerings to All the buddhas that arose.
I was the prince Conqueror, Who, seeing people imprisoned, Gave up my body to free them And thus attained this liberation.
I cultivated it for eons as many As atoms in oceans of lands, Expanding it moment by moment Through endless incomparable means.
From all the buddhas I saw I gained some realization And was shown this liberation By a succession of means.
From them I learned the inconceivable Reality of liberation over countless eons, Imbibing all at once the multitude of teaching Projected by the buddhas when established therein.
Those established therein Go everywhere without attachment, Instantly comprehending the countless Names and groups of past, present, and future.
They appear before all the multitudes Of buddhas of all times, Manifesting themselves in the presence Of those buddhas as reflected images.
They go everywhere and appear Before all the buddhas, Showering all kinds of ornaments As offerings to the buddhas.
Then they ask the myriads of buddhas Multitudes of questions And remember the infinite teachings Poured forth by the buddhas.
They go to the circles of buddhas everywhere, As far as they can see, Sitting on seats of many forms, Manifesting various miracles.
With bodies of infinite appearances, They fill all realms, by the thousands; They show an endless, endless variety of forms, And all those forms in one.
From each pore they emanate countless Multitudes of light rays And extinguish the fire of afflictions Of all beings by various means.
In this state, emanating myriad projected bodies From each and every pore, They pervade all realms with them And guide beings with rain from the ocean of truth.
This way of enlightenment, with inconceivable forms, Is the resort of all enlightening beings; Based on this they carry out practices In all lands for all time.
Expounding the Teaching according to mentalities, They remove the web of views; Dwelling in ultimate felicity, They show people the stage of omniscience.
With inconceivably many bodies of endless forms In all states of existence, They teach according to mentality, Their forms reflections of all beings.
So many and infinitely more, As inconceivably many as atoms in all lands, Are the oceans of manifestations of the fearless ones When they have attained this peaceful liberation.

rigs kyi bu/ kho mos byang chub sems dpa'i rnam par thar pa sems can thams cad yongs su smin par bya bas bsam pa ji lta ba bzhin du dge ba'i rtsa ba la yang dag par skul ba 'di shes par zad na/ kho mos byang chub sems dpa' 'jig rten thams cad kyi lam gyi rgyud las 'das pa/ 'jig rten gyi skye gnas thams cad du gzugs brnyan rab tu 'byung ba/ 'jig rten gyi shes pa thams cad las yang dag par 'das pa/ shes bya'i sgrib pa thams cad kyi ri rnam par 'thor ba la brtson pa/ chos thams cad kyi rang bzhin dang mtshan nyid rab tu rtogs pa/ nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa dang / mun pa thams cad rnam par sel ba la brtson pa/ chos thams cad rab tu dpyad pas mngon par sgrub pa la mkhas pa/ bdag med pa'i chos mngon du gyur pa/ sems can thams cad yongs su smin par bya ba dang / gdul ba rgyun mi gcod pa / chos kyi dbyings kyi tshul gnyis su med par rab tu rtogs pa dag gi lam gyi tshul rgya mtsho thams cad kyi rjes su 'brang ba'i blo dang ldan pa de dag gi spyod pa shes pa'am/ yon tan rgya mtsho la 'jug pa'am/ ye shes kyis rnam par gnon pa yongs su shes par bya ba'am/ sems kyi gnas khong du chud par bya ba'am/ ting nge 'dzin la dbang sgyur ba rtogs par bya ba'am/ rnam par thar pas rnam par 'phrul pa yongs su shes par bya bar nus re skan/

The goddess continued, “I know only this enlightening liberation born of roots of goodness fostering the development of all beings according to their mentalities. How can I know the practice, or comprehend the oceans of virtues, or completely know the power of knowledge, or know the realm of thought, or understand the mastery of concentration, or recognize the miracle of liberation, of the enlightening beings who have transcended all worldly courses, who appear as reflections in all states of being, who are intent on shattering the mountains of barriers to omniscience, who know the nature and characteristics of all things, who are engaged in dispelling the darkness of all barriers caused by afflictions, who are skilled in carrying out a thorough investigation of all things, who actually realize the knowledge of selflessness, who ceaselessly develop and guide all sentient beings, who really know the principle of the nondual reality realm, whose intellects encompass the ocean of all manners of verbal expression?

song rigs kyi bu/ 'dzam bu'i gling 'di nyid kyi lum+bi ni'i nags tshal na lum+bi ni'i nags tshal gyi lha mo gzi brjid kyi dkyil 'khor bzang pos dga' ba'i dpal zhes bya ba 'dug gi /de'i gan du song la ji ltar na/ byang chub sems dpa' de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs su byung ba yin pa dang / ji ltar na/ 'jig rten rnams la snang ba byed par 'gyur ba dang / ji ltar na/ phyi ma'i mtha'i bskal pa'i mur thug par byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa spyad pas mi skyo bar 'gyur ba dris shig /

“In the Lumbini grove, here on Jambudvipa, there lives a goddess of the Lumbini grove named Sutejomandalaratishri. Go ask her how enlightening beings are born in the family of buddhas, how they become light-makers for the world, and how they carry on the practice of enlightening beings forever without wearying.”

de nas tshong dpon gyi bu nor bzang gis mtshan mo'i lha mo 'gro ba thams cad srung ba'i smon lam la brtson pa'i 'od kyi rkang pa gnyis la spyi bos phyag 'tshal te mtshan mo'i lha mo 'gro ba thams cad srung ba'i smon lam la brtson pa'i 'od la lan brgya stong du mar g.yas phyogs su bskor ba byas nas thal mo sbyar te phyir lta zhing mtshan mo'i lha mo 'gro ba thams cad srung ba'i smon lam la brtson pa'i 'od kyi drung nas song ngo/ /
Then Sudhana paid his respects to the night goddess Sarvajagadrak-shapranidhanaviryaprabha and left.
shin tu rgyas pa chen po'i mdo/ /sangs rgyas phal po che zhes bya ba las/ sdong pos brgyan pa'i le'u ste/ bam po brgya drug pa/

drop.crumb: gzi brjid kyi dkyil 'khor bzang pos dga' ba'i dpal

fuse.drop: [lum+bi ni'i nags tshal gyi lha mo gzi brjid kyi dkyil 'khor bzang pos dga' ba'i dpal]
Sutejomandalaratishri

de nas tshong dpon gyi bu nor bzang mtshan mo'i lha mo 'gro ba thams cad srung ba'i smon lam la brtson pa'i 'od kyi gdams ngag de rjes su dran par byed cing / byang chub sems dpa'i rnam par thar pa sems can thams cad yongs su smin par bya bas bsam pa ji lta ba bzhin du dge ba'i rtsa ba la yang dag par skul ba de la yongs su sgom pa dang / khong du chud par bya ba dang / rgya cher byed cing mthar gyis lum+bi ni'i nags tshal gang na ba der phyin te lum+bi ni'i nags tshal la g.yas phyogs su bskor ba byas nas lum+bi ni'i nags tshal gyi lha mo gzi brjid kyi dkyil 'khor bzang pos dga' ba'i dpal yongs su tshol tshol ba las/ lum+bi ni'i nags tshal gyi lha mo gzi brjid kyi dkyil 'khor bzang pos dga' ba'i dpal lum+bi ni'i nags tshal na rin po che'i shing gi yal ga thams cad kyi dkyil 'khor gyi khyim brtsegs pa zhig na seng+ge'i khri rin po che'i pad+mo'i snying po can zhig la 'dug cing nags tshal gyi lha mo khrag khrig brgya stong phrag nyi shu'i 'khor gyis kun nas bskor te mdun du byas nas chos ston te/ byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyi skye ba rgya mtsho shin tu bstan pa zhes bya ba'i mdo sde yongs su ston cing / de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs kyi rgyud du rigs dang ldan par skyes pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi yon tan rgya mtsho'i shugs rnam par 'phel bar byed cing 'dug pa mthong nas lum+bi ni'i nags tshal gyi lha mo gzi brjid kyi dkyil 'khor bzang pos dga' ba'i dpal gang na ba der song ste phyin nas lum+bi ni'i nags tshal gyi lha mo gzi brjid kyi dkyil 'khor bzang pos dga' ba'i dpal gyi rkang pa gnyis la spyi bos phyag 'tshal nas mdun du 'dug ste thal mo sbyar nas 'di skad ces smras so/ /'phags ma/ bdag gis bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed na/ ji ltar na/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs su byung ba lags pa'ang ma 'tshal/ ji ltar na/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams spyod pa la spyod cing sems can rnams la snang ba 'byin par 'gyur ba'ang ma 'tshal to/ /de skad ces smras pa dang /

Remembering the instruction of the night goddess Sarvajagadrak-shapranidhanaviryaprabha, cultivating and extending the enlightening liberation born of roots of goodness fostering the development of all beings according to their mentalities, Sudhana made his way to the Lumbini grove. When he got to the Lumbini grove he circled it, looking for the goddess Sutejomandalaratishri. Finally he saw her sitting on a jewel lotus calyx lion seat in a tower made of encircling branches of trees of all jewels in the Lumbini grove, surrounded by twenty million billion wood goddesses, teaching them, expounding to them a scripture called Exposition of the Ocean of Lives of All Enlightening Beings, born in the family of buddhas, increasing the flood of the ocean of virtues of enlightening beings. Seeing the goddess, Sudhana went up to her, paid his respects, and said, “I have set my mind on supreme perfect enlightenment, but I do not know how enlightening beings get to be born in the family of buddhas, or how, carrying out the practice of enlightening beings, they become light-makers for sentient beings.”

lum+bi ni'i nags tshal gyi lha mo gzi brjid kyi dkyil 'khor bzang pos dga' ba'i dpal gyis tshong dpon gyi bu nor bzang la 'di skad ces smras so/ /rigs kyi bu/ bcu po 'di dag ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi skye ba ste/ de dag dang ldan na/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs su skyes pa yin no/ /de dag las byung na; byang chub sems dpa' rnams sems kyi skad cig re re la'ang byang chub sems dpa'i dge ba'i rtsa bas rnam par 'phel bar 'gyur te/ thogs pa med pa dang / zhum pa med pa dang / phyir ldog pa med pa dang / rgyun gcod pa med pa dang / yongs su skyo ba med pa dang / sgyid lug par 'gyur ba med pa dang / nyams par 'gyur ba med pa dang / nyams dma' bar 'gyur ba med pa dang / yongs su yi chad par 'gyur ba med pa dang / chud za bar 'gyur ba med pa dang / thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi phyogs kyi rjes su 'brang bar 'gyur ba dang / chos kyi dbyings kyi tshul la yongs su gzhol bar 'gyur ba dang / sangs rgyas kyi byang chub tu yongs su smin pa thob par 'gyur ba dang / byang chub sems dpa' sems bskyed pa shin tu yangs par 'gyur ba dang / pha rol tu phyin pa thams cad kyis rnam par 'phel bar 'gyur ba dang / 'jig rten gyi lam rgyud thams cad las rnam par ldog par 'gyur ba dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i sar yongs su grub par 'gyur ba dang / ye shes kyis mngon par shes pa shin tu byang bar 'gyur ba dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos mngon du 'gyur pa dang / thams cad mkhyen pa'i yul gyi don dang ldan par 'gyur ba'o/ /

The goddess replied, “There are ten kinds of birth by which enlightening beings become born in the family of buddhas. Enlightening beings who have accomplished these develop correctly by means of the skills of enlightening beings, without stopping, without becoming exhausted, without regressing, without giving up, without wearying, without becoming discouraged, without becoming confused, without tarrying, without becoming afraid, without waning away. They follow the way to omniscience and remember the principle of the realm of reality; they become ripe for the enlightenment of buddhas and broaden the determination for enlightenment. They grow by means of all the transcendent ways, they withdraw from all worldly ways, and progress into the stage of those who realize Thusness. They refine mystic knowledge, become aware of all principles of enlightenment, and accord with the realm of omniscience.

bcu gang zhe na/ 'di lta ste/ sangs rgyas thams cad la bsnyen bkur ba'i smon lam gyi sbyor ba'i snying po zhes bya ba ni/ byang chub sems dpa'i skye ba dang po'o/ /byang chub kyi sems kyi yan lag yongs su grub par 'gyur ba 'byung ba'i snying po zhes bya ba ni/ byang chub sems dpa'i skye ba gnyis pa'o/ /chos kyi tshul la nges par rtogs par gzhag pa'i sbyor ba'i tshul mngon du gyur pa 'byung ba'i snying po zhes bya ba ni/ byang chub sems dpa'i skye ba gsum pa'o; ;dus gsum snang bar bya ba'i lhag pa'i bsam pa rnam par dag pa'i snying po zhes bya ba ni/ byang chub sems dpa'i skye ba bzhi pa'o/ /kun nas snang ba'i 'od kyi snying po zhes bya ba ni/ byang chub sems dpa'i skye ba lnga pa'o/ /de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs kyi rgyud du 'byung ba'i snying po zhes bya ba ni/ byang chub sems dpa'i skye ba drug pa'o/ /de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi stobs kyi 'od snang ba'i rgyan gyi snying po zhes bya ba ni/ byang chub sems dpa'i skye ba bdun pa'o/ /ye shes kyi sgo kun nas rnam par spyad pas yongs su 'grub pa 'byung ba'i snying po zhes bya ba ni; byang chub sems dpa'i skye ba brgyad pa'o/ /chos kyi dbyings sprul pas brgyan pa bye ba'i snying po zhes bya ba ni/ byang chub sems dpa'i skye ba dgu pa'o/ /de bzhin gshegs pa'i sa yongs su gnon pa'i shugs drag po'i snying po zhes bya ba ni/ byang chub sems dpa'i skye ba bcu pa'o/ /

What are these ten kinds of birth of enlightening beings? The first is called the birth of enlightening beings as offspring of the undertaking of the vow to serve all buddhas. The second is the birth of enlightening beings as offspring of consummation of all elements of the determination for enlightenment. The third is the birth of enlightening beings as offspring of meditation on the principles of the Teaching. The fourth is the birth of enlightening beings as offspring of purification of the intent in viewing past, present, and future. The fifth is the birth of enlightening beings as offspring of the light of universal awareness. The sixth is the birth as enlightening beings as offspring of the family of all buddhas. The seventh is the birth of enlightening beings as offspring of the array of lights of the manifestation of powers of buddhas. The eighth is the birth of enlightening beings as offspring of consummation of contemplation of the way to omniscience. The ninth is the birth of enlightening beings as offspring of manifestation of emanations throughout the cosmos. The tenth is the birth of enlightening beings as offspring of momentum going into the stage of the enlightened.

rigs kyi bu/ de la byang chub sems dpa'i skye ba dang po sangs rgyas thams cad la bsnyen bkur ba'i smon lam gyi sbyor ba'i snying po zhes bya ba gang zhe na/ rigs kyi bu/ 'di la byang chub sems dpa' thog mar sangs rgyas mchod cing rim gror bya ba la 'jug ste/ de sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams la rim gro dang / bkur sti dang / bsti stang dang / mchod pa byed cing bsnyen bkur byed de dgyes par byed la thugs byung bar mi byed pas de bzhin gshegs pa'i zhal blta bas mi doms pa/ sangs rgyas la rim gro bya bar brtson pa/ sangs rgyas la dga' ba'i shugs kyis rnam par spel ba'i shugs dang ldan pa; de bzhin gshegs pa mthong bas mos pa'i shugs drag po yongs su skyes pa de phyir mi ldog pa'i dad pas bsod nams yongs su sdud pa'i tshe de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad la mchod pa'i tshogs yongs su bsdu ba la brtson zhing sbyor ba rgyun mi gcod pa yin te/ rigs kyi bu/ de ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi skye ba dang po sangs rgyas thams cad la bsnyen bkur ba'i smon lam gyi sbyor ba'i snying po zhes bya ba ste/ thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi tshogs dge ba'i rtsa ba yongs su 'grub par yang dag par sdud par 'gyur ba'o/ /

“What is the first birth of enlightening beings, as offspring of the undertaking of the vow to serve all buddhas? Here the enlightening beings, honoring, respecting, serving, attending, and pleasing all buddhas just as when they first made offerings in service of a buddha, never tire of seeing the enlightened; their minds expanded by floods of joy from the buddhas they honor, they are flooded with well-being by the sight of buddhas. Gaining virtue with unwavering faith, tireless, they ceaselessly work to bring offerings to all buddhas. This is enlightening beings’ first kind of birth, as offspring of the undertaking of the vow to serve all buddhas, which is conducive to the production and acquisition of roots of goodness in preparation for omniscience.

rigs kyi bu/ de la byang chub sems dpa'i skye ba gnyis pa byang chub kyi yan lag yongs su grub par 'gyur ba 'byung ba'i snying po zhes bya ba gang zhe na/ rigs kyi bu/ 'di la byang chub sems dpa' bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed de/ 'di ltar sems can thams cad yongs su bskyab pa'i phyir snying rje chen po'i sems dang / shin tu dgyes par bya ba'i phyir sangs rgyas thams cad bsnyen bkur ba'i sems dang / dngos po thams cad la phangs par mi brtsi ba'i phyir sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad yongs su btsal ba'i sems dang / thams cad mkhyen pa nyid mngon du 'gyur bar bya ba'i phyir bshams pa chen po'i sems dang / 'gro ba thams cad yongs su bsdu ba'i sbyor bas rgyas par dgang ba'i phyir byams pa chen po'i sems dang / thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi go cha bstan par bya ba'i phyir 'gro ba thams cad yongs su mi gtong ba'i sems dang / yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du shes pa'i snang ba rab tu thob par bya ba'i phyir g.yo dang sgyu med pa'i sems dang / byang chub sems dpa'i lam lan nan tan du bya ba'i phyir kha 'og tu lus khrus pa'i sems dang / de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi smon lam dang mi 'gal bar bya ba'i phyir sangs rgyas thams cad la sku bslu ba med pa'i sems dang / phyi ma'i mtha'i mur thug par sems can thams cad yongs su smin par bya ba dang gdul ba rgyun mi gcad pa'i phyir thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du smon lam chen po 'debs pa'i sems dang / de dag la sogs pa byang chub sems kyi yan lag gi tshogs sangs rgyas kyi zhing gi rdul shin tu phra ba snyed kyis yongs su rdzogs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni/ de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs su skyes pa yin te/ rigs kyi bu/ de ni/ byang chub sems dpa'i skye ba gnyis pa byang chub kyi sems kyi yan lag yongs su grub par 'gyur ba 'byung ba'i snying po zhes bya ba'o/ /

“What is enlightening beings’ birth as offspring of consummation of all elements of the determination for enlightenment? Here enlightening beings arouse the will for supreme perfect enlightenment: that involves the will of great compassion to save all beings; the will to please all buddhas ultimately; the will to seek all ways of enlightenment, to be equanimous toward all things; the will for the greatest of undertakings, to head for omniscience; the will of great kindness, to treat all beings with care; the will not to abandon any beings, to be firmly equipped for omniscience; the will to avoid deceit and falsehood, to attain the light of truthful knowledge; the will to act in accord with one’s speech, to carry out the path of enlightening beings; the will not to disappoint the buddhas, to keep the vows of all buddhas; the will for the great undertaking of omniscience, to ceaselessly guide and perfect all beings that will ever be. When enlightening beings have fulfilled as many such elements of the determination for enlightenment as atoms in a buddha-land, then they are born in the family of buddhas.

rigs kyi bu/ de la byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi byang chub sems dpa'i skye ba gsum pa chos kyi tshul la nges par gzhag pa'i sbyor ba'i tshul mngon du gyur pa 'byung ba'i snying po zhes bya ba gang zhe na/ rigs kyi bu/ 'di la byang chub sems dpa' chos thams cad kyi tshul rgya mtsho yod do cog nges par rtogs pas mngon du bya ba'i sems dang ldan pa/ thams cad mkhyen pa'i lam gyi rnam pa yongs su rdzogs par bya bas mngon du bya bar gcig tu sems pa'i sems dang ldan pa; kha na ma tho ba med pa'i las la yang dag par spyad par sems pa'i sems dang ldan pa/ byang chub sems dpa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi tshul rgya mtsho thams cad yongs su dag par bya bas mngon du bya ba'i sems dang ldan pa/ byang chub sems dpa'i yon tan thams cad la nan tan du bya bas yongs su grub par bya ba'i sems dang ldan pa/ byang chub sems dpa'i lam gyi rgyan thams cad mngon par sgrub pa'i sems dang ldan pa/ thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du dmigs pa'i tshogs rgya chen po yongs su sgrub pa bskal pa'i me 'bar bas kyang rgyun mi gcad par brtson par bya ba'i sems dang ldan pa/ 'gro ba thams cad yongs su smin par bya ba dang / gdul ba la rab tu zhugs pa/ byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa kun tu bzang po mngon par sgrub pa'i sems dang ldan pa/ yongs su spyad pa'i tshul thams cad la rab tu zhugs pa ni/ byang chub sems dpa'i yon tan yongs su rdzogs par bya ba la dngos po thams cad rnam par sgom pas dngos po med pa'i tshul la zhugs pa'i sems dang ldan pa yin te/ rigs kyi bu/ 'di ni/ byang chub sems dpa'i skye ba gsum pa chos kyi tshul la nges par rtogs pas gzhag pa'i sbyor ba'i tshul mngon du gyur pa 'byung ba'i snying po zhes bya ba'o/ /

“What is enlightening beings’ birth as offspring of meditation on the principles of the Teaching? Here the enlightening beings’ minds are turned to meditation according all the principles of the teaching, dedicated to fulfilling all aspects of the path of omniscience, intent on practicing impeccable actions, bent on purification of the ocean of all concentration methods of enlightening beings, determined to practice and perfect all qualities of enlightening beings, intent on accomplishing all elements of the path of enlightening beings, energetically striving for omniscience, like the fire that burns ceaselessly through an eon of destruction, determined to accomplish the infinite variety of practices of enlightening beings aimed at guiding all sentient beings to perfection; in terms of all practical techniques and accomplishments of perfect qualities of enlightening beings they enter into the means of realization of all methods of cultivation and meditation.

rigs kyi bu/ de la byang chub sems dpa'i skye ba bzhi pa dus gsum snang bar bya ba'i lhag pa'i bsam pa rnam par dag pa'i snying po zhes bya ba gang zhe na/ rigs kyi bu/ 'di la byang chub sems dpa' lhag pa'i bsam pa'i dbyings las gya nom par yongs su dag pa yin/ sangs rgyas kyi byang chub la snang ba rab tu thob pa yin/ byang chub sems dpa'i tshul rgya mtsho la rab tu zhugs pa yin/ bsam pa brtan pa rdo rje'i khams lta bus yongs su zin pa'i sems dang ldan pas shin tu brtan pa yin/ srid pa'i lam gyi rgyud du skye ba las phyin phyogs su phyogs pa yin/ de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi rnam par 'phrul pa yongs su grub par bya ba la mngon du gyur pa yin/ byang chub sems dpa'i dbang po rnam par spel ba la khyad par du 'bogs pa rab tu thob pa yin/ lhag pa'i bsam pa shin tu 'od gsal bar bya ba'i phyir/ sems shin tu dge ba yin/ smon lam brtan zhing rgya che ba rnam par 'phel bar bya ba la mi g.yo ba yin/ sgrib pa thams cad kyi ri rnam par gtor ba'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyis yang dag par dgongs pa yin/ 'gro ba thams cad nye bar 'tsho bas mgon du gyur pa yin te/ rigs kyi bu/ 'di ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi byang chub sems dpa'i skye ba bzhi pa dus gsum snang bar bya ba'i lhag pa'i bsam pa rnam par dag pa'i snying po zhes bya ba'o/ /

“What is enlightening beings’ birth as offspring of purification of the intent in viewing past, present, and future? Here enlightening beings become pure in the element of intent; they come into the range of the enlightenment of buddhas; they enter the ocean of methods of enlightening beings; their minds are firm, governed by an intent as strong as steel; they are aloof from all forms of existence; they are attentive to the accomplishments of miracles of all buddhas; they gain higher direction so as to increase the keenness of awakening faculties; they become noble-minded, so that their will becomes clear; they become unshakable, so that they develop their firm great vows; they are kept in mind by the buddhas, so that they break through all barriers; they become refuges relied upon by all sentient beings.

rigs kyi bu/ de la byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi byang chub sems dpa'i skye ba lnga pa kun nas snang ba'i 'od kyi snying po zhes bya ba gang zhe na/ rigs kyi bu/ 'di la byang chub sems dpa' 'gro ba thams cad yongs su smin par bya ba dang / gdul ba la rab tu zhugs pas sbyor ba phun sum tshogs pa yin/ sbyin pa lhug par gtong bas dngos po'i 'du shes thams cad las gyen du 'phags pa yin/ tshul khrims mtha' yas pas mtha' las rgal bar rnam par dag pa yin/ sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad la bzod pa'i snang ba rab tu thob pas de bzhin gshegs pa'i yul la gnas pa'i bzod pa dang ldan pa yin/ thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du yangs par 'byung ba la zhugs pas brtson 'grus chen po dang ldan pa yin/ sgo kun tu lta ba'i ting nge 'dzin gyi dkyil 'khor rnam par dag pas bsam gtan la rab tu brtson pa yin/ chos snang ba thams cad rab tu thob pas shes rab kyi mthu'i 'od dang ldan pa yin/ sangs rgyas blta ba rgya mtsho rnam par dmigs par bya ba la zhugs pas thogs pa med pa'i mig dang ldan pa yin/ 'jig rten thams cad yongs su tshim par byed pas chos thams cad kyi de kho na nyid la dbang sgyur bas smos pa yin/ chos kyi tshul yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du thob par bya ba la rab tu brtson pa yin te/ rigs kyi bu/ 'di ni/ byang chub sems dpa'i rnams kyi byang chub sems dpa'i skye ba lnga pa kun nas snang ba'i 'od kyi snying po zhes bya ba'o/ /

“What is enlightening beings’ birth as offspring of the light of universal awareness? Here the enlightening beings become fully engaged in the effort to guide all sentient beings to perfection. They become free from any notion of things, having let go and relinquished all. They become perfectly pure and self-controlled, dwelling in the sphere of those who arrive at Thusness. They become tolerant, having attained the light of acceptance of all teachings of buddhas. They become greatly energetic, accomplishing right emancipation everywhere. They become released through meditation, having purified the sphere of knowledge of all-sided concentration. They become radiant with the energy of transcendent wisdom, having attained awareness of all truths. They become unimpeded in vision, perceiving the manifestations of the ocean of vision of buddhas. They manifest the total potential of the reality of all things, satisfying all beings. They become engrossed in the attainment of truth.

rigs kyi bu/ de la byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi byang chub sems dpa'i skye ba drug pa de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs kyi rgyud du 'byung ba'i snying po zhes bya ba gang zhe na/ rigs kyi bu/ 'di la byang chub sems dpa' de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs su byung ba yin/ de bzhin gshegs pa'i rgyud du skyes pa yin/ tshul gyi sgo thams cad la shin tu grub pa yin/ 'das pa dang / ma byon pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi smon lam chen po la rnam par dag pa yin/ de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi dge ba'i rtsa ba la rang bzhin gcig pa'i dge ba'i rtsa bar gyur pa yin/ sangs rgyas thams cad dang lus gcig tu gyur pa yin/ chos dkar pos 'jig rten gzhan du 'gro ba yin/ sangs rgyas kyi byin gyi rlabs yongs su bstan pa'i ting nge 'dzin la bdag nyid che ba'i chos kyis rnam par spyod pa yin/ dus la ji ltar 'bab pa bzhin du sems can rnam par dag par bya ba'i chos la zhugs pa yin/ sangs rgyas kyi chos yongs su dris pa la spobs pa rgyun mi 'chad pa yin te/ rigs kyi bu/ 'di ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi byang chub sems dpa'i skye ba drug pa de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs kyi rgyud du 'byung ba'i snying po zhes bya ba'o/ /

“What is enlightening beings’ birth as offspring of the family of all buddhas? Here the enlightening beings are born in the family of buddhas, born into the lineage of buddhas. They become accomplished in the methods of all buddha teaching and pure in the great vows of the buddhas of past, present, and future. Their roots of goodness become one with the roots of goodness of all buddhas, and they become one body with all buddhas. They go beyond the world by pure qualities. They come to abide in the state of a great being, in absorption in the sight of the power of buddhas. They carry out the means of purifying beings according to the time and are tireless in answering questions about the ways of enlightenment.

rigs kyi bu/ de la byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi byang chub sems dpa'i skye ba bdun pa de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi stobs kyi 'od snang ba'i rgyan gyi snying po zhes bya ba gang zhe na/ rigs kyi bu/ 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sangs rgyas kyi stobs la 'jug pa'i snang bas sangs rgyas kyi zhing du 'gro ba las phyir mi ldog go /byang chub sems dpa'i yon tan rgya mtsho las phyir mi 'gyur ro/ /chos thams cad sgyu ma'i rnam pa ltar yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du shes par bya ba la gnas pas yongs su yi chad par mi 'gyur ro/ /'jig rten thams cad rmi lam lta bur rab tu rtogs par byed do/ /gzugs su rnam par dmigs pa'i gnas thams cad gzugs brnyan lta bur mngon par sgrub bo/ /mngon par shes pas rnam par 'phrul pa sprul pa lta bu la dbang rab tu thob par byed do/ /srid pa thams cad du skye ba grib ma lta bur gdod rab tu ston to/ /de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi chos kyi 'khor lo sgra brnyan lta bur rab tu shes so/ /thabs kyi tshul don sna tshogs dang ldan pa la rab tu brtson pas chos kyi dbyings kyi tshul rab tu bstan pa la pha rol tu phyin pa'i dam pa thob pa yin te/ rigs kyi bu/ 'di ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi byang chub sems dpa'i skye ba bdun pa de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi stobs kyi 'od snang ba'i rgyan gyi snying po zhes bya'o/ /

“What is enlightening beings’ birth as offspring of the array of lights of the manifestation of powers of buddhas? Here enlightening beings, within range of entry into the powers of buddhas, do not regress in their travels to buddha-lands, and do not backslide in their approach to the ocean of various virtues of enlightening beings. They are not frightened by the knowledge that all things are really illusory, and they know all worlds are like dreams. They effect the magical manifestation of all forms, like reflections, and they attain mastery of the miraculous effects of mystic knowledge, like emanations. They show their faces like shadows or reflected images in all states of being. They know all buddhas’ teachings are like echoes, and they attain supreme perfection of explanation of the principles of the reality realm, teaching through the use of various meanings and methods.
