rigs kyi bu/ de la byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi byang chub sems dpa'i skye ba brgyad pa ye shes kyi sgo kun nas rnam par dpyad pas yongs su 'grub par 'byung ba'i snying po zhes bya ba gang zhe na/ rigs kyi bu/ 'di la byang chub sems dpa' gzhon nur gyur cing byang chub sems dpa'i rnam par dgod pa la rnam par gnas pa yin te/ de la gnas nas thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ye shes kyi tshul la rnam par dpyod do/ /ye shes kyi tshul gyi sgo re re la yang byang chub sems dpa'i spyod yul tshad med par yongs su ston pas bskal pa tshad med par zad par 'gyur ro/ /byang chub sems dpa'i ting nge 'dzin thams cad la'ang pha rol tu phyin pa'i dam pas dbang du 'gyur te/ sems kyi skad cig re re zhing sems kyi skad cig thams cad la yang phyogs bcu'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing brjod du med pa dag na bzhugs pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi zhabs kyi drung du skyes te/ dmigs pa tha mi dad pas tha mi dad pa'i ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par 'jug go /tha mi dad pa'i chos rnams la tha dad pa'i ye shes kyi dbang yongs su ston to/ /dmigs pa brjod du med pa dag kyang bsgribs pa med pa'i dbyings yongs su non par byed do; ;dmigs pa chung dus kyang mtha' yas pas brtan pa'i sa la yongs su 'jug go /chos nyid tshad med pa yang chung ba'am/ che bar khong du chud par byed do/ /'jig rten thams cad kyang rnam par dmigs pa dang / mnyam par rab tu rtogs par byed do/ /chos kyi dmigs pa thams cad dang / rnam par shes pa'i rgyud thams cad kyang sgom pas khong du chud par byed do; rigs kyi bu/ 'di ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi byang chub sems dpa'i skye ba brgyad pa ye shes kyi sgo kun nas rnam par dpyad pas yongs su 'grub pa 'byung ba'i snying po zhes bya ba'o/ /

“What is enlightening beings’ birth as offspring of consummation of contemplation of the ways to omniscience? Here the enlightening beings, like children, become established in the state of enlightening beings, where they contemplate the way to omniscience. In each medium of the way of knowledge they will travel for measureless eons defining the infinite realm of enlightening beings, and they become masters of all concentrations of enlightening beings, attaining supreme perfection. In each and every moment of awareness they appear in the presence of the buddhas in untold buddha-lands in the ten directions. They attain holistic concentration on differentiated objects, and show mastery of distinct knowledge of inseparable things. They enter the realm of no object in boundless objects. They enter the stage of endless definition of minute objects, and they know the immeasurable nature of things as small or large. They realize all worlds are equally definitions of consciousness, and they understand all objects and all modes of making them known, by means of meditation.

rigs kyi bu/ de la byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi byang chub sems dpa'i skye ba dgu pa chos kyi dbyings sprul pas brgyan par byed pa'i snying po zhes bya ba gang zhe na/ rigs kyi bu/ 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems kyi skad cig thams cad la rgyan sna tshogs dang / rgyan du mar ldan pa'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing byin gyis rlob ste/ sprul pa thams cad la mi 'jigs pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i dam pa thob pa yin/ sangs rgyas kyi sprul pa thams cad la shin tu mkhas par gyur pa yin/ chos kyi sprul pa la mi 'jigs pa rnam par dag pa yin/ chos kyi dbyings dam pa chags pa med pa'i spyod yul dang ldan pa yin/ bsam pa ji bzhin du sems can gyi lus rnam par dmigs par bya ba'i byin gyi rlabs la mkhas pa yin/ sems can gdul ba mkhas pa bsam gyis mi khyab pa dang ldan pa yin/ spyod pa sna tshogs kyis mngon par 'tshang rgya ba yongs su ston pa yin/ thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi lam sgrib pa med pa mngon par sgrub pa la mkhas pa yin/ de'i rgyud kyi chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba la mkhas pa yongs su ston pa yin/ sems can mtha' dang dbus med pa gdul ba'i thabs mngon par sgrub pa la mkhas pa yin/ rnam par snang mdzad kyi ye shes dbyig tu bya ba'i mdzod dang ldan pas sems can gdul ba'i dus la bab na rtag tu sta gon du gnas pa yin te/ rigs kyi bu/ 'di ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi byang chub sems dpa'i skye ba dgu pa chos kyi sprul pas brgyan par byed pa'i snying po zhes bya ba'o; ;

“What is enlightening beings’ birth as offspring of manifestation of emanations throughout the universe? Here the enlightening beings set up variously arrayed buddha-lands everywhere in an instant of thought. They become perfectly expert in creating emanational beings, skilled in producing emanational buddhas, and expert in creating projections of the Teaching. Their sphere of action is the unobstructed cosmos of realities; they become able to produce manifestations of all kinds of bodies according to the mentalities of those they are dealing with, and arrive at the skill to guide unthinkable numbers of sentient beings. They show enlightenment through various practices, are skilled in accomplishing the unobstructed path of omniscience, and thereupon demonstrate the ability to turn the wheel of the Teaching. They become skilled in accomplishing an infinite variety of means of guiding sentient beings; they are able to guide sentient beings with proper timing, and are always absorbed in the mother lode of illuminating knowledge.

rigs kyi bu/ de la byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi byang chub sems dpa'i skye ba bcu pa de bzhin gshegs pa'i sa yongs su gnon pa'i shugs drag po'i snying po zhes bya ba gang zhe na/ 'di la byang chub sems dpa' dus gsum gyi de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad dang rang bzhin gcig pa'i yul la dbang bskur ba yin te/ 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad 'dab chags pa'i yul la rab tu 'jug pa yin/ sems can thams cad kyi sngon gyi mtha' dang / phyi ma'i mtha'i shi 'pho ba dang / skye ba'i sems rgyun chags par 'byung ba'ang rab tu shes so/ /byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyi ye shes 'dab chags pa'i yul yang rab tu shes so/ /'das pa dang / ma byon pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i sangs rgyas thams cad kyi mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya ba 'dab chags pa yang rab tu shes so/ /chos thams cad kyi rgyud 'dab chags pa la mkhas par bya ba yang rab tu shes so; ;bskal pa 'jig pa dang 'du ba thams cad kyi sngon gyi mtha' dang / phyi ma'i mtha' dang / da ltar byung ba rnams kyang ming dang bcas/ sa tshigs dang bcas par 'dab chags par rab tu shes so/ /sems can tshul ji lta bur yongs su smin par byas pa dang / dus la gang du 'bab pa rnams la mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya ba'i rgyan dang / rnam par 'tshang rgya bas gdul bar bya ba yongs su bstan pa'i phyin gyi rlabs kyi ye shes kyang mngon par sgrub bo/ /sangs rgyas byung ba thams cad mngon par 'tshang rgya ba'i drung du nye bar 'gro zhing chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba la mkhas pa'i tshul 'dab chags pa yang sems can gyi khams mtha' dang dbus med pa gdul ba'i thabs mngon par sgrub pa la mkhas pas yongs su ston te/ rigs kyi bu/ 'di ni; byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi byang chub sems dpa'i skye ba bcu pa de bzhin gshegs pa'i sa yongs su gnon pa'i shugs drag po'i snying po zhes bya ba'o/ /

“What is enlightening beings’ birth as offspring of momentum going into the stage of the enlightened? Here enlightening beings are initiated into the realm of oneness of all buddhas of all times, and they enter into the perspective of continuity of all worlds. They know the continuous generation of mind of all beings in their past and future goings and comings. They know the continuum of action and knowledge of all enlightening beings, they know the continuum of enlightenment of all past, future, and present buddhas, and they know the continuum of skill in use of all the teachings. They know the continuum of all past, future, and present ages of formation and disintegration, as well as their names and features. They effect the knowledge underlying showing sentient beings the realm of awakening to the manifestation of enlightenment according to their development, at the appropriate times, and they show the continuity of the means of turning the wheel of teaching leading to realization of enlightenment applied by all buddhas who appear in the world, by skill in carrying out techniques of guiding endless numbers of beings.

rigs kyi bu/ de dag ni; byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi byang chub sems dpa'i skye ba bcu rnams te/ de dag gis byang chub sems dpa' rnams skye bar 'gyur ba'o/ /'byung bar 'gyur ba'o/ /yang dag par sgrub bar byed pa'o/ /yang dag par 'phel bar byed pa'o/ /rab tu rdzogs par byed pa'o/ /yongs su grub par byed pa'o/ /zhing ma lus pa thams cad khong du chud par bya ba'i phyir rgyan gcig gi lhab lhub la rgyan dang lhab lhub kyi rgyud rnam pa sna tshogs byin gyis rlob pa'o/ /sems can gyi khams gdul ba rgyun mi gcad pa'i phyir phyi ma'i mtha'i bskal pa'i mur thug par byin gyis rlabs kyis rgyun chad pa med par byed pa'o/ /chos rgya mtsho thams cad kyi dmigs pa sna tshogs dang / shin tu bstan pa gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pa sna tshogs du ma rnam pa tha dad pa dang / chos mtha' yas pa gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pa'i rgyun mngon par 'tshang rgya bar byed pa'o/ /sangs rgyas kyi khyu mchog gi mthu phyung ba bsam gyis mi khyab pa chos kyi dbyings kyis klas pa/ nam mkha'i dbyings kyi mtha' gtugs pa yongs su ston pa'o/ /sems can tshad med pa spyod pa rgya mtsho sna tshogs dang ldan pa yongs su smin par bya ba dang / gdul bas yongs su 'dus pa rnams la chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba yongs su ston pa'o/ /sems can gyi khams thams cad sangs rgyas 'byung ba dang mi 'bral bar byin gyis rlob pa'o/ /chos thams cad kyi sprin dbyangs kyi yan lag rgya mtsho brjod du med pas rnam par dag pa dmigs pa thams cad las rab tu 'byung ba rnam par dmigs par byed pa'o/ /tshad med par rnam par spyad pa la sgrib pa med par rtogs pas khong du chud pa rnams chos yid du 'ong ba'i rgyan thams cad dang ldan pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i dkyil 'khor bsam pa dang / mos pa gang dang ldan pa'i tshul bzhin du sems can rnams la yongs su ston pa'o/ /sangs rgyas kyi sa tshad med pa'i rjes su song ba rnams 'jig rten thams cad yongs su bsgrub pa'i don du chos kyi mdzod mtha' dang dbus med pa rab tu ston pa'o/ /

“These are enlightening beings’ ten births as enlightening beings, in which they are born, come into existence, form and develop, are fulfilled and completed; they magically produce offerings of adornments in a single array for awakening in all lands; they produce magical powers for endless eons to guide sentient beings ceaselessly; they awaken to the stream of the endless succession of teachings in the multifaceted succession of particularizations of the various objects of sense in the ocean of all actualities; they show the inconceivable majesty of buddhas throughout the space of the cosmos; they show the operation of the Teaching in the context of the immeasurable oceans of varieties of actions of sentient beings, to develop and guide and care for them; they cause all worlds never to be deprived of the presence of a buddha; they convey the multitudes of all teachings, the purity of the ocean of their innumerable utterances, in all objects of sense; having reached the state of unobstructed infinitude, they produce spheres of enlightening beings beautifully arrayed with all realities; they expound the infinitely various treasury of the Teaching, pursuant to infinite buddhahood, for the purpose of perfecting all beings, expounding it to all beings in accord with their mentalities.”

de nas lum+bi ni'i nags tshal kyi lha mo gzi brjid kyi dkyil 'khor bzang pos dga' ba'i dpal gyis de'i tshe byang chub sems dpa'i chos kyi don 'di nyid gsal bar brjod pa'i phyir sangs rgyas kyi byin gyi rlabs kyis phyogs bcur rnam par bltas te tshong dpon gyi bu nor bzang la tshigs su bcad de smras pa/

Then Sutejomandalaratishri, goddess of the Lumbini grove, looking over the ten directions by the empowerment of Buddha, spoke these verses to Sudhana, shedding light on the meaning of the ten kinds of birth of enlightening beings:

lhag pa'i bsam pa dri med rnyog pa med pa yis/ / gang rnams rgyal ba blta bas nam yang mi ngoms shing / / rgyal ba kun gyi phyi ma'i mtha' yi rgyan sprin la/ / smon pa'i mkhas pa de dag skye ba'i thog ma gnas/ /
dus gsum byung ba'i 'jig rten ma lus kun bkang ste/ / zhing dang sems can de bzhin chos dang sangs rgyas rnams/ / sems can dgrol phyir smon lam 'debs pas brgyan pa'i sems/ / de ni bsam gyis mi khyab rnams kyi skye ba gnyis/ /
gang rnams chos kyi sprin 'thung nam yang mi ngoms shing / / ngoms par rtogs pa'i yid kyis dus gsum chags med lus/ / mkha' dbyings dri med mnyam med sems kyi lus ldan pa/ / mtshungs pa med pa de ni de dag skye ba gsum/ /
lhag pa'i bsam pa ri rab brdo rje mtshungs brtan pas/ / thams cad mkhyen tshul rgya mtshor rnam par 'jug byed cing / / gang rnams snying rje chen po'i gang chen mtshor 'jug pa/ / de ni skyes bu khyu mchog rnams kyi skye ba bzhi/ /
gang rnams byams pas phyogs bcu rgyas par yongs bkang zhing / / pha rol phyin pa dri med rgya mtsho mngon bsgrubs te/ / chos kyi 'od 'gyed 'gro ba yongs su smin byed pa/ / de ni skyes bu chen po de dag skye ba lnga/ /
chos kyi rang bzhin rab tu rtogs pas chags med sems/ / dus gsum dpe zla med pa'i sangs rgyas rigs byung zhing / / gang rnams chos dbyings rgya mtsho'i tshul la 'jug byed pa/ / de ni mkhas pa de dag skye ba yangs pa drug /
gang rnams chos lus yongs su chags pa med pa'i sems/ / zhing rnams ma lus rang gi lus kyis dgang byas shing / / sangs rgyas stobs rnams ma lus khong du chud rtogs pa/ / de ni mkhas pa rnams kyi skye ba bsam yas bdun/ /
gang rnams ye shes rgya mtsho'i tshul la dbang ldan zhing / / thams cad mkhyen pa'i sgo tshul rnam par dpyod byed la/ / ting nge 'dzin kun tshul gang chen mtsho la yongs 'jug pa/ / de ni de bzhin nyid rten rnams kyi skye ba brgyad/ /
gang rnams zhing kun 'byams klas yongs su sbyong byed cing / / sems can thams cad yongs smin byed 'dul rab brtson la/ / sangs rgyas rnam par 'phrul pa'i rgyan rnams rnam ston pa; ; de ni grangs pa chen po rnams kyi skye ba dgu/ /
gang rnams rgyal ba'i stobs rnams ji bzhin rab zhugs te/ / thams cad mkhyen pa'i shugs drag yangs pa rnam spel cing / / gang rnams chos dbyings gzhi tshul tha dad chags med pa/ / de ni rgyal sras rnams kyi skye ba bcu yin no/ /

Those who behold the buddhas With pure, untainted minds never weary: Undertaking endless offerings to all buddhas, They are established in the first birth, wise.
Extending to all lands in all times, All things, and all buddhas, Minds equipped with the vow to liberate beings, This is called the second birth of the inconceivable.
Those who tirelessly imbibe the Teaching, Contemplative and unattached, Equanimous in mind and body, pure as space, Attain the third peerless birth.
Those who enter the ocean of great compassion With wills as firm as a diamond mountain, Plunging into the ocean of means of omniscience, Theirs is the fourth birth of the best of people.
Those who carry out the oceans of pure transcendent ways, Suffusing all worlds with love, Developing beings by the lights of truth, Theirs is the fifth birth of great people.
Knowing the nature of things, unhindered in mind, Born in the family of the peerless buddhas of all times, Those who enter the ocean of the reality realm Attain the sixth great birth of sages.
Those whose spiritual body is pure and mind unattached, Who pervade all lands with their own bodies, And enter into all powers of buddhas, Attain the seventh inconceivable birth of the enlightened.
Those who have mastered the ocean of knowledge, Contemplate the way to omniscience, And enter the ocean of all ways of concentration Attain the eighth birth of those abiding in Thusness.
Those who purify spiritual realms, Engaged in perfection of all beings, And show the miraculous effects of buddhas, Attain the ninth birth of the great-minded.
Those who enter the power of the conquerors, Developing the immense force of omniscience, With unhindered knowledge of the differentiation of the cosmos, Attain the tenth birth of the offspring of buddhas.

rigs kyi bu/ skye ba bcu po de dag gis byang chub sems dpa' rnams de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs su skye'o/ / de ltar na/ 'jig rten thams cad la snang ba byed pa yin no/ / rigs kyi bu/ kho mo ni/ byang chub sems dpa'i rnam par thar pa bskal pa tshad med par dmigs pa thams cad du byang chub sems dpa'i skye bas rnam par 'phrul ba yongs su ston pa thob pa'o/ / smras pa/ 'phags ma/ byang chub sems dpa'i rnam par thar pa bskal pa tshad med par dmigs pa thams cad du byang chub sems dpa'i skye bas rnam par 'phrul ba yongs su ston pa 'di'i yul ji lta bu zhig mchis/

“By these ten births enlightening beings are born in the family of buddhas and become light-makers for sentient beings.
“Also, I have attained an enlightening liberation of vision of the birth of enlightening beings in all objects for incalculable eons.”
Sudhana asked, “What is the scope of this liberation?”

smras pa/ rigs kyi bu/ kho mo ni/ byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyi skye ba yongs su lta zhing nye bar 'gro ba'i smon lam yongs su grub pa ste/ rigs kyi bu/ de ltar kho mo ni/ bcom ldan 'das rnam par snang mdzad kyi skye ba rgya mtsho shin tu yangs pa la 'jug cing khong du chud pa ste/ 'di ltar stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams 'di'i byang chub sems dpa'i skye ba khong du chud par byed cing / gling bzhi pa skal pa dang ldan pa'i dzam+bu'i gling 'di'i lum+bi ni'i nags tshal du byang chub sems dpa' 'byung ba yongs su blta ba'i don du sngon gyi smon lam gyis skyes te/ da ltar kho mo 'di ni; byang chub sems dpa' 'byung ba'i rjes su dran pa sgom zhing rnam par spyod do/ / de ltar kho mo 'di na gnas gnas te/ de phan chad lo brgya na bcom ldan 'das dga' ldan gyi pho brang nas 'pho bar 'gyur ro/ /

The goddess said, “I have perfected a vow to go to see all manifestations of birth of enlightening beings. Indeed, I have entered the immense ocean of births of the blessed Vairocana—perceiving the births of the enlightening being in this billion-world universe, when the Blessed One was to manifest birth here in the Lumbini grove, I appeared here by my past vow and stayed here cultivating recollection of the enlightening being’s births, and as I did so I realized that the Blessed One would descend to earth from the heaven of happiness in one hundred years.

zhes bya ba'i tshe lum+bi ni'i nags tshal 'dir sngon gyi ltas bcu byung bar gyur te/ bcu gang zhe na/ 'di ltar lum+bi ni'i nags tshal 'di thams cad mthon dman med la ngam grog dang ga yang sa med cing mnyam par gnas par gyur pa 'di ni/ sngon gyi ltas dang po byung ba'o/ / yang lum+bi ni'i nags tshal 'di thams cad gseg ma dang gyo mo med la/ sdong dum dang tsher ma dang bral te sa'i gzhi rdo rje las grub par gyur nas rin po che mang pos yongs su gang bar gnas par gyur pa 'di ni/ sngon gyi ltas gnyis pa byung ba'o/ / yang lum+bi ni'i nags tshal 'di thams cad rin po che thams cad kyi shing dang / sA la dang / ta la'i phreng bas rnam par 'khrigs pas yongs su brgyan par kun nas gnas par gyur pa 'di ni/ sngon gyi ltas gsum pa byung ba'o/ / yang lum+bi ni'i nags tshal 'di thams cad lha rdzas las kyang 'das pa'i spos kyi myu gu kun nas thon pa dang / phye ma thams cad kyi mdzod kun nas thon pa dang / rgyal mtshan thams cad kyi sprin dang na bun yongs su byung ba dang / spos kyi rin po che'i gzugs kyi shing drung kun nas 'khor te rgyan yongs su sbyangs par kun nas gnas par gyur pa 'di ni/ sngon gyi ltas bzhi pa byung ba'o/ / yang lum+bi ni'i nags tshal 'di thams cad lha rdzas kyi me tog dang / phreng ba dang / lhab lhub sna tshogs kyi mdzod rnam pa thams cad yongs su rgyas pa dang ldan par kun nas gnas par gyur pa 'di ni/ sngon gyi ltas lnga pa byung ba'o/ / yang lum+bi ni'i nags tshal 'di thams cad kyi shing thams cad la nor bu rin po che dam pa'i mdzod mngon par grub par gyur pa 'di ni/ sngon gyi ltas drug pa byung ba'o/ / yang lum+bi ni'i nags tshal 'di thams cad kyi pad+mo'i tshal thams cad du chu las skyes pa'i me tog thams cad kyang kha 'bus te sa'i gzhi las thon nas chu las mngon par 'phags par gnas pa 'di ni/ sngon gyi ltas bdun pa byung ba'o// yang 'jig rten gyi khams 'di'i 'dod pa la spyod pa dang / gzugs la spyod pa'i lha'i bu rnams dang / klu dang / gnod sbyin dang / dri za dang / lha ma yin dang / mi'am ci dang / lto 'phye chen po dang / 'jig rten gyi dbang po'am/ 'gro ba'i dbang po ji snyed cig yod pa de dag thams cad kyang lum+bi ni'i nags tshal 'di na thal mo sbyar cing 'khod par gyur te/ 'di ni/ sngon gyi ltas brgyad pa byung ba'o/ / yang 'dzam bu'i gling gi 'jig rten gyi khams 'di'i lha'i bu mo'am/ klu'i bu mo'am/ gnod sbyin dang / dri za dang / lha ma yin dang / nam mkha'i lding dang / mi'am ci dang / lto 'phye chen po'i bu mo ji snyed cig yod pa de dag thams cad kyang rab tu dga' ba'i yid kyis mchod pa'i rnam pa thams cad lag na thogs shing blag sha'i yal ga la mngon du lta ste 'dud cing phyag 'tshal bar 'khod par gyur pa 'di ni/ sngon gyi ltas dgu pa byung ba'o/ / yang phyogs bcu'i de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi sku lte ba'i dkyil dag nas byang chub sems dpa'i skye bas rnam par 'phrul ba'i sgron ma zhes bya ba'i 'od zer mang po thon te/ lum+bi ni'i nags tshal 'di thams cad snang bar byas nas gnas par gyur te/ 'od zer gyi sgo'i dkyil 'khor de dag thams cad la'ang de bzhin gshegs pa de dag thams cad kyi skye bas rnam par 'phrul ba gzugs brnyan du gyur par snang ba dang / thog ma bltams pa'i rnam par 'phrul ba dang bcas par byang chub sems dpa'i yon tan thams cad kyang sangs rgyas kyi gsung gi dbyangs dang ldan par 'od zer gyi sgo'i dkyil 'khor de dag las sgrar thon cing grags par gyur pa 'di ni/ sngon gyi ltas bcu pa byung ba'o/ / byang chub sems dpa' skye ba'i dus la bab pa'i tshe sngon gyi ltas bcu po de dag byung bar gyur te/ de byung bas 'jig rten gyi dbang po thams cad kyis kyang byang chub sems dpa' 'byung bar 'gyur ro/ / zhes bya bar shes so/ / rigs kyi bu / de ltar kho mo sngon gyi ltas bcu po 'di dag mthong bas kyang dga' ba'i shugs bsam gyis mi khyab pa rab tu thob bo/ /

“Then ten omens appeared in this Lumbini grove. What ten? The whole grove became level, without uneven terrain, without any pitfalls; this was the first omen to appear. Then the whole grove became clear of gravel and brambles, and the ground became diamond, strewn with jewels; this was the second omen to appear. Then the whole grove was adorned with rows of trees of all kinds of jewels; this was the third omen to appear. Then the whole grove was arrayed with adornments set on tree roots made of figurines of fragrant jewels, sending forth sprouts more fragrant than celestial perfumes, growing from mines of aromatic powders, producing multitudes of all kinds of banners and pennants; this was the fourth omen to appear. Then the whole grove was filled with all kinds of arrays of garlands of various celestial flowers; this was the fifth omen to appear. Then great treasuries of jewels opened up in all the trees in this grove; this was the sixth omen to appear. Then in all the lotus ponds in the grove, all kinds of jewel lotuses sprang up from the earth in bud and emerged on the surface of the water; this was the seventh omen to appear. Then the various beings of the realms of desire and the realm of form in this world all stood reverently here in this grove; this was the eighth omen to appear. Then the females of all the various kinds of beings came here joyfully with all kinds of offerings and bowed before the holy fig tree; this was the ninth omen to appear. Then lights called “lamp of the magical manifestations of birth of enlightening beings” emanating from the navels of all the buddhas of the ten directions appeared in this grove; and in all the beams of light, reflections of the magical manifestations of births of all the buddhas were seen, and the sounds of the voices of buddhas telling of the virtues of enlightening beings magically born were heard emanating from the light beams. This was the tenth omen to appear. These ten omens appeared when the time of the enlightening being Vairocana’s birth was near, and because of the appearance of these omens the thought occurred to all world leaders that the enlightening being would be born. And I, for my part, was flooded with inconceivable joy from seeing those omens.

rigs kyi bu/ gzhan yang lha mo sgyu ma grong khyer chen po ser skya'i gnas nas byung ba'i tshe lum+bi ni'i nags tshal 'dir sngon gyi ltas snang ba chen po bcu byung bar gyur to/ / de dag byung bas sems can tshad med pa rnams thams cad mkhyen pa'i chos kyi snang bas dga' ba'i shugs rnam par 'phel bar gyur to/ /

“Then, as Lady Maya (mother of Vairocana-Shakyamuni Buddha) went out of the city of Kapilavastu, ten omens of great light appeared in this Lumbini grove, by the appearance of which the fervor of joy of vision of the teaching of omniscience grew in countless beings.

bcu gang zhe na/ 'di lta ste/ sa'i steng na gnas pa'i rin po che'i khang pa brtsegs pa thams cad du snang ba rab tu byung ngo/ / rin po che'i pad+mo kha ma bye ba kha bye bar gyur pa'i 'dab ma thams cad las snang ba rab tu byung ste bltams pa legs par bltams so/ / zhes bya ba'i sgra snyan pa yang de dag bas byung bar gyur to/ / phyogs bcu'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis thog ma sems bskyed pa'i snang ba ji snyed cig yod pa de dag kyang lum+bi ni'i nags tshal 'dir snang bar byas te mngon par shar to/ / phyogs bcu'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams byang chub sems dpa'i sa thams cad yongs su gnon pa'i snang ba'i rnam par 'phrul ba ji snyed cig yod pa de dag kyang lum+bi ni'i nags tshal 'dir byung ngo/ / phyogs bcu'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams pha rol tu phyin pa thams cad yongs su sgrub cing ye shes khong du chud pa'i snang ba'i 'od ji snyed cig yod pa de dag kyang lum+bi ni'i nags tshal 'dir byung bar gyur to/ / phyogs bcu'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams smon lam thams cad la dbang sgyur ba'i ye shes snang ba'i 'od ji snyed cig yod pa de dag kyang lum+bi ni'i nags tshal 'dir byung bar gyur to/ / phyogs bcu'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams smon lam rgya chen po mngon par sgrub pa'i ye shes snang ba'i 'od ji snyed cig yod pa de dag kyang lum+bi ni'i nags tshal 'dir byung bar gyur to/ / phyogs bcu'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams sems can yongs su smin par bya ba dang / gdul bar byed pa'i ye shes snang ba'i 'od ji snyed cig yod pa de dag kyang lum+bi ni'i nags tshal 'dir byung bar gyur to/ / phyogs bcu'i byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyis chos kyi dbyings kyi tshul gyi ye shes khong du chud pa'i snang ba ji snyed cig yod pa de dag kyang lum+bi ni'i nags tshal 'dir byung bar gyur to/ / phyogs bcu'i byang chub sems dpa' thams cad sangs rgyas thams cad kyi rnam par 'phrul ba dang / skye ba dang / mngon par byung ba dang / byang chub tu rnam par 'tshang rgya ba dang / ye shes thugs su chud par mdzad pa'i snang ba'i 'od ji snyed cig yod pa de dag kyang lum+bi ni'i nags tshal 'dir byung bar gyur to/ / sngon gyi ltas snang ba chen po bcu po de dag rab tu byung bar gyur te/ de dag gis sems can mtha' dang dbus med pa'i sems dang bsam pa'i mun pa thibs po thams cad kyang rab tu snang bar byas so/ /

What were the ten? Light appeared in the chambers of all the jewel towers on the ground level; light appeared in the buds of all the fragrant flowers; light appeared in the blossoming buds of all the jewel lotuses, coming from all the petals, and sweet, agreeable sound flowed from them. Also, the light of the first inspiration of the enlightening beings of the ten directions appeared, illumining this Lumbini grove. Also, the mystical manifestation of light of the enlightening beings of the ten directions entering all the stages of enlightening beings appeared in this grove. Also, the light of the attainment of knowledge on consummation of all the transcendent ways by the enlightening beings of the ten directions appeared in this grove. Also the light of knowledge controlling all vows of the enlightening beings of the ten directions appeared in this grove. Also the light of all enlightening beings’ knowledge of developmental disciplines appeared in this grove. Also the light of all enlightening beings’ attainment of knowledge of the principles of the reality realm appeared in this grove. Also the light of all enlightening beings’ attainment of knowledge of buddhas’ projected birth, leaving society, and realization of enlightenment appeared in this grove. These ten omens of light appeared, by which the darkness of the recesses of the minds of infinite enlightening beings were lit up.

rigs kyi bu/ de la lha mo sgyur ma shing blag sha'i gnas su phyin pa'i tshe 'jig rten gyi dbang po 'dus pa thams cad dang / 'dod pa'i khams kyi lha'i bu lha'i bu'i tshogs dang / lha'i bu mo'i 'khor dang bcas te 'dus pa thams cad dang / gzugs la spyod pa'i lha'i bu dri nga ba med pa thams cad dang / klu dang / gnod sbyin dang / dri za dang / lha ma yin dang / nam mkha' lding dang / mi'am ci dang / lto 'phye chen po'i 'khor dang bcas te tshogs pa/ byang chub sems dpa' la mchod par brtson pa thams cad kyi lus dang / mchod pa'i tshogs thams cad kyang lha mo sgyu ma'i gzi brjid dang / dpal dang / kha dog dang / gzugs kyis rab tu snang bar byas so/ / stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams 'di na 'od gang ji snyed cig yod pa de dag thams cad kyang zil du brlags par gyur te zil gyis mnan to/ / lha mo sgyu ma'i ba spu'i sgo thams cad nas byung ba'i 'od dang snang ba dag ni/ 'od gzhan gyis nyams par gyur pa med/ bsgribs par gyur pa med/ chod par gyur pa med/ thogs par gyur pa med de/ phyogs thams cad rgyas par bkang nas sems can dmyal ba'i sdug bsngal thams cad dang / byol song gi skye gnas kyi sdug bsngal thams cad dang / gshin rje'i 'jig rten gyi sdug bsngal thams cad dang / srid pa'i lam gyi rgyud du gtogs pa'i sems can thams cad kyi sdug bsngal thams cad dang / nyon mongs pa thams cad rab tu zhi bar byas te lhag ge/ lham me/ lhang nger gnas par gyur to/ / rigs kyi bu/ 'di ni/ byang chub sems dpa' skye ba'i rnam par 'phrul pa lum+bi ni'i nags tshal du byung ba dang po'o/ /

“Then, as Lady Maya leaned against the holy fig tree, all the world rulers, the gods and goddesses of the realm of desire, the gods and goddesses of the realm of form, and all the other beings who had gathered there to make offerings to the enlightening being were bathed in the glorious radiance of Maya’s body, and their arrays of offerings were also illumined thereby; and all the lights in the billion-world universe were eclipsed by Maya’s light. The lights emanating from all her pores, not repelled by other lights, unobscured, unobstructed, pervaded everywhere, extinguished all the pains of the hells, the animal realms, the ghost realms, and the pains and afflictions of the beings in all states of existence, then remained, shining, illuminating. This was the first miracle attending the birth of the enlightening being in the Lumbini grove.

rigs kyi bu; gzhan yang gang gi tshe lha mo sgyu ma'i lus su stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams 'di chud cing gzugs brnyan byung bar snang bar gyur pa de'i stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyi gling bzhi pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams bye ba phrag brgya'i 'dzam bu'i gling thams cad kyi rgyal po'i gnas ming sna tshogs dang ldan pa sha stag dang / nags tshal gyi mid sna tshogs dang ldan pa sha stag dang / shing drung rnam pa tha dad pa sha stag tu'ang lha mo sgyu ma phyin cing 'jig rten gyi dbang po thams cad kyis yongs su bskor te byang chub sems dpa'i skye ba la stag gon du sdod cing / byang chub sems dpa'i yum gyi ye shes kyi rnam par 'phrul ba bsam gyis mi khyab pas rnam pa 'di bzhin du snang bar gyur te/ rigs kyi bu/ 'di ni/ byang chub sems dpa' skye ba'i rnam par 'phrul pa lum+bi ni'i nags chel du byung ba gnyis pa'o/ /

“Then everything in this universe was seen reflected in the abdomen of Lady Maya, and in all the worlds in the universe, at the foot of trees in groves in the capitals of the southern continents Lady Maya appeared just as she did in the Lumbini grove, surrounded by all the world leaders as she was about to give birth to the enlightening being, by the miracle of knowledge which gives birth to enlightening beings. This was the second miracle attending the birth of the enlightening being in the Lumbini grove.

rigs kyi bu/ gzhan yang lha mo sgyu ma'i ba spu'i bu ga thams cad kyi ba spu'i sgo re re la yang sngon byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa mdzad pa'i tshe bcom ldan 'das kyis de bzhin gshegs pa ji snyed cig bsnyen bkur te/ rim gror mdzad pa dang / bsti stang dang / bkur stir mdzad de mchod pa de dag thams cad kyang yongs su snang bar gyur to/ / de bzhin gshegs pa de dag gis chos ji snyed cig bstan pa de dag thams cad kyang ba spu'i bu ga de dag nas sangs rgyas kyi gsung gi yan lag dang ldan par ma lus par grags par gyur te/ dper na/ chu'i phor bu chung ngu'am/ gser gyi rdul phra mo'am/ me long gi dkyil 'khor shin tu gsal ba'am/ chu shin tu dang ba la nam mkha'i dkyil 'khor nyi zla dang gza' skar gyi tshogs kyis rab tu brgyan pa dang / sprin gyi tshogs 'brug sgra zab mo 'byin pa can yang gzugs brnyan du gyur par snang ngo/ / rigs kyi bu/ de bzhin du lha mo sgyu ma'i ba sbu'i sgo'i dkyil 'khor thams cad la'ang sngon gyi de bzhin gshegs pa'i rnam par 'phrul pa rnams kyang yongs su snang / chos bstan pa'i sgra thams cad kyang yongs su grags par gyur te/ rigs kyi bu/ 'di ni/ byang chub sems dpa' skye ba'i rnam par 'phrul pa lum+bi ni'i nags tshal du byung ba gsum pa'o/ /

“Then, from every one of Lady Maya’s pores came visions of how the Blessed One had served buddhas as he carried out enlightening practice in the past, and the teachings expounded by those buddhas were also heard in the buddhas’ voices coming from her pores. Just as the sun, moon, stars, planets, and thunderclouds are seen reflected in a lake, in a piece of gold, in a mirror, or in crystal-clear water, in the same way the past emanations of the buddhas, thundering with exposition of all the teachings, were seen in the pores of Lady Maya. This was the third miracle attending the birth of the enlightening being in the Lumbini grove.

rigs kyi bu/ gzhan yang lha mo sgyu ma'i lus thams cad dang / ba spu'i sgo'i dkyil 'khor thams cad las ba spu'i sgo re ra nas kyang zhing ji snyed cig dang / 'jig rten gyi khams rgya mtsho ji snyed cig dang / 'jig rten gyi khams 'byams klas pa ji snyed cig dang / 'jig rten gyi khams kyi rgyud ji snyed cig dang / 'jig rten gyi khams kyi ming du bya ba ji snyed cig tu bcom ldan 'das kyis sngon byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa mdzad de/ zhing gi gzhi ji lta bu zhig dang ldan par gyur pa dang / dbyibs ni/ ci 'dra ba dang / rgyan ni/ ji lta bu zhig dang ldan par gyur pa dang / lhun ni/ ji lta bu zhig dang ldan par gyur pa dang / ri'i rgyan ni / ji lta bu dag cig yod par gyur pa dang / grong dang / grong khyer dang / yul dang / grong rdal gyi rgyan ni/ ji lta bu dag cig gnas gnas pa dang / bza' shing gi ra ba dang / mtsho dang / lu ma dang / rgya mtsho'i rgyan ni/ ji lta bu zhig dang ldan par gyur pa dang / nam mkha' dang / sprin gyi rgyan ni/ ji lta bu zhig dang ldan par gyur pa dang / sems can gyi gnas ni/ ji lta bu zhig yod par gyur pa dang / theg pa bstan pa ni/ gang dang ldan par gyur pa dang / bskal pa'i mid dang grangs ni/ ji snyed cig ces bya bar gyur ba dang / sangs rgyas skye ba ni; ji snyed cig byung bar gyur pa dang / rnam par dag pa ni/ gang du 'du bar gyur pa dang / sems can gyi tshe'i tshad ni/ ji tsam zhig dang ldan par gyur pa dang / 'jig rten gyi skye gnas ni/ gang du skyes par gyur pa dang / sems can ni/ ji lta bu zhig dang 'grogs 'grogs pa dang / dge ba'i bshes gnyen ni/ ji lta bu zhig la brten brten pa dang / dge ba'i chos ni/ ji lta bu zhig la brtson par spyod spyod pa dang / chos kyi nan tan ni/ ji lta bu zhig la brtson par byas te/ byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa spyod spyod pa'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing de dag thams cad kyang yongs su snang bar gyur/ bcom ldan 'das kyis phyir mi ldog pa'i gnas brnyes nas sngon sku ni/ ji snyed cig rnam par spyod pa ji lta bu zhig /cha byad ni/ ji lta bu zhig /longs spyod ni/ ci dang ldan/ bde ba dang sdug bsngal ni/ ji lta bu zhig sku nyams su bzhes/ sku tshe'i rgyud ni/ ji lta bu zhig dang ldan par gyur te/ sngon byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa spyad par gyur pa de dag thams cad kyang ba spu'i sgo thams cad nas yongs su snang bar gyur to/ / sangs rgyas kyi zhing de dag thams cad kyi skye gnas de dag tu lha mo sgyu ma byang chub sems dpa'i yum du gyur pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i sku de dag thams cad kyang lha mo sgyu ma'i ba spu'i sgo thams cad du rnam par 'phrul pa'i gzugs brnyan byung bar gyur te; rigs kyi bu/ 'di ni/ byang chub sems dpa'i skye ba'i rnam par 'phrul pa lum+bi ni'i nags tshal du byung ba bzhi pa'o/ /

“Then, from each of Maya’s pores appeared visions of all the universes, all the worlds, all the lands, and all the places the Blessed One had carried on enlightening practices, all the features of the lands, the means of salvation being taught, the names and numbers of the ages, the buddhas there, the pinnacles of purification, the life span of the beings of those ages, the enlightening being’s births in the worlds, the people he associated with, the spiritual benefactors he followed, the good practices he applied himself to, the principles he put into action, the buddha-lands in which he carried out enlightening practice, the bodies in which he performed enlightening practice and attained nonregression, and what his appearance, surroundings, and pleasant and painful experiences were in his successive lifetimes—all was seen in each of Maya’s pores. And in each of those lifetimes, Lady Maya was the mother of the enlightening beings. And all the bodies of the enlightening being were seen as a magical reflection in the pores of Lady Maya. This was the fourth miracle attending the birth of the enlightening being in the Lumbini grove.

rigs kyi bu/ gzhan yang bcom ldan 'das kyi sngon sku ni/ ji snyed cig gis byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa spyad pa dang / kha dog ni/ ji lta bu zhig/ dbyibs ni/ ci 'dra ba zhig /cha byad ni/ ji lta bu zhig /da rod ni/ ji lta bu zhig longs spyod ni/ ci dang ldan/ bde ba dang sdug bsngal ni/ ji lta bu zhig sku nyams su bzhes/ sku tshe'i rgyud ni/ ji lta bu zhig dang ldan par gyur pa de dag thams cad kyang lha mo sgyu ma'i lus kyi ba spu'i sgo thams cad la gzugs brnyan du snang bar gyur te/ rigs kyi bu/ 'di ni/ byang chub sems dpa' skye ba'i rnam par 'phrul pa lum+bi ni'i nags tshal du byung ba lnga pa'o/ /

“Then the physical forms, the means of subsistence, the pleasures and pains, and the life cycles through which the Blessed One performed enlightening practice in the past were all seen reflected in all the pores of Lady Maya’s body. This was the fifth miracle attending the birth of the enlightening being in the Lumbini grove.

rigs kyi bu/ gzhan yang bcom ldan 'das sngon byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa mdzad pa'i tshe gtang bar dka' ba yongs su btang ste/ zhabs dang phyag yongs su btang ba'am/ snyan dang shangs yongs su btang ba'am/ ljags dang tshems yongs su btang ba'am/ spyan dang / dbu yongs su btang ba'am/ sha dang khrag yongs su btang ba'am/ rus pa dang rkang yongs su btang ba'am/ mkhal ma dang thugs yongs su btang ba'am/ pags pa dang phri yongs su btang ba'am/ phyi nang gi dngos po yongs su btang ba'am/ sras po dang / sras mo dang / btsun mo yongs su btang ba'am/ sku yongs su btang ba'am/ longs spyod rin po che yongs su btang ba'am/ grong dang / grong khyer dang / ljongs dang / yul dang / khams dang / rgyal po'i gnas yongs su btang ba'am/ nor dang / 'bru dang / mdzod dang / bang ba yongs su btang ba'am/ nor bu dang / mu tig dang / be DUr+ya dang / dung dang / man shel dang / byi ru dang / gser dang / dngul yongs su btang ba'am/ rin po che'i rgyan sna tshogs yongs su btang ba'am/ ma la cha yongs su btang ba'am/ khang pa dang gzhal med yongs su btang ba'am/ yo byad yongs su btang ba de ltar gtong ba'i byang chub sems dpa'i sku gzugs dang / rnam pa ji lta bur yongs su btang bar gyur pa dang / len pa de dag kyang rnam pa ji lta bus len par gyur pa dang / sbyin pa'i dngos po rnam pa ji lta bu dag yongs su btang bar gyur pa dang / yul gyi phyogs gang dag tu yongs su btang bar gyur pa dang / de'i ste byang chub sems dpa'i 'khor du gyur pa de dag thams cad kyang lha mo sgyu ma'i ba sbu'i sgo thams cad las gzugs brnyan du snang bar gyur to/ / slong mo ba'i sgra de dag kyang grags par gyur te/ rigs kyi bu/ 'di ni/ byang chub sems dpa' skye ba'i rnam par 'phrul ba lum+bi ni'i nags tshal du byung ba drug pa'o/ /

“Then the difficult sacrifices the Blessed One made in the course of his past enlightening practice, relinquishing everything inside and outside himself, the appearances of the enlightening being as a donor, the appearances of those who received his gifts, the gifts themselves, the circumstances of the giving, and the company of the enlightening being, were all seen reflected in the pores of Lady Maya. This was the sixth miracle attending the birth of the enlightening being in the Lumbini grove.

rigs kyi bu/ gzhan yang sngon gyi mtha'i rgyud du byung ba'i de bzhin gshegs pa rnams yum gyi sku nas bltams par gyur pa'i tshe sangs rgyas kyi zhing gi rgyan dang lhab lhub ji snyed cig byung bar gyur pa dang / sems can gyi rgyan rnam par phye ba dang / bza' shing gi rgyan rnam par phye ba dang / me tog dang / bdug ba dang / spos dang / phreng ba dang / byug pa dang / phye ma dang / na bza' dang gdugs dang / rgyal mtshan dang / ba dan gyi rgyan rnam par phye ba dang / rin po che'i rgyal po thams cad rnam par 'phrul pa'i rgyan rnam par phye ba dang / rol mo dang / glu dang / bstod pa dang / sil snyan gyi sgra ji snyed cig byung bar gyur pa de dag thams cad kyang lha mo sgyu ma lum+bi ni'i nags tshal du phyin pa'i tshe lum+bi ni'i nags tshal 'dir yongs su byung bar gyur to/ / mngon par skyes so/ / 'gro bas rnam par dmigs su yod par byung bar gyur te/ rigs kyi bu/ 'di ni/ byang chub sems dpa' skye ba'i rnam par 'phrul ba lum+bi ni'i nags tshal du byung ba bdun pa'o/ /

“Then manifestations of the lands, the groves, the raiment, the flowers and garlands, perfumes and incenses, banners, pennants, and parasols, all the precious adornments, and the sublime sounds of the music and singing of the times when all the buddhas of the past descended into their mother’s womb, appeared in this grove for all to see and hear. This was the seventh miracle attending the birth of the enlightening being in the Lumbini grove.

rigs kyi bu/ gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa'i longs spyod lha'i dbang po thams cad kyi gnas kyi rgyan gyi longs spyod las yongs su 'das pa dang / klu dang / gnod sbyin dang / dri za dang / lha ma yin dang / nam mkha' lding dang / mi'am ci dang / lto 'phye chen po dang / mi'i dbang po thams cad kyi gnas kyi rgyan gyi longs spyod las 'das pa 'di lta ste/ rin po che'i rgyal po thams cad kyi khang pa brtsegs pa'i longs spyod dam/ rin po che'i rgyal po'i gzhal med khang gi longs spyod dam/ rin po che'i rgyal po'i dra ba'i longs spyod dam/ rin po che'i rgyal po'i 'bru'i longs spyod dam/ rin po che'i rgyal po'i gzugs kyi longs spyod dam/ rin po che'i rgyan thams cad kyi longs spyod dam/ spos kyi rgyal po thams cad kyi longs spyod dam/ dmigs pa thams cad bzang zhing mthun pa'i longs spyod kyang rung ste/ de dag thams cad lha mo sgyu ma'i rum nas ma 'dres par thon te lum+bi ni'i nags tshal 'di yongs su brgyan cing kun nas gnas par gyur te/ rigs kyi bu/ 'di ni/ byang chub sems dpa' skye ba rnam par 'phrul pa lum+bi ni'i nags tshal du byung ba brgyad pa'o/ /

“Then all the furnishings of the enlightening being, surpassing those arraying the abodes of the celestial chiefs and the abodes of the chiefs of all other realms of being—diamond towers, diamond mansions, diamond nets, diamond statues, diamond ornaments, all the finest fragrances, and all kinds of beautiful objects—emerged from Lady Maya’s abdomen and arrayed this Lumbini grove. This was the eighth miracle attending the birth of the enlightening being in the Lumbini grove.

rigs kyi bu/ gzhan yang lha mo sgyu ma'i lus las byang chub sems dpa' sangs rgyas kyi zhing brjod du med pa bye ba khrag khrig brgya phrag stong gi rdul shin tu phra ba snyed bcom ldan 'das rnam par snang mdzad dang / sku gzugs dang / sku mdog dang / dbyibs 'dra ba/ mtshan dang / dpe byad bzang po'i rgyan gyis 'dra bar brgyan pa/ 'od 'dra ba dang / 'od zer 'dra ba rab tu 'gyed pa/ tshul dang 'gros stabs 'dra ba/ rtsal dang mthu 'dra ba/ rnam par snang ba'i rnam par 'phrul pa mthun pa/ 'khor 'dra ba; rgyan mtshungs pa mang po yang bcom ldan 'das rnam par snang mdzad kyi legs pa rgya mtsho yongs su brjod cing thon par gyur te/ rigs kyi bu/ 'di ni/ byang chub sems dpa' skye ba'i rnam par 'phrul ba lum+bi ni'i nags tshal du byung ba dgu pa'o/ /

“Then as many enlightening beings as atoms in untold millions of buddha-lands, all of the same appearance as the blessed Vairocana, adorned with similar marks and embellishments of greatness, with similar auras, emanating similar lights, with similar deportment, projecting similar radiance, with similar retinues, and similar adornments, emerged from Lady Maya’s abdomen first, extolling the myriad qualities of the Blessed One. This was the ninth miracle attending the birth of the enlightening being in the Lumbini grove.

rigs kyi bu/ gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' bltams par gyur pa'i dus la bab pa dang / lha mo sgyu ma'i mdun du 'og gi rdo rje'i gzhi las sa chen po mngon par brtol te/ rin po che'i rgyal po'i pad+mo chen po rin po che thams cad kyi rgyan gyi dam pa zhes bya ba/ chu ba rin po che'i rgyal po gzhan gyis mi thub pa'i rdo rje chen po las grub pa/ rin po che'i rgyal po 'gro ba rgya mtsho'i nang rim dang ldan pa/ ze ba'i rtse mo rin po che'i rgyal po thams cad kyis brgyan pa/ 'dab ma'i phreng ba sangs rgyas kyi zhing bcu'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed kyis brgyan cing shin tu rnam par phye ba/ lo ma'i dkyil 'khor rin po che'i rgyal po sna tshogs kyis byas pa; snying po mdzes pa rin po che yid bzhin gyis rnam par dag pa dang ldan pa/ ze ba'i phreng ba rnam par phye ba dang / rin po che thams cad kyi kha dog tshad med pa dang ldan pa/ rin po che'i rgyal po grangs med pa'i dra ba'i rgyan dang ldan pas yongs su yog pa/ rin po che'i rgyal po rdo rje mthu bo ches mi shigs pas lhun kun nas bkab pa/ lha'i ris thams cad kyis kun nas bskor ba/ klu'i dbang po thams cad kyis spos chu'i sprin gyi char mngon par dbab pa/ gnod sbyin gyi dbang po thams cad kyis kun nas bskor cing lha rdzas kyi me tog snyim pa nas gtor ba/ dri za'i dbang po thams cad kyis sngon gyi sangs rgyas la rim gror byas pa'i klu'i dbyangs snyan cing yid du 'ong ba'i da ro dang sbyar te bstod pa'i sprin gyis mngon par bstod pa/ lha ma yin gyi dbang po thams cad kyis nga rgyal dang / rlom pa dang / dregs pa thams cad btang zhing shin tu btud de phyag bya ba/ nam mkha' lding gi dbang po thams cad kyis rin po che'i snam bu kun tu spyangs te nam mkha' kun nas brgyan par bya ba/ mi'am ci'i dbang po thams cad kyis byang chub sems dpa'i yon tan yongs su brjod cing rol mo dang / glu'i dbyangs la brtson pa dang / nyams su rab tu bde bas kun nas blta ba/ lto 'phye chen po'i dbang po thams cad kyis shin tu dga' ba dang mos pa skyes pas yongs su blta zhing sgra snyan pa byung ste rgyan gyi sprin thams cad kyi char mngon par dbab pa byung bar gyur te/ rigs kyi bu/ 'di ni/ byang chub sems dpa' skye ba'i rnam par 'phrul ba lum+bi ni'i nags tshal du byung ba bcu pa'o/ /

“Then, when the time for the birth of the enlightening being had come, the diamond ground in front of Lady Maya split and a great jewel lotus called Calyx Arrayed with All Jewels emerged. Its calyx was unsurpassed diamond, surrounded by all the finest jewels in a dazzling array. It had as many petals as atoms in ten buddha-lands, all evenly arrayed, made of various jewels fringed with pure wish-fulfilling gems, lined with innumerable filaments the colors of all jewels, draped with nets of countless jewels, covered with heaps of indestructible diamonds, surrounded by celestial chiefs, sprinkled by showers from fragrant clouds by the water spirits, surrounded by the chief demigods clasping celestial flowers in their hands, with the chief celestial musicians appearing singing eulogies of the enlightening being’s past service of buddhas, the chief titans prostrating themselves in respect, freed of arrogance, pride, and conceit, the chief birds trailing jewel streamers, adorning the sky, the chief celestial choristers looking on joyfully singing songs encouraging the enlightening beings, the chief serpents showering adornments, proclaiming their joy. This was the tenth miracle attending the birth of the enlightening being in the Lumbini grove.

rigs kyi bu/ byang chub sems dpa' skye ba'i rnam par 'phrul pa bcu po de dag lum+bi ni'i nags tshal du byung bar gyur nas de'i rjes la byang chub sems dpa' 'od tshad med bsam gyis mi khyab pa mnga' ba/ blta na btang mi bra ba zhig lha mo sgyu ma'i rum nas bltams te nam mkha'i dbyings rum nas nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor shar ba lta; sprin gyi tshogs rum nas glog gi phreng ba 'gyur ba lta/ ri chen po'i spo rum nas nyi ma shar kha'i sprin go lta/ mun pa stug rum nas sgron ma chen po byung ba lta ste/ mngon par bltams par gyur to/ / de ltar byang chub sems dpa' lha mo sgyu ma'i lus las gzugs brnyan ltar bstan pa'i chos nyid dang / rmi lam ltar bstan pa'i chos nyid dang / sgyu ma'i rnam pa'i gzugs rnam par dmigs pa ltar bstan pa'i chos nyid dang / 'gro ba dang 'ong ba med pa'i chos nyid dang / skye ba dang 'gag pa med pa'i 'od rnam par dmigs pa yongs su bstan pa'i chos nyid kyis mngon par 'byung ba yongs su bstan to/ /

“After these ten miracles had appeared, the enlightening being, manifesting an effusion of inconceivable, measureless light, emerged from Lady Maya’s abdomen, like the sun from the horizon, like lightning from the clouds, like the diffusion of the dawn from the mountains, like a great torch from the darkness. Thus did the enlightening being manifest emergence from the abdomen of Lady Maya, by the nature of manifestation of illusory form, by the nature of noncoming, by the nature of manifestation of appearance to the world without origin or extinction.

rigs kyi bu/ de ltar kho mo ni/ lum+bi ni'i nags tshal 'di na gnas shing / bcom ldan 'das rnam par snang mdzad kyi sku tshe'i rnam par 'phrul pa rgya mtsho la lta zhing khong du chud par byed de/ rigs kyi bu/ kho mo gling bzhi bskal pa dang ldan pa 'di na bcom ldan 'das rnam par snang mdzad kyi sku tshe'i rnam par 'phrul ba la lta zhing khong du chud par bya bar gnas pa de bzhin du stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad kyi gling bzhi pa thams cad kyi 'dzam bu'i gling bye ba phrag brgya thams cad na'ang bcom ldan 'das rnam par snang mdzad kyi sku tshe'i rnam par 'phrul ba bye ba phrag brgya la lta zhing khong du chud par byed do/ / stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du 'dus pa'i rdul shin tu phra ba'i khongs su chud pa'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing thams cad rdul shin tu phra ba la 'jug pa'i ye shes kyis khong du chud pa dag tu yang sems kyi skad cig re re la sems kyis khong du chud par bya ba re res bcom ldan 'das rnam par snang mdzad kyi sku tshe'i rnam par 'phrul ba sangs rgyas kyi zhing gi rdul shin tu phra ba snyed la lta zhing khong du chud par byed do/ / de'i 'og ma'i sems kyis sangs rgyas kyi zhing rdul shin tu phra ba rnams kyi khong du chud pa'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing de dag las sangs rgyas kyi zhing re rer yang de dang mnyam pa'i byang chub sems dpa' skye ba'i rnam par 'phrul pa la lta zhing khong du chud par byed de/ tshul de lta bus sangs rgyas kyi zhing thams cad kyi rdul shin tu phra ba'i khongs su chud pa'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing re re dag tu yang byang chub sems dpa' skye ba'i rnam par 'phrul pa thams cad la lta zhing khong du chud par byed kyang rdul shin tu phra ba thams cad kyi rdul re re la zhing gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pa'i mtha' rnyed par mi rung ngo/ / zhing thams cad kyi zhing re rer byang chub sems dpa' skye ba gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pa'i yang mu rnyed par mi rung ngo/ / ji ltar kho mo 'jig rten gyi khams 'di'i byang chub sems dpa'i skye ba rnam par 'phrul pa thams cad la lta zhing khong du chud par byed pa de bzhin du phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams mtha' dang dbus med pa dang / rdul shin tu phra ba thams cad la'ang sems kyi skad cig re re'i sems kyis khong du chud par bya ba re re la byin gyi rlabs rgyun mi 'chad pa'i tshul gyis byang chub sems dpa' skye ba'i rnam par 'phrul ba thams cad la lta zhing khong du chud par byed do/ / de skad ces smras pa dang /

“Thus did I perceive the oceans of miracles attending the birth of the Blessed Vairocana as I sojourned here in the Lumbini grove. And just as I perceived the oceans of miracles attending the birth of this Vairocana in this world, in the same way I perceived the oceans of miracles attending the birth of Vairocana Buddha in all worlds in this universe. And just as I perceived the billions of miracles attending the birth of Vairocana Buddha in all worlds in this universe, so also did I perceive, in each mental moment, with each penetration of consciousness, as many miracles attending the birth of Vairocana Buddha as atoms in a buddha-world, in the worlds within all the atoms in all universes accessible to knowledge penetrating the atoms in all buddha-lands. In the next moment I perceived, in each of the buddha-lands in the atoms of a thousand buddha-lands, an equal number of miracles attending the birth of the enlightening being. In this way, in each of the buddha-lands in the atoms of each buddha-land, I perceived all the miracles attending the birth of the enlightening being, without reaching their end. I did not reach the end of the succession of buddha-lands in each and every atom, or of the miracles attending the birth of the enlightening being in each and every one of those buddha-lands. And just as I perceived all the miracles attending the birth of the enlightening being in this world, so also did I perceive, in each moment of consciousness, all aspects of all the miracles attending the birth of the enlightening being in infinitely many worlds in the ten directions, by application of unceasing power.”

tshong dpon gyi bu nor bzang gis lum+bi ni'i nags tshal gyis lha mo gzi brjid kyi dkyil 'khor bzang pos dga' ba'i dpal la 'di skad ces smras so/ / 'phags ma/ khyod kyis byang chub sems dpa'i rnam par thar pa bskal pa tshad med par dmigs pa thams cad du byang chub sems dpa'i skye ba rnam par 'phrul ba yongs su ston pa 'di rnyed nas yun ji srid cig lags/
Then Sudhana asked the goddess, “How long ago did you attain this enlightening liberation of vision of the miracle of birth of enlightening beings in all objects over incalculable eons?”

smras pa/ rigs kyi bu/ sngon 'das pa'i dus bskal pa sangs rgyas kyi zhing bye ba'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed 'das pa'i pha rol de'i yang pha snga zhig tu 'jig rten gyi khams kun nas rin po che zhes bya bar bskal ba mnyam par bzhag pa zhes bya ba sangs rgyas bye ba khrag khrig brgyad cu byung ba la de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas dbang phyug gi yon tan gzhan gyis mi thub pa'i rgyal mtshan zhes bya ba/ mkhyen pa dang zhabs su ldan pa/ bde bar gshegs pa/ 'jig rten mkhyen pa/ bla na med pa/ skyes bu 'dul ba'i kha lo sgyur ba/ lha dang mi rnams kyi ston pa sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das 'jig rtan du byung ngo/ / rigs kyi bu/ 'jig rten gyi khams kun nas rin po che zhes bya ba der gling bzhi pa dbu ma rgyan sna tshogs kyi 'od ces bya ba byung ste/ gling bzhi pa de'i 'dzam bu'i gling gi dbus su rgyal po'i gnas ri rab rnam par dag pa'i rgyan gyi rgyal mtshan zhes bya ba byung ste/ rgyal po'i gnas der rgyal po rin po che 'od 'phro ba'i mig gi 'od ces bya ba byung ngo/ / rgyal po rin po che 'od 'phro ba'i mig gi 'od de la btsun mo rab tu dga' ba'i 'od la dbang sgyur ba zhes bya ba mnga'o/ / rigs kyi bu/ dper na/ gling bzhi pa skal pa dang ldan pa 'di'i 'dzam bu'i gling du lha mo sgyu ma bcom ldan 'das rnam par snang mdzad kyi yum du gyur pa de bzhin du de'i tshe de'i dus na gling bzhi pa rgyan sna tshogs kyi 'od kyi 'dzam bu gling du yang rab tu dga' ba'i 'od la dbang sgyur ba zhes bya ba yang bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa dbang phyug gi yon tan gzhan gyis mi thub pa'i rgyal mtshan gyi yum du gyur te/ sangs rgyas bye ba khrag khrig phrag brgyad cu bskal pa'i dang po la byung ste/ thog mar byung ba'i bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa dbang phyug gi yon tan gzhan gyis mi thub pa'i rgyal mtshan gyi yum du gyur te/ rigs kyi bu/ lha mo rab tu dga' ba'i 'od la dbang sgyur ba de byang chub sems dpa' skye ba'i dus la bab pa dang / bud med khrag khrig brgya stong phrag nyi shu dang lhan cig tu bza' shing gi ra ba chen po 'od kyi dkyil 'khor gser gyi me tog ces bya ba der phyin te/ dbang phyug gi yon tan gzhan gyis mi thub pa'i rgyal mtshan gzhon nu de yang byang chub sems dpa' skye ba'i rnam par 'phrul ba bsam gyis mi khyab pas der bltams so/ / de'i tshe bza' shing gi ra ba chen po 'od kyi dkyil 'khor gser gyi me tog ces bya ba de'i dbus su pho brang brtsegs pa rin po che sna tshogs bzang po las brtsegs pa zhes bya ba byung ste/ pho brang brtsegs pa de'i nang du shing 'dod pa thams cad 'byin pa'i yal ga la 'ju ste lha mo rab tu dga' ba'i 'od la dbang sgyur ba las/ bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa dbang phyug gi yon tan gzhan gyis mi thub pa'i rgyal mtshan bltams so/ /

She replied, “In the past, as many eons ago as atoms in ten million buddha-lands and even more, there was a buddha named Invincible Paragon of Virtue who emerged in a world called Ubiquitous Jewels in an age in which eighty decillion buddhas appeared. In that world there was a central group of four continents called Dazzling Array of Lights, in the southern continent of which was a capital city called Lofty Banner of Pure Adornments, where there was a king named Jewel Flame Eye Light, whose wife was named Queen of Joyous Light. Just as Maya is the mother of the Buddha Vairocana here, that queen was the mother of that buddha Invincible Paragon of Virtue in that world at that time, the first of the eighty decillion buddhas of the age. When the time for the birth of the enlightening being came, the queen went to a park called Circle of Lights of Golden Flowers, accompanied by twenty decillion women, and there gave birth to the child Invincible Paragon of Virtue, by the inconceivable miracle of the birth of an enlightening being. In the middle of that park was a tower called Brilliant Heap of Pure Jewels, and this was where that queen gave birth to that buddha, holding on to the limb of a wish-fulfilling tree.

de'i tshe bcom ldan 'das de bltams khar ma ma dri ma med pa skyed pa'i 'od ces bya ba sta gon du gnas gnas te/ byang chub sems dpa' de bltams par gyur ma thag tu 'jig rten gyi dbang po rnams kyis spos dri shin tu zhim pa'i spos chu'i bum pa me tog dri zhim zhing yid du 'ong ba sna tshogs mngon par 'thor bas sku bsil te/ de la tshul dang mthun pa'i mchod pa bsam gyis mi khyab la grangs med pa mchog tu bya bas mchod nas ma ma dri ma med pa skyed pa'i 'od kyi bar du bzhag go /ma ma des byang chub sems dpa' pang du blangs ma thag tu de'i mod la ma ma de dga' ba dang / mos ba'i shugs chen po thob par gyur nas byang chub sems dpa'i ting nge 'dzin yul kun tu lta ba zhes bya ba thob par gyur to/ / de thob par gyur ma thag tu des phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams na bzhugs pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa tshad med pa de dag thams cad kyang mthong bar gyur to/ / byang chub sems dpa'i rnam par thar pa bskal pa tshad med pa dmigs pa thams cad du byang chub sems dpa'i skye bas rnam par 'phrul pa yongs su ston pa 'di la 'ang shin tu phra ba'i tshul gyis zhugs par gyur te/ de ni/ dper na/ ma'i mngal du zhugs ma thag pa'i rnam par shes pa lta bu'o/ / rnam par thar pa de thos par gyur pas kyang des de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad skye ba'i rnam par 'brul pa yang dag par lta ba'i smon lam chen po yang mngon par bsgrubs so/ /

“At the time of the buddha’s birth there was a wet nurse named Light of Purity standing by, and as soon as the buddha was born, the world leaders bathed him with fragrant water, presented countless suitable offerings of the finest quality, then handed him over to the nurse Light of Purity. As soon as she took him into her hands, the nurse was flooded with great joy and attained an enlightening concentration called ‘sphere of the universal eye,’ by the attainment of which she saw countless buddhas in various worlds in the ten directions, and this enlightening liberation of vision of the miracle of birth of enlightening beings in all objects over countless ages subtly entered into her, just as the consciousness of the embryo enters the abdomen of the mother on the day of conception. By attaining this liberation, she accomplished the great vow to see the miracle of birth of all buddhas.

rigs kyi bu/ de la ji snyam du sems/ de'i tshe de'i dus na byang chub sems dpa'i ma ma dri ma med pa skyed pa'i 'od ces bya ba byung bar gyur pa de gzhan zhig yin pa snyam du sems na ni/ khyod kyis de ltar mi blta ste/ kho mo ni/ de'i tshe de'i dus na byang chub sems dpa'i ma ma dri ma med pa skyed pa'i 'od ces bya bar gyur to/ / rigs kyi bu/ de la ji snyam du sems de'i tshe de'i dus na bud med khrag khrig brgya stong phrag nyi shu byung bar gyur pa de dag gzhan dag cig yin pa snyam du sems na yang de ltar mi lta ste/ lha mo khrag khrig brgya stong phrag nyi shu po lum+bi ni'i nags tshal na gnas pa kho mo'i 'khor du gyur pa 'di dag yin no/ / rigs kyi bu/ de la ji snyam du sems/ de'i tshe de'i dus na dbang phyug gi yon tan gzhan gyis mi thub pa'i rgyal mtshan gzhon nu'i yum rab tu dga' ba'i 'od la dbang sgyur ba zhes bya ba byung ba de gzhan zhig yin pa snyam du sems na'ang de ltar mi blta ste/ lha mo sgyu ma 'di ni/ de'i tshe de'i dus na rab tu dga' ba'i 'od la dbang sgyur ba zhes bya ba'i lha mor gyur to/ / rigs kyi bu/ de la ji snyam du sems/ de'i tshe de'i dus na rgyal po rin po che 'od 'phro ba'i mig gi 'od ces bya ba byung ba de gzhan zhig yin pa snyam na'ang de ltar mi blta ste/ rgyal po zas gtsang ma 'di ni/ de'i dus na rgyal po rin po che 'od 'phro ba'i mig gi 'od ces bya bar gyur to/ / rigs kyi bu/ de ltar kho mo ni/ de phyin chad du bcom ldan 'das rnam par snang mdzad kyi byang chub sems dpa'i skye ba'i rnam par 'phrul pa rgya mtsho la lta zhing khong du chud par byed pa dang / sems can rnam par 'dul ba'i khyu mchog gi mthus rnam par 'phrul ba rgya mtsho la lta zhing khong du chud par byed pa dang / skad cig thams cad du bral bar ma gyur to/ /

“Now, who do you think the enlightening being’s nurse Light of Purity at that time was? It was none other than I myself who was the nurse Light of Purity. And who do you think the twenty decillion women were? They were none other than the twenty decillion goddesses who live here in the Lumbini grove, my companions. And who do you think was Queen of Joyous Light, mother of the child Invincible Paragon of Virtue? It was none other than Lady Maya here. And who was the king Jewel Flame Eye Light? It was none other than this king Shuddhodana. From that time on I was never separated from the Blessed Vairocana, by entry into the ocean of miracles of his births as an enlightening being, and entry into the ocean of miraculous manifestations of his power to guide sentient beings, in every moment of awareness.

rigs kyi bu/ kho mo mi mjed kyi 'jig rten gyi khams 'di na bcom ldan 'das rnam par snang mdzad kyi smon lam rgya mtsho 'byams klas pa las byung ba'i de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi sangs rgyas kyi zhing rgya mtsho rdul shin tu phra ba thams cad na yod pa la sems kyi skad cig thams cad du rdul shin tu phra ba thams cad la yongs su 'dul ba'i ye shes kyi mig gis lta zhing khong du chud par byed de/ sangs rgyas kyi zhing de dag tu de bzhin gshegs pa byung brgya mtsho dag kyang lta zhing khong du chud par byed la; de bzhin gshegs pa de dag gi byang chub sems dpa' skye ba'i rnam par 'phrul pa rgya mtsho chen po dag la lta zhing khong du chud par byed pa de bzhin du phyogs bcu'i de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi byang chub sems dpa' skye ba'i rnam par 'phrul brgya mtsho dang / sems can rnam par 'dul ba'i khyu mchog gi mthu phyung bas rnam par 'phrul ba rgya mtsho thams cad la'ang sems kyi skad cig thams cad du lta zhing khong du chud par byed do/ / ji ltar stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams 'dir rdul shin tu phra ba 'byams klas pa thams cad gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pa la 'jug pas byang chub sems dpa' skye ba ma nor par mngon du gyur te/ sangs rgyas kyi yon tan la zhugs par gyur pa de bzhin du phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams sangs rgyas kyi zhing brjod du med pa bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong phrag bcu'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed kyi rdul shin tu phra ba 'byams klas pa thams cad kyi khongs su chud pa'i zhing rgya mtsho thams cad la'ang sangs rgyas 'jug ste/ de dag tu'ang sangs rgyas rgya mtsho shin tu yangs pa la 'jug go /sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag byang chub sems dpar gyur pa'i byang chub sems dpa' 'byung ba'i rnam par 'phrul pa rnams kyang mngon du gyur par blta'o/ / de bzhin gshegs par gyur nas mchod par byed do/ / de bzhin gshegs pa de dag las kyang chos bstan pa nyan to/ / chos la yang gnyer ba'i chos kyis nan tan byed do/ /

“Furthermore, just as in this world I perceived the oceans of lands of Vairocana and the buddhas born of the ocean of the totality of great vows in every moment of thought in all atoms by the eye of knowledge penetrating all atoms, and perceived the ocean of manifestations of buddhas in those lands, and perceived the ocean of miracles of births of those buddhas as enlightening beings, in the same way, in every mental moment I perceived the oceans of miracles of births as enlightening beings of infinite buddhas in the ten directions. And just as in this universe, by successive penetration of all atoms, I perceived the buddha-qualities of complete perfect buddhas as they were being born as enlightening beings, in the same way I perceived oceans of lands in the atoms of untold decillions of buddha-lands in the ten directions, and perceived the vast oceans of buddhas therein, saw those buddhas as they were miraculously being born as enlightening beings, paid reverence to them as buddhas, listened to those buddhas’ teachings, and practice in accord with their teaching.”

de nas lum+bi ni'i nags tshal gyi lha mo gzi brjid kyi dkyil 'khor bzang pos dga' ba'i dpal gyis de'i tshe byang chub sems dpa'i rnam par thar pa bskal pa tshad med par dmigs pa thams cad du byang chub sems dpa'i skye bas rnam par 'phrul pa yongs su ston pa 'di gsal bar bstan pa'i phyir sangs rgyas kyi byin gyi rlabs kyis phyogs bcur rnam par bltas te tshigs su bcad pa 'di dag smras so/ /

Then Sutejomandalaratishri, goddess of the Lumbini grove, elucidating this enlightening liberation of vision of the miracle of birth of enlightening beings over countless eons, looked over the ten directions by the power of Buddha and spoke these verses:

rim gro bskyed cing nga la gang 'dri ba [?]/ / de dag bdag las rgyal ba'i sras nyon cig / rgyal ba'i spyod yul blta dga' zhi ba ste/ / rgyu dang rkyen gyis tshul gyis rnam par bstan/ /
zhing rnams bye ba'i rdul phran rab snyed kyi/ / sngon gyi bskal pa bsam gyis mi khyab dran/ / bskal pa'i ming ni snga phyi mnyam zhes bya/ / de la rgyal ba bye ba brgyad cu byung / /
bskal pa'i dang por de bzhin gshegs byung ba/ / dbang phyug yon tan mi thub rgyal mtshan no/ / nags tshal dam pa gser mdog me tog tu/ / mgon po de 'khrungs bdag gis mthong bar gyur/ /
ming du dri med skyed pa'i 'od ces bya/ / de yi ma ma mkhas par bdag gyur te/ / bltams ma thag tu gser mdog dam pa'i 'od/ / 'jig rten dbang pos bdag gis pang du bzhag /
gang zag dam pa pang du bzhag tshe yang / / de yi spyi gtsug blta bar mi nus te/ / bsam yas de la g.yas dang g.yon du yang / / bltas shing mtha' rnyed mthong bar ma gyur to/ /
mtshan rab bzang pos de ni yongs su brgyan/ / dri med de sku blta na rab sdug ste/ / rin chen gzugs 'dra bdag gis mthong gyur nas/ / dga' ba'i shugs drag mtshungs med rnam par 'phel/ /
de yi yon tan dpag yas sems sems nas/ / kho mo'i bsod nams rgya mtsho dpag med 'phel/ / de yi rnam 'phrul rgya mtsho mthong gyur nas/ / rgya chen byang chub sems kyang skyes par gyur/ /
rgyal ba'i legs pa rgya mtsho dga' smon nas/ / smon lam rgya mtsho bdag gis rab tu bskyed/ / 'byams klas zhing rnams thams cad rnam par sbyangs/ / dan song lam rnam kun kyang rnam par bzlog /
zhing rnams 'byams klas kun gyi bde gshegs rnams/ / ma byon bsam gyis mi khyab mchod pa dang / / sems can sdug bsngal rnam par dgrol ba'i phyir/ / smon lam rgya mtsho kho mos btab par gyur/ /
mgon po de las bdag gis chos thos nas/ / rnam thar dam pa'i dkyil 'khor 'di yang thob/ / bskal pa zhing rnams bye ba'i rdul snyed du/ / spyad pa spyad de de yang rnam par sbyangs/ /
de la mgon po ji snyed byung gyur pa; ; de dag ma lus bdag gis kun kyang mchod/ / rnam thar rgya mtsho 'di ni sbyong byed cing / / de dag bstan pa kho mos yongs su bzung / /
zhing rnams bye ba'i rdul phran rab snyed kyi/ / stobs bcu mnga' ba ji snyed 'das byung ba/ / de dag chos kyi 'khor lo kho mos bzung / / rnam thar dkyil 'khor 'di yang rab tu bsgoms/ /
sangs rgyas zhing gi rdul phran ji snyed pa; ; rdul rtse 'byams klas kun la rnam par mthong / / rdul phran re re la yang rgya mtsho'i zhing / / sngon chad rgyal bas sbyangs pa rab tu mthong / /
zhing rnams 'byams klas de dag kun tu yang / / mgon po thugs rgyud gcig la bsam yas pa'i/ / rlam 'phrul yangs pa yongs su ston mdzad cing / / nags tshal mchog tu 'khrungs gyur bdag gis mthong / /
rgyal ba la la zhing rnams la la na/ / byang chub 'dam par 'tshang rgya thugs dgongs shing / / dga' ldan 'jig rten gnas na bzhugs pa yang / / zhing rnams bye ba bsam gyis mi khyab po/ /
zhing rnams rgya mtsho'i dbyings su rnam 'phrul ba/ / shin tu yangs pa skye pa'ang bdag gis mthong / / na chung dam pa'i tshogs kyi dbus bzhugs shing / / mgon po chos rnams ston pa'ang de bzhin mthong / /
zhing rnams bye ba'i rdul phyan rang snyed kyis/ / dpa' bo sems kyi skad cig re re la/ / mngon par byung zhing shing rgyal drung gshegs dang / / sangs rgyas spyod yul yangs pa ston pa mthong / /
zhing gcig rdul la bsam gyis mi khyab bar/ / yul rnams gzhan dang gzhan dag ston mdzad pas/ / 'gro rgyud sems can sdug bsngal 'grol mdzad cing / / mi gtso rnam par 'tshang rgya bdag gis mthong / /
rdul phran re re'i rtse la mi zad pa'i/ / rang byung 'khor lo rab tu bskor mdzad cing / / dbyangs rnams rgya mtsho mi zad sgrog mdzad pas/ / chos sprin rgya chen char 'bebs mdzad pa mthong / /
'gro pa kun la rnam pa du mar yang / / skad cig re rer mya ngan 'das ston pa/ / zhing rnams bye ba'i rdul phran rab snyed kyi/ / sangs rgyas zhing gcig rdul la bdag gis mthong / /
rdul gcig bltas kyang zhing rnams rgya mtsho dang / / rgyal ba 'byung ba ji snyed kun kyang mthong / / tshe rabs kun tu lus mang khrag khrig gis / de dag mchod pa'i don du nye bar phyin/ /
zhing tshul rgya mtsho bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i/ / 'gro rgyud mi bzad ji snyed yod pa yi/ / 'gro ba kun la mngon du kho mo ni/ / chos sprin yangs pa'i char yang rab tu 'bebs/ /
rgyal sras kho mos bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i/ / rnam thar dkyil 'khor dam pa 'di shes kyi/ / bskal pa bye ba khrag khrig bsam yas su/ / thams cad bstan par kho mos nus re skan/ /

Son of Buddha, listen respectfully To what I say to your question: The realm of buddhas, silent and hard to see, I explain in terms of cause.
I remember unthinkable eons ago, past as many eons As atoms in a hundred million lands, An age in which there were Eight decillion buddhas.
Invincible Paragon of Virtue Was the first of those buddhas; I saw him being born In the wonderful park of golden flowers.
I was then his wet nurse, By the name of Light of Purity, wise; The world guardians put him in my arms When he was born, shining with golden light.
Taking that supreme person in my arms, I could not see the top of his head; Looking at his inconceivable body, I could not see any bounds.
Adorned by marks of greatness, pure, His body was beautiful to behold; Seeing him, like a jewel figurine, Incomparable joy welled up in me.
Thinking of his measureless virtues, An infinite sea of felicity grew in me; And seeing his ocean of miracles, I was inspired to seek enlightenment.
Seeking the oceans of qualities of buddhas, My ocean of vows grew; All lands were purified, And all paths of miserable states were closed.
To serve the inconceivable buddhas To come in all lands, And to liberate suffering beings, My ocean of vows emerged.
Hearing the teachings of those saviors, I attained this excellent sphere of liberation, Having carried out practice to purify enlightenment For as many eons as atoms in a hundred million lands.
I served all the buddhas Who appeared over the ages, And remembered their teachings, Purifying this ocean of liberation.
There were as many buddhas in the past As atoms in a hundred million lands; Remembering their cycles of teaching, I developed this sphere of liberation.
Seeing all atoms In a buddha-land, In every atom I see oceans of lands Purified by the Buddha.
In those lands I see Guides Being born in the best of groves, In an instant manifesting Inconceivable vast miracles.
I see the leaders, in whatever land, Seeking supreme enlightenment, Living in heaven, or appearing to be born, In inconceivable decillions of lands.
I see them being born with great miracles, In hundreds of oceans of lands, Attended by the best of women, Expounding the Teaching.
I see as many buddhas as atoms in a hundred million In one moment of consciousness, Showing the world in many ways Tranquillity in an instant.
I see all the births of buddhas, Looking into the oceans of lands in an atom; In life after life, in millions of bodies, I arrive at compassion in their service.
In inconceivable oceans of lands, In the endless realms where they appeared, In all those worlds I appear before them And make the clouds of Teaching rain.
Child of Buddha, I know This inconceivable, exalted liberation, Which could not be all seen Even in inconceivable decillions of eons.

rigs kyi bu/ kho mos byang chub sems dpa' rnam par thar pa bskal pa tshad med par dmigs pa thams cad du byang chub sems dpa'i skye bas rnam par 'phrul ba yongs su ston pa 'di shes par zad na/ kho mo byang chub sems dpa' sems kyi skad cig re re la bskal pa thams cad du zhugs pa'i mngal nas yongs su byung ba'i sems dang ldan pa/ chos kyi tshul thams cad nges par rtogs pa'i skye ba rab tu ston pa/ de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad mchod pa'i smon lam gyis bsam pa yongs su skyed pa; sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar bya ba la rab tu gzhol ba/ sems can thams cad kyi rigs dang / rgyud kyi lam yongs su bstan pa la gzugs brnyan lta bur gyur pa/ de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi zhabs kyi drung du pad+mo'i nang nas skye ba/ 'gro ba thams cad yongs su smin par bya ba'i dus la mkhas pa/ sems can thams cad gdul ba la mngon par mos shing cher skye bas rnam par 'phrul pa yongs su ston pa/ zhing 'byams klas pa thams cad du rnam par 'phrul ba'i sprin yongs su ston pa/ 'gro ba thams cad kyi rgyud du skye ba dang / rigs su gzugs brnyan byung bar gyur pa de dag gi spyod pa shes pa'am/ yon tan brjod par nus re skan/

“I just know this enlightening liberation of vision of the miracles of birth of enlightening beings in all objects over countless ages—how can I know the practice or tell the virtues of the enlightening beings whose minds are the sources of all eons from moment to moment of consciousness, who manifest birth by meditation on all the principles of the Teaching, who are determined to serve all buddhas, who are intent on realizing all buddha-teachings, who are like reflections appearing to be born in all races, who are born spontaneously in lotus calyxes in the presence of all buddhas, who have higher knowledge of proper timing in developing all beings, who manifest miracles of birth oriented toward guiding all beings, who show multitudes of miracles in all lands, who are reflected in all conditions and classes and families of beings?

song rigs kyi bu/ grong khyer chen po ser skya'i gnas 'di na shAkya'i bu mo go pa zhes bya ba 'dug gi /de'i gan du song la ji ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems can yongs su smin par bya ba'i phyir 'khor ba'i 'khor bar bya ba dris shig /
“In the city of Kapilavastu lives a girl of the Shakya clan named Gopa. Go ask her how an enlightening being should live in the world for enlightening development.”

de nas tshong dpon gyi bu nor bzang gis lum+bi ni'i nags tshal gyis lha mo gzi brjid kyi dkyil 'khor bzang pos dga' ba'i dpal gyi rkang pa gnyis la spyi bos phyag 'tshal te lum+bi ni'i nags tshal gyi lha mo gzi brjid kyi dkyil 'khor bzang pos dga' ba'i dpal la lan brgya stong du mar g.yas phyogs su bskor ba byas nas yang dang yang bltas te lum+bi ni'i nags tshal gyi lha mo gzi brjid kyi dkyil 'khor bzang pos dga' ba'i dpal gyi drung nas song ngo/ /
Then Sudhana paid his respects and left the goddess of the Lumbini grove.
shin tu rgyas pa chen po'i mdo/ sangs rgyas phal bo che zhes bya ba las/ sdong pos brgyan po'i le'u ste/ bam po brgya bdun pa/
[shAkya'i bu mo go pa ]
Gopa

de nas tshong dpon gyi bu nor bzang lum+bi ni'i nags tshal gyi lha mo gzi brjid kyi dkyil 'khor bzang pos dga' ba'i dpal gyi drung nas song ste grong khyer chen po ser skya'i gnas gang na ba der phyin nas byang chub sems dpa'i rnam par thar pa bskal pa tshad med par dmigs pa thams cad du byang chub sems dpa'i skye bas rnam par 'phrul pa yongs su ston pa de nyid sgom pa dang / khong du chud par bya ba dang / rgya cher bya ba dang / nan tan du bya ba dang / shin tu sbyangs pa dang / yongs su bsam pa dang / rnam par dbye ba byed cing / byang chub sems dpa' yang dag par 'gro ba'i khang pa chos kyi dbyings rab tu snang ba'i 'od gang na ba der song ngo; /der 'gro ba'i tshe byang chub sems dpa' yongs su 'gro ba'i khang pa'i lha mo mya ngan med pa'i dpal zhes bya ba khyim gyi lha mo stong phrag bcu dang bcas pas bsu nas tshong dpon gyi bu nor bzang la 'di skad ces smras so/ /

Then Sudhana left the Lumbini goddess and went to the city of Kapilavastu; cultivating that enlightening liberation of vision of miracles of birth of enlightening beings in all objects over countless ages, entering into it, expanding it, practicing it, purifying it, mastering it, contemplating it, examining it, he made his way to the meeting hall of enlightening beings reflecting the cosmos. When he went there, a goddess of the enlightening beings’ meeting hall named Sorrowless, together with ten thousand house goddesses, appeared before Sudhana and said to him,

skyes bu chen po shes rab dang ye shes chen pos rnam par gnon pa/ byang chub sems dpa'i rnam par thar pa bsam gyis mi khyab pa sgom pa la lhag par dmigs pa'i smon lam gyi sems dang ldan pa/ chos yangs pa'i gzhal med khang gi spyod yul la spyod pa/ chos kyi grong khyer du mngon par gzhol ba/ byang chub sems dpa'i thabs kyi tshul mtha' yas pas sems can gdul ba la 'jug pa rgyun mi gcod pa/ de bzhin gshegs pa'i yon tan rgya mtsho snang ba rab tu thob pa/ 'gro ba thams cad rnam par gdul ba la rab tu snang ba'i spobs pa dang ye shes mngon du gyur pa/ sems can thams cad kyi spyod pa shes pa'i lus kyis 'gro zhing rjes su 'brang bar bya ba'i spyod pa la mngon du gyur pa'i sems dang ldan pa/ 'gro ba thams cad kyi sems kyi dga' ba rgya mtsho'i shugs rnam par 'phel bar bya ba'i smon lam dang ldan pa/ de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi chos khong du chud par bya ba'i lam du zhugs pa khyod byon pa legs so/ /mig phyir glan pa med pas spyod pa dang spyod lam zab cing rnam par dag pa'i spyod yul can khyod la bltas na/ khyod ni/ ring po mi thogs par de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku dang / gsung dang / thugs kyi rgyan rnam par dag pa bla na med pa rab tu thob ste mtshan dang dpe byad bzang pos rab tu brgyan pa'i lus dang / stobs bcu'i ye shes snang bas brgyan pa'i sems kyis 'jig rten du rnam par spyod par 'gyur ro/ /khyod kyi brtson 'grus dang / rnam par gnon pa la bltas na/ khyod ni/ ring po mi thogs par dus gsum gyi de bzhin gshegs pa mngon du gyur par mthong ba dang ldan zhing de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi chos kyi sprin yongs su 'dzin pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i bsam gtan dang / rnam par thar pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / snyoms par 'jug pa'i chos zhi ba dang ldan pa'i gzhal med khang gi dga' ba myong ba dang / sangs rgyas kyi rnam par thar pa zab mor chud par 'gyur ro/ /de
