yang de ltar khyod dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyi drung du 'gro ba dang / blta ba dang / bsnyen bkur ba dang / gdams ngag ma nor bar blang ba dang / de'i yon tan la nan tan du bya ba'i tshul la brtson par byed pas yongs su mi skyo/ phyir mi ldog /sgyid lug par mi 'gyur te/ khyod la bgegs sam; bar du gcod pa'am/ sgrib pa gang gis kyang mi tshugs te/ bdud dam bdud kyi ris su gtogs pa'i lha rnams kyang mdun na gnas pa med pa de'i phyir khyod ni/ ring po mi thogs par sems can thams cad dga' bar byed par 'gyur ro/ /de skad ces smras pa dang /

“Welcome is the great person with wisdom, knowledge, and courage, who roams the grounds of the vast palace of reality intent on cultivating the inconceivable liberations of enlightening beings, in the presence of the city of truth, ceaselessly entering into the endless methods of enlightening beings, attaining manifestation of the ocean of virtues of those who realize Thusness, aiming for the knowledge of how to act and speak so as to mature all people, acting and speaking according to knowledge of the behavior of all people, mind oriented toward spiritual practice, committed to increasing the flood of the ocean of joy in the feelings of all beings, on the path of knowledge of the Teaching of all those who arrive at thusness. As I see you, with steady gaze on the pure realm of conduct of profound spiritual practice, before long you will attain perfection of the supreme ornaments of body, speech, and mind of the enlightened, and will act in the world with a body adorned with the marks and embellishments of greatness and a mind adorned with the light of knowledge of the ten powers. As I see your steadfast, energetic exertion, before long you will be furnished with all the requisites for manifesting your being in the presence of all buddhas of past, present, and future; receiving their teachings, experiencing the delight of the tranquil palace of spirituality, with all the meditations, liberations, concentrations, and attainments of enlightening beings, you will see into the profound liberation of buddhas. That is because you do not tire, do not regress, do not feel pain in going to spiritual benefactors, meeting them, associating with them, receiving instructions, and applying the ways to virtue; and you are not overcome by any interference or barrier or obstacle, or by any demon or deity. Therefore you will soon become a source of joy for all beings.”

tshong dpon gyi bu nor bzang gis byang chub sems dpa' yongs su 'gro ba'i khang pa'i lha mo mya ngan med pa'i dpal la 'di skad ces smras so/ /lha mo/ khyod kyis ji skad du smras pa de ltar 'gyur ro/ /lha mo/ kho bo ni/ sems can thams cad kyi nyon mongs pa'i gdung ba rnam par zhi bas dga' bar 'gyur ro/ /sems can thams cad kyi las nyam nga ba'i rnam par smin pa phyir log pa dang / sems can thams cad kyi bde ba 'grub pa dang / sems can thams cad kha na ma tho ba med pa'i las la nan tan du byed pas dga' ba dam pa nyams su myong bar 'gyur ro/ /nam sems can de dag las dang nyon mongs pa rnam pa sna tshogs mi bde ba'i sbyor bas sems rnam par 'khrugs shing ngan song du ltung bar gyur pa'am/ bde ba'i rgyud na gnas kyang lus dang sems kyi sdug bsngal dang / yid mi bde ba sna tshogs nyams su myong bar gyur cing mi dga' bar gnas pa de'i tshe byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyang shin tu ying mi bde bar 'gyur ro/ /lha mo/ 'di lta ste/ dper na/ mi shin tu ngang gis byams pa zhig la bu gcig pa sdug cing yid du 'ong ba zhig bdog par gyur la/ de'i yan lag dang nying lag bcad pa zhig mthong na/ shin tu ngang gis byams pa'i phyir rab tu yid mi bde zhing mi dga' bar 'gyur ro; ;lha mo/ de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' byang chub sems dpa'i spyad pa spyod pa'i tshe yang sems can rnams las dang nyon mongs pa'i dbang gis ngan song gsum gyi rgyud du ltung ba zhig mthong na/ rab tu mi dga' la shin tu nyams mi bde bar 'gyur ro/ /gang gi tshe sems can rnams lus dang / ngag dang / yid kyis legs par spyad pa yang dag par len pa'i rgyus lus zhig nas bde ba'i rgyus mtho ris kyi 'jig rten du skye bar gyur tam/ lha dang mi'i lam gyi rgyud du lus dang sems kyi bde ba nyams su myong ba zhig tu gyur na/ de'i tshe byang chub sems dpa' shin tu bde ba dang ldan zhing nyams bde ba dang / yid dga' ba dang / rab tu spro ba dang / dga' ba'i yid nyams su bde ba dang ldan par 'gyur ro/ /

Then Sudhana said to the goddess Sorrowless, “May it be as you say—I would find supreme joy in extinguishing the burning of all beings’ afflictions, in stopping the development of their evil deeds, in making them all happy, in getting them to act impeccably. Whenever sentient beings are involved in evil deeds and afflictions, with scattered minds, fall into painful or pleasurable states, and experience various forms of physical and mental distress, enlightening beings become most unhappy at that. Just as a doting parent would love its only child and would be most distressed at seeing the child be dismembered, in the same way a practicing enlightening being is most unhappy to see people fallen into miserable states because of compulsion by afflictions in action. Whenever sentient beings live in felicity because of good thoughts, words, and deeds, and experience physical and mental pleasures in celestial and human realms, enlightening beings are delighted and become happy and joyful.

lha mo/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni/ bdag gi don gyi phyir thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du smon cing don du gnyer ba ma yin te/ 'khor ba'i dga' ba dang / bde ba sna tshogs nyams su myong bar bya ba'i phyir ma yin/ 'dod pa'i khams su gtogs pa'i dga' ba rnam pa tha dad pa sna tshogs don du gnyer bas ma yin/ 'du shes dang / sems dang / lta ba phyin ci log tu gyur pa'i dbang gis ma yin/ kun tu sbyor ba dang / 'ching ba dang / bag la nyal ba dang / kun nas 'khor ba'i dbang du gyur pas ma yin/ srid pa dang / lta ba'i dbang du gyur pas ma yin/ sems can sna tshogs dang 'du zhing 'dzi ba'i dga' ba'i 'du shes kyi sems rnam par 'phel bas ma yin/ bsam gtan gyi dga' ba dang / bde ba myong ba la yongs su chags pas ma yin/ sgrib pa sna tshogs kyis bsgribs shing 'khor ba'i rgyud na 'dre ldog pa ma yin gyi/

“Furthermore, enlightening beings do not seek omniscience for their own sake, nor to produce mundane enjoyments and pleasures, nor in search of the various enjoyments of the realm of desire, nor under the compulsion of errors of conception, thought, and view. They live and work in the world without being controlled by fetters, bonds, propensities, or obsessions, without being controlled by craving or views, without their minds being bound up in ideas of mundane enjoyments, without being taken with the taste of pleasure of meditation, without being blocked by mental barriers.

lha mo/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni/ sems can 'khor ba'i rgya mtsho na 'khod cing sdug bsngal dpag tu med pas shin tu mnar ba rnams la snying rje chen po bskyed cing 'gro ba thams cad yongs su bsdu ba'i smon lam chen po mngon par sgrub ste/ de dag ni/ snying rje chen pos smon lam mngon par sgrub pa'i shugs kyis sems can yongs su smin par bya ba dang / gdul ba la brtson zhing / 'khor ba na byang chub sems dpa'i spyad pa spyod par snang ngo/ /de dag ni/ sems can thams cad kyi sgrib pa thams cad rnam par bzlog pa'i don du thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes sgrib pa med pa yongs su tshol zhing / de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad mchod pa dang / bsnyen bkur ba'i smon lam mngon par sgrub bo/ /de dag de bzhin gshegs pa mchod cing rim gror bya ba'i smon lam gyi dbang gis byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pas yongs su skyo ba med de/ de dag byang chub sems dpa'i spyad pa la spyod pa'i tshe kun nas nyon mongs pa'i zhing mthong na/ sangs rgyas kyi zhing thams cad yongs su dag par bya ba'i smon lam mngon par sgrub bo/ /kun nas nyon mongs pa'i zhing yongs su sbyong zhing sems can thams cad kyi skye mched sna tshogs mthong bar gyur pa'i tshe chos kyi sku tha dad pa med cing bla na med pa yongs su dag par bya ba'i phyir smon lam mngon par sgrub bo/ /sems can rnams kyi lus dang / ngag dang / sems kun nas nyon mongs pa dang ldan pa mthong na/ sems can thams cad kyi lus dang / ngag dang / sems kyi rgyan yongs su dag par bya ba'i phyir smon lam mngon par sgrub bo/ /sems can skye mched ma tshang ba dang / sems yongs su ma dag pa mthong na/ sems can thams cad kyi sems dang / spyod pa yongs su sbyong zhing / byang chub sems dpa'i spyad pa la spyod pas yongs su skyo ba med do/ /

“Furthermore, enlightening beings, giving rise to great compassion for sentient beings suffering immeasurable miseries in the ocean of existence, undertake a great vow to care for all beings. They appear carrying out the practice of enlightening beings in the mundane whirl, engaged in the development and guidance of sentient beings, by the force of the power of carrying out the vow of great compassion. They undertake a vow to serve all buddhas in quest of thoroughly unobstructed omniscience for all sentient beings. By mastery of the vow to serve buddhas, they do not tire in enlightening practice. While they carry on enlightening practice, seeing defiled lands they undertake a vow to purify all buddha-lands. While purifying oceans of lands, observing the variety of beings’ states, they undertake a vow to purify the undifferentiated supreme reality body. Seeing sentient beings’ acts, words, and thoughts defiled, they undertake a vow to purify sentient beings’ acts, words, and thoughts. Seeing sentient beings with incompletely purified senses and minds, they carry on enlightening practice tirelessly, completely purifying the mental behavior of all sentient beings.

lha mo/ de ltar byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni/ yongs su skyo ba med pa'i sems kyis byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa mtha' dang dbus med pa la spyod do/ /de ltar spyod pa ni/ lha dang mi'i phun sum tshogs pa yongs su skyed pas lha dang bcas pa'i 'jig rten gyi rgyan du gyur pa yin/ byang chub tu sems bskyed pa la rab tu 'god pa'i phyir pha dang mar gyur pa yin/ byang chub sems dpa'i lam du 'dzud pas ma ma lta bur gyur pa yin/ ngan song gi g.yang sa'i 'jigs pa las srung ba'i phyir lhan cig skyes pa'i lha rtag tu phyi bzhin 'brang blta bur gyur pa yin/ 'khor ba'i rgya mtsho las sgrol ba'i phyir mnyan pa chen po lta bur gyur pa yin/ bdud dang nyon mongs pa'i 'jigs pa thams cad rnam par zlog pa'i phyir skyabs su gyur pa yin/ shin tu bsil ba'i rang bzhin nye bar stob pas gnas su gyur pa yin/ sangs rgyas rgya mtsho thams cad du 'jug par byed pas mu stegs su gyur pa yin/ chos rin po che'i gling du skyel bas mgon byed par gyur pa yin/ sangs rgyas kyi yon tan thams cad kyi me tog gis sems yongs su rgyas par byed pas me tog tu gyur pa yin/ bsod nams dang ye shes kyi 'od yangs pa rab tu 'gyed pas rgyan du gyur pa yin/ kun nas mdzes pas dga' ba dang bde ba dam pa yin/ kha na ma tho ba med pa'i las la nan tan du byed pas phrad na legs pa yin/ yan lag dam pa rnam pa thams cad du yongs su tshang ba'i lus dang ldan pas kun tu bzang ba yin/ blta na mi mthun pa med pas btang mi bra ba'i gzugs dang ldan pa yin/ ye shes kyi 'od zer rab tu 'gyed pa'i phyir 'od byed pa yin/ chos kyi sgron ma 'dzin pa'i phyir snang ba byed pa yin/ byang chub kyi bsam pa yongs su dag par byed pa'i phyir gsal bar byed pa yin/ bdud kyi las rnam par zlog pa'i phyir dmag dpon du gyur pa yin/ shes rab kyi 'od zer gyi dra ba rab tu snang ba 'gyed pa'i phyir nyi mar gyur pa yin/ chos kyi nam mkha' la blo'i zla ba 'char bar byed pas zla bar gyur pa yin/ 'gro ba thams cad du chos kyi sprin chen po'i char 'bebs pas sprin du gyur pa yin te; lha mo/ de ltar nan tan du byed pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni/ sems can thams cad kyi yid du 'ong ba yin no/ /

“Thus enlightening beings are indefatigable in carrying out the infinitely various practice of enlightening beings. Practicing in this way, they become ornaments of heaven and earth, by producing human and celestial welfare. They become parents, because they bring enlightening beings into existence. They become nurses, leading into the path of enlightening beings. They become guardian spirits, giving protection from the danger of falling into bad ways. They become great mariners, ferrying beings across the ocean of the mundane whirl. They become refuges, eliminating the dangers of all demons and afflictions. They become resorts, leading to the ultimate state of coolness. They become landings leading into the ocean of enlightenment. They become guides, leading to the island of spiritual jewels. They become flowers, their minds blooming with the virtues of all buddhas. They become adornments, radiating the light of great virtue and knowledge. They become sources of supreme joy, pleasing in all ways. They become worth visiting, because they act impeccably. They become universally good, perfecting themselves in all respects. They become an ever-welcome sight, never appearing disagreeable. They become light-makers, emanating light beams of knowledge. They become illuminators, holding the lamp of truth. They become radiant, purifying the will for enlightenment. They become warrior chiefs, stopping the acts of demons. They become suns, radiating webs of light rays of wisdom. They become moons, the moon of awareness rising in the sky. They become clouds, showering the Teaching on all beings. Thus do enlightening beings become a joy to all living creatures as they carry out enlightening practice.”

de nas byang chub sems dpa' yongs su 'gro ba'i khang pa'i lha mo mya ngan med pa'i dpal khyim gyi lha mo stong phrag bcu dang bcas pas tshong dpon gyi bu nor bzang la lha rdzas las kyang 'das pa'i me tog dang / phreng ba dang / bdug spos dang / phye ma dang / byug pa dang / phye ma rin po che'i rgyan gyi char yid kyi rang bzhin mngon par phab ste kun nas bskor cing rjes su 'brangs nas byang chub sems dpa'i khang par 'gro ba'i tshe tshigs su bcad pa 'di dag gis mngon par bstod do/ /

Then Sorrowless, goddess of the hall of assembly of enlightening beings, with those ten thousand house goddesses, showered Sudhana with a rain of mentally created flower garlands, aromatic powders, perfumes, and jewelry, all superior to those in the heavens; then, surrounding him, they sang these verses in his praise as he entered the abode of enlightening beings:

byang chub rdzogs par thugs bskyed cing / / sems can kun la thugs brtse bas/ / rgyal ba ye shes nyi ma rnams/ / bar 'ga' zhig na 'jig rten 'byung / /
bskal pa bye ba mang pos kyang / / khyod kyi zhal mthong shin tu dka'/ / 'jig rten ma rig ldongs pa la/ / khyod kyi ye shes nyi chen yin/ /
mi shes rab rib sgrib pa yi/ / 'jig rten phyin ci log gzigs nas/ / thugs rje chen po rab bskyed de/ / khyod ni rang byung nyid du zhugs/ /
khyod ni dgongs pa rnam dag pas/ / sangs rgyas byang chub don du brtson/ / dge bshes bsnyen bkur bstan mdzad cing / / lus srog phangs par mdzad mi mnga'/ /
khyod ni 'jig rten brten mi mnga'/ / 'du 'dzi mi mnga' gnas mi mnga'/ / 'dren pa ma mchis mi brten pas/ / dgongs pa thogs med nam mkha' bzhin/ /
byang chub sems dpa'i spyod mdzad cing / / bsod nams dkyil 'khor 'od bzang bas/ / ye shes sgron ma rab 'gyed pas/ / 'jig rten tshad med kun tu 'char/ /
'jig rten nas kyang 'phags mi mdzad/ / 'jig rten chos kyis yongs mi 'go / chags pa med par 'jig rten spyod/ / mkha' la ser bu ji bzhin no/ /
bskal pa'i me 'bar me bzhin du/ / rtag tu 'bar bas rab tu brtson/ / me lta bu yi brtson 'grus kyis/ / byang chub spyad pa spyod pa mdzad/ /
seng+ge bzhin du shin tu dpa'/ / brtson 'grus rnam par gnon pa brtan/ / ye shes rnam par gnon dang ldan/ / gzhan gyis thub pa med par spyod/ /
chos dbyings rgya mtsho 'di dag ni; ; rgya mtsho'i tshul rnams ji snyed pa/ / der yang dge bshes bsnyen bkur pas/ / dpa' bo khyod ni 'jug par 'gyur/ /

Buddhas emerge in the world at times, Producing the light of knowledge, Resolved on perfect enlightenment Out of compassion for the world.
Hard to get to see Even in millions of eons, You are a sun of knowledge For the world in the darkness of ignorance.
Seeing the world in error, Shrouded in the darkness of nescience, Conceiving great compassion You’ve set out for independence.
With pure intention you seek The enlightenment of buddhas; You serve spiritual benefactors Without concern for yourself.
You are not attached to the world, You are independent and aloof; You do not dwell in the defilement of the world, Your mind is free as the sky.
You practice lofty deeds of enlightenment, Beautiful light of virtues; You appear in the world Radiating lights of knowledge.
You do not leave the world, Nor are you stained by worldly things; You traverse the world unattached, Like the wind through the sky.
Just as the holocaust Burns constantly, With energy like fire You carry on enlightening practice.
Lionlike, great hero, Progressing boldly with steadfast vigor, Imbued with the power of knowledge, You practice undaunted.
All the oceans Of principles in the cosmos You will enter, O Hero, By serving true benefactors.

de nas byang chub sems dpa' yongs su 'gro ba'i khang pa'i lha mo mya ngan med pa'i dpal gyis tshong dpon gyi bu nor bzang la tshigs su bcad pa de dag gis mngon par bstod de/ de 'gro ba'i phyi bzhin chos 'dod pa'i don du 'brang bar gyur to/ / de nas tshong dpon gyi bu nor bzang byang chub sems dpa' yang dag par 'gro ba'i khang pa chos kyi dbyings rab tu snang ba'i 'od du phyin te/ nang du song nas shAkya'i bu mo go pa mthong bar 'dod de kun tu bltas na/ shAkya'i bu mo go pa byang chub sems dpa' yang dag par 'gro ba'i khang pa chos kyi dbyings rab tu snang ba'i 'od kyi dbus na stan rin po che byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyi gnas snang bar byed pa/ gzugs brnyan gyi pad+mo'i snying po can zhig la bud med rgyal po'i rigs su byung ba/ sngon byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa la dge ba'i rtsa ba'i skal ba mnyam pa/ sngon sbyin pa'i yongs su bsdu bas shin tu bsdus pa/ tshig snyan cing 'jam par smra ba'i ngang tshul dang ldan pa/ thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du don mngon du bya bas shin tu bsdus pa/ sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa'i yang dag par sgrub pa la don mthun pas shin tu bzung ba/ snying rje chen po sngon du 'gro bas bu dang bu mo yongs su gzung ba'i tshul bcangs pa/ byams pa chen po dang ldan pa'i rang gi khyim thab kyi rjes su 'brang ba yongs su dag par byas pa/ sngon byang chub sems dpa'i thabs mkhas pa bsam gyis mi khyab pas yongs su smin par byas pa/ stong phrag brgyad cu rtsa bzhi'i 'khor gyis kun nas bskor cing 'dug pa mthong ngo/ /bud med stong phrag brgyad cu rtsa bzhi po de dag kyang bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub las phyir mi ldog pa; byang chub sems dpa'i pha rol tu phyin pa tshul la shin tu zhugs pa/ byang chub sems dpa'i bslab pa la gzhan gyi dring mi 'jog pa/ chags pa thams cad dang bral ba'i sems dang ldan pa/ 'khor ba'i dga' ba thams cad kyis skyo ba'i yid dang ldan pa/ chos kyi dbyings kyi tshul chags pa med pas yongs su dag pa/ thams cad mkhyen pa nyid mngon du bya ba'i sems kyi shugs dang ldan pa/ sgrib pa dang bar du gcod pa'i dra ba dang bral ba/ chags pa'i lam thams cad las shin tu 'das pa/ chos kyi sku la legs par sprul bas rnam par spyod pa; 'jig rten thams cad yongs su smin par bya ba dang / gdul ba la mngon par phyogs pa/ bsod nams rgya mtsho dri ma med pas yongs su byung ba'i sems dang ldan pa/ byang chub sems dpa' kun tu bzang po'i spyod pa dang smin lam gyis shin tu byung ba/ byang chub sems dpa'i stobs kyi shugs yangs pas ye shes kyi nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor gyis sems rab tu snang ba yang dag par bskyed pa sha stag go /

Then the goddess Sorrowless, having eulogized Sudhana, followed him as he went on, bound to him by love for truth. Sudhana went into the meeting hall of enlightening beings which shone with reflections of the cosmos and looked around, desirous of seeing the Shakyan girl Gopa. He saw her in the middle of the hall sitting on a seat of jewels which reflected the abodes of all enlightening beings, surrounded by eighty-four thousand maidens, all of royal lineage, who had equally established good foundations of the practice of enlightening beings, who had been won over by her generosity in the past, who practiced gentle, pleasing speech, who were taken with the happiness of approaching the goal of omniscience, who were thoroughly absorbed in the common purpose of complete knowledge of buddhas and enlightening beings, who were sustained by the loving care guided by great compassion, who had purified great kindness, who had already developed the inconceivable skill in means of enlightening beings. All of those eighty-four thousand women were irreversible in progress toward supreme perfect enlightenment; they had comprehended enlightening beings’ means of transcendence, and needed no one’s guidance in the studies of enlightening beings. Their minds were free from all attachments and aloof of all mundane pleasures. They had cleared the way to the unobstructed cosmos and their minds were rapidly approaching omniscience. They were free from the web of all obstacles and barriers, and transcended all attachments. They acted as positive emanations of the body of reality, dedicated to leading all beings to perfection. Their minds sprang from a vast ocean of virtue, and they carried out the vow of the practice of universal good. They had developed tremendous energy in powers of enlightening beings, and the light of their minds was as a sun of knowledge.

de nas tshong dpon gyi bu nor bzang shAkya'i bu mo go pa gang na ba der phyin nas shAkya'i bu mo go ba'i rkang pa gnyis la spyi bos phyag 'tshal te langs nas mdun du 'dug ste thal mo sbyar nas 'di skad ces smras so/ /'phags ma/ bdag gis bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub sems bskyed na/ ji ltar na/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams 'khor ba na yongs su 'khor yang 'khor ba'i skyon gyis mi gos pa dang / chos thams cad mnyam pa nyid kyi rang bzhin yang khong du chud la nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi sa la'ang mi gnas pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos snang ba'ang rab tu thob la byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa yang rgyun mi gcod pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i sa la'ang rab tu gnas la de bzhin gshegs pa'i yul yang yongs su ston pa dang / 'jig rten gyi lam gyi rgyud thams cad las kyang yongs su 'das la 'jig rten gyi lam gyi rgyud thams cad du yang nye bar spyod pa dang / chos kyi lus yongs su grub pa dang ldan yang gzugs kyi lus kha dog mtha' yas pa'ang mngon par sgrub pa dang / mtshan ma med pa'i chos kyi sku la yang rab tu gzhol la 'gro ba thams cad kyi kha dog dang dbyibs kyi lus kyang yongs su ston pa dang / chos thams cad brjod du ma mchis par yang rab tu rtogs la dag gi lam dang / nges pa'i tshig thams cad brjod pas kyang sems can rnams la chos ston pa dang / sems can thams cad sems can med par yang rab tu shes la sems can gyi khams gdul ba'i tshul las kyang phyir mi ldog pa dang / chos thams cad ma skyes pa dang ma 'gag par yang khong du chud la de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad la mchod cing rim gror bya ba'i sbyor ba las kyang phyir mi ldog pa dang / chos thams cad la las dang rnam par smin pa ma mchis par yang rtogs la dge ba'i las mngon par 'du bya ba'i sbyor ba las kyang phyir mi ldog pa ma 'tshal to/ /de skad ces smras pa dang /

Then Sudhana went up to Gopa, paid his respects, and said, “I have set my mind on supreme perfect enlightenment, but I do not know how enlightening beings act in the midst of the mundane whirl without being stained by its ills; how they realize the equal essence of all phenomena without staying in the stage of personal liberation alone; how they manifest the qualities of buddhas without stopping the practice of enlightening beings; how they remain in the stage of enlightening beings yet show the sphere of all buddhas; how they transcend all worldly states yet act in the midst of worldly states; how they achieve the reality-body yet produce endless physical manifestations; how they resort to the formless reality-body yet manifest bodies like all beings; how they comprehend all the inexpressible truths, yet expound the truths to sentient beings in all languages; how they know there are no beings in the elements of existence, yet do not give up efforts to guide all beings; how they realize all phenomena are unoriginated and unperishing, yet do not give up the effort to serve all buddhas; how they realize there are no results of action in phenomena, yet do not give up the effort to perform good deeds.”

shAkya'i bu mo go bas tshong dpon gyi bu nor bzang la 'di skad ces smras so/ /rigs kyi bu/ de ltar khyod byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa'i chos nyid rnam pa de lta bu dri bar sems pa lags so/ / legs so/ /dri ba brjod pa de dag kyang kun tu bzang po'i smon lam dang spyod pa la mngon du gyur pa'i tshig go /rigs kyi bu/ de bas na/ legs par nyon la shin tu yid la zungs shig dang / sangs rgyas kyi byin gyis bstan par bya'o/ /

Gopa said to Sudhana, “It is very good that you think it fit to ask about the nature of this kind of practice of enlightening beings, as this is the question of one who is set on practicing the vow of universal good. So listen well and think carefully, for I will tell you, by the power of Buddha.

rigs kyi bu/ chos bcu dang ldan pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni/ byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa rnam pa 'di lta bu mig 'phrul gyi gzhi'i dpe dang 'dra ba/ ye shes kyi 'od kun tu 'byung ba yongs su rdzogs par byed do/ /bcu gang zhe na/ 'di lta ste/ dge ba'i bshes gnyen rlabs po che la brten pa dang / mos pa rgya chem po rab tu thob pa dang / dge ba'i bsam pa rlabs po che rnam par dag pa dang / bsod nams dang ye shes rgya mtsho yangs pas rab tu brtan pa'i sems dang / sangs rgyas skye ba 'byung pa'i chos bstan pa chen po thos pa rab tu thob pa dang / dus gsum gyi de bzhin gshegs pa la mos pa'i sems kyis gnas pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa'i dkyil 'khor thams cad mnyam pa nyid du khong du chud pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi byin gyi rlabs rab tu thob pa dang / rang bzhin gyis snying rje chen po'i lhag pa'i bsam pa rnam par dag pa dang / 'khor ba'i 'khor lo thams cad rab tu gcad pa'i sems kyi stobs shugs drag po dang ldan pa rab tu thob pa ste/ rigs kyi bu/ chos bcu po de dag dang ldan pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa rnam pa 'di lta bu mig 'phrul gyi gzhi'i dpe dang 'dra ba/ 'od kun tu 'byung ba yongs su rdzogs par byed do/ /

“There are ten things by which enlightening beings fulfill this kind of enlightening practice, the light of total knowledge, like the cosmic net of interrelation of all things. What are the ten? Association with superior spiritual friends; attainment of enormous devotion; purity of lofty good will; a state of mind founded on oceanic virtue and knowledge; listening to the great teaching of buddhas; associating with thought devoted to the buddhas of past, present, and future; equally following the practices of all enlightening beings; gaining the empowerment of all buddhas; purity of intent, greatly compassionate in nature; attainment of the basic power of mind to stop all vicious circles. Having attained these ten things, enlightening beings fulfill this kind of enlightening practice, like the cosmic net of interrelation of all things, radiating total knowledge.

rigs kyi bu/ de brtson 'grus phyir mi ldog pa dang ldan pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni/ chos de dag thob par gyur nas kyang mi zad pa'i tshul du mngon par sgrub cing /sgom pa dang / shin tu rgya che bar bya ba'i phyir dge ba'i bshes gnyen bsnyen bkur cing rnam pa bcus mngon par dga' bar byed do/ /bcu gang zhe na/ 'di lta ste/ lus dang srog la phangs par mi rtsi ba dang / 'khor ba'i yo byad don du mi gnyer ba dang / chos thams cad kyi rang bzhin mnyam pa nyid du khong du chud pa dang / thams cad mkhyen pa'i smon lam las phyir mi ldog pa dang / chos kyi dbyings kyi tshul thams cad la rnam par lta ba dang / srid pa'i rgya mtsho thams cad las gyen du 'phags pa'i yid dang / gnas med pa'i chos kyi nam mkha' la mi gnas mi rten pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyi smon lam la bsgribs pa med pa dang / zhing rgya mtsho thams cad du rab tu 'dal ba dang / byang chub sems dpa'i ye shes kyi dkyil 'khor bsgribs pa med pa shin tu sbyangs pa ste/ rigs kyi bu/ chos bcu po de dag dang ldan pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams dge ba'i bshes gnyen bsnyen bkur cing mngon par dga' bar byed do/ /

“Then enlightening beings with unrelenting vigor, having attained these things, developing and expanding them by putting them into practice in endless ways, propitiate spiritual benefactors in ten ways: by indifference to themselves, by not seeking worldly goods, by realizing the equality of essence of all things, by not turning back from the commitment to omniscience, by observing all the principles of the cosmos, by being mentally free of all existents, by independence in the space of truth where there is nothing to depend on, by freedom from obstruction in the undertaking of all enlightening beings, by entering all lands, by perfect clarification and purification of the unobstructed sphere of knowledge of enlightening beings.”
de nas shAkya'i bu mo go bas don de nyid yongs su bstan pa'i phyir sangs rgyas kyi byin gyis phyogs bcur bltas te de'i tshe tshigs su bcad pa 'di dag smras so/ /
Then, by the empowerment of Buddha, looking over the ten directions, Gopa uttered these verses illustrating what she meant:

rlabs chen dri med blo ldan gzhan gyi don zhugs shing / / dge bshes dam pa bsnyen brtson g.yo dang sgyu med pa/ / ston pa'i 'du shes thob cing skyo med brtson 'grus can/ / de dag spyod pa 'jig rten mig 'phrul 'dra 'di yin/ /
gang rnams mos pa rlabs chen mkha' dang 'dra ldan zhing / / de yi khongs su dus gsum 'jig rten chud pa dang / / zhing dang sems can chos dang sangs rgyas de bzhin pa/ / ye shes 'od byed de dag spyod pa 'di yin no/ /
gang rnams bsam pa mkha' 'dra mtha' dang dbus med la/ / kun nas nyon mongs dri mas mgos rab dag cing / / de bzhin gshegs pa kun gyi yon tan 'byung gyur pa/ / de dag spyod pa mig 'phrul gzhi yi rnam pa 'dra/ /
kun mkhyen ye shes rnam yangs tshad med bsam yas dag / yon tan rgya mtshos yid bsal ldan pa nyer brten pa/ / de dag bsod nams rgya mtsho'i lus ngag snying po ste/ / 'jig rten spyod kyang 'jig rten dri mas gos mi 'gyur/ /
rgyal ba'i gsung gi yan lag sgra skad tshul kun gyis/ / chos kyi 'brug sgra nyan kyang gang rnams mi ngoms shing / / chos tshul rjes su snyegs pa'i shes rab 'od kyi sgron/ / de dag 'gro bar 'od gsal byed pa'i spyod 'di yin/ /
gang rnams phyogs bcu'i de bzhin gshegs pa tshad med pa/ / gzhan dang gzhan dag sems kyi skad cig kun sems shing / / bde gshegs rgya mtsho thams cad lta zhing shes byed pa/ / sangs rgyas sems ldan de dag spyod yul 'di yin no/ /
rgyal ba rnams kyi rnam par yangs pa'i 'khor mthong zhing / / de dag ting nge 'dzin tshul rgya mtsho mang bo dang / / smon lam rgya mtsho mtha' dang dbus med tshul 'jug pa/ / mig 'phrul lta bu de dag spyod pa 'di yin no; ;
phyogs bcu'i rgyal ba ma lus kun gyis byin brlabs te/ / phyi mtha'i bskal par spyod byed kun tu bzang po'i rnams/ / zhing rnams 'byams klas kun tu gzugs brnyan byung gyur pa/ / chos 'od byed pa de dag spyod pa 'di yin no/ /
gang rnams ye shes nyi ma snying rje'i dkyil 'khor can/ / 'gro ba nyams nyes mthong zhing chos kyi 'od snang bas/ / 'gro ba'i mun pa bsal cing brtan pa 'char 'byung ba/ / nyi ma lta bus de dag spyod pa 'di yin no/ /
skye rgu srid pa'i rgyud na 'dre ldog mthong gyur nas/ / yid gsal 'khor ba'i rgyud rnams phyir zlog rab gnas shing / / chos kyi 'khor lo kun nas yongs su sgrub byed pa/ / spyod pa kun bzang dam pa'i blo can rab tu spyod/ /
tshul 'di bslab pa de dag mtha' dang dbus med pa'i/ / lus rnams bsam pa ji bzhin 'gro bar nyer bstan te/ / gzugs brnyan mig yor 'dra ba'i rang lus tshad med pas/ / srid pa'i rgya mtsho dag na 'gro mang yongs smin byed/ /
byams tshul shin tu yangs pas 'gro mang rgyas bkang ste/ / mos pa sna tshogs 'gro la rnam par spyod bstan nas/ / 'gro bar bsam pa ji bzhin chos kyi char 'bebs shing / / brtan pa byang chub don du sems can khrag khrig 'dul/ /

Those who set out for vast pure wisdom for the welfare of others And serve true benefactors honestly With tireless vigor, seeing them as teachers, Carry out practice in the world like the cosmic net.
Those whose devotion is vast as the sky, Embracing all worlds of past, present, and future, All lands, beings, phenomena, and buddhas— Theirs is this practice, producers of the light of knowledge.
When the will is infinite as the sky, Supremely pure, free from the taint of afflictions, Therein arise the virtues of all buddhas, Concentrating the whole variety of the cosmic net of practice.
The wise who rest on great oceans of virtue, Inconceivable, infinite, vast as omniscience, As pure offspring of the body of all virtues They act in the world unstained by the filth of the world.
Those who listen to the teaching of buddhas And tirelessly catch every nuance Are lamps shining with wisdom in accord with truth; Theirs is this practice which lights the world.
Those who perceive in an instant of awareness The infinite buddhas everywhere, interrelated, Contemplate the ocean of all buddhas; This is the way into the mind of the enlightened.
Those who see the vast audiences of the buddhas Enter the ocean of their meditations And their infinite ocean of vows; This is the practice of those like the cosmic net.
Those empowered by all the buddhas Practice universal good for endless ages, Reflected in all lands; This is the practice of the lights of truth.
The suns of compassion and knowledge emerge, steadfast, Seeing the misfortune of the world, And disperse the darkness of delusion with the light of truth; This is the practice of those like the sun.
Seeing people revolve in the rut of existence, The wise stand opposed to the flow of the mundane whirl; Developing the measureless wheel of true teaching, They practice universal higher goodness and wisdom.
Those who learn these infinite principles, Appearing in the world according to people’s mentalities, With their own bodies like reflected images, Develop people in the oceans of being.
Suffusing the world with myriad expressions of love, Showing spiritual practice to people of various interests, Teaching them according to their mentalities, The steadfast lead billions to enlightenment.

de nas shAkya'i bu mo go pas tshigs su bcad pa de dag smras nas tshong dpon gyi bu nor bzang la 'di skad ces smras so; ;rigs kyi bu/ kho mos ni/ byang chub sems dpa'i rnam par thar pa byang chub sems dpa'i ting nge 'dzin rgya mtsho'i tshul thams cad la rnam par lta ba'i yul thob pa'o/ /
Then Gopa said to Sudhana, “I have attained an enlightening liberation whose sphere is observation of the ocean of concentrations of all enlightening beings.”
nor bzang gis smras pa; 'phags ma/ byang chub sems dpa'i rnam par thar pa byang chub sems dpa'i ting nge 'dzin rgya mtsho'i tshul la rnam par lta ba'i yul de'i yul ji lta bu zhig mchis/
Sudhana asked, “What is the scope of this liberation?”

smras pa/ rigs kyi bu; kho mo byang chub sems dpa'i rnam par thar pa 'di la snyoms par zhugs na/ 'jig rten gyi khams 'di'i bskal pa sangs rgyas kyi zhing brjod du med pa'i rdul shin tu phra ba rnyed mthong zhing khong du chud do/ /bskal pa de dag gi sems can lam gyi rgyud thams cad du gtogs pa ji snyed cig yod pa de dag kyang rab tu shes so/ /sems can de dag gi shi 'pho dang / skye ba'i sgo ji snyed cig yod pa de bzhin du rab tu shes so/ /mngon par 'grub pa'i sgo ji snyed cig yod pa dang / las mngon par 'du byed pa yongs su sgrub pa ji snyed cig yod pa dang / las rnam par smin pa sna tshogs ji snyed cig yod pa de dag kyang rab tu shes so/ /de dag gi las yongs su blangs pa dge ba yang rab tu shes so/ /mi dge ba dang / 'byung ba dang / mi 'byung ba dang / nges pa dang / ma nges pa dang / log par nges pa dang / bag la nyal ba dang bcas pa dang / bag la nyal ba med pa dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba phun sum tshogs pa dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba rgud par gyur pa dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba yongs su zin pa dang / mi dge ba'i rtsa ba yongs su zin pa dang / dge ba dang mi dge ba yongs su zin pa dang / de dag gi dge ba'i chos yongs su 'dus pa dang / sdig to'i chos yongs su 'dus pa'i las yongs su blangs pa yang rab tu shes so/ /

Gopa replied, “Having attained this liberation, I penetrate as many ages in this world as atoms in untold buddha-lands, and I know all the beings in all conditions of existence therein, and I know all the deaths and births of those beings, their developments, their accomplishments, the variety of results of their actions; I know their undertakings—good, bad, liberative, nonliberative, certain, uncertain, wrongly fixated, compulsive, noncompulsive, based on good, not based on good, fostered by good, fostered by evil, fostered by good and evil, good by development, bad through neglect.

bskal pa sangs rgyas kyi zhing brjod du med pa'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed po de dag la sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das ji snyed cig byung ba de dag gi mtshan rgya mtsho yang shes shing khong du chud do/ /sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag gis thugs dang po bskyed pa rgya mtsho yang rab tu shes so; ;thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du zhugs pa'i tshul rgya mtsho yang rab tu shes so/ /smon lam rgya mtsho thams cad mngon par bsgrubs pa yang rab tu shes so/ /sngon gyi sangs rgyas byung ba rnams kyi drung du gshegs pa rgya mtsho yang rab tu shes so/ /sngon gyi sangs rgyas la mchod cing rim gror mdzad pa'i sbyor ba rgya mtsho yang rab tu shes so/ /sngon byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa yongs su rdzogs par mdzad pa rgya mtsho yang rab tu shes so/ /'byung ba'i rgyan rgya mtsho yang rab tu shes so/ /sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag gis sems can yongs su smin par mdzad pa dang gdul ba rgya mtsho yang rab tu shes so/ /mngon par 'tshang rgya ba mdzad pa rgya mtsho yang rab tu shes so/ /chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba'i khyu mchog gi mthu dang rnam par 'phrul pa yang rab tu shes so/ /sangs rgyas kyi rnam par 'phrul pa rgya mtsho thams cad kyang rab tu shes so/ /sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag gi 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor rnam par phye ba dag kyang rab tu shes so/ /'khor gyi dkyil 'khor de dag na nyan thos ji snyed cig 'khod pa de dag gi 'byung ba'i tshul yang rab tu shes so/ /sngon kyi dge ba'i rtsa ba yang rab tu shes so; ;lam bsgoms pa sna tshogs kyang rab tu shes so/ /ye shes thob par bya ba phun sum tshogs shing rnam par dag pa'i bye brag kyang rab tu shes so/ /de bzhin gshegs pa de dag gis sems can ji snyed cig rang sangs rgyas kyi byang chub la bkod pa de dag kyang rab tu shes so/ /rang sangs rgyas de dag gi sngon gyi dge ba'i rtsa ba ji snyed cig yod pa de dag kyang rab tu shes so; ;rang sangs rgyas de dag gis rang sangs rgyas kyi byang chub khong du chung ba ji snyed cig yod pa de dag kyang rab tu shes so/ /rang sangs rgyas de dag gi zhi ba'i rnam par spyod pa la rnam par rtse ba'i rnam par thar ba'i sgo ji snyed cig yod pa de dag kyang rab tu shes so/ /rang sangs rgyas de dag gi rdzu 'phrul gyi rnam par 'phrul ba ji snyed cig yod pa de dag kyang rab tu shes so/ /rang sangs rgyas de dag gis sems can ji snyed cig yongs su smin par byas pa de dag kyang rab tu shes so/ /rang sangs rgyas de dag gis chos bstan pa ji snyed cig brjod pa de dag kyang rab tu shes so/ /rang sangs rgyas de dag ting nge 'dzin mtha' yas pa la rnam par spyod cing rnam par thar pa rnam pa sna tshogs kyis rnam par rtse ba ji snyed cig yod pa de dag kyang rab tu shes so/ /sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag gi yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba ji snyed pa de dag kyang rab tu shes so/ /

“I know the oceans of names of all the buddhas in those ages as numerous as atoms in untold buddha-lands; I know the oceans of initial inspirations of those buddhas, the ways they set out for omniscience, their undertakings of the oceans of all vows, their heading for previous buddhas, their oceans of efforts in the service of previous buddhas, their oceans of fulfillment of past enlightening practices, their oceans of arrangements of means of emancipation. I also know the oceans of those buddhas’ development and guidance of sentient beings, and I know their oceans of attainment of enlightenment, their majestic displays of mystic power in turning the wheel of the teaching, and their oceans of miraculous displays of all buddhas. I also know the differences in the audiences of those buddhas, and I know the methods of emancipation of the listeners in those audiences, as well as their past roots of goodness, the variety of their cultivation of the path, and the difference in the purity of their attainment of knowledge. I also know the sentient beings who have been led to individual enlightenment by those buddhas, and I know the past roots of goodness of those individual illuminates, as well as their attainments of individual enlightenment, the doors of liberation mystically developing in their peaceful states, their various spiritual transformations, their development of others, their teachings, and the various freedoms of liberation in their infinite states of concentration. I also know the ultimate extinction of those buddhas.

sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag gi byang chub sems dpa'i 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor rgya mtsho ji snyed pa de dag kyang rab tu shes so/ /byang chub sems dpa' de dag gis thog ma dge ba'i rtsa ba bskyed bdag kyang rab tu shes so; ;thog ma sems pa skyed pa'i smon lam dag kyang rab tu shes so/ /smon lam rnam par dag pa tha dad pa dag kyang rab tu shes so/ /byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pas 'byung ba'i rgyan thams cad mngon par sgrub pa rnam pa tha dad pa yang rab tu shes so/ /pha rol tu phyin pa'i lam gyi yan lag gi tshogs rnam par dag par bya ba rnam pa tha dad pa yang rab tu shes so/ /byang chub sems dpa'i lam la nan tan du bya ba'i rgyan rnam pa tha dad pa yang rab tu shes so/ /byang chub sems dpa'i sa yongs su gnon pa'i tshogs rnam pa tha dad pa yang rab tu shes so/ /byang chub sems dpa'i sa yongs su gnon pa'i shugs drag po rnam pa tha dad pa yang rab tu shes so/ /byang chub sems dpa'i sa la bzem pa'i mthu dang ldan pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi dkyil 'khor rnam pa tha dad pa yang rab tu shes so/ /byang chub sems dpa'i sa la yongs su gnon pas rnam par rtse ba dag kyang rab tu shes so/ /byang chub sems dpa'i sa yongs su gnon pa'i rnam par spyod pa dag kyang rab tu shes so/ /byang chub sems dpa'i sa la rab tu gnas pa dag kyang rab tu shes so/ /byang chub sems dpa'i sa sgom pa'i rgyud dag kyang rab tu shes so/ /byang chub sems dpa'i sa yongs su sbyangs pa'i tshul dag kyang rab tu shes so/ /byang chub sems dpa'i sa la yang dag par gnas par bya ba dag kyang rab tu shes so/ /byang chub sems dpa'i sa'i mtshan ma dag kyang rab tu shes so/ /byang chub sems dpa'i sa'i dbang dag kyang rab tu shes so/ /byang chub sems dpa'i sa nas sar 'phar pa'i ye shes dag kyang rab tu shes so/ /byang chub sems dpa'i sa yongs su bsdu ba'i ye shes dag kyang rab tu shes so/ /byang chub sems dpa'i sa yongs su smin par bya ba'i ye shes dag kyang rab tu shes so/ /byang chub sems dpa' rnam par dgod pa la yang dag par gnas par bya ba yang rab tu shes so/ /byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa'i dkyil 'khor gyi rgya yang rab tu shes so/ /byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa la rnam par rtse ba dag kyang rab tu shes so/ /byang chub sems dpa'i ting nge 'dzin rgya mtsho dag kyang rab tu shes so/ /byang chub sems dpa'i rnam par thar pa'i chul rgya mtsho dag kyang rab tu shes so/ /byang chub sems dpa' de dag sems kyi skad cig re re la ting nge 'dzin rgya mtsho sna tshogs thob par byed pa dag kyang rab tu shes so/ /thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi snang ba'i tshul thob par byed pa dag kyang rab tu shes so/ /thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi glog gi snang ba'i sprin dag kyang rab tu shes so/ /byang chub sems dpa'i bzod pa thob pa'i tshul dag kyang rab tu shes so/ /thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du 'jug pa'i ye shes kyi rnam par gnon pa dag kyang rab tu shes so; ;byang chub sems dpa' rnams zhing rgya mtshor rjes su bgrod par byed pa dag kyang rab tu shes so/ /chos rgya mtsho'i tshul la 'jug pa dag kyang rab tu shes so/ /sems can rgya mtsho'i mtshan nyid tha dad pa dag kyang rab tu shes so/ /byang chub sems dpa'i dam par spyod pa'i tshul thams cad kyi rnam par 'phrul pa dag kyang rab tu shes so/ /smon lam gyi tshul sna tshogs rgya mtsho dag kyang rab tu shes so/ /rdzu 'phrul gyi rnam par 'phrul pa sna tshogs rgya mtsho rnam pa tha dad pa dag kyang rab tu shes so/ /

“I also know the oceans of enlightening beings surrounding those buddhas, and I know those enlightening beings’ first cultivation of roots of goodness, their first inspirations and vows, the variety of their vows, the variety of their production of arrangements of vehicles of emancipation by all the practices of enlightening beings, the variety of their perfection of provisions for the path of transcendence, the variety of the manifestations of their practices of the path of enlightening beings, the variety of their provisions for advancing through the states of enlightening beings, the variety of the speed of their advance through the states of enlightening beings, the variety of their spheres of concentration in the stages of enlightening beings, the spiritual manifestations of their advance through the states of enlightening beings, their spiritual states during their progress through the states of enlightening beings, their footholds in the stages of enlightening beings, their practices cultivating the states of enlightening beings, their methods of purifying the stages of enlightening beings, their abodes in the stages of enlightening beings, their characteristics in the stages of enlightening beings, their mastery of the stages of enlightening beings, their science of entry into the stages of enlightening beings, the enlightening beings’ science of salvation, the enlightening beings’ science of development, the different states of enlightening beings, the mystic projections of enlightening beings’ practices, the oceans of concentrations of enlightening beings, the oceans of methods of liberation of enlightening beings. I also know those enlightening beings’ attainments of oceans of various concentrations in each moment of consciousness, their discoveries of the range of omniscience, their tremendous flashes of omniscience, their means of attainment of the forbearance of enlightening beings, their plunges into omniscience. I also know those enlightening beings’ travels to oceans of lands, their penetrations of the principles of oceans of phenomena, the variety of characteristics of all things, the mystic projection of the designs of all states of enlightening beings, the oceans of principles of various vows, and the variety of oceans of miracles.

rigs kyi bu/ kho mo ji ltar mi mjed kyi 'jig rten gyi khams 'di'i 'das pa dang da ltar byung ba'i bskal pa sna tshogs rgya mtsho la zhugs te khong du chud pa de bzhin du phyi ma'i mtha' gcig nas gcig tu brgyud de rgyun mi 'chad pa'i ma 'ongs pa'i bskal pa rgya mtsho dag kyang rab tu shes so/ /mi mjed kyi 'jig rten gyi khams kyi bskal pa rgya mtsho ji ltar shes pa de bzhin du mi mjed kyi 'jig rten gyi khams su gtogs pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pa thams cad kyi bskal pa rgya mtsho dag kyang rab tu shes so/ /mi mjed kyi 'jig rten gyi khams su gtogs pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pa thams cad kyi bskal pa rgya mtsho ji ltar shes pa de bzhin du mi mjed kyi 'jig rten gyi khams kyi rdul shin tu phra ba'i khongs su chud pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pa thams cad kyi bskal pa rgya mtsho dag kyang rab tu shes so/ /mi mjed kyi 'jig rten gyi khams kyi rdul shin tu phra ba'i khongs su chud pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pa thams cad kyi bskal pa rgya mtsho rnams ji ltar shes pa de bzhin du mi mjed kyi 'jig rten gyi khams phyogs bcur 'dab chags su gnas pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad kyi bskal pa rgya mtsho dag kyang rab tu shes so/ /mi mjed kyi 'jig rten gyi khams phyogs bcur 'dab chags su gnas pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad kyi bskal pa rgya mtsho rnams ji ltar shes pa de bzhin du mi mjed kyi 'jig rten gyi khams phyogs bcur 'dab chags su gnas pa gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pa dag na gnas pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad kyi bskal pa rgya mtsho dag kyang rab tu shes so/ /mi mjed kyi 'jig rten gyi khams phyogs bcur 'dab chags su gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pa dag na gnas pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad kyi bskal pa rgya mtsho rnams ji ltar shes pa de bzhin du phyogs bcu kun tu 'od rnam par snang ba'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyi rgyud du gtogs pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad kyi bskal pa rgya mtsho dag kyang rab tu shes so/ /phyogs bcu kun tu 'od rnam par snang ba'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyi rgyud du gtogs pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad kyi bskal pa rgya mtsho ji ltar shes pa de bzhin du/ phyogs bcu kun tu 'od rnam par snang ba'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyi rgyud phyogs bcur 'dab chags su gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pa dag la gnas pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyi rgyud gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pa rnams kyi bskal pa rgya mtsho dag kyang rab tu shes so/ /phyogs bcu kun tu 'od rnam par snang ba'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyi rgyud phyogs bcur 'dab chags su gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pa dag la gnas pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad kyi bskal ba rgya mtsho rnams rab tu shes pa de bzhin du gzhi dang snying po me tog gi rgyan gyis brgyan pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams rgya mtsho 'dir gtogs pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams 'byams klas pa rnams kyi bskal pa rgya mtsho dag kyang rab tu shes so/ /de bzhin du 'jig rten gyi khams tshul du bya ba rnams dang / 'jig rten gyi khams kyi 'khor lo rnams dang / 'jig rten gyi khams kyi dkyil 'khor rnams dang / 'jig rten gyi khams kyi bye brag rnams dang / 'jig rten gyi khams kyi chu klung rnams dang / 'jig rten gyi khams kyi klong rnams dang / 'jig rten gyi khams yongs su 'khyil pa dang / 'jig rten gyi khams ri rab dang / 'jig rten gyi khams yongs su 'byung ba dang / 'jig rten gyi khams pad+mo dang / 'jig rten gyi khams sdong po dang / 'jig rten gyi khams rta babs dang / 'jig rten gyi khams ming du bya ba rnams kyi bskal pa rgya mtsho dag kyang rab tu shes so/ /

“Just as I penetrate the various oceans of ages past in this world, in the same way I know the endless unbroken succession of ages of the future; and just as I know all this in this world, so do I know it in all the worlds within this world. And just as I know this in all the worlds within this world, so do I know it in all the worlds in the atoms of this world. And just as I know it in all the worlds in the atoms of this world, so do I know it in the worlds in the ten directions contiguous with this world. And just as I know it in the worlds in the ten directions contiguous with this world, so do I know it in all the worlds in the ten directions surrounding this world. And just as I know it in all the worlds in the ten directions surrounding this world, so do I know it in all the worlds in the radiant world system of Vairocana. And just as I know it in all the worlds in the radiant world system of Vairocana, I know it in all the worlds surrounding the radiant world system of Vairocana. And just as I know it in all the worlds surrounding the radiant world system of Vairocana, I know it in all the places in the worlds in the oceans of worlds in the masses of worlds in this whole flower treasury universe, and in all the structures and features of the worlds.

'jig rten gyi khams rgya mtsho gzhi dang snying po me tog gi rgyan gyis brgyan pa 'di ji ltar shes par gyur pa de bzhin du phyogs bcu mtha' yas mu med pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams rgya mtsho chos kyi dbyings kyis klas pa/ nam mkha'i mthas gtugs pa dag gi bcom ldan 'das rnam par snang mdzad kyi sngon gyi smon lam rgya mtsho dag kyang rab tu shes so/ /rjes su dran no/ /sngon gyi sbyor ba rgya mtsho dag la'ang shes shing khong du chud do/ /sngon yongs su bsgrubs pa'i tshul rgya mtsho dag la yang shes shing khong du chud do/ /bskal pa mtha' dang dbus med par byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa la yang dag par bzhugs pa mdzad pa dag kyang shes shing khong du chud do/ /zhing yongs su dag par mdzad pa'i tshul dag kyang shes shing khong du chud do/ /sems can yongs su smin par mdzad pa'i thabs kyi tshul dag kyang shes shing khong du chud do/ /sngon gyi de bzhin gshegs pa rnams la bsnyen bkur mdzad cing gshegs pa'i rnam par 'phrul ba dag kyang shes shing khong du chud do/ /sngon gyi de bzhin gshegs pa la mchod cing rim gror mdzad pa'i sbyor ba'i tshul dag kyang shes shing khong du chud do/ /sngon gyi de bzhin gshegs pa dag gis chos bstan pa yongs su bzung ba'i tshul dag kyang shes shing khong du chud do/ /sngon gyi byang chub sems dpa'i ting nge 'dzin rab tu brnyes pa'i tshul dag kyang shes shing khong du chud do/ /yo byad la dbang sgyur ba rab tu brnyes pa'i tshul dag kyang shes shing khong du chud do/ /sngon gyi de bzhin gshegs pa'i yon tan rgya mtsho la nan tan du mdzad pa'i tshul dag kyang shes shing khong du chud do/ /sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i tshul rgya mtsho dag kyang shes shing khong du chud do/ / byang chub sems dpa'i tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs kyi dkyil 'khor yongs su dag pa mngon par sgrub pa mdzad pa'i tshul dag kyang shes shing khong du chud do/ /byang chub sems dpa'i bzod pa brnyes pa'i tshul dag kyang shes shing khong du chud do/ /byang chub sems dpa'i brtson 'grus kyi shugs drag po rgya mtsho dag kyang shes shing khong du chud do/ /bsam gtan gyi yan lag thams cad yongs su rdzogs par mdzad pa'i tshul rgya mtsho dag kyang shes shing khong du chud do/ /shes rab kyi dkyil 'khor yongs su dag par mdzad pa'i tshul rgya mtsho dag kyang shes shing khong du chud do/ /'jig rten gyi khams kyi skye gnas thams cad du sku'i gzugs brnyan yongs su bstan pa mdzad pa'i thabs kyi tshul dag kyang shes shing khong du chud do/ /kun tu bzang po'i spyod pa dang smon lam gyi dkyil 'khor yongs su dag par mdzad pa'i tshul dag kyang shes shing khong du chud do/ /zhing rgya mtsho thams cad yongs su rgyas par mdzad pa dag kyang shes shing khong du chud do/ /sangs rgyas kyi zhing thams cad yongs su dag par mdzad pa'i tshul rgya mtsho dag kyang shes shing khong du chud do/ /de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad las ye shes snang bar gyur pa rgya mtsho dag kyang shes shing khong du chud do/ /sangs rgyas kyi zhing thams cad kyi byang chub yongs su gnas pa mdzad pa'i rnam par 'phrul pa rgya mtsho dag kyang shes shing khong du chud do/ /de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes snang ba rab tu brnyes pa'i tshul dag kyang shes shing khong du chud do/ /thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du zhugs te thugs su chud pa'i tshul rgya mtsho dag kyang shes shing khong du chud do/ /mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya ba'i rnam par 'phrul pa rgya mtsho dag kyang shes shing khong du chud do/ /chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba'i khyu mchog gi mthu dang rnam par rol pa'i tshul rgya mtsho dag kyang shes shing khong du chud do/ /'khor gyi dkyil 'khor rgya mtsho dag kyang shes shing khong du chud do/ /'khor gyi dkyil 'khor de dag gi byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyi sngon gyi dge ba'i rtsa ba rgya mtsho dag kyang shes shing khong du chud do/ /thog ma'i smon lam gyi tshul rgya mtsho dag kyang shes shing khong du chud do/ /sems can yongs su smin par byed pa dang 'dul ba'i thabs kyi tshul rgya mtsho dag kyang shes shing khong du chud do/ /bcom ldan 'das kyis sngon byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa mdzad pa'i tshe sems can rgya mtsho yongs su smin par mdzad pa de dag kyang shes shing khong du chud do/ /sems can de dag gi sems kyi skad cig re re'i dge ba'i rtsa ba rnam par 'phrul pa'i thabs kyi tshul rgya mtsho dag kyang shes shing khong du chud do/ /ting nge 'dzin rab tu thob pa'i tshul rgya mtsho dag kyang shes shing khong du chud do/ /gzungs kyi sgo rab tu thob pa'i tshul rgya mtsho dag kyang shes shing khong du chud do/ /spobs pa'i ye shes kyi dkyil 'khor rnam par dag pa'i tshul rgya mtsho dag kyang shes shing khong du chud do/ /byang chub sems dpa'i sa thams cad yongs su gnon pa'i rnam par 'phrul pa'i tshul rgya mtsho dag kyang shes shing khong du chud do/ /spyod pa'i dra ba mngon par sgrub pa'i tshul rgya mtsho dag kyang shes shing khong du chud do/ /mthar gyis yongs su sgrub pa'i phyogs la 'jug pa'i ye shes kyi tshul rgya mtsho dag kyang shes shing khong du chud do/ /de dag gi dbang po dang / stobs dang / byang chub kyi yan lag dang / bsam gtan dang / rnam par thar pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / snyoms par 'jug pa'i rnam par 'phrul pa rgya mtsho dag kyang shes shing khong du chud do/ /

“And as in this flower treasury universe, so also in all universes in the endless cosmos, throughout space, I know, comprehend, and recall the oceans of past vows of Vairocana, his oceans of past efforts, oceans of past attainments, persistence in enlightening practice through infinite ages, methods of purifying lands, means of serving past buddhas, ways of receiving the teachings of past buddhas, methods of attaining enlightening concentrations in the past, means of attaining control over utensils, ways of practicing the oceans of virtues of past buddhas, oceans of ways of perfecting giving, methods of effecting the purification of the conduct of an enlightening being, means of attaining the forbearance of an enlightening being, oceans of force of the vigor of an enlightening being, oceans of methods of fulfilling all elements of meditation, oceans of ways of purification of the sphere of wisdom, means of manifesting reflections of life in all worlds, ways of purification of the sphere of vows of practice of universal good, pervasion of all worlds, oceans of means of purification of all lands, oceans of light of knowledge of all buddhas, oceans of spiritual manifestations of accession to the enlightenment of all buddhas, means of attainment of the range of knowledge of all buddhas, oceans of mystic manifestations of attainment of enlightenment, oceans of ways of free exercise of the majestic power of turning the wheel of teaching, oceans of various audiences, the past roots of goodness of all the enlightening beings in all those audiences, their oceans of initial vows, their oceans of methods of developing and guiding sentient beings, the oceans of sentient beings matured by the Buddha as he carried out enlightening practice in the past, those enlightening beings’ oceans of means of causing roots of goodness to grow in every moment of consciousness, their oceans of ways of attaining concentration, oceans of means of attaining total mental command, oceans of means of purification of the sphere of expository knowledge, oceans of mystic manifestations of accession to all stages of enlightenment, oceans of means of effecting the network of practice, oceans of gradual refinement, oceans of knowledge of gradual attainment entering all worlds, and oceans of all faculties, powers, elements of enlightenment, meditations, liberations, concentrations, attainments, and spiritual transformations.

ji ltar bcom ldan 'das rnam par snang mdzad kyi sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa rgya mtsho chos kyi dbyings thams cad du byung ba shes shing khong du chud do/ /mngon par sgrub pa de bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa rgya mtsho dang / ye shes kyi sgyu ma'i dra ba mtha' yas pa la 'jug pa chos kyi dbyings mtha' yas pa rgyas par 'gengs pa/ sgo mtha' yas pa nas shin tu bstan par bya ba/ phyi ma'i mtha' bskal par gnas pa la 'jug pas bstan par bya ba/ phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams rgya mtsho chos kyi dbyings kyis klas pa/ nam mkha'i mthas gtugs par byung ba thams cad kyang ma 'dres par shes shing khong du chud do/ /mngon par sgrub bo/ /de ci'i phyir zhe na/ rigs kyi bu/ byang chub sems dpa'i rnam par thar pa byang chub sems dpa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi tshul rgya mtsho thams cad la rnam par lta ba'i yul gyi yul ni; de lta bu ste/ de'i phyir de la snyoms par zhugs na/ sems can thams cad kyi sems dang spyod pa'i tshul rab tu shes so/ /sems can thams cad kyi dge ba'i tshogs kyang rab tu shes so/ /sems can thams cad kyi kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba'i ye shes kyi tshul rnams kyang rab tu shes so/ /sems can thams cad kyi las sna tshogs kyang rab tu shes so/ /nyan thos thams cad kyi ting nge 'dzin gyi sgo rnams kyang rab tu shes so/ /nyan thos thams cad kyi ting nge 'dzin gyi sa yang rab tu shes so/ /rang sangs rgyas thams cad kyi rnam par thar pa zhi bas rnam par 'phrul pa yang shes shing khong du chud do/ /byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyi ting nge 'dzin rgya mtsho'i tshul dag kyang rab tu shes so/ /byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyi rnam par thar pa rgya mtsho la 'jug pa yang rab tu shes so/ /de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi rnam par thar pa'i tshul rgya mtsho la 'jug pa yang rab tu shes so/ /

“And just as I comprehend, know, and realize the oceans of enlightening practice of Vairocana Buddha in this whole cosmos, so also do I comprehend, know, and realize the indivisible oceans of enlightening practice of all buddhas in all oceans of worlds throughout the cosmoses throughout all space. In this way I comprehend the entry into the indivisible totality of all enlightening beings’ practices, entry into the infinite web of illusion, infinite cosmic pervasion, infinite instruction, and indication of entry into the basis of endless eons, of all buddhas in all oceans of worlds throughout the cosmos, to the furthest reaches of space. Why? Because this is the scope of the enlightening liberation whose sphere is observation of the ocean of concentrations of all enlightening beings; having attained this, I know the patterns of mental behavior of all beings, the accumulations of goodness of all beings, the means of purgation of defilements of all beings, the variety of deeds of all beings, the doors of concentration of all buddhas’ disciples, the stage of concentration of all buddhas’ disciples, the tranquillity, liberation, and mystic transformation of all individual illuminates, the methods of the oceans of concentrations of all enlightening beings, the ocean of ways of liberation of all enlightening beings, and the ocean of ways of liberation of all buddhas.”

de nas tshong dpon gyi bu nor bzang gis shAkya'i bu mo go pa la 'di skad ces smras so/ /'phags ma/ khyod kyis byang chub sems dpa'i rnam par thar pa byang chub sems dpa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi chul rgya mtsho thams cad la rnam par lta ba'i yul 'di brnyes nas ji srid cig lags/
Then Sudhana asked Gopa, “How long ago did you attain this liberation?”

smras pa/ rigs kyi bu/ sngon 'das pa'i dus sangs rgyas kyi zhing brgya'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed kyi bskal pa 'das pa'i pha rol gcig tu 'jig rten gyi khams mi 'jigs pa byed pa zhes bya ba byung ste/ 'jig rten gyi khams de'i bskal pa 'gro ba'i mchog ces bya bar gyur to/ /'jig rten gyi khams de'i dbus su gling bzhi pa bde ba yod pa zhes bya ba byung ste/ gling bzhi pa de'i 'dzam bu'i gling gi dbus su rgyal po'i gnas sdong po ri bo'i dpal zhes bya ba grong rdal stong phrag brgyad cu rtsa bzhi'i phul du bya ba byung ste/ rgyal po'i gnas sdong po ri bo'i dpal de dang / grong rdal stong phrag brgyad cu rtsa bzhi po de dag kyang so so nas sa'i gzhi bai DUr+ya sngon po las grub pa la gnas rin po che bdun las byas pa'i ra bas kun nas bskor ba/ 'obs spos chus yongs su gang ba/ gzhi gser gyi bye ma bdal ba; utpal dang / pad+mo dang / ku mu da dang / me tog puN+Da rI ka shing rta'i 'khor lo tsam kha dog dang 'od kyi dra ba sna tshogs shing dri zhim pas kun nas khyab pa bdun gyis yongs su bskor ba/ rin po che las byas pa'i stegs bu'i khri 'phang bdun las ta la'i phreng ba rim pa bdun gyis kun nas dkrigs pa/ rin po che sna bdun gyi shing gi nags tshal gyi phreng ba dkrigs pas kun nas bskor ba/ steng nas gser gyi dra ba bres pa rin po che sna tshogs kyis rnam par phye ba'i mig mang ris mdzes par rnam par bres pas sa'i gzhi shin tu spa bar gyur pa/ dngos grub can gyi tshogs rnam par rgyu ba/ bya btsun pa'i khyus sgra skad yid du 'ong ba'i dbyangs snyan pa phyung ba/ bza' shing gi rab bye ba brgya phrag stong gis mdzes par byas pa/ shin tu skyid cing phun sum tshogs par gnas pa/ skyes pa dang bud med brgya stong rab tu dga' bas gang ba/ ser bu bde zhing yid du 'ong bas bskyod de me tog gi char mang po rgyun mi 'chad par rab tu 'brul ba/ sa'i bdag po dam pa brgya phrag stong gi gnas su gyur pa dag ste/ grong rdal chen po de dag gi rin po che'i shing thams cad dang / gser gyi dra ba'i rgyan la sogs pa rlung gis bskyod de rol mo mang po'i sgra dang / snyan pa'i sgra skad byung ba dag las yid du 'ong ba'i tshig 'di skad byung ngo/ /gsol cig /mnobs shig /chos la spyod cig /byang chub tu sems skyed cig /phyir mi ldog pa'i sa la mnga' thob mdzod cig /khyed rnams bde bar gyur cig /ces zer ro/ /

She replied, “As many eons ago as atoms in a hundred buddha-lands, there was a world called Producing Fearlessness. In that world was an age called Superior Conduct. In the middle of that world was a set of four continents called Safe. On the southern continent was a metropolis called Magnificent Trees, the greatest of eighty-four billion cities. Each of the cities was built on a ground of blue lapis lazuli and was surrounded by walls made of seven precious substances and seven moats of fragrant water with gold sand on the bottom, covered with red, white, and blue lotuses as big as cartwheels radiating brilliant webs of light and beautiful scents. They were also surrounded by seven networks of railings made of jewels and seven rings of palm trees, and abounded in groves of trees made of seven precious substances. Above, they were covered with networks of clouds. The grounds of the cities were like jeweled checkerboards, the plots evenly divided by arrays of various jewels. Groups of mystic adepts lived and roamed there, and birds filled the air with pleasing song. The cities were adorned with millions of parks, and they were prosperous and wealthy. Hundred of thousands of happy men and women populated them. There were constant showers of beautiful flowers, stirred by the wind. Hundreds of thousands of earth spirits lived in them. Furthermore, from the golden nets of wind chimes adorning all the trees came happy voices saying, ‘Bathe, drink, eat, practice the Teaching, arouse the determination for enlightenment, realize mastery of the stage of nonregression; happiness to you!’

rgyal po'i gnas sdong po ri bo'i dpal der khams kyi rgyal po nor gyi bdag po zhes bya ba byung ste/ de la btsun mo'i 'khor bud med stong phrag brgyad cu rtsa bzhi yod do/ /blon po brgya phrag lnga yod par gyur te/ rgyal po nor gyi bdag po de la bu lnga brgya yod pa de thams cad kyang dpa' ba/ rtul phod pa/ yan lag dam pa'i gzugs dang ldan pa/ gzhan gyi sde rab tu 'joms pa/ shin tu mdzes pa/ blta na sdug pa/ kha dog bzang po'i mchog shin tu rgyas pa dang ldan pa sha stag go /rgyal po nor gyi bdag po de'i btsun mo dam pa ni/ pad+mo'i dpal dam pa 'byung ba zhes bya ba ste/ bud med stong phrag brgyad cu rtsa bzhi po de dag gi nang nas gtso mor bya ba'o/ /de'i bu gzi brjid kyi dbang po zhes bya ba gzugs bzang ba/ shin tu mdzes pa/ blta na sdug pa/ mi chen po'i mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis kyis rab tu brgyan pa'i lus dang ldan pa zhig yod par gyur te/ de la mi chen po'i mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis po 'di dag yod par gyur to/ /

“At that time, in the capital city Magnificent Trees, there was a king named Lord of Wealth, ruler of the region. He had eighty-four thousand women in his palace. He also had five hundred ministers, and also five hundred sons, all of whom were brave, powerful warriors, handsome and well built. His queen, the foremost of the eighty-four thousand women, was named Lotus Born. She had a son named Lord of Glory, who was very handsome and bore the thirty-two marks of a great man, pleasing to the sight of all.

de'ang 'di ltar rgyal bu gzhon nu gzi brjid kyi bdag po de rkang pa'i mthil shin tu gnas pa dang ldan te/ sa chen po la rkang pa'i mthil 'dor na mnyam par 'dor la/ 'deg na mnyam par 'deg ste/ gzhog na rkang pa'i mthil kun gyis sa chen po la mnyam par reg go /de'i rkang pa'i mthil gnyis la 'khor lo rtsibs stong dang ldan pa/ lte ba dang bcas pa/ mu khyud dang bcas pa/ rnam pa thams cad du shin tu tshang ba/ shin tu mdzes pa/ blta na sdug pa dag kyang byung bar gyur to/ /de'i rkang pa'i bol gnyis kyang shin tu rgyas par gyur to/ /rkang pa'i steng gi mdog shin tu gsal la shin tu mdzes te/ me tog dam pa bas kyang lhag par mdog bzang zhing gsal bar gyur to/ /de'i rkang lag gi sor mo dra bar 'brel bar gyur te shin tu mdzes pas rnam par bye ba; bu ga med pas zag pa med pa ni/ dper na/ ngang pa'i rgyal po gnas srung lta bur gyur to/ /de rkang pa'i rting pa yangs pa/ shin tu dag la shin tu gsal ba/ rin po che thams cad kyi 'od rab tu 'gyed par grub pa dang ldan par gyur to/ /de'i sor mo rnams kyang ring zhing zlum la tshigs bar mnyam zhing yangs pa dang ldan par gyur te/ de dag mnyam par sa la 'jog go /mnyam par sa las 'deg go /de'i rkang pa dang lag pa'i mthil yang ka tsa lin+da bas kyang lhag par reg na bde bar gyur te/ des skyes pa'am/ bud med dam/ khye'u dang bu mo gang la reg kyang rung ste/ de dag thams cad bde ba dang / yid dga' ba'i dam pas tshim zhing yid shin tu bde bar 'gyur ro/ /de'i byin pa ri e na ya'i byin pa ltar 'dug par gyur te/ rim gyis gzhol ba dang / shin tu mdzes pa dang / legs par grub par gyur pas/ ri kyi rgyal po e na ye ltar de la sus kyang bsnyegs pa'am sleb par mi nus te/ 'gro bas ngal zhing dub par mi 'gyur ro/ /rgyal bu gzhon nu gzi brjid kyi dbang po de bdun shin tu mtho ba dang yang ldan par gyur te/ de'i rkang pa gnyis la shin tu mtho ba zlum la shin tu legs pa dang / shin tu rgyas pa dang / tshigs mi snang ba dang / shin tu yid du 'ong ba dang / blta na sdug pa gnyis grub par gyur to; ;lag pa la gnyis/ thal gong gi lhun la gnyis/ ltag pa la gcig ste/ de ltar bdun no/ /de'i mtshan gsang ba'i sbubs na 'dug pa grub par gyur te/ de'i gsang pa'i gnas sbubs na 'dug pa shin tu mi mngon la nang du nub cing kun nas yog par 'dug pa ste/ dper na/ glang po cang shes sam/ rta cang shes ltar 'dug pas de gos ma gyon par 'dug kyang bud med dam/ skyes pa'am/ khye'u'am/ bu mo'am/ rgan pa'am/ dar la bab pa'am/ bla ma'am/ bla mar bya ba rnams kyis kyang mi mthong ste/ gzhan du na bdag longs par spyod pa'am/ ched du bstan par bya ste/ 'dod pas spyad pa ni/ ma gtogs so/ /rgyal bu gzhon nu gzi brjid kyi bdag po de ro stong seng+ge ltar 'dug pa dang ldan par gyur te/ lus rim pas rgyas la ro stod shin tu yangs shing rdzogs pas/ ri kyi rgyal po bas kyang mdzes par dbyibs shin tu legs pa'i ro stod dang ldan par gyur to/ /de'i thal gong rgyas shing lus shin tu rgyas pa/ lus rnam par phye ba/ lus kyi cha thams cad rkyen du 'bab par mnyam pa/ lus la dma' ba med pa/ lus la mtho ba med pa/ lus la zhum pa med pa/ lus la dgu pa med pa; lus rin po che'i gtan pa shin tu phyis pa bas kyang lhag par gsal bar gyur to/ /de dpung mgo shin tu zlum zhing sha rgyas la shin tu mdzes par gang ba dang ldan par gyur to/ /des mi chen po'i mtshan lag pa shin tu ring ba thob par gyur pa/ des lus ma btud de lus drang por 'dug kyang pus mo'i lha nga gnyis la nyug cing reg go /des mi chen po'i mtshan lus che zhing drang ba'ang thob par gyur te/ rnam pa thams cad du mchog tu gyur pa dang ldan la/ lus tshul dang 'dra bar mnyam pa dang / lus rab tu mnyen pa dang / lus shen tu lci ba dang / lus rab tu gsal ba dang / lus shin tu sim par byed pa dang ldan par gyur te/ des mi chen po'i mtshan mgul dung lta bu yang thob par gyur te/ mi dma'i mgul dang / de'i mgul gyi 'khor thams cad dang / bzhin gyi 'khor thams cad na rtsa ji snyed cig yod pa de dag thams cad kyang shin tu mnyam par gyur te/ kun kyang rab tu tshang bar gyur to/ /mi chen po'i mtshan seng+ge'i 'gram pa lta bu yang thob par gyur te/ za 'gram shin tu mkhregs pa dang / bzhin gyi dkyil 'khor shin tu rgyas pa dang / bzhin gyi dkyil 'khor shin tu legs shing yongs su dag pa dang / kha'i sgo shin tu yangs pa dang ldan par gyur to/ /mi chen po'i mtshan so mnyam pa bzhi bcu dang yang ldan par gyur te/ so ma tshang ba med pa la zas shig za na yang lan gcig bldad pas chung du na 'bras can gyi 'bru 'ga' yang ma zhig par za ba med do/ /so thags bzang zhing mnyam pa rab tu thob ste/ mtshams chu sgo med pa dang / shin tu mnyam pa dang / rkyen rkyen du shin tu mdzes pa ste/ de kha zas shig za na yang 'go ba dang / 'chags pa dang / zhen pa dang / ljan ljin du 'gyur ba'am; thogs par 'gyur ba'am/ gseb 'gang bar 'gyur ba med do/ /mi chen po'i mtshan so mnyam pa rab tu thob par gyur te/ so mnyam zhing rnga rngo med pa dang / so lhag med pa dang / so zhum pa med pa dang / so gyes pa med pa dang / so thog drung mnyam pa dang / so rngo ba med par gyur to/ /gzhon nu de'i mche ba shin tu dkar bar gyur te/ mche ba skyon med pa/ mche ba shin tu gsal ba/ mche ba shin tu dag pa/ mche ba shin tu brtan par gyur to/ /mi chen po'i mtshan lce shin tu yangs pa yang rab tu thob par gyur te/ de'i lce ni/ shin tu yangs la srab cing mnyen te/ shin tu 'jam pa dang / las su rung ba dang / yid du 'ong ba dang / bsgyur na bde ba dang / gdong gi dkyil 'khor kun 'gebs pa dang / bden zhing phan par 'gyur ba'i don dang / yi ge dang / ngag dang / nges pa'i tshig thogs pa med par rjod par gyur to/ /gzhon nu de tshangs pa'i dbyangs dang ldan par gyur te/ dbyangs yid du 'ong ba dang / rol mo'i sgra dang / klu'i nga ro dang / sil snyan gyi dbyangs dang / sgra skad dang / brjod cing smra ba'i tshig gi las yid du 'ong ba brjod pas/ ngag gi lam mngon par dga' ba bskyed pa/ 'jig rten thams cad mngon par 'dun par 'gyur bar tshangs pa las kyang lhag pa'i dbyangs kyis ngag rjod de/ 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor las kyang gud du mi 'da' bar thams cad kyi yid dang mthun par byed pa dang ldan par gyur to/ /gzhon nu de ni/ mig dkar nag 'byes par gyur te/ mig shin tu dang ba dang / mig yongs su dag pa dang / mig la 'od chags pa dang / mig rnam par gsal ba dang / mig mngon par mdzes pa dang / mig blta na sdug pa dang / mig yid du 'ong ba dang / mig 'dzum pa dang ldan par gyur to/ /gzhon nu de ni/ rdzi ma ba'i rdzi ma lta bu dang ldan par gyur to/ /mig gi skye mched rin po che pad+ma rA ga ltar shin tu dag pa/ mig gi sprin mnyam pa/ mig gi sprin mtshungs pa/ mig gi sprin legs pa/ mig gi sprin yangs pa/ mig gi sprin rdzogs pa/ mig gi sprin shin tu brtan par gyur to/ /de'i smin mtshams su mdzod spu skyes par gyur te/ 'jam pa/ las su rung ba/ shin tu mnyen pa; shing bal ltar reg na bde ba/ dang ba/ gsal ba/ 'od yod pa/ chab rom lta bu kha ba'i kha dog ltar 'dug pa/ 'od zer dkar po'i dkyil 'khor gyi 'od rab tu snang ba dang ldan par gyur to; ;de'i spyi bo la gtsug tor mngon par grub par gyur te shin tu legs pa/ kun nas zlum pa/ dbus su bab pa/ skra'i rgyan du gyur pa/ rin po che'i pad+mo 'dab ma bye ba brgya phrag stong dang ldan pa ltar snang ba/ kun nas cha mnyam par gnas pa/ rin thang gdab tu tshad med pas gces pa'i gtsug tu gyur pa dang ldan par gyur to/ /gzhon nu de pags pa shin tu 'jam pa dang ldan par gyur te/ de'i lus la rdul tam/ dri ma'am/ rdul tam/ ser ka'am/ gnyer ma'am/ lhod pa'am/ 'khums pa'am/ 'phyang ba'am/ slod bag tu gnas pa med par gyur to/ /gzhon nu de ni/ mdog gser gyi kha dog lta bu dang ldan par gyur te/ 'dzam bu chu klung gi gser gyi mdog lta bu dang ldan zhing 'od kun tu 'dom gang ba dang / gser ltar gcig tu 'bar ba'i 'od kyi dkyil 'khor gyis mdzes par brgyan pa dang / ba spu'i bu ga thams cad nas dri zhim po'i 'od zer 'byung bas lus kyi rgyan rab rib med cing 'od gsal ba dang ldan par gyur to/ /gzhon nu de ni/ ba spu re re'i byung ba dang ldan par gyur te/ ba spu'i bu ga re re nas ba spu re re skyes par gyur pa/ bai DUr+ya sngon po'i kha dog lta bu/ g.yas phyogs su 'khyil ba/ legs par skyes pa/ mthang la zhi bar 'dug pa/ shin tu legs par gnas pa dang ldan par gyur to/ /gzhon nu de'i spu yan lag gyen du 'khyil bar gyur te/ phyir mi ldog pa'i spu dang / mi ldog pa'i spu dang / ma 'dres pa'i spu dang ldan par gyur to/ /gzhon nu de mi chen po'i mtshan skra mthon mthing du 'dug pa thob par gyur te/ de'i skra nor bu rin po che rnam par snang ba'i mdog ltar mthon mthing du 'dug pa/ 'jam pa/ snum pa/ legs par 'khyil ba/ g.yas phyogs su 'khyil ba; drung shin tu ran pa/ zad zed med pa/ 'jam 'jam ltar 'dug pa/ mi 'dzings pa/ dbyibs mnyam zhing mthun par gnas pa dang ldan par gyur to/ /rgyal bu gzhon nu de shing gro d+ha ltar mchu zheng gab pa'i mi chen po'i mtshan rab tu thob par gyur te/ kun nas rkyen du ran pa dang / kun tu bzang ba dang / kun tu mdzes pa dang ldan par gyur te/ de ni/ mdun nas bltas na'ang ngoms mi shes shing / blta na yid du 'ong ba/ rgyab dang / g.yas g.yon dang / 'gro ba dang / 'dug pa dang / 'greng ba dang / nyal ba dang / smra ba dang / mi smra bar 'dug pa la bltas na'ang ngoms mi shes shing yid du 'ong la blta na sdug par gyur te/
rigs kyi bu/ rgyal bu gzhon nu gzi brjid kyi bdag po de mi chen po'i mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis po de dag gis yongs su brgyan pa'i lus dang ldan par gyur te/ sems can thams cad kyis blta na yid du mi 'ong ba'i bag med pa/ blta na bsam pa thams cad yongs su rdzogs par byed pa/ blta na sems can thams cad kyi dga' ba yongs su 'byung ba de lta bu zhig skyes par gyur te/

rigs kyi bu/ de nas lan gcig cig rgyal bu gzhon nu gzi brjid kyi bdag po de yab kyis gnang nas rgyal po'i gnas sdong po ri bo'i dpal gyi bza' shing gi ra ba spos kyi myu gu'i rtse mo las 'od kyi sprin 'byung ba zhes bya ba der sa bzang po blta ba'i phyir bu mo stong phrag nyi shu dang lhan cig tu bsod nams kyi gzi brjid dang dpal gyi bskal ba bzang po'i rnam par 'phrul pa'i rgyan gyis byung nas skyes pa dang bud med kyi tshogs kyis kun nas dga' bar bya zhing / dzam+bu chu klung gi gser gyi shing rta rdo rje rin po che'i 'khor lo chen po bzhi dang ldan pa/ rdo rje mthu bo che'i srog shing sra ba/ tsan+dan dam pa las bsgrubs pa'i yu ba bzang po dang ldan pa/ rin po che'i rgyal po spos sna tshogs kyi shing thags rnam par bkye ba/ rin po che thams cad kyi me tog sna tshogs kyis rab tu mdzes par byas pa/ rin po che thams cad kyi dra bas kun nas yog pa'i rgyan dang ldan pa/ seng+ge'i khri rin po che dam pa'i dra ba'i rgyan gyi snying po can dbus su bshams pa/ bu mo lnga brgyas rin po che'i srad bu'i lnga ldi nas yongs su bzung ba/ nam mkha' la chags pa med pa'i rlung ltar mgyogs pa'i rta cang shes stong dang bcas pa la zhon nas gdugs chen po rim gyis gzhol zhing blta na sdug pa/ steng g.yogs rin po che'i rgyal po bai DUr+ya dkar po las byas pa/ 'od dri ma med pa tshad med pa 'byung ba/ rin po che bsam gyis mi khyab pa rmad du byung ba sna tshogs thams cad kyis spa bar spras te rnam pa thams cad du mdzes par brgyan pa/ yub rin po che'i rgyal po bai DUr+ya sngon po las bsgrengs pas ni/ bskyabs/ srog chags brgya stong mang pos ni/ yongs su bskor/ rol mo brgya stong mang po lha rdzas kyi dbyangs yid du 'ong ba snyan pa dang ldan pa dag ni/ rab tu blangs/ me tog gi char chen po ni/ mngon par 'bab/ lha rdzas kyi spos dri zhim pa'i bdug spos kyi snod bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong gis ni/ rab tu bdug cing 'gro bar gyur to/ /de de ltar 'gro ba'i tshe lam yang rgyud brgyad dang ldan par gyur te/ mthon dman med pa dang / gseg ma dang gyo mo med pa dang / gser dngul dang rin po che'i rgyal po sna tshogs kyi khams kyis sa'i gzhi rab tu bsgrubs pa dang / gser gyi phye ma bkram pa dang / rin po che sna tshogs kyi me tog sil mas chal bar gang ba dang / g.yas g.yon nas rin po che'i shing gi phreng bas dkrigs pa dang / rin po che sna tshogs kyi kha ran bkye ba dang / steng nas rin po che'i dra ba bres pa dang / rin po che'i gnam yol sna tshogs kyis bkab pa dang / rin po che'i rgyal mtshan dang / ba dan dang / snam bu brgya stong rab tu brgyan pa du ma bsgrengs shing dpyangs pas mdzes par brgyan pa dang / g.yas g.yon nas rin po che'i stegs bu'i phreng ba rnam par bkod pas rnam par brgyan pa ste/

“Once, as a youth, this prince went, with the permission of his father and mother, to go see one of the parks of the city, called Clouds of Light on a Mountain of Fragrant Plants. He went together with twenty thousand girls, projecting a great aura of felicity, glory, energy, splendor, and beauty, admired by men and women all around. They got into a golden vehicle with four huge diamond wheels and unbreakable diamond axles set in the finest sandalwood. It was ribbed with well-arranged diamonds of all fragrances, splendidly adorned with flowers of all jewels, draped with nets of all jewels, with a lion seat set in the middle of the interior, arrayed with great jewels. The reins, strings of jewels, were held by five hundred girls, and it was drawn by a thousand thoroughbred horses fleet as the wind.
