rigs kyi bu/ de la ji snyam du sems/ de'i tshe de'i dus na rgyal pa gzi brjid kyi bdag po'i 'khor du gyur pa de rnams gzhan zhig yin pa snyam du sems na ni/ rigs kyi bu/ de ni/ de ltar mi blta ste; bcom ldan 'das kyis byang chub sems dpa' kun tu bzang po'i spyod pa dang / smon lam yongs su rdzogs par bya ba la dgod dgod pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor 'di nyid na 'khod cing / 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du gzugs brnyan rab tu byung ba'i lus dang / byang chub sems dpa'i ting nge 'dzin thams cad la rnam par spyod pa las ma nyams pa'i sems dang / de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi zhal mngon du mthong bar rnam par dmigs pa'i mig dang / de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi gsung gi yan lag gi sprin nam mkha' dang mnyam pa'i 'khor lo rab tu bsgrags pa'i dbyangs rnam par dmigs pa'i rna ba dang / chos thams cad la rnam par spyad par dbang sgyur ba'i dbugs phyi nang du rgyu ba dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing thams cad du rjes su grags pa'i ming gi sgra dang / de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor du nye bar 'gro ba rgyun mi gcod pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i lus dang / sems can thams cad la bsam pa ji lta ba bzhin du mngon par ston pa'i lus yongs su smin par bya ba dang / gdul ba la rjes su mthun pa mngon par bsgrubs pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' kun tu bzang po'i spyod pa dang / smon lam yongs su rdzogs par bya ba dang / yang dag par sgrub pa phyogs kyi dra ba ma lus pa thams cad du 'dal te/ ma 'ongs pa'i bskal pa thams cad du rgyun mi 'chad pa dang ldan pa sha stag bcom ldan 'das kyi 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor na 'khod pa 'di dag yin no/ /

“Who do you think were the retinue of the king Lord of Wealth? They were these enlightening beings seated here in this assembly, guided by the Buddha to the fulfillment of the vows of universally good action, with a body reflected in all worlds, mind unadulterated and unfragmented in all concentration states of enlightening beings, eyes seeing the being and countenance of all buddhas, ears hearing the utterances of all buddhas, breath in control of all spiritual stations, voice going to all buddha-lands, the body of an enlightening being ceaselessly going to the audiences of all buddhas, entering the network of all places by production of embodiments suitable to develop and guide according to the mentalities of those to whom the enlightening beings appear, arriving at fulfillment of the vows of practice of universal good unbroken throughout the ages.

rigs kyi bu/ de bzhin gshegs pa sku nyi ma dam pa de ni/ 'khor los bsgyur ba gzi brjid kyi bdag po dang / kho mos nam bzhugs kyi bar du na bza' dang / bshos dang / gzims cha dang / snyun gyi rkyen sman dang / yo byad kyis bsnyen bkur to/ /rigs kyi bu/ de bzhin gshegs pa sku nyi ma dam pa yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa'i 'og tu 'jig rten gyi khams de nyid du de bzhin gshegs pa sku shin tu dang ba zhes bya ba 'jig rten du byung ste; de yang kho mo cag gis bsnyen bkur to/ /rim gror byas so/ /bsti stang du byas so/ /phu dud du byas so/ /mchod do/ /de'i 'og tu de bzhin gshegs pa sku thams cad la ye shes kyi gzugs brnyan gyi zla ba snang ba zhes bya ba 'jig rten du byung ste/ de yang kho mo cag gis lha'i dbang por gyur te bsnyen bkur to/ /de'i 'og tu de bzhin gshegs pa 'dzam bu chu klung gi gzi brjid kyi rgyal po zhes bya ba bsnyen bkur to/ /de'i 'og tu de bzhin gshegs pa sku mtshan gyis rnam par brgyan pa zhes bya ba bsnyen bkur to/ /de'i 'og tu de bzhin gshegs pa 'od zer sna tshogs 'bar ba'i zla ba zhes bya ba bsnyen bkur to/ /de'i 'og tu de bzhin gshegs pa shin tu rnam par gzigs pa'i ye shes dpal zhes bya ba bsnyen bkur to/ /de'i 'og tu de bzhin gshegs pa ye shes chen po'i 'od zer shin tu yangs pa'i rgyal po zhes bya ba bsnyen bkur to/ /de'i 'og tu de bzhin gshegs pa rdo rje mthu bo che'i brtson 'grus zhes bya ba bsnyen bkur to/ /de'i 'og tu de bzhin gshegs pa ye shes gzhan gyis mi thub pa'i mthu zhes bya ba bsnyen bkur to/ / de'i 'og tu de bzhin gshegs pa kun tu rnam par gzigs pa'i ye shes zhes bya ba bsnyen bkur to/ /de'i 'og tu de bzhin gshegs pa ye shes dri ma med pa phun sum tshogs pa'i sprin zhes bya ba bsnyen bkur to/ /de'i 'og tu de bzhin gshegs pa seng+ge rnam par bsgyings pa'i 'od ces bya ba bsnyen bkur to/ /de'i 'og tu de bzhin gshegs pa 'od zer 'bar ba'i gtsug phud ces bya ba bsnyen bkur to/ /de'i 'og tu de bzhin gshegs pa yon tan 'od zer rgyal mtshan zhes bya ba bsnyen bkur to/ /de'i 'og tu de bzhin gshegs pa ye shes nyi ma'i gzi brjid ces bya ba bsnyen bkur to/ /de'i 'og tu de bzhin gshegs pa sku rin po che'i pad+mo shin tu rgyas pa zhes bya ba bsnyen bkur to/ /de'i 'og tu de bzhin gshegs pa bsod nams sgron ma'i rgyal mtshan zhes bya ba bsnyen bkur to/ /de'i 'og tu de bzhin gshegs pa ye shes 'od zer gyi sprin gyi 'od ces bya ba bsnyen bkur to/ /de'i 'og tu de bzhin gshegs pa kun tu rnam par snang ba'i zla ba zhes bya ba bsnyen bkur to/ /de'i 'og tu de bzhin gshegs pa rgyan dang gdugs kyi dbyangs kyi rgyal po zhes bya ba bsnyen bkur to/ /de'i 'og tu de bzhin gshegs pa ye shes snang bas rnam par gnon pa'i seng+ge zhes bya ba bsnyen bkur to/ /de'i 'og tu de bzhin gshegs pa chos kyi dbyings kyi yul gyi blo gros zla ba zhes bya ba bsnyen bkur to/ /de'i 'og tu de bzhin gshegs pa sems can nam mkha'i sems snang ba'i gzugs zhes bya ba bsnyen bkur to; ;de'i 'og tu de bzhin gshegs pa rab tu zhi ba'i spos kyi gtsug bzang po zhes bya ba bsnyen bkur to/ /de'i 'og tu de bzhin gshegs pa zhi ba'i dbyangs kun tu bsgrags pa zhes bya ba bsnyen bkur to/ /de'i 'og tu de bzhin gshegs pa ye shes rab tu brtan pa'i 'od zer gyi dra ba'i gzugs kyi phung po zhes bya ba bsnyen bkur to/ /de'i 'og tu de bzhin gshegs pa bdud rtsi'i ri bo'i gzi brjid ces bya ba bsnyen bkur to/ /de'i 'og tu de bzhin gshegs pa chos rgya mtsho'i 'brug sgra sgrog pa'i dbyangs zhes bya ba bsnyen bkur to/ /de'i 'og tu de bzhin gshegs pa sangs rgyas nam mkha' snang ba'i gtsug phud ces bya ba bsnyen bkur to/ /de'i 'og tu de bzhin gshegs pa 'od zer zla ba mdzod spu'i sprin ces bya ba bsnyen bkur to/ /de'i 'og tu de bzhin gshegs pa ye shes kyi zhal shin tu rgyas pa zhes bya ba bsnyen bkur te/ /de'i 'og tu de bzhin gshegs pa ye shes shin tu rnam par dag pa'i me tog snang ba zhes bya ba bsnyen bkur to/ /de'i 'og tu de bzhin gshegs pa rin chen 'od 'phro'i ri bo dpal gyi gzi brjid kyi rgyal po zhes bya ba bsnyen bkur to/ /de'i 'og tu de bzhin gshegs pa yon tan rgya chen po gzi brjid kyi 'od ces bya ba bsnyen bkur to/ /de'i 'og tu de bzhin gshegs pa ting nge 'dzin gyi ri rab mngon par 'phags pa'i ye shes zhes bya ba bsnyen bkur to/ /de'i 'og tu de bzhin gshegs pa rin chen zla ba'i rgyal mtshan zhes bya ba bsnyen bkur to/ /de'i 'og tu de bzhin gshegs pa sku 'od 'phro ba'i dkyil 'khor zhes bya ba bsnyen bkur to/ /de'i 'og tu de bzhin gshegs pa rin chen mchog gi 'od kyi gzi brjid ces bya ba bsnyen bkur to/ /de'i 'og tu de bzhin gshegs pa ye shes kyi spyod pa kun tu thogs pa med pa zhes bya ba bsnyen bkur to/ /de'i 'og tu de bzhin gshegs pa 'od 'phro rgya mtsho'i sgo'i sgron ma zhes bya ba bsnyen bkur to/ /de'i 'og tu de bzhin gshegs pa rin chen zla ba'i rgyal mtshan zhes bya ba bsnyen bkur to/ /de'i 'og tu de bzhin gshegs pa chos kyi gzhal med khang gi dbyangs kyi rgyal po zhes bya ba bsnyen bkur to/ /de'i 'og tu de bzhin gshegs pa yon tan mi mtshungs grags pa'i rgyal mtshan zhes bya ba bsnyen bkur to/ / de'i 'og tu de bzhin gshegs pa phyag rab tu brkyang ba zhes bya ba bsnyen bkur to/ /de'i 'og tu de bzhin gshegs pa sngon gyi smon lam gyis 'phrul pa'i zla ba zhes bya ba bsnyen bkur to/ /de'i 'og tu de bzhin gshegs pa nam mkha'i ye shes don gyi sgron ma zhes bya ba bsnyen bkur to/ /de'i 'og tu de bzhin gshegs pa chos kyis 'phags pa'i nam mkha'i dbang phyug ces bya ba bsnyen bkur to/ /de'i 'og tu de bzhin gshegs pa rnam par snang mdzad dpal gyi snying po rgyal po zhes bya ba bsnyen bkur to/ /de'i 'og tu de bzhin gshegs pa chos mthu bo che'i dpal zhes bya ba bsnyen bkur to/ /de'i 'og tu de bzhin gshegs pa ye shes dpal zhes bya ba bsnyen bkur to/ /de'i 'og tu de bzhin gshegs pa chos rgya mtsho'i pad+mo zhes bya ba bsnyen bkur to/ /rigs kyi bu/ de ltar de bzhin gshegs pa de dag la sogs pa 'jig rten gyi khams der sangs rgyas bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong phrag drug cu byung ste/ de dag thams cad kho mo cag gis na bza' dang / bshos dang / gzims cha dang / snyun gyi rkyen sman dang / yo byad kyis bsnyen bkur to/ /rim gror byas so/ /bsti stang du byas so/ /phu dud du byas so/ /mchod do/ /

“The king Lord of Glory and I, furthermore, attended the buddha Supreme Sun as long as he lived, providing him with the necessities of life. After that buddha passed away entirely, a buddha named Pure Body emerged, in that same world, and we honored and served him. After that we served, in succession, buddhas named Moon Reflecting Knowledge in All Limbs, King of Golden Light, Adorned with Marks of Greatness, Moon Blazing with a Web of Brilliant Light Beams, Paragon of Observant Knowledge, King Illumined with Great Knowledge, Adamantine Energy, Invincible Power of Knowledge, All-Observing Knowledge, Cloud of Pure Light, Crown Blazing with Lights of Knowledge, Banner of Lights of Virtue, Energy of the Sun of Knowledge, Limbs Like Blooming Jewel Lotuses, Lamp of Felicity, Radiance of Multitudes of Rays of Knowledge, Moon Shining Everywhere, Powerful Lion Illumined by Universal Knowledge, Moon of Cosmic Mind, Reflection in the Spacelike Mind of Beings, Tranquil and Well Balanced, Ubiquitous Sound of Silence, Cluster of Images in a Network of Light Rays of Stable Knowledge, Radiance of the Mountain of Immortality, Thunder of the Ocean of Truths, Crown of Light in the Sky of Buddhas, Moon of Light Beams, Face of Complete Knowledge, Luster of Flowers of Pure Knowledge, Glorious Light of a Mountain of Jewel Flowers, Light of Myriad Stars of Virtue, Knowledge Emerging from the Heights of Concentration, Jewel Moon, Circle of Flames, Sublime Jewel Radiance, Unhesitating in Practice of Universal Knowledge, Blazing Lamp Topped with a Sea of Flames, King Proclaiming the Mansion of Truth, Famed for Peerless Virtue, Moon Reflecting Past Vows, Lamp of Meaning with Spacelike Knowledge, Lord of the Sky, Born of Truth, King Filled with Shining Light, Paragon of Spirituality, Chief in Knowledge, Lotus in the Ocean of Truth. Beginning with these, there were sixty decillion buddhas in that world whom we honored, served, and provided with food and clothing, medicine and furniture.

rigs kyi bu/ sangs rgyas bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong phrag drug cu po de dag thams cad kyi tha mar de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas chos rgya chen po la mos pa yang dag par 'byung ba'i gzi brjid ces bya ba byung ste/ bcom ldan 'das de grong khyer du gshegs pa la kho mo rgyal po'i chung mar gyur te khyim thab dang bcas pas de bzhin gshegs pa'i mchod pa'i sgo rnam pa thams cad du bshams pas mchod pa byas nas bcom ldan 'das de las chos kyi rnam grangs de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad skye ba 'byung ba'i sgron ma zhes bya ba thos so/ /de thos nas kho mos ye shes kyi mig rab tu thob ste byang chub sems dpa'i rnam par thar pa byang chub sems dpa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi tshul rgya mtsho thams cad la rnam par lta ba'i yul 'di yang rab tu thob par gyur to/ /

“The last of those sixty decillion buddhas was one named Energy Born of Great Zeal for Truth. When that buddha came to town, I, as wife of the king, together with my husband, made all kinds of offerings and then heard an exposition of the Teaching from the buddha called ‘lamp produced by the emergence of all those who arrive at Thusness,’ on hearing which I attained the eye of knowledge, and attained this enlightening liberation whose sphere is observation of the oceans of concentrations of all enlightening beings.

rigs kyi bu/ de ltar kho mo rnam par thar pa 'di la sgom zhing / byang chub sems dpa' dang lhan cig tu byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa spyod cing bskal pa sangs rgyas kyi zhing brgya phrag stong gi rdul shin tu phra ba snyed cig tu rgyu rgyu ste/ sangs rgyas kyi zhing de snyed kyi rdul shin tu phra ba snyed kyi bskal pa de dag la de bzhin gshegs pa mtha' dang dbus med pa zhig bsnyen bkur nas bskal pa la la la ni/ de bzhin gshegs pa bskal par bzhugs pa gcig kyang bsnyen bkur to/ /bskal pa la la ni/ de bzhin gshegs pa gnyis kyang bsnyen bkur to/ /bskal pa la la la ni/ de bzhin gshegs pa brjod du med pa'i bar dag kyang bsnyen bkur to/ /bskal pa la la la ni/ de bzhin gshegs pa sangs rgyas kyi zhing gi rdul shin tu phra ba snyed kyang bsnyen bkur to/ /de srid du kho mos byang chub sems dpa'i sku yang tshad ni/ ji tsam zhig /dbyibs ni/ ji lta bu zhig /sku mdog ni/ ji 'dra ba zhig yin pa khong du ma chud do/ /sku'i 'phrin las kyang khong du mchud do/ /gsung gi 'phrin las dang / thugs kyi 'phrin las kyang khong du mchud do/ ye shes kyi gzigs pa dang / ye shes kyi spyod yul dang / ye shes kyi ting nge 'dzin gyi yul yang khong du mchud do/ /rigs kyi bu/ byang chub sems dpa' ji snyed cig gis byang chub sems dpa' byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa mdzad pa mthong nas byang chub sems dpa' la dga' ba'i sems bskyed de brda sna tshogs dang / bsnyen pa sna tshogs kyis mos pa bskyed par gyur pa de dag thams cad kyang byang chub sems dpa'i 'jig rten dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i thabs sna tshogs kyis yongs su bzung ste/ byang chub sems dpa'i 'khor du gyur to/ /de dag kyang byang chub sems dpa' byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa mdzad pa'i tshe 'khor du 'grogs 'grogs pas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub las phyir mi ldog par gyur to/ /

“Cultivating this liberation for as many eons as atoms in one hundred buddha-lands, carrying out enlightening practice with the enlightening being Vairocana, I associated with countless buddhas during those many eons. In an eon I might serve one buddha or two, up to an inexpressible number of buddhas; some eons I served as many buddhas as atoms in a buddha-land. Yet never did I know the size of the enlightening being’s body or what it looked like; nor did I know the enlightening being’s physical, verbal, or mental actions, nor his knowledge and vision, his range of knowledge, or his realm of concentration of knowledge. As for those who, seeing the enlightening being carrying out the practice of enlightening beings, developed pure faith through various associations, all of them were taken care of by the enlightening being by various worldly and transmundane means, and became associates of the enlightening being. Associating with the enlightening being as he carried on enlightening practice, they never regressed on the way to supreme perfect enlightenment.

rigs kyi bu/ de ltar kho mos de bzhin gshegs pa chos rgya chen po la mos pa yang dag par 'byung ba'i gzi brjid kyi zhal mthong ma thag tu byang chub sems dpa'i rnam par thar pa byang chub sems dpa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi tshul rgya mtsho la rnam par lta ba'i yul 'di thob nas rnam par thar pa 'di sgom zhing / byang chub sems dpa' dang / bskal pa sangs rgyas kyi zhing brgya phrag stong gi rdul shin tu phra ba snyed cig tu 'grogs 'grogs te/ bskal pa sangs rgyas kyi zhing brgya'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed po de dag la de bzhin gshegs pa ji snyed cig byung bar gyur pa de dag thams cad kyang kho mos bsnyen bkur to/ /mchod do/ /rim gror byas so/ /de bzhin gshegs pa de dag thams cad las kyang kho mos chos bstan pa thob ste yongs su blangs so/ /yang dag par bzung ngo/ /sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag thams cad las kyang kho mos rnam par thar pa 'di tshul sna tshogs dang / mdo sde'i tshul gyi gsung sna tshogs dang / rnam par thar pa'i rang bzhin sna tshogs dang / rnam par thar pa'i sgo sna tshogs dang / rnam par thar pa'i rgyud sna tshogs dang / dus la 'jug pa sna tshogs dang / zhing rgya mtsho la 'jug pa sna tshogs dang / sangs rgyas blta ba rgya mtsho rnam par dmigs par bya ba sna tshogs dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor du 'jug pa sna tshogs dang / byang chub sems dpa'i smon lam rgya mtsho'i tshul gyi lam sna tshogs dang / byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa mngon par sgrub pa sna tshogs dang / byang chub sems dpa'i rnam par thar pa 'byams klas pa sna tshogs kyis thob par gyur kyang byang chub sems dpa'i rnam par thar pa kun tu bzang po'i tshul ni/ khong du mchud do/ /de ci'i phyir zhe na/ byang chub sems dpa' kun tu bzang po rnams kyi rnam par thar pa'i tshul ni/ nam mkha'i dbyings kyis klas par tshad med do/ /sems can gyi ming du bya ba thams cad kyi dbyings ltar tshad med do/ /dus gsum gyi rgyud rgya mtsho'i dbyings ltar tshad med do/ /phyogs rgya mtsho'i dbyings ltar tshad med do/ /chos kyi dbyings kyi tshul rgya mtsho'i dbyings ltar tshad med do/ /rigs kyi bu/ byang chub sems dpa' kun tu bzang po rnams kyi rnam par thar pa'i tshul gyi lus ni/ de bzhin gshegs pa'i yul dang mnyam pa'o; ;

“Having attained the enlightening liberation whose sphere is observation of the oceans of concentrations of all enlightening beings when I saw the buddha Energy Born of Zeal for Truth, as I cultivated this liberation along with the enlightening being for as many eons as atoms in a hundred buddha-lands, I propitiated, served, and attended all the buddhas who emerged in those ages and heard, took up, and remembered their teachings; and I attained this liberation from all those buddhas, by various methods, by various enunciations of principles and systems of scriptures, by various bodies of liberation, by various doors of liberation, by various liberative meditations and procedures, by various ways of access, by entry into various oceans of buddha-lands, by various visions of oceans of buddhas, by entry into various buddhas’ assemblies, by various paths following the oceans of vows of enlightening beings, by carrying out various paths following the oceans of vows of enlightening beings, by carrying out various practices of enlightening beings, by accomplishing various practices of enlightening beings, by various manifestations of the scope of the endeavor of enlightening beings: yet I still did not enter the enlightening being’s universally good liberation. Why? Because the ways of liberation of the universally good enlightening beings are infinite as space, infinite as the thoughts of all sentient beings, infinite as the ocean of time periods of past, present, and future, infinite as the ocean of places, infinite as the ocean of structures of the cosmos; indeed, the ways of liberation of the universally good enlightening beings are equal to the sphere of buddhahood.

de ltar rigs kyi bu/ kho mos bskal pa sangs rgyas kyi zhing gi rdul shin tu phra ba snyed cig tu byang chub sems dpa'i sku la lta lta yang blta bas ma ngoms te/ rigs kyi bu/ 'di lta ste; dper na/ gcig tu 'dod chags la spyod pa'i skyes pa dang bud med phan tshun nas 'phrad par dus byas pa gnyis la ni/ sems kyi rgyud tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa las byung ba gtsang ba'i 'du shes pa dang / rnam par rtog pas mos pa las byung ba tshad med pa zhig skye'o/ /rigs kyi bu/ de bzhin du kho mo byang chub sems dpa'i sku la lta na/ ba spu'i sgo re re nas kyang 'jig rten gyi khams kyi rgyud 'byams klas pa mtha' dang dbus med pa/ tshad med par shin tu bstan pa/ gzhi sna tshogs dang ldan pa/ mtshams kyi rgyan sna tshogs dang ldan pa; dbyibs sna tshogs dang ldan pa/ ri'i rgyan sna tshogs kyis brgyan pa/ sa'i gzhi'i rgyan sna tshogs bstan du yod pa/ sprin sna tshogs dang ldan pa'i nam mkha' kun nas khyab pa'i rgyan dang ldan pa/ tshul dang / ming dang / grangs sna tshogs su brjod pa/ sangs rgyas 'byung ba dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i rgyud sna tshogs 'byung ba/ snying po byang chub kyi rgyan sna tshogs kyis brgyan pa/ de bzhin gshegs pa chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba'i rnam par 'phrul pa sna tshogs dang ldan pa/ de bzhin gshegs pa'i 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor gyi rgyan sna tshogs dang ldan pa/ mdo sde'i tshul sna tshogs shin tu bstan pa'i sgra 'byung ba/ theg pa'i tshul sna tshogs mngon par sgrub pa 'byung ba dang ldan pa / yongs su dag pa'i 'od dang / snang ba sna tshogs kyis rab tu snang pa/ mtshan ma sngon chad ma mthong ba dag sems kyi skad cig re re zhing mig lam du snang ngo/ /ba spu'i sgo re re nas kyang sangs rgyas rgya mtsho mtha' dang dbus med pa'i snying po byang chub kyi rgyan sna tshogs mnga' ba/ chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba'i rnam par 'phrul pa sna tshogs dang ldan pa/ mdo sde'i tshul sna tshogs sgrog pa'i rnam par 'phrul pa dang ldan pa dag kyang rgyun mi 'chad pa'i tshul du sems kyi skad cig re re la mig lam du snang ngo/ /ba spu'i sgo re re nas kyang sems can rgya mtsho mtha' dang dbus med pa khyim dang / kun dga'i ra ba dang / ri dang / gzhal med khang dang / chu klung dang / rgya mtsho la gnas pa gzugs dang / lus sna tshogs can/ longs spyod kyi yul sna tshogs dang ldan pa/ spyod pa dang / spyod yul dang / sbyor ba sna tshogs dang ldan pa/ dbang po sna tshogs su grub pa'i tshul dang ldan pa dag kyang sems kyi skad cig re re la mig lam du snang ngo/ /ba spu'i sgo re re nas kyang dus gsum rgya mtsho la 'jug pa'i tshul mtha' dang dbus med pa zhig mig lam du snang ngo/ /byang chub sems dpa'i smon lam rgya mtsho mtha' dang dbus med pa zhig ni/ rnam par dag par 'gyur ro/ /byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa rnam pa tha dad pa rgya mtsho mtha' dang dbus med pa dag kyang yongs su snang ngo/ /byang chub sems dpa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i tshul rgya mtsho yongs su dag pa mtha' dang dbus med pa dag kyang yongs su snang ngo/ /byang chub sems dpa'i sngon gyi sbyor ba rgya mtsho mtha' dang dbus med pa dag kyang yongs su snang ngo/ /sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par bya ba'i tshul rgya mtsho mtha' dang dbus med pa dag kyang yongs su snang ngo/ /byang chub sems dpa'i byams pa chen po'i tshul rgya mtsho mtha' dang dbus med pa dag kyang yongs su snang ngo/ /sems can thams cad yongs su smin par bya ba dang / gdul ba'i mthu dang / thabs rgya mtsho dag la'ang 'jug cing khong du chud do/ /byang chub sems dpa'i snying rje chen po'i sprin gyi tshul rgya mtsho mtha' dang dbus med pa dag kyang yongs su 'grub bo/ /byang chub sems dpa'i dga' ba'i shugs chen po rgya mtsho mtha' dang dbus med pa dag kyang rnam par 'phel te/ sems kyi skad cig re re la yang sems can thams cad yongs su bsdu ba'i tshul rgya mtsho mtha' dang dbus med pa dag kyang rab tu 'grub bo/ /

“For as many eons as atoms in a buddha-land I gazed at the enlightening being, never tired of seeing him. Just as countless illogical thoughts and illusions rise in the minds of a woman and man full of passion when they get together, as I watched the body of the enlightening being, in every moment of consciousness I perceived infinitely various indications from each of his pores—the range of world systems, their various foundations, various conjoining arrangements, various configurations, various mountain ranges, various arrays of the ground, various arrays of clouds in the sky, various names and numbers of eons, emergence of various buddhas and formation of lineages of buddhas, various adornments of enlightenment sites, various occult powers involved in the buddhas’ teaching procedures, various arrays of buddhas’ audiences, various enunciations of scriptures, productions of various vehicles of emancipation, and various manifestations of pure light, the like of which I had never seen before. By ceaseless effort, from each of his pores I saw in each moment of consciousness infinite oceans of buddhas, various adornments of enlightenment sites, various mystic operations of the Teaching, and various miraculous proclamations of scriptures. From each of his pores I saw, in each moment of consciousness, infinite oceans of beings, various houses, gardens, mountains, palaces, rivers, seas, and dwellings, various physical bodies, various goods, various actions and efforts, and various forms of development of faculties. From every one of his pores infinitely various ways of entering past, present, and future became perceptible; infinitely various oceans of vows of enlightening beings were purified, infinite oceans of differences of the practices of the stages of enlightening beings became perceptible, the infinitely various purities of the transcendent ways of enlightening beings became perceptible, infinitely various oceans of past efforts of enlightening beings became perceptible, infinitely various oceans of ways of purifying buddha-lands became perceptible; infinitely various oceans of the universal love of enlightening beings, oceans of universal love for all beings, and oceans of heroic efforts to develop and guide all beings descended into the world, infinite oceans of the universal compassion of enlightening beings arose, infinite oceans of the great joy of enlightening beings grew, and in every moment of consciousness infinitely various oceans of efforts to take care of all sentient beings were accomplished.

rigs kyi bu/ de ltar kho mo bskal pa sangs rgyas kyi zhing brgya'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed dag tu byang chub sems dpa'i ba spu'i sgo re re zhing sems kyi skad cig re re la chos kyi tshul rgya mtsho mtha' dang dbus med pa la zhugs te/ khong du chud par byas kyang mthar thug par ma gyur te sngon khong du chud pa la bzlas te khong du chud par byas pa'ang med do/ /sngon thob pa las bzlas te thob par byas pa'ang med do/ /rigs kyi bu/ de ltar don thams cad grub pa btsun mo'i 'khor gyi nang na bzhugs shing / bud med kyi tshogs kyis yongs su bskor bar bzhugs pa'i tshe'ang kho mo ni/ ba spu'i sgo re re nas kyang dus gsum gyi tshul rgya mtsho mtha' dang dbus med pa la chos kyi dbyings la 'jug pa'i tshul rgya mtsho khong du chud par bya bas yongs su 'jug go /

“In each moment of consciousness through those eons numerous as atoms in a hundred buddha-lands, I perceived oceans of principles of the Teaching from each pore of the enlightening being, and never reached the end, even though I did not go into what I had already gone into, and did not attain what I had already attained. This I did by going into the ocean of various ways of liberation of the enlightening being, even when he was the prince Siddhartha in the royal palace surrounded by women; I perceived infinitely various oceans of principles of past, present, and future through each of his pores, by penetrating the oceans of ways into the realm of reality.

rigs kyi bu/ kho mos byang chub sems dpa'i rnam par thar pa byang chub sems dpa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi tshul rgya mtsho thams cad la rnam par lta ba'i yul 'di shes te mnyam par gzhog par zad na/ kho mos byang chub sems dpa' thabs kyi tshul rgya mtsho mtha' dang dbus med pa la zhugs pa/ sems can thams cad dang mnyam zhing 'dra ba'i dbyibs su gnas pa'i lus rnam par dmigs pa yongs su ston pa/ 'gro ba thams cad kyi bsam pa dang mthun par spyod pa yongs su ston pa/ ba spu'i sgo thams cad nas kha dog mtha' yas pa'i sprul pa'i sprin rab tu 'gyed pa/ lus med pa'i chos nyid kyi ngo bo nyid kyi rang bzhin shin tu rnam par dag pa/ nam mkha'i mtshan nyid du 'gro ba'i rang bzhin khong du chud pas rnam par rtog pa med pa/ thams cad du rjes su song ba'i blo rnam par gdon mi za bas de bzhin gshegs pa dang mnyam par rnam par 'phrul pa la brtson pa/ rnam par thar pa'i yul mtha' dang dbus med pas rnam par 'phrul pa la zhugs pa/ chos kyi dbyings shin tu rgya chen por sems bskyed pas 'jug pa la rnam par spyod cing dbang sgyur ba/ chos kyi gnas sgo thams cad dang ldan pa'i rnam par thar pa rgya mtsho la rnam par rtse ba de dag gi spyod pa shes pa'am/ yon tan gyi gter ma lus par bstan par nus re skan/

“I only know and have attained this enlightening liberation whose sphere is observation of the oceans of concentrations of all enlightening beings. How can I know the practice, tell of the qualities, or show all the oceans of virtue of the enlightening beings who have gone into the infinitely various oceans of liberative means, who purposely appear physically like all beings, who appear to act in accord with the mentalities of all beings, who emanate infinitely various appearances from all their pores, who realize the purity of essence and nature of all bodies, who are free from discriminatory thought because of awareness of the spacelike quality of the nature of beings, whose intellect reaches everywhere with certain discernment, occupied with spiritual powers equal to those who arrive at Thusness, who produce miraculous displays of infinite spheres of liberation, who have mastered the state where they can enter the vast cosmos of realities in a thought, who roam freely in the ocean of liberation of the all-sided stage of all truths?

song rigs kyi bu/ bcom ldan 'das rnam par snang mdzad kyi zhabs kyi drung 'di nyid na khri rin po che sna tshogs kyi rgyan dang ldan pa/ nor bu rin po che'i rgyal po pad+mo'i snying po can la byang chub sems dpa'i yum lha mo sgyu ma zhes bya ba 'dug gi /de'i gan du song la/ ji ltar byang chub sems dpa'i spyad pa spyod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams 'jig rten gyi chos kyi dri ma thams cad kyis mi gos pa yin pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa mchod pa'i nan tan la rgyun mi 'chad pa yin pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i las kyi mtha' thams cad las phyir mi ldog pa yin pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i rnam par thar pa la 'jug pa la sgrib pa thams cad dang bral bar 'gyur ba yin pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i rnam par spyod pa thams cad la gzhan gyi dring mi 'jog pa yin pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad dang mngon du gyur par gnas pa yin pa dang / sems can thams cad yongs su bsdu ba'i nan tan las phyir mi ldog pa yin pa dang / phyi ma'i mtha'i mur thug pa'i bskal par byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa thams cad la gnas par bya ba las phyir mi ldog pa yin pa dang / theg pa chen po'i smon lam las phyir mi ldog pa yin pa dang / 'gro ba thams cad kyi dge ba'i rtsa ba yongs su gzung ba dang / rnam par spel ba la sgyid lug par mi 'gyur pa yin pa dris shig /

“Go to Lady Maya, mother of the enlightening being, who is sitting on a great jewel lotus seat near the Blessed Vairocana. Go ask her how enlightening beings become undefiled by the taint of worldly things while they are carrying out the practice of enlightening beings, how they become unflagging in serving all buddhas, how they become undeviating from the ends of the actions of enlightening beings, how they become free from all hindrances to entry into the liberations of enlightening beings, how they become unfixed to all states of enlightening beings, how they come into the presence of all buddhas and do not stop their efforts to take care of all sentient beings, do not cease enlightening practice for all time, do not regress from the undertaking of the Great Vehicle of universal enlightenment, and do not become discouraged in maintaining and increasing the roots of goodness in the world.”
de nas shAkya'i bu mo go pas rnam par thar pa'i sgo'i tshul 'di nyid yongs su bstan pa'i phyir sangs rgyas kyi byin gyi rlabs kyis de'i tshe tshigs su bcad pa 'di dag smras so/ /
Then, by the empowerment of Buddha, Gopa spoke these verses illustrating this way of liberation:

yang dag byang chub spyod la brtson pa yi/ / sems can dam pa sems can sus mthong ba/ / mos pa'i sems can khong khro ldan yang rung / / de yi bsdu bas kun kyang yongs su 'du; ;
zhing brgya'i rdul phran rab tu phra snyed kyi/ / bskal pa mang po kho mos 'di nas dran/ / de yi pha rol bskal pa rnam brgyan la/ / 'jig rten khams rab ri bo'i 'od byung ngo/ /
de la thub pa stong phrag bgrangs pa ni/ / bye ba khrag khrig sum cu drug byung ste/ / de kun tha mar thub dbang byung ba ni/ / 'gro ba'i sgron ma chos kyi rgyal mtshan no/ /
de tshe rgyal po dpal gyi gzi brjid byung / / thub dbang de ni mya ngan yongs 'das nas/ / dgra yi 'khor bcom 'dzam bu'i rgyal mtshan 'dir/ / bka' la thogs med mnga' bdag dam par gyur/ /
de la bu ni brgya phrag lnga yod do/ / kun kyang dpa' zhing rtul bod gzugs dang ldan/ / yan lag kun rdzogs rnam par dag pa'i lus/ / gong na med pa'i dpal gyis rab tu brgyan/ /
rgyal po sras bcas bde gshegs 'dun par gyur; ; rgyal ba'i mchod pa rgya chen rab kyang byas/ / de ni rtag tu dam chos yongs bzung ba'i/ / chos la mngon brtson rab tu brtan par gyur/ /
rgyal po de sras 'od zer bzang po ni/ / sems can rnam dag gzhon nu 'khrungs gyur pa/ / shin tu blta mdzes yid 'ong gzugs ldan te/ / yan lag mtshan rab sum cu rtsa gnyis brgyan/ /
rgyal srid yongs su spangs nas mi yi 'khor/ / bye ba lngas bskor de tshe rab tu byung / / rab tu byung nas brtson 'grus brtan ldan te/ / rgyal po'i chos kyang yongs su bzung bar gyur/ /
pho brang dam pa sdong po ldan pa ni/ / grong mchog bye ba stong gis kun nas bskor/ / nags tshal yal ga sna tshogs der byung ba/ / rab tu sgra zhi bla na med pa'i dpal/ /
de ni 'od bzang brtul zhugs rab ldan pa/ / 'jigs med shes rab spobs dang ldan pa bzhugs/ / des ni sems can nyon mongs sbyangs pa'i phyir/ / rgyal ba'i chos kyang yongs su bstan pa mdzad/ /
shes rab ldan pa de ni bsod snyoms la/ / spyod lam mdzes shing cha byad zhi ba dang / / mi g.yeng spyan gyis dgongs pa mkhyen bzhin du/ / tshul zab bstan par bzhud pas grong du byon/ /
grong mchog dga' ba'i rgyal mtshan zhes bya bar/ / tshong dpon legs pa'i snyan grags der byung ste/ / kho mo de yi bu mo yid 'ong gyur/ / gzugs mdzes ldan te nyi ma'i 'od ces bya/ /
khyim gyi dam pa de yi sgo gnas su/ / 'od zer bzang po 'khor bcas kho mos mthong / / yan lag mtshan brgyan shin tu mdzes pa ste/ / de la kho mo mos pa mchog cig skyes/ /
de ni kho mo'i khyim gyi sgor byon nas/ / nor bu de yi lhung bzed nang du gsol/ / rgyan rnams kun kyang bkrol te mos sems kyis/ / shin tu 'dun par de la bdag gis phul/ /
bde gshegs sras po 'od zer bzang dpal la/ / 'dod chags sems kyis mchod pa rnams bsgrubs pas/ / bskal pa'i dam pa nyis brgya lnga bcur yang / / ngan song gang du'ang song bar ma gyur to/ /
lha yi yul du lha rigs ldan par skyes/ / mi yi yul du rgyal po'i sras mor gyur/ / kha dog mtha' yas sku yi mdog mnga' bas/ / kun tu kho mo mngon par zhal yang bstan/ /
bskal pa nyis brgya la bcu 'das gyur nas/ / sbrul tshong gtso mo blta na sdug pa ste/ / mi 'jigs byed pa'i bu mor skyes par gyur/ / de tshe shin tu sbyangs zhes bya ba yin/ /
rgyal bu gzi brjid 'od kyis bdag mthong nas/ / kho mos de la dga' bas mchod pa byas/ / bdag nyid de la yongs su dbul byas nas/ / kho mo de yi dbang gyur chung mar gyur/ /
drang srong chen po sku mchog nyi ma la'ang / / bdag cag bsdongs te legs par mchod pa byas/ / mos pas sangs rgyas de yi zhal bltas nas/ / bdag gis byang chub mchog tu sems kyang bskyed/ /
rgyal ba bye ba drug cu tshang ba yang / / bskal pa de la kho mos rim gro byas/ / rgyal ba de dag tha ma'i dus kyi tshe/ / sangs rgyas mos pa'i gzi brjid byung bar gyur/ /
der ni kho mo'i chos mig rnam par dag / chos kyi rang bzhin bdag gis khong du chud/ / tshul min rnam rtog rab tu zhi bar gyur/ / de tshe tshun chad kho mos snang ba thob / /
rgyal sras rnams kyi ting nge 'dzin gyi yang / / de phyi tshun chad rnam par mthong bar gyur/ / sems kyi skad cig gcig gis rgya mtsho'i zhing / / bsam las rnam 'das phyogs su kho mo 'jug /
phyogs rnams kun gyi sna tshogs rnam dag pa'i/ / zhing rnams tshad med rmang byung kho mos mthong / / mthong yang de dag la ni chags pa med/ / nyon mongs bcas la'ang khong khro sdang ba'ang med/ /
zhing rnams de dag ma lus thams cad kyi/ / snying po byang chub sangs rgyas ma lus mthong / / de dag 'od kyi rgya mtsho tshad med pa'ang / / sems kyi skad cig gcig gis rnam par lta/ /
de dag 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor rgya mtsho yang / / sems gcig thogs pa med pas khong du chud/ / rnam par thar pa tshad med thams cad dang / / de dag ting 'dzin ma lus de bzhin gshegs/ /
de dag spyod pa yangs pa'ang khong du chud/ / sa tshul ma lus kun kyang kho mos shes/ / smon lam grangs med rgya mtsho chen po yang / / skad cig re res mtha' yas khong du chud/ /
bskal pa mtha' yas spyad pa spyod byed cing / / skyes bu dam pa'i sku la lta lta ste/ / de yi ba spu re re rnam 'phrul pa'ang / / nam yang mur phyin bdag gis ma nus so/ /
de yi ba spu gcig gi rtse la yang / / zhing mang rgya mtsho grangs las 'das pa mthong / / rlung gi phung po chu bo chen po dang / / sa yi lhun rnams me yis yongs gang mthong / /
gzhi rnam sna tshogs rnam phye'i gzugs ldan zhing / / dbyibs tshul sna tshogs khong du chud bya ba; ; dbyibs dang lus kyi rnam pa sna tshogs shing / / lus dang rnam pa mtha' yas gzugs ldan pa'i/ /
brjod yas khams rnams zhing rnams rgya mtsho dag / tshad med rnams su tha dad gsal bar mthong / / chos kyi gsung gis 'gro ba gdul don du/ / brtson pa'i rgyal ba de nyid bzhugs pa mthong / /
bskal par spyod pa yangs pa spyod pa'i tshe/ / sku yi 'phrin las kho mos de ma shes/ / gsung dang thugs min de gnyis 'phrin las min/ / rdzu 'phrul rnam 'phrul tha dad tshul ma shes/ /

Those who see the best of people Engaged in the practice of perfect enlightenment All go to join him, Be they friendly or inimical.
I remember as many eons as there are atoms In a hundred lands; There was an excellent world of outstanding light, With an age of supreme magnificence.
In that age, in that world, Were sixty decillion buddhas; The last of them, best of sages, Was a lamp of the world, Spiritual Paragon.
At the time of that buddha’s demise There was a glorious king Who had conquered all enemies, A king of kings with unobstructed knowledge.
He had five hundred sons Who were heroic, brave, and handsome, Physically perfect and pure, Adorned with unexcelled splendor.
The king and his sons had faith in Buddha And made great offerings to the enlightened; They always followed the true teaching And were unshakable in application of its practice.
The king had a brilliant son, A pure being, Adorned with the thirty-two Marks of a great man.
Giving up his kingship, he left home Together with five million people; Having gone forth, he worked with firmness and energy To preserve the teaching of the Buddha.
There was a city full of trees, Best of a billion cities; There was a forest there of various trees, Quiet and most beautiful.
There the king’s son sojourned, Experienced, intelligent, clear-minded; He elucidated the Buddha’s teaching To purify the spirit of defiled beings.
Gathering wise people, he entered the city, Composed, of noble mien and serene appearance, His gaze steady, mindful, aware, His action profound, walking steadily.
There was an excellent town, Banner of Joy, And a grandee there named Resounding Fame; I was his beloved daughter, Named Shining Light, more beautiful.
I saw the shining prince and his retinue As I stood in the door of my house; He was handsome, with the marks of greatness, And I became very happy on seeing him.
When he passed my door, I put a pearl in his bowl; Then, taking off all my jewelry, Full of love I gave it to him.
With an impassioned heart I made a gift to that enlightening being, And for two hundred and fifty eons Did not fall into evil states.
I was born among celestials, Or as a human princess, And in endless forms I always saw the prince.
Then I was born to a courtesan, Saw the prince and fell in love, Made myself known to him, And became his obedient wife.
He and I together made offerings To the sage Supreme Sun with pure faith, And having seen that buddha, I was inspired to seek supreme enlightenment.
During that eon sixty decillion Buddhas emerged in the world: The last of those buddhas Was Energy of Zeal for Truth.
Then my objective eye was clarified And I became aware of the essence of things; My continuous errant conceptions were silenced, And I attained this illumination thenceforth.
After that I observed the stage Of concentration of enlightening beings; In a mental instant I see unthinkable Oceans of lands in the ten directions.
And I see in all directions Various pure worlds, infinitely wondrous; Seeing them, my mind does not cling to them, Nor is it repelled by defiled lands.
I also see the enlightenment sites in those lands And all the buddhas there, And I behold in one thought Their measureless oceans of light.
In the same way I see their oceanic congregations In an instant of awareness, unimpeded, And know all their concentrations, And all their immeasurable liberations.
I also keep their myriad practices in mind, And penetrate all the principles of the stages; And in each and every instant I enter Into the countless oceans of their vows.
Observing the body of the True Man for endless eons And carrying out his practice, I have never seen an end to the mystic projections Emanating from his every hair.
And I see oceans of lands beyond number On the tip of a single hair, With their masses of air and water, fire and earth, On various foundations, with different forms, And diverse patterns of structure, Of various types, according to distribution of elements, With an endless variety of adornments.
I see each of the untold realms In the measureless oceans of lands, And I see the buddhas therein Guiding people by articulating truth.
I do not understand his activities, His speech, his mind, or its action, Or his mystic powers and miracles, or great sublime practice, Though I have been working at this for eons.

de nas tshong dpon gyi bu nor bzang gis shAkya'i bu mo go pa'i rkang pa gnyis la spyi bos phyag 'tshal te shAkya'i bu mo go pa la lan brgya stong du mar g.yas phyogs su bskor ba byas nas yang bltas te shAkya'i bu mo go pa'i drung nas song ngo// //
Then Sudhana paid his respects and took leave of Gopa.
shin tu rgyas pa chen po'i mdo/ sangs rgyas phal po che zhes bya ba las/ sdong pos brgyan pa'i le'u ste/ /bam po brgya dgu pa/
[lha mo sgyu ma]
Maya

de nas tshong dpon gyi bu nor bzang lha mo sgyu ma'i gan du 'gro bar mngon du bltas nas sangs rgyas kyi spyod yul gyi rgyud kyi ye shes la zhugs pa des 'di snyam du bsam mo/ /bdag gis dge ba'i bshes gnyen 'jig rten thams cad las gyen du 'phags pa'i skye mched drug dang ldan pa/ gnas med pa la rab tu gnas pa/ chags pa thams cad las yang dag par 'das pa'i lus dang ldan pa/ chags pa med par 'gro ba'i lam du zhugs pa / chos kyi lus shin tu rnam par dag pa/ lus kyi lam sgyu mas legs par sprul pa'i lus dang ldan pa/ ye shes sgyu ma'i rnam par 'jig rten na rnam par spyod pa/ smon lam sgyu ma'i gzugs dang lus su ldan pa/ sangs rgyas kyi byin gyi rlabs yid kyi rang bzhin gyi lus dang ldan pa/ ma skyes ma 'gag pa'i lus dang ldan pa; 'ong ba med pa'i lus dang ldan pa/ bden pa med pa dang rdzun pa med pa'i lus dang ldan pa/ ma 'phos ma zhig pa'i lus dang ldan pa/ ma byung mi 'jig pa'i lus dang ldan pa/ mtshan nyid med par mtshan nyid gcig pa'i lus dang ldan pa/ gnyis la chags pa dang bral ba'i lus dang ldan pa/ kun gzhi med pa la gnas pa'i lus dang ldan pa/ mi zad cing nyams pa med pa'i lus dang ldan pa/ gzugs brnyan ltar rnam par rtog pa med pa'i lus dang ldan pa/ rmi lam dang mnyam par rnam par rgyu ba'i lus dang ldan pa/ me long gi dkyil 'khor ltar 'pho ba med pa'i lus dang ldan pa/ phyogs med pa ltar rab tu zhi ba khong du chud pa'i lus dang ldan pa/ /phyogs kun tu rgyas par 'gengs pa'i lus dang ldan pa/ dus gsum du tha mi dad pa'i lus dang ldan pa/ lus med pa'i sems kyi lus rnam par mi rtog pa'i lus dang ldan pa/ 'jig rten thams cad kyi mig gi lam las yongs su 'das pa'i lus dang ldan pa/ kun tu bzang po'i mig gi rgyud kyis rnam par shes par bya bas 'dul ba'i lus dang ldan pa/ chags pa med pa nam mkha'i spyod yul dang ldan pa rnams mthong bar bya ba'am/ bsnyen bkur bar bya ba'am/ mngon sum du 'phrad par bya ba'am/ 'grogs par bya ba'am/ mtshan ma gzung bar bya ba'am/ dbyangs kyi dkyil 'khor rnam par rig par bya ba'am/ tshig gi rgyud yongs su shes par bya ba'am/ gdams ngag yongs su gzung bar bya bar thabs ji lta bu zhig tu nus par 'gyur snyam nas de ltar sems shing

Then Sudhana, turning to go to Lady Maya, having attained knowledge from investigation of the sphere of buddhahood, thought to himself, “How can I meet, associate with, and learn from spiritual benefactors whose senses are detached from all worlds, who do not abide anywhere, whose bodies are beyond all attachments, who have set out on the unimpeded path, who have purified the spiritual body, who skillfully project bodily forms by the illusion of physical action, who observe the world as being within the illusion of knowledge, who are physical embodiments of vows, whose bodies are made of mind by the power of Buddha, whose bodies are not born and do not perish, whose bodies are neither real nor unreal, whose bodies neither come nor go, whose bodies neither become nor disintegrate, whose bodies are of one form which is formless, whose bodies are nondual and freed from attachments, whose bodies have no resting place, whose bodies have no extinction, whose bodies are like reflections and have no difference, whose bodies are like dreams in action, whose bodies are like images in a mirror, whose bodies stand tranquilly everywhere equally, whose bodies are emanations pervading all directions, whose bodies are continuous through past, present, and future, whose bodies are neither physical nor mental and are indivisible, whose bodies are beyond the range of vision of all worldlings, whose secret being can only be known to the vision of the eye of universal good, whose realm of action is unobstructed like space?”

yid la byed pa la brtson par gnas pa'i tshe grong khyer gyi lha mo rin chen mig ces bya ba/ nam mkha'i lha mo'i tshogs kyis yongs su bskor ba zhig gis bdag gi lus rgyan sna tshogs kyis yongs su brgyan pa/ bdag gi lus rgyan gyis rnam par klubs par nam mkha' la 'dug par nye bar bstan nas lha rdzas kyi me tog rnam pa dang / kha dog du ma can snyim pa nas mngon par gtor te tshong dpon gyi bu nor bzang la 'di skad ces smras so/ /rigs kyi bu; khyod kyis 'khor ba'i yid la dga' bar mi gnas pas sems kyi grong khyer yongs su srung ba la brtson par gyis shig /rigs kyi bu/ khyod kyis de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu la dmigs pas sems kyi grong khyer brgyan pa la brtson par gyis shig /rigs kyi bu /khyod kyis phrag dog dang / ser sna dang / g.yo dang bral bas sems kyi grong khyer yongs su sbyangs pa la brtson par gyis shig /rigs kyi bu/ khyod kyis chos thams cad kyi rang bzhin nges par rtogs par bya bas sems kyi grong khyer gyi yongs su gdung ba rab tu zhi bar bya ba la brtson par gyis shig /rigs kyi bu/ khyod kyis thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi tshogs la brtson 'grus chen po'i shugs rnam par spel bas sems kyi grong khyer rnam par spel ba la brtson par gyis shig /rigs kyi bu/ khyod kyis ting nge 'dzin dang / snyoms par 'jug pa dang / bsam gtan dang / rnam par thar pa dang / chos kyi gzhal med khang yangs pa'i rnam par spyod pa la dbang sgyur bas sems kyi grong khyer dang / gnas kyi mdzod brgyan pa dang / srung ba la brtson par gyis shig /rigs kyi bu; khyod kyis de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor yang dag par sgrub pa'i sa thams cad kyi shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rab tu thob par 'tshal bas sems kyi grong khyer snang bar bya ba la brtson par gyis shig /rigs kyi bu/ khyod kyis de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad yang dag par byung ba'i thabs kyi lam gyis rang gi sems kyi grong khyer du gzhol bar bya bas sems kyi grong khyer nye bar brtan pa la brtson par gyis shig /rigs kyi bu/ khyod kyis byang chub sems dpa' kun tu bzang po'i spyod pa dang / smon lam mngon par sgrub pa'i sems rnam par dag pas sems kyi grong khyer gyi ra ba brtan pa mngon par sgrub par gyis shig /rigs kyi bu/ khyod kyis nyon mongs pa dang / bdud kyi ris kyi sdig to'i grogs po dang / bdud kyi 'khor gyis mi chom par bya bas sems kyi grong khyer rgal dka' ba dang / bshig par dka' ba mngon par sgrub pa la brtson par gyis shig /rigs kyi bu/ khyod kyis sems can thams cad de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes snang bas khong du chud par bya ba'i phyir sems kyi grong khyer snang bar bya ba la brtson par gyis shig /rigs kyi bu/ khyod kyis de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi chos kyi sprin gyi char yongs su bzung bas sems kyi grong khyer mngon par brlan pa la brtson par gyis shig /rigs kyi bu/ khyod kyis de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi bsod nams rgya mtsho rang gi sems kyis yang dag par blangs pas sems kyi grong khyer brtan pa la brtson par gyis shig /rigs kyi bu/ khyod kyis byams pa chen pos 'gro ba thams cad rgyas par dgang bas sems kyi grong khyer rab tu rgyas par bya ba la brtson par gyis shig /rigs kyi bu/ khyod kyis mi dge ba'i chos kyi gnyen po chos kyi gdugs yangs par sgrub pas sems kyi grong khyer yongs su dag pa la brtson par gyis shig /rigs kyi bu/ khyod kyis snying rje chen po shin tu yangs pas 'gro ba thams cad kyi don du sems g.yo par bya bas sems kyi grong khyer rab tu bskyob pa la brtson par gyis shig /rigs kyi bu/ khyod kyis phyi nang gi dngos po 'gro ba thams cad la yongs su bstan pa'i phyir sems kyi grong khyer gyi sgo dbye ba la brtson par gyis shig /rigs kyi bu/ khyod kyis 'khor ba'i yul thams cad la dga' ba las phyin phyogs su blta bas sems kyi grong khyer rnam par dag par bya ba la brtson par gyis shig /rigs kyi bu/ khyod kyis mi dge ba'i chos kyi rgyud thams cad mi srid par bya bas sems kyi grong khyer gyi srog rab tu mkhrang ba mngon par sgrub pa la brtson par gyis shig /rigs kyi bu/ khyod kyis thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi tshogs yang dag par sgrub pa'i brtson 'grus las phyir mi ldog par bya bas sems kyi grong khyer brtan par bya ba la brtson par gyis shig /rigs kyi bu/ khyod kyis dus gsum gyi de bzhin gshegs pa'i dkyil 'khor thams cad dran pa shin tu snang bar byas pas sems kyi grong khyer rab tu gsal bar bya ba la brtson par gyis shig / rigs kyi bu/ khyod kyis de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi chos kyi 'khor lo'i mdo sde sna tshogs kyi chos kyi sgo rab tu dbye ba'i ye shes la mngon par mkhas par bya bas sems kyi grong khyer rnam par dbye ba'i tshul la mkhas par gyis shig /rigs kyi bu/ khyod kyis 'gro ba thams cad mngon sum du gnas pa'i thams cad mkhyen pa'i sgo dang / lam gyi tshul yongs su brtan pa'i phyir sems kyi grong khyer dmigs par bya ba la brtson par gyis shig /rigs kyi bu/ khyod kyis dus gsum gyi de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi smon lam rgya mtsho rang gi smon lam du mngon par sgrub pa rnam par dag par bya ba'i phyir sems kyi grong khyer byin gyis brlab pa'i tshul la mkhas par gyis shig /rigs kyi bu/ khyod kyis chos kyi dbyings thams cad du bsod nams dang / ye shes kyi tshogs rgya chen po rnam par spel bas sems kyi grong khyer gyi tshogs kyi mthu rnam par 'phel bar bya ba'i thabs la mkhas par gyis shig /rigs kyi bu/ khyod kyis sems can thams cad kyi sems dang / bsam pa dang / dbang po dang / mos pa dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba shes par bya bas sems kyi grong khyer nas 'od kun tu dgye ba'i thabs la mkhas par gyis shig /rigs kyi bu/ khyod kyis chos kyi dbyings kyi tshul thams cad yang dag par bsdu bas sems kyi grong khyer du dbang sgyur ba'i tshul la mkhas par gyis shig /rigs kyi bu/ khyod kyis de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad dran zhing snang bar bya bas sems kyi grong khyer 'od gsal bar bya ba la brtson par gyis shig /rigs kyi bu/ khyod kyis lus med pa'i chos kyi tshul thams cad khong du chud par bya bas sems kyi grong khyer gyi rang bzhin yongs su shes par bya ba la brtson par gyis shig /rigs kyi bu/ khyod kyis thams cad mkhyen pa'i chos kyi grong khyer du 'gro bar bya bas sems kyi grong khyer sgyu ma lta bur brtag pa la brtson par gyis shig /

As he was engaged in such thoughts, a city goddess named Jewel Eyes, surrounded by a group of sky goddesses, showed herself in the sky, her body adorned with various adornments, holding a basket of celestial flowers of many shapes and colors, and spoke to Sudhana in these terms as she scattered them before him: “You should guard the city of mind, by not dwelling on enjoyment of mundane objects. You should adorn the city of mind, by concentrating on the ten powers of the enlightened. You should clean the city of mind, by getting rid of jealousy, envy, and guile. You should extinguish the burning of the city of mind, by meditating on all truths. You should expand the city of mind, by increasing the flow of great energy in preparing for omniscience. You should protect the dwellings, storehouses, and facilities of the city of mind, by command of the vast spiritual palace of all concentrations, attainments, meditations, and liberations. You should illumine the city of mind, by absorbing universal transcendent wisdom in the assemblies gathered around all buddhas. You should make the city of mind firm, by putting the paths of means produced by all buddhas into the city of your own mind. You should build strong walls about the city of mind, by purification of mind in carrying out the vow of practice of universal good. You should make the city of mind invincible and impregnable, by being invulnerable to all afflictions and bad influences. You should light up the city of mind, by illumining all beings with the knowledge of the enlightened. You should irrigate the city of mind, by receiving the clouds of teaching of all buddhas. You should firmly brace the city of mind, by absorbing into your own mind the oceans of virtues of all buddhas. You should broaden the city of mind, by suffusing all beings with great love. You should provide shelter, by producing the shield of all good ways in the vast canopy of the Teaching. You should water the city of mind, by feeling great compassion for all beings. You should open the doors of the city of mind, by giving of yourself and giving goods to all beings. You should purify the city of mind, by turning away from passion for ephemeral things. You should make the city of mind steadfast and strong, by excluding all unhealthy elements from your body-mind continuum. You should energize the city of mind, by maintaining the energy to produce the provisions for omniscience. You should illuminate the city of mind, by the illumination of recollection of the spheres of the buddhas of past, present, and future. You should know how to stock the city of mind, by examination, learning, and higher knowledge of the various doors of truth in the scriptures of the cycles of teaching of all buddhas. You should know how to govern the city of mind, by showing all beings the path of entries into omniscience in various ways. You should know how to support the city of mind, by perfection of accomplishment of the vows of all buddhas of past, present, and future. You should know how to increase the power to provide for the city of mind, by increasing the great stores of virtue and knowledge from all realms of truth. You should know how to emanate light throughout the entire city of mind, by higher knowledge of the science of stripping away defilements from the minds, senses, and interests of all sentient beings. You should know how to control the city of mind, by embracing all the principles of the realm of reality. You should make the city of mind light, by the light of mindfulness of all buddhas. You should know the essence of the city of mind, by penetrating the principle of nonsubstantiality of all things. You should observe the illusoriness of the city of mind, by going to the spiritual city of omniscience.

rigs kyi bu/ khyod kyis de ltar sems kyi grong khyer yongs su sbyangs pa la brtson pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad yongs su sgrub pa thob par nus so/ /de ci'i phyir zhe na/ de ltar sems kyi grong khyar yongs su dag pa'i byang chub sems dpa' de'i mdun na ni/ sangs rgyas mthong bar bya ba la sgrib pa'am/ chos mnyan par bya ba la sgrib pa'am/ de bzhin gshegs pa mchod cing rim gror bya ba la sgrib pa'am/ sems can yongs su bsdu ba'i sbyor ba la sgrib pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par bya ba la sgrib pa yang rung ste/ sgrib pa thams cad mi gnas so/ /rigs kyi bu/ sgrib pa thams cad dang bral ba'i sems dang / lhag pa'i bsam par dge ba'i bshes gnyen yongs su btsal ba la mngon par brtson pa'i byang chub sems dpas ni/ las gron chung dus dge ba'i bshes gnyen mthong bar 'gyur te/ rigs kyi bu; dge ba'i bshes gnyen la rag las pa yang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi thams cad mkhyen pa nyid do/ /

“By thus purifying the city of mind, an enlightening being can produce all good. Why? Because no obstacles stand before an enlightening being whose mind-city is thus purified—no obstacles to seeing buddhas, or obstacles to hearing the Teaching, or obstacles to serving buddhas, or obstacles to efforts to save sentient beings, or obstacles to purifying buddha-lands. Spiritual friends are easily perceptible to an enlightening being looking for spiritual friends when the mind is free from obstacles; and omniscience for enlightening beings comes through the help of spiritual friends.”

de nas lus kyi ris su gtogs pa'i lha mo chos kyi pad+mo dpal gyi dkyil 'khor ces bya ba dang / ngo tsha shes pa'i dpal gyi dog pa'i 'od ces bya ba gnyis shig lha mo'i tshogs tshad med pas yongs su bskor nas lha mo sgyu ma'i legs pa rjod cing snying po byang chub nas thon te tshong dpon gyi bu nor bzang gi mdun gyi nam mkha' la 'khod nas rang rang gi rin po che'i rna cha las 'od zer gyi dra ba rin po che'i kha dog tu 'dug pa du ma dang / spos dang / bdug pa dri ma med pa 'od 'phro ba'i kha dog tu 'dug pa du ma dang / sems dang / bsam pa mos par byed pa'i kha dog dang; sems kyi dga' ba'i shugs rnam par 'phel bar byed pa'i kha dog dang / lus kyi gdung ba sim par byed pa'i kha dog dang / lus rnam par dag pa yongs su ston pa'i kha dog dang / lus kyi mthu thogs pa med par 'byung ba'i yul dang ldan pa'i 'od zer gyi dra ba mang po bkye bas/ zhing rgya chen po snang bar byas nas tshong dpon gyi bu nor bzang la de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi sku thams cad du khyab pa thams cad la mngon du gyur pa yongs su bstan nas 'jig rten thams cad la g.yas phyogs su bskar ba byas te tshong dpon gyi bu nor bzang gi spyi bo'i gtsug tu shar nas spyi bo'i gtsug man chad ba spu'i bu ga thams cad du zhugs te lus kun tu khyab par gyur to; ;

Then a goddess, Spiritual Lotus, surrounded by innumerable goddesses radiant with modesty and beauty, came forth from the enlightening site praising Lady Maya and stopped in the sky in front of Sudhana, each goddess emanating webs of light of many jewel colors, colors of pure flames of incense of many fragrances, colors soothing the mind, colors increasing the flow of joy in the mind, colors cooling the fever of the body, colors showing physical purity, webs of light produced by the motion of unattached, unimpeded bodies. Illumining a multitude of lands, revealing to Sudhana the forms of all buddhas everywhere, the lights then circled the whole world and descended into Sudhana’s head, and from his head entered into all of his pores.

de ltar lha mo de dag gi 'od zer gyis tshong dpon gyi bu nor bzang la phog ma thag tu de'i mod la mun pa thams cad dang mi gnas pa'i mig rdul dang bral ba'i 'od snang ba zhes bya ba thob par gyur to/ /sems can gyi rang bzhin khong du chud par byed pa'i mig rab rib dang bral ba'i 'od snang ba zhes bya ba thob par gyur to/ /sems can gyi rang bzhin khong du chud par byed pa'i mig rab rib dang bral ba zhes bya ba thob par gyur to/ /chos thams cad kyi rang bzhin gyi dkyil 'khor la rnam par lta ba'i mig rdul dang bral bas dbang bsgyur ba zhes bya ba thob par gyur to/ /zhing thams cad la rnam par lta ba'i mig rnam par dag pa la dbang bsgyur ba zhes bya ba thob par gyur to/ /de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi chos kyi sku la rnam par lta ba'i mig rnam par snang ba zhes bya ba thob par gyur to/ /de bzhin gshegs pa'i gzugs kyi sku yongs su grub pa rnam par phye ba bsam gyis mi khyab pa la rnam par lta ba'i mig rnam par dag pa'i blo gros zhes bya ba thob par gyur to/ /zhing rgya mtsho 'byams klas pa thams cad kyi 'jig rten gyi khams 'byung ba dang / 'jig pa rnam par phye ba la rnam par lta ba'i mig chags pa med pa'i 'od ces bya ba thob par gyur to/ /de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi chos kyi 'khor lo'i mdo sde'i tshul mngon par sgrub pa'i phyogs la rnam par lta ba'i mig kun tu snang ba zhes bya ba thob par gyur to/ /sangs rgyas kyi rnam par 'phrul pa dang / sems can 'dul ba'i byin gyi rlabs la rnam par lta ba'i mig kun nas yul du 'gyur ba zhes bya ba thob par gyur to/ /sangs rgyas kyi zhing thams cad du byung ba'i sangs rgyas skyes pa la rnam par lta ba'i mig kun tu lta ba zhes bya ba thob par gyur to/ /

As soon as the light rays of the goddesses touched Sudhana, he acquired an eye called ‘dispassionate light,’ with which no darkness can coexist; he acquired an eye called ‘unobscured,’ whereby he saw the essence of beings; he acquired an eye called ‘dispassionate sovereign,’ whereby he viewed the sphere of essence of all phenomena; he acquired an eye called ‘pure state,’ whereby he viewed the nature of all lands; he acquired an eye called ‘shining light,’ whereby he viewed the reality body of those who arrive at Thusness; he acquired an eye called ‘universal light,’ whereby he viewed the inconceivable perfection of the physical embodiment of those who arrive at Thusness; he acquired an eye called ‘unobstructed light,’ whereby he viewed the becoming and disintegration of worlds in all universes; he acquired an eye called ‘total illumination,’ whereby he observed the manner of extraction of the principles of the scripture in the teachings of all buddhas; he acquired an eye called ‘universal scope,’ whereby he viewed the infinite variety of mystic powers used by buddhas to guide beings; he acquired an eye called ‘all-seeing,’ whereby he observed the emergence of buddhas in all lands.

de nas byang chub sems dpa' yang dag par 'gro ba'i khang pa'i sgo srung srin po'i dbang po srin po stong phrag bcu'i gtso bo mig bzang zhes bya ba chang mar bcas/ bu dang bcas/ rang gi gnyen bshes dang 'khor du bcas pas tshong dpon gyi bu nor bzang la me tog kha dog sna tshogs yid du 'ong bas mngon par gtor te 'di skad ces smras so/ /rigs kyi bu/ chos bcu dang ldan pa'i byang chub sems dpas ni/ dge ba'i bshes gnyen thams cad dang nye bar bsnyen pa yin te/ bcu gang zhe na/ 'di ltar bsam pa yongs su dag pa g.yo dang sgyu med pa dang / 'gro ba thams cad yongs su sdud pa la tha mi dad pa'i snying rje chen po dang / sems can thams cad la sems can med pa'i rang bzhin nges par rtsogs pa'i rab tu rtog pa dang / lhag pa'i bsam pa'i stobs thams cad mkhyen par 'gro ba las phyir mi ldog pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i dkyil 'khor la mngon par 'dun pa'i mos pa'i stobs dang / chos thams cad kyi rang bzhin dri ma med pas rnam par dag pa'i mig dang / sems can gyi dkyil 'khor thams cad la tha mi dad pa'i byams pa chen po dang / sgrib pa thams cad rnam par 'thor ba'i ye shes kyi snang ba dang / 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal thams cad kyi gnyen po gdugs su gyur pa'i chos kyi sprin chen po dang / chos kyi dbyings kyi rgyud thams cad la rab tu zhugs shing dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyi rjes su 'brang ba mngon du gyur pa'i ye shes kyi mig ste/

Then a supernatural being named Fine Eye, doorkeeper of the hall of assembly of enlightening beings, at the head of ten thousand supernatural beings, together with his wife and son and clan, sprinkled Sudhana with flowers of various colors and pleasant fragrances, and said, “An enlightening being imbued with ten qualities can approach all spiritual friends. What are these ten? A pure mind free from guile and deceit; great compassion taking in all beings as a whole; meditation on the unreality of self-existence of all beings; the willpower to proceed unswervingly toward omniscience; the power of attention to the spheres of all buddhas; clear perception of the purity of essence of all phenomena; great kindness to all beings as a whole; the light of knowledge that dissolves all barriers; the great body of teachings that acts as a shield against the miseries of the mundane whirl; the eye of knowledge of all currents of reality, directed toward the path of spiritual friends.

rigs kyi bu/ chos bcu po de dag dang ldan pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni/ dge ba'i bshes gnyen thams cad dang nye bar bsnyen pa yin no/ /ting nge 'dzin la nges par gzhag pa'i sgo bcus rnam par lta ba'i byang chub sems dpa' ni/ dge ba'i bshes gnyen thams cad dang mngon du gyur pa 'thob pa yin te/ bcu gang zhe na/ ting nge 'dzin la nges par gzhag pa'i sgo chos thams cad nam mkha' ltar rdul dang bral bar rnam par dpyod pa'i dkyil 'khor dang / ting nge 'dzin la nges par gzhag pa'i sgo phyogs rgya mtsho thams cad mngon du gyur pa'i mig dang / ting nge 'dzin la nges par gzhag pa'i sgo dmigs pa thams cad la rnam par mi rtog rnam par mi dpyod pa dang / ting nge 'dzin la nges par gzhag pa'i sgo phyogs thams cad du de bzhin gshegs pa'i sprin yongs su 'byung ba dang / ting nge 'dzin la nges par gzhag pa'i sgo thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes dang / bsod nams rgya mtsho gsog pa'i snying po dang / ting nge 'dzin la nges par gzhag pa'i sgo sems bskyed pa thams cad la dge ba'i bshes gnyen 'byung ba dang 'bral ba med cing nye bar gyur pa dang / ting nge 'dzin la nges par gzhag pa'i sgo de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi yon tan dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyi khar las pas yongs su 'grub pa dang / ting nge 'dzin la nges par gzhag pa'i sgo dge ba'i bshes gnyen thams cad dang yongs su mi 'bral ba dang / ting nge 'dzin la nges par gzhag pa'i sgo dge ba'i bshes gnyen thams cad mnyam pa nyid kyis rtag par kun tu nye bar 'gro ba'i sbyor ba dang / ting nge 'dzin la nges par gzhag pa'i sgo dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyi thabs kyi spyod pa thams cad kyis dub pa med pa'i sbyor ba ste/ rigs kyi bu/ ting nge 'dzin la nges par gzhag pa'i sgo bcu po de dag dang ldan pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni/ dge ba'i bshes gnyen thams cad dang mngon du gyur pa 'thob pa yin te/ ting nge 'dzin gyi rnam par thar ba de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi chos kyi 'khor lo dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyi kha nas grags pa zhes bya ba yang 'thob pas/ de la zhugs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni/ sangs rgyas thams cad tha mi dad cing mnyam pa nyid du gyur pa yang rab tu 'thob bo/ /dge ba'i bshes gnyen tha mi dad cing thams cad du khyab pa 'di rab tu thob par 'gyur ro/ /

“Having attained these ten things, enlightening beings can approach all spiritual friends; and by observation through ten ways of concentrated meditation they can come face to face with all spiritual friends. What are the ten? Meditation on the purity of the sky of reality; meditation viewing the ocean of all realms; meditation without discrimination or thought of any objects; meditation on the appearance of the multitudes of buddhas of all realms; meditation on the multitude of virtues of omniscience; meditation with every thought constantly on spiritual friends; meditation on the virtues of all buddhas deriving from spiritual friends; meditation on being with all spiritual friends forever; meditation on always going to all spiritual friends everywhere equally; meditation devoted to tireless application of the techniques of all spiritual friends. The enlightening being who has accomplished these ten kinds of concentrated meditation comes face to face with all spiritual friends and attains a liberation through concentration called ‘enunciation of the teachings of all buddhas by spiritual friends,’ practicing which the enlightening being realizes the indivisible sameness of all buddhas and finds spiritual friends everywhere in contact.”

srin po'i dbang po mig bzang gis de skad ces smras pa dang / tshong dpon gyi bu nor bzang gis nam mkha'i dbyings la bltas te 'di skad ces smras so/ /'phags pa/ bdag la thugs brtse bar mdzad de/ dge ba'i bshes gnyen bsten pas sman yon btags pa ma nongs so/ /da dung yang dge ba'i bshes gnyen blta ba'i slad du ji ltar brtson par bgyi ba dang / phyogs gang logs su mchi bar bgyi ba dang / gnas gang zhig tu yongs su btsal ba dang / dmigs pa gang zhig bsam par bgyi ba'i thabs kyi sgo ma nor bar bstan du gsol/ smras pa/ rigs kyi bu/ de bas na/ phyogs kun tu rab tu 'dud pa'i lus dang / dmigs pa thams cad du dge ba'i bshes gnyen dran pa dang 'brel ba'i bsam pa dang / kun tu 'gro ba'i ting nge 'dzin gyi rjes su 'brang ba dang / sems kyi shugs rmi lam lta bu dang / yid kyi lus gzugs brnyan lta bus rnam par rgyu ste 'gro bas dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyi gan du song zhig /

Having been told this by the supernatural being, Sudhana looked up to the sky and said, “Bravo, O noble one, sympathetic one; you are trying to help me and show me spiritual friends. Tell me, in the right way, how to proceed; where should I go? Where should I search? What should I meditate on to see spiritual friends?”
The supernatural being said, “One may go into the presence of spiritual friends by an attitude of universal respect, by mental focus on remembering spiritual friends in all things, by concentration speeding everywhere by dreamlike speed of mind, by realizing mind and body as like reflections.”

de nas tshong dpon gyi bu nor bzang gis srin po'i dbang po mig bzang gis ji skad du gtam pa de ltar nan tan du byas pa dang / mdun gyi sa'i nang nas pad+mo chen po rdo rje rin po che thams cad las grub pa'i chu ba can; nang rim rin po che'i rgyal po 'gro ba rgya mtsho sna tshogs las byas pa/ rin po che'i rgyal po thams cad las 'dab ma'i phreng ba grub pa/ rin po che'i rgyal po rnam par snang ba'i snying po can/ spos kyi rin po che'i rgyal po rin po che thams cad gyi mdog gi ze ba dang ldan pa/ rin po che'i dra ba grangs med pas kun nas yog pa byung ba mthong ngo/ /rin po che'i rgyal po'i pad+mo chen po de'i snying po la'ang khang pa brtsegs pa chos kyi phyogs su yang dag par gzhol ba'i snying po zhes bya ba/ shin tu spa la blta na sdug pa; sa'i gzhi rnam par snang ba'i dbyibs dang ldan pa/ rin po che rgyal po thams cad las byas pa'i ka ba stong tshang bas mdzes par brgyan pa/ rgyan thams cad du rin po che thams cad bkram pa/ 'dzam bu chu klung gi gser dri ma med pa'i lha rdzas kyi gzhi bting ba/ mu tig gi phreng ba sna tshogs kyi dra ba grangs med pa kun nas bres pa; rin po che'i rgyal po sna tshogs rab tu spa bar spel bas brgyan pa/ dzam+bu chu klung gi nor bu rin po ches kun nas rnam par phye ba/ rin po che'i khri 'phang grangs med pas kun nas bskor ba/ phyogs thams cad nas rin po che rgyal po'i them skas mdzes par bkye ba gnas par mthong ngo/ /khang pa brtsegs pa de'i dbus na yang khri nor bu rin po che yid bzhin gyi pad+mo'i snying po can/ nor bu rin po che'i gzugs 'jig rten gyi dbang po'i dbyibs lta bu'i rten gyis bzung ba/ nor bu rin po che'i 'bru thams cad kyi kha dog tu 'dug pa/ dbang po'i rgyal mtshan rab tu snang ba'i dbyibs su 'dug pa/ rdo rje rin po che'i 'khor lo'i sa la brten pa/ rin po che'i rgyal po sna tshogs kyi phreng bas brgyan pa; rin po che'i khri 'phang du ma las blangs pa/ rin po che'i rgyal po snang ba'i rgyal mtshan gyis rab tu spras pa/ rin po che sna tshogs kyi rgyan gyis shin tu brgyan pa/ rin po che'i rgyal po'i stan lha rdzas las 'das pa legs par bting ba/ gos rin po che kha dog mtha' yas pa sna tshogs kyis gzhi thams cad du bkram pa/ rin po che'i gos thams cad kyi gnam yol bres pas nam mkha' rab tu brgyan pa/ rin po che thams cad kyi dra ba kun tu bres pa/ phyogs kun nas rin po che'i rgyal mtshan dkrigs pa'i sgra 'byung ba; rin po che thams cad kyi snam bu'i rgyal mtshan phur lab tu lding ba/ spos rin po che thams cad kyi rgyal mtshan rnam par bres pas kun nas brgyan pa/ me tog thams cad kyi rgyal mtshan las me tog gi klong sna tshogs char du mngon par 'brul ba/ rin po che'i dril bu'i rgyal mtshan 'khrol ba'i sgra yid bde ba'i dbyangs snyan par grags pa/ khang pa'i kha thams cad nas rin po che sna tshogs kyi phreng ba rab tu dpyangs pa/ rin po che'i gzugs sna tshogs kyi kha nas spos chu kha dog du ma dang ldan pa'i char 'bab pa/ nor bu rin po che'i rgyal po rnam par snang ba las glang po dam pa'i gzugs su byas pa'i kha nas pad+mo'i dra ba 'byung ba dang ldan pa/ rdo rje sna tshogs kyi seng+ge'i kha nas spos kyi sprin kha dog mtha' yas pa rab tu 'byung ba/ rin po che'i rgyal po rnam par snang ba tshangs pa'i gzugs su 'dug pa'i kha nas byams pa chen po'i tshul tshangs pa'i dbyangs kyi nga ror sgrog pa dang ldan pa/ rin po che sna tshogs shin tu mdzes pa'i gzugs kyi kha nas dkar po'i phyogs kyi legs pa rab tu rjod pa'i nga ro 'byung ba/ dus gsum gyi sangs rgyas kyi mtshan gser gyi dril gyi phreng ba las sgra snyan pa'i dbyangs su 'byung ba dang ldan pa/ nor bu rin po che dam pa'i dril gyi phreng ba las sangs rgyas thams cad kyi chos kyi 'khor lo'i sgra yid du 'ong ba 'byung ba dang / rdo rje'i dril sna tshogs las byang chub sems dpa'i smon lam thams cad kyi sgra rab tu 'byung ba/ rin po che'i rgyal po zla ba'i rgyal mtshan gyi phreng bas sangs rgyas thams cad kyi gzugs brnyan rab tu 'byung ba'i dbyings sna tshogs tu sgrog pa/ nor bu rin po che'i rgyal po snying po dag pa'i phreng bas dus gsum du gshegs pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi sku tshe gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pa'i gzugs brnyan rnam par dmigs par bya ba/ rin po che'i rgyal po nyi ma'i snying po'i phreng bas nam mkha'i dbyings kyi mthas klas pa'i phyogs bcu'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing sna tshogs kyi dbyings su 'od zer yongs su bstan pa/ rin po che'i rgyal po snang ba'i rgyal mtshan gyi phreng bas de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi 'od kyi dkyil 'khor snang ba rab tu dbye ba/ nor bu rin po che'i rgyal po snang ba'i phreng bas sprul pa'i sprin 'gro ba thams cad kyi dbang po lta bu/ de bzhin gshegs pa la mchod cing rim gro byed pa'i 'od rab tu dgye ba/ rin po che'i rgyal po yid bzhin gyi phreng bas byang chub sems dpa' kun tu bzang po'i rnam par 'phrul bas skad cig re re la chos kyi dbyings su rgyas par dgang ba/ rin po che'i rgyal po ri bo'i rgyal mtshan gyi phreng bas lha'i dbang po thams cad kyi khyim gyi lha mo'i dbyangs snyan pa rab tu sgrog pa dang ldan zhing / khri de dmigs pa thams cad du de bzhin gshegs pa la bstod pa'i sprin 'gyed pas yon tan dang / legs pa bsam gyis mi khyab pa brjod du yod pa dang / rin po che'i rgyan grangs med pa'i 'khor gyi stan gyis bskor bar mthong ngo/ /

Then Sudhana, practicing as he had been taught by the supernatural being Fine Eye, saw a great jewel lotus spring up from the ground in front of him. In the heart of the lotus he saw a tower called ‘chamber containing the cosmos,’ beautifully made of gold and jewels. Inside the tower he saw a lotus calyx throne made of wish-fulfilling jewels, set on jewel figurines of the chiefs of all realms of being, arrayed with many kinds of precious adornments and bells which emanated sounds telling of the principle of universal love, the names of the buddhas of past, present, and future, the teachings of all buddhas, and the vows of all enlightening beings. It was also arrayed with rows of jewels which reflected the manifestations of buddhas and the succession of births of all buddhas of past, present, and future, rows of radiant jewels showing the lights of the activities in all buddha-lands throughout space and the effecting of all miracles, emanating the auras of light of all buddhas, emanating apparitions like the chiefs of all worlds making offerings to buddhas, and jewels filling the cosmos in every moment with the mystic projections of the universally good enlightening being. Every object on the throne of inconceivable qualities emanated celestial eulogies of the enlightened. The throne was also surrounded by an inconceivable number of seats arrayed with jewels.

khri de la lha mo sgyu ma 'jig rten gsum las yang dag par 'das pa'i gzugs 'jig rten thams cad la mngon par gnas pa dang / srid pa'i rgyud thams cad las gyen du 'phags pa'i gzugs 'gro ba thams cad kyis rnam par dmigs su yod pa dang / 'jig rten thams cad kyis ma gos pa'i gzugs bsod nams yangs pas byung ba dang / 'gro ba thams cad dang mnyam zhing 'dra ba'i gzugs sems can thams cad la bzhin mngon par ston pa dang / 'gro ba thams cad yongs su smin par bya ba dang / gdul bar mthun pa'i gzugs sems can thams cad dang mngon sum du 'dal ba dang / dus thams cad 'gro ba nam mkha' la rnam par dmigs pa tha mi dad pa'i gzugs 'gro ba thams cad kyi mthas klas par dmigs su yod par byin gyis rlob pa dang / 'gro ba med pa'i gzugs 'jig rten gyi lam gyi rgyud thams cad 'gag pa dang / 'ong ba med pa'i gzugs 'gro ba thams cad du ma byung ba dang / ma skyes pa'i gzugs mi skye bar mnyam pa'i chos la brtson pa dang / ma 'gag pa'i gzugs 'jig rten gyi rnam par spyod pa thams cad la gzhol ba dang / yang dag par dmigs pa'i gzugs bden pa med pa dang / 'jig rten gyis rnam par dmigs pa'i gzugs rdzun pa med pa dang / 'pho ba med pa'i gzugs shi 'pho ba dang skye ba las 'das pa dang / mi 'jig pa'i gzugs chos kyi dbyings kyi rang bzhin gyis 'jig pa med pa dang / mtshan nyid med pa'i gzugs dus gsum tshig gi lam du gzhol ba dang / mtshan nyid gcig pa'i gzugs mtshan nyid med pas byung ba dang / gzugs brnyan lta bu'i gzugs 'gro ba thams cad kyi sems dang / bsam pa ji lta ba bzhin du dmigs pa dang / sgyu ma lta bu'i gzugs ye shes sgyu mas yongs su grub pa dang / smig rgyu lta bu'i gzugs 'gro ba'i 'du shes bzhin du byin gyis rlob pa la gzhol ba dang / grib ma lta bu'i gzugs sngon gyi smon lam gyis 'gro ba thams cad kyi rjes su 'brang ba dang / rmi lam lta bu'i gzugs bsam pa ji lta ba bzhin du 'gro bas dmigs pa la ma 'dres pa dang / chos kyi dbyings thams cad du gzhol ba'i gzugs nam mkha'i dbyings ltar rang bzhin yongs su dag pa dang / snying rje chen pos byung ba'i gzugs sems can gyi rgyud thams cad yongs su bskyang ba la brtson pa dang / chags pa med pa'i sgos byung ba'i gzugs skad cig re res chos kyi dbyings rgyas par 'gengs pa dang / mtha' dang dbus med pa'i gzugs rnyog pa med par 'gro ba thams cad la brten pa dang / tshad med pa'i gzugs tshig gi lam thams cad las yang dag par 'das pa dang / mi gnas pa'i gzugs 'gro ba thams cad gdul ba'i byin gyi rlabs kyis grub pa dang / byin gyis ma brlabs pa'i gzugs byin gyi rlabs kyis 'gro ba'i don la brtson pa dang / ma byung ba'i gzugs smon lam sgyu mas yongs su grub pa dang / zil gyis mi non pa'i gzugs 'jig rten thams cad las mngon par 'phags pa dang / yang dag pa ma yin pa'i gzugs zhi gnas kyi snang bas rnam par dmigs pa dang / mi 'byung ba'i gzugs 'gro ba'i las ji lta ba bzhin du rjes su 'brang ba dang / rin po che yid bzhin gyi rgyal po ltar bsam pa ji lta ba bzhin du sems can thams cad kyi bsam pa yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i smon lam yongs su grub pa dang / rnam par mi rtog pa'i gzugs 'gro ba thams cad kyi yongs su rtog pa bzhin du nye bar gnas pa dang / mi rtog pas rtog pa med pa'i gzugs 'gro ba thams cad kyi rnam par dmigs pa dang / thogs pa med pa'i gzugs 'khor ba las bzlog pa la rab tu brtson pa dang / rnam par dag pa'i gzugs de bzhin nyid dang mnyam par rnam par mi rtog pa dang / rnam pa de lta bu'i gzugs gzugs med par gzugs su snang ba dang / tshor ba med pa'i gzugs kyis 'jig rten gyi sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba rab tu zhi bar bya ba la brtson pa dang / 'du shes kyi rnam pa thams cad las gyen du 'phags pa'i gzugs sems can thams cad kyi 'du shes kyi rnam pas rnam par dmigs pa dang / mngon par 'du bya ba med pa'i chos nyid kyis byung ba'i gzugs chos sgyu ma'i rnam pas grub pa dang / rnam par shes pa'i yul las yongs su 'das pa'i gzugs byang chub sems dpa'i smon lam gyi ye shes las byung ba dang / rang bzhin med pa'i gzugs 'gro ba thams cad kyi tshig gi lam la gzhol ba dang / gdung ba yongs su bsal ba'i gzugs chos kyi sku bsil ba dam pa dang ldan pas lha mo sgyu ma bsam pa ji lta ba bzhin du 'gro ba'i gzugs kyi lus yongs su ston pa dang / sems can gyi bsam pa'i dbang du 'gro ba thams cad dang mnyam zhing 'dra ba'i gzugs kyi lus 'gro ba thams cad kyi gzugs kyi lus las 'phags pa ston cing 'dug pa mthong ngo/ /de la sems can la las ni/ lha mo sgyu ma de bdud kyi bu mo'i gzugs su 'dug la/ bdud kyi bu mo'i gzugs pas kyang lhag par mthong ngo/ /la las ni/ dbang sgyur gyi lha'i bu mo'i gzugs pas kyang lhag par mthong ngo/ /la las ni/ rab 'phrul dga'i lha'i bu mo'i gzugs pas kyang lhag par mthong ngo/ /la las ni/ rab dga' ldan gyi lha'i bu mo'i gzugs pas kyang lhag par mthong ngo/ /la las ni/ rab mtsho ma'i lha'i bu mo'i gzugs pas kyang lhag par mthong ngo/ /la las ni/ sum cu rtsa gsum gyi lha'i bu mo'i gzugs pas kyang lhag par mthong ngo/ /la las ni/ rgyal po chen po bzhi'i ris kyi lha'i bu mo'i gzugs pas kyang lhag par mthong ngo/ /la las ni/ grul bum gyi bu mo'i gzugs pas kyang lhag par mthong ngo/ /la las ni/ lto 'phye chen po'i dbang po'i bu mo'i gzugs pas kyang lhag par mthong ngo/ /sems can la las ni/ lha mo sgyu ma de mi'i dbang po'i bu mo'i gzugs pas kyang lhag par mthong ngo/ /

Sudhana saw Lady Maya sitting on that throne, her physical form transcending all in the triple world, having gone beyond all states of being; facing all beings, appearing according to their mentalities; unstained by any world, being made of myriad virtues; in the likeness of all beings, appearing in such a way as to please all beings; adapted to develop and guide all beings, descending into the presence of all beings;
