appearing continuously to beings at all times like the sky, appearing to all beings to be permanent; not going anywhere, not passing away from all worlds, not coming anywhere, not coming into existence in any world; unoriginated, absorbed in the equanimity of nonorigination; unextinguished, involved in the affairs of all worlds; not real, having attained suchness; not false, appearing in accord with the world; not in motion, being divorced from death and birth; not annihilated, because of the nonannihilation of the nature of reality; undefinable, being beyond any manner of speaking; uniform, her auspicious characteristics issuing from indefinability; like a reflection, appearing according to the minds of all beings; like magic, made of the magic of knowledge; like specks of light, moment to moment sustained by the thoughts of beings; like a shadow, bound to all beings by commitment; dreamlike, appearing to beings according to their mentalities without being mixed up; reaching throughout all universes, being in nature pure as space; issuing from universal compassion, engaged in the protection of the community of beings; issuing from the door of nonobstruction, pervading the cosmos in each instant; infinite, dwelling in all worlds without defilement; measureless, transcending all manner of verbal expression; nondwelling, manifesting to guide all beings; unfixed, appearing magically in the body of a living being; not really existing, made by the magic of aspiration; unsurpassed, being beyond all worlds; unreal, being a manifestation of tranquillity; unproduced, connected to beings according to their acts; like a wish-fulfilling jewel, fulfilling the commitment to satisfy the wishes of all beings; without discrimination, based on the thoughts of all beings; beyond conception, unknowable to all beings; based on resolve, never leaving the mundane; pure, nonconceptual like Thusness.
In this form did Sudhana see Lady Maya, manifesting a physical body that was not form, being a reflection of form; not feeling, being the ultimate cessation of painful feelings of the world; outside the thoughts of all beings, but appearing in their thoughts; issuing from the unfabricated nature of reality, detached from illusory action; transcending the sphere of discriminatory consciousness, born of the knowledge of vows of enlightening beings; having no intrinsic essence, being beyond the range of all verbal expression; free from the burning of the mundane whirl, having arrived at the state of supreme coolness of the reality-body—she was appearing physically to beings in accord with their minds by mastery of their minds, appearing in forms resembling all beings but superior to the physical forms of all beings. Some beings saw her in the form of a devil woman, with a form superlative among devil women; some saw her in forms superlative among the goddesses of various heavens; some saw her in forms superlative among the females of the various kinds of beings; some saw her in the form of a most beautiful human princess.

de nas tshong dpon gyi bu nor bzang'gro ba thams cad kyi gzugs kyi 'du shes dang bral yang sems can pha rol gyi bsam pa la 'jug pa des sems can thams cad kyi bsam pa'i rnam pa la lha mo sgyu ma 'gro ba thams cad nye bar 'tsho ba'i bsod nams dang ldan pa/ thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bsod nams kyis bsgrubs pa'i lus dang ldan pa/ sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i sbyor ba tha mi dad pa dang ldan pa/ 'gro ba thams cad la mnyam pa nyid kyis zhugs pa/ snying rje chen po'i lus su sems can thams cad yongs su sdud pa/ de bzhin gshegs pa'i yon tan thams cad nan tan du byas pas byung ba/ bzod pa thams cad kyi tshul rgya mtsho la zhugs pa/ thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi brtson 'grus kyi shugs kyis sems rnam par spel ba/ chos kyi dkyil 'khor thams cad yongs su dag par bya ba la phyir mi ldog pa'i brtson 'grus dang ldan pa/ chos thams cad kyi rang bzhin nges par rtogs pas byung ba/ bsam gtan gyi yan lag dang tshul thams cad las yongs su grub pa'i sems dang ldan pa/ bsam gtan gyi yan lag tha mi dad pa'i yul yongs su 'dzin pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa'i bsam gtan gyi dkyil 'khor snang ba rab tu thob pa/ sems can thams cad kyi nyon mongs pa rgya mtsho bskam pa la shin tu gdon mi za bar byas pa'i nges par rtogs pa sna tshogs la gnas pa; de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi chos kyi 'khor lo rnam par dbye ba'i tshul la mkhas pa/ chos thams cad kyi tshul rgya mtsho rnam par dpyad pa'i shes rab dang ldan pa/ de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad mthong bas ma ngoms pa/ dus gsum gyi de bzhin gshegs pa gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pa la rnam par lta ba'i rgyun mi gcod pa/ sangs rgyas thams cad lta ba'i sgo la mngon du gyur pa/ de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyis yongs su bsgrubs pa'i lam yongs su dag par bya ba; rnam pa tha dad pa'i tshul la mkhas pa/ de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi spyod yul nam mkha' dang mnyam pa/ sems can thams cad yongs su bsdu ba'i thabs kyi tshul la mkhas pa/ 'gro ba mtha' dang dbus med pa bsam pa ji lta ba bzhin du yongs su smin par bya ba dang gdul ba'i snang ba rab tu thob pa/ sangs rgyas thams cad kyi sku rnam par dag pa rnam pa tha dad pa la zhugs pa/ zhing rgya mtsho thams cad yongs su dag par bya ba'i smon lam dang ldan pa/ sems can gyi khams thams cad rnam par gdul ba'i byin gyi rlabs mthar thug par bya ba'i smon lam yongs su dag pa/ de bzhin gshegs pa'i yul thams cad mchod pas rgyas par dgang ba'i sems dang ldan pa/ byang chub sems dpa'i rnam par 'phrul pa thams cad la brtson pas byung ba/ chos kyi sku bla na med pa yongs su dag pa dang ldan pa/ gzugs kyi lus mtha' yas pa yongs su ston pa/ bdud kyi dpung thams cad rab tu 'joms pa/ dge ba'i rtsa ba shin tu rgya chen po'i stobs dang ldan pa/ chos kyi stobs rab tu sgyes pa'i blo can/ sangs rgyas kyi stobs snang ba rab tu thob pa/ byang chub sems dpa'i dbang thams cad kyi stobs yongs su rdzogs pa/ thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi shugs kyi stobs yongs su skyes pa/ de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes glog gi shes rab snang bar byas pa/ sems can mtha' dang dbus med pa'i sems rgya mtsho rnam par dpyad pa la mkhas pa; 'gro ba shin tu mang ba'i bsam pa la zhugs pa/ sems can pha rol gyi dbang po rnam pa tha dad pa shes par bya ba'i tshul la mkhas pa/ sems can mtha' yas pa'i mos pa rnam pa tha dad pa'i rgyus la mkhas par khong du chud pa/ phyogs bcu'i zhing rgya mtsho tshad med pa lus kyis rgyas par 'gengs pa/ 'jig rten gyi khams rnam pa tha dad pa thams cad shes par bya ba'i tshul dang rnam pa la mkhas pa/ zhing tha dad pa'i tshul thams cad shes par bya ba'i tshul la mkhas pa'i rjes su song ba/ ye shes kyis lta ba phyogs rgya mtsho thams cad du rab tu 'dal ba/ dus rgya mtsho thams cad du khyab pa'i blo dang ldan pa/ sangs rgyas rgya mtsho thams cad la mngon sum du 'dud pa'i lus can/ chos kyi sprin rgya mtsho'i char thams cad yang dag par gzung ba la mngon du gyur pa'i sems dang ldan pa/ de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi yon tan rab tu rdzogs par bya ba'i nan tan gyis 'byung ba la rab tu brtson pa/ byang chub sems dpa'i tshogs thams cad yongs su sgrub pa la rab tu zhugs pa'i blo dang ldan pa/ byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyi rab tu 'jug pa la rnam par dpyod pa'i mthu yod pa/ byang chub kyi sems kyi yan lag thams cad yongs su grub pa/ byang chub sems dpa' thams cad yongs su bskyang ba la rab tu brtson pa/ sangs rgyas thams cad kyi legs pa'i sprin kun tu snang ba rab tu ston pa/ byang chub sems dpa' dang / rgyal ba thams cad skyed pa'i smon lam gyis byung ba dang /

Then Sudhana, emptied of notions of the forms of all beings, penetrating the minds of other beings, saw Lady Maya in the minds of all beings, her virtue sustaining all beings, her body an accumulation of the virtues of omniscience; she was engaged in nondiscriminatory perfect giving, impartial toward all beings, having united all beings in the fellowship of universal compassion; she had set out to actualize the virtues of all buddhas; she had entered the ocean of all ways of tolerance; her mind was expanded with a flood of energy of omniscience; she was indefatigable in clarification of all spheres of truth; she was adept in meditation on the essence of all things; her mind was accomplished in all branches of meditation; she was engaged in all branches of meditation without confusion and had perceived the unique sphere of meditation of those who arrive at Thusness; she was intent on various meditations to evaporate the ocean of afflictions of all beings; she knew how to analyze the teachings of all buddhas; she had the wisdom to consider all the designs of reality; she gazed tirelessly on all buddhas; she ceaselessly observed the succession of buddhas of past, present, and future; she faced the door of vision of all buddhas; she knew the variety of techniques to perfectly accomplish the path of attainment of all buddhas; she coursed in the space of all who realize Thusness; she knew how to take care of all beings; she appeared in an infinite variety of reflections to develop and guide beings according to their mentalities; she comprehended the variety of purities of all buddha-bodies; she had vowed to purify all lands; she had perfected the vow to guide all beings to ultimate liberation; her mind pervaded the spheres of all buddhas with respect; she had the energy to produce all the miracles of enlightening beings; she had purified the supreme spiritual body; she manifested infinite physical bodies; she crushed the power of all demons; she was imbued with the power of great roots of goodness; with intellect born of the power of truth she perceived the power of buddhas; she had perfected all powers of mastery of enlightening beings; she was flooded with the power of omniscience; her wisdom was illumined by the lightning of the knowledge of all buddhas; her knowledge contemplated the infinite ocean of minds of beings; she comprehended the myriad mentalities of beings; she was expert in knowledge of the differences in faculties of others; she was skilled in knowledge of the differences in interests of infinite beings; her body pervaded infinite oceans of lands in the ten directions; she was expert in knowledge of the differences in all worlds; she was skilled in the means of knowing the junction and disjunction of all lands; she saw throughout all realms by knowledge; she was aware of all times; she bowed to all buddhas; her mind was directed toward reception of the ocean of all buddha-teachings; she was engaged in accomplishing fulfillment of all qualities of buddhas; her intellect was applied to the production of all the provisions for enlightenment; she boldly considered and carried out all the undertakings of enlightening beings; she had completed all the elements of development of the will for enlightenment; she was engaged in protecting all beings; she undertook to be the mother of all enlightening beings and buddhas.

de dag la sogs pa mthong ba'i tshul 'dzam bu'i gling gi rdul shin tu phra ba snyed kyi lha mo sgyu ma tshong dpon gyi bu nor bzang gis mthong bar gyur to/ /des de mthong nas lha mo sgyu ma ji snyed yod pa de snyed du bdag gi lus byin gyis brlabs nas phyogs thams cad la mngon du bltas pa'i lha mo sgyu ma la thams cad du khyab pa'i lus kyis phyag byas so/ /des de ltar phyag byas ma thag tu ting nge 'dzin gyi sgo mtha' dang dbus med pa thob par gyur te/ des ting nge 'dzin gyi sgo de dag la rnam par bltas nas mtshan mar bya ba dang / bsgom pa dang / lhur blang ba dang / rjes su dran par bya ba dang / rgyas par dgang ba dang / rab tu rgya cher bya ba dang / blta ba dang / rnam par spel ba dang / mngon par bsgrub pa dang / rgyas gdab par byas te ting nge 'dzin gyi sgo de dag las langs nas lha mo sgyu ma 'khor dang bcas/ gnas dang bcas/ stan dang bcas pa la g.yas phyogs su bskor ba byas te mdun du 'dug nas thal mo sbyar te 'di skad ces smras so/ /'phags ma/ bdag ni/ 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed de/ dge ba'i bshes gnyen bsnyen bkur ba la yongs su bskul ba bgyis pa ste/ de ltar bdag dge ba'i bshes gnyen nas dge ba'i bshes gnyen du bsnyen bkur bgyid cing / mthar gyis khyod kyi zhabs kyi drung 'di'i bar du mchis pa lags na/ 'phags ma/ ji ltar byang chub sems dpas byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa la bslab na/ rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du 'grub pa lags/

Beginning with these, Sudhana saw Lady Maya in as many ways as atoms in the continent: seeing her, he magically made his body as extensive as Lady Maya, and with this omnipresent body bowed to the ubiquitous Maya. As he was bowing, an infinite variety of concentrations entered into him. Observing those concentrations, making them externally undetectable, cultivating them, mastering them, remembering them, making them all-pervasive, expanding them, watching them, increasing them, accomplishing them, and fixing their impression, he rose from those concentrations and circled Lady Maya, her retinue, her abode and seat, and then stood respectfully before her and said, “Noble one, Manjushri inspired me to seek supreme perfect enlightenment and directed me to attend spiritual benefactors. So I have been approaching spiritual friends, benefactors, and in the course of doing so I have come to you. Now please tell me, noble one, how an enlightening being may achieve omniscience while carrying out the practice of enlightening beings.”

des smras pa/ rigs kyi bu/ kho mo ni/ byang chub sems dpa'i rnam par thar pa smon lam chen po'i ye shes sgyu ma'i rnam pas rnam par brgyan pa thob pa ste/ rigs kyi bu/ kho mo rnam par thar pa de dang ldan pas 'jig rten gyi khams rgya mtsho 'di'i 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad kyi 'dzam bu'i gling thams cad na bcom ldan 'das rnam par snang mdzad kyi byang chub sems dpa'i srid pa'i tha ma la skye ba'i rnam par 'phrul pa ji snyed cig yod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' srid pa'i tha ma pa de dag thams cad so so'i mar gyur pa ste/ byang chub sems dpa' de dag thams cad kyang kho mo'i lto na gnas pa/ kho mo'i lto g.yas pa nas 'byung ngo/ /rigs kyi bu/ skal pa dang ldan pa'i gling bzhi pa 'di nyid kyi grong khyer chen po ser skya'i gnas su yang rgyal po zas gtsang ma'i btsun mo'i rigs dang ldan pa'i tshul gyis byang chub sems dpa' don grub byang chub sems dpa' skye ba'i rnam par 'phrul pa rgya chen po bsam gyis mi khyab pas bskyed do/ /

She said, “I have attained an enlightening liberation, ‘magical manifestation of knowledge of great vows.’ Imbued with this liberation, I am the mother of all the enlightening beings in their final existence in all the worlds in this world-ocean where Vairocana Buddha’s miraculous manifestation of birth as an enlightening being in the final existence takes place. All those enlightening beings grow in my belly and come forth from my right side. So here too in this great city of Kapilavastu, as wife of the king Shuddhodana, I became the mother of the enlightening being Siddhartha, by the great inconceivable miracle of the birth of an enlightening being.

rigs kyi bu/ de ltar kho mo rgyal po zas gtsang ma'i pho brang na 'dug 'dug pa las/ byang chub sems dpa' dga' ldan gyi pho brang nas 'pho ba'i dus la bab pa dang / ba spu'i sgo thams cad kyi ba spu'i sgo re re nas kyang 'od zer de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi yum gyi yon tan gyi dkyil 'khor las byung ba'i snang ba zhes bya ba mang po byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyi yum gyi yon tan gyi rgyan sangs rgyas kyi zhing brjod du med pa'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed thon nas 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad snang bar byas te kho mo'i lus la shar nas spyi bo man chad ba spu'i bu ga thams cad du 'phros par gyur to/ /rigs kyi bu/ de ltar byang chub sems dpa'i 'od zer ming gcig la byang chub sems dpa'i yum gyi rnam par 'phrul pa dang rgyan dang rnam par thar pa sna tshogs rab tu 'gyed pa de dag kho mo'i lus su dong ma thag tu de'i mod la kho mo'i lus su byang chub sems dpa'i 'od zer gyi sgo'i dkyil 'khor gyis rnam par dmigs par byas te byang chub sems dpa'i skye ba'i rnam par 'phrul pa'i tshul dang / rgyan thams cad yongs su snang bar gyur to/ /khyim dang 'khor la yang de bzhin du snang bar gyur to/ /rigs kyi bu/ de ltar byang chub sems dpa'i 'od zer de dag kho mo'i lus su dong ma thag tu de'i mod la byang chub sems dpa'i 'od zer gyi sgo'i dkyil 'khor de dag gis byang chub sems dpa' gang dag gi skye ba'i tshul dang / rnam par 'phrul pa rnam par dmigs par byas pa de dag thams cad kyang kho mos mthong bar gyur te/ de dag thams cad kyang snying po byang chub du gshegs nas seng+ge'i gdan la bzhugs shing / byang chub sems dpa'i 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor gyis bskor te 'jig rten gyi dbang po rnams kyis bskor cing chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba mang po mthong ngo/ /de bzhin gshegs pa de dag gis sngon byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa mdzad pa'i tshe de bzhin gshegs pa ji snyed cing bsnyen bkur ba de dag thams cad kyang kho mos dang po thugs bskyed pa dang / skye ba'i rnam par 'phrul pa dang bcas mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa dang / chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba dang / mya ngan las 'das pa'i rnam par 'phrul pa dang bcas/ sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag pa'i rgyan dang bcas par mthong ngo/ /de bzhin gshegs pa de dag gi sprul pa'i dkyil 'khor sems kyi skad cig re re la chos kyi dbyings thams cad rgyas par 'gengs pa de dag thams cad kyang kho mos mthong bar gyur to/ /rigs kyi bu/ de ltar kho mo'i lus su byang chub sems dpa'i 'od zer de dag dong ma thag tu kho mo'i lus kyang 'gro ba thams cad las mngon par 'phags par gyur te/ rum nam mkha'i dbyings ltar yangs par gyur kyang mi'i lus las lhag par yang mi snang ngo/ /phyogs bcu na byang chub sems dpa'i mngal gyi gnas dang / khang khyim dang / rgyan ji snyed cig yod pa de dag thams cad kyang kho mo'i lus kyi khongs su chud pa dang / kho mo'i lus su shod bar gyur par snang bar gyur to/ /

“At that time I was in the house of king Shuddhodana, and when the time of the enlightening being’s descent from the heaven of contentment had arrived, from every pore the enlightening being emanated as many rays of light as atoms in untold buddha-lands, arrayed with the qualities of the birth of all enlightening beings, known as the light originating from the qualities of birth of all buddhas; those rays of light illumined the whole world, then descended on my body and entered into every pore of my body, beginning with my head. As soon as those light rays of the enlightening being, with various names, emanating magical projections of the various miracles attending the birth of an enlightening being, had entered me, they caused the spheres of light at the front of the enlightening being’s light rays to be manifest in my body, and the supernal manifestations of miracles attending the birth of all enlightening beings were visible. And as soon as those light rays of the enlightening being had entered my body, I saw all the enlightening beings whose birth-miracles were shown in the spheres at the front of the enlightening being’s light rays, as they sat on the Buddha’s lion throne at the site of enlightenment, surrounded by congregations of enlightening beings, honored by the leaders of the worlds, turning the wheel of the teaching. I also saw all the buddhas with whom those buddhas associated as they carried out enlightening practices in the past. I also saw mystical projections of their initial inspiration, attainment of enlightenment, turning of the wheel of the teaching, final extinction, and the pure arrays of all buddha-lands, as well as the multitudes of emanations of those buddhas pervading the cosmos in each moment of consciousness. When those rays of light of the enlightening being entered my body, my body outreached all worlds, and my belly became as vast as space, and yet did not go beyond the human physical size. The supernal manifestations of the enlightening beings’ abode in the womb everywhere in the ten directions all appeared in my body.

rigs kyi bu/ de ltar kho mo'i lus su byang chub sems dpa'i mngal gyi gnas dang / khang khyim dang / rgyan dang / longs spyod byung bar gyur pa dang / de'i mod la byang chub sems dpa' sangs rgyas kyi zhing bcu'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed kyi byang chub sems dpa' smon lam gcig pa/ skal pa mnyam par spyod spyod pa/ dge ba'i rtsa ba gcig pa/ rgyan gcig pa/ rnam par thar pa gcig la rnam par spyod pa/ ye shes kyi sa gcig la gnas pa/ rnam par 'phrul pa gcig gis byung ba/ smon lam gcig gis grub pa/ spyod pa gcig gis byung ba/ chos kyi lus yongs su dag pa/ gzugs kyi lus mtha' dang dbus med pa'i byin gyi rlabs dang ldan pa/ byang chub sems dpa' kun tu bzang po'i spyod pa dang / smon lam dang / rnam par 'phrul pas byung ba dag dang / rin po che klu'i dbang po'i snying po'i khang pa brtsegs pa na 'khod cing klu'i rgyal po gang chen mtsho la sogs pa klu'i dbang po stong phrag brgyad cu dang / 'jig rten gyi dbang po thams cad kyis kyang mngon par mchod cing byang chub sems dpa'i rnam par 'phrul pa/ dga' ldan gyi pho brang thams cad nas shi 'pho yongs su ston pas dga' ldan gyi gnas re re nas kyang 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du 'dal ba'i gling bzhi par skye ba len pa yongs su ston pa/ sems can yongs su smin par bya ba'i thabs kyi tshul bsam gyis mi khyab pa la mkhas pa'i rjes su song ba dang / sems can bag med pa thams cad yongs su skul zhing mngon par zhen pa thams cad las gyen du bskyod pa dang / 'od zer gyi dra ba chen po rab tu dgye bas 'jig rten gyi mun pa thams cad rnam par sel ba dang / ngan song thams cad kyi sdug bsngal zhi bar byed pa dang / sems can dmyal ba'i lam gyi rgyud thams cad nas rnam par zlog pa dang / sems can thams cad kyi sngon gyi las yongs su skul ba dang / sems can gyi khams thams cad yongs su skyob pa dang / sems can thams cad la lus mngon par ston pas dga' ldan gyi pho brang nas 'phos te 'khor dang bcas par kho mo'i lus su zhugs nas de dag thams cad kyang kho mo'i khong na gom pa stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams tsam du yangs pa nas 'jig rten gyi khams sangs rgyas kyi zhing brjod du med pa'i rdul shin tu phra ba snyed du yangs pa'i 'gros kyis rgyu zhing spyod do/ /phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams 'byams klas pa thams cad kyi de bzhin gshegs pa'i zhabs kyi drung gi byang chub sems dpa'i 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor brjod du med pa dag kyang sems kyi skad cig re re la byang chub sems dpa'i mngal gyi gnas dang / rnam par 'phrul ba blta ba'i phyir kho mo'i khong du 'dong ngo/ /rgyal po chen po bzhi dang / brgya byin dang / rab mtshe ma dang / rab dga' ldan dang / rab 'phrul dga' dang / dbang sgyur gyi lha'i dbang po rnams dang / tshangs pa rnams kyang mngal gyi gnas na bzhugs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' la blta ba dang / phyag bya ba dang / bsnyen bkur ba dang / chos nyan pa'i gtam nyams su myong bar bya ba'i phyir nye bar 'dong yang kho mo'i rum 'dis de snyed kyi 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor zhig yongs su bzung yang yangs par gyur pa yang med/ mi'i lus tha mal pa las kho mo'i lus khyad par can du gyur pa yang med mod kyi/ 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor de snyed kyang yongs su bzung ngo/ /lha dang mi de dag thams cad kyis kyang byang chub sems dpa'i longs spyod sna tshogs dang / rgyan yongs su dag pa yang mthong bar gyur to/ /de ci'i phyir zhe na/ de ni/ byang chub sems dpa'i rnam par thar pa smon lam chen po'i ye shes sgyu ma'i rnam pa 'di nyid shin tu bsgoms pa'i phyir ro/ /

“Upon the appearance in my body of the furnishings of the enlightening being’s abode in the womb, the enlightening being, together with as many enlightening beings as atoms in ten buddha-lands, all with the same vow, the same practice, the same roots of goodness, the same state of liberation and the same stage of knowledge, adept at the same mystic projection, having accomplished the same endeavor, adept at the same practice, having purified the same spiritual body, able to assume an infinite variety of physical forms, expert in the projection of the endeavors of universally good enlightening beings, respectfully attended by chiefs of all worlds, descended from the heaven of contentment by the great miracle of enlightening beings; appearing to pass away from all heavens of contentment, appearing to become regenerated in all worlds, from each heaven of contentment to early existence, following skill in means of developing inconceivable numbers of sentient beings to maturity, alerting all intoxicated, deluded beings, detaching from all attachments, emanating a great network of light beams dispelling the darkness from all worlds, stopping all evils and miseries, putting an end to all hellish ways of being, making all beings aware of their past deeds, rescuing all beings, appearing in the presence of all beings, he descended from the heaven of contentment with his retinue and entered my belly.
“Once all of them were in my belly, they walked around in strides as big as a billion-world universe, even as big as worlds as numerous as atoms in untold buddha-lands. Also all the untold congregations of enlightening beings at the feet of all buddhas in all worlds in the ten directions entered my belly in every moment of thought to see the miracle of the enlightening being’s dwelling in the womb. The chief gods of all the heavens also came to the enlightening being in the womb, to see and honor him, to listen to the Teaching and hear his discourse. Yet even though it took in all those multitudes, my belly was not enlarged, nor did this body of mine become any more than a human body. Yet it received so many multitudes; and all the celestials and humans saw the various pure arrays of the enlightening beings’ surroundings. Why was this? Because of the development of this enlightening liberation of the magic of knowledge of great vows.

rigs kyi bu/ ji ltar kho mo skal pa dang ldan pa'i gling bzhi pa 'di'i 'dzam bu'i gling na byang chub sems dpa' khong na yongs su 'dzin pa de bzhin du/ stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyi gling bzhi pa thams cad kyi 'dzam bu'i gling dag na'ang rnam par 'phrul pa'i rgyan gyi tshul 'di nyid kyis yongs su 'dzin par byed de/ byang chub sems dpa'i rnam par thar pa smon lam chen po'i ye shes sgyu ma'i rnam pa 'di nyid shin tu bsgoms pa'i phyir kho mo'i lus 'di gnyis su gyur pa'ang med/ mi gnyis pa'ang med/ gcig la gnas pa'ang med/ mang po la gnas pa'i med do/ /rigs kyi bu/ ji ltar kho mo bcom ldan 'das rnam par snang mdzad 'di'i yum du gyur pa de bzhin du/ sngon gyi de bzhin gshegs pa mtha' dang dbus med pa dag gi yang yum du gyur to/ /la la zhig tu byang chub sems dpa' pad+mo'i spubs nas rdzus te skye ba zhig tu gyur na yang pad+mo'i tshal gyi lha mor gyur cing / kho mos byang chub sems dpa' len te/ 'jig rten rnams kyis kyang kho mo ni/ byang chub sems dpa'i yum yin par shes so/ /la la zhig tu thu bar skye bar gyur na yang de dag tu yang kho mos thu bar blangs te byang chub sems dpa'i yum du gyur to/ /la la zhig tu sangs rgyas kyi zhing du de bzhin 'byung bar gyur na'ang de dag tu'ang kho mo snying po byang chub kyi lha mor gnas gnas so/ /rigs kyi bu/ thabs kyi sgo ji snyed cig gis byang chub sems dpa' srid pa'i tha ma pa 'jig rten du 'byung ba yongs su ston pa de snyed kyi thabs kyi sgos kho mo byang chub sems dpa'i yum du gyur te/ rigs kyi bu/ kho mo 'jig rten gyi khams 'di na bcom ldan 'das rnam par snang mdzad kyi byang chub sems dpa'i skye ba'i rnam par 'phrul pa yongs su bstan pa dag tu yum du gyur pa de bzhin du/ bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa log par dad sel dang / gser thub dang / bsod skyabs kyi yum du 'ang gyur to/ /

“Just as I received the enlightening being in my belly in this world, so did I likewise do so in all worlds in the billion-world universe, and with this same miraculous manifestation; yet this body of mine is neither dual nor nondual, neither single nor multiple; this is because of the development of this enlightening liberation of the magic of knowledge of great vows. And just as I was the mother of this buddha Vairocana, so was I the mother of infinite buddhas before. Whenever an enlightening being was spontaneously born in the calyx of a lotus, there I became a lotus-pond goddess and received the enlightening being, and the world recognized me as the progenetrix of the enlightening being; in whatever buddha-land an enlightening being appeared, I became an enlightenment-site goddess there: thus in whatever ways enlightening beings manifested birth in the world in their final existence, in so many ways did I become the mother of the enlightening beings.
“Just as I was the mother of this buddha in this world in all his manifestations of miracles of birth as an enlightening being, so was I the mother of the buddhas Krakucchanda, Kanakamuni, and Kashyapa; and so will I be the mother of all the buddhas of this eon.

de bzhin du ma byon pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa bskal pa bzang po pa rnams kyi'ang yum du 'gyur te/ 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' byams pa dga' ldan gyi gnas na bzhugs shing shi 'pho yongs su ston pa'i dus la bab pa dang / 'od zer byang chub sems dpa' thams cad skye bar 'byung zhing / mngal na bzhugs pa'i rnam par 'phrul pa yongs su ston pa'i 'od bkye nas chos kyi dbyings thams cad kyi tshul dang / gzhi rab tu snang bar byas te chos kyi dbyings kyi tshul dang / gzhi ji snyed cig tu byang chub sems dpa' byams pas mi'i 'jig rten gyi mi'i dbang po'i rigs su cher skye ba yongs su bstan pas sems can gdul bar bya ba ji snyed cig yod pa de dag thams cad du'ang kho mo byang chub sems dpa'i yum du 'gyur ro/ /byang chub sems dpa'i yum du ji ltar 'gyur ba de bzhin du/ byams pa'i 'og tu bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur ba seng+ge dang / de bzhin du rab tu snang ba dang / dpal dang / spyan bzang po dang / me tog dang / me tog dpal dang / rgyas pa dang / rgyal dang / thugs bzang po dang / rdo rje dang / rdul dang bral ba dang / zla ba sgron ma 'dzin pa dang / grags pa dang / rdo rje dag pa dang / don gcig tu ston pa dang / mi dkar yan lag dang / pha rol tu phyin pa dang / rin po che 'od 'phro ba'i ri bo dang / sgron ma chen po 'dzin pa dang / pad+mo dam pa dang / sgra rnam par grags pa dang / yon tan dpag tu med pa mnga' ba dang / mar me'i dpal dang / yan lag rnam par brgyan pa dang / legs par bzhud pa dang / byams pa'i dpal dang / sprul pa bzang po dang / gnas dang bral ba dang / gzi brjid 'bar ba dang / gsung mtha' yas pa dang / len pa med pa'i mu khyud dang / yid gnyis rnam par sel ba dang / yongs su dag pa dang / 'od shin tu yangs pa dang / grags pa dag pas byung ba dang / sprin gyi dpal dang / gtsug phud rnam par mdzes pa dang / shing gi rgyal po dang / rin po che'i dkyil 'khor rin po che thams cad kyis rnam par brgyan pa'i kha dog dang / blo gros rgya mtsho dang / rin po che bzang po dang / stobs la thub pa med pa dang / dgongs pa yongs su rdzogs pa dang / dbang phyug chen po dang / dbang po'i dpal dang / me'i dpal dang / mchog gi dpal dang / tsan+dan gyi sprin dang / mi dkar ring ba'i spyan dang / blo gros dam pa dang / blo gros rnam par bsgoms pa dang / sgrub pa'i rgyal po dang / sbyong ba'i rgyal po dang / rdo rje'i blo gros dang / rnam par brgyan pa dang / phun sum tshogs pa dang / ze ba dga' ba dang / dbang phyug lha dang / gtsug tor dpal dang / ye shes rdo rje'i ri bo dang / dpal gyi snying po dang / gser gyi dra bas sku rnam par brgyan pa dang / shin tu rnam par phye ba dang / dbang phyug lha dang / dbang chen lha dang / mi dmigs pa'i dpal dang / rnam par dag pas dgyes pa dang / 'od 'phro mnga' ba dang / chu'i dpal dang / rnam dag blo gros dang / theg pa dam pa dang / ma nyams pa'i yon tan 'byung ba dang / dgra las dben pa dang / gsung sgrog pa dang / dbang du gyur pa'i yon tan gzi brjid dang / rnam par snang mdzad dpal dang / dri zhim po'i longs spyod dang / dri zhim po rnam par phye ba dang / yan lag rnam par phye ba dang / sa ga bzang ba dang / zhal nas spos thams cad 'od du 'phro ba dang / rdo rje rin po ches rnam par brgyan pa dang / rab tu bzhad pa'i spyan dang / 'dod chags rdul bcom dang / sku mchog tu 'khrungs pa dang / lha'i dbyig dang / rlabs chen lha dang / 'gog par gzhol ba dang / thugs rnam par sangs rgyas pa dang / rdul rnam par bsal ba dang / 'od 'phro ba mnga' chen dang / nye bar zhi ba mnga' ba dang / sa ga'i lha dang / rdo rje ri bo dang / ye shes 'od 'phro 'bar ba'i sku dang / bde bar mdzad pa dang / bsgrun pa'i stag dang / dge ba yongs su rdzogs pa dang / grags pa yid du 'ong bas bzang ba dang / mthus rnam par gnon pa dang / don dam pa rnam par gnon pa dang / zhi ba'i 'od zer dang / gcig tu 'phags pa dang / dbyangs zab mo dang / sa'i bdag po dang / dpag tu med pa dang / dbyangs kyi dpal dang / rnam par grags pa dang / longs spyod mthun pa dang / longs spyod tshogs pa dang / sman pa'i dam pa dang / yon tan zla ba dang / bzhad pa'i gzi brjid dang / yon tan bsags pa dang / zla ba 'phags pa dang / nyi ma'i lha dang / 'jigs par grags pa dang / 'od zer gyi zhal dang / sA la'i dbang po'i lhun dang / grags pa dang / sman gyi rgyal po dang / rin chen mchog dang / blo gros rdo rje dang / dkar po'i dpal dang / gzhi shin tu sbyangs pa dang / rin chen rgyal po dang / grags pa chen po dang / shugs drag 'dzin pa dang / mi dpog 'od dang / 'od 'phro chen pos bzhugs pa dang / don yod pa'i chos la mnga' ba dang / brtson 'grus ma nyams pa dang / dag pa'i lha dang / 'od brtan pa dang / kun gyi bshes gnyen dang / rnam par grol ba'i dbyangs dang / rnam par bsgrags pa'i rgyal po dang / tshig gcod pa dang / tsam+pa ka dri ma med pa'i 'od dang / kha na mi tho ba mi mnga' ba dang / zla ba rnam par 'phags pa dang / sgron ma 'dzin pa dang / sku rnam par mdzes pa dang / brjod du med par 'phags pa dang / 'gro ba'i bshes gnyen dang / 'od zer mang po dang / dbyangs kyi yan lag dpa' bo dang / chu lha'i spyan dang / mos pa'i blo gros mnga' ba'i gzi brjid dang / me tog kun da'i dpal dang / mchod pa'i zla ba dang / blo mi mnga' ba dang / chags pa mi mnga' ba dang / mi dmigs pa'i blo gros dang / phung po bsags pa dang / ngan song rab tu 'joms pa dang / me tog dam pa dang / seng+ge rnam par sgrog pa dang / don mi dma' ba dang / bsgribs pa med par gzigs pa dang / pha rol gyi tshogs 'joms pa dang / rlung gi mu khyud dang / snying po mi g.yo ba dang / snying po bzang po dang / gzhan gyis mi thub pa'i ri bo dang / mi gnas ye shes dang / mtha' yas bzhugs pa dang / g.yul du brtan pa dang / spyod pas grub pa dang / bla mas bon pa dang / mchog tu dga' ba dang / rjes su 'dzin pa'i zla ba dang / lhun mi g.yo ba dang / thugs drag po dang / thugs brtse ba'i blo gros dang / shin tu mtho 'dzin dang / 'od zer mu khyud dang / mtshan dpe med pa dang / gzi brjid ma nyams pa dang / thams cad kha dog dang / mtshan ma med pa'i shes rab dang / mi g.yo ba'i lha dang / bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i dpal dang / rnam par thar pa'i zla ba dang / bla na med pa'i rgyal po dang / zla ba'i phung po dang / mchod pa'i tshangs pa dang / spyan mi 'gyur ba dang / byams pa'i rigs dang / 'phrin las 'phags pa dang / gnyer ba'i chos kyi blo gros dang / bla na med pa'i dpal dang / tshangs pa'i lha dang / yon tan bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i 'od dang / bla na med pa'i chos kyi spyod yul dang / mtha' yas bzang po dang / tshul dang 'dra ba'i gsung dang / byang chub sems dpa' shin tu mtho ba'i lha dag ste/

“When the time comes for the enlightening being Maitreya, now in the heaven of contentment, to manifest descent from heaven, and emanate the lights of the manifestation of the miracles of enlightening beings abiding in the womb whence they are born, I will see all realms in all universes which are illumined thereby, where Maitreya will be born in a royal family in the human world and will guide sentient beings, and everywhere therein I will be the mother of the enlightening being.

rigs kyi bu/ de ltar stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams 'di'i ma byon pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa byams pa la sogs te/ smos pa 'di dag la sogs pa bskal pa bzang po pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas thams cad kyi yum du'ang kho mo nyid 'gyur ro/ /'jig rten gyi khams 'dir ji lta ba de bzhin du/ phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams tshad med pa'i chos kyi dbyings kyi tshul mtha' dang dbus med pa la zhugs te/ ji ltar de bzhin gshegs pa byams pa'i yum du yon tan gyi khyad par brjod du med par 'gyur ba de bzhin du/ yon tan gyi khyad par brjod du med pa'i yang brjod du med pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa seng+ge nas de bzhin gshegs pa snang ba'i bar gyi yum du 'gyur ro/ /ji ltar de bzhin gshegs pa bskal pa bzang po pa rnams kyi yum du 'gyur ba de bzhin du/ 'jig rten gyi khams rgya mtsho gzhi dang snying po me tog gi rgyan gyis brgyan pa 'di thams cad kyi 'jig rten gyi khams kyi rgyud thams cad dang / 'jig rten gyi khams 'byams klas thams cad kyi 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad na 'dzam bu'i gling yod pa thams cad du phyi ma'i mtha'i mur thug pa'i bskal par byang chub sems dpa' kun tu bzang po'i spyad pa spyod cing / bskal pa thams cad du sems can thams cad yongs su smin par bya ba dang / gdul bar byin gyis brlabs te/ ma byon pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa byang chub sems dpar gyur pa thams cad kyi yum du'ang 'gyur ro/ /de skad ces smras pa dang /

“And just as I will be the mother of Maitreya, so will I be the mother of all buddhas in this eon in this universe, and in all universes of the ten directions, penetrating endless universes. And just as I will be the mother of Maitreya, by untold virtues, so shall I be the mother of all the buddhas in this eon, and in endless billions of eons in all the worlds in all world systems in this flower treasury ocean of worlds, I will be the mother of all the buddhas of the future when they are enlightening beings, carrying on the practice of universally good enlightening beings, establishing guidance for the perfection of all beings in all ages.”

tshong dpon gyi bu nor bzang gis lha mo sgyu ma la 'di skad ces smras so/ /'phags ma/ khyod kyis byang chub sems dpa'i rnam par thar pa smon lam chen po'i ye shes sgyu ma'i rnam pas rnam par brgyan pa 'di brnyes nas ji snyed cig lags/
Then Sudhana asked Lady Maya, “How long ago did you attain this enlightening liberation of magical manifestations of knowledge of great vows?”

smras pa/ rigs kyi bu/ sngon 'das pa'i dus bskal pa bsam gyis mi khyab pa sems kyi yul las 'das par rigs dang ldan pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i mig gi lam gyis rnam par dmigs pa/ rnam par shes pas bgrang ba las yongs su 'das pa'i pha rol cig tu bskal pa dge ba'i 'od ces bya ba zhig byung ste/ bskal pa dge ba'i 'od de la 'jig rten gyi khams ri bo shin tu mtho ba'i dpal zhes bya ba rnam par dag la kun nas nyon mongs pa/ rin po che du ma las grub pa/ khor yug dang bcas pa/ ri rab dang rgya mtshor bcas pa/ 'gro ba lnga'i rgyud dang bcas pa sna tshogs blta na mdzes pa zhig byung ste/ 'jig rten gyi khams ri bo shin tu mtho ba'i dpal der gling bzhi pa bye ba brgya phrag bcu byung ste/ gling bzhi pa bye ba brgya phrag bcu po de dag gi dbus na gling bzhi pa dbu ma seng+ge rgyal mtshan dam pa'i gzi brjid ces bya ba zhig yod par gyur te/ gling bzhi pa der rgyal po'i gnas bye ba brgya phrag brgyad cu byung bar gyur to/ /rgyal po'i gnas bye ba brgya phrag brgyad cu po de dag gi dbus su rgyal po'i gnas dbu ma rgyal mtshan gyi dam pa dang ldan pa zhes bya ba byung ste/ der 'khor los bsgyur ba'i rgyal po gzi brjid chen po'i mthu zhes bya ba byung ngo/ /rgyal po'i gnas rgyal mtshan gyi dam pa dang ldan pa der snying po byang chub yal ga sna tshogs kyi 'od ces bya ba zhig byung ste/ de na snying po byang chub kyi lha mo mig gi dpal zhes bya ba 'dug 'dug go /snying po byang chub yal ga sna tshogs kyi 'od de la byang chub sems dpa' rgyal mtshan dri ma med pa zhes bya ba zhig thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi chos khong du chud par bya ba'i phyir 'dug pa las/ de'i thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi chos khong du chud par bya ba la bar chad bya ba'i phyir bdud kha dog bzang po'i 'od ces bya ba bdud kyi sde chen po'i 'khor dang ldan pa zhig lus mi snang bar ma byas par drung du phyin par gyur ro/ /'khor los bsgyur ba gzi brjid chen po'i mthu de yang byang chub sems dpa'i dbang thob pa'i rdzu 'phrul chen po'i rnam par 'phrul pas byung ba zhig ste/ des bdud kyi sde de bas kyang 'phags la ches mang ba'i dpung gi tshogs chen po mngon par sprul te bdud kyi sde pham par bya ba'i phyir snying po byang chub de'i 'khor kun nas yongs su bskor ba dang / des bdud kyi sde chen po de yang rnam par gtor bar gyur to/ /bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa rgyal mtshan dri ma med pa des kyang bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas so/ / de nas snying po byang chub kyi lha mo mig gi dpal gyis 'khor los bsgyur ba'i rgyal po gzi brjid chen po'i mthu la bu'i 'du shes bskyed nas de bzhin gshegs pa de'i zhabs gnyis la phyag 'tshal nas smon lam btab pa/ bcom ldan 'das/ bdag gang dang gang du skyes pa de dang der 'khor los bsgyur ba gzi brjid chen po'i mthu 'di bdag gi bur gyur cig /nam 'di bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur ba de'i tshe 'ang bdag nyid de'i mar gyur cig /ces nas des smon lam de skad du btab ste/ snying po byang chub yal ga sna tshogs kyi 'od de nyid la gnas shing bskal pa 'od bzang po 'di nyid la de bzhin gshegs pa khrag khrig phrag bcu bsnyen bkur to/ /

Maya replied, “Inconceivable eons ago, beyond the range of mind, beyond conscious calculation, there was an age called Pure Light. In that age of Pure Light there was a world called Elevated, which was pure with some defilement, made of many jewels, with surrounding mountains, polar mountains, and oceans, containing realms of celestials, humans, animals, ghosts, and hells, variegated and pleasant to see. In that world were a billion sets of four continents, in the middle of which was a group of four continents called Supreme Lionlike Majesty, in which there were eighty billion metropolises, among which was one called Possessed of the Best of Banners. There in that metropolis was a king called Great Energetic Power, a sovereign ruler. There was also an enlightenment site in that metropolis called Conspicuous Rays of Light, wherein there was a deity called Radiant Eyes. Furthermore, at that enlightenment site an enlightening being named Pure Standard sat, to attain omniscience. A demon named Golden Light, along with a great army of cohorts, had come invisibly to prevent the enlightening being from attaining omniscience; but the king Great Energetic Power, who had attained the mastery which enlightening beings realize, issued a great magical projection, producing a great army, more numerous than and superior to that of the demons, to surround the enlightenment site and fight off the demon army. The demon army was thereby scattered, and the blessed Pure Standard realized perfect enlightenment.
“The goddess of the enlightenment site, Radiant Eyes, looking upon the king as her son, then prostrated herself before the buddha and made a vow: ‘Wherever I may be born, may the king Great Energetic Power be my son; and when he attains supreme perfect enlightenment, I will be his mother then too.’ Having made this vow, she attended ten decillion buddhas at that enlightenment site during that eon.

rigs kyi bu /de la ji snyam du sems/ de'i tshe de'i dus na snying po byang chub kyi lha mo mig gi dpal zhes bya bar gyur pa de gzhan zhig yin pa snyam du sems na ni/ rigs kyi bu khyod kyis de ltar mi blta ste/ kho mo ni/ de'i tshe de'i dus na snying po byang chub kyi lha mo mig gi dpal zhes bya bar gyur to/ /rigs kyi bu/ de la ji snyam du sems/ de'i tshe de'i dus na 'khor los bsgyur ba'i gzi brjid chen po'i mthu zhes bya ba/ byang chub sems dpa'i dbang thob pa/ rdzu 'phrul chen po'i rnam par 'phrul pas byung ba/ bdud kyi sde chen po rnam par mthor bar byed pa de gzhan zhig yin pa snyam du sems na ni/ de ltar mi blta ste/ bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnam par snang mdzad 'di ni/ de'i tshe de'i dus na 'khor los bsgyur ba'i rgyal po gzi brjid chen po'i mthu zhes bya bar gyur to/ /rigs kyi bu; de ltar kho mo de nas nye bar bzung nas gang dang gang du skyes pa de dag thams cad du'ang 'di ni/ kho mo'i bur gyur te/ sangs rgyas kyi zhing thams cad du byang chub sems dpa'i spyad pa spyod cing / 'gro ba'i rgyud kyi sgo thams cad dang / skye gnas kyi sgo thams cad dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba'i sgo thams cad dang / byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa'i rgyud kyi tshul thams cad dang / skyes pa'i rabs kyi tshul thams cad dang / lha'i dbang po'i tshe thams cad dang / 'jig rten gyi dbang po'i 'gro ba'i rgyud thams cad dang / dbang phyug gis thams cad dang / 'gro ba'i rgyud du snang ba thams cad gang dang gang du sems can yongs su smin par bya ba'i don du skyes par gyur pa de dag thams cad du yang kho mo nyid 'di'i yum du gyur te/ srid pa thams cad du 'ang kho mo nyid dang bral ba med par yum du gyur to/ /byang chub sems dpa'i skye ba'i sgo thams cad du skad cig skad cig cing byang chub sems dpa'i skye ba'i rnam par 'phrul pa bstan par gyur to/ /de dag thams cad du yang kho mo nyid 'di'i yum du gyur to/ /'das pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa mtha' dang dbus med pa tshad med pa dag gi yum du'ang kho mo gyur to/ /phyogs bcu'i de bzhin gshegs pa da ltar byung ba mtha' dang dbus med pa tshad med pa dag gi yum du'ang kho mo gyur te/ de bzhin gshegs pa ji snyed cig gi srid pa tha ma la kho mo byang chub sems dpa'i yum du gyur pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa de dag thams cad kyi sku lte ba'i dkyil 'khor nas 'od zer mang po byung zhing / kho mo'i lus dang sems rab tu snang bar mdzad do/ /

“Now, who do you think that goddess was? It was I myself who was the enlightenment-site goddess Radiant Eyes at that time. As for the king Great Energetic Power, who had the mastery of an enlightening being and destroyed the demon army by means of a magical projection, it was none other than this present buddha, the blessed Vairocana, the saint, the perfectly enlightened one, who was at that time the king Great Energetic Power. Ever since then, wherever I have been, he has come as my son, carrying out the practice of enlightening beings in all buddha-lands, in all states of being, in all lifetimes, based on all that is good, in all undertakings through which enlightening practice is carried out. Wherever he emerged to develop and perfect sentient beings, there I was his mother, and in his final existence too, I was his mother, everywhere. In all modes of birth as an enlightening being, moment to moment, however many miracles of birth as an enlightening being he displayed, in every case I was his mother. In the same way I was the mother of infinite buddhas of the past, and I am mother to the infinite buddhas of the ten directions in the present. And all the buddhas I was mothers to in their last existence as an enlightening being emanated lights from their navels and illumined this great body and this seat.

rigs kyi bu/ kho mos byang chub sems dpa'i rnam par thar pa smon lam chen po ye shes sgyu ma'i rnam pas rnam par brgyan pa 'di shes par zad na; kho mos byang chub sems dpa'i snying rje chen po'i snying po dang ldan pa/ thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du yongs su smin par bya ba dang / gdul bas mi ngoms pa'i lta can/ de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi rnam par 'phrul ba ba spu'i rtse mo las 'byung bar ston pa la dbang sgyur ba de dag gi spyod pa shes pa'am/ yon tan brjod par nus re skan/

“I only know this enlightening liberation of magical manifestation of knowledge of great vows—how can I know the practice or tell of the virtues of the enlightening beings who are filled with great compassion, who never tire of guiding to perfection of omniscience, who are able to display projections of the miracles of all buddhas from every pore?

song rigs kyi bu/ sum cu rtsa gsum gyi dbang po'i gnas de nyid na lha'i bu dran pa dang ldan pa'i bu mo lha dbang 'od ces bya ba 'dug gi /de'i gan du song la ji ltar byang chub sems dpas byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa la bslab par bya ba dang / ji ltar nan tan du bya ba dris shig/

“In the thirty-three-fold heaven of this world is a goddess named Surendrabha, who is the daughter of a god named Smrtimati. Go ask her how to learn and carry out the practice of enlightening beings.”

de nas tshong dpon gyi bu nor bzang gis lha mo sgyu ma'i rkang pa gnyis la spyi bos phyag 'tshal te lan brgya stong du mar g.yas phyogs su bskor ba byas nas yang dang yang bltas te/ lha mo sgyu ma'i drung nas song ngo/ /
So then Sudhana paid his respects and left Lady Maya.
shin tu rgyas pa chen po'i mdo/ sangs rgyas phal po che zhes bya ba las/ sdong pos brgyan pa'i le'u ste/ ` bam po brgya bcu pa/
[lha'i bu mo lha dbang 'od]
Surendrabha

de nas tshong dpon gyi bu nor bzang sum cu rtsa gsum gyi dbang ba'i gnas gang na ba dang / lha'i bu dran pa dang ldan pa'i bu mo lha dbang 'od gang na ba der song ste phyin nas lha'i bu mo lha dbang 'od kyi rkang pa gnyis la spyi bos phyag 'tshal te; lha'i bu mo lha dbang 'od la lan brgya stong du mar g.yas phyogs su bskor ba byas nas lha'i bu mo lha dbang 'od kyi mdun du 'dug ste thal mo sbyar nas 'di skad ces smras so/ /'phags ma lha mo/ bdag gis bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed na/ ji ltar byang chub sems dpas byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa la bslab par bgyi ba dang / ji ltar nan tan du bgyi ba ma 'tshal te/ 'phags ma ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams la gdams ngag dang / rjes su bstan pa mdzad do/ /zhes bdag gis thos na/ 'phags ma lha mo/ ji ltar byang chub sems dpas byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa la bslab par bgyi ba dang / ji ltar nan tan du bgyi ba bdag la bstan du gsol/ de skad ces smras pa dang / lha'i bu mo lha dbang 'od kyis tshong dpon gyi bu nor bzang la 'di skad ces smras so/ / rigs kyi bu/ kho mo ni/ byang chub sems dpa'i rnam par thar pa dran pa thogs pa med pa/ rnam par dag pas brgyan pa zhes bya ba thob pa ste/ rigs kyi bu/ kho mos mngon par dran pa bskal pa ut+pa la zhes bya ba zhig byung ba la kho mos de bzhin gshegs pa chu klung gang+gA'i bye ma snyed cig bsnyen bkur te/ de dag mngon par ma byung ba'i tshe yang yongs su srung ba byas so/ /mchod pa byas so/ /longs spyod pa'i don du bza' shing gi ra ba gsol to/ /sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag byang chub sems dpar gyur te/ yum gyi sku na bzhugs pa dang / bltams pa dang / gshegs stabs mdun du bzhud pa dang / seng+ge'i nga ro chen po sgrog pa dang / gzhon nu'i sa la bzhugs pa dang / btsun mo'i 'khor gyi nang na bzhugs pa dang / mngon par byung ba dang / byang Then Sudhana went to the thirty-three-fold heaven, and went to the goddess Surendrabha. Paying his respects to the goddess, Sudhana stood before her and said, “Noble one, I have set my mind on supreme perfect enlightenment, but I do not know how to learn and carry out the practice of enlightening beings. I hear you give instruction to enlightening beings, so please tell me how to learn and practice.”
Surendrabha replied, “I have attained an enlightening liberation called pure manifestation of unimpeded recollection. I am aware that there was an age called Flowering, in which I served as many buddhas as there are grains of sand in the Ganges River. When they went forth from their customary surroundings, I protected them, provided for them, and made parks for their use. And all the developmental guidance of sentient beings performed by those buddhas—while they were enlightening beings, while in the womb of the mother, while being born, while taking seven steps, while roaring the lion’s roar, during childhood, during life at home, when leaving home, when awaking at the site of enlightenment, while teaching, while displaying the miracles of buddhas—all that, from their first inspiration to the final ending of their true teaching, I know and remember, recall and keep in mind, reflect on and follow.

“There was an eon called Well-Being, in which I served as many buddhas as sand grains in ten Ganges Rivers; there was an eon called Good Fortune, in which I served as many buddhas as atoms in a buddha-land; there was an eon called No Attainment, in which I served eighty-four thousand duodecillion buddhas; there was an eon called Beautiful Light, in which I served as many buddhas as atoms in this continent; there was an eon called Peerless Light, in which I served as many buddhas as sand grains in twenty Ganges Rivers; there was an eon called Blazing Glory, in which I served as many buddhas as sand grains in the Ganges River; there was an eon called Sunrise, in which I served as many buddhas as sand grains in eighty Ganges Rivers; there was an eon called Victorious March, in which I served as many buddhas as sand grains in sixty Ganges Rivers; there was an eon called Beautiful Moon, in which I served as many buddhas as sand grains in seventy Ganges Rivers.

“In this way, I remember as many eons as sand grains in the Ganges River, during which I was always with buddhas, and I heard of this enlightening liberation of pure manifestation of unimpeded recollection from those buddhas, and practiced it as they told me. Thus, constantly engrossed in this liberation, I recollect, remember, keep in mind, reflect on, and recall the supernal manifestations of all those buddhas from their stages of enlightening to the end of the duration of their true teachings, by means of this enlightening liberation of pure manifestation of unimpeded recollection.

“I only know this enlightening liberation—how can I know the practice, or tell the virtues, of the enlightening beings who are free from all obscurity and darkness, who light up the night of the mundane whirl, who are rid of all obstacles, who do not slumber, who are rid of apathy and indolence, who have stopped compulsive actions based on conditioning, who have purified awareness of the essence of all things, who awaken others to the purity of the ten powers?

“In the city of Kapilavastu there lives a boy named Vishwamitra who is a teacher. Go ask him how to learn and carry out the practice of enlightening beings.”

Descending from the thirty-three-fold heaven, Sudhana made his way to Kapilavastu, where he went to see the young teacher Vishwamitra. I hear you give enlightening beings instruction, so please tell me how to learn and practice.”

Shilpabhijna said, “I have attained an enlightening liberation with higher knowledge of arts. In uttering the phonemes, as I pronounce A, by the associative power of an enlightening being I enter a door of transcendent wisdom called sphere of totality; pronouncing Ra, I enter a door of transcendent wisdom called differentiation of infinite levels; pronouncing Pa, I enter a door of transcendent wisdom called differentiation of levels of the cosmos of realities; pronouncing Cha, I enter a door of transcendent wisdom called analysis of the universal sphere; pronouncing Na, I enter a door of transcendent wisdom called independence; pronouncing La, I enter a door of transcendent wisdom called unattached; pronouncing Da, I enter a door of transcendent wisdom called unregressing effort; pronouncing Ba, I enter a door of transcendent wisdom called adamantine sphere; pronouncing Da, I enter a door of transcendent wisdom called universal sphere; pronouncing Sa, I enter a door of transcendent wisdom called ocean womb; pronouncing Va, I enter a door of transcendent wisdom called branching out everywhere; pronouncing Ta, I enter a door of transcendent wisdom called sphere of light; pronouncing Ya, I enter a door of transcendent wisdom called multitude of mixtures; pronouncing Shta, I enter a door of transcendent wisdom called light extinguishing all burning; pronouncing Ka, I enter a door of transcendent wisdom called unified multitude; pronouncing Sha, I enter a door of transcendent wisdom called directed rain; pronouncing Ma, I enter a door of transcendent wisdom called crest of various currents of great force; pronouncing Ga, I enter a door of transcendent wisdom called extending to all levels; pronouncing Tha, I enter a door of transcendent wisdom called unified womb of Thusness; pronouncing Ja, I enter a door of transcendent wisdom called plunging into purification of the mundane whirl; pronouncing Swa, I enter a door of transcendent wisdom called supernal manifestation of recollection of all buddhas; pronouncing Dha, I enter a door of transcendent wisdom called contemplative investigation of truths; pronouncing Sha, I enter a door of transcendent wisdom called light of the wheel of teaching of all buddhas; pronouncing Kha, I enter a door of transcendent wisdom called womb of knowledge of the causal ground of accomplishment; pronouncing Ksha, I enter a door of transcendent wisdom called investigation of the treasury of the ocean in which all actions are stilled; pronouncing Sta, I enter a door of transcendent wisdom called light of purity dispelling all afflictions; pronouncing Ña, I enter a door of transcendent wisdom called access to worldly knowledge; pronouncing Tha, I enter a door of transcendent wisdom called sphere of knowledge of the cycles of the mundane whirl; pronouncing Bha, I enter a door of transcendent wisdom called array of manifestations of spheres of existence; pronouncing Chha, I enter a door of transcendent wisdom called division of the encompassing sphere of practice applied to development; pronouncing Sma, I enter a door of transcendent wisdom called turning to face all directions to see all buddhas; pronouncing Hwa, I enter a door of transcendent wisdom called matrix of power to observe what all sentient beings cannot; pronouncing Tsa, I enter a door of transcendent wisdom called plunging into practice of the ocean of all virtues; pronouncing Gha, I enter a door of transcendent wisdom called strong oceanic vessel holding the multitude of all teachings; pronouncing Tha, I enter a door of transcendent wisdom called going in the direction of the vows of all buddhas; pronouncing Na, I enter a door of transcendent wisdom called voicing the millions of configurations of the wheel of phonemes; pronouncing Pha, I enter a door of transcendent wisdom called sphere of the ultimate development of all sentient beings; pronouncing Ska, I enter a door of transcendent wisdom called suffusion of the sphere of light of unimpeded intellectual powers contained in the stages of enlightenment; pronouncing Sya, I enter a door of transcendent wisdom called sphere of exposition of all buddha-teachings; pronouncing Shcha, I enter a door of transcendent wisdom called thunder of truth filling the sky of beings; pronouncing Ta, I enter a door of transcendent wisdom called lamp of the ultimate consummation of selfless work for the benefit of sentient beings; pronouncing Dha, I enter a door of transcendent wisdom called matrix of the distinction of cycles of the Teaching.

rigs kyi bu/ kho bo de ltar yi ge'i ma mo slob pa'i tshe shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i sgo de dag la sogs pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i sgo tshad med grangs med pa zhig khong du chud do/ /rigs kyi bu/ de ltar kho bo ni/ byang chub sems dpa'i rnam par thar pa bzo mngon par shes pa dang ldan pa 'di thob pa ste/ rigs kyi bu/ kho bos de shes par zad na; kho bos byang chub sems dpa' 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i bzo gnas thams cad kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i mchog thob pa/ bzo'i gnas thams cad la 'jug pa dang / yi ge dang / grangs dang / rtsis dang / shod thabs thams cad khong du chud par bya ba dang / sngags dang / sman thams cad kyi tshul la mkhas pa rab tu thob par bya ba dang / 'byung po dang / gza' dang / skar ma dang / brjed byed dang / byang stems dang / ro langs kyi gnod pa thams cad gso ba dang / sems can gyi khams gso bar bya ba'i sman dang thabs kyi rgyus dang / khams kyi thabs yongs su bsdu ba'i cho ga dang / gser dang / nor bu dang / mu tig dang / bai DUr+ya dang / dung dang / man shel dang / byi ru dang / mu tig dmar po dang / mu sa ra gar+b+ha dang / ke sa ra dang / dpal gyi snying po dang / rin po che thams cad 'byung zhing skye ba dang / rigs dang / 'byung khungs dang / rin thang gi rgyus shes par bya ba dang / bza' shing gi ra ba dang / dka' thub kyi nags tshal dang / grong dang / grong khyer dang / ljongs dang / khams dang / rgyal ba'i gnas mngon par sgrub pa dang / ri dang / 'khor lo dang / mtshan ma blta ba dang / sems can gyi mtshan gyi ltas dang / sa g.yo ba dang / phyogs tshig pa dang / skar mda' ltung ba dang / dge mi dge dang / mu ge dang / lo legs pa la sogs pa 'jig rten gyi thabs lag thams cad kyi rgyus khong du chud par bya ba dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos rnam par phye ba thams cad brjod cing bstan pa dang / khong du chud par bya ba dang / yang dag pa nyid rjes su rig par bya ba'i rgyus la sgrib pa'am/ the tshom mam/ yid gnyis sam/ nem nur ram/ tsham tshom mam/ mgo rmongs pa'am/ 'khor ba'am/ mi bde ba'am/ sgyid lug pa'am/ mi shes pa'am/ khong du mi chud pa med pa de dag gi spyod pa shes pa'am/ yon tan brjod par nus re skan/

“As I pronounce the phonemes, I enter immeasurable, innumerable doors of transcendent wisdom, beginning with these forty-two. I have attained this enlightening liberation with higher knowledge of arts, and it is this I know. How can I know the practice or tell the virtues of enlightening beings who have attained perfection of all mundane and transcendental arts, inasmuch as they have no barrier, no doubt, no confusion, no uncertainty, no hesitation, no ignorance, no difficulty, no impairment, no frustration, no lack of knowledge, and no misunderstanding in regard to the subject matters of all arts—all writing and mathematics, all applied sciences of spells and herbs, all the bases of obsession, psychotherapy, epilepsy, lameness, and insanity, the science of compounding medicines, chemistry, mineralogy, the making of parks, groves, villages, towns, and cities, knowledge of the vicissitudes of the world through astronomy, physiognomy, geomancy, meteorology, agronomy, and prediction of trends of events, and the analysis, communication, understanding, and actualization of all transmundane phenomena.

song rigs kyi bu/ yul ma ga d+ha 'di nyid kyi ljongs dag pa zhes bya ba'i grong khyer 'tsho ba zhes bya ba na dge bsnyen ma bzang mo'i mchog ces bya ba 'dug gi /de'i gan du song la ji ltar byang chub sems dpas byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa la bslab par bya ba dang / ji ltar nan tan du bya ba dris shig /

“In the city of Vartanaka, in the region of Kevalaka, in this same country of Magadha, there lives a laywoman named Bhadrottama. Go ask her how an enlightening being is to learn and carry out the practice of enlightening beings.”

de nas tshong dpon gyi bu nor bzang gis tshong dpon gyi bu bzo mngon par shes pa'i rkang pa gnyis la spyi bos phyag 'tshal te/ tshong dpon gyi bu bzo mngon par shes pa la lan brgya stong du mar g.yas phyogs su bskor ba byas nas yang dang yang bltas te tshong dpon gyi bu bzo mngon par shes pa'i drung nas song ngo/ /
So Sudhana paid his respects and left the noble youth Shilpabhijna.
[dge bsnyen ma bzang mo'i mchog]
Bhadrottama

de nas tshong dpon gyi bu nor bzang ljongs dag pa'i grong khyer 'tsho ba gang na ba dang / dge bsnyen ma bzang mo'i mchog gang na ba der song ste phyin nas dge bsnyen ma bzang mo'i mchog gi rkang pa gnyis la spyi bos phyag 'tshal nas dge bsnyen ma bzang mo'i mchog la lan brgya stong du mar g.yas phyogs su bskor ba byas te dge bsnyen ma bzang mo'i mchog gi mdun du 'dug nas thal mo sbyar te 'di skad ces smras so/ /'phags ma/ bdag gis bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed na/ ji ltar byang chub sems dpas byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa la bslab par bgyi ba dang / ji ltar nan tan du bgyi ba ma 'tshal te/ 'phags ma ni; byang chub sems dpa' rnams la gdams ngag dang / rjes su bstan pa mdzad do/ /zhes bdag gis thos na/ ji ltar byang chub sems dpas byang chub dpa'i spyod pa la bslab par bgyi ba dang / ji ltar nan tan du bgyi ba 'phags mas bdag la bstan du gsol/

Then Sudhana went to Vartanaka city in the region of Kevalaka, where he called on the laywoman Bhadrottama. Paying his respects to her, he said, “Noble one, I have set my mind on supreme perfect enlightenment, but I do not know how an enlightening being is to learn and carry out the practice of enlightening beings. I hear you give enlightening beings instruction, so please tell me how to learn and practice.”

des smras pa/ rigs kyi bu/ kho mo ni/ chos kyi rnam grangs gnas med pa'i dkyil 'khor ces bya ba shes shing ston pa ste/ kho mos thogs pa med pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin kyang thob bo/ /ting nge 'dzin de ni/ chos gang la yang thogs pa med de/ de la gnas na/ thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du mig thogs pa med pa 'jug go/ thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du rna ba thogs pa med pa dang / thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du sna tshogs pa med pa dang / thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du lce thogs pa med pa dang / thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du lus thogs pa med pa dang / thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du yid thogs pa med pa yang rab tu 'jug go/ thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi rlabs thogs pa med pa dang / thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du snang ba thogs pa med pa dang / thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du shugs thogs pa med pa 'gro ba rab tu snang ba'i dkyil 'khor dag kyang rab tu 'jug go /

She said, “I know and teach a doctrine called ‘baseless sphere’ and have attained a concentration of mystic empowerment. In that concentration there is no foundation of any phenomenon whatsoever. Therein is produced the mystical empowerment of the eye of omniscience, the mystical empowerment of the ear of omniscience, the mystical empowerment of the nose of omniscience, the mystical empowerment of the tongue of omniscience, the mystical empowerment of the body of omniscience, the mystical empowerment of the mind of omniscience, the mystical power of the waves of omniscience, the mystical power of the lightning of omniscience, the mystical power of the flood of omniscience, spheres illumining the world.
rigs kyi bu/ kho mo ni/ chos kyi rnam grangs gnas med pa'i dkyil 'khor 'di shes shing khong du chud par zad na/ kho mos byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa chags pa med pa ril gyis shes par nus re skan/
“It is this doctrine of the baseless sphere that I know. How can I know all the unobstructed, unattached practices of enlightening beings?

song rigs kyi bu; lho phyogs kyi rgyud na khrong khyer rgyas pa'i 'gram zhes bya ba yod do/ de na gser tshong gces pa gtong ba zhes bya ba 'dug gi /de'i gan du song la ji ltar byang chub sems dpas byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa la bslab par bya ba dang / ji ltar nan tan du bya ba dris shig/
Go south—there is a city called Bharukaccha, where there lives a goldsmith named Muktasara. Go ask him how an enlightening being is to learn and carry out the practice of enlightening beings.”

de nas tshong dpon gyi bu nor bzang gis dge bsnyen ma bzang mo'i mchog gi rkang pa gnyis la spyi bos phyag 'tshal te/ dge bsnyen ma bzang mo'i mchog la lan brgya stong du mar g.yas phyogs su bskor ba byas nas yang dang yang bltas te dge bsnyen ma bzang mo'i mchog gi drung nas song ngo/ /
So then Sudhana paid his respects, took his leave, and departed.
[gser tshong gces pa gtong ba]
Muktasara

de nas tshong dpon gyi bu nor bzang mthar gyis lho phyogs kyi rgyud du song ste/ grong khyer rgyas pa'i 'gram du gser tshong gces pa gtong ba gang na ba der phyin te/ gser tshong gces pa gtong ba'i rkang pa gnyis la spyi bos phyag 'tshal te mdun du 'dug nas thal mo spyar te 'di skad ces smras so/ /'phags pa/ bdag gis bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed na/ ji ltar byang chub sems dpas byang chub sems dpa'i spyad pa la bslab par bgyi ba dang / ji ltar nan tan du bgyi ba ma 'tshal te/ 'phags pa ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams la gdams ngag dang / rjes su bstan pa mdzad do/ /zhes bdag gis thos na/ ji ltar byang chub sems dpas byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa la bslab par bgyi ba dang / ji ltar nan tan du bgyi ba 'phags pas bdag la bka' stsal du gsol/ des smras pa/ rigs kyi bu/ kho bo ni/ byang chub sems dpa'i rnam par thar pa dran pa thogs pa med la rnam par dag pas rnam par brgyan pa zhes bya ba shes te/ kho bo ni/ phyogs bcu'i de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi zhabs kyi drung du chos yongs su tshol ba rgyun mi gcod pa'o/ /

Then Sudhana made his way south, to the goldsmith Muktasara in the city of Bharukaccha. Paying his respects to Muktasara, Sudhana said, “Noble one, I have set my mind on supreme perfect enlightenment, but I do not know how an enlightening being is to learn and carry out the practice of enlightening beings. I hear you give enlightening beings instruction, so please tell me how to learn and practice.”
Muktasara said, “I know an enlightening liberation called supernal manifestation of unobstructed mindfulness, and I ceaselessly seek the Teaching at the feet of all buddhas in the ten directions.

rigs kyi bu/ kho bos byang chub sems dpa'i rnam par thar pa dran pa thogs pa med la rnam par dag pas rnam par brgyan pa 'di shes par zad na/ kho bos byang chub sems dpa' bag tsha ba med par seng+ge'i nga ro sgrog pa/ bsod nams dang ye shes chen po la gnas pa de dag gi spyod pa shes pa'am/ yon tan brjod par nus re skan;

I only know this enlightening liberation. How can I know the practice or tell the virtue of the enlightening beings who roar the fearless roar of the lion, who are grounded on great virtue and knowledge?

song rigs kyi bu/ rgyas pa'i 'gram gyi grong khyer 'di nyid na khyim bdag zla ba bzang po zhes bya ba/ rtag tu khyim snang bar gyur pa dang ldan pa zhig 'dug gi/ de'i gan du song la ji ltar byang chub sems dpas byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa la bslab par bya ba dang / ji ltar nan tan du bya ba dris shig/
“There is a householder named Suchandra living in this city, whose house is always illuminated; go ask him how to learn and carry out the practice of enlightening beings.”

de nas tshong dpon gyi bu nor bzang gis gser tshong gces pa gtong gi rkang pa gnyis la spyi bos phyag 'tshal te/ gser tshong gces pa gtong ba la lan brgya stong du mar g.yas phyogs su bskor ba byas nas yang dang yang bltas te gser tshong gces pa gtong ba'i drung nas song ngo/ /
So Sudhana paid his respects, took his leave, and departed.

drop.crumb: khyim bdag zla ba bzang po

fuse.drop: [zla ba bzang po]
Suchandra

de nas tshong dpon gyi bu nor bzang khyim bdag zla ba bzang po gang na ba der song ste/ khyim bdag zla ba bzang po'i rkang pa gnyis la spyi bos phyag 'tshal nas mdun du 'dug ste thal mo sbyar nas 'di skad ces smras so/ /'phags pa/ bdag gis bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed na/ ji ltar byang chub sems dpas byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa la bslab par bgyi ba dang / ji ltar nan tan du bgyi ba ma 'tshal te/ 'phags pa ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams la gdams ngag dang / rjes su bstan pa mdzad do/ /zhes bdag gis thos na/ ji ltar byang chub sems dpas byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa la bslab par bgyi ba dang / ji ltar nan tan du bgyi ba 'phags pas bdag la bstan du gsol/

Then Sudhana went to the householder Suchandra, paid his respects, and said, “Noble one, I have set my mind on supreme perfect enlightenment, but I don’t know how to learn and carry out the practice of enlightening beings. I hear you give enlightening beings instruction, so please tell me how an enlightening being is to learn and practice.”

smras pa/ rigs kyi bu/ kho bos ni/ rnam par thar pa ye shes dri ma med pa'i 'od ces bya ba thob ste/ rigs kyi bu/ kho bos byang chub sems dpa'i rnam par thar pa ye shes dri ma med pa'i 'od 'di shes par zad na/ kho bos byang chub sems dpa' rnam par thar pa tshad med pa thob pa rnams kyi spyod pa shes pa'am/ yon tan brjod par nus re skan/ song rigs kyi bu/ lho phyogs kyi rgyud 'di nyid na grong khyer ri gnas zhes bya ba yod de/ de na khyim bdag mi pham sde zhes bya ba 'dug gi/ de'i gan du song la ji ltar byang chub sems dpas byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa la bslab par bya ba dang / ji ltar nan tan du bya ba dris shig/

Suchandra said, “I have attained an enlightening liberation called light of undefiled knowledge. I only know this liberation. How can I know the practice or tell of the virtues of the enlightening beings who have attained infinite liberation? South of here is a city called Roruka, where a householder named Ajitasena lives. Go ask him how to learn and carry out the practice of enlightening beings.”

de nas tshong dpon gyi bu nor bzang gis khyim bdag zla ba bzang po'i rkang pa gnyis la spyi bos phyag 'tshal te khyim bdag zla ba bzang po la lan brgya stong du mar g.yas phyogs su bskor ba byas nas yang dang yang bltas te khyim bdag zla ba bzang po'i drung nas song ngo/ /
So Sudhana paid his respects and left.
[khyim bdag mi pham sde]
Ajitasena

de nas tshong dpon gyi bu nor bzang mthar gyis grong khyer ri kyi gnas gang na ba der song ste/ khyim bdag mi pham sde gang na ba der phyin nas khyim bdag mi pham sde'i rkang pa gnyis la spyi bos phyag 'tshal te mdun du 'dug nas thal mo sbyar te 'di skad ces smras so/ /'phags pa/ bdag gis bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed na/ ji ltar byang chub sems dpas byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa la bslab par bgyi ba dang / ji ltar nan tan du bgyi ba ma 'tshal te/ 'phags pa ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams la gdams ngag dang / rjes su bstan pa mdzad do/ /zhes bdag gis thos na/ ji ltar byang chub sems dpas byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa la bslab par bgyi ba dang / ji ltar nan tan du bgyi ba bdag la bka' stsal du gsol;

Then Sudhana made his way to the city of Roruka, where he called on the householder Ajitasena. Paying his respects, Sudhana said, “Noble one, I have set my mind on supreme perfect enlightenment, but I do not know how an enlightening being is to learn and carry out the practice of enlightening beings. I hear you give enlightening beings instruction, so please tell me how to learn and practice.”

smras pa/ rigs kyi bu/ kho bos ni/ byang chub sems dpa'i rnam par thar pa mi zad pa'i mtshan nyid ces bya ba thob ste/ de thob pas ni/ sangs rgyas mi zad pa mthong ba'i gter rab tu thob par 'gyur ro/ /song rigs kyi bu/ lho phyogs kyi rgyud 'di nyid kyi chos kyi yul gru na bram ze zhi 'dzin mchog ces bya ba 'dug gi /de'i gan du song la ji ltar byang chub sems dpas byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa la bslab par bya ba dang / ji ltar nan tan du bya ba dris shig /

Ajitasena said, “I have attained an enlightening liberation called inexhaustible appearance, with the attainment of which I obtained an inexhaustible treasury of vision of buddhas. South of here is a village called Dharma, where there lives a brahmin named Shivaragra. Go ask him how an enlightening being is to learn and carry out the practice of enlightening beings.”

de nas tshong dpon gyi bu nor bzang gis khyim bdag mi pham sde'i rkang pa gnyis la spyi bos phyag 'tshal te/ khyim bdag mi pham sde la lan brgya stong du mar g.yas phyogs su bskor ba byas nas yang dang yang bltas te khyim bdag mi pham sde'i drung nas song ngo/ /
So then Sudhana paid his respects again and left.
[bram ze zhi 'dzin mchog]
Shivaragra

de nas tshong dpon gyi bu nor bzang mthar gyis chos kyi yul grur song nas bram ze zhi 'dzin mchog gang na ba der phyin te/ bram ze zhi 'dzin mchog gi rkang pa gnyis la spyi bos phyag 'tshal te mdun du 'dug nas thal mo sbyar te 'di skad ces smras so/ / 'phags pa/ bdag gis bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed na/ ji ltar byang chub sems dpas byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa la bslab par bgyi ba dang / ji ltar nan tan du bgyi ba ma 'tshal te/ 'phags pa ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams la gdams ngag dang / rjes su bstan pa mdzad do/ /zhes bdag gis thos na; ji ltar byang chub sems dpas byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa la bslab par bgyi ba dang / ji ltar nan tan du bgyi ba 'phags pas bdag la bka' stsal du gsol/

Then Sudhana made his way to Dharma village and called on the brahmin Shivaragra. Paying his respects, he said, “Noble one, I have set my mind on supreme perfect enlightenment, but I do not know how an enlightening being is to learn and carry out the practice of enlightening beings. I hear you give enlightening beings instruction, so please tell me how to learn and carry out the practice of enlightening beings.”

des smras pa/ rigs kyi bu/ kho bo ni/ bden pa'i byin gyi rlabs kyis spyod pa ste/ bden pa'i tshig gang gis dus gsum du byang chub sems dpa' gang yang bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub las phyir mi ldog /ldog par mi 'gyur zhe na/ bden pa'i tshig gi byin gyi rlabs des bdag gi dgos pa 'di dang 'di zhig grub par shog cig /ces byas na yang des kho bo'i bsam pa thams cad de bzhin du 'grub bo/ /rigs kyi bu/ kho bo ni/ bden pa'i byin gyi rlabs de lta bus dgos pa thams cad sgrub ste; rigs kyi bu/ kho bos bden pa'i byin gyi rlabs 'di shes par zad na/ kho bos byang chub sems dpa' bden pa'i rjes su 'brang ba'i tshig rab tu thob pa rnams kyi spyod pa shes pa'am/ yon tan brjod par nus re skan/

Shivaragra said, “I act on a vow of truth, that as by truth, by speaking truth, there has never been, is not now, and never will be, a single enlightening being who has turned away from supreme perfect enlightenment, who is turning away, or who will turn away, by that vow of truthful speech this work of mine may succeed. So whatever I wish comes to fruition. By this vow of truth, I accomplish all my tasks. It is this vow of truth that I know. How can I know the practice or tell the virtues of the enlightening beings whose words and deeds mutually accord in truth?

song rigs kyi bu/ lho phyogs kyi rgyud 'di nyid na grong khyer yid bzang po'i sgo zhes bya ba yod de; de na khye'u dpal 'byung ba zhes bya ba dang / bu mo dpal gyi blo gros ma zhes bya ba gnyis shig 'khod kyi/ de'i gan du song la ji ltar byang chub sems dpas byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa la bslab par bya ba dang / ji ltar nan tan du bya ba dris shig/

“South of here is a city called Sumanamukha, where there live a boy named Shrisambhava and a girl named Shrimati. Go ask them how an enlightening being is to learn and carry out the practice of enlightening beings.”

de nas tshong dpon gyi bu nor bzang gis chos kyi rim gro cher bskyed de bram ze zhi 'dzin mchog gi rkang pa gnyis la spyi bos phyag byas nas bram ze zhi 'dzin mchog la lan brgya stong du mar g.yas phyogs su bskor ba byas te yang dang yang bltas nas bram ze gzhi 'dzin mchog gi drung nas song ngo/ /
Then, with great reverence for the Teaching, Sudhana paid his respects to the brahmin Shivaragra and left.

fuse.drop: [khye'u dpal 'byung ba dang / bu mo dpal gyi blo gros ma]
Shrisambhava and Shrimati

de nas tshong dpon gyi bu nor bzang mthar gyis grong khyer yid bzang po'i sgor song ste/ khye'u dpal 'byung ba dang / bu mo dpal gyi blo gros ma gang na ba der song nas de gnyis kyi rkang pa la spyi bos phyag 'tshal te mdun du 'dug nas thal mo sbyar te 'di skad ces smras so/ /'phags pa; bdag gis bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed na/ ji ltar byang chub sems dpas byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa la bslab par bgyi ba dang / ji ltar nan tan du bgyi ba ma 'tshal te/ 'phags pa dag ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams la gdams ngag dang / rjes su bstan pa mdzad do/ /zhes bdag gis thos na/ ji ltar byang chub sems dpas byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa la bslab par bgyi ba dang / ji ltar nan tan du bgyi ba 'phags pa dag gis bdag la bka' stsal du gsol/

Then Sudhana went to the city of Sumanamukha, and there he called on the boy Shrisambhava and the girl Shrimati; paying his respects to them, he said, “Noble ones, I have set my mind on supreme perfect enlightenment, but I do not know how an enlightening being is to learn and carry out the practice of enlightening beings. I hear you give enlightening beings instruction, so please tell me how to learn and carry out the practice of enlightening beings.”
