de nas khye'u dpal 'byung ba dang / bu mo dpal gyi blo gros mas tshong dpon gyi bu nor bzang la 'di skad ces smras so/ /rigs kyi bu/ bdag cag gnyis kyis ni/ byang chub sems dpa'i rnam par thar pa sgyu ma'i rnam pa zhes bya ba thob ste/ mngon du byas so/ /rigs kyi bu/ de ltar kho bo cag rnam par thar pa 'di dang ldan pas 'jig rten thams cad sgyu ma'i rnam par rgyu rkyen sgyu ma las byung bar mthong ngo/ /las dang nyon mongs pa sgyu mar shes pas sems can thams cad kyang sgyu ma'i rnam par shes so/ /ma rig pa dang / srid pa dang / sred pa'i rgyu las byung bas 'gro ba thams cad kyang sgyu ma'i rnam par mthong ngo/ /phan tshun gyi rkyen gyi rgyu las byung bas chos thams cad kyang sgyu ma'i rnam par mthong ngo/ /phyin ci log gi rgyu las byung bas khams gsum thams cad kyang sgyu ma'i rnam par mthong ngo/ /yang dag pa ma yin pa'i rtog pa'i rgyus bskyed pas sems can thams cad kyi 'chi 'pho dang / 'byung ba dang / skye ba dang / rga shi dang / mya ngan dang / smre sngags 'don pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / yid mi bde ba dang 'khrug pa rnams kyang sgyu ma'i rnam par mthong ngo/ /'du shes dang / sems dang / lta ba phyin ci log gi rgyu las dngos po med pa'i 'du shes kyis rmongs te byung bas zhing thams cad kyang sgyu ma'i rnam par mthong ngo/ /ye shes kyi spong ba'i rgyu la brtags te bskyed pas nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas thams cad kyang sgyu ma'i rnam par mthong ngo/ /sgyu mar mngon par bsgrubs pa las grub ste/ sprul pa'i spyod pa dang / 'dul ba sgyu ma'i rang bzhin pas byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa dang / smon lam gyis yongs su smin par bya ba dang / gdul ba gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pa yang sgyu ma'i rnam pa lta bur shes so/ /smon lam dang / ye shes sgyu mas mngon par bsgrubs te; yul bsam gyis mi khyab pa bsgyu ma'i rang bzhin yin pas sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyi dkyil 'khor kyang sgyu mar mthong ngo/ /

They said to him, “We have attained and experienced an enlightening liberation called ‘illusory.’ Having realized this liberation, we see all worlds as illusory, being produced by the illusion of causes and conditions. We know all beings are illusory, by knowledge of the illusion of afflictions in action. We see all worldlings as illusory, born of the illusion of ignorant craving for existence. We see all phenomena as illusory, arisen from the illusion of mutual conditioning. We see the whole triple world as illusory, produced by the illusion of misunderstanding. We see all sentient beings, afflicted by birth, old age, death, grief, lament, suffering, and sorrow, as illusory, born of the illusion of untrue ideas. We see all lands as born of illusion, produced by the delusion of ideas of substance of existence in the illusions wrongly seen by the conceiving mind. We see all hearers and individual illuminates as illusory, born of illusory thoughts of knowledge and effort. We know the succession of all enlightening beings’ practices, vows, and developmental guidance of sentient beings as illusory, being essentially illusions of action and teaching created from illusion. We see the circle of all buddhas and enlightening beings as illusory, being essentially illusions of the inconceivable realm, produced by the illusions of vows and knowledge.

rigs kyi bu; bdag cag gnyis kyis ni/ byang chub sems dpa'i rnam par thar pa sgyu ma'i rang bzhin 'di shes par zad na/ kho bo cag gis byang chub sems dpa' las sgyu ma mtha' yas pas rnam par sgrub pa'i dra ba khong du chud pa rnams kyi spyod pa shes pa'am/ yon tan brjod par nus re skan/

“We know this enlightening liberation of illusoriness. How can we know the practice or tell of the virtues of the enlightening beings who follow the extensive network of the endless illusion of action?”

de nas khye'u dpal 'byung pa dang / bu mo dpal gyi blo gros mas tshong dpon gyi bu nor bzang dge ba'i rtsa ba'i shugs drag po bsam gyis mi khyab pas mngon par brlan nas rang gi rnam par thar pa'i yul bstan te 'di skad ces smras so; ;song rigs kyi bu/ lho phyogs kyi rgyud 'di nyid kyi phyogs kyi sgo'i gnas rgya mtsho'i 'gram zhes bya ba de na bza' shing gi ra ba rgya chen po zhes bya ba yod de de'i nang na khang pa brtsegs pa chen po rnam par snang mdzad kyi rgyan gyis brgyan pa'i snying po zhes bya ba/ byang chub sems dpa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba rnam par smin pa las mngon par grub pa/ byang chub sems dpa'i sems dang yid la bya ba las byung ba/ byang chub sems dpa'i smon lam las mngon par skyes pa/ byang chub sems dpa'i dbang las byung ba; byang chub sems dpa'i mngon par shes pa'i ye shes kyi stobs kyis sprul pa/ byang chub sems dpa'i thabs mkhas pa las byung ba/ byang chub sems dpa'i bsod nams dang ye shes kyi stobs kyis rdzogs pa/ byang chub sems dpa'i snying rje chen pos sems can rnam par gdul ba'i don du bstan pa/ byang chub sems dpa'i byin gyi rlabs rnam par phye bas bsgru bas pa/ byang chub sems dpa'i rnam par thar pa bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i gnas la 'jug pa'i rgyan gyis brgyan pa yod de/ de na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po byams pa zhes bya ba/ skye ba'i sa la gnas pa'i mi rnams rjes su gzung ba dang / pha dang / ma dang / gnyen du gyur pa rnams yongs su smin par bya ba dang / der skyes pa'i byang chub sems dpa' skal pa mnyam pa rnams kyi theg pa chen po rab tu bstan par bya ba dang / de ma yin pa'i sems can gzhan rnams kyang gar 'os pa'i sar dge ba'i rtsa bas yongs su smin par bya ba dang / rang gi rnam par thar pa'i tshul la 'jug par bya ba yongs su bstan pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i skye ba la dbang sgyur ba thams cad kyi rjes su song ba rab tu brjod pa dang / sems can thams cad kyi skye ba yongs su bstan pa la mngon par gzhol bar bya bas sems can yongs su smin par bya ba mi gtang ba dang / 'gro ba thams cad yongs su gzung ba mi smad pas byang chub sems dpa'i snying rje chen po'i stobs bstan par bya ba dang / byang chub sems dpa'i gnas gzhi rten thams cad las gyen du 'phags pa khong du chud par bya ba dang / gnas med pa la gzhol bar srid par skye ba thams cad na gnas pa yongs su bstan pa'i don du 'dug gi/ de'i gan du song la ji ltar byang chub sems dpas byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa yongs su dri ba dang / ji ltar byang chub sems dpa'i lam yongs su dag par bya ba dang / ji ltar byang chub sems dpas byang chub sems dpa'i bslab pa la nan tan du bya ba dang / ji ltar byang chub sems dpas byang chub kyi sems yongs su sbyang bar bya ba dang / ji ltar byang chub sems dpas byang chub sems dpa'i smon lam mngon par bsgrub par bya ba dang / ji ltar byang chub sems dpas byang chub sems dpa'i tshogs yongs su gsog par bya ba dang / ji ltar byang chub sems dpas byang chub sems dpa'i sa yongs su gnon par bya ba dang / ji ltar byang chub sems dpas byang chub sems dpa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par bya ba dang / ji ltar byang chub sems dpas byang chub sems dpa'i bzod pa la 'jug par bya ba dang / ji ltar byang chub sems dpas byang chub sems dpa'i nan tan gyi yon tan la gnas par bya ba dang / ji ltar byang chub sems dpas dge ba'i bshes gnyen bsnyen bkur bar bya ba dris shig/

Then the boy and girl, having showered Sudhana with an inconceivable stream of virtue and told him of their own range of liberation, said to him, “Go south, to a place called Samudrakaccha. There is a park called Great Array there, wherein there is a great tower called Chamber of Adornments of Vairocana, which has been produced by the maturation of roots of goodness of enlightening beings, originating from the thoughts of enlightening beings, arisen from the vows of enlightening beings, based on the masteries of enlightening beings, created by the power of mystic knowledge of enlightening beings, made of the skill in means of enlightening beings, completed by the power of virtue and knowledge of enlightening beings, showing enlightening beings’ great compassionate guidance of sentient beings, built of arrays of spiritual powers of enlightening beings, adorned by the states of inconceivable liberation of enlightening beings. There an enlightening being, a great being named Maitreya, lives for the purpose of benefiting the people of his native land, developing his parents and relatives to maturity, making those there who carry out the same practices firm in the Great Vehicle, to develop the roots of goodness of other beings according to their states, to show how to enter this liberation, to cultivate the power of an enlightening being to be born anywhere and travel about, appearing in all states of being, to perfect those beings, to develop the power of universal compassion of enlightening beings in the desire to benefit all beings, to become aware of the state of enlightening beings, which is detached from all abodes and locations, and to appear to live in all states of existence while being ultimately unattached.
“Go to Maitreya and ask how an enlightening being is to seek the practices of enlightening beings, clarify the path of enlightening beings, carry out the studies of enlightening beings, purify the aspiration for enlightenment, accomplish the vows of enlightening beings, establish the provisions of enlightening beings, enter the stages of enlightening beings, fulfill the transcendent ways of enlightening beings, persist in the tolerances of enlightening beings, stabilize the qualities of achievement of enlightening beings, and attend spiritual benefactors.

de ci'i phyir zhe na/ rigs kyi bu/ byang chub sems dpa' byams pa zhes bya ba de ni/ byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa thams cad la zhugs pa'o/ /de ni/ sems can thams cad kyi sems dang / bsam pa rtogs par khong du chud pa'o/ /de ni/ sems can thams cad kyi spyod pa'i rjes su zhugs pa'o/ /de ni/ sems can thams cad yongs su smin par bya ba dang / gdul ba la mngon du gyur pa'o/ /des ni/ pha rol tu phyin pa thams cad yongs su rdzogs par byas pa'o/ /de ni/ byang chub sems dpa'i sa thams cad la rab tu gnas pa'o/ /des ni/ byang chub sems dpa'i bzod pa thams cad rab tu thob pa'o/ /de ni/ byang chub sems dpa'i skyon med par zhugs pa'o/ /des ni/ lung bstan pa thams cad yang dag par blangs pa'o/ /de ni/ byang chub sems dpa'i rnam par thar pa thams cad la rnam par rtse ba'o/ /des ni/ sangs rgyas kyi byin gyi rlabs thams cad yongs su blangs pa'o/ /de ni/ de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyis thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes kyi yul la dbang bskur bas mngon par dbang bskur ba'o/ /rigs kyi bu; dge ba'i bshes gnyen de khyod la dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad kyis ni/ mngon par brlan par byed do/ /byang chub tu sems bskyed pa ni/ rnam par 'phel bar byed do/ /lhag pa'i bsam pa'i dbyings ni/ rab tu ston par byed do/ /dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad ni/ shin tu byang bar byed do/ /byang chub sems dpa'i dbang po'i shugs ni; yang dag par 'phel bar byed do/ /chos kyi phyogs bsgribs pa med pa ni/ yongs su ston par byed do/ /gzhi kun tu zug pa'i sa khong du chud par bya ba ni/ rtogs par byed de; ;byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyi smon lam gyi sar 'byung ba'i sgo la ni/ gzhog par byed do/ /byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyi spyod pa dang / smon lam gyi yon tan yongs su 'grub pa ni/ yang dag par brjod par 'gyur ro/ /byang chub sems dpa' kun tu bzang po'i spyod pa thos par bya ba skye ba'i sgo ni/ yongs su ston par 'gyur gyi; rigs kyi bu/ khyod dag ba'i rtsa ba gcig la chags par ma byed cig/ chos kyi sgo'i 'od snang ba gcig la gzhol bar ma byed cig/ spyod pa gcig yongs su rdzogs pas chog par ma sems shig/ smon lam gcig pu mngon par sgrub pa lhur ma len cig/ lung bstan pa gcig gi mthar thug pas rgyun gcad par ma byed cig /bzod pa gsum la 'jug pas chog par bya ba'i 'du shes su ma byed cig/ pha rol tu phyin pa drug yongs su rdzogs par bya ba rgyun ma gcod cig/ sa bcu thob pas mthar thug par ma byed cig /sangs rgyas kyi zhing tshad yod pa yongs su gzung ba dang / yongs su dag par bya ba ma smon cig /dge ba'i bshes gnyen tshad yod pa dga' bar bya ba dang / bsnyen bkur bas ngoms par ma byed cig /

“Why? Because the enlightening being Maitreya has entered into all practices of enlightening beings; he has reached the goal of aspirations of all enlightening beings; he has comprehended the actions of all beings; he has confronted the developmental guidance of all beings; he has fulfilled all the transcendent ways; he has been through all the stages of enlightening beings; he has attained all the tolerances of enlightening beings; he has attained the certainty of enlightening beings; he has received all the predictions of buddhahood; he has roamed in all the liberations of enlightening beings; he has held the empowerments of all buddhas; he has been anointed by all buddhas with the consecration of the realm of omniscience. As a spiritual benefactor, he will nourish your roots of goodness, increase your determination for enlightenment, make your will firm, purify all your roots of goodness, increase the powers of your enlightening faculties, show you the realm of nonobstruction, bring you into conformity with the stage of universal goodness, introduce you to the means of carrying out all the vows of enlightening beings, describe to you the perfection of the virtues of the practical undertakings of all enlightening beings, and tell you about the practice of universal good.
“You should not develop just one virtue, nor concentrate on clarifying just one doctrine, nor be satisfied with just one practice, nor concentrate on carrying out just one vow, nor take up just one instruction, nor rest in completion, nor think of attaining the three tolerances as ultimate, nor rest upon fulfillment of the six transcendent ways, nor stop on attainment of the ten stages, nor vow to encompass and purify a finite buddha-land, nor be content with attendance on a limited number of spiritual benefactors.

de ci'i phyir zhe na/ rigs kyi bu/ byang chub sems dpas ni/ dge ba'i rtsa ba tshad med pa yongs su bsdu bar bya dgos so/ /byang chub sems dpa'i tshogs tshad med pa shin tu bsgrub dgos so/ /byang chub sems dpa'i sems kyi rgyu tshad med pa yongs su gsag dgos so/ /yongs su bsngo ba'i tshul tshad med pa bslab par bya ba dgos so/ /sems can gyi khams tshad med pa yongs su smin par bya dgos so/ /sems can gyi bsam pa'i khams tshad med pa la 'jug par bya dgos so/ /sems can gyi dbang po tshad med pa yongs su shes par bya dgos so/ /sems can gyi mos pa tshad med pa'i rjes su 'brang bar bya dgos so/ /sems can gyi spyod pa tshad med pa khong du chud par bya dgos so/ /sems can tshad med pa gdul bar bya dgos so/ /nyon mongs pa dang bag la nyal ba tshad med pa yang dag par gzhom dgos so/ /las kyi sgrib pa tshad med pa yongs su sbyang dgos so/ /lta ba'i rnam pa tshad med pa rnam par bzlog dgos so/ /sems can gyi kun nas nyon mongs pa tshad med pa gsal bar bya dgos so/ /sems rnam par dag pa tshad med pa bskyed par bya dgos so/ /sdug bsngal gyi zug rdu tshad med pa yang dag par dbyung dgos so/ /sred pa'i rgya mtsho tshad med pa yongs su bskam par bya dgos so/ /ma rig pa'i mun pa tshad med pa rnam par bsal dgos so// nga rgyal gyi ri tshad med pa rab tu bsnyil dgos so/ /'khor ba'i bcings pa tshad med pa shin tu gtub dgos so/ /srid pa'i chu bo tshad med pa brgal dgos so/ /tshe'i rgya mtsho tshad med pa bskam dgos so/ /sems can 'dod pa'i 'dam du thogs pa tshad med pa yongs su dgrol dgos so/ /sems can khams gsum gyi khyim du thogs pa tshad med pa gdon par bya dgos so/ /sems can tshad med pa 'phags pa'i lam la dgod dgos so/ /'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug gi spyod pa tshad med pa rab tu zhi bar bya dgos so/ /bdud kyi zhags pa tshad med pa las yang dag par 'das par bya dgos so/ /bdud kyi las tshad med pa rnam par bzlog dgos so/ /byang chub sems dpa'i lhag pa'i bsam pa'i khams tshad med pa yongs su sbyang dgos so/ /byang chub sems dpa'i sbyor ba tshad med pa rnam par 'phel bar bya dgos so/ / byang chub sems dpa'i dbang po tshad med pa yongs su bskyed dgos so/ /byang chub sems dpa'i mos pa tshad med pa yongs su sbyang dgos so/ / byang chub sems dpa'i mnyam pa nyid tshad med pa la 'jug par bya dgos so/ /byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa'i khyad par tshad med pa'i rjes su 'brang bar bya dgos so; ;byang chub sems dpa'i yon tan tshad med pa yongs su dag par bya dgos so/ /byang chub sems dpas bya ba'i spyod pa tshad med pa yongs su rdzogs par bya dgos so/ /'jig rten gyi spyod pa tshad med pa'i rjes su 'brang bar bya dgos so/ /'jig rten gyi rjes su 'brang ba tshad med pa yongs su bstan dgos so/ /dad pa'i stobs tshad med pa yongs su bskyed dgos so/ /brtson 'grus kyi stobs tshad med pa nye bar brtan dgos so/ /dran pa'i stobs tshad med pa yongs su dag par bya dgos so/ /ting nge 'dzin gyi stobs tshad med pa yongs su rdzogs par bya dgos so/ /shes rab kyi stobs tshad med pa bskyed par bya dgos so/ /mos pa'i stobs tshad med pa brtan par bya dgos so/ /bsod nams kyi stobs tshad med pa yang dag par bsgrul dgos so/ /ye shes kyi stobs tshad med pa rnam par spel dgos so/ / byang chub sems dpa'i stobs tshad med pa yang dag par bsgrub dgos so/ /sangs rgyas kyi stobs tshad med pa yongs su rdzogs par bya dgos so/ /chos kyi sgo tshad med pa rab tu dbye dgos so/ /chos kyi phyogs tshad med pa la 'jug par bya dgos so/ /chos kyi sgo tshad med pa yongs su sbyang dgos so/ /chos kyi snang ba tshad med pa yang dag par bskyed dgos so/ /chos kyi gsal ba tshad med pa rab tu dgos so/ /dbang po'i rgyud tshad med pa snang bar bya dgos so/ /nyon mongs pa'i nad tshad med pa yongs su shes par bya dgos so/ /chos kyi sman tshad med pa yang dag par bsdu dgos so/ /nyon mongs pa'i nad kyis btab pa'i sems can gyi khams tshad med pa gso dgos so// bdud rtsi'i tshogs tshad med pa yang dag par bsdu bar bya dgos so/ /sangs rgyas kyi zhing yang tshad med pa 'da' bar bya dgos so/ /de bzhin gshegs pa tshad med pa mchod dgos so/ /byang chub sems dpa'i 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor tshad med par 'jug par bya dgos so/ /de bzhin gshegs pa'i bstan pa tshad med pa yongs su gzung dgos so/ /sems can gyi gnod pa tshad med pa bzod par bya dgos so/ /mi khom pa dang / ngan song gi lam tshad med pa yongs su gcad dgos so/ /sems can gyi bde ba tshad med pa nye bar bsgrub dgos so/ /sems can bsdu ba tshad med pa bya dgos so/ /gzungs kyi sgo tshad med pa yongs su sbyang dgos so/ /smon lam gyi sgo tshad med pa mngon par bsgrub pa dgos so/ /byams pa chen po dang / snying rje chen po'i stobs tshad med pa yongs su bsgom dgos so/ / chos yongs su btsal ba la brtson par bya ba tshad med pa brgyun mi gcad par bya dgos so/ /nges par rtogs pa'i stobs tshad med pa'i rjes su 'jug dgos so/ /mngon par shes pa mngon du sgrub pa tshad med pa bskyed dgos so/ /rig pa dang / ye shes kyi snang ba tshad med pa rnam par dag par bya dgos so/ /sems can gyi rgyud tshad med pa'i rjes su 'gro bar bya dgos so/ /srid par skye ba tshad med pa yongs su gzung dgos so/ /lus rnam par phyi ba tshad med pa yongs su bstan dgos so/ / skad rnam par phye ba tshad med pa yongs su shes par bya dgos so/ /sems can gyi sems rnam pa tha dad pa tshad med pa khong du chud par bya dgos so/ /byang chub sems dpa'i spyod yul rgya chen po'i rjes su 'jug par bya dgos so/ /byang chub sems dpa'i gnas shin tu yangs par rjes su spyad dgos so/ /byang chub sems dpa'i rnam par spyod pa zab mo la rnam par blta dgos so/ /byang chub sems dpa'i yul rtogs par dka' ba khong du chud par bya dgos so/ /byang chub sems dpa'i lam bgrod par dka' ba bgrod par bya dgos so/ /byang chub sems dpa'i shugs sgrub par dka' ba yongs su gzung dgos so/ /byang chub sems dpa'i skyon med par 'jug par dka' ba la 'jug par bya dgos so/ /byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa rnam pa sna tshogs khong du chud par bya dgos so/ /byang chub sems dpa'i rnam par 'phrul pa thams cad du khyab pa kun tu bstan dgos so/ /byang chub sems dpa'i chos kyi sprin yongs su gzung dgos so/ /byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa'i dra ba mtha' dang dbus med pa rab tu rgyas par bya dgos so/ /byang chub sems dpas pha rol tu phyin pa thams cad yongs su rdzogs par bya dgos so/ /byang chub sems dpas lung bstan pa tshad med pa yang dag par mnod dgos so/ /byang chub sems dpas bzod pa'i sgo dpag tu med pa la 'jug par bya dgos so/ /byang chub sems dpas sa grangs med pa yongs su sbyang dgos so/ /byang chub sems dpas chos kyi sgo dpag tu med pa yongs su dag par bya dgos so/ /byang chub sems dpas sangs rgyas kyi zhing brjod du med pa yongs su sbyang dgos so/ /byang chub sems dpas bskal pa mtha' yas par go cha bgo dgos so/ /byang chub sems dpas de bzhin gshegs pa dpag tu med pa mchod par bya dgos so/ /byang chub sems dpas smon lam mngon par sgrub pa bsam gyis mi khyab pa mngon par bsgrub dgos so; ;

“Why? Because an enlightening being should gather infinite roots of goodness, assemble infinite provisions for enlightenment, produce infinite bases of aspiration for enlightenment, learn infinite principles, extinguish the afflictions of infinite beings, penetrate the minds of infinite beings, know the faculties of infinite beings, work for the emancipation of infinite beings, be aware of the conduct of infinite beings, create guidance for infinite beings, destroy infinite afflictions and their consequences, clear away infinite obstacles caused by actions, put a stop to infinite views, remove infinite mental afflictions, produce infinite mental purities, destroy infinite miseries, evaporate infinite oceans of beings’ cravings, dispel infinite ignorance, bring down infinite mountains of pride, remove infinite bonds of the mundane whirl, evaporate the infinite ocean of birth, cross over infinite torrents of existence, extricate infinite beings stuck in the mud of desire, emancipate infinite beings from the dungeon of the triple world, place infinite beings on the path of sages, extinguish infinite lust, hatred, and delusion, rise above infinite nets of demons, purify infinite will of enlightening beings, increase infinite effort of enlightening beings, produce infinite faculties of enlightening beings, purify infinite resolutions of enlightening beings, enter infinite equanimity of enlightening beings, pursue infinite practices of enlightening beings in their entirety, purify infinite qualities of enlightening beings, fulfill infinite practices of enlightening beings, accord with infinite worldly practices, show infinite adaptations to the world, produce infinite power of faith, stabilize infinite power of vigor, clarify infinite power of mindfulness, purify infinite power of concentration, arouse infinite power of wisdom, stabilize infinite power of resolution, produce infinite power of virtue, expand infinite power of knowledge, establish infinite power of enlightening beings, fulfill infinite power of buddhas, ascertain infinite ways to truth, enter infinite realms of truth, clarify infinite doors to truth, produce infinite lights of truth, create infinite perspectives on truth, illumine infinite groups of faculties, clear away infinite afflictions, collect infinite spiritual medicines, cure sentient beings of infinite sicknesses caused by afflictions, collect infinite stores of immortality elixir, enter infinite buddha-lands, honor infinite buddhas, enter infinite assemblies of enlightening beings, remember infinite instructions of buddhas, endure infinite maliciousness from sentient beings, cut off infinite paths of misfortune, give infinite happiness to sentient beings, create infinite benefit for sentient beings, purify infinite methods of mental command, carry out infinite vows, cultivate infinite powers of universal love and compassion, persist in infinite endeavors in search of truth, pursue infinite powers of meditation, develop infinite mystic knowledge, purify infinite lights of knowledge, go the ways of infinite beings, encompass infinite becoming, appear in infinite different forms, know infinite different languages, comprehend infinite differences in the minds of beings, enter the vast realm of action of enlightening beings, live in the vast palace of enlightening beings, observe the profound state of enlightening beings, awaken to the mysterious realm of enlightening beings, reach the difficult goal of enlightening beings, sustain the hard-to-attain energy of enlightening beings, enter the difficult-of-access certainty of enlightening beings, be aware of the varied practice of enlightening beings, show the ubiquitous miracle of enlightening beings, receive the united multitudes of teachings, spread the infinitely varied network of practices of enlightening beings, fulfill the endless ways of transcendence, receive infinite directions for the future, enter countless doors of tolerance, purify countless stages of enlightenment, purify innumerable ways of access to truth, purify untold buddha-lands, put on spiritual armor for endless eons, serve infinite buddhas, accomplish the undertakings of inconceivable vows.

rigs kyi bu/ mdor na/ sems can thams cad yongs su smin par byed pas byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi spyod pa ni/ sems can thams cad dang mnyam par bstan to/ /bskal pa thams cad du gnas pas bskal pa thams cad mnyam par bstan to/ /thams cad du skye ba yongs su bstan pas skye ba thams cad dang mnyam par bstan to/ /dus gsum gyi ye shes khong du chud par bya ba'i phyir dus thams cad dang mnyam par bstan to/ /chos thams cad la nan tan du byed pas chos thams cad dang mnyam par bstan to/ /zhing thams cad yongs su dag par byed pas zhing thams cad dang mnyam par bstan to/ /smon lam thams cad yongs su rdzogs par byed pas smon lam thams cad dang mnyam par bstan to/ /sangs rgyas thams cad mchod pa mngon par sgrub pas sangs rgyas thams cad dang mnyam par bstan to// byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyi smon lam dang gcig tu 'gyur ba'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' thams cad dang mnyam par bstan to/ /dge ba'i bshes gnyen thams cad la bsnyen bkur byed pa'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi spyod pa ni/ dge ba'i bshes gnyen thams cad dang mnyam par bstan to/ /

“In short, the practice of enlightening beings is to perfect all sentient beings, to live in all ages, to manifest birth everywhere in all conditions, to awaken to knowledge of all times past, present, and future, to practice all truths, to purify all lands, to fulfill all vows, to provide for all buddhas, to be one with all enlightening beings in aim, to attain rapport with all spiritual friends.

rigs kyi bu/ de bas na/ khyod kyis dge ba'i bshes gnyen yongs su btsal pa la skyo bar mi bya'o/ /dge ba'i bshes gnyen mthong bas ngoms pa bskyed par mi bya'o/ /dge ba'i bshes gnyen la yongs su dri bas chog shes par mi bya'o/ /dge ba'i bshes gnyen dang 'grogs pa las bsam pa phyir ldog par mi bya'o/ /dge ba'i bshes gnyen la phu dud dang / rim gro sbyor ba rgyun gcad par mi bya'o/ /dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyi gdams ngag dang / rjes su bstan pa log par gzung bar mi bya'o/ /dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyi yon tan thob par 'gyur ba la the tshom mi bskyed do/ /dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyis 'byung ba'i sgo bstan pa la yid gnyis su mi bya'o/ /dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyi thabs kyi bsam pa dang / 'jig rten gyi rjes su 'brang bar bya ba'i rgyud la zhe sdang bskyed par mi bya'o/ /dge ba'i bshes gnyen la mos pa rnam par bskyed pas lus dang / sems rnam par ldog par mi bya'o/ /

“Therefore you should not tire of seeking spiritual friends and benefactors, should not weary of meeting spiritual friends and benefactors, should not become complacent about questioning spiritual friends and benefactors, should not give up the determination to contact spiritual friends and benefactors, should not cease striving to respectfully attend spiritual friends and benefactors, should not misconstrue or resist the advice or instruction of spiritual friends and benefactors, should not be irresolute in acquiring the qualities of spiritual friends and benefactors, should not doubt the ways of emancipation shown by spiritual friends and benefactors, should not malign the acts of spiritual friends and benefactors adapting to the world to expedite their work, should not give up increasing pure faith in spiritual friends and benefactors.

de ci'i phyir zhe na/ rigs kyi bu/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa thams cad thos pa ni/ dge ba'i bshes gnyen la rag las pa'o/ /byang chub sems dpa'i yon tan yongs su rdzogs par bya ba thams cad ni/ dge ba'i bshes gnyen las byung ba'o; ;byang chub sems dpa'i smon lam gyi rgyun thams cad ni/ dge ba'i bshes gnyen las byung ba'o/ /byang chub sems dpa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad ni/ dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyis bskyed pa'o/ /byang chub sems dpa'i tshogs thams cad ni/ dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyis bsgrubs pa'o/ /byang chub sems dpa'i chos kyi sgo snang ba thams cad ni/ dge ba'i bshes gnyen las byung ba'o/ /byang chub sems dpa'i 'byung ba'i sgo rnam par dag pa thams cad ni/ dge ba'i bshes gnyen las byung ba'o/ /byang chub sems dpa'i bslab pa la nan tan du bya ba thams cad ni/ dge ba'i bshes gnyen la rag las pa'o/ /byang chub sems dpa'i yon tan gyi chos thams cad ni/ dge ba'i bshes gnyen la gnas pa'o/ /byang chub sems dpa'i lhag pa'i bsam pa yongs su dag pa thams cad ni/ dge ba'i bshes gnyen rtsa bar gyur pa'o/ /byang chub sems dpa'i sems bskyed pa brtan pa thams cad ni/ dge ba'i bshes gnyen las skyes pa'o/ /byang chub sems dpa' gzungs dang / spobs pa'i sgo snang ba thams cad du khrid pa ni/ dge ba'i bshes gnyen no/ /byang chub sems dpa'i rnam par dag pa'i sgo'i mdzod thams cad ni/ dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyis yongs su bzung ba'o/ /byang chub sems dpa'i ye shes snang ba thams cad ni/ dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyis yang dag par bskyed pa'o/ /byang chub sems dpa'i smon lam khyad par can thams cad ni/ dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyi lag na 'dug pa'o/ /byang chub sems dpa'i smon lam gyi tshul rgyud gcig tu gyur pa thams cad ni/ dge ba'i bshes gnyen la brten pa'o/ /byang chub sems dpa'i yang dag par sgrub pa khyad par can mnyam pa thams cad ni/ dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyi rgyud las byung ba'o/ /byang chub sems dpa'i gsang ba'i gnas thams cad ni/ dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyi mdzod na 'dug pa'o/ /byang chub sems dpa'i chos thams cad ni; dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyi 'byung gnas nas byung ba'o/ /byang chub sems dpa'i dbang po'i shugs kyi myu gu thams cad ni/ dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyis rnam par spel pa'o/ /byang chub sems dpa'i ye shes rgya mtsho thams cad ni/ dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyis yang dag par spel ba'o/ /byang chub sems dpa'i gter gyi mdzod thams cad ni/ dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyis yongs su bskyangs pa'o/ /byang chub sems dpa'i bsod nams bsags pa thams cad ni/ dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyis bsrungs pa'o/ /byang chub sems dpa'i tshe rnam par dag pa thams cad ni/ dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyis bskyed pa'o/ /byang chub sems dpa'i chos mnyan pa'i sprin thams cad ni/ dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyi kha nas byung ba'o/ /byang chub sems dpa'i 'byung ba'i lam la 'jug pa thams cad ni/ dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyi khong na yod pa'o/ /sangs rgyas thams cad kyi byang chub ni/ dge ba'i bshes gnyen la rim gror byas pas thob pa'o/ /byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa thams cad ni/ dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyis yongs su bzung ba'o/ /byang chub sems dpa'i yon tan brjod pa thams cad ni/ dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyis bstan pa'o; ;byang chub sems dpa'i chos kyi phyogs kyi rjes su 'brang ba thams cad ni/ dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyis yongs su bstan pa'o/ /byang chub sems dpa'i sems dang lhag pa'i bsam pa'i bdag nyid che ba ni/ dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyis yang dag par brjod pa'o/ /byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi byams pa chen po'i stobs ni; dge ba'i bshes gnyen las byung ba'o/ /byang chub sems dpa'i rnams kyi snying rje chen po'i stobs ni/ dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyis bskyed pa'o/ /byang chub sems dpa'i dbang thams cad ni/ dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyis yongs su bzung ba'o/ /byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi yan lag thams cad ni/ dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyis bskyed pa'o/ /byang chub sems dpa'i phan pa nye bar sgrub pa thams cad ni/ dge ba'i bshes gnyen las byung ba'o/ /

“What is the reason for this? It is from spiritual benefactors that enlightening beings learn the practice of enlightening beings; it is through spiritual benefactors that all enlightening beings’ virtues are perfected; spiritual benefactors are the source of the streams of all enlightening beings’ vows; the roots of goodness of all enlightening beings are produced by spiritual benefactors; the provisions for enlightenment are produced by spiritual benefactors; all enlightening beings’ perceptions of truth derive from spiritual benefactors; the purification of all ways to enlightenment derives from spiritual benefactors; the accomplishment of all studies of enlightening beings depends on spiritual benefactors; the virtuous qualities of all enlightening beings are based on spiritual benefactors; the purification of all enlightening beings’ wills is rooted in spiritual benefactors; the steadfastness of determination of all enlightening beings is born of spiritual benefactors; the light of the oceanic mental command and intelligence of all enlightening beings derives from the guidance of spiritual benefactors; the treasuries of ways of purification of enlightening beings are sustained by spiritual benefactors; the lights of knowledge of all enlightening beings are generated by spiritual benefactors; the excellence of vows of all enlightening beings is in the hands of spiritual benefactors; single-mindedness is led by spiritual benefactors; the faith characteristic of the attainment of all enlightening beings has its source in spiritual benefactors; the secrets of all enlightening beings are in the treasury of spiritual benefactors; spiritual benefactors are mines of principles of enlightening beings; the sprouts of power of the faculties of all enlightening beings are fostered by spiritual benefactors; the oceans of knowledge of all enlightening beings are expounded by spiritual benefactors; the treasuries of all enlightening beings are guarded by spiritual benefactors; the accumulations of virtues of all enlightening beings are protected by spiritual benefactors; the purities of life of all enlightening beings are generated by spiritual benefactors; the multitude of teachings for all enlightening beings come from spiritual benefactors; the entries into the paths of emancipation of all enlightening beings are in the keeping of spiritual benefactors; the enlightenment of all buddhas is attained by association with spiritual benefactors; the practice of all enlightening beings is governed by spiritual benefactors; the developments of virtues of all enlightening beings are illumined by spiritual benefactors; the directions followed by all enlightening beings are shown by spiritual benefactors; the greatness of will of all enlightening beings is described by spiritual benefactors; the power of universal love of enlightening beings derives from spiritual benefactors; the power of universal compassion of enlightening beings is generated by spiritual friends; the masteries of all enlightening beings are governed by spiritual benefactors; all elements of enlightenment are produced by spiritual benefactors; the charitable works of all enlightening beings originate from spiritual friends.

rigs kyi bu/ dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyis yang dag par zin pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni/ ngan song du mi ltung ngo/ /dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyis yongs su bzung ba'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni/ theg pa chen po las mi ldog go /dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyis yongs su bsam pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni/ byang chub sems dpa'i bslab pa dang 'gal bar mi byed do/ /dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyis shin tu bsrungs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni/ sdig pa'i grogs pa'i lag tu mi 'dong ngo/ /dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyis yongs su bskyangs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni/ byang chub sems dpa'i chos las nyams par mi 'gyur ro/ /dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyis yang dag par zin pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni/ so so skye bo'i sa las yongs su 'da'o/ /dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyis yongs su bsrungs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni/ nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi skyon med par mi 'jug go /dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyis bskyangs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni/ 'jig rten las mngon par 'phags pa yin no/ /dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyis yang dag par bskyed pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni/ 'jig rten gyi chos kyis mi gos pa yin no/ /dge ba'i bshes gnyen bsnyen bkur ba'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni/ spyod pa thams cad la mi 'khrul bar spyod pa yin no; ;dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyis bsgrubs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni/ brtsams pa thams cad las phyir mi ldog go /dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyis yongs su bzung ba'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni/ las dang / nyon mongs pas thub par dka' ba yin no/ /dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyi stobs kyis bstan pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni/ bdud thams cad kyis mi thub pa yin no/ /dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyi rten la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni/ byang chub kyi yan lag thams cad kyis rnam par 'phel lo/ /

“Sustained by spiritual benefactors, enlightening beings do not fall into bad ways; supported by spiritual benefactors, enlightening beings do not fall away from the Great Vehicle; minded by spiritual benefactors, enlightening beings do not overstep the precepts of enlightening beings; guarded by spiritual benefactors, enlightening beings do not come under the sway of bad influences; protected by spiritual benefactors, enlightening beings do not deviate from the laws of enlightening beings; aided by spiritual benefactors, enlightening beings go beyond the stage of sentient beings; taught by spiritual benefactors, enlightening beings do not drop into the fall of those who seek individual liberation alone; hidden by spiritual benefactors, enlightening beings rise above the world; developed by spiritual benefactors, enlightening beings are unstained by mundane things; attended by spiritual benefactors, enlightening beings become heedful and alert in all their practices; roused by spiritual benefactors, enlightening beings do not give up their undertakings; assisted by spiritual benefactors, enlightening being become invulnerable to active afflictions; based on the power of spiritual benefactors, enlightening beings cannot be crushed by any demons; in association with spiritual benefactors, enlightening beings develop all the elements of enlightenment.

de ci'i phyir zhe na/ rigs kyi bu/ dge ba'i bshes gnyen ni/ sgrib par gyur pa'i chos thams cad las rnam par sbyang ba'o/ /dge ba'i bshes gnyen ni/ sdig to las rnam par bzlog pa'o/ /dge ba'i bshes gnyen ni/ mi bya ba rnams khong du chud par byed pa'o/ /bag med pa'i gnas las yang dag par zlog pa'o/ /ma rig pa'i mun pa rnam par sel ba'o/ /lta ba'i 'ching ba thub pa'o/ /'khor ba'i grong khyer nas 'don pa'o/ /'jig rten gyi gnas 'dor bar byed pa'o/ /bdud kyi zhags pa las thar par byed pa'o/ /sdug bsngal gyi zug rngu 'byin pa'o/ /mi shes pa thibs po las thar par byed pa'o/ /lta ba'i mya ngan las yongs su zlog pa'o/ /srid pa'i chu bo las sgrol ba'o/ /'dod pa'i 'dam nas 'byin pa'o/ /lam mi bde ba nas rnam par zlog pa'o/ /byang chub sems dpa'i lam yang dag par ston pa'o/ /byang chub sems dpa'i yi dam la gzhog pa'o/ /nan tan la rab tu 'god pa'o/ /thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du 'gro ba'i phyogs rab tu ston pa'o; ;shes rab kyi mig rnam par sbyong ba'o/ /byang chub sems dpa' rnam par 'phel bar byed pa'o/ /snying rje chen po yang dag par skyed pa'o// spyod pa yongs su ston pa'o/ /pha rol tu phyin pa'i gdams ngag rab tu ston pa'o/ /sa la rab tu 'god pa'o/ /bzod pa rnam par 'byed pa'o/ /dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad yongs su 'grub par byed pa'o/ /tshogs thams cad skyed par byed pa'o/ /byang chub sems dpa'i yon tan thams cad stob pa'o/ /sangs rgyas thams cad kyi zhabs kyi drung du phyin par byed pa'o/ /yon tan thams cad yongs su ston pa'o/ /don thams cad yang dag par len du 'jug pa'o/ /nan tan la gzengs bstod pa'o/ /'byung ba'i sgo ston pa'o/ /lam gol ba las yongs su srung ba'o/ /chos snang ba'i sgo snang bar byed pa'o/ /chos kyi sgo mngon par rlan par byed pa'o/ /chos thos par bya ba'i sprin gyi char rab tu 'bebs pa'o/ /nyon mongs pa thams cad zhi bar byed pa'o/ /lta ba'i rnam pa thams cad las zlog pa'o/ /sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad la gnas par byed pa'o/ /

“What is the reason for this? Spiritual benefactors are those who clear away obstructions, restrain us from evil, teach us what is not to be done, extricate us from folly, dispel ignorance, break the bonds of views, emancipate us from the mundane whirl, cut off attachments to the world, free us from the nets of demons, extract the barbs of suffering, liberate us from the thicket of nescience, convey us across the desert of views, ferry us over the torrents of existence, pull us out of the mud of desire, extricate us from false paths, show the path of enlightening beings, enjoin on us the undertaking of enlightening beings, establish us in spiritual practices, lead the way to omniscience, clarify the eye of wisdom, strengthen the determination for enlightenment, foster universal compassion, tell about enlightening practices, give instruction in the ways of transcendence, direct us into the stages of enlightenment, impart tolerance, engender all roots of goodness, produce all preparations for enlightenment, bestow all virtues of enlightening beings, deliver us to the presence of all buddhas, show all virtuous qualities, inspire us to our goals, enhance efforts and attainments, show the ways to emancipation, protect us from the paths of destruction, illumine the ways to perceive truth, shower multitudes of teachings, extinguish all afflictions, stop the formation of views, and introduce us to all aspects of enlightenment.

'di ltar yang rigs kyi bu/ dge ba'i bshes gnyen ni/ sangs rgyas kyi rigs su skyed bas ma lta bu'o/ /dge ba'i bshes gnyen ni/ phan pa rgya chen po sgrub pas pha lta bu'o/ /dge ba'i bshes gnyen ni/ sdig pa thams cad las srung bas ma ma lta bu'o/ /dge ba'i bshes gnyen ni/ byang chub sems dpa'i bslab pa khong du chud par byed pas slob dpon lta bu'o/ /dge ba'i bshes gnyen ni/ pha rol tu phyin pa'i lam du 'dzud pas lam mkhan lta bu'o/ /dge ba'i bshes gnyen ni/ nyon mongs pa'i nad las thar par byed pas sman pa lta bu'o/ /dge ba'i bshes gnyen ni/ ye shes kyi sman rnam par 'phel bar byed pas gangs kyi ri lta bu'o/ / dge ba'i bshes gnyen ni/ 'jigs pa thams cad las srung bas dpa' bo lta bu'o/ /dge ba'i bshes gnyen ni/ 'khor ba'i chu bo chen po las sgrol bas mnyan pa lta bu'o; ;dge ba'i bshes gnyen ni/ thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes rin po che'i gling du phyin par byed pas skye ba 'dzin pa lta bu'o/ /

“Moreover, spiritual benefactors are mothers, giving birth to the family of buddhas; they are fathers, producing great benefit; they are nurses, protecting us from all evils; they are mentors, elucidating the learning of enlightening beings; they are guides, leading us into the path of transcendence; they are physicians, relieving us of the maladies of afflictions; they are like the Himalaya Mountains, growing the herb of knowledge; they are heroic warriors, protecting us from all perils; they are ferrymen, ferrying us across the torrents of the mundane whirl; they are helmsmen, delivering us to the treasure island of omniscience.

rigs kyi bu/ de lta bas na/ de ltar yid la bya ba rgyun ma chad pas khyod kyi dge ba'i bshes gnyen bsnyen par gyis shig /khur thams cad bkur bas yongs su mi skyo ba'i phyir sa lta bu'i sems dad/ mi phyed pa'i phyir rdo rje lta bu'i sems dang / sdug bsngal thams cad kyis mi sgul ba'i phyir khor yug lta bu'i sems dang / ci dga' bar bka' nyan pas bran lta bu'i sems dang / ngag thams cad mi gcog pas slob ma lta bu'i sems dang / las thams cad nyams su blang ba la mi smad pas 'jig rten gyi bran lta bu'i sems dang / nyon mongs pa thams cad kyis mi skyo ba'i phyir ma ma lta bu'i sems dang / bya'o cog la mthun par gzung bas g.yog lta bu'i sems dang / nga rgyal dang / mtho ba'i nga rgyal spangs pas phyag dar ba lta bu'i sems dang / dus dang / dus ma yin par mtho dman du 'gyur bas zla ba nya lta bu'i sems dang / mi srun pa thams cad rnam par spangs pas rta cang shes lta bu'i sems dang / khur lci ba bkur bas theg pa lta bu'i sems dang / dul ba dang / cang shes kyi bsam pas glang po lta bu'i sems dang / mi sgul mi bskyod pas ri lta bu'i sems dang / mi khro bas khyi lta bu'i sems dang / nga rgyal dang dus med pas gdol ba lta bu'i sems dang / dregs pa thams cad med pas khyu mchog ra bcad pa lta bu'i sems dang / rlom sems med pas mtshan bu lta bu'i sems dang / 'gro zhing 'ong bas mi skyo bas gru lta bu'i sems dang / dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyi ngag gi mthar phyin par byed pas zam pa lta bu'i sems dang / dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyi ngor lta bas bu mdzangs ba lta bu'i sems dang / chos kyi rgyal po'i bka' las mi 'gal bar bya bas rgyal po gzhon nu lta bu'i sems kyis dge ba'i bshes gnyen la bsnyen par bya'o/ /

“Therefore, thinking in this way, you should continue to approach spiritual benefactors, with a mind like the earth, bearing all burdens unbendingly; with a mind like adamant, having an unbreakable will; with a mind like a mountain range, impenetrable to all miseries; with a mind like a servant, doing whatever is bidden; with a mind like a student, following all instructions; with a mind like a slave, willing to take on all tasks; with a mind like a nurse, not overcome by afflictions; with a mind like a servant, taking up any task obediently; with a mind like a street cleaner, getting rid of pride and conceit; with a mind like the full moon, appearing at the proper times; with a mind like a good horse, avoiding all unruliness; with a mind like a vehicle, carrying a precious cargo; with a mind like an elephant, tame and docile; with a mind like a mountain, unshakable; with a mind like a dog, not getting angry; with a mind like an outcaste youth, free from arrogance and egotism; with a mind like a bull with its horns cut off, stripped of all haughtiness; with a mind like an apprentice, free from inflated ideas of your own worth; with a mind like a ship, coming and going tirelessly; with a mind like a bridge, crossing over with the directions of spiritual benefactors; with a mind like a good son, looking up to the countenance of spiritual benefactors; with a mind like a prince, carrying out the directives of the spiritual king.

rigs kyi bu; khyod kyis bdag la nad par 'du shes bskyed do/ /dge ba'i bshes gnyen la ni/ sman pa'i 'du shes dang / gdams ngag la ni/ sman gyi 'du shes dang / nan tan nyams su blang ba la ni/ nad 'tsho ba'i 'du shes bskyed par bya'o/ /rigs kyi bu/ khyod kyis bdag la ni/ 'gron po'i 'du shes bskyed pa'o/ /dge ba'i bshes gnyen la ni/ lam mtshon pa'i 'du shes dang / gdams ngag la ni/ lam gyi 'du shes dang / nan tan la ni/ phyogs bde bar 'gro ba'i 'du shes bskyed par bya'o/ /rigs kyi bu/ khyod kyis bdag la ni/ pha rol tu 'gro ba'i 'du shes bskyed par bya'o/ /dge ba'i bshes gnyen la ni/ mnyan pa'i 'du shes dang / rjes su bstan pa la ni/ mu stegs kyi 'du shes dang / nan tan la ni/ gru'i 'du shes bskyed par bya'o/ /rigs kyi bu/ khyod kyis bdag la ni/ zhing pa'i 'du shes bskyed par bya'o/ /dge ba'i bshes gnyen la ni/ klu'i dbang po'i 'du shes dang / gdams ngag la ni/ char pa'i 'du shes dang / nan tan la ni/ lo tog 'grub pa'i 'du shes bskyed par bya'o/ /rigs kyi bu/ khyod kyis bdag la ni/ dbul po'i 'du shes bskyed par bya'o/ /dge ba'i bshes gnyen la ni/ ngal bso ba'i 'du shes dang / gdams ngag la ni/ nor dang / don gyi 'du shes dang / nan tan la ni/ dbul ba sel ba'i 'du shes bskyed par bya'o/ /rigs kyi bu/ khyod kyis bdag la ni/ slob ma'i 'du shes bskyed par bya'o; ;dge ba'i bshes gnyen la ni/ slob dpon gyi 'du shes dang / gdams ngag la ni/ bzo'i 'du shes dang / nan tan la ni/ bzo khong du chud pa'i 'du shes bskyed par bya'o/ /rigs kyi bu/ khyod kyis bdag la ni/ 'jigs pa'i 'du shes bskyed par bya'o/ /dge ba'i bshes gnyen la ni/ dpa' bo'i 'du shes dang / gdams ngag la ni/ mtshon cha'i 'du shes dang / nan tan la ni/ dgra sel ba'i 'du shes bskyed par bya'o/ /rigs kyi bu/ khyod kyis bdag la ni/ tshong pa'i 'du shes bskyed par bya'o/ /dge ba'i bshes gnyen la ni/ skya ba 'dzin pa'i 'du shes dang / gdams ngag la ni/ rin po che'i 'du shes dang / nan tan la ni/ rin po che'i sdud pa'i 'du shes bskyed par bya'o/ /rigs kyi bu/ khyod kyis bdag la ni/ bu dam pa'i 'du shes bskyed par byed pa'o/ /dge ba'i bshes gnyen la ni/ pha ma'i 'du shes dang / rjes su bstan pa la ni/ rigs kyi tshul gyi 'du shes dang / nan tan la ni/ tshul ma nyams pa'i 'du shes bskyed par bya'o/ /rigs kyi bu/ khyod kyis bdag la ni; rgyal po gzhon nu'i 'du shes bskyed par bya'o/ /dge ba'i bshes gnyen la ni chos kyi rgyal po dang / blon po dam pa'i 'du shes dang / gdams ngag la ni/ rgyal po'i khrims kyi 'du shes dang / nan tan la ni/ ye shes kyi rgyal po'i cod pan dang / rgyan dang / chos kyi thabs mgo la bcing ba dang / chos kyi rgyal po'i grong khyer la rnam par lta ba'i 'du shes bskyed par bya ste/

“Think of yourself as sick, and think of spiritual benefactors as physicians; think of their instructions as medicines, and think of the practices as getting rid of disease. Think of yourself as a traveler, and think of spiritual benefactors as guides; think of their instructions as the road, and think of the practices as going to the land of your destination. Think of yourself as crossing over to the other shore, and think of spiritual benefactors as boatmen; think of their instructions as a ford, and think of the practices as a boat. Think of yourself as a farmer, and think of spiritual benefactors as water spirits; think of their instructions as rain, and think of the practices as the ripening of the crops. Think of yourself as a pauper, and think of spiritual benefactors as the givers of wealth; think of their instructions as wealth, and think of the practices as getting rid of poverty. Think of yourself as an apprentice, and think of spiritual benefactors as mentors; think of their instructions as arts, and think of the practices as accomplishments. Think of yourself as fearless, and think of spiritual benefactors as heroic warriors; think of their instructions as attack, and think of the practices as vanquishing enemies. Think of yourself as a merchant, and think of spiritual benefactors as ship captains; think of their instructions as treasure, and think of the practices as obtaining treasures. Think of yourself as a good son, and think of spiritual benefactors as parents; think of their instructions as the family business, and think of the practices as the perpetuation of the family business. Think of yourself as a prince, and think of spiritual benefactors as the chief ministers of a spiritual king; think of their instructions as the precepts of kingship, and think of the practices as putting on the turban of truth adorned with the crest of knowledge and overseeing the capital of the spiritual sovereign.

rigs kyi bu/ khyod kyis de lta bu'i 'du shes yid la bya ba yongs su bsgoms te dge ba'i bshes gnyen rnams la nye bar bsnyen par gyis shig/ de ci'i phyir zhe na/ rigs kyi bu/ de ltar dge ba'i bshes gnyen la lhag pa'i bsam pa yongs su dag pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni/ dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyi ngag thams cad nyams su len pa'i tshe gangs kyi ri la brten pa'i dang / gel pa dang / sman dang / nags tshal lta bu dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad kyis rnam par 'phel lo/ /rgya mtsho chen po chu'i snod du gyur pa ltar chos thams cad kyi snod du 'gyur ro/ /gang chen mtsho chen po rin po che mang po'i 'byung gnas su gyur pa ltar yon tan thams cad kyi 'byung gnas su 'gyur ro/ /me'i drod kyis gser yongs su 'byang ba ltar byang chub kyi sems yongs su byang bar 'gyur ro/ / rgya mtsho chen po las 'phags pa'i ri rab ltar 'jig rten las mngon par 'phags par 'gyur ro/ /pad+mo la chus mi chags pa ltar 'jig rten gyi chos kyis mi gos par 'gyur ro/ /rgya mtsho chen po ro rul pa dang mi 'grogs pa ltar spyod pa ngan pa thams cad dang mi 'grogs so/ /yud du yar gyi zla ba ltar chos dkar pos rnam par 'phel bar 'gyur ro/ /dzam+bu'i gling snang bar byed pa'i nyi ma ltar chos kyi dbyings su snang bar 'gyur ro/ /pha ma dang 'grogs pa'i bu ltar byang chub sems dpa'i smon lam gyi lus thams cad yang dag par skye bar 'gyur ro/ /

“You should approach spiritual benefactors with these thoughts in mind. Why? With their attitude toward spiritual benefactors purified in this way, practicing the instructions of spiritual benefactors, enlightening beings grow in goodness, like plants, bushes, and trees growing up the mountains; they become vessels of all buddha-teachings, as the oceans are of water; they become repositories of all virtues, as the seas are of pearls; they purify the determination for enlightenment, as fire does gold; they rise above the world, like the polar mountain over the sea; they become unstained by things of the world, like a lotus in water; they reject all bad actions, as the ocean throws up a corpse; they increase in good qualities, as the moon grows brighter as it waxes; they illumine the reality realm, as the sun does the earth; they grow the bodies of vows of enlightening beings, just as children grow in the care of their parents.

de ltar mdor na/ rigs kyi bu/ dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyi gdams ngag la zhugs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni/ yon tan bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong brjod du med pa phrag bcu ni/ rab tu 'dzin par 'gyur ro/ /de'i lhag pa'i bsam pa bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong phrag bcu ni/ rab tu 'phel bar 'gyur ro/ /byin gyi rlabs bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong phrag bcu ni/ rnam par sbyong bar 'gyur ro/ /sgrib pa'i chos bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong phrag bcu ni/ yongs su spyod par 'gyur ro/ /sgrib pa'i chos grangs med pa brgya stong phrag bcu ni/ yongs su dag par 'gyur ro/ /bdud grangs med pa brgya stong phrag bcu las ni/ yang dag par 'dam par 'gyur ro/ /chos kyi sgo grangs med pa brgya stong phrag bcu la ni/ rab tu 'jug par 'gyur ro/ /tshogs rnam par dag pa'i sgo grangs med pa bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong phrag bcu ni/ yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ro/ /spyod pa grangs med pa brgya stong phrag bcu ni/ kun nas dag par 'gyur ro/ /smon lam chen po grangs med pa brgya stong phrag bcu ni/ mngon par grub par 'gyur ro/ /

“In short, enlightening beings who have put the instruction of spiritual benefactors into effect embody untold virtues, purify untold resolutions, develop untold enlightening faculties, purify untold mystic powers, perfect untold worthy practices, get beyond untold demons, abide by untold ways to truth, fulfill untold ways of purifying virtue and knowledge, fulfill untold deeds, purify untold modes of conduct, carry out untold vows.

rigs kyi bu/ de ltar mdor na/ byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa thams cad dang / byang chub sems dpa'i pha rol tu phyin pa thams cad dang / byang chub sems dpa'i sa thams cad dang / byang chub sems dpa'i bzod pa la 'jug pa thams cad dang / byang chub sems dpa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi sgo thams cad dang / byang chub sems dpa'i mngon par shes pa'i ye shes kyi rnam par 'phrul pa thams cad dang / byang chub sems dpa'i gzungs dang spobs pa'i snang ba thams cad dang / byang chub sems dpa'i bsngo ba'i ye shes dang / mngon par shes pa tshad med pa thams cad dang / byang chub sems dpa'i smon lam mngon par sgrub pa thams cad dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad rab tu thob cing yongs su grub pa rnams ni/ dge ba'i bshes gnyen la rag las pa dang / go ;dge ba'i bshes gnyen rtsa bar gyur pa dag go /dge ba'i bshes gnyen las byung ba dag go /dge ba'i bshes gnyen skye gnas su gyur pa dag go /dge ba'i bshes gnyen skye mched du gyur pa dag go /dge ba'i bshes gnyen las yongs su skyes pa dag go /dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyis yongs su spel ba dag go /dge ba'i bshes gnyen la rab tu brten pa dag go /dge ba'i bshes gnyen rgyur gyur pa'o/ /dge ba'i bshes gnyen las rab tu skyes pa dag go /

“In sum, all practices of enlightening beings, all transcendent ways of enlightening beings, all stages of enlightening beings, all concentrations of enlightening beings, all mystic knowledges and spiritual powers of enlightening beings, all manifestations of mental command and intellectual power of enlightening beings, all knowledge of dedication and infinity of superknowledge of enlightening beings, all accomplishments of vows of enlightening beings, and all perfections of attainments of all aspects of buddhahood, derive from spiritual benefactors, are rooted in spiritual benefactors, are born of spiritual benefactors, are fostered by spiritual benefactors, are based on spiritual benefactors, are caused by spiritual benefactors, are produced by spiritual benefactors.”

de nas tshong dpon gyi bu nor bzang gis rnam pa de lta bu'i dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyi yon tan dang / bsngags pa rjes su bstan pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa tshad med pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos rgya chen po thos nas dga' rangs te mgu zhing nyams bde la tshim zhing yid bde ba skyes nas khye'u dpal 'byung dang / bu mo dpal gyi blo gros ma gnyis kyi rkang pa la spyi bos phyag 'tshal te khye'u dpal 'byung ba dang / bu mo dpal gyi blo gros ma gnyis la lan brgya stong du mar g.yas phyogs su bskor ba byas nas khye'u dpal 'byung ba dang / bu mo dpal gyi blo gros ma'i drung nas song ngo// //

Now Sudhana, hearing about the virtues and qualities of spiritual benefactors, about the infinity of practice of enlightening beings, and the vastness of the buddha-teaching, was thoroughly delighted and uplifted in mind. He then paid his respects again to the boy Shrisambhava and the girl Shrimati and took his leave.
shin tu rgyas pa chen po'i mdo/ sangs rgyas phal po che zhes bya ba las/ sdong pos brgyan pa'i le'u ste; ;bam po brgya bcu gcig pa/
[byang chub sems dpa' byams pa]
Maitreya

de nas tshong dpon gyi bu nor bzang dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyi gdams ngag gis sems mngon par brlan pa de/ byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa rjes su bstan pa de ni/ rjes su rnam par sems/ sngon gyi mtha'i lus mang po yang dag pa'i spyod pa nyams su ma blangs par chud zos pa la bsam pas ni/ lus kyi stobs rab tu brtan par byed/ sngon gyi mtha'i mur thug pa'i lus dang / sems yongs su dag kyang don med par 'khor ba'i sems kyi rgyud du gyur pa la bsam pas ni; sems dang yid la bya ba rab tu sbyong / sngon gyi mtha'i mur thug pa'i las yang dag pa ma yin pas 'jig rten gyi don du g.yen spyo ste mi gces par sha thang pa la bsam pas ni/ da ltar byung ba'i don shin tu gces pa la legs par sgrub pa rnam par sems/ sngon gyi mtha'i mur thug pa'i yongs su rtog pa yang dag pa ma yin par rnam par brtags pa las byung ba/ phyin ci log gis yid la bya ba'i kun nas glags pa la bsam pas ni/ byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa thams cad yang dag pa'i rtog pas mngon par 'du bya ba'i stobs yang dag par skyed/ 'das pa'i lus kyis bdag gi don gyi sbyor pa la rtsom rtsom pa'i yul la yongs su bsam pas ni/ sems can thams cad kyi sbyor ba las khyad par du 'phags par lhag pa'i bsam pas ni/ stobs rab tu brtan par byed/ sngon 'dod pa yongs su tshol tshol ba'i spyod pa ro med pa la yongs su bsam pas ni/ sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad 'thob pa'i sbyor bas dbugs phyin pa chen po 'thob pa'i dbang po'i shugs drag po rnam par 'phel bar byed/ 'das pa'i dus kyi lhag pa'i bsam pa phyin ci log dang ldan pa'i sbyor ba la yongs su bsam pas ni/ da ltar byung ba'i dus su phyin ci log med pa dang ldan pa'i yang dag pa'i lta ba dang / byang chub sems dpa'i smon lam la yi dam bca' bas sems kyi rgyud yongs su rgyas par byed/ sngon gyi mtha'i brtson 'grus brtsams pa mi cha la don ma yin pa dang / yongs su ma grub pa'i brtson 'grus nyams su blangs pa la yongs su bsam pas ni/ da ltar byung ba'i dus su sangs rgyas kyi chos yongs su bsdu ba la sta gon du gnas pa'i brtson 'grus chen po rtsom pa'i rnam par gnon pas lus dang sems kyi gzengs mtho ba yang dag par skyed/ sngon gyi mtha'i mur thug pa'i 'gro ba lnga'i rgyud kyi ngan song du bdag dang gzhan bor ba la brtag pas lus 'tsho ba med pa yongs su bzung ba la yang dag par bsam pas ni/ sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad yongs su sgrub pa dang / 'gro ba thams cad nye bar 'tsho ba dang / dge ba'i bshes gnyen thams cad bsnyen bkur bar nus pa'i lus yongs su bzung bas dga' ba dang / mos pa'i shugs drag po rgya chen po rnam par 'phel bar byed/ da ltar byung ba'i tsher mngon par grub kyang dga' ba dang / na ba dang / 'chi ba dang / mya ngan gyi 'byung gnas su gyur te/ 'du ba dang 'bral ba'i gter du gyur pa'i lus kyang phyi ma'i mtha'i bskal pa'i mur thug par byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa spyad pa la brtson pa dang / sems can yongs su smin par bya ba dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos yongs su bsdu ba la brtson pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i zhal lta zhing zhing thams cad du rgyu ba dang / chos smra ba thams cad la rim gror bya ba dang / de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi bstan pa yongs su bzung ba la brtson pa dang / chos thams cad yongs su btsal ba'i grogs su gyur pa dang / dge ba'i bshes gnyen thams cad mthong bar bya ba dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad yang dag par bsdu ba la brtson pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i smon lam dang / ye shes kyi lus kyi rgyu dang rkyen du gyur pa la bltas shing / dge ba'i rtsa ba'i dbang po dang / shugs bsam gyis mi khyab pa rnam par 'phel bar byed cing

Then Sudhana, his mind enriched by the instructions of spiritual benefactors, went to the region of Samudrakaccha, contemplating that instruction in the conduct of enlightening beings, strengthening his body by thinking of past activities inconsistent with proper conduct, controlling his thoughts by thinking of past mundane mental behavior not conducive to purification of body and mind, contemplating the greater common weal in the present by thinking of the vanity of past involvement in harmful mundane activities, establishing the power of forming correct ideas of the practice of enlightening beings by thinking of former untrue notions based on mere fancy, strengthening the will based on the excellence of striving for the welfare of all beings by thinking of the ills of past striving for his own personal benefit, increasing the energy of his faculties with great inspiration to strive to attain all elements of buddhahood by thinking of past indulgence in pleasure seeking; purifying his being with the vow of enlightening beings connected with correct perception in the present free from delusion by thinking of past endeavors made up of error inextricably bound up with delusion; unifying body and mind with great vigor in action by thinking of past accomplishment of tasks through exertion of great vigor and striving for the attainment of complete buddhahood in the present; developing great joy and happiness by thinking how it would be to go on forever as in the past—helpless amid the ills of unenlightened life—and instead dedicating himself to the aid and benefit of all beings by establishing all the teachings of enlightenment, developing energy in his faculties rooted in inconceivable good by seeing this present life as a cause of old age, sickness, death, and grief, an abode of assemblage and disintegration, and yet the basis and condition of carrying out the practice of enlightening beings forever, absorbing the buddha-teachings that mature sentient beings, seeing the buddhas and going to all their lands, attending all teachers of truth, keeping the instructions of all buddhas, seeking all truths, meeting all spiritual friends, realizing all elements of buddhahood, and embodying the vows of enlightening beings.

de lta bu'i sems dang / de lta bu'i yid la bya ba dang / tshul bzhin de lta bu la rab tu brtson pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyi mos pas yang dag par bsgrubs pa'i dad pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyi bsam pas yongs su bsgrubs pa'i nye bar sems pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyi lhag pa'i bsam pas sgro btags pa'i rim gro dang / byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyi dbang po dang bar sgro btags pa'i phu dud dang / byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyi ston pa la mos pas yang dag par bsgrubs pa'i dbang po dang ba'i shugs dang / byang chub sems dpa' thams cad la rim gros byung ba'i sems kyi mos pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyi dad pa las yongs su byung ba'i dge ba'i rtsa ba'i tshogs dang / byang chub sems dpa'i mngon par 'du bya ba thams cad las yongs su grub pa'i mchod pa rnam pa tha dad pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' thams cad dang mnyam pa'i lus kyi thal mo sbyar ba dang / 'gro ba'i lus thams cad du yongs su byung ba'i mig rnam pa sna tshogs kyis blta ba dang / 'gro bar ming btags pa thams cad du sgro btags pa'i byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyi chos mnyam pa nyid rnams dang / byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyi smon lam gyis sprul pa las byung bar sgro btags pa'i lus kyis 'dud cing phyag bya ba tshad med pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyi dbyangs kyi yan lag rnam par dag pa las byung ba'i legs pa brjod pa'i rgyan mngon par sgrub pa dang / sngon gyi mtha' dang / da ltar byung ba'i dus su byung ba'i sems can gyi gnas kyi gnas thams cad yongs su rgyas pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa'i pho brang mngon du byas pa'i 'du shes kyi rnam pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i rnam par 'phrul pas mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya ba thams cad du khyab pa dang / skra'i rtse mo gcig las kyang lhag pa med par byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyis rgyas par 'gengs pa'i rjes su song ba dang / byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyi mig gi lam rnam par dag par sgro btags pa'i mngon par shes pa snang bas rnam par dmigs pa dang / phyogs kyi dra ba tha dad pa thams cad kyi rjes su song ba'i yid kyi skye mched dang / chos kyi dbyings kyi gzhi tha dad pa rgyas par 'gengs pa'i smon la ma mngon par sgrub pa'i stobs dang / chos thams cad la 'jug pa'i sgo nam mkha'i dbyings kyis klas te mthas gtugs par thams cad du khyab la/ dus gsum du tha mi dad cing rgyun mi 'chad pa dang / dad pa dang / mos pa la 'jug pa'i stobs dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyi gdams ngag snang ba'i phyogs la zhugs pas yul rgya mtsho'i 'gram gang na ba der phyin te/ de ltar tshong dpon gyi bu nor bzang rim gro dang phu dud dang / mchod pa dang / bstod pa dang / phyag bya ba dang / blta ba'i byin gyi rlabs dang / smon lam dang / 'du shes kyi rjes su song ba de lta bu'i yid dang ldan pa dang / ye shes kyi spyod yul tshad med pa'i sa de lta bu la zhugs pa'i ye shes kyi mig gis khang pa brtsegs pa chen po rnam par snang mdzad kyi rgyan gyis brgyan pa'i snying po'i sgo nas lus thams cad kyis phab ste phyag byas so/ /

In this frame of mind, with these thoughts, engaged in such reasoning, with faith in the grace of all enlightening beings, with admiration for the determination of all enlightening beings, with respect for the determination of all enlightening beings, with reverence for the purity of the senses of all enlightening beings, with the powers of purity of sense derived from attentiveness to the teachings of all enlightening beings, with clarity of mind deriving from respecting all enlightening beings, with provisions of roots of goodness deriving from faith in all enlightening beings, with varieties of offerings deriving from the accomplishments of all enlightening beings, with expressions of respect made equally to all enlightening beings, with observations of the variety of eyes developed in the bodies of all beings, with productions of arrays of descriptions of the conceptual worlds of all beings made with the clarity of expression of all enlightening beings, with perception of the state of presence in the abodes of all buddhas by fulfillment of the mystic power of all enlightening beings of past and present, with awareness of the miracles of buddhas and enlightening beings everywhere, following the all-pervasiveness of the bodies of all buddhas and enlightening beings in every single point, with perception of the light of superknowledge of the purity of vision of all enlightening beings, with a mind sense comprehending the network of all places as a whole, pervading all levels of the cosmos, with the power of accomplishment of vows, extending everywhere throughout the entirety of space, continuous through past, present, and future, ceaselessly penetrating all truths, entering all areas illumined by the instructions of all spiritual benefactors, by the penetrating power of faith and resolve, Sudhana, his mind pursuing such thoughts of respect, reverence, honor, submission, regard, empowerment, and determination, with the eye of knowledge intent upon the ground of the realm of such infinite knowledge, prostrated himself in front of the door of the great tower, chamber of the adornments of Vairocana, the illuminator.

des rnam pa de lta bu'i mngon par sgrub pa'i tshul yud tsam du rnam par dpyad de mos pa dang / dad pa las byung ba'i lhag pa'i bsam pa dang / smon lam gyis mngon par bsgrubs pa'i mthus de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi zhabs kyi drung du bdag nyid rgyun mi 'chad par byin gyis brlabs so/ /de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' thams cad dang mngon sum du gnas pa dang / dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyis gnas thams cad dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i mchod rten thams cad dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku gzugs thams cad dang / sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa'i pho brang thams cad dang / chos rin po che'i gnas thams cad dang / nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas thams cad kyi gnas dang / mchod rten thams cad mngon sum du gnas pa nas 'phags pa'i tshogs dang / sbyin pa'i gnas dang / bla ma dang / pha ma thams cad kyi bar gyi 'gro ba'i tshogs thams cad dang / mngon sum du gnas pa rgyun mi 'chad par ye shes kyi lus tha mi dad pa'i tshul la 'jug pa thams cad kyi rjes su song ba dang / 'du shes kyi byin gyi rlabs dang / ye shes yid la bya bas byin gyis brlabs so/ /

Contemplating such application of accomplishment for a while, by the power of effectuation of resolute vows, deriving from intense faith, Sudhana projected himself continuously into the presence of all buddhas, and likewise into the presence of all enlightening beings, to the abodes of all spiritual benefactors, to all monuments of buddhas, to all statues of buddhas, to the abodes of all enlightening beings and buddhas, to the locations of all treasures of true teaching, to the presence of all monuments to saints and individual illuminates, to the vicinities of all groups of sages, worthies, and parents: he continuously projected himself into the presence of all beings, by entering into the totality of the body of knowledge, extending everywhere, by focusing attention through knowledge of control of formation of mental images.

khang pa brtsegs pa chen po rnam par snang mdzad kyi rgyan gyis brgyan pa'i snying po'i sgo nas ji lta ba de bzhin du gong du brjod pa'i dmigs pa thams cad la yang chos kyi dbyings thams cad rgyas par 'gengs pas 'dud cing phyag bya bar byin gyis brlab so/ /

And just as he prostrated himself before the great tower of the chamber of the adornments of Vairocana, in the same way he prostrated himself before all the aforementioned beings and objects throughout the cosmos.

de bzhin du phyi ma'i mtha'i mur thug par rgyun 'chad pa med par byin gyis brlabs te/ nam mkha'i dbyings tshad med pa dang mnyam pa nyid dang / chos kyi dbyings sgrib pa med pa dang mnyam pa nyid dang / yang dag pa'i mtha' thams cad kyi rjes su song ba dang mnyam pa nyid dang / de bzhin nyid rnam par mi rtog pa dang mnyam pa nyid dang / grib ma lta bu'i ye shes dang 'du shes kyis rgyas par dgang ba mnyam pa nyid dang / rmi lam lta bu'i rnam par dpyod pa dang mnyam pa nyid dang / gzugs brnyan lta bur 'jig rten dang 'gro ba thams cad rnam par dmigs pa'i mnyam pa nyid dang / rgyu dang rkyen las byung bas sgra brnyan lta bu'i mnyam pa nyid dang / 'byung ba dang 'jig pa mi skye ba dang mnyam pa'i mnyam pa nyid dang / rkyen dang rten pa'i rgyud dngos pa med pa'i rang bzhin dang mnyam pa'i mnyam pa nyid kyis las ji lta ba bzhin du yongs su byung ba'i rnam par smin pa la ni/ mos par byed/ rgyu ji lta ba bzhin du yongs su byung ba'i 'bras bu la ni/ mos par byed/ bsags pa ji lta ba bzhin du yongs su byung ba'i bya ba thams cad la ni/ mos par byed/ dad pa las yongs su byung ba'i de bzhin gshegs pa 'byung ba thams cad la ni/ mos par byed/ mos pa ji lta ba bzhin du yongs su byung ba'i sangs rgyas mchod pa'i sprul pa thams cad la ni/ mos par byed/ rim gro las byung ba'i de bzhin gshegs pa'i sprul pa thams cad la ni/ mos par byed/ dge ba'i rtsa ba'i tshogs las yongs su 'byung ba'i sangs rgyas thams cad kyi chos nyid la ni/ mos par byed/ shes rab dang thabs las yongs su byung ba'i rgyan yid kyi rang bzhin du sgrub pa thams cad la ni/ mos par byed/ smon lam las yongs su byung ba'i sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad la ni/ mos par byed/ bsngo ba las yongs su byung ba'i byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa thams cad dang / chos kyi dbyings thams cad mkhyen pa'i yul du gyur pa rnam par sgrub pas rgyas par dgang pa'i rgyan la ni/ mos par byed cing / yongs su bsngo ba'i ye shes tshad med pa'i 'du shes dang bral ba dang / skye ba med pa'i ye shes rtog pa'i 'du shes med pa dang / yang dag pa'i spyod pa la 'jug cing / rgyu nye bar gsog pa'i ye shes rgyu dang bya ba'i lta ba med pa dang / phyin ci log med pa'i ye shes phyin ci log gi lta ba dang bral ba dang / gzhan gyi dring mi 'jog pa'i ye shes dbang phyug tu lta ba med pa dang / rten pa la 'jug pa'i ye shes bdag dang phyi rol gyi 'du shes kyi lta ba dang bral ba dang / chos kyi dbyings mtha' dang dbus med pa la 'jug pa'i ye shes mthar 'dzin pa'i lta ba dang bral ba dang / gzugs brnyan lta bur mngon par grub pa'i ye shes 'pho ba'i lta ba med pa dang / mi skye mi 'gag pa'i ye shes skye ba dang 'jig pa'i lta ba dang bral ba dang / stong pa nyid kyis mi skye ba'i ye shes lta ba'i rnam pa thams cad dang bral ba dang / smon lam mngon par sgrub pa'i ye shes kyi stobs dbang phyug med pa'i chos nyid rab tu rtogs pa dang / mtshan ma med pa'i mtha'i sgo dang ldan pa'i ye shes mtshan ma thams cad dang bral bas sa bon las myu gu chud mi za ba'i chos nyid dang / rgya las rgya'i gzugs brnyan 'byung ba'i chos nyid dang / gzugs las gzugs brnyan 'byung ba'i chos nyid dang / sgra brnyan dang sgrar mnyam pa rnam par dmigs pa'i chos nyid dang / rnam par dpyod pa dang rmi lam du mnyam par rnam par dmigs pa'i chos nyid dang / sems gzugs med pas 'jig rten yongs su bskyed pa'i chos nyid dang / rkyen dang rgyu ji ltar bsags pa bzhin du 'bras bu 'byung ba'i chos nyid dang / las ji ltar bsags pa dang mnyam par rnam par sbyin pa 'byung ba'i chos nyid dang / thabs mkhas pas rnam par bsgrubs pa'i chos nyid dang / chos dang chos ma yin pa mnyam pa nyid kyis mngon par brlan pa'i chos nyid dang / ye shes kyi rjes su 'jug pa de lta bus mngon par bsgrubs pa'i 'du shes dang yid la bya bas/ tshong dpon gyi bu nor bzang gis khang pa brtsegs pa rnam par snang mdzad kyi rgyan gyis brgyan pa'i snying po'i sgo nas rnam pa de lta bur btud de phyag 'tshal nas

“In this way, continuously mystically manifesting the eons of the endless future, by equanimity like the infinity of space, equanimity like the nonobstruction of the reality realm, equanimity toward the omnipresent ultimate limit of reality, the equanimity of absence of false notions in those who realize Thusness, the pervasiveness of perceptions of reflectional knowledge, equanimity toward thoughts as being like dreams, equanimity toward the representations of all worlds as being like reflections, equanimity toward conditional origins being like echoes, equanimity toward nonorigination, equanimity toward formation and disintegration, and equanimity toward the evolution of causal conditions as being equal to nonexistence, believing that development takes place according to actions, believing that results come about according to causes, believing that all Three Vehicles come to be according to accumulation of spiritual practices, believing that the appearance of all buddhas comes from faith, believing that all creations of offerings to buddhas come from devotion, believing that all projections of buddhas derive from respect, believing that the nature of all buddhas derives from the accumulation of virtues, believing that all arrays of mental adornments derive from wisdom and technique, believing that all buddha-teachings derive from vows, believing all the arrays of adornments spreading throughout the realm of realities, the sphere of omniscience, by the practices of all enlightening beings, derive from dedication; and by elimination of nihilism by knowledge of dedication, by elimination of the notion of permanence by knowledge of nonorigination, by elimination of erroneous views of causality by knowledge of causality, by elimination of false views by independent knowledge, by elimination of notions of self and others by knowledge of interdependence, by elimination of views attached to extremes by knowledge of the reality realm without extremes or mean, by elimination of the notion of transmigration by knowledge of the equal extinction of all abodes, by elimination of notions of becoming and decay by knowledge of nonorigination and nonextinction, by elimination of all views by knowledge of the nonorigination of emptiness, by dealing with the nonindependent nature of things with the power of knowledge of how to accomplish vows, by detachment from all notions of appearances by knowledge of the signless ultimate, due to the nature of things being unperishing like seeds producing sprouts, due to the nature of things being like the impression of a stamp, due to the nature of things being like seeing reflected images, due to the nature of things as being represented by sounds that are like echoes, due to the nature of things as arising from acts that are like illusions, due to the nature of things as rousing the formless world of mind, due to the nature of things as results conforming to the accumulation of causes and conditions, due to the nature of things as like developments according to accumulation of acts, due to the nature of things as outgrowths of skill in means, due to the nature of things as flowing into the transcendent equality of reality and unreality—with conscious thought accomplishing entry into knowledge thus, Sudhana prostrated himself before the great tower, the chamber of adornments of Vairocana.

yun ring mo zhig lon pa dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba'i shugs bsam gyis mi khyab pas mngon par brlan pa'i sems dang ldan pa/ lus dang sems shin tu sim par gyur pa de khang pa brtsegs pa'i gnas nas langs te yud tsam zhig tu khang pa brtsegs pa chen po rnam par snang mdzad kyi rgyan gyis brgyan pa'i snying po de la mig mi 'gengs pas bltas nas thal mo sbyar te lan brgya stong du mar g.yas phyogs su bskor ba byas nas de lta bu'i 'du shes dang yid la bya bas bskul ba'i sems dang ldan pas tshig tu brjod pa/ 'di ni/ stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa'i gnas la rnam par spyod pa rnams kyi gnas so/ /'di ni/ chos thams cad la rnam par mi rtog pa'i gnas la rnam par spyod pa rnams kyi gnas so/ /chos kyi dbyings tha mi dad pa'i gnas la rnam par spyod pa/ sems can gyi khams mi dmigs pa'i gnas la rnam par spyod pa/ chos thams cad gnas med pa'i gnas la rnam par spyod pa/ 'jig rten thams cad gnas med pa'i gnas la rnam par spyod pa/ 'gro ba thams cad kyi gnas gnas med pa'i gnas la rnam par spyod pa/ gnas thams cad rnam par bsgoms pa'i gnas la rnam par spyod pa/ brten pa thams cad la mi rten pa'i gnas la rnam par spyod pa/ lus thams cad la mi rten pa'i gnas la rnam par spyod pa/ 'du shes kyi rnam pa thams cad bsal ba'i gnas la rnam par spyod pa rnams kyi gnas so/ /'di ni/ chos thams cad rang bzhin med pa'i gnas la rnam par spyod pa rnams kyi gnas so/ /rtog pa dang / rnam par rtog pa dang / yongs su rtog pa thams cad du rnam par mi rtog pa'i gnas la rnam par spyod pa; 'du shes dang / sems dang / yid thams cad kyis rnam par dben pa'i gnas la spyod pa/ lam thams cad blang ba med pa dang / dor ba med pa'i gnas la rnam par spyod pa; shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zab mo la 'jug pa'i gnas la rnam par spyod pa/ sgo kun nas chos kyi dbyings rgyas par 'gengs pa'i thabs kyi gnas la rnam par spyod pa/ nyon mongs pa thams cad zhi zhing nye bar zhi ba'i gnas la rnam par spyod pa/ lta ba dang / sred pa dang / nga rgyal thams cad spangs pa'i shes rab shas che ba'i gnas la rnam par spyod pa/ bsam gtan dang / rnam par thar pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / snyoms par 'jug pa dang / mngon par shes pa dang / rigs pa skyed pa thams cad la rnam par rol pa'i gnas la rnam par spyod pa/ byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyi ting nge 'dzin gyi spyod yul sgom pa'i gnas la rnam par spyod pa rnams kyi gnas so/ /'di ni/ sangs rgyas thams cad kyi zhabs kyi drung na nye bar gnas pa'i gnas la rnam par spyod pa rnams kyi gnas so/ /'di ni/ gang de dag bskal pa gcig la bskal pa thams cad dang / bskal pa thams cad la bskal pa gcig tu 'jug pa'i gnas la rnam par spyod pa/ gang
