de dag zhing gcig dang zhing thams cad du zhing thams cad dang zhing gcig tu tha mi dad pa'i gnas la rnam par spyod pa/ gang de dag chos gcig dang chos thams cad du chos thams cad dang chos gcig tu mi 'gal ba'i gnas la rnam par spyod pa/ gang de dag sems can gcig dang sems can thams cad du sems can thams cad dang sems can gcig tu tha mi dad pa'i gnas la rnam par spyod pa/ gang de dag sangs rgyas gcig dang sangs rgyas thams cad du sangs rgyas thams cad dang sangs rgyas gcig tu mi gnas la rnam par spyod pa/ gang de dag dus thams cad la skad cig gcig gis 'jug pa'i gnas la rnam par spyod pa/ gang de dag sems bskyed pa gcig gis zhing thams cad du 'gro ba'i gnas la rnam par spyod pa/ gang de dag sems can thams cad kyi gnas su gzugs brnyan snang ba'i gnas la rnam par spyod pa/ gang de dag 'jig rten thams cad la phan pa dang bde ba'i sems kyi gnas la rnam par spyod pa/ gang de dag thob par bya ba thams cad rang la rag las pa'i gnas la rnam par spyod pa de dag gi gnas so/ /

After a long while, his being flooded by the energy of inconceivable roots of goodness, his body and mind refreshed, he rose from the doorstep of the tower, gazed with unblinking eyes at the great tower containing the adornments of Vairocana, circled it respectfully hundreds of thousands of times, and voiced these thoughts: “This is abode of those who dwell in the state of emptiness, signlessness, and wishlessness; this is the abode of those who dwell in the state of nonconceptualization of all things, those who dwell in the state of the unity of the cosmos, those who dwell in the state of ungraspability of the realm of beings, those who dwell in the state of the nonorigination of all things, those who dwell in the state of nonattachment to all worlds, those who dwell in the state of nonreliance on what all worldlings rely on, those who dwell in the state of having shed everything those who dwell in the state of independence from all supports, those who dwell in the state of independence of all bodily existence, those who dwell in the state of annihilation of all afflictive notions, those who dwell in the state of the essence of all things, those who dwell in the state of freedom from false imaginings, those who dwell in the state of detachment from all thought, those who dwell in the state of neither entering nor leaving all perceptions, those who dwell in the state of entry into profound transcendent wisdom, those who dwell in the state of capacity to penetrate the realm of reality in all its aspects, those who dwell in the state of ability to extinguish all afflictions, those who dwell in the higher state of wisdom free from all views, cravings, and conceits, those who dwell in the state of freedom arising from higher knowledge of all meditations, liberations, concentrations and spiritual attainments, those who dwell in the state of development of all spheres of concentration of enlightening beings, those who dwell in the state of presence with all buddhas. This is the abode of those who dwell in the state where one eon enters all eons and all eons enter one eon; those who dwell in the state of the totality of one land and all lands as one land; those who dwell in the state where one thing and all things, all things and one thing, harmonize without conflict; those who dwell in the state of the unity of one being and all beings as one being; those who dwell in the state of nonduality of one buddha and all buddhas, all buddhas and one buddha; those who dwell in the state of instantaneous penetration of all meanings; those who dwell in the state of going to all lands in a single mental pulse; those who dwell in the state of appearance in the abodes of all beings; those who dwell in the state of willing welfare and happiness for all beings; those who dwell in the state of attainment of complete independence.

'di ni/ gang de dag 'jig rten gyi gnas thams cad las gyen du 'phags kyang sems can thams cad yongs su smin par bya ba'i phyir 'gro ba thams cad kyi gnas na snang ba dang / gang de dag zhing thams cad la mi gnas kyang de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad la mchod pa bya ba'i phyir zhing thams cad du rjes su spyod pa dang / gang de dag sangs rgyas kyi zhing thams cad kyi rgyan yongs su gzung ba'i phyir zhing thams cad du rjes su spyod kyang gnas nas g.yo ba med pa dang / gang de dag de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi zhabs kyi drung na 'dug kyang sangs rgyas kyi 'du shes su mngon par zhen pa dang bral ba dang / gang de dag dge ba'i bshes gnyen thams cad la brten pa'i gnas la rnam par spyod kyang 'gro ba thams cad na de'i ye shes la mnyam zhing 'dra ba med pa dang / gang de dag bdud kyi gnas thams cad na spyod kyang 'dod pa'i yon tan gyi dga' ba dang bral ba dang / gang de dag 'du shes kyi rnam pa'i gnas thams cad la rnam par spyod kyang 'du shes kyi rnam pa thams cad rnam par bsal ba'i yid dang ldan pa dang / gang de dag 'gro ba thams cad du khyab pa'i lus dang ldan yang bdag dang sems can du gnyis su bya bar mi spyod pa dang / gang de dag 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad kyi khong du chud pa'i lus dang ldan yang chos kyi dbyings tha dad du bya ba'i gnas la rnam par mi spyod pa dang / gang de dag ma 'ongs pa'i bskal pa thams cad du gnas par bya ba'i smon lam dang ldan yang bskal pa ring pa dang thung ba'i 'du shes kyi rnam pas rnam par mi spyod pa dang / gang de dag skra'i rtse mo gcig nas mi g.yo yang 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du snang ba de lta bur sgrub dka' ba'i chos kyi phyogs la 'jug par rnam par spyod pa de dag gi gnas so/ /

“This is the abode of those who have dropped all attachments to the world yet appear in the abodes of all beings in order to develop them to maturity; those who are not attached to any land but travel in all lands in the service of buddhas, those who travel in all lands to encompass the arrangement of all buddha-lands, without leaving where they are; those who are in the presence of all buddhas while free from attachment to the conception of Buddha; those who continue to associate with spiritual friends, even though they have no peer in any world in terms of knowledge; those who dwell in the abodes of all demons while yet being detached from passion; those who dwell in the state of comprehension of all ideas while their minds are clear of all ideas; those who adapt to all beings without duality between self and other; those who are physically present in all worldly realms without being cut off from the realm of reality; those who vow to remain in the world for all time without dwelling on the idea of long or short periods; those who appear in all worlds without moving from one spot.
“This is the abode of those who abide in the state of entering everywhere into the recondite realms of truth; those who dwell in the state hard to know;

'di ni/ zab mo'i gnas la rnam par spyod pa/ mi gnyis pa'i gnas la rnam par spyod pa/ mtshan nyid med pa'i gnas la rnam par spyod pa/ gnyen po med pa'i gnas la rnam par spyod pa/ mi dmigs pa'i gnas la rnam par spyod pa/ spros pa med pa'i gnas la rnam par spyod pa/ byams pa chen po dang snying rje chen po'i gnas la rnam par spyod pa/ nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas thams cad kyis chud par dka' ba'i gnas la rnam par spyod pa/ bdud kyi yul thams cad las yang dag par 'das pa'i gnas la rnam par spyod pa/ 'jig rten gyi yul thams cad kyis ma gos pa'i gnas la rnam par spyod pa/ byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyi gnas kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i gnas la rnam par spyod pa/ sangs rgyas thams cad kyi gnas dang mthun pa'i gnas la rnam par spyod pa rnams kyi gnas so/ /

those who dwell in the profound state; those who dwell in the nondual state; those who dwell in the signless state; those who dwell in the unopposed state; those who dwell in the ungraspable state; those who dwell in the nonconceptual state; those who dwell in the state inconceivable to all individual illuminates; those who dwell in the state that is beyond the sphere of all demons; those who dwell in the state that is undefiled by any worldly objects; those who dwell in the state of the transcendent ways of enlightening beings; those who dwell in the state of conformity to the state of all buddhas.

gang de mtshan ma thams cad dang bral ba'i gnas la rnam par spyod kyang nyan thos kyi skyon med par mi 'jug pa dang / gang de dag chos thams cad skye ba med pa'i gnas la rnam par spyod kyang mi skye ba'i chos nyid du mi ltung ba dang / gang de dag mi sdug pa'i gnas la rnam par spyod kyang 'dod chags dang bral ba'i chos nyid mngon du mi byed do/ 'dod chags kyi chos dang yang lhan cig mi gnas pa dang / gang de dag byams pa'i gnas la rnam par spyod kyang zhe sdang gi dri ma'i rjes su stong ba'i sems med pa dang / gang de dag rten cing 'brel pa'i gnas la rnam par spyod kyang chos thams cad la shin tu rmongs pa med pa dang / gang de dag bsam gtan bzhi'i gnas la rnam par spyod kyang bsam gtan gyi dbang gis mi skye ba dang / gang de dag tshad med pa bzhi'i gnas la rnam par spyod kyang sems can yongs su smin par bya ba'i don du gzugs kyi khams kyi lam gyi rgyud du mi 'dong ba dang / gang de dag gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bzhi'i gnas la rnam par spyod kyang snying rje chen pos yongs su zin pas gzugs med pa'i khams kyi lam gyi rgyud du mi 'dong ba dang / gang de dag zhi gnas dang lhag mthong gi gnas la rnam par spyod kyang sems can yongs su smin par bya ba'i phyir bdag gis rig pa'i rnam par grol ba mngon du mi byed pa dang / gang de dag btang snyoms chen po'i gnas la rnam par spyod kyang sems can gyi khams yongs su mi gtong ba dang / gang de dag stong pa nyid kyi gnas la rnam par spyod kyang lta ba'i rnam pa la mi gnas pa dang / gang de dag mtshan ma med pa'i spyod yul dang ldan yang mtshan ma la spyod pa'i sems can rnam par gdul ba la brtson pa dang / gang de dag smon lam thams cad dang bral ba yin yang byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa'i smon lam gyi rgyun mi 'chad pa dang / gang de dag las dang nyon mongs pa thams cad la dbang bsgyur yang sems can yongs su smin par bya ba'i don du las dang nyon mongs pa'i rjes su 'brang bar snang ba dang / gang de dag shi 'pho dang skye ba yongs su shes kyang tshe'i shi 'pho dang skye ba yongs su ston pa dang / gang de dag 'gro ba thams cad las rnam par log kyang sems can gdul ba'i dbang gis 'gro ba thams cad du 'dong ba dang / gang de dag byams pa la rnam par spyod kyang gang la yang chags par rnam par spyod pa med pa dang / gang de dag snying rje la rnam par spyod kyang gang la yang chags par lta bas rnam par spyod pa ma yin pa dang / gang de dag dga' ba la rnam par spyod kyang sems can sdug bsngal ba la rnam par lta bas rtag tu mi dga' ba dang / gang de dag btang snyoms la rnam par spyod kyang gzhan gyi don la rtag tu 'bad pa dang / gang de dag mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu la rnam par spyod kyang 'dod pa'i khams su skye ba la mi smod pa dang / gang de dag skye ba thams cad la mi gnas par rnam par spyod kyang yang dag pa'i mtha' mngon du bya ba la rnam par mi spyod pa dang / gang de dag rnam par thar pa gsum la rnam par spyod kyang nyan thos kyi rnam par thar pa thob par bya ba la rnam par mi spyod pa dang / gang de dag 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi rnam par blta ba la rnam par spyod kyang 'bras bu mngon du bya ba'i phyir rnam par mi spyod pa dang / gang de dag rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba zab mo brtag pa la rnam par spyod kyang shin tu 'gog par ltung ba la rnam par mi spyod pa dang / gang de dag 'phags pa'i lam gyi yan lag brgyad sgom pa la rnam par spyod kyang shin tu 'byung ba la rnam par mi spyod pa dang / gang de dag so so'i skye bo'i sa las shin tu 'das par rnam par spyod kyang nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi sar ltung ba la rnam par mi spyod pa dang / gang de dag nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga yongs su shes pa la rnam par spyod kyang phung po shin tu 'gog par ltung ba la rnam par mi spyod pa dang / gang de dag bdud kyi lam bzhi las shin tu 'das par rnam par spyod kyang bdud du rtog pa la rnam par mi spyod pa dang / gang de dag skye mched drug las shin tu 'das par rnam par spyod kyang shin tu mngon par grub pa la rnam par mi spyod pa dang / gang de dag de bzhin nyid la rnam par spyod kyang yang dag pa'i mthar ltung ba la rnam par mi spyod pa dang / gang de dag theg pa thams cad kyi 'byung ba yongs su ston pa la rnam par spyod kyang theg pa chen po las nyams pa la rnam par mi spyod pa de dag de lta bur yon tan gyi gnas thams cad la rnam par spyod pa rnams kyi gnas so/ /

“This is the abode of those who dwell in the state that is void of signs yet do not enter the unchangeability of individual illuminates; those who dwell in the abode of nonorigination of all things and yet do not fall into the condition of nonorigination; those who dwell in contemplation of impurity yet do not make the condition of dispassion their final realization, nor do they live with elements of passion; those who dwell in the state of love, their minds not stained by hatred; those who dwell on interdependent origination, ultimately free from delusion in regard to all things; those who dwell in the four meditation states, yet do not come under the sway of meditation; those who dwell on the four immeasurables, yet do not go to the world of pure form, so that they may develop all sentient beings; those who dwell in the states of the four formless attainments, yet do not go to the formless world, because of universal compassion; those who dwell in the state of tranquillity and insight, yet do not realize knowledge and liberation for themselves alone, so that they may develop all sentient beings; those who dwell in the state of universal equanimity, yet do not abandon the realm of sentient beings; those who dwell in the state of emptiness yet do not stick to it as a view; those whose sphere is not in appearances yet who confront the guidance of beings who act on appearances; those who have no wishes at all, yet do not give up the vows of enlightening beings; those who can control all active afflictions, yet for the sake of developing sentient beings appear to act under the influence of afflictions; those who have ended death and birth by perfect knowledge, yet appear to be born and die; those who are detached from all conditions of existence, yet go into all conditions of existence by the power to guide all beings; those who dwell in love but have no emotional attachment; those who dwell in compassion but show no hesitation; those who dwell in joy but are always grieving because they watch all who are suffering; those who dwell in equanimity while working for others; those who dwell in the attainments of the nine successive stages of meditation, yet do not disdain the realm of desire; those who are independent of all becoming yet do not dwell in the experience of the absolute; those who dwell in the three liberations but do not dwell in the feeling of liberation of individual saints; those who observe the four holy truths but do not dwell in the experience of the result; those who dwell in profound contemplation of interdependent origination but do not dwell in attachment to the ultimate; those who practice the eightfold holy path but do not dwell in ultimate emancipation; those who transcend the states of sentient beings but do not dwell in attachment to individual liberation; those who have perfect knowledge of the five grasping clusters but do not dwell in ultimate extinction of the clusters; those who are beyond the four demons but do not dwell on the idea of demons; those who have transcended the senses yet do not remain ultimately inoperative; those who dwell in Thusness, but do not dwell in the absolute limit of reality; those who show all vehicles of emancipation but do not leave the Great Vehicle—this is the abode of those who abide in all virtues.”
de nas tshong dpon gyi bu nor bzang gis de'i tshe tshigs su bcad pa 'di dag smras so/ /
Then Sudhana spoke these verses:

'di la thugs rje chen po brnyes pas rnam dag pa/ / byams pa shes gnyen dpal chen 'jig rten phan brtson pa/ / dbang bskur sa gnas rgyal ba'i sras kyi thu bo ste/ / sangs rgyas yul la rjes su dgongs shing rnam par spyod/ /
rgyal ba'i sras po grags pa chen po mnga' ba rnams/ / ye shes chen po'i spyod yul rnam thar bzhugs pa dag / gang rnams chos dbyings kun tu thogs med rnam rgyu ba/ / dpe zla med pa de dag gnas ni 'di 'dra yin/ /
dul sbyin tshul khrims bzod pa brtson 'grus stobs kyis 'phags/ / bsam gtan mngon shes stobs kyi mthar phyin shes rtogs pas; ; shes rab thabs dang smon lam stobs la gnas pa rnams/ / theg chen pha rol phyin pa rnams kyi gnas 'di yin/ /
'di ni chags med blo gros bsam pa rgya chen te/ / nam mkha'i spyod yul ldan pa mi gnas mi rten pa/ / dus gsum thams cad rgyas 'gengs bsgribs pa med pa rnams/ / srid kun dngos po rnam par bsgoms pa rnams kyi gnas/ /
gang rnams chos kun mi skye'i tshul la zhugs pa rnams/ / chos kyi rang bzhin nam mkha'i dngos nyid rtogs mdzad la/ / ci la'ang gnas pa mi mdzad nam mkha'i bya bzhin te; ; mkhyen pas bsnyengs pa mi mnga' de dag gnas 'di yin/ /
gang rnams 'dod chags zhe sdang gti mug rang bzhin dngos/ / rtog pa'i rgyus bskyed phyin ci log las byung mkhyen nas; ; 'dod chags bral ba'ang rnam par rtog par mi mdzad pa/ / zhi dang nye bar zhi ldan de dag gnas 'di yin/ /
gang rnams rnam par thar dang bden tshul 'phags lam dang / / phung po de bzhin khams dang skye mched rten pa'i dngos/ / yongs su rtogs mdzad mkhas pa zhi bar mi ltung ba/ / shes rab thabs la mkhas pa de dag gnas 'di yin/ /
gang rnams sgrib pa med pa'i ye shes phyogs bzhugs shing / / rgyal ba'i zhing la yongs rtog rnam rtog kun zhi la/ / chos rnams dngos po'i rang bzhin med par rtogs mdzad pa/ / zhi bar gzhol ba de dag gnas ni 'di 'dra'o/ /
gang rnams chags med spyod pas chos dbyings 'di dag tu/ / dngos dang bral bar rnam spyod mkha' yi rlung 'dra ba/ / dngos po kun dang bral zhing dngos med rnam spyod pa/ / mi gnas blo mnga' de dag gnas ni 'di yang 'dra/ /
gang rnams ngan song rgyud du 'gro ba song gyur te/ / sdug bsngal nad pa mi bde nyams su myong gzigs shing / / byams pa'i 'od kyis ngan song thams cad zhi mdzad pa/ / byams dang thugs rje'i thugs mnga' de dag gnas 'di yin/ /
nyam nga'i 'khor na gnas shing 'phags lam gol gyur te/ / 'gron po dmus long dmigs dang bral bar gyur 'dra ba'i/ / 'jig rten gzigs shing bar lam rab la 'god mdzad pa/ / 'gron po'i bsel rab 'dra ba de dag gnas 'di yin/ /
gang rnams skye dang mya ngan rga shi dbang gyur pa'i/ / 'gro ba bdud kyi zhags pas yongs su bcings gzigs shing / / rnam par bkrol nas mi 'jigs phyogs bder 'don mdzad pa/ / dpa' bo de dag thub par dka' ba'i gnas 'di yin/ /
nyon mongs nad pa'i 'gro mang gang gis gzigs gyur cing; ; ye shes bdud rtsi sman chen yongs su bsdu mdzad nas/ / thugs rje chen po bskyed cing yongs su 'grol mdzad pa/ / sman pa'i rgyal po chen po 'dra ba'i gnas 'di yin; ;
gang gis 'gro mang sdug bsngal mgon med gyur pa rnams/ / nyon mongs gtos su lhung ste tsham gyi mtshor lhung ba/ / gzigs shing dge ba'i chos kyi gru chen yongs sbyar te/ / sgrol mdzad mnyan pa'i bu 'dra de dag gnas 'di yin/ /
gang gis nyon mongs rgya mtsho spyod pa'i 'gro gzigs shing / / thams cad mkhyen thugs rin chen dgongs dag sems can mchog / srid pa'i rgya mtshor gshegs shing mngon par 'dren mdzad pa/ / mnyan pa'i bu ltar spyod pa de dag gnas 'di yin/ /
smon lam gnas na bzhugs shing thugs rje byams spyan gyis/ / gang rnams sems can gnas su rnam par gzigs mdzad cing / / srid pa'i rgya mtsho gnas pa'i 'gro mang mngon 'don pa/ / mkha' lding gzhon 'dra de dag gnas ni 'di 'dra'o/ /
gang rnams chos dbyings mkha' la nyi zla 'dra tshul du/ / sems can gnas su 'od kyis khyab par rnam spyod pa/ / smon lam dkyil 'khor ye shes dri med bzang po'i 'od/ / 'jig rten snang bar mdzad pa de dag gnas 'di yin/ /
gang rnams sems can gcig ni yongs su smin bya'i phyir/ / phyi mtha'i bskal pa bye ba zad du brtan gnas la/ / sems can gcig la ji bzhin de bzhin 'gro ba kun/ / 'jig rten mgon du gyur pa de dag gnas 'di yin/ /
gang rnams 'byams klas zhing gcig mtha' yi bskal par yang / / 'gro don brtson 'grus skyo med spyod pa rnam spyod pa/ / zhing gcig ji bzhin de bzhin phyogs rnams kun tu ste/ / bsam pa rdo rje bzhin brtan de dag gnas 'di yin/ /
gang rnams phyogs bcu'i bde gshegs rnams kyi chos sprin la/ / stan gcig gnas bzhin rmongs pa med pa 'thung byed kyang / / phyi mtha'i bskal pa khrag khrig bgrangs par mi ngoms sems/ / blo chen rgya mtsho lta bu'i gnas ni 'di 'dra'o/ /
gang rnams zhing mang rgya mtsho brjod du med 'dod zhing / / mgon po'i 'khor rnams rgya mtshor yongs su 'jug byed la/ / rgyal ba'i mchod pa sna tshogs rgya mtsho rab byed pa/ / chags med spyod yul mnga' ba de dag gnas 'di yin/ /
brtan pa grangs rnams smon lam rgya mtshor 'jug byed cing / / spyod pa rgya mtsho mtha' dang dbus med zhugs gyur te/ / 'gro la phan phyir bskal pa rgya mtsho mang spyod pa/ / yon tan 'byung gnas de dag gnas ni 'di 'dra'o/ /
gang rnams skra rtsa gcig tu zhing rnams thams cad dang / / sangs rgyas thams cad bskal pa mtha' dang dbus med pa/ / 'dzud cing de yi tshul la 'jug kyang rmongs med pa/ / chags pa med pa'i mig can rnams kyi gnas 'di yin/ /
gang rnams sems kyi skad cig gcig la rgya mtsho yi/ / bskal pa 'dzud byed zhing dang sangs rgyas 'gro ba rnams/ / de bzhin 'dzud byed bsgribs med ye shes dran gnas pa; ; yon tan mthar phyin de dag gnas ni 'di 'dra'o/ /
gang rnams zhing mang thams cad rdul du bgrangs byas shing / / chu ba ma lus thams cad thigs pas tshad bzung ste; ; de snyed grangs su smon lam mngon par sgrub byed pa/ / chags med bgrang ba de dag gnas ni 'di 'dra 'o/ /
smon lam gzungs dang ting 'dzin sgo la 'jug bya ba/ / bsam gtan rnam thar smon lam sgo rnams de bzhin te/ / bskal pa mtha' yas mngon par sgrub cing rnam spyod pa/ / bde gshegs sras po dgongs ldan de dag 'dir 'dong ngo/ /
'di na gnas pa rgyal sras rnam pa sna tshogs te/ / tshig dang don ldan gtsug lag mang po mngon par sgrub/ / 'gro la bder 'gyur bzo yi gnas su bya ba dag / rjes su bsam shing dam pa'i gnas na rnam par spyod/ /
'di na gnas pa mngon shes thabs dang ye shes kyis/ / phyogs bcu'i sems can 'gro rgyud sna tshogs ji snyed pa/ / kun tu skye zhing 'chi ba'i khyad par rnam par ston/ / rnam thar sgyu ma'i tshul gnas chags med spyod dang ldan/ /
'di na gnas pa thog mar sems bskyed nyer bzung zhing / / chos bzang mthar thug chos kyi spyod pa yongs su ston/ / sprul pa'i sprin gyis chos dbyings yongs su rgyas bkang zhing / / de bzhin rnam 'phrul brgya mang kun kyang nye bar ston/ /
gang rnams sems kyi cha gcig byang chub rnam sangs rgyas/ / ye shes blo gros mtha' dang dbus med la 'jug pa/ / thos te rnam par bsam na 'jig rten rmongs su rung / / thub par dka' ba de dag gnas ni 'di 'dra'o/ /
'di ni chags med blo gros rnams/ / chos dbyings bsgribs pa med pa rnam par spyod byed pa/ / dmigs pa med pa'i spyod yul can/ / dri med bsam pa'i blo gros gnas yin no/ /
gang rnams chags pa med spyod cing / / zhing rnams kun tu gnas pa med par rnam spyod pa/ / mi gnyis shes la spyod pa yi/ / mnyam pa med pa de dag gnas 'di yin/ /
gang rnams nam mkha'i rang bzhin dang / / mnyam pa'i chos rnams gnas med zhi ba rtogs gyur te/ / gang rnams mkha' yul rnam spyod pa/ / rdul dang bral ba de dag gnas 'di yin/ /
'di ni snying rje'i sems ldan pa/ / gnas shing 'gro ba sdug bsngal gzir ba mthong gyur nas/ / 'jig rten phan par bsam brtson te/ / snying rje chen po brnyes pa rnam par spyod/ /
'di nas mi snang med gsal bar/ / sems can kun gyi gnas su thogs pa med par snang / / nyi ma zla ba'i dkyil 'khor bzhin/ / 'khor ba'i zhags pa kun las rnam par grol/ /
rgyal sras de dag 'di na gnas/ / rgyal ba rnams kyi zhabs drung thams cad kun na yang / / zhing rnams kun tu rab tu snang / / mtha' yas bskal pa rnams kyang zad par mdzad/ /
'di nas 'gro ba'i lus mnyam dang / / rgyal sras kun gyi lus dang grangs mang mnyam pa yi/ / sprul pa'i sprin gyis phyogs kyi rnams/ / ma lus thams cad rgyas par 'gengs par mdzad/ /
'di na bzhugs pa'i dpa' bo rnams/ / rgyal ba'i spyod yul thams cad yongs su 'jal byed cing / / bskal pa bye bar rnam spyod kyang / / yongs su ngoms par 'gyur ba'i dus med do/ /
'di ni ting 'dzin bye ba rnams/ / brjod du med pa skad cig re rer rtogs byas shing / / ting nge 'dzin gyi tshul bzhin du/ / sangs rgyas yul rnams rnam par ston pa mdzad/ /
'dir ni skad cig brjod med pa'i/ / bskal pa zhing rnams sangs rgyas mtshan la rab zhugs te/ / shin tu yangs pa'i blo ldan pa/ / bskal pa dpag tu med pa'i mthar yang 'byin/ /
'di na gnas shing tshad med pa'i/ / bskal par sems rgyud gcig gis rab tu 'jig pa byed/ / yongs rtog 'du shes med bral yang / / 'gro ba'i 'du shes dbang du ston pa byed; ;
de dag ting 'dzin 'di gnas su/ / zhugs kyang dus gsum thams cad gsal bar mngon du mthong / / skad gcig yud la gnas brten cing / / rnam thar gnas la rnam par spyod pa mdzad/ /
de dag rnam spyod gnas 'di na/ / ma g.yos lus kyis skyil mo krung du 'khod bzhin du/ / zhing rnams thams cad kun tu yang / / thams cad khyab par gcig car yongs su snang / /
khyu mchog de dag 'di na gnas/ / bde gshegs rnams las chos kyi rgya mtsho yang dag 'thung / / ye shes rgya mtshor rab tu zhugs/ / mi zad yon tan rnams kyi pha rol phyin/ /
'di na zhing rnams kun grangs dang / / bskal pa'i grangs dang de bzhin chos kyi grangs rnams dang / / rgyal ba kun gyi mtshan gyi grangs/ / sgrib med sems pa rnam par dgongs pa mdzad/ /
rgyal sras de dag 'di na gnas/ / dus gsum zhing mang bgrangs pa thams cad ma lus par/ / de dag skad cig gcig gis kyang / / yongs su 'byung dang 'jig pa rnam par 'byed/ /
rgyal sras de dag 'di na gnas/ / rgyal ba'i spyod pa smon lam 'gro ba'i dbang po rnams/ / gnas na rnam par spyod byed kyang / / rgyal sras blo la thogs pa med pas mthong / /
rdul phran gcig la gang yod pa'i/ / 'khor rnams rgya mtsho zhing mang sems can de bzhin du/ / bskal pa rdul phran kun mnyam pa/ / sgrib pa med par mthong ba rnams kyis mthong / /
rdul phran kun rtser de bzhin du/ / 'khor dang zhing dang bskal pa thams cad ma lus par/ / kun kyang gzugs brnyan thabs tshul du/ / shin tu rnam phye yongs su mthong ba yin/ /
'di nas de dag chos rnams kyi/ / rang bzhin zhing rnams kun dang dus dang bskal pa dang / / yang dag sangs rgyas de bzhin te/ / rang bzhin dngos bral 'byung ba'i tshul gyis mkhyen/ /
'di nas sems can mnyam nyid dang / / chos rnams mnyam pa nyid dang sangs rgyas mnyam nyid dang / / zhing dang smon lam mnyam pa nyid; ; dus gsum mnyam pa nyid la'ang de bzhin 'jug /
sems can khrag khrig rnam par 'dul/ / sangs rgyas khrag khrig rnams kyang de bzhin gzhan mchod byed/ / gzhan rnams chos la rnam par rtog /'on kyang brtan pa gnas mchog 'di na 'khod/ / bskal pa khrag khrig mang pos kyang / /
de dag smon lam ye shes yul blo'i rnam pa dag /bdag gis brjod par mi nus te/ / mtha' yas blo mnga' rnams kyi shin tu yang / / de dag smad pa mi mnga' ba/ / bsgribs med spyod yul rab la shin tu dgyes pa yi/ /
pho brang 'di la thal sbyar te/ / bdag kyang lus btud gus par phyag 'tshal lo/ / rgyal po'i sras kyi thu bo ste/ / bsgribs med spyod pa mnga' ba 'phags pa byams pa de/ /
rnam dag blo mnga' dpe med la/ / de yi rjes su bsam ste phyag 'tshal lo/ /

Here is the compassionate, pure-minded Maitreya, Radiant with love, striving for the good of the world; At the stage of coronation, heir of the buddhas, He dwells in contemplation of the enlightened realm.
This is the realm of great knowledge Of the illustrious offspring of buddhas, secure in liberation; This is the abode of those unrivaled ones Who travel the realm of reality without attachment.
This is the abode of those risen from the power of discipline, generosity, patience, and vigor, Who have reached perfection of the power of mystic knowledge by meditations, Who are firm in wisdom, technique, resolve, and power, Who have reached the goal of the Great Vehicle.
This is the abode of those of unobstructed intellect and broad mind, Enjoying the realm of space, free from dependence, Penetrating all times, free from obstruction, Clearly perceiving all being and becoming.
Those who understand the principle of nonorigination of all things Realize the nature of things as of the essence of space; They do not rest on anything, like a bird in the sky— This is the abode of those who are perfect in knowledge.
Those who, knowing the nature of passion, hatred, and delusion As unreal, evolving from thoughts, Go to dispassion, free from conception— This is their abode, who have realized peace and tranquillity.
Investigating the doors of liberation, the truths, their meanings, The path, the clusters, the senses, beings, and relativity, Those who do not become attached to quiescience, Who have wisdom and skill in means—this is their abode.
This is the abode of those who have entered the realm of unobstructed knowledge, In whom vain imaginings and false thoughts of lands and beings have ceased, Who have abandoned the notion of self-existence of things, Do not grasp things, and are filled with peace.
Those who traverse this cosmos unattached and unhindered Roam free of existents, like the wind in the sky; Free from all dependence, acting independently, This is their abode, those of independent wisdom.
This is the abode of the compassionate ones Who radiate love to extinguish all the ills Of all beings in the miserable states of views Suffering grievous pains.
In the confines of the mundane whirl, having lost the path of the wise, Like a troop of people born blind without a guide; Those who see the world like this and guide them to the path of liberation, Like the leader of a caravan—this is their abode.
This is the abode of those invincible warriors Who see the world in the snare of demons, Mastered by birth, sorrow, old age, and death, And lead the way to safety, peace, and emancipation.
Seeing this world afflicted, diseased, They gather the medicines of immortal knowledge And foster release, with great compassion; This is the abode of those like master physicians.
This is the abode of those like mariners Who make a ship of good ways To save those fallen in the sea of death, a mass of sorrows, Soothing troubled, helpless beings.
Those of pure minds devoted to omniscience Who relieve beings in the sea of affliction, Cross the ocean of existence and pull them out— This is their abode, who are like fishers.
This is the abode of those like giant birds Who watch the abodes of all beings With love and compassion, based on great vows, And pull beings out of the sea of existence.
This is the abode of those who course in the sky of reality, As suns and moons illumining the abodes of beings, With the orb of vows and rays of knowledge Lighting up the world.
This is the abode of the steadfast Who remain for eons to develop even one being, And as for one do the same for all, As refuges for the world.
This is the abode of those of adamant will Who spend endless ages in a single land Working tirelessly for the benefit of the world, And as in one land, do the same everywhere in the ten directions.
This is the abode of those like oceans of intellect Who imbibe the multitudes of teachings of buddhas In the ten directions at a single sitting And continue forever, alert and never complacent.
This is the abode of those unobstructed in action Who go forth to untold oceans of lands, Enter the assemblies of the Guides, And serve the buddhas in various ways.
This is the abode of the mines of all virtue Who have entered the infinite ocean of practice, Steadfast, plunging into the ocean of vows, Acting for the weal of the world for myriad eons.
This is the abode of those with unobstructed eyes Who perceive infinite lands, buddhas, beings, And ages, in a single point, going in and out Without encountering any boundaries.
This is the abode of those exalted in perfection of virtue Who perceive myriad eons, lands, buddhas, and beings In a single moment of awareness, Based on unobstructed knowledge.
This is the abode of those unattached and unhindered in action Who carry out as many vows As atoms in all lands And drops of water in the oceans.
They enter holy undertakings, mnemonic powers, concentrations, Meditations, liberations, and vows, Practicing these for endless eons; The mindful offspring of Buddha are in here.
Here abide the offspring of Buddha, various, diverse; They carry out many instructive talks, And, considering arts and sciences beneficial to the world, They dwell here, in the abode of the wise.
Here they dwell, in knowledge of means of supercognition, Of all the different patterns of existence everywhere; They see births and deaths everywhere, While grounded in liberation within illusion, unhindered in action.
Abiding here, from their first determination, They show spiritual practice based on the good; Filling the cosmos with multitudes of emanations, Thus they show hundreds of miracles.
Those who awaken to enlightenment in an instant of awareness Enter an endless variety of acts of knowledge; This is the abode of those who have reached what is hard to attain, Such that the thought of it would drive the worldling mad.
This is the abode of those whose minds are unhindered, Who course in the unobstructed reality realm, Whose sphere is that of nongrasping, Whose will and intellect are pure.
This is the abode of the peerless ones Who live and act in all worlds Without attachment, who abide In knowledge of nonduality.
This is the abode of the dispassionate Who realize phenomena are like space in essence, Without any basis, quiescent, And live among them as in space.
Here abide the merciful Who see the world injured by pain and sorrow And concentrate on the welfare of the world, Filled with great compassion.
Here the infinitely liberated Appear in the abodes of all beings Like the sun and moon, Free from the snare of the mundane whirl.
Here the offspring of Buddha stay, Yet in the presence of all buddhas, Appearing in all lands, Throughout endless eons.
While here they pervade all directions With multitudes of emanations, As many as the bodies of all enlightening beings, Equal to the universe.
The valiant ones are all in here Examining the sphere of the enlightened; They abide for countless eons Yet never become surfeited.
Here, in each instant awakening To untold millions of concentrations, They reveal the realm of buddhahood In accord with the concentration they enter.
Those of vast perception here Instantly gain access to Eons, lands, and buddha-names, Throughout measureless eons.
Here they enter infinite eons In a single thought, Free of false ideas, By control of thoughts of the world.
Here, in the abode of concentration, They see past, present, and future, Pinpointed on each instant, As they roam in the palace of liberation.
While here in this abode, Sitting cross-legged, without disappearing They simultaneously appear In all lands, everywhere.
Abiding here, these mighty ones Drink of the ocean of buddhas’ teachings, Having gone into the sea of knowledge And reached the other shore of inexhaustible virtue.
Here, with unobstructed thought, They think of the number of all buddhas, The number of all lands and ages, And the number of all phenomena as well.
Staying here, the offspring of buddhas Instantly discern the formation and decay Of all the lands there be In past, present, and future.
Here, in the palace of enlightening beings, They observe in all their difference The action of the buddhas, The aspirations and faculties of beings.
In a single atom they see Congregations, lands, beings, and ages, As numerous as all atoms, All there without obstruction.
In the same way They see in all atoms Congregations, lands, beings, and ages, All clearly defined.
Here they discern the essence of things, Of all lands, ages, and buddhas, As without inherent existence, Through the principles of nonbecoming.
Here they observe the equality Of beings, phenomena, and buddhas, And discern the equality of lands and endeavors Of past, present, and future.
The steadfast ones here in this best of abodes Guide millions of other beings, Glorify millions of buddhas, And also contemplate phenomena.
In millions of eons I could not tell The scope of the undertakings and knowledge Of the wise, beyond thought, So endlessly vast is it.
I bow in respect to the abode Of the blameless ones in the realm of nonobstruction And to the noble Maitreya, best of enlightening beings, Unhindered in action, incomparably pure in mind, always aware.

de nas tshong dpon gyi bu nor bzang gis khang pa brtsegs pa chen po rnam par snang mdzad kyi rgyan gyis brgyan pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams la de dag dang / byang chub sems dpa'i bstod pa gzhan tshad med pa dag gis kyang mngon par bstod de/ shin tu btud nas phyag 'tshal te rab tu gus par bltas nas rim gror byas te mngon tu byas nas mchod de khang pa brtsegs pa chen po rnam par snang mdzad kyi rgyan gyis brgyan pa'i snying po'i sgo na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po byams pa la blta bar ni/ mos/ byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po byams pa dang phrad par ni/ dga' zhing sdod sdod pa las/ des byang chub sems dpa' byams pa khang pa brtsegs pa de'i phyi rol gyi phyogs gzhan zhig nas srog chags brgya stong du ma'i 'khor dang / lha dang / klu dang / gnod sbyin dang / dri za dang / lha ma yin dang / nam mkha' lding dang / mi'am ci dang / lto 'phye chen po'i dbang po du mas mdun du byas te g.yas g.yon nas brgya byin dang / tshangs pa dang / 'jig rten gyi mgon po rnams kyis phyag bya zhing / yul de na gnas pa gnyen bshes su 'ong ba'i bram ze brgya stong mang pos bskor cing mdun du byas te/ khang pa brtsegs pa rnam par snang mdzad kyi rgyan gyis brgyan pa'i snying po logs su 'ongs pa mthong nas dga' rangs te mgu zhing nyams bde la/ tshim zhing yid bde ba skyes nas byang chub sems dpa' byams pa gang na ba de logs su mngon du bltas te thag ring po nas byang chub sems dpa' byams pa la lus thams cad kyis phab ste phyag byas so/ /

Having praised and honored the enlightening beings dwelling in the great tower of the chamber of adornments of Vairocana in this way with innumerable eulogies of enlightening beings, Sudhana stood at the foot of the tower wishing to see the great enlightening being, desirous of meeting Maitreya. Then he saw Maitreya outside the tower, coming from somewhere else, followed by a great number of beings, respectfully flanked by the gods Indra, Brahma, and the world guardians, surrounded by many relatives and priests, coming toward the great tower of the chamber of the adornments of Vairocana. Seeing Maitreya, Sudhana was uplifted in mind, very happy and joyful, and prostrated himself before Maitreya from afar.
de nas byang chub sems dpa' byams pas tshong dpon gyi bu nor bzang la bltas te 'khor kun la lag pa g.yas pas bstan nas yang dag pa'i yon tan gyis bsngags te tshigs su bcad pa 'di dag smras so/ /
Now Maitreya, seeing Sudhana, pointed him out to the crowd with his right hand and spoke these verses eulogizing the virtuous qualities he had actualized:

ltos shig bsam pa yongs su dag pa 'di/ / nor bzang nor rnams rab tu brtan pa'i bu/ / byang chub spyod pa dam pa yongs tshol zhing / / mkhas pa nga yi drung du nye bar 'ongs/ /
legs par 'ongs sam snying rje byams byung khyod/ / byams pa'i dkyil 'khor yangs par legs 'ongs sam/ / legs par 'ongs sam blta na rab zhi ba/ / spyad pa spyod tshe dub par ma gyur tam/ /
rnam dag bsam ldan tshur shog 'ongs pa legs/ / skyo med yid ldan tshur shog 'ongs pa legs/ / dbang po ma zhum tshur shog 'ongs pa legs/ / mkhas pa spyod tshe dub pa med grang ngo/ /
chos rnams thams cad rnam dbye'i don byung ba/ / 'gro ba thams cad rnam 'dul rab brtson pa/ / bshes gnyen thams cad bsnyen bkur rab zhugs pa/ / brtul zhugs mi g.yo brtan pa khyed 'ongs legs/ /
dge ba'i lam gyis 'ongs pa bder 'ongs sam/ / yon tan lam la gnas pa bder 'ongs sam/ / rgyal ba'i lam du zhugs pa bder 'ongs sam/ / lam rnams gang du'ang ngal bar ma gyur tam/ /
yon tan rang bzhin tshur shog bder 'ongs sam/ / dge bas mngon brlan tshur shog bder 'ongs sam/ / mtha' yas spyod yul legs par bder 'ongs sam/ / 'gro ba kun na khyod mthong shin tu dkon/ /
thob dang ma thob mnyam pa'i yid ldan pa/ / smad dang sdug bsngal ma grags rnam par spangs/ / 'jig rten chos la ut+pal pad+mo bzhin/ / yid la 'khrul med legs par bder 'ongs sam/ /
g.yo dang sgyu bral bsam pa dge ldan pa/ / nga rgyal dregs med snod kyi dam pa po/ / khro dang 'tshig med khengs shing 'gying pa med/ / blta na sdug pa khyod mthong legs pa yin/ /
tshur shog phyogs kun spyod yul mngon gyur pa/ / tshur shog rgyal ba'i mdzod rnams sgrub byed pa/ / tshur shog rgyal ba'i mdzod rnams 'phel byed pa/ / yid la dub med legs par khyod 'ongs sam/ /
tshur shog dus gsum yul ldan 'ongs pa legs/ / chos kyi dbyings la mos pa'i dkyil 'khor ldan; ; sangs rgyas kun gyi yon tan snying por byung / / mkhas pa legs par 'ongs sam mi ngal lam/ /
tshur shog 'jam dpal ye shes pad+mo'i mchog / tshur shog sprin dpal char pas rnam spel ba/ / rgyal ba kun gyi sras kyis btang ba tshur/ / khyod la bsgribs pa med pa'i phyogs kyang bstan/ /
ltos shig smon lam dra ba ci 'dra ba/ / chos dbyings rgyas 'gengs bsam gyis mi khyab ste/ / byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa lam bsgrubs pa/ / rgya che yang byed nor bzang 'dir 'ongs so/ /
bde bar gshegs pa'i spyod yul tshol byed cing / / rdul dang bral ba'i spyod pa 'gro ba'i phyir/ / smon lam rlabs chen yongs su 'dri byed cing / / skyo ba'i yid med 'di ni 'dir 'ongs so/ /
'das pa'i mgon pos gang la bslabs mdzad de/ / de bzhin ma byon rnams kyang slob 'gyur la/ / bde gshegs bzhugs pa'i spyad par bya ba rnams/ / yongs su dri phyir 'di ni 'dir 'ongs so/ /
'di ni bdag gi dge bshes chos smra ba/ / chos kun nan tan yongs su ston byed pa/ / byang chub sems dpa'i spyod lam yongs ston pa/ / yin zhes sems gcig bsam nas 'dir 'ongs so/ /
byang chub sems dpa' bdag gi blo skye ba/ / sangs rgyas sras po byang chub skyed byed pa/ / 'di dag bdag bshes sangs rgyas bsngags pa zhes/ / de ltar dge ba'i sems kyis 'dir 'ongs so/ /
'di dag skyed pas bdag gi ma lta bu/ / yon tan 'o ma ldud pas ma ma 'dra/ / byang chub yan lag yongs su skyong ba yin/ / dge bshes 'di dag gnod pa rnam par zlog /
rga shi thar byed sman pa lta bu ste/ / bdud rtsi'i char 'bebs brgya byin lha dbang 'dra/ / zla ba lta bur dkar po'i phyogs kyis rgyas/ / zhi ba'i phyogs ston nyi ma gsal ba 'dra; ;
dgra dang grogs la ri bo 'dra ba ste/ / rgya mtsho bzhin du mi 'khrug sems dang ldan/ / yongs su skyong dang mnyan pa 'dra ba zhes/ / de 'dra'i sems kyis nor bzang 'dir 'ongs so/ /
'jigs med skyob pas dpa' bo lta bu ste/ / ded dpon mgon dang skyabs su gyur pa yin/ / 'di dag bdag la bde stob mig yin zhes/ / de 'dra'i sems kyis dge bshes bsnyen bkur byed/ /
chos kyi phyogs rnams rtag tu ston pa ste/ / sangs rgyas yon tan ye shes ston pa yin/ / ngan song ngan 'gro thams cad sbyong bar byed/ / dge bshes 'di dag bdag la dge ba ston/ /
'di dag rgyal ba'i mdzod kun stob pa yin/ / 'di dag rgyal ba kun gyi mdzod srung ste/ / 'di dag rgyal ba kun gyi gsang 'dzin ces/ / de ltar mkhas pa 'di ni dge bshes bsnyen/ /
ye shes phun ldan 'di las rnam par dag / gzugs dang longs spyod tshe rigs phun sum tshogs/ / 'di las phun sum tshogs kun dkon pa min/ / bsam pa de 'dras 'di ni 'dir 'ongs so/ /
bsam pa rlabs chen 'di la kun kyang ltos/ / mkhas pa'i dge bshes rnams la 'di sten cing / / mkhas pa 'di blo ci 'dra skyed pa ltos/ / khyod kyis rtag tu de ltar bslab par bya/ /
'di ni sngon gyi bsod nams dge ba'i rgyus/ / byang chub zhugs te 'jam dpal mthong gyur nas/ / de yi gdams ngag rjes su mthun spyod cing / / skyo ba med par rgyu ba 'di la ltos/ /
'dis ni dga' ba de thams cad kun spangs te/ / lha rdzas lta bu'i khyim yang yongs su spangs/ / pha ma ma ma skyid pa rgya chen kun/ / yongs su spangs shing bran ltar bshes gnyen sten/ /
mkhas pa 'dis ni bsam pa rnam sbyangs te/ / bdag gis mi lus yongs su spangs byas nas/ / sangs rgyas kun gyi pho brang 'gro bar 'gyur/ / de phyir 'bras bu de 'dra'ang thob par 'gyur/ /
'di ni rga dang nad kyis yongs mnar ba'i/ / srog chags sdug bsngal brgya yis gces pa rnams/ / skye shi mya ngan 'jigs pas gdungs mthong nas/ / de dag don du snying rje'i sems kyis spyod/ /
'gro rgyud lnga yi 'khor lo'i dkyil 'khor du/ / sdug bsngal 'khrul 'khor btsir ba'i 'gro mthong nas/ / sdug bsngal 'khrul 'khor 'khor lo 'joms pa yi/ / ye shes rdo rje sra ba 'di tshol lo/ /
'dod chags zhe sdang sdong tsher ma can/ / lta chags mang yongs su 'dzings pa yi/ / sems can zhing ni yongs su sbyong ba'i phyir/ / shes rab gshol brtan bzang po 'di tshol lo/ /
gti mug ma rig thibs po'i bsam pa can/ / 'gro ba shes rab mig stor dmigs med pa/ / de la phyogs bde ston pa'i mthu yod pa/ / 'gro ba'i ded dpon bzang por 'di 'gyur ro/ /
bzod pa'i go bgos rnam thar bzhon pa zhon/ / ye shes ral gris mya ngan dgra 'joms pas/ / mi 'jigs stob pa'i dpa' bor gyur pa 'di; ; 'gro ba rnams kyi lam ston 'gyur ba yin/ /
'di ni chos kyi gru rab sbyor ba ste/ / ye shes rgya mtsho'i lam la slob pa'o/ / zhi ba rin chen mchog gi gling skyel ba; ; 'di ni khams gsum mtsho yi skya ba 'dzin/ /
ye shes 'od zer smon lam dkyil 'khor can/ / sems can kun gyi gnas su snang byed pa'i/ / chos dbyings mkha' la 'od chen rab ldan par/ / 'di ni khams gsum nyi mar 'char bar 'gyur/ /
byams pa'i dga' ldan ting 'dzin dang bsil ba'i/ / sems can kun la snyoms sems 'od bzang la/ / dkar po'i chos kyi dkyil 'khor yongs rgyas pa'i/ / sangs rgyas zla ba 'di ni 'char bar 'gyur/ /
bsam pa'i gzhi rten brtan la rab gnas pa/ / byang chub spyod pas rim gyis 'phags pa ste/ / chos kun rin chen 'byung gnas ldan pa yi/ / ye shes rgya mtsho'i mchog tu 'di 'gyur ro/ /
byang chub sems kyi klu yi dbang gis byung / / chos kyi dbyings kyi mkha' la mngon par 'phags/ / dkar po'i 'bras bu'i lo tog 'phel byed pa'i/ / 'di ni 'gro bar chos sprin char 'bebs 'gyur/ /
dag pa'i snying po dri gsum mun sel ba; ; byams pa'i snum yod dran pa'i snod brtan pa/ / dri med byang chub sems bskyed 'od bzang ba'i/ / chos kyi mar me 'di ni 'bar byed 'gyur/ /
byang chub sems ni mar mer snying rje sko/ / byams pa rdos pa mi g.yo bsam pa mkhregs/ / byang chub yan lag mthar gyis byung ba yi/ / sangs rgyas sras su 'di ni yang dag skye/ /
bsod nams snying po mngon par 'phel bar byed/ / ye shes snying po yongs su sbyong bar 'gyur/ / 'di ni shes pa'i snying po 'char bar byed/ / smon lam ji bzhin snying po yang dag byung / /
snying rje byams pas sprul pa 'di 'dra ba/ / sems can dgrol blo phan pa'i bsam ldan pa/ / rnam dag yid can 'di ni ci 'dra ba/ / de 'dra'i 'gro ba lha dang mir bcas dkon/ /
'di 'dra'i bsam pa rab tu rtsa brtan la; ; 'di 'dra'i sbyor ba brtan pas rnam 'phel cing / / srid gsum yog par byed pa 'di 'dra ba'i/ / ye shes shing chen 'bras bu 'byung ba dkon/ /
'di ni yon tan kun sgrub don du gnyer; ; chos rnams thams cad yongs su dri bar mos/ / the tshom thams cad rnam par bsal don du/ / le lo med par bshes gnyen thams cad sten/ /
'di ni bdud kyi dkrug ma nyon mongs 'joms/ / 'di ni lta ba'i dri ma srid pa sel/ / 'di ni 'gro ba thams cad dgrol la brtson/ / mkhas pa 'di ni rtag tu khyad par tshol/ /
yon tan lam la ma nor 'di gnas pas/ / 'di ni ngan song thams cad sbyong bar 'gyur/ / mtho ris lam yang nye bar ston par 'gyur/ / thar pa'i lam du 'gro ba 'dzud par 'gyur/ /
'di ni 'gro rgyud kun gyi sdug bsngal sel/ / 'di ni 'gro rgyud kun gyi bde ba stob/ / 'di ni srid pa kun gyi zhags pa thub/ / srid pa'i 'gro rgyud thams cad sel bar 'gyur/ /
lta ba dog pa rnam par 'byed par 'gyur/ / sred pa'i 'khri shing dra ba gcod par 'gyur/ / chags pa'i 'dod chags nye bar sbyong bar 'gyur/ / srid gsum lam yang yongs su ston par 'gyur/ /
'di ni 'jig rten mgon dang skyabs yin te/ / 'di ni 'gro ba kun la 'od byed pa'o/ / rnam pa kun tu srid pa sel la mkhas/ / sa gsum kun gyi 'dren par 'di 'gyur ro/ /
nyon mongs gnyid log 'gro ba sad par byed/ / 'dod pa'i 'dam las mkhas pa 'di sgrol te/ / 'du shes chags las yongs su 'di yang 'grol/ / bcings pa kun las thar bar byed par 'gyur/ /
chos dbyings gzhi yi bye brag snang bar byed/ / 'jig rten khams kyi bye brag sbyong bar 'gyur/ / chos kun gzhi yi bye brag pha rol phyin/ / nor bzang khyod ni dga' ba skyed par 'gyur/ /
mkhas pa khyod kyi sbyor ba'i tshul dag dang / / dag cing khyod la smad pa med tshul dang / / khyod kyi bsam pa'i yon tan ldan tshul las/ / bsam pa thams cad yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur/ /
khyod kyis bdag nyid dge bar byas tshul gyis/ / ring por mi thogs sangs rgyas kun mthong 'gyur/ / ring por mi thogs zhing rnams kun 'gror 'gyur/ / chos kun ring por mi thogs shes par 'gyur/ /
zhing rnams rgya mtsho rnam par sbyong bar 'gyur/ / sems can rgya mtsho rnam par 'grol bar 'gyur/ / spyod pa rgya mtsho yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur/ / khyod kyi nan tan rgya mtsho de 'dra'o/ /
khyod kyi mos pa'i dkyil 'khor tshul las na/ / khyod ni yon tan rnams kyi snod du 'gyur/ / khyod ni dge ba yang dag 'byung gnas 'gyur/ / khyod ni rgyal ba'i sras dang mnyam par 'gyur/ /
khyod kyi smon lam dkyil 'khor tshul las na/ / khyod kyis bdud kyi dkyil 'khor pham par byas/ / khyod kyis las kyi dkyil 'khor rnam par sbyangs/ / nyon mongs dkyil 'khor khyod kyis dag par byas/ /
ye shes rgyud ni rnam par sbyong bar 'gyur/ / chos kyi rgyud ni rab tu brjod par 'gyur/ / las dang nyon mongs sdug bsngal 'khrul 'khor rgyud/ / ring por mi thogs rnam par zlog par 'gyur/ /
'jig rten 'khor lo srid pa'i 'khor lor brten/ / shu ba'i lam rgyud lnga yi 'khor lor rmongs/ / 'gro kun sdug bsngal 'khor lo gcod pa yi/ / chos kyi 'khor lo dam pa bskor bar 'gyur/ /
sangs rgyas rigs ni rjes su 'dzin par 'gyur/ / chos kyi rigs ni yongs su sbyong bar 'gyur/ / dge 'dun rigs ni yongs su sdud par 'gyur/ / rin chen 'byung ba'i 'byung gnas khyod 'gyur ro/ /
sred pa'i dra ba rnam par zlog par 'gyur/ / lta ba'i dra ba thibs po de bzhin te/ / 'gro ba'i sdug bsngal dra ba 'grol bar 'gyur/ / smon lam dra ba de ni khyod kyis sbyangs/ /
sems can khams ni yongs su smin byed 'gyur/ / 'jig rten khams ni yongs su sbyong bar 'gyur/ / ye shes khams ni shin tu dag byed 'gyur/ / khyod kyi bsam pa'i khams ni de 'dra'o/ /
nor bzang dga' ba 'phel bar byed pa khyod/ / sems can kun la phan bde dga' byed 'gyur/ / byang chub sems dpa'i rigs rgyud dga' byed cing / / sangs rgyas thams cad smon lam dga' byed 'gyur/ /
sems can kun gyi 'gro ba'i gnas ston pa/ / zhing rnams thams cad gzugs brnyan snang ston pa/ / chos rnams thams cad snang ba rab ston pa'i/ / blta na bzang ba'i rgyal bar khyod 'gyur ro/ /
chos dbyings snang bar byed pa'i 'od ldan pa/ / sems can khams rnams bde byed 'od ldan pa/ / ngan song thams cad zhi byed 'od ldan pa'i/ / srid gsum sdug bsngal zhi bar byed par 'gyur/ /
mtho ris lam ni nye bar ston par 'gyur/ / sangs rgyas lam ni 'gro la 'byed par 'gyur/ / thar pa'i lam du 'gro ba khrid par 'gyur/ / de 'dra'i lam ni khyod kyis rnam par sbyangs/ /
log pa'i lam ni rnam par zlog par 'gyur; ; skye bo 'phags pa'i lam la 'dul bar 'gyur/ / brtan pa'i blo gros le lo med pa khyod/ / mi g.yeng byang chub lam ni de ltar tshol/ /
srid pa'i rgya mtshor gnas pa'i lus can rnams/ / sdug bsngal mthar phyin bya bar khyod brtson pa/ / 'gro ba srid pa'i mtsho las sgrol bar 'gyur/ / khyod kyi yon tan mtsho chen de 'dra'o/ /
ye shes nyi ma mchog gi 'od zer mtshos/ / lus can nyon mongs rgya mtsho yongs bskams shing / / de dag nan tan mtsho la bkod byas nas/ / ye shes rgya mtshor rab tu 'god par 'gyur; ;
blo gros rgya mtsho rnam par 'phel bar 'gyur/ / spyod pa rgya mtsho rnam par sbyong bar 'gyur/ / sangs rgyas kun gyi smon lam rgya mtsho la/ / ring por mi thogs yongs su 'jug par 'gyur/ /
mkhas pa khyod ni blo gros rgya mtsho'i mthus/ / zhing rnams rgya mtsho mang por phyin par 'gyur/ / 'khor rnams rgya mtsho mang po mthong bar 'gyur/ / chos mang rgya mtsho yongs su 'thung bar 'gyur/ /
sangs rgyas sprin mang khrag khrig mthong bar 'gyur/ / mchod sprin shin tu rgya chen byed par 'gyur; ; chos kyi sprin mang khrag khrig thos par 'gyur/ / khyod ni smon lam de 'dra'i sprin kyang byed/ /
sems can thams cad gnas mang rgyas 'gengs 'gyur/ / zhing rnams kun gyi gnas su 'gro bar 'gyur/ / sangs rgyas kun gyi gnas su phyin par 'gyur/ / khyod ni de 'dra'i phyogs su zhugs pa yin/ /
khyod ni ting 'dzin gnas su 'jug par 'gyur/ / khyod kyis rnam thar gnas rnams thob par 'gyur/ / khyod ni mngon shes gnas la spyod par 'gyur/ / chos kyi dbyings kyi gnas la rab tu gnas; ;
nyi zla'i gzugs rnams rab tu snang ba ltar/ / sems can kun gyi gnas su 'char bar 'gyur/ / rgyal ba rnams kyi spyan sngar mngon 'byung 'gyur/ / khyod kyi 'byung ba'i lam chen de 'dra'o/ /
'jig rten kun la mi gnas spyod yul dang / / nam mkha'i spyod yul bzang por khyod spyod 'gyur/ / khyod kyi spyod yul rab tu zhi bar 'gyur/ / khyod kyi mngon shes spyod yul de 'dra'o/ /
mig 'phrul dra ba'i bye brag gzhi mkhas khyod/ / zhing gi dra ba'i bye brag ji snyed gzhi/ / ser po mkha' la chags pa med pa ltar; ; ring por mi thogs rgyas par 'gengs par 'gyur/ /
chos dbyings 'byams klas khong du chud par 'gyur/ / 'byams klas 'jig rten khams su 'gro bar 'gyur/ / dus gsum gshegs pa'i sangs rgyas 'byams klas kun/ / mthong bar 'gyur gyi nor bzang dga' bar gyis/ /
khyod kyis de 'dra'i rnam thar de lta bu/ / mthong la mthong zhing da dung mthong bar 'gyur/ / de bas mkhas pa skyo bar ma byed cig / dga' yangs zang zing med pa nyams su longs/ /
nor bzang khyod ni yon tan snod bzang ste/ / khyod ni rgyal ba rnams kyi gdams ngag mthun/ / khyod kyis tshul 'di yongs su gzung bar gnas/ / de bas rnam par 'phrul pa 'di dag mthong / /
sangs rgyas sras po gnas med spyod yul can/ / gang rnams mthong bar bskal pa khrag khrig tu/ / shin tu dka' na legs brjod mi smos pa/ / de dag spyod legs spyod tshe khyod kyis mthong / /
de ltar 'jam dpal mngon du mthong gyur te/ / de 'dra'i yon tan snod du gyur byas pa/ / khyod kyi thos pa rgya che bsam mi khyab/ / mi yi srid par khyod ni legs par 'ongs/ /
ngan song lam rnams thams cad rnam par zlog / mi khom ngan 'gro thams cad rnam par sbyangs/ / sdug bsngal chos rnams khyod kyis thams cad bor/ / mi dga' thams cad yongs su spang bar gyis/ /
byis pa'i sa ni khyod kyis rnam par bzlog / byang chub sems dpa'i yon tan sa la gnas/ / ye shes sa yi dam pa yongs bskang zhing / / sangs rgyas sa rab ring por mi thogs 'thob/ /
byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa rgya mtsho snyed/ / sangs rgyas ye shes nam mkha'i mdzod dang mtshungs/ / de yi tshad kyi smon lam gang chen mtsho/ / khyod kyis btsal zin shin tu dga' bar gyis/ /
de ltar dbang po yongs su mi skyo la/ / bsam pa brtan zhing sbyor ba nges pa rnams; ; gang dag 'di 'dra'i bshes gnyen sten byed pa/ / de dag ring por mi thogs mgon por 'gyur/ /
khyod kyi byang chub spyod pa sna tshogs kyis/ / sems can mang po dul bar 'gyur mthong zhing / / chos kun sgo yi byang chub spyod pa la/ / nam yang yid gnyis byed par ma gyur cig /
de ltar phun sum tshogs pa 'di 'dra 'di/ / sangs rgyas sras pos de ring 'dir mthong ba/ / don chos yon tan dad pa phun sum tshogs/ / khyod kyi bsod nams phun ldan bsam mi khyab/ /
de ltar rgyal sras rnams kyis rgyun 'brel bar/ / rang rang so so'i smon lam bstan byas te/ / khyod kyis de dag ma lus mthun rtogs pa/ / khyod kyis thob pa chen po ci 'dra ltos/ /
byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa'i snod gyur pa/ / de 'dra srid pa brgyar yang dkon pas na/ / de phyir rgyal sras de dag rgyun 'brel ba/ / khyod la rnam thar tshul rnams yongs su ston/ /
bskal pa khrag khrig bye bar 'gro ba gang / / bde gshegs sras dang lhan cig 'grogs gyur ba/ / de dag de rnams spyod yul mi shes te/ / de dag yon tan snod du bdag ma byas; ;
khyod kyis 'di 'dra'i tshul 'di thos par gyur/ / byang chub sems dpa' chen po'i rnam 'phrul pa/ / 'gro ba kun na dkon pa khyod kyis mthong / / de ltar nor bzang dga' ba'i yid du gyis/ /
khyod la sangs rgyas thams cad dgongs pa mdzad/ / byang chub sems dpa' khyod gzung phyir yang gnas/ / khyod kyang de dag rjes su bstan la gnas/ / legs so nor bzang khyod kyi 'tsho ba dge /
byang chub sems dpa'i rigs kyi chos la gnas/ / khyod ni rgyal sras yon tan rnams la slob/ / bde bar gshegs rigs rnam par 'phel byed 'gyur/ / nor bzang dga' ba rgya chen nyams su longs/ /
sangs rgyas mnyam med thams cad khyod kyi pha/ / byang chub sems dpa' thams cad khyod dang spun/ / byang chub yan lag thams cad khyod gyi gnyen/ / khyod ni bde gshegs thugs las skyes pa'i sras/ /
chos kyi rgyal po'i rigs kyi rgyud 'dzin pa/ / byang chub sems dpa'i rigs rgyud 'phel bar byed/ / ring por mi thogs chos rgyal 'thob 'gyur gyi/ / nor bzang dbang po tshim zhing dga' bar gyis/ /
sangs rgyas kun gyi dbang bskur dam pa yang / / ring por mi thogs rmad byung thob par 'gyur/ / rgyal ba'i sras dang mtshungs shing mnyam par 'gyur/ / khyod kyi spyod pa'i tshul mthun de 'dra'o/ /
mi gang ci 'dra'i sa bon 'debs byed pa/ / de ni de 'dra'i 'bras bu 'thob par 'gyur/ / dga' ba rgya chen bsam yas nyams su longs/ / ngas ni de ring khyod kyi dbugs kyang dbyung / /
tshe gcig khyod kyis gang rnams thog gyur pa/ / byang chub sems dpa' khrag khrig bsam yas pa/ / bskal pa khrag khrig byang chub spyod spyod pa/ / de dag gis kyang phun sum 'di ma rnyed/ /
'di rnams thams cad mos pa'i 'bras bu ste/ / brtson 'grus bsam pa dag ni de bzhin no/ / gang zhig spyod pa 'di 'drar dga' ba yang / / nor bzang spyod pa gang yin de la spyod/ /
spyod pa thams cad smon lam byung ba yin/ / chos rnams thams cad mos las yongs su gyur/ / nor bzang de ltar khyod kyis yongs su bsgrubs/ / rtag tu khyad par spyod pa btsal bar gyis/ /
klu yi bsam pa ji snyed byung gyur pa/ / de snyed char pa yongs su 'bab par 'gyur/ / smon lam ye shes spyod yul ji snyed pa/ / de snyed byang chub spyod pa rgyas par 'gyur/ /
nor bzang bzang po'i spyod ces bya ba 'di/ / tshul 'di khyod la bstan pa 'di yin gyi/ / de shes gyis la dge bshes rang bzhin gyis/ / bsnyen bkur byed tshe 'jigs par ma byed cig /
lus rnams bye ba sngon chad khyod kyis kyang / / 'dod pa'i don du don med zad byas soms/ / da ni byang chub yongs su tshol gyur na/ / brtul zhugs bzang po brtul bas zhig ko 'dod/ /
khyod kyis bskal pa bye ba 'das byas te/ / 'du byas sdug bsngal thams cad nyams su myong / / gang+gA'i bye snyed sangs rgyas mnyes ma byas/ / 'di 'dra'i tshul yang thos par ma gyur to/ /
de las da ni khom par mir yang skyes; ; sangs rgyas byung mthong dge bshes 'di 'dra ste/ / byang chub mchog gi spyod pa'ang thos par gyur/ / rnam dag sems su de ko cir mi 'gyur/ /
bde bar gshegs pa yang du 'byung bar 'gyur/ / dge bshes de bzhin chos mnyan thos par 'gyur/ / gal te bsam pa yongs su ma sbyangs na/ / tshul 'di phyin chad thos par dka' ba yin/ /
de bas dad dang mos dang bsam pa rnams/ / yongs su skyed la bla ma phu dud kyis/ / the tshom lta ba yongs su skyo spongs la/ / yang dang yang du 'di 'dra'i tshul nyon cig /
gang gis spyod la 'jug pa 'di 'dra 'di/ / thos nas de 'dra'i smon lam mngon bsgrubs pa/ / de dag ni [?] yi srid par legs par 'ongs/ /
gang gis de 'dra'i mos pa sbyangs pa ni/ / de la dge bshes thams cad mi dkon no/ /
de ni rgyal ba rnams kyi sras dang spun/ / de la phyin chad byang chub the tshom med/ / gang zhig 'di 'dra'i tshul 'dir zhugs gyur ba/ /
des ni log par ltung ba thams cad spangs/ / des ni sdug bsngal chos rnams thams cad bsal/ / des ni yon tan thams cad bsdu bar byas/ /
lus ni bor nas ring por mi thogs su/ / yongs su dag pa'i sangs rgyas zhing du 'gro / byang chub sems dpa'i gnas su 'jug par 'gyur/ / phyogs bcu'i de bzhin gshegs pa mthong bar 'gyur/ /
nor bzang khyod kyi sngon gyi rgyu sdug pas/ / da ltar byung la mos pa nges pa yis; ; khyad par don gnyer dge bshes bsten byas pas/ / chu las ut+pa la bzhin de phyir 'phel/ /
dge bshes thams cad phu dud bsam pa dang / / sangs rgyas thams cad dgyes bya'i bsam pa dang / / chos kun yongs su dri ba'i bsam pa can/ / brtul zhugs bzang po ldan pa dal gyis longs/ /
chos kyi nan tan kun la rab gnas pa/ / lam rnams rjes su kun tshol rab gnas pa/ / sangs rgyas sras kyi smon lam rab gnas pa/ / yon tan chos rnams kun gyi snod khyod longs/ /
mos pa phun sum tshogs pa ci 'dra bas; ; khyod kyis nga la phyag 'di byas pa ni/ / sangs rgyas thams cad 'khor du mngon sum du/ / ring por mi thogs yongs su 'byung bar 'gyur/ /
skyo ba'i yid med nor bzang legs pa yin/ / sangs rgyas kun gyi smon lam sems ldan pa/ / brtul zhugs brtan khyod ring por mi thogs par/ / sangs rgyas kun gyi yon tan mthar phyin 'gyur/ /
ye shes spyod yul rnam thar mthar phyin pa'i/ / 'jam dpal gan du nor bzang khyod song ste/ / bzang po'i spyod pa dam pa mchog dris shig / de tshul khyod 'jug de ni byed par 'gyur/ /

Look at Sudhana, pure in mind, born of enduring riches; Seeking the practice of supreme enlightenment, this wise one has come to me.
Welcome, son of compassion and love, universally kind; Welcome, tranquil eyes; do not flag in practice.
Welcome, pure of heart, tireless in mind; Welcome, buoyant in sense; do not flag in practice.
Having set out to contemplate all truths, guide all beings, And follow all spiritual benefactors, You are welcome, with your unshakable, steadfast resolve.
You are welcome, having come by a good path, on the path of virtue; You are welcome, having set forth on the path of the Victors; May you succeed, never stopping.
Welcome, full of virtue, enriched by goodness; Your scope of action is endless; it is rare to see such as you in the world.
You consider gain and not gaining equal, you are beyond censure, Misery, and ill repute; like a lotus, unstained by worldly things, You are undistracted in mind.
Your heart is pure, free of guile and deceit, a good receptacle, Free from pride and conceit; free from anger, not arrogant, You are a welcome sight.
Attentive to all fields of awareness, born of the treasures of every dimension, Developing the treasuries of all buddhas; welcome, indefatigable one.
Aware of past, present, and future, absorbed in the reality realm, Born of the womb of virtues of all buddhas; welcome, tireless hero.
Sprung from the ground of Manjushri’s knowledge, grown by the watering Of Meghashri, having sought out all enlightening beings, come— I will show you the unimpeded realm.
See this net of vows, pervading the cosmos, inconceivable; Spreading it, drawing forth the path of enlightening practice, Sudhana has come.
Seeking the realm of the Victors, pursuing the practice of the undefiled, Inquiring into the ocean of vows, this indefatigable one has arrived.
Asking where the past guides have studied, what the future ones will learn, And what the present ones practice, he has come here.
He comes with the thought of spiritual teachers, Guides to the realization of all truths, Teachers of the path of enlightening practice— Thus he has come here.
He comes with these thoughts: “Enlightening beings increase my wisdom And grant me enlightenment, they are praised by the buddhas.
“They are my parents, my wet nurses of virtue, always protecting my limbs of enlightenment, keeping me free from all harm.
“As physicians they release me from old age and death, As celestial beings they shower the ambrosia of immortality; They are like the moon, clear and full, like the sun, Showing the way to peace.
“They are like polar mountains, impartial to friend and foe, Like oceans, unshakable in mind, like pilots and protectors.
“They are valiant givers of fearlessness, reliable caravan leaders, guides who give me well-being”—with these thoughts he serves the Friends.
“They always show all spheres of truth, Showing the virtue and knowledge of all buddhas; Removing the ills of all states of woe, They show me what is good.
“They bestow the treasures of buddhas, They guard the treasuries of the Victors; They are holders of the secrets of the buddhas”— Thus this wise one follows the Friends.
See this wise one of lofty aspiration serving the Friends; You should study as he indicates.
By virtue of past goodness he saw Manjushri and set out for enlightenment, Acting on Manjushri’s instructions; observe his perseverance.
Having given up all comforts, home, family, and wealth, like an immortal, He attends the Friends as a servant.
Having purified his mind and relinquished his body, this wise one Will see the abode of all buddhas and henceforth develop this fruit.
Seeing people afflicted with sickness, beings tortured by a hundred pains, Burning with the fears and sorrows of birth and death, He compassionately acts for their benefit.
Seeing the world beaten by the mechanisms of suffering, In the repetitious circle of conditioning, He seeks the adamantine knowledge That breaks the mechanism of suffering and the circle of conditioning.
Aiming to clear all lands of the weeds and brambles of lust and hatred, Infestations of clinging to views, sprouts of harm, He seeks the strong plow of wisdom.
The mind of the world is thick with delusion and ignorance, Bereft of the eye of wisdom, without a guide; He will become a leader of the world, Showing the way to the abode of safety.
He will be a conveyor of tolerance and liberation, Assailing the enemy afflictions with the sword of knowledge, Heroic bestower of freedom from fear, teacher of the world.
He is assembling the ship of the Teaching, Having learned the route of the ocean of knowledge; He is a helmsman on the sea of existence, Leading to the treasure island of peace.
This buddha-sun will rise in the sky of reality, a great light, An orb of vows with rays of knowledge, illumining the abodes of all beings.
This buddha-moon will rise, a full orb of virtues Equally cooling with higher love, exquisite light impartial toward all.
Based on a firm ground of will, enlightenment practice gradually rising, He will become an ocean of knowledge, mine of all spiritual jewels.
Born of the dragon of the mind of enlightenment, ascended into the sky of reality, Raining the teachings everywhere, he fosters all good fruits.
He will light the lamp of truth, the pure wick, Dispelling the darkness of defilement, The lamp in a strong vessel of love and awareness, Glowing with the pure flame of the spirit of enlightenment.
From the embryo of the aspiration for enlightenment, compassion, and love, Gradually developing the limbs of enlightenment, this baby buddha is growing.
He will develop the embryo of virtue and clarify the path of knowledge; He is recognized as an embryo of knowledge, developed in accord With the womb of vows.
One like this, girt with compassion and love, An altruist determined to liberate beings, Is hard to find in the world, celestial or human, So pure is his mind.
Based on good roots of mind, grown through steadfast effort, Shading the three realms of being—such a fruit-bearing tree of knowledge Is hard to find.
Aiming to develop all virtues, inquire into all truths, And break through all doubts, he serves the Friends with diligence.
Destroying the afflictions of demons, clearing away views, defilement, and craving, Intent on freeing all beings, he has learned to do what is best.
He will clear away the states of woe and show heaven; he will lead the world On the road of liberation, on which virtuous path he stands.
He will become a destroyer of conditioned existence, Cutting through the net of all states of being, Liberating beings in all states from misery And giving them well-being.
He will free them from the straits of views, Cut through the entanglements of the web of craving, Clear away blameworthy passions, And become a guide on the path for the world.
He will be a refuge for the world, providing light for all beings, A guide in the three realms of existence, knowing becoming and decay everywhere.
He will purify people asleep in affliction, wisely pulling them from the mud of lust, Freeing them from clinging to notions, liberating them from bondage.
Rejoice, Sudhana, for you will illumine the various aspects of reality, Illumine the various aspects of the world, And reach the goal of the various aspects of all truths.
As your behavior is mild, as your faith is impeccable, As your intention is virtuous, you shall fulfill them all.
You will see all buddhas soon, you will soon go to all lands, You will soon know all truths—such good have you done on your own.
You will purify many lands and liberate masses of beings; You will fulfill myriad practices—such are your many attainments.
You will be a vessel of virtues, a source of good; You will be equal to the offspring of buddhas, in accord with your devotion.
You have conquered the demons and purified your actions; You have cleared away the afflictions in accord with your vows.
You will clear the path of knowledge and realize the path of truth; Before long you will halt the course of the mechanism of suffering, Which is due to afflictions in action.
You will turn the supreme wheel of truth, breaking the cycle of suffering Of all beings, which is based on the routines of the world, The circle of becoming, gone astray in repetition of mundane states.
You will preserve the lineage of buddhas, purify the lineage of the Teaching, Support the spiritual Community, and become a source of treasures.
You will remove the web of craving and the dense net of views, You will free the world from the net of suffering, Having purified such a network of vows.
You will perfect beings, purify the world, and establish The realm of knowledge—such is your intention.
You will bring greater felicity, beneficially gladdening sentient beings, Gladdening the family of enlightening beings, satisfying the wishes of all buddhas.
You will be a buddha clearly seeing the abodes of all states of being, Seeing reflections of all lands and the scope of all truths.
You will be a light illumining the reality realm, Extinguishing all states of woe, bringing felicity to existence.
You will show the door of heaven and open the door of enlightenment in the world; You will lead the world to the door of liberation, the doorway you have cleared.
You will lead away from false paths into the path of sages; You will humbly follow the path of enlightenment, resolute and diligent.
Intent on freeing beings in the sea of existence from suffering, You will save the world from the sea of existence— Become such an ocean of virtue.
You will evaporate the sea of afflictions of beings With the transcendent lights of the sun of knowledge; Introducing them to the ocean of spiritual practice, You will lead them into the ocean of knowledge.
You will increase the ocean of understanding And purify the ocean of practice; Soon you will plunge deep into the ocean Of the vows of all buddhas.
You will view many oceans of lands and see the oceans of congregations therein; By the power of the ocean of understanding, you will imbibe the ocean of teachings.
You will see multitudes of buddhas and will make myriads of offerings; You will hear millions of truths—such are the vows you make.
You will go to the abodes of all lands, to all the abodes of beings, And will observe the abodes of all buddhas—this is the direction you are taking.
You will observe the abode of concentration and tell of the abodes of liberation; You will dwell in spiritual powers, grounded in the reality realm.
You will rise over the abodes of all beings, like the light of sun and moon, And ascend to the presence of the buddhas—such is your climb on the great path.
You will walk in the realm of good, in the realm unattached to any world, And attain supreme peace—such is your realm of higher knowledge.
The differentiations of the cosmic network, And all the differentiations of the network of lands, Soon you will see, pervading, like the wind unhindered in the sky.
You will see the extent of the reality realm, You will go to the reaches of the worlds, You will see all buddhas of all times; So rejoice, Sudhana.
Do not be downhearted, be happy and content, In that you have seen, see, and will see yet such liberation as this.
Sudhana, you are a good vessel of virtues, following the instructions of Buddha; You are fit to bear this Teaching—by it you see this wonder.
Such as are hard to see in millions of eons, much more to reveal their virtues, You have seen carrying out good practice, enlightening beings In the realm of nonattachment.
You are welcome in the human world; inconceivably great is your gain, That you have seen Manjushri face to face and made such a vessel of virtue.
You have left all states of woe, cleared away the misfortune of situations Inopportune for attaining enlightenment, transcended all evil things— Do not be weary or distressed.
You have left the stage of the ignorant and are firmly grounded In the virtues of enlightening beings; having fulfilled The greatest knowledge, soon you will attain buddhahood.
Enlightening practice is like an ocean, enlightened knowledge is like space, The ocean of vows is equally vast—you should be happy with these.
The Friends are indefatigable, firm in will, and sure in application; Those who follow such Friends as these will soon become guides themselves.
Seeing how various are the many practices of enlightening beings To educate sentient beings, do not become perplexed About enlightenment practice that confronts all realities.
Your achievement of virtue is inconceivable; You are useful, righteous, virtuous, and faithful.
By this accomplishment today you see such enlightening beings.
See how great is your gain in seeing enlightening beings continuously; They each show you your vows, and you follow them all.
Hard to find even in hundreds of lifetimes Is such a participant in the practices of enlightening beings; Therefore the enlightening beings, one after another, Show you their ways of liberation.
People live with enlightening beings for millions and billions of ages Yet do not know of their state, nor make themselves vessels of virtue.
You hear this teaching, and see what is hard to find in the world, The spiritual manifestation of greatness of enlightening beings— You should be uplifted in mind.
All the buddhas are minding you, the enlightening beings are caring for you, And you are grounded in their teaching—bravo, Sudhana, you live a good life.
You live according to the principles of the family of enlightening beings, And learn the qualities of the offspring of buddhas; You will prolong the lineage of buddhas—you should be most joyful.
All buddhas are your peerless parents, all enlightening beings your siblings; The elements of enlightenment are all your relatives— Nobly born are you, as an offspring of the buddhas.
Sustainer of the lineage of spiritual sovereigns, Prolonger of the lineage of enlightening beings, You will attain buddhahood soon, so be happy, Sudhana, full of joy.
Soon you will receive the supreme marvelous coronation of all buddhas And become equal to the peerless heirs of the Victors.
As a man sows a seed, so shall he reap the fruit; Today I bring you glad tidings, that you may find inconceivable joy.
Even unthinkable millions of enlightening beings Who have carried out this practice for millions of eons Have not attained such accomplishment As you have realized in one lifetime.
This is all the fruit of devotion and firmness and vigor of will; Those who admire this practice should take up what Sudhana has done.
All practice derives from vows, all qualities derive from application; Sudhana, you have accomplished this, forever the best course of conduct.
The extent to which the dragons will is the extent to which rain is produced; The extent of the scope of vows and knowledge is the extent of pervasion Of enlightenment practice.
This should be shown to you, Sudhana, by the practice of the good; Once one realizes this, one will be serving the Friends thereby.
Remember the millions of bodies past that you squandered uselessly for lust; Now pursuing the path of enlightenment, this body, well disciplined, Should be critical.
Over millions of eons past you experienced all miseries in conditioned states; Having turned away from myriad buddhas, you did not hear such a doctrine as this.
Now you have got your chance as a human, in the presence of Buddha, With such spiritual friends; how could one not be purified when one has heard of the practice of supreme enlightenment? Even if there are buddhas existing and the Teaching is heard From spiritual friends and benefactors, If one does not listen to this doctrine one’s mind will not be purified.
By it an attitude of faith and devotion is produced, supreme respect; Getting rid of desire, views, and lassitude, listen to this Teaching more and more.
Hearing of such an entry into practice, whoever accomplishes this undertaking Makes a supreme gain, inconceivable—this human life is worthwhile.
For one whose mind is thus purified, the buddhas are not hard to find, The enlightening beings are all friends, and there is no more doubt of enlightenment.
One who has entered such a teaching keeps all the precepts, Abandons all causes of misery, and embraces all virtues.
Soon, relinquishing this body, you will go to a buddha-land, purified; You will see the abode of enlightening beings and behold the buddhas everywhere.
You have completed a set of past causes, Sudhana, based on your devotion; You serve the Friends with the highest aim, thereby growing like a lotus in water.
Intent on rapport with all spiritual friends and with all buddhas, Intent on seeking out all truths, arise, well disciplined, and do not weary.
Set out to apply all truths and follow all the paths; offspring of Buddha, Grounded on vows, arise, vessel of all virtues.
Through such perfect devotion you have paid this honor to me; Soon you will come into the presence of the assemblies of all buddhas.
Bravo, Sudhana, buoyant in mind, conscious of the vows of all buddhas; Firm in resolve, you soon will reach the perfection of virtue of buddhas.
Ask Manjushri about ultimate liberation in the realm of knowledge; He will initiate you into the highest practice of good in your final existence.

de ltar byams pa chags med spyod yul gyis/ / nor bzang yang dag legs pas 'phags mthong nas/ / 'khor rnams kun la mngon par bstan byas te/ / de yi yon tan legs mdzod 'di brjod do/ /
'di 'dra'i rjes su bstan pa dam pa dang / / gdams ngag de 'dra nor bzang thos gyur nas/ / dga' ba'i shugs kyis dbang po mngon brlan pas/ / mchi ma'i rgyud mang rab tu des kyang blags/ /
dga' ba'i nyams chen nyams su myong bar 'gyur/ / dbang po tshim nas shugs kyis dbugs kyang phyung / / nor bzang langs te thal mo rab sbyar nas/ / byams pa de la bskor ba rab tu byas/ /
de yi lag tu 'jam dpal sems dbang gis/ / me tog phreng ba rin chen mdzes pa dag / byang chub sems dpa'i smon pas mngon thon pa/ / yid du 'ong ba mang po byung bar gyur/ /
nor bzang de tshe rab tu dga' gyur nas/ / dga' bar de dag khyams pa de la gtor/ / de tshe de yi mgo la kun nas byugs/ / byams pas tshigs su bcad pa 'di dag smras/ /
rgyal ba'i sras po nor bzang legs so legs/ / de ltar khyod ni yongs su mi skyo bas/ / nga dang 'jam dpal ci 'dra ci bzhin du; ; yon tan snod du khyod ni myur te 'gyur/ /
thos nas nor bzang dga' ba'i tshig brjod pa/ / 'di 'dra'i dge bshes bdag dang phrad pa ni/ / srid pa brgya phrag bgrangs par shin tu dkon/ / bdag gis de ring 'dir phyin shin tu legs/ /
yon tan kun gyi pha rol phyin gyur pa/ / 'jam dpal khyod kyi byin rlabs bzang po yis/ / bdag gis bshes gnyen 'di dag dkon pa rnyed/ / khyod dang bdag tu myur du 'grogs par 'gyur// //

Thus Maitreya, seeing Sudhana arrive, imbued with virtues, in the realm of nonobstruction, revealed him to the assembly, speaking of his treasury of qualities. Sudhana, hearing such supreme direction and instruction, was flooded with joy and burst into tears. His hair stood on end and he sighed with delight. He rose and paid his respects to Maitreya. Then, by the mental power of Manjushri, there appeared in his hands beautiful flower garlands and jewels, produced by the vows of enlightening beings; blissfully, Sudhana showered these on Maitreya. Then Maitreya patted him on the head and said, “It is good that you are so indefatigable, Sudhana; you will be a vessel of virtues, like Manjushri and me.”
Hearing this, Sudhana disclosed the joy of his heart: “It is hard to find, even in hundreds of lifetimes, such Friends as these whom I have now met. It is good for me to have come here today. By the direction of the honorable Manjushri, perfect in true virtue, I have found this rare Friend. I should quickly meet Manjushri himself.”
shin tu rgyas pa chen po'i mdo/ sangs rgyas phal po che zhes bya ba las/ sdong pos brgyan pa'i le'u ste/ bam po brgya bcu gnyis pa/
