de nas tshong dpon gyi bu nor bzang gis byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po byams pa'i mdud du 'dug ste thal mo sbyar nas 'di skad ces smras so/ /'phags pa/ bdag bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yang dag par zhugs na/ ji ltar byang chub sems dpas byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa la bslab par bgyi ba dang / ji ltar nan tan du bgyi ba ma 'tshal te/ 'phags pa byams pa ni/ de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi sku tshe gcig gis thogs par bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu lung bstan pa ste/ gang bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sku tshe gcig gis thogs pa de ni/ byang chub sems dpa'i rnam par dgod pa thams cad las yang dag par 'das pa lags/ des ni/ byang chub sems dpa'i sa thams cad rab tu brnyes pa lags/ de ni/ byang chub sems dpa'i skyon med pa rab tu zhugs pa lags/ des ni/ pha rol tu phyin pa thams cad yongs su rdzogs pa lags/ de ni/ bzod pa'i sgo thams cad du zhugs pa lags/ des ni/ byang chub sems dpa'i sa thams cad rab tu brnyes pa lags/ de ni/ byang chub sems dpa'i rnam par thar pa'i sgo thams cad la rnam par rol pa lags/ des ni/ ting nge 'dzin thams cad yongs su sgrub pa lags/ de ni/ byang chub sems dpa'i rgyud thams cad rtogs par thugs su chud pa lags; de ni/ gzungs dang spobs pa snang ba'i tshul thams cad rab tu brnyes pa lags/ de ni/ byang chub sems dpa'i dbang thams cad la mnga' thob pa lags/ des ni; byang chub sems dpa'i tshogs thams cad shin tu bsags pa lags/ de ni/ shes rab dang thabs mkhas pa'i tshul la rnam par rol pa lags/ des ni/ mngon par shes pa chen po dang / rig pa dang / ye shes snang ba'i tshul bskyed pa lags/ de ni/ bslab pa thams cad la byung ba lags/ des ni/ byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa yongs su sbyangs pa lags/ des ni/ smon lam gyis 'byung ba'i sgo thams cad mngon par bsgrubs pa lags/ des ni/ de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi lung bstan pa rab tu blangs pa lags/ de ni/ theg pa thams cad kyis 'byung ba'i sgo la mkhas pa lags/ des ni/ de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi byin gyi rlabs yang dag par blangs pa lags/ des ni/ sangs rgyas thams cad kyi byang chub yongs su bzung ba lags/ des ni/ de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi chos kyi mdzod bzung ba lags; des ni/ de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi gsang ba'i mdzod 'dzin pa lags/ de ni/ byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyi gsang ba'i dkyil 'khor thams cad kyi spyi bor phyin pa lags/ de ni/ nyon mongs pa'i dpung thams cad rnam par dkrug pa la shin tu dpa' ba lags/ de ni/ 'khor ba'i 'brog dgon par lus pa rnams kyi lam ston pa lags/ de ni/ nyon mongs pa'i nad kyis thebs pa rnams kyi sman par gyur pa lags/ de ni/ sems can thams cad kyi phul du phyin pa lags/ de ni/ 'jig rten gyi dbang po thams cad kyi dbang po lags/ de ni/ 'phags pa'i gang zag thams cad kyi thu bo lags/ de ni/ nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas thams cad kyi gtso bo lags; de ni/ 'khor ba'i rgya mtsho la rgyu ba rnams kyi skya ba 'dzin pa lags/ des ni/ sems can gdul ba'i thabs kyi rgya mtsho chen po bshal ba lags/ de ni/ 'gro ba yongs su smin pa rnams kyi dbang po rnam par gzigs pa lags/ de ni/ sems can thams cad yongs su bsdu ba la brtson pa lags/ de ni/ byang chub sems dpa' thams cad yongs su bskyang ba la brtson pa lags/ de ni/ byang chub sems dpa'i bya ba thams cad la yang dag par 'gro bar brtson pa lags/ de ni/ de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi zhabs kyi drung na gnas pa lags/ de ni/ 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor thams cad du mngon par 'phags pa lags/ de ni/ 'gro ba thams cad kyi gnas su gzugs brnyan snang ba lags/ de ni/ 'jig rten gyi chos thams cad kyis ma gos pa lags/ de ni/ bdud kyi yul thams cad las yang dag par 'das pa lags/ de ni/ sangs rgyas kyi yul thams cad kyi rjes su bzhud pa lags/ de ni/ byang chub sems dpa'i yul thams cad la sgrib pa med pa brnyes pa lags/ de ni/ de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad la mchod par brtson pa lags/ de ni/ sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad la rgyud kyi tshul gcig tu gyur pa lags/ de ni/ dbang bskur ba'i thabs thob pa lags/ de ni/ chos kyi rgyal srid chen po la gnas par 'gyur ba lags/ de ni/ thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes kyi yul la dbang bskur ba lags/ de ni; sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad rab tu byung ba lags/ de ni/ thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes la dbang bsgyur ba'i mthar phyin pa lags na/

Then Sudhana stood respectfully before Maitreya and said, “Noble one, I have set out for supreme perfect enlightenment, but I do not know how an enlightening being is to learn and carry out the practice of enlightening beings. It has been predicted by all the buddhas that noble Maitreya will become supremely perfectly enlightened in one lifetime; and one who is sure of supreme perfect enlightenment in one lifetime has gone beyond all the stations of enlightening beings, entered the certainty of enlightening beings, fulfilled all the transcendent ways, entered all doors of tolerance, attained all states of enlightening beings, mastered all ways of liberation, perfected all concentrations, reached the goal of all courses of action of enlightening beings, attained all powers of memory, intellect, and methods of elucidation, mastered all powers of enlightening beings, gathered all provisions of enlightening beings, mastered the methods of wisdom and skill in means, developed the illumination of higher knowledge, mastered all learning, purified all practices of enlightening beings, accomplished all methods of carrying out vows, received the directions of all buddhas, comprehended all vehicles of liberation, taken on the empowerment of all buddhas, embraced the enlightenment of all buddhas, preserved the treasuries of all buddhas, stored the secrets of all buddhas, gained leadership of the esoteric circle of all enlightening beings. Such a one is a hero in all assaults against afflictions, a guide to those in the wilderness of the mundane whirl, a physician for those sick with afflictions, a chief of all beings, a leader, preeminent among all noble people, highest of all saints, a pilot for those in the sea of the mundane whirl; such a one draws the net of means to guide sentient beings, observes the faculties of people who have matured, is united with all sentient beings, is engaged in protecting all enlightening beings, is in concert with all the works of enlightening beings, is in the circles of all buddhas, is reflected in the abodes of all beings, is unstained by the things of the world, is beyond the reach of all demons, is in accord with the realm of all buddhas, has attained nonobstruction in the sphere of all enlightening beings, is engaged in the service of all buddhas, is one with all enlightened qualities, wears the turban of coronation, sits on the throne of spiritual sovereignty, is initiated into the realm of omniscience, is a source of all enlightened teachings, has attained enlightenment and mastery of omniscience.

'phags pa/ ji ltar byang chub sems dpas byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa la bslab par bgyi ba dang / ji ltar nan tan du bgyi ba dang / ji ltar byang chub sems dpas nan tan du bgyis na/ sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad 'thob par 'gyur ba dang / sems can gyi khams ji ltar gnyer ba'i tshul bzhin du rim gror bgyid par 'gyur ba dang / yi dam ji ltar bcas pa'i tshul bzhin du mthar phyin par 'gyur ba dang / byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa chen po brtsams pa grub par 'gyur ba dang / lha dang bcas pa'i 'jig rten dbugs 'byin par 'gyur ba dang / bdag dang / sems can dang / sangs rgyas dang / chos dang / dge 'dun slu bar mi 'gyur ba dang / sangs rgyas kyi rigs rgyun mi gcod pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i rigs stong par mi 'byin pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i tshul yongs su 'dzin par 'gyur ba bdag la bka' stsal du gsol/

“So please tell me, noble one, how an enlightening being is to learn and carry out the practice of enlightening beings, by which practice an enlightening being attains enlightenment and understands all enlightened teachings, responds when called upon, rescues sentient beings, fulfills the commitment to carry out the practice of enlightenment, comforts and inspires people, keeps true to one’s word, ascertains all the myriad buddha-teachings, sustains the lineage of buddhas and enlightening beings, and preserves the eye of enlightenment.”

de nas byang chub sems dpa' byams pas 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor de thams cad la bltas te tshong dpon gyi bu nor bzang la nye bar bstan nas 'di skad ces smras so/ /rigs kyi bu dag /tshong dpon gyi bu 'di 'di ltar nga la byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa dang / yon tan yongs su sgrub pa 'dri ba la ltos/ bzod pa can dag/ tshong dpon gyi bu 'di ni/ brtson 'grus brtsams pa 'di lta bu dang / don du gnyer ba 'di lta bu dang / mos pa'i yi dam 'di lta bu dang / lhag pa'i bsam pa brtan pa 'di lta bu dang brtson 'grus mi ldog pa 'di lta bu dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos kyis mi ngoms pa 'di lta bu dang / khyad par yongs su btsal ba 'di lta bu dang / mgo'i thod la me 'bar ba lta bur spyod pa 'di lta bu dang / dge ba'i bshes gnyen mthong bar 'dod pa 'di lta bu dang / dge ba'i bshes gnyen bsnyen bkur bas skyo ba med pa 'di lta bus dge ba'i bshes gnyen thams cad yongs su tshol zhing yongs su dri ba dang / bsnyen bkur ba byed cing / 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pas btang nas grong khyer dpal gyi 'byung gnas nye bar bzung ba nas lho phyogs kyi rgyud thams cad du rgyus te dge ba'i bshes gnyen brgya rtsa bcu la yongs su dri ba byed cing / tha ma nga'i drung 'di'i bar du skyo ba thams cad dang bral ba'i lhag pa'i bsam pas phyin te/ rigs kyi bu dag /rnam pa 'di lta bur theg pa chen po la yang dag par zhugs pa; yi dam chen po la yang dag par gnas pa/ bsam pa chen po la rab tu rtul ba'i yid dang ldan pa/ snying rje chen po'i go bgos pa'i ngad dang ldan pa/ byams pa chen pos sems can thams cad yongs su bskyab pa'i blo gros can/ brtson 'grus chen po'i pha rol tu phyin pa la rab tu brtson pa/ sems can gyi lam grogs mang pos yongs su bskyang ba la mngon par brtson pa/ 'khor ba'i rgya mtsho chen po las sems can bsgral ba la zhugs pa/ thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi lam chen po la zhugs pa; chos kyi gru chen po yang dag par bsham pa la brtson pa/ chos chen po dang bsod nams rin po che yongs su bsdu ba la rab tu rtul ba/ chos kyi mchod sbyin chen po'i tshogs bsags pa la brtson pa rnams kyi ming thos pa'am/ gzugs kyi lus mthong ba'am/ gzugs kyi lus mthong ba'am/ spyod yul du 'grogs pa'am/ spyod pa dang skal ba mnyam pa ni/ shin tu dkon no/ /

Then the enlightening being Maitreya, looking over the whole crowd, pointed out Sudhana and said, “Good people, look at this fine young man, who asks me about the perfection of the virtues of enlightening practice. With this diligence, this purposefulness, this zealous commitment, this steadfast will, this unflagging vigor, this thirst for enlightened teaching, this excellent questing, this burning urgency, this desire to meet spiritual friends and benefactors, this indefatigability in attendance on spiritual friends and benefactors, he left his city in search of spiritual benefactors at the direction of Manjushri and traveled south, inquiring of a hundred and ten spiritual benefactors, until finally he has come to me, his mind thoroughly unwearied.
“Good people, it is hard even to get to hear of the name of those like this who have set forth on the Great Vehicle of universal enlightenment, who have undertaken the great vow, who are resolute in the great endeavor, who are girt with great compassion, who are intent on saving sentient beings with great love, who act with transcendental energy, who are engaged in protecting the great caravan of beings, who are carrying beings across the ocean of the mundane whirl, who are on the road to omniscience, who are engaged in assembling the spiritual ark, who are determined to assemble the great wealth of the treasures of the Teaching, who are engaged in assembling the preparations for the great spiritual activity—it is hard to even hear their names, to see them in person, to associate with them, or to share in their practice.

de ci'i phyir zhe na/ rigs kyi bu/ skyes bu dam pa 'di ni/ 'gro ba thams cad yongs su bskyab pa'i don du byung ba ste/ sems can thams cad sdug bsngal las yongs su thar par byed pa dang / ngan song thams cad yang dag par bsal ba dang / mi khom pa'i lam thams cad rnam par bzlog pa dang / lam nyam nga ba thams cad yongs su spang ba dang / mi shes pa'i mun pa nag po thams cad rnam par bsal ba dang / 'khor ba'i 'brog dgon pa thams cad las yang dag par bzla ba dang / 'gro ba'i rgyud kyi 'khor lo thams cad rnam par bzlog pa dang / bdud kyi yul thams cad las yang dag par bzla ba dang / gnas kyi rten thams cad las gyen du bskyod pa dang / rten gyi gzhi thams cad las bskul ba dang / 'gro ba'i rgyud thams cad du mi gnas par bya ba dang / 'dod pa'i 'dam nas yang dag par gdon pa dang / dga' ba'i 'dod chags spang ba dang / lta ba'i bcings pa gtub pa dang / 'jig tshogs la mngon par zhen pa rnam par bzlog pa dang / 'du shes kyi zhags pa yang dag pa gcad pa dang / phyin ci log gi lam nas rnam par bzlog pa dang / nga rgyal gyi rgyal mtshan bsnyal ba dang / bag la nyal ba'i zug rdu yang dag par dbyung ba dang / sgrib pa'i sgo glegs gzhom pa dang / sgrib pa'i ri rnam par gtor ba dang / srid pa'i dra ba nas gdon pa dang / ma rig pa'i kun tu sbyor ba las dbye ba dang / sred pa'i chu bo las bsgral ba dang / g.yo dang sgyu spang ba dang / sems kyi rnyog pa dang ba dang / the tshom dang / yid gnyis dang / nem nur bsal ba dang / mi shes pa'i chu po chen po las bsgral ba dang / 'khor ba'i skyon thams cad rnam par smad pa'i phyir rab tu zhugs pa'o/ /

“Why is this? This sincere good person has set out to save all beings, undertaken to liberate all beings from misery, to evaporate all bad tendencies, to put an end to all states that are inopportune for attaining enlightenment, to block off all perilous roads, to dispel all darkness of ignorance, to cross all the wastelands of the mundane whirl, to stop all vicious circles, to get beyond the reach of all demons, to remove all attachment and dependence, to rescue people from the mire of lust, to abandon passion for joy, to remove the fetters of views, stop attachment to the body as real, cut through the snare of conception, stop the pursuit of error, to pluck out the thorns of delusion, to break through obstacles, to shatter the mountains of obstructions, to remove the net of craving, to dissolve the bonds of ignorance, to illuminate existence, to do away with guile and deceit, to clear mental disturbance, to remove doubt and confusion, to get out of the current of ignorance and delusion, to repel all the ills of the mundane whirl.

rigs kyi bu/ skyes bu dam pa 'di ni/ sems can rnams chu bo bzhi las yongs su bsgral ba'i phyir chos kyi gru chen po yang dag par bsham par 'dod pa'o/ /lta ba'i 'dam du bying ba rnams kyi chos kyi rkang stegs chen po dgod par 'dod pa'o; ;gti mug gi mun par 'thoms pa rnams la ye shes kyi snang ba dbyung bar 'dod pa'o/ /'khor ba'i mya ngan du 'khyams pa rnams la 'phags pa'i lam bstan par 'dod pa'o; ;nyon mongs pa'i nad chen pos gzir ba rnams la chos kyi sman sbyin par 'dod pa'o/ /skye ba dang / rga ba dang / 'chi bas gtses pa rnams la 'chi ba med pa'i dbyings sbyin par 'dod pa'o/ /me gsum rab tu 'bar ba rnams la zhi gnas kyi chus rab tu zhi bar bya bar 'dod pa'o/ /mya ngan dang / smre sngags 'don pa dang / yid mi bde ba dang / 'khrug pas gdungs pa rnams la dbugs phyin pa chen po sbyin par 'dod pa'o/ /srid pa'i btson ras 'khor ba rnams la ye shes kyi mtshon cha sbyin par 'dod pa'o/ /lta ba'i bcings pas glags pa rnams la shes rab kyi mtshon chas bstud par 'dod pa'o/ /khams gsum gyi grong khyer gyis 'khor ba rnams la thar pa'i sgo bstan par 'dod pa'o/ /phyogs mi bde bar mngon par gzhol ba rnams la bde ba'i phyogs bstan par 'dod pa'o/ /nyon mongs pa'i chom pos gtses pa rnams la dbugs phyin pa chen po sbyin par 'dod pa'o; ;ngan song gi g.yang sas 'jigs shing skrag pa rnams la 'ju sa'i lag pa brkyang bar 'dod pa'o/ /phung po'i gshed mas gtses pa rnams la mya ngan las 'das pa'i grong khyer bstan par 'dod pa'o/ /khams kyi sprul gyis kun nas 'khor ba rnams la 'phags pa'i lam gyis 'byung ba bstan par 'dod pa'o/ /skye mched kyi grong stong pa na gnas pa rnams shes rab kyi snang bas gdon par 'dod pa'o/ /mu stegs ngan pa la zhugs pa'i sems can rnams yang dag pa'i mu stegs su gzud par 'dod pa'o; ;bshes gnyen ma yin pa'i lag tu lhung ba rnams la yang dag pa'i dge ba'i bshes gnyen bstan par 'dod pa'o/ /byis pa'i chos kyi spyod yul la mngon par mos pa rnams 'phags pa'i chos la rab tu dgod par 'dod pa'o/ /'khor ba'i khyim la mngon par dga' ba rnams gyen du bskyod de thams cad mkhyen pa'i pho brang du gzud par 'dod pa'o; ;

“Indeed, good people, this worthy wishes to assemble the ship of the Teaching, a precious gift, to rescue beings from the four torrents. He wishes to set up the great bridge of the Teaching for those sunk in the morass of views. He wishes to produce the light of knowledge for those in the darkness of delusion. He wishes to point out the path of sages to those lost in the wilderness of the mundane whirl. He wishes to dispense the medicine of the teaching to those suffering from the illness of afflictions. He wishes to give the element of immortality to those assailed by birth, old age, and death. He wishes to cool those burning with the three fires by means of the water of tranquillity. He wishes to give great comfort to those suffering from sorrow, grief, misery, and depression. He wishes to give those bound in the prison of existence the knowledge of how to break out. He wishes to give the sword of wisdom to those tied up in the bonds of views. He wishes to show the door of liberation to those locked in the city of the triple world. He wishes to show the direction of safety to those headed in dangerous directions. He wishes to comfort those suffering from the joint operation of afflictions. He wishes to lend a hand to those terrorized by the perils of falling into states of woe. He wishes to show the citadel of nirvana to those struck by the murderous clusters. He wishes to tell those surrounded by the serpents of the elements how to escape. To those loitering in the ghost town of the sense media, he wishes to show the way out by the light of wisdom. Those on wrong paths he wishes to lead into the right path. To the friendless he wishes to show true spiritual friends. Those clinging to the realm of the infantile unenlightened condition he wishes to initiate into the teachings of sages. Those clinging to the city of the mundane whirl he wishes to lead away into the city of omniscience.

rigs kyi bu dag /de ltar skyes bu dam pa 'di ni/ sems can yongs su skyob pa'i blo gros de lta bus byang chub tu sems bskyed pa rnam par dag par bya ba yongs su btsal ba la rgyun mi 'chad pa'o/ /theg pa chen po yongs su bsgrub pa'i phyir yongs su skyo ba med pa'o/ /chos kyi sprin thams cad la 'thung bas mi ngoms pa'o/ /tshogs thams cad yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir rtag tu brtson pa'i/ /chos kyi sgo thams cad yongs su sbyang ba'i phyir mi gtong ba la brtson pa'o/ /byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa thams cad spyad pa'i phyir brtson 'grus mi gtong ba'o/ /smon lam thams cad mngon par bsgrub pa'i phyir mi ldog pa'i sbyor ba dang ldan pa'o/ /dge ba'i bshes gnyen thams cad mthong bar bya bas mi ngoms pa'o/ /dge ba'i bshes gnyen thams cad bsnyen bkur bas lus la dub par 'gyur ba med pa'o/ /dge ba'i bshes gnyen thams cad kyi gdams ngag dang / rjes su bstan pa la mthun par 'dzin pa ste/

“Thus, for the salvation of sentient beings, this worthy, ceaselessly pursuing the complete purification of the aspiration for enlightenment, is tireless in mastering the Great Vehicle, never complacent in seeking all means of conveying truth, constantly engaged in fulfilling all the provisions for enlightenment, always bearing the responsibility of clarifying all avenues of truth, carrying out all practices of enlightening beings with vigor, not stopping anywhere, carrying out all vows with unbending effort, meeting all spiritual benefactors without complacence, tireless in attendance on all spiritual benefactors, properly following the advice and instruction of all spiritual benefactors.

rigs kyi bu dag /sems can gyi 'jig rten na sems can gang bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu smon lam 'debs pa de lta bu'i sems can dkon no/ /de bas kyang gang bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yang dag par zhugs te brtson 'grus brtsam pa'i tshul 'di lta bus sangs rgyas kyi chos yongs su sdud pa dang / mos pa drag po 'di lta bus byang chub sems dpa'i lam yongs su tshol ba dang / don du gnyer ba 'di lta bus byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa yongs su dag par byed pa dang / nyon mongs pa 'di lta bus dge ba'i bshes gnyen bsnyen bkur byed pa dang / mgo'i thod la me 'bar ba ltar spyod pa 'di lta bus dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyi ngag dang 'gal bar mi byed pa dang / lhag pa'i bsam pa brtan pas nan tan du byed pa 'di lta bus dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyi gdams ngag la nan tan du byed pa dang / mthun par len pa 'di lta bus byang chub kyi yan lag yongs su sgrub pa dang / khe dang / bkur sti dang rnyed pa don du mi gnyer ba 'di lta bus byang chub sems dpa'i bsam pa'i khams dang 'gal bar mi byed pa dang / khyim dang; longs spyod dang / 'dod pa'i dga' ba dang / bde ba dang / pha ma dang / gnyen bshes dang / dngos po thams cad la ltos pa med par yongs su btang ba 'di lta bus byang chub sems dpa'i grogs yongs su tshol ba dang / lus dang / srog la phangs par mi rtsi ba 'di lta bus thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la mngon par mos par byed pa de lta bu'i sems can ni/ chos dkon no/ /rigs kyi bu dag /'dis ji ltar cher skyes pa 'di gcig la ji snyed cig thob pa dang / khong du chud pa de ni/ byang chub sems dpa' de ma yin pa gzhan gyis bskal pa bye ba khrag khrig brgya phrag stong gis kyang byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa dang / smon lam yongs su rdzogs par bya ba thob pa dang / khong du chud pa'am/ sangs rgyas kyi byang chub tu nye bar 'gyur ba'am/ sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par bya ba'am/ sems can yongs su smin par bya ba dang / gdul ba'am/ chos kyi dbyings kyi ye shes la 'jug pa'am/ pha rol tu phyin pa yang dag par bsgrub pa'am/ spyod pa'i dra ba rgya cher bya ba'am/ smon lam mngon par bsgrub pa yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'am/ bdud kyi las las yang dag par 'da' bar bya ba'am/ dge ba'i bshes gnyen bsnyen bkur ba'am/ byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa thams cad mngon par bsgrub par bya ba dang / yongs su dag par bya ba'am/ byang chub sems dpa' kun tu bzang po'i spyod pa mngon par sgrub pa'i stobs yongs su rdzogs par bya ba la yang dag par 'byung ba med do/ /

“In all the world it is hard to find people who aspire to supreme true enlightenment; it is even harder to find those who set out for supreme true enlightenment, who master the teachings of buddhas with such diligent application, seek the path of enlightening beings with such ardor, purify the practice of enlightening beings with such purposefulness, attend spiritual benefactors with such diligence, follow the knowledge of spiritual benefactors with such urgency, carry out the instructions of spiritual benefactors with such unbending determination, assemble the elements of enlightenment with such correct understanding, be so indifferent to gain, honor, and praise as not to ruin the will appropriate to an enlightening being, seek the Great Vehicle of enlightening beings with such detachment from home and family, comforts, enjoyments, and material goods, and seek omniscience with such indifference to joy and life. Other enlightening beings will not, in millions of eons, attain the fulfillment of the practice and vows of enlightening beings, abide in enlightenment, purify a buddha-land, guide sentient beings, know the reality realm, attain the transcendent ways, extend the network of practices, fulfill the undertakings of vows, transcend the works of demons, develop rapport with spiritual friends, perfect all the practices of enlightening beings, or accomplish the power to carry out the practice of the universally good enlightening being, to the extent that this Sudhana will achieve these things in one lifetime.”

de nas byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po byams pas tshong dpon gyi bu nor bzang gi yon tan dang / legs pa yang dag par yongs su brjod pa byas nas de la brten te srog chags brgya phrag stong gi byang chub kyi yan lag gi bsam pa brtan par byas nas tshong dpon gyi bu nor bzang la 'di skad ces smras so/ /rigs kyi bu/ de ltar khyod kyi 'jig rten thams cad la phan pa dang / bde ba'i phyir sems can gyi khams thams cad yongs su bskyab pa'i don du sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad rab tu thob par bya ba'i phyir bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed pa legs so legs so/ /rigs kyi bu/ khyod kyis bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu de ltar sems bskyed pa ni; khyod kyis thob par bya ba legs par thob bo/ /khyod kyis mi'i lus legs par thob bo/ /'tsho ba'i 'jig rten du khyod legs par 'tshos so/ /khyod kyis sangs rgyas byung ba dgyes par byas so/ /khyod kyis dge ba'i bshes gnyen 'jam dpal legs par mthong ngo/ /khyod kyis bsam pa'i rgyud snod bzang por gyur to/ /khyod ni/ dge ba'i rtsa bas mngon par brlan to/ /khyod ni/ dkar po'i chos kyis legs par brtan no/ /khyod kyis mos pa rlabs chen po dang / dge ba'i bsam pa legs par shin tu sbyangs so/ /khyod ni; sangs rgyas thams cad kyis legs par dgongs so/ /rigs kyi bu/ khyod ni/ dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyis legs par bzung ngo/ /

Then Maitreya, having eulogized the true virtues of Sudhana, and thereby strengthened the determination for enlightenment in hundreds of thousands of people, said to Sudhana, “It is good that you have set your mind on supreme perfect enlightenment for the welfare and happiness of all worlds, for the salvation of all beings, for the attainment of all enlightened qualities. You have made a great gain, and your existence amid humanity is indeed welcome. You live the good life among the living and have satisfied the purpose of the emergence of Buddha in the world. You have met the benefactor Manjushri and have made yourself a worthy vessel of truth. You have been nourished with virtues and stabilized on good qualities. You have purified high resolve and good intention. You are minded by all buddhas, and you are in the care of all spiritual friends. By this intent of yours you have developed the determination for supreme perfect enlightenment.

de ci'i phyir zhe na/ rigs kyi bu/ byang chub kyi sems ni; sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad kyi sa bon lta bu'o/ /'gro ba thams cad kyi chos dkar po rnam par 'phel bar byed pas zhing lta bu'o/ /'jig rten thams cad rab tu rten pas sa lta bu'o; ;nyon mongs pa'i dri ma thams cad dag par byed pas chu lta bu'o/ /'jig rten thams cad la rten pa med pas rlung lta bu'o/ /lta ba'i nye bar len pa'i rtsa ba thams cad rab tu sreg pas me lta bu'o/ /sems can thams cad kyi gnas snang bar byed pas nyi ma lta bu'o/ /chos dkar po'i dkyil 'khor yongs su rgyas par byed pas zla ba lta bu'o/ /chos kyi snang ba byed pas sgron ma lta bu'o/ /mnyam pa dang mi mnyam pa yongs su mthong bar byed pas mig lta bu'o/ /thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi grong khyer du phyin par byed pas lam lta bu'o; ;mu stegs ngan pa rnam par spong bas mu stegs lta bu'o/ /byang chub sems dpa' thams cad mngon par gnas pas bzhon pa lta bu'o/ /byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa thams cad kyi sgor 'jug par byed pas sgo lta bu'o/ /ting nge 'dzin gyi khang pa na gnas par byed pas gzhal med khang lta bu'o/ /chos kyi dga' ba dang mos pa nyams su myong bar byed pas bza' shing gi ra ba lta bu'o/ /'gro ba thams cad yongs su skyob pas gnas lta bu'o/ /'jig rten thams cad la phan pa skyed pas rten lta bu'o/ /byang chub sems dpa'i spyad pa thams cad spyod par byed pas gzhi lta bu'o/ /byang chub sems dpa' thams cad yongs su srung bas pha lta bu'o/ /byang chub sems dpa' chen po thams cad kyi ma lta bu'o/ /thams cad las yongs su skyong bas ma ma lta bu'o/ /slob pa dang mi slob pa dang rang sangs rgyas thams cad kyi sems zil gyis gnon pas rgyal po lta bu'o/ /smon lam thams cad kyis khyad par du 'phags pas dbang po lta bu'o/ /yon tan thams cad yang dag par 'du bas rgya mtsho chen po lta bu'o/ /sems can thams cad la sems mnyam pas ri chen po lta bu'o/ /'jig rten thams cad rten pas khor yug lta bu'o/ /ye shes kyi sman rnam par 'phel bar byed pas gangs kyi ri lta bu'o/ /yon tan gyi spos thams cad kyi gnas su gyur bas spos kyi ngad ldang ba lta bu'o/ /yon tan rgya che bas nam mkha' lta bu'o/ /'jig rten gyi chos thams cad kyis mi gos pas pad+ma lta bu'o/ /sems dul zhing cang shes pas glang po lta bu'o/ / rgod pa thams cad dang bral bas rta cang shes lta bu'o/ /theg pa chen po yongs su skyong ba'i sngon du 'gro bas kha lo sgyur ba lta bu'o/ /nyon mongs pa'i nad sos par byed pas sman lta bu'o; ;mi dge ba'i chos thams cad zad par byed pas sa'i 'og lta bu'o/ /chos thams cad nges par khong du chud par byed pas rdo rje lta bu'o/ /yon tan gyi dri zhim par byed pas spos kyi snod lta bu'o/ /'jig rten thams cad kyi blta na mngon par dga' bas me tog dam pa lta bu'o/ /'dod chags kyi gdung ba bsil bar byed pas kha ba'i tsan+dan lta bu'o/ /chos kyi dbyings thams cad rgyas par 'gengs pas a ga ru nag po lta bu'o/ /nyon mongs pa'i nad thams cad 'joms pas sman gyi rgyal po blta na sdug pa lta bu'o/ /bag la nyal ba'i zug rngu thams cad yang dag par 'byin pas 'bral bar byed pa'i sman lta bu'o/ /dbang po thams cad la dbang sgyur bas dbang po lta bu'o/ /dbul ba thams cad yongs su sel bas ngal ba so po lta bu'o/ /yon tan thams cad kyi rgyan gyis brgyan par byed pas dpal lta bu'o/ /byang chub sems dpa' thams cad mdzes par byed pas lhab lhub lta bu'o/ /nyes byas thams cad sreg pas bskal pa 'tshig pa'i me lta bu'o/ /sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad rnam par 'phel bar byed pas rtsa ba ma grugs pa'i sman gyi rgyal po chen po lta bu'o/ /nyon mongs pa'i dug thams cad rnam par sel bas klu'i rin po che lta bu'o/ /rnyog pa thams cad sel bas nor bu rin po che chu 'dang lta bu'o/ /don thams cad yongs su grub pas yid bzhin rin po che'i rgyal po lta bu'o/ /bsam pa thams cad yongs su rdzogs par byed pas bum pa bzang po lta bu'o/ /yon tan thams cad kyi rgyan gyi char mngon par 'bebs pas 'dod sbyin gyi shing lta bu'o; ;'khor ba'i skyon thams cad dang ma 'dres pas gos dang ris can lta bu'o/ /rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal bas shing bal gyi rgyud lta bu'o/ /sems can gyi bsam pa'i zhing rnam par spyod pas gshol bu lta bu'o/ /'jig tshogs kyi go cha brtol bas mde'u thung lta bu'o/ /sdug bsngal gyi 'ben nges par 'bigs pas mda' lta bu'o/ /nyon mongs pa'i dgra las rnam par rgyal bar byed pas mdung lta bu'o/ /tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa 'gebs pas go cha lta bu'o/ /nyon mongs pa'i klad pa 'gems pas ral gri lta bu'o/ /nga rgyal dang dregs pa dang rlom pa'i go cha 'dral bas ral gri'i so lta bu'o/ /bag la nyal gyi go cha gshog pas mda' ste'u kha lta bu'o/ /nga rgyal gyi rgyal mtshan snyol bas dpa' bo'i ru mtshon lta bu'o/ /mi shes pa'i shing sgyel bar byed pas lag cha lta bu'o/ /sdug bsngal gyi shing rab tu gcod pas sta re lta bu'o/ /gnod pa thams cad las yongs su skyob pas mtshon cha lta bu'o/ /pha rol tu phyin pa'i lus yongs su srung bas lag pa lta bu'o/ /yon tan thams cad la so sor 'god pas rkang pa lta bu'o/ /ma rig pa'i dri'i ling tog yongs su sel bas mig mkhan lta bu'o/ /'jig tshogs kyi zug rngu yang dag par 'byin pas skam pa lta bu'o/ /bag la nyal gyi tsher ma 'byin pas tsher zungs lta bu'o/ /'khor ba'i bcing pa las yongs su 'grel bas mdza' bo lta bu'o/ /gnod pa thams cad sel bas nor bu lta bu'o/ /byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa thams cad kyis 'byung ba'i lam mngon par shes par byed pas gtsug lag lta bu'o/ /bsod nams mi zad pas gter lta bu'o/ /ye shes mi zad pas chu mig lta bu'o/ /chos thams cad kyi gdong gi gzugs brnyan ston pas me long gi dkyil 'khor lta bu'o/ /'go ba med pas me tog puN+Da rI ka lta bu'o/ /pha rol tu phyin pa dang bsdu ba'i dngos po rgyun du 'bab pas chu klung chen po lta bu'o/ / chos kyi sprin gyi char mngon par 'bebs pas klu'i rgyal po chen po lta bu'o/ /byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyi snying rje chen po yongs su 'dzin pas 'tsho ba'i dbang po lta bu'o/ / 'chi ba med pa'i dbyings su phyin par byed pas bdud rtsi lta bu'o/ /'dul ba'i sems can thams cad yongs su sdud cing 'dren pas kun nas 'khor ba'i snying lta bu'o/ /'khor ba'i chu la rgyu ba mngon par 'don pas mchil ba lta bu'o/ /yon tan thams cad kyi dri zhim po 'dzin pas spos kyi snod lta bu'o/ /shin tu nad med par byed pas dug sman lta bu'o/ /'dod pas dga' ba'i dug med par byed pas dug gi gnyen po lta bu'o/ /tshul bzhin ma yin pa'i dug thams cad 'byang bar byed pas sngags dang gzungs lta bu'o/ /sgrib pa dang bar chad kyi thams cad rnam par 'thor bas rlung gi dkyil 'khor lta bu'o/ /byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rin po che thams cad kyi 'byung gnas su gyur pas rin po che'i gling lta bu'o/ /chos dkar po thams cad 'byung bas rigs lta bu'o/ /yon tan gyi chos thams cad skye ba'i sgor gyur pas 'byung gnas lta bu'o/ /byang chub sems dpa'i tshong pa thams cad kyis spyod pas tshong dus lta bu'o; ;las dang nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa dang dri ma thams cad yongs su sbyong bas chu'i khams lta bu'o/ /thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi tshogs yongs su rdzogs par byed pas sbrang rtsi'i gnas lta bu'o/ /byang chub sems dpa' thams cad mkhyen pa'i pho brang du phyin par byed pas lam lta bu'o/ /chos dkar po thams cad yongs su 'dzin pas snod lta bu'o/ /nyon mongs pa'i rdul thams cad mi snang bar byed pas char pa lta bu'o/ /byang chub sems dpa'i rnam par dgod pa thams cad ston pas gnas lta bu'o/ /nyan thos kyi rnam par grol ba dang mi 'dra bas rdo ba khab len lta bu'o/ /rang bzhin gyis dri ma med pas bai DUr+ya lta bu'o/ /nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas thams cad dang / 'jig rten gyi shes pa thams cad zil du brlag pa dang zil gyis non par byed pas in+d+ra nI la lta bu'o/ /nyon mongs pa'i gnyid kyis log pa'i sems can sad par byed pas mtho ris kyi rnga lta bu'o; ;rnyog pa med pas chu pa lta bu'o/ /'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas la spyod pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba'i tshogs zil du rlag par byed pas dzam+bu chu klung gi gser gyi rgyan lta bu'o; ;'jig rten gsum las mngon par 'phags pas ri'i rgyal po chen po lta bu'o/ /skyabs tshol ba yongs su mi gtong bas skyabs lta bu'o/ /don ma yin pa 'joms pas don lta bu'o/ /snying dga' bar byed pas dbyig lta bu'o/ /'gro ba thams cad yongs su tshim par byed pas mchod sbyin gyi yo byad lta bu'o/ /'gro ba thams cad kyi sems kyi gtso bo dang thu bor gyur pas na/ rgan pa lta bu'o/ /sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad 'dzin pas gleng gzhi lta bu'o/ /byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa dang smon lam thams cad sdud pas mdo lta bu'o; ;'jig rten thams cad skyong bas rdzi'u lta bu'o/ /sdig to thams cad rnam par zlog pas srung ma lta bu'o/ /nyon mongs pa'i lha ma yin 'dren pas dbang po'i mig 'phrul lta bu'o// 'dul ba 'dren pas chu'i zhags pa lta bu'o/ /bag chags dang bag la nyal ba dang nyon mongs pa thams cad gzhob tu rlog pas dbang po'i me lta bu'o/ /lha dang mi dang lha ma yin du bcas pa'i 'jig rten rnams la mchod rten lta bu'o/ /rigs kyi bu/ de ltar byang chub kyi sems ni/ yon tan de dag dang / yon tan gyi khyad par gzhan dag kyang tshad med pa dang ldan pa ste/ rigs kyi bu/ mdor na/ sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad dang / sangs rgyas kyi yon tan ji snyed pa de snyed du byang chub kyi sems la yon tan dang legs pa yod par blta'o/ /
de ci'i phyir zhe na/ 'di las ni/ byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyi spyod pa'i dkyil 'khor rab tu 'byung ba ste/ 'das pa dang / ma byon pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i sangs rgyas thams cad kyang 'di las 'byung ngo/ /rigs kyi bu/ de bas na/ gang gis bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed pa de ni/ thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi sems dang / lhag pa'i bsam pas shin tu bzung bas yon tan tshang med pa phun sum tshogs pa yin no/ /

“What is the reason? The determination for enlightenment is the seed of all elements of buddhahood; it is like a field, growing good qualities in all beings; it is like the earth, being a support for all beings; it is like water, washing away all afflictions; it is like wind, unattached to all worlds,; it is like fire, burning up the deadwood of clinging to views; it is like the sun, illumining the abodes of all beings; it is like the moon, fulfilling the sphere of all good qualities; it is like a lamp, producing spiritual light; it is like an eye, seeing the even and the uneven; it is like a road, leading to the city of omniscience; it is like a passageway, leading away from all wrong paths; it is like a vehicle, carrying all enlightening beings; it is like a door, leading into all the practices of enlightening beings; it is like a mansion, because of determination to abide in concentration; it is like a park, because of experience of spiritual pleasures; it is like a home, protecting all beings; it is like a basis, being the practice of all enlightening beings, it is like a father, protecting all enlightening beings; it is like a mother to all beings; it is like a nurse, protecting in every way; it is like a king, overwhelming the mentality of all individually liberated ones; it is like an overlord, because of the excellence of all vows; it is like the ocean, containing all jewels of virtue; it is like the polar mountain, being impartial toward all beings; it is like the surrounding mountains, being a refuge for all beings; it is like the Himalaya, growing the herb of knowledge; it is like intoxicating fragrance, being the seat of all scents of virtue; it is like the sky, because of the great extent of its virtue; it is like a lotus, unstained by any things of the world; it is like an elephant, patient and noble; it is like a horse of good breed, free from all unruliness; it is like a charioteer, being the driver of the Great Vehicle; it is like medicine, curing the ills of afflictions; it is like a pit, because in it all bad qualities disappear; it is like a thunderbolt, penetrating all things; it is like a chest of incense, producing the aroma of all virtues; it is like a great flower, pleasant to the sight of all beings; it is like cooling sandalwood, cooling off the burning of passion; it is like the moon, pervading the cosmos; it is like the medicine ‘good to see,’ obliterating all ills due to afflictions; it is like an extracting drug, as it extracts the arrows of evil propensities; it is like a chief of gods, because of mastery of all the faculties; it is like the god of wealth, because it puts an end to all poverty; it is like the goddess of beauty, being adorned with all virtues; it is like jewelry, gracing all enlightening beings; it is like the conflagration that ends an eon, burning up all evildoing; it is like medicine for underdevelopment, because it increases the growth of all enlightened qualities; it is like a dragon pearl, repelling the poison of all afflictions; it is like a water-clearing jewel, because it removes all turbidity and pollution; it is like a wish-fulfilling jewel, granting success in all aims; it is like the horn of plenty, fulfilling all wishes; it is like the desire-granting tree, as it showers the ornaments of all virtues; it is like a goose-feather robe, as it does not absorb any of the ills of the mundane whirl; it is like cotton fiber, being soft in nature; it is like a plow, clearing the mind-field of sentient beings; it is like a warrior, striking down the self; it is like an arrow, piercing its target of suffering; it is like power, overcoming its enemy, afflictions; it is like armor, protecting logical thought; it is like a scimitar, cutting off the head of affliction; it is like a sword blade, slashing through the armor of pride, conceit, and arrogance; it is like a razor, slicing off compulsive propensities; it is like the banner of a hero, bringing down the banner of pride; it is like a machete, felling the tree of ignorance; it is like an ax, cutting through the tree of suffering; it is like combat, being a savior from all attacks; it is like hands, protecting the body of the transcendent ways; it is like feet, being the base of all virtue and knowledge; it is like a surgical probe, cleaning away the covering of the sheath of ignorance; it is like an extracting instrument, extracting the thorn of the notion of self; it is like a hoe, dragging away the thorns of propensities; it is like a benefactor, freeing you from the bonds of the mundane whirl; it is like wealth, rejecting all that is useless; it is like a teacher, knowing the way to carry out all enlightening practices; it is like a mine, having inexhaustible blessings; it is like a fountain, having inexhaustible knowledge; it is like a mirror, showing the reflection of all ways into truth; it is like a white lotus, free from defilement; it is like a great river, carrying forth the streams of the ways of transcendence and the ways of integration; it is like the chief water spirit, causing the clouds of the Teaching to shower; it is like the root of life, sustaining the universal compassion of all enlightening beings; it is like the elixir of immortality, bringing you to the deathless realm; it is like an all-encompassing net, taking in all beings who can be guided; it is like health, producing endless health; it is like an antidote to poison, vitiating the poison of desire; it is like a spell, destroying the poison of all folly; it is like wind, removing all barriers and obstacles; it is like an island of jewels, being a mine of the spiritual jewels of all the limbs of enlightenment; it is like a family, producing all good qualities; it is like a home, being the abode of all virtuous qualities; it is like a market, attended by all enlightening ‘merchants’; it is like liquid metal, clearing all obstructions caused by actions and afflictions; it is like a honeybee, filling the stores of provisions for omniscience; it is like a road, whereby all enlightening beings approach the city of omniscience; it is like a vessel, holding all pure qualities; it is like rain, settling the dust of afflictions; it is like a basis, defining the respective stations of all enlightening beings; it is like a magnet, unaffected by individual liberation; it is like a jewel, inherently pure; it is like an emerald, being totally beyond the knowledge of all individual illuminates and worldlings; it is like the drum that sounds the hour, because it wakes up beings sleeping in affliction; it is like still, clear water, being pure; it is like an ornament of the finest gold, obscuring all collections of virtue in the conditioned realm; it is like an enormous mountain, being invulnerable to anything in the triple world; it is like a savior, not abandoning any who take refuge in it; it is like motivation, because it draws you toward your aim; it is like intelligence, because it creates contentment of the heart; it is like sacrifice, because it satisfies all beings; it is like understanding, because it is what is best in the minds of all beings; it is like a treasury, preserving all enlightened qualities; it is like a summary, containing all the practices and vows of enlightening beings; it is like a protector, protecting all beings; it is like a guardian, repelling all evils; it is like the net of Indra, rounding up the titans of afflictions; it is like the snare of the sky god, rounding up the teachable; it is like the fire of Indra, burning up all habitual propensities and afflictions; it is like a monument for the world. In sum, the virtues of the determination for enlightenment are equal to all the qualities and virtues of buddhas.
Why? Because it is the source of all the practices of enlightening beings, and from it come all buddhas of past, future, and present. Therefore, whoever has aroused the determination for supreme perfect enlightenment becomes imbued with measureless virtues because of being absorbed by the will for omniscience.

rigs kyi bu/ 'di lta ste/ dper na/ 'jigs pa med pa zhes bya ba'i rtsi yod de/ de 'chang na/ 'jigs pa lnga mi 'byung ste/ 'di ltar mes mi 'tshig go /dug gis mi tshugs so/ /mtshon gyis mi chod do/ /chus mi 'khyer ro/ /du bas mi 'chi'o/ /rigs kyi bu/ de bzhin du thams cad mkhyen pa'i sems kyi rtsi 'chang ba'i byang chub sems dpa' yang 'dod chags kyi mes mi 'tshig go /yul gyi dug gis mi tshugs so/ /nyon mongs pa'i mtshon gyis mi chod do/ /srid pa'i chus mi 'khyer ro/ /yongs su rtog pa'i du bas mi 'chi'o/ /

“Just as there is a medicine called ‘fearless’ that prevents five perils—one is not burned by fire, not affected by poison, not wounded by weapons, not swept away by water, not suffocated by smoke—in the same way, an enlightening being who has taken the medicine of the will for omniscience is not burned by the fire of passion, not affected by the poison of objects, not wounded by the weapons of afflictions, not swept away by the torrent of existence, not suffocated by the smoke of false discrimination.

rigs kyi bu/ 'di lta ste/ dper na/ rnam par mi gtong ba zhes bya ba'i rtsi yod de/ de 'chang na/ gzhan gyis gnod par bya ba'i 'jigs pa thams cad mi 'byung ngo/ /de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' byang chub kyi sems kyi ye shes kyi rtsi 'chang ba'ang 'khor ba'i gnod pa'i 'jigs pa thams cad mi 'byung ngo/ /

“Just as there is a medicine called ‘liberated’ that frees one from fear of attack, in the same way an enlightening being who has taken the medicine of knowledge of aspiration for enlightenment has no fear of being impinged upon by the mundane whirl.

rigs kyi bu/ 'di lta ste/ dper na/ mchu zhes bya ba'i rtsi yod de/ de 'chang na/ dri tshor ba tsam gyis sprul thams cad 'byer ro/ /de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' byang chub kyi sems kyi rtsi 'chang ba'i yon tan gyi dri tsam gyis kyang nyon mongs pa'i sbrul thams cad 'byer bar 'gyur ro/ /
“Just as there is an herb whose scent repels all poisonous snakes, in the same way the scent of the determination for enlightenment wards off the vipers of afflictions.

rigs kyi bu/ 'di lta ste/ dper na/ skyes bu gzhan gyis mi thub pa'i rtsi 'chang na ni/ dgra'i dkyil 'khor thams cad kyis mi tshugs so/ /de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi sems gzhan gyis mi thub pa'i rtsi 'chang ba yang bdud dang phyir rgol ba thams cad kyis thub par dka'o/ /

“Just as a person who has taken the herb of invincibility is victorious over all enemies, the enlightening being who has taken the herb of invincibility of the will for omniscience is invulnerable to all opposing demons.

rigs kyi bu/ 'di lta ste; dper na/ rnam par sel ba zhes bya ba'i rtsi yod de/ de bcangs na/ zug rdu thams cad 'byin par 'gyur ro/ /de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' byang chub kyi sems rnam par sel ba 'chang ba ni/ 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug gi zug rngu thams cad mi 'byung ngo/ /

“Just as there is a medicine called ‘extracting’ that removes all barbs, so all barbs of passion, hatred, delusion, and views drop out of the enlightening being who has taken the extracting medicine of the determination for enlightenment.

rigs kyi bu/ 'di lta ste/ dper na/ rtsi'i rgyal po chen po blta na sdug pa zhes bya ba yod de/ de bcangs na/ nad thams cad sel bar 'gyur ro/ /de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' byang chub kyi sems rtsi'i rgyal po chen po blta na sdug pa 'chang ba yang nyon mongs pa dang / mi shes pa'i nad thams cad rab tu sel bar 'gyur ro/ /

“Just as there is a medicine called ‘good to see’ that cures all illnesses, the enlightening being who has taken the good-to-see medicine of the aspiration for enlightenment is cured of all the illnesses of afflictions and ignorance.

rigs kyi bu/ 'di lta ste/ dper na/ rtsi'i shing chen po sbyor ba zhes bya ba yod de/ de'i shun pas rma la reg ma thag tu rma thams cad 'tsho bar 'gyur ro/ /gang nas bshus pa de'i shun phrags kyang phyir skye'o/ /de bzhin du byang chub kyi sems kyi sa bon las skyes pa'i shing thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du sbyor ba yang mthong ma thag tu rigs kyi bu dad pa rnams kyi las dang nyon mongs pa'i rma yongs su 'tsho bar 'gyur ro/ /thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi shing de la yang 'jig rten thams cad kyis rma dbyung ba'am/ nyams par mi 'gyur ro/ /

“Just as there is a medicinal tree called ‘continuity’ whose bark heals all wounds and ulcers upon application and which itself regrows as it is stripped, the tree of continuity of omniscience, which grows from the seed of the essence of enlightenment, heals the wounds and ulcers of actions and afflictions of the faithful on sight, and the tree of omniscience cannot be exhausted or killed by all beings.

rigs kyi bu/ 'di lta ste/ dper na/ rtsi chen po'i rnam par tsa ba ma grugs pa zhes bya ba yod de; de'i mthus 'dzam bu'i gling gi shing thams cad kyang yan lag thams cad rnam par 'phel lo/ /de bzhin du byang chub kyi sems rtsa ba ma grugs pa'i rtsi chen po'i mthus kyang slob pa dang / mi slob pa dang / rang sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyi dge ba'i rtsa ba'i chos kyi shing rnams rnam par 'phel lo/ /

“Just as there is a kind of herb that promotes growth, by the efficacy of which all the trees in the continent grow, similarly by the efficacy of the growth-promoting drug of the will for enlightenment, the saints and enlightening beings all grow.

'di lta ste/ dper na; dga' ba 'thob pa zhes bya ba'i rtsi yod de/ de su'i lus la thogs pa'i lus dang / sems nad med par 'gyur ro/ /de bzhin du thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi sems dga' ba 'thob par byed pa'i rtsi yang byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyi lus dang / sems nad med pa yongs su skyed do/ /

“Just as there is an herb called ‘attainment of pleasure,’ which when applied to the body produces physical and mental health, in the same way the ‘attainment of pleasure’ herb of the aspiration for omniscience produces physical and mental health in enlightening beings.

rigs kyi bu/ 'di lta ste/ dper na/ dran pa 'thob pa zhes bya ba'i rtsi yod de/ de bcangs na/ sems kyi dran pa rnam par dag par 'gyur ro/ /de bzhin du thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du sems bskyed pa dran pa thob par byed pa'i yang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad la sgrib pa med pa'i dran pa rnam par dag par byed do/ /

“Just as there is an herb called ‘gaining memory’ that purifies the conscious memory, in the same way the memory herb of the aspiration for enlightenment produces in enlightening beings purity of unhindered memory of all buddha-teachings.

rigs kyi bu/ 'di lta ste/ dper na/ pad+ma chen po zhes bya ba'i rtsi yod de/ de zos pa tsam gyis tshe'i tshad bskal par 'gyur ro/ /de bzhin du byang chub kyi sems pad+mo chen po'i rtsi zos pa'i byang chub sems dpa' yang bskal pa grangs med pa'i tshe la dbang pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa thob par 'gyur ro/ /

“Just as there is an herb called ‘great lotus’ by which one may live for an eon, the enlightening being who keeps taking the great spiritual medicine of the will for enlightenment becomes able to live for countless eons.

rigs kyi bu/ 'di lta ste/ dper na/ mi snang ba zhes bya ba'i rtsi yod de/ de bcangs na/ mi dang mi ma yin pa thams cad kyis mi mthong ngo/ /de bzhin du byang chub kyi sems kyi rtsi mi snang bar 'gyur bar bcangs te 'dres pas rnam par spyod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' yang bdud kyi yul thams cad du mi snang ngo/ /

“Just as there is an herb of invisibility that renders one invisible to any humans or nonhumans, the enlightening being under the protection of the invisibility herb of the will for enlightenment, who is assured of buddhahood, cannot be seen in the range of all demons.

rigs kyi bu/ 'di lta ste/ dper na/ rgya mtsho chen po'i nang na nor bu rin po che'i rgyal po chen po rin po che thams cad yongs su sdud pa zhes bya ba yod de/ de 'jig rten gyi khams gzhan du ma 'phos na/ rgya mtsho chen po la bsal pa tshig pa'i me thams cad kyis kyang ta la tsam yang skam par nus pa'i gnas med skabs med do/ /de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du sems bskyed pa nor bu rin po che thams cad yongs su sdud pa'i nor bu rin po che'i rgyal po chen po bsam pa dang sems kyi rgyud la yod pa rnams kyi dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du bsngos pa 'ga' zhig rnam par chud za bar 'gyur ba de lta bu'i gnas med skabs med de/ de ni/ mi srid de/ thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du sems bskyed pa yongs su btang ba zhig tu gyur na ni/ dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad kyang skam par 'gyur ro/ /

“Just as there is a great jewel in the ocean called ‘totality of all jewels,’ which is such that it is impossible for all the eonic fires to evaporate even a drop of the ocean where it is, in the same way it is impossible that enlightening beings whose mental course is imbued with the ‘totality of all jewels’ gem of the determination for omniscience could lose even one virtue dedicated to omniscience; whereas if they abandon the determination for omniscience, all of their roots of goodness would evaporate.

rigs kyi bu/ 'di lta ste / dper na/ nor bu rin po che chen po 'od thams cad yongs su 'dus pa zhes bya ba yod de/ de mgul du btags na/ nor bu rin po che'i rgyan thams cad kyang zil gyis non par 'gyur ro/ /de bzhin du byang chub kyi sems 'od thams cad yongs su 'dus pa'i rin po che chen po bsam pa'i rgyan du thogs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' yang nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas su sems bskyed pa'i rin po che'i rgyan thams cad zil gyis gnon to/ /

“Just as there is a great jewel called ‘collection of all lights,’ which in a necklace obscures all jewelry, in the same way an enlightening being wearing the ornament of the ‘collection of all lights’ mind-jewel of the aspiration for enlightenment is unsurpassed by all aspirations to individual salvation.

rigs kyi bu/ 'di lta ste/ dper na/ nor bu rin po che chen po chu 'dang zhes bya ba yod de; de chur bcug na/ 'dam dang rnyog pa thams cad rab tu dang bar byed do/ /de bzhin du byang chub kyi sems chu 'dang gi nor bu rin po che yang nyon mongs pa'i 'dam dang / rnyog pa thams cad rab tu dang bar byed do/ /

“Just as there is a water-clarifying jewel that will clear all turbidity and foulness from water in which it is placed, in the same way the water-clarifying jewel of the determination for enlightenment clears all the murk and turbidity of afflictions.

rigs kyi bu/ 'di lta ste/ dper na/ nor bu rin po che chen po chu dang 'grogs pa zhes bya ba thogs pa'i nya pa ni/ chur mi 'chi'o/ / de bzhin du thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi sems chu dang 'grogs pa'i nor bu rin po che chen po thogs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' yang 'khor ba'i rgya mtsho thams cad du mi 'chi'o/ /

“Just as fishers wearing the water dwelling gem do not die in water, in the same way an enlightening being protected by the water-dwelling gem of the will for omniscience does not die in the sea of the mundane whirl.

rigs kyi bu/ 'di lta ste/ dper na/ nor bu rin po che klu'i nor bu'i go cha zhes bya ba yod de/ de lag na 'dug na/ nya pa la sogs pa chu las 'tsho ba rnams klu'i gnas thams cad du dong yang klu'i sbrul thams cad kyis mi tshugs so/ /de bzhin du thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du sems bskyed pa'i ye shes klu'i nor bu'i go cha 'chang ba'i byang chub sems dpa' yang 'dod pa'i gnas kyi khams thams cad du 'gro yang nyams par mi 'gyur ro/ /

“Just as there is a jewel called ‘dragon scale gem,’ with which fishers and others who live from the sea enter the abodes of the dragons without being attacked by dragons or sea serpents, in the same way an enlightening being holding the spiritual jewel of the dragon of knowledge of the determination for omniscience enters the abodes of the realm of desire without being harmed.

rigs kyi bu/ 'di lta ste/ dper na/ nor bu rin po che brgya byin mngon par chags pa thogs pa'i lha'i rgyal po brgya byin ni/ lha'i tshogs thams cad zil gyis gnon to/ /de bzhin du thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi sems brgya byin mngon par chags pa'i nor bu rin po che'i rgyal po chen po smon lam gyi cod pan mgo la thogs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' yang khams gsum pa thams cad zil gyis gnon to/ /

“Just as the chief of gods overwhelms other gods when wearing the jewel of lordship, in the same way the enlightening being wearing the crown of vows with the regal jewel of the aspiration for omniscience overwhelms all in the triple world.

rigs kyi bu/ 'di lta ste/ dper na/ nor bu rin po che chen po yid bzhin gyi rgyal po thogs pa'i mi ni/ 'phongs pa thams cad kyis mi 'jigs so/ /de bzhin du thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du sems bskyed pa yid bzhin gyi rgyal po'i nor bu rin po che chen po thogs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' yang yo byad dang 'tsho ba'i bag tsha ba thams cad kyis mi 'jigs so/ /
“Just as someone with a wish-fulfilling jewel does not fear poverty, the enlightening being with the wish-fulfilling jewel of the aspiration for omniscience has no fears about livelihood.

rigs kyi bu/ 'di lta ste/ dper na/ nor bu rin po che nyi mas mdzes pa ni/ nyi ma la bstan na/ me 'byung ngo/ /de bzhin du thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du sems bskyed pa nyi mas mdzes pa'i nor bu rin po che yang shes rab kyi 'od zer gyis phog na/ ye shes kyi me 'byin to/ /

“Just as a ‘sun beauty’jewel emanates fire when exposed to the sun, in the same way the sunny jewel of the will for omniscience emanates the fire of knowledge when touched by the light rays of the jewel of wisdom.

rigs kyi bu/ 'di lta ste/ dper na/ nor bu rin po che zla bas mdzes pa zhes bya ba la zla ba'i 'od kyis phog na/ chu'i rgyun 'byin to/ /de bzhin du byang chub tu sems bskyed pa zla bas mdzes pa'i rin po che chen po yang dge ba'i rtsa ba yongs su bsngos pa'i zla ba'i 'od kyis phog na/ dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad kyi smon lam gyi chu'i rgyun 'byin to/ /

“Just as the moon beauty jewel emits water when touched by moonlight, in the same way the moon beauty jewel of the aspiration for enlightenment emits the water of commitment to all good when touched by the light of the moon of dedication of roots of goodness.

rigs kyi bu/ 'di lta ste/ dper na/ nor bu rin po che yid bzhin gyi rgyal po'i cod pan thogs pa'i klu'i rgyal po chen po rnams la gzhan gyis gnod par bya ba'i 'jigs pa med do/ /de bzhin du byang chub kyi sems snying rje chen po'i nor bu rin po che yid bzhin gyi rgyal po thogs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams la'ang ngan song dang / ngan 'gros gnod par bya ba'i 'jigs pa med do/ /

“Just as great elephants wearing a crown of wish-fulfilling jewels have no fear of attack, in the same way those wearing the crown of wish-fulfilling jewels of great compassion of the aspiration for enlightenment have no fear of the ills of the state of misery.

rigs kyi bu/ 'di lta ste/ dper na/ nor bu rin po che chen po 'gro ba'i rgyan dam pa zhes bya ba ni/ sems can thams cad kyi bsam pa yongs su rdzogs par bya bas nam yang byang bar mi 'gyur ro/ /de bzhin du byang chub tu sems bskyed pa 'gro ba thams cad kyi rgyan gyi dam pa'i nor bu rin po che chen po yang sems can thams cad kyi bsam pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i smon lam yongs su rdzogs par bya bas nam yang byang bar mi 'gyur ro/ /

“Just as a jewel called ‘repository of the adornments of the world’ fulfills the wishes of all beings without ever being exhausted, in the same way the aspiration for enlightenment, the great jewel containing the adornments of all worlds, is never exhausted because of fulfilling the undertaking of enlightenment, which is the wish of all beings.

rigs kyi bu/ 'di lta ste/ dper na/ rgyal po 'khor los bsgyur ba'i nor bu rin po che chen po ni/ mun pa thams cad yongs su sel cing 'gro ste/ khyim gyi nang na gnas na yang rab tu snang bar byed do/ /de bzhin du thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du sems bskyed pa 'khor los bsgyur ba'i nor bu rin po che chen po yang ma rig pa'i mun pa thams cad sel cing 'gro ba'i rgyud thams cad du 'gro ste/ 'dod pa'i khams na gnas na yang ye shes kyi snang ba chen po rab tu 'gyed do/ /

“Just as the great jewel of a sovereign king dispels darkness and lights up the palace, in the same way the royal jewel of the aspiration for omniscience dispels the darkness of ignorance in all states of being and radiates the great light of knowledge in the realm of desire.

rigs kyi bu; 'di lta ste/ dper na/ gang ci yang rung ste/ nor bu rin po che chen po in+d+ra nI la'i 'od kyis phog pa de dag thams cad ni/ nor bu rin po che chen po in+d+ra nI la'i kha dog tu 'gyur ro/ /de bzhin du thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du sems bskyed pa'i nor bu rin po che chen po in+d+ra nI la'ang chos gang dang gang la rnam par spyad pa dang / yongs su btang ba dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba gang ci yang rung ste/ thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du sems bskyed pas yongs su bsngos pa de dag thams cad kyang thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi nor bu rin po che chen po'i kha dog tu 'gyur ro/ /

“Just as everything bathed in sapphire light becomes blue, wherever the sapphire of the aspiration for omniscience is taken, and whatever roots of goodness are dedicated by the will for omniscience, all become the color of the jewel of omniscience.

rigs kyi bu/ 'di lta ste/ dper na/ nor bu rin po che bai DUr+ya ni/ lo brgya phrag stong du mi gtsang ba'i nang zhig na 'dug kyang dri mi zhim pa thams cad dang lhan cig mi gnas te/ de'i rang bzhin 'od gsal ba ni/ de bzhin du gsal zhing shin tu dri ma med do/ /de bzhin du thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du sems bskyed pa'i nor bu rin po che bai DUr+ya yang bskal pa brgya phrag stong zhig tu 'dod pa'i khams thams cad du gnas kyang 'dod pa'i khams kyi skyon thams cad kyis kun nas nyon mongs par mi 'gyur te/ chos kyi dbyings kyi rang bzhin 'od gsal ba ni/ de bzhin du shin tu dag par gnas so/ /

“Just as a jewel in a shower of filth does not absorb any foul odors, in the same way the jewel of the aspiration for enlightenment is not defiled though in the realm of desire, because it is essentially pure.

rigs kyi bu/ 'di lta ste/ dper na/ nor bu rin po che chen po dri ma med pas rnam par dag pa'i 'od ces bya ba ni/ rin po che'i 'byung gnas thams cad zil gyis gnon to/ /de bzhin du thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du sems bskyed pa'i nor bu rin po che chen po dri ma med pas rnam par dag pa'i 'od kyang so so'i skye bo dang / slob pa dang / mi slob pa dang / rang sangs rgyas thams cad kyi yon tan rin po che'i 'byung gnas zil gyis gnon to/ /

“Just as the jewel ‘pure light’ outshines all other jewels, in the same way the jewel of ultimately pure light of the aspiration for omniscience is not overcome by the accumulated virtues of all ordinary people, or all learners, saints, and solitary illuminates.

rigs kyi bu/ 'di lta ste/ dper na/ rin po che chen po me 'byung ba zhes bya ba ni/ gcig pu gnas kyang mun pa thams cad rnam par sel to/ /de bzhin du thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du sems bskyed pa'i nor bu rin po che me 'byung ba lhag mthong dang ldan pa gcig pu yang tshul bzhin yid la bya bas mi shes pa'i mun pa thams cad rnam par sel to/ /

“Just as one fiery jewel disperses all darkness, in the same way one fiery jewel of the aspiration for omniscience, coupled with objective observation and correct thought, dispels the darkness of ignorance.

rigs kyi bu/ 'di lta ste/ dper na/ rgya mtsho chen po nas grus blangs pa'i nor bu rin po che rin thang med pa tshong pa'i lag tu 'ongs pa ni/ grong khyer du phyin na/ nor bu mching bu brgya phrag stong yang kha dog dang / rin thang gi zil gyis gnon to/ /de bzhin du 'khor ba'i rgya mtsho chen po na gnas kyang thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du sems bskyed pa'i nor bu rin po che chen po rin thang med pa smon lam gyi grur bcug pa ni/ byang chub sems dpa' sems dang po bskyed pa'i lhag pa'i bsam pa'i rgyud la 'dug ste/ thams cad mkhyen pa'i grong khyer du ma phyin kyang rnam par grol ba'i grong khyer du phyin na/ nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas nor bu mching bu lta bu thams cad zil gyis gnon to/ /

“Just as a priceless jewel in the hand of a merchant in a boat on the sea is superior in beauty and value to hundreds of thousands of crystals in town, in the same way the priceless jewel of the aspiration for omniscience, even in the ocean of the mundane whirl, in the boat of vows, in the determination of an enlightening being who has just aspired to enlightenment for the first time, even though not having yet reached the city of omniscience, is still superior to the crystals of all hearers and individual illuminates in the town of liberation.

rigs kyi bu/ 'di lta ste/ dper na/ nor bu rin po che chen po dbang gi rgyal po zhes bya ba yod de/ de ni/ 'dzam bu'i gling na gnas kyang dpag tshad stong phrag bzhi bcu na gnas pa'i nyi zla'i dkyil 'khor gyi khyim gzhal med khang gi gzugs brnyan gyi rgyan yongs su ston to; ;de bzhin du yon tan thams cad kyis yongs su sbyangs pa'i thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du sems bskyed pa'i nor bu rin po che chen po dbang gi rgyal po yang 'khor ba'i gnas na 'dug bzhin du chos kyi dbyings kyi nam mkha'i spyod yul las rgyu ba'i de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes chen po'i nyi zla dang / sangs rgyas kyi yul gyi dkyil 'khor thams cad kyang gzugs brnyan gyi rgyan yongs su ston to/ /

“Just as the jewel known as the ‘powerful king,’ even when on the surface of the earth, shows the arrays of appearances of the abodes on the far-distant sun and moon, in the same way the powerful king jewel of the aspiration for omniscience, in which all virtues are purified, even while in the mundane whirl shows the arrays of appearances of the spheres of all buddhas in the great sun and moon of knowledge of those who realize Thusness in the reaches of the sky of the cosmos of reality.

rigs kyi bu/ 'di lta ste/ dper na/ ji srid du nyi zla'i dkyil 'khor gyis snang bar byed pa de srid du nor dang / 'bru dang / rin po che'i rnam pa dang / gser dang / dngul dang / me tog dang / spos dang / phreng ba dang / gos dang / longs spyod gang ji snyed pa de dag thams cad kyis nor bu rin po che chen po dbang gi rgyal po'i rin du mi chog go /de bzhin du ji srid du dus gsum la thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes chos kyi dbyings kyi yul snang bar mdzad pa de srid du lha dang / mi dang / nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas thams cad kyi dge ba'i rtsa ba zag pa yod pa'am/ zag pa med pa gang ji snyed pa de dag thams cad kyis kyang byang chub tu sems bskyed pa'i nor bu rin po che chen po dbang gi rgyal po'i rin du mi chog go /

“Just as all the wealth, jewels, silver, gold, flowers, perfumes, garlands, clothes, and furnishings there are as far as the sun and moon shine do not match the worth of the powerful king jewel, in the same way, all the virtues of celestials and humans, all Buddhist disciples and self-illuminates, tainted or untainted, as far as the scope of the reality-realm reveals, do not match the worth of the powerful king jewel of the determination for enlightenment.

rigs kyi bu/ 'di lta ste/ dper na/ nor bu rin po che chen po rgya mtsho'i rgyan gyi dam pa zhes bya ba yod de/ de ni/ rgya mtsho'i rgyan thams cad yongs su ston to/ /de bzhin du byang chub du sems bskyed pa'i nor bu rin po che chen po rgya mtsho'i rgyan gyi dam pa yang thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes kyi yul rgya mtsho'i rgyan thams cad yongs su ston to/ /

“Just as the jewel known as ‘containing the arrays of the oceans’ shows the arrays of all oceans, in the same way the determination for enlightenment shows the array of the ocean of the scope of all-knowledge.

rigs kyi bu/ 'di lta ste/ dper na/ nor bu rin po che chen po yid bzhin gyi rgyal po ma gtogs par lha rdzas kyi 'dzam bu chu klung gi gser las lhag par 'phags pa gang yang med do/ /de bzhin du thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes nor bu rin po che chen po yid bzhin gyi rgyal po ma gtogs par byang chub tu sems bskyed pa'i lha rdzas kyi 'dzam bu chu klung gi gser las lhag par khyad par du 'phags pa gang yang med do/ /

“Just as nothing surpasses celestial gold, with the exception of a wish-fulfilling jewel, there is nothing except the wish-fulfilling jewel of omniscience, which surpasses the celestial gold of the aspiration for enlightenment.

rigs kyi bu/ 'di lta ste/ dper na/ klu'i tshogs grub par 'gyur ba'i sprul 'dul ba ni/ klu dang sprul thams cad la dbang sgyur ro/ /de bzhin du thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du sems bskyed pa'i nan tan gyi klu'i dkyil 'khor grub pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sprul 'dul ba yang nyon mongs pa'i klu dang sprul thams cad la dbang sgyur ro/ /

“Just as a master snake-catcher can place all serpents under his control, the enlightening snake-catcher who has mastered the will for enlightenment can place all the serpents of affliction under control.

rigs kyi bu/ 'di lta ste/ dper na/ dpa' bo lag cha dang ldan pa ni/ dgra'i 'khor gyis tshugs par dka'o/ /de bzhin du thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du sems bskyed pa'i lag cha dang ldan pa'i byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyang nyon mongs pa'i dgra'i dkyil 'khor thams cad kyis thub par dka'o/ /
“Just as an armed warrior is invulnerable to enemy troops, the enlightening being armed with the determination for omniscience becomes invulnerable to the enemy troops of afflictions.

rigs kyi bu/ 'di lta ste/ dper na/ lha rdzas kyi tsan+dan sprul gyi snying po'i phye ma srang gcig gis ni/ stong gsum gyi 'jig rten gyi khams dri zhim pos rgyas par 'gengs te/ de zho gcig tsam la yang stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams rin po ches yongs su gang bas rin du mi chog go /de bzhin du thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du sems bskyed pa lha rdzas kyi tsan+dan sprul gyi snying po lhag pa'i bsam pa gcig la gnas pa'i khams kyang chos kyi dbyings thams cad yon tan gyi dri zhim pos rgyas par 'gengs te/ slob pa dang / mi slob pa dang / rang sangs rgyas thams cad kyi sems kyi sems kyang zil gyis gnon to/ /

“Just as one handful of celestial serpent sandalwood powder perfumes a thousand worlds, and three thousand worlds full of jewels cannot match the worth of an ounce of it, in the same way one element of the celestial serpent sandalwood of the aspiration for omniscience perfumes the whole cosmos with virtue and surpasses the minds of all learners, those who are beyond learning, and self-illuminates.

rigs kyi bu/ 'di lta ste/ dper na/ tsan+dan rin po che chen po kha ba'i tsan+dan zhes bya ba ni/ gdung ba thams cad rab tu zhi bar byed de/ lus thams cad kyang rab tu bsil bar byed do/ /de bzhin du thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du sems bskyed pa'i kha ba'i tsan+dan rin po che yang nyon mongs pa'i kun tu rtog pa dang / 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug gi gdung ba thams cad kyang rab tu sel to/ /ye shes kyi lus kyang rab tu sim par byed do/ /

“Just as the precious snowy sandalwood stops all burning and cools the whole body, in the same way the snowy sandalwood of the aspiration for omniscience stops the burning of all afflictions, false notions, lust, hatred and delusion, and cools the body of knowledge.

rigs kyi bu/ 'di lta ste/ dper na; ri'i rgyal po ri rab kyi drung du ji snyed cig nye bar 'ongs pa de dag thams cad kyang gser gyi kha dog tu kha dog gcig tu 'gyur ro/ /de bzhin du gang su'ang rung ste/ thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du sems bskyed pa dang ldan pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i drung du nye bar 'ongs pa de dag thams cad kyang thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi kha dog tu kha dog gcig par 'gyur ro; ;

“Just as all who come to the polar mountain become one color, gold, in the same way all who approach enlightening beings who are entirely dedicated to omniscience become one color, the color of omniscience.

rigs kyi bu/ 'di lta ste/ dper na/ shing sus kyang mi tshugs pa dang kun nas 'du ba'i shun phrags kyi dri zhim po 'byung ba de lta bu ni/ 'dzam+bu'i gling gi me tog par shi ka dang / me tog dzA ti dang / me tog su ma na la sogs pa me tog gi rnam pa thams cad la'ang med do/ /de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du sems bskyed ba'i sa bon las byung ba'i smon lam gyi shing gi yon tan dang / ye shes kyi shun phrags kyi dri zhim po'i ngad 'byung ba de lta bu ni/ dge ba'i rtsa ba dma' ba dang ldan pa thams cad dang / nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi me tog par shi ka dang / me tog dzA ti dang / me tog su ma na'i tshul khrims pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / shes rab dang / rnam par grol ba dang / rnam par grol ba'i ye shes mthong ba zag pa med pa dang ldan pa thams cad la'ang med do/ /

“Just as the bark of a tree of paradise emits a fragrance that is not found in all the flowers on earth, in the same way the fragrance of the bark of virtue and knowledge of the tree of vows grown from the seed of enlightening beings’ determination for omniscience is not found in any of the flowers of hearers and individual illuminates, who have lesser roots of goodness, in their untainted discipline, concentration, wisdom, liberation, and knowledge and vision of liberation.

rigs kyi bu/ 'di lta ste/ dper na/ shing sus kyang mi thub pa dang / kun nas 'du ba kha 'bus par gyur na/ me tog stong phrag mang po'i 'byung gnas su gyur par shes par bya'o/ /de bzhin du thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du sems bskyed pa'i shing kun nas 'du ba dge ba'i rtsa bas kha 'bus par gyur na/ lha dang mi grangs med pa'i byang chub kyi me tog zag pa dang bcas pa dang / zag pa med pa'i skye gnas su 'gyur bar shes par bya'o/ /

“Just as it can be known of a budding tree of paradise that it will produce hundreds of thousands of blossoms, in the same way it can be known that the paradise tree of the aspiration for omniscience budding with roots of goodness will produce countless flowers of enlightenment, imperfect and perfect, in celestials and humans.

rigs kyi bu/ 'di lta ste/ dper na/ shing kun nas'du ba'i me tog gis nyi ma gcig tu bsgos pa'i gos sam/ til mar las dri zhim pa'i ngad 'byung ba de lta bu yang me tog tsam pa ka dang / me tog su ma nas nyi ma brgya phrag stong du bsgos pa'i gos sam/ til mar las kyang mi 'byung ngo/ /de bzhin du thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi sems kyi rgyud tshe gcig tu yongs su bsgos ba'i byang chub sems dpa'i yon tan dang / ye shes kyi dri zhim po'i ngad phyogs bcu'i sangs rgyas kyi zhabs kyi drung du ldang ba de lta bu ni/ bskal pa brgya phrag stong du bsgos pa'i nyen thos dang / rang sangs rgyas thams cad kyi sems las kyang zag pa med pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba dang chos kyi ye shes kyi dri zhim po mi 'byung ngo/ /

“Just as the fragrance of cloth or oil perfumed for one day with paradise tree flowers is not to be found in cloth or oil perfumed for a hundred thousand days with jasmine flowers, in the same way the fragrance of enlightening beings’ virtue and knowledge, of the mind and body infused for one lifetime with the determination for omniscience, wafts to the presence of all buddhas in the ten directions, and is not to be found in the fragrance of untainted virtue and spiritual knowledge of those infused for a hundred thousand eons with the aspirations of those who seek individual salvation.

rigs kyi bu/ 'di lta ste/ dper na/ shing gi rigs na li ke re zhes bya ba rgya mtsho gnod pa dang bral ba nas skye ba yod do/ /de'i rtsa ba yan chad me tog gi bar du yang dus thams cad du nam yang sems can rnams kyi nye bar 'tsho bar mi 'gyur ba med do/ /de bzhin du snying rje chen po dang / smon lam gyi rtsa ba yang dag par skyes pa'i byang chub sems dpa' yang thog ma thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du sems bskyed pa nas nye bar bzung ba phyin chad dam pa'i chos gnas pa'i mthar thug gi bar du nam yang lha dang bcas pa'i 'jig rten gyi nye bar 'tsho bar mi 'gyur ba med do/ /

“Just as there is a kind of tree that grows in an ocean, on all of which, from its roots to its flowers and fruits, all beings are at all times living, in the same way the world is sustained by the process of enlightening, growing from the root of vows based on great compassion, from the initial aspiration for omniscience through the duration and ending of the true teaching.

rigs kyi bu/ 'di lta ste/ dper na/ dngul chu'i rigs gser du snang ba zhes bya ba yod do/ /de ni; srang gcig gis kyang lcags srang stong gser du sgyur ro/ /dngul chu srang gcig po de ni/ lcags srang stong po des zad par bya ba'am/ lcags su bsgyur bar mi nus so/ /de bzhin du thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du sems bskyed pa'i ro'i khams dge ba'i rtsa ba yongs su bsngos pa'i ye shes kyis bzung ba ni/ las dang nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa'i lcags thams cad zad par byas te/ chos thams cad thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi kha dog tu byed kyang thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du sems bskyed pa'i ro'i khams gcig po de ni; las dang nyon mongs pa'i lcags thams cad kyis kyang kun nas nyon mongs par bya ba'am/ zad par mi nus so/ /

“Just as there is an ointment called ‘golden light,’ one ounce of which will make a thousand ounces of copper gold, while those thousand ounces of copper cannot appropriate the ounce of ointment and make it copper, in the same way the one element of the essence of the aspiration for omniscience, concentrated by knowledge of dedication of roots of goodness, takes away the copper of the barriers caused by actions and afflictions and makes them into the color of total knowledge of all things, and the essential element of the aspiration for omniscience cannot be defiled or appropriated by any actions or afflictions.

rigs kyi bu/ 'di lta ste/ dper na; me ni/ ji tsam du chung du zin kyang rkyen ji tsam dang phrad pa de tsam gyi me lce yongs su skyed do/ /de bzhin du thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du sems bskyed pa'i me ji tsam du chung du zin kyang dmigs pa rgya chen po'i tshogs kyi rkyen ji tsam dang phrad pa de tsam du ye shes kyi 'od 'phro ba rab tu dgye bas rnam par 'phel bar byed do/ /

“Just as even a little bit of fire will produce as much flame as the amount of fuel it gets, in the same way even a little bit of the fire of the determination for omniscience, because of mixing with objects, will increase in its production of flames of knowledge to the extent of the provisions it is supplied with.

rigs kyi bu/ 'di lta ste/ dper na/ me mar gcig las me mar bye ba brgya phrag stong zhig bus kyang me mar de ni/ de snyed byung bas mi zad de/ mthar thug pa med do/ /de bzhin du thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du sems bskyed pa'i me mar gcig las 'das pa dang / ma byon pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du thugs bskyed pa'i me mar mang po 'bar yang thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du sems bskyed pa'i me mar gcig po de ni/ de snyed kyi thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du sems bskyed pa'i me mar byung bas mi zad de/ mthar thug pa med do/ /

“Just as millions of lamps can be lit from one lamp, without the one lamp being exhausted or diminished by all the lamps taking their flame from it, in the same way from the one lamp of the aspiration for omniscience the lamps of aspiration for omniscience of all buddhas of past, future, and present are lit, yet the one lamp of aspiration for omniscience is not exhausted, and shines undiminished by the lights of the lamps of aspiration to omniscience proceeding from it.

rigs kyi bu/ 'di lta ste/ dper na/ me mar gcig cig khyim mam khang bu ji lta bur bcug kyang rung ste/ bcug ma thag tu lo stong du bsags bsags pa'i mun pa yang rnam par sel cing snang bar byed do/ /de bzhin du thams cad mkhyen pa'i sems bskyed pa gcig kyang sems can gyi bsam pa'i khyim thibs po ma rig pa'i mun pa dang ldan pa ci lta bu yang rung ste/ de'i rgyud du phyin na/ de phyin ma thag tu bskal pa brgya stong brjod du med par bsags pa'i las dang nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa dang / mun pa thams cad rnam par sel cing ye shes kyi snang ba yongs su skyed do/ /

“Just as when a lamp is put into a room, even a thousand years of darkness immediately vanishes and it lights up the place, in the same way when the lamp of the aspiration for omniscience enters the room of the mind of sentient beings, dark with ignorance, immediately untold eons of darkness caused by the obstruction by afflictions is dispelled, and the lamp produces the light of knowledge.

rigs kyi bu/ 'di lta ste/ dper na/ me mar ni/ snying po ji tsam pa de'i rkyen tsam du snang bar byed de/ mar gyi tshogs ji srid du gnas pa de srid du 'bar ro/ /de bzhin du thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du sems bskyed pa'i me mar yang byang chub sems dpa'i smon lam gyi snying po'i khyad par ci 'dra ba de lta bur chos kyi dbyings yongs su snang bar byed de/ snying rje chen pos spyod pa'i me mar gyi tshogs ji srid du gnas pa de srid du sems can gdul ba dang / zhing yongs su dag par bya ba dang / sangs rgyas kyi sku don sgrub pa la yongs su 'bar bar gnas so/ /

“Just as a lamp makes light according to the condition of its wick, and burns as long as there is a supply of oil, in the same way the lamp of the aspiration for omniscience lights up the realm of reality according to the excellence of the wick of vows of the enlightening being, and as long as there is a supply of the oil of the practice of universal compassion, so long will there be the power for the buddha-tasks of guiding sentient beings and purifying lands.
