shin tu rgyas pa chen po'i mdo/ sangs rgyas phal po che zhes bya ba las/ sdong pos brgyan pa'i le'u ste/ bam po brgya bcu gsum pa/

rigs kyi bu/ 'di lta ste/ dper na/ lha rdzas kyi 'dzam bu chu klung gi gser gyi rgyan lha'i rgyal po dbang sgyur ba'i mgo la thogs pa ni/ 'dod pa na spyod pa'i lha'i bu thams cad kyis mi 'phrog go /de bzhin du thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du sems bskyed pa lha rdzas kyi 'dzam bu chu klung gi gser gyi rgyan nan tan dang / yon tan la rab tu gnas pa byang chub sems dpa' phyir mi ldog pa rnams kyi smon lam chen po'i mgo la thogs pa ni/ byis pa tha dad pa'i skye bo dang / slob pa dang / mi slob pa dang / rang sangs rgyas thams cad kyis mi 'phrog go /

“Just as celestial gold ornaments on the head of the king of gods of control over others’ emanations cannot be outshone by any of the celestials in the realm of desire, in the same way the celestial gold ornament of the aspiration for omniscience, set on perfected virtue and fastened on the head of universal vows of nonregressing enlightening beings, cannot be outshone by ordinary people or by learners or attainers of individual liberation.

rigs kyi bu/ 'di lta ste/ dper na / ri kyi rgyal po seng+ge'i nga ros ni/ seng+ge'i phru gu skyes nas ring po ma lon pa'ang nyams su bde zhing rta'i ri thams cad ni/ kun tu 'byer bar 'gyur ro/ /de bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pa skyes bu'i seng+ge chen po'i thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi nga ro byang chub kyi sems yongs su brjod pa phyung bas ni/ las dang po pa'i byang chub sems dpa' seng+ge'i phru gu rnams sangs rgyas kyi chos kyis nyams su bde zhing rta'i dmigs pa la gnas pa'i sems can thams cad ni/ kun tu 'byer ro/ /

“Just as lion cubs thrive on the roar of the lion, king of beasts, while the other animals all hide, in the same way by the roar of omniscience of the Buddha, the human lion, extolling the determination for enlightenment, the lion-cub beginning enlightening beings thrive on the enlightened teachings, while all grasping, clinging people hide.

rigs kyi bu/ 'di lta ste; dper na/ seng+ge'i rgyus pa las rgyud du byas pa'i pi wang gi sgras ni/ pi wang thams cad kyi rgyud yongs su 'chad do/ /de bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pa seng+ge'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i sku mnga' ba'i byang chub tu sems bskyed pa'i rgyus pa'i yon tan brjod pa'i sgras 'dod pa'i rgyud kyi dga' ba'i pi wang thams cad kyi rgyud yongs su 'chad par 'gyur ro/ / nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi spyod pa dang / yon tan gyi gtam thams cad kyang yongs su 'gag par 'gyur ro/ /

“Just as the strings of all instruments snap at the sound of an instrument strung with lion sinew, in the same way at the virtue-extolling sound of the instrument strung with the sinew of the aspiration for enlightenment of the buddha-lion whose body is the transcendent ways, the strings of the lute of sensuality snap and the songs of praise of the virtues of the individually liberated fade out.

rigs kyi bu/ 'di lta ste/ dper na/ rgya mtsho chen po pa dang / ma he dang / ra'i 'o mas yongs su gang ba'i nang du seng+ge'i 'o ma thigs gcig blugs pas/ 'o ma de dag thams cad 'gyes par 'gyur te/ 'dur mi btub bo/ /de bzhin du bskal pa brgya phrag stong du bsags pa'i nyon mongs pa kun gyi 'o ma'i rgya mtshor yang de bzhin gshegs pa skyes bu'i seng+ge chen po'i thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du sems bskyed pa'i 'o ma thigs pa gcig blugs pas thams cad ma lus par zad par 'gyur te/ nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas thams cad kyi rnam par thar pa rnams kyang mi gnas mi 'du'o; ;

“Just as a drop of lion milk in an ocean of cow milk causes all the milk to separate and does not mix with it, in the same way the ocean of milk of acts and afflictions accumulated over hundreds of thousands of eons is destroyed by putting into it one drop of the milk of the determination for omniscience of the Buddha, the human lion, and it does not mix with the liberation of those who are only enlightened for themselves alone.

rigs kyi bu/ 'di lta ste/ dper na/ bya ka la phing+ka'i phru gu sgo nga'i sbubs nas ma byung ba la nga ro'i mthu'i khyad par yod pa de lta bu ni/ gangs kyi ri la gnas pa'i bya'i tshogs mthu dang shugs thams cad yongs su rdzogs pa thams cad la yang med do/ /de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' ka la ping+ka'i phru gu las dang po pa 'khor ba'i sgo nga'i sbubs na 'dug pa la snying rje chen po dang / byang chub kyi sems kyi nga ro'i mthu'i khyad par yod pa de lta bu ni/ nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas thams cad la med do/ /

“Just as the extraordinary power of the cry of a kalavinka chick still in the shell is not found in any of the birds of the mountains, even when they are full grown, in the same way the extraordinary power of the cry of universal compassion of the aspiration for enlightenment of a fledgling enlightening being still in the shell of the mundane whirl is not found in the individually liberated.

rigs kyi bu/ 'di lta ste/ dper na/ nam mkha' lding chen po'i phru gu skyes nas ring po ma lon pa la gshog pa'i rlung gi stobs dang / mthu bdog pa dang / mig yongs su dag pa'i yon tan yod pa de lta bu ni/ de ma yin pa'i bya lus tshad du phyin pa gzhan thams cad la'ang med do/ /de bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pa nam mkha' lding chen po'i rigs dang / rgyud du byung ba'i byang chub sems dpa' nam mkha' lding chen po'i phru gu sems dang po bskyed pa la thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du sems bskyed pa'i gshog pa'i rlung gi stobs dang / shugs bdog pa dang / snying rje chen po dang / lhag pa'i bsam pa'i mig yongs su dag pa'i yon tan yod pa'i nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas bskal pa brgya stong tshang bas byung ba thams cad la med do/ /

“Just as the wing flapping power and clear vision of a newborn garuda is not found even in fully grown birds of other species, in the same way the power of the determination for enlightenment and the purity of the mind of compassion in a beginning enlightening being born in the family of the buddhas is not found even in seekers of individual liberation and self-illuminates who have been practicing for a long time.

rigs kyi bu/ 'di lta ste/ dper na/ skyes bu chen po'i lag nas spyad pa'i mde'u thung gis ni/ go cha ji tsam du sra yang brtol to/ /de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' brtson 'grus brtan po dang ldan pa'i lag nas spyad pa'i thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du sems bskyed pa'i mde'u thung gis kyang lta ba dang / bag la nyal ba'i go cha thams cad mi brtol ba med do/ /

“Just as a spear in the hand of a powerful man can pierce any armor, however strong it is, in the same way the spear of the determination for omniscience, in the hand of an enlightening being of steadfast vigor, pierces the armor of all views and propensities.

rigs kyi bu/ 'di lta ste/ dper na/ mthu bo che chen po khros te rngam pa'i 'phral ba la thor bu ji srid du gnas pa de srid du 'dzam bu'i gling gi mi thams cad kyis kyang mi thub bo/ /de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' mthu bo che chen po snying rje chen pos rngam pa'i lhag pa'i bsam pa'i gdong la thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du sems bskyed pa'i thor bu ji srid du gnas pa de srid du 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du gtogs pa'i bdud thams cad dang / bdud kyi las thams cad kyis kyang mi thub bo/ /

“Just as a mighty man full of wrath cannot be defeated by any man on earth as long as there are eruptions on his forehead, in the same way a mighty enlightening being filled with universal love and compassion cannot be overcome by any devils or actions in any world as long as the eruptions of the determination for omniscience do not disappear from the face of will.

rigs kyi bu/ 'di lta ste/ dper na/ 'phong gi slob dpon gyi mchan bu ma byang ba 'phong gi thabs la ma goms pa la 'phong gi gnas dang / thabs kyi mthu dang / khyad par bdog pa de lta bu ni/ thams cad la byang yang 'phong mi shes pa rnams la med do/ / de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' cad shes las dang po pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la ma goms pa la smon lam gyi ye shes dang mos pas spyod pa'i mthu'i khyad par ci bdog pa de lta bu ni/ byang chub tu sems ma bskyed pa'i sems can thams cad dang / slob pa dang / mi slob pa dang / rang sangs rgyas thams cad la med do/ /

“Just as the special strength of application to technique of a student of archery is not found in a teacher of archery who has already learned it all, the special strength of zealous practice of beginning enlightening beings is not found in those who seek and attain personal salvation without the aspiration for universal enlightenment.

rigs kyi bu/ 'di lta ste; dper na/ 'phong slob pa'i 'phong gi rgyus thams cad la ni/ dang por rkang pa'i stangs la goms par bya ba sngon du 'gro'o/ /de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi sa la slob pas sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad khong du chud par bya ba la yang dang por thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du sems bskyed pa'i lhag pa'i bsam pa la yang dag par gnas pa sngon du 'gro'o/ /

“Just as the first step in learning archery is to learn the stance, in the same way for an enlightening being learning about omniscience is the first step to understanding all the buddha-teachings in the act of setting out with the determination for omniscience.

rigs kyi bu/ 'di lta ste/ dper na/ sgyu ma'i mkhan po sgyu ma'i rnam pa dang / yul thams cad yongs su ston pa'i bya ba thams cad ni/ dang por sngags kyi dngos grub mngon par sgrub pa yid la byas na/ 'grub par 'gyur ro/ /de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa'i yul dang / rnam par 'phrul pa thams cad yongs su ston pa'i sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa'i yul thams cad la yang dang po sems bskyed pa'i smon lam mngon par sgrub pa ni/ yongs su grub pa yin no/ /

“Just as when a magician is going to make a display of magical effects, all the effects are accomplished by first thinking of the magical formula, in the same way when manifesting the spheres of buddhas and enlightening beings, the establishing of the spheres of buddhas and enlightening beings takes place by first evoking the vow to accomplish enlightenment.

rigs kyi bu/ 'di lta ste/ dper na/ sgyu ma'i sngags dang / rig sngags thams cad ni/ gzugs med la bstan du med pa yin yang sems bskyed pas sgyu ma'i sprul pa dang / gzugs kyi rnam pa thams cad yongs su ston to/ /de bzhin du thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du sems bskyed pa yang gzugs med la bstan du med de/ chos kyi dbyings thams cad sems bskyed pa la dbang bsgyur ba tsam gyis chos kyi dbyings thams cad yon tan gyi rgyan rnam par phye ba thams cad kyis rnam par sgrub bo/ /

“Just as all magical formulas are formless and invisible but produce magical phantoms with form by mental activity, in the same way the determination for omniscience is formless and invisible, yet it fashions all spiritual realms with arrays of ornaments of all virtues merely by control of mental activity.

rigs kyi bu/ 'di lta ste/ dper na/ byi la'i mig gis bltas pa tsam gyis byi ba thams cad kun tu 'byer ro/ /de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa'i thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du sems bskyed pa'i lhag pa'i bsam pa'i sbyor ba tsam gyis las dang / nyon mongs pa thams cad 'byor bar 'gyur ro/ /

“Just as all rats and mice take cover as soon as they see a wildcat on the prowl, in the same way all conditioning and affliction flee just from the proceeding of application of intense determination for omniscience.

rigs kyi bu/ 'di lta ste/ dper na / 'dzam bu chu klung gi gser gyi rgyan btags na/ rgyan thams cad zil gyis gnon to/ /de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' byang chub kyi sems 'dzam bu chu klung gi gser gyi rgyan thogs pa yang nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas thams cad kyi yon tan gyi rgyan zil gyis gnon to/ /zil tu rlags par byed do/ /

“Just as when one puts on an ornament of the finest gold it outshines all bangles, in the same way the enlightening being wearing the gold ornament of the determination for omniscience outshines the ornaments of virtue of all hearers and individual illuminates.

rigs kyi bu/ 'di lta ste/ dper na/ rdo ba khab long gi rgyal po khams ji tsam du chung yang lcags sgrog sra ba thams cad zhig par byed do/ /de bzhin du sems thag pa nas bskyed pa'i thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du sems bskyed pa'i khams ji tsam du chung yang lta ba'i rnam pa dang / ma rig pa dang / sred pa'i sgrog thams cad zhig par byed do/ /

“Just as even the smallest bit of the most powerful magnet can burst strong chains asunder, in the same way even the smallest bit of aspiration for omniscience with powerful determination can burst asunder the chains of views, ignorance, and craving.

rigs kyi bu/ 'di lta ste/ dper na/ rdo ba khab long gi khams ni/ gang dang gang du bzhag pa de dang der lcags phal ba thams cad 'gyes shing mi gnas la mi 'du'o/ /de bzhin du thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du sems bskyed pa'i khams kyang las sam/ nyon mongs pa'am/ nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi rnam par grol ba gang dang gang du byung ba de dang de dag gi las dang / nyon mongs pa thams cad dang / nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi rnam par thar pa thams cad kyang 'byer zhing mi 'khong mi 'du'o/ /

“Just as wherever a magnet is used, all metals that it expels are repelled and do not remain there or join with it, in the same way wherever the determination for omniscience is used, whether in the midst of actions or afflictions or the liberation of hearers and individual illuminates, those actions and afflictions and individual liberation are expelled and do not remain or join with it.

rigs kyi bu/ 'di lta ste; dper na/ chu srin gyi tshal gyi zegs ma gcig zos pa'i nya ba ni/ chu'i srog chags thams cad kyi 'jigs pa dang bral ba yin te/ chu srin gyis sos btab kyang lus la mi tshugs so/ /de bzhin du lhag pa'i bsam pas byang chub kyi sems kyi cha gcig zos pa'i byang chub sems dpa' yang 'khor ba'i las dang / nyon mongs pa'i 'jigs pa dang bral ba yin te/ nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas thams cad kyis mngon par khong du chud par bya ba'i nang na 'dug kyang yang dag pa'i mtha' mngon du bya ba'i lam gol bar ltung bas gnod par mi 'gyur ro/ /

“Just as a fisher with knowledge of sea monsters is free from fear of any creatures of the sea and is safe from harm even in the mouth of a whale, in the same way the enlightening being with the knowledge of the powerful determination of the aspiration for enlightenment is free from fear of all the actions and afflictions of the mundane whirl and cannot be annihilated even in the midst of realization of individual liberation, because of not falling into the extinction produced by witness of ultimate reality.

rigs kyi bu/ 'di lta ste/ dper na/ bdud rtsi'i chu 'thungs pa'i skyes bu ni/ gzhan gyis gnod par bya ba thams cad kyis mi 'chi'o/ /de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du sems bskyed pa'i bdud rtsi'i chu 'thungs pa yang nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas thams cad kyi sar mi 'chi'o/ /byang chub sems dpa'i snying rje chen po'i smon lam las kyang rgyun 'chad par mi 'gyur ro/ /

“Just as one who has drunk the elixir of immortality does not die from the attacks of others, in the same way the enlightening being who has drunk the immortality elixir of the aspiration for omniscience does not die in the stages of learners of individual salvation and does not cease acting on the vow of universal compassion of enlightening beings.

rigs kyi bu/ 'di lta ste/ dper na/ bsku ba grub pa'i skyes bu ni/ mi'i gnas thams cad rnam par spyod kyang mi kun gyis mi mthong ngo/ /de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' byang chub tu sems bskyed pa'i shes rab dang / smon lam gyis nye bar brtan pa bdud kyi yul thams cad la rnam par spyod kyang bdud thams cad kyis mi mthong ngo/ /

“Just as a man who has perfected the ointment of invisibility can wander through people’s houses unseen by anyone, the enlightening being grounded on the wisdom and commitment of the determination for enlightenment can roam in the realms of all demons without being seen by any demons.

rigs kyi bu/ 'di lta ste/ dper na rgyal po chen po la brtan pa'i skyes bu ni/ skye bo ma rabs thams cad kyis mi 'jigs so/ /de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du sems bskyed pa chos kyi rgyal po chen po la brten pa yang sgrib pa dang / bar chad dang / ngan song thams cad kyis mi 'jigs so/ /

“Just as a person who cleaves to a great king does not fear ordinary people, the enlightening being who cleaves to the spiritual king of the determination for omniscience does not fear any obstacles, hindrances, or states of misery.

rigs kyi bu/ 'di lta ste/ dper na/ sa phug gi khyim na gnas na/ sa'i gseb thams cad rlan gyis yangs su gang bas me'i 'jigs pa med do/ /de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' sems kyi rgyud byang chub sems kyi dge ba'i rtsa bas mngon par brlan pa la'ang nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi rnam par grol ba'i ye shes kyi mes 'jigs pa med do/ /

“Just as someone in water is in no danger from fire, the enlightening being who is soaked in the virtue of the aspiration for enlightenment is in no danger from the fire of knowledge of individual liberation.

rigs kyi bu/ 'di lta ste/ dper na/ dpa' bo la brten pa'i mi ni/ dgra thams cad kyis mi 'jigs so/ /de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du sems bskyed pa'i dpa' bo la brtan pa yang spyod pa ngan pa'i dgra thams cad kyis mi 'jigs so/ /

“Just as a person who cleaves to a heroic warrior does not fear enemies, the enlightening being who cleaves to the heroic warrior of the determination for omniscience does not fear the enemies that are evil actions.

rigs kyi bu/ 'di lta ste/ dper na/ lha'i dbang po brgya byin rdo rje'i lag cha thogs pa ni/ lha ma yin gyi tshogs thams cad rab tu 'joms so/ /de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du sems bskyed pa brtan pa'i lhag pa'i bsam pa rdo rje'i lag cha thogs pa yang bdud dang phas kyi rgol ba'i lha ma yin gyi tshogs thams cad rab tu 'joms so/ /

“Just as the king of gods with the thunderbolt weapon crushes all the titans, the enlightening being with the thunderbolt of the steadfast will of the aspiration for omniscience crushes all the titans of demons and false teachers.

rigs kyi bu/ 'di lta ste/ dper na/ rtsi ro'i bcud 'thungs pa'i skyes bu ni/ tshe shin tu ring par gnas so; ;nyam chung bar mi 'gyur ro/ /rga bar mi 'gyur ro/ /de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du sems bskyed pa'i ro'i bcud kyi tshogs 'thungs pa yang bskal pa grangs med par 'khor ba na 'khor yang yongs su skyo ba med la 'khor ba'i skyon gyis mi gos so/ /

“Just as a person who takes the elixir of life lives for a long time and does not grow weak, the enlightening being who uses the elixir of the aspiration for omniscience goes around in the mundane whirl for countless eons without becoming exhausted and without being stained by the ills of the mundane whirl.

rigs kyi bu/ 'di lta ste/ dper na/ sman gyi ro sbyar ro cog thams cad du chu ni/ sngon du 'gro ba ste/ gang la yang skyon du mi 'gyur ro/ /de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa dang / smon lam gyi tshogs sbyar ba thams cad du thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du sems bskyed pa ni/ sngon du 'gro ba ste/ gang la yang skyon du mi 'gyur ro/ /

“Just as in all compounds of herbal extracts potable water is primary, never spoiling, in the same way in the application of preparations of all enlightening beings’ practices and vows the determination for omniscience is primary, never becoming corrupt.

rigs kyi bu/ 'di lta ste/ dper na/ mi'i don du bya ba thams cad la ni; srog gi dbang po sngon du 'gro'o/ /de bzhin du byang chub sems dpas sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad yang dag par blang ba la'ang byang chub kyi sems sngon du 'gro'o/ /
“Just as in all of a person’s doing the faculty of life is the primary necessity, for an enlightening being to absorb the buddha-teachings the aspiration for enlightenment is the primary necessity.

rigs kyi bu/ 'di lta ste/ dper na/ skyes bu srog gi dbang po dang bral ba ni/ las thams cad la mthu med pas pha ma dang / gnyen bshes kyi tshogs kyis kyang nye bar 'tsho bar byar med do/ /de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du sems bskyed pa dang bral ba yang sangs rgyas kyi ye shes thob par bya ba la mthu med pas/ sems can thams cad kyis kyang thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi yon tan gyis nye bar 'tsho bar byar med do/ /

“Just as a person who has lost the faculty of life has no way to live, being unable to do anything for his people, in the same way an enlightening being without the life root of the determination for omniscience has no way to live, being unable to obtain enlightened knowledge for all beings.

rigs kyi bu/ 'di lta ste/ dper na/ rgya mtsho chen po ni/ dug thams cad kyis gdug par mi nus so/ /de bzhin du thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du sems skyed pa'i rgya mtsho chen po yang las dang / nyon mongs pa dang / nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas su sems bskyed pa'i dug thams cad kyis gdug bar mi nus so/ /

“Just as the ocean cannot be ruined by any poisons, the ocean of aspiration for omniscience cannot be ruined by any of the poisons of compulsive actions, afflictions, or aspirations for personal liberation alone.

rigs kyi bu/ 'di lta ste/ dper na/ nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor ni skar ma thams cad kyi 'od kyis thub par mi nus so/ /de bzhin du thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du sems bskyed pa'i nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor yang nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi skar ma thams cad kyi yon tan zag pa med pa'i 'od kyis mi thub bo/ /
“Just as the sun is not outshone by the lights of all the stars, the sun of aspiration to omniscience is not outshone by the taintless virtues of those who are personally liberated.

rigs kyi bu/ 'di lta ste/ dper na/ rgyal po'i bu skyes nas yun ring du ma lon pa yang blon po'i mchog tu bya ba nas rgan pa thams cad rigs su rigs dang ldan par skyes pa dang / dbang gis zil gyis gnon to/ /de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' byang chub tu sems bskyed nas ring po ma lon pa / chos kyi rgyal po de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs su skyes pa'i las dang po pa yang yun ring po nas tshangs par spyod spyod pa'i nyan thos nas rgan pa thams cad byang chub kyi sems kyi snying rje chen po'i dbang gis zil gyis gnon to/ /

“Just as a newborn prince is not inferior to fully grown ministers, because of his superior birth, a beginning enlightening being, born in the family of the enlightened spiritual kings, is not inferior to Buddhist disciples with long experience in religious practice, because of the superiority of universal compassion of the aspiration for enlightenment.

rigs kyi bu/ 'di lta ste/ dper na/ blon po ji tsam du rgan pas kyang rgyal bu gzhon nu ji tsam du chung ba la'ang phyag bya dgos so/ /rgyal po'i bus kyang blon po rgan po la rim gro mi bya ba ma yin no/ /de bzhin du nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas ji tsam du rgan la/ ji tsam du tshangs pa'i spyod pa ring du spyod spyod pa rnams kyis kyang byang chub sems dpa' las dang po pa la 'dud bar bya'o/ /byang chub sems dpas kyang nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas rnams la rim gro med par bya ba ma yin no/ /

“Just as a minister, no matter how old, should pay respect to a prince, no matter how young, and a prince need not honor a minister, in the same way Buddhist disciples and self-illuminates, no matter how long they have performed religious practice, should pay respect to even a beginning enlightening being, and the enlightening being need not honor those who are enlightened only for themselves.

rigs kyi bu/ 'di lta ste/ dper na/ rgyal po'i bu thams cad kyis mi dgos par bya ba zhig na'ang rgyal po'i mtshan dang ldan na/ rigs kyi btsun pas rgyal po'i blon po dam par bya ba thams cad dang yang mi mnyam mo/ /de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' las dang po las dang nyon mongs pa'i nye bar len pa thams cad kyis non pa yang thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du sems bskyed pa'i mtshan dang ldan na/ sangs rgyas kyi rigs kyi btsun zhing che bas nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas mchog tu phyin pa thams cad dang yang mi mnyam mo/ /

“Just as a prince, without any power yet never without the character of royalty, is not equaled even by the ministers who have gained eminence, because of his superior birth, in the same way a beginning enlightening being, no matter how much under the sway of action and affliction, is never without the character of the aspiration for omniscience, and is not equaled even by eminent Buddhist disciples and self-illuminates, because of being of the family of enlightened ones.

rigs kyi bu/ 'di lta ste/ dper na/ nor bu rin po che yongs su dag pa ni mig la rab rib kyi skyon yod na/ yongs su ma dag par snang ngo/ /de bzhin du thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du sems bskyed pa rin po che rang bzhin gyis yongs su dag pa yang sems can dang pha'i mig mi shes pa'i rab rib kyi skyon dang ldan pa rnams la yongs su ma dag par snang ngo/ /
“Just as a clear jewel appears impure to a clouded eye, the inherently pure jewel of the aspiration to omniscience is perceived as impure by those whose eye of unbelief is beclouded by ignorance.

rigs kyi bu/ 'di lta ste/ dper na/ rtsi'i gzungs sngags dang rtsi thams cad bsdus te byas pa ni reg gam/ mthong ngam/ 'grogs na yang sems can gyi nad rab tu zhi bar byed do/ /de bzhin du byang chub kyi sems kyi smon lam dang / ye shes kyi lus dge ba'i rtsa ba'i tshogs dang / shes rab dang / thabs kyi sngags dang / rtsi thams cad las bsgrubs pa byang chub kyi sems dang ldan pa ni/ thos sam/ mthong ngam/ 'grogs sam/ rjes su dran pa'i tshul gyis kyang sems can gyi nyon mongs pa'i nad rab tu zhi bar byed do/ /

“Just as a body of medicine endowed with all medical knowledge and medicinal herbs curse the diseases of sentient beings by sight, contact, and association, in the same way the body of vows and knowledge of enlightening beings, sustained by the knowledge and medicine of wisdom and means assembling all roots of goodness, endowed with the will for enlightenment, cures sentient beings’ diseases of afflictions by hearing, seeing, association, recollection, and application.

rigs kyi bu/ 'di lta ste/ dper na/ gos dang ba'i mtshan nyid can ni/ 'dam gyi nyes pa thams cad kyis mi gos so/ /de bzhin du byang chub kyi sems kyi gos dang ba'i mtshan nyid can ni/ 'khor ba'i nyon mongs pa'i 'dam gyi skyon thams cad kyis kun nas nyon mongs par mi 'gyur ro/ /
“Just as a goose-feather robe is not stained by any dirt, the goose-feather robe of the aspiration for enlightenment is not stained by the dirt of afflictions of the mundane whirl.

rigs kyi bu/ 'di lta ste/ dper na/ shing gi gzugs mgo gzer gyis btab pa ni/ yongs su 'gyes par mi 'gyur te/ bya ba thams cad kyang byed do/ /de bzhin du thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du smon pa'i ye shes kyi lus kyi spyi bo byang chub tu sems bskyed pa'i smon lam gyi gzer gyis btab pa yang byang chub sems dpa'i bya ba thams cad la mthu yod de/ thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi smon lam gyi ye shes las lus su grub pa yin pas yongs su 'gyes par mi 'gyur ro/ /

“Just as a wooden figure held together by the main pin does not fall apart and can perform any kind of movement, in the same way the body of the vow and knowledge of omniscience, held together by the main pin of the vow of enlightenment, can perform the tasks of enlightening beings, and does not fall apart as the embodiment of the vow of omniscience.

rigs kyi bu/ 'di lta ste/ dper na/ gzer dang mi ldan pa'i 'khrul 'khor ni/ shing gi yan lag de nyid yin yang dgos pa bya ba'i mthu med do/ /de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du sems bskyed pa'i lhag pa'i bsam pa dang mi ldan na/ byang chub kyi yan lag gi tshogs de nyid yin yang sangs rgyas kyi chos sgrub pa la mthu med do/ /

“Just as a machine without its pins cannot work, even though the parts are the same, similarly, the enlightening being without the commanding will of the aspiration to omniscience cannot attain buddhahood, even though the preparations of the parts of enlightenment be the same.

rigs kyi bu/ 'di lta ste/ dper na/ 'khor los bsgyur ba'i rgyal po la rin po che a ga ru nag po glang po'i snying po zhes bya ba yod pa des bcugs ma thag tu rgyal po 'khor los bsgyur ba'i yan lag bzhi pa'i dpung gi tshogs thams cad kyang nam mkha' la gnas par 'gyur ro/ /de bzhin du thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du sems bskyed pa a ga rus bdugs pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad kyang khams gsum pa thams cad las rnam par 'das te/ de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes nam mkha'i spyod yul 'dus ma byas pa thams cad kyi mthar thug par 'gyur ro/ /

“Just as a sovereign ruler has a precious incense by the perfume of which his four armies are levitated into the air, in the same way the roots of goodness of an enlightening being, perfumed by the incense of the determination for omniscience, leave the mundane and end up in the unconditioned realm of the sky of enlightened knowledge.

rigs kyi bu/ 'di lta ste/ dper na/ rdo rje ni/ rin po che ma rabs kyi 'byung khungs nas mi 'byung gi /rdo rje'i 'byung khungs sam/ gser gyi 'byung khungs nas 'byung ngo/ /de bzhin du thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du sems bskyed pa rdo rje lta bu'ang sems can gyi bsam pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba ma rabs kyi rin po che'i 'byung gnas nas mi skye ste/ gzhan du na sems can yongs su skyob pa'i snying rje chen po'i rdo rje'i 'byung khungs sam/ thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes la lhag par dmigs pa'i gser gyi 'byung khungs chen po nas 'byung ngo/ /

“Just as diamond comes from nowhere else but a jewel mine, from a diamond or gold mine, in the same way the diamondlike aspiration for omniscience comes from nowhere else but the jewel mine of roots of goodness in sentient beings’ minds, from the diamond mine of universal compassion saving all beings, or from the gold mine of concentration on omniscience.

rigs kyi bu/ 'di lta ste; dper na/ shing gi rigs rtsa ba med pa zhes bya ba yod de/ de'i rtsa ba mthar thug pa mi dmigs mod kyi/ shing rnams la yal ga dang / lo ma dang / 'dab ma dang / me tog shin tu rgyas pa dra ba lta bur gyur pa snang ngo/ /de bzhin du thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du sems bskyed pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba'i mthar thug pa'ang mi dmigs mod kyi/ 'jig rten gyi skye gnas thams cad du'ang thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bsod nams dang / ye shes dang / mngon par shes pa'i me tog shin tu rgyas pa smon lam chen po'i dra bar gyur pa'ang yongs su snang ngo/ /

“Just as there is a kind of tree called ‘rootless’ whose roots cannot be found, yet branches, leaves, and flowers appear luxuriantly on the tree, in the same way the root of the aspiration for omniscience cannot be found, yet it appears in all worlds, blooming with all virtues, knowledge, and mystic capacities, forming a web of vows.

rigs kyi bu/ 'di lta ste/ dper na/ rdo rje ni/ snod ngan pa'i gzhi la 'dug na mdzes par mi snang ngo/ /snod ma rdol ba ma gtogs par snod rdol ba dang bu ga can gyis gzung bar mi nus so/ /de bzhin du thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du sems bskyed pa'i rdo rje chen po yang sems can mos pa zhan pa'i snod dang / ser sna can nam/ tshul khrims ngan pa can nam/ gnod sems can nam/ le lo can nam/ dran pa 'khrugs pa'am/ shes rab 'chal ba can rnams la mi mdzes te/ byang chub sems dpa'i lhag pa'i bsam pa rin po che'i snod ma gtogs par sems can lhag pa'i bsam pa log pa la zhugs pa blo mi brtan pa'i snod kyis kyang gzung bar mi nus so; ;

“Just as a diamond does not shine beautifully in another kind of vessel, and cannot be held in an imperfect, perforated vessel, only in a perfect vessel, in the same way the diamond of the aspiration for omniscience does not shine in the vessels of people with inferior resolutions, in the envious, in the immoral, in the mentally corrupt, in the lazy, in the heedless, or in the stupid, and it cannot be held by a vessel of a wavering, inconstant mind with defective will, only in the precious vessel of the powerful will of an enlightening being.

rigs kyi bu/ 'di lta ste/ dper na/ rdo rje ni/ rin po che thams cad 'bigs so/ /de bzhin du/ thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du sems bskyed pa'i rdo rje yang sangs rgyas kyi chos rin po cha thams cad 'bigs par khong du chud par byed do/ /
“Just as diamond pierces all jewels, the diamond of the determination for omniscience pierces the jewels of all truth.

rigs kyi bu/ 'di lta ste/ dper na/ rdo rje ni/ brag thams cad shigs par 'dzems so/ /de bzhin du thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du sems bskyed pa'i rdo rje yang lta ba'i rnam pa thams cad kyi brag shigs par 'joms so/ /
“Just as adamant splits all mountains, the adamant of the aspiration for omniscience splits the mountains of all views.

rigs kyi bu/ 'di lta ste/ dper na/ rdo rje rin po che ni/ chag kyang thams cad las khyad par du 'phags pa'i gser gyi rgyan zil gyis gnon to/ /de bzhin du thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du sems bskyed pa'i rdo rje rin po che bsam pa log par zhugs pas chag par gyur kyang nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas thams cad kyi yon tan gyi gser gyi rgyan zil gyis gnon to/ /

“Just as even a cracked diamond is better than an ornament of gold, the finest of precious metals, in the same way the diamond of the aspiration for omniscience is better than the gold ornaments of the virtues of hearers and individual illuminates, even if the will is broken by adversity.

rigs kyi bu/ 'di lta ste/ dper na/ rdo rje rin po che ni/ chag kyang phongs pa thams cad rnam par sel to/ /de bzhin du thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du sems bskyed pa'i rdo rje rin po che nan tan med pas chag par gyur kyang 'khor ba'i phongs pa thams cad rnam par sel to/ /
“Just as a diamond, even if cracked, relieves poverty, in the same way the diamond of the determination for omniscience, even if split, relieves the poverty of the mundane whirl.

rigs kyi bu/ 'di lta ste/ dper na/ rdo rje'i khams ni/ ji tsam zhig tu chung yang nor bu dang rdo thams cad gcog pa'i mtshan nyid do/ /de bzhin du dmigs pa ji tsam du chung ba la zhugs kyang thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du sems bskyed pa'i rdo rje'i khams ni/ mi shes pa thams cad 'jig par byed pa'i mtshan nyid do/ /
“Just as a diamond, however little, breaks all gems and stones, in the same way the diamond of the aspiration for omniscience, focused on however small an object, breaks all ignorance.

rigs kyi bu/ 'di lta ste/ dper na/ rdo rje rin po che ni/ skye bo ma rabs kyi lag tu phyin par mi 'gyur ro/ /de bzhin du thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du sems bskyed pa'i rdo rje rin po che yang ma rabs kyi bsam pa dang ldan pa dge ba'i rtsa ba ngan don can gyi lha dang mi'i lag tu phyin par mi 'gyur ro; ;

“Just as a diamond does not come into the hands of an ordinary man, the diamond of the determination for omniscience does not come into the hands of those of low intentions and poor roots of goodness.

rigs kyi bu/ 'di lta ste/ dper na/ rin po che yongs su brtag pa la mi mkhas pa'i skyes bu ni/ rdo rje rin po che'i yon tan nyams su myong bar mi 'gyur ro/ /de bzhin du shes rab 'chal ba'i ngang tshul dang ldan pa'i skyes bu gang zag kyang byang chub kyi sems rdo rje rin po che chen po'i yon tan la mi mkhas pas kyang de'i yon tan gyi khyad par nyams su myong bar mi 'gyur ro/ /

“Just as someone who has no knowledge of gems does not recognize the qualities of diamonds or understand their excellence, in the same way a stupid person does not know the qualities of the diamond of wisdom of the aspiration for enlightenment and does not understand its excellence.
rigs kyi bu/ 'di lta ste/ dper na/ rdo rje ni/ zhu bar mi nus so/ /de bzhin du thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi rgyur gyur pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed pa'i rdo rje yang zhu bar mi nus so/ /
“Just as a diamond cannot be worn out, the diamond of the aspiration for enlightenment, the basis of omniscience, cannot be worn out.

rigs kyi bu/ 'di lta ste/ dper na/ rdo rje'i lag cha chen po ni/ gzhan du na mthu bo che chen po'i stobs ltar khyad par du 'phags pa'i mthu stobs kyi shugs drag po ma gtogs par stobs po che chen pos kyang gzung bar mi nus so/ /de bzhin du thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du sems bskyed pa'i rdo rje'i lag cha chen po yang gzhan du na byang chub sems dpa' chen po thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi rgyu'i stobs kyi brtan pa dge ba'i rtsa ba chad med pa'i mthu bo che chen po'i stobs ltar khyad par du 'phags pa stobs kyi shugs chen po rab tu thob pa ma gtogs par nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas stobs po che thams cad kyis kyang yongs su gzung bar mi nus so/ /

“Just as the thunderbolt weapon cannot be held even by a strong man unless he has superhuman strength, likewise the thunderbolt of the aspiration for enlightenment cannot be held even by the mighty saints and sages, only by the great enlightening beings with great illumination, excelling in the superhuman might of infinite roots of goodness based on the power of the cause of omniscience.

rigs kyi bu; 'di lta ste/ dper na/ mtshon cha thams cad kyis mi tshugs pa gang du yang rdo rjes mi tshugs pa med de/ kha mi 'bab bo/ /de bzhin du sems can yongs su smin par bya ba dang / gdul ba'am/ dus gsum gyi bskal par spyad pa'i sdug bsngal dang 'grogs par bya ba gang du nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi smon lam dang / ye shes kyi mtshon chas rdugs pa/ thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du sems bskyed pa'i rdo rje'i mtshon cha chen po thogs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' yongs su skyo ba'i yid med pas ni/ mi bzod pa med de/ kha mi 'bab bo/ /

“Just as a thunderbolt can prevail where all other weapons cannot, and will not be destroyed, in the same way where the weapons of vows and knowledge of all Buddhist disciples and self-enlightened ones cannot prevail, in developing and guiding people or living through the toils of practice through the ages of past, present, and future, there the enlightening being who holds the great thunderbolt weapon of the determination for omniscience, indefatigable, prevails unharmed.

rigs kyi bu/ 'di lta ste/ dper na/ rdo rje ni/ gzhan du na rdo rje nyid las gyur pa'i gzhi ma gtogs par sa'i phyogs gang gis kyang gzung bar mi nus so/ /de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa'i 'byung ba'i smon lam gyi tshogs kyi rdo rje ni/ gzhan du na lhag pa'i bsam pas byang chub tu sems bskyed pa'i rdo rje brtan pa'i sa'i gzhi ma gtogs par nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas thams cad kyis gzung bar mi nus so/ /

“Just as adamant cannot be held on any spot on the earth except on an adamantine surface, in the same way the adamant vows of emancipation of enlightening beings cannot be held by those whose goal is personal salvation only; it can only be supported by the adamantine ground of the resolute determination for universal enlightenment.

rigs kyi bu/ 'di lta ste/ dper na/ rgya mtsho chen po'i snod rdo rje'i gzhi sra zhing gseb med pas/ chu gsang du 'dzag par mi 'gyur ro/ /de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba byang chub kyi sems kyi rdo rje gseb med pa yongs su bsngos pa'i gzhi can la gnas pa yang srid par skyes pa thams cad kyis zad par mi 'gyur ro/ /

“Just as the ocean does not leak any water because it is a solid container with an unyielding ground, in the same way the roots of goodness of an enlightening being, grounded on adamant, solid, unyielding dedication to enlightening, do not die out in any states of existence.

rigs kyi bu/ 'di lta ste/ dper na/ rdo rje'i gzhi la brtan pa'i sa chen po ni/ 'jig par mi 'gyur ro/ /dma' bar mi 'gyur ro/ /de bzhin du byang chub tu sems bskyed pa'i rdo rje sra ba'i gzhi la brtan pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i smon lam rnams kyang khams gsum thams cad du 'jig par mi 'gyur ro/ /dma' bar mi 'gyur ro/ /

“Just as earth set on an adamantine base does not collapse or sink, in the same way the vows of enlightening beings, grounded on the adamantine base of the determination for enlightenment, are not rent apart and do not collapse in any mundane realm.

rigs kyi bu/ 'di lta ste/ dper na/ rdo rje ni/ chus bangs pa'am rul bar mi 'gyur ro/ /de bzhin du byang chub tu sems bskyed pa'i rdo rje yang las dang / nyon mongs pa thams cad kyi chur bskal par gnas kyang rul bar ma 'gyur/ bangs par mi 'gyur ro/ /
“Just as a diamond does not rot in water, the diamond of the aspiration for enlightenment does not decompose or soften even though it remain in the water of action and affliction for all ages.

rigs kyi bu/ 'di lta ste/ dper na/ rdo rje ni/ me thams cad kyi drod kyis kyang tshig par mi 'gyur/ yongs su gdung bar yang mi 'gyur ro/ /de bzhin du thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du sems bskyed pa'i rdo rje yang 'khor ba thams cad kyi sdug bsngal gyi me'i drod thams cad kyis mi tshig go /nyon mongs pa thams cad kyi me'i gdung bas gdungs par mi 'gyur ro/ /

“Just as a diamond is not burnt or heated by fire, the diamond of the determination for omniscience is not burnt by the fires of suffering of the mundane whirl and is not heated up by the fires of afflictions.

rigs kyi bu/ 'di lta ste/ dper na/ de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas snying po byang chub la bzhugs shing bdud rgol du gzhug pa mdzad pa dang / thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya ba rnams kyi gdan ni/ gzhan du na stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyi rdo rje'i lte ba'i sa'i gzhi ma gtogs par sa'i phyogs gzhan gyis gzung bar mi nus so/ /de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu smon lam 'debs pa dang / spyad pa spyod pa dang / pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par byed pa dang / bzod pa la 'jug pa dang / sa thob par byed pa dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba yongs su rdzogs par byed pa dang / lung bstan pa yongs su nod pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i lam gyi tshogs thams cad nye bar ston pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad la mchod pa byed pa dang / chos kyi sprin chen po yongs su 'dzin pa rnams kyi dge ba'i rtsa ba'i stobs dang / shugs dang / drag shul de dag kyang gzhan du na thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du sems bskyed pa smon lam thams cad kyi ye shes rdo rje sra ba'i lte ba can ma gtogs par sems gzhan gyis yongs su gzung bar mi nus so/ /

“Just as the seat of buddhas sitting on the site of enlightenment battling the devil and awakening to omniscience cannot be supported by any spot on earth except the earth surface of the adamantine center of the universe, in the same way the great force of power of the roots of goodness of enlightening beings aspiring to perfect enlightenment, carrying out the practice, fulfilling the transcendent ways, entering into tolerance, attaining spiritual station, dedicating roots of goodness, receiving assurance of buddahood, providing the necessities for the path of enlightening beings, and holding the multitudes of teachings of all buddhas, cannot be sustained by mind other than the mind set on omniscience, the adamantine core of all vows and knowledge.

rigs kyi bu/ de ltar thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du sems bskyed pa ni/ yon tan de dag dang / gzhan tshad med pa nas yon tan gyi khyad par brjod du med pa'i yang brjod du med pa dang ldan pa ste/ sems can gang gis bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed pa de dag kyang yon tan gyi chos de lta bu dang ldan par gyur to/ /ldan par 'gyur ro/ /de bas na/ rigs kyi bu/ de ltar khyod bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed de/ yon tan 'di dag rab tu thob par bya ba'i phyir byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa yongs su tshol ba ni/ khyod kyis thob par bya ba legs par thob bo/ /

“The aspiration for omniscience has these and untold other extraordinary virtues; and those who have set their minds on supreme perfect enlightenment are, have been, and will be endowed with such virtues. Therefore you have made a great gain in having aspired to supreme perfect enlightenment and seeking the practice of enlightening beings, because of attainment of these virtues.

rigs kyi bu/ khyod na re/ ji ltar byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa la spyad par bya/ ji ltar nan tan du bya zhes zer ba ni/ rigs kyi bu/ khang pa brtsegs pa chen po rnam par snang mdzad kyi rgyan gyis brgyan pa'i snying po 'di nyid kyi nang du song ste ltos shig dang / der khyod kyis ji ltar byang chub sems dpas byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa la bslab par bya ba dang / bslab nas kyang yon tan ji lta bu yongs su 'grub par 'gyur ba shes par 'gyur ro/ /

“Also, you ask how an enlightening being is to learn and carry out the practice of enlightening beings. Go into this great tower containing the adornments of Vairocana and look—then you will know how to learn the practice of enlightening beings, and what kind of virtues are perfected in those who learn this.”

de nas tshong dpon gyi bu nor bzang gis byang chub sems dpa' byams pa la g.yas phyogs su bskor ba byas te 'di skad ces smras so; ;'phags pa/ pho brang brtsegs pa'i chab sgo dbyer gsol nang du mchi'o/ / de nas byang chub sems dpa' byams pas khang pa brtsegs pa rnam par snang mdzad kyi rgyan gyis brgyan pa'i snying po'i sgo drung du phyin te/ lag pa g.yas pas se gol gtogs te sgra byung ba dang / de'i sgo de'ang rang bye bar gyur pa dang / des smras pa/ rigs kyi bu/ da khang pa brtsegs pa 'dir song zhig /
de nas tshong dpon gyi bu nor bzang ngo mtshar chen po thob par gyur te/ khang pa brtsegs pa de'i nang du phyin pa dang / phyin ma thag tu sgo de yang rang chad par gyur to/ /

Then Sudhana respectfully circumbulated the enlightening being Maitreya and said, “Please open the door of the tower, and I will enter.” Then Maitreya went up to the door of the tower containing the adornments of Vairocana, and with his right hand snapped his fingers; the door of the tower opened, and Maitreya bade Sudhana to enter. Then Sudhana, in greatest wonder, went into the tower. As soon as he had entered, the door shut.

des mthong ba khang pa brtsegs pa de shin tu rgya che zhing yangs la/ rgyar dpag tshad brgya stong mang po dang ldan pa/ nam mkha'i dbyings kyi tshad kyis gzhal ba/ 'khor thams cad du nam mkha'i dbyings ltar yangs pa/ gdugs dang / rgyal mtshan dang / ba dan gyi rgyan grangs med pas brgyan pa/ rin po che grangs med pa'i rgyan gyis brgyan pa/ mu tig gi phreng ba grangs med pa rab tu dbyangs pa'i rgyan gyis brgyan pa/ rin po che'i phreng ba grangs med pa rab tu dpyangs pa'i rgyan gyis brgyan pa/ mu tig dmar po'i phreng ba grangs med pa rab tu dpyangs pa'i rgyan gyis brgyan pa/ seng+ge'i mu tig gi phreng ba grangs med pa rab tu dpyangs pa'i rgyan gyis brgyan pa/ seng+ge'i rgyal mtshan grangs med pa'i rgyan gyis brgyan pa/ zla ba dang zla gam grangs med pa'i rgyan gyis brgyan pa/ dar gyi lnga ldi sna tshogs grangs med pa rab tu dpyangs pa'i rgyan gyis brgyan pa/ dar gyi ba dan sna tshogs grangs med pa'i rgyan gyis brgyan pa/ rin po che mang po grangs med pa'i 'od kyi rgyan gyis brgyan pa/ gser gyi dra ba grangs med pa'i rgyan gyis brgyan pa/ rin po che'i snam bu grangs med pa'i rgyan gyis brgyan pa/ gser gyi lcags bod rin po ches spras pa grangs med pa'i rgyan gyis brgyan pa/ dril bu sgra snyan pa'i byung ba grangs med pa'i rgyan gyis brgyan pa/ rin po che'i dril bu g.yer kha'i dra ba bskyod na yid du 'ong ba'i sgra 'byung ba grangs med pa'i rgyan gyis brgyan pa/ lha rdzas kyi me tog mang po'i char mngon par 'bab pa grangs med pa'i rgyan gyis brgyan pa/ lha rdzas kyi phreng ba'i lnga ldi mngon par dpyangs pa grangs med pa'i rgyan gyis brgyan pa/ gam yo nas smos kyi snod nas bdug spos 'thul ba'i yo byad grangs med pa'i rgyan gyis brgyan pa/ gser gyi phye ma'i char rab tu 'bab pa grangs med pa'i rgyan gyi brgyan pa/ pu shu'i dra ba grangs med pa'i rgyan gyis brgyan pa/ skar khung grangs med pa'i rgyan gyis brgyan pa/ rta babs grangs med pa'i rgyan gyis brgyan pa/ ba gam grangs med pa'i rgyan gyis brgyan pa; me long gi dkyil 'khor grangs med pa'i rgyan gyis brgyan pa/ rin po che'i pha gu grangs med pa gtams pa'i rgyan gyis brgyan pa/ rin po che'i rtsig pa grangs med pa'i rgyan gyis brgyan pa/ rin po che'i ka ba grangs med pa'i rgyan gyis brgyan pa/ rin po che'i gos kyi sprin grangs med pa'i rgyan gyis brgyan pa/ rin po che'i shing grangs med pa'i rgyan gyis brgyan pa; rin po che'i khri 'phang grangs med pa'i rgyan gyis brgyan pa/ rin po che'i lam grangs med pa'i rgyan gyis brgyan pa/ rin po che grangs med pa'i ba dan gyi rgyan gyis brgyan pa/ sa'i gzhi rgyan sna tshogs grangs med pa'i rgyan gyis brgyan pa/ rin po che grangs med pa las brtsegs pa'i khang pa'i rgyan gyis brgyan pa/ rin po che'i khri grangs med pa'i rgyan gyis brgyan pa/ rin po che'i bu mo grangs med pa'i rgyan gyis brgyan pa/ rin po che'i snam bu grangs med pa bting ba'i 'chag sa'i rgyan gyis brgyan pa; 'dzam bu chu klung gi gser gyi chu shing gi ka ba shin tu rnam par phye ba grangs med pa'i rgyan gyis brgyan pa/ rin po che thams cad kyi gzugs grangs med pa'i rgyan gyis brgyan pa/ byang chub sems dpa'i lus grangs med pa'i rgyan gyis brgyan pa/ bya'i tshogs sna tshogs yid du 'ong ba'i sgra 'byin pa grangs med pa'i rgyan gyis brgyan pa/ rin po che'i pad+mo grangs med pa'i rgyan gyis brgyan pa/ rin po che'i srog shing 'dzin pa grangs med pa'i rgyan gyis brgyan pa/ rdzing bu grangs med pa'i rgyan gyis brgyan pa/ me tog puN+Da rI ka grangs med pa'i rgyan gyis brgyan pa/ rin po che'i them skas grangs med pa'i rgyan gyis brgyan pa/ rin po che'i stegs bu rnam par bkod pa grangs med pa'i rgyan gyis brgyan pa; rin po che sna tshogs grangs med pas spras pa'i rgyan gyis brgyan pa/ nor bu rin po che chen po'i 'od grangs med pa rab tu 'gyed pa'i rgyan gyis brgyan pa/ rin po che thams cad rnam par phye ba grangs med pa'i rgyan gyis brgyan pa/ yon tan dang legs pa phun sum tshogs pa grangs med pa'i rgyan gyis brgyan pa 'dug par mthong ste/ khang pa brtsegs pa de'i nang na yang khang pa brtsegs pa gzhan brgya stong 'di lta bu'i rgyan dang / /lhab lhub kyis brgyan pa/ rin po che'i gdugs dang / rgyal mtshan dang / lha'i bdag grangs med pa'i rgyan gyis brgyan pa nas yon tan dang legs pa phun sum tshogs pa grangs med pa'i bar gyi rgyan gyis brgyan pas gang bar mthong ngo/ /khang pa brtsegs pa de dag thams cad kyang de ltar rgya che zhing yangs pa/ de ltar tshad med de nam mkha'i mdzod du gyur pa kun nas shin tu spa bar 'khod par mthong ngo/ /des khang pa brtsegs pa rnam par phye ba de dag thams cad kyang dmigs pa gcig la phan tshun ma 'dres pa dang / phan tshun ma 'dzings pa dang / phan tshun sa la gsal bor 'dug par gzugs brnyan gyi tshul du de la snang bar gyur te/ dmigs pa gcig la ji lta ba de bzhin du dmigs pa ma lus pa de dag thams cad la'ang snang bar mthong ngo/ /

He saw the tower immensely vast and wide, hundreds of thousands of leagues wide, as measureless as the sky, as vast as all of space, adorned with countless attributes; countless canopies, banners, pennants, jewels, garlands of pearls and gems, moons and half moons, multicolored streamers, jewel nets, gold nets, strings of jewels, jewels on golden threads, sweetly ringing bells and nets of chimes, flowers showering, celestial garlands and streamers, censers giving off fragrant fumes, showers of gold dust, networks of upper chambers, round windows, arches, turrets, mirrors, jewel figurines of women, jewel chips, pillars, clouds of precious cloths, jewel trees, jewel railings, jeweled pathways, jeweled awnings, various arrays of the floor, chambers of jewels, jeweled promenades, rows of golden banana trees, statues made of all kinds of jewels, images of enlightening beings, singing birds, jewel lotuses, lotus ponds, jewel stairways, ground of masses of various jewels, radiant gems, arrays of all kinds of jewels. Also, inside the great tower he saw hundreds of thousands of other towers similarly arrayed; he saw those towers as infinitely vast as space, evenly arrayed in all directions, yet these towers were not mixed up with one another, being each mutually distinct, while appearing reflected in each and every object of all the other towers.

de nas tshong dpon gyi bu nor bzang gis khang pa brtsegs pa chen po rnam par snang mdzad kyi rgyan gyis brgyan pa'i snying po'i yul dang / rnam par 'phrul pa bsam gyis mi khyab pa rnam pa de lta bu dag mthong nas dga' ba'i thugs dpag tu med pa rnam par 'phel ba'i spro ba dang / mos pa chen pos lus dang sems mngon par brlan pa dang / 'du shes kyi rnam pa thams cad rnam par bsal pa'i yid dang / sgrib pa thams cad rnam par zlog pa'i sems dang / rmongs pa thams cad dang rnam par bral ba dang / 'khrul pa med pa'i phyogs la rab tu gzhol ba dang / thams cad la thogs pa med pa'i dran pas rnam par dmigs pa'i rna ba dang ldan pa dang / yid la bya ba'i rnam par 'khrug pa thams cad dang bral ba dang / rnam par thar pa sgrib pa med pa'i tshul gyi rjes su 'brang ba'i blo dang / dmigs pa thams cad la sgrib pa med par mig rab tu 'gro bar gyur nas phyogs kyi rgyud thams cad la mngon du bltas pa'i lus kyis phyag bya bar mngon par sgrub pa'i stobs thams cad du khyab pa dang ldan pa'i lus thams cad kyis phab ste phyag byas so/ /

Then Sudhana, seeing this miraculous manifestation of the inconceivable realm of the great tower containing the adornments of Vairocana, was flooded with joy and bliss; his mind was cleared of all conceptions and freed from all obstructions. Stripped of all delusion, he became clairvoyant without distortion, and could hear all sounds with unimpeded mindfulness. He was freed from all scattering of attention, and his intellect followed the unobstructed eye of liberation. With physical tranquillity, seeing all objects without hindrance, by the power of production everywhere he bowed in all directions with his whole body.

de ltar tshong dpon gyi bu nor bzang gis phyag byas ma thag tu byang chub sems dpa' byams pa'i byin gyi rlabs kyi mthus khang pa brtsegs pa de dag thams cad kyi nang du bdag nyid phyin par shes par gyur to; ;khang pa brtsegs pa de dag thams cad du'ang rnam par 'phrul ba bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i yul can rnam pa sna tshogs rnam pa tha dad pa mang po yang mthong bar gyur to/ khang pa brtsegs pa la lar ni/ byang chub sems dpa' byams pas thog ma rigs ni/ gang du skyes te/ ming ci zhes bya bar gyur pa zhig gis dge ba'i rtsa ba gang dang / yongs su bskul ba gang dang / dge ba'i bshes gnyen gang gis yang dag par bskul ba dang / tshe'i tshad ni/ ji tsam zhig tu/ bskal pa'i ming ni/ ci zhes bya bar/ de bzhin gshegs pa ni/ gang la/ rgyan ni/ ji lta bu zhig dang ldan pa'i zhing du/ 'khor ni/ ji lta bu zhig tu/ smon lam gyi khyad par ni/ ji lta bu zhig mngon par bsgrubs te bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu smon lam gyi sems bskyed pa de dag thams cad kyang mthong bar gyur to/ /shes par gyur to/ /khong du chud par gyur to/ /de'i tshe sems can de dag dang / de bzhin gshegs pa de'i sku tshe'i tshad dang / tshe'i tshad ji srid gcig tu gyur pa de tsam gyi dus su de bzhin gshegs pa de'i zhabs kyi drung na bdag nyid 'dug par yang shes par gyur te/ bya ba de dag thams cad kyang mthong bar gyur to/ /

The moment he bowed, by the power of Maitreya, Sudhana perceived himself in all of those towers; and in all those towers he saw various diverse inconceivable miraculous scenes. In one tower he saw where the enlightening being Maitreya first aspired to supreme perfect enlightenment, what his family was, what his basic goodness was, how he was inspired, how he was encouraged by spiritual friends, how long he lived, what age he lived in, what buddha he met, what land he adorned, what assembly he was in, and what kind of special vows he undertook. He also perceived the length of life of the beings and the buddha of that time, and saw himself in the presence of that buddha, and saw all of his works.

khang pa brtsegs pa la lar ni/ byang chub sems dpa' byams pas thog ma gang du byams pa'i ting nge 'dzin thob par gyur pa dang / dus gang nas bzung ste de'i ming byams pa zhes bya bar gyur pa de dag mthong bar gyur to/ /la lar ni/ gang du spyod pa spyad pa dang / la lar ni/ gang du pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par byas pa dang / la lar ni/ gang du bzod pa la zhugs pa dang / la lar ni/ gang du sa non pa dang / la lar ni/ gang du sangs rgyas kyi zhing gi rgyan yongs su bzung ba dang / la lar ni/ gang du de bzhin gshegs pa'i bstan pa yongs su bzung ba dang / la lar ni/ gang du mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa thob par gyur pa dang / la lar ni/ gang du bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu lung bstan pa dang / rnam pa ni/ ji lta bu zhig tu lung bstan pa dang / lung ni/ sus bstan pa dang / yun ni/ ji srid gcig gis lung bstan pa de dag thams cad kyang mthong bar gyur to/ /

In one tower he saw where Maitreya first attained absorption in love, whence came his name, “The Loving One.” In another he saw where he carried out spiritual practice; in another, where he fulfilled the transcendent ways; in another, where he attained acceptance of things as unoriginated; in another, where he was assured of supreme perfect enlightenment, how he was assured, by whom, and how long it was predicted it would be before he was enlightened.

khang pa brtsegs pa la lar ni/ byang chub sems dpa' byams pa 'khor los bsgyur ba'i rgyal por gyur te sems can rnams dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam la rab tu 'god pa mthong bar gyur to/ /la lar ni/ 'jig rten gyi mgon por gyur te/ 'jig rten gyi phan pa dang / bde ba thams cad kyis sems can rnams la nye bar sdud pa dang / la lar ni; brgya byin du gyur te/ 'dod par yon tan gyi dga' ba las sems can rnams rnam par zlog pa dang / la lar ni/ tshangs par gyur te bsam gtan dang / tshad med pa'i dga' ba sems can rnams la yongs su rjod pa dang / la lar ni/ lha'i dbang po rab mtsho mar gyur te tshad med pa'i yon tan sems can rnams la yongs su rjod pa dang / la lar ni/ lha'i dbang po rab dga' ldan du gyur te/ byang chub sems dpa' tshe gcig gis thogs pa'i yon tan rjod pa dang / la lar ni/ lha'i rgyal po rab 'phrul dga' bar gyur te/ lha'i 'khor du byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyi sprul pa'i rgyan yongs su ston pa dang / la lar ni/ lha'i rgyal po dbang sgyur du gyur te/ lha rnams la chos thams cad la dbang sgyur ba yang dag par ston pa dang / la lar ni/ bdud du gyur te lha rnams la phun sum tshogs pa thams cad mi rtag par ston pa dang / la lar ni/ lha ma yin gyi dbang po'i gnas su skyes te lha ma yin gyi 'khor na nga rgyal dang / dregs pa dang / rlom pa thams cad rab tu spang ba dang / ye shes kyi rgya mtsho chen por 'jug par bya ba dang / chos kyi ye shes kyi rgyu thob par bya ba'i phyir chos ston pa mthong ngo/ /

In one tower he saw Maitreya as a sovereign king directing people to virtuous action; in another he saw Maitreya as a world guardian bestowing well-being and happiness on the world; in another he saw Maitreya as Indra, fostering detachment in those obsessed with pleasure; in another he saw Maitreya as Brahma, describing to people the measureless pleasure of meditation; in another he saw Maitreya as the chief of the gods of timely portion, describing to people the virtues of attentiveness and diligence; in another he saw Maitreya as the chief of the heaven of contentment, revealin the virtues of enlightening beings bound to become buddhas in one lifetime; in another he saw Maitreya as a king of the heaven of good emanations, showing a company of celestials the array of emanations of all enlightening beings; in another he saw Maitreya as a lord of the heaven of control, explaining to the gods control over all phenomena; in another he saw Maitreya causing the devil to act, showing the gods the impermanence of all states of being; in another he saw Maitreya born in the palace of titans, teaching the titans truth so that they might do away with all conceit, pride, and arrogance, plunge into the ocean of knowledge, enter the ocean of spiritual knowledge, and attain the magic of knowledge of truth.

khang pa brtsegs pa la lar ni/ gshin rje'i 'jig rten mthong bar gyur te/ de na byang chub sems dpa' byams pa 'od kyis sems can dmyal ba thams cad snang bar byed cing / sems can dmyal bar skyes pa'i sems can rnams kyi sems can dmyal ba'i sdug bsngal thams cad rab tu zhi bar byed pa mthong ngo/ /khang pa brtsegs pa la lar ni/ yi kyi gnas mthong bar gyur te; de na byang chub sems dpa' byams pa sems can yi kyi gnas su skyes pa rnams la kha zas dang / btung ba mang po nye bar sgrub cing bkres pa dang / skom pa rab tu zhi bar byed pa mthong ngo/ /khang pa brtsegs pa la lar ni/ byol song gi skye gnas na skye ba'i skye mched rnam pa tha dad pa sna tshogs kyis byol song gi skye gnas su gtogs pa'i sems can mang po 'dul ba mthong ngo/ /

In one tower he saw the underworld and saw Maitreya illumine the great hells with light and relieve the hellish pains of the beings in hell. In another tower he saw the ghost world and saw Maitreya giving much food and drink to the ghosts, relieving their hunger and thirst. In another tower he saw Maitreya guiding the beings in the animal realm.

khang pa brtsegs pa la lar ni/ rgyal po chen po'i khams su gtogs pa'i lha'i 'khor na 'jig rten gyi mgon po rnams la chos ston pa mthong ngo/ /la lar ni/ lha'i dbang po brgya byin gyi 'khor na/ la lar ni/ lha'i rgyal po rab mtshe ma'i 'khor na/ la lar ni/ lha'i rgyal po rab dga' ldan gyi 'khor na/ la lar ni/ lha'i rgyal po rab 'phrul dga'i 'khor na/ la lar ni/ lha'i rgyal po dbang sgyur gyi 'khor na/ la lar ni/ bdud kyi 'khor na/ khang pa brtsegs pa la lar ni/ tshangs pa'i dbang po'i 'khor na byang chub sems dpa' byams pa chos ston pa mthong ngo/ /

In one tower he saw Maitreya expounding the Teaching to world guardians in an assembly of celestial kings; in another he saw him in a group of chief gods of the thirty-three-fold heavens; in another he saw him in a group of chiefs of the heaven of timely portion; in another he saw him in a group of lords of the heaven of contentment; in another he saw him in a group of chiefs of the heaven of good emanations; in another he saw him in a group of kings, of the heaven of control; in another tower he saw Maitreya as a Great Brahma in a group of Brahma lords, expounding the Teaching.

la lar ni/ klu dang lto 'phye chen po'i 'khor na; la lar ni/ gnod sbyin dang srin po'i 'khor na/ la lar ni/ dri za dang mi 'am ci'i 'khor na/ la lar ni/ lha ma yin dang gsod 'phrog gi dbang po'i 'khor na/ la lar ni/ nam mkha' lding gi dbang po chen po'i 'khor na/ la lar ni/ mi'i 'khor na/ khang pa brtsegs pa la lar ni/ lha dang / klu dang / gnod sbyin dang / dri za dang / lha ma yin dang / nam mkha' lding dang / mi 'am ci dang / lto 'phye chen po dang / mi dang mi ma yin pa'i 'khor na byang chub sems dpa' byams pa chos ston pa mthong ngo/ /

In one tower he saw Maitreya in a group of dragons and serpents; in another, in a group of goblins and fiends; in another, in a group of titans and demons; in another, in a group of giant serpents; in another, in a group of human chiefs; in another tower, he saw the enlightening being Maitreya in a group of gods, dragons, goblins, fiends, cherubs, titans, birds, minotaurs, serpents, humans, and nonhumans, expounding the Teaching to them.

la lar ni/ nyan thos kyi 'khor na/ la lar ni/ rang sangs rgyas kyi 'khor na/ la lar ni/ byang chub sems dpa'i 'khor na/ khang pa brtsegs pa la lar ni/ byang chub sems dpa' sems thog ma bskyed pa las dang po pa rnams la byang chub sems dpa' byams pa chos ston pa mthong ngo/ /la lar ni/ spyod pa la zhugs pa rnams la/ la lar ni/ bzod pa thob cing phyir mi ldog pa rnams la/ la lar ni/ tshe gcig gis thogs shing dbang bskur pa rnams la/ khang pa brtsegs pa la lar ni/ byang chub sems dpa' sa dang po la gnas pa rnams la sa'i khyad par yongs su brjod pa mthong ngo/ /

In one tower he saw Maitreya in a group of hearers; in another, in a group of individual illuminates; in another, in a group of enlightening beings; in another tower, he saw Maitreya expounding the Teaching to beginning enlightening beings who had just set their minds on enlightenment. In another tower he saw Maitreya extolling the excellences of the stages to those who had undertaken practice; in another, to those who had attained tolerance and were irreversible; in another, to those bound to be enlightened in one lifetime who had attained coronation; in another tower, to enlightening beings in the first stage.

la lar ni/ sa bcu la gnas pa'i bar gyi byang chub sems dpa' rnams dang lhan cig tu byang chub sems dpa' byams pa sa thams cad kyi khyad par yang dag par bgro ba byed pa mthong ngo/ /la lar ni/ pha rol tu phyin pa thams cad yongs su rdzogs par bya ba dang / la lar ni/ bslab pa thams cad la mngon du 'jug par bya ba kun tu mtha' yas pa dang / la lar ni/ ting nge 'dzin gyi sgo la 'jug pa rgya chen po dang / la lar ni/ rnam par thar pa'i tshul zab mo dang / la lar ni/ bsam gtan dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / snyoms par 'jug pa dang / mngon par shes pa zhi ba'i yul gyis rgyas par dgang ba dang / la lar ni/ byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa dang / 'dul ba dang / thabs kyi sgo la 'jug pa dang / la lar ni/ smon lam mngon par sgrub pa rgya che ba dang / khang pa brtsegs pa la lar ni/ byang chub sems dpa' byams pa skal pa mthun par spyod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams dang 'grogs shing 'jig rten la phan par bya ba'i don du bzo'i gnas sna tshogs dang / gtsug lag gi khyad par sems can thams cad la phan pa dang / bde bar 'gyur ba dang / 'byor pa rnams yang dag par bgro ba mthong ngo/ /

In another tower he saw Maitreya with enlightening beings in stages up to the tenth, extolling the excellence of all the stages. In another tower he saw Maitreya speaking of the infinity of fulfillment of the transcendent ways; in another, of impartiality in approaching and entering into all studies; in another, of breadth of entry into concentration; in another, of depth of liberation; in another, of pervasion of the realm of higher knowledge of quiescent meditation, concentration, and trance; in another, of entry into the methods of guidance in enlightening practice; in another, of breadth of performance of vows; in another tower he saw Maitreya with a group of enlightening beings engaged in the same practice as he, speaking of the relevance of providing for the welfare and happiness of all beings, of the various arts and sciences to be employed for the benefit of the world.

la lar ni/ byang chub sems dpa' tshe gcig gis thogs pa rnams dang 'grogs shing / sangs rgyas thams cad kyi ye shes la dbang bskur ba'i sgo yang dag par bgro ba mthong ngo/ /khang pa brtsegs ba la lar ni/ byang chub sems dpa' byams pa 'chag pa byed cing lo brgya stong du mar mi gtong ba la brtson pa mthong ngo/ /la lar ni/ lung 'bog pa dang / kha ton bya ba la brtson par/ la lar ni/ chos kyi sgo rab tu brtag pa la brtson par; la lar ni/ dam pa'i chos bgro ba la brtson pa/ la lar ni/ dam pa'i chos bri ba la brtson par/ la lar ni/ byams pa la mnyam par bzhag par/ la lar ni/ bsam gtan dang tshad med pa thams cad la mnyam par bzhag par/ la lar ni/ rgyas pa'i skye mched dang / rnam par thar pa thams cad la mnyam par bzhag pa dang / khang pa brtsegs pa la lar ni/ byang chub sems dpa' byams pa byang chub sems dpa'i mngon par shes pa sgrub pa'i thabs kyi ting nge 'dzin la mnyam par bzhag pa mthong ngo/ /

In another tower he saw Maitreya with a group of enlightening beings bound to be enlightened in one life, telling them about coronation with the knowledge of all buddhas. In another tower he saw Maitreya perambulating ceaselessly for hundreds of thousands of years; in another, he saw him engaged in recitation; in another, engaged in contemplation of doctrine; in another, engaged in exposition of doctrine; in another, engaged in writing down the Teaching; in another, absorbed in concentration on universal love; in another, absorbed in all the meditations and immeasurables; in another, absorbed in the points of totality and the liberations; in another tower he saw Maitreya absorbed in the practice of bringing forth the higher knowledge of enlightening beings.

khang pa brtsegs pa la lar ni/ byang chub sems dpa'i ting nge 'dzin sprul pa yod pa la mnyam par bzhag pa'i byang chub sems dpa' mang po mthong ste/ de dag gi lus thams cad dang / ba spu'i sgo thams cad nas sprul pa thams cad kyi sprin mang po 'byung ba mthong ngo/ /la lar ni/ lus dang ba spu'i sgo thams cad nas ni/ lha'i ris kyi sprin mang po 'byung ba mthong ngo/ /la la'i lus dang ba spu'i sgo thams cad nas ni/ klu dang / gnod sbyin dang / dri za dang / lha ma yin dang / nam mkha' lding dang / mi 'am ci dang / lto 'phye chen po dang / brgya byin dang / tshangs pa dang / 'jig rten gyi mgon po dang / 'khor los bsgyur ba'i sprin mang po 'byung ba dang / la la'i lus dang ba spu'i sgo thams cad nas ni/ khams kyi rgyal po'i sprin mang po 'byung ba dang / la la'i lus dang ba spu'i sgo thams cad nas ni/ rgyal bu gzhon nu'i sprin mang po 'byung ba dang / la la'i lus dang ba spu'i sgo thams cad nas ni/ tshong dpon dang / blon po dang / khyim bdag gi sprin mang po dang / la la'i lus dang ba spu'i sgo thams cad nas ni/ nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa'i sprin mang po dang / la la'i lus dang ba spu'i sgo thams cad nas ni/ de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku'i sprin mang po dang / la la'i lus dang ba spu'i sgo thams cad nas ni/ sems can thams cad du sprul pa'i sprin tshad med pa 'byung ba mthong ngo/ /la la'i lus dang ba spu'i sgo thams cad nas ni/ chos kyi sgo rnam pa sna tshogs 'byung ba thos par gyur te/ 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa'i yon tan bsngags pa'i sgo dang / sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i sgo dang / tshul khrims dang / bzod pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / bsam gtan dang / shes rab dang / thabs dang / smon lam dang / stobs dang / ye shes kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i sgo dang / bsdu ba'i dngos po dang / bsam gtan dang / tshad med pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / snyoms par 'jug pa dang / mngon par shes pa dang / rig pa dang / gzungs dang / spobs pa dang / bden pa dang / tha dad pa yang dag par shes pa dang / zhi gnas dang / lhag mthong dang / rnam par thar pa'i sgo dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba dang / rten pa dang / chos kyi mdo dang / dran pa nye bar gzhag pa dang / yang dag par spong ba dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa dang / dbang po dang / stobs dang / byang chub kyi yan lag dang / lam dang / nyan thos kyi theg pa'i gtam dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa'i gtam dang / theg pa chen po'i gtam dang / sa dang / bzod pa dang / spyod pa dang / smon lam gyi sgo dang / de bzhin du chos thams cad kyi sgor 'jug pa'i sgra mang po 'byung ba thos so/ /

In one tower he saw enlightening beings absorbed in an enlightening concentration which emanated phantoms, and saw multitudes of all kinds of emanations coming from every pore of their bodies. From the pores of some he saw multitudes of celestial hosts emerging; from some he saw multitudes of dragons, goblins, cherubs, titans, birds, minotaurs, serpents, Indras, Brahmas, world guardians, and emperors; from some he saw multitudes of princes; from some he saw multitudes of grandees, ministers, and gentlemen; from some he saw multitudes of hearers, individual illuminates, and enlightening beings; from some he saw multitudes of buddha-bodies; from the pores of some he saw measureless multitudes of phantoms of all sentient beings emerge. He heard various aspects of the Teaching being broadcast from the pores of some of the enlightening beings—teachings of the virtues of enlightening beings, transcendent generosity, discipline, tolerance, vigor, meditation, wisdom, methods, vows, power, knowledge, the means of integration, the immeasurables, concentrations, trance, superknowledge, mystic spells, intellectual powers of analysis and exposition, tranquillity and observation, means of liberation, interdependent origination, the reliances, summarization of teachings, the points of mindfulness, the right efforts, the bases of mystic powers, the religious faculties and powers, the limbs of enlightenment, the paths, explanation of the vehicle of hearers, explanation of the vehicle of individual illuminates, explanation of the Great Vehicle, the stages, tolerances, practices, and vows—in this way he heard voices expressing all the ways into the Teaching being broadcast.

khang pa brtsegs pa la lar ni/ de bzhin gshegs pa'i 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor du kun nas 'dus par mthong ste/ de bzhin gshegs pa de dag gi rnam pa tha dad pa rnam pa sna tshogs skye ba dang / rigs rnam pa tha dad pa dang / sku rnam par phye ba tshad med pa rnam pa tha dad pa dang / sku tshe rnam pa tha dad pa dang / zhing rnam pa tha dad pa dang / bskal pa rnam pa tha dad pa dang / chos bstan pa rnam pa tha dad pa dang / 'byung ba'i sgo rnam pa tha dad pa dang / dam pa'i chos gnas pa rnam pa tha dad pa nas 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor rnam pa thams cad du rnam pa tha dad pa dag kyang ma lus par mthong bar gyur to/ /

In another tower he saw gatherings of the audiences of buddhas, as well as the various differences among those buddhas, their different families, the infinite variety of their physical adornments, the variety of their life spans, the differences in their lands and eras, the variety of their teachings, the variety of the outwardness of their projected manifestations, the differences in the duration of their true teachings, and all the differences in their assemblies.

khang pa brtsegs pa chen po rnam par snang mdzad kyi rgyan gyis brgyan pa'i snying po de'i dbus su khang pa brtsegs pa gcig cig gzhan pas che la yangs shing khang pa brtsegs pa gzhan thams cad kyi rgyan ma lus pa thams cad pas kyang ches lhag par 'phags pa'i rgyan gyis yang dag par brgyan pa zhig 'dug par mthong ste/ khang pa brtsegs pa de'i nang na stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams 'dug pa mthong ngo/ /stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams de na yang gling bzhi pa bye ba phrag brgya dang / 'dzam bu'i gling bye ba phrag brgya dang / dga' ldan gyi gnas bye ba phrag brgya 'khod par mthong ngo/ /'dzam bu'i gling de dag thams cad na'ang byang chub sems dpa' byams pa pad+mo'i nang nas skye ba dang / brgya byin dang / tshangs pas yongs su blangs pa dang / gom pa bdun du 'gro ba dang / phyogs bcur rnam par bltas pa dang / seng+ge'i nga ro chen po sgrog pa dang / gzhon nu'i sa thams cad yongs su ston pa dang / btsun mo'i 'khor gyi nang na gnas pa dang / bza' shing gi ra bar 'gro ba dang / thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la mngon du phyogs te mngon par byung nas rab tu 'byung ba dang / dka' ba'i spyod pa yongs su ston pa dang / zas za ba dang / snying po byang chub tu 'gro ba dang; bdud rgol du 'jug pa dang / byang chub tu rnam par 'tshang rgya ba dang / byang chub kyi shing la mig mi 'gebs pas lta ba dang / changs pa chen pos gsol ba gdab pa dang / mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas te chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba'i yul sna tshogs yongs su bstan pa rnam pa tha dad pa dang / tshul dang ming rnam pa sna tshogs bstan pa rnam pa tha dad pa dang / tshe'i tshad sna tshogs rnam pa tha dad pa dang / 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor gyi rgyan sna tshogs rnam pa tha dad pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing rnam par dag pa'i tshul bstan pa rnam pa sna tshogs rnam pa tha dad pa dang / spyod pa dang / smon lam brjod pa sna tshogs rnam pa tha dad pa dang / chos bstan cing rnam par dgod pa dang / sems can yongs su smin par bya ba'i thabs sna tshogs rnam pa tha dad pa dang / ring bsrel bgo ba dang / bstan pa gnas pa'i byin gyi rlabs yongs su bstan pa sna tshogs rnam pa tha dad pas chos kyi 'khor lo bskor zhing / lha'i gnas su 'gro ba mthong ste/ de dag thams cad na yang tshong dpon gyi bu nor bzang nyid rkang pa'i drung na 'dug par rang gis shes par gyur to/ /de 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor thams cad dang / bya ba thams cad yongs su bstan pa dang / tshe'i tshad rnam pa tha dad pa thams cad la dran pa ma nyams pa'i byin gyi rlabs kyis 'du shes kyi rnam pa thams cad khong du chud pa'i ye shes kyi sa la gnas pas khang pa brtsegs pa de dag gi dril dang / dril bu g.yer kha'i dra ba dang / rol mo dang / glu la sogs pa'i dmigs pa ji snyed cig yod pa de dag thams cad las chos kyi sprin gyi 'brug sgra bsam gyis mi khyab pa 'byung ba thos par gyur te/ la la las ni/ byang chub kyi sems rnam pa tha dad pa dang / la la las ni/ pha rol tu phyin pa'i spyod pa dang / smon lam rnam pa tha dad pa dang / la la las ni/ sa tshad med pa rnam pa tha dad pa dang / la la las ni/ mngon par shes pa bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i rnam par 'phrul pa rnam pa tha dad pa dang / la la las ni/ de bzhin gshegs pa'i mchod pa sna tshogs rnam pa tha dad pa dang / la la las ni/ sangs rgyas kyi zhing gi rgyan rnam pa tha dad pa dang / la la las ni/ de bzhin gshegs pa'i chos kyi sprin tshad med pa rnam pa tha dad pa dang / de bzhin du chos thams cad kyi sgra gong du ji skad du brjod pa thams cad thos par gyur to/ /la la las ni/ thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du 'jug pa'i sgra thos te/ 'jig rten gyi khams che ge mo zhig ces bya bar byang chub sems dpa' ming dang che ge mo zhig gis chos kyi sgo ni/ che ge mo zhig ces bya ba thos/ dge ba'i bshes gnyen ni/ che ge mo zhig gis yang dag par bskul/ de bzhin gshegs pa ni/ che ge mo zhig gi zhabs kyi drung du/ bskal pa'i ming ni/ 'di zhes bya bar/ sangs rgyas kyi zhing ni/ 'di lta bu zhig tu/ 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor ni/ 'di lta bu zhig na 'dug 'dug ste/ dge ba'i rtsa ba ni/ 'di lta bu zhig bskyed nas de bzhin gshegs pa'i yon tan ni/ 'di lta bu dag cig thos te/ lhag pa'i bsam pa ni/ 'di lta bu dang / smon lam gyi rnam pa ni; 'di 'dra ba zhig gis byang chub tu sems bskyed nas des bskal pa ni/ 'di snyed cig tu byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa spyad de/ bskal pa 'di snyed cig gis bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur ro/ /mtshan ni/ 'di zhes bya/ sku tshe'i tshad ni/ 'di tsam zhig ste; sangs rgyas kyi zhing gi yon tan dang / rgyan phun sum tshogs pa 'di 'dra ba dang / smon lam gyi khyad par 'di lta bu zhig dang / sems can rnam par gdul pa 'di 'dra ba zhig dang / nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi 'khor kun nas 'dus pa 'di 'dra ba zhig go /de yongs su mya ngan las 'das nas kyang bskal pa 'di snyed cig tu dam pa'i chos gnas par 'gyur ro/ /sems can gyi don ni/ 'di tsam zhig tu 'gyur ro/ /zhes bya ba'i sgra thos so/ /la la las ni/ 'jig rten gyi khams che ge mo zhig na byang chub sems dpa' ming dang / che ge mo zhig sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod na/ gtang bar dka' ba 'di lta bu'i yongs su gtong ba brgya ni/ byed do; ;byang chub sems dpa' che ge mo zhig ni/ tshul khrims srung ngo/ /bzod pa sgom mo/ /brtson 'grus rtsom mo/ /bsam gtan la snyoms par 'jug go /shes rab kyis rnam par dbye ba la brtson no/ /byang chub sems dpa' che ge mo zhig ni/ dam pa'i chos yongs su btsal ba'i don du rgyal po'i srid yongs su gtong bar byed do/ /rin po che yongs su gtong ba dang / bu yongs su gtong ba dang / chung ma yongs su gtong ba dang / rkang lag dang / mig dang / mgo yongs su gtong bar byed do; ;mer mchong bar byed do/ /byang chub sems dpa' ming dang / che ge mo zhig gis ni/ de bzhin gshegs pa'i bstan pa bzung ste chos smra ba byed do/ /chos kyi sbyin pa gtong ngo/ /chos kyi mchod sbyin byed do/ /chos kyi rgyal mtshan sgreng ngo/ /chos kyi rnga rdung ngo/ /chos kyi dung 'bud do/ /chos kyi char 'bebs so/ /de bzhin gshegs pa'i bstan pa 'dzin to/ /de bzhin gshegs pa'i mchod rten brgyan pa byed do/ /de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku gzugs brgyan pa byed do/ /sems can la bde ba'i yo byad kyis sdud do/ /dam pa'i chos kyi mdzod srung ngo/ /zhes bya ba'i sgra thos so/ /la la las ni/ 'jig rten gyi khams che ge mo zhig ces bya ba na de bzhin gshegs pa mtshan che ge mo zhig dbang bskur ba ming dang che ge mo zhig gis 'khor 'di lta bu zhig na sangs rgyas kyi zhing 'di lta bu zhig dang / bskal pa 'di lta bu zhig la sku tshe'i tshad 'di tsam zhig dang / chos bstan pa 'di lta bu dang / sems can 'dul ba 'di 'dra ba dang / 'di lta bu'i smon lam gyis mngon par 'tshang rgya bas da ltar bzhugs shing 'tsho skyong ngo/ /zhes bya ba dang / de bzhin du dril dang / dril bu dang / g.yer kha'i dra ba dang / rol mo la sogs pa'i dmigs pa thams cad las chos kyi sgo rnam pa tha dad pa tshad med pa'i sgra thos par gyur te/ sgra de dag thams cad thos pas/ tshong dpon gyi bu nor bzang dga' ba'i shugs rgya chen pos mngon par brlan pa'i sems kyis chos kyi sgo de dag thos nas la lar ni/ gzungs kyi sgo mang po thob par gyur to/ /la lar ni/ spobs pa'i sgo mang po thob par gyur to/ /la lar ni/ bzod pa'i sgo mang po thob par gyur to/ /la lar ni/ spyod pa'i sgo mang po thob par gyur to/ /la lar ni/ smon lam gyi sgo mang po thob par gyur to/ /la lar ni/ pha rol tu phyin pa'i sgo mang po thob par gyur to/ /la lar ni/ mngon par shes pa'i sgo mang po thob par gyur to/ /la lar ni/ rig pa dang ye shes snang ba'i sgo mang po thob par gyur to/ /la lar ni/ rnam par thar pa'i sgo mang po thob par gyur to/ /la lar ni/ ting nge 'dzin gyi sgor 'jug pa mang po thob par gyur to/ /

In the middle of the great tower containing the adornments of Vairocana he saw one tower which was bigger than all the others and arrayed with adornments surpassing all the other towers. In that tower he saw a billion-world universe, in which he saw a hundred million sets of four continents, with a hundred million Jambudvipas and a hundred million heavens of contentment.
