In those Jambudvipa continents he saw the enlightening being Maitreya being born in a lotus calyx; he also saw Maitreya taking seven steps as Indra and Brahma watched, looking over the ten directions, making the lion roar, showing all the stages of childhood, in the palace, out in the garden, setting out for omniscience, appearing to undertake ascetic practice, finally eating food, going to the site of enlightenment, conquering the devil, awakening to enlightenment, steadily gazing on the tree of enlightenment, being asked by Brahma to teach, and turning the wheel of the teaching, going into the celestial abodes, with various different manifestations of enlightening teaching, using various names of eras in different ways, with various different spans of life, various different arrays of gatherings, with various demonstrations of ways of purification of lands, carrying out various practices and vows, with various structures of teaching used as means to develop and mature all concerned, showing various distributions of relics and bases of maintaining the teachings. And everywhere there Sudhana perceived himself at Maitreya’s feet.
In all those assemblies, in all the manifestations of works, in the varieties of spans of life, by means of the knowledge based on clear recollection, standing on the ground of knowledge, sure to reach omniscience, Sudhana heard, from all the objects in all those towers, the nets of bells and chimes, the drums and songs, and so on, and from the beings therein, the thunder of inconceivable multitudes of voices. From some he heard of the variety of aspirations for enlightenment; from some, about the variety of offerings to buddhas; from some, about the variety of arrays of buddha-lands; from some, about the infinite variety of teachings of buddhas—thus he heard the voices of all the teachings as they had been expounded in the past.
He also heard about setting out for omniscience—in such-and-such a land the enlightening being so-and-so aspired to enlightenment, heard such-and-such a teaching, was inspired by the spiritual benefactor so-and-so, went to such-and-such a congregation at the foot of the buddha so-and-so in such-and-such a land in such-and-such an age, planted such-and-such roots of goodness, heard about such-and-such qualities of buddhahood, undertook such-and-such a variety of vows with such-and-such an intention, will realize supreme perfect enlightenment in so many eons after having carried out practice for so many eons, will be named so-and-so, will live so long, in a buddha-land with such-and-such qualities, with such-and-such higher commitments, such-and-such guidance of beings, such-and-such a congregation of disciples, individual illuminates, and enlightening beings, the true teaching to last for so many ages after the death of the Buddha, with such-and-such benefits.
He heard another voice saying that in such-and-such a world the enlightening being so-and-so makes so many hundreds of difficult sacrifices in the practice of transcendent giving; the enlightening being so-and-so keeps the precepts, cultivates tolerance, acquires vigor, attains meditations, engages in the investigation of wisdom; the enlightening being so-and-so, in search of truth, relinquishes kingship, wealth, family, hands and feet, eyes and head, and practices self-mortification by fire; the enlightening being so-and-so, advanced in the teaching of those who arrive at Thusness, works as a spiritual preacher, giving the gift of religion, performs the service of religion, raises the banner of religion, beats the drum and blows the horn of religion, showers the rain of religion, preserves the teaching of the enlightened, adorns monuments to the enlightened, has images of buddhas made, comforts beings, and guards the treasury of truth.
He heard another voice say that the buddha so-and-so now is in such-and-such a world, currently existing and expounding the Teaching, with such-and-such an initiation, in such-and-such an assembly in such-and-such a land in such-and-such an age, with such-and-such a life span, with such-and-such a doctrine guiding people in such-and-such a way, realizing such-and-such vows.
In this manner, from each object Sudhana heard articulations of an infinite variety of aspects of the Teaching, and by listening to all those voices he heard those facets of the Teaching with a mind flooded with joy. From some he got facets of mental command; from others, facets of commitment, tolerance, conduct, transcendence, higher perceptions, mystic knowledge, liberation, and concentration.
shin tu rgyas pa chen po'i mdo/ sangs rgyas phal po che zhes bya ba las/ sdong pos brgyan pa'i le'u ste/ ` /bam po brgya bcu bzhi pa/

me long gi dkyil 'khor de dag las kyang gzugs brnyan gyi rgyan rnam par dmigs pa tshad med pa mthong bar gyur te/ la lar ni/ de bzhin gshegs pa'i 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor gyi gzugs brnyan rnam par dmigs pa mthong ngo/ /la lar ni/ byang chub sems dpa'i 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor gyi gzugs brnyan rnam par dmigs pa dang / la lar ni/ nyan thos kyi 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor gyi gzugs brnyan rnam par dmigs pa dang / la lar ni/ rang sangs rgyas kyi 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor gyi gzugs brnyan rnam par dmigs pa dang / la lar ni/ de bzhin gshegs pa'i 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor gyi gzugs brnyan rnam par dmigs pa dang / la lar ni; kun nas nyon mongs pa'i zhing gi gzugs brnyan rnam par dmigs pa dang / la lar ni/ rnam par dag pa'i zhing gi gzugs brnyan rnam par dmigs pa dang / la lar ni/ kun nas nyon mongs shing rnam par dag pa'i zhing gi gzugs brnyan rnam par dmigs pa dang / la lar ni/ rnam par dag cing kun nas nyon mongs pa'i zhing gi gzugs brnyan rnam par dmigs pa dang / la lar ni/ sangs rgyas dang bcas pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyi gzugs brnyan rnam par dmigs pa dang / la lar ni/ sangs rgyas mi bzhugs pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyi gzugs brnyan rnam par dmigs pa dang / la lar ni/ chung ba'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyi gzugs brnyan rnam par dmigs pa dang / la lar ni/ che ba'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyi gzugs brnyan rnam par dmigs pa dang / la lar ni/ phra ba'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyi gzugs brnyan rnam par dmigs pa dang / la lar ni/ rgya che ba'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyi gzugs brnyan rnam par dmigs pa dang / la lar ni/ mig 'phrul gyis 'jug pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyi gzugs brnyan gyi rnam par dmigs pa dang / la lar ni/ snrel zhi'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyi gzugs brnyan rnam par dmigs pa dang / la lar ni/ spyi'u tshugs kyi 'jig rten gyi khams kyi gzugs brnyan rnam par dmigs pa dang / la lar ni; sa'i gzhi mnyam par 'dug pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyi gzugs brnyan rnam par dmigs pa dang / la lar ni/ sems can dmyal ba dang / byol song dang / yi kyi gnas kyi 'jig rten gyi khams kyi gzugs brnyan rnam par dmigs pa dang / la lar ni/ lha dang mis gang ba'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyi gzugs brnyan rnam par dmigs pa mthong bar gyur to/ /

He also saw measureless arrays of reflections in the mirrors, reflections of assemblies of buddhas, circles of enlightening beings, congregations of disciples, groups of self-illuminates, defiled lands, pure lands, defiled and pure lands, reflections of all buddhas in one world, worlds with buddhas, small worlds, large worlds, subtle worlds, gross worlds, worlds in the cosmic net of Indra, inverted worlds, level worlds, worlds of hells, animals, and ghosts, worlds full of celestials and humans.

'chags de dag dang / gnas de dag dang / stan de dag la byang chub sems dpa' grangs med pa dgos pa sna tshogs la brtson pa dag kyang mthong bar gyur te/ la lar ni/ 'chag pa dang / la lar ni/ bsam gtan byed pa dang / la lar ni/ lta ba dang / la lar ni/ sems can rnams la snying rje chen pos rgyas par 'gengs pa dang / la lar ni/ gtsug lag gi tshul sna tshogs 'jig rten gyi don du 'gyur ba sgrub pa dang / la lar ni/ lung nod pa dang / la lar ni/ kha ton byed pa dang / la lar ni/ yi ge 'bri ba dang / la lar ni/ dri ba yongs su 'dri ba dang / la lar ni/ phung po gsum pa'i bshags pa dang / yongs su bsngo ba la brtson pa dang / la lar ni/ smon lam mngon par sgrub par byed par mthong ngo/ /

He also saw countless enlightening beings on the promenades or sitting on their seats, engaged in various activities. Some were walking around, some were doing spiritual exercises, some were practicing observation, some were projecting universal compassion, some were working on various sciences having to do with the welfare of the world, some were instructing, some were reciting, some were writing, some were asking questions, some were engaged in ripening conduct, concentration, and knowledge, some were undertaking vows.

ka ba de dag las kyang rin po che'i rgyal po thams cad kyi 'od kyi dra ba mang po 'byung ba mthong ste/ la la las ni/ kha dog sngon po dang / la la las ni/ kha dog ser po dang / la la las ni/ kha dog dmar po dang / la la las ni/ kha dog dkar po dang / la la las ni/ shel gyi kha dog dang / la la las ni/ gser gyi kha dog dang / la la las ni/ in+d+ra nI la'i kha dog dang / la la las ni/ 'ja'i kha dog dang / la la las ni/ 'dzam bu chu klung gi gser gyi kha dog dang / la la las ni/ 'od thams cad du sna tshogs pa'i kha dog lus dang sems kyi bde ba skyed pa/ blta na mchog tu mdzes pa mthong bar gyur to/ /

He saw webs of jewel lights coming from the pillars, some sapphire, some topaz, some ruby, some white, some crystal, some golden, some emerald, some diamond, some rainbow, some the colors of all lights, delightful to the body and mind, supremely pleasant to the eye.

'dzam bu chu klung gi gser gyi chu shing gi ka ba de dag dang / rin po che thams cad kyi gzugs de dag kyang lag nas me tog gi sprin mngon par sbyong bar mthong ste/ lag nas phreng ba'i lda ldi dang / lag nas gos dang / lag nas gdugs dang / rgyal mtshan dang / ba dan dang / lag nas spos dang / gdug spos dang / byug pa dang / lag nas nor bu rin po che'i dra ba dang / lag nas rin po che sna tshogs dang / gser gyi lcags pod sna tshogs dang / lag nas mu tig sna tshogs kyi se mo do dang / lag nas rin po che sna tshogs kyi se mo do mngon par sbyong ba dang / lag nas rgyan thams cad thogs par mthong ngo/ /la lar ni/ gtsug gi rin po che dang / cod pan gyis 'dud cing mig mi 'gebs par lta ba dang / thal mo sbyor zhing phyag 'tshal bar mthong ngo/ /mu tig gi phreng ba de dag las kyang spos sna tshogs kyis dri zhim por byas pa'i chu yan lag brgyad dang ldan pa'i char gyi rgyun phra mo 'bab par mthong ngo/ /rin po che bai DUr+ya'i phreng ba'i dra ba de dag las kyang mar [?] me'i phreng ba rab tu 'bar ba mang po mthong bar gyur to/ /rin po che'i gdugs de dag kyang rgyan dang / lhab lhub thams cad kyis mdzes par brgyan te/ rin po che'i dril dang / dril bu g.yer kha'i dra ba dang / dar gyi lda ldi dang / chun po dang / rin po che'i shar bu dang / nor bu rin po che sna tshogs kyi sgo ngas yongs su brgyan pa'i snying po dang ldan par mthong ngo/ /rdzing de dag nas kyang rin po che'i me tog pad+mo dang / ut+pa la dang / ku mu da dang / puN+Da ri ka grangs med pa mngon par thon par mthong ste/ la la ni/ mtho gang 'khor ba tsam/ la la ni/ 'dom gang 'khor ba tsam/ la la ni/ shing rta'i 'khor lo tsam ste; de dag la yang gzugs sna tshogs kyi rgyan mang po 'khod par mthong ste/ 'di ltar bud med kyi gzugs dang / skyes pa'i gzugs dang / khye'u'i gzugs dang / bu mo'i gzugs dang / brgya byin gyi gzugs dang / tshangs pa'i gzugs dang / 'jig rten gyi mgon po'i gzugs dang / lha dang / klu dang / gnod sbyin dang / dri ba dang / lha ma yin dang / nam mkha' lding dang / mi 'am ci dang / lto 'phye chen po'i gzugs dang / nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa'i gzugs dang / 'gro ba thams cad kyi gzugs kyi dbyibs su 'dug pa'i lus kha dog sna tshogs rnam pa du ma dang ldan pa mang po thal mo sbyar te lus 'dud cing phyag 'tshal bar 'khod pa mthong ngo/ /de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku gzugs mi chen po'i mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis kyis brgyan pa skyil mo krung du bcas te bzhugs pa dag kyang mthong ngo/ /

He also saw the golden statues of women and all the jewel statues with their hands extended downward, holding myriads of flowers, garlands, parasols, banners and pennants, incense and perfume, various jewels on gold strings, various pearl necklaces, garlands of various jewels, holding all kinds of ornaments in their hands. He saw some figures bowing, crowned with jewels, with steady gaze, palms joined, in gestures of respect. He also saw delicate clouds of pure water imbued with all fragrances coming from the pearl necklaces, and saw long streams flowing from the webs of strings of lapis lazuli. He also saw all the jewel parasols embellished with all kinds of ornaments, and he saw the inner chamber adorned with jewel bells, sets of chimes, silk streamers, strings of bells, slivers of jewels, and heaps of various gems. He saw countless superb red, blue, and white lotuses growing in the lotus ponds, some a foot across, some a fathom across, some as big as a wagon wheel; and in them he saw arrays of various figures—figures of women, men, boys, girls, Indra, Brahma, the world guardians, gods, dragons, goblins, cherubs, titans, birds, centaurs, serpents, sages, saints, and enlightening beings—bodies in the forms of all living beings, various in appearance, joining their palms and bowing in gestures of respect. He also saw figures of buddhas adorned with the thirty-two marks of great people, sitting in the lotus posture.

sa chen po'i gzhi bai DUr+ya las grub pa mig mang ris su 'dug pa'i mig mang ris re re nas kyang gzugs brnyan rnam par dmigs pa bsam gyis mi khyab pa mang po mthong bar gyur te/ khang pa brtsegs pa la la las ni/ zhing gi gzugs brnyan rnam par dmigs pa/ la la las ni/ byang chub sems dpa'i gzugs brnyan rnam par dmigs pa/ la la las ni/ sangs rgyas kyi gzugs brnyan rnam par dmigs par mthong bar gyur te/ khang pa brtsegs pa de dag gi rgyan dang / lhab lhub ji snyed pa de dag thams cad kyang mig mang ris re re la gzugs brnyan du snang bar mthong ngo/ /rin po che'i shing rin po che'i me tog dang 'bras bu'i mdzod sna tshogs dang ldan pa de dag thams cad las kyang lus phyed tsam byung ba'i gzugs dbyibs sna tshogs dang / kha dog sna tshogs su 'dug pa mang po thon par mthong ste/ la la las ni/ sangs rgyas kyi sku phyed tsam byung ba dang / la la las ni/ byang chub sems dpa'i lus phyed tsam byung ba dang / la la las ni/ lha dang / klu dang / gnod sbyin dang / dri za dang / lha ma yin dang / nam mkha' lding dang / mi 'am ci dang / lto 'phye chen po'i lus phyed tsam byung ba dang / la la las ni/ brgya byin dang / tshangs pa dang / 'jig rten gyi mgon po'i lus phyed tsam byung ba dang / la la las ni/ 'khor los bsgyur ba dang / mi'i dbang po'i lus phyed tsam byung ba dang / la la las ni/ rgyal bu gzhon nu dang / tshong dpon dang / khyim bdag dang / blon po dang / skyes pa dang / bud med dang / khye'u dang / bu mo dang / dge slong dang / dge slong ma dang / dge bsnyen dang / dge bsnyen ma'i lus phyed tsam byung ba mthong ste/ la la'i lag nas ni/ me tog gi phreng ba sbyong ba dang / la la'i lag nas ni/ rin po che'i phreng ba mngon par sbyong ba dang / la la'i lag nas ni/ rgyan thams cad mngon par thogs pa dang / la la ni/ lus 'dud cing thal mo sbyar te mig mi 'gebs par lta zhing phyag 'tshal ba dang / la la ni/ mngon par bstod pa dang / la la ni/ mnyam par bzhag pa dang / la la ni/ gser gyi kha dog tu 'dug pa dang / la la ni/ dngul gyi kha dog tu 'dug pa dang / la la ni/ byi ru'i kha dog tu 'dug pa dang / la la ni/ rin po che bai DUr+ya sngon po'i kha dog tu 'dug pa dang / la la ni/ rin po che in+d+ra nI la'i kha dog tu 'dug pa dang / la la ni/ nor bu rin po che rnam par snang ba'i kha dog tu 'dug pa dang / la la ni/ rin po che thams cad kyi kha dog tu 'dug pa dang / la la ni/ me tog tsam pa ka'i kha dog tu 'dug pa dang / la la ni/ 'od kyi lus dang / la la ni/ mtshan gyis rnam par bris pa'i lus su mthong bar gyur to/ /zla gam de dag las kyang nyi zla dang / gza' skar gyi gzugs brnyan grangs med pa mang po thon te phyogs bcur snang bar byed pa mthong bar gyur to/ /khang pa dang / gzhal med khang dang / khang pa brtsegs pa'i rtsig ngos de dag thams cad kyang rin po che thams cad kyis mig mang ris sna tshogs su bris par mthong ste/ rin po che'i mig mang ris de dag thams cad las kyang byang chub sems dpa' byams pas byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa rim pas ji ltar spyad pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa thams cad rim par mthong bar gyur to/ /mig mang ris la la las ni/ byang chub sems dpa' byams pas mgo byin pa mthong ngo/ /la la las ni/ mig byin pa dang / la la las ni/ lag pa byin pa dang / la la las ni/ gtsug gi rin po che byin pa dang / la la las ni/ thor pag dang bcas pa'i gtsug gi rin po che byin pa dang / la la las ni/ so byin pa dang / la la las ni/ lce byin pa dang / la la las ni/ rna ba byin pa dang / la la las ni/ sna byin pa dang / la la las ni/ snying byin pa dang / la la las ni/ sha dang rkang byin pa dang / la la las ni/ khrag byin pa dang / la la las ni/ pags pa dang phri byin pa dang / la la las ni/ sen mo sha dang bcas par byin pa dang / la la las ni/ dra bar 'brel pa dang bcas pa'i sor mo byin pa dang / la la las ni/ bu dang / bu mo dang / chung ma byin pa dang / la la las ni/ rin po che'i phung po byin pa dang / la la las ni/ grong dang / grong khyer dang / ljongs dang / yul dang / khams dang / rgyal po'i gnas byin pa dang / la la las ni/ 'dzam bu'i gling byin pa dang / la la las ni/ gling bzhi byin pa dang / la la las ni/ rgyal srid kyi dbang phyug byin pa dang / la la las ni/ rgyal po'i khri byin pa dang / la la las ni/ bran pho mo byin pa dang / la la las ni; btsun mo'i 'khor byin pa dang / la la las ni/ bza' shing gi ra ba dang / dka' thub kyi nags tshal byin pa dang / la la las ni/ gdugs dang / rgyal mtshan dang / ba dan byin pa dang / la la las ni/ me tog dang / phreng ba dang / byug pa byin pa dang / la la las ni/ nad kyi rtsi byin pa dang / la la las ni/ kha zas dang / skom gyi rnam pa mang po byin pa dang / la la las ni/ yo byad thams cad byin pa dang / la la las ni/ gnas thams cad byin pa dang / la la las ni/ gzhal ba'i snod rin po ches bkang ba byin pa dang / la la las ni/ rin po che'i shing rta byin pa dang / la la las ni/ btson ra na 'khod pa thar par byed pa dang / la la las ni/ gsad par chad pa las thar par byed pa dang / la la las ni/ byis pa gso ba byed pa dang / la la las ni; lam stor ba la lam ston pa dang / la la las ni/ mnyan par gyur te chu klung gi rgyud la gru 'dor ba dang / la la las ni/ rta'i rgyal po stobs kyis sgrol bar gyur te/ rgya mtsho chen po'i srin po'i gling du phyin par gyur pa'i sems can yongs su skyob pa dang / la la las ni/ drang srong chen por gyur te bstan pa mngon par sgrub pa dang / la la las ni/ 'khor los bsgyur bar gyur te/ sems can dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam la 'god pa dang / la la las ni/ sman par gyur te na ba'i gsos byed pa dang / la la las ni/ pha ma la phu dud byed pa dang / la la las ni/ dge ba'i bshes gnyen la rim gro byed pa dang / la la las ni/ nyan thos kyi kha dog dang / gzugs kyis sems can 'dul ba la brtson pa dang / la la las ni/ rang sangs rgyas kyi kha dog dang / gzugs kyis sems can 'dul ba la brtson pa dang / la la las ni/ byang chub sems dpa'i kha dog dang / gzugs kyis sems can 'dul ba la brtson pa dang / la la las ni/ sangs rgyas kyi sku mdog dang; sku gzugs kyis sems can 'dul ba la brtson pa dang / la la las ni/ skyes pa'i rabs kyi khyad par thams cad kyis skye ba yongs su bstan te sems can yongs su smin par byed pa dang / la la las ni/ chos smra ba'i gzugs kyis de bzhin gshegs pa'i bstan pa la zhugs te lung 'bog pa dang / kha ton bya ba dang / tshul bzhin du dpyad par bya ba la brtson pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i mchod rten la rgyan gyis brgyan par byed pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku gzugs byed du 'jug pa dang / sangs rgyas mchod pa la sems can yongs su bskul ba dang / spos dang byug pa gsol zhing 'bru mar dri zhim pos byug pa dang / dril bu dang me tog gi phreng ba gsol pa la sogs pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi mchod pa rnam pa thams cad la brtson pa dang / dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam la sems can rab tu 'god pa dang / bslab pa'i gnas lnga dang / gso sbyong gi yan lag brgyad dang / sangs rgyas dang / chos dang / dge 'dun la skyabs btsal ba dang / rab tu 'byung ba dang / chos mnyan pa dang / lung mnod pa dang / kha ton bya ba dang / tshul bzhin yid la bya ba la sems can 'god par byed pa dang / chos kyi gtam bya ba'i phyir seng+ge'i stan la 'dug cing sangs rgyas kyi byang chub rnam par 'grel ba dang / de ltar byang chub sems dpa' byams pas bskal pa bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong grangs med par pha rol tu phyin pa drug la spyad pa de dag thams cad tshong dpon gyi bu nor bzang gis mig mang ris de dag las rnam pa gzhan dang gzhan mthong bar gyur to/ /
des khang pa brtsegs pa la la las ni/ byang chub sems dpa' byams pas dge ba'i bshes gnyen ji snyed cig bsnyen bkur ba de dag thams cad kyi rnam par 'phrul pa'i rgyan thams cad kyang mthong bar gyur te/ dge ba'i bshes gnyen de dag thams cad kyi drung du bdag nyid phyin cing / tshur shog nor bzang legs par 'ongs sam/ mi ngal lam/ 'di re byang chub sems dpa'i rgyan dang / yul rnam par sprul pa bsam gyis mi khyab pa 'di dag la ltos shig /ces bsgo zhing gtam byed par shes par gyur te/

Also, on the checkerboard lapis-lazuli surface of the ground, he saw inconceivable reflections in each square; here he saw the reflection of a land, there the reflection of a buddha. All the arrays of adornments in those towers he saw reflected in each of the squares.
Also, in all the flowers, fruits, and buds of the jewel trees he saw golden busts of all kinds of beings—buddhas, enlightening beings, gods, dragons, goblins, cherubs, titans, birds, serpents, Indras, Brahmas, the world guardians, human emperors, princes, grandees, ministers, women, men, boys, girls, monks, nuns, male and female devotees, some with flower garlands hanging from their hands, some with strings of jewels hanging from their hands, some holding all kinds of ornaments, some bowing with their palms joined and gaze steady, paying respect, some singing hymns of praise, some in trance, some with a golden luster, some with a silver luster, some with a frosty luster, some with a sapphire luster, some with a shining jewel luster, some shining with the colors of all jewels, some with a saffron luster, some shining like bodies of light, some with bodies adorned with the marks of greatness.
From the crescents adorning the towers he saw reflections of countless moons, suns, stars, and planets emerge and illumine the ten directions.
He also saw the walls of the palatial towers resplendent with checkerboards of all jewels, and in all of the jewel square he saw Maitreya carrying out all the practices of enlightening beings, as he had done while performing enlightening practice in the past: in one square he saw Maitreya giving away his head; in another, giving away clothing; in another, giving away his topknot jewel; in another, giving the crown jewel of truth; in another, giving away his teeth; in another, giving away his tongue; in another, giving away his ears and nose; in another, giving away his heart; in another giving away his marrow and flesh; in another, giving away his blood; in another, giving away his skin; in another, giving away his limbs; in another, giving away his body; in another, giving away his sons, daughters, and wife; in another, giving away heaps of jewels; in another, giving away village, town, city, and country; in another, giving away the continent; in another, giving away four continents; in another, giving away all powers of rulership; in another, giving away the throne; in another, giving away servants; in another, giving away the palace and harem; in another, giving away parks and retreats; in another, giving parasols, banners, and pennants; in another, giving garlands and perfumes; in another, giving medicines; in another, giving all kinds of food and drink; in another, giving all kinds of implements; in another, giving all kinds of furniture, cushions, and shelters; in another, giving precious copper vessels; in another, giving excellent vehicles; in another, freeing those in bondage; in another, freeing the condemned; in another, giving medical care to the young; in another, showing the right path to those on the path of destruction; in another, navigating the rivers as a boatman; in another, as a wonder horse, rescuing people on the isle of demons in the ocean; in another, as a great seer, practicing the sciences; in another, as a ruler, leading people into the paths of righteous conduct; in another, as a physician, engaged in treating the sick; in another, serving his mother and father; in another, listening to spiritual benefactors; in another, in the form of a Buddhist disciple, engaged in teaching people; in another in the form of a self-illuminate, in another in the form of an enlightening being, in another in the form of a buddha, engaged in teaching people; in another, manifesting existence as paragons of types of beings, developing beings to maturity; in another, as a religious preacher expounding experience of the teachings of buddhas, reciting the teachings, reflecting deeply on them, decorating monuments of buddhas, having statues of buddhas made, enjoining people to honor the buddhas, giving out perfumes, making all kinds of offerings to buddhas, leading people into paths of actions based on virtuous ways, directing people to the precepts, to refuge in the Buddha, the Teaching, and the Community, to listening to the Teaching, to discussion, recital, and profound contemplation of the Teaching, sitting on the lion seat to talk of the Teaching, revealing the enlightenment of buddhas. Thus Sudhana saw Maitreya’s practices of the six ways of transcendence over countless eons, projected from each of the squares of the checkerboard walls. In one tower he saw magical arrays of all the spiritual benefactors whom Maitreya attended, and he perceived himself in the presence of all those spiritual benefactors, being welcomed and told not to be weary, to behold this wonder of the enlightening being.

de ltar tshong dpon gyi bu nor bzang gis khang pa brtsegs pa de dag re re dang / dmigs pa de dag re re las kyang bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i rgyan dang / yul rnam par sprul pa 'di dag dang / gzhan dag kyang grangs med pa mang po mthong bar gyur te/ dran pa'i mthu nyams pa med pa dang / mig yongs su dag pa phyogs kun rnam par lta ba dang / lhag mthong la lta ba'i ye shes sgrib pa med pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i ye shes dang / byin gyi rlabs kyi dbang rab tu thob pas byang chub sems dpa'i 'du shes kyi rnam pa la zhugs pa'i ye shes kyi sa la gnas te mtha' yas pa'i rgyan dang / yul rnam par sprul pa de dag thams cad mthong bar gyur to/ /

So Sudhana saw these and other inconceivable projections of magnificent scenes from each of the towers and each object in the towers. By the power of unwavering mindfulness, by all-encompassing purity of vision, by unobstructed knowledge of observational skill, by attainment of control over the basis of knowledge of enlightening beings, standing on the ground of knowledge issuing from the perceptions of enlightening beings, he saw this whole endless manifestation of marvelous scenes.

'di lta ste/ dper na/ skyes bu gnyid kyis log pa'i rmi lam du gzugs kyi dmigs pa'i khyad par sna tshogs mang po zhig mthong bar gyur te/ 'di ltar khyim dang gzhal med khang mdangs dga' ba'am/ grong dang / grong khyer dang / ljongs dang / yul mdangs dga' ba'am/ bza' shing gi ra ba dang / kun dga'i ra ba dang / dka' thub kyi nags tshal mdangs dga' ba'am/ shing dang / chu klung dang / rdzing dang / ri mdangs dga' ba'am/ gos dang / kha zas dang / btung ba'i longs spyod nyams su bde ba'am/ glu dang / sil snyan dang / rol mo'i sgra snyan pa sna tshogs kyis rtse ba nyams su dga' ba zhig mthong ngam/ pha ma dang / gnyen bshes dang / bdag nyid 'grogs par shes par gyur pa'am/ rgya mtsho chen po dang / ri'i rgyal po ri rab dang / lha'i gnas thams cad dam/ 'dzam bu'i gling dag na bdag dpag tshad brgya phrag du mar gnas par shes par gyur la/ khyim mam/ gnas de'ang shin tu yangs shing yon tan dang / rgyan thams cad kyis yongs su brgyan par mthong ste/ nyin par zhig yin par shes kyang nam de yang ring ba dang / thung bar bye brag mi 'byed la/ rmi lam yin pa tsam du'ang mi shes so/ /bdag nyid kyang bde ba'i yo byad thams cad dang ldan zhing / lus kyi 'du byed zo bdog bde la snyom pa dang / gnyid med de mi dga' ba thams cad yongs su bsal bas dga' ba dang / bde ba rgya chen po nyams su myong ste/ yun kyang ring mo zhig lon pa snyam nas nyin gcig gam/ nyin bdun nam/ zla ba phyed dam/ zla ba gcig gam/ lo gcig gam/ lo brg+ya'am/ de bas kyang ring ba zhig lon pa tsam du shes par gyur nas sad na/ de thams cad kyang rjes su dran no/ /de bzhin du tshong dpon gyi bu nor bzang gis kyang byang chub sems dpa'i byin gyi rlabs dang / khams gsum pa thams cad rmi lam lta bur yang dag par gzhol ba'i ye shes kyis chung ba'i 'du shes 'gags pa'i sems dang ldan par gyur te/ byang chub sems dpa'i 'du shes kyi rnam pa yangs shing rgya che ba dang / sgrib pa med pa la gnas shing / byang chub sems dpa'i rgyan gyi yul khong du chud la byang chub sems dpa'i tshul la 'jug pa bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i rjes su 'brangs pa'i blo dang ldan pas/ rgyan rnam par sprul pa de dag thams cad kyang mthong bar gyur to/ /shes par gyur to/ /nyams su myong bar gyur to/ /rnam par dpyad par gyur to/ /mtshan mar byas par gyur to/ /dmigs kyis rtogs par gyur to/ /bdag nyid kyang de dag na 'dug par shes par gyur to/ /

It was like someone asleep seeing various things in a dream—nice houses and mansions, charming villages, towns, and cities, agreeable clothing, food and drink, or delightful performances of music, song, and dance; or as one might see pleasant parks, gardens, and retreats, trees, rivers, lotus ponds, and mountains, or perceive oneself together with family and friends, or as one might see the ocean, or the polar mountain, or the celestial abodes on the highest mountains, or the whole continent, or perceive oneself to be many miles tall, in which case one would see one’s house and surroundings as enormous; one sees all the elements arrayed together, as if it were daytime, and one does not know the length or brevity of the night, nor realize one is asleep. If one sees oneself in a pleasant situation, one’s body will be at rest, one will be free from torpor and drowsiness, with all attachments removed, feeling great joy and bliss; it will seem to last long—a day, a week, a fortnight, a year, a century, or even more—and when one awakes, one will remember it all. In the same way Sudhana, by the power of the enlightening being, by the knowledge of the collection of dreams that constitutes the world, the notion of smallness gone from his mind, abiding in the immensely vast unobstructed perception of enlightening beings, with the mental scope of enlightening beings, his intellect having entered into the inconceivable wisdom of enlightening beings, saw the whole supernal manifestation, was perfectly aware of it, understood it, contemplated it, used it as a means, beheld it, and saw himself there.

'di lta ste/ dper na/ mi nad pa sems kyi rgyud tha ma byung bar gyur te/ de ma thag tu skye ba'i sems nye bar gags nas las kyi srid pa mngon du gyur na/ las ji lta bur byas shing bsags pa'i rnam par smin pas las mi dge ba'i rkyen gyis ni/ sems can dmyal ba dang / byol song gi skye gnas dang / yi kyi yul lam/ gshin rje'i mi lag cha gnyems pa thogs pa gshe zhing khro ba dag kyang mthong bar gyur/ sems can dmyal ba pa'i dud mo dang / 'o dod kyi sgra yang thos par gyur la ba chu de dag mthong ste/ spu gri'i so gshibs pa'i ri de dag dang / lcags kyi shal ma li'i sdong po de dag dang / ral gri'i so'i nags tshal de dag kyang mthong bar gyur tam/ sems can dmyal ba de dag kyang kun nas 'bar zhing yongs su 'bar ba dang / rab tu 'bar ba dang / lcags kyi bum pa gcig tu 'bar ba dag kyang mthong bar gyur la/ gnod pa de dag thams cad kyis kyang gnod par bya zhing / tshor ba de dag kyang nyams su myong ba tsam du shes par gyur te/ sems can dmyal ba de dag kyang me'i gdung bas sdug bsngal ba zhig tu mthong ngam/ bdag gis myong bar gyur tam/ las dge ba'i tshogs kyis lha'i khang pa dang / gnas shig mthong bar gyur tam/ lha'i 'khor dang / lha mo'i tshogs dang / rgyan rnam par phye ba thams cad kyang mthong bar gyur te/ bza' shing gi ra ba dang / dka' thub kyi nags tshal dang / chu klung dang / rdzing dang / rin po che'i ri dang / yid bzhin gyi shing dang / longs spyod mang po mthong ngam nyams su myong bar gyur te/ tshe'i yun kyang de dang mnyam par shes par gyur na/ de ni/ 'di nas kyang 'phos pa med/ der yang skyes pa med de/ mi snang bar ma gyur bzhin du/ las kyi yul bsam gyis mi khyab pas bya ba'i rnam pa de lta bu dag shes shing mthong la nyams su myong bar rung ngo/ /de bzhin du tshong dpon gyi bu nor bzang gis byang chub sems dpa'i las kyi yul bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i phyir rgyan rnam par sprul pa de dag thams cad kyang mthong bar gyur to/ /

It was like the case of a dying man hovering in his final mental state, on the brink of the mental state immediately preceding rebirth, faced with the state of being which is caused by his actions, as a result of the accumulation of whatever actions he has done; he will see hell if he has done evil, or the state of animals, ghosts, or the underworld, and may see angry, abusive henchmen of the underworld carrying weapons, and hear the cries of lament and anger of the beings in hell. He will also see the great hells burning, blazing masses of flames, and will see the copper cauldrons and the tortures being carried out, and will perceive those undergoing them. He will also see and feel the pains of the burning of the fires of hell. But by accumulation of good actions one will see heaven, and will see the assemblies of gods and goddesses and all the magnificent arrays of heaven; one will see and experience the enjoyments of the parks, palaces, rivers, lotus ponds, mountains of jewels, and wish-fulfilling trees. At the end of one’s life one will feel one has passed away from this world and been reborn in the next, even though one has not yet died; thus by the wonder of the mental realms caused by actions one will see and experience these events. In the same way Sudhana, by the wonder of the states caused by the actions of an enlightening being, saw that whole supernal manifestation of the tower of Vairocana.

'di lta ste/ dper na/ skyes bu 'byung po'i gdon gyis non pa ni/ gzugs kyi rnam pa sna tshogs mang po mthong ste/ ci dris pa de dag gi lung yang ston to/ /de bzhin du tshong dpon gyi bu nor bzang gis byang chub sems dpa'i ye shes dang / byin gyi rlabs kyi mthus rgyan de dag thams cad mthong bar gyur to/ /
Just as a man possessed by a spirit sees various things, and tells of what he is asked about, in the same way Sudhana, by the power of knowledge of an enlightening being, saw all those arrays.

'di lta ste/ dper na/ klu'i khang par byin pa'i skyes bus ni/ klu'i 'du shes kyi rnam pa la zhugs pas/ nyi ma gcig gam/ nyi ma bdun nam/ zla ba phyed dam/ zla ba gcig gam/ lo gcig gam/ lo brgyar yang 'du shes kyi rnam pas shes te/ klu'i 'du shes kyi rnam pa dang bral nas mi'i 'du shes kyi rnam par na yud tsam las ma lon par mthong ngo/ /de bzhin du tshong dpon gyi bu nor bzang byang chub sems dpa'i 'du shes kyi rnam pas ma btang ba'i blo dang ldan pas kyang byang chub sems dpa' byams pa'i byin gyi rlabs kyis yud tsam gcig po de yang bskal pa bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong mang por shes par gyur to/ /

Just as a man who has entered the abode of water spirits, by entering into the perception of water spirits, thinks a day or a week or a fortnight or a month or a year or a century has passed, merely in his perception, and when leaving the perception of water spirits for the perception of humans sees that it was only a short time, in the same way, with the mindfulness of the perception of an enlightening being, by the power of Maitreya, in that short time Sudhana had the sense of the passage of billions of eons.

'di lta ste/ dper na/ tshangs pa chen po'i gzhal med khang 'gro ba thams cad na rgyan gyi dam pa phul zhes bya ba yod de; de'i nang du stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad kyang gzugs brnyan gyi tshul du dmigs pa thams cad dang ma 'dres par gsal bar snang ngo/ /de bzhin du tshong dpon gyi bu nor bzang gis kyang rgyan de dag thams cad dmigs pa thams cad du phan tshun ma 'dres pa dang / phan tshun ma 'dzings par gzugs rab tu byung ba mthong ngo/ /

There is a celestial mansion called “chamber of the finest ornaments of all worlds,” wherein the whole universe is seen by reflection, with all objects clearly defined; in the same way Sudhana saw all those arrays, unconfused, reflected in all the objects.

'di lta ste/ dper na/ rgyal ba'i skye mched kyi snyoms par 'jug pa la rnam par spyod pa'i dge slong ni/ gcig pu gnyis su med pa'i khang bu'am/ 'chag sa'am/ 'dug pa'i gnas na 'dug gam/ bskyed gang rung ste/ 'jig rten thams cad rgyas pa'i skye mched gang la snyoms par zhugs pa'i yul bzhin du bsam gtan pa'i yul bsam gyis mi khyab par mthong zhing nyams su myong ngo/ /de bzhin du tshong dpon gyi bu nor bzang gis kyang yul gang la zhugs pa'i tshul bzhin du/ rgyan de dag thams cad mthong zhing shes te nyams su myong bar gyur to/ /

Just as a monk in the trance of absorption in one of the points of totality is single-minded and undivided whether walking, standing still, sitting, or reclining, and sees and experiences the whole world through entry into the sphere of total absorption in whatever point of totality he is focused on, by the marvel of meditation, in the same way Sudhana saw all those arrays whatever object he immersed himself in.

'di lta ste/ dper na/ dri za'i grong khyer rnams kyi rgyan dang / lhab lhub thams cad nam mkha'i dbyings la byung ba ni/ yongs su snang yang ci la yang sgrib par mi 'gyur ro/ /'di lta ste/ dper na/ gnod sbyin gyi gzhal med khang mi'i khang pa na 'dug pa'am/ mi'i khang pa gnod sbyin gyi khang pa'i khongs na 'dug pa ni/ phan tshun tha mi dad de/ las kyi yul rnam pa ji ltar dag pa'i tshul bzhin du snang ngo/ /'di lta ste/ dper na/ rgya mtsho chen po la stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad kyang rgya'i gzugs brnyan ltar snang ngo/ /'di lta ste/ dper na/ sgyu ma'i mkhan po ni; sngags dang / rig sngags dang / rtsi'i mthu dang / byin gyi rlabs kyis gzugs kyi rnam pa thams cad dang / bya ba thams cad kyang yongs su ston to/ /de bzhin du tshong dpon gyi bu nor bzang gis kyang byang chub sems dpa' byams pa'i byin gyi rlabs ye shes sgyu ma bsam gyis mi khyab pa la zhugs pas byang chub sems dpa'i dbang dang / byin gyi rlabs kyi ye shes chos thams cad shes pa'i sgyu ma'i stobs kyis mngon par bsgrubs pa'i mthus rgyan gyi yul rnam par sprul pa de dag mthong bar gyur to/ /

Just as all the adornments of the cities of celestial musicians are visible in the sky, without constituting a barrier to anyone, just as human abodes within demonic abodes, each distinct within the demonic abodes, are visible according to the purity of the objects of desire, just as reflections of the worlds of the universe are seen in the ocean, just as a magician sees all forms and activities by the power of spells and drugs, in the same way Sudhana, by the inconceivable direction of the magic of the enlightening mystic knowledge of Maitreya, saw all those miraculous displays, by bringing forth the power of magic of knowledge of truth, by the power of mystic knowledge mastered by the enlightening being.

de nas byang chub sems dpa' byams pas khang pa brtsegs pa de'i nang du song ste byin gyi rlabs de dag brtul nas tshong dpon gyi bu nor bzang la se gol gyi sgra byas te 'di skad ces smras so/ /rigs kyi bu/ 'di ni/ chos rnams kyi chos nyid yin gyi/ longs/ rigs kyi bu/ chos thams cad ni/ rnam par bsgrubs na/ nye bar 'grub pa'i mtshan nyid de/ byang chub sems dpa'i ye shes kyi byin gyis brlabs pa'i rang bzhin de lta bu ste/ yongs su ma grub pa'o/ /sgyu ma dang / rmi lam dang / gzugs brnyan lta bu'o/ /

Then the enlightening being Maitreya, entering the tower and relaxing his magical force, snapped his fingers and said to Sudhana, “Arise. This is the nature of things; characterized by nonfixity, all things are stabilized by the knowledge of enlightening beings, thus they are inherently unreal, and are like illusions, dreams, reflections.”

de nas tshong dpon gyi bu nor bzang se gol gyi sgra des ting nge 'dzin de las langs par gyur pa dang / de la byang chub sems dpa' byams pas smras pa/ rigs kyi bu/ khyod kyis byang chub sems dpa'i byin gyi rlabs rnam par 'phrul ba mthong mod/ khyod kyis byang chub sems dpa'i tshogs kyi mthu dang / rgyu mthun pa mthong mod/ khyod kyis byang chub sems dpa'i smon lam gyi ye shes kyis rnam par bsgrubs pa mthong mod/ khyod kyis byang chub sems dpa'i gnas mdangs dga' ba mthong mod/ khyod kyis byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa yongs su bsdu ba mthong mod/ khyod kyis byang chub sems dpa'i 'byung ba'i sgra thos mod/ khyod kyis sangs rgyas kyi zhing gi yon tan dang / rgyan tshad med pa mthong mod/ khyod kyis de bzhin gshegs pa'i smon lam rnam pa tha dad pa'i khyad par mthong mod; khyod kyis byang chub sems dpa'i rnam par thar pa bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i rjes su 'brang ba byas mod/ khyod kyis byang chub sems dpa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi dga' ba dang bde ba myong mod/

Then, at a finger snap, Sudhana emerged from that trance and Maitreyasaid to him, “Did you see the miraculous display of the magical power of enlightening beings? Did you see the results of the power of enlightening beings’ preparations for enlightenment? Did you see the creations of the vows and knowledge of enlightening beings? Did you see the practices and attainments of enlightening beings? Did you hear the enlightening beings’ ways of emancipation? Did you see the infinity of adornments of buddha-lands? Did you see the excellence of the vows and expertise of buddhas? Did you realize the inconceivability of the liberation of enlightening beings? Did you experience enlightening beings’ bliss of absorption?”

nor bzang gis smras pa/ 'phags pa/ dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyi byin gyi rlabs dang / dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyis dgongs pa dang / dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyi mthus mthong ngo/ /'phags pa/ rnam par thar pa 'di'i ming ci zhes bgyi/ smras pa/ rigs kyi bu/ rnam par thar pa 'di ni/ dus gsum gyi dmigs pa thams cad la shes pa rab tu zhugs pa'i dran pa nyams pa med pas brgyan pa'i snying po zhes bya ba ste/ rigs kyi bu/ rnam par thar pa 'di lta bu brjod du med pa'i yang brjod du med pa dag ni; tshe gcig gis thogs pa'i byang chub sems dpas thob bo/ /nor bzang gis smras pa/ 'phags pa/ rgyan de dag gang du mchis/ smras pa/ gang nas 'ongs pa der ro/ nor bzang gis smras pa/ gang nas mchis/

Sudhana said, “I saw, noble one, by the empowerment and spiritual force of the benefactor. And what is this liberation called?”
Maitreyasaid, “This liberation is called the sanctum of supernal manifestations of unconfused recollection entering into knowledge of all objects of past, present, and future. And an enlightening being assured of enlightenment in one lifetime attains untold liberations like this.”
Sudhana said, “Where has that magnificent display gone?”
Maitreyasaid, “Where it came from.”
Sudhana said, “Where did it come from?”

smras pa/ byang chub sems dpa'i ye shes kyi byin gyi rlabs mngon par bsgrubs pa las 'ongs so/ /de ni/ byin gyi rlabs de nyid la gnas shing gang du yang song ba med la 'phos pa med do/ /phung por gyur pa med do/ /tshogs su gyur pa med do/ /brtsegs par gnas pa med do/ / dngos por gnas pa med do/ /yul na gnas pa ma yin no/ /phyogs na gnas pa ma yin no/ /rigs kyi bu/ 'di lta ste/ dper na/ klu rnams kyi sprin gyi dra ba ni lus la yang mi gnas/ sems la yang mi gnas/ nang na yang mi gnas mod kyi/ klu'i sems kyi dbang dang / klu'i dbang bsam gyis mi khyab pas char gyi rgyun tshad med pa bkye ba ni med pa ma yin te snang ngo/ /rigs kyi bu/ de bzhin du rgyan de dag kyang nang na gnas pa yang ma yin/ phyi rol na gnas pa yang ma yin te/ byang chub sems dpa'i byin gyi rlabs kyi dbang dang / khyod kyi snod bzang ba'i phyir mi snang ba'ang ma yin no/ /

Maitreyasaid, “It came from the effectuation of the magical power of knowledge of enlightening beings, and it resides in that very magical power. It does not go or come at all, it is not an aggregate or an accumulation, it is not uniform and unchangeable, it is not abiding or fixed in existence, it is not located in any place. It is like the network of clouds of the water spirits which do not appear from body or mind and yet are indeed seen in masses; by the mental power of the water spirits measureless clouds emerge, by the wonder of the realm of the water spirits. In the same way, those supernal manifestations are not internal or external, yet it is not that they are not seen, by the magical power of the enlightening being, and because of your own capacity.

rigs kyi bu/ 'di lta ste/ dper na/ sgyu ma'i mkhan pos ni yul thams cad yongs su bstan kyang gang nas kyang 'ongs pa med/ bshig kyang gang du yang 'gro ba med de/ 'pho ba med mod kyi sngags dang rtsi'i mthus yongs su mi snang ba ma yin no/ /rigs kyi bu/ de bzhin du rgyan de dag kyang gang du yang song ba med/ gang nas kyang 'ong ba med la/ gang du yang phung por gyur ba med mod kyi/ byang chub sems dpa'i ye shes sgyu ma bsam gyis mi khyab pa la shin tu bslab pa dang / sngon gyi smon lam gyi byin gyi rlabs dang / ye shes kyi dbang gis yongs su mi snang ba ma yin no/ /

“Just as the illusions of a magician manifesting illusory objects do not come from anywhere or go away, nor are they in transit, yet they appear by the power of spells and drugs, in the same way those supernal arrays have never gone or come, nor accumulated, but they appear by proper learning of the inconceivable magic of knowledge of enlightening beings, by mastery of knowledge empowered by past vows.”

nor bzang gis smras pa/ 'phags pa/ shul ji srid cig nas gshegs/ smras pa/ rigs kyi bu/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams 'gro ba ni 'ong ba med par 'gro'o/ /g.yo ba dang gnas pa med par 'gro'o; ;gnas dang rten med par 'gro'o/ /shi 'pho dang skye ba med par 'gro'o/ /gnas pa dang 'pho ba med par 'gro'o/ /g.yo ba dang ldang ba med par 'gro'o/ /ltos pa dang gnas med par 'gro'o/ /las dang rnam par smin pa med par 'gro'o/ /mi skye ba dang mi 'gag par 'gro'o/ /rtag pa med pa dang chad pa med par 'gro'o/ /gzhan yang rigs kyi bu; byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi 'gro ba ni 'dul ba'i sems can la lta bas snying rje chen po'o/ /byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi 'gro ba ni sdug bsngal ba'i sems can yongs su skyob pas byams pa'o/ /byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi 'gro ba ni gang du dga' bar skye bas tshul khrims so/ /byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi 'gro ba ni sngon gyi byin gyis rlabs kyis smon lam mo/ /byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi 'gro ba ni thams cad de bzhin yongs su ston pas mngon par shes pa'o/ /byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi 'gro ba ni/ de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi zhabs kyi drung nas g.yo ba med pas mngon par 'du bya ba med pa'o/ /byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi 'gro ba ni/ lus dang sems yongs su mi gtong bas len pa dang 'dor ba med pa'o/ /byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi 'gro ba ni/ sems can thams cad kyi rjes su 'brang bas shes rab dang thabs so/ /byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi 'gro ba ni/ mig yor dang / gzugs brnyan dang / sprul pa lta bu yin pas sprul pa yongs su ston pa'o/ /rigs kyi bu/ gzhan yang khyod lam ji srid cig nas 'ongs zhes khyod kyis smras pa ni/ rigs kyi bu/ nga ni/ tshe'i sa yul phreng ba stobs kyi grong rdal khang khyim can zhes bya ba de na tshong dpon sa skyong zhes bya ba zhig yod de/ de sangs rgyas kyi chos la bzhag nas tshe'i sa'i mi rnams la snod kyi tshul bzhin du chos bstan pa byas te/ pha ma dang / bram ze dang / khyim bdag gnyen bshes su 'ong ba rnams theg pa chen po la yang dag par bskul nas 'dir 'ongs so/ /

Sudhana said, “From how far away do you come?”
Maitreyasaid, “In the state where there is no coming; the state of enlightening beings is the state of neither motion nor stasis, the state of no support or abode, the state of no passing away or rebirth, the state neither static nor transient, the state of no stirring or arising, the state of no concern or attachment, the state of no deeds or fruition, the state of no origination or destruction, the state of no annihilation or eternity. Furthermore, great compassion is the state of enlightening beings, as they attend to sentient beings who can be guided; great kindness is the state of enlightening beings, as they rescue suffering beings; discipline is the state of enlightening beings, as they become reconstituted according to will; commitment is the state of enlightening beings, based on past vows; spiritual power is the state of enlightening beings, as they manifest all that is pleasant; nondoing is the state of enlightening beings, as they do not leave the presence of all buddhas; neither grasping nor rejecting is the state of enlightening beings, as they are not obsessed with body or mind; wisdom and means is the state of enlightening beings, as they adapt to sentient beings, manifesting emanations is the state of enlightening beings, their bodies being equivalent to reflected images.
“And you ask how far away I come from—I come here from the village of Kuti in the territories of the Malada people, land of my birth. There is a gentleman there named Gopalaka, who guides people into the buddha-teachings, teaches the native people according to their capacities, and establishes family and relatives, priests and householders, in the Great Vehicle.”
nor bzang gis smras pa/ 'phags pa; byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi tshe'i sa gang lags/
Sudhana asked, “What are the native lands of enlightening beings?”

smras pa/ rigs kyi bu/ bcu po 'di dag ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi tshe'i sa ste/ bcu gang zhe na/ 'di lta ste/ byang chub kyi sems ni/ byang chub sems dpa'i rigs su skyes pas byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi tshe'i sa'o/ /lhag pa'i bsam pa ni/ dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyi rigs su skyes pas byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi tshe'i sa'o/ /sa la gnas pa ni/ pha rol tu phyin pa'i rigs su skyes pas byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi tshe'i sa'o/ /smon lam mngon par sgrub pa ni/ spyod pa'i rigs su skyes pas byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi tshe'i sa'o/ /snying rje chen po ni/ bsdu ba'i dngos po thams cad kyi rigs su skyes pas byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi tshe'i sa'o/ /yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du chos rtogs par bya ba ni/ shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i rigs su skyes pas byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi tshe'i sa'o/ /theg pa chen po ni/ thabs mkhas pa'i rigs su skyes pas byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi tshe'i sa'o/ /sems can yongs su smin par bya ba ni/ mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya ba'i rigs su skyes pas byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi tshe'i sa'o/ /thabs dang shes rab gnyis ni/ mi skye ba'i chos kyi bzod pa'i rigs su skyes pas byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi tshe'i sa'o/ /rigs kyi bu/ chos thams cad kyi nan tan ni/ 'das pa dang / ma byon pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi rigs su skyes pas byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi tshe'i sa te/ /rigs kyi bu/ bcu po de dag ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi tshe'i sa'o/ /

Maitreyasaid, “There are ten native lands of enlightening beings. What are they? The arousal of the aspiration for enlightenment is a native land of enlightening beings, causing one to be born in the family of enlightening beings. Strong will is a native land of enlightening beings, causing one to be born in the family of spiritual friends. The stages are a native land of enlightening beings, causing one to be born in the family of the transcendent ways. Carrying out vows is a native land of enlightening beings, causing one to be born in the family of sublime acts. Universal compassion is a native land of enlightening beings, causing one to be born in the house of means of salvation. Profound contemplation is a native land of enlightening beings, causing one to be born in the house of transcendent wisdom. The Great Vehicle is a native land of enlightening beings, causing one to be born in the house of skill in means. Educating sentient beings is a native land of enlightening beings, causing one to be born in the house of buddhas. Knowledge and means is a native land of enlightening beings, causing one to be born in the house of tolerance of things as unoriginated. Practicing and realizing all truths is a native land of enlightening beings, causing one to be born in the house of all buddhas of past, future, and present.

rigs kyi bu/ thabs mkhas pa ni/ byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi pha'o/ /shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni; ma'o/ /sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa ni/ 'o ma'o/ /tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni/ ma ma'o/ /bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa ni/ lhab lhub dang rgyan to/ / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni/ skyed pa'o/ /bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni/ spyod pa rnam par dag par byed pa'o/ /dge ba'i bshes gnyen rnams ni/ bslab pa la spyod du 'jug pa'o/ /byang chub kyi yan lag thams cad ni/ grogs po'o/ /dge ba'i rtsa ba'i chos thams cad ni/ gnyen bshes so/ /byang chub sems dpa' thams cad ni/ phu nu bo'o/ /byang chub kyi sems ni/ rigs so/ /nan tan ni/ rigs kyi chos so/ /sa'i gnas ni/ rigs kyi gnas so/ /bzod pa thob pa ni/ rigs su rigs dang ldan par skyes pa'o/ /smon lam mngon par sgrub pa ni/ rigs kyi gzhung thob pa'o/ /spyod pa rnam par dag pa ni/ rigs kyi chos kyi rjes snyegs pa'o/ /theg pa chen po la yang dag par skul ba ni/ rigs kyi rgyun mi gcod pa'o/ /dbang bskur nas tshe gcig gis thogs pa ni/ chos kyi rgyal po'i sras kyi thu bo'o/ /de bzhin gshegs pa nyid du yang dag par sgrub pa ni/ rigs kyi bu rgyud yongs su dag pa ste/

“Transcendent wisdom is the mother of enlightening beings, skill in means is the father of enlightening beings, transcendent generosity is the milk of enlightening beings, transcendent discipline is their nurse, transcendent tolerance is their adornment, transcendent vigor is what makes them grow, transcendent meditation purifies their practice, spiritual friends teach them, the elements of enlightenment are their companions, all enlightening beings are their siblings, the determination for enlightenment is their family, practice is the rule of their family, the stages are their residence, attainment of tolerance is birth in the family, carrying out vows is acquisition of the knowledge of the family, purity of conduct is following the rule of the family, promoting the Great Vehicle is preserving the continuity of the family, consecration as one bound to attain buddhahood in one life is princehood among spiritual kings, and the attainment of all who arrive at Thusness is complete purification of the family.

rigs kyi bu/ de ltar na/ byang chub sems dpa' byis pa tha dad pa'i skye bo'i sa las shin tu 'das pa yin/ byang chub sems dpa'i skyon med par zhugs pa yin/ de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs su yang dag par byung ba yin no/ /de bzhin gshegs pa'i rgyud la rab tu gnas pa yin/ dkon mchog gsum gyi rigs rgyun mi gcad pa la zhugs pa yin/ byang chub sems dpa'i rigs yongs su bsdu ba la mngon par brtson pa yin; rigs dang rus kyis yongs su dag pa yin/ gnad kyi rgyud kyis smad du med pa yin/ lha dang bcas pa'i 'jig rten dang / bdud dang bcas pa dang / tshangs pa dang bcas pa dang / dge sbyong dang / bram zer bcas pa'i skye rgu'i nang na rigs la smos pa'i skyon thams cad kyi kha na ma tho ba med pa yin te/ sangs rgyas kyi rigs dam par skyes la; smon lam chen po'i lus dang ldan pas rigs kyis btsun pa yin/

“Thus the enlightening being has gone beyond the stage of the ignorant and has entered the certainty of enlightening beings, has been born in the family of buddhas, has been established in the lineage of buddhas, has become capable of perpetuating the three treasures, has become involved in protecting the family of enlightening beings, has become socially pure and impeccable, blameless among all people, has become well born in the highest family of buddhas, the body a repository of great vows.

rigs kyi bu/ rgyud kyi rigs de lta bu dang ldan pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni/ chos thams cad gzugs brnyan lta bur yongs su shes pas 'jig rten gyi skye gnas thams cad du smad pa med pa yin te/ srid pa'i skye gnas thams cad sprul pa lta bur yongs su shes pas srid pa'i lam gyi rgyud du skye zhing gnas pa thams cad kyis kun nas nyon mongs par mi 'gyur ro/ /chos thams cad bdag med par khong du chud pas sems can thams cad yongs su smin par bya ba dang / gdul bas yongs su mi skyo'o/ /byams pa chen po dang / snying rje chen po'i lus dang ldan pa'i phyir sems can thams cad la phan gdags pas ngal bar mi 'gyur ro/ /'khor ba thams cad rmi lam lta bur yongs su rtogs pas bskal pa thams cad du gnas pas sgyid lug par mi 'gyur ro/ /phung po thams cad sgyu ma lta bur yongs su shes pas skye ba dang / 'chi 'pho dang / 'chi ba yongs su bstan pa thams cad kyis dub par mi 'gyur ro; ;khams dang / skye mched chos kyi dbyings kyi rang bzhin tu rab tu rtogs pas yul thams cad kyis rma mi 'byung ngo/ /'du shes kyi rnam pa thams cad smig rgyu lta bur shin tu bsgoms pas 'khor ba'i dga' ba thams cad kyis mos par mi 'gyur ro/ /sgyu ma lta bu'i chos thams cad la rnam par rtse bas bdud kyi yul thams cad kyis mi gos so/ /chos kyi lus su byung bas nyon mongs pa thams cad du smos su med do/ /skye ba la dbang rab tu thob pas 'gro ba'i rgyud thams cad rtogs par khong du chud pa yin no/ /

“Enlightening beings who have succeeded in being born in the family this way do not shrink away from existence in any world, because they realize all things are like reflections; they are not defiled by life in any state of existence, because they realize birth in all states of being is phantomlike; they are tireless in guiding and perfecting all beings, because they are aware all is selfless; they never cease taking care of all beings, because they embody universal love and compassion; they do not fear living through all ages, because they believe the mundane whirl is like a dream; they are not afflicted by the appearance of birth and death, because they realize the clusters of mental and physical elements are illusory; they are not injured in the midst of all objects, because they realize they are of the nature of the reality realm; they are not deluded by any of the states of the mundane whirl, because they have thoroughly realized they are like mirages; they are unaffected by any bedeviling objects because they are familiar with the illusoriness of all things; they are incapable of being deceived by any afflictions, because they have mastered the spiritual body; they reach their goal in all states of being, because they have attained control over becoming.

rigs kyi bu/ de ltar nga ni/ 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad kyi skye gnas kyi khongs su chud pa'i lus dang / 'gro ba thams cad kyi gzugs dang mnyam pa'i kha dog gi khyad par dang / sems can thams cad dang mnyam pa'i nges pa'i tshig gi bye brag dang / 'gro ba thams cad dang mnyam pa'i ming rnam pa tha dad pa dang / sems can thams cad kyi mos pa dang mnyam pa'i spyod lam dang / 'gro ba rnam par gdul ba thams cad dang mnyam pa'i 'jig rten gyi rjes su 'brang ba dang / sems can rnam par dag par bya ba thams cad dang mnyam pa'i tshe dang / rigs su skye ba yongs su bstan pa dang / byis pa'i spyod pa thams cad dang mnyam pa'i bya ba la 'jug pa'i sgo dang / sems can gyi 'du shes kyi rnam pa thams cad dang / mnyam pa'i yongs su shes par bya ba la 'jug pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i smon lam gyi sprul pa thams cad dang mnyam pa'i lus yongs su bstan cing brjod pas/ chos kyi dbyings thams cad rgyas par bkang ste/ sngon skal pa mnyam par spyod spyod pa'i sems can byang chub kyi sems stor bar gyur pa rnams yongs su smin par bya ba dang / 'dzam bu'i gling du skyes pa'i tshe yongs su bstan pa dang / lho phyogs kyi rgyud 'di'i yul phreng ba stobs kyi grong rdal khang khyim dang ldan pa zhes bya ba 'di'i bram ze'i rigs su skyes pa rnams dang / pha ma dang gnyen bshes su 'ong ba rnams rnam par gdul ba dang / bram ze'i rigs dang rgyud kyi khyad par gyis rigs kyi nga rgyal can du gyur pa 'di dag nga rgyal med par byas te/ de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs su bskyed pa'i don du 'dir skyes so/ /

“With a body existing in all worlds, in forms like all beings, with different powers, with distinct forms of speech like those of all beings, with modes of conduct like those approved by all beings, with adaptations to the world as extensive as the precepts of all beings, appearing to be born in families consonant with all kinds of purity, by entries into the perceptions and ideas of all beings through engagement in activity, by powers of physical manifestation equal to the creations of vows of all enlightening beings, I pervade all universes, and arrived here in the south, in the village of Kuta in the Malada region, in order to develop to maturity those who carried out the same practices as I in the past but have lost the aspiration for enlightenment, and to manifest birth on this continent, to guide parents and relatives born in the priestly caste, and to generate the family of enlightened ones so as to free them from the pride and conceit of the superiority of the priestly caste.

rigs kyi bu/ de ltar nga lho phyogs kyi rgyud 'di na thabs rnam pa 'di lta bus sems can bsam pa'i tshul ji lta bu dang ldan pa dang / rnam pa ji lta bus 'dul ba rnams yongs su smin par bya ba dang / gdul ba byed cing / khang pa brtsegs pa chen po rnam par snang mdzad kyi rgyan gyis brgyan pa'i snying po 'di na 'dug go /'di nas shi 'phos nas kyang bsam pa'i tshul ji lta ba bzhin du sems can rnams kyi rjes su 'brang bar bya ba dang / dga' ldan gyi ris su gtogs pa'i lha'i bu skal pa mnyam par spyod spyod pa rnams yongs su smin par bya ba dang / 'dod pa'i khams nas yongs su 'das pa thams cad la'ang byang chub sems dpa'i bsod nams dang / ye shes dang / sprul pa'i rgyan yongs su bstan pa dang / 'dod pa'i dga' ba'i sred pa las rnam par bzlog pa dang / 'du byed thams cad mi rtag pa nyid du bstan pa dang / lhar skyes pa thams cad kyang mthar rgud par 'gyur ba yongs su bstan pa dang / ye shes chen po'i chos kyi sgo 'chi 'pho'i rnam pa zhes bya ba tshe gcig gis thogs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams dang yang dag par bgro bar bya ba dang / lhan cig yongs su smin par gyur pa rnams der skye bar yongs su bsdu bar bya ba dang / de bzhin gshegs pa shAkya thub pas bkye ba'i pad+mo rnams kyang kha dbye ba'i phyir dga' ldan gyi gnas su skye ba yongs su ston te/ dus la bab la bsam pa yongs su rdzogs nas ni/ thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyang thob par byed kyi/ ngas byang chub mthong nas kyang rigs kyi bu khyod dang / 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur par bcas pas da dung yang mthong bar 'gyur ro/ /

“Here in the south, by that means guiding beings according to their mentalities and according to their capacity for being taught, I live in this tower containing the adornments of Vairocana. When I have passed away from here, I will manifest birth in Tushita, the celestial abode of happiness and contentment, in order to adapt to beings according to mentality, and to mature the celestials of that heaven engaged in the same practice, to manifest supernal arrays of emanations of the virtue and knowledge of enlightening beings beyond all realms of desire, to dispel all craving for sensual enjoyment, to make it clear that all mundane routines are impermanent, to show that all celestial existence ultimately declines and passes away, to join with the enlightening beings bound for buddhahood in one life in proclaiming the teaching of great knowledge called ‘appearance of descent from heaven into rebirth on earth,’ to take care of those matured together in that state of existence, and to enlighten those sent forth by Shakyamuni when the time comes to be guided. At that time I will realize omniscience, the fulfillment of my aspiration; and when I have attained enlightenment, you will see me again, with the spiritual benefactor Manjushri.

song rigs kyi bu/ da dung yang 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa'i gan du song la/ ji ltar byang chub sems dpas byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa la bslab par bya ba dang / ji ltar kun tu bzang po'i spyod pa'i dkyil 'khor la 'jug par bya ba dang / ji ltar mngon par bsgrub pa dang / ji ltar smon par bya ba dang / ji ltar rgyas par bya ba dang / ji ltar rjes su 'brang bar bya ba dang / ji ltar yongs su sbyang bar bya ba dang / ji ltar khong du chud par bya ba dang / ji ltar yongs su rdzogs par bya ba dris shig dang / dge ba'i bshes gnyen des khyod la ston par 'gyur ro/ /de ci'i phyir zhe na/ 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pas spyod pa mngon par sgrub pa de lta bu'i smon lam gyi khyad par ni/ byang chub sems dpa' bye ba khrag khrig brgya phrag stong la yang med do/ /'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa'i smon lam mngon par sgrub pa ni/ tshad med do/ /'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i yon tan gyi khyad par thams cad mngon par sgrub pa ni/ tshad med do/ /'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa ni/ sangs rgyas bye ba khrag khrig brgya phrag stong gi yum lta bu'o/ /'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa ni/ byang chub sems dpa' bye ba khrag khrig brgya phrag stong la gdams ngag ston pa'o/ /'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa ni/ sems can gyi khams thams cad yongs su smin par bya ba dang / gdul ba la rab tu brtson pa'o/ /'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa ni/ phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams su ming gi 'khor los rnam par rgyas par gyur pa'o/ /'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa ni/ de bzhin gshegs pa'i 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor thams cad du gtam gyi skyes bur gyur pa'o/ /'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa ni/ de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyis bsngags shing bstod pa'o/ /'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa ni/ chos thams cad yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du mthong ba ste/ chos zab mo'i ye shes la rnam par spyod pa'o/ /'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa ni/ rnam par thar pa thams cad kyi tshul thams cad la ring du song ba'i spyod yul dang ldan pa ste/ byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa kun tu bzang po la zhugs pa'o/ /rigs kyi bu/ dge ba'i bshes gnyen de ni/ khyod de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs su skyed pa'o/ /dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad yongs su 'phel bar byed pa'o/ /byang chub sems dpa'i tshogs mang po rab tu sgrub pa'o/ /yang dag pa'i dge ba'i bshes gnyen ston pa'o/ /yon tan thams cad la yang dag par skul ba'o/ / smon lam chen po'i dra ba thams cad du 'jug pa'o/ /smon lam mngon par sgrub pa thams cad la rab tu gzhog pa'o/ /byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyi gsang ba thos par byed pa'o/ /byang chub sems dpa'i bsam gyis mi khyab pa thams cad yang dag par ston pa'o/ /sngon gyi tshe'i gnas su skal pa mthun par spyod pa'o/ /

“Now go back to Manjushri and ask him how an enlightening being is to learn and carry out the practice of enlightening beings, enter the sphere of universally good practice, undertake and carry it out, expand it, follow it, purify it, enter fully into it, and fulfill it. He will show you the real benefactor. Why? The best of vows of decillions of enlightening beings is Manjushri’s; vast is the outcome of the practice of Manjushri; measureless is the accomplishment of vows of Manjushri; ceaseless is Manjushri’s achievement of the best of virtues of all enlightening beings; Manjushri is the mother of decillions of buddhas; Manjushri is the teacher of decillions of enlightening beings; Manjushri is engaged in the perfection of all beings; widespread is the name of Manjushri in all worlds of the ten directions; Manjushri is the interlocutor in the assemblies of untold buddhas; Manjushri is praised by all buddhas; abiding in the knowledge of profound truth, Manjushri sees all things according to their true significance; Manjushri has ranged far into all modes of liberation; he is immersed in the practice of universally good enlightening beings. He is the progenitor of spiritual benefactors, who makes you grow in the family of the enlightened, causes you to establish roots of goodness, shows you the provisions for enlightenment, introduces you to true benefactors, immerses you in all virtues, establishes you in the network of universal vows, causes you to hear of the accomplishment of all vows, shows the secrets of all enlightening beings, and has similarly practiced the wonder of all enlightening beings together with you in past lives.

rigs kyi bu/ de bas na; khyod da ltar yang 'jam dpal gyi rkang pa'i drung na 'dug gi /yon tan gyi gdams ngag thams cad thob par bya ba dang / yongs su skyo ba ma skyed cig /yongs su sgyid lug par ma byed cig /de ci'i phyir zhe na/ nor bzang / khyod kyis dge ba'i bshes gnyen ji snyed cig mthong ba dang / spyod pa'i sgo ji snyed cig thos pa dang / rnam par thar pa'i tshul ji snyed cig la zhugs pa dang / smon lam gyi khyad par ji snyed cig khong du chud pa de dag thams cad kyang 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa'i mthu dang / byin gyi rlabs su blta ste/ 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa ni/ thams cad la'ang pha rol tu phyin pa'i mchog thob pa'o/ /

“Therefore when you go to Manjushri, do not be faint-hearted, do not become weary in receiving instruction in all virtues. Why? All the spiritual benefactors you have seen, all the ways of practice you have heard, all the modes of liberation you have entered, all the vows you have plunged into, should all be looked upon as the empowerment of Manjushri; and Manjushri has reached the ultimate perfection.”

de nas tshong dpon gyi bu nor bzang gis byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po byams pa'i rkang pa gnyis la spyi bos phyag 'tshal te lan brgya stong du mar g.yas phyogs su bskor ba byas nas yang dang yang bltas te byang chub sems dpa' byams pa'i drung nas song ngo/ /
Then Sudhana paid his respects to Maitreya the enlightening being and went on.
[jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa]
Manjushri

de nas tshong dpon gyi bu nor bzang grong khyer brgya rtsa bcu kun tu rgyus te phyogs kyi gnas yid bde ba mngon du gyur pa zhes bya ba zhig na 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa la sems shing rnam par lta bas 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa mthong bar mos shing smon la phrad par dga' bas sdod cing 'dug 'dug pa dang / de nas 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pas dpag tshad brgya rtsa bcu bzhi'i pha rol nas lag pa brkyang ste tshong dpon gyi bu nor bzang grong khyer yid bde ba mngon du gyur pa na 'dug pa'i spyi bor bzhag ste 'di skad ces smras so/ /rigs kyi bu/ legs so/ /legs so/ /dad pa'i dbang po dang mi ldan pa/ sems skyo ba can/ bsam pa zhum pa can/ sbyor ba bor ba/ brtson 'grus ldog pa/ yon tan cung zad kyis dga' bar rtsi ba/ dge ba'i rtsa ba gcig la zhen par gnas pa/ spyod pa dang / smon lam mngon par sgrub pa la mi mkhas pa/ dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyis yongs su ma bzung ba/ sangs rgyas kyis ma dgongs pa rnams kyis ni/ chos nyid 'di lta bu yongs su shes par bya ba dang / tshul 'di lta bu dang / spyod yul 'di lta bu dang / gnas 'di lta bu yongs su shes par bya ba dang / rnam par shes par bya ba'am/ khong du chud par bya ba'am/ 'jug par bya ba'am/ yid ches par bya ba'am/ brtag par bya ba'am/ rtog par bya ba'am/ thob par bya bar mi nus so/ /zhes te/ des de la chos kyi gtam gyis yang dag par bstan pa dang / yang dag par bskul ba dang / gzengs bstod pa dang / dga' bar byas te chos kyi sgo grangs med pa dang ldan par byas nas ye shes mtha' yas pa'i snang ba chen po thob par byas te byang chub sems dpa'i gzungs dang / spobs pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / mngon par shes pa dang / ye shes mtha' yas pa'i byin gyis byin du brlabs par byas te kun tu bzang po'i spyod pa'i dkyil 'khor la bzhag nas bdag gi yul la'ang rab tu bzhag ste/ tshong dpon gyi bu nor bzang gi drung nas song ngo/ /

Then Sudhana, passing more than one hundred and ten cities, went to Sumanamukha and stayed there thinking about Manjushri, wishing to see and meet with Manjushri. Then Manjushri extended his hand over a hundred and ten leagues and laid it on the head of Sudhana, who was standing in the city of Sumanamukha, and said, “Good, good! Those without the faculty of faith, those who are weary or sluggish in mind, those who have not accumulated efforts, those whose vigor recedes, those who are satisfied with meager virtues, those imbued with only one root of goodness, those unskilled in carrying out practical vows, those who are not in the care of spiritual benefactors, those who are not minded by the buddhas, cannot know this true nature, this principle, this sphere, this abode—they are unable to know, to fathom, to penetrate, to believe, to conceive, to know exactly, or to attain.”
Having caused Sudhana to see by means of his spiritual talk, having directed him, inspired him, gladdened him, imbued him with countless facets of truth, illumined him with the great light of infinite knowledge, led him into the endless mental command, presence of mind, concentration, and superknowledge of enlightening beings, plunged him into the sphere of universally good practice, and established him in his own place, Manjushri left the presence of Sudhana.
shin tu rgyas pa chen po'i mdo/ sangs rgyas phal po che zhes bya ba las/ sdong pos brgyan pa'i le'u ste/ bzhi bcu rtsa lnga pa'o// ;;

fuse.drop: The Vow of Practice of Universal Good

de nas tshong dpon gyi bu nor bzang dge ba'i bshes gnyen stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyi rdul shin tu phra ba snyed bsnyen bkur ba/ thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du tshogs bsags pa'i sems dang ldan pa/ dge ba'i bshes gnyen thams cad kyi gdams ngag dang / rjes su bstan pa la mthun par 'dzin pas zhugs pa/ dge ba'i bshes gnyen thams cad kyi drung du bsam pa mnyam pas 'gro ba/ dge ba'i bshes gnyen thams cad dga' bar bya bas yid mi dbyung ba'i blo dang ldan pa/ dge ba'i bshes gnyen thams cad kyi gdams ngag dang / rjes su bstan pa'i tshul rgya mtsho'i rjes su song ba/ snying rje chen po'i bsam pa rgya mtsho las yang dag par byung ba'i snying po dang ldan pa; byams pa chen po'i tshul gyi sprin gyis 'gro ba thams cad rnam par snang bar byed pa/ dga' ba chen po'i shugs rnam par 'phel ba'i lus dang ldan pa/ byang chub sems dpa'i rnam par thar pa rgya chen po la rab tu zhi bar rnam par spyod pa/ sgo thams cad nas lhag par 'phro ba'i gtong ba'i mig dang ldan pa/ de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi yon tan rgya mtsho'i nan tan rab tu rdzogs pa/ de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi mos pa'i lam du zhugs pa/ thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi tshogs la brtson 'grus kyi shugs rnam par 'phel bas byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyi sems dang / bsam pas shin tu sbyangs pa'i blo dang ldan pa/ dus gsum gyi de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pa la zhugs pa/ sangs rgyas thams cad kyi chos kyi tshul rgya mtsho khong du chud pa/ de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi 'khor lo'i rgya mtsho'i rjes su song ba/ 'jig rten gyi skye gnas thams cad du gzugs brnyan yongs su ston pa'i spyod yul dang ldan pa/ byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyi smon lam gyi tshul rgya mtsho la zhugs pa/ bskal pa thams cad du byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa la rab tu zhugs pa/ thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi yul snang ba rab tu thob pa/ byang chub sems dpa'i dbang po thams cad rnam par 'phel ba/ thams cad mkhyen pa'i lam snang ba rab tu thob pa/ phyogs thams cad du sgrib pa med pa'i snang ba rab tu thob pa/ chos kyi dbyings thams cad kyi tshul la rab tu zhugs pa'i blo dang ldan pa/ zhing gi tshul thams cad la snang ba rab tu grub pa/ sems can 'byams klas pa thams cad kyi don bya ba la rgyud dang mi mthun pa med par rjes su song ba/ sgrib pa'i g.yang sa'i ri thams cad rnam par 'thor ba/ sgrib pa med pa'i chos kyi rjes su song ba/ byang chub sems dpa'i rnam par thar pa sa'i gzhi kun tu gnas pa'i chos kyi dbyings kyi snying po can la rab tu zhi bar rnam par dpyod pa/ de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi spyod yul rjes su tshol ba/ de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyis byin gyis brlabs pa de byang chub sems dpa' kun tu bzang po'i spyod yul la rnam par dpyod cing 'dug par gyur te/

Then Sudhana, attending as many spiritual benefactors as atoms in a billion-world universe, his mind having accumulated the provisions for omniscience, acting on the instructions of all spiritual benefactors with correct understanding, his mind equally attentive to all spiritual friends, his intellect in harmony with all spiritual friends without emotion, following the ocean of principles of the advice and instruction of all spiritual friends, filled with universal compassion, illumining all beings with universal love, physically blissful, abiding at peace in the vast liberation of enlightening beings, his equanimous vision attentive to all dimensions, having accomplished the ocean of virtues of all buddhas, on the path of resolve of all buddhas, strengthened by the energy of vigor of preparation for omniscience, his mind thoroughly dedicated to the will of all enlightening beings, comprehending the succession of all buddhas of past, present, and future, awake to the ocean of principles of all enlightened teachings, following the ocean of principles of the wheels of teaching of all buddhas, in the realm of manifesting reflections of life in all worlds, immersed in the principles of the vows of all enlightening beings, set out to carry on enlightening practice throughout all ages, seeing the realm of omniscience, having developed all the faculties of enlightening beings, aware of the path of omniscience, his intellect focused on all the principles of the reality realm, illumining the principles of all lands, following the course of beneficial action extending to all beings, shattering the precipitous mountains of spiritual impediments, according with the unimpeded nature of reality, abiding at peace in the liberation of enlightening beings containing the universal reality realm, investigating the realm of all buddhas, empowered by all buddhas, stood contemplating the realm of the enlightening being Universally Good.

byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po kun tu bzang po'i ming thos pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa thos pa dang / smon lam gyi khyad par thos pa dang / tshogs yongs su sgrub pa la 'jug pa dang / gnas pa'i khyad par thos pa dang / mngon par sgrub pa dang / 'byung ba'i lam gyi khyad par thos pa dang / kun tu bzang po'i sa'i tshul gyi rgyud thos pa dang / sa'i tshogs thos pa dang / sa thob par byed pa'i shugs thos pa dang / sa yongs su gnon pa thos pa dang / sa la gnas pa thos pa dang / sa sngon du 'dor bas gnon pa thos pa dang / sa'i spyod yul thos pa dang / sa'i byin gyi rlabs thos pa dang / sa la yang dag par gnas pa thos nas byang chub sems dpa' kun tu bzang po mthong bar dga' zhing skom ste nam mkha'i dbyings ltar shin tu yangs pa'i sems mngon par zhen pa thams cad las gyen du 'phags pa dang / zhing gi 'du shes shin tu bsgoms pa dang / chags pa thams cad las yang dag par 'das pa'i sems chos thams cad la sgrib pa med pa'i spyod yul can dang / thogs pa med pa'i sems phyogs rgya mtsho thams cad rgyas par 'gengs pa dang / sgrib pa med pa'i sems thams cad mkhyen pa nyid yul yongs su gnon pa dang / shin tu rnam par dag pa'i sems snying po byang chub kyi rgyan lhag mthong gis yongs su dag pa dang / shin tu rnam par phye ba'i sems sangs rgyas thams cad kyi chos rgya mtsho la zhugs pa dang / shin tu yangs pa'i sems sems can gyi khams thams cad yongs su smin par bya ba dang / gdul ba rgyas par 'gengs pa dang / shin tu che ba'i sems sangs rgyas kyi zhing thams cad yongs su dag par byed pa dang / tshad med pa'i sems sangs rgyas thams cad kyi 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor du gzugs brnyan rab tu 'byung ba dang / bskal pa thams cad du gnas pas mi zad cing mthar thug pa med pa'i sems/ de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi stobs dang / mi bsnyengs pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos kyi ma 'dres pa'i mthar thug pas snying po byang chub rdo rje dam pa'i snying po can de la pad+mo'i stan rin po che thams cad kyi lhun can zhig la de bzhin gshegs pa'i gdan seng+ge'i khri la mngon par bltas te 'dug go /
